excerpts: I really enjoyed the salads and the soup of the day which consisted of seafood in a tomato base.
The edamame and pretzel Goldfish crackers were very cute, and I also enjoyed the wakame salad and the broccolini.
soup of the day.author: Melissa K.
soup of the day.review:
After a long flight from the east coast, we were hungry and tired of driving around so we decided to take a chance with Pacific Catch.  What a great choice!

Coming from Hawaii, I was a bit wary of restaurant's "Hawaii" theme and of the poke and other fish items but I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food relative to the price.  Entrees range from $10-$20 and everything is fresh and delicious.  Lots of fresh, creative salads, plenty of seafood options, and the food bursts with flavor and color.  

I really enjoyed the salads and the soup of the day which consisted of seafood in a tomato base. The edamame and pretzel Goldfish crackers were very cute, and I also enjoyed the wakame salad and the broccolini. The salmon salad had tons of crispy fried salmon skin and the California Roll salad had plenty of crab salad but without heavy mayo. The fish tacos were very fresh and filling. And the cocktails are phenomenal. 

Service was very good-- the waitstaff were very friendly and welcoming. Also, I'm super glad there is a parking area!

excerpts: 3rd and last the food wasn't as good as I expected, the soup of the day was awful and too much spices!
soup of the day.author: Zohan E.
soup of the day.review:
Bad service and rude waiters 


I'm a big fan of Pacific catch but this location is the worst experience I had! About 2 weeks ago after the academy of science visit I decided to go there with 3 of my friends and we all were disappointed. 

First the server was rude, and looked like he hated working there. 2nd the food took forever Even though there was only 3 tables with customers, so it wasn't busy. We asked the waiter whats going on with our food, then he started mugging us plus all the food didn't come out at the same time, took another 10 for my plate to come out while my friends are eating already..3rd and last the food wasn't as good as I expected, the soup of the day was awful and too much spices! Overall I'm never going back there...

2 stars for the clean environment and their good salamon I stole from my friend because my plate wasn't good that's all

excerpts: If you ever see "ALASKAN KING CRAB SOUP" listed in the menu under Soup Of the Day section, GET IT!
soup of the day.author: Jane A.
soup of the day.review:
update on an update....

If you ever see "ALASKAN KING CRAB SOUP" listed in the menu under Soup Of the Day section, GET IT!!!!

The best soup i have ever had. My friend liked it so much she said she could make love to the soup. yup, its that good it'll make you say some crazy things. She had seconds. All i have to say is... who sprinkled crack in my soup because i'm addicted.

excerpts: I also had a taste of the soup of the day-a chayote chowder, which had one of the best tastes I've had in a chowder.
soup of the day.author: Tawnee K.
soup of the day.review:
If I remember correctly, Pacific Catch had a booth at Outside Lands in August. I tried a sample of something (ceviche perhaps?) and the taste stuck with me. Good thing too- I put two and two together when exiting Botanical Gardens and Pacific Catch was towering in front of me like a beacon of light for my hungry bits. 

We went in there on New Years Day and what better way to celebrate the new decade but with a basket of fish and chips? There is no better way, that's what. I also had a wakame (seaweed) salad which was absolutely peachy- especially considering the fact that they didnt scrimp on the green goodness, and there was a dressing soaked bed of cucumber waiting for me at the end once I finished. 

I stepped up the standard fish and chips to a sampler which included fried oysters, shrimp and fish, I chose standard fries since other people at the table got spicy cajun fries and sweet potato fries. Pacific catch has the fries down- absolutely. I loved the combo basket and was simultaneously salivating over everyone elses meal at the table. The Ahi sandwhich looks ridiculously good. Had I not been so full after the combo I had, I would have stolen the bits that left unfinished on my friend's plate. I also had a taste of the soup of the day-a chayote chowder, which had one of the best tastes I've had in a chowder. I didn't know what chayote was when I walked in, but when I walked out I was a fanatic.

A bit on the expensive side of affordable, but for good food (fresh fish) and a good experience, I say it is worth it. 

Also, the place is full of amazing things to daydream at. The chandeliers made out of blue bottles are great taste, event the bathroom has tiny strands of bamboo hidden behind the stall walls. The whole place is open, bright, and tastefull.

excerpts:
$9 Baja Shrimp Ceviche - lime, serrano chili, avocado, cilantro, tortilla chips:
These bite-size shrimp are springy, meaty and seasoned well.
The verde sauce is on the runny side and is quite spicy.
baja shrimp ceviche.author: Joy W.
baja shrimp ceviche.review:
I've been here several times over the past few years and I've come to the conclusion that it's never a bad time to have some tasty ahi, as long as it tastes fresh. The menu features mainly California seafood dishes with some Asian fusion touches here and there. This corner venue is large and spacious with very high ceilings, but they keep the place pretty cold. There is also some cozy outdoor seating under some heaters, but keep in mind, it is right next to the bus stop. 

They start you off with some complimentary shelled edamame and pretzel goldfish, which is a cute nod to the seafood menu, but I'd still prefer bread. I also think edamame is more enjoyable with the shell on.

$16.50 Japanese Wasabi rice bowl w/ Hawaiian poke - seaweed salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori, soy-wasabi sauce:
The bowl has a decent portion of bite-size chunks of sweet, juicy tuna. The soy-wasabi sauce is mild and not too strong on the wasabi. It is also seasoned with green onions, chives, and sesame seeds. Everything tastes fresh including the pale slivers of creamy avocado and crunchy, crisp seaweed salad. Be sure to get a little bit of everything in each bite, otherwise you're left with a lots of rice at the bottom of the bowl. 

$15.50 Ahi Tuna Salad w/ seared ahi, greens & romaine, avocado, cucumber, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds, soy-wasabi vinaigrette:
When I want something lighter, I'll go for the salad. The ingredients are pretty much the same, but with lettuce instead of rice. But with a salad, I go for the seared tuna instead of poke, because it creates the illusion of a meatier salad. Again, try to eat a little of everything together, otherwise you're left with a ton of greens, or as my friend calls it, 'rabbit food.'

A lot of people like the sweet potato fries. They're alright, but sweet potato fries are becoming a ubiquitous offering across the board.

Happy hour deals are pretty good if you are in the area in the afternoons. Poke is about $8.

$9 Baja Shrimp Ceviche - lime, serrano chili, avocado, cilantro, tortilla chips:
These bite-size shrimp are springy, meaty and seasoned well. The verde sauce is on the runny side and is quite spicy. I could eat this on its own without tortilla chips too, but the thin, crunchy chips make a nice vehicle.

$12.50 Hawaiian Poke with wonton chips - original ahi tuna, sesame-soy marinade, spicy seasonings:
A small bowl of juicy ahi cubes covered in sesame seeds and micro greens are accompanied with some fried wontons.

$7 Mochi Fondue - vanilla, chocolate, coffee mochi balls & chocolate dipping sauce:
I've tried this out of curiosity, but if you've ever had store-bought mochi ice cream balls, I'd say skip it. The taste is pretty similar with the addition of a little bowl of chocolate sauce on the side for dipping.

The tasty rice bowls are still my go-to items to order here. If I were in the area, I'd come back to try some of the other menu items too.

excerpts: We both ordered the spicy pacific cocktail to start, as well as sweet potato fries, baja shrimp ceviche, and ahi serrano poke.
Sweet potato fries were pretty good, but man, there was a LOT.
Great flavor, but we definitely ordered way too much food.
Baja shrimp ceviche was not that great.
It was like this weird avocado concoction that was trying to be a guac.
Very lime-y.
Ahi serrano poke was pretty good.
The ahi part was great, every thing else was meh.
baja shrimp ceviche.author: Leslie C.
baja shrimp ceviche.review:
2.5 stars.

My first time here and my BFF and I decided to stop by for HH before CAS Nightlife. We both ordered the spicy pacific cocktail to start, as well as sweet potato fries, baja shrimp ceviche, and ahi serrano poke.

Our drinks were hella spicy! My friend could barely drink hers. A little too much kick for me, I think. It was do-able after the first 5 sips though. We're probably getting a lot older than we want, but we definitely felt a bit buzzed after the first few sips!

Sweet potato fries were pretty good, but man, there was a LOT. Great flavor, but we definitely ordered way too much food. 
Baja shrimp ceviche was not that great. It was like this weird avocado concoction that was trying to be a guac. Very lime-y. 
Ahi serrano poke was pretty good. The ahi part was great, every thing else was meh. There was a little too much aioli for my taste, but I'm not one to douse my proteins.

Overall, would mayyyybe be back to try a margarita, but I definitely learned my lesson when it comes to their food.

excerpts: Baja shrimp ceviche:
A very delicious shrimp dish.
Recommended.
baja shrimp ceviche.author: Nathan Y.
baja shrimp ceviche.review:
I came here for a company dinner, which mainly consisted of delicious appetizers.

For appetizers, we had:
A starter salad
The california roll: It was pretty generous for a basic roll and was very filling.
Baja shrimp ceviche: A very delicious shrimp dish. Recommended.
Ahi tuna poke: Those wonton chips were amazing, but the Ahi tuna poke was even better. The tuna was very fresh and tender. Highly-recommended.

For my entree, I had a Japanese wasabi rice bowl with seared Ahi tuna: The wasabi taste was light but definitely noticeable. It blended very well with the included salad. Similar to the Ahi tuna poke appetizer, the tuna was delicious. It had great texture and a very juicy taste.

The restaurant had good service and gave very generous portions for appetizers and entrees. (I was beyond stuffed)

I was quite impressed and look forward to returning to one of their many locations in the Bay Area.

excerpts: The first time I got the Baja shrimp ceviche and the coconut shrimp.
Both were really tasty, the coconut batter on the shrimp was just right and the shrimp ceviche had a lot of shrimp in it.
The second time I got the ceviche sampler, which comes with the baja shrimp ceviche, the Peruvian ceviche and the Hawaiian poke.
baja shrimp ceviche.author: Christine U.
baja shrimp ceviche.review:
I've been here twice now, and seafood is definitely fresh. The first time I got the Baja shrimp ceviche and the coconut shrimp. Both were really tasty, the coconut batter on the shrimp was just right and the shrimp ceviche had a lot of shrimp in it. The second time I got the ceviche sampler, which comes with the baja shrimp ceviche, the Peruvian ceviche and the Hawaiian poke. The Baja was still the best, the Poke was a little over seasoned and the Peruvian kind of skimped on the amount of fish (and was kind of...oily?).

While I liked my meals, the people that I went with (on both occasions) both got the rice bowls and complained that it was way too much rice and not nearly enough meat/fish. 

The food is pretty good, but the rice bowls ($15)  were overpriced in my opinion for the amount of protein you get. 

I would give this a 3.5 probably but the staff was nice so I rounded up!

excerpts: Baja Shrimp Ceviche ($8.50):  a fair amount of shrimp, lime, cilantro and chilies, served in a martini glass and surrounded by tortilla chips.
baja shrimp ceviche.author: Samantha L.
baja shrimp ceviche.review:
I have been to Pacific Catch a number of times (mainly due to the fact that it's pretty close to UCSF) and it's consistently pretty good/"a-ok."  I've never actually come for dinner, because I think there are plenty of better (and more student-budget-friendly restaurants) in the area, but it is a great option for happy hour or just place to catch up with friends over a drink and appetizers.

The restaurant is pretty nice looking inside, yet casual.  If you dine-in, they give you a tray of pretzel goldfish and edamame.  Some of the many appetizers I've tried include:

Cabo Calamari ($9): fried calamari (both rings and tentacles, lemon slices and chilies); taste is pretty standard and it's served with a "spicy" chipotle aioli.  During my last visit, this was free via a Foursquare check-in offer.

Sweet Potato Fries ($6):  always delicious and served with interesting dipping sauces: ginger wasabi aioli and sweet Thai chili.  I prefer ketchup.  

Baja Shrimp Ceviche ($8.50):  a fair amount of shrimp, lime, cilantro and chilies, served in a martini glass and surrounded by tortilla chips.  This was pretty tasty, but not that stand-out is.  

Hawaiian Poke ($9.50): this is probably the only appetizer that actually shines.  The tuna is marinated in a sesame-soy marinade and served with crispy wonton chips.  It can be a bit salty, but just make sure you have a nice cocktail also.

Happy hour is 4-6 p.m. Monday through Friday and also 10 p.m. to close each night.  They have a fair selection of beer for $3-4, wells for $4.50 and a selection of appetizers as well.  The service is generally pretty helpful and I think overall, it's a pretty fun place to get snacks/drinks.

excerpts: Ordered the Baja Shrimp Ceviche... Fish & Chips mixed catch basket...
Escolar..and ummm ok
, i guess i forgot what my mom ordered..
but it was good from what i stole a bite from, and she finished it without really sharing =
baja shrimp ceviche.author: Kenneth V.
baja shrimp ceviche.review:
Me and my sister took our mom here for Mothers Day lunch time.  I would prob give this place a 5 if we didn't get seated 5 min. after our reservation time... but understandable, it was mothers day and busy is busy.

any how, hands down... The food is Bomb. If your into seafood... hit this place up!

Ordered the Baja Shrimp Ceviche... Fish & Chips mixed catch basket...  Escolar..and ummm ok, i guess i forgot what my mom ordered.. but it was good from what i stole a bite from, and she finished it without really sharing =P

My 2x mojitos was  surprisingly  heavy handedly poured :)  which was cool but i got somewhat of a headache by 5pm

excerpts: The baja shrimp ceviche was tasty and tangy, the Hawaiian poke tuna was perfectly marinated, and the Peruvian ceviche was close to being great!
I come from an area where Peruvian restaurants sort of rule, so
I'm used to the ceviche being more authentic- with the white cornuts and the yucca-
baja shrimp ceviche.author: Yahra V.
baja shrimp ceviche.review:
My first time here, definitely not my last!

We were in quandry about where to go for my birthday dinner last night; after a bit of research and wanting to not venture too far out into the city since we had family in town, we decided on Pacific Catch.

Treading through GGP with a 4-year old nephew can make anyone very hungry so it was great that we were so close. We kept our car parked at the park (lol) and walked less than a block to the restaurant. 

First impressions work always- the place was clean, nice decor and the wait staff was friendly.

Early dinner equals Happy Hour... unfortunately they only serve the happy hour menu at the bar and it just didn't seem right to sit there with younger ones in tow. Womp womp :(
That didn't stop me from trying their lemongrass mojito though- delicious! Tart and sweet and minty with the right amount of rum... yum!

The trio ceviche was enjoyed by all- even the ones that weren't fans of fish (really?). The baja shrimp ceviche was tasty and tangy, the Hawaiian poke tuna was perfectly marinated, and the Peruvian ceviche was close to being great! I come from an area where Peruvian restaurants sort of rule, so I'm used to the ceviche being more authentic- with the white cornuts and the yucca- but this was still tasty and satisfying. 

Our dinner was an assortment of their rice bowls, fish tacos, fish and chips (made with the catch of the day... cod) and chicken tenders for the little one. All the dishes were very good. The taco and fish plates came with fries. Regular and sweet potato thumbs up- nothing spectacular about the "spicy" fries though. And nothing really "spicy" about them. dipping sauces were a plus, epecially the jalapeno tartar for the fish and chips and the wasabi (guessing) ranch for the sweet potato fries.

Our server was friendly and attentive and when asked a few questions about the menu she was knowledgeable and in one instance when she didn't know, she returned later with information and actually followed up. That was nice!

Lastly, my surprise birthday dessert (surprise!) was a near perfect brownie topped with vanilla ice cream and chocolate sauce. The brownie was dense but moist with walnuts and the vanilla bean ice cream... the icing on the cake!

Price was very reasonable for a party of 5.5.... $120 or so. Gratuity not included.

Overall, an enjoyable experience and a memorable birthday! 

Thanks Pacific Catch!

excerpts: The Baja Shrimp Ceviche starter is a another highlight, arriving in a classy martini glass with tortilla chips.
baja shrimp ceviche.author: Kerry D.
baja shrimp ceviche.review:
Under the sea
Under the sea
Nobody beat us
Fry us and eat us
In fricassee
We what the land folks loves to cook
Under the sea we off the hook
We got no troubles
Life is the bubbles
Under the sea!

I feel really bad for people who don't eat seafood.  I love me some fish! 
 
I know a lot of feathers were ruffled when Pacific Catch took the place of Canvas.  One less hipster coffee shop in SF, boo-freakin-hoo.  I really like what they did with the space here and I think Pacific Catch adds a lot to the Inner Sunset restaurant selection.  
The Hawaiian poke is my personal favorite (that's what SHE said), on top o' rice bowl or a salad.  The Baja Shrimp Ceviche starter is a another highlight, arriving in a classy martini glass with tortilla chips.  Island tacos, fresh sushi rolls, stews and fish and chips (with sweet potato fries!)  are also scrumptious choices and help diversify the menu.  There really is a little something for everyone.  This location next to the park is ideal and the limited outdoor seating is lovely.  

I've had consistently spotty service here, with the place both packed and empty.  But even so, luckily the food itself is consistently delicious and fresh.  If you have the patience to endure being ignored by the waitstaff and a large space CRAWLING with young kids (Hey -I love 'em, but I know some people don't....) Pacific Catch is a solid casual dining spot.

excerpts:
Baja Shrimp Ceviche
Sweet Potato Fries (Get them!)
baja shrimp ceviche.author: Jessica B.
baja shrimp ceviche.review:
I used to come here whenever I had disposable 20 and wanted to treat myself to some qual-it- A food. I've had fun happy hour times with some friends and even quick one drink hang outs. I had not eaten here in over a year and was excited when the opportunity came to indulge in a yummy lunch. After Bay to Breakers, my friends went to Gordos (YUM) and I chose to order take out from Pacific Catch. I requested the seared ahi rice bowl.  Excited to chow down, I ran to Gordos and proceeded to stuff my face. However, one thing felt wrong. The fish did not taste the same. Again, here is another place that overloads on the sodium to masque the taste of their food. Not only was the fish too salty, but there was something fishy about the fish. After a while, I decided to cease my "chow down" and wrapped the food back into the bag. There is a huge problem if I order food and do not devour the entire thing. This means I either am not hungry or the food does not taste good. Thinking that I must not have been hungry, I decided to eat the bowl later that day. From the moment I went to my bfs house to later that afternoon, my stomach was hurting. I assumed it was due to the hangover from B2B, but it did not make sense. I went to go finish the bowl and figured out my stomach was hurting from the food. Pretty sad. The bowls used to be enjoyable.

What I have eaten here: 
Baja Shrimp Ceviche
Sweet Potato Fries (Get them!)
Cabo Calamari
Seared Ahi Bowl
Hawaiian Poke Bowl

I'll keep the rating 3/5 because this could have been the one bad experience. I was always a fan of Pacific Catch, but I may need to take a permanent break from them. SORRY!

excerpts: appetizer was the baja shrimp ceviche with chips that was really good too.
The service was very fast, and the manager even comped our desert (egg nog ice cream-it was ok.)
Overall a great atmosphere, tasty food, great service.
I'd definitely recommend Pacific Catch
baja shrimp ceviche.author: Kyle D.
baja shrimp ceviche.review: This is a great place, I had a tilapia with tomatillo/avocado sauce that was really really tasty. excellent sweet potato fries and grilled zucchini to go with it. appetizer was the baja shrimp ceviche with chips that was really good too. The service was very fast, and the manager even comped our desert (egg nog ice cream-it was ok.) Overall a great atmosphere, tasty food, great service. I'd definitely recommend Pacific Catch

excerpts: We saw one table had ordered the Baja Shrimp Ceviche
so we decided to start with that.
The presentation was really cool.
The ceviche, stuffed full of shrimp and avocado, was served in a tall martini glass with a pile of tortilla chips sprawled around the base.
The best thing about this dish was how much shrimp they gave us!
It's always annoying when you pay a premium for a shrimp entre and get 3 shrimp.
We counted each shrimp as we were going through the ceviche, they were good sized shrimp mind you, and ended up with almost 20!
baja shrimp ceviche.author: Timothy C.
baja shrimp ceviche.review:
Pacific Catch just recently opened on 9t Street and we decided to go try it for a mellow weekend lunch.  We weren't sure what to expect because it was new, but the online menu sure looked great.

The decor is modern and clean, providing a rather trendy atmosphere.  The place wasn't crowded when we came so we didn't have to wait for a table, which is always nice.  We saw one table had ordered the Baja Shrimp Ceviche so we decided to start with that.   The presentation was really cool.  The ceviche, stuffed full of shrimp and avocado, was served in a tall martini glass with a pile of tortilla chips sprawled around the base.  The best thing about this dish was how much shrimp they gave us!  It's always annoying when you pay a premium for a shrimp entre and get 3 shrimp.  We counted each shrimp as we were going through the ceviche, they were good sized shrimp mind you, and ended up with almost 20! The chef was overly generous with the shrimp for the price we payed.

For my entre, I went with 3 tacos; 1 BBQ salmon with corn salsa and lime crema, 1 tropical grilled shrimp with mango salsa, and 1 spice-rubbed grilled mahi mahi with avocado tomatilla salsa.  Now let me first say that I am a little biased when it comes to fish tacos.  I've been a long time advocate for Wahoo's fish tacos and nothing has ever compared to their tacos.  Pacific catch however served me some really tasty fish tacos, which can definitely compete with Wahoo's.  I really appreciated the nice quality of salsas and toppings that went into the tacos.  They worked well and tasted great with the various fish and shrimp pairings.  I took down these bad boys so fast and had to restrain myself from ordering more!

We also ordered sweet potato fries which were good.  I tend to find any type of french fry that offers a spin off the traditional French fry (different potatoes, etc) very satisfying.

Pacific Catch is definitely a decent restaurant and we will for sure go there again.  They had other dishes, such as sushi and fancy deserts that I would also like to try.  I also noticed they had a pretty nice full bar with comfy seats and a decent happy hour.  This would be a good place to come have some drinks and a nice dinner with some friends or even a date.

excerpts: we tried both the hawaiian poke (a must eat) and the baja shrimp ceviche, which came out in a cool martini glass with tortilla chips... so refreshing and good!
baja shrimp ceviche.author: Andrey C.
baja shrimp ceviche.review:
with the appetizer coupons we scored at the yelp party in hand, we headed over to the sunset pacific catch for some consistently delicious grub and, as usual, we weren't disappointed. we tried both the hawaiian poke (a must eat) and the baja shrimp ceviche, which came out in a cool martini glass with tortilla chips... so refreshing and good! i'm usually wary about getting salmon, but the salmon wasabi bowl here was perfect! and you can never go wrong with the rock cod fish and chips...

chef chandon and chef (eek! forgot your name!) even came out to greet us and shoot the breeze about the yelp party the night before... can't believe they actually DONATED all that food that, well, i didn't get to eat (cuz i'm not elite... pshh).

i had actually come to this location earlier this year, and enjoyed one of their lunch-time sandwiches... which were super good as well. only wish i lived closer... i'd probably eat here at least 1x a week if that were the case!

excerpts: If you sign up for the e-newsletter, you get a free appetizer (alternates between baja shrimp ceviche with tortilla chips and poke) with any $12.95 order.
There is a small parking lot behind the restaurant.
I think it fits about eight cars.
Looking for parking around here is not fun, especially on a Friday or Saturday night.
Making a reservation doesn't hurt to help you get seated quicker!
So far service has been good.
baja shrimp ceviche.author: Jenn O.
baja shrimp ceviche.review: I really enjoy eating here. I alternate between my two favorites whenever I eat here: a wasabi bowl (usually poke) or the wasabi ahi sandwich. You can't go wrong with either! For an extra $1.95, you can get the delicious sweet potato fries with your sandwich. If you sign up for the e-newsletter, you get a free appetizer (alternates between baja shrimp ceviche with tortilla chips and poke) with any $12.95 order. There is a small parking lot behind the restaurant. I think it fits about eight cars. Looking for parking around here is not fun, especially on a Friday or Saturday night. Making a reservation doesn't hurt to help you get seated quicker! So far service has been good.

excerpts: My sweet potato fries were cold.
Wife and son were not impressed with their meals.
I'm writing this review in from of empty plates.
Had to go up and ask for the check, still with plates at the table.
sweet potato fries.author: Eric M.
sweet potato fries.review:
We used to love this place. Would come here at least once a month, and we had a few waitstaff who would recognize us. Food was a little pricey, but it was good and the service was fine. It was a fun little family indulgence. 

Our first time back in about a year. We should have known something was up when we saw empty tables on a Sunday night. We were sat right away, but had to wait for 8 minutes for someone to come by our table. Looks like it was the manager. He took our drink order, as well as our appetizers and dinner order. Apps were out quick, but we didn't see our mains for a God's 20 minutes after. 

Food was ok. My sweet potato fries were cold. Wife and son were not impressed with their meals. I'm writing this review in from of empty plates. Had to go up and ask for the check, still with plates at the table. I guess it's safe to say service is crap as well. 

What a pity! We won't be back.

excerpts: Whatever you do, do not turn down the opportunity to pay an extra $1 for sweet potato fries.
They are beyond flavorful and help you forget that you're eating at a chain restaurant.
I also like the quaint Honolulu Tribune newspaper wax/butcher paper that the fish tacos come on because it feels like how a mom-and-pop fish stand would serve 'em.
I like to get the three taco platter ($17.50 with the sweet potato fries) with traditional baja and cabo shrimp.
sweet potato fries.author: Amy C.
sweet potato fries.review:
Apologies in advance to anyone from San Diego, but Pacific Catch is my baseline for good fish tacos. I know it's technically a Bay Area chain restaurant, but there's no denying that Pacific Catch manages to keep locals coming back whenever they're craving some unpretentious seafood: abundant seating (with the chance to choose between a livelier, younger happy hour crowd on the left side of the restaurant and a more family-oriented booth seating on the right), complimentary pretzel Goldfish and edamame at the beginning of your meal, and a plethora of menu options.

Sure, you can order a rice bowl, sandwich, or maybe even a slightly overpriced poke bowl here, but I truly think the fish tacos are where Pacific Catch shines. Having driven past Pacific Catch all the time when I was younger, I didn't think to finally check it out until a few years ago when two of my friends shared that this was where they got their fish taco fix. 

Whatever you do, do not turn down the opportunity to pay an extra $1 for sweet potato fries. They are beyond flavorful and help you forget that you're eating at a chain restaurant. I also like the quaint Honolulu Tribune newspaper wax/butcher paper that the fish tacos come on because it feels like how a mom-and-pop fish stand would serve 'em. I like to get the three taco platter ($17.50 with the sweet potato fries) with traditional baja and cabo shrimp. With the cod and avocado-tomatillo salsa, the traditional baja is my personal favorite because it seems juicier and fresher, but I'm also a sucker for the cabo shrimp because of the generous amount of avocado it comes with. $17.50 certainly seems like a lot to pay for three fish tacos, but I've never been disappointed with the quality of the fish or found myself hungry again a few hours later.

Speaking of prices, the Mai Tai here sure is tasty and will fulfill all your rum-related dreams, but at $11, I have a hard time justifying it because it's not exactly of cocktail bar caliber. So get a pitcher of it instead -- $40 for five servings!

excerpts: Sweet potato fries are a sleeper hit.
sweet potato fries.author: Patty J.
sweet potato fries.review:
Solid. Solid. Solid. I've never had a bad meal here, and their ever-evolving list of seasonal specials always provides at least one standout dish per order. 

Seems like everyone is perpetually happy in this place--customers and employees. Is it the complimentary dish of edamame and pretzel goldfish? Is it the Mai Tais? It's probably the Mai Tais. The Lemongrass Mojito is excellent too. 

Obviously the poke is a must-order. Don't cheat yourself, get the trio. 

Sweet potato fries are a sleeper hit. What's in the seasoning???

I recommend dining in the bar area where local sports are always on, or the heated patio which is super dog friendly.

excerpts: A lot of people like the sweet potato fries.
They're alright, but sweet potato fries are becoming a ubiquitous offering across the board.
sweet potato fries.author: Joy W.
sweet potato fries.review:
I've been here several times over the past few years and I've come to the conclusion that it's never a bad time to have some tasty ahi, as long as it tastes fresh. The menu features mainly California seafood dishes with some Asian fusion touches here and there. This corner venue is large and spacious with very high ceilings, but they keep the place pretty cold. There is also some cozy outdoor seating under some heaters, but keep in mind, it is right next to the bus stop. 

They start you off with some complimentary shelled edamame and pretzel goldfish, which is a cute nod to the seafood menu, but I'd still prefer bread. I also think edamame is more enjoyable with the shell on.

$16.50 Japanese Wasabi rice bowl w/ Hawaiian poke - seaweed salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori, soy-wasabi sauce:
The bowl has a decent portion of bite-size chunks of sweet, juicy tuna. The soy-wasabi sauce is mild and not too strong on the wasabi. It is also seasoned with green onions, chives, and sesame seeds. Everything tastes fresh including the pale slivers of creamy avocado and crunchy, crisp seaweed salad. Be sure to get a little bit of everything in each bite, otherwise you're left with a lots of rice at the bottom of the bowl. 

$15.50 Ahi Tuna Salad w/ seared ahi, greens & romaine, avocado, cucumber, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds, soy-wasabi vinaigrette:
When I want something lighter, I'll go for the salad. The ingredients are pretty much the same, but with lettuce instead of rice. But with a salad, I go for the seared tuna instead of poke, because it creates the illusion of a meatier salad. Again, try to eat a little of everything together, otherwise you're left with a ton of greens, or as my friend calls it, 'rabbit food.'

A lot of people like the sweet potato fries. They're alright, but sweet potato fries are becoming a ubiquitous offering across the board.

Happy hour deals are pretty good if you are in the area in the afternoons. Poke is about $8.

$9 Baja Shrimp Ceviche - lime, serrano chili, avocado, cilantro, tortilla chips:
These bite-size shrimp are springy, meaty and seasoned well. The verde sauce is on the runny side and is quite spicy. I could eat this on its own without tortilla chips too, but the thin, crunchy chips make a nice vehicle.

$12.50 Hawaiian Poke with wonton chips - original ahi tuna, sesame-soy marinade, spicy seasonings:
A small bowl of juicy ahi cubes covered in sesame seeds and micro greens are accompanied with some fried wontons.

$7 Mochi Fondue - vanilla, chocolate, coffee mochi balls & chocolate dipping sauce:
I've tried this out of curiosity, but if you've ever had store-bought mochi ice cream balls, I'd say skip it. The taste is pretty similar with the addition of a little bowl of chocolate sauce on the side for dipping.

The tasty rice bowls are still my go-to items to order here. If I were in the area, I'd come back to try some of the other menu items too.

excerpts: I had a sushi roll and a side of the sweet potato fries.
They both were awesome, but I wish that my sushi roll was a bit spicier (I ordered some sort of spicy roll in the name of the item, maybe firecracker?).
Overall, we like to sit on the bar side because it seems a bit more of young and hip crowd, where the other sit down side is family-oriented.
Love love love, one of our favorites.
sweet potato fries.author: Micah L.
sweet potato fries.review: I'm always a fan of Pacific Catch. Came in on a Friday night with my boyfriend to grab a late dinner and beat the crowd. Parking is pretty easy if you park on the golden gate park side of Lincoln and then cross the street to Pacific Catch on the corner. I had a sushi roll and a side of the sweet potato fries. They both were awesome, but I wish that my sushi roll was a bit spicier (I ordered some sort of spicy roll in the name of the item, maybe firecracker?). Overall, we like to sit on the bar side because it seems a bit more of young and hip crowd, where the other sit down side is family-oriented. Love love love, one of our favorites.

excerpts: (along with sweet potato fries)
sweet potato fries.author: Ania B.
sweet potato fries.review:
I got addicted to Pacific Catch over a decade ago when there was only one location in the Marina.  

This location offers more space, a full bar (try the spicy margarita), and a bigger menu although the poki wasabi bowl is still my go-to.  (along with sweet potato fries)

I honestly don't care about the ambiance so much - the food is where it's at.   Healthy ingredients, yummy outcomes.  Never fails to to make go MMMMMmmmm...!

excerpts: We shared the Korean sticky ribs and the sweet potato fries for appetizer.
The sweet potato fries were really good and not too greasy like I had at many other places.
The sticky ribs were marinated well, but I didn't get too much meat from it.
sweet potato fries.author: Wendy F.
sweet potato fries.review:
Lovely Asian-fusion diner! Love their Ahi Tuna salad!!!

FOOD: We shared the Korean sticky ribs and the sweet potato fries for appetizer. The sweet potato fries were really good and not too greasy like I had at many other places. The sticky ribs were marinated well, but I didn't get too much meat from it. For entree I got the Ahi Tuna salad. It had a good mix of greens, avocado, sauteed cabbages, and 4 big piece of Ahi Tuna. Everything tasted great when mixed all together, with the soy-wasabi vinaigrette. My friend tried the Pacific Crab Salad (with real crab meat) and it was great too!

SERVICE: We came here on a Tuesday evening and was seated immediately. Very friendly waiter and food came by within reasonable time.

SETTING: I really like how spacious it is on the inside and also its ambient lighting. They have nice interior decors and there is also an outdoor patio where you can sit and dine (heat lamp provided during the freezing SF nights). Parking is probably impossible so just take Lyft or the muni. 

OVERALL IMPRESSION: I like it! I always run past this place but never really knew how tasty the food is. Will come back again for sure!

excerpts: Recommendation: the two taco platter (one steak, one ahi) and their spicy fries or sweet potato fries or cole slaw as the side.
sweet potato fries.author: Tiffany S.
sweet potato fries.review:
I love coming here for dinner when I'm too exhausted to cook. 

Recommendation: the two taco platter (one steak, one ahi) and their spicy fries or sweet potato fries or cole slaw as the side. This is my favorite, but I've never been disappointed ordering the other menu offerings.

Staff is super friendly and familiar. What sparked me finally writing a review for one of my favorite bars/restaurants was when I came in for a quick bite, a glass of water after a day of way too much coffee, and space to read. The bartender was slammed, but so calm and attentive and polite to all of the patrons and waiters requesting her attention. I really appreciated her maintaining a positive attitude despite a really stressful situation. 

I've never been disappointed with an experience here - whether it's a too-tired-to-cook dinner, a night out with friends, a date, or a family dinner.

excerpts: I also tried their mahi mahi tacos with sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: Jenna G.
sweet potato fries.review:
Honestly this place is so good. I've been to both the Marina and sunset location. Their poke is so fresh and good. I've tried the original and the salmon avocado. I also tried their mahi mahi tacos with sweet potato fries. Everything was solid. 

It is a little pricey because it's seafood, but I will keep coming back here for poke.

excerpts: Came with sweet potato fries as a choice of side.
The steak was amazing so tender and tasty, hint of sweetness.

Pretzel
Fish and edamame come as bar snacks while you wait for your food, pretty creative and yummy.
This was our first visit here
and we were really surprised.
Only one con to mention, the menu lacks entrees.
The restaurant feels like a main entree type restaurant but actually has a tapas menu.
I was in the mood for fish main entree, still good though.
The outer patio looks cozy with gas fireplace pits!
Reception area and wait staff were all very helpful and friendly.
I will try the San Mateo branch next time, closer to my house.
sweet potato fries.author: Tiffany M.
sweet potato fries.review:
Really enjoyed apps and drinks in the bar area on a very busy evening. My friend and I could not get a table inside the restaurant area or patio dining area. But the bar area was great! The service was super speedy and friendly, mindful of timing our apps delivery, too! We ordered fried oysters, soft shell crab salad, shrimp ceviche and beef & mahi mahi tacos. Loved the tacos! Came with sweet potato fries as a choice of side. The steak was amazing so tender and tasty, hint of sweetness. Pretzel
Fish and edamame come as bar snacks while you wait for your food, pretty creative and yummy. This was our first visit here and we were really surprised. Only one con to mention, the menu lacks entrees. The restaurant feels like a main entree type restaurant but actually has a tapas menu. I was in the mood for fish main entree, still good though. The outer patio looks cozy with gas fireplace pits! Reception area and wait staff were all very helpful and friendly. I will try the San Mateo branch next time, closer to my house.

excerpts: We both ordered the spicy pacific cocktail to start, as well as sweet potato fries, baja shrimp ceviche, and ahi serrano poke.
Sweet potato fries were pretty good, but man, there was a LOT.
Great flavor, but we definitely ordered way too much food.
Baja shrimp ceviche was not that great.
It was like this weird avocado concoction that was trying to be a guac.
Very lime-y.
Ahi serrano poke was pretty good.
The ahi part was great, every thing else was meh.
sweet potato fries.author: Leslie C.
sweet potato fries.review:
2.5 stars.

My first time here and my BFF and I decided to stop by for HH before CAS Nightlife. We both ordered the spicy pacific cocktail to start, as well as sweet potato fries, baja shrimp ceviche, and ahi serrano poke.

Our drinks were hella spicy! My friend could barely drink hers. A little too much kick for me, I think. It was do-able after the first 5 sips though. We're probably getting a lot older than we want, but we definitely felt a bit buzzed after the first few sips!

Sweet potato fries were pretty good, but man, there was a LOT. Great flavor, but we definitely ordered way too much food. 
Baja shrimp ceviche was not that great. It was like this weird avocado concoction that was trying to be a guac. Very lime-y. 
Ahi serrano poke was pretty good. The ahi part was great, every thing else was meh. There was a little too much aioli for my taste, but I'm not one to douse my proteins.

Overall, would mayyyybe be back to try a margarita, but I definitely learned my lesson when it comes to their food.

excerpts: really good sweet potato fries and their coconut shrimp ate pretty good as well.
sweet potato fries.author: Arman J.
sweet potato fries.review: I come here all the time.  I love their salad bowls and their calamari is to die for. I recommend the Chipotle chicken or the salmon for the salad.  They have really good sweet potato fries and their coconut shrimp ate pretty good as well.

excerpts: We also had the fish and chips with sweet potato fries and that was a good choice too.
sweet potato fries.author: Ali F.
sweet potato fries.review:
I came here based on a recommendation from a friend to try the wasabi bowl with hawaiian poke. This was an excellent choice! I don't normally like wasabi but it's flavor was mild in this dish. The combination of the sauce, poke, and the seaweed, salad and sprouts was flavorful yet light. We also had the fish and chips with sweet potato fries and that was a good choice too. The batter was slightly sweet and crispy.

The restaurant is large so it shouldn't be too difficult to get a table. And they have outdoor seating with a fireplace and heat lamps.

excerpts: I had the fish and chips with sweet potato fries.
It was an Alaskan Cod...quite greasy...
sweet potato fries.author: Dee R.
sweet potato fries.review:
I guess this place is a chain restaurant. Went here for lunch . The place has a nice ambiance. Food was mediocre...

I had the fish and chips with sweet potato fries. It was an Alaskan Cod...quite greasy...lacked salt but the jalapeño sauce that it came with balanced out the blandness. 

My friend had the trio poke...original Hawaiian (ahi tuna), salmon avocado Hawaiian , and the serrano Hawaiian...I preferred the Serrano Hawaiian

excerpts: +    2 Piece Fish and Chips with Sweet Potato Fries - $10 - 3/5 -
When ordering this, there is a choice of regular, spicy, or sweet potato fries or a salad.
Yelp says get the sweet potato fries!
After ordering, the waitress returned and had to ask which fries I asked for.
The presentation of this dish is quite cute.
It comes on a newspaper themed wax/butcher paper.
The fish wasn't very crispy.
They were large slabs of fish, but after sitting there for under 5 minutes, the whole bottom side was soggy.
No bueno.
The sweet potato fries were very very good when they came out hot.
If you don't order the appetizer, it doesn't come with the ginger wasabi aioli, but it does come with the Thai chile sauce.

(sauce on the side, sweet potato fries)

ROOM AND DECOR

+Sweet potato fries recommended
+Ballast Point Calico Amber Ale recommended

Overall, I enjoyed the food.
sweet potato fries.author: Kaje Y.
sweet potato fries.review:
Posted hours say they open at 11am. Now, I've been fasting for 2.5 days, (my eating disorder is a whole other story), so after 60 hours of not eating, I decided I should put some food in my belly before I pass out! 

11:03AM I arrive and the doors are locked. 
11:05AM a UPS man comes by to deliver some packages. Doors unlocked.
11:09AM somebody props the door open and brings the signs out. I ask if they're open and they say yes, is it 11AM yet?

I enter, and takes about 1 minute for somebody to tend to me, despite being the first customer there. I'm seated and provided menus.

Shortly after, a waitress came to see what I wanted to drink, but I have not looked at the menu yet, so I said water is fine and she left. She came back with water and complementary Edamame and Goldfish Pretzels. She leaves again to give me some time to decide on what I want.

My waitress comes back shortly. When I order, she decides to memorize it rather than write it down. I ordered the following:

FOOD 3.75/5*
++  Japanese Wasabi Pan-Asian Rice Bowl with Hawaiian Poke - $15 - 4/5 - wakame salad, avocado, daikon, sprouts, cucumber, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori and soy-wasabi sauce.
=    This bowl was fairly good. Per other yelper's reviews, I asked for the soy wasabi sauce on the side, but I guess she forgot. The avocados were flavourless and not ripe, I guess they're not in season? Everything else was very delicious, the rice was a little bit on the tougher side. The Hawaiian Poke was quite fresh and delicious. 

++    2 Piece Fish and Chips with Sweet Potato Fries - $10 - 3/5 - When ordering this, there is a choice of regular, spicy, or sweet potato fries or a salad. Yelp says get the sweet potato fries! After ordering, the waitress returned and had to ask which fries I asked for. The presentation of this dish is quite cute. It comes on a newspaper themed wax/butcher paper. The fish wasn't very crispy. They were large slabs of fish, but after sitting there for under 5 minutes, the whole bottom side was soggy. No bueno. 
= The sweet potato fries were very very good when they came out hot. If you don't order the appetizer, it doesn't come with the ginger wasabi aioli, but it does come with the Thai chile sauce. Pairs really well with the Thai Chile sauce.

++    Ballast Point Calico Amber Ale - $5.50 - 5/5 - YUM. Upon my first sip, I thought I was drinking an IPA, but then I looked down and saw it was a warm amber colour. Amber Pale Ale? The flavours were great, complex body, and hops off the end. Great beer, decently priced. 

**It's a weighted average.

PRICE 3.5/5
The pricing is fairly average, but just a little bit on the pricier side. Nothing spectacular, but also pretty affordable for SF.

SERVICE 4/5
The service was very very nice. My waitress smiled a lot, was very attentive. I saw in my peripheral that she would talk to the other waiters/waitresses but occasionally glance over to see I was still doing okay. She came over to see how everything wa around my half way point. Only thing is that she should have just written down my order so nothing was missed. (sauce on the side, sweet potato fries)

ROOM AND DECOR 5/5
There is plenty of seating, good for both intimate conversations and large groups. The decor is primarily fish paintings and sculptures. Very fitting.

TIPS / NOTES:
+ UCSF (students?) employees get 10% off
+ They are currently running a $10 off if you pay with Paypal Mobile (the receipt will generate a code, you enter the code into your phone, and it'll pay them automatically. The app will first show the full amount, then after you submit it, it will send you a confirmation email or with the amount you paid as $10 less.)
+ Happy hour: M-F 4-6 and M-Su 10pm-close.

+Rice bowl recommended
-Fish and Chips NOT recommended
+Sweet potato fries recommended
+Ballast Point Calico Amber Ale recommended

Overall, I enjoyed the food. Don't worry I didn't finish it. Boxed the leftovers. It was good, and I may stop by to try some stuff on happy hour.

excerpts: Sweet potato fries on point.
Excellent service and friendly demeanor.
sweet potato fries.author: Brad Y.
sweet potato fries.review: They didn't mind that I brought in a big electric longboard and took me straight to a table with an outlet so I could charge it. Fish and shrimp tacos were fantastic! Sweet potato fries on point. Excellent service and friendly demeanor.

excerpts: and we chose the sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: Teresa W.
sweet potato fries.review:
I tried this for the first time after being recommended by a friend.  Seating was pretty fast and it came with a small dish of complementary Chickpeas and Pretzel crackers.  After reading the reviews, we decided to try the California Style Hawaiian Poke and Mahi Mahi Tacos.  What I loved the best of this place is the Hawaiian Poke!  That is super delicious and it comes with chips that you can use to scoop and eat with the poke.  That's probably my favorite out of the two that we tried.  Trying the mahi mahi tacos was just okay.  From the reviews about the tacos, I was looking forward to it and it was a bit of a disappointment.  I was expecting something super delicious but it gets the job done.  Apparently, it came with fries too and we chose the sweet potato fries.  They were okay as well. 

Overall, food was okay.  Definitely love the poke and will return for it.  Not so much for the tacos.  I love the staff though because they were super friendly.  On two occasions, I was trying to take photos with a friend and both a waitress and a waiter offered to help us take a photo.  That was a very sweet gesture of them!  Will definitely return for the awesome staff and the yummy poke!  I might try something new next time instead of the tacos.

excerpts: We really loved the sweet potato fries for an appetizer.
Some food, like sweet potato fries, tacos were served on a sheet of a newspaper which happened to be a Hawaiian Tribune from April 1, 1901.
sweet potato fries.author: Michelle R.
sweet potato fries.review:
A very solid place, with good food and great presentation.

It is an all-occasion spot, you can come for a casual Sunday dinner or to celebrate a birthday.  You can see  all ages and all kind of groups of people, from families with babies to ones with  older parents and everyone in between.  Groups of friends, ages from  20 something to seniors.

We really loved the sweet potato fries for an appetizer.  They came with red chili pepper sauce (yumm) and wasabi aioli.

My mahi mahi tacos were really good. They came with avocado and lettuce, a small bowl of beans on the side, and you could have an option of fries or salad with it.  There were 2 tacos on a plate.  I don't like huge portions, so this was plenty.

 My husband had a bowl of grilled mahi mahi with brown rice, roasted pineapple, caramelized onions and shaved coconut.   He really enjoyed it and could barely finish his plate, it was so much food.

We were so full that we couldn't  even  finish our side of warm edamame.

My son had fish and chips.  I tried his fries, the seasoning on them was a really good combination.

Some food, like sweet potato fries, tacos were served on a sheet of a newspaper which happened to be a Hawaiian Tribune from April 1, 1901.  Pretty cool, although I've seen it before (at an Italian Seafood place, on Irving and 9th, not far from this one.)

Cons:  The California roll that my daughter ordered was a bit dry. It also was overpriced at $9.  The wine was overpriced too, at $9 a glass, and it wasn't that much wine in the glass.  Also, they were out of one of Hawaiian Poke tonight - spiced tofu.

Nevertheless, we enjoyed our dinner and definitely will be back.

excerpts: Ordered the vietnamese steak sandwich with sweet potato fries ($12).
sweet potato fries.author: Lauren K.
sweet potato fries.review:
I've been here before a couple of times for dinner but my friends wanted to go to their happy hour from 4-6pm so we sat in the bar area. I got there shortly after happy hour ended even though my friends were able to enjoy it so I had to order off the regular menu. Ordered the vietnamese steak sandwich with sweet potato fries ($12). 

Service just really sucked. I get that it's busy and there were only 2 people in that area: 1 waiter and 1 bartender but like isn't the whole point to get people in and then out of the restaurant? Not make them sit there for 10 minutes whille you do random stuff. Yeah, I could have got up to get them but I didn't feel like it after I did it 3 times before.

I love the feel of the restaurant and I get that they're busy but don't think I'd come back for awhile. The price, service, and quality are just O-K.

excerpts:
- Sweet potato fries - yummy
- Sticky Ribs Korean BBQ - I liked it!
sweet potato fries.author: Tammy F.
sweet potato fries.review:
We came for a Mother's Day Dinner with my Mom and brother. We made a reservation and waited about 15 minutes for our table. 

[ S E R V I C E ] 
- Our waitress Chelsea is super friendly. She came back to check on us multiple time. GREAT SERVICE!

[ F O O D ]
- ORIGINAL HAWAIIAN POKE - yummmy!! must get! I love the combination of avocado, tuna, seaweed salad, etc.
- Fish and Chip - I've had better but its not bad here...I liked the Jalepeno tartar.
- Calfornia Salmon Sandwich - my brother said it was one of the best sandwich he ever had.
- Sweet potato fries - yummy
- Sticky Ribs Korean BBQ - I liked it! Finger-lickin' good!

[ A M B I A N C E ]
- Bar is nice with TVs so you can watch the game.
- Restaurant seemed cleaned.
- Spacious! I love the booths!

[ P A R K I N G ]
- Parking lot located right next to the restaurant but there are limited spaces and they are usually occupied. I usually look for street parking, which could be hard around that area.

[ H A P P Y H O U R ]
- Happy hour from 4:00 to 6:00 Monday through Friday and everyday from 10pm to closing. Will definitely come back and try the HH.

excerpts: Had the three taco platter with traditional Baja, mahi-mahi, and cabo shrimp and side of sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: Raymond N.
sweet potato fries.review: Had the three taco platter with traditional Baja, mahi-mahi, and cabo shrimp and side of sweet potato fries. Also had the mixed catch fish and chips. The fish and chips were okay but I don't really know how to describe the tacos. The tortilla was on the dry side and most of it was filled with cabbage, a lot of thick slices of cabbage. The ingredients didn't really hold together, just felt like hasty assortment of ingredients thrown together. The mahi-mahi was really dry. The crispy Alaskan cod was mildly crispy so I ended up eating just the fish. You can get much better taco at any taco truck. Service was good. Environment was clean.

excerpts: We ordered sweet potato fries and stuck with drafts.
Bff enjoyed her IPA
and I got Sapporo, but
that got boring
so I ordered my fave bourbon, Basil Hayden at $10 a pour.
sweet potato fries.author: Lily Y.
sweet potato fries.review:
Thanks to Pacific Catch for staying open for HH on xmas eve... got to fit in some girlie time with the bff. 

Happy hour 4-6pm, only served at bar, is limited with drafts at $4 and bar bites from $3-7.  We ordered sweet potato fries and stuck with drafts.  Bff enjoyed her IPA and I got Sapporo, but that got boring so I ordered my fave bourbon, Basil Hayden at $10 a pour.  We also ordered calamari, a few more drafts for her, and I, a Yamazaki, also a $10 pour.

The bartender was courteous & friendly, but as it got a bit busier, our order of calamari was forgotten and one of the drafts was a wrong pour.  An apology was given and our calamari + couple drinks comp'd.  When the bill came, it was an ease on our holiday budgeted wallets.  We definitely left happy during these visited hours! 

CONVENIENCE: ***** [Located at the corner of 9th & Irving, FREE parking lot available, but usually filled.]
AMBIANCE: *** [Casual, dining room, outdoor seating, & bar area for HH or light eating.]
SERVICE: ***** [Stellar service, but not perfect.  Made a mistake and definitely made up for it!]
PRICE: $$ [$3-10 per food/drink at happy hour.]
OVERALL: **** [4-stars... altho not my first choice for HH, it's 1/2 off wine Tuesdays so I'll definitely be back for that!]

Nuff said.

[#63 of 100 YELP CHALLENGE 2013]

excerpts: When the food arrived I concluded that the waitress must've heard my order wrong because she gave sweet potato fries instead of the spicy tuna roll.
When I told her that they got my order wrong, she generously gave me the sweet potato fries on the house.
sweet potato fries.author: Lisa H.
sweet potato fries.review:
Came here for lunch to satisfy a seafood craving. Went late in the afternoon and there wasn't any wait to be seated. I ordered the shrimp ceviche and the spicy tuna roll. Even though they gave us complimentary edamame and crackers while we waited for our food, the wait was excruciatingly long. It took about 20 minutes to get our food. When the food arrived I concluded that the waitress must've heard my order wrong because she gave sweet potato fries instead of the spicy tuna roll. When I told her that they got my order wrong, she generously gave me the sweet potato fries on the house. 

The shrimp ceviche with avocado was delicious! It had a lot of flavor to it and the portion was generous as well. The spicy tuna roll was delicious too except for the fact that they put watercress in it (yuck). The sweet potatoes were my favorite! It was lightly salted and it came with a cream wasabi and sweet&sour sauce. 

Four stars because I think the service is great but prices are a little too steep. I understand that it's seafood and that's always gonna be expensive but the ceviche and sushi roll cost me 9 dollars each! 

Overall, this place is worth coming to. The quality of the food and the service is great.

excerpts: Oh and always opt for those sweet potato fries.
I've never had a bad experience and whoever hires all the servers finds the nicest people in the City!
sweet potato fries.author: Krislyn T.
sweet potato fries.review: This is a great place for lunch and has become my go-to spot where I take all my friends.  The modern decor is refreshing.  Their rice bowls and salads are wonderful with the half rice and salad option in the rice bowl.  My favorite protein for these is the mahi mahi although the salmon and crab salad are a close second.  I got stuck on the tropical iced tea for a long time but recently tried the sparkling lemonade which offers free refills and is delicious!  Oh and always opt for those sweet potato fries.  I've never had a bad experience and whoever hires all the servers finds the nicest people in the City!

excerpts: Sweet potato fries and an ecstasy roll for appetizer seriously hit the table in 7 minutes flat...
i was so happy!!!
sweet potato fries.author: Bethany Y.
sweet potato fries.review:
I was so starving after we were done with the park, and stressed from chasing the kids this place has the perfect atmosphere for calming down.

Our server was busy but our drinks came quickly.  A fantastic blood orange margarita for me ( i had just had a bad one the day before so i was really craving one...) they also happened to have my favorite fume blanc, ferrari carano.

Sweet potato fries and an ecstasy roll for appetizer seriously hit the table in 7 minutes flat... i was so happy!!! The sushi was so fresh tasting i could have eaten double!!!

The kids teriyaki chicken was too dry for kids and it was left untouched but the chipotle bbq chicken breast on my salad was lightly seasoned and perfectly cooked. Super yummy!!! Also my boyfriend's salmon disappeared before i got a good look at it but i did taste the sauce that came with his artichoke... some kind of basil dill aioli? sooo nice!!! i will be trying to copy it in my kitchen right away!!!

Next time I am in town I will be back!!

excerpts: but I love their sweet potato fries (the only reason I wanted to come in the first place haha)
sweet potato fries.author: Tiffany V.
sweet potato fries.review:
I think the text my best friend sent me yesterday morning sums up my feelings about Pacific Catch, "wtf wtfff why are you always at pacific catch crazy woman" Haha. 

I didn't even realize how much I loved this place until I kept finding myself there. It wasn't even until the third time did I realize they had a parking lot next to the restaurant! How handy! Such a rare find in San Francisco. 

Fish & Chips: Everyone loves these but I don't think its their best thing there. You should definitely get 4 pieces though since its $14 and 2 pieces is already $10. The pieces of fish aren't that big. I love the sauces it comes with but the Jalapeno Tartar sauce was never spicy to me. I think the coleslaw side is far too small as well but I love their sweet potato fries (the only reason I wanted to come in the first place haha)

California Roll Salad: I love this salad! Although I had it at every meal and I got kind of sick of it at the end. The salad is huge and you'll probably have a hard time finishing it. It comes with a ton of avocado and a even bigger mound of real crab. It really does taste like a california roll! I think its around $13. 

Hawaiian Poke Brown Rice Bowl: I never would've thought of ordering this if it wasn't for Yelp! I'm eating it right now as I type. I had a ton leftover because it wasn't the best thing to eat yesterday morning hungover! By far my favorite thing from Pacific Catch. You can also get it with white rice or 1/2 rice & 1/2 greens. 

Mochi Fondue: Nothing special. Just 3 mochi balls cut in half and a little bowl of tasty melty chocolate to dip it in. There was way too much chocolate in the bowl though and I felt bad for wasting it. I don't think its worth the money since it isn't very creative and you could just make the same thing yourself for far less. 

There is never a wait when I go. My friend and I were about to get dinner at the Presidio location until we drove by it noticed how tiny and packed it was. We just drove all the way to the 9th street location. This location is huge. Service has always been nice as well. I probably wouldn't go on a first date here though as it is a little bit commercial and there are tons of better first date restaurants in the area.

excerpts: Came with a side of sweet potato fries which were super delicious, so I recommend yall get that if you come here.
sweet potato fries.author: Carmen C.
sweet potato fries.review:
Me and my friend were looking for sit-down pretty afforable and worth it place to eat. So we stopped by here and it seemed decent and there was no wait. I wouldn't say that this place was worth it. I left thinking I could totally eat more food, but I already spent more than I wanted for a quick dinner. 


White Tuna Poke- not my favorite dish. It was pretty fresh, but the sauce was very sweet and seemed kinda creamy and citrusy. The wonton strips it came with was mostly folded and I could not eat it with the tuna. I probably would try something else next time.

Fish Tacos- 
I got the 3 taco platter plate to share. First off, I got the grilled Mahi-Mahi tacos. Kind of dry, to be honest, and pretty bland. The steak taco was pretty good! very filling! Then for the third taco, I got the shrimp one. The shrimp were pretty large and fried and it was my favorite taco out of the three. Came with a side of sweet potato fries which were super delicious, so I recommend yall get that if you come here.

excerpts: The Poke and Sweet Potato Fries were overwhelming mentioned in many reviews, so I decided to entrust in my fellow Yelpers
and I was not disappointed.
SWEET POTATO FRIES ($3.50 for a Side Order):
DANGEROUSLY ADDICTING!
The fresh-out-of the fryer sweet potato fries were crispy throughout with a soft, fluffy center.
The light sprinkle of salt brought out the natural sweetness of the potatoes.
There were two accompanying sauces:
Thai Sweet Chili and Wasabi Aioli.
The is one of the few times that Yelpers didn't lead me astray, so if you're coming to Pacific Catch, definitely order the Poke and Sweet Potato Fries.
You will NOT be disappointed!
sweet potato fries.author: Cherylynn N.
sweet potato fries.review:
The Third Time was Definitely a Charm...

Before my Yelping hiatus which started two years ago, I had come to this Pacific Catch location two other times and was not impressed, not even remotely. The food was mediocre at the very best and forgettable.

On Friday, 5.27.11, I came to Pacific Catch for my friend's Birthday Dinner. We had reservations for a party of 14 at 7 pm. Upon arrival, it took about 5-7 minutes for them to set up our table and be seated.

F O O D:
This time I did my due diligence and made sure I looked at the other Yelper's reviews to see what to order. The Poke and Sweet Potato Fries were overwhelming mentioned in many reviews, so I decided to entrust in my fellow Yelpers and I was not disappointed. Thank you, Yelpers!

*HAWAIIAN POKE WASABI BOWL w/ Tobiko & Brown Rice ($14.95 +$2 for Tobiko):  YUMMY!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/3bxO8T8U96uKu2numljjsw?select=GXy8_YmqbfOJ6fPhUrOi7w

The poke was hands down the BEST I've ever had! The thick chunks of tuna were uber fresh, tender and succulent. The soy wasabi sauce, albeit a bit salty, gave the tuna a nice savory sweet flavor with a hint of spice while the sesame seeds and roasted nori gave it a touch of nuttiness. The accoutrements of wakame salad, daikon sprouts, cucumber, and ginger were all very fresh and crisp. The brown rice, however, was undercooked and hard.

*SWEET POTATO FRIES ($3.50 for a Side Order): DANGEROUSLY ADDICTING!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/3bxO8T8U96uKu2numljjsw?select=neBvXM0nJIZivB8_tiEe7g

The fresh-out-of the fryer sweet potato fries were crispy throughout with a soft, fluffy center. The light sprinkle of salt brought out the natural sweetness of the potatoes. There were two accompanying sauces: Thai Sweet Chili and Wasabi Aioli. I preferred the Wasabi Aioli as it added a layer of creaminess with a slight nose tingle from the wasabi.

S E R V I C E:
Very friendly but slow which is understandable because we were in a large party and the restaurant was packed. Nevertheless, the staff did a good job making sure everyone got their entrees at the same time although the last three took 5 minutes longer than the others. I did have to ask several times for my water glass to be refilled so perhaps leaving a water pitcher for larger parties may be a good idea.

A M B I A N C E / D É C O R:
Contemporary and fun; Pacific Catch is good for casual lunch and dinners. Since it's a large restaurant, it's also good for large parties. The noise level is very, very loud though so it's very likely you'll have to scream across the table if you want to be heard.

P A R K I N G:
Although Pacific Catch has a small lot with a 10-car capacity, getting a parking space in that lot is like hitting the jackpot. Street parking is no easy task either so make sure to allot an extra 15 minutes to find parking. Your best bet is looking for parking at Golden Gate Park which is just across the street. 

The is one of the few times that Yelpers didn't lead me astray, so if you're coming to Pacific Catch, definitely order the Poke and Sweet Potato Fries. You will NOT be disappointed!

excerpts: The good: fish tacos, sweet potato fries and their Happy Hour.
sweet potato fries.author: T J.
sweet potato fries.review:
Very mixed feelings about this place. The good: fish tacos, sweet potato fries and their Happy Hour.

The bad: I was served a taco containing a 1/4" chunk of hard plastic (nearly as hard as metal, not soft plastic). I discovered this on my first bite, and it hurt the hell out of my crown and upper tooth for many days.

The worse: when the "manager" came over to deal with it, she looked at the remains of what I had to spit out and said "oh, that shouldn't be in there, we'll make you a new one," and that was it. No "wow, are you hurt?" or anything even feigning empathy.

To their credit, I did get a replacement taco that DIDN'T have a dangerous foreign object inside, that was awesome. Even more awesome after being ignored for the next half hour after food delivery was they took an entire twelve dollars off the bill for nearly requiring me to do an emergency visit to the dentist (or possibly the hospital had I swallowed). 

Their response was appropriate for an instance where they served the wrong drink, not where they served contaminated and dangerous food that caused injury. We were stunned and almost amused at the level of their tone-deafness.

The "real" manager came by after we had paid and briefly discussed it then tried to take my money again. Then the kitchen chef came by and actually apologized and showed some empathy for what had happened, but at that point it was too little and far too late. But he was the one guy who seemed to give a damn about what their mistake did.

I have given it a couple weeks before writing this. Wrote a note to to their corporate headquarters while still at the table and later received back some mumbo-jumbo that didn't really indicate they gave a sh_t. They also promised to get back to me but they didn't. 

-------
UPDATE: Within a day of posting this review, I finally heard back from them (thanks, power of social media...). I'll bump it up a star just because I got the sense that management is aware of ongoing issues at this location and the guy was real with me. The food is decent, location good and prices reasonable, I would really like this place to succeed and never put anyone else through this (or worse). Not sure if I will return, but I hope for everyone's sake this is a turning point where they wake up and fix the service issues that I and others have been yelping about.

excerpts: Husband got the fish and chips sampler that included fried fish, oysters, and coconut shrimp along with sweet potato fries.
All were very good.
Waited for happy hour to start at 10pm to order drinks and got 2 margaritas.
Very tasty and only $6 each!
Overall nice place and would come back.
sweet potato fries.author: Irene R.
sweet potato fries.review:
My husband and I came here last night (Friday) around 930pm and easily found a table in the bar area. I ordered the California poke which was good but heavier and creamier than I thought it would be. Husband got the fish and chips sampler that included fried fish, oysters, and coconut shrimp along with sweet potato fries. All were very good.
Waited for happy hour to start at 10pm to order drinks and got 2 margaritas. Very tasty and only $6 each! Overall nice place and would come back.

excerpts: Both of these go very well with their sweet potato fries.
In addition to salads and sandwiches they offer a somewhat decent variety of sushi, all of which is very good.
sweet potato fries.author: Chris S.
sweet potato fries.review:
I come here frequently with my wife and mom for lunch dates in between classes. The restaurant itself has nice decor, as well as a small parking lot on the side. It is always very well kept up and clean. We never have issues getting a booth, and service is always very good. 

They have a great selection of salads and sandwiches. My personal favorites are the BBQ chicken salad/sandwich and the California Salmon Sandwich. Both of these go very well with their sweet potato fries. In addition to salads and sandwiches they offer a somewhat decent variety of sushi, all of which is very good.

excerpts: The thai coconut shrimp, poke, and sweet potato fries are always in some kind of rotation when I go.
sweet potato fries.author: Kaitlin E.
sweet potato fries.review:
I have gone to Pacific Catch since it opened and love it. The thai coconut shrimp, poke, and sweet potato fries are always in some kind of rotation when I go. I also love the salmon salad. PC always has specials as well which adds variation to my rotation! lol
The staff is always nice and the wait time usually isn't too long (20min or less) especially in the day time.

excerpts: Fish & Chips - opted for the sweet potato fries - a must do!
The cod still moist & perfectly fried with a crunchy coating.
Not greasy...totally yummy!
sweet potato fries.author: Kim S.
sweet potato fries.review:
Smart to capitalize on the World Series fever.  The 2 flat screens over the bar were showing the game with the sound on!  I wouldn't have known that except for the chalkboard sign outside.  Scored a table dead center to 1 of the tv's so we were set.  Oh the food...we shared...

Fish & Chips - opted for the sweet potato fries - a must do!  The cod still moist & perfectly fried with a crunchy coating.  Not greasy...totally yummy!  Gobbled it up.

Hawaiian Teriyaki rice bowl w/ marinated skirt steak, brown rice, shiitake mushrooms, grilled pineapple, glazed carrots, edamame, crispy sweet onions, sesame seeds & teriyaki sauce.  Ordered to be "healthy" & balance the fried indugence.  It was good & the brown rice not dry.

Oh, I like the pretzel goldfish & edamame samples you get when ordering entrees.

excerpts: as we browsed through the menu, he mentioned that the sweet potato fries were a must.
I love sweet potato fries, so.... why not!
they were delicious with two choices of sauces.
a sweet and tangy
sauce(usually eaten with egg rolls) and a wasabi ginger kind.
I wasn't a big fan of wasabi or ginger haha.
but the fries were yummy!
sweet potato fries.author: Audrey K.
sweet potato fries.review:
I've been waiting to try this place! I've heard mixed reviews from people I knew. but, my boyfriend said he's been here many times and said it was good. 
we came around 11, right when they open and it was getting relatively busy! so I'm taking that as a good thing. as we browsed through the menu, he mentioned that the sweet potato fries were a must. I love sweet potato fries, so.... why not! they were delicious with two choices of sauces. a sweet and tangy sauce(usually eaten with egg rolls) and a wasabi ginger kind. I wasn't a big fan of wasabi or ginger haha. but the fries were yummy! then we ordered salmon poke. the salmon was nicely seasoned with small cuts of avocado too. it was with a side of crispy wonton chips to compliment the appetizer even more. it had a nice refreshing flavor. then...... onto the main course! I ordered the Hawaiian teriyaki pan Asian bowl with grilled chicken. they had the option to change the white rice to 1/2 brown rice and 1/2 salad. so that's what I did. I didn't know the bowl was going to be so huge.... omg. it came with crispy onions, mushrooms, grilled pineapple, carrots. it wasn't too overly sauced, but the chicken tasted very chewy. I don't know, it was weird. haha. but everything else in the bowl was good. my boyfriend ordered the Korean bbq bowl with white rice and sticky ribs. let me tell you.... the ribs were PRETTY sticky, hahah. we both barely even touched our bowls because we were so filled up on the two appetizers.. but we took them to go. and for two appetizers and two main courses, the total only came out to be $50! so I thought that was a good deal. the presentation of each dish was really presentable and nicely put together. the interior of the place was huge and you could opt for outdoor seating too. I literally felt as if I was dining in Hawaii. I do plan to come back, but my eyes were definitely bigger than my stomach... haha.

excerpts: I love the Tuna Poki Wasabi Bowl with half greens and half brown rice and my husband enjoys the Three tacos (you choose which ones) and sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: Karina A.
sweet potato fries.review:
Pacific Catch is one of my favorite spots right now. There is usually never a line, the service is nice and quick and food is delicious!

I love the Tuna Poki Wasabi Bowl with half greens and half brown rice and my husband enjoys the Three tacos (you choose which ones) and sweet potato fries.

Recommend to all my friends all the time!

excerpts: Don't be boring with the regular fries, and mix-and-match the spicy fries with the sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: Kevin W.
sweet potato fries.review:
I'm still wish that Pacific Catch's Happy Hour would go past 6PM for us poor working saps.  GRRR!

-- Spicy Pacific Martini ($7 HH) - My new favorite is strong and spicy with a few pepper seeds floating inside.  Much better and more unique than the typical $4.50 HH well drinks or the $6 HH well martinis.

-- Basket of Fries ($4 HH) - Don't be boring with the regular fries, and mix-and-match the spicy fries with the sweet potato fries.

-- Peruvian Ceviche ($6 HH) - Purple potato chips and a great tasting yellow ceviche with generous helpings of avocado, tomatoes, and fish.

-- Hawaiian Poke ($9.5) - I still love the Poke even though it's not on Happy Hour anymore.  It's that good.

-- Spicy Tuna Roll ($6 HH) - The tuna had a little too much something (aioli?) mixed in, so the roll was a pinkish color rather than a deep red.  Not pretty on the eyes, but pretty in the tummy.

Extend the Happy Hour, goshdarnit!

excerpts: We had a lot of dishes, fish and chips, deep fried Brussels sprouts, sweet potato fries, Hawaiian poke rice bowl, and the daily fish.
Everything was cooked well,with lots of flavor.
Fish and chips had an especially nice batter and the cod was nice and flaky.
sweet potato fries.author: John R.
sweet potato fries.review:
Great service and really tasty food. The parking lot was a nice relief from a crowded area.

We had a lot of dishes, fish and chips, deep fried Brussels sprouts, sweet potato fries, Hawaiian poke rice bowl, and the daily fish. Everything was cooked well,with lots of flavor. Fish and chips had an especially nice batter and the cod was nice and flaky.

excerpts: Ordered the special 3 poke combo, with sweet potato fries, and a mahi mahi fish taco duet.
sweet potato fries.author: Benjamin B.
sweet potato fries.review:
Second time here, first time this location. Reserved tables via open table and had no problem walking in and getting seated. Our waitress was super nice. 

Ordered the special 3 poke combo, with sweet potato fries, and a mahi mahi fish taco duet. 

Everything tasted superb, A little pricey, but I still really enjoyed it

excerpts: Sweet potato fries are also really yummy.
sweet potato fries.author: Stephanie L.
sweet potato fries.review:
I loveeeeee their Dulce de Leche Spring Rolls dessert!! I have to get it every time I go here!
