I like getting the Pacific Steak Island Tacos (marinated grilled steak, crispy sweet onions, cabbage & sriracha aioli), but I think they took it off their menu, but if you ask for it they will still make it. Sweet potato fries are also really yummy.

One time I came here and my server kept on forgetting to bring me utensils and water so to make up for it she offered us Iced Teas or Thai Iced Teas on the house. I worked at a Thai restaurant, so I wanted to try something I haven't already. We decided to get the Lemongrass Infused Tea and the Tropical Iced Tea. The ice teas were unsweetened, bleh :/ I like it sweet.

I want to come back and try the Poke Wasabi Bowl!

excerpts: Their sweet potato fries were close to perfection.
sweet potato fries.author: Claudia T.
sweet potato fries.review:
I went to lunch with my mom and two family friends. We got seated right away which was great but then I felt like the waitress was hanging over us rushing us to order. The restaurant was close to empty. She brought our drinks and then gave us a few moments to continue to look over the menu. I ordered the nojito which is a mojito sans alcohol. It was awesome. I even got two of them for the price of one because the bartender accidentally made two. Hey, can't complain. I ordered the Tom Kha soup and California Roll. The soup was absolutely amazing, bursting with flavors. Loved it. The California Roll was a major disappointment. I could have gone to Safeway and bought a better roll. So sad. The taco bowls were HUGE and were brought home as leftovers. Their sweet potato fries were close to perfection.

Unfortunately the service was seriously lacking. The server took my mom's food and brought it back to the kitchen and put it in a to-go box. Our friend also asked to take hers home and our waitress practically threw the to-go box at her. Our friend also asked for a second glass of wine and let me tell you what a process that was. So that was super weird. It literally took our waitress an HOUR to bring us our bill. An hour? Really? Luckily we had the day off so we had plenty of time to kill and catch-up but seriously, how can it take that long to bring us our bill? Especially when the waitress asked us if we wanted anything else and we said no. Wouldn't that be your clue to bring us our bill? It was great for people watching since we had such an opportunity to watch people come and go. 

I  will return because I really liked the soup and there were other items on the menu that looked really good. Hopefully the service improves.

excerpts: My wife enjoyed a very generous portion of fried coconut shrimp with sweet potato fries.
My dinner was a very nice plate of crusted filet of sole (allegedly 'local' sole) with brown rice and asparagus.
Sole is my weak spot, and I eat it nearly everywhere
I can-
and this was truly tasty
and I cleared the plate completely.
sweet potato fries.author: Andy S.
sweet potato fries.review:
We had an excellent meal at Pacific Catch in the Inner Sunset a couple of nights ago.
The place was extremely busy on a Monday night around 8pm, which is a testament to the quality and variety on the menu, as well as the reasonable pricing.

My wife enjoyed a very generous portion of fried coconut shrimp with sweet potato fries.  My dinner was a very nice plate of crusted filet of sole (allegedly 'local' sole) with brown rice and asparagus.  Sole is my weak spot, and I eat it nearly everywhere I can- and this was truly tasty and I cleared the plate completely.  Also ordered was a spicy tuna roll- while it was ok, large and generous, and I completely devastated it- the sushi will not be what brings me back here.  The sole, overall great menu diversity, and the Drake's beer on tap (dark and delicious) will.  $60 for everything including the tip was quite reasonable from my perspective. See you again soon (but probably your Chestnut St restaurant as its closer to my home).

excerpts: The sweet potato fries were recommended by Eileen H. Boy
she was right!
crispy and simply adorned with rock salt, it comes with two dipping sauces.
I didn't like the flavored mayo nor the sweet chili sauce, but the fries are good on their own.
sweet potato fries.author: Janice C.
sweet potato fries.review:
On my only day off, do I really want to spend it with my crazy family?!

"Oh, don't worry, your dad's not coming" my mom said.

* If you know my 'rents, I'm sure you'd also say thank God! *

Since it was just my mom and I, we decided to have lunch at Pacific Catch.  She loves seafood -- fish, shrimps, crab, baked, fried or broiled.  This place was ideal since it was walking distance to GG park, which we were headed to after lunch.

We picked out a couple of items and decided to share.  

The sweet potato fries were recommended by Eileen H. Boy she was right!  crispy and simply adorned with rock salt, it comes with two dipping sauces. I didn't like the flavored mayo nor the sweet chili sauce, but the fries are good on their own. (a side order is enough for two people)

The California roll was made with real crab but surprisingly lacking in flavor.  I've never been so thankful for soy sauce to dip it in.

On to the poke dish -- huge chunks of ahi tuna perfectly marinated in a soy sesame dressing.  It'll be easier to chew on it if the cut was smaller, but I shouldn't complain because I got my money's worth on that dish. 

Save your $4.95 on the grilled yellowtail taco. (it was a special for that day) The taco was small and the fish was overwhelmed with all the other trimmings in there. 

My mom loved her grilled mahi mahi with pineapple salsa. Served with a side of bok choy, onion strings and a big scoop of rice.  She couldn't finish this dish, not because it wasn't delicious, but the portions were so huge!

Service is very good, both from our waitress and the bussers, constantly refilling water and taking away used dishes. 

I'm curious about their happy hour, so I may come back for that!

excerpts: Everything were fantastic, especially the sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: Alice W.
sweet potato fries.review:
I've been to this place several times and also their location in the marina. I absolutely adore the rice bowls here!! What other way to wind down after a marathon than a big bowl of the good stuff?

Surprisingly, my three friends who rode their bikes were able to get there ahead of time after the race and hold a table for 10!! I was expecting an epic wait but for some reason, the place wasn't all that full. I guess runners wanted deep fried goodness after their runs (who can blame them?).

My boyfriend and I shared the grilled ahi tuna rice bowl with extra fish and brown rice. They even split the bowl for us into two servings! We also shared the Peruvian ceviche. I have to say the ceviche wasn't their finest hour. The fish wasn't raw and the sauce was oily. In the past, I've also tried their sandwiches, fish tacos and sushi. Everything were fantastic, especially the sweet potato fries.

This location is much bigger than the place in the marina and great for groups. Can't wait to have another rice bowl again!

excerpts: The sweet potato fries are delicious, especially with the white dipping sauce (I asked what it was one time, but I've since forgotten).
The sushi rolls are all a pretty good hh deal too, and although definitely not authentic in any way, they are flavorful and fresh.
I like the coconut shrimp except for the fact that they are hard to take off the skewer
sweet potato fries.author: Caroline K.
sweet potato fries.review:
I can't believe I haven't reviewed Pac Catch yet.  I have been here countless times with friends and classmates celebrating the end of midterms or finals, birthdays, girls' nights out, etc.  Definitely try to come for happy hour (4-6pm or 10-close in the bar area only).  The drinks are kind of expensive normally, but they have some good hh deals.  Not super cheap, but better than normal prices and good quality.

We also love their appetizers.  The sweet potato fries are delicious, especially with the white dipping sauce (I asked what it was one time, but I've since forgotten).  The sushi rolls are all a pretty good hh deal too, and although definitely not authentic in any way, they are flavorful and fresh.  I like the coconut shrimp except for the fact that they are hard to take off the skewer and I almost always end up making a mess or dropping one on the floor (sacrilege!).

This has been one of my favorite hangouts over the past 4 years, and I will miss it when I've graduated!

excerpts:
I had seared ahi salad and a side of sweet potato fries. 
Everything was delicious, and ginger-lemongrass iced tea was very refreshing.
Service was fast and friendly.
A lady at the next table was asking about the seasoning on the fries, and the chef came out to talk to us and was very friendly. 
It's a great place, if you are in that area check it out!
sweet potato fries.author: Marina I.
sweet potato fries.review:
It's a small restaurant that serves amazing seafood. I had seared ahi salad and a side of sweet potato fries. Everything was delicious, and ginger-lemongrass iced tea was very refreshing.
Service was fast and friendly.
A lady at the next table was asking about the seasoning on the fries, and the chef came out to talk to us and was very friendly. 
It's a great place, if you are in that area check it out!

excerpts: some people wanted sweet potato fries and others wanted regular fries, the waitress was very nice in letting us get 1/2 portion of each so that everyone could be happy =]
the coconut shrimps were especially tasty and crispy on the outside, with the right balance of sweet and saltyness.
sweet potato fries.author: Tina A.
sweet potato fries.review:
A local girl mentioned that she loved this place.  Was in the area with good friends to try it out.

Food:

-Cabo Calamari:  this was some tasty calimari! could have been crispier though.  the chipotle aioli was quite unique and had just the right amount of heat in it.  

-Mixed Catch Basket: a variety of fried fish, coconut shrimp, and fried oyster with fries.  some people wanted sweet potato fries and others wanted regular fries, the waitress was very nice in letting us get 1/2 portion of each so that everyone could be happy =]  the coconut shrimps were especially tasty and crispy on the outside, with the right balance of sweet and saltyness.  the other fried items were average.

-Japanese Wasabi Rice Bowl [Hawaiian Ahi Poke]: there was a good amount of food on this dish, with a great mix of seaweed salad, shreded nori, sprouts, etc.  the ahi was fresh tasting and flavorful, however they could have done with less salt/soy sauce.  it made me very thristy, and the waitress did not come by to refill water.   although i did not taste the wasabi, the dish tasted savory/meaty.   I dont know if this was intentional, but the rice was cold, and a little hard..

- Special of the Day: Escolar with mashed potatoes and spinach:  this was the best dish of the bunch.   The fish was cooked to perfection, did not taste "fishy" and was nicely complemented by a mango-salsa type topping.  The mashed potatoes tasted buttery and fresh.  The spinach was garlicy, which is nice, and not grainy.  The amount of food you get for the price however is not worth it.


Service:

- the waitress was very friendly and made good suggestions on the type of food, splitting the fries, etc.  however we did not recieve any service after we got our food.  the water was not refilled until half an hour after it was empty, we were waiting a good 10 minutes before we could even get the bill.  


3 Stars:
Overall, I would maaaybe come back here if someone invited me (because of the above average food), but otherwise the price for the amount of food is not worth it, and the service is sub-par given that it was a pretty empty restaurant when we got there.

excerpts: The only thing good that we ordered was the basket of sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: Christine A.
sweet potato fries.review:
Ew. I came here again and we got HORRIBLE service. Our server didn't come to take our orders until almost 20 minutes after we were seated. The waiter also didn't collect our check way after we were ready to pay. The restaurant wasn't even that busy at the time! 

The food was not that good either. I had the Grilled Salmon Salad and the salmon was the driest shit of my life. The dressing was also bland and nothing special. The only thing good that we ordered was the basket of sweet potato fries.

Parking is a bitch because it's 9th and Irving. I really wouldn't have came here again if it wasn't for the fact that it's one of the bigger restaurants on the street, so it didn't have a wait. Now I know why...

excerpts: Sweet potato fries-Yum!
I'll be back tomorrow for lunch with friends.
sweet potato fries.author: Nancy S.
sweet potato fries.review:
I can't believe how picky San Francisco Yelp restaurant reviewers are!   I'm giving Pacific Catch 5 stars for food for the price.  Find me a better tuna sashimi rice bowl or salad bowl (or combination of both) and I'll eat my socks.  I've never seen this dish anywhere.  Its delicious and healthy. 
     Fish and chips are great.  Sweet potato fries-Yum!  I'll be back tomorrow for lunch with friends.

excerpts: I ordered the salmon salad and sweet potato fries.
The veggies in the salad were fresh, the dressing was good and the salmon was fresh and very tasty.
The sweet potato fries were light and tasty.
sweet potato fries.author: Sharon L.
sweet potato fries.review:
This is a great casual place to stop and eat if you are at Golden Gate Park.  

I ordered the salmon salad and sweet potato fries.  The veggies in the salad were fresh, the dressing was good and the salmon was fresh and very tasty.  The sweet potato fries were light and tasty.  Nothing had too much salt, which was very nice.

I also drank lemon-grass infused iced tea.  Very different and good.

The service was good and friendly.

excerpts: My mom's sandwich was equally delicious and the sweet potato fries were super crispy.
My dad enjoyed his fish and chips too but he mentioned that the regular fries were kinda soggy.
The fish, shrimp and oysters were battered just enough and crispy all around.
sweet potato fries.author: Juvi Anne B.
sweet potato fries.review:
First timer here with the parents and I must say, not bad. We came in for a late lunch around 1:30 pm on a Tuesday and there wasn't a lot of people. The ambiance was quite nice. I just wished we were sitting in a booth instead of a table close to the kitchen, but that's just me being picky. 

We ordered the wasabi ahi poke bowl, the California salmon sandwich and the mixed fish and chips. My ahi poke bowl was delicious! So fresh and the ahi poke was very flavorful. The wasabi sauce they use was soo good too! My only thing was the proportion to rice to the amount of poke. I had a ton of rice leftover. My mom's sandwich was equally delicious and the sweet potato fries were super crispy. My dad enjoyed his fish and chips too but he mentioned that the regular fries were kinda soggy. The fish, shrimp and oysters were battered just enough and crispy all around.  Prices are on the higher end, but it's seafood. 

Overall, we'll definitely come here again! :)

excerpts: My bf loves their sandwiches...nice piece of seafood and delicious crispy sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: Fannie S.
sweet potato fries.review:
If this is hard to read, sorry...but this is how I shorten it.

Drinks = Great.  I'm a lemon drop girl...so I like the Yuzu drop.   They make the fufu drinks, a nice bright color of pastels but they're strong.  I'm not a fan of their alcoholic punches though.  They have an awesome drink list though...wines, hard liquors, etc.  

Food = good.  I love their wasabi bowls, their appetizers, and their oysters.  Hey, I hate oysters, but this place gets me to eat 'em!  My bf loves their sandwiches...nice piece of seafood and delicious crispy sweet potato fries.

Service = good.  Refills on water.  Re-order on drinks.  Providing the appropriate plates, silverware.  

Seating = strange during their dinner hour.  Walk-in and reservations available.

Atmosphere = quiet with some music when not packed.  Really noisy when packed, but you can still carry some conversation through it.

Parking = pain, but that's typical in this area.  They do have a very small parking lot, which is generally full, unless you go at 'odd' hours...i.e. around 2 p.m.  


Caveat: Sometimes, they have a bad night, and they forget the drinks, mess up on the menus (i.e. wrong specials menu for every other person), or just a horridly executed entree...

I've been to the location on Chestnut, and it's a really small place, but this one is much bigger, and it's totally new...so I guess some things need time and adjustment.

excerpts: We also shared the sweet potato fries, ahi tuna salad, and mahi mahi tacos.
Every single dish was so delicious, and even though we were full after our meal, we didn't feel like we were about to explode
sweet potato fries.author: Melinda W.
sweet potato fries.review:
After many years of refusing sashimi, I've recently acquired the taste for raw fish, so my roommates decided to introduce me to the Hawaiian Poke at Pacific Catch. Wow, and I do mean WOW that is goooooood. Beautifully flavored and pairs well with the chips served in the appetizer dish. We also shared the sweet potato fries, ahi tuna salad, and mahi mahi tacos. Every single dish was so delicious, and even though we were full after our meal, we didn't feel like we were about to explode like we sometimes do after a carb binge.

Service was great and the interior was very well decorated. Made me feel like I was dining at a classy seaside resto (until I looked out the window and saw the traffic instead of the ocean, but whatever).

excerpts: The sweet potato fries with sweet chili sauce were very yummy.
sweet potato fries.author: Erica A.
sweet potato fries.review:
Been here a few times, and I really love the ambiance! I think it's really great that they are open past 10pm. Oh, AND there's a parking lot! Definite plus since it's an absolute pain to find parking in that area during dinner time, and meters in SF are too expensive!

I've gotten the wasabi ahi sandwich a few times, and I really do like it! The wasabi mayo is very good, and it's interesting that they put pickled ginger inside the sandwich. I love sushi ginger, so definite plus for me. The sweet potato fries with sweet chili sauce were very yummy. I had their spicy fries, which were too salty and soggy for me.

Service seems like a hit or miss.. When I went last night, our waiter was very unpleasant. He didn't check on us once during our meal, he walked up to us and just kind of stared at us for a few seconds before asking us to order. After we finished ordering our food, I had to shout after him to ask for a lemonade because he didn't bother asking if we wanted drinks.

By the end of the meal, when we were just kind of sitting there and talking, he walked up to us and just stared at me blankly for about 10 seconds before I just flat out asked "may I please have a box?"

Having worked in a food establishment before, I understand that shifts are long and by the end of the day people are usually just WORN out, but come on.. USE YOUR WORDS!

excerpts: I've heard so much about the sweet potato fries that I just had to try them.
And they didn't disappoint!
Great flavor and good texture (crispy outside, soft inside) with two dipping sauces.
Mmmm.
Definitely one of the better sweet potato fries I've eaten.
sweet potato fries.author: Jeff C.
sweet potato fries.review:
I couldn't decided between 3 and 4 stars, so I'll just go in between... 3.5 but round down to 3.  Now for me, a 3 star place is somewhere where I wasn't disappointed with, it just wouldn't be my VERY first choice in the area.  However, I did enjoy my visit to Pacific Catch for the most part.

I've heard so much about the sweet potato fries that I just had to try them.  And they didn't disappoint!  Great flavor and good texture (crispy outside, soft inside) with two dipping sauces.  Mmmm.  Definitely one of the better sweet potato fries I've eaten.  We also had the poke appetizer, that was a winner too!

For the main course, I ate the "Rising Sun" roll and my gf ate the "Let's Get Saucy Roll".  Not bad at all.  Our friends ordered the seared ahi bowl to share since they weren't very hungry.  It was a nice touch that they served it in two separate bowls for them.

The atmosphere and environment were really nice...  very clean and a pleasant place to eat.  But the issues that irked me was that it is a little bit pricey and the happy hour specials are only at the bar!  They wouldn't give us the specials at our table even though the place was around half full only.  Booooooo....

excerpts: I ordered the mixed catch basket, which comes with coconut shrimp, fried oysters, fish, and sweet potato fries.
I thought the coconut shrimp was kinda forgettable - something about it
didn't wow me.
The fish was definitely fresh but like the coconut shrimp, I was "whatever" about it.
I did, oddly enough, really like the fried oyster.
Maybe it's because it was the only thing in my basket that had tons of flavor?
And the sweet potato fries were kinda cold?
Or at least, they were not warm.
I love sweet potato fries and mine were just bland in a way.
sweet potato fries.author: Stephanie B.
sweet potato fries.review:
Eh - so much hype for this place and it really wasn't allll that. 

It's cute they give you goldfish and edamame to munch on but kinda weird they give a small amount. But then again, you don't want to eat too much!

You MUST MUST MUST order the Hawaiian poke as an appetizer. It was my favorite dish of the night. The wonton chips were perfectly crispy and well cooked (also had a bit of a sweet flavor), and the ahi-tuna was melt in your mouth DELISH! I loved it. 

After the poke though, everything else fell kinda short.

The cabo calamari was good but not unique or better than other calamari dishes I have tried. Calamari is always the standard appetizer, but I say get the Hawaiian poke instead.

I ordered the mixed catch basket, which comes with coconut shrimp, fried oysters, fish, and sweet potato fries. I thought the coconut shrimp was kinda forgettable - something about it didn't wow me. The fish was definitely fresh but like the coconut shrimp, I was "whatever" about it. I did, oddly enough, really like the fried oyster. Maybe it's because it was the only thing in my basket that had tons of flavor? And the sweet potato fries were kinda cold? Or at least, they were not warm. I love sweet potato fries and mine were just bland in a way.

They also don't give you enough sauce for your food.

I'm hoping that maybe I ordered the wrong thing? Or maybe at the wrong time? I would just come back for the Hawaiian poke!

excerpts: Meanwhile on the other side of the table, my friend had the mixed seafood platter and had no complaints, and I also got to sample some of the sweet potato fries for the first time -
those are BOMB.
sweet potato fries.author: Felix C.
sweet potato fries.review:
I usually patronize the Pacific Catch in Campbell, but I was in San Francisco one night and was in the mood for some Asian-seafood fusion, so I thought the Pacific Catch here would be a safe fall-back.

My friend and I were quickly seated, and I ordered the California Salmon sandwich - one of my usual entrees at the Campbell branch. The salmon was slightly dry, the bread was a bit chewier than I'd like, and the spicy fries that arrived with the sandwich were soggy. Meh. Meanwhile on the other side of the table, my friend had the mixed seafood platter and had no complaints, and I also got to sample some of the sweet potato fries for the first time - those are BOMB. We also ordered the Let's Get Saucy sushi roll, which was just dandy (although its pretty hard to screw up sushi).

The service here was decent. Our server was very friendly and had a good sense of humor, but didn't stop by the table very often. Whenever we needed something, we'd spend several minutes trying to flag him down cause he was consistently MIA for long periods of time.

Overall I had higher hopes for this Pacific Catch, especially considering this is San Francisco. I won't be returning and I definitely cannot recommend this location.

excerpts: The sweet potato fries were okay; they were on the soggy side.
The 2nd order of sweet potato fries ended up being on the House since we complained about how slow the service was.
sweet potato fries.author: Kathy W.
sweet potato fries.review:
Review for late night happy hour.

Mediocre food. The best was the wasabi and chipotle sauces for the fried calamari. The sweet potato fries were okay; they were on the soggy side. The 2nd order of sweet potato fries ended up being on the House since we complained about how slow the service was.

Horrible service. The restaurant wasn't even full. We arrived and sat at table hoping that they would clean it once we sat down. Nope. The waiter ignored us for about 10 minutes. Once he came, he just gave us menus and didn't bother to clean the table. If it weren't for his co-worker, our table would have never been cleaned. Anytime we asked him for something he didn't look happy. However, when he was helping another table, he was more amiable. How about treating all customers the same?

Overall nothing notable. Won't be coming back.

excerpts: My boyfriend and I shared their Baja style fish tacos with sweet potato fries (ick).
To eat we shared the Vietnamese Steak sandwich.
Their fish tacos are incredible!
The batter looked crunchy, but oh no, it was delicate and the fish was not at all fishy.
Even with mountain of guacamole on it, you could still catch all of the flavors off the dish.
sweet potato fries.author: Jamie L.
sweet potato fries.review:
After sitting for a few hours in the sun of Speedway Meadows at GGP for a free concert, came here with my good friend, her husband, my boyfriend and daughter. 

I was told that this was the bigger location of the original one down on Chestnut Street. The location is definitely in a very busy area off GGP. Luckily, our friends were already sitting. Service is quick-quick-quick. I love that, especially at a busy eatery. 

My boyfriend and I shared their Baja style fish tacos with sweet potato fries (ick). To eat we shared the Vietnamese Steak sandwich. Their fish tacos are incredible! The batter looked crunchy, but oh no, it was delicate and the fish was not at all fishy. Even with mountain of guacamole on it, you could still catch all of the flavors off the dish. I was completely blown away that I actually tasted an amazing fish taco.

Since my boyfriend and I shared the sandwich, the staff was nice enough to split it in half, as well as split up the regular french fries. Again, I was completely enthralled by their great combination of flavor of siracha aioli (!) and thee most tender steak I have ever bit into. Moreover, their cole slaw, which I normally don't care for, was crispy and not at all drenched in mayo. 

Their prices are a little higher than what I would pay for, but it was so worth it. I would definitely come back if I am in the area.

excerpts: Sweet Potato Fries ($6)
- Portion was big.
The fries was so good.
Thick, crispy outside and soft inside.
It came with ginger wasabi aioli and sweet Thai chili sauces.
sweet potato fries.author: Liza T.
sweet potato fries.review:
first time came here and I love it.......

We had reservation at 7:30pm but we were15 minutes early.  Good that we got seated right the way.   Parking was a nightmare there.  Make sure you come early to allow yourself to look for parking.

All the staffs were friendly there.  Our server was very nice and friendly but was lacking service toward the end of the meal,  I guess he was too busy with the other big party (15 people).  He was pretty slow and did not refill our water.

The menu was extensive.  There were a lot of varieties that you could choose from.  You can choose from Salad, Rice Bowls, Tacos, Sandwiches, etc...

What we ordered:

Pacific Ceviche Trio ($17) - a sampling of shrimp ceviche, Hawaiian poke & Peruvian ceviche with chips.  It was great.  The portion was good for share.  I really like the purple potato chips.  It was perfect to eat with the poke.  Poke was so fresh and flavorful.  

Sweet Potato Fries ($6) - Portion was big.  The fries was so good.  Thick, crispy outside and soft inside.  It came with ginger wasabi aioli and sweet Thai chili sauces.  I think the wasabi aioli was better with the fries.  

Spicy Tuna Sushi Roll ($8.50) - The sushi roll was huge.  very filling......everything was so fresh.

California Roll ($9.00) - Again, the roll was big.  The crab meat was real crab salad.  Tasty.......

I got the Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl ($15).  It had tuna, wakame salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, cucumber, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori and soy-wasabi sauce.  I agree with other Yelpers.  The portion was huge and had a lot of rice but not much fish.  $15 was a little bit over price.  But the taste was pretty good.   The fish was fresh and flavorful.  I got half brown rice and half salad.  All ingredients were very fresh and tasty.  The only thing is the soy-wasabi sauce was little bit too much.  Kinda of salty to me.

My sister got the Ahi Rice Bowl ($15).  The ingredients were the same as the other rice bowls except the fish.  Ahi was very fresh.  I did not read the menu carefully.  If I knew the Ceviche Trio had poke, I would order Ahi rice bowl instead.

I really wanted to try their mochi for the dessert but I was too full.....Ok, next time!

excerpts: I also say that they have the best sweet potato fries in the city.
This place is child friendly with a good selection on the children's menu.
When one sits down they give a small plate of pretzels and edamame to snack on while waiting for the food.
Kids love this finger food.
Also, there are chopsticks at the table as well as Western cutlery.
We have never had any complaints about the service nor prices.
sweet potato fries.author: Kay P.
sweet potato fries.review: I think this is the best restaurant in the neighborhood.  Really like how the fish is prepared here and like to order from the specials.  I also say that they have the best sweet potato fries in the city.  This place is child friendly with a good selection on the children's menu.  When one sits down they give a small plate of pretzels and edamame to snack on while waiting for the food.  Kids love this finger food.  Also, there are chopsticks at the table as well as Western cutlery.   We have never had any complaints about the service nor prices.  I would recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants to know where to eat in the Inner Sunset.

excerpts: I am alway sure to get it with the sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: Rebecca D.
sweet potato fries.review:
This is a solid fish place, and perhaps has a special place in my heart since my boyfriend took me here on our first date. We've been back many times since.

I like the fish sandwiches. Ahi tuna one is great. I am alway sure to get it with the sweet potato fries.

I also really like the fish and chips and ceviche. I find the sushi rools to be delicious!

excerpts: Shrimp or Chicken Tacos with a side of sweet potato fries and Racer 5 IPA...
what more do you need when sitting at the bar watching a Giants game or Warriors basketball.
sweet potato fries.author: ERICA G.
sweet potato fries.review:
Shrimp or Chicken Tacos with a side of sweet potato fries and Racer 5 IPA...what more do you need when sitting at the bar watching a Giants game or Warriors basketball.  This is one of my go to spots for a not so sports bar with good food.  

The bar staff are always fun and attentive.  I've spent time in the dinning area, but to be honest I prefer to bar area.  It's a little more upbeat and relaxed. This is also a great spot to dine outdoors and bring your pet.  [

I do recommend sticking with the tacos and the appetizers are great, however, the sushi not so much.

excerpts: Last time, the kitchen made an extra order of sweet potato fries, so the server gave it to my friend and I gratis!
Heart.
sweet potato fries.author: Laurel K.
sweet potato fries.review:
I have an unhealthy obsession with salmon. Well, I guess not that unhealthy if you take into account the omega-3s but seriously, I always crave it. And thus, I LOVE Pacific Catch's Japanese rice bowl with grilled salmon. Everything (avocado, seaweed, veggies) is fresh, and the salmon is cooked perfectly. Plus, it's big enough that I usually eat it over two meals.

I've also had the Hawaiian poke, and it's delicious - fresh and light.

I saw some complaints w/service here - whenever I've been it's definitely bustling, but I've never experienced any delays. Last time, the kitchen made an extra order of sweet potato fries, so the server gave it to my friend and I gratis! Heart.

excerpts: Food was boring, uninspired, unseasoned--the artichokes were begging for flavor & the sweet potato fries were nothing without the dipping sauces (which were brought out only when I asked for them...
u mean if I didn't ask for sauce, I would have been stuck w/ boring fries?!
sweet potato fries.author: Fancypants X.
sweet potato fries.review:
Date & Time: Thursday, 9 pm
Reason For Going: 9th Annual Dine Out For Life (25% of your bill goes to STOP AIDS Project)
Company: The BFF
Rating: 2.5 stars (I don't think I will ever eat at PC again. especially at this location.) 

Hostess was wonderful (enthusiastic, friendly) but our waitress clearly hated her job. Service was horrid--it took forever to order, we were basically neglected (checked on once right before we were done eating), water glasses filled once (again, pretty much at the end of the meal.) I don't expect any server to be Little Miss Sunshine (especially at the end of their shift) but please save the curt, one word answers & annoyed look for when you're fighting with your bf, not when you're dealing with a customer. 

Food was boring, uninspired, unseasoned--the artichokes were begging for flavor & the sweet potato fries were nothing without the dipping sauces (which were brought out only when I asked for them...u mean if I didn't ask for sauce, I would have been stuck w/ boring fries?! Boring fries are a no-no!) 

We ordered chicken wings which were brought out way after our entrees, so they graciously took it off the bill. Our entrees were lukewarm (pretty much the same way I felt about the entire dining experience with the exception of my best friend's company which is always 10 stars.) BBQ salmon for me, hawaiian themed escolar for him. Both very blah. The only thing that kept me from giving 1 star is the fact that the entire bill was about $41. 

The only positive thing that came out of dinner was being able to catch up with my friend & doing a small good deed at the same time.

excerpts: This dish came with a side of coleslaw (that wasn't really good) and a side of fries ( I picked the sweet potato fries).
The sweet potato fries was good until it got cold and soggy, I recommend you eating it as soon as you get them!
As for the sandwich, I was disappointed with it.
sweet potato fries.author: Erica T.
sweet potato fries.review:
My friend and I decided to come here for dinner on a Friday night. We decided to sit near the bar area because we would have to wait 15 mins for the next dining table. No biggie for us, I don't mind where I sit.

What I ordered:

Fruit punch (alcoholic cocktail) $9.50: Vodka with various types of fruit juices. This drink was STRONG! My face was red and I was pretty buzzed. I guess if I can feel the alcohol from one drink, it is worth the $9.50 you pay for it because you actually get alcohol in it, none of that watered down drinks at other places.

Thai Coconut Shrimp $13:  7 pieces of jumbo shrimp with coconut shaving batter, deep fried and with the sweet chili sauce.... mMMmm nom nom nom. My friend ordered this appetizer and I was a little hesitant. A lot of restaurants end up giving you small shrimp with crappy battered textured. This was pretty good, you can taste the actual coconut shavings, the batter was light and crispy and the shrimp was bigger than I thought it would be. I was happy with this dish.

California Salmon $12:  This is where I wasn't too happy. This dish came with a side of coleslaw (that wasn't really good) and a side of fries ( I picked the sweet potato fries). The sweet potato fries was good until it got cold and soggy, I recommend you eating it as soon as you get them! As for the sandwich, I was disappointed with it. You get a slice of salmon that you can't even see at all, but can taste it. I swear the slice of the salmon was the thickness of 10 sheets of paper... not the filet that you would expect from a salmon sandwich. The bread was not toasted and so it was cold and not warm and crispy. I think texture is key when making a sandwich, you get the lettuce, tomato, avocado and salmon (all of which have a moist texture -- except the lettuce) and you want the bread to add a different texture... this is just me, I like my bread warm and crispy. As for flavor, it had enough flavor and it was actually tasty, just sad that the main attraction in this sandwich was nowhere to be seen.

Service was great! The lady came by quite often to make sure our water will filled and to make sure we were ok. Overall, the food was ok and the service was great.  I would give 3.5 stars if Yelp let me....

excerpts: The only reason this review is not for 5 stars is because the sweet potato fries, though tasty, could have been so much better!
sweet potato fries.author: A H.
sweet potato fries.review:
I brought my husband and 3 sons here who are all (well maybe minus the 1 and 2 year old) complete snobs about their fried fish.  I convinced them it was going to be good based on one experience I had at the Marina Pacific Catch location.  The Asian fusion aspect was throwing them a bit but in the end my recommendation was whole heartedly appreciated.  We each got the 4 piece fish (hubby and teen had regular fries, I had the sweet potato ones).  The only reason this review is not for 5 stars is because the sweet potato fries, though tasty, could have been so much better!  And they were the first time I had them at the Marina location so, who knows, maybe I just got the bottom of the barrel on 9th.  

Highlights:  the fish is perfectly seasoned, battered and fried, not overly greasy at all
Loved the complimentary edamame and goldfish pretzels as did my 1 and 2 year old (thank you very much!!!). The jalapeño tartar kicks butt and it isn't overly spicy at all as the server assured us.  I LOVE spicy food, I eat raw jalapeños but my husband and teenager aren't into spicy but they liked the sauce too.

Last but not least great service, location and ambiance and we came on a busy Saturday afternoon to boot!

excerpts: My favorite item that we had was the sweet potato fries.
My friend had the ahi poke salad, and while I'm poke is not my fave, I thought it was delicious.
I'll definitely be back for dinner soon!
sweet potato fries.author: Zherr-Anne A.
sweet potato fries.review: Only been here during happy hour, but from what I've experienced at the bar, the food, drinks, and service are great. I came with just one other person and we ordered four snack items from the happy hour menu. We were surprised at how generous the servings were. My favorite item that we had was the sweet potato fries. My friend had the ahi poke salad, and while I'm poke is not my fave, I thought it was delicious. I'll definitely be back for dinner soon!

excerpts: You have the option for sweet potato fries which is a nice change.
Good beer and wine selection - mixed drinks are a hit or miss.
Park in the park nearby if you don't get street parking.
sweet potato fries.author: Ketan D.
sweet potato fries.review: Great large place, great for large parties.  Very friendly staff.  This is our go to place at least once a month.  Their fish is just so fresh, they usually have specials so try those too.  I mostly get their spice rubbed fish tacos - hit the spot every time.  We also get their bowls - curry is good but spicy.  Their salmon rolls are very good.  You have the option for sweet potato fries which is a nice change.  Good beer and wine selection - mixed drinks are a hit or miss.  Park in the park nearby if you don't get street parking.

excerpts: Be sure to check out their Cabo shrimp tacos, ahi tuna bowl, sweet potato fries, coconut shrimp, calamari and fried oysters!
But skip the dungeons crab chowder-- totally not worth it!
sweet potato fries.author: Tiffany U.
sweet potato fries.review: The good thing about this location is the parking-- it's still not good but it beats trying to find parking on Chestnut! The food here is exactly like the location on Chestnut, always consistent and fresh. I love how this location never has a wait! Be sure to check out their Cabo shrimp tacos, ahi tuna bowl, sweet potato fries, coconut shrimp, calamari and fried oysters! But skip the dungeons crab chowder-- totally not worth it!

excerpts: I go the sweet potato fries - great choice.
He ordered the japanese wasbi bowl with poke - which i learned is so popular in hawaii and is just soy sauce marinated tuna...or something like that.
sweet potato fries.author: Nina Y.
sweet potato fries.review:
So we've passed by this place probably more times than we should have and NOT tried it. We pass by it to go to the Park, or eat a different places on 9th, but one night, when deciding where to go for dinner instead of cooking, we decided to come here. 

Coconut shrimp was delicious beginning of our meal. The shrimp seemed to have been coated in breadcrumbs and coconut shreds and the boy doesn't like coconut, but ate these shrimp up. They were really good. 

I ordered the salmon sandwich, it's quite a big portion, but damn it was good. the sauce they have on it, OMG. so good. I go the sweet potato fries - great choice.  He ordered the japanese wasbi bowl with poke - which i learned is so popular in hawaii and is just soy sauce marinated tuna...or something like that. Definitely delicious. 

Really wished we got dessert, but we were so full afterwards, we could barely walk. Great meal, great service, pretty good prices.

excerpts: I got a large plate of sweet potato fries and a steak taco for only 3 bucks each.
sweet potato fries.author: Marie B.
sweet potato fries.review: Happy Hour at Pacific Catch is the bomb!   Our bartender Adam not only knew his stuff mixing marvelous mai tais, but he was super fun with his "cork toss" game.  I got a large plate of sweet potato fries and a steak taco for only 3 bucks each.  My group got ahi tuna, ceviche, sushi, and everything was super fresh and delicious.  The happy hour is only from 4-6p Monday through Friday, so I suggest making a bee-line to hit this spot!   You won't regret it!

excerpts: I sometimes splurge on their Sweet Potato Fries.
Outstanding!
This was the first restaurant where I had this dish.
sweet potato fries.author: Howard S.
sweet potato fries.review:
Many years ago, there was a small seafood restaurant on Chestnut called Pacific Catch. Ate there and was hooked. I now know of two others-one in Corte Madera, and one on 9th and Lincoln in SF. I frequent the 9th Ave. place the most. 

It is consistently good. How many places can rate this remark? I often order the Ahi Tuna Rice Bowl over Brown Rice and greens. Delish! Never a bad piece of Ahi. My wife enjoys Wild Salmon Teriyaki Bowl. I sometimes splurge on their Sweet Potato Fries. Outstanding! This was the first restaurant where I had this dish. Now most places have it on their menu.

Service is professional and prices are reasonable. Decor is cool, yet friendly. My only complaint is this place does get a bit noisy at times. There is a bar off to one side and it can get rowdy. 

I still give it 5 stars, mostly for the consistent food quality.

excerpts: Their dressings were great, and they had decent sweet potato fries.
They also had some of the best seaweed salad I've eaten in a long time.
Kudos.
sweet potato fries.author: Emily D.
sweet potato fries.review:
Good tofu salad, except some of my lettuce was brown.. =(

Their dressings were great, and they had decent sweet potato fries. They also had some of the best seaweed salad I've eaten in a long time. Kudos.

excerpts:
Sweet Potato Fries Basket - "signature" fries
Fried Dulce de Leche "Spring Rolls" - with vanilla ice cream & caramel sauce 

Happy Hour
sweet potato fries.author: Elaine L.
sweet potato fries.review:
LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE!

1. Tasty food (I'll get into that below)
2. Great atmosphere
3. Friendly servers, bartenders, & owners
4. Great happy hour specials! Even late night!!

All ingredients to win a spot as one of my favorite restaurants!!

FOOD FAVs: 
Hawaiian Poke - sushi-grade ahi tuna in a sesame-soy marinade with wonton crisps
House Cured Sake Salmon - nori rice cakes, wasabi creme fraiche & black tobiko caviar
Sweet Potato Fries Basket - "signature" fries
Fried Dulce de Leche "Spring Rolls" - with vanilla ice cream & caramel sauce 

Happy Hour
4:00pm - 6:00pm, Monday through Friday
10:00pm - close, nightly

I've seen Pacific Catch participate at a ton of local events like the SF Weekly DISH and the Yelp Unwrapped Holiday Party and it's always been a big hit!  They really love their local customers and it shows when you talk to the staff either at these events or in their restaurant.

Now, I'm just patiently waiting till they open one up in the East Bay =)

excerpts: The seasonal crab melt was excellent and the sweet potato fries were very good.
The ahi salad was quite tasty too, just a little slim on the tuna.
Very cute that they serve pretzel fish crackers and shelled edamame (kind of unsanitary!)
sweet potato fries.author: Lisa H.
sweet potato fries.review:
Not bad. Pretty commercial - a safe place to bring out of towners or your grandparents. The seasonal crab melt was excellent and the sweet potato fries were very good. The ahi salad was quite tasty too, just a little slim on the tuna. Very cute that they serve pretzel fish crackers and shelled edamame (kind of unsanitary!) while you wait for your food. 

Note: there is a lot specifically for the restaurant off of Lincoln going east right after 9th st. We missed this and paid at a lot off of 9th. Boo. Another note - this location is right on the fringe of Golden Gate park, so easy to take a walk over there after you eat!

excerpts: Sweet potato fries are good, but I wish they would take it easy with the salt.
sweet potato fries.author: Julie P.
sweet potato fries.review:
This place is in my neighborhood and I've become a regular.
I love the fish tacos and the shrimp tempura rolls.
Sweet potato fries are good, but I wish they would take it easy with the salt.

Great place for happy hour and do some great deals.
Good food and friendly service.

excerpts:
The sweet potato fries were little overdone and the dipping sauces were kind of weird (tarter, really?)
Large open space, good for big noisy groups.
If you want good seafood head to the wharf.
sweet potato fries.author: Naomi K.
sweet potato fries.review:
Poke was tasty but the cut of fish was stringy. The sauce overwhelmed the flavor of the fish. Coconut shrimp were crispy and well done. The maki rolls were average. The sweet potato fries were little overdone and the dipping sauces were kind of weird (tarter, really?)
Large open space, good for big noisy groups. If you want good seafood head to the wharf.

excerpts: Good sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: Raul S.
sweet potato fries.review:
FAST Review 

Food 3/5 
Mahi tacos overpowered by sauce. Cabo shrimp tacos had two measly pieces of shrimp. Tasty though. Good sweet potato fries.

Ambiance 3/5 
Hmm, to describe briefly: Bland, minimalist, clean, modern

Service 4/5
Good, prompt service

Total Impression 3/5 
Standard Pacific Asian American fusion fare

excerpts: N match of the Steak taco and the Mahi mahi taco (both with onion strings atop) with sweet potato fries and black beans.
The steak taco was yummy
Sweet potato fries were just right--not too sweet and not too salty.
sweet potato fries.author: Kat L.
sweet potato fries.review:
Mahi Mahi Taco with onion strings atop--delish! Day dream worthy! 

Did a mix N match of the Steak taco and the Mahi mahi taco (both with onion strings atop) with sweet potato fries and black beans. The steak taco was yummy but boy was the Mahi mahi totally something different. I absolutely recommend this combo! 
Sweet potato fries were just right--not too sweet and not too salty. 

Our appetizer = Seviche with sun baked chips on the side. Little too salty for my taste but I'm guessing that's the whole point with seviche? 

Service was good; we arrived around noon time and was sat instantly by the bar along the window--beautiful view of the outskirts of Golden Gate Park on a sunny day! Really loved the atmosphere of the place and I think it's mainly because of the huge, open bay windows.

I can see this as a nice dinner place in the evening with amber lighting. Great place for family, friends or dates.

excerpts: Sweet Potato Fries ($6):  always delicious and served with interesting dipping sauces: ginger wasabi aioli and sweet Thai chili.
sweet potato fries.author: Samantha L.
sweet potato fries.review:
I have been to Pacific Catch a number of times (mainly due to the fact that it's pretty close to UCSF) and it's consistently pretty good/"a-ok."  I've never actually come for dinner, because I think there are plenty of better (and more student-budget-friendly restaurants) in the area, but it is a great option for happy hour or just place to catch up with friends over a drink and appetizers.

The restaurant is pretty nice looking inside, yet casual.  If you dine-in, they give you a tray of pretzel goldfish and edamame.  Some of the many appetizers I've tried include:

Cabo Calamari ($9): fried calamari (both rings and tentacles, lemon slices and chilies); taste is pretty standard and it's served with a "spicy" chipotle aioli.  During my last visit, this was free via a Foursquare check-in offer.

Sweet Potato Fries ($6):  always delicious and served with interesting dipping sauces: ginger wasabi aioli and sweet Thai chili.  I prefer ketchup.  

Baja Shrimp Ceviche ($8.50):  a fair amount of shrimp, lime, cilantro and chilies, served in a martini glass and surrounded by tortilla chips.  This was pretty tasty, but not that stand-out is.  

Hawaiian Poke ($9.50): this is probably the only appetizer that actually shines.  The tuna is marinated in a sesame-soy marinade and served with crispy wonton chips.  It can be a bit salty, but just make sure you have a nice cocktail also.

Happy hour is 4-6 p.m. Monday through Friday and also 10 p.m. to close each night.  They have a fair selection of beer for $3-4, wells for $4.50 and a selection of appetizers as well.  The service is generally pretty helpful and I think overall, it's a pretty fun place to get snacks/drinks.

excerpts: I am in love their sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: Evan L.
sweet potato fries.review:
If no one told me, I would never thought this is an actually chain restaurant. 

I really liked what they did to the restaurant, the layout, and the environment. A really good place some asian fusion food.

I am in love their sweet potato fries. =)

excerpts: We were tempted to also start off with some sweet potato fries, but since many of the dinner meals come with a side of fries, we decided not to.
sweet potato fries.author: Allan L.
sweet potato fries.review:
Pacific Catch sounds like a corny show from the 90s but in reality, it's a mighty fine restaurant. I enjoyed my Pacific Catch experience. We came here on a Saturday night and had a reservation, so they seated us immediately. We got lucky and found a spot in their free parking lot, but parking is incredibly difficult in this area, so give yourself enough time to find a spot.

We started off with the fried calamari. It was a healthy portion, and had a small kick to it. We were tempted to also start off with some sweet potato fries, but since many of the dinner meals come with a side of fries, we decided not to. I ordered the 3 taco plate (mahi mahi, shrimp, and traditional baja) and enjoyed the shrimp taco the best. One of the tacos, I think the traditional baja, lacked flavor and was disappointing. For $15, I was stuffed at the end of the meal and had no room for dessert. The service was excellent and the staff was attentive. I'd come here again.

My tummy gives Pacific Catch...4 Stars!

excerpts: I ordered the fish tacos with sweet potato fries and the Kiwi Flash.
Big pieces of fish for each taco was enough to fill me for the day.
The kiwi flash drink was good as well.
Its a mix of gin, with fresh kiwi, cucumer and lemon juice.
Just perfect for a hot day .Their
salad and rice bowls looks uhmazing, I would have to try them when I come back.
sweet potato fries.author: Claudine V.
sweet potato fries.review: Great and fresh seafood. I ordered the fish tacos with sweet potato fries and the Kiwi Flash.  Big pieces of fish for each taco was enough to fill me for the day. The kiwi flash drink was good as well. Its a mix of gin, with fresh kiwi, cucumer and lemon juice. Just perfect for a hot day .Their salad and rice bowls looks uhmazing, I would have to try them when I come back.

excerpts: The sandwich was served with coleslaw and sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: Tiffany H.
sweet potato fries.review:
PC is very roomy, theres a bar, booth seats, and tables. Families can definitely have a nice dinner here. I love their high ceilings!

My dad loves their sandwiches, specifically the Wasabi Ahi. It was grilled rare ahi with ginger, avocado, daikon sprouts and ginger-wasabi aioli. The sandwich was really filling. The sandwich was served with coleslaw and sweet potato fries. 

My mom loves the Pacific Ceviche Trio. Three different types of ceviche served with purple potato chips. Yummmmmmm. The fish was grilled seared with ginger! Very flavorful! 

We also had the Pan Asian Bowl, the thai curry with grilled chicken. They were very nice and gladly adhered to our half brown rice and half vegetable request (thank you!). The crispy shallots also added a nice touch.

Customer service? Very nice and speedy. 

My younger sister had Korean BBQ, the Marinated Skirt Steak. She thought it was too salty. She only ate the meat (left the vegetables and rice alone) because she said it was way too salty. (This says a lot because she normally loves rice.)

This place was definitely worth it, but my recommendation? Stay clear of the Korean BBQ!

excerpts: We ended up getting the sweet potato fries( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/F7Jasi9YOKm_xukGraPLqw/l ), Hawaiian surf & turf( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/b-odRG7EHLA9pF6Tad_32Q/l ), and the ahi tuna wasabi bowl( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/yQEL8q5t9x7sXXys5QP-mA/l ).
sweet potato fries.author: Patra I.
sweet potato fries.review:
I read so many reviews saying how people really liked Pacific Catch.  I live so close to this place, I had to try it for myself.  I went on a Thursday night at 7:30, and expected a wait, but there were actually a lot of open tables.

Of course we had to start out dinner with drinks, so we got the Pacific Punch and Kamikaze Bloody Mary( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/xrXCgiAiwQKfIcWmIUZDpQ/l ).  The Pacific Punch really tasted like punch...very easy to get drunk off of them!

It took a while to pick what we wanted for dinner.  Nothing really stood out on the menu.  We ended up getting the sweet potato fries( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/F7Jasi9YOKm_xukGraPLqw/l ), Hawaiian surf & turf( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/b-odRG7EHLA9pF6Tad_32Q/l ), and the ahi tuna wasabi bowl( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/yQEL8q5t9x7sXXys5QP-mA/l ).  

The fries were good, but the rest of the food was just ok.  Nothing was super spectacular.  They have happy hour from 4:00-6:00, so I'll just be back for some drinks.

excerpts: We also got the sweet potato fries and they tasted a bit unseasoned.
sweet potato fries.author: Rachel A.
sweet potato fries.review:
The boyfriend and I ambled in here on a gorgeous Saturday afternoon, and had no trouble grabbing a table near the bar. Things started out well: We got menus quickly, and were brought a great little snack tray with pretzel goldfish and edamame. Their menu has a lot to offer, and both of the cocktails we ordered were fantastic (a Dark & Stormy for him, a Guava Mint Cooler for me). I really liked sitting in the bar area. We got a table right next to the window with a beautiful view of the park in all it's green, sunshine-y glory. 

For starters, he got the Crab & Corn chowder, which I think was a seasonal special but was SO tasty and crab-a-licious. I ordered the Peruvian Ceviche. Ceviche appetizers are usually so small (even though they're expensive), but Pacific Catch does NOT mess around. The ceviche dish was HUGE! I was begging my boyfriend to have some so I'd have room for our main dish. They really packed in the fish and all of it was so fresh and delicious, I thought about licking the bowl (boyfriend vetoed, but only because I told him he couldn't lick his soup bowl clean, either).

We split the Sushi Grade Ahi salad, and they were nice enough to bring it to us in separate bowls. I really loved the wasabi dressing (a nice kick at the bottom of the bowl), but I thought the actual Ahi itself was only alright. We also got the sweet potato fries and they tasted a bit unseasoned. 

While the service at the beginning had been fantastic, it took a really long time to get anyone's attention and after we got the check, nobody came by to pick it up again. The bar isn't that large, wasn't full, they had more people working than when we'd walked in, and it still seemed impossible to get anyone's attention for the bill. It wasn't until a bus boy stopped by to clear our salad bowls that the bill got paid. 

Overall, I really really liked the food here. Not a cheap lunch but well worth it. They would have gotten 5 stars if the service had been more consistent!

excerpts: I never had sweet potato fries prior eating here.
They started a trend of me ordering that side dish whenever I see it on the menu in other food establishments.
sweet potato fries.author: Alisa M.
sweet potato fries.review:
The three taco order: baja, shrimp and chicken were good. I never had sweet potato fries prior eating here. They started a trend of me ordering that side dish whenever I see it on the menu in other food establishments. Good stuff

Bit pricey just for asian food IMO, thus, the tacos.

excerpts: The sweet potato fries were solid, but not as well seasoned and yummy as I remembered it.
I think next time I'll just go to the Marina location even if it's smaller and harder to find parking.
Service was exceptional, but it wasn't good enough to take the bad taste out of my mouth.
sweet potato fries.author: Thy L.
sweet potato fries.review: I haven't been able to drop by a Pacific Catch in a long time, and needless to say I was excited. I usually go to the location in Marina, but this one was closer and generally easier to find parking. Unfortunately, it's also the less tasty one. I ordered a fried calamari, which was drenched in oil, making it less appetizing. I ordered a poke wasabi bowl, but the wasabi sauce was nowhere to be found, and the cook had a heavy hand with the soy sauce. The ahi used to make the poke also left a lot to be desired. The sweet potato fries were solid, but not as well seasoned and yummy as I remembered it. I think next time I'll just go to the Marina location even if it's smaller and harder to find parking. Service was exceptional, but it wasn't good enough to take the bad taste out of my mouth.

excerpts: I also tried the sweet potato fries which I thoroughly enjoyed because they didn't taste overly fried or oily.
sweet potato fries.author: Margaret R.
sweet potato fries.review:
I got the wasabi bowl with hawaiian poke. It was a very large bowl with many pieces of poke, japanese seaweed, avocado, ginger, sprouts, sesame seeds and other random ingredients that are sometimes found in sushi over your choice of white or brown rice. The pieces of poke were fresh and well marinated...you definitely get a good amount of poke so much that I felt that I was all "fished" out towards to end of my meal.

I also tried the sweet potato fries which I thoroughly enjoyed because they didn't taste overly fried or oily. They came with a special wasabi dip which complemented the fries well.

The overall atmosphere was pretty chill and definitely relaxing when it's a nice sunny day as you can sit against the window or outside. Service was friendly and fast.

excerpts:
Crab Rangoons (SUCCULENT morsels)
Sweet Potato Fries uh-mazing (dip them in the crab rangoon sauce!)
sweet potato fries.author: Maggie C.
sweet potato fries.review:
Two words: HAPPY HOUR. For $40, yes forty dollars (including a $10 tip b/c Grayson was a rockstar server!):

Tuna Poke
Spicy Tuna Roll
CA Roll (REAL Crab!)
Crab Rangoons (SUCCULENT morsels)
Sweet Potato Fries uh-mazing (dip them in the crab rangoon sauce!)

All regular servings  = $30 (including a soda and tax? UNREAL) 

Bottles of Sriracha on every table...be still my beating heart. 

Happy Hour. 4-6 and after 10. 'Nuff said.

excerpts: My shrimp tacos were still good, but the sweet potato fries were cold and soggy.
Thirty minutes after finishing our meal, we weren't offered a dessert menu.
I think we might've been stuck their all night if I didn't flag our waiter down for the check.
sweet potato fries.author: Sophia B.
sweet potato fries.review: Pacific Catch just isn't what it used to be. With every visit, the food and service gets worse. Tonight was no exception. First they seated us with no menus. Then we waited for our food as a table that placed their orders after us finished their meals. My biggest disappointment, however, was with their Hawaiian Poke. Looked like someone hacked away at some tuna and threw it in a bowl. The quality of fish wasn't nearly as great, and the portion keeps getting smaller. My shrimp tacos were still good, but the sweet potato fries were cold and soggy. Thirty minutes after finishing our meal, we weren't offered a dessert menu. I think we might've been stuck their all night if I didn't flag our waiter down for the check.

excerpts: Spicy fries were good, but I prefer sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: Kylie L.
sweet potato fries.review:
Today for lunch, there wasn't a wait to get a table.

Coleslaw was way better today, compared to last time. Last time it was soooo onion-y. I like KFC cloeslaw a lot more than Pacific Catch's coleslaw.

Spicy fries were good, but I prefer sweet potato fries.

excerpts: We get the sweet potato fries as an appetizer and they serve it with sweet pepper sauce, such a weird mix, but really awesome.
sweet potato fries.author: Kristin F.
sweet potato fries.review: This place is great! It is one of our favorite date spots; really nice restaurant but with a casual feel. The food is different but delicious. I always end up getting the same thing; the salmon korean bbq bowl. The salmon is always cooked perfectly and when paired with the yummy sticky rice and tasty veggies, perfection. We get the sweet potato fries as an appetizer and they serve it with sweet pepper sauce, such a weird mix, but really awesome.

excerpts: I stepped up the standard fish and chips to a sampler which included fried oysters, shrimp and fish, I chose standard fries since other people at the table got spicy cajun fries and sweet potato fries.
Pacific catch has the fries down- absolutely.
I loved the combo basket and was simultaneously salivating over everyone elses meal at the table.
The Ahi sandwhich looks ridiculously good.
Had I not been so full after the combo I had, I would have stolen the bits that left unfinished on my friend's plate.
sweet potato fries.author: Tawnee K.
sweet potato fries.review:
If I remember correctly, Pacific Catch had a booth at Outside Lands in August. I tried a sample of something (ceviche perhaps?) and the taste stuck with me. Good thing too- I put two and two together when exiting Botanical Gardens and Pacific Catch was towering in front of me like a beacon of light for my hungry bits. 

We went in there on New Years Day and what better way to celebrate the new decade but with a basket of fish and chips? There is no better way, that's what. I also had a wakame (seaweed) salad which was absolutely peachy- especially considering the fact that they didnt scrimp on the green goodness, and there was a dressing soaked bed of cucumber waiting for me at the end once I finished. 

I stepped up the standard fish and chips to a sampler which included fried oysters, shrimp and fish, I chose standard fries since other people at the table got spicy cajun fries and sweet potato fries. Pacific catch has the fries down- absolutely. I loved the combo basket and was simultaneously salivating over everyone elses meal at the table. The Ahi sandwhich looks ridiculously good. Had I not been so full after the combo I had, I would have stolen the bits that left unfinished on my friend's plate. I also had a taste of the soup of the day-a chayote chowder, which had one of the best tastes I've had in a chowder. I didn't know what chayote was when I walked in, but when I walked out I was a fanatic.

A bit on the expensive side of affordable, but for good food (fresh fish) and a good experience, I say it is worth it. 

Also, the place is full of amazing things to daydream at. The chandeliers made out of blue bottles are great taste, event the bathroom has tiny strands of bamboo hidden behind the stall walls. The whole place is open, bright, and tastefull.

excerpts: They came with a choice of sweet potato fries, spicy fries, regular fries or a salad, and a little bit of black beans.
The avocado-tomatillo sauce was good and they didn't skimp on the portion of it.
Since one of us ordered sweet potato fries and one ordered spicy fries and they were both declared to be the best, I wondered which really was the best.
sweet potato fries.author: Madeline M.
sweet potato fries.review:
I thought the food was pretty good here and not too pricey but the service was poor.

I had the traditional fish tacos, 2 for $12.  They came with a choice of sweet potato fries, spicy fries, regular fries or a salad, and a little bit of black beans.  The avocado-tomatillo sauce was good and they didn't skimp on the portion of it.  The fish had a light and crunchy batter.

The things we found annoying were every time we ordered something, the waitress said "Oh, that's the best choice!"  Since one of us ordered sweet potato fries and one ordered spicy fries and they were both declared to be the best, I wondered which really was the best.

Then my friend's order of spicy fries didn't come with the rest of the food.  When we asked about it she apologized and said it was coming, which it did when my friend had already finished his entree.   We wanted salt and there was none on the table and it took a while to get a waiter's attention and bring the salt.  Also, after my friend paid the bill he noticed we had been charged extra for the spicy fries even though they were supposed to be included with his entree.  They corrected it but it was all slightly annoying.

I'd try it again but hope I don't get a waitperson that gives opinions on everything ordered and I'll check the bill before paying.

excerpts: This time we got the soup, poke appetizer dish, and the fish tacos with sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: Sue Y.
sweet potato fries.review:
Always a delight! This time we got the soup, poke appetizer dish, and the fish tacos with sweet potato fries.

This was my first time getting the poke appetizer, but I definitely  recommend getting the poke bowl instead. I usually get the bowl with half brown rice and half salad and the brown rice soaks up the excess poke sauce beautifully and compliments the fish. The appetizer poke comes with fried Wonton wrappers which were also good, but a little overwhelming.

The tacos were good, but not super impressive. There was a lot of fish and even more Wasabi [mayo] sauce . 

It was a cold day and I was getting over a flu, so I ordered the soup. It came with two clams, two-three shrimp, and a nice tomato broth. I'm not really sure what I was expecting, but I found the broth a touch watered down. It came with a toast that was slathered (albeit very prettily) in mayo sauce. Whoever was at the kitchen today really liked their mayo. I chucked the bread, found the soup satisfying, but the poke [bowl] is my favorite dish.

excerpts: Finally, a place where I can enjoy my poke wasabi bowl, munch on some baja fish tacos and nibble on some sweet potato fries without having to cram side-by-side each other like at their Chestnut location.
Great service
- they kept refilling my water - and great food.
sweet potato fries.author: Jonas T.
sweet potato fries.review:
Finally, a place where I can enjoy my poke wasabi bowl, munch on some baja fish tacos and nibble on some sweet potato fries without having to cram side-by-side each other like at their Chestnut location. Great service - they kept refilling my water - and great food. Parking sucks, but what else is new?

JONASAPPROVED!

excerpts: They come with sweet potato fries, yum!
I had the Surf and Turf, for 19.95, amazing!
The surf was shrimp with 2 skewers loaded, about 6 shrimp to a skewer.
The meat was seasoned and juicy, very good.
The entree also came with fried shoestring onions and pineapple fried rice, you have the option to substitute for plain brown rice.
sweet potato fries.author: Frankie F.
sweet potato fries.review:
My 2nd visit:

I was so impressed with my meal at P Catch the other night I had to try a couple things on the menu I wasn't able to the 1st time around.  So I ordered a bunch of rolls for pick up last night. 

Once again service rocks and the rolls were great. There are 8 large rolls per order, you have the option to substitute for brown rice which was a nice thing to see. Hopefully more sushi places will follow in P Catchs' footsteps and be offering this healthy option more.   

OG Review:

Pacific Catch really saved the day on Saturday night. I called in for a 15 head party the morning of and Rob, the general manger, really came through for me. He had a large party already booked but recommended I book 2 reservations and he would try to seat the parties close to each other. 

We all adjourned in the bar area for drinks. The bartender was awesome, great customer service! We were then seated and Rob reserved  2 booths next to each other. It worked out perfect because we used 1 booth as the kids table and the other for the 8 adults. 

There are peeled soy beans and pretzel gold fish on the tables to start munching. The menu rocks!  You can order sushi rolls, and sashimi for the sushi lover but for the not so seasoned raw fish eater there are teriyaki bowls and great specials available as well. I started with the seaweed salad and clam miso, so good. The table ordered the fried calamari which was liked by everybody. Watch out!  It comes with a spicy creamy dipping sauce which was received well, but it is hot! 

The tacos were a favorite of the group. Each taco has a different fish, mahi mahi, cod and salmon. They come with sweet potato fries, yum! I had the Surf and Turf, for 19.95, amazing!  The surf was shrimp with 2 skewers loaded, about 6 shrimp to a skewer. The meat was seasoned and juicy, very good. The entree also came with fried shoestring onions and pineapple fried rice, you have the option to substitute for plain brown rice. Large portion and great price! 

The staff brought out a complimentary dessert for the birthday girl. I didn't try any but I have a pic I'll attach. It looked fantastic and finished the night off perfectly. 

We had a great time and the staff was just great to us. Very accommodating. I will definitely be back and I love that it is so close to home!

excerpts:
Hawaiian poke, avocado, cucumber, daikon sprouts, ginger & sesame seeds with soy-wasabi vinaigrette $13.50
-Side of sweet potato fries $3
-Spicy Tuna: hi tuna with sriracha aioli, chili oil, cucumber, daikon sprouts & green onion $8
-(*)Fried Dulce de Leche "Spring Rolls": with vanilla ice cream & caramel sauce
sweet potato fries.author: Stacey L.
sweet potato fries.review:
We ate here on Thursday for dinner and had a deal from Scoutmob.  I believe our server's name was Neal.  5 stars to him.  He went out of his way to ensure that we were enjoying our time, filled our glasses, split our salad into two bowls for my sister and & I to share, brought extra dessert forks and spoons.  I haven't had this great of service in months.  Our order:

-3 Taco Platter $14.50
-Vietnamese Steak Sandwich: marinated grilled steak, seasoned cucumber-daikon-carrot salad, sliced chilies, cilantro & sriracha aioli $12
-(*)Sushi Grade: Hawaiian poke, avocado, cucumber, daikon sprouts, ginger & sesame seeds with soy-wasabi vinaigrette $13.50
-Side of sweet potato fries $3
-Spicy Tuna: hi tuna with sriracha aioli, chili oil, cucumber, daikon sprouts & green onion $8
-(*)Fried Dulce de Leche "Spring Rolls": with vanilla ice cream & caramel sauce  $6

(*) = Favorites

excerpts: I recommend the coconut skewered shrimp and ordering anything that will get you some of their delicious sweet potato fries (healthier than regular fries, at least!)!
sweet potato fries.author: Amy L.
sweet potato fries.review:
While I desperately miss the Canvas Gallery, this place is a lovely new addition to one of my favorite neighborhoods, the Inner Sunset.  The food is good while offering many healthy options, the prices mostly reasonable, the feel is spacious, clean and stylish, and there's even a small parking lot by the side of the building with free parking for patrons...it's hard not to love this place!

This place doesn't add anything special to the neighborhood from a culinary standpoint, since it's another Asian Fusion place on the same block with three (yes, THREE!!!) other Japanese restaurants and within a block or two of several more sushi bars and fish restaurants...and arguably there's something formulaic and trite about the intentional hipness of the decor...

But there's also something to be said for dining in comfort, which is exactly what whoever designed and decorated this restaurant seemed to have in mind:  the lighting is mild and pleasant, the ceiling vaulted, giving the overall feeling of weightlessness, and the chairs and booths are mostly comfortable...although the booths will feel slightly cramped if you are very tall or have a big butt or tummy, since the tables are low and there's a non-removeable 1/2-height cushion behind your back that takes up about 5-6" of your rump room.  If you are under 6' tall and on the slender side, you'll be just fine.

The servers are very friendly and attentive, which is a pleasant departure from many restaurants in San Francisco, where courteous service sometimes seems to have been otherwise forgotten in the shuffle.  Pacific Catch seems to operate the way many serious, highly rated professional restaurant environments do, with a highly trained staff, attention to detail overall, and a menu that reflects modern trends.  For example, this menu offers not only foodie versions of Miso soup, but also a brown rice substitution option for those of us watching our waistlines or simply attempting to eat a more healthy diet.  

I recommend the coconut skewered shrimp and ordering anything that will get you some of their delicious sweet potato fries (healthier than regular fries, at least!)!  Be warned that you won't be able to eat just one...

I also thoroughly enjoyed their salmon teriyaki bowl which came with shitake mushrooms, asparagus cut into the perfect size bites, and bok choy which was cooked to perfection, served over brown rice that's been dosed with some more of their flavorful teriyaki sauce (normally it's served with pineapple fried rice, but I opted for their complimentary brown rice substitution instead).

Their traditional miso soup is average at best, and at twice the price that other Japanese restaurants in the neighborhood will charge for the same size bowl, it's nothing special and you get the feeling it's pricier because everything on the menu is priced a little higher, not because of an increase in quality.  Still, the presentation of the bowl, which arrived covered and was quickly de-topped by the server at the table, gives at least some clue as to what your money buys here:  a higher end experience, even if it's at a chain restaurant, even if the menu looks like a mash-up of Sushi-Bar-Meets-Fish'n'Chips-Joint, even if it's a Monday night in the Inner Sunset.  

There's something to be said for a restaurant that does what it does well.

excerpts:
Ceivche - Too limey, not enough chips
Sweet Potato Fries - YUMMM
Catch of the Day - YUM
Teriyaki bowls - TOO SWEET, sickkk
Any Tacos - Mediocre (go to Nick's Crispy Tacos instead)
sweet potato fries.author: Heidi C.
sweet potato fries.review:
This review is for both the Marina district and 9th Ave locations.

9TH AVE -- accommodating for a huge party (takes reservations)
MARINA -- the whole restaurant seats maybe 20 at a time. VERY SMALL (does NOT take reservations)
Btw, parking at both locations suck but the 9th Ave location has a small parking lot in back which maybe parks about 8 cars at most.

Thai Iced Tea - YUM
Hawaiian Poke - YUM (chunks are a bit too big though...)
Hawaiian Poke Roll - Was okay
Ceivche - Too limey, not enough chips
Sweet Potato Fries - YUMMM
Catch of the Day - YUM
Teriyaki bowls - TOO SWEET, sickkk
Any Tacos - Mediocre (go to Nick's Crispy Tacos instead)
Mochi Fondue - A must get!!

And that is about all the food I've tried between the two locations. The place is cute, service is good and you just have to come and try this restaurant at least once in your life.

(Photos uploaded)

excerpts: The sweet potato fries kicked an up a notch and balanced the meal with the sweetness and crunchiness to the fries.
It is some good stuff, I usually don't like sweet potato fries and I sure do like these!
sweet potato fries.author: Kenneth Y.
sweet potato fries.review:
Had a great experience eating at this restaurant I must first say, especially the waiter and the food had made this experience to a five star.  

Before we begin looking at the Menu, the server saw us walk to the table and simply gave us some starters in a rectangle dish that's divided with edamame and pretzel goldfishes.  We were extremely hungry and read to chow down. So we finished it and after we ordered our food the server refilled it again.  Normally I guess they don't do it, or maybe they are lazy but he did the extra mile and refilled us not twice but three times total.  I was really happy and the waiter knew how to treat his customer's right!

- food -

I ordered the Pan-Asian Rice Bowls: wakame salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, cucumber, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori & soy-wasabi sauce with seared Ahi with brown rice.

The presentation of the bowl was very balanced, I enjoy most was the seared Ahi; it was perfectly grilled and raw in the middle.  It was so good you can even taste that it was seared on a grill and the Ahi just melts in your mouth with the soy-wasabi sauce on top.
