The salad was a bit interesting with mixed greens and Romanians top off with some Japanese style shredded green seaweed with the soy-wasabi sauce too.  I am a fan of brown rice and there brown rice is made perfect, not to soft or hard.  If you are not a fan of wasabi, I would not recommended because it is a little bit mild spicy.  You can have the choice of either 1/2 salad or 1/2 rice I eat a lot so I thought I would have too much rice but I would get full rice next time!


I also tried some of the Fish & chips my girlfriend order: 2 pieces of fish, 3 coconut shrimp & 3 crispy oysters with jalapeño tartar 

The fish and chips were amazing, the batter they used was very light and not overwhelming, yet enough to have a crunch, the fish was tender and juicy.  The fried oysters were smooth and creamy.  The sweet potato fries kicked an up a notch and balanced the meal with the sweetness and crunchiness to the fries.  It is some good stuff, I usually don't like sweet potato fries and I sure do like these!

Overall the food is great, the se

excerpts: The taco platter also includs sweet potato fries (YUM!!) & black beans.
The platter cost about $14.95.
My friend ordered the Eel Wasabi Bowl but she requested no wasabi
but instead terayaki sauce which was really good!
i wished i ordered the Eel bowl instead ($14.95).
In addition to the menu, each meal includes  fish shaped pretzels & endame beans.
sweet potato fries.author: Carol Y.
sweet potato fries.review:
I had a great time dining at Pacific Catch tonight. My friend and i walked into Pacific Catch without reservations and were seated promptly. I LOVE the decor, you wouldn't even think the place was previously the Canvas Gallery. I love the red walls, there are plenty of seating, full bar & most importantly an open kitchen. I love restaurants with an open kitchen which means the place is clean.

It was my first time dining at Pacific Catch and i thought the menu was overwhelming but at the end i finally ordered the 3 tacos platter (Grilled Salmon taco -- which was very good!, Spicy Chicken Taco -- very disappointing because it wasn't spicy at all!, & Shrimp Taco -- my favorite because it comes with a mango salsa). The taco platter also includs sweet potato fries (YUM!!) & black beans. The platter cost about $14.95. My friend ordered the Eel Wasabi Bowl but she requested no wasabi but instead terayaki sauce which was really good! i wished i ordered the Eel bowl instead ($14.95). In addition to the menu, each meal includes  fish shaped pretzels & endame beans.  Our whole meal cost about $30 with drinks. 

Overall, i really enjoyed my meal and i cant wait to come back and try the other items in the menu. I thought the service was really good, our waitress was very sweet and attentive. I am not sure why there are some bad reviews about the service. The waitress even came back to refill my diet coke without me requesting for one! 

thanks Pacific Catch for a memorable dinner! :) 

PS. parking can be alittle tough!

excerpts: For my entree, I had the mahi mahi, which was served with amazing sweet potato fries, a delicious tomatillo sauce, and fresh grilled vegetables.
So delicious!
sweet potato fries.author: Noelle T.
sweet potato fries.review:
My husband and I have eaten at Pacific Catch on our last two trips to San Francisco after getting lost, being crabby hungry, and stumbling across this gem last summer.  We loved it so much the first time that we made sure to make it a part of our vacation itinerary.

The food here is amazing!  Both times, I have tried things off of their seasonal menu.  The first time we went there, I tried items on their chalkboard menu that was Peruvian themed, and my husband ordered Korean barbeque.  On this last trip, we shared the shrimp coctel that was served with a mini shot of tequila.  For my entree, I had the mahi mahi, which was served with amazing sweet potato fries, a delicious tomatillo sauce, and fresh grilled vegetables. So delicious!  My husband got the salmon that came with rice and vegetables.  

The real star of the meal is the dessert!  Both times, we have had the fried dulce de leche.  It is literally the most incredible dessert ever.  It's rich, creamy, cheesecakey, gooey, and it's served with caramel sauce and vanilla ice cream.

I will definitely go back to this restaurant again!

excerpts: dipping sauces were a plus, epecially the jalapeno tartar for the fish and chips and the wasabi (guessing) ranch for the sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: Yahra V.
sweet potato fries.review:
My first time here, definitely not my last!

We were in quandry about where to go for my birthday dinner last night; after a bit of research and wanting to not venture too far out into the city since we had family in town, we decided on Pacific Catch.

Treading through GGP with a 4-year old nephew can make anyone very hungry so it was great that we were so close. We kept our car parked at the park (lol) and walked less than a block to the restaurant. 

First impressions work always- the place was clean, nice decor and the wait staff was friendly.

Early dinner equals Happy Hour... unfortunately they only serve the happy hour menu at the bar and it just didn't seem right to sit there with younger ones in tow. Womp womp :(
That didn't stop me from trying their lemongrass mojito though- delicious! Tart and sweet and minty with the right amount of rum... yum!

The trio ceviche was enjoyed by all- even the ones that weren't fans of fish (really?). The baja shrimp ceviche was tasty and tangy, the Hawaiian poke tuna was perfectly marinated, and the Peruvian ceviche was close to being great! I come from an area where Peruvian restaurants sort of rule, so I'm used to the ceviche being more authentic- with the white cornuts and the yucca- but this was still tasty and satisfying. 

Our dinner was an assortment of their rice bowls, fish tacos, fish and chips (made with the catch of the day... cod) and chicken tenders for the little one. All the dishes were very good. The taco and fish plates came with fries. Regular and sweet potato thumbs up- nothing spectacular about the "spicy" fries though. And nothing really "spicy" about them. dipping sauces were a plus, epecially the jalapeno tartar for the fish and chips and the wasabi (guessing) ranch for the sweet potato fries.

Our server was friendly and attentive and when asked a few questions about the menu she was knowledgeable and in one instance when she didn't know, she returned later with information and actually followed up. That was nice!

Lastly, my surprise birthday dessert (surprise!) was a near perfect brownie topped with vanilla ice cream and chocolate sauce. The brownie was dense but moist with walnuts and the vanilla bean ice cream... the icing on the cake!

Price was very reasonable for a party of 5.5.... $120 or so. Gratuity not included.

Overall, an enjoyable experience and a memorable birthday! 

Thanks Pacific Catch!

excerpts: And their sweet potato fries cannot be done wrong.
Too bad this place lost its footing and I am hoping maybe the next time I give this place a chance it will be different!
sweet potato fries.author: Michelle I.
sweet potato fries.review: We were excited to see this place open a couple of years ago in our neighborhood. Since then we have been there multiple times. Recently we found the food to have lost its luster. The ahi tuna wasabi sandwich that I used to die for is now lost its great taste and the tuna isnt just as fresh anymore. The firecracker sushi is still alright. And their sweet potato fries cannot be done wrong. Too bad this place lost its footing and I am hoping maybe the next time I give this place a chance it will be different!

excerpts: The sweet potato fries had no WOW to it
and I'm wondering why everyone is raving about them so much, they taste the same!
sweet potato fries.author: Connie C.
sweet potato fries.review:
I came here with two galpals to explore the city and it was a definitely MUST to come here, according to one galpal. I had a 50% off discount for the bill courtesy of Scoutmob, and I still was not impressed. 

I got the Wasabi bowl and was impressed with the portion I got. My wasabi sticky rib bowl came with 5-6 ribs, tons of rice, cucumber strips, and seaweed! It cost $13.99 and you can even choose from other themes like Korean themed, Japanese themed, and two others. The ribs were falling off the bone and good! However, I wish the rest of the bowl could have helped enhance the flavor or somehow tie it all together. I couldn't finish my bowl and gladly took it home. 

The sweet potato fries had no WOW to it and I'm wondering why everyone is raving about them so much, they taste the same!

excerpts: I ordered the California Salmon sandwich with a side of sweet potato fries.
The sandwich was really good.
The salmon was cooked perfectly, cooked all the way through, but it was still tender.
The bread was surprisingly good.
It was a Ciabatta, but the outside was crisp and the inside was soft and warm.
It also came with avocado, and a citrus aoli.
I have to talk about the avocado because the avocado here is extremely good.
Usually, the avocado I get at restaurants are not ripe and bland, but at PC it was soft and very flavorful.
The aoli was good too.
Not sure how it's supposed to taste like, but I liked it.
The sweet potato fries were decent, this last time I had them.
When I had them this time, they were a little soggy and cold.
I was disappointed because I had them once before
sweet potato fries.author: Anthony N.
sweet potato fries.review:
Came here for lunch around 12pm.  There was no wait at all for small groups; in fact, there were quite a few tables open.  The thing is this Pacific Catch is on the corner of 9th and Lincoln, so it's really hard to find parking.  PC does have a parking lot, but it's fairly small so it's hard to find a space in there.  

Decor: The place is really nice looking for a restaurant that's not super fancy.  Nice hardwood floors.  There are booths and tables; indoor and outdoor seating.  Wine bottle light fixtures here are a cool touch.  There's an open kitchen and a bar you can hang out at if you don't want to sit down and eat.

Food:  I ordered the California Salmon sandwich with a side of sweet potato fries.  The sandwich was really good.  The salmon was cooked perfectly, cooked all the way through, but it was still tender.  The bread was surprisingly good.  It was a Ciabatta, but the outside was crisp and the inside was soft and warm.  It also came with avocado, and a citrus aoli.  I have to talk about the avocado because the avocado here is extremely good.  Usually, the avocado I get at restaurants are not ripe and bland, but at PC it was soft and very flavorful.  The aoli was good too.  Not sure how it's supposed to taste like, but I liked it.  The sweet potato fries were decent, this last time I had them.  When I had them this time, they were a little soggy and cold.  
I was disappointed because I had them once before and they were on point.

Service: Here's where PC loses some stars. Minus one star for being slow.  The waitress actually took our orders and brought our food out very quickly, but after that the service fell off.  Took awhile to get a refill on my drink, and to get the check after the meal was over.

This might be mean, but minus one star for the hostess.  Don't get me wrong, the hostess was nice and all, but she was wearing this black mini-skirt, showing off way too much skin (she wasn't the attractive).  The whole time I was thinking, you're a hostess at a restaurant, not a vegas night club.  Other than that, the foods great.

Sweet Potato Fries

sweet potato fries.review:

excerpts: Sandwich came with Sweet Potato fries and a wasabi aioli which was also really good.
sweet potato fries.author: Resa N.
sweet potato fries.review:
I worked in the inner sunset area today and was excited to try some new lunch spots.  I ended up yelping a few  places but Pacific Catch caught my attention with the reviews and pictures of their Poke and Dulce de Leche Spring Rolls.

I sat at the bar and ordered my food to go to enjoy it directly across the street from Golden Gate Park.  I ordered:

Poke Appetizer - It really was ono (dee-lish). I mean it wasn't like the real stuff in Hawaii but it was pretty good.  The sushi grade Ahi was cut perfectly and the color was bright (meaning fresh) with just the right amount of marinade.  It did lack the seaweed flavor but the crispy wontons they serve with it was the perfect combination of textures.

Vietnamese Steak Sandwich - Yummy!  It's not your average Bun Mi.  First of all, it's square shaped.  And the bread is soft!!! It still has the same marinated steak, seasoned veggies and heat flavor.  Sandwich came with Sweet Potato fries and a wasabi aioli which was also really good.

Dulce de Leche Spring Rolls - I was so full from the poke and half a sandwich that I didn't really get to enjoy this as fresh as I wanted to, therefore this was just OK to me.  I probably need to try it again to enjoy it more.  It kind of reminded me a skinny chimi cheesecake with vanilla ice cream.  

Regardless, I really enjoyed my food and I'd def be back if in the near vicinity.

excerpts: Sweet potato fries =
Extra crispy, kind of a spicy touch.
hrm, not sure if it suits my palate.
sweet potato fries.author: Angela L.
sweet potato fries.review:
FOOD:
1.) Korean Bbq rice bowl = Yum! Worth it. Falls off the bone, good taste
2.) Poke = It was good. Tastes a lil different than other poke? Not sure if the fish is the freshest..
3.) Sweet potato fries = Extra crispy, kind of a spicy touch. hrm, not sure if it suits my palate. I think I was expecting it to be sweet 

SERVICE:
Good. Ummm and pretty good Happy Hour prices

ATMOSPHERE:
It's pretty nice, contemporary, good for a casual date. Has a nice bar area. Some outdoor seating, plus booth seating.

excerpts: Awesome sweet potato fries with kosher salt, a nice mildly sweet twist from the fish tacos with salsa and plenty of lime.
The lemongrass mojito was sharp, and they have some pretty good beer on tap.
sweet potato fries.author: Chelsea P.
sweet potato fries.review:
Pretty solid.

Generous servings on the fish tacos. Big chunks of fish, lots of tomatillo sauce and aoili (I had to scrape some off). I opted for the shrimp, mahi mahi and the catch of the day which was rock cod, and the rock cod was probably my favorite. The tacos held their form pretty well, but I still had to eat a little with my fork. No complaints, it was equally delicious. Awesome sweet potato fries with kosher salt, a nice mildly sweet twist from the fish tacos with salsa and plenty of lime. The lemongrass mojito was sharp, and they have some pretty good beer on tap. Bomb.

Annnnnd if you snagged a goody bag at the Yelp Holiday Party this year there's a coupon for a free Hawaiian poke or shirmp ceviche appetizer with a  purchase of entree priced at $12.95 or above. The poke they had at the party had bit too much soy, but my guess is because it was made and then brought to the party (poke chunks probably dripped along the way and gathered a pool), not made to order like at the restaurant. The poke we ordered was plump and by no means soggy. Served with plenty of fried won tons. MMMM.

I wouldn't come here for sushi, but they do seafood well and the staff (including the chefs they had at PLEY!) were very friendly. Not the decor, but the menu seemed a little touristy and like a chain (a la Elephant Bar and such), but the food was good. They offer a late night happy hour on the weekend (after 10pm, but before they close at 11pm) with cheap appetizers and drinks, definitely a great deal. There's even a parking lot for customers. How awesome is that?!

excerpts: Ordered california rolls, sweet potato fries, and some other things involving seafood which I do not remember.
sweet potato fries.author: Jenn L.
sweet potato fries.review:
Pretty nice place for reasonably priced fusion japanese seafood. Ordered california rolls, sweet potato fries, and some other things involving seafood which I do not remember. But I assure you it was pretty delicious. 

Oh and just noticed they have a parking lot!!! That's pretty rare in this city.

excerpts: As others have noted, the sweet potato fries are bomb and come with many of the dishes, so before you order yourself a whole side of sweet potato fries, check if your meal already comes with it!
sweet potato fries.author: Lydia W.
sweet potato fries.review:
First of all, note that they have a private parking lot on the Lincoln side of the restaurant. Because we drove down 9th, we went straight into the park and worked up an appetite walking to the restaurant. No biggie because who doesn't love a stroll through the park? But for the anxious-parker, rejoice at the private parking lot!

I love the dining area. The high ceilings are almost unheard of in affordable city dining and it creates a really spacious atmosphere. It is also bright and tables have a good amount of space in between them. 

Pacific Catch has the most adorable nibble-food I've ever seen. Maybe I'm just a sucker for goldfish. Every table gets a tray of edamame and pretzel-flavored goldfish crackers! So cute. The two don't really go that well together but it makes for a very aesthetically pleasing start to the meal.

The menu is a little big and overwhelming. I just picked stuff off of the June specials menu because they were promoting some succulent shrimp specials that sounded enticing. I was tempted to go for the ahi wasabi bowls that I had read about but decided I didn't want to pay $14 for a rice bowl. Maybe next time.

Instead I went with the $13 shrimp banh mi. I expected it to be delicious because this is 26 times more expensive than a banh mi from Saigon and 3 times more expensive than a typical banh mi from Vietnamese sandwich shops. Of course it didn't need to be "authentic", just tasty. It sounded very good in theory but I think the presentation fell short. The bread was much too heavy to enjoy completely; it was more like a cross between a baguette and a roll. Ergh..overall the sandwich tasted like an Asian fusion po'boy. 

I liked that it came with a cool Asian looking salad, but did not like the coleslaw. Too many salads, make up your mind! 

As others have noted, the sweet potato fries are bomb and come with many of the dishes, so before you order yourself a whole side of sweet potato fries, check if your meal already comes with it!

The tacos looked good but overpriced. The fish looked tasty and reasonable for what you pay. The shrimp papaya salad was not good and the little shrimp was just weird to eat with the crunchy papaya! 

They charge you for brewed green tea. Our server was not particularly friendly to us and seemed completely uninterested in anything, but didn't really do much to affect our dining experience here. 

A solid semi-chain restaurant.

excerpts: For two of us, we ordered the Hawaiian Poke, Cabo Calamari, King crab leg soup, and traditional tacos with sweet potato fries.
My favorite was Hawaiian poke, sushi-grade ahi tuna in a sesame-soy marinade & spicy seasonings with wonton crisps, and Calamari.
sweet potato fries.author: Stacy L.
sweet potato fries.review:
Went there on Saturday for dinner, and we got seated right before the dinner crowded came in.  Finding parking is always challenge in Irving area at night, but we were lucky to find a parking in the parking lot. The dinner was great and the services was fast. For two of us, we ordered the Hawaiian Poke, Cabo Calamari, King crab leg soup, and traditional tacos with sweet potato fries. 
My favorite was Hawaiian poke, sushi-grade ahi tuna in a sesame-soy marinade & spicy seasonings with wonton crisps, and Calamari. To me, the ahi tuna got slightly too salty near the bottom of the bowl, I think it might be the soy sauces that marinade the fish. For dinner we ordered, the Fried Dulce de Leche "Spring Rolls", which spring roll that wrap with cluster or cheese cake filling.  And served with vanilla ice cream & caramel sauce....Yummy

excerpts: I was tempted to order everything on their Bar Bites menu but opted to have just the first 5 items (minus the edamame beans and sweet potato fries) and 2 refreshing cosmos - YUM YUM.
I have been here before but
for some reason the food was not as good as I remembered.
sweet potato fries.author: Rose J.
sweet potato fries.review:
The bar area was already packed at 4:15pm on a Friday but my bf and I were quickly seated to begin our happy hour experience.  We sat at one of the tables with the tall bar stools, which was quite uncomfortable as the bottom of the table was not hollow for our legs to fit into.  My knees kept hitting the sides of the table. 

Now for the food.  I was tempted to order everything on their Bar Bites menu but opted to have just the first 5 items (minus the edamame beans and sweet potato fries) and 2 refreshing cosmos - YUM YUM.  I have been here before but for some reason the food was not as good as I remembered.  I had the following in the order of favorite to least favorite:

Asparagus & Shiitake Roll: It was an interesting vegetarian take on a sushi roll and I found the asparagus tempura and the tiny strings of mushroom and carrot to be quite lovely.

Thai Coconut Shrimp: It's funny because when I had my first bite, I was like "OMG...it feels like a Thai restaurant in my mouth."  Now looking at the menu as I write this entry, the dish's name is quite befitting. The coconut flavors are so quintessentially Thai.  I loved the crunch of the crispy coconut flakes and the juicy shrimp.  Frankly, I ended up just eating the coconut flake outer layer instead of the shrimp because it was so good.  The sweet and sour dipping sauce (that you can buy at any Asian market) was a nice complement. 

Spicy Tuna Roll: This roll was actually spicy, which I appreciated.  It was yummy with the bitterness of the daikon sprouts.  

Hawaiian Poke:  This was a disappointment as everyone had been raving about it.  Mainly because the poke tasted so gummy.  It did not simply melt in my mouth and the chopped green onions were a bit too overpowering.  I do like my poke to be marinated for a few hours so that the fish really soaks up the flavors but I just felt it had been marinated too long.  And the crispy chips started to give me a headache...which I get when I eat too much fried food.  Disappointing.

Spicy Cabo Calamari:  Pretty good but nothing too spectacular.  It was interesting that they also deep-fried slices of lemon and peppers.  The peppers were really yummy and SPICY...hehe...I attempted to eat the lemons too, but I suggest you not do that.      

The food is pretty good and very well priced. They also played good music...love Bob Marley. :) I think I hyped myself up for this dining experience as I hadn't been here in a long time.  I probably won't go for a few months.  I'm sure I will start missing the Coconut Shrimp by then.

excerpts: mixed basket & chips: fish, coconut shrimp, oysters w/ sweet potato fries.
Everything was fresh and were lightly battered which i like.
The fish was cooked perfectly for deep fried fish.
Normally at other places, i get this heavily battered fish where the meat doesn't flake off, it's just one hard and dry piece of fish.
here it was still soft and flaky.
The coconut shrimp was delicious in taste, i only wish it was bigger shrimp.
The oyster was pretty good.
The sweet potato fries was really good too - perfectly crisp and lightly salted.
sweet potato fries.author: Cherie T.
sweet potato fries.review:
3.5 stars

ceviche - looked more like guacamole than what i've had of ceviche but it still tasted really good. they give you 7 whole shrimps and was loaded w/ fresh avocados.  Oh and they also give you tortilla chips so you can eat it w/ the ceviche.

mixed basket & chips: fish, coconut shrimp, oysters w/ sweet potato fries. Everything was fresh and were lightly battered which i like. The fish was cooked perfectly for deep fried fish. Normally at other places, i get this heavily battered fish where the meat doesn't flake off, it's just one hard and dry piece of fish. here it was still soft and flaky. The coconut shrimp was delicious in taste, i only wish it was bigger shrimp. The oyster was pretty good. The sweet potato fries was really good too - perfectly crisp and lightly salted. 

service was great! we had told them beforehand that we were going to  share the appetizer and the mixed basket. They divided the basket for us which made it easier for us to eat since we now have our own basket of food. And instead of giving us 3 oysters total.. we got 4 (2 for each of us). And we each have our own plate of cole slaw and fries! 


yes, i'd come back here again. And it's walking distance from california academy of sciences - perfect place to grab lunch during your visit at CAS or dinner after you visit the CAS

excerpts: The sweet potato fries were soggy, but our waiter kindly and quickly brought us a fresh order.
The $19 miso cod was bleh.
sweet potato fries.author: Amy J.
sweet potato fries.review:
This is the TGIFridays/Bennigans/AppleBee's of San Francisco! Perfect atmosphere if you have 3 children who want to bang chopsticks on the table for 1 hour! Perhaps you have a kid who wants to throw french fries on the ground? Or maybe your children just love to be kids, singing, yelling, running around a restaurant? Well, THIS is the place for YOU! 

Every staff member we encountered was great. No complaints. 

Everything on the menu sounded sooo good! The food and the presentation were both a huge letdown. They serve some of their dishes in a paper lined metal basket. The sweet potato fries were soggy, but our waiter kindly and quickly brought us a fresh order. The $19 miso cod was bleh. The ahi poke was the saltiest dish ever.

The place is HUGE and loud. Not a good place for a date night. This felt like a good hang out joint for 16 year olds, and 4 year olds. 

Sorry!

excerpts:
Ok I need to update my review
Sweet potato fries - definitely worth it..
sweet potato fries.author: Monica S.
sweet potato fries.review:
Ok I need to update my review
Sweet potato fries - definitely worth it.. 

Sushi - pretty gross.. AND yes i know this isnt a sushi place so what was I thinking.. I am now telling myself. What were you thinking!

note to self.. fries - yes.. sushi - never!

Takeout service was pretty lame. My bag was waiting in the kitchen forever.. I watched it, thankfully my blood sugar wasn't low!

excerpts: I used to come here since this was the only place way back when that had sweet potato fries.
Since everyone has them now it isn't as fun
sweet potato fries.author: Michelle B.
sweet potato fries.review:
This place is very Yummy! I usually don't like raw fish but the Hawaiian Poke is wonderful! Weather you get it in a salad or a sushi roll it is very good with great flavor! 

I used to come here since this was the only place way back when that had sweet potato fries. Since everyone has them now it isn't as fun however I must say this is the best place still compared to everywhere I have tried them! 

The island tacos are very tasty as well! Not very big but still great. But the reason why i love it here is for the JAPANESE WASABI RICE BOWLS! (wakame salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, cucumber, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori & soy-wasabi sauce). I was here about two months ago and I see they changed and added some new rice bowls but I haven't tried them yet. These are very filling and you will for sure have something to take home with you for later if that is what you are looking for. 

Also if you likes sweets you cant leave this place without trying their Fried Dulce de Leche "Spring Rolls" (vanilla ice cream & caramel sauce). OMG TO DIE FOR! It is not a huge dessert and since it tastes so great it is NOT FOR SHARING! lol 

Definitely a good place to eat...

excerpts: Some fish that starts with an e that I can't remember, but it had some spice rub on it, served with some green sauce, sweet potato fries and grilled zucchini, peppers and corn.
- Dessert:
sweet potato fries.author: Nadia L.
sweet potato fries.review:
I was introduced to this place a couple of years ago when we attended a graduation celebration here. Since then I haven't had a chance to make it back here until recently and I'm so glad I did. 

After running B2B, we were trying to decide where to eat and since I've been talking about wanting to go back here for I don't know how long, the rest of my group decided to accomodate my request. 

We got there right at 11am when it opened which was perfect since we were able to find parking in the small lot next to the restaurant for customers and we were seated in a nice table next to the window where we could see peopel walkby in their costumes.

For lunch we had:
- Ahi tuna poke (starter) served with wonton chips- super fresh and just as tasty as I remember. I could probably eat a whole serving of this myself
- Sushi grade ahi salad- seared ahi, avocado, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds with soy-wasabi vinaigrette- delicious and fresh it was a perfect meal after a run
- Cabo shrimp taco- crispy shrimp with pico de gallo, avocado, jalapeño tartar & lime crema- huge shrimp, lightly battered and super tasty. 
- Monthly special: Some fish that starts with an e that I can't remember, but it had some spice rub on it, served with some green sauce, sweet potato fries and grilled zucchini, peppers and corn.
- Dessert: Mochi fondue- came with 3 type of mochi- chocolate, vanilla and coffee with a warm fudge in the middle- yummy!! 

Everything was fantastic. If I lived in SF or if my office was remotely close to this restaurant,  I would probably be here a lot more. Service was also super friendly and I appreciate our server for putting up with my endless requests for tea (it was freezing outside!). What can I say, I love this place and am looking forward to coming back to try more dishes from their menu.

excerpts: Sweet potato fries and ceviche were both pretty good, too.
The order of ceviche was kind of small.
sweet potato fries.author: ROB L.
sweet potato fries.review:
Came here after Fan Fest for some non-ballpark food.  We'd never been to the Chestnut location, and this is just too close to home to pass up.  It was crab season, so there was a slew of extra crab items on the menu.  I had the crab melt, and it was something kind of awesome.  Well, I actually split it with my sister, who had the crab chowder (bisque? well soup something).  Either way, we both agreed that the crab melt was SO much superior than the soup!  Her friend from England had the fish and chips.  She said they were "ok."  Sandra got shrimp tacos.  I think she also liked the crab melt better!  

Sweet potato fries and ceviche were both pretty good, too.  The order of ceviche was kind of small.  Probably should stick to the Mission for ceviche!  

We'd probably walk over here again, but only during crab season!

excerpts: The highlights are the Wasabi Brown Rice Bowls (Usually get the Hawaiian Poke), the Fish Tacos (whatever is the special fish of the day), and the Sweet Potato Fries.
sweet potato fries.author: Dee T.
sweet potato fries.review:
I used to grub at the Marina location once a month, but since they established the Sunset location, I was ecstatic as there is parking lot, more spacious, and no long lines.  

The highlights are the Wasabi Brown Rice Bowls (Usually get the Hawaiian Poke), the Fish Tacos (whatever is the special fish of the day), and the Sweet Potato Fries. The dipping sauces are such a great complement. 

Ambiance is definitely more airy than the Marina joint and the decor has a contemporary feel. 

Prices are reasonable for its generous portions. 

Staff is always friendly and don't make you wait to long to place an order, ask for stuff, or get you the bill. 

Can't wait for my next trip here...

excerpts:
The sweet potato fries were abundant, too. 

I think if I were to come here again, I'd order calamari and a side of sweet potato fries for dinner.
sweet potato fries.author: Amy D.
sweet potato fries.review:
I was the first to arrive for a birthday party of 13, 15 minutes before the reservation. Upon checking in, the hostess took my box of a dozen cupcakes back for me without me having to ask. 

We had calamari, California rolls and fried shrimp rolls for appetizers. All were really tasty. I can't even remember the last time I've had a California roll with real crab. When you order the calamari, watch out for the slices of fried lemon! 

Dinner went smoothly without any mixed up orders. The birthday girl's grandmother ordered salmon cakes and wasn't very happy with her order, but everyone else seemed satisfied. I had the Mixed Catch Basket ($13.95)- it's a lot of food. In order of preference, 1. fish 2. oysters 3. coconut shrimp. The sweet potato fries were abundant, too. 

Later, they served the cupcakes on plates with spoons to everyone and it was really nice.

I think if I were to come here again, I'd order calamari and a side of sweet potato fries for dinner.

PS- They have disposable chopsticks here, and if you use a pair for appetizers, the waiter will take them away with your plate, and you have to open a new pair of chopsticks for your entree. Am I the only one who thinks this is super wasteful? I don't mean to go all Avatar on you (I haven't even seen it), but think of the trees!

excerpts: Forgot to mention to start out with the sweet potato fries, which are probably the best I've ever had.

I think he was trying to be cool and memorize our order (not too hard because we only ordered three things), but my bowl came out with brown rice instead of sushi rice, and halfway through the meal we figured out we wouldn't be getting our sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: Kuishinbo E.
sweet potato fries.review:
I've been here three times in the past 13 months.  The first two times were last summer, 2010, with the most recent being yesterday.  The first two times, I became infatuated with their Japanese Wasabi 'Asian Bowl' with Hawaiian Poke.  Ordered sushi rice both times over brown rice and loved the combination of flavors with the added zing of the wasabi.  The bowl seems a little on the pricey side until you get it and it's huge and filling.  Forgot to mention to start out with the sweet potato fries, which are probably the best I've ever had.   

My only gripe about this place came yesterday, when my party was among the handful of tables here but had to wait to be seated, wait to make our orders, and on top of that, the waiter messed up on everything.  I think he was trying to be cool and memorize our order (not too hard because we only ordered three things), but my bowl came out with brown rice instead of sushi rice, and halfway through the meal we figured out we wouldn't be getting our sweet potato fries.  I'm guessing the manager came out and took over our table because of the multiple errors and comped our fries.

All in all, whether it was the poor service or just my overdue, over-hyped expectation, my bowl was not as great as last year.  Sad to say, this experience ruined this place a little for me which is too bad because the place is a nice place to eat.  Also, my silverware was dirty and that's unacceptable when you're charging $40+ for lunch.

excerpts: but if anything I will definately go back for the Fried Oysters and the sweet potato fries.
YUM...
And the people are nice too..
sweet potato fries.author: Jamie B.
sweet potato fries.review:
This place is awesome... i love going to the Marina to eat.  This place is a gem.  I haven't had everything on the menu...but if anything I will definately go back for the Fried Oysters and the sweet potato fries.YUM... 
And the people are nice too..

excerpts: I got a deece sando, mahi or whatever fish bullshit, and some sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: Michael P.
sweet potato fries.review:
This is going to piss of John T., I know it.

I don't really like this place.  I thought, when I first went there, that it was a dos coyotes (http://www.yelp.com/biz/dos-coyotes-sacramento) of seafood. I got a deece sando, mahi or whatever fish bullshit, and some sweet potato fries.  Those were damn good, but so is bacon every time you eat it.  

Beyond that, fuck it.  Location speaks for itself: it's designed to capture tourists from the science museums that want seafood because they're in San Francisco...  when does that EVER lead you in the right direction?  In-N-Out, that's where.  But besides that, this place is low on the list.  Tried the martinis during happy hour.  4 dollars or something real cheap, but it's shitty booze, and the better shit is ~$3 more than it should be.

AND THEY RAN OUT OF FISH AND CHIPS AT OUTSIDE LANDS AT 5PM.

excerpts: I finally settled on the shrimp and salmon tacos, which comes with a side of sweet potato fries.
I thought everything tasted okay, fresh, crispy and not-soggy fries.
sweet potato fries.author: Dru C.
sweet potato fries.review:
The family suggested this place for lunch, so we came here after finding some hard-earned street parking down several blocks away. Parking meters and their wretched quarter-gulping system... damn you! That's one thing that I hate, not enjoying a meal because you're worried if you're parking meter will run out of time. 

I'm a big seafood fan, especially fish or shrimp, so I had a tough time choosing what to eat. I finally settled on the shrimp and salmon tacos, which comes with a side of sweet potato fries. I thought everything tasted okay, fresh, crispy and not-soggy fries. Everyone else in the party seemed to enjoy their fish entrees. 

The problem is, living down in SoCal, there's a restaurant called California Fish Grill that's very similar to this place. Decent quality food, a plethora of choices, and a wide variety. Not quite the "Asian-fusion" vibe or waiter service, but comparable. The major difference is that Cali Fish Grill is very inexpensive compared to Pacific Catch. 

Our bill at Pacific Catch including tip was over $80, which I thought was very overpriced. Then again, there was nothing to complain about with the food. Perusing the reviews, it seems like Happy Hour is where it's at for the best deals. With all the other seafood choices in SF, I don't think I'd be returning again.

excerpts: When we were finally seated, we ordered sweet potato fries, calamari, lets get saucy sushi roll, and coconut shrimp.
sweet potato fries.author: Robert Y.
sweet potato fries.review:
Came here for happy hour right after thursday nightlife. It seemed this place was understaffed as only 2 waiters and a busboy was serving the entire restaurant and took them at least 10 mins to get our tables cleaned and ready from the previous customers. When we were finally seated, we ordered sweet potato fries, calamari, lets get saucy sushi roll, and coconut shrimp. 

The calamari was decent and came with a wasabi/horseradish sauce and a sweet, sour, and spicy sauce. This was probably the best appetizer dish on the happy hour menu. The sweet potatoe fries were nothing special but a little soggy and less crispy then I expected. The lets get saucy roll was very tasty and I would recommend it.  The coconut shrimp was nothing special but if you like shrimp its decent enough to warrant a order. I also got the Kona Longboard Lager which  was light and slightly more flavorful then bud or coors.

Overall its a decent place for happy hour, especially after nightlife since its a 5 min walk; although the service was subpar due to understaffing. I might come back here again but probably just for happy hour as the rest of the menu is quite expensive and I hear its also smalled portioned.

excerpts: Also you get a choice of sweet potato fries or regular fries or other stuff.
I've never been to a place where sweet potato fries is an option, usually you have to pay extra and you get a giant basket that's meant for 4 people to share.
This makes me happy.
Everything is good, service is great, and well priced.
Never had a bad meal here.
sweet potato fries.author: Catface G.
sweet potato fries.review:
Sometimes I just want some fish. Not make some fish, but have fish that someone else made for me (preferably by a chef) without going to a fancy restaurant and paying a lot for it because i'm really at a steak restaurant with 2 Michelin stars and they just happen to have fish. It's affordable and not smelly gross fish like they have at Applebees. 

Also you get a choice of sweet potato fries or regular fries or other stuff. I've never been to a place where sweet potato fries is an option, usually you have to pay extra and you get a giant basket that's meant for 4 people to share. This makes me happy. Everything is good, service is great, and well priced. Never had a bad meal here.

excerpts: The last time I had good sweet potato fries was back in LA at Father's Office.
Coming here was a must
once I knew we were going to the Academy Arts & Sciences Nightlife.
sweet potato fries.author: Alexander H.
sweet potato fries.review:
Reunited at last. The last time I had good sweet potato fries was back in LA at Father's Office.  Coming here was a must once I knew we were going to the Academy Arts & Sciences Nightlife.  For $12 bucks, you can get a savory BBQ Salmon Sandwich with a generous helping of orange goodness.  To top it off, the two extra sauces (sweet spicy & wasabi aioli) makes everything that much better.  Although I haven't tried their tacos, but judging from the silence at the table I figured it was DAMN good.

I'll be back soon to try their bowls.  I don't think you can go wrong at this restaurant, it's definitely a "CATCH". =)

excerpts: My friends and I ordered fried calamari, peruvian ceviche, sweet potato fries, and platters of hawaiian poke.
The dishes are soo fresh!
I liked the fried battered lemons and the brown rice on my entree.
The service was excellent, the atmosphere was relaxing, and the food is delicious!
I would love to come back!
A bit pricy but worth it!
sweet potato fries.author: Allister D.
sweet potato fries.review: This place is legit for their seafood platters. My friends and I ordered fried calamari, peruvian ceviche, sweet potato fries, and platters of hawaiian poke. The dishes are soo fresh! I liked the fried battered lemons and the brown rice on my entree. The service was excellent, the atmosphere was relaxing, and the food is delicious! I would love to come back! A bit pricy but worth it!

excerpts:
(if you can't find parking on Irving, try parking at the park and walk across the street)

Catch of the Day with sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: Roll N.
sweet potato fries.review:
- nice & clean restaurant
- great location, across the street from the Golden Gate Park (if you can't find parking on Irving, try parking at the park and walk across the street)

Catch of the Day with sweet potato fries. It was good, but not great. The pineapple fried rice is awesome though! Sorry, not much help.

excerpts: We both ordered the 3-taco plate with side of sweet potato fries.
Everything was delicious!.
It was a bit hard to get waiters attention but only
bc it was so busy at the time.
sweet potato fries.author: Nicole K.
sweet potato fries.review:
Came here for the first time last wednesday for dinner. We ended up sitting in the bar so we could watch the bball game. The bartender was awesome. Let you taste beers if you weren't too sure about what you wanted, and made a damn good top shelf margarita!

We both ordered the 3-taco plate with side of sweet potato fries. Everything was delicious!. It was a bit hard to get waiters attention but only bc it was so busy at the time.

excerpts: The sweet potato fries however, unlike Helen V.'s review, were cold.
sweet potato fries.author: Dorian T.
sweet potato fries.review:
Came here tonight for my friend's graduation dinner.

I ordered the triple taco mahi mahi platter for $14.50. The tacos were very good. The fish was hot and crispy and the flavors were all around delightful. The sweet potato fries however, unlike Helen V.'s review, were cold. 

The waitress was very friendly, even joking around with some of my friends and I. Although the price for the food was fair, it did not wow me to the point where finding parking was worth being a regular here.

However, they do have a happy hour menu and I probably will come back for that. Till then - Happy Dining!

Oh, and I found out one of the waitresses do not like spicy sauce, and no I was not hitting on her.

excerpts: the sweet potato fries it came with were so good.
sweet potato fries.author: Stella J.
sweet potato fries.review:
service was really good, it was speedy!

tried the clam miso soup, not really a fan of miso soup, but this one changed my mind, it had the right amount of flavor and it wasnt like other places way too salty.

had the cabo shrimp tacos those were good, but the spicy chipolte chicken one was a bit on the dry side. the sweet potato fries it came with were so good.

my friend had the hawiian poke dish, the poke was so good here and it was fresh. it came with a tad too much rice though.

overall, i would come back here again, it was good!

excerpts: The sweet potato fries make an excellent combo!
sweet potato fries.author: Rob R.
sweet potato fries.review:
For lunch, we had the Ahi Tuna Sandwich ($10), the assorted seafood tacos ($15), and a brownie sundae ($7).  The ahi sandwich was excellent and I would definitely recommend it.  The seafood tacos were fair, but I would only get the shrimp again.  The sweet potato fries make an excellent combo!

The service was average, but we did manage to ask for a couple of refills of iced tea.

excerpts:
Sturgeon with Sweet Potato Fries & Veggies
Nothing really special, a bit disappointed
sweet potato fries.author: Yan N.
sweet potato fries.review:
Appetizer:
Ahi Tuna Poke - OK
Won Ton Chips were tasty, not bland for once

Entree:
Sturgeon with Sweet Potato Fries & Veggies
Nothing really special, a bit disappointed

The one star for our waiter being awesome! (Parker)
Gave us dessert on the house since we didnt really enjoy our food
Dulche De Leche Sping Rolls - The highlight of the whole meal!

I probably wont be coming back here...

excerpts: Always always always start off with the sweet potato fries.
Always.
Then order whatever the hell you want to drink.
Then order a dish that includes  poke.
The rice bowl for a heartier meal, a salad for a light one, but always with the poke!
Whatever else you want to order is up to you =)
sweet potato fries.author: Heidi L.
sweet potato fries.review:
I think I've held off on reviewing Pacific Catch because it makes me think of the food, and when I think of the food I start salivating, my stomach starts to rumble and the thought of hawaiian poke just fills my mind and my cravings for it go out of whack.  

Always always always start off with the sweet potato fries.  Always.  Then order whatever the hell you want to drink.  Then order a dish that includes  poke.  The rice bowl for a heartier meal, a salad for a light one, but always with the poke!  Whatever else you want to order is up to you =)

excerpts: Sweet Potato Fries -
while I love them, there was nothing impressive here.
They came with some Thai chili sauce and this other mayo-based sauce.
Mixed Catch Basket - deep fried coconut shrimp, fish, oysters with more sweet potato fries.
The fish was nice and flaky but maybe they need to work on the batter.
sweet potato fries.author: Ellis L.
sweet potato fries.review:
Sorry friends, while I greatly enjoyed your company, the decision to eat here was not.

Sweet Potato Fries - while I love them, there was nothing impressive here. They came with some Thai chili sauce and this other mayo-based sauce. I preferred them with the mayo-based sauce that came with the calamari.

Calamari - not bad, maybe their specialty is to batter-fry the lemon/peppers with it too...I was like: eeek, this calamari tastes like a lemon! (It was!)

Mixed Catch Basket - deep fried coconut shrimp, fish, oysters with more sweet potato fries. The fish was nice and flaky but maybe they need to work on the batter. For me, aside from good ingredients, if I'm gonna eat something fried, the batter needs to be helllla bomb.

The boy ordered some sort of sushi with salmon on it. And avocado. Both of which I love, but not at this particular place.

Sorry Pacific Catch, maybe I caught you on an off day.

excerpts: The salmon and steak tacos were really good and the calamari and sweet potato fries were excellent!
sweet potato fries.author: Kate A.
sweet potato fries.review: We came here for happy hour and it was delicious!! A bit smaller inside but nice atmosphere and really nice wait staff. The salmon and steak tacos were really good and the calamari and sweet potato fries were excellent!

excerpts: The fish was pretty dry, but the sweet potato fries were pretty nice.
I would go here again!
sweet potato fries.author: Nick L.
sweet potato fries.review: I came here for a birthday party, and all I have to say is that this place offers fresh seafood and is worth trying. I would go here more often if it weren't that pricey, but otherwise I would definitely recommend the Hawaiian poke, one of the wasabi bowls, or the tacos. My girlfriend had the salmon fish and chips. The fish was pretty dry, but the sweet potato fries were pretty nice. I would go here again!

excerpts: when i mentioned I loved the dipping sauces for the sweet potato fries they were nice enough to give me extra.
sweet potato fries.author: Amy P.
sweet potato fries.review:
I had the most wonderfully pleasant expierence ordering take out from pacific catch.  The staff was friendly and very efficient, I called and first asked if i could have an order ready by a certain time and they told me that I could do that, but there was a small chance it could get lost (I know there is always this risk and I appreciated they were honest) and it typically to about 20 minutes or something to get an order ready.  I decided to call later.  When i did I got the same friendly service and when i mentioned I loved the dipping sauces for the sweet potato fries they were nice enough to give me extra. YUMMY!!!!

When i got there to pick my food up they were quick, helpful and just made me feel like my business, even if it was pick up, was VERY welcome.  

Also, the curry bowls are SOOOOOO GOOD!!!!  I love the Green Thai Curry with Salmon and Brown Rice.  It always lasts more than a day and heats up super well.  Full of fresh veggies I always feel good when i get it.

excerpts: The calamari and sweet potato fries were amazing!
sweet potato fries.author: Dorris W.
sweet potato fries.review:
They have a really good happy hour. A lot of different drink and food choices! Most happy hour places only give you a few selections, but they give you a wide variety.

The calamari and sweet potato fries were amazing! LARGE PORTION AND CHEAP! 

I wasn't a big fan of spicy tuna since i can't stand too much wasabi, but if you're a wasabi fan you'll like it.

excerpts: We ordered an Ahi Poke appetizer and a few baja tacos with sweet potato fries.
The sweet potato fries were great...
sweet potato fries.author: Rochelle D.
sweet potato fries.review:
We arrived here at 9:30pm on a Thursday night.  All the tables in the bar were full, so we sat in the almost-empty dining room.

We ordered an Ahi Poke appetizer and a few baja tacos with sweet potato fries.

We have always ordered the ahi poke.  Its a definite favorite.  But this time the ahi was a bit too salty.  I think they sprinkled it with sea salt...after it just got doused with soy sauce.  The sweet potato fries were great...this time they didn't come with that great aoili sauce.

Overall...we were able to get a parking space in their 6-car parking lot and were in and out of there in about 30 minutes.

excerpts: The sweet potato fries were pretty good.
The fried oysters and fish n chips were very good.
The staff was nice and fairly attentive.
I plan on goin back fo sho!
sweet potato fries.author: Aaron Y.
sweet potato fries.review: The sweet potato fries were pretty good. The fried oysters and fish n chips were very good. The staff was nice and fairly attentive. I plan on goin back fo sho!

excerpts: Their sweet potato fries are good as everyone says.
Deliciously fried and tastes sweetly made.
sweet potato fries.author: Winè C.
sweet potato fries.review:
I was unpleasantly surprised by the food that I got here, I thought that it was going to be so much better than this.

My friends who came with me ordered the tacos, which i actually suggest in this case though it is supposed to be Asian fusion. Their sweet potato fries are good as everyone says. Deliciously fried and tastes sweetly made. There was the Salmon fish taco which was particularly good as the Salmon was seasoned with the perfect amount of spices. My other friend ordered another sort of fish which was less satisfying but overall edible.

I ordered the crab chowder special for this month and was absolutely confused. At the time, I knew that they were leaning towards the Asian fusion as the decor and the menu boasted a modern chic approach to Asian food. Then tell me why oh why was my crab chowder Mexican? There were bell peppers diced into my soup with celery and what looked like green salsa/hot sauce atop of it. The crab was fresh but the overall taste of everything together tasted like they threw it all together to become a soup. To top it all of too, my plate was warmer than my soup. I saw the soup sitting there for awhile, unaware that it could be mine.

My friends and I came at 2:30PM with minimal amounts of people, however that also translated to minimal amounts of service. I couldn't get someone to heat up my soup until it was well cooler than warm and we couldn't get the check for another 20 minutes after our meal was completely over, as in all the utensils have been collected and the dessert menus are put neatly in a stack next to us.

It was a pretty place and I enjoyed the decor and my friend's company there as it is spacious and nice for drinks.
However for the price that we paid and the service I acquired, I am disappointed. The most disappointing thing of all was the food as I was starving and couldn't even like the food.

It would be nice if you were looking for somewhere to chill and had some time on your hands, but we had to keep sending someone off to feed the meter.

excerpts: I love the sweet potato fries and the free edamame and pretzels to snack on while waiting.
And the wait usually isn't that long.
We haven't been here in about 2 months
so maybe it's gone downhill (judging by a few reviews below)
sweet potato fries.author: Craigary P.
sweet potato fries.review:
I should preface this by saying I actually wanted to hate this place because it replaced the Canvass Cafe, a cafe I loved to frequent. It just looked like some big chain fish place. How dare they!

So given that, I really have been surprised at how much I've liked the food here and have been back several times with the g/f. We've liked the salads but better are the fish tacos and most of their fish entrees. I love the sweet potato fries and the free edamame and pretzels to snack on while waiting. And the wait usually isn't that long.  We haven't been here in about 2 months so maybe it's gone downhill (judging by a few reviews below) but for us the food has always been tasty and the experience has always been good. 

I will say I recommend the fish tacos at Underdog's taco shop down the street even more, but if you're here, they're solid. And I also had a very good fish sandwich.  I would stay away from the Sushi here just because there are some great Sushi specialty places right nearby that do it better, not because it was terrible per se.  But the sandwiches, fish entrees, tacos, all that is good. And we also dig the artichoke appetizer. 

All in all, I still miss the cafe but no longer think this place is evil for existing.

excerpts: The sweet potato fries were irresistible- not too greasy; I kept chomping on them!
sweet potato fries.author: Lisa C.
sweet potato fries.review:
Having been here for lunch, I was looking forward to dinner. I arrived thinking I wanted the seared ahi salad, but that quickly changed as we browsed the menu.  Instead, we opted for a few appetizers and two sushi rolls to share.  The sweet potato fries were irresistible- not too greasy; I kept chomping on them! The Hawaiian Poke and the Shrimp Ceviche starter plates both came with plenty of poke and shrimp pieces. I loved the lime-cilantro-avocado sauce the shrimps were covered in.

Though the starter plates were great, I think the sushi rolls were only ok.  We asked for brown rice for the rising sun and the firecracker salmon rolls.  I was not impressed by the rolls because the brown rice didn't stick too well and the rice fell apart.  I think the next time I'll skip the sushi rolls. 

Surprisingly, there was no wait at all for a Saturday night, and we were able to snag a nice corner window seat.

excerpts: Try the poke, sweet potato fries, or spicy tuna roll.
That said, happy hour is the only time I'd let the Catch reel me in.
sweet potato fries.author: Lou S.
sweet potato fries.review:
Don't get caught up in the hype. 

The entrees are all about $15 but aren't worth more than $10. The salads are unimpressive; the bowls are better but nothing spectacular.  

Happy hour (4-6, 10-11:30) is a good deal, with quality tap beer and small dishes $2-6. Try the poke, sweet potato fries, or spicy tuna roll. That said, happy hour is the only time I'd let the Catch reel me in.

excerpts: Sweet potato fries were good, but slightly overfried and dry.
All our orders came out about the same time.
sweet potato fries.author: Thomas L.
sweet potato fries.review: Had to fill my tummy after Bay to Breakers craziness.... We managed to find Pacific Catch after wandering through GG park, and luckily we got a table for 7 of us.. The waitress was pretty nice took our orders in a timely fashion. I got the Pacific catch of the day fish and chips. It was cod, and was fried perfectly. Slightly crunchy on the outside and very soft and flaky on the inside. They included a sweet chili and tartar dip, both were flavored nicely. Sweet potato fries were good, but slightly overfried and dry. All our orders came out about the same time.

excerpts:
We ordered the following:

Calamari
Coconut Shrimp
Asparagus and Shitake Mushroom sushi
A mix of seasoned and unseasoned sweet potato fries and seasoned fries
The seasoned sweet potato fries were so peppery you couldn't taste the sweet potato at all.
The unseasoned sweet potato fries tasted a little better, but felt too soggy and soft to me.
sweet potato fries.author: Lyn L.
sweet potato fries.review:
This is the only place I've ever been to which has a late night happy hour. I came here around 11pm last night for some late night happy hour eats after having gone to a private event at the CA Academy of Sciences across the street in Golden Gate Park. 

Prices were very reasonable ranging from $4.95 to $5.95. We ordered the following:

Calamari
Coconut Shrimp
Asparagus and Shitake Mushroom sushi
A mix of seasoned and unseasoned sweet potato fries and seasoned fries

The place is very spacious and has high ceilings. The service is good, but as much as I want to give this place more stars I just can't. Here's why:

The calamari had slices of lemon battered and fried along with the calamari. That would have been fine if the calamari didn't taste soggy.

The coconut covering around the shrimp kept falling off. It was hard to take a bite out of the shrimp without having the the batter completely fall apart off the shrimp. On the bright side the coconut  batter was nice and crunchy, but that could have been because it was overly fried. 

Just a tip, if you see that fried items are not a golden brown, but a dark brown, it could be because the items have been either re-fried or fried for too long.

The seasoned sweet potato fries were so peppery you couldn't taste the sweet potato at all. It comes with two dipping sauces, one is a sweet sauce, the same one you get with the coconut shrimp, and the other is supposed to be a tangy sauce, but tasted too vinegary. 

The unseasoned sweet potato fries tasted a little better, but felt too soggy and soft to me. They are thinly sliced, and I think I would have preferred if it they were more crunchy. 

The only bright spot was the asparagus and shitake mushroom sushi, which was delicious. It would have been nice if it came with a little saucer of soy sauce or something so you could mix the wasabi in it for dipping.

This place might be great for dinner, but for their happy hour eats I didn't think they were that great.

excerpts: We also ordered the famous sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: Jenny K.
sweet potato fries.review:
I finally ate here and wondered why I hadn't tried this place sooner! After a day at the DeYoung Museum, we were starving and tried many seafood delights. As it was dungeness crab season, there were a number of crab specials. We tried the dungeness crab and corn chowder (not overly creamy, delicious, with lots of lump crab meat) and the dungeness crab dumplings (scrumptious). We also ordered the famous sweet potato fries. So good and served with two tasty dipping sauces - a sweet chili sauce and a wasabi-infused aioli sauce. 

For my entree I had the ahi poke wasabi bowl with brown rice and my husband had the grilled yellowtail special. I am officially addicted to the wasabi bowls. The portion was huge: many hearty chunks of poke tuna, perfectly ripe avocado slices, nori, wakame, daikon radish sprouts, ginger atop nutty brown rice. YUMMMM. My husband loved his yellowtail; I had a bite and it was really good - cooked perfectly with a delicious sauce.

I found the prices to be reasonable for the quality and portion sizes. Commendable service.

excerpts: Speaking of fries, SWEET POTATO FRIES, yummay!!
The Cajun fries weren't bad too, but I love sweet potato fries and these would be rated 9 on my scale of 10 (10 being absolute perfection).
sweet potato fries.author: Ede S.
sweet potato fries.review:
I thought I did a good job by reading Yelp reviews before I came to this place for my future brother in law's surprise birthday lunch. After seeing what everyone else at the table ordered compared to me and my fiance, I was deeply disappointed in myself. I should've read everything more thoroughly, doh!

I did read that the fish tacos were good so I ordered that. They weren't horrible, but comparing my dish to everyone else, it felt like I was a kid who got chicken fingers and fries at a wedding whereas everybody else got the prime rib. Speaking of fries, SWEET POTATO FRIES, yummay!! The Cajun fries weren't bad too, but I love sweet potato fries and these would be rated 9 on my scale of 10 (10 being absolute perfection).

For a casual encounter, I would definitely recommend fish tacos which comes with the choice of fries (choose sweet potato). But everyone at the table (or at least 90% of the people) ordered the Wasabi bowl. Next time I'm back, I will definitely get that. Not only does it look delish, it's also quite healthy as well. From what I noticed with other people, they had a choice of white or brown rice, half salad and half Ahi tuna. Oh my gosh my mouth is watering and my stomach just grumbled a bit while I thought about that.

Next time... Wasabi bowl... get in my belly!!!

excerpts: The sweet potato fries are a great show stopper, while the off menu Vietnamese sandwich is fantastic...but very hot.
sweet potato fries.author: Sami R.
sweet potato fries.review:
We have come to this location a couple of times, and have been impressed on each visit. Its not quite as good as the Corte Madera branch, but still a nice, spacious location with its own parking lot (a huge plus for the crowded area).

In terms of the food, its always top notch. The portions are a little on the small side, but the food is good. The sweet potato fries are a great show stopper, while the off menu Vietnamese sandwich is fantastic...but very hot.

The downside of this location is that it's on the pricey side, as it's pretty hard to get out of here without spending around $35 on a party of two.

Overall, a little pricier than we like, but still a nice location and a nice menu to compliment it.

excerpts: Their sweet potato fries are delish.
I've never been disappointed here.
sweet potato fries.author: Christie C.
sweet potato fries.review:
Beware the Dark and Stormy.

In other news.. been here a couple of times.  Left happy and satisfied each time.  The most recent time I came w/ a pretty big group (12 people?) and reserved ahead on Open Table.  They were totally cool when I kept calling in and changing the numbers, almost right up to the actual day.

It's been a while so I don't exactly remember what I got.. but I think it was one of the specials of the day w/ salmon.  I do remember that it had a grilled artichoke.  I'm a sucker for some good artichoke.  And it was good.  The fish too, obvy.  Their sweet potato fries are delish.  I've never been disappointed here.

excerpts: (Don't forget to add sweet potato fries!)
sweet potato fries.author: Ravena F.
sweet potato fries.review:
This is by far my favorite rendition of this space.  Ideally located on a corner spot, near Golden Gate Park, Pacific Catch has an expansive and airy feel.  Add to that the double happy hour times (4-6pm & 10-closing), and you have yourselves a very pleasant atmosphere in which to relax and chat over some mighty fine beverages.  (Don't forget to add sweet potato fries!)

Dinners are quite tasty as well, though all dishes are not created equally.  By far the best bang for the buck is the Wasabi bowl (around $16) with your choice of protein (I'm a fiend for the Hawaiian poke).  You get a huge bowl of rice, seaweed salad, sprouts, wasabi, and all sorts of other tasty additions, plus of course, the poke.  This is the dish that, when ordered, everyone at the table sort of eyes ruefully, perhaps wishing they'd ordered it themselves.  Combine this with the spicy martini (vodka, chili peppers, passion fruit juice), and there I am: leaning back, rubbing my belly, convinced I'm on a tropical vacation, with nothing to do except melt into a silky little puddle of happy place.  

Pacific Catch strikes me as more of a chill with friends or colleagues place, rather than a hot date place.  It is good for groups (definitely make reservations).  I've been told that groups have a 2 hour time limit (even on weekdays), though in my experience that has yet to be enforced.

So to recap:
Go spend a sunny day in the park, get here in time for happy hour, eat, rub your belly.  Thank me later.

excerpts: We got: plenty of beer, sweet potato fries, calamari, spicy tuna roll and a few sides of rice.
I know, nothing totally unique
but regardless we had a great experience.
After all the beer I was too full to order a real entree.
Fast service, quality food at a great price, all on a beautiful day in SF.
I cant wait to go back and try the wasabi bowls.
Also, I am intrigued about the Chestnut location.
sweet potato fries.author: Holl T.
sweet potato fries.review:
Ever since the weird appetizers (cubed raw tuna a la cart served in a paper cup to drunk people) at the Christmas Yelp 'Elite' event last year, I have been wanting to pay a visit to Pacific Catch. I have always heard such good things and could not accept that lame appetizer as the true essence of Pacific Catch. After many hours at the Academy of Science, I wanted Seafood, and Pacific Catch was right there on the corner to full fill my needs! It just so happened to be happy hour too. We were welcomed into a spacious and rather 'safely' designed ambiance - nothing special but still comfortable and nice. 

Anyway, onto the food! Unfortunately I have to do that thing where you can only technically review the happy hour but everything I saw come out of the kitchen looked amazing! We got: plenty of beer, sweet potato fries, calamari, spicy tuna roll and a few sides of rice. I know, nothing totally unique but regardless we had a great experience. After all the beer I was too full to order a real entree. Fast service, quality food at a great price, all on a beautiful day in SF. I cant wait to go back and try the wasabi bowls. Also, I am intrigued about the Chestnut location.

excerpts: And they both came with the sweet potato fries!
It was so tasty & delicious!
The jalapeno tartar sauce was also a nice touch.
Oh, and the tropical tea + lemongrass tea fused together tastes like an arnold palmer
sweet potato fries.author: Liane T.
sweet potato fries.review:
I found this place courtesy of you yelpers out there, and because of you all it is now one of my favorites :)

I took my boyfriend out here for a lunch date in the city. When you first walk in, the ambiance is something of it's own. It has a semi-formal feel, and then it has a casual feel and  I like the fusion of different asian decor. It was rather light out in the day so the sun coming in also had a nice feel. 

Our server was one of the most hospitable that I've ever encountered in my dining out life. He was welcoming since we were new to the place and made recommendations accordingly. He even brought out some of the drink samples (non alcoholic haha mind you) so we could figure out what we'd like. 

We had the thai coconut shrimp appetizer which was delicious, but rather on the small side. My bf has the mixed fish basket and I ordered the fried oyster basket. And they both came with the sweet potato fries! It was so tasty & delicious! The jalapeno tartar sauce was also a nice touch. Oh, and the tropical tea + lemongrass tea fused together tastes like an arnold palmer :) jus thought i'd mix both to give it a try.

I would definitely recommend this place to anyone and everyone. Great service, great ambiance. Parking is a little of a pain but hey, it's the city, it's expected. 

Note to self: A million more things to try next time. Hawaiian Poke. Mahi Mahi Bowl. Etc.

excerpts: get their sweet potato fries, i like that one the best
sweet potato fries.author: Kapo T.
sweet potato fries.review:
i m not a big asian fusion fan probably because i think asian food is traditional enough and shouldn't be made any different. i've been here 3 times and the food is OK. nothing great. the location is great if you need a snack from walking the GGP or the museums. (but there are other food to eat around there also).  

the only thing that i recommend is the happy hour here. on a nice sunny day, the bar and outside seating is packed.  happy hour is from 4p-6p so get your orders in before 6p.  

here's their HH menu: 
Hawaiian Poke - sushi-grade ahi tuna in a sesame-soy marinade & spicy seasonings with wonton crisps
Asparagus & Shiitake - asparagus tempura & shiitake mushrooms with miso dressing
Spicy Tuna - ahi tuna with sriracha mayo
Thai Coconut Shrimp - Thai sweet-chili sauce
Spicy Cabo Calamari - crispy chili & lemon with spicy chipotle sauce
Warm Edamame - Hawaiian Alaea sea salt
Basket of Fries - "signature" sweet potato, traditional or spicy 

and yup, we ordered 3 of everything on the HH menu to beat the time! get their sweet potato fries, i like that one the best

excerpts: Sunshine roll and sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: J F.
sweet potato fries.review:
My girlfriend and I come here 2-4 times a month minimum. Love it! Katie the manager is a firecracker of a sweetheart, the bartenders make some delicious (read strong and tasty) drinks, they have t.v.'s above the bar, and the service is always friendly and neighborly. Neil is our favorite! 

About the food: all very clean, crisp, fresh and satisfying without breaking the bank. You can often request and substitute your order to fit your dietary needs (i.e. gluten free, brown rice, more salad versus rice in your rice bowl, etc.)

Bonus: Sign up for their monthly email alerts and you'll receive coupons for free starters and the like. 

Double Bonus: AMAZING make you wanna do the happy dance happy hours. 

Necessary: Sunshine roll and sweet potato fries. Eat and Repeat!

Parking: Park in the park.

excerpts: This came with cole slaw and sweet potato fries.
Lightly battered so not to overwhelm the fresh rock cod.
Very juicy and moist on the inside, slight crispiness on the outside.
Came with a jalapeno tartar sauce and and a Thai sweet chili sauce.
I added some more sriracha sauce for more kick.
Purple-cabbage cole slaw had a nice light vinaigrette for refreshing taste, instead of a creamy sauce.
Sweet potato fries were great.
sweet potato fries.author: Steve L.
sweet potato fries.review:
After a pretty big banquet lunch at Golden Horse, I figured I was done eating for the day. We dropped by my folks place after lunch, and since they haven't seen the kids in a while, they wanted to spend some time with them. They offered to watch the girls and feed them dinner, so the wife and I can go out for dinner. 

What a nice surprise! An unexpected date night with my wife. Yeah, we were still full from lunch, but we took my folk's offer and headed out. Problem was that it was 7PM on a Saturday night, we had no reservations, and most places were pretty crowded already. We struck out on a couple of places either because parking sucked (No Nopa this time), business closed (bye PJ's), or I was wearing the wrong clothes (I had a sweater, and Naan and Curry was steaming inside, unless I wanted a permanent tandoori smell).

We walked into Pacific Catch, and got a table in the bar area. Pretty lively inside the bar area, with the Cal vs. UCLA hoops game going on (too bad Cal). A lot of people in the bar section were dining in, so the waitresses were doing double duty serving drinks and serving food. 

We ordered: 

-House Cured Sake Salmon. This came with 2 crispy nori rice cakes, wasabi creme fraiche, onions, and black tobiko caviar. Salmon had a mildly cured taste, the wasabi creme fraiche had a little, but not overpowering kick. Rice cakes were nice and crispy. OK starter. 

-2 Chipotle BBQ Salmon Tacos. This was a mistake. My wife wanted 1 salmon taco, and one Cabo shrimp taco, but they gave her 2 salmon tacos, but she didn't complain. These taco were topped with cabbage, corn salsa, and lime crema. Nice big chunk of salmon in each taco, and very tasty. 

-5 piece Fish and chips. Fish of the day was rock cod. This came with cole slaw and sweet potato fries. Lightly battered so not to overwhelm the fresh rock cod. Very juicy and moist on the inside, slight crispiness on the outside. Came with a jalapeno tartar sauce and and a Thai sweet chili sauce. I added some more sriracha sauce for more kick. Purple-cabbage cole slaw had a nice light vinaigrette for refreshing taste, instead of a creamy sauce. Sweet potato fries were great. Not overly fried, but crispy enough so I could still taste the sweet potatoes. 

Too full for dessert : ( 

Food came out pretty quickly, and the servers remembered and follow on requests in spite of the bar being elbow to elbow. 

I driven by this place for years while driving along Lincoln Blvd, and glad we finally tried it. Places like this reminded my wife and I of our dating years. Nice memories......

excerpts: Sweet potato fries were a little sad and not as good as I remembered.
Place was empty for lunch on a Saturday and felt like we were eating at an Islands.
In hindsight, I'd prefer eating at Islands - I would have enjoyed a Big Wave burger and fries much more.
sweet potato fries.author: Kelly R.
sweet potato fries.review: Recently came back here with some friends and was pretty disappointed with my fish tacos (my fault for not going 10 more blocks for delicious fish tacos at Underdog) as well as the overall atmosphere. Sweet potato fries were a little sad and not as good as I remembered. Place was empty for lunch on a Saturday and felt like we were eating at an Islands. In hindsight, I'd prefer eating at Islands - I would have enjoyed a Big Wave burger and fries much more.

excerpts: Island tacos, fresh sushi rolls, stews and fish and chips (with sweet potato fries!)  are also scrumptious choices and help diversify the menu.
There really is a little something for everyone.
sweet potato fries.author: Kerry D.
sweet potato fries.review:
Under the sea
Under the sea
Nobody beat us
Fry us and eat us
In fricassee
We what the land folks loves to cook
Under the sea we off the hook
We got no troubles
Life is the bubbles
Under the sea!

I feel really bad for people who don't eat seafood.  I love me some fish! 
 
I know a lot of feathers were ruffled when Pacific Catch took the place of Canvas.  One less hipster coffee shop in SF, boo-freakin-hoo.  I really like what they did with the space here and I think Pacific Catch adds a lot to the Inner Sunset restaurant selection.  
The Hawaiian poke is my personal favorite (that's what SHE said), on top o' rice bowl or a salad.  The Baja Shrimp Ceviche starter is a another highlight, arriving in a classy martini glass with tortilla chips.  Island tacos, fresh sushi rolls, stews and fish and chips (with sweet potato fries!)  are also scrumptious choices and help diversify the menu.  There really is a little something for everyone.  This location next to the park is ideal and the limited outdoor seating is lovely.  

I've had consistently spotty service here, with the place both packed and empty.  But even so, luckily the food itself is consistently delicious and fresh.  If you have the patience to endure being ignored by the waitstaff and a large space CRAWLING with young kids (Hey -I love 'em, but I know some people don't....) Pacific Catch is a solid casual dining spot.

excerpts: We got the sweet potato fries and they were just as good as everyone else has commented here.
I've never had bad ones
so I have nothing to compare them to.
I loved the horseradish dipping sauce they served with them.
I couldn't imagine a better way to spend my Sunday, sitting in the sun, sipping a corona with lime, eating sushi and sweet potato fries with my friend and our lovely moms.
I can't wait to do this again!
sweet potato fries.author: L. L.
sweet potato fries.review:
This restaurant has something for everyone! My good friend and I brought our moms here after a visit to the Academy of Sciences on one of those rare, gloriously sunny Sundays. My friend and I wanted sushi and our moms wanted fish and chips or ceviche so we came here.

I was surprised the restaurant wasn't more crowded on such a beautiful day. We got a table outside and sipped beer and pisco sours in the warm sun. My friend's mom did not like her pisco sour martini, she said it tasted like it was made from a mix. Well, in all fairness it was a pisco sour *martini* so it was not going to taste exactly like a pisco sour. She is from Chile and a connoisseur :)

I ordered the shrimp tempura sushi and my friend got the spicy tuna and a vegetarian roll. The rolls are huge and definitely well priced for 8 pieces ($7.00-8.00.) They drizzle a mayo-like sauce on them so if you're a purist I would suggest skipping the sauce.

We got the sweet potato fries and they were just as good as everyone else has commented here. I've never had bad ones so I have nothing to compare them to. I loved the horseradish dipping sauce they served with them. I'd like to come back just for drinks and appetizers sometime.

My friend's mom got the shrimp ceviche which was very good. It was loaded with cilantro and avocado. It came with corn chips for dipping. My mom got the fish and chips and was very happy with hers. Overall, everything was delicious, fresh, flavorful and satisfying.
