The service was great too. Our table was tiny but we had two servers helping us rearrange things to get everything to fit. I couldn't imagine a better way to spend my Sunday, sitting in the sun, sipping a corona with lime, eating sushi and sweet potato fries with my friend and our lovely moms. I can't wait to do this again!

excerpts: I had the fish and chips (sweet potato fries) and the fish was good and the fries were yummy.
sweet potato fries.author: Ang F.
sweet potato fries.review: Good fish and interesting menu. Huge place so it's great for groups.  I had the fish and chips (sweet potato fries) and the fish was good and the fries were yummy.

excerpts:
Sweet potato fries - crispy and sweet.
Cerviche - eh.
sweet potato fries.author: A I.
sweet potato fries.review:
I go here because parking is usually convenient and the food is above average. I have never been there when there isn't a child seated near me. 

Edamame and goldfish pretzel crackers? Interesting....
Poke - very good.
Seaweed salad - Excellent, with cucumber and citrus.
Sweet potato fries - crispy and sweet.
Cerviche - eh.
Yellow tail special - had a bit too much seasoning, but was fresh and light.

Would I go again. Yes. They are consistent.

excerpts: I'm craving for some fish tacos & sweet potato fries right now!
yum!
Oh my friend got the lemongrass iced tea along with added sweeteners & it
sweet potato fries.author: Rosalynn D.
sweet potato fries.review:
I came here last night for my birthday dinner with my girls and i thought the food was pretty good. I wanted to order the hawaiian mahi mahi, but it just happens that they were running low on fish that day or something because upon ordering, our waitress announced that they ran out of mahi mahi and a LONG list of other items :*(

So to replace my mahi, i got the mong chong fish. i dont know what that is but it sure ain't the same as mahi. oh well. i'll try back another time. The pineapple fried rice was just okk...it was a bit on the soggy side though, so try to avoid that & their weak skinny onion rings.

It was so hard to choose what I wanted from the menu since everything sounded so good but I have to come back next time to try their fish tacos. I'm craving for some fish tacos & sweet potato fries right now! yum! Oh my friend got the lemongrass iced tea along with added sweeteners & it was so refreshing!

Overall, i thought this place was decent and accommodating to our party of 12 even though we all arrived at different times. damn asians.

i give it a 3.5

excerpts: Yet the sweet potato fries were great as well the thinly sliced onion rings on top that had just a faint amount of batter on them.
sweet potato fries.author: Jonathan F.
sweet potato fries.review:
After hearing so much praise for the fish tacos at Pacific Catch I finally tried them. They are delicious! A real treat and well made. My only criticism is the steak taco. The meat was good but I think the chef needs to slice the steak into strips rather than just one long piece. Not that easy to swallow. 

Yet the sweet potato fries were great as well the thinly sliced onion rings on top that had just a faint amount of batter on them. So they had a bit of crunch but were not smothered in a heavy greasy batter as typical onion rings are. 

The Ahi was just right and delicious. The sauces were hot but flavorful. Oh and the homemade Miso soup is satisfying. Also try the Lemongrass Ice Tea, very good when eating those really spicy dishes. So refreshing. 

Service is good, even when busy and on a weekend, like Friday or Saturday the place gets busy and fills up fast. 

When I go back I want to try the dessert menu. macadamia nut brownies, sound outstanding as I am a fan of macadamia nut anything.

One of my coworkers Robert Callan praises Pacific Catch and he too enjoys the fish tacos. If you ever want to know more about the City and places to go, eat, etc. Talk to Robert. See his web site at:

http://www.robertcallanjr.com/

excerpts: Everything comes freshly fried with those awesome sweet potato fries.
But eat everything while they are fresh!
I don't recommend taking leftover fries home.
so it was spice rubbed and grilled, served with tomatilla avocado sauce, some thin slices of veggies, and fresh grilled corn over sweet potato fries.
I could tell the fish was very fresh but for me, it was TOO seasoned and got a little salty since the fish wasn't very thick.
And though I had originally wanted the fries, I would now have preferred and wished that the fish was served over rice.
sweet potato fries.author: Julia T.
sweet potato fries.review:
Out of the three Pacific Catch locations, I would say this is my overall favorite. Chestnut St. is just way too tiny and crowded, though that might result in the food tasting better because you had to fight so hard to park/get a table. Corte Madera's location is too embedded in the outdoor mall scene and has way too many kiddies running around. But this 9th Ave. location is pretty much perfect with plenty of seating for the bar and regular dining area. It also has its own parking lot so you don't have to compete for the street meters. 

Food is pretty consistent at all locations. You can count on the fact that mostly everything you order from the regular menu will be very good. Some of my favorites are the wasabi bowls (with brown or sushi rice) and any of the fried seafood baskets. I love the Mixed Catch Basket with fish, coconut shrimp and crispy oysters with jalapeño tartar. SO GOOD. Everything comes freshly fried with those awesome sweet potato fries. But eat everything while they are fresh! I don't recommend taking leftover fries home. They really those their flavor after they've cooled down. 

Though their sushi roll selection lacks raw fish, I think they are still made very well with the mostly cooked ingredients. One of my favorites and one that DOES have raw fish is the Rising Sun roll. It has tempura shrimp and avocado wrapped in ahi tuna with a citrus sauce. I don't like that they stuff pickled ginger into the roll but if you're like me, just request that they leave it out. Otherwise it's a very tasty roll. The ahi tuna is always fresh and flavorful.  I love that they give you big pieces of it too. (We got that roll totally F-R-E-E! with the coupon in the Green Zebra book!) I could dine happily on their sushi rolls alone. 

Just recently I ventured off from my regulars and tried one of the their specials: Trout bbq'd baja style so it was spice rubbed and grilled, served with tomatilla avocado sauce, some thin slices of veggies, and fresh grilled corn over sweet potato fries. I could tell the fish was very fresh but for me, it was TOO seasoned and got a little salty since the fish wasn't very thick. And though I had originally wanted the fries, I would now have preferred and wished that the fish was served over rice. I think I'll stick to my regulars next time. 

Big pluses:
-I've talked to the workers and seen for myself that Pacific Catch is environmentally conscious. They use biodegradable materials, from the takeout containers to the straw in your drink. Pacific Catch also practices composting from their kitchen to the leftover food scraps. Smiles all around. =D
-I don't know anywhere else that you can get UNLIMITED refills on Thai iced tea. I could drink three glasses easy. LOVE IT!

excerpts: I've had the coconut shrimp--which were only OK, but since they came with sweet potato fries, I was a happy camper and forgave the overly friend shrimps.
The desserts were HEAVEN.
The Macadamia Nut chocolate cake was to die for.
Spicy Tuna Rolls, calamari, and sweet potato fries for only $3.
sweet potato fries.author: Marissa N.
sweet potato fries.review:
I love Pacific Catch.  Casual and easygoing environment with decent prices, good food, and fruity cocktails.

I've been here a few times before and I've always had a good time.  Several times I've ordered the fish tacos, poke, and fantastic speciality cocktails who's names I cannot recall.  I've had the coconut shrimp--which were only OK, but since they came with sweet potato fries, I was a happy camper and forgave the overly friend shrimps.  The desserts were HEAVEN.  The Macadamia Nut chocolate cake was to die for.  Very rich, so share with at least one other person.

I recent went there with a few friends for Happy Hour (4-6 weekdays).  I have to say I had a great time.  We sat near the bar on a few couches and ordered a truck-load of food: Poke for half price (instead of $11.95 its only $5.95, and seriously its the regular portion!), Spicy Tuna Rolls, calamari, and sweet potato fries for only $3.  The spicy tuna roll was OK, but everything else was heaven.  It also helps that there's $3 pints and $4 well drinks.  NICE.  

The service is attentive and friendly.  Our waiter got extra points for checking in with us before Happy Hour was over ("Do you want to order anything else before HH ends?"---loved it!).

PC is also a place I want to bring friends who visit from out of town. Its a nice place to grab some fusion Pacific-region food and fancy cocktails that you can't find anywhere else.

Parking off of Irving is always tough, but during happy hour it was easy to find parking on surrounding streets.  By 7pm, the dinner crowd rolled in deep.  I suggest carpooling to save some time and space.

excerpts: Ate there last week and it was bad-sweet potato fries were very oily and soggy the coconut shrimp were not well cooked the artichoke was hardly done and we couldn't eat it.
Sorry
but this is the worst meal I ever ate there
sweet potato fries.author: Heidi B.
sweet potato fries.review: Ate there last week and it was bad-sweet potato fries were very oily and soggy the coconut shrimp were not well cooked the artichoke was hardly done and we couldn't eat it.Sorry but this is the worst meal I ever ate there and since I live in the Sunset this is sad.

excerpts: We also got a whole basket of sweet potato fries..
The basket of sweet potato fries ($4.95) came with two sides of dips, wasabi mayo and chili sweet and sour?
Wasabi mayo was delicious.
Went great with the sweet potato fries..
Those were amazingly good.
Crispy and sweet.
sweet potato fries.author: Juliane N.
sweet potato fries.review:
I don't know who invented mysitic tans but whoever did, I really dislike you! After a long busy night and then a long busy morning at work, I was starving. Everyone decided to tan and do mytics the last minute and I just wasn't feeling it. I was so happy when I got off that all I wanted to do was stuff my face with food because that is all I was thinking about. I did have a bag of Ruffles on the desk but couldn't eat it since I had clients sitting on the couch staring at me.. I wouldn't want no orange lips, smelly cheesy breath, and pieces of chips all over me... that's just not professional....

After I got off, we headed to Pacific Catch! Finally got the chance to come try this place out! I've heard mixed reviews but more good then bad. I've wanted to try this place out since I saw it on Chestnut but never had the chance. Glad I ended my year with a good meal. 

Everything on the menu and everything on other customers tables looked so good but I came in here knowing what I was going to order. The rice bowls! I knew that I was going to order the Hawaiian Poke Rice bowl since I saw many great looking pictures. We also got a whole basket of sweet potato fries.. Yum!!!!

The basket of sweet potato fries ($4.95) came with two sides of dips, wasabi mayo and chili sweet and sour? Wasabi mayo was delicious. Went great with the sweet potato fries.. Those were amazingly good. Crispy and sweet. Then my big bowl of Hawaiian Poke ($14.95) came. You could choose between sushi rice or brown rice. Me, of course went with the sushi rice! The big bowl came with tons of fresh tuna cubes, topped with wakame salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, cucumber, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori and soy-wasabi sauce. I just wanted to dive into the bowl and stuff it all in my mouth. But I am a lady, and I do have manners at the table.. sometimes... Everything in the bowl was yummy besides the avocado.. There were big brown spots everywhere. Ewww... I didn't know if it was suppose to be eaten like a bi bim bap or just pick things out as you go.. So I just mixed everything together and ate it. So good. I think there bowls are a must order because I noticed a lot of the tables ordered those too!

The place itself had a very comfy feel. Service could of been better. I was getting very impatient with the waitress. My water glass was not filled and I was thirsty, and the check took FOREVER to come.... I would definitely come back because everything else on the menu sounded good.

excerpts: They were, and so was the shrimp cocktail, calamari, fries/sweet potato fries, and other items which I'm unable to recall.
sweet potato fries.author: Raymond C.
sweet potato fries.review:
My friends and I came here for appetizers before heading to our work prom, as it was recommended by one in our group.  I was told that the fried oysters are a treat.  They were, and so was the shrimp cocktail, calamari, fries/sweet potato fries, and other items which I'm unable to recall.

We had a reservation waiting for us.  Some of my other coworkers showed up without a reservation and were seated very quickly even though the place was crowded.  That's a positive on their service.  As for the value of the food, well we weren't looking for cheap.  We didn't order any entrees, yet it was enough to last most of us through the night without a full dinner, and only cost $10 per person.  Not bad!

This is a really nice place, we were dressed up in suits, ladies in dresses and didn't feel out of place, nor were others who were dressed more casually.

excerpts: I really liked that the fries were sweet potato fries (YUMM!!)
.. the spicy chili sauce is actually Mai Ploy sauce.
You can get it at any asian supermarket (for some yelpers that commented about the sauce).
Overall, we'd come back.
sweet potato fries.author: Julie F.
sweet potato fries.review:
I'd give this place 3.5 stars. 

I read alot of the reviews prior to coming here tonight and i was pleasantly surprised with the atmosphere, service and food. Atmosphere was beautful, i really enjoyed the high ceilings and cool decorations. Service was good; whenever I wanted to look around to ask someone to refill my water - my waiter was there already doing it. 

Tonight we tried:
-Poke Appetizer
- 3 piece Fish and chips (tonights fish was Talipia)
- Skirt Steak Rice Bowl

We finished ALL the food - and was very full. The rice bowl was huge and the fish and chips hit the spot. I really liked that the fries were sweet potato fries (YUMM!!).. the spicy chili sauce is actually Mai Ploy sauce. You can get it at any asian supermarket (for some yelpers that commented about the sauce).  Overall, we'd come back.

excerpts: If you have never tried Pacific Catch, please try some of their best Asian/ Fusion dishes: shrimp ceviche, crab and avocado salad, poke wasabi bowl, ahi bowl, rock cod, and their sweet potato fries.
They have been consistently delicious at this location.
sweet potato fries.author: CT L.
sweet potato fries.review:
"Spooning leads to forking" may be great nocturnal advice for an intimately-challenged couple, but it sure is not a pretty sight for a couple to be eating with their spoon AND fork at the same time. 

It was an eye opening experience to see them shoveling their fried rice with their Ahi Tuna poke (rhymes with hokey-pokey) almost non-stop until their plates were clean.  I almost said to our server:  I wanna have what they are having.  

If you have never tried Pacific Catch, please try some of their best Asian/ Fusion dishes: shrimp ceviche, crab and avocado salad, poke wasabi bowl, ahi bowl, rock cod, and their sweet potato fries.  They have been consistently delicious at this location.  Also opt for the brown rice as a healthy option.  

If you have to get sushi, their spicy tuna roll stands out.

Since Pacific Catch's parking lot fills up quickly, you can park one block away in Golden Gate Park.  You are close to the museums and botanical garden - perfect to stroll after a date.

Drinks are a bit on the weak side, even though the pomegranate mojitos and lemongrass mojitos are tasty before the ice melts.

Decor is nice and roomy inside with a few outdoor tables.
Bathroom is pleasantly clean.  Servers and hostesses are friendly.

Tips:
*  Call ahead for best seating.  Otherwise they will seat you close to the bar and not in the booths.
 
It was the couple's anniversary, and maybe they were in a hurry to move onto their next activity.  Anyway, I wish them happy spooning and happy forking!

excerpts: The sweet potato fries were good.
$12.95 for some sweet potato fries and about 8 pretty small shrimps just didn't feel right.
sweet potato fries.author: Joshua C.
sweet potato fries.review:
I felt a little let down with the food here. The coconut shrimp was just okay. Honestly the frozen coconut shrimp from Trader Joe's is my favorite. I wasn't a fan of the sweet chili dipping sauce. C'mon, you can buy that stuff in any Asian grocery store (even TJ's has their version). I wish restaurants would be more creative and make their own sauces. The sweet potato fries were good. The california roll was okay.

I like the concept but the food I had wasn't anything special. Since I'm not much of a seafood eater, my only option was the shrimp and coconut shrimp always seems like a good idea. Don't get me wrong, I ate the whole basket (even the slaw, which I'm usually not a fan of) but I didn't feel that it was worth the money. $12.95 for some sweet potato fries and about 8 pretty small shrimps just didn't feel right.

Service was good. We had brought our own dessert for my friend's birthday and they put them on plates and served them to us. Even though it wasn't cake, the waiter put a candle in one and we sang Happy Birthday to my friend.

I wouldn't make the drive from the East Bay just for this place, but if I happened to be in the area, I just might give it a second shot. But don't hold me to it.

excerpts: Reason we came here was because my friend loved their sweet potato fries.
It didn't disappoint.
Sushi here is good too.
They used to make a roll with mango that was(and I quote) "like orgasm in my mouth".
sweet potato fries.author: Xiaoyin W.
sweet potato fries.review:
This space is just fabulous. It's on the corner of 9th and Lincoln. I loved this space when it was Canvas Cafe. It was the best cafe in all of sunset. Sad that it closed. But anyway, enough nostalgia.

The restaurant is very spacious. The way they set up the tables gives you a lot of privacy. Reason we came here was because my friend loved their sweet potato fries. It didn't disappoint. Sushi here is good too. They used to make a roll with mango that was(and I quote) "like orgasm in my mouth". We didn't see it on the menu anymore so ordered sake sake roll (salmon soaked in sake) instead. It wasn't fancy but it was damn good.

Now the entrees, I got the miso salmon and my friends got ahi three way and korean bbq beef. I was already half full at this point so I didn't enjoy my entree as much as I could have had I been famished.  Overall pretty tasty still. The rice is sushi rice (slighty sour), kinda neat.  All 3 ways of the ahi were raw. I had a bite and liked it. But I don't know about eating a whole entree of raw fish and sushi rice. Korean bbq beef was sweet and fatty and juicy and all that good stuff.

Dinner for three=$87 plus tips.

Would come back again, but this time will be mentally prepared to dish out some cash.

excerpts:
One of my favorite Happy Hours in the City by the Bay!

FOOD:  SWEET POTATO FRIES.
sweet potato fries.author: Catherine C.
sweet potato fries.review:
One of my favorite Happy Hours in the City by the Bay!

FOOD:  SWEET POTATO FRIES.  Ok so when you offer good fries, I'm pretty easy to please.  It's great that they allow you to mix up the different kinds of fries too.  I also really liked their veggie roll (it's worth the price during HH) and actually I'm not sure why peeps are complaining about their mojitos because I really liked mine.  My favorite drink is the Spicy Pacific... some concotion of passionfruit nectar and jalapenos.  I know it sounds weird and gross, but it's SO GOOD... try it!!!  Oh, and though I don't eat fish, my friend craves the poke specifically from here at least twice a month.

AMBIENCE:  This is actually much nicer and much more spacious than the PC in the Marina district.  A good place for a date.  High ceilings keep the restaurant from getting too stuffy. Lighting is slightly subdued and gives a vaguely sexy feel to everything. The best part?  TWO Happy Hours on weekdays - 4-6 pm, then again from 10 pm to closing.  Boo-yah!

PRICES: Fairly reasonable, especially during HH.  One can easily have good food and two drinks for under $20 and not have to eat dinner afterwards.  And the portions are fairly generous so you definitely get your money's worth.

PARKING: There's actually a lot behind the restaurant, but it fills up rather quickly.  As with most things in SF, it's always better not to drive, but if you must take your car then know that there's usually more parking along the avenues east of the restaurant (try scoping 5th-8th avenues).

See you here for Happy Hour!

excerpts: you haven't lived until you've had an ahi poke wasabi bowl with a side of sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: Christine P.
sweet potato fries.review:
you haven't lived until you've had an ahi poke wasabi bowl with a side of sweet potato fries. just do it. 

before you leave to emark on your journey, pray to the parking gods. it'll do you good.

excerpts: Of course we added sweet potato fries for $1.95 more.
sweet potato fries.author: Cecilia L.
sweet potato fries.review:
Dropped in for an early dinner after visiting the Cartier and America exhibit at the Legion of Honors. 

My friend and I were STARVING. It had been 5 hours since brunch and we decided to grab an early bite before heading back to Russian Hill. 

We shared the "Crab Fest 2010" Crab & Corn Chowder which and both got the Wasabi Ahi sandwich (served on fresh-baked rolls with organic spring greens & sesame slaw on the side). Of course we added sweet potato fries for $1.95 more.

Food was fast, fresh, and tasty. Can't beat it when you're in the mood for seafood!

excerpts: I actually came here just to try their sweet potato fries.
I was actually debating with my boyfriend whether to get the traditional or spicy potato fries.
The waiter (he was extremely nice
and I forgot his name), actually suggested to me that I should do half/half.
I was excited that I could try both at one time.
So, I ordered a whole basket of it since I LOVE sweet potato fries!
sweet potato fries.author: Willa L.
sweet potato fries.review:
I actually came here just to try their sweet potato fries. I was actually debating with my boyfriend whether to get the traditional or spicy potato fries.  The waiter (he was extremely nice and I forgot his name), actually suggested to me that I should do half/half. I was excited that I could try both at one time. So, I ordered a whole basket of it since I LOVE sweet potato fries!

Aside from the fries, I also ordered the chipotle chicken sandwich because nothing on the menu really appealed to me. But the sandwich turned out really good. The chicken was not dry, which is a plus. I couldn't even finish the whole sandwich by myself, so I was able to pack it to go to eat the next day. 

I was lucky enough to find a parking spot in their mini parking lot, but I am not complaining. I am glad they actually have a parking lot to begin with.

excerpts: Like Ellis L. said, the sweet potato fries were good but nothing crazy, the Calamari was good but nothing you cant find at some place like cheese cake factory.
sweet potato fries.author: Byron C.
sweet potato fries.review:
This place was ok. Maybe because the last seafood restaurant (pappaboux) I went to was simply amazing, but Pacific Catch made me yearning for more. Like Ellis L. said, the sweet potato fries were good but nothing crazy, the Calamari was good but nothing you cant find at some place like cheese cake factory. And I also tried my friend's poke over rice and it was a little too salty for my taste. 

I personally had the swordfish special which was paired with coconut rices blocks which were lightly fried on the outside as well as baby eggplant with a curry seasoning, and a mango salad. The rice was pretty good and had an interesting presentation, the mango salad brought a little acidity to the table which was needed and worked well with the fish. And now to the fish; the swordfish was lightly grilled and had little seasoning. Taste wise, it definitely needed help from the mango salad to bring some zing into the equation. Overall the dish  was so so. I think serving the fish over steamed rice with a mango salsa on top would have worked better.

Pacific Catch is definitely a cool place to be. The location is excellent, with plenty of parking in the park across the street. The decor/atmosphere was nice, open and modern. But the food could be better.

Enjoy..

excerpts: That and the spicy tuna roll, sweet potato fries, and two orders of the let's get saucy roll.
Spicy tuna roll wasn't that good, but I really liked the let's get saucy roll.
Could've eaten that for days especially since I'm not the type of person that gets fried sushi rolls lol.
It's an exception.
sweet potato fries.author: Diane L.
sweet potato fries.review: Came here for a quick HH & had like 4 margaritas lol. That and the spicy tuna roll, sweet potato fries, and two orders of the let's get saucy roll. Spicy tuna roll wasn't that good, but I really liked the let's get saucy roll. Could've eaten that for days especially since I'm not the type of person that gets fried sushi rolls lol. It's an exception.

excerpts: Their sweet potato fries are great but their Japanese food items are not as good as at a real Japanese restaurant and a lot of their other items seem a little overpriced.
sweet potato fries.author: John K.
sweet potato fries.review:
I have lived in the neighborhood for a while and only recently had the chance to visit Pacific Catch. 

Overall, I think it was only average. Nothing extraordinary. Their sweet potato fries are great but their Japanese food items are not as good as at a real Japanese restaurant and a lot of their other items seem a little overpriced. 

It's a great place to go with large groups though because they have space to accommodate you, which is often tough to find in San Francisco.

excerpts: But the sweet potato fries and calamari that I nicked from my comrades-in-sunset-drinking were impressive, and they even have that sauce, known to me only as "crack sauce" (and which I previously thought endemic to Seattle breweries) that leaves an indelible mark on the buds of all who taste it.
sweet potato fries.author: Wes M.
sweet potato fries.review:
Must...boycott...trendy seafood place that replaced Canvas...

What's that you say?  They have a bar?  With Coconut Porter?  Part of the Microcanning Revolution?  Well, maybe just a quick gander then.

Sure enough, the blond ceiling and red walls have a suburban sheen that's as overly-polished as Tom Scholz' production on the Boston songs coming from their 100% classic-rock speakers.  And the giant plastic bottles of chinese hot sauce on every table sort of belie the trendiness factor.

But the sweet potato fries and calamari that I nicked from my comrades-in-sunset-drinking were impressive, and they even have that sauce, known to me only as "crack sauce" (and which I previously thought endemic to Seattle breweries) that leaves an indelible mark on the buds of all who taste it.  So I'm just saying.

But guys, seriously, turn the lights down after 9, would ya?  You'll save the earth and your potential for booze-friendly ambiance.

excerpts: The sweet potato fries are really good too!
sweet potato fries.author: mike j.
sweet potato fries.review:
This place is a pretty good asian fusion place.  I must admit that although I've been here quite a few times, I tend to get the same thing...because it's so damn good and filling.

The Ahi tuna Wasabi bowl, is delicious.  Lots of ahi and enough rice to feed a family.  You won't be able to finish this.  

I also like the Ahi 3 ways, which is served 1) seared, 2) hawaiian poke style and 3) sashimi.  That's pretty tasty as well.

The sweet potato fries are really good too!

excerpts: Sweet potato fries...lets see, yea it was pretty good too..not soggy or anything and just a good amount of salt..
sweet potato fries.author: phillip w.
sweet potato fries.review:
I had some fried stuff and some poke...

who doesnt like fried coconut shrimp and salmon?

ooo which reminds me i had this fried salmon in Dallas, it was from a bento box out of some japanese restaurant i cant remember..but that was really good..um besides that...the salmon fish n chips was pretty good

hmmm no complaints there, coconut shrimp is a typical one that you can find in most places that serve it. Either its good or its bad, and they did it good here so no complaints there either..

Sweet potato fries...lets see, yea it was pretty good too..not soggy or anything and just a good amount of salt..

the poke was good...but it was a bit too spicy..well maybe that or im just a big weenie but then again i do like spicy food so i dont know what happenend there kakaka...o well 

Anyways overall..i only ordered to-go so i cant say much about service except for the fact that the girl that i spoke to had good phone etiquette. The place looks nice and even though i was only in there for like 5 min i guess i should come by and at least have a sit down dinner..

for a to-go order the food wasnt soggy which i was kind of expecting especially with fried fish and shrimp. So that was a plus for me~ 

I think i wrote too much..

excerpts: What I should have done was substitute it for the sweet potato fries, but I didn't know how popular they were until it was too late.
sweet potato fries.author: Thuy H.
sweet potato fries.review:
Started off with the rare ahi tuna over a small salad: this was really good.  The tuna was fresh and tasty.  The salad was light and not overwhelming with dressing.  It's how a starter should be, it left me wanting more.

I ordered the mahi mahi special.  The mahi mahi was small, and there was a whole lot of grilled onions.  I wasn't a fan of the grilled onions.  What I should have done was substitute it for the sweet potato fries, but I didn't know how popular they were until it was too late.

I was so disappointed in my meal I was tempted to try the vietnamese special sandwich.  It seemed as if everyone had ordered it and  it looked so good!

Our waitress wasn't so nice.  Service was a little slow.

excerpts: The service was friendly & attentive, & we were all very satisfied with our respective meals (I got the Tokyo Salmon w/sweet potato fries, & it was delicious!).
sweet potato fries.author: Pete J.
sweet potato fries.review:
I had dinner at Pacific Catch last night with my girifriend, my roommate/best friend, & his girlfriend/my college friend, so you might say that it was an intimate affair. But holy crap, let me note just for a moment -- how fucking GROWN UP does this dinner sound? A far cry from my usual "grab a quick meal with whomever is around" approach.

Anyway, I should note that Pacific Catch was working against a bit of a disadvantage, since I'd been a pretty big fan of the Canvas Gallery. In all honesty, though? The space works a lot better as a restaurant. Now that I've eaten at Pacific Catch, I can see that fully. It's big, expansive & almost cavernous. All those attributes work in favor of a big dining establishment. The high ceilings & warm lighting made it feel like the kind of place an exec from The Cheesecake Factory might model their next restaurant after (but with more mable columns).

Unintentional backhanded compliments aside, it's the type of place that's appealing on a large scale. The service was friendly & attentive, & we were all very satisfied with our respective meals (I got the Tokyo Salmon w/sweet potato fries, & it was delicious!).

It's a low key place for dinner (what we were looking for), & the kind of restaurant you can go when you feel like eatin' good in the neighborhood.

excerpts: What brought us in......just the sweet potato fries.
Kylie L. got fish and chips that came with sweet potato fries and we got an extra basket of SPF's.
Yummy!
the spf came with sweet and sour sauce, and a sweet horse radish sauce.
The horse radish one is good!
sweet potato fries.author: kim w.
sweet potato fries.review:
Came back here with Kylie L.!! What brought us in......just the sweet potato fries.

Kylie L. OOo'ed, and I Ahh'd, and we went in.  It seemed busy, but there were a few tables that were free.  The hostess said it will take about 5-10 mins..........wtf? There are tables, so after waiting for about 3mins id say, we got one of the empty tables near the entrance...hmmm

Anyway, I ordered the 3 Ahi something, that came with 3 different kinds of ahi tuna.  Sounded like a small meal, but I got it anyway. Kylie L. got fish and chips that came with sweet potato fries and we got an extra basket of SPF's.  Yummy!! the spf came with sweet and sour sauce, and a sweet horse radish sauce.  The horse radish one is good!  I ate half the basket, theyre just addicting.  

My ahi came, DANG, it was huge, maybe because of the big bowl of rice in the middle.  3 pieces of seared ahi covered with sesame seeds, that one was the best.  Another 3 pieces of seared ahi with some kinda thousand island dressing on it..2nd place. And tuna poke.  Poke ALWAYS sounds good, but it is not so good here...its just drenched in soy sauce.  SO i have 3 different  kinds of ahi in 3 different kinds of sauces, and one the side were shitake mushrooms fried with something also in sauce...hmm..all the sauces mixed together did not go so well with my rice...so i had a lot left over and made chinese porridge the next day.  That was not so good either..

I didnt try the fish and chips, but it looked like a lot.

The goods: food comes fast and SPF's
The bads: didnt i just tell u about them?

excerpts: I have to admit that i only eat the poke bowl and sweet potato fries here.
I've had a bite of the unagi bowl which was REALLY fresh, and this is coming from someone who thinks unagi tastes like mold.
Their fish and chips are pretty good.
I haven't been impressed with any of the specials or other entrees
so i just stick to what i like.
sweet potato fries.author: Susan Z.
sweet potato fries.review:
Pacific Catch takes reservations?!?!  They need to advertise that more.  I have to admit that i only eat the poke bowl and sweet potato fries here.  I've had a bite of the unagi bowl which was REALLY fresh, and this is coming from someone who thinks unagi tastes like mold.  Their fish and chips are pretty good.  
I haven't been impressed with any of the specials or other entrees so i just stick to what i like.

excerpts: The catch was fresh rock cod served with sweet potato fries.
Although the rock cod was battered, it didn't taste to overly deep fried like what you would expect.
sweet potato fries.author: Janet H.
sweet potato fries.review:
Wandering around Golden Gate Park and DeYoung Museum, we realized we were close by the many restaurants in the Inner Sunset.  We walked into Pacific Catch on a beautiful day.

For starters we each got the Signature Miso and Shiitake Miso.  I thought the miso could have had a little bit more flavor in the broth, but it was still good.  The shiitake miso had veggies (mushrooms & asparagus) which made it also good.

Our entrees were the Sesame Crusted Ahi and the Crispy Catch of the Day.  I chose the Ahi as a healthy alternative and it was seared perfectly.  The catch was fresh rock cod served with sweet potato fries.  Although the rock cod was battered, it didn't taste to overly deep fried like what you would expect.  Also we ordered 2 a la carte tacos, the BBQ Salmon and the Tropical Shrimp which were very good.

We noticed there was loud music playing overhead (why?).  We also noticed that Pacific Catch is kid friendly.  This is a plus for parents who are looking for a healthier choice than a diner or greasy spoon.  Pacific Catch is a good midday meal!

excerpts: The sweet potato fries were also very tasty.
sweet potato fries.author: Brian H.
sweet potato fries.review:
Well, after yelping our unfortunate experience on our first visit to Pacific Catch, the wife and I were contacted by PC's marketing manager, who apologized and offered us a $50 credit if we would give PC another try.

Needless to say, we took him up on the offer, and went back a week after our initial visit. The manager working that night was very apologetic about out previous visit and went to great pains to make sure we were taken care of.

This time, I'm pleased to report that PC lived up to the expectations we'd initially gone in with.  No shards of glass this time. Of course, that's sort of to be expected, but I think our second visit was probably more representative of the typical PC experience and the 4 stars were definitely well-deserved. It was even close to 5 star territory, but again I was hit with a little bout of post-meal queasiness. Not as bad as the first time around but enough that I couldn't in fairness give 5 stars. Still, our meal on this evening was very, very good.

We started with the house cured sake salmon with nori rice cakes, wasabi creme fraiche, and black tobiko ($9.95), which was out-of-this-world delicious. The craime fraiche could have used a bit more of a wasabi kick, but that's a very quibbling critique of what was a very well executed and beautifully presented dish.

For my entree I had the Tokyo salmon fish and chips with ginger-wasabi aioli and lemon ponzu ($13.95). Again my only criticism here was the sauces. The ponzu wasn't as tart as I would have liked and the aioli definitely could have been punched up a couple of notches. The most important part of the dish- the fish- was spot on. Crispy on the inside and moist on the inside, just the way it should be. The sweet potato fries were also very tasty.

Katie had one of the specials- hawaiian opah with pineapple fried rice and bok choy ($20ish?). Aside from the bok choy which was very al dente and very difficult to eat (it should have been pre-cut or served with a steak knife- it was very hard to cut with a butter knife and too large and stringy to just take a bite), her meal was excellent. The fish and rice went together beautifully and he bok choy would have been a nice complement if it had been less cumbersome to eat. Katie also had a couple of pomegranate cocktails of some sort which were yummy.

All in all, an excellent meal and a nice gesture on the part of PC's management to redeem itself and earn back some good will.

We will definitely be back for more!

excerpts: My wife ordered the fried oysters with sweet potato fries subbed in for their traditional fries...both DEE-licious.
sweet potato fries.author: B. Earl K.
sweet potato fries.review:
Very easy to make a same day (Sunday) lunch reservation via OpenTable.com.

They started us with a small two-compartment dish of fresh edamame and some little Pepperidge Farm-esque pretzel nuggets. 

Extremely fast service for our "appetizer", Hawaiian Poke. The ahi cubes were very soft and the sesame soy marinade was perfect. This dish was a great value at $8.50...the ahi was piled high alongside and on top of several tasty wonton crisps.

My wife ordered the fried oysters with sweet potato fries subbed in for their traditional fries...both DEE-licious. I ordered the salmon teriyaki bowl with brown rice subbed in for the pineapple fried rice. The latter didn't sound very appealing to me; plus, my wife is always telling me about the healthy benefits of brown rice! Their bowls are HUGE, btw. The size of my bowl reminded me of something I would get at the Cheesecake Factory. The size of the grilled salmon could have certainly been larger, and the quantity of rice could have been far less. Otherwise, it was just okay.

Friendly, speedy service. Nice variety on their menu(s). We'll definitely return to try some more of what they have to offer!

excerpts:
The sweet potato fries are nothing special.
Five spice fries taste like bbq chips, not my thing.
sweet potato fries.author: Jen Y.
sweet potato fries.review:
Pluses:
The place is pretty nice, spacious with cool lighting.
Large menu with lots of choices
Big plates
Kids are welcome

Ehs:
The food was okay. The sweet potato fries are nothing special.
Five spice fries taste like bbq chips, not my thing.
The bread on the wasabi ahi tuna sandwich was really chewy and tough. The sandwich also had very little tuna for 9 dollars.
The fried mix fish basket was only ok, again nothing special.
Menu doesn't really have cohesion. I guess that's the price you pay for lots of choices: nothing is exceptional.
The service was not good. I think there were only one or two waitresses working the entire place.

Overall: good for large parties who want a lot of choice but it's nothing special.

excerpts: My aunt and I split the ahi tuna salad, small sweet potato fries and the shiso roll.
The salad was alright, they could have given more pieces of ahu, but the dressing was good.
Not salty like most restaurants and my salad was drowning in it.
I loved the shiso roll!!
It went well with the tempura and avocado in it.
The sweet potato fries were ok.
sweet potato fries.author: Lindsay G.
sweet potato fries.review: They have a little bit of every thing on the menu. My aunt and I split the ahi tuna salad, small sweet potato fries and the shiso roll. The salad was alright, they could have given more pieces of ahu, but the dressing was good. Not salty like most restaurants and my salad was drowning in it. I loved the shiso roll!! It went well with the tempura and avocado in it. The sweet potato fries were ok.

excerpts: At this local, I've had the tuna wasabi bowl, the spicy tuna roll (both brown rice), the house salad and the sweet potato fries.
The fries never disappoint but the 2 other dishes and salad weren't that tasty.
sweet potato fries.author: Susan C.
sweet potato fries.review:
I've only had the fish tacos at the Marina location and that's what gave their review 4 stars and this one only 3.  At this local, I've had the tuna wasabi bowl, the spicy tuna roll (both brown rice), the house salad and the sweet potato fries.  The fries never disappoint but the 2 other dishes and salad weren't that tasty.  They were under-seasoned and the brown rice wasn't as soft as I've made or had in other restaurants.

But the service was up to par, the atmosphere was sweet, and the bartenders were cute.  Hahaha.

excerpts: I love sweet potato fries so that will be part of my next meal there.
They have what, 5 parking spaces there, but there's plenty of parking across the street and in the park.
sweet potato fries.author: Stacey C.
sweet potato fries.review:
I just came back from my Valentine's Day dinner and I'm all alone and yelping already.  I was really excited to try this place because the reviews are pretty decent so far.  So we went for the Valentine's Day special for $65.  Everything on there I believe you can order through the chalkboard special menu or regular dinner menu.  

Decor was nice and the place looks a lot bigger than it does from the outside.  I guess I never noticed Canvas was that big inside.  The beech wood on the ceiling brightens up the place while still looking a little romantic, and even the bathroom walls/doors have the little bamboo inside plexiglass look which is nice to look at when you have to pee.

Starter:
Firecracker roll - a spicy tempura salmon roll
Entrees:
1. Ahi Tuna 3 way - poke, sesame seared and another kind of seared with rice, seaweed salad, some terryaki mushroom edamame mix and another mixed salad that could've been one of those japanese mixes with turnip.
2. Grilled Salmon with artichoke and a layer of tomatos
Dessert:
Mochi ice cream fondue with vanilla, coffee and chocolate flavored ice cream
Drinks: Sparkling white wine

The portions were pretty good sized for $65 for 2 people.  The firecracker roll was rather large, but if you look closely, it's a lot of rice wrapped in them.  It still tasted good though and didn't come out looking all sloppy like some restaurants make their sushi.  I really liked the ahi 3-way.  The seared kinds were better and more buttery than the poke, which to me was kind of chewy.  Not exactly the way I pictured poke.  But every other piece was fine.  My husband had the salmon and said he wished he picked something else.  Salmon is salmon - nothing special, but cooked really nicely - not overcooked, just right.  
Dessert was really good.  I love chocolate and I like mochi ice cream on a stick.  This was just right.  
The wine was definitely not the best.  I think with our chosen food, the wine just ended up tasting sour.  But I love sweet white wines and that's just my preference.

The service was really good for such a crowded night.  We had a really upbeat and polite waitress and they served us our food quickly enough.  A nice place to eat overall with a lot more to try.  I love sweet potato fries so that will be part of my next meal there.  They have what, 5 parking spaces there, but there's plenty of parking across the street and in the park.

excerpts: How could you go wrong with fried fish and sweet potato fries?
There's everything you could want: fried fish, sweet potato fries with jalapeno tartar sauce, sushi, poki, alcohol in crazy concoctions, sandwiches, etc.
Just try it out!
And even if you're not in the area...
Pacific Catch would be a great place to make your way to for a totally worth it meal.
sweet potato fries.author: stefany f.
sweet potato fries.review:
I've been here several times and I've always left extremely happy and full. How could you go wrong with fried fish and sweet potato fries? Exactly, you can't!

Today, I went here with a good friend after venturing through the Academy of Sciences. We worked up quite the appetite and were ready to chow. 

I tend to get the same thing every time...Catch of the Day. Sometimes I get the Hawaiian Poki Bowl, which is also awesome and super tasty. But I like to change it up with the drink. Today our server, who was awesome as well, suggested I try this spicy yet sweet cocktail. I cannot remember its name, but it was on the second page of the drink menu on the top of the page. Trust me, I will order this again...and again...and again! It was a nice sweetness from passion fruit juice, but had a nice hit of spice and heat with serrano peppers. Amazing! I know, it sounds like a crazy mix, but it was amazing and very different.

My friend got salmon fish tacos (she's such a SoCal girl) and Fat Tire's Mothership. She very much enjoyed her food...and mine as well! She also agreed well with my drink.

So yah, when you're in the area, I'd definitely suggest making a stop at Pacific Catch for a nice meal. There's everything you could want: fried fish, sweet potato fries with jalapeno tartar sauce, sushi, poki, alcohol in crazy concoctions, sandwiches, etc. Just try it out! And even if you're not in the area...Pacific Catch would be a great place to make your way to for a totally worth it meal.

excerpts: on the side i had some of their sweet potato fries -
so damn good with the sauce!
sweet potato fries.author: Alex C.
sweet potato fries.review:
LOVE IT!

ASSUMPTION: thought this place was over priced with undersized portionsserved by snobby and pretentious staff.

TRUTH: oh how i was sooo wrong... SOOOO WRONG! *slaps* myself wrong.

so after a long ASS day of manuvering through lovefest09 and over crowded muni, it was really nice to sit down at the nicely decor and chill atmosphere of... pacific catch!

the staff is extremely friendly, attentive and knowledgeable! never was i left with a half empty glass.. 

I ordered fish tacos, and boy oh boy, these tacos are bad ass, the fish is moist and seasoned very well! on the side i had some of their sweet potato fries - so damn good with the sauce! *drools* 

my other friends order wasabi bowls, HELLA good!!! 
WHAT ARE THEY? they are pretty much sushi in a bowl... it's a bowl of sushi rice topped with your choice of fish (you have about 5-6 choices), and piles of veges on top of that... very tasty.

perfectly cooked seafood, large menu, fair prices, friendly staff...
i'll definitely be revisiting pacific catch for another dinner rendezvous!

excerpts: The real standout is the basket of sweet potato fries which comes with an out of this world wasabi aoli and a spicy sweet and sour sauce for dipping.
sweet potato fries.author: Cristofer P.
sweet potato fries.review:
The real standout is the basket of sweet potato fries which comes with an out of this world wasabi aoli and a spicy sweet and sour sauce for dipping. Their poke tastes really fresh so if you're looking for something a bit more filling than bar bites, try either the Hawaiian Poke Wasabi Bowl or the Ahi Three Way, both dishes that come with poke.

I love that they have a late night happy hour.

excerpts: Sweet potato fries, nice.
Happy hour, happy.
Ambience, contrived but comfy.
Not a bad view, either (GG Park).
sweet potato fries.author: Jennifer B.
sweet potato fries.review:
Would you eat Mexican food at a sushi restaurant?  
Would you eat sushi at a Mexican restaurant?  
Would you eat fresh fish fusion at a California concept cafe?

OK.  Fine.  Go to Pac Catch then.

Fish has nooooooooooo flavor.  But, the wasabi bowl (besides being a misnomer) is giant, and tasty.  Fish tacos, not bad.  Sweet potato fries, nice.  Happy hour, happy.  Ambience, contrived but comfy.  Not a bad view, either (GG Park).

excerpts: We got free sweet potato fries for checking in on yelp/foursquare, which was an instant bonus, and also had the orange ale, which was a great beer and cheap for a nice restaurant!
sweet potato fries.author: Courtney A.
sweet potato fries.review: I went here with a friend and had a great time! We got free sweet potato fries for checking in on yelp/foursquare, which was an instant bonus, and also had the orange ale, which was a great beer and cheap for a nice restaurant! We also both ordered the seared ahi sandwich and house salad, which comes with edamame and a miso dressing. Both were really good. I was impressed by the amount of ahi on the sandwich and the unique blend of flavors and was able to take a half home after all the other food. The servers were really nice, too. A little pricey but I would go back to try some of the other amazing things on the menu.

excerpts: and I stuck what I always love at Pacific Catch... the ahi tuna salad bowl and the sweet potato fries!
YUM!!!
sweet potato fries.author: Denise L.
sweet potato fries.review:
Great space! It's HUGE! I love it since it's always a pain to go to the one on Chestnut. There's a bar here too, so it's a great place for cocktails. The menu is also more extended with sushi offerings as well as other specialties such as Korean BBQ beef.

I came here two already and I stuck what I always love at Pacific Catch... the ahi tuna salad bowl and the sweet potato fries! YUM!!!

excerpts: And EVERYONE we knew that has been there told us to get the sweet potato fries.
- Sweet Potato Fries:
My boyfriend is a fries fiend
so he totally enjoyed this.
If I were to go back it would be for the sweet potato fries, Hawaiian poke, and maybe to try the Wasabi Bowls and fish tacos.
sweet potato fries.author: Ashley C.
sweet potato fries.review:
So my boyfriend took me here for Mother's Day because a friend suggested it. And EVERYONE we knew that has been there told us to get the sweet potato fries. 

The first thing that I noticed was that out of all the booths, the hostess sat us at one where I was literally blinded by the sunlight. I ended up sitting next to my boyfriend, which is nice, but I like sitting across from him so we can talk easier. Our waiter (his name totally slipped my mind, sorry!) was nice and attentive. Took our orders and our appetizers came out in like 10 minutes! Kind of threw me off on how fast it came out. 

we ordered: 

- Sweet Potato Fries: My boyfriend is a fries fiend so he totally enjoyed this. I'm not that big on fries, but I must admit that it was pretty delish. 

- Hawaiian Poke: My absolute fave of the night. I always have to try poke if a restaurant has it on their menu and this one totally hit the spot. Not as good as homemade, but close enough! Could do without the won ton chips. Would have been great with a seaweed salad. 

- Cabo Calamari: This is another dish we usually always try if it's on the menu. We were quite disappointed. Usually when you eat a piece of calamari without the sauce, it should still have some flavor from the breading its coated in, but this was just so...BLAND. Then when we dipped it in the sauce, it completely broke apart. No good. 

- Miso Glazed Salmon: Loved the crispy outside and buttery inside. Sauce, mushroom & edamame side, was delicious. The salad on the side was not to my liking. I don't know what it was, but the flavor was horrible and the texture was really tough. 

- Korean BBQ Steak: First of all, the waiter hadn't asked my boyfriend how he wanted it cooked. It came out medium rare which was fine though. Tim loved the flavor, but the meat was TOUGH. Don't think it was the way it was cooked, just that that particular cut of meat was tough. He also didn't like the salad. 

- Lemongrass Mojito: Pretty good. Bartender made it strong, just the way I like it. 

Overall, it was alright. If I were to go back it would be for the sweet potato fries, Hawaiian poke, and maybe to try the Wasabi Bowls and fish tacos.

excerpts: We also had the Crispy Catch of the Day which came with the sweet potato fries and 2 dipping sauces.
The Talapia was SO good and the sweet potato fries are always delicious.
sweet potato fries.author: Steph M.
sweet potato fries.review:
NUTS!! I was hoping to be the first to review, but 6 other people beat me to it.  Thats ok! :)

My friend and I saw that there were people inside, so we walked in.  Apparently, the restaurant was closed for Friends & Family before the grand opening, but they sat us anyway! 

Full, tasty menu, same great taste as the Chestnut location.  We were more than pleasantly surprised when they told us our meal was free so that the wait staff could practice on us.  (Our waiter seemed to be able to read out minds when he brought us a glass of water perfectly on time.)

We had the fried calamari, which was really good, but also really greasy.  I ate 1/3 of the plate and ended up feeling extremely nauseas afterwards.  Probably my own fault for eating so much of it!!!! :)  That being said though, the calamari was extremely soft.  There was no hard calamari texture that you sometimes get.  hurrah!

Our main course came:  Wasabi Ahi Poke bowl with brown rice.  Always an awesome option on the menu.  Wasabi bowl anything is usually reaaaaaallly good.  We also had the Crispy Catch of the Day which came with the sweet potato fries and 2 dipping sauces.  The Talapia was SO good and the sweet potato fries are always delicious.  It was just hard to eat after feeling too woozy from the calamari.

Anyway--loved it!!!! it's going to be hugely successful.  I do miss Canvas because of the art, but Pacific Catch has some super cool art itself.

Thanks for the free meal Pacific Catch!  It was absolutely delicious!!!!!

excerpts: I seriously had to narrow it down from sweet potato fries, crispy oysters, teriyaki bowls, macademia crusted seabass, catfish sandwich, sushi....
it was rather extensive!!
sweet potato fries.author: Tammy H.
sweet potato fries.review:
Still not off the Hawaii tip =p  Wanted something close to the spicy tuna bowl I had at Aloha Sushi in Honolulu....rice, 2 scoops of spicy tuna, and all the fixins in a bowl.  The bf suggested Pacific Catch for the comparable taste.  
Parking was a (%&# as usual around 9th/Irving on a beautiful Sunday afternoon right next to GG park.  All good...beauiful day in the sunset...cant beat those!!  Walked past the cute little tables in their patio and was seated right away and attended to.  The entire menu looked super yum!  I seriously had to narrow it down from sweet potato fries, crispy oysters, teriyaki bowls, macademia crusted seabass, catfish sandwich, sushi....it was rather extensive!!  We finally narrowed it down to....

Spicy Fries:  Normal fries just tossed with a cajun seasoning I think.  I LOVE fries so it was a great version...especially since they were "skinny" fries that were super crispy.  The dipping sauces were a nice touch: sweet chili sauce (the one for lumpia!!...I blended that combo LONG before I came here!!  I like their thinking here) and a creamy miso dip!!  yum!!  Mix them together...its perfect!

Salmon Wasabi Bowl:  I thought it was going to be raw salmon but it turned out to be grilled. Apparently the raw stuff is the Hawaiian Poke?  How the hell was I suppose to know that??!!  I wish there was a description on the menu.  Boooo!!  Even though I was in the mood for raw fish the salmon was a great compliment to the brown rice covered with a wasabi miso sauce, radish sprouts, seaweed salad, cucumber salad, pickled ginger and avocado.  It was all the ingredients to a honkin sushi roll but in a bowl.  For about $15, the portions were huge, fresh, and tastey.  I probably ate a little less than half and was STUFFED!  

Tuna Wasabi Bowl: Same condiments in the bowl just with lighly seared tuna.

I think I was a little disappointed that the salmon was cooked, obviously my fault, but I still enjoyed my meal.  Looking around at the other tables and their selections, the wasabi bowl was probably the best priced dish.  The menu will definitely bring me back to finalize their rating.  I cant wait to try all the other delicious goodies....crispy oysters....mmmm...cant wait!!!

excerpts:
To summarize what our party ordered

- Wasabi bowl: ahi poki and vegatables over japanese rice
- Fish n chips: salmon strips with crispy sweet potato fries
- Terriyaki beef: with shrimp, rice and thinly sliced crispy onion rings

crispy spring roll with icecream and carmel sauce

All were good except for the salmon.
sweet potato fries.author: Oanh N.
sweet potato fries.review:
I was unsure of how the food would turn out because of it's chainy environment. In fact, it's a unique one because it serves japanese cuisine with an american touch. To summarize what our party ordered

- Wasabi bowl: ahi poki and vegatables over japanese rice
- Fish n chips: salmon strips with crispy sweet potato fries
- Terriyaki beef: with shrimp, rice and thinly sliced crispy onion rings
- Dessert: crispy spring roll with icecream and carmel sauce

All were good except for the salmon. It was tasteless unless drowned in the malt/vinegar sauce or horseradish sauce. 

I definitely want to come back because of their wide range of really healthy meals like their wasabi salads!

excerpts: The "spicy" fries were wayyy over seasoned (and not spicy at all) and the sweet potato fries (supposedly one of their specialities) weren't very special at all.
Also, their sushi was not good and I would not recommend it at all.
sweet potato fries.author: Lauren B.
sweet potato fries.review:
I want to give this place more stars but it just really didn't live up to my expectations. The waiter, though very friendly and well-meaning, was a complete bubble brain and seemed confused the whole time. Half of our orders came out 20 minutes before the rest so some of us were done before the others even got their food. The "spicy" fries were wayyy over seasoned (and not spicy at all) and the sweet potato fries (supposedly one of their specialities) weren't very special at all. Also, their sushi was not good and I would not recommend it at all. The tacos were pretty yummy but too dry. 

On the good side, my mahi mahi rice bowl was delicious as was my Kamikaze Bloody Mary (with wasabi,  yummm). I definitely recommend their drinks but most of the food fell way short.

excerpts: The sweet potato fries were faultless and I would probably go here again just to eat these.
The coconut prawns were a little odd and so were the oysters.
Even so I can't fault it on being a tasty .. basket of food.
sweet potato fries.author: Adam S.
sweet potato fries.review:
I was hunting for a nice place to eat for one person on Irving and I came across Pacific Catch after seeing that Park Chow was full. In comparison this place was pretty much empty at about 1pm. 

I walked in and was greeted by a friendly waitress, I ordered the fish & chips basked which arrive. The sweet potato fries were faultless and I would probably go here again just to eat these. The coconut prawns were a little odd and so were the oysters. Even so I can't fault it on being a tasty .. basket of food. It was a nice enviroment to sit down and read the paper in, pretty single-friendly although there were also groups around.

Very handy location right by GG Park and on the 44 bus route, the outdoor seating looked nice but it was a bit chilly the day I went.

excerpts: The sweet potato fries also hit the spot.
We had some wine and beer but it was too early to have a hard drink from the full bar.
sweet potato fries.author: Pelle Y.
sweet potato fries.review:
12/1/2007
My friends and I are huge Pacific Catch fans and we attended the complimentary lunch service today.  Pacific Catch on 9th lived up to and exceeded our expectations based on our experiences at the Corte Madera and Marina locations.

We like our poke bowls and didn't stray from our typical ordering.  The poke bowls arrived and were perfectly made.  The poke was fresh, abundant, and authentic (confirmed by the Hawaiian at our table).  It went well with the accompanying seaweed salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, shredded cucumber, and pickled ginger.  The sweet potato fries also hit the spot.  We had some wine and beer but it was too early to have a hard drink from the full bar.  I do look forward to trying their cocktail menu though.

It seems to be a huge staff.  The waiters seemed a tad nervous but the hostesses, general manager, and head chef were pros.  Overall, service was nice, happy, friendly and attentive.  But granted, it's an opening and to be expected.  We hope they can maintain it.

It was nice to see that they made good use of the enormous Canvas Gallery space.  There are plenty of comfy booths and tables all around and many counter seats are also available by the kitchen.  The bar is set off and mostly faces Lincoln and the park, which will help to siphon off the expected noise and buzz.  There is also a section by the 9th Street side, which can probably be closed off and booked for private parties.

The design is warm and inviting, similar to the Corte Madera location.  We liked all the bamboo too.  Good feng shui.

Welcome to the neighborhood, Pacific Catch.

P.S. And to everyone that got annoyed I reviewed this location before it opened, well, hey, tough.  Chalk it up to my rational exuberance.  And c'mon, there are more things in life to have snits about.

6/20/2007
How funny.  I had gone to the Pacific Catch in the Marina earlier this month and whined on Yelp about how they should open one in Inner Sunset  (see review on 6/3/2007).  Lo and behold, tonight I walked past where the Canvas Gallery used to be and there are signs plastered advertising that Pacific Catch will soon be opening it's third outpost here on 9th and Lincoln.  Although the owner planned this months before my Yelp whine, score for me!

And yes, although I haven't tried the food yet since it hasn't opened (expect late summer), I already give it one more star than the review I gave the Marina Pacific Catch because it will be in my beloved hood and it will have a full bar.

You can read more here: 
http://www.pacificcatch.com/press_sunsetbeacon.html

excerpts: The one thing I found very cool about this place was that they served SWEET POTATO FRIES.
These are hands down one of my favorite treats and this time was no exception.
They may even have been better than the  ones I had over at Solstice (which is hard to beat) for no other reason than they served them with this amazing creamy dip.
I found myself literally drenching the fries in it (so much for that eating healthier resolution).
I found it a little odd that they were serving them at this type of restaurant
sweet potato fries.author: Julia N.
sweet potato fries.review:
It's always a little on the difficult side for me to review restaurants that serve seafood. It's not that I don't enjoy it, it's that what I order typically seems to be the same across the board. I have a lot of allergies to fish so when I dine out I tend to not be that adventurous.

The one thing I found very cool about this place was that they served SWEET POTATO FRIES. These are hands down one of my favorite treats and this time was no exception. They may even have been better than the  ones I had over at Solstice (which is hard to beat) for no other reason than they served them with this amazing creamy dip. I found myself literally drenching the fries in it (so much for that eating healthier resolution). I found it a little odd that they were serving them at this type of restaurant but hey, I'll take what I can get!

The sushi roll I ordered was average. It was dripping with this sweet  sauce which I found to be a tad overwhelming. It's funny because a year ago I'd probably be all over that sauce but as I've gotten older my sweet tooth has diminished considerably. 

Everything else kinda blended in with the experience leaving me with little to no opinion...the miso soup was well, miso soup - nothing special. The service was fine but not particularly notable. The decor was good but what is really worth mentioning is the bar...FULL bar. It was probably the most appealing part of the inside; even though it was only 3pm when we ate, I found myself mysteriously drawn to it. Damn these alcoholic tendencies of mine.

excerpts: The side of sweet potato fries were awesome.
I'd order that on it's own.
sweet potato fries.author: Diwata B.
sweet potato fries.review:
Fried Oysters. Poke Roll.  It's not "to-die-for" food but I'd eat there again none the less.  Service was un-noticeably good (not too bad, nothing spectacular).  They have a mini parking lot in the back, which is good considering the parking in the nearby streets.  

Appetizer: 
"Crispy Oysters" - $9.50: about 10 on the plate.  Fried.  would order it again

My meal:
"Firecracker Salmon" roll - $9.95: not a big fan of the over-induced daikon sprouts.  Didn't know I was ordering cooked-salmon til I got it.  Shouldn't have overlooked the 'tempura-salmon' description.  I'll try something else next time.
"Hawaiian Poke" roll - $8.95:  Giant cubed ahi in a roll (which I like)   I was diggin' the sesame-soy marinade.    

Got a taste of:
"Mixed Catch Basket" - $13.95
2 pieces of fish, 4 coconut shrimp & 3 crispy oysters with jalapeno tartar
No taste of coconut in my coconut shrimp.  The side of sweet potato fries were awesome.  I'd order that on it's own.

excerpts: The food was still pretty good (although my sweet potato fries were cold when they got to me), but the service was what ruined the night.
Our server was slow with EVERYTHING- the water, the apps, the wine, the dishes, the check and then the check pick-up.
It sucks when you go out and you find yourself looking around over and over again for your server.
Disappointment from a former favorite...
sweet potato fries.author: Tara R.
sweet potato fries.review: I have loved Pacific Catch for years.  My experience today was very disappointing.  The food was still pretty good (although my sweet potato fries were cold when they got to me), but the service was what ruined the night.  Our server was slow with EVERYTHING- the water, the apps, the wine, the dishes, the check and then the check pick-up.  It sucks when you go out and you find yourself looking around over and over again for your server.  Disappointment from a former favorite...

excerpts: Had the special chowder to start which was great, and then the Island Tacos (Baja, BBQ Salmon and Cajun Shrimp), with sweet potato fries.
Was very good.
There is a lot of food for not a huge amount of money, I think the chowder was about $6 and the Tacos were $14.
sweet potato fries.author: Paul G.
sweet potato fries.review:
Dropped in on Pacific Catch on 9th on New Year's Day following a wander round the Botanical Gardens and had a great late lunch. I had tried Pacific Catch's booth at Outside Lands Festival and really liked the food.

Had the special chowder to start which was great, and then the Island Tacos (Baja, BBQ Salmon and Cajun Shrimp), with sweet potato fries. Was very good. There is a lot of food for not a huge amount of money, I think the chowder was about $6 and the Tacos were $14. Not cheap, but by no means expensive, especially for fresh fish.

The wait staff was very friendly and the place is very clean and has great decor. Definitely a recommended spot if you're over near 9th and Irving....

excerpts: The popular sweet potato fries were not bad, but when it came to my Tokyo salmon, it felt like mall food.
sweet potato fries.author: Fotos C.
sweet potato fries.review:
Some one year ago, this place used to be the Canvas Gallery - a bar, cafe, art gallery, and live music performance space all in one! I always thought the location and design felt in tune back then.

Welp, fast forward to today and you have Pacific Catch, where they serve infused Japanese-American food, slightly overpriced and unexciting.  The actual space is bigger and more utilized, but it felt noisy during my sitting. The kitchen was exposed, the wall art was uninteresting, the food and service was sub par.  Upon looking at the menu, almost everything is either grilled or fried. The popular sweet potato fries were not bad, but when it came to my Tokyo salmon, it felt like mall food. The rice bowls did not look like anything special either. 

Maybe I need to order something more American and less Japanese here, to go with the fries? I don't know.

excerpts: Among the three of us, we had a basket of sweet potato fries, which was enormous (I mean, it doesn't look like much but sweet potatoes can be dense!)
I don't think anyone can mess up on sweet potato fries, so I was happy.
After my indulgence on sweet potato fries and a piece of corn, I could only finish a quarter of my rice bowl.
sweet potato fries.author: Candice B.
sweet potato fries.review:
Although like many others, I was sad to see Canvas go, I was also super curious to see what Pacific Catch did with the space.  Since I had a $20 Opentable cheque to use and some friends actually said good things about the new restaurant, I decided to finally give it a try.  Oh and also, nothing seems to be open on Easter Sunday for dinner and we desperately needed to take a friend out for his birthday. 

We had a reservation for 6:30 and one of us was very late, but the hostess and waitress gave us no grief and didn't make us feel guilty at all.  That's a giant plus for me.  It didn't seem like a lot of people made reservations, as our table was the only visible one with the sign "reservation" on it.  

The decor, well, I get it, it's Hawaiian themed.  The color is a bit loud for me and made the space look much smaller than its actual size.  I am glad they retained the high ceiling that I loved when it was Canvas, and we were all in awe that we were sitting where the middle bar used to be.  One thing I really didn't like was the carpet.  It was just ugly.  I don't see why they couldn't do some sort of chic hardwood floor.  And the noise level---it sounded like Happy Hour with a hundred suits packed in some Financial District bar at 5.  

Our waitress was prompt and friendly and efficient.  Our dishes arrived timely.  Among the three of us, we had a basket of sweet potato fries, which was enormous (I mean, it doesn't look like much but sweet potatoes can be dense!)  I don't think anyone can mess up on sweet potato fries, so I was happy.  The sauces were pretty good, but I prefer to eat them without anything.  

I had an unsweetened iced tea, which reminded me of the iced tea from the Grove.  Meaning, it's good---fruity aroma but not actually really sweet.  My boyfriend had a glass of sake.   Our friend had a mojito, which looked really good. 

We wanted to get some grilled corn but apparently they ran out, cuz it was a nice day and therefore everyone ordered corn (our waitress' explanation).  But she came back and told us the kitchen managed to find a piece so they will throw that in our dish.  Free corn?  I was thrilled.  But it was just okay.  I imagined it to be that famous Mexican grilled corn from Cafe Habana in New York, but nope, just your ordinary slightly charred, buttery, hard corn.  Kinda disappointing.

For entree, I had the ahi poke wasabi bowl.  I am not a huge wasabi fan, but I do enjoy wasabi noodles from the House and thought it might be a subtle flavor like that.  It basically came as a giant bowl with every ingredient you can find in a tuna roll, but deconstructed, and enlarged.  I didn't think the rice was flavored enough to be called "sushi rice."  But the ahi poke was delicious and the soy-wasabi sauce was pungent and flavorful.  Did I mention it's giant?  After my indulgence on sweet potato fries and a piece of corn, I could only finish a quarter of my rice bowl.  I think it'll be good as left over. 

The other two had the specials, sturgeon and some other fish---I can't remember!  Both fish dishes looked just alright to me that I didn't even feel tempted to try them, but they both claimed that the dishes were good.  So I will take their word for it.  

We also shared a macadamia nut brownie with ice cream.  It was nice and sweet, and comes in a good portion for sharing.  

The restaurant was packed around 6:30 but by the time we left at 9, it was practically empty.  Sorta surprising to me that people ate so early.  I was glad that no one pressured us to leave long after we ate everything and paid and sat around.  But then again, it wasn't like they needed the table or anything. 

I would go back for the fries.  And possibly go for their Happy Hour special which seems to be a good deal.  $3 beers and little munchies to go along.

excerpts: I had the crispy fried salmon with sweet potato fries.
Never had fried salmon before, so it sounded interesting.
I've also never liked sweet potato fries.
The fried salmon was great (or maybe I liked it more because salmon season was canceled this year), and the sweet potato fries were also great.
The fried salmon was great (or maybe I liked it more because salmon season was canceled this year), and the sweet potato fries were also great.
sweet potato fries.author: Rob T.
sweet potato fries.review:
I wasn't that hungry when I came here for dinner - perfect attitude for a critical review.

Started out with a Kamikaze Bloody Mary. Tastes like a Bloody Mary, hits like a Kamikaze.

Ahi poke wasabi bowl with tobiko was delicious - almost like a sashimi bowl, with lots of seaweed. The poke wasn't that seasoned, but the ahi was good enough to make up for the lack of spice.

I had the crispy fried salmon with sweet potato fries. Never had fried salmon before, so it sounded interesting. I've also never liked sweet potato fries. The fried salmon was great (or maybe I liked it more because salmon season was canceled this year), and the sweet potato fries were also great.

All the fried stuff did not taste that greasy.

Had some mochi fondu for dessert. A little thick for mochi (I expect it to be delicate), but tasty all the same.

excerpts: The sweet potato fries, however, were fantastic.
Salty and sweet and fried up right.
sweet potato fries.author: Michael H.
sweet potato fries.review:
Pacific Catch is a bullshit fish place.  The selection of fish was severely limited, the beer list was nothing special, and the atmosphere is loud and uncomfortable.  I couldn't hear a damned thing over the classic rock blasting throughout.  This place feels corporate.  Kind of like The Olive Garden or something.  

I ordered fish tacos.  They were soggy and small and totally overpriced.  The tomatillo sauce on said tacos was tasty but overpowering and overabundant.  The Thai Iced Tea was too milky and its flavors were unbalanced.  The sweet potato fries, however, were fantastic.  Salty and sweet and fried up right.  So good in fact that I'm gonna give this place another star.

The service was friendly and quick for the most part.  I was seated immediately and brought edamame and pretzels promptly.  I ordered a beer and had to wait awhile before it came.  My server forgot that I ordered it.  I could tell because I saw him walk by my table and look at me, and when he did that this look came over his face like "oh shit!" and he walked quickly to the kitchen.  A minute later I had my Oatmeal Stout.  I didn't really hold that against him though because he was otherwise attentive and nice, and I didn't really have to wait THAT long.  Everybody forgets shit from time to time.  

Another thing that was great:  They brought us the check like a few seconds after we asked for it.  I HATE it when I have to wait forever for the check.  As if it were some kind of pleasure to linger for 15 minutes in a restaurant after the food has been eaten and drinks have been drunk.  Nicely done.  

So...quick and polite service, but lame overpriced food and chain restaurant ambiance.  Bleh...I'm not coming back.

excerpts: Still love the sweet potato fries and next time I will try the sushi which looks yummy.
sweet potato fries.author: Amy A.
sweet potato fries.review:
My boyfriend HATES fish. As long as I've known him he has refused to eat fish. I, however, am a crafty and creative girl and I SWORE that ONE DAY I would get him to enjoy fish!
So...
One day we both had a sweet potato craving and I casually mentioned that there was a place near the park where we could eat and take a casual stroll. It was a nice day so he agreed. Ah ha! After 4 years, my plan was working..

We came in and sat down but we were sat in these super uncomfortable tall akward wicker chairs. "Surprise Boyfriend! We're at a fish place!"
Then we were served edamame and cute fishy crackers which was awesome because we were starving and made up for the crappy seating. I ordered some kind of ginger-tini and the boyfriend ordered a dark and stormy. Both were fabulous! The drinks were top notch! 
The two of us split a sweet potato basket of fries and loved it. Great dipping sauces!
I ordered the mahi mahi teriyaki bowl with pineapple fried rice and really enjoyed it. The boyfriend ordered the fish and chips. AH? Fish you say?! YES FISH!! And guess what? He LIKED it! 
For dessert, we had the Dulce de leche Spring rolls. MM MM GOOD!! If your thinking of going, make reservations.

***Update: The boyfriend took me here for Valentines day and it was one of the best dates ever! We had a cute corner table with candle light and it was very romantic. Waitress was sweet and attentive while still giving us plenty of time to stare deeply in each others eyes. The tokyo salmon was great but the calamari was not so great. Still love the sweet potato fries and next time I will try the sushi which looks yummy. ****

excerpts: The sweet potato fries.
They are SO delicious!
This is pretty embarrassing
