but I can finish a whole basket of sweet potato fries and still be ready for a second helping
Did I mention that their sweet potato fries during happy hour is ONLY $3 for a whole basket?!
And beers are only $3 as well?!
sweet potato fries.author: Be. N.
sweet potato fries.review:
This restaurant is really one of my favorite !

3 top reasons I love going to Pacific Catch:

1. The sweet potato fries.  They are SO delicious! This is pretty embarrassing but I can finish a whole basket of sweet potato fries and still be ready for a second helping :) hehe

2. The Crab/Avocado salad.  Huge portion and super yummy.  This will take care of your vegetable intake for the whole week!

3. They have a GREAT happy hour menu from 4-6pm M-F and after 10pm everyday.  I just found out that they also do happy hour on Sat and Sun after 10pm.  Did I mention that their sweet potato fries during happy hour is ONLY $3 for a whole basket?! And beers are only $3 as well?!

excerpts: Taco platter with the Mahi Mahi which comes with Sweet Potato Fries.
(The fries were amazing!
Definitely my favorite part of my meal.

The tacos were also pretty flavorful)
-Skirt Steak Teriyaki bowl (Felt like we could get this as part of a Bento box at any Japanese restaurant.) 
-Spicy
Mahi Mahi sandwhich (This was also superb.
It came with avocados which added so much flavor.)
-Skinny
Dip ON TAP!!!
And the chorus begins to sing...
sweet potato fries.author: Helen V.
sweet potato fries.review:
I came with my parents around 7:30 and were told we had to wait 25 minutes.  So we sat down grabbed a menu and decided what we wanted for dinner.  No more than 10 minutes later, our table was ready.  This place we off to a good start.  But it took forever for our food to come!  Tables that were seated after us...got their food before us!  ???  But back to the food.  We ordered...

-Calamari (Not seasoned well enough for me and a little dry)
-Two Taco platter with the Mahi Mahi which comes with Sweet Potato Fries.  (The fries were amazing!  Definitely my favorite part of my meal.  The tacos were also pretty flavorful)
-Skirt Steak Teriyaki bowl (Felt like we could get this as part of a Bento box at any Japanese restaurant.) 
-Spicy Mahi Mahi sandwhich (This was also superb.  It came with avocados which added so much flavor.)
-Skinny Dip ON TAP!!! *And the chorus begins to sing...*

Overall a decent dinner at Pacific Catch.  The food was good for the price we paid; however, nothing really "caught" my attention.  I did notice that they have Happy Hour daily and will probably come back to try that!

excerpts: My faves: salmon or ahi tuna wasabi bowl with brown rice, or the taco combo with sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: Misha F.
sweet potato fries.review:
Without a blink, 4 stars. 

I seriously love this place. I love the menu, the ambiance, the wicked happy hour deals. 

Sign up for the Pacfic Catch newsletters...there is always a monthly "deal." In October, it was 'buy one entree, get the 2nd free!' 

My faves: salmon or ahi tuna wasabi bowl with brown rice, or the taco combo with sweet potato fries.

I love coming here with girlfriends, esp because you can get opentable.com reservation points--win-win baby!

excerpts: How piggy are we...only 4 of us girls and we polished off TWO large baskets of the addicting sweet potato fries...as apps...for lunch!
That's how good they are...and fairly priced at $5 for a large basket.
I liked the menu but my House Special Salad w/ grilled tofu
was meh @ $12.
Others ordered Fish & Chips and Asparagus & Shiitake Rolls (asparagus tempura) and said it was good.
sweet potato fries.author: Jeannie C.
sweet potato fries.review:
How piggy are we...only 4 of us girls and we polished off TWO large baskets of the addicting sweet potato fries...as apps...for lunch!  That's how good they are...and fairly priced at $5 for a large basket.  I liked the menu but my House Special Salad w/ grilled tofu was meh @ $12.  Others ordered Fish & Chips and Asparagus & Shiitake Rolls (asparagus tempura) and said it was good.  Plenty of good drink choices. 

Space is cool...very open, high ceilings w/ lots of booths in the main room w/ a huge sky light and open kitchen.  Off to the right of the entrance is another room where we sat.  This room could easily accommodate a large semi-private party.   

I really appreciate that they serve sustainably-sourced seafood and consult the Monterey Bay Aquarium Seafood Watch "green light" list.

excerpts: Started with the sweet potato fries and the poki as our apps.
Potato Fries were good, although it would've been nice if they were crispier.
sweet potato fries.author: H C.
sweet potato fries.review:
Service was fantastic.  We had reservations and were seated promptly and the server was friendly and refilled our drinks promptly and often.

Unfortunately, I thought the food was just okay.  Started with the sweet potato fries and the poki as our apps.  Potato Fries were good, although it would've been nice if they were crispier.  Poki was just average.

My friend had the scallops and I had the combination fish and chips.  The fish was very good.  Fresh, but a little on the small side.  The shrimp and oysters were average although they were deep fried...  Forget fusion, just deep fry everything and I'd be happy.  Wrap it in bacon and I'd be in heaven (probably figuratively and literally).

Dessert was excellent.  Fried Dulce de Leche "Spring Rolls"   Yum.

Parking is a bit yuck like normal around the Irving area.  You can find it, but you have to do the parking crawl.

All in all, it was decent.  I'd go back, but probably not as my first choice.

excerpts: The sweet potato fries were okay.
sweet potato fries.author: Maricar M.
sweet potato fries.review:
I'm a bit obsessive.  When I know that I'll be going to a restaurant, I like to study the menu and plan out what I'll order as well as what my husband needs to order. 

I finally narrowed it down to the tacos, and I got uber happy to know that I could mix up the tacos.  Sadly, when I finally bit into all three of them (shrimp, mahi-mahi, regular fish), they all tasted the same to me.  The sauces in those tacos overpowered everything else inside those tortillas.  The sweet potato fries were okay.  I got tired of them after a while.

My husband ordered the wasabi bowl, and that was pretty tasty.  

Overall, the restaurant was okay.  My stomach couldn't have possibly expanded any more from all the food I was piling into it.

excerpts: I enjoyed the sweet potato fries with the flavorful aioli.
The fish tacos were also yummy.
sweet potato fries.author: Anne K.
sweet potato fries.review:
1 star for their accommodating parking spaces in the back of restaurant. Although limited, still very convenient, especially in the sunset district.

1 star for their prime customer service. The entire staff was very friendly. From the start of our experience with the host, to the end of the meal when the manager approached our table for comments.

1 star for their food. What an array of interesting selections. I enjoyed the sweet potato fries with the flavorful aioli. The fish tacos were also yummy.
A few other items that were a hit for my party were the california rolls, spiced cajun fries and wasabii chicken bowl.

Last star for the spacious floor plan. The tables and chairs weren't so crowded around each other and the place was very family friendly. 

The only reason they were shy of 5 stars were the prices. Some items were a bit overpriced for the quantity of food given.

excerpts: The fish tacos and sweet potato fries were the common entrees that got praise.
sweet potato fries.author: Ian C.
sweet potato fries.review:
Originally, I was looking for their location in the Marina, but we were near Golden Gate Park and the tiny but small parking lot had a few open spots so I figured why not.  With multiple locations, the differences in ratings didn't really seem logical.

My family enjoyed the quick service as we were hungry.  The waiter recommended the coconut shrimp for an appetizer and I'll pass that recommendation along.  The fish tacos and sweet potato fries were the common entrees that got praise.  

The only universal entree that got high marks was the dessert.  The fried Dulce de Leche spring rolls at first didn't sound appealing to everyone, but we devoured two orders without an effort.  

4 out of 5 stars, and next time I am hungry and nearby, I'll definitely stop in even if the parking lot is full.

excerpts: Their sweet potato fries are also very delicious, served with sweet and sour sauce.
sweet potato fries.author: Diane L.
sweet potato fries.review:
I'm so glad that they opened up a Pacific Catch in Inner Sunset... the Marina one is just WAY WAY WAY too small and difficult to get to with parking issues too.  

Pacific Catch is in no way supposed to be close to being authentic japanese food.  Instead of serving you bread, they give you a small plate of fish pretzels and edamame beans.  

They have a large variety of dishes to try.  I like their wasabi bowls.  It comes with seaweed, fish (depending on what kind, I get the Ahi Tuna or Poke Tuna), guacamole, and some other ingredients I don't remember.  The bowl itself is pretty big, and will definitely fill you up!  It costs about $15 for this bowl.  Their sweet potato fries are also very delicious, served with sweet and sour sauce.  Their sushi rolls are average, and nothing spectacular...

I tried their soup special one day... I forget the actual name of it, but it was similar to a ciopinno.  It was a tomato based soup with seafood.  The broth was very flavorful!  There was plenty of content in the soup too.  I was actually surprised by how much I enjoyed it!!  The soup cost about $12 though.  But very delicious.  It's something not always on their menu.

Their fish and chips were very good, comes with about 3-4 pieces depending on what combo you get...  The fish was fresh.  I also got a fish special of the day.  The fish was cooked nicely, and not overcooked.  I don't remember what was in it, but it was reallygood over all.

Overall, if you go here, get their fish dishes.  It's not as cheap as the other restaurants on Irving, but it's worth it for what they give you.  They also can take large groups with reservations... we had a group of 14 or so and the service wasn't bad or lagging at all.

excerpts:
The Food:

- SWEET POTATO FRIES.
sweet potato fries.author: Kay N.
sweet potato fries.review:
This location is pretty closeby. I like the 10PM-closing happy hour. 

Yes, parking sucks, but it's usually not a problem after 9:30PM, and it's really nice to have the little parking lot on the side for customers.

The bartenders are attentive and helpful.

The Food:

- SWEET POTATO FRIES. MMM...they're crispy and salted just right. I wish I had some right now.

- Poke bowl. - has always been a good choice for me.

- Sushi rolls. - nothing to write home about, but they taste good.

- Marinated steak bowl. - marinated, grilled meat, need I say more? 

- Fish and Chips, Coconut Shrimp, other fried items - good, fried, no complaints. 

- Ceviche. - wasn't particularly impressed. Sauce seemed a little overpowering.

excerpts: Sturgeon with sweet potato fries with a spicy guac sauce, scallops with shitake mushrooms and seaweed salad, and the sushi grade ahi salad.
THE BOMB!!!
It doesn't sound like any of that would go together well, but it did.
sweet potato fries.author: Jocelyn J.
sweet potato fries.review:
I really didn't want to go to this restaurant because from the outside it just seemed like some wanna-be trendy fish spot. At the behest of my mom and cousin....I was forced to partake. Walking inside it definitely has that trendy feel, so I sat my frown down not at all in the mood for some crazy fish concoctions. 

The menu is mostly Asian with a twist of Mexican on some dishes. We had 3 dishes and shared them all around the table. Sturgeon with sweet potato fries with a spicy guac sauce, scallops with shitake mushrooms and seaweed salad, and the sushi grade ahi salad. THE BOMB!!! It doesn't sound like any of that would go together well, but it did. We were all very impressed.

None of us had any cocktails but the wine we had was wonderful and our server paired it with our meal nicely. Mikey (our server) was very attentive without being irritating. He hooked us up with a comp dessert which was crazy good! Ice cream fondue...which translates into fried ice cream wrapped in rice paper and dipped in chocolate sauce. It was a great finish to a great meal. 

We stayed for a pretty long time converstating and enjoying ourselves. When we were leaving I did notice there were a few families with kids so it seems like a good place for all ages. 

One of the managing partners came by our table to check on us and gave us the rundown of the restaurant....I'm sure his presence contributed to how great everything was, but I can't imagine anything truly suffering in his absence.
Most definitely will go again and again and again.

excerpts: I ordered the special - organic chinook salmon, tomatillo salsa, grilled veggies and sweet potato fries.
The fish was perfectly cooked, not underdone but not dry or tough.
The spice rub on it was AHMAZING!
The salsa was pretty good, not my favorite part of the dish, but was nice.
The grilled veggies were fully cooked, maybe even a little overcooked, but since I was feeding them to my toddler, I didn't mind.
The sweet potato fries, totally awesome.
Toddler LOVED them.
sweet potato fries.author: Laura G.
sweet potato fries.review:
I am so sold on this place. I came in with a clean slate, having never tried Pacific Catch anywhere. First impressed by how clean, fresh everything was. The high ceilings make the place feel even more spacious. The wait staff and hostesses were all very friendly. HUGE bonus points for the fact that they're super kid friendly and even have "stroller parking" back by the restrooms. I ordered the special - organic chinook salmon, tomatillo salsa, grilled veggies and sweet potato fries. The fish was perfectly cooked, not underdone but not dry or tough. The spice rub on it was AHMAZING! The salsa was pretty good, not my favorite part of the dish, but was nice. The grilled veggies were fully cooked, maybe even a little overcooked, but since I was feeding them to my toddler, I didn't mind. The sweet potato fries, totally awesome. Toddler LOVED them. I loved them!

The only thing was that I was a bit disappointed by the portions, which felt on the small side. But, I don't need any encouragement to overeat so I don't feel too bad about the portions. 

I definitely recommend if you get a salad, ask for the miso dressing. My mother-in-law tried it and we were dipping everything in it. Totally delicious.

excerpts: Ordered almost all of the happy hour appetizers: sweet potato fries, calamari, spicy tuna roll, and poke.
I'm not sure how discounted the happy hour pricing was, but they all seemed pretty cheap for the serving size.
Both the fries and the calamari were fried crispy and light, not at all greasy.
Poke was good, but not the best cuts of tuna, and it seemed a little heavy on the sauce.
Spicy tuna roll was good, and I'm not usually a fan of "spicy" rolls.
sweet potato fries.author: marissa a.
sweet potato fries.review:
Went for happy hour last Friday.  We got there early enough to snag seats at the bar, but the bar area filled up pretty quickly after we arrived.  The dining room is huge (and was pretty empty), but happy hour deals are only good if you sit in the bar area. Why?? This rule made it difficult for groups larger than 3 or 4 to sit together.

Ordered almost all of the happy hour appetizers: sweet potato fries, calamari, spicy tuna roll, and poke.  I'm not sure how discounted the happy hour pricing was, but they all seemed pretty cheap for the serving size.  Both the fries and the calamari were fried crispy and light, not at all greasy.  Poke was good, but not the best cuts of tuna, and it seemed a little heavy on the sauce.  Spicy tuna roll was good, and I'm not usually a fan of "spicy" rolls.  

Nice alcohol selection at the bar, and decent variety of beer on tap.  Also tried a kumquat mojito and a lemongrass mojito - yummm.  Not too sweet.  Service was ok, although it was hard to figure out who our server/bartender actually was.

excerpts: The sweet potato fries are a must!!!
sweet potato fries.author: LiveToEat F.
sweet potato fries.review:
I like this location more than the one on Chestnut.  

This location is roomy and the decor is quite nice.  I always get the hawaiian poke wasabi bowl!  SOOOOO GOOD! I usually get it with sushi rice but I got it with brown rice recently and it was just as good! and healthier too might I add.   the mahi and tuna sandwiches are also quite tasty.  Their fish is fresh and always cooked perfectly in the sandwiches.  
The sweet potato fries are a must!!!  They are so thin, sweet and delicious!  

A plus:  I love the complimentary edamame and pretzel fishes.  YES! FREE FOOD!

I'll be back!

excerpts: Also I would recommend the sweet potato fries and shimp ceviche.
sweet potato fries.author: Jafar Amir Hanovic Ismailov M.
sweet potato fries.review:
If you ever have a chance to purchase the oatmeal stout at this restaurant I would highly recommend it. The oatmeal stout is a very sophisticated beverage that really defines what's possible if you get creative with your brewing processes. 

The location of this place (on the lively corner of Lincoln and 9th Ave) makes Pacific Catch an excellent venue for happy hour meet ups or one on one dates.

I personally prefer the outside patio sitting but those are usually fairly busy during peak hours.

Also I would recommend the sweet potato fries and shimp ceviche.

I think this place will continue to be an important part of the inner sunset scene for years to come because it reeks of good vibes.

excerpts: I love sweet potato fries, but the ones here were dry and oily.
Pricing for the food isn't worth what you get.
sweet potato fries.author: Janel Y.
sweet potato fries.review:
I wanted to try this place to see if it was worth closing the Canvas Gallery for and I'm so sad and disappointed because now, I miss the Canvas Gallery even more!

Wasn't too impressed with the food. I love sweet potato fries, but the ones here were dry and oily. Pricing for the food isn't worth what you get. Service was decent as well as decor.

Giving this place 2 stars since I'm biased...I LOVED the Canvas Gallery and am disappointed with what replaced it.

excerpts: The Good stuff: The sweet potato fries were pretty good, and yeah.. for dessert, we split the mango cheesecake - now..
this WAS good.
I'd order this again.
sweet potato fries.author: Harry W.
sweet potato fries.review:
Wow.. after reading all the glowing reviews for Pacific Catch on 9th, we dashed on over there to see what all the hubbub was about..

Sorry to say, we were a bit disappointed.  

Nutshell Review: Anything we experienced that was good tonight (food, service, etc), also had an unexpected mild downside to it.

The Good stuff: The sweet potato fries were pretty good, and yeah.. for dessert, we split the mango cheesecake - now.. this WAS good.  I'd order this again.  OK.. all good on the dessert.

The three tacos I ordered up as the main dish were decent.  I ordered one each of (1) a Grilled Mahi-Mahi taco,  (2) a traditional Baja-style fried fish taco, and (3) one shrimp taco.  As for Taco #2, I think I've had better at Rubios.. Um. wait.. I have..  The others were okay. The best was probably the shrimp taco.  

Grilled Corn - this little side dish was complemented beautifully with a flavorful chili-lime butter - AWESOME butter. but hey.. they didn't grill the corn the whole way - either that, or it was just sitting around too long after leaving the grill.  Parts of the kernels were clearly COLD upon biting em.. 

The Mahi-Mahi Teriyaki Bowl my significant other had was overseasoned and covered in a heavy sweet sauce that completely drowned out any other flavors or texture that once were part of the pineapple fried rice which became almost mush.   The Mahi itself was perfectly prepared.  What a bummer.  Maybe the better way to go here is to go instead with the brown rice they also offer as an option.

Service: So-so.  Our greeter and waitress were very friendly and greeted us with HUGE smiles and a wonderful attitude, but once we ordered up our food, our server was very hard to find, even though we were seated near the front of the restaurant where all of the OTHER servers congregated.  It seemed as if I was invisible there tonight, as I was pretty thirsty, but well,  we only got refills twice over the hour we were there.    Our waitress did a great job and was probably swamped. It's just that the other help that we tried to flag down seemed as if we didn't exist.

 I'll probably give them another try, but there's plenty of competition from other cuisines all over this neighborhood.  

I was expecting much better, and to place this restaurant into our normal "rotation" of places to eat. Oh well.  Blame it on my expectations being sky-high..

excerpts: Had a fantastic ahi sandwich that came with sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: cyndi L.
sweet potato fries.review:
The decor of this place is far above the Chestnut Street location or the Corte Madera one too. The main dining area seems to have like 3 areas. The center of the floor is split between tables and booths. I generally don't like booths, or is the designer term banquette? Whatever it is I don't care much for them as you have to scoot in and out of it and that's not a feat that can be accomplished by many with much grace. There is an area that is off to the side, on 9th Avenue that is just tables, I believe. There is also a bar area that looks nice and you can be seated there too. And there is also seating right in front of the open kitchen but I would advise against that unless you're that desparate because it's also where the pick up area is. So the wait staff is constantly marching back and forth or just waiting right there.

Have been in for lunch and for dinner. The lunch service was good, it wasn't too crowded or anything. Had a fantastic ahi sandwich that came with sweet potato fries.

The dinner service was not great. Place was packed. Very glad I had a reservation. I'll give them a little leeway because any place that has been open for under a couple months (heck even 6 months) is going to need to work out it's pacing/service issues. We ordered dessert and it took them 20 minutes to bring out mochi ice cream that was pretty much coming out of a freezer. And that was after the waiter asked if we had gotten it yet. I'll still go here but more so for lunch than dinner.

**4.29.08 came back for dinner and the service is much, much better. Had the escolar (fish) and that was yummy. What was also on the plate was pineapple fried rice and grilled baby bok choy. Eh. The baby bok choy needed seasoning stat. Salt, pepper, something. I can see how the pineapple fried rice can appeal to some people. I am not one of those people. Maybe if the pineapple chunks were not so huge. The grilled calamari that we had as a starter was excellent. Stuffed with sausage and it wasn't too chewy, just the right texture.

excerpts:
There wasn't anything special about this, except the fact that her side of Sweet Potato Fries were YUMMY!!

4 stars for their strong drinks, my Ahi Tuna Wasabi bowl and my friend's sweet potato fries!
sweet potato fries.author: Serena W.
sweet potato fries.review:
Arrived here expecting just sushi. Their menu only consisted of about 5-7(?) plain-nothing-out-of-the-original sushi rolls. Then me and my friend realized Pacific Catch was a Japanese-Mexican fusion restaurant, but we decided to give it a try anyways since we were drooling over the food on the table next to us. 

We started off with the Spicy Cabo Calamari, which was really soft in texture, definitely not crispy because the breaded exterior would fall off whenever we tried to pick at one; not spicy at all, it lacked much taste until i doused the heck out of it with the dipping sauce. Then we also figured out they also added a few other concocsions that should have just been left outta the fryer.....like the fried lemon I accidently ate.....twice. 

My friend ordered the Mixed Catch Basket. There wasn't anything special about this, except the fact that her side of Sweet Potato Fries were YUMMY!!

I ordered the Ahi Tuna Wasabi Bowl, topped with (of course) ahi tuna, wakame salad, avocado, ginger and cucumber. The sushi rice was flavored with a wasabi sauce, which was somewhat mild, but SO GOOD!! It's basically like sushi, but bigger and broken down into all its components. 

We also ordered two drinks, a Mai Tai & forgot the name of the other one, but both were pretty strong!! I like! I like!

Gotta come back to try their Mojito & Mochi Fondue!!

4 stars for their strong drinks, my Ahi Tuna Wasabi bowl and my friend's sweet potato fries!


[UPDATED: 4.26.2008]

Came here again with another friend around 8ish. Considering it was a Friday, there was a 30 min. wait for the tables inside, so we decided to dine outside, which turned out really nice...although it was butt-freezing cold at first. Thank god they had the protective sheet to block off most of the wind. 

Tried the Ahi Poke Wasabi bowl this time and it was delicious! Although I did like my Ahi Tuna from my last dining here, I would recommend the Ahi Poke over that. My Lemon Grass Mojito was refreshing as well. My friend's Gin & Tonic was pretty stiff.

Service was still attentive, friendly, consistent and quick. The bar was open till 1AM that day, but too bad we couldn't stay for another round of  drinks considering my friend had the Asian glow by the time he finished his Gin & Tonic. -sigh-

excerpts: The sweet potato fries were just ok (didn't get any dip) and the cole slaw was bland - both could use some heavier seasoning.
Skip the lemongrass tea.
sweet potato fries.author: Esther R.
sweet potato fries.review:
We had an amazing early dinner on the small outdoor patio with Sadie.  As we basked in the warm summer breeze, I gobbled up the shrimp ceviche.  It was perfectly tangy tart with a satisfyingly large quantity of plump, sweet shrimp with lime juice, cilantro, onions, and avocado.  I tossed the tortilla chips aside and just started forking it up.  The ahi tuna sandwich was lightly seared with spring greens, tomato, wasabi mayonaise, fresh ginger and avocado on chewy ciabatta bread.  It was like a sushi sandwich aka the best sandwich I have had in a long time.  

One star down for the sides.  The sweet potato fries were just ok (didn't get any dip) and the cole slaw was bland - both could use some heavier seasoning.  Skip the lemongrass tea.  It was like slightly flavored water for $2.25.  

Service was average.

This is a great stop before or after visiting GG Park.  I'll be back.

excerpts: When I got to the restaurant and placed my order, I stayed along that line, except I got the oyster basket with sweet potato fries.
The waiter also mentioned that it was light in terms of fried food.
For me, it was delicious, but really heavy like all other fried food
(don't ask me why I was expecting fried food to be light).
The sweet potato fries were awesome.
sweet potato fries.author: Diana R.
sweet potato fries.review:
Went here for a friends birthday. The venue is excellent if you have a big group and they take reservations. I really like the inside of the restaurant because the kitchen was in plain sight, and I was able watch them cook, which gives me some sort of entertainment.

So it should be noted that I am really not a big fan of seafood. It is actually something I have very recently got into so I am still a little shy when it comes to trying fish that isn't in sushi (don't question, I'm just weird). So when I looked at the menu online I figured I would take small step forward in my food trying experience and go for the fish and chips. When I got to the restaurant and placed my order, I stayed along that line, except I got the oyster basket with sweet potato fries. The waiter also mentioned that it was light in terms of fried food. For me, it was delicious, but really heavy like all other fried food (don't ask me why I was expecting fried food to be light). The sweet potato fries were awesome. I threw some hot sauce on the oysters as well to give it a kick.

The group also had various appetizers ordered in the beginning that included edamame, poke, and the basket of fries. All tasty.

The executive chef came out and visited with us for a moment to check on our experience, as well as how we liked the food. I was really impressed with that.

The service was decent, however in the earlier part of our dining experience, the waiter gave the wrong drink to someone at our table. When we told him this, he corrected it, but also freaked out a bit and started playing "musical drinks," and attempted to take my drink, which was correct. It was a bit funny but annoying because usually you just take the drink back and correct it.

excerpts: This is where I was first introduced to sweet potato fries!
The menu said that one could choose between traditional or spicy fries....
so I asked the waiter if we could have spicy sweet potato fries.
The waiter thought I was strange
but he did it anyway!
sweet potato fries.author: Christine C.
sweet potato fries.review:
3.5 stars really.

Great happy hour options (one in the evening and one from 10pm to closing), very nice and accomodating staff and the food is good too.

This is where I was first introduced to sweet potato fries! The menu said that one could choose between traditional or spicy fries.... so I asked the waiter if we could have spicy sweet potato fries. The waiter thought I was strange but he did it anyway! And they were delish!

Also have tried the coconut shrimp (nice and crispy) and the firecracker salmon roll (it was only ok). Fish tacos are pretty tasty, too(several options of fish). 

The lemongrass mojitio is a delightfully interesting combination. 

All in all, a good place to have a small bite to eat. It gets busy during dinner time.

excerpts: i ordered the catch of the day fish and chips because it included sweet potato fries and i knew my friend was finding for those.
after receiving my plate, the price of it seemed to outweigh the overall quantity of it, even though the fish of the night was talapia from costa rica...
(the best kind of talapia there is).
the sweet potato fries but "not the greatest fries ever".

my friend got some wasabi bowl and she dint seem to really have a taste for it much as she seemd to only pick out the fish leaving a a bowl full of rice that can feed a hungry family in vietnam with ..
sweet potato fries.author: Rex P.
sweet potato fries.review:
came here for a post valentines day dinner. place was packed and supposedly had reservations booked until 10pm. THIS PLACE MUST BE REALLY GOOD THEN. Well....it was OK. Looking it seems to fused japanese and american dishes, and judging by the name of the restaurant,  it is a seafood place.

 i ordered the catch of the day fish and chips because it included sweet potato fries and i knew my friend was finding for those. after receiving my plate, the price of it seemed to outweigh the overall quantity of it, even though the fish of the night was talapia from costa rica...(the best kind of talapia there is). the sweet potato fries but "not the greatest fries ever". my friend got some wasabi bowl and she dint seem to really have a taste for it much as she seemd to only pick out the fish leaving a a bowl full of rice that can feed a hungry family in vietnam with ..haha jk

food was average at best. there are so many restaurant in the surrounding area, as i observed as we took a stroll around the block to kill time before out table was ready. But who really goes out on a vday dinner or in, this case post vday, primarily for the food....its really  about who your having the meal with.

excerpts: Coconut Shrimp and sweet potato fries are
cant miss items.
Nice touches like lemon grass in my mojito.
and it was still really delicious and tasty and for tolerating children so well, the best sweet potato fries, and the lemongrass mojito
, I grant thee one more star.
sweet potato fries.author: Matthew C.
sweet potato fries.review:
Tasty, Fresh and Affordable. 

We have been here several times for brunch/lunch. Good food for sure. Nice salads, fish, tacos, fried dishes, deserts, full bar. Coconut Shrimp and sweet potato fries are cant miss items. Nice touches like lemon grass in my mojito. ;-)

Good place for dates, large groups (long tables allow for parties of 12 or more), quick bites, casual and friendly. And I did mention it has a full bar? Because you know it's those "little" things that can make a place worth returning to.

Parking is horrendous in this area. I either walk or pay for parking. But we are all used to that.  It's tight with strollers, but kid friendly. 

Right across from the park, a wonderful location, with a lot of competition on the block, I expect this place to do well. We shall return.

updated to 4 stars: we went back and it was still really delicious and tasty and for tolerating children so well, the best sweet potato fries, and the lemongrass mojito, I grant thee one more star.

excerpts:
After the oysters we had the shrimp teriyaki bowl and the 3 pieces of the fresh catch of the day with the sweet potato fries.

The sweet potato fries were the highlight.
sweet potato fries.author: SF N.
sweet potato fries.review:
One word: disappointing. 

Also poor service, wannabe Asian food, great decor.

I love the decor and the way the place is designed, but the food is lacking. The atmosphere wasn't too bad. There were people of all ages there and even a few crying babies.

We started with the crispy oysters and they were great. I'm not a fan of them but I enjoyed. You also can't go wrong with deep frying stuff.

After the oysters we had the shrimp teriyaki bowl and the 3 pieces of the fresh catch of the day with the sweet potato fries.

The teriyaki bowl was horrible. Who drenches sauce all over the rice? It was so SWEET!  The Pineapple fried rice was not even fried like it said on the menu. The sweet sauce ruined it. The veggies were okay though. The bok choy and mushrooms were nice. This was basically wet rice with sauce and a bunch of veggies and grilled shrimp. I could have made a better bowl at home.

The fish and chips were fine because you cannot seriously mess up on fried foods.  The pieces of fish were decent sized, but for around $15 I expected more. The sweet potato fries were the highlight.

Oh wait, let me talk about service. It was non-existant. Johanna our server was nowhere to be seen. We had to tell the hostess that we were ready to order. After ordering our food, she did not acknowledge us at all until we asked for the check. She didn't even bring out the food. What was she doing???? No refills on water, no how are you guys doing, and no eye contact. Worst server ever.

This place is a nice date place, but you can get better food elsewhere. It seems to me that something is wrong with the fusion. The food tasted like it was made by someone who thinks they know Asian food but really doesnt. I guess thats where the "fusion" comes in. I won't get over how they drench teriyaki sauce all over rice. Eww.

excerpts: Another place to eat their delicious sweet potato fries!
Yikes!
Am I gonna od on them. .
I think not!
I have always enjoyed Pacific Catch on Chestnut street, but was anxious to see the new location.
Gorgeous - wall treatment an amazing terra cotta color, artwork awesome ,use of space was excellent with a full bar on one side and eating area that is children friendly on the other.
Open kitchen with counter service.
Saw generous bowls of salads and chicken teriyaki over rice passing by.
Poke wasabi salad here
I come......recently ordered the fried oysters with sweet potato fries and they were just the right crunchness.
everything is fresh and perfectly prepared - what more could you ask for.
sweet potato fries.author: Kea C.
sweet potato fries.review:
Another place to eat their delicious sweet potato fries!  Yikes!  Am I gonna od on them. . I think not!  I have always enjoyed Pacific Catch on Chestnut street, but was anxious to see the new location.  
Gorgeous - wall treatment an amazing terra cotta color, artwork awesome ,use of space was excellent with a full bar on one side and eating area that is children friendly on the other. Open kitchen with counter service. Saw generous bowls of salads and chicken teriyaki over rice passing by.  Poke wasabi salad here I come......recently ordered the fried oysters with sweet potato fries and they were just the right crunchness. everything is fresh and perfectly prepared - what more could you ask for.

excerpts:
Baja Shrimp Ceviche
Sweet Potato Fries (Get them!)
sweet potato fries.author: Jessica B.
sweet potato fries.review:
I used to come here whenever I had disposable 20 and wanted to treat myself to some qual-it- A food. I've had fun happy hour times with some friends and even quick one drink hang outs. I had not eaten here in over a year and was excited when the opportunity came to indulge in a yummy lunch. After Bay to Breakers, my friends went to Gordos (YUM) and I chose to order take out from Pacific Catch. I requested the seared ahi rice bowl.  Excited to chow down, I ran to Gordos and proceeded to stuff my face. However, one thing felt wrong. The fish did not taste the same. Again, here is another place that overloads on the sodium to masque the taste of their food. Not only was the fish too salty, but there was something fishy about the fish. After a while, I decided to cease my "chow down" and wrapped the food back into the bag. There is a huge problem if I order food and do not devour the entire thing. This means I either am not hungry or the food does not taste good. Thinking that I must not have been hungry, I decided to eat the bowl later that day. From the moment I went to my bfs house to later that afternoon, my stomach was hurting. I assumed it was due to the hangover from B2B, but it did not make sense. I went to go finish the bowl and figured out my stomach was hurting from the food. Pretty sad. The bowls used to be enjoyable.

What I have eaten here: 
Baja Shrimp Ceviche
Sweet Potato Fries (Get them!)
Cabo Calamari
Seared Ahi Bowl
Hawaiian Poke Bowl

I'll keep the rating 3/5 because this could have been the one bad experience. I was always a fan of Pacific Catch, but I may need to take a permanent break from them. SORRY!

excerpts: We also order a small side order of sweet potato fries.
It's sweet potato fries.
It's great.
sweet potato fries.author: Crystal L.
sweet potato fries.review:
My friend kept recommending this place to me, so I finally went and tried their Hawaiian Poke Wasabi bowl with brown rice. It was great.  It reminded me of the Korean dish bibimbap but this in a Japanese/ Hawaiian fusion version. You have a choice of white rice, sushi rice or brown rice.  And you can also have it with half salad half rice instead of full rice.  It is a big bowl for its price and can definitely be split into at least 2 servings.   The tuna was well seasoned and the rice had a great wasabi soysauce all over it.  We also order a small side order of sweet potato fries.  It's sweet potato fries. It's great. haha

My friend said this location has a larger sitting area than the marina/cow hollow location and is easier to find parking.  There is a small parking lot available, but mainly street parking.

excerpts: One of their refreshing cocktails, Sweet potato fries, and Hawaiian Poke.
Yummmmm!
sweet potato fries.author: Nat S.
sweet potato fries.review:
I am kind of obsessed with this place. The food is delicious, very fresh and interesting seafood dishes. My favorite part though, is it's close proximity to CA Academy of Sciences. For some reason, every time I go to CA Academy of Sciences, I have a mad craving to eat seafood. That may seem a little perverse, but at least I don't crave animals after the zoo.  Anyways, I am writing this review after my last visit there on a Thursday night (after my mouth watered from staring at the fish in CA Academy)....I went around 9 pm and Pacific Catch was pretty packed. Luckily, without reservations, the super sweet and amazing Anastasia was so helpful. She walked me and my date directly to a table. I'm not sure why Anastasia got a  bad review before, she was so nice and prompt to accommodate my hunger pangs. 
Must orders for Pacific Catch: One of their refreshing cocktails, Sweet potato fries, and Hawaiian Poke. Yummmmm!

excerpts: One grilled mahi mahi and one cabo shrimp with a side of sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: BrElla4eva H.
sweet potato fries.review:
I'd really give this place 3 1/2 stars...4 stars for food, 3 stars for the service. I actually really like this restaurant. The place is pretty casual, but fun. A good spot to get together with a small group of friends for a reasonably priced dinner. The food was delicious, but the service was mediocre. I think our server was new to the job so I felt bad for him. . We ordered the hawaiian poke to start off but didn't end up actually getting it till a little bit after our server came out with our entrees. But better late than never because it was ooh so good. Very fresh and flavorful. After contemplating about the many enticing choices on the menu, I opted for the island tacos for my main entree. One grilled mahi mahi and one cabo shrimp with a side of sweet potato fries. Definite thumbs up! 

I do need to mention a strange but funny incident we had while dining here. As we were all finishing up our food, one of my friends was drinking waster out of his glass...when all of a sudden I see a big splash. At first I thought he dropped his glass of water but it turned out that the bottom of his glass broke and all the ice and water spilled out! And let me just tell you...it broke just on the bottom of the glass in almost a perfect, complete circle! How weird is that!?! Luckily he already finished his meal. We, of course, complained to our server and he was able to get his meal for free. He mentioned that it probably happened because the glass was hot when they poured in cold water.

Now for dessert...always my favorite part! The four of us shared 2 different plates....the mochi fondue and the fried dulce de leche spring rolls. Both were scrumptious! I never thought of dipping mochi ice cream balls in hot chocolate sauce but it is dee-lish!

YES, I'd come back to this place and YES, I recommend it!

excerpts: I heart the sweet potato fries from this place!
The drinks are usually solid standards with a slight twist that have never done me wrong and dessert is always fun if I have room after consuming mass quantities of sweet potato fries!
sweet potato fries.author: Stephanie W.
sweet potato fries.review:
I heart the sweet potato fries from this place! Seriously, I will come here just for that, but more my usual addition is the Hawaiian Poke which is really tasty. The Poke is really something I recommend as the appetizer version b/c then it comes with yummy fried won tons to eat it on. 

The drinks are usually solid standards with a slight twist that have never done me wrong and dessert is always fun if I have room after consuming mass quantities of sweet potato fries!

excerpts: LOVED the sweet potato fries as well.
sweet potato fries.author: Shoshana g.
sweet potato fries.review:
oh.my.god. I am considering flying back to San Fran JUST for the Ahi Tuna Wasabi bowl. 

Sushi was fresh and amazing and exactly what I was hoping for.

LOVED the sweet potato fries as well. 

Wish I had had room for dessert!

excerpts: Again, sweet potato fries can do no wrong but the service here can definitely do with some speeding up.
sweet potato fries.author: Maggie L.
sweet potato fries.review:
One would think that going to the bigger Pacific Catch, one would be seated in timely manner but this is not the case. People definitely tend to linger around this one a lot longer than at the Chestnut St. location. Again, sweet potato fries can do no wrong but the service here can definitely do with some speeding up. 

Pretty good sushi rolls and ceviche. Not a big fan of the tacos because they all seem to taste the same, i.e. drenched in the same avocado sauce. I still love the salmon sandwich.

excerpts: excellent sweet potato fries and grilled zucchini to go with it.
sweet potato fries.author: Kyle D.
sweet potato fries.review: This is a great place, I had a tilapia with tomatillo/avocado sauce that was really really tasty. excellent sweet potato fries and grilled zucchini to go with it. appetizer was the baja shrimp ceviche with chips that was really good too. The service was very fast, and the manager even comped our desert (egg nog ice cream-it was ok.) Overall a great atmosphere, tasty food, great service. I'd definitely recommend Pacific Catch

excerpts: I indulged in the sweet potato fries with the wasabi and chili dipping sauces.....
sweet potato fries.author: K B.
sweet potato fries.review:
Delicious!!! 

We came here  wanting fresh salads and fish and we got it. The salads are huge and a meal in and of themselves. I indulged in the sweet potato fries with the wasabi and chili dipping sauces..... oh my gawd yum!!!

they have a takeout menu so you can call it in since it's at the corner of 9th and Lincoln so parking can suck. 

now that the mr. and i have started our pre-wedding 'fight the fat' starvation diet, we will be dining here quite a bit.

excerpts: I usually order the sweet potato fries and the Hawaiian poke (pronouced po-kee, not like "poke" in the eye) wasabi bowl.
The rice in the last wasabi bowl I had was poorly cooked and still hard.
I hope they can refocus on serving quality...
It's A-OK.
sweet potato fries.author: Randall L.
sweet potato fries.review:
I came here to eat with my family for my birthday.  Why did I pick it?  I was bored of all the other food I had eaten in the past week and hadn't been here for about a year.  I just wanted a change of taste plus a restaurant that wasn't anything too fancy or expensive.  And that's exactly what we got.  

There's nothing too special or particularly awesome about their seafood and Asian/Hawaiian inspired dishes.  Pacific Catch has become a mainstream chain that lacks uniqueness.  There's nothing that will WOW you here.

I usually order the sweet potato fries and the Hawaiian poke (pronouced po-kee, not like "poke" in the eye) wasabi bowl.  The rice in the last wasabi bowl I had was poorly cooked and still hard.  I hope they can refocus on serving quality...  It's A-OK.

excerpts: I had the Thai Coconut Shrimp with sweet potato fries.
People rave about the sweet potato fries and they are good, but I've had better.
You can't go wrong with the Shrimp.
sweet potato fries.author: Babette C.
sweet potato fries.review:
My sister comes here a lot when she's in the avenues to hang out with her friends.  She insisted that I try it.  I was reluctant, because I hate driving out to the avenues ad I abhor street parking in San Francisco, but I trust my sister's instincts when it comes to food, because she's as particular as I am.

It's places like this that makes me trust her.  This place was pretty good.  I'd give it 4 stars, but I hate crowded places and this place is crowded.  People love this place and the wait to get in is trying.  We must have missed the height of the dinner rush, because we were seated after 20 minutes.  

I had the Thai Coconut Shrimp with sweet potato fries.  People rave about the sweet potato fries and they are good, but I've had better.  You can't go wrong with the Shrimp.  My sister is addicted to the Hawaiian Poke Wasabi Bowl with brown rice.  It looked like health food.  Yuck!  Then I tasted it.  It's tasty.  Taking one bite made me feel healthier.  We also had some of the Dulce de leche spring rolls a la mode, which was not greasy and very good.  Can't wait to try this place again.

excerpts: Sweet potato fries are soooo good!
Everything tastes good, and the service is fine, it isn't too expensive, but it feels a little impersonal and kind of chain-y.
sweet potato fries.author: Aunt B.
sweet potato fries.review:
Sweet potato fries are soooo good!
Everything tastes good, and the service is fine, it isn't too expensive, but it feels a little impersonal and kind of chain-y.

excerpts: (the sweet potato fries were nice...)
sweet potato fries.author: bm b.
sweet potato fries.review:
I gave you a shot, Pacific Catch, i wanted to like you-- i really did.

But god dammit, why is your take-out so sloppy!!??  Did you just throw it in the box and shake that shit up like a martini before you gave it to me?? Did you box this in a washing machine?! You're fired. (the sweet potato fries were nice...)

excerpts: I subbed in pineapple fried rice for the sweet potato fries, even though I've heard those are amazing.
The rice was really delicious too.
sweet potato fries.author: Steve C.
sweet potato fries.review:
Sweet Jesus this place is awesome. 

We started with calarmari, and it was easily among the most delicious I've had. The aoili that came with it was great, and complemented the calamari well. 

I had shrimp tacos, which again were delicious. I got the three taco plate which was a little too much, but I was starving. The two taco plate is plenty though. I subbed in pineapple fried rice for the sweet potato fries, even though I've heard those are amazing. The rice was really delicious too. I can't remember what my fiancee got, probably because I was face down in my plate.  

We split a mochi fondue for dessert and I almost died because it was INSANE. I would not hesitate to kill any of you for some more of that stuff. Holy crap. 

Add in a pretty nice bottle of wine, and we were still out of there for around a hundred bucks, including the tip. 

My fiancee really, REALLY misses Hawaii often, and this is one of the places I can take her in San Francisco that makes it hurt a little less. The food is really fresh and the fish is amazing, and it's similar to what you would get on the islands. The staff are all very friendly and knowledgeable, and according to our waitress, a lot of them are from Hawaii as well. 

We made a reservation about an hour in advance (Friday night), but when we arrived twenty minutes early, we found an open table in the bar area, so we just grabbed that.

excerpts: This place was good- tasty seafood salads, and yummy sweet potato fries!
sweet potato fries.author: Lisa M.
sweet potato fries.review: This place was good- tasty seafood salads, and yummy sweet potato fries!

excerpts: We ordered a set of Mahi Mahi tacos containing two tacos with sweet potato fries, a four piece Fish and Chip set with regular fries and the Hawaiian Poke as an appetizer.
The Hawaiian Poke was a first for me.
It's essentially tuna sashimi that is drowned in soy sauce and sesame seed oil.
It comes with this wonton strip-like crackers that are light and crunchy, which you eat with the tuna just like chips to salsa.
At first try, it's very flavorful with the soft, creamy texture of the tuna mixed with the crunchy...chip?
The soy sauce and sesame seed oil work
well together, but only on the top most portion of the tuna.
Most of the sauce stayed at the bottom, which made the tuna at the bottom too salty.
It would be better if the tuna were equally marinated instead of having a special few that literally drowned in its own sauce.
So each of us had a basket with one Mahi Mahi Taco and a basket with Fish and Chips.
I love the sweet potato fries!
Sweet and soft goodness in a crispy outer crust!
It's definitely a good alternative to the regular potato fries, but good thing
it's an option.
I still prefer the ol' fashioned potato fries.
Still sweet potato fries...good alternative.
The Mahi Mahi Tacos were good.
The Mahi Mahi was grilled, of course, instead of the usual beer battered filet.
Everything on the taco was well-balanced and the fish was light.
There's a picture with a couple of tacos dressed with a generous portion of guacamole.
sweet potato fries.author: Jeremy L.
sweet potato fries.review:
I've always wanted to try Pacific Catch from every moment that I have driving on 9th from Golden Gate Park! Well, I got my chance when I wanted Fish and Chips and this was the place my girlfriend and I decided to go to!

First thing's first, it was awesome how they could call you when your seat is ready. It was a twenty minute wait for us, so we opt for them to call us and took a stroll along Irving for the duration of the time. 

After being seating, I was taken away from the comfortable booth seats! I could lean back a little for a more relax sitting position, but note that it works for someone my height (at about 5'10''). Either way, it's very comfortable. 

We ordered a set of Mahi Mahi tacos containing two tacos with sweet potato fries, a four piece Fish and Chip set with regular fries and the Hawaiian Poke as an appetizer. 

The Hawaiian Poke was a first for me. It's essentially tuna sashimi that is drowned in soy sauce and sesame seed oil. It comes with this wonton strip-like crackers that are light and crunchy, which you eat with the tuna just like chips to salsa. At first try, it's very flavorful with the soft, creamy texture of the tuna mixed with the crunchy...chip? The soy sauce and sesame seed oil work well together, but only on the top most portion of the tuna. Most of the sauce stayed at the bottom, which made the tuna at the bottom too salty. It would be better if the tuna were equally marinated instead of having a special few that literally drowned in its own sauce. Recommended dish, but eat in moderate for its sodium content.

The entrees were both great and it was pleasant of the waiting staff to separate the taco and fish for the both of us since we wanted to share. So each of us had a basket with one Mahi Mahi Taco and a basket with Fish and Chips. 

I love the sweet potato fries! Sweet and soft goodness in a crispy outer crust! It's definitely a good alternative to the regular potato fries, but good thing it's an option. I still prefer the ol' fashioned potato fries. Still sweet potato fries...good alternative.

The Mahi Mahi Tacos were good. The Mahi Mahi was grilled, of course, instead of the usual beer battered filet. Everything on the taco was well-balanced and the fish was light. There's a picture with a couple of tacos dressed with a generous portion of guacamole. Looks just like that, but with grilled white fish filet instead. 

Fish and Chips are like any other Fish and Chips. The only problem I had with it was the thickness of the batter. A little too thin for me. I drizzled some lemon over the fish and the batter couldn't hold the fish together, so it became a messy basket of fish meat and batter. The good part about it: the freshness of the fish, which was Tilapia that night (I think). 

Overall, I thought it was a delightful experience eating at Pacific Catch. There are sushi and rolls on the menu, but I learn to have sushi elsewhere for now. The tacos and fish and chips are something to try out and there are many other options to choose from. The price is reasonable with the more expensive choice under the special catch of the day. I would come back again for another try.

excerpts:
Don't be fooled by their "fancy-dancy" name, NOTHING special about this place and this was what we ordered:

Spicy Tuna roll - very fresh and the ONLY satisfying dish
Sweet potato fries - decent and had better
Calamari - the WORST I ever had.
sweet potato fries.author: Katy N.
sweet potato fries.review:
Don't be fooled by their "fancy-dancy" name, NOTHING special about this place and this was what we ordered:

Spicy Tuna roll - very fresh and the ONLY satisfying dish
Sweet potato fries - decent and had better
Calamari - the WORST I ever had. HUGE batter covered these  diminutive shellfish & BLAND like there was no tomorrow!!!!!!!!
Spicy Ahi sandwich - mediocre
And there was one more entree yet I can't remembered, guess it tells how you how much I adore this place :P LOL

excerpts: Although I was quit fond of the sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: Joanne H.
sweet potato fries.review:
My bf and I split the ahi poke wasabi bowl and fish and chips.  The wasabi bowl was a little bland.  There wasn't enough ahi and too much rice.  The fish and chips were good.  But tasted like fish and chips from any other place.  Although I was quit fond of the sweet potato fries.  

A great place to dine if you're passing by, but not anything to make your way out to.

excerpts: So far I have tried the fish tacos, sweet potato fries, and the trout.
All were very good.
Their drinks are good too!
Try the pomegranate ginger martini or the mai tai.
Yes, incase you haven't noticed I'm a drinker!
sweet potato fries.author: anne m.
sweet potato fries.review: This place is yummy and reasonably priced.  So far I have tried the fish tacos, sweet potato fries, and the trout.  All were very good.  Their drinks are good too!  Try the pomegranate ginger martini or the mai tai.  Yes, incase you haven't noticed I'm a drinker!

excerpts: Everybody LOVED the sweet potato fries - yum!
All in all, a decent value for your money in the seafood scene.
sweet potato fries.author: OfLit G.
sweet potato fries.review:
We were looking for inexpensive seafood and that's what we got.
The place was clean and the service was friendly and attentive.
We started with the miso soup which was nice and a little fishy (in a good way), the Hawaiian Poke which was fresh enough but really not very well cut - it had unchewable bits, which is a big no-no in raw fish. The Mahi Mahi was overly seasoned and the fish got lost in the dish. The grilled salmon salad was nice except that the fish was lacking in flavor, but we were pleasantly surprised by the California Crab & Avocado salad which was just right! Everybody LOVED the sweet potato fries - yum!
All in all, a decent value for your money in the seafood scene.

excerpts: (cooked just right), Baja tacos, Korean Bowl, Mixed fish and chips, of course the great sweet potato fries.
Only miss was the "Peruvian Ceviche".

Not like any seen before...small pieces of fish in a cup of very spicy ahi; served with good purple potato chips, like a dip, but not what was expected and maybe need a better description on the menu?
Overall a great place for a get-together.
sweet potato fries.author: Gale H.
sweet potato fries.review: Treated our party of 10 well:  pleasant service and overall tasty, fresh food. Hits:  the specials rainbow trout and yellowtail (cooked just right), Baja tacos, Korean Bowl, Mixed fish and chips, of course the great sweet potato fries. Only miss was the "Peruvian Ceviche". Not like any seen before...small pieces of fish in a cup of very spicy ahi; served with good purple potato chips, like a dip, but not what was expected and maybe need a better description on the menu? Overall a great place for a get-together.

excerpts: My friend ordered a salmon sandwich, which came with their awesome sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: Evelyn K.
sweet potato fries.review:
The first time that I experienced Pacific Catch was at the original location on Chestnut... but on a busy and blustery Thursday night, we tried for Irving location because we were starved and figured that we had a better chance of getting served and fed more quickly.  

We were told that the wait was 15-20 minutes, which was definitely reasonable...but even better than that, we found a comfortable table in the bar area and was able to plop ourselves down almost immediately.  

I was craving the Ahi Poke Rice Bowl, and it didn't disappoint.  There were piles of spicy poke, with seaweed salad, and heaps of rice to keep me very satiated.  My friend ordered a salmon sandwich, which came with their awesome sweet potato fries.  I think the fries are better as an appetizer because then you get a larger serving and yummy sauces to boot!

I'm tempted to rate PC 5 stars, but I think I need to experience it a few more times and try some more dishes to qualify the rating.

excerpts: I like this place, but I don't understand people's love of their sweet potato fries.
I've always found them soggy and undercooked.
Similarly, their fried fish could use a bit more crunch.
That said, they have tasty and inventive preparations for their fresh fish.
The rice bowls are particularly tasty, and big enough for a meal.
sweet potato fries.author: D V.
sweet potato fries.review: I like this place, but I don't understand people's love of their sweet potato fries. I've always found them soggy and undercooked. Similarly, their fried fish could use a bit more crunch. That said, they have tasty and inventive preparations for their fresh fish. The rice bowls are particularly tasty, and big enough for a meal.

excerpts: Try the sweet potato fries.
The fish from the fresh catch and fries could've been fried harder.
The dessert didn't impress.
sweet potato fries.author: Ezduzit S.
sweet potato fries.review:
I love what they did with the space.  The decor and vibe was comfortable.  The staff and service were professional and attentive, although you can tell they're still learning on the job.  The food was tasty and reasonably price.  Try the sweet potato fries.  The fish from the fresh catch and fries could've been fried harder.  The dessert didn't impress.  Worth a revisit.

p.s.  Corkage fee is only $10.  A good place to bring those white wines you've been saving.

excerpts: The only saving grace is the sweet potato fries.
And only because not a lot of restaurants have sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: Robert L.
sweet potato fries.review:
I thought this would be a good place. Seafood in San Francisco? Sounds like a sure bet.

Not so.  Scallops, while fresh and big, were tasteless and merely lightly grilled.  The grilled salmon was dried up and burnt.  The waitress seemed quite proud of them being organic salmon, though.  They did have some big rice bowls, but you might as well go to the Serramonte Mall's food court if you want to eat rice bowls.

The only saving grace is the sweet potato fries.  And only because not a lot of restaurants have sweet potato fries.  

Two stars because I'm not coming back here and won't recommend anyone else to.

excerpts: Me heart sweet potato fries.
I was a little heart broken when they closed Canvas.
I found it, and fell immediately in love with their sweet potato fries with wasabi aioli and sweet-chili dipping sauce.
I could eat the whole basket as a meal.
We had the grill mahi and Hawaiian BBQ surf and turf.
The mahi was a little bland to start.
Since I add hot sauce to everything, it was good after a little spice.
sweet potato fries.author: Muncia S.
sweet potato fries.review:
Me heart sweet potato fries.  I was a little heart broken when they closed Canvas.  Like alot of my past relationships, I picked up the pieces of my broken heart and went in search for a new love.

I found it, and fell immediately in love with their sweet potato fries with wasabi aioli and sweet-chili dipping sauce.  I could eat the whole basket as a meal.  We had the grill mahi and Hawaiian BBQ surf and turf.  The mahi was a little bland to start.  Since I add hot sauce to everything, it was good after a little spice.  The steak was better than the mahi, very tasty and tender.

The place is much bigger than the marina location.  You don't have to worry about elbowing the person next to you when you are fumbling around with chopsticks.   I was the victim.  I know how to use chopsticks.

excerpts: We also ordered sweet potato fries which were good.
sweet potato fries.author: Timothy C.
sweet potato fries.review:
Pacific Catch just recently opened on 9t Street and we decided to go try it for a mellow weekend lunch.  We weren't sure what to expect because it was new, but the online menu sure looked great.

The decor is modern and clean, providing a rather trendy atmosphere.  The place wasn't crowded when we came so we didn't have to wait for a table, which is always nice.  We saw one table had ordered the Baja Shrimp Ceviche so we decided to start with that.   The presentation was really cool.  The ceviche, stuffed full of shrimp and avocado, was served in a tall martini glass with a pile of tortilla chips sprawled around the base.  The best thing about this dish was how much shrimp they gave us!  It's always annoying when you pay a premium for a shrimp entre and get 3 shrimp.  We counted each shrimp as we were going through the ceviche, they were good sized shrimp mind you, and ended up with almost 20! The chef was overly generous with the shrimp for the price we payed.

For my entre, I went with 3 tacos; 1 BBQ salmon with corn salsa and lime crema, 1 tropical grilled shrimp with mango salsa, and 1 spice-rubbed grilled mahi mahi with avocado tomatilla salsa.  Now let me first say that I am a little biased when it comes to fish tacos.  I've been a long time advocate for Wahoo's fish tacos and nothing has ever compared to their tacos.  Pacific catch however served me some really tasty fish tacos, which can definitely compete with Wahoo's.  I really appreciated the nice quality of salsas and toppings that went into the tacos.  They worked well and tasted great with the various fish and shrimp pairings.  I took down these bad boys so fast and had to restrain myself from ordering more!

We also ordered sweet potato fries which were good.  I tend to find any type of french fry that offers a spin off the traditional French fry (different potatoes, etc) very satisfying.

Pacific Catch is definitely a decent restaurant and we will for sure go there again.  They had other dishes, such as sushi and fancy deserts that I would also like to try.  I also noticed they had a pretty nice full bar with comfy seats and a decent happy hour.  This would be a good place to come have some drinks and a nice dinner with some friends or even a date.

excerpts: sweet potato fries with sweet chili sauce - SWEET!
discount for
cocktails sans alcohol
sweet potato fries.author: Em C.
sweet potato fries.review:
I can see how some reviewers think that this place is trying too hard, with it's hodge-podge all over the place menu, but it definitely works for me.  5 reasons why I like it:

1.  drinks - Guava Mint Cooler was delicious and refreshing
2.  happy hour at 10pm - need I say more?
3.  meal for 3 people including drinks was $51
4.  sweet potato fries with sweet chili sauce - SWEET!
5.  discount for cocktails sans alcohol

excerpts: We had sweet potato fries of course as well.
Everything was delicious fresh and flavorful.
I also had a 50% off deal from Scoutmob which the waiter graciously accepted.
I always make it a point to tip the waiter/waitress generously when I come with a coupon, especially if the service was good.
Will definitely be coming back!
sweet potato fries.author: An-Nhien L.
sweet potato fries.review: Went here for a catch-up dinner date with one of my girlfriends and had a great time! I love the complimentary pretzel goldfish and edamame. Our waiter was great and the food came fast. I had the traditional baja and pacific steak tacos and my friend got the baja and chicken tacos. We had sweet potato fries of course as well. Everything was delicious fresh and flavorful. I also had a 50% off deal from Scoutmob which the waiter graciously accepted. I always make it a point to tip the waiter/waitress generously when I come with a coupon, especially if the service was good. Will definitely be coming back!

excerpts: Sweet potato fries =
WIN (They need to cut these bigger!
So GOOD)
Any Ice Tea= LOSE (water with lemon tastes better than lemon grass)

WASABI BOWLS= LOSE (4 tiny pieces of not fresh tuna, and rice $14)
Sanwich= WIN

Sweet potato fries are great, and I only wish they came in bigger cuts.
sweet potato fries.author: Joe O.
sweet potato fries.review:
This place is supposed to be FUSION of Asian and American cuisine.

Basically it's Asian food for white people as my friend said over dinner.  The American food with an Asian twist wins.  The Asian food with American flavor is somewhat bland and uninspired.

Waitresses are very friendly, and service was great.  There is this Asian guy that stands at the counter, but is not dressed in a uniform.  He looked like a customer, but don't be fooled he works there =T 

Fried Fish (n Chips)= WIN (Not greasy, well fried, mostly good chunks)
Sweet potato fries = WIN (They need to cut these bigger! So GOOD)
Any Ice Tea= LOSE (water with lemon tastes better than lemon grass)
WASABI BOWLS= LOSE (4 tiny pieces of not fresh tuna, and rice $14)
Sanwich= WIN

Sweet potato fries are great, and I only wish they came in bigger cuts.  I liked the sweet dipping sauce.  The ahi tuna wasabi bowl came in a large bowl, but the tuna did not taste too fresh.  I did appreciate that they offered brown rice as a substitute for white rice.  I will go back for those fries!

excerpts: The sweet potato fries were nothing special.
They were sweet potato fries that could be made at home with no extra seasoning and taste the same.
sweet potato fries.author: Calvin L.
sweet potato fries.review:
When I first found out i was going here to celebrate my girlfriend's sister's  birthday, I just had to look it up on yelp. The pictures here didn't look to good, decor wise. But to be honest, the decor was really nice. Very modern and the place was pretty spacious. 

The food is moderately priced, but I somehow wound up spending $40. The group ordered two rolls of sushi and I wasn't paying attention at the time, so I didn't know what either was called. One of them was very tasty, while the other was completely bland. 

Personally I ordered the Thai Coconut Shrimp. There was nothing Thai about it, and there was too much coconut. I really like coconut shrimp, if balanced correctly. It was not. It was overwhelming and I was barely able to finish it. The sweet potato fries were nothing special. They were sweet potato fries that could be made at home with no extra seasoning and taste the same. 

The service was good. Our waitress was on top of everything and the food came out pretty fast considering how crowded it was. And if you plan on celebrating a birthday here, it's a $10 fee if you bring a cake and have them bring it out and sing happy birthday. (To me, for them to sing happy birthday was nice, but makes the restaurant all the more generic). 

This place gets the 3 stars because of the good service, the decor, price and just below average food. My expectations weren't huge of this place, and the food matched what I thought it'd be. 
Would i come back? Sure, I'll give other menu items a try, but coconut shrimp will never be an option here.

excerpts: The food is the same in terms of taste and the sweet potato fries (which I love w/ the wasabi aeoli) were consistantly yummy.
sweet potato fries.author: Jen Y.
sweet potato fries.review:
I was excited to try the Pacific Catch on 9th because I've heard great things about the space and it's kind of a hassle to go all the way to Chestnut. The look of the restaurant is beautifully casual and comfortable with plenty of seating. For that, I give this restaurant big ups. 

Our waitress on the other hand was just blah. It looked like she cared more about socializing and dancing with her co-worker friends more than earning her tip from us. The whole time she seemed insincere from the moment she brought us our drinks to handing us the check. 

I always liked Pacific Catch's food, even though it's slightly over-priced.  The food is the same in terms of taste and the sweet potato fries (which I love w/ the wasabi aeoli) were consistantly yummy. Even though we ordered the Firecracker Salmon Roll and Spicy Tuna Roll, I don't recommend trying the sushi here. It lacks flavor, authenticity, and freshness..but I didn't expect it to be good so I wasn't surprised. The fish tacos are always delicious; especially the Mahi Mahi Fish Taco which is one of my favorites. 

The atmosphere, location, and food is great. However, the waitress we had and the sushi are not. Something else was just lacking as a whole but I can't put my finger on it. But, I will be back to this location..

Service: 2
Food: 4
Atmosphere: 4
Overall: 3.5

excerpts: We got the sweet potato fries as an appetizer.
While they were good
I've had them elsewhere
so it wasn't that exciting.
The sweet potato fries don't hold their temperature long so you need to enjoy them fast.
sweet potato fries.author: Kevin L.
sweet potato fries.review:
I went to Pacific Catch this evening for dinner and while I like the concept of the menu I wasn't overly impressed with my salmon teriyaki bowl. Yes it was fresh, but the rice had a bit too much sauce on it for my taste. I'm not sure if this was the reason, but I was extremely thirsty after having a few bites of my entree. Even when I got home I was thirsty. My friend had the grilled mahi mahi which I tasted and thought it was good. We got the sweet potato fries as an appetizer. While they were good I've had them elsewhere so it wasn't that exciting. The sweet potato fries don't hold their temperature long so you need to enjoy them fast.

The decor of the restaurant is eco-friendly and asian themed. They used quite a bit of bamboo throughout the restaurant and use environmentally friendly products per the insert in the menu. Overall I liked the decor and the openess of the restaurant which is a result of the high ceilings. Regardless it's nice to be able to have room when you're dining. 

Service was decent but nothing really spectacular. A manager did come by and greet us and thank us for making a reservation on OpenTable. I'm not too sure if this has anything to do with being an OpenTable VIP member. For those wondering I haven't noticed anything different when dining since being designated a VIP user.

excerpts: The sweet potato fries were definitely the most amazing part.
Price was as to be expected for a chain like that, definitely not cheap but not outrageous for what we got...
I think for two of us sharing two 8 piece sushi rolls (fancier ones), a basket of sweet potato fries (they do hook you up there) and 2 Sapporo beers it was something like $38.
I would go back for drinks and sweet potato fries, that's probably it.
sweet potato fries.author: Ariana K.
sweet potato fries.review:
My reaction to my experience here = meh.  My friend had hyped it up a bit for me so that was part of the reason.  Anyway there were 4 of us that went on a Friday night around 8pm after having a few very cheap yummy beers at Mucky Duck up the street.  When we walked in there were maybe 4 people in front of us and a few open tables in the dining room but for some odd reason the airhead of a hostess told us it would be 30 - 40 min wait.  My friends were hungry and we almost didn't wait but I decided to put our name in while we figured where we would go.  She then told me it would be a 35-45 min wait...ridiculous.  We stood contemplating getting take out when after barely 5 min had passed we were seated!!! huh??

Anyway food wise was alright. I'm a very picky sushi eater so I wasn't that impressed but I wouldn't say it was bad.  The sweet potato fries were definitely the most amazing part.  Price was as to be expected for a chain like that, definitely not cheap but not outrageous for what we got...I think for two of us sharing two 8 piece sushi rolls (fancier ones), a basket of sweet potato fries (they do hook you up there) and 2 Sapporo beers it was something like $38.  

I would go back for drinks and sweet potato fries, that's probably it.

excerpts: I like their sweet potato fries and the wasabi bowls.
sweet potato fries.author: J T.
sweet potato fries.review:
I like their sweet potato fries and the wasabi bowls. :)

But I think they are pricey. Pricey price pricey! For what the food is...

I didn't like the poke too much. I thought they should had cut the cubes smaller and marinated them w/ a light yummier sauce.

They should get some pointers from hawaii :) Places in hawaii serve DELICIOUS poke. I can still remember the taste... every morsel of it.... :9

I hear the Pacific Catch in the Marian District is better -- in taste and price. :)

P.S. Ahi Tuna has high levels of Mercury. I'm trying not to eat tuna too much!! eep! (See article in NYTimes).

excerpts: The Sweet potato fries, calamari, sushi, and wide variety of fish are delicious.
sweet potato fries.author: Dylan T.
sweet potato fries.review:
Pacific Catch is a great place to go for lunch and dinner. It serves very tasty food at a decent price. Few drawbacks, but not much to affect it.

Service: Service is decent, they come around to give u water/coffee/w/e else u want refilled and they get the orders put in quick. Nothing wrong w/ it, but nothing spectacular. 

Food: The food tastes great. The Sweet potato fries, calamari, sushi, and wide variety of fish are delicious. The price is decent for the food and it comes out pretty fast compared to most places. 

The restaurant is decently sized, can accommodate a good amount of people, but parking sucks. I'd recommend this place if u decide to go early in hope of finding a parking space or if u live around there.

excerpts: I had the Thai coconut shrimp skewers with sweet potato fries.
The shrimp was nothing special to write home about, but the sweet potato fries were excellent!
My husband had the unagi wasabi bowl and he seemed pretty satisfied after finishing off 3/4 of it.
sweet potato fries.author: Kelly R.
sweet potato fries.review:
If Pac Catch wasn't highlighted as kid-friendly resto, I probably would not have discovered this place.

Service was quick to accommodate our party of 7 (3 kids!) and to handout appetizers - pretzel goldfish and edamame. Lucky for us, my daughter LOVES goldfish, so that was able to tide her over until her meal came.

Food was good - not outstanding, but good. I had the Thai coconut shrimp skewers with sweet potato fries. The shrimp was nothing special to write home about, but the sweet potato fries were excellent! My husband had the unagi wasabi bowl and he seemed pretty satisfied after finishing off 3/4 of it. I had a bite of my daughter's fish & chips - tasty, not too greasy.

We were all too stuffed for dessert - perhaps on the next visit.

Definitely kid friendly, but they do not provide coloring materials as other restos would.

Didn't try the sushi, but with Ebisu up the street, why would you?

excerpts: The sweet potato fries were good, but it didn't necessarily win a new fanatic (like other reviewers).
sweet potato fries.author: Gray C.
sweet potato fries.review:
Here's the conversation after our meal...

S.O.: So you gonna write about this on yelp?

Me: I'm trying to be nicer and eat at a place more than once before I write a review.

S.O.: So that means you'd have to come back here again...

Me: Hmm...good point. Okay, I'll just give it 3 stars. [and skip the return trip!]

The food was just okay -- didn't quite like the "baja bbq style" for the fish. The mixed fried basket was okay. The sweet potato fries were good, but it didn't necessarily win a new fanatic (like other reviewers).

The Good: Very quick service (on an active Sunday night), nice waiter (sorta looked like a young Will Ferrell), and nice ambiance.

A little pricey given the quality of food -- we would've paid $25-30 for something that cost more like $50. Oh well. That's what we get for trying a new place!

excerpts: You cannot go wrong..sweet potato fries are seriously the best...
