sweet potato fries.author: Julie H.
sweet potato fries.review:
I have been a fan of Pacific Catch for years now!  Def am relieved that the Irving location has opened - its so much bigger...

Ok down to the food - ahi tuna/poke wasabi bowl with brown rice!  You cannot go wrong..sweet potato fries are seriously the best...their tacos (big portions) are filled with freshest fish...granted I only go for my favorites - but I've nibbled off a few of my friends' plate, and have yet to be disappointed by the food.

The new location beats waiting in line - def try this place out if you're looking for a fresh alternative!

excerpts:
Ahi poke wasabi bowl and sweet potato fries.... 
It's the same kind of dementia that makes me ALWAYS order a 15 or a 17 at Tu Lan (http://tinyurl.com/5trmyz). 
I don't even look at the menu anymore. 
I do 
but I just do it to kill some time while other people order. 
You can't go wrong. 
Well, you can if you order it with brown rice. 
Why you wanna go fancy?! 
Plain, good ol' rice vinegar seasoned sushi rice.
The only spiffage allowed is'a touch' of sriracha...but don't overdo it.
We can still be friend, Pacific Catch, for a long time.
sweet potato fries.author: Dario B.
sweet potato fries.review:
Ahi poke wasabi bowl and sweet potato fries.... 
It's the same kind of dementia that makes me ALWAYS order a 15 or a 17 at Tu Lan (http://tinyurl.com/5trmyz). 
I don't even look at the menu anymore. 
I do but I just do it to kill some time while other people order. 
You can't go wrong. 
Well, you can if you order it with brown rice. 
Why you wanna go fancy?! 
Plain, good ol' rice vinegar seasoned sushi rice.
The only spiffage allowed is'a touch' of sriracha...but don't overdo it.
We can still be friend, Pacific Catch, for a long time.

excerpts: For appetizers we ordered sweet potato fries (very yummy) and artichokes (good but could have done without).
sweet potato fries.author: Terry D.
sweet potato fries.review:
I love this place! Randomly decided to try Pacific Catch on a Saturday night (no reservation) and we got a table outside for 5 in less than 10 minutes. Even though it was really cold outside their heat lamps were superb and kept us toasty throughout dinner.

I actually pass by this restaurant every day on my bus ride to work and had no idea that it was an Asian fusion restaurant. The menu took me by surprise but in a good way. 

For appetizers we ordered sweet potato fries (very yummy) and artichokes (good but could have done without). I ordered the white tuna poki with crab salad (very good) and surf & turf (steak w/shrimp, pineapple fried rice, onion shoe strings, and asparagus) to share with my friend. I was very satisfied with my entrees and was completely stuffed afterwards.

The prices are reasonable. For a group of 5 we spent about $107 (pre tax and tip) so it's not bad at all. Service is very friendly as well. Definitely will go back!

excerpts: Add some sweet potato fries and you're good!
sweet potato fries.author: Ryan M.
sweet potato fries.review: The Wasabi bowls are great if you're hungry. Add some sweet potato fries and you're good!

excerpts: We also ordered sweet potato fries.
This was the first time I have ever tried sweet potato fries and I became a believer.
I always thought it was for females for some reason....
excuse my ignorant rationale.
It was so good that I hogged the whole basket.
The only thing I was not fond of was the wasabi sauce.
They give you this asian dipping sauce also which is the secret to King of Thai #31...
wadDUUUP.
I eat my fries with 2 things...ranch or ketchup.
I grabbed the ketchup bottle, squirted a gob and was good.
While sweet potatoe fries were good, regular french fries still capture the majority of my thump thump.
My poke bowl came out and it looked very good.
They were not scrouges on the poke.
Everything was neatly proportioned...
a couple slivers of avacado, wakame salad, radish, a lotta poke, etc.
When I took my first bite, I nearly grimaced.
I forgot to request no wasabe sauce.
While the taste wasn't overly strong, it was still lingering enough to make me quite sad.
sweet potato fries.author: Brian V.
sweet potato fries.review:
Pacific Catch is a fusion Japanese/seafood place that I've had my eye on for a while.  It sure is gaudy and lures you with the baubles and trinkets however, fails to live up to the expectations.  It is like a beautiful yet underwhelming performer of a car.  Walking in, it is very ample in size.  The ambiance is very cozy and there is a nautical theme.  Our hostess led us to our table and accommodated us when we wanted to sit in the booth.  The back support of soft cushions beats those of hard wooden backings any day.  Our waiter was a very nice chap, a water sprite of some sort...calm and collected on the surface but a giggler I am sure underneath.  

We were given goldfish/unsalted beans to start of the night.  Never was served goldfish as a starter but I can't complain.  I love goldfish.  Alas, it was the nasty pretzel flavored ones.  I ordered the Hawaiian poke bowl while my female counterpart ordered the miso salmon.  We also ordered sweet potato fries.  This was the first time I have ever tried sweet potato fries and I became a believer.  I always thought it was for females for some reason....excuse my ignorant rationale.  It was so good that I hogged the whole basket.  The only thing I was not fond of was the wasabi sauce.  They give you this asian dipping sauce also which is the secret to King of Thai #31...wadDUUUP.  I eat my fries with 2 things...ranch or ketchup.  I grabbed the ketchup bottle, squirted a gob and was good.  While sweet potatoe fries were good, regular french fries still capture the majority of my thump thump.  My poke bowl came out and it looked very good.  They were not scrouges on the poke.  Everything was neatly proportioned...a couple slivers of avacado, wakame salad, radish, a lotta poke, etc.  When I took my first bite, I nearly grimaced.  I forgot to request no wasabe sauce.  While the taste wasn't overly strong, it was still lingering enough to make me quite sad.  My girlfriend's miso salmon was good however, nothing of the taste made it stand out as a Pacific Catch dish.  It tasted like something I could get at any Jap restaurant.  

Pacific Catch is very generous in portions and the price is not too bad.  However, the food, while nice in presentation, was only that...superficial...the way I like my girls...jk jk.  You will leave this place full, no doubt about that, but it is the type of full that leaves you hungering for more tasteful experience.

excerpts: Loved the three Korean Sticky Rib bowls, three orders of 3 Island Tacos (shrimp, Baja and Mahi), Fresh Catch was fresh, one sweet potato fries, one spicy fries, fried Calamari went fast and the Ceviche was perfect.
I highly recommend the Pomegranate Ginger Martini.
It was worth every penny and the staff was friendly, thanks Alysssa.
sweet potato fries.author: Girl L.
sweet potato fries.review: We finally ate at Pacific Catch, took our 6 kids ages 27-6. Wasn't sure if bringing all of them was going to be worth it since there were a lot of really great reviews and bad ones. Well it was totally worth the hassle of finding an available parking spot and having a $200 bill. Loved the three Korean Sticky Rib bowls, three orders of 3 Island Tacos (shrimp, Baja and Mahi), Fresh Catch was fresh, one sweet potato fries, one spicy fries, fried Calamari went fast and the Ceviche was perfect. I highly recommend the Pomegranate Ginger Martini. It was worth every penny and the staff was friendly, thanks Alysssa.

excerpts: as giant heifers, we got the poki, sweet potato fries, shrimp ceviche, and sides of artichoke and corn.
sweet potato fries.author: Regina C.
sweet potato fries.review:
i've had the poki many times at various venues but have never actually sat in at the restaurant to eat. i came with a friend after we'd gone to Hukilau to try and attend their poki festival only to find a bunch of drunk people and no poki. as giant heifers, we got the poki, sweet potato fries, shrimp ceviche, and sides of artichoke and corn. all of it was good and i wasn't disappointed with anything. 

....and their description of mochi said something like "pulverized rice," which i thought was hilarious.

excerpts: The food is great (the table shared sweet potato fries, and I had the wasabi bowl with ahi).
The menu is inspired.
sweet potato fries.author: christi m.
sweet potato fries.review:
The food is great (the table shared sweet potato fries, and I had the wasabi bowl with ahi). The menu is inspired. The portions are generous (as in way too big, I ate my meal for dinner and lunch the next day). 

So why the three stars? This place feels a chain restaurant. When trying to explain the chain feel to my boyfriend I couldn't put my finger on it-- but something about the menu, platings, tables, atmosphere, lighting made me feel like I was in Applebees or Fridays. I know they only have 3 locations but seriously, go there and tell me you don't feel like you're in Tony Romas.  

P.S. the bloody mary was marginal and overpriced (around $10).

excerpts: Oh wait, I haven't mentioned about the sweet potato fries.
It was HEAVENLY, as always.
sweet potato fries.author: Andy W.
sweet potato fries.review:
I can finally take this place happily out from my bookmarks. The three of us rushed-in in the midst of San Francisco's heaviest rain on Sunday evening. Stepping into this place feels like arriving at a warm sanctuary. We were a bit discouraged by the 20-minute wait we were told. Thankfully, in not even 5 minutes the waitress came and said that our table was ready. 

Looking at the menu, the three hungry creatures start drooling. We ordered three wasabi rice bowls (2 ahi and 1 poke) in addition to one fish+chips for sharing, and 2 bottles of Cooper's Beer from Aussie. OMG, it was a real feast! Overall experience was great. We were even impressed by the decor in the bathroom. 

Enuff abt the poz side. The fish on the fish+chips were fresh, but the batter was kind of soggy. I love the edamame as the starter, but the fish-shaped pretzel remind me of the sodium-infused cheap airline snacks. The service was just okay, could have been more friendly.

I guess that's it! =)

Oh wait, I haven't mentioned about the sweet potato fries. It was HEAVENLY, as always.

excerpts: Wasabi Bowls are great as are the sweet potato fries with different dipping sauces.
sweet potato fries.author: Alyson C.
sweet potato fries.review:
Tasty Drinks! Their Guava Mint drink was a bit too grainy for me, but I guess that's what you expect out of 100% Guava Puree. However, the Citrus Ginger drink was reallllly good. I will go back for that.

Wasabi Bowls are great as are the sweet potato fries with different dipping sauces. 

For dessert, we had the Mochi Fondue -- not worth it.

The bartender was a sweetheart but our waiter had an "i'm a jerk" attitude. 

I'll definitely go back for the drinks and the poke wasabi bowl with Brown Rice.

excerpts: Try the sweet potato fries and raw tuna.
sweet potato fries.author: Amy T.
sweet potato fries.review: Definitely my favorite happy hour in the area -every Monday through Friday from 4-6 and after 10. The drinks are good, especailly  the margaritas, but the happy hour appetizers are what make it worth it. Try the sweet potato fries and raw tuna.

excerpts: i ordered their fish and chip which came with their sweet potato fries.
their fries were pretty good, but i guess it was a bad idea for me to concentrate too much on the fries and not the fish.
you can tell that their fish was fresh and not the frozen type.
i was surprise that i didnt have to wait for a table being that it was a saturday.
however, i think the grease got to me, and i had to down some tea before my tummy goes the wrong direction.
ifyou are not a seafood fan this is not the place for you.
if you are,  the prices are pretty reasonable and you should give this place a try.
sweet potato fries.author: Belinda C.
sweet potato fries.review: ever since they turned this place into pacific catch i promised myself i would never step foot here.  this place used to be The Canvas Gallery and it was my fav hang out. however, after looking for an hour for parking around this area and realizing that this was the only place that i have yet to try i finally gave in. plus i was hungry. i ordered their fish and chip which came with their sweet potato fries.  their fries were pretty good, but i guess it was a bad idea for me to concentrate too much on the fries and not the fish.  you can tell that their fish was fresh and not the frozen type. i was surprise that i didnt have to wait for a table being that it was a saturday.  however, i think the grease got to me, and i had to down some tea before my tummy goes the wrong direction. ifyou are not a seafood fan this is not the place for you.  if you are,  the prices are pretty reasonable and you should give this place a try.

excerpts: Sides of two sauces- sweet chili and aioli- for the sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: Staci M.
sweet potato fries.review:
I have had two really good experiences here.  The first was during their happy hour.  The poke was delicious and they did not skimp.  

A few nights ago, our (well, my) lazy ass decided on take-out.  We had the spicy tuna sandwich and 3 tacos.  The bbq salmon taco was amazing.  Same with the crispy shrimp one.  Sandwich was what I expected- very yum.  

And what was really cool was the care they took in getting the order together.  Sides of two sauces- sweet chili and aioli- for the sweet potato fries.  

I guess they had my boyfriend waiting pretty long for the order, so the bartender bought him a beer.  V cool of them- especially since the bf is not the bitching type and was prob sweetly surprised by the freebie.  THAT'S the stuff people remember.

excerpts: These wasn't your ordinary, run-of-the-mill sweet potato fries, they were crispy!
The fish was alright.
I wasn't feeling the little wire plate they served my meal on.
So it was like a wire/mesh plate type deal which they covered with a piece of parchment paper that when I put malt vinegar on my fish, it made the paper all soggy.
sweet potato fries.author: Ivan F.
sweet potato fries.review:
A good friend of mine had his birthday celebration here about 2 weeks ago and it was my first time. I ain't gonna lie, money was kinda tight so I Yelped it (yeeh!) to find out what they had and how much it was gonna break me off. As I read reviews, I figured, not too bad.

I must say that the ambience is dope. Nice place to take a date because it don't get too loud, although they do have music (80's when I was there) playing on the p.a. system. It wasn't bothersome though.

I had the Pacific Fish & Chips which wasn't too shabby. It wasn't all that but it didn't suck. The sweet potatoe fries really broke it through the otherside for me. These wasn't your ordinary, run-of-the-mill sweet potato fries, they were crispy! The fish was alright. I wasn't feeling the little wire plate they served my meal on. So it was like a wire/mesh plate type deal which they covered with a piece of parchment paper that when I put malt vinegar on my fish, it made the paper all soggy. Boo.

Big up for the decor of the spot. Real nice like and original. The bathroom was clean. Not to mention that the place is baby friendly. My homies' daughter was there and she's 2 yrs. old and just started walking so she was up and about mingling with everybody. 

I'd probably come back...but not on the regular.

excerpts: Sweet potato fries were fantastic, definitely the standout original of my meal.
Great sweet potato fries.
And sauces.
sweet potato fries.author: Taylor M.
sweet potato fries.review:
Can't say I've been to the original location so I can't compare but I thought Pacific Catch was pretty good nonetheless. 
I had the fish and chips with the catch of the day. Quite good, extremely fresh fish (would be scared if it wasn't!). The dipping sauces added something special to the fish, which was fresh but not overwhelmingly tasty on its own, so I do recommend giving them a try (the Thai one especially). Sweet potato fries were fantastic, definitely the standout original of my meal. Probably the one thing that would get me coming back to Pacific Catch again!

I also tried a bit of the sushi, just California Roll and Spicy Tuna. Nothing special, so I can't speak for the quality of the specialty pieces, but if I was looking for quality basics or specialties... I'd just go out for some sushi! So decent sushi but not worth the price when there are much better options within walking distance. Also had a good beer from the rotating selection but it was almost $6!

So all in all, good food. Very good choice if you want a broad selection of choices on the menu, all with very fresh fish. The place seemed pretty popular on a Friday night, very trendy and nice setting. Service wasn't fantastic: very friendly, but took a while just to get water. Busy night though. For the negatives, can't recommend the sushi as a standout and the food wasn't special enough to be paying more than a 10-er for each dish (even the salads). Still. Great sweet potato fries. And sauces.

excerpts: the sweet potato fries ARE really good!
i liked the sweet and sour sauce that comes with it.
sweet potato fries.author: Soph I.
sweet potato fries.review:
the sweet potato fries ARE really good!  i liked the sweet and sour sauce that comes with it.  california rolls are excellent, my crab salad wasabi bowl was excellent, and my friends poke bowl was excellent!  
bartender was a really nice guy as well!  oh! and the spring roll for dessert is excellent toooo!!!

excerpts:
Just came from  another nice dinner at Pacific Catch
I hate sweet potato   even  do not put it TG table , but Sweet potato fries there are soo
tasty!Also had grilled snapper
- that was 8 out of 10 (still pretty good )
I love this place .

not saying that is superb - but very very good
And great place to go with kids too.
B+ for all .
sweet potato fries.author: Lena M.
sweet potato fries.review:
Just came from  another nice dinner at Pacific Catch
I hate sweet potato   even  do not put it TG table , but Sweet potato fries there are soo tasty!Also had grilled snapper - that was 8 out of 10 (still pretty good )
I love this place . not saying that is superb - but very very good
And great place to go with kids too. 
B+ for all .

excerpts: I had the salmon sandwich with a side of sweet potato fries and my pals had 2 salads.
Salmon was just right for my sandwich and the roll it came on was pretty good as well, definitely makes the sandwich better than just any ordinary bread.
The sweet potato fries were great as well, and they came with some sort of tasty honey mustard dipping sauce.
sweet potato fries.author: Vilen G.
sweet potato fries.review:
Went here for the first time a few days ago and was pretty satisfied. I had the salmon sandwich with a side of sweet potato fries and my pals had 2 salads. Salmon was just right for my sandwich and the roll it came on was pretty good as well, definitely makes the sandwich better than just any ordinary bread. The sweet potato fries were great as well, and they came with some sort of tasty honey mustard dipping sauce.

The salads my friends had looked pretty tasty as well, I will probably have one myself next time I return here. Another great point is the bottomless Thai Iced tea they serve here, I drank so much of it I was sweating thai iced tea later that day.

excerpts: We also ate the sweet potato fries which were great and come with tasty dips, and the edamame, which was yawn.
I guess you can't win 'em all.
sweet potato fries.author: Leslie S.
sweet potato fries.review:
I will definitely be going back for the happy hour! 

We sat in the bar/lounge area and all three adorable bartenders waited on us. We had the delicious Hawaiian Poke (so good we ordered another one). My friend had a mai tai, I had gin & tonics. All the drinks were really stiff. Felt like we were getting our moneys worth. 

The prices during happy hour were great! Fresh fish for $4.50!? I was skeptical about the $4 well drinks (sounded pricey for a happy hour), but their 'well' alcohol is way decent. We also ate the sweet potato fries which were great and come with tasty dips, and the edamame, which was yawn. I guess you can't win 'em all.

excerpts: You MUST order the sweet potato fries.
Yes, sounds so simple, but they are crisp, slightly sweet, and not greasy at all.
The fried oysters are good as well, batter is light and crisp and the oyster is still plump and juicy.
You can still taste the oyster...
The Poke was ok.
It was fresh but lacked a bit of seasoning.
also, they threw in a couple of chunks that had a lot of sinew in it, and if you've read my previous review, i LOATHE sinew in raw fish.
For dessert we got the mochi with ice cream dipped in hot chocolate sauce, can you say
sweet potato fries.author: Kat T.
sweet potato fries.review:
Had dinner here last night with some old friends. It's a good place to catch up with people, have some drinks, and/or take the family for a casual dinner. 

Food:
You MUST order the sweet potato fries. Yes, sounds so simple, but they are crisp, slightly sweet, and not greasy at all. The fried oysters are good as well, batter is light and crisp and the oyster is still plump and juicy. You can still taste the oyster...
The Poke was ok. It was fresh but lacked a bit of seasoning. also, they threw in a couple of chunks that had a lot of sinew in it, and if you've read my previous review, i LOATHE sinew in raw fish.
For dessert we got the mochi with ice cream dipped in hot chocolate sauce, can you say YUM-O?!?!

They have a small parking lot on Lincoln. Make reservations.

excerpts: We also tried the sweet potato fries, which is served with an interest sweet and sour sauce.
Never had sweet potato fries with that before, but it was pretty good.
At $3 for a huge basket, it's hard to beat.
sweet potato fries.author: Bailey Z.
sweet potato fries.review: Over the years, I have seen this location transform from an empty building to a coffee shop/bar, to this current seafood restaurant. After a quick bite to eat across the street, we walked over here for happy hour. It seems to cater to the after work crowd and they deliver on the cheap foods. After the wonderful smell of fried calamari on the roof of the Academy of Sciences, I craved the fried appetizer here. They make it decent here with an aioli dip. Don't be food by the fried lemon, it doesn't taste great. We also tried the sweet potato fries, which is served with an interest sweet and sour sauce. Never had sweet potato fries with that before, but it was pretty good. At $3 for a huge basket, it's hard to beat. The Hawaiian poke was also decent. I tried the Alaskan Oatmeal Stout just because it sounded interesting. At first glance, it was a dark beer, but didn't taste dark at all, which was good for me. Overall, it was good, but I didn't get much of a chance to taste much of the Asian fusion seafood, which makes up much of their menu. Happy hour prices are decent, but it doesn't really showcase fish much other than the tuna.

excerpts: The Hawaiian Poke appetizer and the mixed catch basket with sweet potato fries are definitely our favorites.
When it comes to drinks, the Dark and Stormy is delicious and has quite a kick!
They have happy hour after 10pm with good deals off the bar menu.
Parking in the area is sometimes difficult
but I'd definitely consider it worth it.
sweet potato fries.author: Dominique K.
sweet potato fries.review: My boyfriend and I have been coming in here at least once a week for the past couple of months.  We choose to sit in the bar where it seems to be a cozier atmosphere than in the main restaurant.  We are always given menus and order is taken right away.  The bartenders are very friendly and the service is spot on.  The Hawaiian Poke appetizer and the mixed catch basket with sweet potato fries are definitely our favorites.  When it comes to drinks, the Dark and Stormy is delicious and has quite a kick!   They have happy hour after 10pm with good deals off the bar menu.  Parking in the area is sometimes difficult but I'd definitely consider it worth it.

excerpts:
+ Mahi Mahi fish tacos
+ Grilled Asparagus w/ wasabi mayo dip
+ Sweet Potato Fries
+ Lemongrass Mojitos
sweet potato fries.author: Tulip F.
sweet potato fries.review:
+ Mahi Mahi fish tacos
+ Grilled Asparagus w/ wasabi mayo dip
+ Sweet Potato Fries
+ Lemongrass Mojitos

excerpts: we had a basket of sweet potato fries, fried calamari, shrimp ceviche to share.
the shrimp should have been cut up for easier scooping with provided chips.
i then had the ahi poke wasabi bowl which was very good.
sweet potato fries.author: claudia y.
sweet potato fries.review:
i finally get to visit this location of pacific catch.  it is much roomier and less claustrophobic than the marina location but service is still a bit shotty and slow.

we opted to sit in the "bar area" to the left of the entrance upon walking in.  the tables are smaller but beats waiting 20 minutes.  there were a lot of tables open when we walked in but i guess they were reserved.

they said they would give us menus but we had to ask and the table next to us who got seated afterwards got their menus before us.  then they told us they ran out of menus. 

they have a full bar.  i had a guava drink which was delicious.  they also have additional items on their menu that dont appear on the marina menu.

we had a basket of sweet potato fries, fried calamari, shrimp ceviche to share.  the shrimp should have been cut up for easier scooping with provided chips.  i then had the ahi poke wasabi bowl which was very good.  but i was so full from our appetizers that i had to take it home.

our waiter was also a bartender so we had to wait to get his attention. o well.

excerpts: First, we ordered the sweet potato fries which are usually pretty good, but they were soggy and not particularly hot.
sweet potato fries.author: Mz S.
sweet potato fries.review:
Just had dinner here. Have been here on more than one occasion but find that the service and the food quality is going down hill. 

First, we ordered the sweet potato fries which are usually pretty good, but they were soggy and not particularly hot. 

Second, we ordered hot tea and waited about 10 minutes before the waiter came back to tell us that it was being brewed and would we mind drinking a different tea "to tide us over until it was ready"? We were ok with that but he never offered us the regular tea after that.

Third, we waited a VERY long time (close to 40 min) for our meal. We ordered about 5 minutes after the couple on one side of us and they were done before we even got our meals. The couple on the other side of us came about 20 minutes after us and got their meal at the same time.

Very disappointed at the poor organization and food service.

excerpts: If you're doubtful that the salad won't quench your appetite, order a side order of their sweet potato fries to push you just over the edge.
These crispy, subtly sweet fries score big on their own, but what knocks them out of the ballpark for me is the sweet chili dipping sauce.
sweet potato fries.author: Jana H.
sweet potato fries.review:
Alas, the much-anticipated Pacific Catch has finally reached the Inner Sunset!  Though The Canvas served up delicious lemon bars and ambiance conducive for a late afternoon catch-up with a close friend, Pacific Catch seems to round off the 9th Ave area perfectly by joining the ranks of cheap eats like Park Chow, Hotei and Pluto's.

Desiring for a guilt-free meal at times, my husband and I used to trek to the Chestnut location to treat ourselves to their ahi-tuna or hawaiian poke salads.  Now, ask anyone close to me, and they will affirm that my palette is adamantly of the anti-salad mode, but Pacific Catch's hawaiian poke salad has converted me.  The salads are HUGE, comprised of a generous helping of rare hawaiian poke atop a bed of mixed greens garnished generously with slices of avocado, a handful of baby tomatoes, a healthy sprig of daikon sprouts, shredded carrots in a joyous, unassuming soy-wasabi vinaigrette.

If you're doubtful that the salad won't quench your appetite, order a side order of their sweet potato fries to push you just over the edge.  These crispy, subtly sweet fries score big on their own, but what knocks them out of the ballpark for me is the sweet chili dipping sauce.  For those who enjoy variety (as my hubby and I do!), they also have a wasabi-aioli dipping sauce too.

Just when we thought Pacific Catch couldn't impress us anymore, today we tried their fried dulce de leche 'spring rolls' for a sweet finish to our already yummy meal.  W-O-W!!  That's all I have to say.  It was a sweet perfection of texture and flavor that honestly, you won't comprehend unless you experience it yourself.  The warmth of the deep fried outside and the contrast with the vanilla ice cream that it's served with is an absolute wonder in the mouth.  And that's not even taking note of the dulce de leche and mascarpone in the middle of the deep fried bliss.  

Don't miss out on this place!  It offers a ton of variety so you're never bored and there's always something new to tempt your tastebuds.

excerpts: The calamari and Sweet Potato fries aren't bad either.
sweet potato fries.author: Daria M.
sweet potato fries.review:
I usually come to Pacific Catch for the happy hour. They have two, one at 4-6pm, and one from 10pm til late. The happy hour menu is pretty nice. I usually order the Hawaiian Poke and Spicey Tuna roll. The calamari and Sweet Potato fries aren't bad either.

I wouldn't recommend coming for a regular meal as they get more pricey for the amount you get.

excerpts: Some items I have tried here: the Hawaiian Poke, Wasabi Rice Bowls (which is a freaking large portion), side of Pineapple rice, the Mixed Catch Basket, the calamari, the sweet potato fries, etc etc.
Everything is great.
I would highly recommend any of these items!
sweet potato fries.author: Jennifer H.
sweet potato fries.review: This place is near where I work so I've been here several times. Some items I have tried here: the Hawaiian Poke, Wasabi Rice Bowls (which is a freaking large portion), side of Pineapple rice, the Mixed Catch Basket, the calamari, the sweet potato fries, etc etc. Everything is great. I would highly recommend any of these items!

excerpts: i came w/ my fiance, who is veg, so there weren't many options for him, but he had the sweet potato fries, corn on the cob, and edamame.
they should have more veg options here other than side orders and one veg sushi roll.
sweet potato fries.author: Helen T.
sweet potato fries.review:
i used to go to the location in the marina a lot, and i always liked it.  i came to this location for the first time yesterday and was surprised by how big the place was and how it's actually like a real restaurant as opposed to a hole in the wall!  

i had the ahi poke sushi bowl, which was yummy of course.  it's great that they give you the choice of brown rice, since they give you a bowl of the rice big enuf to feed a family of 4.  

i came w/ my fiance, who is veg, so there weren't many options for him, but he had the sweet potato fries, corn on the cob, and edamame.  they should have more veg options here other than side orders and one veg sushi roll.

excerpts: Of course, as everyone says, the sweet potato fries are the best- nice and thin and crisp and yummy.
My fellow dining companions on multiple occasions have always gone for the fish and chips/taco combos and rave about them.
The miso soup tastes homemade and hearty.
You can order it with shitake mushrooms and asparagus added to it.
Their pisco sour is rivaled only by NOPA's.
Friendly waitstaff who don't look like they hate their job, and even act as though they might like it.
Good vibes, nice atmosphere.
sweet potato fries.author: Anna S.
sweet potato fries.review: This place is good. You should believe me because I love food immensely. You should believe that because food makes me immense. I have ordered the sushi with great results and you cannot go wrong with the teriyaki bowls. Of course, as everyone says, the sweet potato fries are the best- nice and thin and crisp and yummy. My fellow dining companions on multiple occasions have always gone for the fish and chips/taco combos and rave about them. The miso soup tastes homemade and hearty. You can order it with shitake mushrooms and asparagus added to it. Their pisco sour is rivaled only by NOPA's. Friendly waitstaff who don't look like they hate their job, and even act as though they might like it. Good vibes, nice atmosphere.

excerpts: The sweet potato fries were a nice option.
The kids did not seem to be fond of their kid meals but it is always hit or miss with them anyway.
The service was good and there was ample seating.
I would definitely give this place another chance since some of their other menu items looked pretty good.
Other pluses include a small parking lot and conveniently located within walking distnace of the main attractions at Golden Gate Park.
sweet potato fries.author: Julie D.
sweet potato fries.review: I ordered the fish tacos and they were pretty good but not great.  The sweet potato fries were a nice option.  The kids did not seem to be fond of their kid meals but it is always hit or miss with them anyway.  The service was good and there was ample seating.  I would definitely give this place another chance since some of their other menu items looked pretty good.  Other pluses include a small parking lot and conveniently located within walking distnace of the main attractions at Golden Gate Park.

excerpts: Due to the rotating seasonal menus, you can find anything from edamame to burritos to sweet potato fries on the menu.
However, it doesn't really matter what you pick to eat, or how confusing the menu feels, because it all tastes fantastic, and they pull it all together very well.
sweet potato fries.author: Anthony D.
sweet potato fries.review:
Simply put, my favorite place to eat in the city. Everything tastes great!  They have a rotating menu and emphasize different ethnic foods at different times of the year.  Have I mentioned how fantastic the food is?  Anybody can find something to eat here, even if you're not a big seafood person. 

The atmosphere is a little confusing to the senses, because on the one hand it has definite Asian influences, yet it has a contemporary American feel to it as well.  Due to the rotating seasonal menus, you can find anything from edamame to burritos to sweet potato fries on the menu.  However, it doesn't really matter what you pick to eat, or how confusing the menu feels, because it all tastes fantastic, and they pull it all together very well.

excerpts: these are as follows: poke appetizer - if you have not had this dish you are seriously missing out on some wonderful flavor / fish tacos - i usually get a 'catch of the day', a mahi-mahi and one chicken taco to mix it up, all with the famous sweet potato fries / dulche de leche spring rolls - i have no words for how addictive and delicious this little dessert is...
sweet potato fries.author: Karen K.
sweet potato fries.review:
i would like to start off by pointing out that pacific catch is not the big bad wolf responsible for the closing of canvas gallery.  this is an untruth, and in fact, canvas gallery originally opened to showcase the artwork of the owner's wife.  guess whose paintings now hang on the walls of this renovated space?  that's right.  the wife of the owner of canvas gallery.  interesting, hmmn?  yeah, i thought so too.

the space here is incredible.  from the pretty long bar with original and unique cocktails (lemongrass mojito, anyone?) to the vaulted celings with beautiful fixtures, this place has a truly modern and sassy yet comforting feel to it. beware that if you are coming in on a friday or saturday night, you might want to make a reservation or be prepared to wait for 45-1 hour at the bar if you don't.  

there are additions to the menu here different from the chestnut street and corte madera locations, and all of them looked wonderful, but my friend and i decided to stick with the basics as we have been to the other locations countless times and have our favorites.  these are as follows: poke appetizer - if you have not had this dish you are seriously missing out on some wonderful flavor / fish tacos - i usually get a 'catch of the day', a mahi-mahi and one chicken taco to mix it up, all with the famous sweet potato fries / dulche de leche spring rolls - i have no words for how addictive and delicious this little dessert is... you MUST TRY IT:/

service ran smooth, our wine pours were generous, and in all i was really impressed that PC  has managed to make a nice changeover from the fast sit down/take-out marina locale to a more traditional style of dining.  i definitely want to come back with a larger party and try some more of the new cocktails and maybe even be adventurous enough to order something new...

excerpts: but yes, do order the sweet potato fries.
i couldn't choose between the two dipping sauces so i compromised on dipping into both.
sweet potato fries.author: Anh V.
sweet potato fries.review:
hmmm, i do love their pomegranate martinis...

the mood is open and casual.  it's unassuming and friendly to families and big groups with choices of seating at the bar, tables and chairs or comfy booths.  

well, since i was not on a liquid diet yet, i had to sample their menu.

thanks to yelpers, i did read up a bit on what to order.

the grilled artichoke was good but yes, do order the sweet potato fries.  i couldn't choose between the two dipping sauces so i compromised on dipping into both.  
the hawaiian poke sashimi was a close second to the fries.

for entrees, i do recommend the korean bbq skirt steak and  the unagi wasabi bowl - we added grilled fresh salmon to it.
i had the giant scallops which had a jerk chicken like seasoning.  so if you aren't into kicky spices, then this is not the dish for you.  the menu is pretty extensive so there is something for everyone.

we ended the evening with the fried dulce de leche spring rolls which were delish.  next time, i'll have to come back and order the passion mango cheesecake.

parking is tough in the neighborhood but there is a lot a block away.  frankly, i rather pony up for the parking and be sipping on their yummy martinis than circling the block.

excerpts: I got the spicy sweet potato fries with it - not too spicy but very nice nonetheless.
sweet potato fries.author: Nick K.
sweet potato fries.review:
Very nice place to go, especially with kids.

The fish-n-chips was really  nice - flaky fish with a light batter.

I had two fish tacos, also very nice.   I got the spicy sweet potato fries with it - not too spicy but very nice nonetheless.

We also ordered the daily escolar special, which was coated with a chilli-based rub.  Excellent.  Will go there again.

excerpts: The only thing I would come back here for are the sweet potato fries.
But I would only come during the happy hour times.
sweet potato fries.author: Lang T.
sweet potato fries.review: Came here for dinner last night because my husband keeps talking how great their Wasabi bowls are. I got the salmon wasabi bowl (be warned the salmon is cooked). My husband got the tuna wasabi bowl (that was raw). I didn't particularly like mine, I guess I should have gotten the tuna. However, since the meal was called wasabi bowl, I expected wasabi up the ying yang. I didn't get much of any wasabi kick so I was disappointed. The only thing I would come back here for are the sweet potato fries. But I would only come during the happy hour times.

excerpts: The sweet potato fries, spicy tuna roll and Hawaiian poke with won ton chips were all satisfying as a matter of fact
it was too much food.
I've never been to a restaurant where I left 1/2 of the sushi..
I did that here.
You get alot of food and the happy hour prices are outstanding.
Great for families and groups.
sweet potato fries.author: Sherie R.
sweet potato fries.review: It's good. It's safe. It's kinda like a chain but a little better. The space is funky and has a really hip vibe. I like the pomegranate mojito I had. The sweet potato fries, spicy tuna roll and Hawaiian poke with won ton chips were all satisfying as a matter of fact it was too much food. I've never been to a restaurant where I left 1/2 of the sushi..I did that here. You get alot of food and the happy hour prices are outstanding. Great for families and groups.

excerpts: Sweet potato fries are amazing!
Happy hour here kicks ass.
Mother Ship on tap, cool bartenders, beautiful women working here and
sweet potato fries.author: Brandon H.
sweet potato fries.review: Awesome food.  Fish and Chips are perfectly cooked every time!  Sweet potato fries are amazing!  Happy hour here kicks ass.  Mother Ship on tap, cool bartenders, beautiful women working here and Spicy Tuna Rolls are 5 bucks and they actually put TUNA in it!  instead of half assing it.  place constantly amazes me.

excerpts: Great sweet potato fries, nice menu, interesting selection of beers, friendly atmosphere.
Why 2 stars?
Last visit with a crowd of 10 for a birthday; found a gnarly-looking tomato in my otherwise tasty salad.
Waitress said, hmm, can't wait to show this to my manager!
Then we got the check - no
"so sorry about that,"  no happy birthday, not 50 cents off the bill.
We've had worse experiences in much fancier places  (the worst: a used paper towel mid-entree at a high-end restaurant
- they comp'd us a half glass of wine!)
but probably won't breeze by again in a hurry.
sweet potato fries.author: Ellen S.
sweet potato fries.review: Great sweet potato fries, nice menu, interesting selection of beers, friendly atmosphere.  Why 2 stars?  Last visit with a crowd of 10 for a birthday; found a gnarly-looking tomato in my otherwise tasty salad.  Waitress said, hmm, can't wait to show this to my manager!  Then we got the check - no "so sorry about that,"  no happy birthday, not 50 cents off the bill.  We've had worse experiences in much fancier places  (the worst: a used paper towel mid-entree at a high-end restaurant - they comp'd us a half glass of wine!) but probably won't breeze by again in a hurry.

excerpts: Anyway, onto the food.......the sweet potato fries are yummy and once you start you can't stop eating them.
They are a bit addicting, I think they are perfect as is, but my fiance likes to add salt to them
but then again he adds salt to everything and takes blood pressure meds............
the sushi is good and consistent, and the menu is extensive enough where if you have any seafood fan they most likely will find something they will like here.
Most of the food is healthy, but if you want something fried there are plenty of options for that also.
sweet potato fries.author: Denise B.
sweet potato fries.review:
Same concept as the other location on Chestnut Street except in real restaurant format, ie. you sit down and order with a waitress. 

My favorite things about this location I must say are the service which I find fast and friendly, and the atmosphere which is warm and inviting. 
The food, I honestly felt was better at the original location, yet I keep coming back to this location since it's alot closer to me. 

Anyway, onto the food.......the sweet potato fries are yummy and once you start you can't stop eating them. They are a bit addicting, I think they are perfect as is, but my fiance likes to add salt to them but then again he adds salt to everything and takes blood pressure meds............the sushi is good and consistent, and the menu is extensive enough where if you have any seafood fan they most likely will find something they will like here. Most of the food is healthy, but if you want something fried there are plenty of options for that also. My personal favorite for years and years was the Hawaiian poke yet here I find it to be really salty every time I order even though I keep order it again and again thinking the last time was hopefully a fluke. It wasn't. My other let down was possibly the pineapple fried rice, which I usually tend to think, there is no way to mess up, which they diddn't, but they also didn't do anything with to make me even want to finish eating it! Let down! If it sounds like I am complaining I don't mean to because I usually do like what I order here, just the last two times the fried rice and poke have been letting me down. Usually though my experience here though does leave me satisfied, and as mentioned earlier, the atmosphere and service always stay consistent.

excerpts: my sister and i shared the hawaiian surf&turf and the fried oysters with sweet potato fries, and boy, were we stuffed!
friendly servers, great ambiance
sweet potato fries.author: Sharon O.
sweet potato fries.review:
my sister and i shared the hawaiian surf&turf and the fried oysters with sweet potato fries, and boy, were we stuffed! friendly servers, great ambiance, it's a nice place to go for something other than the usual inner sunset food. 

they have late night happy hour every night from 10pm till closing. i passed by on saturday night and the place was packed with people. gotta try their happy hour sometime...

the food was really flavorful and their menu is extensive, ranging from sushi to salads to seafood. 

a bit pricey, but what isn't in san francisco?

excerpts: we ordered a lot of appetizers.. hawaiian poke, sweet potato fries, and calamari... and we were stuffed before entrees came.
I WISH
I had room because from the few bites that I did have... it was so tasty!
I had the Wasabi Bowl with Hawaiian Poke.
The wasabi bowls come with all the things I love
and they all are so great together.
The hubby got the 3 taco platter with 3 different tacos, and they looked delicious as well.
Our friends had also got meals that looked DELICIOUS...
sweet potato fries.author: Kymberli C.
sweet potato fries.review: We were close to the Chestnut location but it was totally packed, and TINY... so we decided to drive over to this location... We were starving and our eyes were hungrier than are stomachs... we ordered a lot of appetizers.. hawaiian poke, sweet potato fries, and calamari... and we were stuffed before entrees came.  I WISH I had room because from the few bites that I did have... it was so tasty!  I had the Wasabi Bowl with Hawaiian Poke.  The wasabi bowls come with all the things I love and they all are so great together.  The hubby got the 3 taco platter with 3 different tacos, and they looked delicious as well.  Our friends had also got meals that looked DELICIOUS... a miso salmon and the salmon wasabi bowl... mmm....  This location is a lot bigger with its own parking lot and the service is very friendly and attentive as well.

excerpts: The food here is consistently very good---favs are the Pacific Salmon (battered fried salmon and sweet potato fries) and the wasabi bowls (any combo).
Servers are efficient and friendly.
A unique  feature of this Pacific Catch is the size of the building (built on an old x-mas tree lot, d'ya remember?).
It's not often to find an SF restaurant that is not a bit cramped
so this place is a treat.
Finally, the martinis are well priced and good sized (have you noticed maritini glasses seem to be shrinking in SF?).
sweet potato fries.author: Michael W.
sweet potato fries.review: Pacific Catch has been a great addition to the Inner Sunset neighborhood.  The food here is consistently very good---favs are the Pacific Salmon (battered fried salmon and sweet potato fries) and the wasabi bowls (any combo).  Servers are efficient and friendly.  A unique  feature of this Pacific Catch is the size of the building (built on an old x-mas tree lot, d'ya remember?).  It's not often to find an SF restaurant that is not a bit cramped so this place is a treat.  Finally, the martinis are well priced and good sized (have you noticed maritini glasses seem to be shrinking in SF?).

excerpts:
this one had tempura inside with tuna on the outside)
-Mixed Catch Basket with SWEET POTATO FRIES (the fries came with diff sauce, but it tasted good dipped in this other seafood sauce from another dish we had, and also good dipped in this sweet sauce that came with our mixed catch basket.
Mixed Catch Basket came with 2 pieces of fish, 4 coconut shrimp, and 3 oyster.
My sister and I agreed the oysters were the best.
Breaded on the outside and when you bite into, it's soft, not quite slimy, and very good!!
We could have done without the so-so fish, and the coconut shrimp)
But I like the appetizers and the sushi and sweet potato fries, so indeed I would return.
Oh, and those oysters, too!!
sweet potato fries.author: Anita C.
sweet potato fries.review:
Went back today with my family for birthday dinners. My sister and I wanted to have and try several things, so we shared A LOT of food. (In our defense, we were going to share with the others in our family, too.)

My sister and I chose:

-Sake Sake Sushi (still very very good. tastes so fresh and yummy. not overdone. had avocado inside with salmon and roe on the outside)
-Rising Sun Sushi (this was okay for me. just may not be a huge fan of the tempura inside. this one had tempura inside with tuna on the outside)
-Mixed Catch Basket with SWEET POTATO FRIES (the fries came with diff sauce, but it tasted good dipped in this other seafood sauce from another dish we had, and also good dipped in this sweet sauce that came with our mixed catch basket. Mixed Catch Basket came with 2 pieces of fish, 4 coconut shrimp, and 3 oyster. My sister and I agreed the oysters were the best. Breaded on the outside and when you bite into, it's soft, not quite slimy, and very good!! We could have done without the so-so fish, and the coconut shrimp)
Last but not least, we also had:
-today's special appetizer - seafood in sauce(i love sauce) with a piece of very crispy bread that was grilled and tasted excellent dipped in the seafoody sauce, and it was topped with some spicy mustard that gave some surprising zing)

Our family also shared:
-Hawaiian Poke (very good. many pieces of poke with little chips to eat with it, though the poke was a little salty)
-Baja Shrimp Ceviche (this was great. tortilla chips with the sour sauce tasted good. and there were many large shrimp we kept discovering beneath the sauce too)

Other family members had:
-Pineapple fried rice - apparently not very good
-Shrimp taco - tasted ok
-sweet tea - basically just sweetened tea
-spicy fries - not too special
-shrimp tempura roll - nothing special. the tempura just didn't do much for me

AND, because my family had 3 birthdays, they comped 3 desserts for us! We got two Mochi Fondues, that come with the ice cream mochis in chocolate, vanilla, and coffee flavors to be dipped in warm chocolate sauce. I had the vanilla and that tasted pretty good. We also had the Macadamia Nut Brownie Sundae. I had a bite, and it was good, but just too sweet for my taste.

Also, the service was interesting. They kept collecting our chopsticks, and once even collected plates they gave my sister and I to use to share our food. We hadn't even used our chopsticks (2nd set) and plates yet! So our food came, and we're like...where are our plates AND our chopsticks! So I was onto my 3rd pair of chopsticks. After that, every time they came by, I held onto my chopsticks. Can you be overserviced?

But I like the appetizers and the sushi and sweet potato fries, so indeed I would return. Oh, and those oysters, too!! So that helps me forget about some of the negatives and give Pacific Catch another 4 stars!

Maybe sometime I can just come for happy hour between 4-6pm, and get the things I like, and not make it a full on meal. :-)

excerpts: However they do serve some very good sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: Greg C.
sweet potato fries.review:
Had a lunch time birthday party there with friends.  Food was decent, if a bit on the boring side.  However they do serve some very good sweet potato fries.  

What was disappointing was the service.  They seemed disorganized, couldn't remember who ordered what, and drinks took a long time to come out.  I had brought a large party with me (around 15), but for some reason they chose to ring it up as two bills.  They forgot to run the charges through for one of the bills when we settled.  About 20 minute later, after I walked all the way to the California Academy of Sciences, the manager called and said we stiffed him on the bill.  We hiked all the way back, missing a planetarium show we were standing in line for.  I wasn't so keen on the forgetful service, and mismanaged bill, and being accused by the manager of stiffing him.

excerpts: I love the one in the Marina and frequented it regularly for the salad bowl with Ahi Tuna Poke and sweet potato fries.
I tried something new today and we split a coconut shrimp appetizer which was really good.
I had fish tacos this time around which were all pretty decent but the sweet potato fries were a bit tasteless.
The ones at the Marina location have also changed from how delicious they used to be.
Not sure if they're using different sweet potatoes
but they're definitely brighter orange and less sweet than they used to be.
Anyway, there was a bit of a glitch in the computer
so our order took a while, but this was all a trial run, so
sweet potato fries.author: Dave L.
sweet potato fries.review:
Oh wow, look at that, I'm the first person to actually have eaten here that is writing a review (despite being the 3rd review).  Disclaimer: This review was written on a preview service meal (first ever served) so please take it with a grain of salt!    

I just had lunch today for the preview service of the newest location of Pacific Catch (Corta Madera and Marina are the other two).  They're doing a preview lunch today and tomorrow before hopefully opening on Tuesday (as per inspectors approving them).  They did an amazing job with all the space of the old Canvas Cafe which I frequented weekly.  The red really pops and the decor is great.  There's a full bar and PLENTY of seats all around.  The vibe is really good and the food is well...it's Pacific Catch!  I love the one in the Marina and frequented it regularly for the salad bowl with Ahi Tuna Poke and sweet potato fries.  I tried something new today and we split a coconut shrimp appetizer which was really good.  I had fish tacos this time around which were all pretty decent but the sweet potato fries were a bit tasteless.  The ones at the Marina location have also changed from how delicious they used to be.  Not sure if they're using different sweet potatoes but they're definitely brighter orange and less sweet than they used to be.  Anyway, there was a bit of a glitch in the computer so our order took a while, but this was all a trial run, so I'm sure it'll be worked out by opening time.  

They have an expanded menu at this location (same as Corta Madera) with sushi and sashimi bar.  The prices are slightly higher than the Chestnut location though.  This place is awesome and I highly recommend it.  Easy parking across the street in Golden Gate Park.  The space is gorgeous (high ceilings with skylight).  The management and staff were really nice and friendly.  The place is huge so you shouldn't have a problem getting seated.  I highly recommend checking it out!

excerpts: For example, the spicy tuna roll is really good and the sweet potato fries!
sweet potato fries.author: Sonya D.
sweet potato fries.review: I really like this restuarant. All of the cocktails I've had from here were really good..esp. the Ginger Pomegranate Martini..sooo good.  Plus they have a 10pm happy hour!! How cool is that? The bar food during the happy hour is cheap and yummy. For example, the spicy tuna roll is really good and the sweet potato fries!

excerpts: He was quick to get us the sweet potato fries for the appetizer but after that he completely forgot our main courses.
We waited for 1 1/2 hours.
He said the kitchen was backed up.
sweet potato fries.author: Novi O.
sweet potato fries.review:
When I first came in, the hostess was really friendly. The waiter was ok. I think he tried to be friendly but was overwhelmed. He was quick to get us the sweet potato fries for the appetizer but after that he completely forgot our main courses. We waited for 1 1/2 hours. He said the kitchen was backed up. That pretty much ruined our mood. 

The 3 course dinner menu was also misleading. Cocktail was listed together with appetizer, main course, and dessert. When we asked the waiter he mocked us by saying oh..i would've loved to get the cocktail too. Wtf? Only after we talked to the manager we got it for free. She said many people questioned the menu as well. Hello...? I was gonna give 2 stars but I give one more because of her.

I had the poke wasabi bowl which was very good. i'd come back just for that.

excerpts:
what a disappointment for an $8 roll

of course the sweet potato fries were good.
sweet potato fries.author: joyce l.
sweet potato fries.review:
i came back here after going to the academy of science.  we had the salmon teriyaki bowl and mahi mahi special which were totally edible. we also decided to get the rock and roll (unagi roll) with brown rice. what a way to ruin a meal. the brown rice was super hard (cold and perhaps undercooked?) and the unagi was disgusting. it was cold (like they had taken it out of the fridge) and they used the hard crusty pieces (hard skin attached, the fish was just hard in general). SERIOUSLY???  what a disappointment for an $8 roll

of course the sweet potato fries were good. don't get the sushi with brown rice or eel if you go!!!

the service was still good but i just had to downgrade them based on the sushi experience.

excerpts: the sweet potato fries were yummy as well but i honestly don't remember how my tacos tasted because i wolfed them down the moment the plate hit the table.
sweet potato fries.author: sasa w.
sweet potato fries.review:
this is a lunch review.
the bestie and i heard good things about this place since it opened so we decided to come by for lunch one day. it was about 12:30pm  when we got there and we were both pretty hungry. we were seated pretty quick, and sadly that was the last thing speedy about this place. 

our server came by to introduce herself and drop off menus... it took her a while to get back to us to take our orders, then gave us our drinks and the house appetizers - edamame and pretzel goldfish. thinking back on it now, i should have realized if it took her that long to get our order, i should have realized it would have taken just as long to get our food... in which case, i should have just ordered a real drink rather than soda. anyways, since i had the time to look around. from what i can tell there were two, maybe three servers in the restaurant and a couple more kitchen/wait staff to bring food to the tables. the restaurant wasn't even busy. it was at most half full.

the bestie had a wasabi bowl and it was tasty. the sweet potato fries were yummy as well but i honestly don't remember how my tacos tasted because i wolfed them down the moment the plate hit the table. 

by the time we left the restaurant it was a bit past 3pm. we were not happy and it definitely didn't feel like it was worth our time or money. never going back.

excerpts: Really good, Sushi and Fish Tacos and Ahi apps and Sweet Potato Fries and more... go here all the time.
sweet potato fries.author: Andy C.
sweet potato fries.review: Really good, Sushi and Fish Tacos and Ahi apps and Sweet Potato Fries and more... go here all the time.

excerpts: So I ended up with some starters and sides: wakame seaweed salad (kindda fishy), pineapple fried rice (kindda bland) and sweet potato fries (ok...
the fries were good especially with their special dips).
sweet potato fries.author: ITesh J.
sweet potato fries.review:
This is a new restaurant in what was Canvas Cafe. (With it's live music night, relatively good food and nice booths/tables to park yourself with your laptop, Canvas was one of my fav spots in the Sunset.  But I remiss...) Anyway, so I'm headed to Pacific Catch because my SO is part of an acronym friends and family group (aka AF&F) and most of them are devout meat worshipers.  I mean they really, really like their meats and fish.  And don't suggest to me that fish is vegetarian.  Hello!  If it's got a face, moves and /or you keep it as a pet, it's not vegetarian.  So Pacific Catch has an upscale look and feel to the place. Nice decor, lighting and a friendly wait staff.  But the menu is not vegetarian friendly.  Lot of choices (sake salmon, calamari, thai coconut shrimp, tuna tataki etc etc...) if you like your meats and fish but not if you're vegetarian.  Most places in SF by now have a section on their menu for vegetarians. Not here. (Btw, I asked the waiter and she didn't have a suggestion off the menu for me as well)  Frustrated, I asked for peanut butter & jelly sandwich and they didn't have that. So I ended up with some starters and sides: wakame seaweed salad (kindda fishy), pineapple fried rice (kindda bland) and sweet potato fries (ok...the fries were good especially with their special dips).  Not very satisfying for $25 (w/ tips) per person bill.

Tip for Pacfic Catch.  Have something vegetarian. Something noodly on your menu. And if you can't do that, at least have peanut butter and jelly sandwich.  Is that asking for too much?

excerpts: we started with the sweet potato fries.
average but good.
the wsabi dipping sauce was interesting but the sweet chili dipping sauce did not go with the fries at all.
as an entree, i had a special.
hawaiian style opah fish with pineapple fried rice and fried onions.
the fish, which is supposed to be a more oily fish, was dry, dry ,dry.
the "hawaiian glaze" tasted like something you could get at TGIF.
the fried onion rings just oozed with oil.
each bite just squirted oil into my mouth.
sweet potato fries.author: Thom Y.
sweet potato fries.review:
maybe i hold a grudge against this place for taking over the space where the canvas gallery used to be.  it was weird going to the bathroom and finding that it was actually clean!  that aside, i thought our evening at pacific catch was pretty mediocre.  not horrible but not great.  

we started with the sweet potato fries.  average but good.  the wsabi dipping sauce was interesting but the sweet chili dipping sauce did not go with the fries at all.  as an entree, i had a special.  hawaiian style opah fish with pineapple fried rice and fried onions.  the fish, which is supposed to be a more oily fish, was dry, dry ,dry.  the "hawaiian glaze" tasted like something you could get at TGIF.  the fried onion rings just oozed with oil.  each bite just squirted oil into my mouth.  the pineapple fried rice was pretty good.  

my friend had the poke wasabi bowl which was good but, like he said, was "nothing special".  i think i'll revisit this place in a month or two to try it out again.  maybe after settling down, they'll fine tune their cooking techniques.  but until then, i'll still be missing my canvas gallery.

excerpts: The salads and wasabi bowls are great, as is the fish and chips with sweet potato fries.
It's perfect on a warm sunny day after a walk in the GG park.
sweet potato fries.author: Eric C.
sweet potato fries.review: This is one of my favorite places in the hood for a quick, easy no frills bite.  The salads and wasabi bowls are great, as is the fish and chips with sweet potato fries.  It's perfect on a warm sunny day after a walk in the GG park.

excerpts: I usually go for the eel bowl with brown rice (LOVE that sauce they use) and never miss the opportunity to get the grilled artichoke and the sweet potato fries
(I wish they had places in NYC that served both of those!!!).
The atmosphere is nice and the service is generally pretty quick and friendly.
sweet potato fries.author: Marina G.
sweet potato fries.review: I am definitely a fan. I usually go for the eel bowl with brown rice (LOVE that sauce they use) and never miss the opportunity to get the grilled artichoke and the sweet potato fries (I wish they had places in NYC that served both of those!!!). The atmosphere is nice and the service is generally pretty quick and friendly.

excerpts: sweet potato fries were tasty however.
sweet potato fries.author: Bobby B.
sweet potato fries.review:
service was outstanding

food was just ok. too much sauce in the salmon dish and the seafood just didn't taste that fresh. sweet potato fries were tasty however.  good selection of beer

prices are out of whack..6.95 for a california roll? 

parking is tough

excerpts: We ordered the wasabi hawaiian poke bowl and the two taco platter (grilled steak & mahi mahi) with sweet potato fries.
Also, I ordered one of the house made drinks that consisted of mint leaves & lime that the waitress recommended.
The poke bowl was a big disappointment.
It felt like there was not a consistency with everything going together and there was very little poke.
The mahi mahi taco was not good, but the grilled steak taco was pretty tasty.
The best thing about this place?
Their sweet potato fries.
The drink I ordered was way too pricey for what it really was too.
Disappointment there also.
I don't think I'd come back anytime soon.
sweet potato fries.author: Syd T.
sweet potato fries.review: Came to try this place out with my boyfriend since he loves poke bowls. We got free calamari for checking in and the calamari was mediocre and not even hot. The waitress even forgot to take it off our tab so I had to remind her when she gave us the bill. We ordered the wasabi hawaiian poke bowl and the two taco platter (grilled steak & mahi mahi) with sweet potato fries. Also, I ordered one of the house made drinks that consisted of mint leaves & lime that the waitress recommended. The poke bowl was a big disappointment. It felt like there was not a consistency with everything going together and there was very little poke. The mahi mahi taco was not good, but the grilled steak taco was pretty tasty. The best thing about this place? Their sweet potato fries. The drink I ordered was way too pricey for what it really was too. Disappointment there also. I don't think I'd come back anytime soon.

excerpts: The sweet potato fries and the spicy fries are definitely worth a try.
sweet potato fries.author: Jenny L.
sweet potato fries.review: The decor was fantastic, but I wish I could say the same about the fish.  The waiter needs to pay attention better; our drink orders were fulfilled.  The sweet potato fries and the spicy fries are definitely worth a try.  I'd stray against the catch of the day, the ahi tuna, and the poke all together.

excerpts: I ordered the Spicy Ahi Tuna Sandwich with sweet potato fries (which were so delicious).
I liked the sandwich but I have to say the tuna wasn't very flavorful.
I also mooched off my friends' Teriyaki Bowls and Wasabi Bowls..pretty good!
sweet potato fries.author: Tiffany T.
sweet potato fries.review: I was just here the other day for a friend's birthday, and it was the perfect place to have it - loud, colorful environment. It was pretty busy but they do take reservations. Their menu is rather unique - they have an interesting variety ranging from sushi rolls to tacos. I ordered the Spicy Ahi Tuna Sandwich with sweet potato fries (which were so delicious). I liked the sandwich but I have to say the tuna wasn't very flavorful. I also mooched off my friends' Teriyaki Bowls and Wasabi Bowls..pretty good! We shared the Mochi Fondue and some kind of brownie a la mode which was really delicious. The service was good, and there was a really cute bus boy. :)

excerpts: I got some sort of mojito (special drink of the day) and the mahi-mahi sandwich which came with the sweet potato fries.
Loved the sweet potato fries.
The sandwich was just okay.
We also ordered shrimp ceviche as an appetizer which was probably my favorite part of the meal.
Served with tortilla chips, it was fresh, light and citrus-y.
The service was friendly, although it did take awhile to get the bill.
sweet potato fries.author: Anne Q.
sweet potato fries.review:
I finally had a chance to go here for an early dinner on a beautiful, warm, sunny Monday evening. Getting there around 5 and on a Monday (my parents' favorite time of the day/week to dine out and now I see why) means absolutely no wait. We sat in a window seat in the bar which was great for people-watching, Golden Gate Park-watching and Irving St. traffic-watching. The food and drinks were tasty and filling. I got some sort of mojito (special drink of the day) and the mahi-mahi sandwich which came with the sweet potato fries. Loved the sweet potato fries. The sandwich was just okay. We also ordered shrimp ceviche as an appetizer which was probably my favorite part of the meal. Served with tortilla chips, it was fresh, light and citrus-y. The service was friendly, although it did take awhile to get the bill. All in all, I thought it was a good meal and a great new addition to my neighborhood restaurants.

Extra tip: You can sign up to receive monthly newsletter emails from Pacific Catch. So far the email always has a "special offer of the month" which is typically a free appetizer that the restaurant chooses(i.e. the shrimp ceviche) if you order entree(s) -- sometimes they require you buy 2 entrees, but with the latest email you only had to buy one.

excerpts: but i do like their poke bowls and their sweet potato fries, both of which were much smaller portioned than at the marina.
and a couple bucks more...
sweet potato fries.author: Caroline I.
sweet potato fries.review: I only came here because I like the food at Pacific Catch in the marina.  the prices here seem steeper and the portions smaller.  that' sprobabl b/c the space is huge compared to the marina location.  the place feels like a gutted starbucks.  very generic feel.  with so many other neighborhood establishments, i'd probably pass on coming here again.  but i do like their poke bowls and their sweet potato fries, both of which were much smaller portioned than at the marina.  and a couple bucks more...

excerpts: The sweet potato fries are great - I've eaten two boxes in one sitting before our holiday party- along with the fish tacos, which are not too greasy or batter-y.
Who cares about service when the food is so good - I still have no complaints about the staff.
They are all accomodating and nice.
This newest location does have limited parking available and a pretty posh bar but I do miss the Cricket Cola from the Marina location.
It gets pretty busy & noisy on the weekends (typical SF dining scene) so call ahead for reservations.
It is definitely worth the wait!
sweet potato fries.author: Trish K.
sweet potato fries.review:
I love this place and now its a short bike ride across the park!  The food is just amazing (if you like seafood & stuff) and I can only suggest the entire menu since I've already eaten everything on it. 
Being a Hawaii girl, my favorite is the Ahi Poke Wasabi bowl since they make it like home along with yummy avacado and wakame salad. And I shouldn't be able to finish the whole thing but I do.  The sweet potato fries are great - I've eaten two boxes in one sitting before our holiday party- along with the fish tacos, which are not too greasy or batter-y. Who cares about service when the food is so good - I still have no complaints about the staff.  They are all accomodating and nice.
This newest location does have limited parking available and a pretty posh bar but I do miss the Cricket Cola from the Marina location.  It gets pretty busy & noisy on the weekends (typical SF dining scene) so call ahead for reservations.  It is definitely worth the wait!

excerpts: The appetizer of sweet potato fries was very delicious.
sweet potato fries.author: Russell P.
sweet potato fries.review:
Some friends and I stopped in here for lunch during a bike ride across the city. Decor was great, staff was friendly, service was prompt, bathrooms were very clean, and the food was quite good. When one of my fellow bike riders dropped his glass of water, we were blown away by the response time of three separate members of the staff showing up in a split second to deal with the crisis. They handled this situation incredibly well and even apologized to surrounding tables for the disruption. 

The appetizer of sweet potato fries was very delicious.

excerpts: The sweet potato fries were crispy and tasted really good with the tar tar sauce and sweet/sour sauce that accompanied the dish.
sweet potato fries.author: Florence T.
sweet potato fries.review:
First pro of eating at Pacific Catch is that reservations can be made online at opentable.com! The interior is much roomier than the marina location and the decor is trendy and comfortable. Our server was friendly and even showed me the box package of the tea that they brew when I asked what type of green tea they used as it has some fruity floral notes unlike other traditional green teas. 

We started with the spicy fries, which were perfectly crispy and had a cajun spice sprinkled on top. It was served hot and the side sized order was a perfectly adequate amount to avoid overfilling on starches before our meal. My boyfriend had the fish and chips with the "catch of the day" which was cod. It was flaky and soft and the batter was light and airy. The sweet potato fries were crispy and tasted really good with the tar tar sauce and sweet/sour sauce that accompanied the dish. I had the seared ahi tuna salad that came with 6 pieces of perfectly cooked tuna that was still raw on the inside. Instead of the wasabi soy dressing, I opted for the miso dressing and was happy with my change as the dressing was creamy and tangy, which matched perfectly with the fish. 

Pacific Catch is a great place to indulge in seafood and enjoy a nice night out in a trendy joint, which i must mention also has a bar area.

excerpts: Sweet potato fries, crab & avocado salad, & oversized California rolls.
What more can you ask for?
They also give you Goldfish pretzels & edamame to munch on before your food arrives.
Yum!
9th & Irving is always busy, so looking for parking can be a pain.
sweet potato fries.author: Stephanie W.
sweet potato fries.review: Sweet potato fries, crab & avocado salad, & oversized California rolls. What more can you ask for? They also give you Goldfish pretzels & edamame to munch on before your food arrives. Yum! 9th & Irving is always busy, so looking for parking can be a pain.

excerpts: The sweet potato fries were also a nice treat!
The service here was great and I loved the dining experience
sweet potato fries.author: Miguel V.
sweet potato fries.review: This was my first time dining at "Pac Catch" and I loved it. My friend and I started with a sushi roll... DELICIOUS!!! Next I had the Tokyo Salmon. I am not always a big fan of the fried fish but I made an exception and it worth it! The sweet potato fries were also a nice treat! The service here was great and I loved the dining experience

excerpts: We ordered the sweet potato fries (of course) and one ahi poke salad and 2 ahi poke wasabi bowls.
The portions are HUGE and the food always tastes good.
When we got there, the hostess said the wait was 45 min but that she could call us right before a table was ready.
I really liked that service
so we walked around and shopped a bit.
sweet potato fries.author: Scott L.
sweet potato fries.review:
Update: 5/17/08

Came here for dinner last night with a friend and my fiancee.  We ordered the sweet potato fries (of course) and one ahi poke salad and 2 ahi poke wasabi bowls.  The portions are HUGE and the food always tastes good.  When we got there, the hostess said the wait was 45 min but that she could call us right before a table was ready.  I really liked that service so we walked around and shopped a bit.  The call came sooner than we expected so we doubled back.

The food is great like everyone says but what I want to talk about is the service.  We had an awful waitress.  She didn't give us nearly enough attention.  She barely served our table.  In the beginning, we asked for water and she completely forgot about them.  We had to ask another server to bring it for us.  The waitress only took our order then another server basically brought us our food and waited on us.  She only came back to check on us once and refill water.  Afterwards, we got our bill and we were casually talking.  She dropped by twice to see if we had paid yet and it made us feel rushed.  

I don't mind being rushed our nicely if the place is packed.  I'm not a jerk and I'll give up a table but there wasn't a wait at all so we had time to sit around.  I thought it was very rude to be ushered out when we weren't done talking yet.  It turned the atmosphere sour so we headed out quickly.  I knew we were being rushed when she realized we hadn't paid the bill so she asked if we wanted a dessert menu.  It sounded like we either buy something else or pay up and leave.  

I understand that this is a one time deal with the waitress and hopefully we won't nearly be as unlucky next time.  But it was very disappointing from a place that I expected solid service from.  

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Original Post:

This new Pacific Catch is much more spacious and a much friendlier date place than the original in the Marina.  However, I found that I was very much disappointed by several things, which are enough to deter me from coming back here.  

1.  The prices are higher (possibly for the ambiance)
2.  Menu is different from the Marina 

The Marina location isn't exactly a hole in the wall cheapo place to eat but it's decently priced at least.  Here on 9th ave., everything is at least $3 more.  They were also missing my favorite sandwiches here as well.  Lastly, we ordered a basket full of fries and were heartily disappointed that it wasn't a very full basket.  

Verdict:  Overpriced.  I'll make the longer drive out to the Marina location.

excerpts: Of course, their sweet potato fries are the best fries around.
Now the bad.
Their service.
Our server, Rochelle, ruined our image and experience of this place.
Not only did she hardly check up on us, near the end of the meal, when our drink glass were completely empty we tried in vain for over 10 minutes to get her to bring us a refill.
It was not a very busy day nor did they seem short staff.
What made it worse was that she made eye contact with myself and my friend MULTIPLE times from a far, acknowledged us and still did not come over.
As far as I could tell, she was only putting away napkins or putting straws away from the counter.
Finally, my friend raised his hand like a child in a classroom for over 2 minutes before she finally came over.
I hope this is a rare occurrence
and we just got unlucky.
Well, good food tho.
sweet potato fries.author: sammy z.
sweet potato fries.review:
This is the second time we've dined here and I hate giving bad reviews to places with good food. The food, indeed is good. Their Tuna Bowl and Tuna sandwich is delicious. Of course, their sweet potato fries are the best fries around. Now the bad. Their service. Our server, Rochelle, ruined our image and experience of this place. Not only did she hardly check up on us, near the end of the meal, when our drink glass were completely empty we tried in vain for over 10 minutes to get her to bring us a refill. It was not a very busy day nor did they seem short staff.
