What made it worse was that she made eye contact with myself and my friend MULTIPLE times from a far, acknowledged us and still did not come over.  As far as I could tell, she was only putting away napkins or putting straws away from the counter. Finally, my friend raised his hand like a child in a classroom for over 2 minutes before she finally came over. 
I hope this is a rare occurrence and we just got unlucky. Well, good food tho.

excerpts: The sweet potato fries.
Yes we'll start there.
Good but not great.
If you have been to Poleng Lounge, you will not be impressed by this signature side dish.
Not to disagree with everyone that has reviewed this place because they were still satisfactory.
Adding to the okayness, we had the calamari.
Good but could use a little more flavor.
Finally we had a trio of seafood tacos.
sweet potato fries.author: Eugenel E.
sweet potato fries.review: Well where can I start. The sweet potato fries. Yes we'll start there. Good but not great. If you have been to Poleng Lounge, you will not be impressed by this signature side dish. Not to disagree with everyone that has reviewed this place because they were still satisfactory. Adding to the okayness, we had the calamari. Good but could use a little more flavor. Finally we had a trio of seafood tacos. Mahi mahi and salmon tacos were okay. Their best is definitely the shrimp tacos. However a good El Tonayense taco truck can totally wip that. Okay server was slow but it was a Friday. A bit pricey for what it is. However on a good final note, it does have atmosphere. You'll love that! Overall, just stroking a par.

excerpts: i ordered the fresh pick of the day, true cod (as opposed to false ones) which came with sweet potato fries, cole slaw and two dipping sauces.
one was a jalapeño tartar and the other was a sweet chili sauce, the kind you dip filipino lumpia into.
the fish was fried nicely and you can tell it was fresh.
sweet potato fries.author: Pamela s.
sweet potato fries.review: came here for a late lunch on sunday after a weekend of camping/rafting in oakdale and it was nice! i ordered the fresh pick of the day, true cod (as opposed to false ones) which came with sweet potato fries, cole slaw and two dipping sauces. one was a jalapeño tartar and the other was a sweet chili sauce, the kind you dip filipino lumpia into. the fish was fried nicely and you can tell it was fresh. i also had a taste of my friend's ahi tuna sandwich and my cousin's salmon sandwich, both of which were delish! i love the ciabatta bread they were on too! also shared one of their special sushi rolls, which had a catchy name that i am blanking on right now. but it had a nice bite, which came form the spicy mayo, and a nice crunch from the tempura batter, mmm!!! i'm craving some right now...

excerpts: sweet potato fries are good and the fried oysters are a great way to start your meal
so be sure to try it.
prices are not that bad, and you're geting real quality food.
parking sucks
but it's a small price to pay for good food.
sweet potato fries.author: Glenn M.
sweet potato fries.review: Try the wasabi bowls. they are BOMB!  the poke is my favorite... get it with the japanese rice and you will not regret it. it also comes in brown rice but the japanese rice will not disappoint.  sweet potato fries are good and the fried oysters are a great way to start your meal so be sure to try it.  prices are not that bad, and you're geting real quality food.  parking sucks but it's a small price to pay for good food.

excerpts: The sweet potato fries that came with my friend's entree were also very special.
sweet potato fries.author: Angela K.
sweet potato fries.review: Went here for lunch and got the Hawaii Poke Wasabi Bowl with brown rice. It took a while but was worth the wait. The edamame and the little fish crackers helped! The sweet potato fries that came with my friend's entree were also very special.

excerpts: I had the sweet potato fries that everyone mentioned, and the ahi tuna 3 way which included the tuna poke that was also mentioned.
The food is ok and prices are reasonable.
Very mediocre chain seafood.
but at least there was a small parking lot to the side.
sweet potato fries.author: Yen C.
sweet potato fries.review: I dont know what all the fuss is about.  I had the sweet potato fries that everyone mentioned, and the ahi tuna 3 way which included the tuna poke that was also mentioned.  The food is ok and prices are reasonable. Very mediocre chain seafood. but at least there was a small parking lot to the side.

excerpts: It comes with the sweet potato fries which I have come to like with fish.
This is good with either a glass of Chardonay or a mixed drink.
When I am headed for the museum, I plan it so that I go here first.
The food here is much much better than the museum and is not as hectic.
Service here is much better.
I tell myself I should try other things on the menu, however, I love this basket!
Enjoy
sweet potato fries.author: L H.
sweet potato fries.review:
I love the mixed basket with oysters, shrimp and fish!  They are crispy on the outside and tender on the inside.  They are not too greasy and taste fresh.  Only once were the shrimp overdone.  It comes with the sweet potato fries which I have come to like with fish.  This is good with either a glass of Chardonay or a mixed drink.
When I am headed for the museum, I plan it so that I go here first.  The food here is much much better than the museum and is not as hectic.  Service here is much better.
I tell myself I should try other things on the menu, however, I love this basket!  Enjoy

excerpts: The sweet potato fries are a great consistency,  not too greasy or soft, and come with two dipping sauces - even though they would be great on their own too.
sweet potato fries.author: Luisa M.
sweet potato fries.review:
Always in the mood to find good seafood, I was excited to eat a full meal at a restaurant that I only sampled at a recent event in San Francisco.

This place has all the ingredients of a great dining experience for me.  Great interior design and a nice, casual atmosphere without sacrificing service.  The sweet potato fries are a great consistency,  not too greasy or soft, and come with two dipping sauces - even though they would be great on their own too.  The sweet chili sauce and wasabi aioli were so delicious that I had a hard time deciding which one to use with each fry.  

I had the ahi poke bowl.  Fair warning, this bowl could feed a small nation.  The poke was a little spicier than I would have liked, and I'll echo requests to cut the cubes into smaller pieces. 

Our waiter was great with wine service, the food was delicious, and I'm already looking forward to coming back for another great meal.

excerpts: The sweet potato fries were delish.
The sesame salad in the bowl was refreshing.
The only thing that wasn't absolutely fabulous were the black beans which weren't bad - just merely came across as an afterthought.
sweet potato fries.author: L F.
sweet potato fries.review:
ohmigoooood!  This place is so unbelievably good I can't stop thinking about it!  We finally got into the Marina location about a year ago and really enjoyed both our meal and our server - friendly, funny and muy helpful!  The only thing we didn't like was how chummy you needed to be with your neighbor.  Definitely elbow to elbow situation.

Last night we wandered over to the 9th street location after a major hot hike in Marin.  While we really liked the coffee shop which occupied this space previously - I have to say welcome to the neighborhood PC!  The space has a very zen-like feel - great color scheme - awesome bar area - even the bathroom is nice with the bamboo stalks pressed between smoked glass.   

Great little starter vittles (sesame? goldfish and edamame).  We shared an ahi tuna wasabi bowl with brown rice and a mahi mahi taco platter.  The fish in both dishes was incredibly well prepared.  Amazing how good (and simple) fresh fish can be!  The sweet potato fries were delish.  The sesame salad in the bowl was refreshing.  The only thing that wasn't absolutely fabulous were the black beans which weren't bad - just merely came across as an afterthought.   Washing everything down with a cold beer - we were two very happy campers!

Service was friendly and attentive - seems like a good place for families and larger groups - definitely one of our new faves along the Irving corridor!

excerpts: the sweet potato fries were okay, although i wasn't sure why they served it with the sweet/spicy sauce....
i actually dipped it in the spicy aioli that came with the calamari, and that worked well...while the calamari was good with the sweet/spicy sauce....go figure....
sweet potato fries.author: Miss P.
sweet potato fries.review:
okay, before i go into the restaurant, i just have one question about parking...when the hell did it become okay for someone to stand in a parking spot to save it for their friends?  wtf?!?!?!?  if you are not a vehicle, you have no business taking up a parking spot.  people like you deserve to have a million bird poopies land of you AND your stinking car...so there!

....now on to the food.  i have to admit, the calamari was pretty dang good!  i would go there for that alone.  i'm not totally sure why some of the slices of lemon were fried up...was i supposed to eat that?  i wasn't sure, so i decided not to take the risk.

the sweet potato fries were okay, although i wasn't sure why they served it with the sweet/spicy sauce....i actually dipped it in the spicy aioli that came with the calamari, and that worked well...while the calamari was good with the sweet/spicy sauce....go figure....maybe it's their ploy to make you order both....

the entree is where they lost me.  the mahi mahi almost didn't look real....and the grill marks were just a bit too perfect....almost like burger king is behind this restaurant or something.  it was also a bit overdone.  the pineapple fried rice was way too mushy.  the the vegetable side was overdone also.

bottom line, i would come here for the calamari, and then go have dinner elsewhere....

excerpts: Our favorites are the shrimp ceviche and assortment of sushi rolls, hearty salads, rice bowls and sweet potato fries.
They also have a nice selection of kids choices that are simple versions of the adult items, not the sub-standard "kids food" you're likely to find at some trendy restaurants.
During shrimp season they feature an amazing soup appetizer called the seafood "chupe" - every time I insist it should be an entree size
it's so tasty.
Another reason we love going to Pacific Catch is Chelsea - she always makes us feel welcome and treats us like family.
Ask to be seated at her station when you go - she's a sweetheart!
sweet potato fries.author: Rebeca M.
sweet potato fries.review: My family and I have been regulars at Pacific Catch for years, and we just realized I had never "yelped" about it! What we love about coming here is the consistency of the menu as well as the nice surprise specials and emphasis on sustainable items. Nothing beats having a delicious meal and not needing to feel guilty about where the food came from! Our favorites are the shrimp ceviche and assortment of sushi rolls, hearty salads, rice bowls and sweet potato fries. They also have a nice selection of kids choices that are simple versions of the adult items, not the sub-standard "kids food" you're likely to find at some trendy restaurants. During shrimp season they feature an amazing soup appetizer called the seafood "chupe" - every time I insist it should be an entree size it's so tasty. Another reason we love going to Pacific Catch is Chelsea - she always makes us feel welcome and treats us like family. Ask to be seated at her station when you go - she's a sweetheart!

excerpts: and I order the same thing every time (cause it's that darn good): BBQ salmon sandwich and sweet potato fries with a side of that awesome Thai chili sauce.
The ingredients are fresh and simple and I always leave satisfied.
I've brought several friends here and sparked their addictions to this place as well.
sweet potato fries.author: Novi M.
sweet potato fries.review: This is easily one of my favorite go-to places and I order the same thing every time (cause it's that darn good): BBQ salmon sandwich and sweet potato fries with a side of that awesome Thai chili sauce. The ingredients are fresh and simple and I always leave satisfied. I've brought several friends here and sparked their addictions to this place as well.

excerpts: Ahi tuna sandwich was excellent and so were the sweet potato fries.
The calamari was bland and only edible because of the good sauce it came with.
sweet potato fries.author: Jason W.
sweet potato fries.review: Ahi tuna sandwich was excellent and so were the sweet potato fries. The calamari was bland and only edible because of the good sauce it came with.

excerpts: The sweet potato fries are also wonderful.
sweet potato fries.author: Dave S.
sweet potato fries.review: I have been there 3 times now, and have had good experiences. The food is very good and the prices are fair. The only gripe i have is that the service can sometimes be slow, but usually thats not the case. Last time i was there, i had to get up & track down the server to get my check...very annoying. Overall, i'll go again. The sushi rolls are the best value for the $$ and are suprisingly good. The sweet potato fries are also wonderful.

excerpts: Some were good tho, the sweet potato fries and the sticky ribs were great but the bowls didn't wow us.
sweet potato fries.author: Kevin C.
sweet potato fries.review: Had dinner here with two of my friends and my friend's two children under 4. Service was good and the menu had a great selection.  Why only 4 stars? Because the food was decent, not outstanding.  Some were good tho, the sweet potato fries and the sticky ribs were great but the bowls didn't wow us. We also had California rolls for the kids but that tasted like a pre packed sushi box  from a supermarket. other than that we would definitely go there again

excerpts: Big fan of the sweet potato fries, dark & stormy cocktail, and wasabi bowls.
I've tried a number of other dishes and have yet to be disappointed.
Seems like a good value too as the portions are on the bigger side.
I love that they are pet friendly in their outdoor seating areas.
Definitely a decided factors for me when I'm hungry and have the pups with me.
Oh and there's a parking lot attached the 9th Ave location.
Score!
sweet potato fries.author: S A.
sweet potato fries.review: I'm not typically a fan of chains, but I do make the exception for local ones. I've been to the 9th Ave and Chestnut locations numerous times. Big fan of the sweet potato fries, dark & stormy cocktail, and wasabi bowls. I've tried a number of other dishes and have yet to be disappointed. Seems like a good value too as the portions are on the bigger side. I love that they are pet friendly in their outdoor seating areas. Definitely a decided factors for me when I'm hungry and have the pups with me. Oh and there's a parking lot attached the 9th Ave location. Score!

excerpts: The chipotle chicken sandwich and sweet potato fries are also yummy.
Extra points for the unique edamame and pretzel gold fish to snack on while you wait!
sweet potato fries.author: Patti L.
sweet potato fries.review: I really like this place.  Not super cheap, but great food and atmosphere!  I am actually not a big seafood fan, but my boyfriend highly recommends the ahi tuna salad and the fried seafood basket.  The chipotle chicken sandwich and sweet potato fries are also yummy.  Extra points for the unique edamame and pretzel gold fish to snack on while you wait!

excerpts: At first I was thinking about a Wasabi Bowl but they had a special of Idaho Trout, served Baja style with sweet potato fries for $12.95 (the bowl is $15.95).
So, I went for it and ordered a beer since I felt like I just saved $3!!
The fish was great, the rub they put on it kicked up the flavor.
Of course the fries were good and it came out in about 12 minutes, not bad.
So, the reason I am giving four stars is that the bill came and it had the trout at $15.95!
I told the waiter that my menu said $12.95 and he said "oh you must have been given a lunch menu... sorry.
Not, "sorry, i'll fix the bill" but just "sorry".
Oh well, at least they don't charge the 3% health care thing.
Pacific Catch is good at what they do.
I'll be back!
sweet potato fries.author: Jim M.
sweet potato fries.review: Was in the area tonight so I stopped off and ate at the bar. At first I was thinking about a Wasabi Bowl but they had a special of Idaho Trout, served Baja style with sweet potato fries for $12.95 (the bowl is $15.95). So, I went for it and ordered a beer since I felt like I just saved $3!! The fish was great, the rub they put on it kicked up the flavor. Of course the fries were good and it came out in about 12 minutes, not bad. So, the reason I am giving four stars is that the bill came and it had the trout at $15.95! I told the waiter that my menu said $12.95 and he said "oh you must have been given a lunch menu... sorry." Not, "sorry, i'll fix the bill" but just "sorry". Oh well, at least they don't charge the 3% health care thing. Pacific Catch is good at what they do. I'll be back!

excerpts: AND I love their sweet potato fries..
sweet potato fries.author: Colleen L.
sweet potato fries.review:
I haven't been to this one in awhile so I dont know if their menu is different from the one in the Marina district.. BUUUT

I love their wasabi bowls! I'm a huge fan of their ahi poke.

I remember them having a poke sampler.. THAT is an awesome deal with a variety of fish. The one in the Marina didn't have it... boo

AND I love their sweet potato fries.. I'd probably get them to go if I walked past the restaurant... but I live on the East Bay.

I don't think I can ever get tired of this place. Their cocktails are so delish too! I can usually handle my alcohol.. but these dang things creep up on me cause they're so good. 

I'm usually pretty quiet when I eat here because there's a constant flow of food into my mouth.

excerpts: Had the sweet potato fries as the side.
I still think the Elephant Bar sweet potato fries are better, but not bad.
Prices are not bad to boot.
sweet potato fries.author: Stephen W.
sweet potato fries.review: I have walked past this place many times on my way into Golden Gate Park.  Finally decided to try it because of a special promotion.  Well, gotta say it was very good.  Had the salmon sandwich which many reviewers have said was great, and it did not disappoint.  The fish was moist and cooked just right.  Had the sweet potato fries as the side.  I still think the Elephant Bar sweet potato fries are better, but not bad.  Prices are not bad to boot.

excerpts: We also ordered the sturgeon fish of the day which came with an avocado sauce, grilled vegetable, and sweet potato fries.
The fries were really good.
The overall portion size for the entree was just right because it still allows room for appetizer if you want.
We are small eaters so it was just right.
Our total bill was about $60 which is not too bad given we had drinks too.
We're definitely going back and will try some of the other menus.
We recommended this place to our friend who liked it too.
The only complain they had was that everything on the menu is fish
Mahi mahi fish of the day - came with grilled veggie, sweet potato fries, mahi mahi served with tomatillo avocado sauce.
The fish had a cajun spice rub that was a bit pungent.
The sweet potato fries as always was great.
Grilled veggie - can't go wrong with this.
Don't like the spice rub so
The sweet potato fries as usual, are always yummy!!!
sweet potato fries.author: Irene C.
sweet potato fries.review:
My husband and I went to Pacific Catch on a Wednesday night and the place was pretty full.  So we sat at the bar instead so that we didn't have to wait, which turned out great cuz the bartender was very nice and both our cocktails tasted delicious!  We ordered the Firecracker Salmon roll which was very good.  We also ordered the sturgeon fish of the day which came with an avocado sauce, grilled vegetable, and sweet potato fries.  The fries were really good.  The overall portion size for the entree was just right because it still allows room for appetizer if you want.  We are small eaters so it was just right.  Our total bill was about $60 which is not too bad given we had drinks too.  We're definitely going back and will try some of the other menus.  We recommended this place to our friend who liked it too.  The only complain they had was that everything on the menu is fish but that was fine with us.

1/1/2008: This is the 2nd time I've been here and I would still give it a 4 star.  We had reservations at 7pm for 7 people and they seated us late for about 10 mins and they comped all our appetizers, without us complaining or mentioning it at all.  Now that's a restaurant that cares about their customers.  It was a pleasant surprise and treat.  The service was great throughout the meal as well.  

With 7 people, we tried alot more different dishes.  

Appetizers:
1) Shrimp ceviche - They were whole shrimp and there were lots of them.  I think they should dice up the shrimp because it was served with tortilla chips and there's no way you can get a whole shrimp on the chip.  But the taste was decent overall, nothing spectacular so I probably won't order it again
2) Grilled artichokes - Fresh, good, seasoned properly.  Would order it again.
3) Calamari - very good, came with fried lemon slices too which is an interesting touch.  the sauce was a little spicy.  Would recommend trying this and I would order it again.

Rolls
1) CA roll - good that it was real crab meat, not some doughy fake ones.  There was too much rice which will fill you up quickly.  I prefer less rice.  Probably would not order it again just because I don't think this is not a signature dish.

2) Rock 'n roll - Too much rice, couldn't find/taste the unagi (bbq eel).  Again, it tastes ok, but wouldn't order it again.

3) Firecracker roll - We had this last time, loved it.  This time it was still good.  For some reason, this roll doesn't not have as much rice as the other too, which is good.  Would order it again

Entrees
1) Mahi mahi fish of the day - came with grilled veggie, sweet potato fries, mahi mahi served with tomatillo avocado sauce.  The fish had a cajun spice rub that was a bit pungent.  The sweet potato fries as always was great.  Grilled veggie - can't go wrong with this.  Don't like the spice rub so won't order it again

2) Grilled shrimp teriyaki bowl - Very tasty, great teriyaki sauce.  Liked that it came with veggie and mushroom, chopped and mixed into the rice.   Would order it again

3) Ono fish of the day - very good.  came with fried onion rings that were delicious.  came with pineapple fried rice which everyone loved.  the fish was grilled on banana leaf so it had a great aroma and taste.  would order it gain.

4) Organic chinook fish of the day - it came with grilled artichoke and brown rice and the fish was served with a tomato sauce.  it was fresh and decently good.  i'm not a big grilled salmon fan so that's why i won't order it again. 

5) Grilled Korean beef (another daily special) - I don't eat beef so I can't comment, but my husband thought it was decent.  This place is called "Pacific Catch" so I'd stick with the fish but if you have a friend that doesn't like seafood, at least there is an option to have meat.

Overall, I'd recommend this place and would go again.  Good atmosphere for couples or groups.  Great service.  Nice decor and clean.  Lots of cocktails, decent size wine list.

2/14/08: This is visit #3.

Cocktail Review:
Sun Burn - average; menu says there's a tropical syrup in it which I think is what gave it a little after taste of some sort.
Some cocktail with Gin 209, kiwi and cucumber juice - DELICIOUS!  We had to order a 2nd one.  

House salad - Good size, very fresh greens, salad dressing was yummy, if you like a Japanese type kinda dressing w/miso; The mushrooms that were in the salad was delicious.  They're cooked in some sauce, not some uncooked mushroom.

Catch of the Day Fish and Chips - The ling cod fish and chips is the freshest fish and chips we ever had.  It's lightly fried, lightly crispy and covered in a thick batter where you eat a lot of batter and not fish.  The fish was cooked to perfection and fresh and was juicy.  The sweet potato fries as usual, are always yummy!!!

Salmon and mahi mahi taco: Both were good and fresh.  The salsa on each one are good.  The salmon one has a spicy kick to it so if you like spicy, try that.

excerpts: The sweet potato fries were ok.
Lorraine L. ordered the mixed the mixed basket which had skewered coconut shrimp, fish fillets, and deep fried oysters.
The coconut shrimp was hard to eat.
She tried to slip one of the shrimps off the skewer and was having a hard time cuz the breading would come right off.
The actual taste of it wasn't too impressive.
Her oysters were somewhat chewy and her fish was just ok.
Another friend ordered the special for the night which was sea bass...which they didnt have
so they said they had trout instead.
Hmm...trout is way different than sea bass last time I checked.
Anyway she got the trout but was pretty flustered about it.
The rest of the friends ordered fish & chips.
Oh...if you wanna ask about how big the fish is...
sweet potato fries.author: Adrian D.
sweet potato fries.review:
Uhm...where do I start....oh....they have a parking lot.  Ok I think that's the highlight of the place oh...and the place looks nice.  Now on to the food.  Hmm...bleh.  That's what I thought about it.  So I ordered the 2 fish taco platter and ordered one grilled mahi mahi and the other one a baja style.  Both of them were pretty bland.  The sweet potato fries were ok.  Lorraine L. ordered the mixed the mixed basket which had skewered coconut shrimp, fish fillets, and deep fried oysters.  The coconut shrimp was hard to eat.  She tried to slip one of the shrimps off the skewer and was having a hard time cuz the breading would come right off.  The actual taste of it wasn't too impressive.  Her oysters were somewhat chewy and her fish was just ok.  Another friend ordered the special for the night which was sea bass...which they didnt have so they said they had trout instead.  Hmm...trout is way different than sea bass last time I checked.  Anyway she got the trout but was pretty flustered about it.  The rest of the friends ordered fish & chips.  Oh...if you wanna ask about how big the fish is...don't ask.  

I think the only reason why I might come back is to try out there late night happy hour.  Other than that I wouldn't come back. =/

excerpts: Went with a large group for dinner on a Saturday night-the sweet potato fries were the hit of the evening, so be sure to order these as an appetizer.
They do bring pretzel goldfish and an edamame appetizer on the house but we found the edamame difficult to eat.
They were already shelled and no servicing spoon was available to scoop these out of the dish.
I had the escolar special which was meaty, flavorful and cooked just right.
Just a bit on the pricey side
but if you work for UCSF, show your ID
and you'll get a 10% discount which certainly helps!
sweet potato fries.author: Al L.
sweet potato fries.review: Went with a large group for dinner on a Saturday night-the sweet potato fries were the hit of the evening, so be sure to order these as an appetizer.  They do bring pretzel goldfish and an edamame appetizer on the house but we found the edamame difficult to eat.  They were already shelled and no servicing spoon was available to scoop these out of the dish.  I had the escolar special which was meaty, flavorful and cooked just right.  Just a bit on the pricey side but if you work for UCSF, show your ID and you'll get a 10% discount which certainly helps!

excerpts: loved complimentary edamame and goldfish pretzels, fish tacos, and sweet potato fries
sweet potato fries.author: Andrea B.
sweet potato fries.review: loved complimentary edamame and goldfish pretzels, fish tacos, and sweet potato fries :)

excerpts: Edamame, wasabi rice bowls, seaweed salad, grilled fish (mahi mahi and tuna are always good), fish tacos, sweet potato fries --
all tasty.
Sometimes the fried fish tacos are a little fishy tasting because they don't always get all of that gray stuff off whatever fish they use for that...
but that's kind of a nit.
Interior's nice too
sweet potato fries.author: Steve R.
sweet potato fries.review:
The rare intersection of great food AND reasonable prices.  Edamame, wasabi rice bowls, seaweed salad, grilled fish (mahi mahi and tuna are always good), fish tacos, sweet potato fries -- all tasty.   Sometimes the fried fish tacos are a little fishy tasting because they don't always get all of that gray stuff off whatever fish they use for that... but that's kind of a nit.  Interior's nice too (though if you require super fancy-schmancy, this might not be you spot).  

Plus -- they actually have (limited) free, dedicated parking.

excerpts: The Mixed Catch Basket was served with sweet potato fries.
It was the probably the best component of the dish.
You couldn't go to far off track with fried foods, and this basket was no exception.
Good, but nothing worth writing about.
sweet potato fries.author: Bor C.
sweet potato fries.review:
Located on a fairly busy corner of 9th and Lincoln, this new restaurant replaced the art gallery, bar, restaurant thing that was here before. The décor was marine themed, and the place appeared clean. Being my first visit here, and sitting in one of the booths I had an impression that they may have some kind of identity confusion. I don't know if it was because the name gave me the assumption they were a California Cusine restaurant with a slant of seafood offering, or the extensive menu that included American entrees, alongside Japanese items like sushi, teriyaki, and Mexican with the tacos. The edamame they served as soon as we were seated tells me they are Japanese. Maybe it was the Hawaiin entrees, or the fact that the visible cook staff was completely Hispanic, except for the one white guy calling out orders at the pass. Mexliforniapanese Dining. Nah, doesn't have the right ring to it. 

We were disappointed in the ahi tuna poke appetizer. The ahi was fresh enough, but the seasoning was monotone, and overdone. There is no evidence of poke seasoning. Just soy sauce with bits of red and green onions. I love salty foods, but even I thought this dish was too salty, and finishes flat.

Our entrees were Wasabi Ahi Tuna sandwich, and the Mixed Catch Basket. The Ahi Sandwich was over-seared (see Medium Well), and missing any kind of a wasabi bite. It tasted good, with the avocado slices providing a nice buttery texture for the sandwich and a somewhat experimental addition of pink ginger slices (yes, the same ones served alongside sushi) that didn't do much. It was an okay sandwich, for what its worth. I couldn't help but think this was some deli's version of a sushi on a french roll - take a roll, replace rice and seaweed with bread. The Mixed Catch Basket was served with sweet potato fries. It was the probably the best component of the dish. You couldn't go to far off track with fried foods, and this basket was no exception. Good, but nothing worth writing about. I should stop here.

The coleslaw that accompanied our entrees were suprisingly good. It was a light cream dressing with a distinct Korean-type pickling tang I detected. It was light and palette refreshing.

Overall, it was an okay experience. The place is nice to be in, be seen in, but not particularly nice to eat. I'll probably be back only when we are doing something in the park, and want to hit a bar... Nah, I'll walk the extra block and head to Yancy's instead.

excerpts: I love the sweet potato fries and the dipping sauces they come with.
The calamari is excellent too.
sweet potato fries.author: James P.
sweet potato fries.review: Wooo!!! I love the sweet potato fries and the dipping sauces they come with. The calamari is excellent too. My salmon teriyaki rice bowl was a bit too sweet, but the fish was cooked perfectly. The wait was a bit long, but the prices were decent, and I look forward to coming back for dessert. Dulce de leche spring rolls and mango cheesecake sounds interesting. If you're craving fish or Asian fusion, Pacific Catch is a pretty safe bet.

excerpts: I love the sweet potato fries.
And my friend ordered the Poke and that was fantastic.
I would definitely go there again.
And they have their own PARKING in the back.
sweet potato fries.author: Julie K.
sweet potato fries.review: Food was fabulous. I love the sweet potato fries. And my friend ordered the Poke and that was fantastic. I would definitely go there again. And they have their own PARKING in the back.

excerpts: The Sweet Potato Fries are bangin.
sweet potato fries.author: JD D.
sweet potato fries.review: The Sweet Potato Fries are bangin.  And if you ever order one of the teriyaki bowls, get the teriyaki sauce on the side, cuz i had waaay too much sauce in my salmon bowl.  I haven't been here in a while.. I need to go back.

excerpts: The Sweet Potato Fries are pretty awesome and the Japanese Rice Bowls are pretty good, but overall it's a little bit pricey for the quality.
sweet potato fries.author: Nicole C.
sweet potato fries.review: The Sweet Potato Fries are pretty awesome and the Japanese Rice Bowls are pretty good, but overall it's a little bit pricey for the quality.

excerpts: I'm a big fan of the shrimp tacos and the sweet potato fries.
A great casual spot for a weekend lunch or a quick week night dinner.
sweet potato fries.author: Sara A.
sweet potato fries.review: I love this place and I am so excited that they opened one up in my neighborhood.  I love the food at the Chestnut location, but the place is so small and there never an available table so I get the food to go.   The 9th Ave location is huge so I don't think there will ever be a problem getting a table here.  The love that there is a variety of healthy dishes at really good prices. As long as you like seafood, there is something for everyone (salads, fish tacos, rice bowels, sandwiches, suchi, etc).  I'm a big fan of the shrimp tacos and the sweet potato fries.   A great casual spot for a weekend lunch or a quick week night dinner.

excerpts: Although the coconut shrimp wasn't great, we enjoyed the sweet potato fries and my fish.
sweet potato fries.author: edie t.
sweet potato fries.review:
cleanliness: 4/5
food quality:  2/5
service: 3/5
cost: $15-$20
other:

2nd Visit: I came here with a friend after another restaurant we wanted
to go to was closed. 

My friend ordered the poke and the traditional baja taco. I had the bbq salmon taco and the spicy chicken. The spicy chicken was not spicy and lacked flavor. The salmon was okay, but also lacked flavor. 

the service was pretty good but nothing outstanding compared to my last visit.

1st Visit:

cleanliness: 4/5
food quality:  3.5/5
service: 5/5
cost: $15-$20
other:

Found parking in the lot, probably because it was early. I came here with Helen and we sat at the bar per my request so we could grab a drink and watch the basketball game. 

She ordered the coconut shrimp and I ordered the catch of the day. She ordered a martini and I got a dark and stormy (which was great!)

The bartender was really friendly and chatted with us from time to time. The nuggets ended up winning and Helen was a great date as always. Unforunately the bartender thought Helen wanted the coconut shrimp appetizer, but she wanted the full entree. Although the coconut shrimp wasn't great, we enjoyed the sweet potato fries and my fish.

The bartender was super and comped us on the appetizer and by the end of the meal we left happy.

excerpts: I ordered the Ahi Tuni wasbai bowl and he had the mixed catch with sweet potato fries.
Both of us were really happy with our meals.
Really good food and good prices.
The only reason I gave it 4 stars was that the service wasn't so great.
I think she was pretty busy though.
We will definitley be back!
sweet potato fries.author: Sarah C.
sweet potato fries.review: My husband I tried this place for the first time last night. I have heard about it so  many times and we were in the area and hungry so we figured it was good time. We walked in at 8:30 on a Friday night and no wait! That was great. The food was very good. I ordered the Ahi Tuni wasbai bowl and he had the mixed catch with sweet potato fries. Both of us were really happy with our meals. Really good food and good prices. The only reason I gave it 4 stars was that the service wasn't so great. I think she was pretty busy though. We will definitley be back!

excerpts: The sweet potato fries weren't that great... they're better at elephant bar.
But overall this place is awesome.
bill came to about $35 for those 3 dishes which isn't too bad.
Will definitely come back!
sweet potato fries.author: Lauren L.
sweet potato fries.review: Came here on a Saturday night and it wasn't super packed which was nice. Service is friendly and nice. The atmosphere is great. The place is clean which is always a plus.Their food is awesomeeeeeeee! And they even had chopsticks which was nice :) haha They have a lot of variety on their menu which is great. The prices are a little high but worth it. We ordered the calimari ( awesome ), fish and chips (okay), and let's get saucy roll (AWESOME!). The sweet potato fries weren't that great... they're better at elephant bar. But overall this place is awesome. bill came to about $35 for those 3 dishes which isn't too bad. Will definitely come back!

excerpts: The food is really great too (sweet potato fries with yummy dips!)
We usually sit in the bar and the service can be a tad on the slow side.
But, if you're just chillin anyway, it doesn't really matter.
sweet potato fries.author: a e.
sweet potato fries.review: I really like this place.  Very chill and always a good choice for happy hour or a leisurly drink.  The food is really great too (sweet potato fries with yummy dips!)  We usually sit in the bar and the service can be a tad on the slow side.  But, if you're just chillin anyway, it doesn't really matter.

excerpts: Sweet potato fries and calamari were decent.
Dipping sauces were excellent.
sweet potato fries.author: Aimee L.
sweet potato fries.review:
Don't do it.  I was really excited to see a new restaurant open in the area and decided to give it a try.  

Pros:  Service was excellent, we had the nicest waitress ever.  She was knowledgeable and didn't push drinks/apps/desserts on us.  Sweet potato fries and calamari were decent.  Dipping sauces were excellent.  Poke flavor was great.

Cons:  Worst ahi tuna (sesame and seared) ever!  You can tell it just came out of the freezer.  Big let down.  Cost is high for quality of food.

I say skip it, and go to a neighboring restaurant for better food.

excerpts: Sweet potato fries?
Meh.
But then sweet potatoes aren't my favorite to begin with.
sweet potato fries.author: Bryan Z.
sweet potato fries.review: Solid dinner time meal... I had a shrimp taco and salmon taco with a side salad. I love that they bring out Pepperidge Farm pretzel goldfish with edamame for you to snack on. The shrimp taco with mango salsa was good but the mango was a little bland so I was disappointed. Maybe I had my hopes set too high for that one? The BBQ salmon taco was outstanding. Good fish, great taste with the BBQ sauce, worked well in a taco. Sweet potato fries? Meh. But then sweet potatoes aren't my favorite to begin with.

excerpts: Ok, so it's not the beloved Canvas Gallery, it's not Gary Danko....but still good neighborhood spot with tasty Mai Tais, good sweet potato fries, fish tacos and and friendly bartenders.
If you want to kick back, just enjoy a low-key bite to eat or happy hour by GG Park...
well, not a bad choice whatsoever...
sweet potato fries.author: Alissa V.
sweet potato fries.review: Ok, so it's not the beloved Canvas Gallery, it's not Gary Danko....but still good neighborhood spot with tasty Mai Tais, good sweet potato fries, fish tacos and and friendly bartenders.  If you want to kick back, just enjoy a low-key bite to eat or happy hour by GG Park...well, not a bad choice whatsoever...

excerpts: For an extra $1.95, you can get the delicious sweet potato fries with your sandwich.
sweet potato fries.author: Jenn O.
sweet potato fries.review: I really enjoy eating here. I alternate between my two favorites whenever I eat here: a wasabi bowl (usually poke) or the wasabi ahi sandwich. You can't go wrong with either! For an extra $1.95, you can get the delicious sweet potato fries with your sandwich. If you sign up for the e-newsletter, you get a free appetizer (alternates between baja shrimp ceviche with tortilla chips and poke) with any $12.95 order. There is a small parking lot behind the restaurant. I think it fits about eight cars. Looking for parking around here is not fun, especially on a Friday or Saturday night. Making a reservation doesn't hurt to help you get seated quicker! So far service has been good.

excerpts: The sweet potato fries were average.
sweet potato fries.author: Swaz E.
sweet potato fries.review:
The hostess could not mask her lack of enthusiasm, her "enjoy your meal" came out like a curse, 

The fried oysters were good.  The fries were average and lacked salt, there was no salt on the table and the waiter was largely absent.  

The cole slaw portion was about two tablespoons, really.  C'mon guys this is cabbage, kick down a little roughage with the deep fried meal.  

The mahi tacos tasted like lime juice.

The black beans were okay, small portion like the cole slaw, but that was all I needed.

The sweet potato fries were average.

I could go back, but I won't have high hopes.  It is a good idea but the execution is lacking.

excerpts: My tacos came with lots of sweet and salty sweet potato fries.
They were the best I've had to date (although I've only tried them 2 other times in my life).
My boyfriend at the time ordered the ahi sandwich and thoroughly enjoyed it.
I also ordered a Mai Tai in the middle of the day and it was not only sufficiently strong, but tasty as well.
Thank you helpful waitress, for assisting me in finalizing that selection.
All in all, I had a good experience, but after reading the rest of the Yelp reviews, I get the feeling that the food here can be a little hit and miss.
sweet potato fries.author: LaSha G.
sweet potato fries.review: I believed that there was a high probability that this place was going to suck big time when I walked in.  The space was HUGE *by SF standards* and had that sort of Texas Big Chain restaurant feel to it. But I was wrong. I thoroughly enjoyed my meal here.  I had the barbecue shrimp tacos and the fried mahi mahi tacos.  Both tacos were yummy, but i liked the shrimp ones best..  My tacos came with lots of sweet and salty sweet potato fries.  They were the best I've had to date (although I've only tried them 2 other times in my life).  My boyfriend at the time ordered the ahi sandwich and thoroughly enjoyed it.  I also ordered a Mai Tai in the middle of the day and it was not only sufficiently strong, but tasty as well.  Thank you helpful waitress, for assisting me in finalizing that selection.  All in all, I had a good experience, but after reading the rest of the Yelp reviews, I get the feeling that the food here can be a little hit and miss.

excerpts: Oh, and had the sweet potato fries - hella good!
They were nice and crispy.
Another cool thing was that they gave us pretzel Goldfish crackers and edamame as snacks before we ordered!!
The service here was also great!!
I only gave this place 3 stars since the food was pretty average but kind of pricey for what it was.
And the place could use better ventilation (the kitchen is open though, which was kind of nice).
Even though I miss Canvas, I'm glad this place is here.
sweet potato fries.author: Michelle H.
sweet potato fries.review: My boyfriend and I tried this place on Monday and I thought the food was just average.  The place is really nice and modern looking. I made reservations through Opentable and got a seat right away.  We got there around 7 and there were still plenty of tables open. I also liked how this place has a parking lot - small, but we were able to get a space.  We ordered the calamari appetizer which was very good! - probably some of the best I've ever had.  For entrees, we got the 3 piece fish n chips and the 3 taco platter.  The fish n chips were average - seasoning was good but not as crispy as I usually like.  The tacos were tasty - we had one of each: cod, tropical shrimp, and i think mahi mahi.  Overall, all of the seafood tasted fresh.  Oh, and had the sweet potato fries - hella good!  They were nice and crispy.  Another cool thing was that they gave us pretzel Goldfish crackers and edamame as snacks before we ordered!!  The service here was also great!!  I only gave this place 3 stars since the food was pretty average but kind of pricey for what it was.  And the place could use better ventilation (the kitchen is open though, which was kind of nice).  Even though I miss Canvas, I'm glad this place is here.

excerpts: The best part was the sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: Amanda H.
sweet potato fries.review: I wouldn't come back to Pacific Catch.  Our meal was too expensive for what we got, which wasn't very flavorful.  The best part was the sweet potato fries.

excerpts: My all time favorite is the Spicy Ahi-Tuna sandwich with sweet potato fries on their lunch menu.
The tuna is seared to perfection and the sweet potato fries is crispy and fresh!
I also really enjoyed their Ahi Poke and their sushi rolls are BIG!!
The wasabi rice bowls are also really good
, it's kinda like a de-constructed sushi with rice, seaweed, some kind of fish or meat, ginger, and fish roe.
If you are really hungry, then the wasabi rice bowl is the way to go.
They also have fish and chip, island tacos, and fresh fish of the day entrees.
Overall this is a great place to come with a group of friends and they also have a full bar for happy hour!
sweet potato fries.author: Annie L.
sweet potato fries.review: I'm usually pretty weary about "Asian Fusion" restaurants because I feel they are often over priced "Asian" inspired food like Betelnut. But, I am pleasantly surprised by Pacific Catch. This place is more like Hawaiian Fusion and the food is absolutely delicious! My all time favorite is the Spicy Ahi-Tuna sandwich with sweet potato fries on their lunch menu. The tuna is seared to perfection and the sweet potato fries is crispy and fresh! I also really enjoyed their Ahi Poke and their sushi rolls are BIG!! The wasabi rice bowls are also really good, it's kinda like a de-constructed sushi with rice, seaweed, some kind of fish or meat, ginger, and fish roe. If you are really hungry, then the wasabi rice bowl is the way to go. They also have fish and chip, island tacos, and fresh fish of the day entrees. Overall this is a great place to come with a group of friends and they also have a full bar for happy hour!

excerpts: We ordered the California Roll and the Shrimp Tempura, we also had the sweet potato fries...
yum i love those!
Their sweet potato fries did not disappoint, my husband and I finished the whole basket!
I can't say the same for the sushi rolls.
After a couple of pieces, they did not taste right to me.
I just didn't like the carrot in the California roll.
Plus it seemed like they put wasabi in the actual rolls
and I didn't like that since I don't eat wasabi anyway.
My husband ended up finishing both the rolls but he didn't really enjoy it.
So just 2 stars for the excellent potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: Christine P.
sweet potato fries.review: We were going to the Japanese Tea Garden but before we went inside we decided to eat lunch first because we were starving. They only had cookies and tea in the garden and the nearby cafe was full of people and we didnt want to wait in line. They told us to walk along for 10mins and we'll find other food places so we did. The first restaurant we saw was Pacific Catch Grill. We decided go to in and check it out, we were excited to try their sushi. We ordered the California Roll and the Shrimp Tempura, we also had the sweet potato fries...yum i love those! Their sweet potato fries did not disappoint, my husband and I finished the whole basket! I can't say the same for the sushi rolls. After a couple of pieces, they did not taste right to me. I just didn't like the carrot in the California roll. Plus it seemed like they put wasabi in the actual rolls and I didn't like that since I don't eat wasabi anyway. My husband ended up finishing both the rolls but he didn't really enjoy it. So just 2 stars for the excellent potato fries.

excerpts: i love their sweet potato fries.
If you dont feel like steak, fast food, or just dont know where to eat....go to pacific catch!
sweet potato fries.author: Linda H.
sweet potato fries.review: Came here for my bf's birthday.  There were a few tables open, but they wont seat us.  We had to wait about 15 minutes before they seat us on one of the open tables that were empty since we got there.  The food is great!  i love their sweet potato fries.  If you dont feel like steak, fast food, or just dont know where to eat....go to pacific catch!

excerpts: I love the baja style mahi mahi and sweet potato fries.
You can sit outdoors if you have a dog, or if it's just a nice day.
There's a teensy parking lot, but usually ample parking on Lincoln or in the park.
The servers and bartenders are really nice.
They take reservations.
The only thing to avoid are the booths over by the bathrooms.
Otherwise, what's not to LOVE?
sweet potato fries.author: L J.
sweet potato fries.review: This is my favorite restaurant for a normal (non-'fancy') out-to-dinner night, or lunch, or happy hour, or to take out of town visitors. The menu is varied enough to please all comers, with asian style, mexican style, and rotating specials. The wasabi bowls are an incredible value, so much delicious sashimi (or cooked salmon or crab or unagi) and seaweed salad, avocado and veggies that I can never finish it all. The sushi rolls are huge and delicious (try the shiitake/asparagus/miso roll!), and they have good prices on tap beers and unique cocktails. The house cured salmon is delectable. I love the baja style mahi mahi and sweet potato fries. You can sit outdoors if you have a dog, or if it's just a nice day. There's a teensy parking lot, but usually ample parking on Lincoln or in the park. The servers and bartenders are really nice. They take reservations. The only thing to avoid are the booths over by the bathrooms. Otherwise, what's not to LOVE?

excerpts: The poke app was excellent, but the complete winner at the table was the fish and chips with the sweet potato fries.
Unlike 99% of fish in such baskets are caked with batter; generally by the time I've eaten one piece I have to peel n' eat.
This was like no other.
The fish was tender, and very lightly fried; probably the best I've had.
The sweet potato fries are terrific too, and a wonderful change.
Yum.
sweet potato fries.author: Gwen E.
sweet potato fries.review: Mix 'n match service with solid food sums it up.  Party of four, we decide to wait in the bar and get some drinks and a snack while waiting for the table.  The bar was really packed, but we found a great area to settle in and proceeded to try to achieve our consumables-related goal.  The waiter in the bar was spacey at best; he took a drink and food order from one of us (four people seated around a low table facing one another) and turned a left.  Hello?  The successful orderer had to chase him down to get him to come back.  Fortunately, we were quickly called to our table and the odd service became efficient and professional.  The poke app was excellent, but the complete winner at the table was the fish and chips with the sweet potato fries.  Unlike 99% of fish in such baskets are caked with batter; generally by the time I've eaten one piece I have to peel n' eat.  This was like no other.  The fish was tender, and very lightly fried; probably the best I've had.   The sweet potato fries are terrific too, and a wonderful change.  Yum.

excerpts: They kept raving about the sweet potato fries and
Now, onto the basket of sweet potato fries we ordered.
Again, my coworkers would not stop talking about them, so you can guess how excited I was to try them.
I wasn't disappointed, but I've had better.
The sweet and sour dipping sauce was a great condiment to go with the fries.
Just pour it from the store bought bottle and serve...so simple!
I believe the other sauce was wasabi something, but I couldn't really tell.
It didn't have much flavor.
I can't pinpoint exactly what I didn't like about the fries.
I mean, they were crispy, cooked fresh and tasty.
sweet potato fries.author: Karen S.
sweet potato fries.review:
I went to Pacific Catch because it was highly recommended by three of my coworkers.  They kept raving about the sweet potato fries and because I'm such a big fan of the "healthy" fries, I just had to taste it for myself.

I was warned about the lack of parking, but we got lucky when we found a spot in the restaurant's small lot in the back.  I never knew how booming the area was until Friday.  The weather was just perfect, even at 9pm.  There were so many people walking around 9th Ave. and around GG park in tshirts and shorts.  Pacific Catch was the perfect place to have dinner.  I loved the restaurant - very casual, big and it just reminded me of being in Hawaii.  I made a reservation on Open Table just 3 hours before and we were seated right away.

The hostess was nice and cordial, but we didn't get much quality service after that.  I have nothing really to say, nothing good or bad.  The conversation was kept at the bare freakin minimum.

My boyfriend opted to get a bunch of appetizers for himself.  The calamari, shrimp ceviche and coconut shrimp.  He originally asked for the crispy oysters, but they ran out (so he got the shrimp instead).  We were both surprised to find whole shrimp in the ceviche.  It was a refreshing dish, but could've used a little bit more flavor.  I ordered the Hawaiian BBQ Surf and Turf.  The asparagus had to be substituted with bak choy cause they were out of that, too.  I'd hate to hear what else they ran out of, but hey, it was hot and I'm sure they were busy all day long.  The shrimp was cooked perfect.  It didn't occur to me until I saw the medium rare steak strips that the waitress hadn't asked me how I wanted it cooked.  It would've been 10x more delicious if it was prepared the way I like it (medium well).  I wasn't a big fan of the pineapple fried rice only because I don't really like pineapples.  But my bf said it was good.

Now, onto the basket of sweet potato fries we ordered.  Again, my coworkers would not stop talking about them, so you can guess how excited I was to try them.  I wasn't disappointed, but I've had better.  The sweet and sour dipping sauce was a great condiment to go with the fries.  Just pour it from the store bought bottle and serve...so simple!  I believe the other sauce was wasabi something, but I couldn't really tell.  It didn't have much flavor.  I can't pinpoint exactly what I didn't like about the fries.  I mean, they were crispy, cooked fresh and tasty.  I guess my coworkers pumped it up so much that I was expecting a lot more.

Nonetheless, I'd go back.  I've read great things about the fish tacos and the dulce de leche dessert that I was too full to try.  And if you know me, you'd know that I live true to "there's always room for dessert."

excerpts: must get the sweet potato fries!
its the best and there beef bowl is really good.
the steak is so tender and flavorful, but the sauce for the rice is okie.
must try this place and the prices are decent.
very casual environment
sweet potato fries.author: Karen H.
sweet potato fries.review: my friend told me about pacific catch, but we would have to go the one in marine until the one on irving opened. the tuna poke is really good. they give u big portions fr a good price, but sometimes is a lil too salty. must get the sweet potato fries! its the best and there beef bowl is really good. the steak is so tender and flavorful, but the sauce for the rice is okie. must try this place and the prices are decent. very casual environment

excerpts: it also came with a side of sweet potato fries and a tiny scoop of coleslaw.
my sister got two tacos, totaling about $12...kind of pricey for my taste, but it came with a super small salad and a tiny scoop of beans.
sweet potato fries.author: Ryanne L.
sweet potato fries.review:
i came here once and will never come back again.

i'm not a fan of shellfish, but i have my moments when i'm craving seafood or will tolerate it. i wasn't picky this night and my sister wanted seafood...she normally comes here..but i shall NEVER return...EVER.

when i first came here, i ordered the mixed basket of fried things..i dont' remember what it was called, but i seemed like a good deal and i couldn't decide on a single item to order, so it seemed like a great decision...and then it was only $13.95. it also came with a side of sweet potato fries and a tiny scoop of coleslaw. my sister got two tacos, totaling about $12...kind of pricey for my taste, but it came with a super small salad and a tiny scoop of beans. i don't remember if she said it was good or anything, but i will never come back because i got food poisoning. 

my meal was free due to a mis-communication with the kitchen and our waiter, but food poisoning really takes those stars away. i went home feeling fine, but about 3 hours later started feeling a gag reflex. i felt it for abuot 2 hours and then i finally threw up...for about 15 minutes. it was disgusting. and it wasn't anything else i ate that day because all i ate was fruit...and i'm pretty sure it was the deep fried oysters because they tasted horrible, but for some reason, i was determined to finish one. i thought it was just because i didn't like oysters but they didn't seem too bad deep fried...little did i know, it ruined my experience of this restaurant forever. and since it was food poisoning, i would give this place 0 stars..but i'm obligated to give it 1 because of the lack of the 0.

excerpts: Loved the Wasabi bowls and sweet potato fries.
sweet potato fries.author: David L.
sweet potato fries.review: Great Variey on Menu, Everything was fresh.  Great appetizers!  Loved the Wasabi bowls and sweet potato fries.

excerpts: The sweet potato fries were to die for.
sweet potato fries.author: jennifer h.
sweet potato fries.review: So delicious.  The service was a bit slow, but in the end it was worth the wait.  The sweet potato fries were to die for.

excerpts: had the calamari and thai coconut shrimp for starters then had the sturgeon with sweet potato fries and the hawaiian style surf and turf.
for dessert had the mochi fondo and another dessert with fried caramel thingy with vanilla ice cream.
wow.
everything was soooo good.
service was one of the best and the restaurant was very nice.
it was realltybusy and our food still came out really fast.
i couldnt stop saying "mmmm yummy
" i would definately come back.
i want to go right now again!
sweet potato fries.author: Cory Y.
sweet potato fries.review: food was excellent. had the calamari and thai coconut shrimp for starters then had the sturgeon with sweet potato fries and the hawaiian style surf and turf. for dessert had the mochi fondo and another dessert with fried caramel thingy with vanilla ice cream. wow. everything was soooo good. service was one of the best and the restaurant was very nice. it was realltybusy and our food still came out really fast. i couldnt stop saying "mmmm yummy" i would definately come back. i want to go right now again!

excerpts: It came with sweet potato fries which also were not greasy.
His fish and chips were delicious!
The fish was perfect, not the kind that tastes fishy, but a good crisp light flavor.
Also the coleslaw was awesome.
Sometimes it can be too flavorful with too much mayo.
It was just a nice light refreshing accent to the rest of the dish.
Just everything was great, the service, atmosphere and food.
i would definitely check this place out!!!!
sweet potato fries.author: Chelsey L.
sweet potato fries.review: I have heard mixed reviews of this restaurant from people so I finally decided to check it out last night.  We walked in around 7 and even though it looked pretty full we were seated within a few minutes.  The whole placeis very open and you can see the kitchen or bar form anywhere in the restaurant which I really like.  We started out with the Cabo Calamari which was amazing. It had just the right amount of batter on it, not greasy and came with a delicous spicy aioli sauce for dipping.  They actually bring you a side of edamame and pretzels to start with which I thought would be an odd combination but its really nice together.   I ordered the mai tai which was kind of sweet but really good.  Their service was great, fast , friendly, not over bearing or neglectful, just the right amount of attention.  My boyfriend ordered the fish and chips and I ordered the coconut shrimp..MY shrimp was the perfect blend of sweet and crunchy and I actually used the sauce from the calamari which was delicious on the sweet shrimp.  It came with sweet potato fries which also were not greasy.  His fish and chips were delicious! The fish was perfect, not the kind that tastes fishy, but a good crisp light flavor.  Also the coleslaw was awesome.  Sometimes it can be too flavorful with too much mayo.  It was just a nice light refreshing accent to the rest of the dish.   Just everything was great, the service, atmosphere and food. i would definitely check this place out!!!!

excerpts: My husband usually likes getting the fried fish and sweet potato fries.
The salads and sushi rolls and calamari are good too.
This is not an elegant choice
but it's casual, comfortable, and consistent.
It's a relatively good value.
Also, pretty fast service.
Make a reservation or call ahead though to get seated quite a bit faster.
sweet potato fries.author: GG P.
sweet potato fries.review: For what it is, an american-asian-seafood fusion chain restaurant, I think this place is great.  The menu rarely changes but the choices are good and the prices are fairly reasonable.  The service is pretty good, usually with a nice smile and good attitude.  The bathrooms are usually clean.  The kitchen is visible from the dining room and looks clean too.  They have a microscopic parking lot but parking is often found nearby in Golden Gate Park without too much trouble (unless something is going on in the park that day) and the atmosphere is family-friendly, cheery, and open.  Not bad at all for a lunch or dinner with friends or family.  I like the chopsticks available on the table and the teryaki bowls.  My husband usually likes getting the fried fish and sweet potato fries.  The salads and sushi rolls and calamari are good too.  This is not an elegant choice but it's casual, comfortable, and consistent.  It's a relatively good value.  Also, pretty fast service.  Make a reservation or call ahead though to get seated quite a bit faster.

excerpts: also crispy catch of the day with their sweet potato fries which are good, but not thaaat good.
so if you dont toss your money around like trash, stay away from this seemingly trendy fusion of a restaurant more like upscale fastfood joint.
sweet potato fries.author: Porkers T.
sweet potato fries.review: this place is overpriced for the quality and quantity of food you get. you could get better quality and quantity at whole foods market or bristol farms. really. because thats what it reminds me of. i had a hawaiian poke wasabi bowl, which tasted just okay. also crispy catch of the day with their sweet potato fries which are good, but not thaaat good. so if you dont toss your money around like trash, stay away from this seemingly trendy fusion of a restaurant more like upscale fastfood joint.

excerpts: Pretty pricey place.. the two of us ended up sharing the Thai coconut shrimp & a tempura shrimp roll from the appetizer menu.
Food was really tasty and even though we just got appetizers it still left me satisfied.
The restaurant itself had a nice ambiance and it was very clean.
Service was good.
thai coconut shrimp.author: Mirelle M.
thai coconut shrimp.review:
Pretty pricey place.. the two of us ended up sharing the Thai coconut shrimp & a tempura shrimp roll from the appetizer menu. Food was really tasty and even though we just got appetizers it still left me satisfied. 
The restaurant itself had a nice ambiance and it was very clean. Service was good.

excerpts: I ordered a Thai coconut shrimp soup and the fish of the day served with a baked artichoke.
Both dishes had excellent flavor with some unique notes that I hadn't expected, but everything was incredibly salty.
I normally like a lot of salt in my meals, but between the salty soup, salty fish, and salt-crusted artichoke, it was just too much.
Maybe it would have been tolerable if only one of the dishes was salty, but
even still I think it would have been unpleasant.
This was unfortunate because the other flavors of the meal were great and the service was wonderful too.
I would definitely give them another shot (maybe the chef's taste buds were a bit off that day?)
but I can't recommend it as a sure bet.
thai coconut shrimp.author: Robert F.
thai coconut shrimp.review:
This restaurant is right across the street from Golden Gate Park making its location convenient for anyone in search of seafood after a long day taking in the scenery.  The atmosphere is pleasant and not too loud even when full.

I ordered a Thai coconut shrimp soup and the fish of the day served with a baked artichoke.  Both dishes had excellent flavor with some unique notes that I hadn't expected, but everything was incredibly salty.  I normally like a lot of salt in my meals, but between the salty soup, salty fish, and salt-crusted artichoke, it was just too much.  Maybe it would have been tolerable if only one of the dishes was salty, but even still I think it would have been unpleasant.  This was unfortunate because the other flavors of the meal were great and the service was wonderful too.  I would definitely give them another shot (maybe the chef's taste buds were a bit off that day?) but I can't recommend it as a sure bet.

excerpts: The thai coconut shrimp, poke, and sweet potato fries are always in some kind of rotation when I go.
thai coconut shrimp.author: Kaitlin E.
thai coconut shrimp.review:
I have gone to Pacific Catch since it opened and love it. The thai coconut shrimp, poke, and sweet potato fries are always in some kind of rotation when I go. I also love the salmon salad. PC always has specials as well which adds variation to my rotation! lol
The staff is always nice and the wait time usually isn't too long (20min or less) especially in the day time.

excerpts: Highlights were the peruvian ceviche, thai coconut shrimp, cabo calamari, let's get saucy, and shiso fine.
We ordered double of some of these (fatties, I know), but the other hh options are definitely more normal items you can get anywhere.
This is a great place for happy hour with great prices, and I would for sure recommend it!
thai coconut shrimp.author: Jessica L.
thai coconut shrimp.review:
My girlfriends and I came here for happy hour M-F 4-6pm, 10pm-close only in the bar area.

Hawaiian Poke (regular menu) - SO DELICIOUS! If you come here, you need to get a poke something. The poke cubes are bigger than normal, super fresh, and is so good.

Happy hour menu was all delicious! We ordered Spicy Pacific Martinis and Agave Margaritas, both good. I would recommend the martini on the rocks!

Highlights were the peruvian ceviche, thai coconut shrimp, cabo calamari, let's get saucy, and shiso fine. We ordered double of some of these (fatties, I know), but the other hh options are definitely more normal items you can get anywhere. This is a great place for happy hour with great prices, and I would for sure recommend it!

excerpts: Thai Coconut Shrimp (it's okay, not bad though), Cabo Calamari (meh, nothing special), and
Fries (sweet potato & normal fries, both were decent, good enough for late night munchies).
We were enjoying our beers and some of their starters from the happy hour
UNTIL we saw the table next to us
(mind you - that came and sat AFTER us) getting served with sushi.
WHAT???
How are you going to tell us that we can't order sushi
and then only to see it get served to another table?
You're not only miscommunicating to us, but we also felt like you were treating us unfairly.
We asked to speak to the waitress, and all she could say was, "Oh, I meant we ran out of white rice, and can only serve sushi with brown rice.
"  WHAT???
If you told us that from the beginning, we would've even been okay with that.
But the fact that you didn't?
Lied to us and then got caught?
thai coconut shrimp.author: Carena N.
thai coconut shrimp.review:
I would've liked to give them at least 3 stars for the food, but I was really, really upset by the service that I had to dock them!  

My first experience here was a pleasant one until we were about to order and the first thing the waitress told us was that sushi was not available for order because the "sushi chef walked out on them."  WHAT???  But okay, we settled for the Peruvian Ceviche (which was super nomsy), Thai Coconut Shrimp (it's okay, not bad though), Cabo Calamari (meh, nothing special), and Fries (sweet potato & normal fries, both were decent, good enough for late night munchies).  We were enjoying our beers and some of their starters from the happy hour UNTIL we saw the table next to us (mind you - that came and sat AFTER us) getting served with sushi.  WHAT???  How are you going to tell us that we can't order sushi and then only to see it get served to another table?  You're not only miscommunicating to us, but we also felt like you were treating us unfairly.  We asked to speak to the waitress, and all she could say was, "Oh, I meant we ran out of white rice, and can only serve sushi with brown rice."  WHAT???  If you told us that from the beginning, we would've even been okay with that.  But the fact that you didn't?  Lied to us and then got caught?  WHAT???

Ugh, we made a complaint to the manager of the night about our experience there, and he tried to save himself by saying they had a shortage of rice and had found some more rice later but told his servers to make up lies meanwhile.  WHAT????  To make it up, he compensated each of us with a complimentary starter ticket and I gave you one star back for doing that, but honestly after my first experience there even with the complimentary starter ticket, I don't plan on coming back.

excerpts: Thai Coconut Shrimp $13:
7 pieces of jumbo shrimp with coconut shaving batter, deep fried and with the sweet chili sauce.... mMMmm nom nom nom.
My friend ordered this appetizer and I was a little hesitant.
A lot of restaurants end up giving you small shrimp with crappy battered textured.
This was pretty good, you can taste the actual coconut shavings, the batter was light and crispy and the shrimp was bigger than I thought it would be.
thai coconut shrimp.author: Erica T.
thai coconut shrimp.review:
My friend and I decided to come here for dinner on a Friday night. We decided to sit near the bar area because we would have to wait 15 mins for the next dining table. No biggie for us, I don't mind where I sit.

What I ordered:

Fruit punch (alcoholic cocktail) $9.50: Vodka with various types of fruit juices. This drink was STRONG! My face was red and I was pretty buzzed. I guess if I can feel the alcohol from one drink, it is worth the $9.50 you pay for it because you actually get alcohol in it, none of that watered down drinks at other places.

Thai Coconut Shrimp $13:  7 pieces of jumbo shrimp with coconut shaving batter, deep fried and with the sweet chili sauce.... mMMmm nom nom nom. My friend ordered this appetizer and I was a little hesitant. A lot of restaurants end up giving you small shrimp with crappy battered textured. This was pretty good, you can taste the actual coconut shavings, the batter was light and crispy and the shrimp was bigger than I thought it would be. I was happy with this dish.

California Salmon $12:  This is where I wasn't too happy. This dish came with a side of coleslaw (that wasn't really good) and a side of fries ( I picked the sweet potato fries). The sweet potato fries was good until it got cold and soggy, I recommend you eating it as soon as you get them! As for the sandwich, I was disappointed with it. You get a slice of salmon that you can't even see at all, but can taste it. I swear the slice of the salmon was the thickness of 10 sheets of paper... not the filet that you would expect from a salmon sandwich. The bread was not toasted and so it was cold and not warm and crispy. I think texture is key when making a sandwich, you get the lettuce, tomato, avocado and salmon (all of which have a moist texture -- except the lettuce) and you want the bread to add a different texture... this is just me, I like my bread warm and crispy. As for flavor, it had enough flavor and it was actually tasty, just sad that the main attraction in this sandwich was nowhere to be seen.

Service was great! The lady came by quite often to make sure our water will filled and to make sure we were ok. Overall, the food was ok and the service was great.  I would give 3.5 stars if Yelp let me....

excerpts: and I pretty much always get the Thai Coconut Shrimp.
thai coconut shrimp.author: Lauren L.
thai coconut shrimp.review:
I've been here a good amount of times and I pretty much always get the Thai Coconut Shrimp. With sweet chili sauce, so NOM-tastic!

I've had a guava alcoholic drink of theirs and another tropical one I can't remember but they were delicious, just slightly pricey.

They usually give you a tiny tray of pretzel goldfish and edamame to snack on before your food arrives. Always great service every time I've been here so really can't complain :)

Hubby and I had the Fried Dulce de Leche "Spring Rolls once that comes with vanilla ice cream & caramel sauce. DELICIOUS!

excerpts: Thai Coconut Shrimp:
It's funny because when I had my first bite, I was like "OMG
...it feels like a Thai restaurant in my mouth."
Now looking at the menu as I write this entry, the dish's name is quite befitting.
The coconut flavors are so quintessentially Thai.
I loved the crunch of the crispy coconut flakes and the juicy shrimp.
Frankly, I ended up just eating the coconut flake outer layer instead of the shrimp because it was so good.
thai coconut shrimp.author: Rose J.
thai coconut shrimp.review:
The bar area was already packed at 4:15pm on a Friday but my bf and I were quickly seated to begin our happy hour experience.  We sat at one of the tables with the tall bar stools, which was quite uncomfortable as the bottom of the table was not hollow for our legs to fit into.  My knees kept hitting the sides of the table. 

Now for the food.  I was tempted to order everything on their Bar Bites menu but opted to have just the first 5 items (minus the edamame beans and sweet potato fries) and 2 refreshing cosmos - YUM YUM.  I have been here before but for some reason the food was not as good as I remembered.  I had the following in the order of favorite to least favorite:

Asparagus & Shiitake Roll: It was an interesting vegetarian take on a sushi roll and I found the asparagus tempura and the tiny strings of mushroom and carrot to be quite lovely.

Thai Coconut Shrimp: It's funny because when I had my first bite, I was like "OMG...it feels like a Thai restaurant in my mouth."  Now looking at the menu as I write this entry, the dish's name is quite befitting. The coconut flavors are so quintessentially Thai.  I loved the crunch of the crispy coconut flakes and the juicy shrimp.  Frankly, I ended up just eating the coconut flake outer layer instead of the shrimp because it was so good.  The sweet and sour dipping sauce (that you can buy at any Asian market) was a nice complement. 

Spicy Tuna Roll: This roll was actually spicy, which I appreciated.  It was yummy with the bitterness of the daikon sprouts.  

Hawaiian Poke:  This was a disappointment as everyone had been raving about it.  Mainly because the poke tasted so gummy.  It did not simply melt in my mouth and the chopped green onions were a bit too overpowering.  I do like my poke to be marinated for a few hours so that the fish really soaks up the flavors but I just felt it had been marinated too long.  And the crispy chips started to give me a headache...which I get when I eat too much fried food.  Disappointing.

Spicy Cabo Calamari:  Pretty good but nothing too spectacular.  It was interesting that they also deep-fried slices of lemon and peppers.  The peppers were really yummy and SPICY...hehe...I attempted to eat the lemons too, but I suggest you not do that.      

The food is pretty good and very well priced. They also played good music...love Bob Marley. :) I think I hyped myself up for this dining experience as I hadn't been here in a long time.  I probably won't go for a few months.  I'm sure I will start missing the Coconut Shrimp by then.

excerpts: Let's Get Saucy roll, and Thai Coconut Shrimp...
thai coconut shrimp.author: Jess H.
thai coconut shrimp.review:
Came here for happy hour with my boyfriend and we got the Peruvian ceviche, Let's Get Saucy roll, and Thai Coconut Shrimp...

Food was edible but not the best tasting; the roll tasted like something you'd get at a sushi buffet and the coconut shrimp tasted like shrimp sample you'd get from Costco... 

The ceviche was okay (a bit spicy for my taste buds) but the purple potato chips that came with them were good. To drink, we tried Kona Longboard, a Hawaiian lager which was pretty good.

Service was ok, our server was really attentive in the beginning but it took awhile to flag him down to get the bill.

excerpts: We had the thai coconut shrimp appetizer which was delicious, but rather on the small side.
My bf has the mixed fish basket and I ordered the fried oyster basket.
thai coconut shrimp.author: Liane T.
thai coconut shrimp.review:
I found this place courtesy of you yelpers out there, and because of you all it is now one of my favorites :)

I took my boyfriend out here for a lunch date in the city. When you first walk in, the ambiance is something of it's own. It has a semi-formal feel, and then it has a casual feel and  I like the fusion of different asian decor. It was rather light out in the day so the sun coming in also had a nice feel. 

Our server was one of the most hospitable that I've ever encountered in my dining out life. He was welcoming since we were new to the place and made recommendations accordingly. He even brought out some of the drink samples (non alcoholic haha mind you) so we could figure out what we'd like. 

We had the thai coconut shrimp appetizer which was delicious, but rather on the small side. My bf has the mixed fish basket and I ordered the fried oyster basket. And they both came with the sweet potato fries! It was so tasty & delicious! The jalapeno tartar sauce was also a nice touch.
