Today my poke bowl came with brown rice instead of white.  They don't check up on the guests often and I had to go to the host to ask if I could speak to my server to change my meal.  

Someone came by at the end of meal to ask if we were ready for the check.  We waited 15 minutes for our original server to come by and ask for the check again.  She brought the check after another 10 minutes.  Wait time is long and it was during the lunch hours on a Sunday.. Not very busy at all. 

Great food but I wish the service was better!!

excerpts: We then ordered the Sunset Sushi Roll (which comes in 8 pieces) and Poke Fest Trio (we tried the original, California, and the Macadamia Nut).
I personally liked the Macadamia Nut and Original Poke.
I think the California Poke was too citrusy (is that a word).
but at least it's an option in the busy inner sunset.
original.author: Phillip D.
original.review:
Finally tried this place after seeing so many friends frequent this restaurant.  I can't believe I only tried this place now. 

First of all, I love that they have a variety of "Pacific Rim" cuisine.  Everything from Hawaiian to Japanese to Korean, we actually tried a bit of all three.  We came on a Wednesday evening (just missed the Happy Hour). We started with the Korean Sticky Ribs. That was tasty but a bit messy (it's nice they have napkins and wet naps to clean off your hands).  We then ordered the Sunset Sushi Roll (which comes in 8 pieces) and Poke Fest Trio (we tried the original, California, and the Macadamia Nut).  I personally liked the Macadamia Nut and Original Poke. I think the California Poke was too citrusy (is that a word).  

I definitely want to try their happy hour (see what deals I can get). They have happy hour both from 4-6 M-F and 10-close! Great for those late night eats. Also, I have to try their rice bowl. From what I saw, they are HUGE! 

Our server (forgot her name) was real nice and pretty attentive. I don't think it was too busy but even if, good service always makes the meal (and review) even better  

They technically have a parking lot in the rear but it's usually full but at least it's an option in the busy inner sunset. 

Definitely a place to come again.

excerpts: The original and macadamia flavors really complemented each other.
original.author: Erick K.
original.review:
Poke, poke, poke. It's what folks are clamoring about here, and it certainly didn't disappoint! I have tried several other poke places in the Bay Area and I can safely say this is the closest thing to Hawaiian poke. The original and macadamia flavors really complemented each other. Combined with the awesome sweet potato, and they have a recipe for success. 

We also ordered the ahi salad (not poke) and it was great. The vegetable was fresh, and the ginger complemented the overall dish well. The ahi is the star though as it was cooked perfectly. Crisp on the outside and raw on the inside. Yum. 

Was mulling for 5 stars but the fish taco was on the average side. Taco is a bit thick and it overpowers the cod fish inside. Definitely 4.5 start though. And if you like poke, definitely a great place to go.

excerpts: It's not the fanciest or most original or unique place in the world, but the food, atmosphere, and service are consistently good.
So many places in this neighborhood have very heavy food (Thai, Chinese, etc.) and it's nice to go somewhere with lighter but still filling options.
Obviously you have to like fish to eat here, but there is enough variety (fried dishes, sushi rolls, rice bowls, etc.)
to please everyone in a group.
original.author: Amy G.
original.review:
You know, I really like this place. It's not the fanciest or most original or unique place in the world, but the food, atmosphere, and service are consistently good. So many places in this neighborhood have very heavy food (Thai, Chinese, etc.) and it's nice to go somewhere with lighter but still filling options. Obviously you have to like fish to eat here, but there is enough variety (fried dishes, sushi rolls, rice bowls, etc.) to please everyone in a group. I really like the ahi salad, and last night I got the salmon salad. 

One thing that's great about Pacific Catch is that they are very clued-in to allergies. There are a lot of gluten-free options. My dad asked for no onions on the side of his dish, and the waiter asked a lot of questions to find out if it was just a preference or if he had an onion allergy, as there were onions in some of the other parts of the dish.

excerpts: My friends come here for the Original Cosmo drink half off During happy hour.
I really like their original idea of edamame beans with pretzel goldfish
original.author: Jonathan L.
original.review:
I enjoy the atmosphere at this place.

I used to come here all the time when they had their ahi poke for happy hour! That stuff was bomb! But they got rid of it.. And it's 10$ as opposed to the previous 5.95$...

Aside from that their happy hours are from 4-6 and after 10pm. My friends come here for the Original Cosmo drink half off During happy hour. 

Today I had the wasabi salmon bowl and it was pretty delicious and healthy! I've never been too big of a fan on wasabi but this bowl taste amazing! It's almost like a light honey mustard taste to the salmon and rice. The bowl came with white rice, salmon, wasabi sauce, ginger, and a seaweed salad.

I really like their original idea of edamame beans with pretzel goldfish, it's actually a great combo when you try them together.

The only problem I have with this place is that the waiters are never really there when you need them.. They take forever and never notice you esp at the bar area.. It gets annoying!

Minus two stars for the service and taking out ahi poke from the happy hour menu!

excerpts: We had they original & the Ahi Mac nut, both great, as are the accompanying wonton frit.
We also shared a special, Figian Mahi-mahi w green curry.
Exc.
Recommend.
original.author: R K.
original.review:
Our server, Zan, was just fantastic! Best server ever!
People are right about the Poke - excellent. We had they original & the Ahi Mac nut, both great, as are the accompanying wonton frit.
We also shared a special, Figian Mahi-mahi w green curry. Exc. Recommend.

excerpts: My friend and I ordered the trio of poke: original, a creamy one with serreno chiles, and a white tuna one.
I LOVED the original.
I thought it was really good.
It tastes like poke is supposed to taste.
The serreno was my least favorite - it was really creamy, and I'm not super into creamy foods.
I did like the spice, though.
The white tuna was really refreshing.
original.author: Jade R.
original.review:
Uhm this place totally rocks. No idea why it's got low stars. I think it was GREAT.

My friend and I ordered the trio of poke: original, a creamy one with serreno chiles, and a white tuna one. I LOVED the original. I thought it was really good. It tastes like poke is supposed to taste. The serreno was my least favorite - it was really creamy, and I'm not super into creamy foods. I did like the spice, though. The white tuna was really refreshing. I would definitely order again.

They were previewing their special SF menu, so I gave their salmon BLT a shot. And OMG it was so great! I loved the salmon, the bacon was cooked to perfection... wow it was good. I only ate half, but that half was more than enough.

The waitresses were also super on top of it and really nice. I would recommend this place to anyone!

excerpts: The poke trio appetizer was good--I liked the lomi lomi and original the best.
original.author: Abby M.
original.review:
Nothing will ever compare to the poke you get in Hawaii, but this will do! The poke trio appetizer was good--I liked the lomi lomi and original the best.  The poke bowl was good too! 

The tres leches dessert with ice cream was sooo good. I don't know exactly what it was called because we said yes as soon as the server recommended it.

Portions are generous.  Service was great.  Nice atmosphere. Parking is a little difficult since it located right along Lincoln, but its SF, get over it.

excerpts: I chose the Original Hawaiian Poke, the special of Pulled Pork sliders with pineapple slaw, and a blood orange margarita.
original.author: Jenessa R.
original.review:
Decided to stop by this place for dinner after walking around the Lincoln/ 9th Ave/ Irving area. What really caught my eye on the menu was the variety of Poke options, and I love me some poke.

The restaurant itself is pretty cute; it has a casual, beachy feel while still seeming nice enough for dinner after work. I chose the Original Hawaiian Poke, the special of Pulled Pork sliders with pineapple slaw, and a blood orange margarita.

Overall, the food was decent. I wasn't too thrilled about it though. I've had some pretty good poke, so my expectations are pretty high. While it was nice, both the poke itself and the wonton chips served with it had way too much salt for me. I finished most of it, but couldn't get through the last little bit just because the taste of salt became so overwhelming. 

The pulled pork sliders were really delicious, with the pork being so nicely seasoned and cooked, and the sweetness of the pineapple slaw plus the Hawaiian rolls were a nice blend. My only gripe about these little sliders is that I wanted there to be more of the pork to balance out the thick fluffiness of the roll. 

The margarita was pretty good; Blood orange flavoring seems to be getting popular right now, and I'm all for that.

My mom seemed to be a little annoyed at how little our server was attending to us. She was very nice and polite when she was, but we had to keep scanning for her and didn't see her very often. 

It was a nice dinner. I may come back here again if I'm in the area, but I'm not salivating or yearning to come back in the near future.

excerpts: I was told that this was the bigger location of the original one down on Chestnut Street.
The location is definitely in a very busy area off GGP.
Luckily, our friends were already sitting.
Service is quick-quick-quick.
original.author: Jamie L.
original.review:
After sitting for a few hours in the sun of Speedway Meadows at GGP for a free concert, came here with my good friend, her husband, my boyfriend and daughter. 

I was told that this was the bigger location of the original one down on Chestnut Street. The location is definitely in a very busy area off GGP. Luckily, our friends were already sitting. Service is quick-quick-quick. I love that, especially at a busy eatery. 

My boyfriend and I shared their Baja style fish tacos with sweet potato fries (ick). To eat we shared the Vietnamese Steak sandwich. Their fish tacos are incredible! The batter looked crunchy, but oh no, it was delicate and the fish was not at all fishy. Even with mountain of guacamole on it, you could still catch all of the flavors off the dish. I was completely blown away that I actually tasted an amazing fish taco.

Since my boyfriend and I shared the sandwich, the staff was nice enough to split it in half, as well as split up the regular french fries. Again, I was completely enthralled by their great combination of flavor of siracha aioli (!) and thee most tender steak I have ever bit into. Moreover, their cole slaw, which I normally don't care for, was crispy and not at all drenched in mayo. 

Their prices are a little higher than what I would pay for, but it was so worth it. I would definitely come back if I am in the area.

excerpts: I like their original location bec
it is a lot smaller but intimate.
However, this location has plenty of space with a lot more seating and a parking lot for maybe 6-7 cars.
original.author: J C.
original.review: I had their entree salad with salmon and I liked it. For $15, I was pretty stuffed. Service was friendly. Filled up our cups right away. I've had their tacos and ahi tuna entree salad. They were also good. I like their original location bec it is a lot smaller but intimate. However, this location has plenty of space with a lot more seating and a parking lot for maybe 6-7 cars.

excerpts: We shared the calamari, ceviche, original Hawaiian poki, and split the spicy tuna salad.
Everything was fresh, delicious, and brought in a timely manner.
The staff is very friendly and accommodating.
They also have a great selection of wine.
(The Riesling was great with the fish!)
I will definitely be returning!
original.author: Gayane B.
original.review: I came here for the first time with a friend after hearing so much about this place! Definitely not disappointed! We shared the calamari, ceviche, original Hawaiian poki, and split the spicy tuna salad. Everything was fresh, delicious, and brought in a timely manner. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. They also have a great selection of wine. (The Riesling was great with the fish!) I will definitely be returning!

excerpts: I had the original poke, and the BF had the hawaiian terriyaki rice bowl with salmon.
The poke was just OKAY, but we enjoyed the rice bowl.
It wasn't the best experience, and I don't know if the food is worth coming back for if I have to deal with service like that.
Perhaps I'll try another location.
My experience here was just .... mehhhh.
original.author: Christine L.
original.review: The food was good, but their service was sub-par. My server, I think her name was Amanda, had quite a bit of attitude. If you hate your job that much, then maybe it's time to find a new one! She didn't refill our waters, and when I asked her for a to-go box she went to the bar to chat it up with her coworkers for awhile. It wasn't until she caught my stare that she had the "Oh, sh*t" look and got my box. I had the original poke, and the BF had the hawaiian terriyaki rice bowl with salmon. The poke was just OKAY, but we enjoyed the rice bowl. It wasn't the best experience, and I don't know if the food is worth coming back for if I have to deal with service like that. Perhaps I'll try another location. My experience here was just .... mehhhh.

excerpts: We got the korean bbq ribs, serrano poke, and the original, mahi mahi and steak tacos with spicy fries.
The best thing for both of us by far was the poke.
I'm not a big or experienced poke fan (insert joke here) but it was very tasty with enough heat but not too much.
The thing I liked second, my friend not so much, was the ribs.
The original and mahi mahi tacos lacked really any flavor and were disappointments with the steak taco being the one taco we both agreed we wish we got instead.
This is also the first time I got black beans with no flavor.
I thought my friend was joking
but it actually had no flavor.
Just a suggestion I think they should put more cheese in with the beans since it added more flavor than without the cheese bites.
Also parking here is TOUGH!
Best parking is either at the park across the street or a couple blocks down on one of the streets.
The original and mahi mahi tacos lacked really any flavor and were disappointments with the steak taco being the one taco we both agreed we wish we got instead.
This is also the first time I got black beans with no flavor.
I thought my friend was joking
but it actually had no flavor.
Just a suggestion I think they should put more cheese in with the beans since it added more flavor than without the cheese bites.
Also parking here is TOUGH!
Best parking is either at the park across the street or a couple blocks down on one of the streets.
original.author: Mike D.
original.review:
Kinda torn on this since this place is like a bowl of kid cereal... wonderful candy marshmallows mixed with things we don't like as much.

Heard all the great reviews so wanted to eat here but found out the meter we paid for was only for 30 mins max. So we decided to get take out and just eat at the beach. We met a very friendly worker named Andrea? Audrea? working in the bar area who took our order, gave us tips, even felt bad for us having to do take out and gave us free sodas for our wait. We got the korean bbq ribs, serrano poke, and the original, mahi mahi and steak tacos with spicy fries. The best thing for both of us by far was the poke. I'm not a big or experienced poke fan (insert joke here) but it was very tasty with enough heat but not too much. The thing I liked second, my friend not so much, was the ribs. I loved the sauce they used and enough meat to not think you got cheated. 

On the other side we found the spicy fries cold and soggy but we drove 5 minutes away so HOPEFULLY that was just our fault and I will put that on us BUT kind of skimpy on them (i think my friend counted 10 thin fries) and it didn't have any "kick" to be called spicy in my opinion. The original and mahi mahi tacos lacked really any flavor and were disappointments with the steak taco being the one taco we both agreed we wish we got instead. This is also the first time I got black beans with no flavor. I thought my friend was joking but it actually had no flavor. Just a suggestion I think they should put more cheese in with the beans since it added more flavor than without the cheese bites. Also parking here is TOUGH! Best parking is either at the park across the street or a couple blocks down on one of the streets. The meters were 30 min max and the parking enforcement marked tires I think so knew if you put in more money and still ticket you.

Overall, I give this place 2 stars for the food we liked and had to give 1 star to Andrea or Audrea (sorry I butchered your name) since she rocks! She gave EXCELLENT customer service, was helpful, very friendly and considerate to give free sodas once she realized the customers had to go with Plan B. THAT is what customer service is all about! Other than that while there are a couple of good things to eat and we may be back we both felt it's not a MUST GO place for us.

excerpts: Original poke is wayyy too salty for me though.
I ordered it once long time ago but thought I was just unlucky on that day
so today I tried one more time and again, way too salty.
original.author: W M.
original.review: Love tuna poke here! Original poke is wayyy too salty for me though. I ordered it once long time ago but thought I was just unlucky on that day so today I tried one more time and again, way too salty. Will stick with Cali style, Serrano poke and Salmon next time.

excerpts: Our group of 6 adults and 3 kids figured that the original would not fit all of us, so we decided on the bigger 9th Ave location.
Well, sometimes bigger ain't better.
The quality of the food overall was lacking.
The fish was just not as fresh as the same dishes at the Chestnut location.
The service was lacking as well.
It's not that they were rude in the least, it was more that the servers looked very confused at times and could not get one of our orders correct after three tries.
This place could be a hit, only if it were as good as the original.
A map to get to the original (http://www.yelp.com/biz/pacific-catch-san-francisco#hrid:dhLLlLumE3qmnO6xnScwYw).
original.author: Al L.
original.review:
I freakin' love Pacific Catch, just not this one. Our group of 6 adults and 3 kids figured that the original would not fit all of us, so we decided on the bigger 9th Ave location. Well, sometimes bigger ain't better. The quality of the food overall was lacking. The fish was just not as fresh as the same dishes at the Chestnut location. The service was lacking as well. It's not that they were rude in the least, it was more that the servers looked very confused at times and could not get one of our orders correct after three tries. This place could be a hit, only if it were as good as the original.

MUST HAVE: A map to get to the original (http://www.yelp.com/biz/pacific-catch-san-francisco#hrid:dhLLlLumE3qmnO6xnScwYw).

excerpts: the ahi poke is nearly indistinguishable from the Hawaiian original.
original.author: Peter T.
original.review:
ambiance was lovely, windows adorn the interior with ample light, and views of golden gate park directly across the street.

the ahi poke is nearly indistinguishable from the Hawaiian original. 

the fish sandwiches are constructed well, but the mahi mahi inside lacked flavor and the texture was a bit dry; sweet potato french fries on the side were good as well.

desert was awesome, caramel something with ice cream and mango passion fruit cheese cake. 

appetizer + 2 sandwiches + 2 deserts = 52 bucks.. not bad at all

excerpts: With the original Chestnut Street location only a couple blocks from my apartment I can't say I'll be frequenting this location very often, but after running some errands on Irving Street
I was hungry.
I looked around at the taquerias and other eateries, and then remembered I was close to Pacific Catch!
original.author: Lindsay B.
original.review:
With the original Chestnut Street location only a couple blocks from my apartment I can't say I'll be frequenting this location very often, but after running some errands on Irving Street I was hungry.  I looked around at the taquerias and other eateries, and then remembered I was close to Pacific Catch!  Having been craving a wasabi bowl for a few days, I braved the cold wind and walked the few blocks to P.C.  

First of all, the place is HUGE!  There is actually a bar area (where I sat) as well as a restaurant area, and even some covered outdoor seating too!  Why can't the Marina location be like this?  When I walked in about 1:30 the place was not very crowded, but by the time I left it was packed.

Being by myself, I chose to sit in the bar, where I alternated between reading a book and watching the soccer game.  In true comparative fashion, I ordered my usual: Ahi Poke Wasabi Bowl with Brown Rice.  I was pleased to discover that it tasted just like what I am used to in the Marina.  Staff was pleasant and accommodating, and if I lived in the area I'd make use of their bar, their drink menu looked yummy and they're fully stocked.

excerpts: Their menu only consisted of about 5-7(?) plain-nothing-out-of-the-original sushi rolls.
original.author: Serena W.
original.review:
Arrived here expecting just sushi. Their menu only consisted of about 5-7(?) plain-nothing-out-of-the-original sushi rolls. Then me and my friend realized Pacific Catch was a Japanese-Mexican fusion restaurant, but we decided to give it a try anyways since we were drooling over the food on the table next to us. 

We started off with the Spicy Cabo Calamari, which was really soft in texture, definitely not crispy because the breaded exterior would fall off whenever we tried to pick at one; not spicy at all, it lacked much taste until i doused the heck out of it with the dipping sauce. Then we also figured out they also added a few other concocsions that should have just been left outta the fryer.....like the fried lemon I accidently ate.....twice. 

My friend ordered the Mixed Catch Basket. There wasn't anything special about this, except the fact that her side of Sweet Potato Fries were YUMMY!!

I ordered the Ahi Tuna Wasabi Bowl, topped with (of course) ahi tuna, wakame salad, avocado, ginger and cucumber. The sushi rice was flavored with a wasabi sauce, which was somewhat mild, but SO GOOD!! It's basically like sushi, but bigger and broken down into all its components. 

We also ordered two drinks, a Mai Tai & forgot the name of the other one, but both were pretty strong!! I like! I like!

Gotta come back to try their Mojito & Mochi Fondue!!

4 stars for their strong drinks, my Ahi Tuna Wasabi bowl and my friend's sweet potato fries!


[UPDATED: 4.26.2008]

Came here again with another friend around 8ish. Considering it was a Friday, there was a 30 min. wait for the tables inside, so we decided to dine outside, which turned out really nice...although it was butt-freezing cold at first. Thank god they had the protective sheet to block off most of the wind. 

Tried the Ahi Poke Wasabi bowl this time and it was delicious! Although I did like my Ahi Tuna from my last dining here, I would recommend the Ahi Poke over that. My Lemon Grass Mojito was refreshing as well. My friend's Gin & Tonic was pretty stiff.

Service was still attentive, friendly, consistent and quick. The bar was open till 1AM that day, but too bad we couldn't stay for another round of  drinks considering my friend had the Asian glow by the time he finished his Gin & Tonic. -sigh-

excerpts: I heard so many great things about their original restaurant down at Marina so always wanted to try this place.
original.author: Cindy L.
original.review:
I had high hopes for this place. I heard so many great things about their original restaurant down at Marina so always wanted to try this place.

I was surprised it felt very corporate, I had been by the Marina location and it looked more homey. But my biggest complaint was about the food of course. I think a salt monkey made our food. We got the White Tuna Tataki | seared white tuna served with crab & daikon salad $9.95. It was REALLY bad. Both the tuna & the crab were incredibly salty. I also ordered a lemongrass mojito, it was not an easy drink so I switched to my friend's papaya cooler. Not great but okay. Service was okay. The mochi fondue was a little bit different than we envisioned. We thought there will actually be a "fondue" instead of just a container of hot fudge that we dip the mochi in. I guess it's a more economical version of fondue... The hot fudge was warm by the time it got to our table, it was a little bit hard to dip.

I am surprised to see so many great reviews on yelp, we must've gotten the b team that day. We all wished we had went to park chow or hotei instead. Much cheaper and much more fulfilling. 

Damn you iPhone commercial, you lied to me!!!

excerpts: I have tried all three fries and the original are my fav but my husband likes the sweet potato.
The wait staff has been very helpful and there when you need them, but not overbearing.
They even had a chalk board and chalk for my son to play with while we waited.
It is a little messy but a great way to pass the time until his food arrives.
A new favorite place!
original.author: Maureen R.
original.review: Have been to the new Campbell location a couple times now and LOVE this place. I have had the Wasabi Ahi sandwich and the Salmon Sandwich, both were amazing! I have tried all three fries and the original are my fav but my husband likes the sweet potato. The wait staff has been very helpful and there when you need them, but not overbearing. They even had a chalk board and chalk for my son to play with while we waited. It is a little messy but a great way to pass the time until his food arrives. A new favorite place!

excerpts: The first time that I experienced Pacific Catch was at the original location on Chestnut... but on a busy and blustery Thursday night, we tried for Irving location because we were starved and figured that we had a better chance of getting served and fed more quickly.
original.author: Evelyn K.
original.review:
The first time that I experienced Pacific Catch was at the original location on Chestnut... but on a busy and blustery Thursday night, we tried for Irving location because we were starved and figured that we had a better chance of getting served and fed more quickly.  

We were told that the wait was 15-20 minutes, which was definitely reasonable...but even better than that, we found a comfortable table in the bar area and was able to plop ourselves down almost immediately.  

I was craving the Ahi Poke Rice Bowl, and it didn't disappoint.  There were piles of spicy poke, with seaweed salad, and heaps of rice to keep me very satiated.  My friend ordered a salmon sandwich, which came with their awesome sweet potato fries.  I think the fries are better as an appetizer because then you get a larger serving and yummy sauces to boot!

I'm tempted to rate PC 5 stars, but I think I need to experience it a few more times and try some more dishes to qualify the rating.

excerpts: Real nice like and original.
The bathroom was clean.
Not to mention that the place is baby friendly.
My homies' daughter was there
and she's 2 yrs.
old and just started walking
original.author: Ivan F.
original.review:
A good friend of mine had his birthday celebration here about 2 weeks ago and it was my first time. I ain't gonna lie, money was kinda tight so I Yelped it (yeeh!) to find out what they had and how much it was gonna break me off. As I read reviews, I figured, not too bad.

I must say that the ambience is dope. Nice place to take a date because it don't get too loud, although they do have music (80's when I was there) playing on the p.a. system. It wasn't bothersome though.

I had the Pacific Fish & Chips which wasn't too shabby. It wasn't all that but it didn't suck. The sweet potatoe fries really broke it through the otherside for me. These wasn't your ordinary, run-of-the-mill sweet potato fries, they were crispy! The fish was alright. I wasn't feeling the little wire plate they served my meal on. So it was like a wire/mesh plate type deal which they covered with a piece of parchment paper that when I put malt vinegar on my fish, it made the paper all soggy. Boo.

Big up for the decor of the spot. Real nice like and original. The bathroom was clean. Not to mention that the place is baby friendly. My homies' daughter was there and she's 2 yrs. old and just started walking so she was up and about mingling with everybody. 

I'd probably come back...but not on the regular.

excerpts: Can't say I've been to the original location
so I can't compare
but I thought Pacific Catch was pretty good nonetheless.
I had the fish and chips with the catch of the day.
Quite good, extremely fresh fish (would be scared if it wasn't!).
The dipping sauces added something special to the fish, which was fresh but not overwhelmingly tasty on its own, so I do recommend giving them a try (the Thai one especially).
Sweet potato fries were fantastic, definitely the standout original of my meal.
original.author: Taylor M.
original.review:
Can't say I've been to the original location so I can't compare but I thought Pacific Catch was pretty good nonetheless. 
I had the fish and chips with the catch of the day. Quite good, extremely fresh fish (would be scared if it wasn't!). The dipping sauces added something special to the fish, which was fresh but not overwhelmingly tasty on its own, so I do recommend giving them a try (the Thai one especially). Sweet potato fries were fantastic, definitely the standout original of my meal. Probably the one thing that would get me coming back to Pacific Catch again!

I also tried a bit of the sushi, just California Roll and Spicy Tuna. Nothing special, so I can't speak for the quality of the specialty pieces, but if I was looking for quality basics or specialties... I'd just go out for some sushi! So decent sushi but not worth the price when there are much better options within walking distance. Also had a good beer from the rotating selection but it was almost $6!

So all in all, good food. Very good choice if you want a broad selection of choices on the menu, all with very fresh fish. The place seemed pretty popular on a Friday night, very trendy and nice setting. Service wasn't fantastic: very friendly, but took a while just to get water. Busy night though. For the negatives, can't recommend the sushi as a standout and the food wasn't special enough to be paying more than a 10-er for each dish (even the salads). Still. Great sweet potato fries. And sauces.

excerpts: Their original location is a bit better in terms of quality and preparation, IMHO.
original.author: Barca F.
original.review:
Their original location is a bit better in terms of quality and preparation, IMHO.

Shame their prices went up because this was one of my 'tried & true' spots....Still, Wasabi bowl is great...Seasoned fries trump the sweet potato ones, for me.

Word to the wise, eating in always is better than carry out

excerpts: I have been here on a number of occasions (i.e. the bigger restaurant in the Sunset -- I have never been to the original hole-in-the-wall place in the Marina) and I remain unconvinced & on-the-fence about the place.
The location is in a well-trafficked area near a main entrance to Golden Gate Park and in the busy 9th & Irving area of the Sunset.
It's a big, comfortable-looking restaurant with a large-ish bar area facing the Park.
The menu has a large selection of seafood dishes (as the restaurant name would suggest) done in a variety of fusion-ish ways.
Some of these are predictable, and in my experience, not that exciting.
I have had the Fish & Chips and the Fish Tacos in the past, and I wasnt very impressed by either.
(Big portions... though on the flip-side, the prices are on the high side.)
However, I was very impressed by some of the more unusual and interesting dishes.
In particular, the different Rice Bowl options are very good.
original.author: donal c.
original.review:
I have been here on a number of occasions (i.e. the bigger restaurant in the Sunset -- I have never been to the original hole-in-the-wall place in the Marina) and I remain unconvinced & on-the-fence about the place.

The location is in a well-trafficked area near a main entrance to Golden Gate Park and in the busy 9th & Irving area of the Sunset. It's a big, comfortable-looking restaurant with a large-ish bar area facing the Park. The menu has a large selection of seafood dishes (as the restaurant name would suggest) done in a variety of fusion-ish ways. Some of these are predictable, and in my experience, not that exciting. I have had the Fish & Chips and the Fish Tacos in the past, and I wasnt very impressed by either. (Big portions... though on the flip-side, the prices are on the high side.) However, I was very impressed by some of the more unusual and interesting dishes. In particular, the different Rice Bowl options are very good. I have become addicted to the  Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl & Brown Rice. VERY tasty, and it feels healthy, with its variety of veggies and carbs (though it probably isnt!)

The place itself feels a bit impersonal - especially, the large restaurant area. It has the feel (just a bit...) of a suburban Red Lobster or TGI Friday's. (Not anything like as cheezy -- but there's a sense of it - not a good thing in an area where there are so many other places that do have personality & character.) The bar feels a bit better - tho the quality of the wait-staff & bartenders is hit-and-miss. 

So - definitely ambivalent about the place, and typically, the price-tab for a meal is a bit on the high side  - but Pacific Catch has its upsides. I remain hopeful, but unconvinced about it.

excerpts: from the pretty long bar with original and unique cocktails (lemongrass mojito, anyone?) to the vaulted celings with beautiful fixtures, this place has a truly modern and sassy yet comforting feel to it.
original.author: Karen K.
original.review:
i would like to start off by pointing out that pacific catch is not the big bad wolf responsible for the closing of canvas gallery.  this is an untruth, and in fact, canvas gallery originally opened to showcase the artwork of the owner's wife.  guess whose paintings now hang on the walls of this renovated space?  that's right.  the wife of the owner of canvas gallery.  interesting, hmmn?  yeah, i thought so too.

the space here is incredible.  from the pretty long bar with original and unique cocktails (lemongrass mojito, anyone?) to the vaulted celings with beautiful fixtures, this place has a truly modern and sassy yet comforting feel to it. beware that if you are coming in on a friday or saturday night, you might want to make a reservation or be prepared to wait for 45-1 hour at the bar if you don't.  

there are additions to the menu here different from the chestnut street and corte madera locations, and all of them looked wonderful, but my friend and i decided to stick with the basics as we have been to the other locations countless times and have our favorites.  these are as follows: poke appetizer - if you have not had this dish you are seriously missing out on some wonderful flavor / fish tacos - i usually get a 'catch of the day', a mahi-mahi and one chicken taco to mix it up, all with the famous sweet potato fries / dulche de leche spring rolls - i have no words for how addictive and delicious this little dessert is... you MUST TRY IT:/

service ran smooth, our wine pours were generous, and in all i was really impressed that PC  has managed to make a nice changeover from the fast sit down/take-out marina locale to a more traditional style of dining.  i definitely want to come back with a larger party and try some more of the new cocktails and maybe even be adventurous enough to order something new...

excerpts: all the servers were bubbly and attentive, the space was renovated only in minor ways as the original,open shell design didn't need much to accommodate a dining spot.
original.author: omar b.
original.review:
so many memories of studying over beers, hanging out with hawt law and medical students, attending cool as hell art and music shows...i am sorry.  when i accepted an invitation to the place that took away my precious canvas, well- let's just say i was not all nice and happy to the staff.

all the servers were bubbly and attentive, the space was renovated only in minor ways as the original,open shell design didn't need much to accommodate a dining spot.

lets talk food...the fish tacos were mediocre, over-seasoned and dry.. BUT the POKE(sounds out like "po-keh," you're welcome round-eye!) bowl was amazingly delicious.  i was flat-out stunned that they actually used limu kohou, which is the utmost vital ingredient for real local kine taste- along with just the right amount of sesame oil. 

close your eyes, think of the ocean, take a bite...and i bet you will feel you are at a local spot in hawaii. 

2 stars for the poke bowl- which is a value for the quality ahi and is actually enough to share for two.  1 star for the smart, pragmatic placement of the bar area right in the front, left side of the space for passerby to peep.

don't be mad pacific catch, i almost didn't review you at all for taking away what was a choice, go-to spot in the 'set.

excerpts: The food, I honestly felt was better at the original location, yet I keep coming back to this location since it's alot closer to me.
original.author: Denise B.
original.review:
Same concept as the other location on Chestnut Street except in real restaurant format, ie. you sit down and order with a waitress. 

My favorite things about this location I must say are the service which I find fast and friendly, and the atmosphere which is warm and inviting. 
The food, I honestly felt was better at the original location, yet I keep coming back to this location since it's alot closer to me. 

Anyway, onto the food.......the sweet potato fries are yummy and once you start you can't stop eating them. They are a bit addicting, I think they are perfect as is, but my fiance likes to add salt to them but then again he adds salt to everything and takes blood pressure meds............the sushi is good and consistent, and the menu is extensive enough where if you have any seafood fan they most likely will find something they will like here. Most of the food is healthy, but if you want something fried there are plenty of options for that also. My personal favorite for years and years was the Hawaiian poke yet here I find it to be really salty every time I order even though I keep order it again and again thinking the last time was hopefully a fluke. It wasn't. My other let down was possibly the pineapple fried rice, which I usually tend to think, there is no way to mess up, which they diddn't, but they also didn't do anything with to make me even want to finish eating it! Let down! If it sounds like I am complaining I don't mean to because I usually do like what I order here, just the last two times the fried rice and poke have been letting me down. Usually though my experience here though does leave me satisfied, and as mentioned earlier, the atmosphere and service always stay consistent.

excerpts: Original Post:
This new Pacific Catch is much more spacious and a much friendlier date place than the original in the Marina.
original.author: Scott L.
original.review:
Update: 5/17/08

Came here for dinner last night with a friend and my fiancee.  We ordered the sweet potato fries (of course) and one ahi poke salad and 2 ahi poke wasabi bowls.  The portions are HUGE and the food always tastes good.  When we got there, the hostess said the wait was 45 min but that she could call us right before a table was ready.  I really liked that service so we walked around and shopped a bit.  The call came sooner than we expected so we doubled back.

The food is great like everyone says but what I want to talk about is the service.  We had an awful waitress.  She didn't give us nearly enough attention.  She barely served our table.  In the beginning, we asked for water and she completely forgot about them.  We had to ask another server to bring it for us.  The waitress only took our order then another server basically brought us our food and waited on us.  She only came back to check on us once and refill water.  Afterwards, we got our bill and we were casually talking.  She dropped by twice to see if we had paid yet and it made us feel rushed.  

I don't mind being rushed our nicely if the place is packed.  I'm not a jerk and I'll give up a table but there wasn't a wait at all so we had time to sit around.  I thought it was very rude to be ushered out when we weren't done talking yet.  It turned the atmosphere sour so we headed out quickly.  I knew we were being rushed when she realized we hadn't paid the bill so she asked if we wanted a dessert menu.  It sounded like we either buy something else or pay up and leave.  

I understand that this is a one time deal with the waitress and hopefully we won't nearly be as unlucky next time.  But it was very disappointing from a place that I expected solid service from.  

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Original Post:

This new Pacific Catch is much more spacious and a much friendlier date place than the original in the Marina.  However, I found that I was very much disappointed by several things, which are enough to deter me from coming back here.  

1.  The prices are higher (possibly for the ambiance)
2.  Menu is different from the Marina 

The Marina location isn't exactly a hole in the wall cheapo place to eat but it's decently priced at least.  Here on 9th ave., everything is at least $3 more.  They were also missing my favorite sandwiches here as well.  Lastly, we ordered a basket full of fries and were heartily disappointed that it wasn't a very full basket.  

Verdict:  Overpriced.  I'll make the longer drive out to the Marina location.

excerpts: but oh why did they close the unique original quirky chill awesome Canvas Cafe and replaced it with a chain restaurant???
why?
that sucks :(
original.author: virginie d.
original.review: why but oh why did they close the unique original quirky chill awesome Canvas Cafe and replaced it with a chain restaurant??? why? that sucks :(

excerpts: We both ordered the spicy pacific cocktail to start, as well as sweet potato fries, baja shrimp ceviche, and ahi serrano poke.
Sweet potato fries were pretty good, but man, there was a LOT.
Great flavor, but we definitely ordered way too much food.
Baja shrimp ceviche was not that great.
It was like this weird avocado concoction that was trying to be a guac.
Very lime-y.
Ahi serrano poke was pretty good.
The ahi part was great, every thing else was meh.
ahi serrano.author: Leslie C.
ahi serrano.review:
2.5 stars.

My first time here and my BFF and I decided to stop by for HH before CAS Nightlife. We both ordered the spicy pacific cocktail to start, as well as sweet potato fries, baja shrimp ceviche, and ahi serrano poke.

Our drinks were hella spicy! My friend could barely drink hers. A little too much kick for me, I think. It was do-able after the first 5 sips though. We're probably getting a lot older than we want, but we definitely felt a bit buzzed after the first few sips!

Sweet potato fries were pretty good, but man, there was a LOT. Great flavor, but we definitely ordered way too much food. 
Baja shrimp ceviche was not that great. It was like this weird avocado concoction that was trying to be a guac. Very lime-y. 
Ahi serrano poke was pretty good. The ahi part was great, every thing else was meh. There was a little too much aioli for my taste, but I'm not one to douse my proteins.

Overall, would mayyyybe be back to try a margarita, but I definitely learned my lesson when it comes to their food.

excerpts: We started off with the ahi Serrano poke; the fish tasted fresh, didn't smell funny and it the flavors blended well together.
ahi serrano.author: Kate T.
ahi serrano.review:
It was surprisingly good! It looked like a chain restaurant so I wasn't sure about it but me and my sister were really hungry so we thought we'd give it a try. Our server was friendly and prompt and we never had to try and flag him down. 
The food was pretty good and reasonably priced. We started off with the ahi Serrano poke; the fish tasted fresh, didn't smell funny and it the flavors blended well together. I had the spicy tuna roll and that was pretty good and really filling and my sister had the mahi mahi sandwich and that was really good too. The best part was the bread pudding with the vanilla ice cream and coffee sauce....my god that was delicious!

excerpts: Ahi Serrano - my fave

, I love spicy food, & very light & fresh
2.
ahi serrano.author: Alyssaaa S.
ahi serrano.review:
Yummy poke!

Great customer service. Made reservations earlier & got seated promptly.
My best friend and I sat down while we waited of two others in our party.  The waitress served us appetizer finger foods- edamame and pretzel goldfishes - while we waited & even gave us another serving per request!

Ordered the poke trio:
1. Ahi Serrano - my fave, I love spicy food, & very light & fresh
2. California Style - a little too creamy for my taste but refreshing with a hint of lemon
3. Ahi Macadamia - something about the onions and the macadamia nuts that just pairs so well together! 

Overall, variety of fresh poke!

excerpts: My dad took the coho salmon with fries
and I had the kanpachi which is one of he
salmon.author: Eyal B.
salmon.review:
If your dad is in town ask for sea food, this is the place to go.
Great location near the golden gate park with great selection of fresh fish.
We started with Cabo calamari which was made perfect accompanied with Spicy aioli sauce.

My dad took the coho salmon with fries and I had the kanpachi which is one of he best Hawaiian fish you can find around.

Service was quick and efficient, will come back for sure !
Thanks

excerpts: I found my Japanese wasabi bowl with salmon (grilled, btw) and 1/2 brown rice 1/2 greens to be very filling
and I liked all of the toppings it included.
The ingredients were fresh and they don't skimp on anything!
The name is a bit of a misnomer though, as there was no wasabi that I could taste or see in my bowl.
My mom's WestCoast grilled salmon bowl looked equally delicious but with an assortment of other toppings.
salmon.author: Sherry L.
salmon.review:
This is a good option for a meal in the sunset area if you are looking for something more commercial. It was bustling on a game night, mostly in the bar area, but we didn't have any issues getting a large table for a party of two. 

We ordered two rice bowls and a two taco platter - way too much food in hindsight, but we enjoyed having all of the options. I found my Japanese wasabi bowl with salmon (grilled, btw) and 1/2 brown rice 1/2 greens to be very filling and I liked all of the toppings it included. The ingredients were fresh and they don't skimp on anything! The name is a bit of a misnomer though, as there was no wasabi that I could taste or see in my bowl. My mom's WestCoast grilled salmon bowl looked equally delicious but with an assortment of other toppings. 

The tacos were quite hefty in serving size as well. The two tacos could have been a meal on their own, but were served with a side of fries (or salad) and a small bowl of black beans. The Traditional Baja taco and the Grilled Steak taco were both excellent choices, depending on your palate and dietary preferences!

excerpts: Salmon Chowder: Definitely a must-get!
The chowder is rich and hearty, and has tons of seafood flavor packed into it!
Not too thick or runny, and contained lots of potatoes and vegetables.
They were a bit skimpy on the salmon however, only placing 4-5 pieces on top of the chowder.
The flavor of the salmon was masqueraded with overly rich sauce that they provided.
salmon.author: Gregory T.
salmon.review:
Definitely a great place to go if you're craving quality seafood! All the options here are super fresh - there is a wide variety of poke, fried seafood, soups, etc. On weekends and also Fridays in the evenings this place is usually pretty full, so don't be surprised if you have to wait a bit! My girlfriend and I ate here on a Saturday night at 7:30pm and we could only get outside seating.

For our food we ordered 3 different items! There were all pretty good, definitely really fresh and well prepared. The service was alright since it was super busy, but all in all the meal was nice!

Coconut Shrimp: A bit pricey for what you get. They give you 8 really delicious fried pieces of shrimp for ~$10. Even for SF standards, this is pretty steep. The playing wasn't too great either - it looked like the shrimp were just thrown on there. However, the taste was really good.

Salmon Chowder: Definitely a must-get! The chowder is rich and hearty, and has tons of seafood flavor packed into it! Not too thick or runny, and contained lots of potatoes and vegetables. They were a bit skimpy on the salmon however, only placing 4-5 pieces on top of the chowder.

Combination Poke: Honestly, compared to getting poke at a restaurant that specializes in poke, this fell short. The pieces of fish were cut very weirdly, too small and not enough to get a good bite. The flavor of the salmon was masqueraded with overly rich sauce that they provided.

excerpts: Got the rice bowl with poki on top (salmon avocado).
The portion size was good, but I could barely taste the dressing.
We also got a sushi roll: some spicy salmon on a california roll kinda thing.
salmon.author: Stephanie K.
salmon.review:
Finally came here, despite living two blocks away. I thought it was going to be a a place that serves like cooked, whole fish, instead of more poke/hawaiian. 

Got the rice bowl with poki on top (salmon avocado). The portion size was good, but I could barely taste the dressing. The rice was also cooked really weird, kinda soggy. 

My bf got a fish sandwich thing and it seemed pretty good. He also got seasoned fries but they were a tad bit too salty.

We also got a sushi roll: some spicy salmon on a california roll kinda thing. It was pretty decent.

I think this place could be good, if you know exactly what to order. Unfortunately, I don't know what that is. I would give it another chance if this was located in some more remote area, but it's hard to resist other restaurants next door that I love.

This is a nice roomy restaurant though! So roomy and large that it felt ginormous to SF residents who are used to whole in the wall kinda places.

excerpts: Salmon in poke was chunky with large pieces, many stringy.
We didn't detect much salmon flavor, just a fish flavor.
Being from the Pacific NW, we know salmon--this was pale in flavor at best.
salmon.author: Elizabeth K.
salmon.review:
From out of town, we were hungry after driving from Reno that day.  We happened to hit happy hour, cheaper prices.  We had poke, calamari, and a sushi roll.  The poke had a nice avocado sauce with it.  Salmon in poke was chunky with large pieces, many stringy.  We didn't detect much salmon flavor, just a fish flavor.  Being from the Pacific NW, we know salmon--this was pale in flavor at best. 

Moving on to the fried calamari, it was delicious!  It had a nice crunchy coating and wasn't oily at all.  Squid was tender, not rubbery.  Good choice!

Then, the California roll.  Pieces were tall, and not tightly rolled.  A little hard to eat as it unrolled on the plate.

All in all, it was fine overall.  Fish was clean, and fresh.  Just not my favorite, for my tastebuds.

excerpts: (Not enough Serrano peppers in its namesake dish) but the salmon was kind of oddly chewy.
salmon.author: Steven J.
salmon.review:
Ugh, I live nearby and drop in from time to time. The food and drinks are (generally) consistent, but one key thing isn't: the service.

Today it took 15 minutes to bring me the water I asked for when I sat down (it arrived with my food). After I ate, it took another 15 minutes for someone to come to the area I was seated in to take my card to pay. No one stopped to check how the food was, to refill the water, or anything.

There were babies / young children wailing, so a relaxing meal was out of the question.

I had the poke trio, and the two tuna options were good (Not enough Serrano peppers in its namesake dish) but the salmon was kind of oddly chewy.

In the past when I've dined at the bar, the bartenders are inattentive. You can finish your drink and they won't be around to ask for a refill until after you're ready to pay and leave.

There are better options nearby for sushi or poke bowls. There are better options a bit further away bit still in the Sunset for fish tacos. There are better options for drinks. I won't be back. Disappointing.

excerpts: I almost always order their Salmon Salad
..it is so delicious it is my favorite salad in the world.
The sauce is what makes it bomb!
Can I buy a bottle?
salmon.author: Annie L.
salmon.review: Yummy goodness! I've been coming to this location for for the past 7 years and every time I get yumminess! With friends, we get a booth in the back but when I'm by myself, I sit at a table in the bar section. I almost always order their Salmon Salad..it is so delicious it is my favorite salad in the world. The sauce is what makes it bomb! Can I buy a bottle? Some other notable favorites are the Hawaiian teriyaki rice bowl, fried oysters, pacific crab salad, fish and chips, mahi mahi and steak tacos, and seasoned fries. Service is always good except one time, nobody came to give me my bill and took a long time to flag someone down. But, otherwise they are attentive.

excerpts: BIG fan of the Wasabi Bowl with Tuna and Salmon (and go half and half, brown rice and salad).
salmon.author: Mike V.
salmon.review:
This place is wildly consistent.

Great portions. Fresh fish and vegetables. BIG fan of the Wasabi Bowl with Tuna and Salmon (and go half and half, brown rice and salad).

Not going to blow you away, but they consistently deliver.

excerpts: I got the salmon Korean bowl.
The "spiced" cucumbers and "pickled" radish didn't have much flavor at all.
salmon.author: Anna C.
salmon.review:
We came here for my gf's bday dinner celebration and sat outside by the fire pit. 

Food: 2/5 - Between the 2 of us, we had calamari and a rice bowl each. I got the salmon Korean bowl. The "spiced" cucumbers and "pickled" radish didn't have much flavor at all. Although the bowls looked good, not everything in it tasted good. 

Ambiance: 5/5 - Sitting outside as the sun was setting was so relaxing. When it started getting breezy, there was a heat lamp above us and the glass fire pit to our side to keep us warm.

Download their app for free desert! We got the macadamia nut ice cream brownie on the house :)

excerpts: I ordered the salmon and avocado poke for dinner.
I've never had poke before, but I must say I am now a fan.
For someone trying to watch what they eat, it was the perfect option.
Plus, Jesse offered to bring me a side of brown rice that went perfect with it.
I turned it into a little salad bowl.
If you love sushi, but you want to lay off the rice-heavy rolls, this is an excellent substitute.
salmon.author: Jonathan R.
salmon.review:
After leaving the Academy of Science, Priscilla H. and I had no problem finding dinner nearby. Just down the street is Pacific Catch, and even though only street parking is available, we lucked out by finding an open spot on Martin Luther King Jr. Drive. It's just a hop and a skip away from the restaurant.

The restaurant has a very cool vibe going on. They have beautiful paintings of aquatic life on the wall, and the whole place feels like it should be located on the water. Our server was Jesse, and he was great. He was friendly, funny, and he made sure we were taken care of before taking off. 

We started our meal with a small dish of shelled edamame and goldfish pretzels. An interesting and unusual combo, I know. But the two together actually made one tasty treat. From there we went to ceviche, and it was so good it took all our strength not to lick the bowl. The ceviche was fairly simple yet tasty, and the amount of shrimp they offer you is incredible. It comes with a side of chips, but I preferred to eat it alone.  I ordered the salmon and avocado poke for dinner. I've never had poke before, but I must say I am now a fan. For someone trying to watch what they eat, it was the perfect option. Plus, Jesse offered to bring me a side of brown rice that went perfect with it. I turned it into a little salad bowl. If you love sushi, but you want to lay off the rice-heavy rolls, this is an excellent substitute. The dish came with won tons, which I saved for snacking later. 

The meal came to an end with a beautiful dessert. Jesse recommended one dessert, but we decided we must try the Dulce de Leche Spring Roll, because how often do you come across something so unique? It was beautiful both visually and gustatory. It's a puff pastry, filled with caramel cheesecake, wrapped up and deep fried, and then topped with a generous portion of the most amazing ice cream ever. The ice cream was incredibly smooth, and if it's not homemade, it's the closest thing to it.  The whole meal was spectacular, but that dessert is mind blowing. 

Pacific Catch offers what every restaurant goer wants: Great food, at great prices, with great customer service.

excerpts: On the other hand my grandma had the Salmon salad
and it was dry and tasteless.
I felt bad for her
we had to order her food some where else afterwards.
salmon.author: CJ L.
salmon.review: I had the Vietnamese sandwich and to me it was really good and spicy. Their coleslaw made the meal taste extra good too. Their water was good than some places I've had. On the other hand my grandma had the Salmon salad and it was dry and tasteless. I felt bad for her we had to order her food some where else afterwards. My husband ordered the chipotle chicken and his was soooooo good! Loved the flavors that meshed together.

excerpts: I got a shrimp taco a la carte and a firecracker salmon roll.
The shrimp taco wasn't that great, fell apart and the shrimps breading fell off them.
The roll was probably the best thing we ordered.
salmon.author: Hayley D.
salmon.review:
Came here for Valentine's Day and got a reservation through open table. 

Food:
We got the calamari appetizer which was good, except the people behind us got almost twice the amount we did.

I got a shrimp taco a la carte and a firecracker salmon roll. The shrimp taco wasn't that great, fell apart and the shrimps breading fell off them. The roll was probably the best thing we ordered. It was flavorful and good. 

My boyfriend got the petrale sole with dungunees crab. We expected that to be like half fish half crab, but in reality it was like a spoonful of crab and pretty small portion of fish too. It was a $30 entree and he was still hungry. Just wasn't explained clear enough on the menu I guess. 

Service:
We got seated exactly at the time of our reservation which was nice. Our waitress was nice but didn't really explain the specials and the menu. 

Overall our food was alright, not sure we will be coming back anytime soon :(

excerpts: Salmon avocado poke -
this was good.
Fish tasted fresh.
The chips that it came with was thin and crunchy, which I liked, but it tasted greasy.
salmon.author: Angie Y.
salmon.review:
First off, service was great! Hostess and waiter were both very nice, and the waiter checked up on us regularly. Unfortunately, I come back for food/drinks... good service is a bonus. 

Now onto happy hour... drinks and food. The Mai tai was great; it's not too strong but you can definitely taste the alcohol so you know they're not skimping on it. $7 for a glass or $34 for a pitcher with 5 servings ($1 saving). The food was overall subpar although portions were good--average $5.5-$6.50 / plate. 

Calamari - not crunchy; tasted almost stale (like it's been sitting out a while).
Salmon avocado poke - this was good. Fish tasted fresh. The chips that it came with was thin and crunchy, which I liked, but it tasted greasy. 
Inside out roll - the spicy tuna on the outside wasn't spicy and it was creamier than I liked, like it had too much mayo. 
Rising sun - the shrimp tempura wasn't crunchy on the inside, but I liked the fresh raw tuna on top.

In short, this wouldn't be my pick for happy hour but if my friends suggest it, I wouldn't fight them on it (if they've been here before and know what they're getting themselves into).

excerpts: Poke was average , salmon was dry & no flavor.
Bowl with Mahi was ok.
Maybe we ordered the wrong type of food....
salmon.author: Jul S.
salmon.review:
I have heard so many great things about this place.... (my last two trips to SF) 

This place is loud.  I apparently yelled at a hostess and made her cry when I was just talking over the loud music.   She gave a horrible face &  I asked why she was making that face. 

The manager was saying she is sensitive & really did not do anything other than tell me his employee was upset. 

We had a GREAT server & that was the best part.  She was super nice & on top of everything. 

Poke was average , salmon was dry & no flavor.  Bowl with Mahi was ok.  Maybe we ordered the wrong type of food....it's packed in here. 

We most likely won't come back.

excerpts: The fresh catch salmon was delicious.
Hubby and I enjoyed the poke trio.
salmon.author: waiming B.
salmon.review:
So kind to my family, including 3 kids under 5. They are always ready with high chairs, edamame, and pretzel goldfish for us. The fresh catch salmon was delicious. Hubby and I enjoyed the poke trio. Will be back soon with our crew. 

It's a great place to eat after a morning at Cal Academy. Metered parking lot on 7th.

excerpts: My favorite dish is the Salmon Salad.
The salad is always fresh and the wild caught salmon is always cooked as I request, a little rare.
The portions of all their dishes are generous as well as delicious.
Their appetizers are also really tasty.
My favorites among them are the Sticky Korean Ribs and the Tempura Ahi Rolls.
I should also mention the staff at Pacific Catch.
The waitstaff couldn't be more pleasant and gently attentive, always noticing when you may want a refill of your green tea, etc.
Two days ago our waiter, Ben, was so very friendly and helpful to us.

As we were leaving I asked to speak to the manager so that I tell him what a fine waiter he had in Ben, but I was told that the manager was in a meeting and so, at last, I am giving Pacific Catch the 5-star yelp review that it's been deserving for several years!
salmon.author: William D.
salmon.review: I've been coming to Pacific Catch for years as it's one of my favorite restaurants in SF.  Every few months an old friend of mine drives down from Sonoma and we eat here.  And I come alone about once every 3 weeks. I've never had a bad or even mediocre meal here. My favorite dish is the Salmon Salad. The salad is always fresh and the wild caught salmon is always cooked as I request, a little rare.  The portions of all their dishes are generous as well as delicious. Their appetizers are also really tasty.  My favorites among them are the Sticky Korean Ribs and the Tempura Ahi Rolls. I should also mention the staff at Pacific Catch.  The waitstaff couldn't be more pleasant and gently attentive, always noticing when you may want a refill of your green tea, etc.  Two days ago our waiter, Ben, was so very friendly and helpful to us.  As we were leaving I asked to speak to the manager so that I tell him what a fine waiter he had in Ben, but I was told that the manager was in a meeting and so, at last, I am giving Pacific Catch the 5-star yelp review that it's been deserving for several years!

excerpts: Calamari was not impressive at all, ceviche was OK but the fish was too tough and my "wild salmon" looked farmed to me, not strong enough taste and not deep color as the wild one I usually buy from Costco.
salmon.author: Gabriel M.
salmon.review: Just OK! Calamari was not impressive at all, ceviche was OK but the fish was too tough and my "wild salmon" looked farmed to me, not strong enough taste and not deep color as the wild one I usually buy from Costco.

excerpts: I got the Serrano along with my bowl, while my boyfriend got the Serrano and Grilled Salmon.
You get a choice of getting it with all rice (White or brown) or half rice and half salad.
salmon.author: Thuyen P.
salmon.review:
I'm from Hawaii and on the last day of my trip, I need my poke fix ASAP or else I will go INSANE. 

My boyfriend and I were meeting my relatives and we needed some grub before heading to the De Young museum. We got here much earlier than them and the hostess allowed us to be seated, as my Aunt made reservations.

When seated, our server (I forgot her name but she is awesome!) promptly asked us what we would like to drink. My boyfriend and I ordered our drinks and we sat there for another 30 minutes waiting for my family. Our server checked in on us regularly, but nothing to the extent of pressuring us to order food. She refilled my boyfriend's lemonade regularly even before we ordered our food. Then after 30 minutes, my family FINALLY came!! I am ready for "California" poke!

What caught my eye was the Asian bowls. My boyfriend and I both got the Japanese Wasabi. I got the Serrano along with my bowl, while my boyfriend got the Serrano and Grilled Salmon. You get a choice of getting it with all rice (White or brown) or half rice and half salad. We both chose half,half. 

At first, I was really surprised how expensive the bowls were, being that it was at $16.50, but when it came out, oh my lordy! They are HUGE. Since my boyfriend got two choices, it was $5 more, which is pricey. The bowl came out and it was a mixture of greens, ocean salad, avocado, and your fish choice and our rice on the bottom. I couldn't finish it! My boyfriend barely finished it. 

The fish quality surprised me! It was just like home. The only thing I did not particularly like were the jalapeños in the poke. I had to pick it out while eating. I like my poke spicy but I don't want jalapeños with it. That is just my personal preference.

I will be back when I come back to San Fran! I wish Hawaii had something like this... It was definitely ono (delicious in Hawaii)!! yuuum!!

excerpts: I had salmon, and hubby had poke, and the coffee was some of the best I have every had.
Our cousin had a noodle dish that I forget the name of, but all of us completely finished our lunches.
We were NEVER rushed.
Since this was a once in a blue moon visit, we naturally lingered to talk, and we never felt that we were in the way at all.
Hightly recommend this restaurant if you are in the area.
salmon.author: Phyllis N.
salmon.review:
We ate a luncheon here while on a very short visit to San Francisco (en route to Fiji). 
We met our Norwegian cousin (in college in SF) and had a mini-reunion lunch, after visiting the beautiful Botanic Gardens. She had suggested this restaurant.
We were so very impressed with the ambiance, the wait staff, the entire mis en scene! Lovely little place!
The menu offered some great fish dishes, and it really lived up to its reputation! I had salmon, and hubby had poke, and the coffee was some of the best I have every had. Our cousin had a noodle dish that I forget the name of, but all of us completely finished our lunches.
We were NEVER rushed. Since this was a once in a blue moon visit, we naturally lingered to talk, and we never felt that we were in the way at all.
Hightly recommend this restaurant if you are in the area.

excerpts: I ordered the salmon chowder and the salmon was not as flaky and soft.
The soup base is very creamy though.
I also ordered fish tacos and it was alright.
Nothing to special.
salmon.author: John M.
salmon.review: Food here is not bad. Would definately come back however the fish isnt as fresh as other places i have been to. I ordered the salmon chowder and the salmon was not as flaky and soft. The soup base is very creamy though. I also ordered fish tacos and it was alright. Nothing to special.

excerpts: My boyfriend had the salmon poke.
It was an amazing variety of delicious fish with super rich and flavorful.
The food and the dining experience was great.
The food is a little heavy so come hungry and don't plan any other large meals that day.
Great place for a large weekend lunch.
salmon.author: Anne S.
salmon.review: Came here on a Saturday for brunch. They had outdoor seating with heating lamps where we cpuld sit without puppy. The qait staff was very attentive and suler friendly and we were able to sit down right away. We had the virgin agave lemonade which was decent for a virgin cocktail. I had the tacos. The fish meat was mostly fried so very yummy but heavy. My boyfriend had the salmon poke. It was an amazing variety of delicious fish with super rich and flavorful. The food and the dining experience was great. The food is a little heavy so come hungry and don't plan any other large meals that day. Great place for a large weekend lunch.

excerpts: Also had salmon poke and ceviche which were great as well!
$5 well drinks and $6 wines plus half price apps, sushi rolls and poke!
What a steal!
salmon.author: Caroline G.
salmon.review: Great, fast service and fabulous happy hour prices!!  The calamari and the tempura sashimi are wonderful! Also had salmon poke and ceviche which were great as well! $5 well drinks and $6 wines plus half price apps, sushi rolls and poke! What a steal!

excerpts: I've tried the original and the salmon avocado.
salmon.author: Jenna G.
salmon.review:
Honestly this place is so good. I've been to both the Marina and sunset location. Their poke is so fresh and good. I've tried the original and the salmon avocado. I also tried their mahi mahi tacos with sweet potato fries. Everything was solid. 

It is a little pricey because it's seafood, but I will keep coming back here for poke.

excerpts:
but I was disappointed that they only had the salmon entree option for lunch, even though on their website they said the swordfish was also an option for lunch :( 

Anyways, for the appetizer, we had the grilled shrimp salad, which was really delicious with the rice noodles and the shrimp was grilled perfectly!
It was either salmon or veggie curry for the entree
so naturally salmon all the way.
The salmon came with some bok choy and some potstickers, which seemed really random since they were a little soggy and weren't listed as part of the meal.
They were kind of good though
so I didn't mind haha.
The salmon was really good, crispy and slightly glazed on the outsider, but so tender on the inside.
salmon.author: Jingxi Z.
salmon.review:
Took my mom out for lunch for their Restaurant Week but I was disappointed that they only had the salmon entree option for lunch, even though on their website they said the swordfish was also an option for lunch :( 

Anyways, for the appetizer, we had the grilled shrimp salad, which was really delicious with the rice noodles and the shrimp was grilled perfectly!
It was either salmon or veggie curry for the entree so naturally salmon all the way. The salmon came with some bok choy and some potstickers, which seemed really random since they were a little soggy and weren't listed as part of the meal. They were kind of good though so I didn't mind haha. The salmon was really good, crispy and slightly glazed on the outsider, but so tender on the inside.

Also had some coconut ice cream at the end!

I thought it was pretty good but I don't know if I'll go out of my way to come here again.

excerpts: Both the ahi and salmon looked days old and was very low quality raw fish.
For being in San Francisco, I wouldn't even give this a rating of mediocre because it was far below that.
salmon.author: Betty R.
salmon.review:
Quality of the food at this place has really gone down. Very disappointing meal.

My husband and I spent the afternoon at the DeYoung Museum so thought we'd grab dinner to avoid traffic heading home to Oakland. I remembered this place was close by and the food was always good so I suggested we eat here. Boy was I wrong! 

We started with the scallop poke which was the seasonal menu appetizer. This sad dish looked like it had been sitting out all day--scallops looked dried out and definitely not fresh. There were little pieces of mango in the dish but there just wasn't much natural sweetness to the scallops so it isn't something I'd order again. I ordered the Chirashi which was literally $23 of old poke served on a platter of very little sushi rice. The ahi was gristly as all hell--I ended up spitting out 1/4 of it because I simply could not chew it down enough to swallow. Both the ahi and salmon looked days old and was very low quality raw fish. For being in San Francisco, I wouldn't even give this a rating of mediocre because it was far below that. My husband got the seared ahi salad. Again, ahi was subpar and too gristly to be enjoyable. The veggies in the salad, however, were extremely fresh and delicious. But come on, this isn't Pacific Veggies or a vegetarian restaurant. If I'm paying over $20 per entree for seafood I expect some quality grub! 

Overall vibe and ambiance of the restaurant was good. They've always been family friendly. We had our 2 month old baby so they gave us a big booth so I could have him sit next to me in his car seat. They offered us a high chair and brought the kids menu which had a decent selection of yummy items for the kiddos. Too bad my little one is still too small for solid food. Outside patio had lots of heaters and a fireplace so was toasty and warm. Service as expected was impeccable as always. We had someone clearing our plates as soon as we finished and the server was pleasant and helpful. However, the food is just really lacking and not what I remember it being. 

Do yourself a favor and take your pick of any of the other awesome restaurants off of Irving rather than waste $70+ on a meal for two at Pacific Catch.

excerpts: We started off with a Fire Cracker Salmon roll, which was delicious!
salmon.author: Katerina Y.
salmon.review:
I drive by this place every, single day. so it eventually made it on to my "must try" list.

 I finally went in yesterday and I honestly regret waiting so long. Everything my friend and I ordered was so delicious and not to mention our waitress was so attentive and delightful!

We ordered a Blood Orange Cocktail and a Kiwi Flash. If it wasn't a Monday night, we honestly wouldn't have stopped at just one each!lol

We started off with a Fire Cracker Salmon roll, which was delicious! 

My friend ordered the Mahi Mahi Hawaiin teriyaki bowl which looked, smelled, and tasted oh so good!

I ordered the 3 taco platter. One Mahi Mahi, one Cabo Shrimp, and lastly a Pacific steak taco. Yes, yes, and YES!! 

The portions were huge so we were full almost immediately but we still had room for some Mochi Fondue!! 

Overall, great location, delicious food, heated outdoor seating, can't go wrong!

excerpts: I regularly (like at least once a week for lunch) order the veggie salad and rotate between adding grilled Mary's chicken, grilled salmon, or seared Ahi tuna on top.
The miso dressing is so delicious and the way they "zoodle" the cucumbers is unique.
It's a good portion and is very filling on its own.
The chicken is always grilled and seasoned perfectly.
That's probably my favorite protein add-on.
The Ahi tuna and salmon (in that order) are good too for some variety.
The Ahi tuna and salmon (in that order) are good too for some variety.
salmon.author: Traci R.
salmon.review: This restaurant has a solid salad game. I regularly (like at least once a week for lunch) order the veggie salad and rotate between adding grilled Mary's chicken, grilled salmon, or seared Ahi tuna on top. The miso dressing is so delicious and the way they "zoodle" the cucumbers is unique. It's a good portion and is very filling on its own. The chicken is always grilled and seasoned perfectly. That's probably my favorite protein add-on. The Ahi tuna and salmon (in that order) are good too for some variety.

excerpts: I ordered the salmon roll and did not have salmon in it.
They were awkward big, cut in different sizes and full of cheap veggies but no salmon.
salmon.author: Eryka S.
salmon.review:
Horrible sushi. They aren't a sushi resrayrant, but oh wow, at least do something descent. Rolls were falling apart, tastless. I ordered the salmon roll and did not have salmon in it. They were awkward big, cut in different sizes and full of cheap veggies but no salmon.
The Hawaiian poke made me sick of my stomach. It is already pre-maid tuna binded with mayo. Not good.
Anyways, there room for plenty of improvement.
I went with 10 co-workers and none of them liked their food. None!

excerpts: Last dish was the Teriyaki Salmon Bowl which was Outstanding and almost more than my friend could eat.
salmon.author: Marla B.
salmon.review:
For whatever reason, I always "sigh" when I enter this restaurant. I love the large but somewhat intimate space (booths are intimate that is), the clean lines and light inviting space. The service is always on point without being pushy. I also find the servers to be very knowledgeable and honest about their menu. Plus it's a great destination place after a stroll in Golden Gate Park.
I had the Mixed Fish Basket (Cod, Calamari and Oysters) which was yummy and just the right portion of food. Another friend had the Wasabi Poke Bowl which she loved and the presentation was gorgeous. Last dish was the Teriyaki Salmon Bowl which was Outstanding and almost more than my friend could eat. I appreciated the fact, on the bowls they mixed the rice, white and brown which added a whole new flavor to the bowls composition.

https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g60713-d944983-r426357920-Pacific_Catch-San_Francisco_California.html#

excerpts: Order the Ahi sandwich but substituted the ahi for salmon
and oh my goodness it was delicious!
The bread was so soft and complimented the grilled salmon perfectly.
Service was amazing and food came out fast.
Will be returning
salmon.author: Raman D.
salmon.review:
Order the Ahi sandwich but substituted the ahi for salmon and oh my goodness it was delicious! 
The bread was so soft and complimented the grilled salmon perfectly. Service was amazing and food came out fast. Will be returning

excerpts: I ordered the salmon tacos which were blah.
The appetizer never came out and we had to ask what happened to it.
Probably won't be back.
salmon.author: Gena K.
