salmon.review: Came here on a Saturday night and sat in the outside area. The waitress was really sweet, but not that attentive. I ordered the salmon tacos which were blah. The appetizer never came out and we had to ask what happened to it. Probably won't be back.

excerpts: I recommend the Chipotle chicken or the salmon for the salad.
They have
salmon.author: Arman J.
salmon.review: I come here all the time.  I love their salad bowls and their calamari is to die for. I recommend the Chipotle chicken or the salmon for the salad.  They have really good sweet potato fries and their coconut shrimp ate pretty good as well.

excerpts: original Hawaiian (ahi tuna), salmon avocado Hawaiian , and the serrano Hawaiian...
I preferred the Serrano Hawaiian
salmon.author: Dee R.
salmon.review:
I guess this place is a chain restaurant. Went here for lunch . The place has a nice ambiance. Food was mediocre...

I had the fish and chips with sweet potato fries. It was an Alaskan Cod...quite greasy...lacked salt but the jalapeño sauce that it came with balanced out the blandness. 

My friend had the trio poke...original Hawaiian (ahi tuna), salmon avocado Hawaiian , and the serrano Hawaiian...I preferred the Serrano Hawaiian

excerpts: Well, I have to say either the salmon or macadamia nut poke...
Per the waitress,  the macadamia nut poke isn't marinated in the sauce,  but the sauce (sweetened ponzu + onions) is poured on top prior to serving.
Therefore, you get the taste of the fish without the overwhelming saltiness of the marinade.
Service was great, even though the kitchen didn't tell her they were out of salmon poke until after they had already delivered our dinner plates.
salmon.author: Christina B.
salmon.review:
I always always always get my fix for poke from Pacific Catch. Perfectly marinated and placed on top of moist, sweet sushi rice and accompanied by Avocado, sprouts,  and ginger. You can even customize your bowls and choose which poke you want on top, as well as if you want everything on a bed of white or brown rice or salad. 

Which poke is the best? Well, I have to say either the salmon or macadamia nut poke... Per the waitress,  the macadamia nut poke isn't marinated in the sauce,  but the sauce (sweetened ponzu + onions) is poured on top prior to serving.  Therefore, you get the taste of the fish without the overwhelming saltiness of the marinade. I knocked off a star because the salad I ordered was over dressed and was salty. 

Service was great, even though the kitchen didn't tell her they were out of salmon poke until after they had already delivered our dinner plates. However, she apologized and I can tell she really did seek to find out what was going on with that whole situation even though it was the end of the night. 

Don't even ask me how the other food is...  Because I'm one of those types that can't get enough of a good thing and haven't ventured far enough to try anything else! 

Oh - and get the Coconut Porter by Hawaii Brewing Company if you haven't had it yet and are a fan of porters... Discovered it on my trip to Maui a couple of years ago and my life was never the same. Ok.. Maybe I'm being facetious, but it's really good.

excerpts: We've tried the Korean sticky ribs, Kona coffee ribs, fried calamari, shrimp ceviche (my favorite), the poke trio with the California, original, and white tuna, the salmon poke, and the spicy tuna sushi roll.
The Kona coffee ribs were amazing
but I think were only around for a limited time.
The sushi rolls were just mediocre, this isn't a sushi joint
so I would stay away from the rolls and stick to the poke.
The original poke is a little too salty
but it's tolerable if you pair with rice
, the white tuna poke was a little on the dry side, I would've liked more liquid/lemon on it
and it had a really "fishy" taste, the California was probably the best, and the salmon poke was good but a bit on the spicy side.
and it had a really "fishy" taste, the California was probably the best, and the salmon poke was good but a bit on the spicy side.
For entrees we've had the poke salad (amazing), the Thai curry bowl with salmon (also amazing it was one of the best salmons I've ever had), and the teriyaki bowl with steak.
To be honest I would stick to what they know best which is probably fish.
The steak was just ok
and they weren't very generous with the portions.
It was more rice and a whole lot of other stuff on it like pineapples, edamame, carrots, shiitake mushrooms, and A LOT of fried onions.
I do have to say tho that the teriyaki sauce they use is delicious, I couldn't stop eating the rice.
salmon.author: Linz C.
salmon.review:
I've been here a couple of times and I must say they have one of the best happy hour menus!  They even give you edamame and goldfish pretzels to snack on! 

We've tried the Korean sticky ribs, Kona coffee ribs, fried calamari, shrimp ceviche (my favorite), the poke trio with the California, original, and white tuna, the salmon poke, and the spicy tuna sushi roll.  The Kona coffee ribs were amazing but I think were only around for a limited time. The sushi rolls were just mediocre, this isn't a sushi joint so I would stay away from the rolls and stick to the poke.  The original poke is a little too salty but it's tolerable if you pair with rice, the white tuna poke was a little on the dry side, I would've liked more liquid/lemon on it and it had a really "fishy" taste, the California was probably the best, and the salmon poke was good but a bit on the spicy side.  The poke trio also comes with wonton chips, a small salad, and a delicious seaweed salad. 

For entrees we've had the poke salad (amazing), the Thai curry bowl with salmon (also amazing it was one of the best salmons I've ever had), and the teriyaki bowl with steak.  To be honest I would stick to what they know best which is probably fish.  The steak was just ok and they weren't very generous with the portions. It was more rice and a whole lot of other stuff on it like pineapples, edamame, carrots, shiitake mushrooms, and A LOT of fried onions.  I do have to say tho that the teriyaki sauce they use is delicious, I couldn't stop eating the rice.

excerpts: My friends ordered the green curry and the salmon salad.
They seemed very satisfied as their servings were very large.
The service was a bit slow but other than that it was a great place with  lots of customers!
salmon.author: Garret W.
salmon.review: Pacific Catch was recommended to me by someone that lives in SF. I ordered the coconut shrimp, it was crispy and hot but the serving was a little small and the side of fries were flavorful but a bit undercooked. My friends ordered the green curry and the salmon salad. They seemed very satisfied as their servings were very large. The service was a bit slow but other than that it was a great place with  lots of customers!

excerpts: Fish parasites were on our salmon poke.
Alive Worms!!
I immediately returned the meal.
I tried to talk with the restaurant about the compensation but no avail.
I still have the receipt, pictures and video from that horrible evening.
Anyway, since that time I didn't go to Pacific Catch.
It's basically closed for me forever.
salmon.author: Denis U.
salmon.review:
I never thought I would write negative... very negative review. Even if I got bad experience usually I share it with my friends only. Nothing would be different with the Pacific Catch restaurant... but today morning they just removed my comment on FB. It was negative but honest... I personally think that business should talk with the customer who is by the way always right. That's why I decided to share this with people on Yelp. It was more than a year ago but still really fresh for my family.
Let me try to make stressful and ugly long story shorter but still horrible. First of all I should say we, my wife and I, are huge seafood fans. A few years ago on Hawaii we were introduced to Poke. It quickly became our food crush... Once we got back to San Francisco we immediately started to look for Poke here. Our friends brought us to the Pacific Catch restaurant on 9th Ave in San Francisco. To be honest we fallen in love... Beautiful place, great location and POKE!!!!! We were absolutely happy! Then it became a nightmare. A few weeks later we were going to celebrate something with my wife. I proposed to buy a Poke. The children went to sleep. My wife lighted the candles. I brought a Poke. What else you can dream about? I thought nothing could ruin such a beautiful evening... I was wrong... Fish parasites were on our salmon poke. Alive Worms!!! I immediately returned the meal. I tried to talk with the restaurant about the compensation but no avail. I still have the receipt, pictures and video from that horrible evening. Anyway, since that time I didn't go to Pacific Catch. It's basically closed for me forever.

excerpts: The salmon smells funky and it's covered in sauce to hide that it's not so fresh.
avoid the salmon ceviche
salmon.author: M S.
salmon.review:
This place gives me an immediate stomache ache.  
This restaurant should be investigated by the health department.  The salmon smells funky and it's covered in sauce to hide that it's not so fresh.  avoid the salmon ceviche

Most of the sushi rolls are covered in some kind of mayonnaise and are poorly made with soggy rice wet seaweed and sloppy fish

The fish tacos are OK

excerpts: We got the Lomi Lomi poke appetizer - chopped pieces of salmon, tomatoes, sweet onions, cilantro, red chilies...
deliciousness.
The fish is always so fresh.
We also got the poke bowl in a roll (yes, we love poke that much) - fresh, delicious, not too much rice, generous amounts of fish.
We each ended with a bowl.
I got the Japanese Wasabi bowl with, yes, Poke.
salmon.author: Lisa G.
salmon.review:
I'm officially obsessed with this place.  

We decided to try the Pacific Catch in inner sunset.  They have sushi!!!  We went on the tenth anniversary for the poke bowls!  We got the Lomi Lomi poke appetizer - chopped pieces of salmon, tomatoes, sweet onions, cilantro, red chilies...deliciousness.  The fish is always so fresh.  We also got the poke bowl in a roll (yes, we love poke that much) - fresh, delicious, not too much rice, generous amounts of fish.  We each ended with a bowl.  I got the Japanese Wasabi bowl with, yes, Poke.  My fiance got the Korean BBQ Bowl with Marinated Skirt Steak.  The sauce was so good and the meat was soooo tender.  

We also had a Mai Tai and a beer.  

Once again, the staff is so friendly and welcoming.  It just makes you want to go back.

excerpts: We also really enjoyed the salmon salad (dressing on the side).
They gave us little edamame nibblets while we waited (not too long) for the entrees.
As good as the entrees were, the star of the show was the pineapple upside-down cake.
Outstanding!
(and it's not always available for some bizarre reason).
A diet disaster if ever.
Comfortable seating; service was a bit slow at first, then picked up.
5-star food quality.
salmon.author: David S.
salmon.review: I thought the fish and chips (we got four pieces) were the best we've ever had:  Very lightly battered, succulent, not greasy with great cole slaw and salad, too (we didn't do the fries).  We also really enjoyed the salmon salad (dressing on the side).  They gave us little edamame nibblets while we waited (not too long) for the entrees.  As good as the entrees were, the star of the show was the pineapple upside-down cake.  Outstanding! (and it's not always available for some bizarre reason). A diet disaster if ever.  Comfortable seating; service was a bit slow at first, then picked up.  5-star food quality.

excerpts: Salmon chowder special was filled with the brown salmon parts near the skin  that better places trim off.
Salads were plain with a few pieces of ahi.
Very boring.
Don't know why I ordered salmon tacos at this place but they were as expected, bland.
Fish did not taste that fresh but was okay.
salmon.author: Jon R.
salmon.review: A solid 3 stars. Not 3.5. Maybe 2.89 so perhaps not so sold. Salmon chowder special was filled with the brown salmon parts near the skin  that better places trim off. Salads were plain with a few pieces of ahi. Very boring. Don't know why I ordered salmon tacos at this place but they were as expected, bland.  Fish did not taste that fresh but was okay.

excerpts: I love the Wasabi Bowl with either Salmon or Poke, depending on my mood.
The food is reliably tasty, but in the times I've ordered something other than a Bowl, I usually find that it isn't as good (like any of the seasonal specials).
The service used to be kind of bad, but in the past years they've definitely improved.
The parking lot is tiny, but at least there's a parking lot.
UCSF affiliated people get a discount, so make sure you ask.
I also use their Thanx app to get points, which accumulate to free stuff!
salmon.author: Victoria J.
salmon.review: Pacific catch is one of my go to restaurants in San Francisco for a typical weekday meal. I love the Wasabi Bowl with either Salmon or Poke, depending on my mood. The food is reliably tasty, but in the times I've ordered something other than a Bowl, I usually find that it isn't as good (like any of the seasonal specials). The service used to be kind of bad, but in the past years they've definitely improved. The parking lot is tiny, but at least there's a parking lot. UCSF affiliated people get a discount, so make sure you ask. I also use their Thanx app to get points, which accumulate to free stuff!

excerpts: I spit out my salmon poke and gagged immediately.
My husband ate a few bites of his cooked salmon and is now violently throwing up.
I am contacting the health department tomorrow.
Shame on this restaurant for making people ill!
You know your fish is not fresh, and you still serve it to people.
salmon.author: Clarity B.
salmon.review: Rancid, rancid, RANCID fish! I spit out my salmon poke and gagged immediately. My husband ate a few bites of his cooked salmon and is now violently throwing up. I am contacting the health department tomorrow. Shame on this restaurant for making people ill! You know your fish is not fresh, and you still serve it to people.

excerpts: We told our waitress and she swapped out his dinner for Salmon instead.
I mean I guess just stick to what they're known for here.. seafood and not steaks?
She was nice enough to change his meal and ended up not charging us for the steak or the salmon dinner.
Sucks
though cause I don't think my dad would want come back
salmon.author: Michelle L.
salmon.review:
My usual is the Japanese Wasabi bowl w/ all salad and Hawaiian Poke! It's nice, healthy, and light! 

I brought my sister and parents for their first time last week. My ma ordered the Japanese Wasabi bowl w/ crab since I already ordered one with poke! The crab was really nice but I think I still prefer the poke!

My sister ordered the 3 taco platter and all three were delicious! 

My dad ordered the steak dinner w/ kimchee fried rice, veggies, etc. Sadly, the steak wasn't so nice.. We told our waitress and she swapped out his dinner for Salmon instead. I mean I guess just stick to what they're known for here.. seafood and not steaks? She was nice enough to change his meal and ended up not charging us for the steak or the salmon dinner. Sucks though cause I don't think my dad would want come back

excerpts: I ordered an original Poke and grill salmon teriyaki rice bowl.
The poke was not so fresh, darker than the ones I ate at the Marina Store, and not as chewy.
The Salmon was alright, but the rice was too sticky and the sauce was too sour.
salmon.author: Yuyang Z.
salmon.review:
Well, not so as what I have expected. The service was fast, but servers turn away fast and not much enthusiasm serving. The whole restaurant was big and open. I ordered an original Poke and grill salmon teriyaki rice bowl. The poke was not so fresh, darker than the ones I ate at the Marina Store, and not as chewy. The Salmon was alright, but the rice was too sticky and the sauce was too sour. I ended up packing up almost the whole rice bowl and brought it home to cook it over. 

Maybe this is just individual case, but I feel like although Marina store is much smaller than here, but I'd say Marina is serving in better quality.

excerpts: We ordered the California Style Poke, Marinated Skirt Steak Rice Bowl, Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl, and Firecracker Salmon Roll.
We finished majority of it all, yes we did (no shame, I'm tellin' you.)
But anyway, I really enjoy their poke, the wonton chips that comes with it was soooo crunchy and thinly cut, it melted in my mouth (a little exaggeration there, but nevertheless, I loved it).
salmon.author: Anna L.
salmon.review:
You know you're hungry when your bill comes out to be around 90$ total with only 2 people. Or maybe we're just fatasses.

I was craving some Hawaiian Poke, so my best friend and I decided to dine here for dinner. We sat near the bar/lounge area; this is a great spot for a good picture if you're a crazy insta-food-ographer like myself #guilty

We ordered the California Style Poke, Marinated Skirt Steak Rice Bowl, Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl, and Firecracker Salmon Roll. We finished majority of it all, yes we did (no shame, I'm tellin' you.) But anyway, I really enjoy their poke, the wonton chips that comes with it was soooo crunchy and thinly cut, it melted in my mouth (a little exaggeration there, but nevertheless, I loved it). PERFECT!

The rice bowl, however, was not as impressive especially for the price of it. I thought my rice bowl was way too overflowing with sauce, which made it so much saltier than it should taste and let me tell you, I am not a big fan of salty food. Not only that, the stuff that comes in it was nothing out of the ordinary. My friend said the same thing regarding the Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl =/ 

We've also ordered drinks as well and I believe we got the Agave Margarita and Pacific Catch Mai Tai. Not too sure if these were the drinks but it balances out the food we ate and helped extract the saltiness in the rice bowl, which is a good thing I guess? 

Other than that, I will come back and try other poke because I am a huge fan of poke!

excerpts: I ordered the salmon poke bowl with half greens and half brown rice!
I love this option.
We also ordered the salmon skin roll.
Oh yum!
While I love the crunch of salmon skin, I also loved that herby minty leaf they put in the roll.
salmon.author: Bern M.
salmon.review:
The man and I went out for dinner after an exhausting working putting us both out of commission in the kitchen...even for eggs.

We meandered through the neighborhood and went into this CA chain.

Ooooo, weee! I love me some poke.

We ordered the bowls.

I ordered the salmon poke bowl with half greens and half brown rice! I love this option. The man ordered the regular Hawaiian poke with half brown rice half white rice the rest greens. Mmmm. The serving size is ginormous. (Welcome to America). And the meal is good enough to be split into two. We took the extra helpings home for lunch the next day.

We also ordered the salmon skin roll. Oh yum! While I love the crunch of salmon skin, I also loved that herby minty leaf they put in the roll. I forgot to ask what exactly it is, but I'll pop in and ask soon! 

We'll be back for more and I can see this being one of our go-to restaurants. 

Come here to sit by the fire and heater or enjoy your food indoors!

excerpts: - Calfornia Salmon Sandwich -
my brother said it was one of the best sandwich he ever had.
salmon.author: Tammy F.
salmon.review:
We came for a Mother's Day Dinner with my Mom and brother. We made a reservation and waited about 15 minutes for our table. 

[ S E R V I C E ] 
- Our waitress Chelsea is super friendly. She came back to check on us multiple time. GREAT SERVICE!

[ F O O D ]
- ORIGINAL HAWAIIAN POKE - yummmy!! must get! I love the combination of avocado, tuna, seaweed salad, etc.
- Fish and Chip - I've had better but its not bad here...I liked the Jalepeno tartar.
- Calfornia Salmon Sandwich - my brother said it was one of the best sandwich he ever had.
- Sweet potato fries - yummy
- Sticky Ribs Korean BBQ - I liked it! Finger-lickin' good!

[ A M B I A N C E ]
- Bar is nice with TVs so you can watch the game.
- Restaurant seemed cleaned.
- Spacious! I love the booths!

[ P A R K I N G ]
- Parking lot located right next to the restaurant but there are limited spaces and they are usually occupied. I usually look for street parking, which could be hard around that area.

[ H A P P Y H O U R ]
- Happy hour from 4:00 to 6:00 Monday through Friday and everyday from 10pm to closing. Will definitely come back and try the HH.

excerpts: We had two salmon specials, fish / chips, and a rice bowl.
The fish entrees were delicious.
The rice bowl was a little heavy in the sauce (sort of common in restaurants).
The "sticky" ribs were tasty but a little tough in the eating.
Service was meh, our waiter was sort of mia.
There was a bit of a wait, but it was worthwhile.
salmon.author: L S.
salmon.review: We happened upon this place as we visited Golden Gate Park.  The restaurant is near the Botanical Garden.  The food was delicious, and probably deserves an extra star because it's a chain.  We had two salmon specials, fish / chips, and a rice bowl.  The fish entrees were delicious.  The rice bowl was a little heavy in the sauce (sort of common in restaurants).  The "sticky" ribs were tasty but a little tough in the eating.  Service was meh, our waiter was sort of mia.  There was a bit of a wait, but it was worthwhile.

excerpts: My favorite protein for these is the mahi mahi although the salmon and crab salad are a close second.
I got stuck on the tropical iced tea for a long time but recently tried the sparkling lemonade which offers free refills and is delicious!
salmon.author: Krislyn T.
salmon.review: This is a great place for lunch and has become my go-to spot where I take all my friends.  The modern decor is refreshing.  Their rice bowls and salads are wonderful with the half rice and salad option in the rice bowl.  My favorite protein for these is the mahi mahi although the salmon and crab salad are a close second.  I got stuck on the tropical iced tea for a long time but recently tried the sparkling lemonade which offers free refills and is delicious!  Oh and always opt for those sweet potato fries.  I've never had a bad experience and whoever hires all the servers finds the nicest people in the City!

excerpts: Another great meal, had the Hawaiian teriyaki bowl with Salmon, wow it was amazing.
Tuesday is also half price bottles of wine yes!
salmon.author: Jackie S.
salmon.review: Another great meal, had the Hawaiian teriyaki bowl with Salmon, wow it was amazing. Tuesday is also half price bottles of wine yes!

excerpts: We got the California style poke, the salmon and gyoza special, and my boyfriend got three tacos.
Everything tasted good, and I requested my salmon to be cooked rare - and it was!
So tasty, and the manager stopped by to make sure it was rare enough haha.
The poke was awesome.
The waiter/bartender was pretty nice too, and the drinks were great.
salmon.author: Medina C.
salmon.review:
Had a great lunch here! I know it's a little bit of a tourist spot but does it matter if the food is cooked well and the service is great?

We got the California style poke, the salmon and gyoza special, and my boyfriend got three tacos. Everything tasted good, and I requested my salmon to be cooked rare - and it was! So tasty, and the manager stopped by to make sure it was rare enough haha. The poke was awesome. The waiter/bartender was pretty nice too, and the drinks were great. I recommend the pomegranate ginger martini.

My only complaint is that the high tables were awkward to sit at because they blocked your knees from scooting in all the way.

We're usually in and out of restaurants in like 45 minutes but pacific catch was chill and we stuck around for a second drink!

excerpts: I got the Korean bowl with salmon, half-and-half with greens and rice.
salmon.author: Austin L.
salmon.review:
OMG the bowls!! Too good and it totally hit the spot. 

I got the Korean bowl with salmon, half-and-half with greens and rice. The curry bowl is also pretty amazing.

Good sized portions, great waitresses, and yummy drinks! Didn't make too bad of a meeting spot for a large group. :)

excerpts: We got the California grilled salmon sandwich and the wasabi poke bowl.
Great food great service
I'd come back again
salmon.author: Georgie O.
salmon.review: Very tasty very satisfying. I left feeling the perfect amount of full. It's very clean and the decor is very pleasing to the eyes. We got the California grilled salmon sandwich and the wasabi poke bowl. Great food great service I'd come back again :)

excerpts: Also my boyfriend's salmon disappeared before i got a good look at it
but i did taste the sauce that came with his artichoke...
some kind of basil dill aioli?
sooo nice!!!
salmon.author: Bethany Y.
salmon.review:
I was so starving after we were done with the park, and stressed from chasing the kids this place has the perfect atmosphere for calming down.

Our server was busy but our drinks came quickly.  A fantastic blood orange margarita for me ( i had just had a bad one the day before so i was really craving one...) they also happened to have my favorite fume blanc, ferrari carano.

Sweet potato fries and an ecstasy roll for appetizer seriously hit the table in 7 minutes flat... i was so happy!!! The sushi was so fresh tasting i could have eaten double!!!

The kids teriyaki chicken was too dry for kids and it was left untouched but the chipotle bbq chicken breast on my salad was lightly seasoned and perfectly cooked. Super yummy!!! Also my boyfriend's salmon disappeared before i got a good look at it but i did taste the sauce that came with his artichoke... some kind of basil dill aioli? sooo nice!!! i will be trying to copy it in my kitchen right away!!!

Next time I am in town I will be back!!

excerpts: I settled on a salmon chowder, and ahi Ecstasy rolls for appetizer.
salmon.author: Nick D.
salmon.review:
My wife and I visited San Francisco, and the Academy Of Sciences. After a little over two hours that morning of looking at nature, and marching through hordes of sight seeing morons, we were in much need of a relaxing lunch. 

Nicole spotted this place on Yelp, which is within throwing distance of the inundated Academy of Foreign Masses. 

We parked on the street, and I set a timer for the meter. The hostess seated us promptly, and our waitress quickly greeted us. After ordering refreshments, we looked over the menu and were very excited by all of the seafood choices. I settled on a salmon chowder, and ahi Ecstasy rolls for appetizer. My wife ordered an Ahi salad, and I chose the wasabi bowl with Poke. 

Our waitress brought a small bowl with edamame beans, and little fish shaped pretzels to munch on before the appetizers came. The ambiance here is very casual, and is decorated in a modern/Japanese motif that is actually very relaxing. It was busy, but not at all packed. 

Both the appetizers and the food were absolutely delicious. I am not a food critique, but my taste buds were quite stimulated by the blend of flavors used in the dishes. We were both very happy to have found this gem.

excerpts: We shared the spicy salmon roll for an appetizer and Chef was nice enough to serve it raw instead of frying it (so we could avoid my shrimp allergy).
I originally laughed at the idea of ordering a rice bowl with only half rice and half salad, but after eating the bowl, I see why.
I am a huge rice eater and still had most of the rice at the end of the meal.
salmon.author: Siu L.
salmon.review:
Service was great! I was a bit concerned about the experience based off the photos on Yelp and their website, as it was very swanky, and worried for all fluff no stuff. I am glad that we gave this place a try after a wonderful day at the CA Academy of Sciences.  I had the Hawaiian punch and poke rice bowl. I strongly suggest the punch if you are a lightweight drinker like me, as it tastes great and not overpowering with alcohol, but I got a fun buzz.  We shared the spicy salmon roll for an appetizer and Chef was nice enough to serve it raw instead of frying it (so we could avoid my shrimp allergy). I originally laughed at the idea of ordering a rice bowl with only half rice and half salad, but after eating the bowl, I see why. I am a huge rice eater and still had most of the rice at the end of the meal. Tip: If you order a rice bowl, order half rice half salad, and ask for extra hot sauce if you prefer more heat.

I will definitely swing by for lunch the next time I am in the area. The botanical garden was also conveniently across the street. It was lovely to enjoy a stroll among trees and flowers after a filling meal.

excerpts: My personal favorites are the BBQ chicken salad/sandwich and the California Salmon Sandwich.
salmon.author: Chris S.
salmon.review:
I come here frequently with my wife and mom for lunch dates in between classes. The restaurant itself has nice decor, as well as a small parking lot on the side. It is always very well kept up and clean. We never have issues getting a booth, and service is always very good. 

They have a great selection of salads and sandwiches. My personal favorites are the BBQ chicken salad/sandwich and the California Salmon Sandwich. Both of these go very well with their sweet potato fries. In addition to salads and sandwiches they offer a somewhat decent variety of sushi, all of which is very good.

excerpts: I also love the salmon salad.
PC always has specials as well which adds variation to my rotation!
lol
The staff is always nice and the wait time usually isn't too long (20min or less) especially in the day time.
salmon.author: Kaitlin E.
salmon.review:
I have gone to Pacific Catch since it opened and love it. The thai coconut shrimp, poke, and sweet potato fries are always in some kind of rotation when I go. I also love the salmon salad. PC always has specials as well which adds variation to my rotation! lol
The staff is always nice and the wait time usually isn't too long (20min or less) especially in the day time.

excerpts: I also came here for dinner before and their salmon/catch of day is pretty good too.
salmon.author: Ruxin H.
salmon.review:
My default place to go when I need a Hawaiian poke fix. Every Time I'm around inner sunset area, I would try my best to come here and get the original poke. I also tried several of their pokes and the original is definitely my favorite. It is kinda marinated ahi tuna chunks with soy sauce and onions. The tuna is fresh and high grade. I wouldn't say it is the highest quality of ahi tuna, but I think it is very good for the price point.

I would recommend getting the appetizer of tuna poke as opposed to wasabi bowls. I feel the portion of fish is a little smaller in the bowls and wonton chips in the appetizer go well with the poke. 

Sometimes I got the take out order of the poke appetizer and they gave a soup cup size of poke. 

I also came here for dinner before and their salmon/catch of day is pretty good too. Very huge portion.

Plus, service is incredible here. They served edamame when you are seated

excerpts: After reading the raving reviews about the salmon poke, i decided to order that with half rice and half salad.
That doesnt come with rice or salad.
You have to get the rice bowl.
His whole demeanour was just unpleasant and why didnt he ask me if i had any questions about the menu?
20 minutes later he brings the food out and finally the water.
Wow if i wanted this kind of service, i wouldve went to eat a chinese hole in the wall restaurant.
Or maybe i should have just ordered take out.
He never even came by to ask how we were doing or how the food was tasting.
The last time we saw him was when he dropped off the check.
salmon.author: Carmen A.
salmon.review: Mehh not impressed. The service was awful, and i can see why this location's ratings are lower than the one in the marina. We sat down and it took about 15 minutes before our server came by- who just dropped off some edamame beans and didnt even ask if we wanted a drink to start with. Another 15 minutes passed by...no water no server. He finally came back and asked if we were ready to order. After reading the raving reviews about the salmon poke, i decided to order that with half rice and half salad. "That doesnt come with rice or salad. You have to get the rice bowl." His whole demeanour was just unpleasant and why didnt he ask me if i had any questions about the menu? 20 minutes later he brings the food out and finally the water. Wow if i wanted this kind of service, i wouldve went to eat a chinese hole in the wall restaurant. Or maybe i should have just ordered take out. He never even came by to ask how we were doing or how the food was tasting. The last time we saw him was when he dropped off the check. Oh i guess he made the executive decision for us to not get some of that mochi fondue because he never asked if we wanted dessert or anything else.

excerpts: then we ordered salmon poke.
the salmon was nicely seasoned with small cuts of avocado too.
it was with a side of crispy wonton chips to compliment the appetizer even more.
it had a nice refreshing flavor.
then...... onto the main course!
I ordered the Hawaiian teriyaki pan Asian bowl with grilled chicken.
they had the option to change the white rice to 1/2 brown rice and 1/2 salad.
so that's what I did.
I didn't know the bowl was going to be so huge....
omg.
it came with crispy onions, mushrooms, grilled pineapple, carrots.
it wasn't too overly sauced, but the chicken tasted very chewy.
I don't know, it was weird.
haha.
but everything else in the bowl was good.
salmon.author: Audrey K.
salmon.review:
I've been waiting to try this place! I've heard mixed reviews from people I knew. but, my boyfriend said he's been here many times and said it was good. 
we came around 11, right when they open and it was getting relatively busy! so I'm taking that as a good thing. as we browsed through the menu, he mentioned that the sweet potato fries were a must. I love sweet potato fries, so.... why not! they were delicious with two choices of sauces. a sweet and tangy sauce(usually eaten with egg rolls) and a wasabi ginger kind. I wasn't a big fan of wasabi or ginger haha. but the fries were yummy! then we ordered salmon poke. the salmon was nicely seasoned with small cuts of avocado too. it was with a side of crispy wonton chips to compliment the appetizer even more. it had a nice refreshing flavor. then...... onto the main course! I ordered the Hawaiian teriyaki pan Asian bowl with grilled chicken. they had the option to change the white rice to 1/2 brown rice and 1/2 salad. so that's what I did. I didn't know the bowl was going to be so huge.... omg. it came with crispy onions, mushrooms, grilled pineapple, carrots. it wasn't too overly sauced, but the chicken tasted very chewy. I don't know, it was weird. haha. but everything else in the bowl was good. my boyfriend ordered the Korean bbq bowl with white rice and sticky ribs. let me tell you.... the ribs were PRETTY sticky, hahah. we both barely even touched our bowls because we were so filled up on the two appetizers.. but we took them to go. and for two appetizers and two main courses, the total only came out to be $50! so I thought that was a good deal. the presentation of each dish was really presentable and nicely put together. the interior of the place was huge and you could opt for outdoor seating too. I literally felt as if I was dining in Hawaii. I do plan to come back, but my eyes were definitely bigger than my stomach... haha.

excerpts: It was the last day of their "wild salmon summer", so I ordered the salmon tacos.
And then started in on my beer.
Then the maitre'd came out, and apologized: they had run out of salmon.
Could I order something else?
Sure, why not
; I ordered what I'd been planning to order before I saw the salmon specials: the mahi-mahi sandwich.
So yeah, it came out a bit late, but
salmon.author: Josh B.
salmon.review:
Lemme tell you a tale of superb customer service.

So, at Pacific Catch on an unexpectedly busy Sunday night, so we sat at the bar.  It was the last day of their "wild salmon summer", so I ordered the salmon tacos.  And then started in on my beer.  Dinner took a while, maybe 35 minutes, but not surpising given how full the place was.

Then the maitre'd came out, and apologized: they had run out of salmon.  Could I order something else?  Sure, why not; I ordered what I'd been planning to order before I saw the salmon specials: the mahi-mahi sandwich.  So yeah, it came out a bit late, but  whatever.

So given how apologetic they were, I was expecting that they'd comp us the sandwich or maybe a beer, and I would have been happy with that.  But they comped us the *whole meal*.  On the house.  Naturally, we left a big tip.

Oh, and mahi-mahi sandwich?  Really good, as usual.

excerpts: I had the Hawaiian bowl with salmon.
Issue was I was supposed to have a lettuce bowl, but got a white rice (I'd even ordered brown rice before I was told I could get it with lettuce.
No refills on soda or water (the server never came around).
salmon.author: Tony S.
salmon.review:
I am so torn about this review.  My wife and I went there on 10/24 for dinner.  The food was really very good, however for as good as the food was, the service was just that bad.  I'd state the server's name, but he never told us his name.  

We had the ceviche for an app (I was supposed to have the Green Goddess Shrimp Salad, but received the ceviche instead......  The wife had the crab & cheese sandwich and fries.  Raved about it.  I had the Hawaiian bowl with salmon.  Issue was I was supposed to have a lettuce bowl, but got a white rice (I'd even ordered brown rice before I was told I could get it with lettuce.  No refills on soda or water (the server never came around).  Had to ask for my check.  

Come on, the food is soooo good, this would have been a 5 star rating if the server had even half-way tried.  As it is, we left annoyed and aggravated.  Hopefully our server will read this or at minimum understand why his tip was what it was.

excerpts:
Wasn't that spicy and was therefore very similar to the california style one... just seemed to have less flavor and no avocado.
- "Salmon" - this was just OK despite the fact that I usually LOVE salmon poke.
Note to self: get the salmon based one next time!
salmon.author: Aaron M.
salmon.review:
Five stars but only if you order right!  The one thing you have to know about this place: WASABI POKE BOWL.  To try it is to love it.  The other stuff on the menu is OK.  But here's the cool thing: you can now order a "poke special" appetizer, which includes your choice of 3 kinds of wasabi poke-style mini-dishes from a list of about 10.  We chose (over two visits):
- Ahi macadamia nut, which was most similar to the famed wasabi poke bowl.  The fav on the first visit.
- California style: creamy and really good, with avocado (winner!  And when I went back with another group, it was the unanimous winner among those who tried it on the second visit.)
- Creamy Spicy: skip it.  Wasn't that spicy and was therefore very similar to the california style one... just seemed to have less flavor and no avocado.
- "Salmon" - this was just OK despite the fact that I usually LOVE salmon poke.  

A special thank you to our server who helped us order well and within food allergy restrictions.  Note to self: get the salmon based one next time!

excerpts: Last night I had the Thai curry bowl with salmon, 1/2 rice and 1/2 salad.
The cucumbers were wilted, I didn't even eat them.
The brown rice was stale, the green beans weren't cooked properly.
The only thing I enjoyed was the salmon.
I'm not sure if it was the chef in the kitchen, they weren't terribly busy, but I left feeling majorly disappointed and knowing that I wouldn't return.
Who would want to pay 16.50 for a bowl of food like that?
Really unfortunate because I used to like this place a lot, but the food I got last night was unacceptable.
salmon.author: Saskia S.
salmon.review: I usually love this place. Their sushi and tacos are good. Last night I had the Thai curry bowl with salmon, 1/2 rice and 1/2 salad. The cucumbers were wilted, I didn't even eat them. The brown rice was stale, the green beans weren't cooked properly. The only thing I enjoyed was the salmon. I'm not sure if it was the chef in the kitchen, they weren't terribly busy, but I left feeling majorly disappointed and knowing that I wouldn't return. Who would want to pay 16.50 for a bowl of food like that? Really unfortunate because I used to like this place a lot, but the food I got last night was unacceptable.

excerpts: , Salmon sandwich (don't recall exact name), and Fish fry (which optionally? come with a very special side salad).
salmon.author: Alan C.
salmon.review:
I need to start by saying that I've been here at least 30 times in the course of the past 12-18 months. I go mostly at lunch or late afternoon, sit outside or at the bar -  you can assume that this effects my perspective.

FOOD: All in all, I'd describe their food as very good. Particularly good are the "Rice Bowls" these mixtures of seafood (your choice), brown or white rice, chock full of special greens, and sauces (again, your choice). All very customizable -  you can get half rice half salad (which I recommend). I'm also a great fan of their Oyster basket (a tinge over-priced but excellent), Salmon sandwich (don't recall exact name), and Fish fry (which optionally? come with a very special side salad). If you're feeling like a larger meal they have an ever changing roster of fresh fish dinners - (good to excellent) in my trials.

SERVICE: Have to give them an excellent rating here - following numerous visits, with numerous servers I've had CONSISTENTLY top notch service - competent, friendly and fast,.  I can only assume that management deserves much of the credit. Some servers especially warrant Kudos:Kate (who alas is leaving shortly), Alex, Rob and area come to mind..Sean, the manager (or day manager? is wonderfully attentive, constantly checking with customers to see if things are are up to snuff.

ATMOSPHERE, ETC: I find this a pleasant, bright and cheerful - but read first paragraph.The decor is simple and tasteful. The outdoor area is pleasantly cozy since recent renovation. I'm not nearly as attracted to the main dining room - but haven't eaten there in years. Noise level is pretty good by SF standards - although you need be prepared for occassional traffic noise in the outdoor porch area during rush hour. PRICING is pretty standard for the area, but varies according to dish. Some items are actually "deals" considering  that nearly everything comes with first rate sides.

excerpts: I am not a raw fish or food person but this is so delicious I believe it's tuna and salmon with avocado wrapped in seaweed and just a couple of tempura flakes and like a one second flash fry which crisps up the seaweed skin while keeping the fish raw.
It's sitting in a yummy sauce but best of all (drum roll....)
NO RICE.
Delicious choice for the folks low carb in it.....the shrimp ceviche is also an excellent choice very Limey.
They do not cook the shrimp but it cooks itself up in the lime juice.
Must be a chemical reaction how marvelous.
I never knew that, how cool.
I've actually never ordered anything else besides these 2 things.
The Mai tais are great!!!
And strong!!!
salmon.author: First L.
salmon.review: I love Pacific Catch. I love food that  reminds me of fresh fish and seafood and Hawaii so I can pretend that I'm in Hawaii. My absolute fave is the Ecstasy roll. I am not a raw fish or food person but this is so delicious I believe it's tuna and salmon with avocado wrapped in seaweed and just a couple of tempura flakes and like a one second flash fry which crisps up the seaweed skin while keeping the fish raw. It's sitting in a yummy sauce but best of all (drum roll....) NO RICE. Delicious choice for the folks low carb in it.....the shrimp ceviche is also an excellent choice very Limey. They do not cook the shrimp but it cooks itself up in the lime juice. Must be a chemical reaction how marvelous. I never knew that, how cool. I've actually never ordered anything else besides these 2 things. The Mai tais are great!!! And strong!!! I love drinking here in the sunset and eating sushi. Nice cocktails. They have a happy hour but it doesn't include the Ecstasy roll ( sad face).

excerpts: Love Love Love the rice wasabi bowl with salmon or ahi tuna!!
salmon.author: Lindsay Y.
salmon.review: Great service in the restaurant and for pick up (Eat24). Love Love Love the rice wasabi bowl with salmon or ahi tuna!!

excerpts: the Mahi Mahi tacos, the Sushi, Chicken salad, rice bowls, Salmon dinners, sandwiches and everything tastes fabulous.
A real winner.
Also, all of their drinks are tasty and refreshing.
I will be going back soon.
salmon.author: Donna C.
salmon.review: What a fabulous newly renovated restaurant with a hip, beautiful ambiance in the bar, restaurant and patio. The food is excellent. I have had the Mahi Mahi tacos, the Sushi, Chicken salad, rice bowls, Salmon dinners, sandwiches and everything tastes fabulous. A real winner. Also, all of their drinks are tasty and refreshing. I will be going back soon.

excerpts: We had the Pan Asian Rice bowl with Salmon, the calamari to start and the Coconut Shrimp to share.
salmon.author: Cat G.
salmon.review:
Calamari, yum!

This place was a great place to have dinner at. The servings were a great size, calamari was fresh, service was great - Amanda served us... and all the food was super fresh, and FAST! We had the Pan Asian Rice bowl with Salmon, the calamari to start and the Coconut Shrimp to share. 


Definitely recommend coming here.

excerpts: Highly recommend the wasabi bowl with either the poke or the salmon.
Always check the specials menu, they do some really great stuff (currently loving the spicy creamy ahi and cedar plank salmon).
salmon.author: Melissa A.
salmon.review:
Over the last few years, Pacific Catch has definitely improved.  They've removed a lot of the really saucy items and have made a huge effort to make quality, Hawaiian style poke - and it works.    

Appetizers:  If you're going with a group, get the ceviche trio - there's something for everyone.  Super tasty and love the won ton chips.  

Sushi:  Love the inside out - combination of california roll and spicy ahi, you just can't go wrong there.

Rice Bowl:  Highly recommend the wasabi bowl with either the poke or the salmon.  Mix it all up so the rice gets nice and flavorful.  

Tacos:  Like that you can choose from 1, 2 or 3 and you can interchange them.  I like the mahi, it's lightly seasoned and has that grilled flavor and it's not heavy so you don't feel like shit when you leave.

Always check the specials menu, they do some really great stuff (currently loving the spicy creamy ahi and cedar plank salmon).

Wine list has also improved - so thanks for that!

excerpts: Wild Salmon Season, etc.
- where you'll often find at least one amazing new item available for only a limited time.
salmon.author: David O.
salmon.review:
Really the only place for decent Poke in the Bay Area.  That, plus the various bowls - especially the wasabi bowl - are the main reasons to come here.  Some excellent cocktails too.  The rest of the menu is a bit hit or miss, with the more comforting items (fish tacos, calamari; fish n chips) faring a bit better than the more expensive main course dishes.

It's nice that they have frequent themed special menus - e.g. Crab Fest; Wild Salmon Season, etc. - where you'll often find at least one amazing new item available for only a limited time.

excerpts: I really like the ahi salad, and last night I got the salmon salad.
salmon.author: Amy G.
salmon.review:
You know, I really like this place. It's not the fanciest or most original or unique place in the world, but the food, atmosphere, and service are consistently good. So many places in this neighborhood have very heavy food (Thai, Chinese, etc.) and it's nice to go somewhere with lighter but still filling options. Obviously you have to like fish to eat here, but there is enough variety (fried dishes, sushi rolls, rice bowls, etc.) to please everyone in a group. I really like the ahi salad, and last night I got the salmon salad. 

One thing that's great about Pacific Catch is that they are very clued-in to allergies. There are a lot of gluten-free options. My dad asked for no onions on the side of his dish, and the waiter asked a lot of questions to find out if it was just a preference or if he had an onion allergy, as there were onions in some of the other parts of the dish.

excerpts: Love their bowls - korean bbq, salmon, ahi...pretty much everything...it's delicious.
salmon.author: Christy L.
salmon.review:
This is my spot for scratching that 'ahi poke' salad craving. I LOVE it.  The pitcher of mai-tais are quite spectacular too ;)

They have a great happy hour with drink and food specials, and their menu offers wonderful selection.  

Love their bowls - korean bbq, salmon, ahi...pretty much everything...it's delicious.  

BUT, I always seem to get the ahi poke salad.  I'm a picky poke eater...they made the cut.

Great for groups and when you're looking for a more reasonable spot to eat after the museum/CA Academy.

excerpts: We then had the Japanese rice bowl with poke and seared ahi as well as the miso salmon (also from the specials menu).
The rice bowl had great flavors- daikon, cucumber, sesame seeds and wasabi.
The poke was definitely the better protein.
(I've previously had the thai-flavored rice bowl and have to say the Japanese one has a much better flavor profile).
The miso salmon was just average, not that interesting, cooked fine, but overall not much to write about.
salmon.author: Amy D.
salmon.review:
Pacific catch has pricey mediocre food of large proportions. The service was friendly although our entrees came out before our appetizers which was not ideal.

We started with the crab dumplings from the specials menu.  They were mushy and came with a bad-Chinese-restaurant-style dipping sauce.  We then had the Japanese rice bowl with poke and seared ahi as well as the miso salmon (also from the specials menu). The rice bowl had great flavors- daikon, cucumber, sesame seeds and wasabi. The poke was definitely the better protein. (I've previously had the thai-flavored rice bowl and have to say the Japanese one has a much better flavor profile). The miso salmon was just average, not that interesting, cooked fine, but overall not much to write about.

The agave lemonade and the mint and lime "nojito" were also just forgettable drinks. They tasted like average watery lemonade and flavored soda water, respectively.

Overall, the meal was fairly bleh to average (which we count as two stars) but pricey for just average mains ($18-$20). I doubt we will be coming back for dinner. However, their happy hour is pretty good and the poke is on it as well.

excerpts: I highly recommend the wasabi bowl with salmon and brown rice.
It was so so good.
I like their sushi too
salmon.author: Hello G.
salmon.review: Delish! How does this only have 3.5 stars?! This place is da' bomb. The food is super tasty. I highly recommend the wasabi bowl with salmon and brown rice. It was so so good. I like their sushi too but it is a bit pricey ($9 for a California roll). That being said, 5 stars for taste!

excerpts: Today I had the wasabi salmon bowl and it was pretty delicious and healthy!
I've never been too big of a fan on wasabi but this bowl taste amazing!
It's almost like a light honey mustard taste to the salmon and rice.
The bowl came with white rice, salmon, wasabi sauce, ginger, and a seaweed salad.
salmon.author: Jonathan L.
salmon.review:
I enjoy the atmosphere at this place.

I used to come here all the time when they had their ahi poke for happy hour! That stuff was bomb! But they got rid of it.. And it's 10$ as opposed to the previous 5.95$...

Aside from that their happy hours are from 4-6 and after 10pm. My friends come here for the Original Cosmo drink half off During happy hour. 

Today I had the wasabi salmon bowl and it was pretty delicious and healthy! I've never been too big of a fan on wasabi but this bowl taste amazing! It's almost like a light honey mustard taste to the salmon and rice. The bowl came with white rice, salmon, wasabi sauce, ginger, and a seaweed salad.

I really like their original idea of edamame beans with pretzel goldfish, it's actually a great combo when you try them together.

The only problem I have with this place is that the waiters are never really there when you need them.. They take forever and never notice you esp at the bar area.. It gets annoying!

Minus two stars for the service and taking out ahi poke from the happy hour menu!

excerpts: The salmon poke served at SF Chefs was delicious.
salmon.author: Belyn L.
salmon.review:
As a newbie to the City, I heard about this place through SF Chefs 2013.

The salmon poke served at SF Chefs was delicious. My experience encouraged me to visit the restaurant.

This location has a small parking area, but it's better than nothing! 

The boyfriend and I ordered the poke appetizer and we each had our own bowls. We both felt it wasn't as amazing as what we had previewed at SF Chefs. The fish didn't taste as fresh. 

I do appreciate that the bowls have vegetables and rice to balance out the diet. 

3 stars from me!

excerpts: For your main, my favorite the Hawaiian Bowl with Poke or the Korean Bowl with Salmon.
Good Lord those are good & incredibly filling!
salmon.author: Chantelle D.
salmon.review:
Don't let the chain-decor fool you (though, it really is a chain), Pacific Catch serves up incredibly fresh & tasty seafood in a variety of ways. You'd be remiss to pass up the Poke (my favorite is the traditional Hawaiian) that's served in a big bowl with warm, freshly made wontons. The calamari is also FANTASTIC. So just order both & thank me later. For your main, my favorite the Hawaiian Bowl with Poke or the Korean Bowl with Salmon. Good Lord those are good & incredibly filling! My boyfriend also loves the fish & chips or the tacos -- both really big portions. 

We prefer this location because it's bigger than the one in the Marina and... has PARKING! Yes, there are about 5 spots in the lot, but you can generally get a spot and a table. Tuesday Nights are also 1/2 priced bottles of wine to boot.

One of our regular faves!

excerpts: the Grilled Salmon Salad and the salmon was the driest shit of my life.
The dressing was also bland and nothing special.
salmon.author: Christine A.
salmon.review:
Ew. I came here again and we got HORRIBLE service. Our server didn't come to take our orders until almost 20 minutes after we were seated. The waiter also didn't collect our check way after we were ready to pay. The restaurant wasn't even that busy at the time! 

The food was not that good either. I had the Grilled Salmon Salad and the salmon was the driest shit of my life. The dressing was also bland and nothing special. The only thing good that we ordered was the basket of sweet potato fries.

Parking is a bitch because it's 9th and Irving. I really wouldn't have came here again if it wasn't for the fact that it's one of the bigger restaurants on the street, so it didn't have a wait. Now I know why...

excerpts: so I gave their salmon BLT a shot.
And OMG it was so great!
I loved the salmon, the bacon was cooked to perfection...
wow it was good.
salmon.author: Jade R.
salmon.review:
Uhm this place totally rocks. No idea why it's got low stars. I think it was GREAT.

My friend and I ordered the trio of poke: original, a creamy one with serreno chiles, and a white tuna one. I LOVED the original. I thought it was really good. It tastes like poke is supposed to taste. The serreno was my least favorite - it was really creamy, and I'm not super into creamy foods. I did like the spice, though. The white tuna was really refreshing. I would definitely order again.

They were previewing their special SF menu, so I gave their salmon BLT a shot. And OMG it was so great! I loved the salmon, the bacon was cooked to perfection... wow it was good. I only ate half, but that half was more than enough.

The waitresses were also super on top of it and really nice. I would recommend this place to anyone!

excerpts: I had the BBQ Salmon Sandwich.
The fillet was perfectly cooked and rested in bread that was neither too hard to too soft and topped with the best sauce I ever tasted.
I'm definitely coming back.
salmon.author: Randy S.
salmon.review: I debated whether or not I wanted post a review because, well, the place is already busy enough. We came here after a day at Golden Gate Park and truly stumbled into a gem. I had the BBQ Salmon Sandwich. The fillet was perfectly cooked and rested in bread that was neither too hard to too soft and topped with the best sauce I ever tasted. I'm definitely coming back.

excerpts: Their grilled salmon japanese wasabi bowl with brown rice was outstanding!!
Everything came out fresh and the flavors were on point.
salmon.author: La C.
salmon.review:
YUMMM!!! Just came back from an awesome lunch at Pacific Catch!! Their grilled salmon japanese wasabi bowl with brown rice was outstanding!! Everything came out fresh and the flavors were on point. Portions were generous to offset the price. 

Don't forget dessert --- you gotta try their dulce de leche fried rolls with vanilla ice cream! Completely delicious....

Service during lunch was not too shabby.....

excerpts: I ordered the salmon salad and sweet potato fries.
The veggies in the salad were fresh, the dressing was good and the salmon was fresh and very tasty.
The sweet potato fries were light and tasty.
salmon.author: Sharon L.
salmon.review:
This is a great casual place to stop and eat if you are at Golden Gate Park.  

I ordered the salmon salad and sweet potato fries.  The veggies in the salad were fresh, the dressing was good and the salmon was fresh and very tasty.  The sweet potato fries were light and tasty.  Nothing had too much salt, which was very nice.

I also drank lemon-grass infused iced tea.  Very different and good.

The service was good and friendly.

excerpts: I had the grilled salmon salad with long beans, shiitake mushrooms, cherry tomatoes, and a miso salad dressing.
It also came with fried salmon skin pieces, very similar to fried pork skins.
The salmon was juicy and not dry at all!
salmon.author: Samantha L.
salmon.review:
Complimentary edamame and goldfish pretzels - Yay?! Pacific Catch on Lincoln & 9th is a large restaurant. Both the bar area and the tables for larger parties are accommodating. As long as you are willing to battle for parking spots in lower irving then your'e good to go. It's a popular restaurant and has been on my list to try for a while.

All salads are $13.50.  I had the grilled salmon salad with long beans, shiitake mushrooms, cherry tomatoes, and a miso salad dressing. It also came with fried salmon skin pieces, very similar to fried pork skins. The salmon was juicy and not dry at all! It was a large salad and i only wish there were more long beans and cherry tomatoes in the mix! 

If i'm ever in the mood for an asian/hawaiian/seafood inspired menu i will be sure to come back to try more off the menu.

excerpts: I had the California sandwich with salmon.
It was an odd combination that didn't fit together.
I again took the fish out and at that.
The Cole slaw was really bland.
salmon.author: Lalena S.
salmon.review:
We were searching for a good seafood restaurant and saw this place. Overall, I'm disappointed. The service was slow and awkward, they gave one of us an incomplete menu and didn't bring us back a second one. The restaurant wasnt that busy but I think it was the way the server's stations are spread out so not everyone gets equal attention. 

The food was hit and miss. We had the calamari as the appetizer. These were the smallest calamari I've had and they also mixed it with red bell pepper and lemon. It was satisfying, nice breading but not usual. 

For dinnner, my friend got two tacos... Shrimp and halibut. They came with black beans and a salad which was so so. The fish itself was good but the combination was lacking flavor overall. He wound up eating just the fish. 

I had the California sandwich with salmon. It was an odd combination that didn't fit together. I again took the fish out and at that. The Cole slaw was really bland. It just needed some mayo. 

Overall, I wouldn't go again.

excerpts: We ordered the wasabi ahi poke bowl, the California salmon sandwich and the mixed fish and chips.
My ahi poke bowl was delicious!
So fresh and the ahi poke was very flavorful.
The wasabi sauce they use was soo good too!
My only thing was the proportion to rice to the amount of poke.
I had a ton of rice leftover.
salmon.author: Juvi Anne B.
salmon.review:
First timer here with the parents and I must say, not bad. We came in for a late lunch around 1:30 pm on a Tuesday and there wasn't a lot of people. The ambiance was quite nice. I just wished we were sitting in a booth instead of a table close to the kitchen, but that's just me being picky. 

We ordered the wasabi ahi poke bowl, the California salmon sandwich and the mixed fish and chips. My ahi poke bowl was delicious! So fresh and the ahi poke was very flavorful. The wasabi sauce they use was soo good too! My only thing was the proportion to rice to the amount of poke. I had a ton of rice leftover. My mom's sandwich was equally delicious and the sweet potato fries were super crispy. My dad enjoyed his fish and chips too but he mentioned that the regular fries were kinda soggy. The fish, shrimp and oysters were battered just enough and crispy all around.  Prices are on the higher end, but it's seafood. 

Overall, we'll definitely come here again! :)

excerpts: - i love salmon

but it was ruined by the saltiness of the citrus/salt
3.
caifornia style
salmon.author: Kenny L.
salmon.review:
After driving by and walking by this place so many times, I finally decided to give it a try on a thursday night

Stepped in about 630ish and there was no wait, which was perfect but yet not so much a good thing too? I guess that means the place isn't as popular as i thought?

Ordered:
Poke Trio.
1. traditional - the only perfect one. nice kick to the tuna
2. lomi lomi - i love salmon but it was ruined by the saltiness of the citrus/salt
3. caifornia style - i didnt really taste the crab but it wasn't bad

Taco trio.
1. traditional - tasted ok, the serrano salsa makes it better
2. mahi mahi - the best taco of the three! just tasted perfect
3. cabo shrimp - least favorite one. it just fell apart

grilled corn w/ lime butter - this was probably the best part of the meal. that corn was some of the best corn i've ever had


OVERALL: i'd be back only for the traditional tuna poke and the mahi mahi taco and that corn. but with all the "OK" food i had, all that dragged this review down to a 3 star.

excerpts: My salmon sandwich was so flavorless.
Can't fault a food business of this size/price range but, bummer calories consumed and dollars spent.
salmon.author: Catherine C.
salmon.review:
Pro: It's huge. Pretty clean. Better than average spirit selection. Nice servers. 

Con: Flavors and food quality bland and mediocre. My salmon sandwich was so flavorless. Can't fault a food business of this size/price range but, bummer calories consumed and dollars spent.

excerpts: The salmon salad had tons of crispy fried salmon skin and the California Roll salad had plenty of crab salad but without heavy mayo.
The fish tacos were very fresh and filling.
salmon.author: Melissa K.
salmon.review:
After a long flight from the east coast, we were hungry and tired of driving around so we decided to take a chance with Pacific Catch.  What a great choice!

Coming from Hawaii, I was a bit wary of restaurant's "Hawaii" theme and of the poke and other fish items but I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food relative to the price.  Entrees range from $10-$20 and everything is fresh and delicious.  Lots of fresh, creative salads, plenty of seafood options, and the food bursts with flavor and color.  

I really enjoyed the salads and the soup of the day which consisted of seafood in a tomato base. The edamame and pretzel Goldfish crackers were very cute, and I also enjoyed the wakame salad and the broccolini. The salmon salad had tons of crispy fried salmon skin and the California Roll salad had plenty of crab salad but without heavy mayo. The fish tacos were very fresh and filling. And the cocktails are phenomenal. 

Service was very good-- the waitstaff were very friendly and welcoming. Also, I'm super glad there is a parking area!

excerpts: I ordered a salmon club sandwich which was wonderful, except there was one problem.
One way I judge a place and their sandwiches, is how well the sandwich can stay together.
This one was sadly all over the place.
The salmon was constantly falling out, ingredients were getting everywhere, I ended up just using a fork to eat it as there was no way I could truly hold the sandwich to eat it.
I may be a predator, but I am by no means a drastic messy eater , so this put me off a bit, but the salmon within was cooked perfectly, and the flavor was very pleasant.
salmon.author: Jei C.
salmon.review:
At some point in one's life, they will feel the need to eat out a place that's a bit fancier than the little place down the street, but not so fancy that you feel intimidated if you don't dress up in fancy attire.

Pacific catch is a wonderful blend of both worlds.

I had heard some great things about this place, so when some friends were visiting from out of town and wanted to eat out, this cat decided to suggest Pacific Catch as a place to go and check out.

The atmosphere of the place is modern with a rustic, almost tropical feel to it. Relaxing, despite the fact that the day we went was quite crowded and noisy, but being a place with a decent reputation, and a sunday night, this is to be expected.

We were seated by a very nice waitress who served us superbly the entire visit.

We ended up ordering a sushi dish as an appetizer which was very professionally presented, and tasted absolutely amazing. While this place does not seem to be known for sushi, it definitely is some of the best I have had.

I ordered a salmon club sandwich which was wonderful, except there was one problem. One way I judge a place and their sandwiches, is how well the sandwich can stay together. This one was sadly all over the place. The salmon was constantly falling out, ingredients were getting everywhere, I ended up just using a fork to eat it as there was no way I could truly hold the sandwich to eat it. I may be a predator, but I am by no means a drastic messy eater , so this put me off a bit, but the salmon within was cooked perfectly, and the flavor was very pleasant.

Would I come here again? Yes, its a bit on the pricy side, and yes the sandwich was a bit of an issue, but that's just one dish of many that are not "hand held", so I may try something else next time.

And again, the people who work here are incredibly professional and nice. I very much felt welcomed here, as did my friends ^ ^

Good stuff!

*chirp*

excerpts: My friend and I were quickly seated, and I ordered the California Salmon sandwich - one of my usual entrees at the Campbell branch.
The salmon was slightly dry, the bread was a bit chewier than I'd like, and the spicy fries that arrived with the sandwich were soggy.
Meh.
salmon.author: Felix C.
salmon.review:
I usually patronize the Pacific Catch in Campbell, but I was in San Francisco one night and was in the mood for some Asian-seafood fusion, so I thought the Pacific Catch here would be a safe fall-back.

My friend and I were quickly seated, and I ordered the California Salmon sandwich - one of my usual entrees at the Campbell branch. The salmon was slightly dry, the bread was a bit chewier than I'd like, and the spicy fries that arrived with the sandwich were soggy. Meh. Meanwhile on the other side of the table, my friend had the mixed seafood platter and had no complaints, and I also got to sample some of the sweet potato fries for the first time - those are BOMB. We also ordered the Let's Get Saucy sushi roll, which was just dandy (although its pretty hard to screw up sushi).

The service here was decent. Our server was very friendly and had a good sense of humor, but didn't stop by the table very often. Whenever we needed something, we'd spend several minutes trying to flag him down cause he was consistently MIA for long periods of time.

Overall I had higher hopes for this Pacific Catch, especially considering this is San Francisco. I won't be returning and I definitely cannot recommend this location.

excerpts: I have an unhealthy obsession with salmon.
Well, I guess not that unhealthy if you take into account the omega-3s but seriously, I always crave it.
And thus, I LOVE Pacific Catch's Japanese rice bowl with grilled salmon.
Everything (avocado, seaweed, veggies) is fresh, and the salmon is cooked perfectly.
salmon.author: Laurel K.
salmon.review:
I have an unhealthy obsession with salmon. Well, I guess not that unhealthy if you take into account the omega-3s but seriously, I always crave it. And thus, I LOVE Pacific Catch's Japanese rice bowl with grilled salmon. Everything (avocado, seaweed, veggies) is fresh, and the salmon is cooked perfectly. Plus, it's big enough that I usually eat it over two meals.

I've also had the Hawaiian poke, and it's delicious - fresh and light.

I saw some complaints w/service here - whenever I've been it's definitely bustling, but I've never experienced any delays. Last time, the kitchen made an extra order of sweet potato fries, so the server gave it to my friend and I gratis! Heart.

excerpts: BBQ salmon for me, hawaiian themed escolar for him.
Both very blah.
salmon.author: Fancypants X.
salmon.review:
Date & Time: Thursday, 9 pm
Reason For Going: 9th Annual Dine Out For Life (25% of your bill goes to STOP AIDS Project)
Company: The BFF
Rating: 2.5 stars (I don't think I will ever eat at PC again. especially at this location.) 

Hostess was wonderful (enthusiastic, friendly) but our waitress clearly hated her job. Service was horrid--it took forever to order, we were basically neglected (checked on once right before we were done eating), water glasses filled once (again, pretty much at the end of the meal.) I don't expect any server to be Little Miss Sunshine (especially at the end of their shift) but please save the curt, one word answers & annoyed look for when you're fighting with your bf, not when you're dealing with a customer. 

Food was boring, uninspired, unseasoned--the artichokes were begging for flavor & the sweet potato fries were nothing without the dipping sauces (which were brought out only when I asked for them...u mean if I didn't ask for sauce, I would have been stuck w/ boring fries?! Boring fries are a no-no!) 

We ordered chicken wings which were brought out way after our entrees, so they graciously took it off the bill. Our entrees were lukewarm (pretty much the same way I felt about the entire dining experience with the exception of my best friend's company which is always 10 stars.) BBQ salmon for me, hawaiian themed escolar for him. Both very blah. The only thing that kept me from giving 1 star is the fact that the entire bill was about $41. 

The only positive thing that came out of dinner was being able to catch up with my friend & doing a small good deed at the same time.

excerpts: I got the "California Salmon Sandwich" with a side of salad and the bf got the "Traditional Baja Tacos" (I think?)...
but Anyway I was debating between that and a rice bowl.
I went with the sandwich and boy was
I delighted once it came out.
The salmon looked so PINK and FRESH!
It was cut in a certain way so that every bite I took, I was able to gather the taste of everything in the sandwich.
Also it was easy to bite into!
It was such a big surprise to me how fresh the fish was.
Usually, most restaurants serve a stingy amount of salmon and it is dry and not fresh at all.
GAWD.
It was so good!
The cole slaw was even good with it
and I hate cole slaw.
The salad was such a plus too!
salmon.author: Katrina T.
salmon.review:
i am seriously trying to go on a diet, so I have been trying to pick restaurants that serve fish or delicious salads! Looking at the pictures for Pacific Catch literally made me DROOL. The pictures of their food looked oh so good, I couldn't wait to try it ! 

Came here on a Friday with my boyfriend and were seated fairly quickly. It's so cute! Right when you sit down, they bring out a little tray with Goldfish Pretzels and Edamame. Weird combo, but I was dying of hunger so I ate it and it tasted fine. I looked at the menu for days before deciding what I really wanted. Be aware, the cost of the food is pretty pricy, but in all honesty, it is worth the money! I would definitely pay this amount to eat the food from here again! 

I got the "California Salmon Sandwich" with a side of salad and the bf got the "Traditional Baja Tacos" (I think?)...but Anyway I was debating between that and a rice bowl. I went with the sandwich and boy was I delighted once it came out. The salmon looked so PINK and FRESH! It was cut in a certain way so that every bite I took, I was able to gather the taste of everything in the sandwich. Also it was easy to bite into! It was such a big surprise to me how fresh the fish was. Usually, most restaurants serve a stingy amount of salmon and it is dry and not fresh at all. GAWD. It was so good! The cole slaw was even good with it and I hate cole slaw. The salad was such a plus too! I couldn't help but notice the couple sitting next to me with their "Hawaiian Poke" bowls!!! That looked awesome too! I super duper want that next time! 

Everything was GOOD GOOD GOOD! LOVE it! Coming back to try more freshness! 

oh yea this place definitely reminds me of Yard House. I don't know why, I couldn't tell if this place served American, Asian Fusion, Americanized Asian errr what. Whatever just as long as they satisfy my hunger I'm all about that!

excerpts: California Salmon $12:
This is where I wasn't too happy.
You get a slice of salmon that you can't even see at all, but can taste it.
I swear the slice of the salmon was the thickness of 10 sheets of paper... not the filet that you would expect from a salmon sandwich.
The bread was not toasted and so it was cold and not warm and crispy.
I think texture is key when making a sandwich, you get the lettuce, tomato, avocado and salmon (all of which have a moist texture -- except the lettuce)
and you want the bread to add a different texture...
this is just me,
I like my bread warm and crispy.
salmon.author: Erica T.
salmon.review:
My friend and I decided to come here for dinner on a Friday night. We decided to sit near the bar area because we would have to wait 15 mins for the next dining table. No biggie for us, I don't mind where I sit.

What I ordered:

Fruit punch (alcoholic cocktail) $9.50: Vodka with various types of fruit juices. This drink was STRONG! My face was red and I was pretty buzzed. I guess if I can feel the alcohol from one drink, it is worth the $9.50 you pay for it because you actually get alcohol in it, none of that watered down drinks at other places.

Thai Coconut Shrimp $13:  7 pieces of jumbo shrimp with coconut shaving batter, deep fried and with the sweet chili sauce.... mMMmm nom nom nom. My friend ordered this appetizer and I was a little hesitant. A lot of restaurants end up giving you small shrimp with crappy battered textured. This was pretty good, you can taste the actual coconut shavings, the batter was light and crispy and the shrimp was bigger than I thought it would be. I was happy with this dish.

California Salmon $12:  This is where I wasn't too happy. This dish came with a side of coleslaw (that wasn't really good) and a side of fries ( I picked the sweet potato fries). The sweet potato fries was good until it got cold and soggy, I recommend you eating it as soon as you get them! As for the sandwich, I was disappointed with it. You get a slice of salmon that you can't even see at all, but can taste it. I swear the slice of the salmon was the thickness of 10 sheets of paper... not the filet that you would expect from a salmon sandwich. The bread was not toasted and so it was cold and not warm and crispy. I think texture is key when making a sandwich, you get the lettuce, tomato, avocado and salmon (all of which have a moist texture -- except the lettuce) and you want the bread to add a different texture... this is just me, I like my bread warm and crispy. As for flavor, it had enough flavor and it was actually tasty, just sad that the main attraction in this sandwich was nowhere to be seen.

Service was great! The lady came by quite often to make sure our water will filled and to make sure we were ok. Overall, the food was ok and the service was great.  I would give 3.5 stars if Yelp let me....

excerpts: Their salmon rolls are very good.
salmon.author: Ketan D.
salmon.review: Great large place, great for large parties.  Very friendly staff.  This is our go to place at least once a month.  Their fish is just so fresh, they usually have specials so try those too.  I mostly get their spice rubbed fish tacos - hit the spot every time.  We also get their bowls - curry is good but spicy.  Their salmon rolls are very good.  You have the option for sweet potato fries which is a nice change.  Good beer and wine selection - mixed drinks are a hit or miss.  Park in the park nearby if you don't get street parking.

excerpts: I ordered the Grilled Salmon salad which said it had these ingredients - salmon, green beans, shiitake mushrooms, tomatoes, crispy salmon skin "croutons", citrus-miso dressing.
I had the dressing on the side and removed the fried salmon skins (there was way too much...)
so it would just be veggies and salmon.
However, after I started eating it, something felt off.
The mushrooms and green beans tasted as if they have been coated in some slick oil.
Somehow there was salad dressing in my salad even though I asked for it to be on the side.
The salmon was grilled with the same slick oil that made my digestive system act up for the remainder of the night.
My husband also had the grilled salmon special.
And guess what.
My husband also had the grilled salmon special.
And guess what.
salmon.author: Lucy C.
salmon.review:
I had high expectations for this place after perusing the menu online.  Since I am on a strict clean eating diet to determine some food allergies, I thought this would be a good place to go.

I ordered the Grilled Salmon salad which said it had these ingredients - salmon, green beans, shiitake mushrooms, tomatoes, crispy salmon skin "croutons", citrus-miso dressing. I had the dressing on the side and removed the fried salmon skins (there was way too much...) so it would just be veggies and salmon.  However, after I started eating it, something felt off.  The mushrooms and green beans tasted as if they have been coated in some slick oil.  Somehow there was salad dressing in my salad even though I asked for it to be on the side. The salmon was grilled with the same slick oil that made my digestive system act up for the remainder of the night.
