My husband also had the grilled salmon special. And guess what. He also had his tummy act up for the night as well.

Anyway, it was not a pleasant experience and wished we had gone to the other tons of restaurants in the Inner Sunset. I guess the lesson learned here is to explicitly ask if the ingredients in a salad are raw or coated in something... (Usually when I get a salad the ingredients are raw veggies unless they specifically say its not!)

Pros - 
- Service was great with a very attentive server 
- The restaurant is spacious and good for groups
- There was no wait to be seated even though the place was getting crowded

Cons -
- Parking is tough on the weekends around this area.  We parked a few blocks away
- Food is not super high quality for seafood

excerpts: I ordered the salmon sandwich, it's quite a big portion, but damn it was good.
the sauce they have on it, OMG.
so good.
salmon.author: Nina Y.
salmon.review:
So we've passed by this place probably more times than we should have and NOT tried it. We pass by it to go to the Park, or eat a different places on 9th, but one night, when deciding where to go for dinner instead of cooking, we decided to come here. 

Coconut shrimp was delicious beginning of our meal. The shrimp seemed to have been coated in breadcrumbs and coconut shreds and the boy doesn't like coconut, but ate these shrimp up. They were really good. 

I ordered the salmon sandwich, it's quite a big portion, but damn it was good. the sauce they have on it, OMG. so good. I go the sweet potato fries - great choice.  He ordered the japanese wasbi bowl with poke - which i learned is so popular in hawaii and is just soy sauce marinated tuna...or something like that. Definitely delicious. 

Really wished we got dessert, but we were so full afterwards, we could barely walk. Great meal, great service, pretty good prices.

excerpts: The salmon chowder is a must have!
salmon.author: Marianne A.
salmon.review:
Great seafood!  We came with the kids in tow and we all found something great on the menu.  The salmon chowder is a must have! 

I will definitely come again!

excerpts: He got the Japanese Wasabi bowl with Grilled Salmon.
I personally didn't taste it, but he said it was too rich, although the salmon was still pretty good.
salmon.author: Czarina Y.
salmon.review:
My friends and I decide that every time we decide to eat out, we need to try a new place. My friend suggested this place, we gave it a shot.

For starters, we tried one of their chalkboard specials. It's a Poke, forgot exactly what's called, but it's calamari poke. It was so good! Then I ordered their Island Tacos, for some reason, I went with their 3-taco platter just like what my friend got. It's pretty awesome that you can mix and match so we tried the Traditional Baja, Mahi Mahi and Cabo Shrimp. My friend finished the entire plate plus his side salad. I didn't =( but I ate all the shrimp and fish just not the tortilla. It was good though, next time I will remind myself that I don't have a huge appetite like my friends do and order 2 tacos maybe :P
My other friend who happens to be my boyfriend got the Pan-Asian Rice Bowl. He got the Japanese Wasabi bowl with Grilled Salmon. I personally didn't taste it, but he said it was too rich, although the salmon was still pretty good. 

Server was friendly and attends very well to our needs. Great experience! Can't complain and I will definitely go back. =)

excerpts: I had curry salmon with rice and bell peppers.
It was excellent.
Very customer friendly.
I am definitely coming back every time I visit San Francisco.
salmon.author: Dawn P.
salmon.review: Gluten Free, awesome.  They had a beautiful menu.  I had curry salmon with rice and bell peppers.  It was excellent.  Very customer friendly.  I am definitely coming back every time I visit San Francisco.

excerpts: This time, I had the Salmon sandwich and it was very good.
Coffee was nice and dark, in a large, modern-style mug and saucer, re-filled nicely.
salmon.author: Kimbalee W.
salmon.review:
In terms of a family-kiddo-friendly restaurant where you can chow down on fresh fare, wash down with a cocktail, stretch out with elbow room, receive attentive service,  IN SF,  I'd say 5-Stars :)

This time, I had the Salmon sandwich and it was very good. Coffee was nice and dark, in a large, modern-style mug and saucer, re-filled nicely. Hubbie had 3 tacos and they hit the spot.

I like this Pacific Catch, specifically. The one in Marin is lousy ... food-wise, ambience-wise, service-wise.

excerpts: I was really craving a great salmon dish and they had the perfect one here.
I was beyond satisfied and highly recommend this place!
salmon.author: Ashley Z.
salmon.review: Love love loved this place! I was really craving a great salmon dish and they had the perfect one here. I was beyond satisfied and highly recommend this place!

excerpts: My wife enjoys Wild Salmon Teriyaki Bowl.
salmon.author: Howard S.
salmon.review:
Many years ago, there was a small seafood restaurant on Chestnut called Pacific Catch. Ate there and was hooked. I now know of two others-one in Corte Madera, and one on 9th and Lincoln in SF. I frequent the 9th Ave. place the most. 

It is consistently good. How many places can rate this remark? I often order the Ahi Tuna Rice Bowl over Brown Rice and greens. Delish! Never a bad piece of Ahi. My wife enjoys Wild Salmon Teriyaki Bowl. I sometimes splurge on their Sweet Potato Fries. Outstanding! This was the first restaurant where I had this dish. Now most places have it on their menu.

Service is professional and prices are reasonable. Decor is cool, yet friendly. My only complaint is this place does get a bit noisy at times. There is a bar off to one side and it can get rowdy. 

I still give it 5 stars, mostly for the consistent food quality.

excerpts:
FOOD FAVs: 
Hawaiian Poke - sushi-grade ahi tuna in a sesame-soy marinade with wonton crisps
House Cured Sake Salmon - nori rice cakes, wasabi creme fraiche & black tobiko caviar
salmon.author: Elaine L.
salmon.review:
LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE!

1. Tasty food (I'll get into that below)
2. Great atmosphere
3. Friendly servers, bartenders, & owners
4. Great happy hour specials! Even late night!!

All ingredients to win a spot as one of my favorite restaurants!!

FOOD FAVs: 
Hawaiian Poke - sushi-grade ahi tuna in a sesame-soy marinade with wonton crisps
House Cured Sake Salmon - nori rice cakes, wasabi creme fraiche & black tobiko caviar
Sweet Potato Fries Basket - "signature" fries
Fried Dulce de Leche "Spring Rolls" - with vanilla ice cream & caramel sauce 

Happy Hour
4:00pm - 6:00pm, Monday through Friday
10:00pm - close, nightly

I've seen Pacific Catch participate at a ton of local events like the SF Weekly DISH and the Yelp Unwrapped Holiday Party and it's always been a big hit!  They really love their local customers and it shows when you talk to the staff either at these events or in their restaurant.

Now, I'm just patiently waiting till they open one up in the East Bay =)

excerpts: House Special Salad with salmon (4.5 stars)
OR the Salmon Salad (4.5 stars) OR the Thai Steak salad (4 stars).
salmon.author: Eugene M.
salmon.review:
I come here a few times a month. Awesome place... as long as you order the right items (I'm gonna tell you which, don't worry). 

For appetizers, I recommend the Hawaiian Poke (4 stars) or the Fried Oysters (3.5 stars). You can get the oysters with fries (I recommend the yam fries - ask for a side of Chili-Pepper sauce, you'll love it). 

For main, I'd go with a Wasabi Bowl; my favorite: Hawaiian Poke (5 stars) with brown or sushi rice (both good). If you've never tried it, get it; it's unique to Pacific Catch and it's awesome. For a lighter alternative, try their salads: House Special Salad with salmon (4.5 stars) OR the Salmon Salad (4.5 stars) OR the Thai Steak salad (4 stars). 

For dessert, get the caramel Spring Roll (4.5 stars)- it's on the sweeter side, but it's delicious.

excerpts: We got the Cajun ceviche, the miso salmon, and some sushi roll ( I don't remember).
Everything tasted amazing.
The ceviche came with fresh potato chips and it was spicy and cold and perfectly balanced.
The miso salmon was sweet and the texture was very tender, melt your mouth type.
The sushi roll was very good also, all sushi kind of blends together for me
but there was definitely nothing bad about it.
The service was great and the restaurant is large for San Francisco.
My only complaint is that it is a little pricey, but what do you expect was good seafood?
salmon.author: Melanie M.
salmon.review: I had heard good things about this place and everything lived up to the expectation.  We got the Cajun ceviche, the miso salmon, and some sushi roll ( I don't remember). Everything tasted amazing. The ceviche came with fresh potato chips and it was spicy and cold and perfectly balanced. The miso salmon was sweet and the texture was very tender, melt your mouth type. The sushi roll was very good also, all sushi kind of blends together for me but there was definitely nothing bad about it. The service was great and the restaurant is large for San Francisco. My only complaint is that it is a little pricey, but what do you expect was good seafood?

excerpts: I had their entree salad with salmon
and I liked it.
For $15, I was pretty stuffed.
Service was friendly.
Filled up our cups right away.
salmon.author: J C.
salmon.review: I had their entree salad with salmon and I liked it. For $15, I was pretty stuffed. Service was friendly. Filled up our cups right away. I've had their tacos and ahi tuna entree salad. They were also good. I like their original location bec it is a lot smaller but intimate. However, this location has plenty of space with a lot more seating and a parking lot for maybe 6-7 cars.

excerpts: I had the California salmon sandwich and my BF had the fish and chips.
After having the sesame slaw and side salad, I was quite full.
I had a bit of my BF's fish and chips (he got the cod and spicy fries) and everything tasted great.
I ended up getting the sandwich to go and later on for dinner
I had half
and it was delicious.
Light, not too heavy with the sauce and the salmon tasted great.
salmon.author: Shauna S.
salmon.review:
We came for a quick bite to eat and overall, gotta say that I'm quite happy with this place.

The Cabo calamari was delicious. Although they do mention that there was lemon slices, we didn't realize that some of them would be breaded and deep fried. Anyhow, they add a great deal of flavour and the bit of spiciness (thanks to the chilies) was really good. The spicy chipotle aioli was also very tasty (and tastes great with the fried fish if you manage to save some for when your entree arrives).

I had the California salmon sandwich and my BF had the fish and chips. After having the sesame slaw and side salad, I was quite full. I had a bit of my BF's fish and chips (he got the cod and spicy fries) and everything tasted great. I ended up getting the sandwich to go and later on for dinner I had half and it was delicious. Light, not too heavy with the sauce and the salmon tasted great.

excerpts: I had the original poke, and the BF had the hawaiian terriyaki rice bowl with salmon.
The poke was just OKAY, but we enjoyed the rice bowl.
It wasn't the best experience, and I don't know if the food is worth coming back for if I have to deal with service like that.
Perhaps I'll try another location.
My experience here was just .... mehhhh.
salmon.author: Christine L.
salmon.review: The food was good, but their service was sub-par. My server, I think her name was Amanda, had quite a bit of attitude. If you hate your job that much, then maybe it's time to find a new one! She didn't refill our waters, and when I asked her for a to-go box she went to the bar to chat it up with her coworkers for awhile. It wasn't until she caught my stare that she had the "Oh, sh*t" look and got my box. I had the original poke, and the BF had the hawaiian terriyaki rice bowl with salmon. The poke was just OKAY, but we enjoyed the rice bowl. It wasn't the best experience, and I don't know if the food is worth coming back for if I have to deal with service like that. Perhaps I'll try another location. My experience here was just .... mehhhh.

excerpts: My favorite entree is the veggie special salad with grilled salmon.
I have even been known to add the korean steak to it.
Recently, I tried their salmon club special.
WTF?
salmon.author: Irina S.
salmon.review:
Why have I not reviewed this place earlier? I love it here. I am a regular here; the servers recognize me, stay and chat. It's great. Sure, like with every place one can have a bad experience, but the great experiences and delicious food (well priced too)  outweigh any hiccup that might occur. 

My favorite entree is the veggie special salad with grilled salmon. I have even been known to add the korean steak to it. It's just perfect. 

Recently, I tried their salmon club special. WTF? That was just awesome! 

I also love me some thai iced tea! They make it super tasty and are generous with the refills. The lemongrass iced is great too, but please don't forget about the full bar! 

Lastly, a very special treat are the Fried Dulce de Leche Spring Rolls. Yea. Wow. Seriously, WOW!

I haven't mentioned their appetizers yet, but I feel like I should. The ceviche and fried oyster appetizers, and their hawaiian poke are really tasty. The spicy fries make a good side or just a yummy starter. 

Ok. I have to control myself. But this place is really good to come to just when you want a quick dinner, to catch up with a friend, or with a group. 

p.s. they have opentable to you get points for making reservations, and just recently started using the punchh app. Double perks for eating here!!!! Yes please.

excerpts: For our entree, I ordered the Hawaiian Teriyaki rice bowl with grilled salmon and it was amazeballs.
salmon.author: Kate E.
salmon.review:
I love this place! My boyfriend and I went here for our first time last week and it is definitely our new favorite spot. The food was great and I love the fact that I do not feel guilty eating their food since their portions are pretty big! Our server (I believe her name was Adriana) was really nice! She asked if we ate there before and of course we said no so she suggested to us what we should try. She was definitely helpful and made our experience there for our first time even better. It is always a love/hate feeling when we get a good server LOL we know we have a good server when we're thinking "dammnit now we really have to tip" lmao. Thanks Adriana!! We ordered the California Style Hawaiian Poke, which she recommended... and it was hella good, lawwd have mercy. For our entree, I ordered the Hawaiian Teriyaki rice bowl with grilled salmon and it was amazeballs. I will definitely be coming back for the rice bowl, the poke, and the service! 

Only downside is that we got pulled over before we got to the restaurant lol apparently we can't drive through a intersection until a pedestrian has gotten onto the sidewalk completely  -___- the pedestrian had barely started walking, but luckily we got off with a warning. They do have a small little lot so parking might be a bit of a hassle, but it is worth it!

excerpts: The Grilled Salmon salad.
Loaded with greens, mushrooms, a generous filet of salmon, and the best part - salmon skin croutons.
salmon.author: Denise M.
salmon.review:
I've found my new favorite salad.  The Grilled Salmon salad.  Loaded with greens, mushrooms, a generous filet of salmon, and the best part - salmon skin croutons.  YUM!!!  

As a special, they have a Dungoness crab and corn chowder.  OMG.  Slightly spice, but sooooooo good.  Chunks of crab to enjoy.

Hubby had 3 tacos.  Two types of fish, and the third was shrimp.  Very generously filled and very tasty.

Will definitely go back.  Only problem is, I'll just want that salad again... so many other things to try on the menu.

excerpts: My 1.5 year old threw up from the salmon and my husband got sick from the mixed catch (fried seafood and french fries).
salmon.author: Momo F.
salmon.review:
I would give zero... we've gotten food poisoning now 2 times. The first time we didn't call them but the 2nd time we spoke to the manager Patrick. Not only was he defensive and unsympathetic,  (and I was being really nice about it although I was furious) but he told me he would call me back about it the next day to follow up. Of course NO call. He also claimed that food poisoning takes 6 hours at least to set in, but if you look it up, if you are eating shellfish, like oysters, it can take 1-6 hours to set in.  

I would stay clear from this place or they should get rid of Patrick. My 1.5 year old threw up from the salmon and my husband got sick from the mixed catch (fried seafood and french fries).

excerpts: The bf ordered the thai curry rice bowl devouring it quickly and my friend ordered the salmon sandwich.
salmon.author: Jeannie L.
salmon.review:
Came here with mixed feelings because of what I read on Yelp but I try to never let it hender my experience. 

It's a nice, large, dimly lighted restaurant with a nice cozy feel to it. 

On the up side, our waiter was really friendly... the downside, he was really frantic and running around during our entire meal. We tried to get his attention a few times throughout and he either never saw us, or didn't have time to stop. The hostesses walking around were quite helpful though.

I got the California Roll salad which seemed to be a pretty popular item on the menu from all the reviews. It DID taste like a california roll, so that was pretty cool. I forgot to ask for dressing on the side, because I normally like my salad naked so that was my own screw up. The avocado was SO creamy like everyone says. I'd come back and order this. Plus, it IS rather large! 

The bf ordered the thai curry rice bowl devouring it quickly and my friend ordered the salmon sandwich. Both seemed pleased with their choices. 

Biggest issue was just the service... true to the reviews, it was lagging. Thankfully, my extra dirty martini helped me be more forgiving than usual. Next time, maybe not so much...

excerpts: I always end up getting the same thing; the salmon korean bbq bowl.
The salmon is always cooked perfectly and when paired with the yummy sticky rice and tasty veggies, perfection.
salmon.author: Kristin F.
salmon.review: This place is great! It is one of our favorite date spots; really nice restaurant but with a casual feel. The food is different but delicious. I always end up getting the same thing; the salmon korean bbq bowl. The salmon is always cooked perfectly and when paired with the yummy sticky rice and tasty veggies, perfection. We get the sweet potato fries as an appetizer and they serve it with sweet pepper sauce, such a weird mix, but really awesome.

excerpts: My BBQ salmon sandwich with spicy fries was excellent.
Plenty of interesting menu choices, kid-friendly and free parking.
It's an  easy to get to location (especially if you're just driving through SF on I-280/GG bridge).
salmon.author: Anna J.
salmon.review: Relaxed, casual pan-Asian dining. My BBQ salmon sandwich with spicy fries was excellent. Plenty of interesting menu choices, kid-friendly and free parking. It's an  easy to get to location (especially if you're just driving through SF on I-280/GG bridge).

excerpts: Each taco has a different fish, mahi mahi, cod and salmon.
salmon.author: Frankie F.
salmon.review:
My 2nd visit:

I was so impressed with my meal at P Catch the other night I had to try a couple things on the menu I wasn't able to the 1st time around.  So I ordered a bunch of rolls for pick up last night. 

Once again service rocks and the rolls were great. There are 8 large rolls per order, you have the option to substitute for brown rice which was a nice thing to see. Hopefully more sushi places will follow in P Catchs' footsteps and be offering this healthy option more.   

OG Review:

Pacific Catch really saved the day on Saturday night. I called in for a 15 head party the morning of and Rob, the general manger, really came through for me. He had a large party already booked but recommended I book 2 reservations and he would try to seat the parties close to each other. 

We all adjourned in the bar area for drinks. The bartender was awesome, great customer service! We were then seated and Rob reserved  2 booths next to each other. It worked out perfect because we used 1 booth as the kids table and the other for the 8 adults. 

There are peeled soy beans and pretzel gold fish on the tables to start munching. The menu rocks!  You can order sushi rolls, and sashimi for the sushi lover but for the not so seasoned raw fish eater there are teriyaki bowls and great specials available as well. I started with the seaweed salad and clam miso, so good. The table ordered the fried calamari which was liked by everybody. Watch out!  It comes with a spicy creamy dipping sauce which was received well, but it is hot! 

The tacos were a favorite of the group. Each taco has a different fish, mahi mahi, cod and salmon. They come with sweet potato fries, yum! I had the Surf and Turf, for 19.95, amazing!  The surf was shrimp with 2 skewers loaded, about 6 shrimp to a skewer. The meat was seasoned and juicy, very good. The entree also came with fried shoestring onions and pineapple fried rice, you have the option to substitute for plain brown rice. Large portion and great price! 

The staff brought out a complimentary dessert for the birthday girl. I didn't try any but I have a pic I'll attach. It looked fantastic and finished the night off perfectly. 

We had a great time and the staff was just great to us. Very accommodating. I will definitely be back and I love that it is so close to home!

excerpts: I also thoroughly enjoyed their salmon teriyaki bowl which came with shitake mushrooms, asparagus cut into the perfect size bites, and bok choy which was cooked to perfection, served over brown rice that's been dosed with some more of their flavorful teriyaki sauce (normally it's served with pineapple fried rice, but I opted for their complimentary brown rice substitution instead).
salmon.author: Amy L.
salmon.review:
While I desperately miss the Canvas Gallery, this place is a lovely new addition to one of my favorite neighborhoods, the Inner Sunset.  The food is good while offering many healthy options, the prices mostly reasonable, the feel is spacious, clean and stylish, and there's even a small parking lot by the side of the building with free parking for patrons...it's hard not to love this place!

This place doesn't add anything special to the neighborhood from a culinary standpoint, since it's another Asian Fusion place on the same block with three (yes, THREE!!!) other Japanese restaurants and within a block or two of several more sushi bars and fish restaurants...and arguably there's something formulaic and trite about the intentional hipness of the decor...

But there's also something to be said for dining in comfort, which is exactly what whoever designed and decorated this restaurant seemed to have in mind:  the lighting is mild and pleasant, the ceiling vaulted, giving the overall feeling of weightlessness, and the chairs and booths are mostly comfortable...although the booths will feel slightly cramped if you are very tall or have a big butt or tummy, since the tables are low and there's a non-removeable 1/2-height cushion behind your back that takes up about 5-6" of your rump room.  If you are under 6' tall and on the slender side, you'll be just fine.

The servers are very friendly and attentive, which is a pleasant departure from many restaurants in San Francisco, where courteous service sometimes seems to have been otherwise forgotten in the shuffle.  Pacific Catch seems to operate the way many serious, highly rated professional restaurant environments do, with a highly trained staff, attention to detail overall, and a menu that reflects modern trends.  For example, this menu offers not only foodie versions of Miso soup, but also a brown rice substitution option for those of us watching our waistlines or simply attempting to eat a more healthy diet.  

I recommend the coconut skewered shrimp and ordering anything that will get you some of their delicious sweet potato fries (healthier than regular fries, at least!)!  Be warned that you won't be able to eat just one...

I also thoroughly enjoyed their salmon teriyaki bowl which came with shitake mushrooms, asparagus cut into the perfect size bites, and bok choy which was cooked to perfection, served over brown rice that's been dosed with some more of their flavorful teriyaki sauce (normally it's served with pineapple fried rice, but I opted for their complimentary brown rice substitution instead).

Their traditional miso soup is average at best, and at twice the price that other Japanese restaurants in the neighborhood will charge for the same size bowl, it's nothing special and you get the feeling it's pricier because everything on the menu is priced a little higher, not because of an increase in quality.  Still, the presentation of the bowl, which arrived covered and was quickly de-topped by the server at the table, gives at least some clue as to what your money buys here:  a higher end experience, even if it's at a chain restaurant, even if the menu looks like a mash-up of Sushi-Bar-Meets-Fish'n'Chips-Joint, even if it's a Monday night in the Inner Sunset.  

There's something to be said for a restaurant that does what it does well.

excerpts: My salmon sandwich was yummy
and I want to try the rest of the menu,
but maybe I'll try a different location.
salmon.author: Annaliese D.
salmon.review:
Went here with a group for lunch on a Sunday. We had a reservation and the table was ready when we arrived. We were quickly given menus and water. Plus they give little dishes of edamame and pretzel goldfish (random!). 

This was where the efficient serviced ended. We had a few late comers so it took awhile for us to order. But I distinctly remember the waiter saying "the food comes out pretty quickly, so take your time" when we were going over the menus.

After we finally put our orders in it was SUCH A LONG WAIT. The restaurant wasn't busy when we arrived so that wasn't the reason. Our table ordered mostly tacos and sandwiches so it should have been relatively easy. Thank goodness we had those goldfish to tide us over.

Finally we got our food. I do admit that it was really tasty and fresh, but the wait was annoying. Prices are decent for a seafood restaurant, but maybe a little high for a regular spot.

My salmon sandwich was yummy and I want to try the rest of the menu, but maybe I'll try a different location.

excerpts: My favorite, hands down, was the BBQ Salmon taco.
Next time, I would get only Salmon for all three.
salmon.author: Rachel H.
salmon.review:
Having a child is a huge pain in the ass. People tell you this before you have a baby, and you understand in theory, but not in practice. Luckily, Baby H. and his face and his blonde locks are the cutest thing ever, so I don't mind lugging him, sans stroller (I forgot), along with all his accoutrements, for eight blocks to get to Pacific Catch. I just die when I get there, and hand over baby care to Grandparents while I drink my adult beverage.

So, parking is difficult, but if you don't have a gigantic baby with lots of luggage, it's not a terrible place to be walking blocks and blocks to and from your car.

I ordered the Kamikazi Margarita, which was a godsend. It made me feel super. For my lunch I had three tacos, each with a different kind of fish. My favorite, hands down, was the BBQ Salmon taco. Next time, I would get only Salmon for all three. 

I shared the fish part of the taco and the black beans that came with it with Baby H. He also enjoyed eating the complimentary Pretzel Fish Crackers and edamame. He was a totally happy guy, and flirted/screamed with/at the waitress a lot. He likes brunettes.

This is a good place to get a nice semi-healthy lunch and bring your baby, but DO NOT forget the stroller. I have since purchased an umbrella stroller that lives in my trunk all the time.

excerpts: but at the end i finally ordered the 3 tacos platter (Grilled Salmon taco -- which was very good!,
Spicy Chicken Taco -- very disappointing because it wasn't spicy at all!, & Shrimp Taco -- my favorite because it comes with a mango salsa).
salmon.author: Carol Y.
salmon.review:
I had a great time dining at Pacific Catch tonight. My friend and i walked into Pacific Catch without reservations and were seated promptly. I LOVE the decor, you wouldn't even think the place was previously the Canvas Gallery. I love the red walls, there are plenty of seating, full bar & most importantly an open kitchen. I love restaurants with an open kitchen which means the place is clean.

It was my first time dining at Pacific Catch and i thought the menu was overwhelming but at the end i finally ordered the 3 tacos platter (Grilled Salmon taco -- which was very good!, Spicy Chicken Taco -- very disappointing because it wasn't spicy at all!, & Shrimp Taco -- my favorite because it comes with a mango salsa). The taco platter also includs sweet potato fries (YUM!!) & black beans. The platter cost about $14.95. My friend ordered the Eel Wasabi Bowl but she requested no wasabi but instead terayaki sauce which was really good! i wished i ordered the Eel bowl instead ($14.95). In addition to the menu, each meal includes  fish shaped pretzels & endame beans.  Our whole meal cost about $30 with drinks. 

Overall, i really enjoyed my meal and i cant wait to come back and try the other items in the menu. I thought the service was really good, our waitress was very sweet and attentive. I am not sure why there are some bad reviews about the service. The waitress even came back to refill my diet coke without me requesting for one! 

thanks Pacific Catch for a memorable dinner! :) 

PS. parking can be alittle tough!

excerpts: My husband got the salmon that came with rice and vegetables.
salmon.author: Noelle T.
salmon.review:
My husband and I have eaten at Pacific Catch on our last two trips to San Francisco after getting lost, being crabby hungry, and stumbling across this gem last summer.  We loved it so much the first time that we made sure to make it a part of our vacation itinerary.

The food here is amazing!  Both times, I have tried things off of their seasonal menu.  The first time we went there, I tried items on their chalkboard menu that was Peruvian themed, and my husband ordered Korean barbeque.  On this last trip, we shared the shrimp coctel that was served with a mini shot of tequila.  For my entree, I had the mahi mahi, which was served with amazing sweet potato fries, a delicious tomatillo sauce, and fresh grilled vegetables. So delicious!  My husband got the salmon that came with rice and vegetables.  

The real star of the meal is the dessert!  Both times, we have had the fried dulce de leche.  It is literally the most incredible dessert ever.  It's rich, creamy, cheesecakey, gooey, and it's served with caramel sauce and vanilla ice cream.

I will definitely go back to this restaurant again!

excerpts:
Green tea : tasted like thai tea without milk  -.-"
BBQ salmon sandwich : flavorful, must try!
Hot/spicy fries : tasted like bbq fries to me, fine with that!
salmon.author: Annie Y.
salmon.review:
Green tea : tasted like thai tea without milk  -.-"
BBQ salmon sandwich : flavorful, must try!
Hot/spicy fries : tasted like bbq fries to me, fine with that!

excerpts: Lately, we've moved on to the Hawaiian Teriyaki Rice Bowl with Grilled Salmon and brown rice.
I like to get half brown rice and half greens.
That's greens, like salad, not green rice.
salmon.author: Kris L.
salmon.review:
A and I come here a lot now.  It's in a great location, spacious, almost always has room for us, and easy to walk to.

We used to always share the California Roll Salad.  They're awesome here because when you tell them you're sharing, they split everything up in two separate bowls for you.  

Lately, we've moved on to the Hawaiian Teriyaki Rice Bowl with Grilled Salmon and brown rice.  I like to get half brown rice and half greens.  That's greens, like salad, not green rice.  That would be weird.

I love the rice bowl.  It's tasty.  It's healthy.  But it's a bit too big for just me to finish.  I'd share with A, but he loves it so much that he always gets his own.

excerpts: The salmon salad was burnt.
salmon.author: Kristina S.
salmon.review:
The salmon salad was burnt. I did not like it.

Loved the place that was here instead a few years back.

excerpts: I ordered the California Salmon sandwich with a side of sweet potato fries.
The sandwich was really good.
The salmon was cooked perfectly, cooked all the way through, but it was still tender.
The bread was surprisingly good.
It was a Ciabatta, but the outside was crisp and the inside was soft and warm.
It also came with avocado, and a citrus aoli.
I have to talk about the avocado because the avocado here is extremely good.
Usually, the avocado I get at restaurants are not ripe and bland, but at PC it was soft and very flavorful.
The aoli was good too.
Not sure how it's supposed to taste like, but I liked it.
The sweet potato fries were decent, this last time I had them.
When I had them this time, they were a little soggy and cold.
I was disappointed because I had them once before
salmon.author: Anthony N.
salmon.review:
Came here for lunch around 12pm.  There was no wait at all for small groups; in fact, there were quite a few tables open.  The thing is this Pacific Catch is on the corner of 9th and Lincoln, so it's really hard to find parking.  PC does have a parking lot, but it's fairly small so it's hard to find a space in there.  

Decor: The place is really nice looking for a restaurant that's not super fancy.  Nice hardwood floors.  There are booths and tables; indoor and outdoor seating.  Wine bottle light fixtures here are a cool touch.  There's an open kitchen and a bar you can hang out at if you don't want to sit down and eat.

Food:  I ordered the California Salmon sandwich with a side of sweet potato fries.  The sandwich was really good.  The salmon was cooked perfectly, cooked all the way through, but it was still tender.  The bread was surprisingly good.  It was a Ciabatta, but the outside was crisp and the inside was soft and warm.  It also came with avocado, and a citrus aoli.  I have to talk about the avocado because the avocado here is extremely good.  Usually, the avocado I get at restaurants are not ripe and bland, but at PC it was soft and very flavorful.  The aoli was good too.  Not sure how it's supposed to taste like, but I liked it.  The sweet potato fries were decent, this last time I had them.  When I had them this time, they were a little soggy and cold.  
I was disappointed because I had them once before and they were on point.

Service: Here's where PC loses some stars. Minus one star for being slow.  The waitress actually took our orders and brought our food out very quickly, but after that the service fell off.  Took awhile to get a refill on my drink, and to get the check after the meal was over.

This might be mean, but minus one star for the hostess.  Don't get me wrong, the hostess was nice and all, but she was wearing this black mini-skirt, showing off way too much skin (she wasn't the attractive).  The whole time I was thinking, you're a hostess at a restaurant, not a vegas night club.  Other than that, the foods great.

excerpts: My daughter and I usually just getting our favorite grilled salmon or ahi salads.
The wait staff is friendly, the ambience is low-key and just upscale enough to make it a good place to have business meals.
Just plan ahead if you need to park - lots of tourists around there on weekends.
salmon.author: Julianne W.
salmon.review: This is one of our 'go to' places when we're in SF - always great!  The menu choices are interesting and varied - have not been disappointed yet! My daughter and I usually just getting our favorite grilled salmon or ahi salads.  The wait staff is friendly, the ambience is low-key and just upscale enough to make it a good place to have business meals. Just plan ahead if you need to park - lots of tourists around there on weekends.

excerpts: Will stick with Cali style, Serrano poke and Salmon next time.
salmon.author: W M.
salmon.review: Love tuna poke here! Original poke is wayyy too salty for me though. I ordered it once long time ago but thought I was just unlucky on that day so today I tried one more time and again, way too salty. Will stick with Cali style, Serrano poke and Salmon next time.

excerpts: I had the salmon teriyaki bowl and my pineapple fried rice was drenched in teriyaki sauce; there was probably 1,000 mg of sodium in every bite (okay, I'm exaggerating just a tad, but it was salty!).
I also tried the calamari...
salmon.author: Jennifer L.
salmon.review:
Not a good restaurant for groups of four or more people. I came here last night with a dozen friends to celebrate my birthday and it was impossible to get in and out of the long "booth" they stuck us in. I was trapped most of the night and couldn't get up to pee without forcing four people to get up and scoot out first. 

The food was sub par. I had the salmon teriyaki bowl and my pineapple fried rice was drenched in teriyaki sauce; there was probably 1,000 mg of sodium in every bite (okay, I'm exaggerating just a tad, but it was salty!). I also tried the calamari...it was okay. 

Overall, it's just an average restaurant, but I want to give them the benefit of the doubt, since my girlfriend's love it so much. Next time I come here, I'll order something different and if it's good, I'll change the rating.

excerpts: Saucy roll (spicy salmon and albacore).
salmon.author: MandS R.
salmon.review:
Have been coming here many times over the past 2 years. Generally consistent food and service, and great for meeting up with people. 

Nice to have a menu that crosses multiple cuisines and tends to satisfy most tastes. M-F, there is also a nice happy hour, which is also offered 10pm to closing.

Recent highlights include the Peruvian Ceviche - super delicious! And,  the Let's Get Saucy roll (spicy salmon and albacore).  

Definitely a place to go back again! and again!

excerpts: The best meal I've had here is the Cedar Plank Salmon slathered in a blackberry chutney.
Mmm...
Amazing.
It comes with a grilled corn on the cob, and potato fingerlings which I can only assume were seasoned with marsala.

Sandwich
-Firecracker Salmon Roll
salmon.author: James B.
salmon.review:
One of my favorite restaurants in SF. 

The best meal I've had here is the Cedar Plank Salmon slathered in a blackberry chutney. Mmm... Amazing. It comes with a grilled corn on the cob, and potato fingerlings which I can only assume were seasoned with marsala. (This is a special and is only available during certain times of the year.)

The best dessert I've had here is the Dulce de Leche Spring Roll. It's one of my all-time favorites. However it can be a bit rich and is best split between two people.

 Several other dishes I highly suggest:

-Thai Coconut Shrimp (amazing starter)
-Salmon Sandwich
-Firecracker Salmon Roll

They usually offer a few exotic beers, and if you're looking for a drink that packs a punch go with the Pacific Catch Mai Tai, if you drink more than one I suggest you catch a cab.

The only downfall here is that the service can become a bit hectic. They seem to be understaffed at times, but during a weekday afternoon there's never a problem. 

Eat on,
James

excerpts: The birthday girl's grandmother ordered salmon cakes and wasn't very happy with her order, but everyone else seemed satisfied.
salmon.author: Amy D.
salmon.review:
I was the first to arrive for a birthday party of 13, 15 minutes before the reservation. Upon checking in, the hostess took my box of a dozen cupcakes back for me without me having to ask. 

We had calamari, California rolls and fried shrimp rolls for appetizers. All were really tasty. I can't even remember the last time I've had a California roll with real crab. When you order the calamari, watch out for the slices of fried lemon! 

Dinner went smoothly without any mixed up orders. The birthday girl's grandmother ordered salmon cakes and wasn't very happy with her order, but everyone else seemed satisfied. I had the Mixed Catch Basket ($13.95)- it's a lot of food. In order of preference, 1. fish 2. oysters 3. coconut shrimp. The sweet potato fries were abundant, too. 

Later, they served the cupcakes on plates with spoons to everyone and it was really nice.

I think if I were to come here again, I'd order calamari and a side of sweet potato fries for dinner.

PS- They have disposable chopsticks here, and if you use a pair for appetizers, the waiter will take them away with your plate, and you have to open a new pair of chopsticks for your entree. Am I the only one who thinks this is super wasteful? I don't mean to go all Avatar on you (I haven't even seen it), but think of the trees!

excerpts: I finally settled on the shrimp and salmon tacos, which comes with a side of sweet potato fries.
I thought everything tasted okay, fresh, crispy and not-soggy fries.
salmon.author: Dru C.
salmon.review:
The family suggested this place for lunch, so we came here after finding some hard-earned street parking down several blocks away. Parking meters and their wretched quarter-gulping system... damn you! That's one thing that I hate, not enjoying a meal because you're worried if you're parking meter will run out of time. 

I'm a big seafood fan, especially fish or shrimp, so I had a tough time choosing what to eat. I finally settled on the shrimp and salmon tacos, which comes with a side of sweet potato fries. I thought everything tasted okay, fresh, crispy and not-soggy fries. Everyone else in the party seemed to enjoy their fish entrees. 

The problem is, living down in SoCal, there's a restaurant called California Fish Grill that's very similar to this place. Decent quality food, a plethora of choices, and a wide variety. Not quite the "Asian-fusion" vibe or waiter service, but comparable. The major difference is that Cali Fish Grill is very inexpensive compared to Pacific Catch. 

Our bill at Pacific Catch including tip was over $80, which I thought was very overpriced. Then again, there was nothing to complain about with the food. Perusing the reviews, it seems like Happy Hour is where it's at for the best deals. With all the other seafood choices in SF, I don't think I'd be returning again.

excerpts: What is disappointing is their other dishes that are Asian-based, such as their Salmon Teriyaki, fall below the standards of your average Japanese restaurant in the city.
Still, I give this restaurant credit for giving decent sized portions of fresh vegetables with most of their orders.
Their vegetables are fresh, and usually cooked firm.
salmon.author: Robert C.
salmon.review: The fish selection is pretty limited and it gets really loud when it's busy.  I usually come here for their seared ahi-tuna salad over rice.  What I like about their dishes is that they always gives you lots of vegetables and more rice than is fashionable these days.  It's hard to finish the entire bowl, especially if you include all that rice.  What is disappointing is their other dishes that are Asian-based, such as their Salmon Teriyaki, fall below the standards of your average Japanese restaurant in the city.  Still, I give this restaurant credit for giving decent sized portions of fresh vegetables with most of their orders.  Their vegetables are fresh, and usually cooked firm.

excerpts: For $12 bucks, you can get a savory BBQ Salmon Sandwich with a generous helping of orange goodness.
To top it off, the two extra sauces (sweet spicy & wasabi aioli) makes everything that much better.
salmon.author: Alexander H.
salmon.review:
Reunited at last. The last time I had good sweet potato fries was back in LA at Father's Office.  Coming here was a must once I knew we were going to the Academy Arts & Sciences Nightlife.  For $12 bucks, you can get a savory BBQ Salmon Sandwich with a generous helping of orange goodness.  To top it off, the two extra sauces (sweet spicy & wasabi aioli) makes everything that much better.  Although I haven't tried their tacos, but judging from the silence at the table I figured it was DAMN good.

I'll be back soon to try their bowls.  I don't think you can go wrong at this restaurant, it's definitely a "CATCH". =)

excerpts: The kids loved their chicken soft tacos and terriakki salmon bowl.
Service was slightly slow but the place was moderately busy.
Staff was friendly.
salmon.author: Michael G.
salmon.review: Poke salad was an excellent main course. One of the best entree salads in recent memory. Dressing was slightly sweet and complimented the mixed greens. The kids loved their chicken soft tacos and terriakki salmon bowl. Service was slightly slow but the place was moderately busy. Staff was friendly.

excerpts: He had something with salmon...
salmon.author: Lauren H.
salmon.review:
Pan-Asian Rice Bowls...Pan-Asian Rice Bowls! Woo Hoo!

My boyfriend came to visit San Francisco, and had a taste for some fish. Since it was pouring raining, and we were visiting Golden Gate Park, we decided to go to Pacific Catch, because it was close. However, we weren't dissapointed. 

I had the Japanese Wasabi with seared ahi! *rubs tummy*   He had something with salmon...I believe it was a sandwich, and those french fries were good. 

Our waitress was cool and I liked how she was able to recommend some wine for dinner. This place is alright with me!

excerpts: We ordered a steak taco, spicy tuna roll, and salmon poké.
The spicy tuna roll was indeed spicy but tolerable if you like spicy food and my poké was pretty good too.
I saw some reviews of people getting sick or not liking theirs but so far I'm feeling fine.
Overall a very good restaurant.
Must try!
salmon.author: Andrea M.
salmon.review: Went there for my first time today for a late birthday lunch for me with a friend for happy hour. Sat at the bar and got promptly waited on. We ordered a steak taco, spicy tuna roll, and salmon poké. Our waitor recommended this seared ahi tuna taco that was sooooo good. He also recommended my friend this spicy margarita drink that had vodka, passionfruit juice & jalapeños in it. It was good but WAY too spicy for us lol. No harm though for happy hour since it was only like $4. I paired my food with the mai thai. *caution* it is very strong so be prepared lol. (I tend to like my drinks strong anyways but it was stronger than I expected. Basically took shots towards the bottom of the drink) The spicy tuna roll was indeed spicy but tolerable if you like spicy food and my poké was pretty good too. I saw some reviews of people getting sick or not liking theirs but so far I'm feeling fine. Overall a very good restaurant. Must try!

excerpts: Portions were huge though the salmon fish and chips wasn't as exciting as I hoped it would be.
The sushi rolls and calamari were tasty!
salmon.author: Sarcastic T.
salmon.review:
Outdoor space with space heaters = dog-friendly. Yeah!
Service was a bit slow, but he was friendly enough. 
The spicy Pacific Catch Martini was AWESOME. Portions were huge though the salmon fish and chips wasn't as exciting as I hoped it would be. The sushi rolls and calamari were tasty!

excerpts: For our entrees I ordered the salmon teriyaki bowl with brown rice and my date got the poke rice bowl.
Both bowls were ok
and I'd go back again but
not as my first choice to eat.
salmon.author: Raquel T.
salmon.review:
I went here for a first dinner date. As we were waiting for the tables getting turned over my date and I had a drink at a bar. I'm not much of a drinker but got a mojito anyway. I was only done with a 1/4 of my cocktail until I started feeling warm. My date got scared that I was turning red and was allergic to something but it was just because I didn't Pepcid AC for my asian glow (I'm a super lightweight drinker). 

As we got seated, we ordered the calamari as an appetizer. The calamari wasn't the best I've had but it was ok. For our entrees I ordered the salmon teriyaki bowl with brown rice and my date got the poke rice bowl. Both bowls were ok and I'd go back again but not as my first choice to eat.

excerpts: The boy ordered some sort of sushi with salmon on it.
And avocado.
salmon.author: Ellis L.
salmon.review:
Sorry friends, while I greatly enjoyed your company, the decision to eat here was not.

Sweet Potato Fries - while I love them, there was nothing impressive here. They came with some Thai chili sauce and this other mayo-based sauce. I preferred them with the mayo-based sauce that came with the calamari.

Calamari - not bad, maybe their specialty is to batter-fry the lemon/peppers with it too...I was like: eeek, this calamari tastes like a lemon! (It was!)

Mixed Catch Basket - deep fried coconut shrimp, fish, oysters with more sweet potato fries. The fish was nice and flaky but maybe they need to work on the batter. For me, aside from good ingredients, if I'm gonna eat something fried, the batter needs to be helllla bomb.

The boy ordered some sort of sushi with salmon on it. And avocado. Both of which I love, but not at this particular place.

Sorry Pacific Catch, maybe I caught you on an off day.

excerpts: I loved my grilled wild salmon.
salmon.author: Marie Lynn M.
salmon.review: This place is super cool. I love the decor and the seating outside on a lovely sunny day. The food is great and really fresh. I loved my grilled wild salmon.

excerpts: - Salmon Teriyaki Bowl ($14.95): Asparagus, shiitake mushrooms, grilled bok choy, sesame seeds with teriyaki sauce, served over pineapple fried rice (I substituted with brown rice).
The brown rice was a little too hard for my liking.
salmon.author: Tracy T.
salmon.review:
This place is a great find. Parking is pretty ridiculous here. I seriously thought parking would be cake, since the park is across the street and by evening time all cars would be gone leaving plenty of street parking. WRONG! NO PARKING during evening hours stated clearly on the signs, but many cars were parked. A cop car drove in and I decided not to risk it. They do have a small parking lot next to the restaurant, but it fills up quickly. I suggest biking or walking. What better way to burn off those after dinner calories than riding/taking a stroll in GG park (warning: it gets really dark in there at night)?!

- Salmon Teriyaki Bowl ($14.95): Asparagus, shiitake mushrooms, grilled bok choy, sesame seeds with teriyaki sauce, served over pineapple fried rice (I substituted with brown rice). The brown rice was a little too hard for my liking. Other than that, I really liked the abundance of vegetables and the sweet/flavorful mix of pineapple in the rice was delicious. 

- Sushi Grade Ahi Salad ($12.95): Subsituted with Hawaiian Poke. Avocado, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds with soy-wasabi vinaigrette. The portion size of this salad is quite generous, great for a meal or for sharing with another dish. The poke accompanied the vegetables well giving me a healthy yet satisfying feeling of fullness. 

- Pineapple-Orange-Guava juice ($2.95): Tasted just how it sounds like; a mixture of all 3 with the guava juice standing out the most. Came in a pretty small glass, so I didn't feel like I got my money's worth. 

No reservations were made and there were plenty of empty tables in the main dining area, but the hostess escorted us and said the only table available was in the bar area. I did not even see the empty tables in the dining area fill up throughout my meal. I don't like the tables at the bar, not much leg room. Other than that, service was quick and efficient. The poke salad and rice bowls are definitely worth coming back for! 

P.S. Opened late until 11PM on Sun-Thurs and 12AM on Fri & Sat, score!

excerpts: The salmon and steak tacos were really good and the calamari and sweet potato fries were excellent!
salmon.author: Kate A.
salmon.review: We came here for happy hour and it was delicious!! A bit smaller inside but nice atmosphere and really nice wait staff. The salmon and steak tacos were really good and the calamari and sweet potato fries were excellent!

excerpts: My girlfriend had the salmon fish and chips.
salmon.author: Nick L.
salmon.review: I came here for a birthday party, and all I have to say is that this place offers fresh seafood and is worth trying. I would go here more often if it weren't that pricey, but otherwise I would definitely recommend the Hawaiian poke, one of the wasabi bowls, or the tacos. My girlfriend had the salmon fish and chips. The fish was pretty dry, but the sweet potato fries were pretty nice. I would go here again!

excerpts: I love the Green Thai Curry with Salmon and Brown Rice.
It always lasts more than a day and heats up super well.
Full of fresh veggies
I always feel good when i get it.
salmon.author: Amy P.
salmon.review:
I had the most wonderfully pleasant expierence ordering take out from pacific catch.  The staff was friendly and very efficient, I called and first asked if i could have an order ready by a certain time and they told me that I could do that, but there was a small chance it could get lost (I know there is always this risk and I appreciated they were honest) and it typically to about 20 minutes or something to get an order ready.  I decided to call later.  When i did I got the same friendly service and when i mentioned I loved the dipping sauces for the sweet potato fries they were nice enough to give me extra. YUMMY!!!!

When i got there to pick my food up they were quick, helpful and just made me feel like my business, even if it was pick up, was VERY welcome.  

Also, the curry bowls are SOOOOOO GOOD!!!!  I love the Green Thai Curry with Salmon and Brown Rice.  It always lasts more than a day and heats up super well.  Full of fresh veggies I always feel good when i get it.

excerpts: Salmon salad and Korean beef rice bowl was good.
salmon.author: Sam C.
salmon.review:
Corkage fee only $10 per bottle. With the mixed basket, fried oysters too 'fishy', shrimps was alright (better with cocktail sauce), fish was somewhat soggy with oils. 

Seating was comfy with pillow cushion. Never rushed us even though we sat there and talked forever. 

Calamari was fluffy and good. Fried lemon slices and peppers was interesting. Salmon salad and Korean beef rice bowl was good.

excerpts: As for my entree I had the Korean BBQ with steak and salmon which was also good.
salmon.author: Pudgy G.
salmon.review:
When this restaurant first opened, it wasn't really that great to me. And I remember the menu being very limited like it was only one page of dishes you could order. 

However, I went back yesterday and the menu has expanded and someone told me the chef changed from when they first opened and I was amazed by how much better it got.

My friend ordered an appetizer, the Hawaiian Poke, and I was just was all over it because it tasted so good!

As for my entree I had the Korean BBQ with steak and salmon which was also good. But I think I could have just had the Hawaiian Poke for a meal because that's much I was over it and kept wanting it.

The service was average between good, but not excellent.

excerpts: There was the Salmon fish taco which was particularly good as the Salmon was seasoned with the perfect amount of spices.
salmon.author: Winè C.
salmon.review:
I was unpleasantly surprised by the food that I got here, I thought that it was going to be so much better than this.

My friends who came with me ordered the tacos, which i actually suggest in this case though it is supposed to be Asian fusion. Their sweet potato fries are good as everyone says. Deliciously fried and tastes sweetly made. There was the Salmon fish taco which was particularly good as the Salmon was seasoned with the perfect amount of spices. My other friend ordered another sort of fish which was less satisfying but overall edible.

I ordered the crab chowder special for this month and was absolutely confused. At the time, I knew that they were leaning towards the Asian fusion as the decor and the menu boasted a modern chic approach to Asian food. Then tell me why oh why was my crab chowder Mexican? There were bell peppers diced into my soup with celery and what looked like green salsa/hot sauce atop of it. The crab was fresh but the overall taste of everything together tasted like they threw it all together to become a soup. To top it all of too, my plate was warmer than my soup. I saw the soup sitting there for awhile, unaware that it could be mine.

My friends and I came at 2:30PM with minimal amounts of people, however that also translated to minimal amounts of service. I couldn't get someone to heat up my soup until it was well cooler than warm and we couldn't get the check for another 20 minutes after our meal was completely over, as in all the utensils have been collected and the dessert menus are put neatly in a stack next to us.

It was a pretty place and I enjoyed the decor and my friend's company there as it is spacious and nice for drinks.
However for the price that we paid and the service I acquired, I am disappointed. The most disappointing thing of all was the food as I was starving and couldn't even like the food.

It would be nice if you were looking for somewhere to chill and had some time on your hands, but we had to keep sending someone off to feed the meter.

excerpts: I chose the ahi tuna serrano, california style, and salmon lomi lomi.
They were all awesome; I'll definitely be going back.
salmon.author: Melissa C.
salmon.review: Went here last night with my boyfriend. We shared the crab soup which was super bomb!! I wish we each got our own. He had the crab sandwich which was really good, too. I got the three poke dinner which is raw fish cut in cubes and marinated/mixed with different stuff. I chose the ahi tuna serrano, california style, and salmon lomi lomi. They were all awesome; I'll definitely be going back.

excerpts: We asked for brown rice for the rising sun and the firecracker salmon rolls.
I was not impressed by the rolls because the brown rice didn't stick too well and the rice fell apart.
salmon.author: Lisa C.
salmon.review:
Having been here for lunch, I was looking forward to dinner. I arrived thinking I wanted the seared ahi salad, but that quickly changed as we browsed the menu.  Instead, we opted for a few appetizers and two sushi rolls to share.  The sweet potato fries were irresistible- not too greasy; I kept chomping on them! The Hawaiian Poke and the Shrimp Ceviche starter plates both came with plenty of poke and shrimp pieces. I loved the lime-cilantro-avocado sauce the shrimps were covered in.

Though the starter plates were great, I think the sushi rolls were only ok.  We asked for brown rice for the rising sun and the firecracker salmon rolls.  I was not impressed by the rolls because the brown rice didn't stick too well and the rice fell apart.  I think the next time I'll skip the sushi rolls. 

Surprisingly, there was no wait at all for a Saturday night, and we were able to snag a nice corner window seat.

excerpts: I ordered the salmon with brown rice.
Yes!
With just the right amount of wasabi, it hit the spot.
And to top it off, we had the mochi balls dipped in warm chocolate.
Decadent, but delicious.
Ambiance nice.
Service was OK.
Could have been a 5 star.
salmon.author: Steve U.
salmon.review: After a nice afternoon at the new California Academy of Sciences we were hunger for seafood and fresh California style cuisine. After searching the internet we found Pacific Catch just minutes from the museum. To my delight, they were featuring their Seafood rice bowls, the perfect meal for three tired souls. I ordered the salmon with brown rice. Yes! With just the right amount of wasabi, it hit the spot. And to top it off, we had the mochi balls dipped in warm chocolate. Decadent, but delicious. Ambiance nice. Service was OK. Could have been a 5 star.

excerpts: Finally stopped by this local, green business to try their Salmon fish 'n chips on a slow Monday after riding my bike all over the city.
The decor of the place is nice, some nice attention to detail.
My waiter was very attentive and personable.
However, for $15, their fish 'n chips was a disappointingly meager and not very moist.

The Dulce de leche dessert was decadent and might have saved them face, but they took nearly 15 minutes to make my $9 cocktail with only 3 other tables in the whole place and waitstaff lounging in boredom on a slow Monday night.
Lame!
Lose 1 star!
salmon.author: Jake G.
salmon.review: Finally stopped by this local, green business to try their Salmon fish 'n chips on a slow Monday after riding my bike all over the city. The decor of the place is nice, some nice attention to detail. My waiter was very attentive and personable. However, for $15, their fish 'n chips was a disappointingly meager and not very moist. The Dulce de leche dessert was decadent and might have saved them face, but they took nearly 15 minutes to make my $9 cocktail with only 3 other tables in the whole place and waitstaff lounging in boredom on a slow Monday night. Lame! Lose 1 star!

excerpts: I went with the grilled salmon salad.
Before the food arrives you will get an appetizer, fresh cold lemon green beans and  very cute  fish shaped crackers.
I never had these kinds of beans before, very cool.
The salad was served quickly after, and was nothing short of amazing (see picture.)
The salmon was grilled crispy on the outside but still soft on the inside.
The salad consisted of bean sprouts, shitake mushrooms, and various salads, mostly baby leafs making it very crunchy.
It also came with what I understand was a yoghurt/lemon/soy sauce dressing.
It was blissful, never had anything like it before.
Another cool thing: the salmon skin is deep fried and served as a replacement for croutons to make everything a little crunchier, very cool idea.
Now this isn't a cheap place by any means, the salad was 14 dollars, but trust me when I say it was worth every penny!
Highly recommended.
salmon.author: Matthias K.
salmon.review: I ended up here after a long walk through Golden Gate Park, and at first I must say I wasn't impressed. From the outside and from quickly glancing over the menu I had the impression that this was a touristy place, pricey but average. Boy was I wrong. After being seated I had a closer look at the menu (there's also a daily catch one) and there were lots of really innovative and tasty sounding things on it, from Asian rice bowls to sandwiches and meal sized salads. I went with the grilled salmon salad. Before the food arrives you will get an appetizer, fresh cold lemon green beans and  very cute  fish shaped crackers. I never had these kinds of beans before, very cool. The salad was served quickly after, and was nothing short of amazing (see picture.) The salmon was grilled crispy on the outside but still soft on the inside. The salad consisted of bean sprouts, shitake mushrooms, and various salads, mostly baby leafs making it very crunchy. It also came with what I understand was a yoghurt/lemon/soy sauce dressing. It was blissful, never had anything like it before. Another cool thing: the salmon skin is deep fried and served as a replacement for croutons to make everything a little crunchier, very cool idea. Now this isn't a cheap place by any means, the salad was 14 dollars, but trust me when I say it was worth every penny! Highly recommended.

excerpts: The salmon special was drenched in sauce, which shouldn't be necessary for a good salmon filet.
salmon.author: Adam L.
salmon.review: Was expecting a little better for the money.  The salmon special was drenched in sauce, which shouldn't be necessary for a good salmon filet.

excerpts: but I think it was one of the specials of the day w/ salmon.
I do remember that it had a grilled artichoke.
I'm a sucker for some good artichoke.
And it was good.
The fish too, obvy.
salmon.author: Christie C.
salmon.review:
Beware the Dark and Stormy.

In other news.. been here a couple of times.  Left happy and satisfied each time.  The most recent time I came w/ a pretty big group (12 people?) and reserved ahead on Open Table.  They were totally cool when I kept calling in and changing the numbers, almost right up to the actual day.

It's been a while so I don't exactly remember what I got.. but I think it was one of the specials of the day w/ salmon.  I do remember that it had a grilled artichoke.  I'm a sucker for some good artichoke.  And it was good.  The fish too, obvy.  Their sweet potato fries are delish.  I've never been disappointed here.

excerpts: I ordered the thai rice bowl with fish (I think salmon).
it said that it had green curry (I am a sissy with spicy, and I hate it)
- I asked our server about how spicy it was
and he said pretty average.
Normally for me that means dude, don't order it - but I did.
It was spicy - but tolerable, as in I didn't need to drink 4 ounces of water and wait 2 minutes after swallowing before the next bite.
salmon.author: Emmet M.
salmon.review:
I've been here multiple times - this review is mostly from my most recent visit, Monday after Christmas (was crowded for a weeknight, probably due to people tired of cooking big holiday meals at home the prior few days and not wanting another night of leftovers!).

We got there close to 8 and had to wait a good 20 minutes (the host said longer, maybe 35) and everything seemed fine. We unluckily got the one bad server that night - it wasn't exactly that he screwed up bigtime specific things, he just seemed like he didn't care. I'm guessing he might've had a bad day or something. All of the other workers on the floor seemed happy, enthusiastic, etc.

The food - I always like it a lot. And when I go everyone else usually orders the fish tacos. Yes, they're good. But I'm the type who likes to try different things, even if I know that I like a specific dish at a specific restaurant. If I try other dishes and I don't like them I'll go back to what I like.

So, this time EVERYONE (7 people) besides myself orders fish tacos. I don't like to call my parents, brothers, and 1st cousins lame - but on this night they all were!

I ordered the thai rice bowl with fish (I think salmon). it said that it had green curry (I am a sissy with spicy, and I hate it) - I asked our server about how spicy it was and he said pretty average. Normally for me that means dude, don't order it - but I did. It was spicy - but tolerable, as in I didn't need to drink 4 ounces of water and wait 2 minutes after swallowing before the next bite. And the rest of it was really good - fresh, hot, a good mix of veggies with everything else.

We didn't order dessert - probably because dad was pretty ticked off.

I give it a 4 for this visit, this is ignoring the negatives about the server - he's human and it seemed like he had the potential to be just as nice as all of the other servers. But he should've not been wearing jeans that sagged (other staff weren't).

I give everyone else in my party a 2. For not trying other things on the menu. For getting angrier than they should've at the server and making it even more of an unpleasant time for all of us. For all of them saying i was weird for not ordering fish tacos then asking me to help them finish theirs even before i finished my fantastic rice bowl.

excerpts: I also tried wild salmon and it was overcooked.
salmon.author: Jessica N.
salmon.review: I recently came back here and enjoyed the food better than the last time.  I had the today's special yellow tail over brown rice.  It was good but nothing to write home about.  I also tried wild salmon and it was overcooked.  Hawaiian Poke appetizer was tasty.  It was a saturday dinner after 6PM and the wait was only 15 mins.  But in an hour the place was packed.

excerpts: As far as the food, he ordered grilled salmon/artichoke/jalepeno sauce, I ordered the meal sized salmon salad.
Both of which left much to be desired.
The oil on the salmon was all I could taste,
when I tasted my boyfriends dish, there was virtually no difference from mine.
salmon.author: Judy A.
salmon.review:
Unfortunately I chose this restaraunt to celebrate my boyfriends 45th Birthday. The service was so slow and the waiter and waitress were bothered by us when we requested water, or to see their selection of teas.  

As far as the food, he ordered grilled salmon/artichoke/jalepeno sauce, I ordered the meal sized salmon salad. Both of which left much to be desired. The oil on the salmon was all I could taste, when I tasted my boyfriends dish, there was virtually no difference from mine. It was like cafeteria food! 

Lastly, our waitress and waiter came by to check on us once only, the 2 or three times we needed anything, we were searching and waiting to flag them down, neither one would look in our direction. The dressing on my salad was absolutely bitter, unpalatable. 
 
I had long awaited trying the food here because it is just a great location with a nice ambiance, and I'm very sad to say, EVERYTHING was extremely disappointing.....

Don't waste your money.

excerpts: We also got some Salmon Roll, sweet potatoe fries, and calamari for appetizers and those were also just normal.
The prices I felt were a little on the higher side as well since the place is suppose to look higher end since its near a lot of other fancy and good choices in that area.
salmon.author: Alex H.
salmon.review:
I didnt think this place was anything special. It is basically just an asian fusion seafood place and has americanized japanese choices as well.

I ordered the Poke Wasabi Bowl which was basically a Japanese Bowl with Poke on top of rice, with seaweed, etc. It was good but nothing extraordinary. We also got some Salmon Roll, sweet potatoe fries, and calamari for appetizers and those were also just normal. The prices I felt were a little on the higher side as well since the place is suppose to look higher end since its near a lot of other fancy and good choices in that area.

excerpts:
We ordered: 

-House Cured Sake Salmon.
Salmon had a mildly cured taste, the wasabi creme fraiche had a little, but not overpowering kick.
Rice cakes were nice and crispy.
-2 Chipotle BBQ Salmon Tacos.
This was a mistake.
My wife wanted 1 salmon taco, and one Cabo shrimp taco, but they gave her 2 salmon tacos, but she didn't complain.
These taco were topped with cabbage, corn salsa, and lime crema.
Nice big chunk of salmon in each taco, and very tasty.
salmon.author: Steve L.
salmon.review:
After a pretty big banquet lunch at Golden Horse, I figured I was done eating for the day. We dropped by my folks place after lunch, and since they haven't seen the kids in a while, they wanted to spend some time with them. They offered to watch the girls and feed them dinner, so the wife and I can go out for dinner. 

What a nice surprise! An unexpected date night with my wife. Yeah, we were still full from lunch, but we took my folk's offer and headed out. Problem was that it was 7PM on a Saturday night, we had no reservations, and most places were pretty crowded already. We struck out on a couple of places either because parking sucked (No Nopa this time), business closed (bye PJ's), or I was wearing the wrong clothes (I had a sweater, and Naan and Curry was steaming inside, unless I wanted a permanent tandoori smell).

We walked into Pacific Catch, and got a table in the bar area. Pretty lively inside the bar area, with the Cal vs. UCLA hoops game going on (too bad Cal). A lot of people in the bar section were dining in, so the waitresses were doing double duty serving drinks and serving food. 

We ordered: 

-House Cured Sake Salmon. This came with 2 crispy nori rice cakes, wasabi creme fraiche, onions, and black tobiko caviar. Salmon had a mildly cured taste, the wasabi creme fraiche had a little, but not overpowering kick. Rice cakes were nice and crispy. OK starter. 

-2 Chipotle BBQ Salmon Tacos. This was a mistake. My wife wanted 1 salmon taco, and one Cabo shrimp taco, but they gave her 2 salmon tacos, but she didn't complain. These taco were topped with cabbage, corn salsa, and lime crema. Nice big chunk of salmon in each taco, and very tasty. 

-5 piece Fish and chips. Fish of the day was rock cod. This came with cole slaw and sweet potato fries. Lightly battered so not to overwhelm the fresh rock cod. Very juicy and moist on the inside, slight crispiness on the outside. Came with a jalapeno tartar sauce and and a Thai sweet chili sauce. I added some more sriracha sauce for more kick. Purple-cabbage cole slaw had a nice light vinaigrette for refreshing taste, instead of a creamy sauce. Sweet potato fries were great. Not overly fried, but crispy enough so I could still taste the sweet potatoes. 

Too full for dessert : ( 

Food came out pretty quickly, and the servers remembered and follow on requests in spite of the bar being elbow to elbow. 

I driven by this place for years while driving along Lincoln Blvd, and glad we finally tried it. Places like this reminded my wife and I of our dating years. Nice memories......

excerpts: Comes in a big big bowl with nori, ginger, rice, seaweed salad, and your choice of hawaiian poke, grilled salmon, seared tuna or crab.
YUM!
Also really like their Guava mint cooler.
Alcoholic drink..
but you don't taste it too much.
salmon.author: Rhonda H.
salmon.review: Been here a few times and I've always left satisfied. Most favorite item on the menu is the Japanese Wasabi rice bowl with Hawaiian poke. Comes in a big big bowl with nori, ginger, rice, seaweed salad, and your choice of hawaiian poke, grilled salmon, seared tuna or crab. YUM! Also really like their Guava mint cooler. Alcoholic drink..but you don't taste it too much.

excerpts: We didn't see it on the menu anymore so ordered sake sake roll (salmon soaked in sake) instead.
It wasn't fancy
Now the entrees, I got the miso salmon and my friends got ahi three way and korean bbq beef.
I was already half full at this point
so I didn't enjoy my entree as much as I could have had I been famished.
Overall pretty tasty still.
The rice is sushi rice (slighty sour), kinda neat.
All 3 ways of the ahi were raw.
I had a bite and liked it.
But I don't know about eating a whole entree of raw fish and sushi rice.
salmon.author: Xiaoyin W.
salmon.review:
This space is just fabulous. It's on the corner of 9th and Lincoln. I loved this space when it was Canvas Cafe. It was the best cafe in all of sunset. Sad that it closed. But anyway, enough nostalgia.

The restaurant is very spacious. The way they set up the tables gives you a lot of privacy. Reason we came here was because my friend loved their sweet potato fries. It didn't disappoint. Sushi here is good too. They used to make a roll with mango that was(and I quote) "like orgasm in my mouth". We didn't see it on the menu anymore so ordered sake sake roll (salmon soaked in sake) instead. It wasn't fancy but it was damn good.

Now the entrees, I got the miso salmon and my friends got ahi three way and korean bbq beef. I was already half full at this point so I didn't enjoy my entree as much as I could have had I been famished.  Overall pretty tasty still. The rice is sushi rice (slighty sour), kinda neat.  All 3 ways of the ahi were raw. I had a bite and liked it. But I don't know about eating a whole entree of raw fish and sushi rice. Korean bbq beef was sweet and fatty and juicy and all that good stuff.

Dinner for three=$87 plus tips.

Would come back again, but this time will be mentally prepared to dish out some cash.

excerpts: We had sushi, ceviche, a chilean pork appetizer, salmon with a soy sauce glaze, coconut shrimp, and a salad.
Everything was fresh and wonderful.
The cocktails were great too, especially the pomegranate martini.
salmon.author: Brian J.
salmon.review: Great food for the price.  Lots of variety in terms of California fusions of Asian and South American meals.  We had sushi, ceviche, a chilean pork appetizer, salmon with a soy sauce glaze, coconut shrimp, and a salad.  Everything was fresh and wonderful.  The cocktails were great too, especially the pomegranate martini.

excerpts: Definitely try their Firecracker Salmon roll - you will not be dissapointed.
The ginger cooler I had was perfect and refreshing with my Firecracker Salmon roll..
The ginger cooler I had was perfect and refreshing with my Firecracker Salmon roll..
salmon.author: Vanessa W.
salmon.review:
I was highly dissappointed that a fish market/restaurant , which was what I was told, was replacing C.G. (Canvas Gallery) and for the longest time, I would not even give P.C. the time of day...until I tried it out a couple months ago. 

P.C. blew me away. I love it! I had the Ahi Poke bowl (sub. brown rice!) and it was healthy, delicious and the fish was so fresh. The sushi rolls there are huge and everything was priced very, very reasonably. Definitely try their Firecracker Salmon roll - you will not be dissapointed. I don't think I saw any Japanese/Asian chefs there, but hey, with sushi this good, I'm colorblind.

The ginger cooler I had was perfect and refreshing with my Firecracker Salmon roll..it was strong; yet not super sugary.

The service was excellent..no complaints there. Our server was nice, friendly and attentive. 

Pacific Catch "caught" my heart.

excerpts:
I had some fried stuff and some poke...

who doesnt like fried coconut shrimp and salmon?
ooo which reminds me i had this fried salmon in Dallas, it was from a bento box out of some japanese restaurant i cant remember..
but that was really good..
um besides that...the salmon fish n chips was pretty good
salmon.author: phillip w.
salmon.review:
I had some fried stuff and some poke...

who doesnt like fried coconut shrimp and salmon?

ooo which reminds me i had this fried salmon in Dallas, it was from a bento box out of some japanese restaurant i cant remember..but that was really good..um besides that...the salmon fish n chips was pretty good

hmmm no complaints there, coconut shrimp is a typical one that you can find in most places that serve it. Either its good or its bad, and they did it good here so no complaints there either..

Sweet potato fries...lets see, yea it was pretty good too..not soggy or anything and just a good amount of salt..

the poke was good...but it was a bit too spicy..well maybe that or im just a big weenie but then again i do like spicy food so i dont know what happenend there kakaka...o well 

Anyways overall..i only ordered to-go so i cant say much about service except for the fact that the girl that i spoke to had good phone etiquette. The place looks nice and even though i was only in there for like 5 min i guess i should come by and at least have a sit down dinner..

for a to-go order the food wasnt soggy which i was kind of expecting especially with fried fish and shrimp. So that was a plus for me~ 

I think i wrote too much..

excerpts: The service was friendly & attentive, & we were all very satisfied with our respective meals (I got the Tokyo Salmon w/sweet potato fries, & it was delicious!).
salmon.author: Pete J.
salmon.review:
I had dinner at Pacific Catch last night with my girifriend, my roommate/best friend, & his girlfriend/my college friend, so you might say that it was an intimate affair.
