However, since the meal was called wasabi bowl, I expected wasabi up the ying yang. I didn't get much of any wasabi kick so I was disappointed. The only thing I would come back here for are the sweet potato fries. But I would only come during the happy hour times.

excerpts: The Tokyo Salmon fish and chips were excellent....
they may have ruined regular fish and chips for me.
The Baja fish tacos were also very good.
Service was also very good and prices are very reasonable.
salmon.author: Alured P.
salmon.review: Some of this may not apply once the crab specials are done, so your experience might differ.  Both the crab dumplings and the crab-corn chowder were amazing... so very delicious I could have made a meal out of them alone.  The Tokyo Salmon fish and chips were excellent.... they may have ruined regular fish and chips for me.  The Baja fish tacos were also very good.  Service was also very good and prices are very reasonable.  All in all, a very nice place to get an early dinner when in the Inner Sunset.

excerpts: a miso salmon and the salmon wasabi bowl... mmm....
This location is a lot bigger with its own parking lot and the service is very friendly and attentive as well.
salmon.author: Kymberli C.
salmon.review: We were close to the Chestnut location but it was totally packed, and TINY... so we decided to drive over to this location... We were starving and our eyes were hungrier than are stomachs... we ordered a lot of appetizers.. hawaiian poke, sweet potato fries, and calamari... and we were stuffed before entrees came.  I WISH I had room because from the few bites that I did have... it was so tasty!  I had the Wasabi Bowl with Hawaiian Poke.  The wasabi bowls come with all the things I love and they all are so great together.  The hubby got the 3 taco platter with 3 different tacos, and they looked delicious as well.  Our friends had also got meals that looked DELICIOUS... a miso salmon and the salmon wasabi bowl... mmm....  This location is a lot bigger with its own parking lot and the service is very friendly and attentive as well.

excerpts: Amazing fish tacos, superb salmon entree, the absolute best rice plates.
salmon.author: Susan T.
salmon.review:
I LOVE this restaurant! And I cannot understand why more people don't give it a 5 star rating. Okay, the parking is difficult. Well, you can say that about anywhere in SF. And yes, it can get noisy, but so is every other place in town, besides noise lends atmosphere. The space may not be for everyone, because it is large. But when was the last time you could walk into a good restaurant in the city, on a Saturday night, in a popular neighborhood, no reservation, and get a table, with no waiting?!

And the food is fantastic! I have eaten here more often than just about anywhere else (except maybe my favorite taqueria). I have tried a lot of the items, and every single thing, every single time, has been delicious. The fish is always fresh, the menu has lots of variety, from Asian style to Asian twists on Mexican. Their fried calamari and coconut shrimp skewers are the best anywhere! Amazing fish tacos, superb salmon entree, the absolute best rice plates.

And I love the decor, especially the creative use of resin panels (made by 3-Form - check out the bathroom stalls. Brilliant to use two panels back to back instead of the boring formica you see everywhere else). But the best is looking at the bar, from the restaurant, at night. The way the blue pendant lights glow through 3-Form ring panels is a really nice effect. 

I have turned lots and lots of my friends onto this place and everyone agrees that it is great. So I don't know what everyone is whining about - don't listen to all the negativity, check it out. (and PJ's was sooooo not better - why do you think they closed down?)

excerpts: The food here is consistently very good---favs are the Pacific Salmon (battered fried salmon and sweet potato fries) and the wasabi bowls (any combo).
Servers are efficient and friendly.
A unique  feature of this Pacific Catch is the size of the building (built on an old x-mas tree lot, d'ya remember?).
It's not often to find an SF restaurant that is not a bit cramped
so this place is a treat.
Finally, the martinis are well priced and good sized (have you noticed maritini glasses seem to be shrinking in SF?).
salmon.author: Michael W.
salmon.review: Pacific Catch has been a great addition to the Inner Sunset neighborhood.  The food here is consistently very good---favs are the Pacific Salmon (battered fried salmon and sweet potato fries) and the wasabi bowls (any combo).  Servers are efficient and friendly.  A unique  feature of this Pacific Catch is the size of the building (built on an old x-mas tree lot, d'ya remember?).  It's not often to find an SF restaurant that is not a bit cramped so this place is a treat.  Finally, the martinis are well priced and good sized (have you noticed maritini glasses seem to be shrinking in SF?).

excerpts:
not overdone. had avocado inside with salmon and roe on the outside)
-Rising Sun Sushi
(this was okay for me.
just may not be a huge fan of the tempura inside.
salmon.author: Anita C.
salmon.review:
Went back today with my family for birthday dinners. My sister and I wanted to have and try several things, so we shared A LOT of food. (In our defense, we were going to share with the others in our family, too.)

My sister and I chose:

-Sake Sake Sushi (still very very good. tastes so fresh and yummy. not overdone. had avocado inside with salmon and roe on the outside)
-Rising Sun Sushi (this was okay for me. just may not be a huge fan of the tempura inside. this one had tempura inside with tuna on the outside)
-Mixed Catch Basket with SWEET POTATO FRIES (the fries came with diff sauce, but it tasted good dipped in this other seafood sauce from another dish we had, and also good dipped in this sweet sauce that came with our mixed catch basket. Mixed Catch Basket came with 2 pieces of fish, 4 coconut shrimp, and 3 oyster. My sister and I agreed the oysters were the best. Breaded on the outside and when you bite into, it's soft, not quite slimy, and very good!! We could have done without the so-so fish, and the coconut shrimp)
Last but not least, we also had:
-today's special appetizer - seafood in sauce(i love sauce) with a piece of very crispy bread that was grilled and tasted excellent dipped in the seafoody sauce, and it was topped with some spicy mustard that gave some surprising zing)

Our family also shared:
-Hawaiian Poke (very good. many pieces of poke with little chips to eat with it, though the poke was a little salty)
-Baja Shrimp Ceviche (this was great. tortilla chips with the sour sauce tasted good. and there were many large shrimp we kept discovering beneath the sauce too)

Other family members had:
-Pineapple fried rice - apparently not very good
-Shrimp taco - tasted ok
-sweet tea - basically just sweetened tea
-spicy fries - not too special
-shrimp tempura roll - nothing special. the tempura just didn't do much for me

AND, because my family had 3 birthdays, they comped 3 desserts for us! We got two Mochi Fondues, that come with the ice cream mochis in chocolate, vanilla, and coffee flavors to be dipped in warm chocolate sauce. I had the vanilla and that tasted pretty good. We also had the Macadamia Nut Brownie Sundae. I had a bite, and it was good, but just too sweet for my taste.

Also, the service was interesting. They kept collecting our chopsticks, and once even collected plates they gave my sister and I to use to share our food. We hadn't even used our chopsticks (2nd set) and plates yet! So our food came, and we're like...where are our plates AND our chopsticks! So I was onto my 3rd pair of chopsticks. After that, every time they came by, I held onto my chopsticks. Can you be overserviced?

But I like the appetizers and the sushi and sweet potato fries, so indeed I would return. Oh, and those oysters, too!! So that helps me forget about some of the negatives and give Pacific Catch another 4 stars!

Maybe sometime I can just come for happy hour between 4-6pm, and get the things I like, and not make it a full on meal. :-)

excerpts: we had the salmon teriyaki bowl and mahi mahi special which were totally edible.
we also decided to get the rock and roll (unagi roll) with brown rice.
what a way to ruin a meal.
the brown rice was super hard (cold and perhaps undercooked?)
and the unagi was disgusting.
it was cold (like they had taken it out of the fridge) and they used the hard crusty pieces (hard skin attached, the fish was just hard in general).
SERIOUSLY??
salmon.author: joyce l.
salmon.review:
i came back here after going to the academy of science.  we had the salmon teriyaki bowl and mahi mahi special which were totally edible. we also decided to get the rock and roll (unagi roll) with brown rice. what a way to ruin a meal. the brown rice was super hard (cold and perhaps undercooked?) and the unagi was disgusting. it was cold (like they had taken it out of the fridge) and they used the hard crusty pieces (hard skin attached, the fish was just hard in general). SERIOUSLY???  what a disappointment for an $8 roll

of course the sweet potato fries were good. don't get the sushi with brown rice or eel if you go!!!

the service was still good but i just had to downgrade them based on the sushi experience.

excerpts: Lot of choices (sake salmon, calamari, thai coconut shrimp,
tuna tataki etc etc...) if you like your meats and fish but not if you're vegetarian.
Most places in SF by now have a section on their menu for vegetarians.
Not here.
(Btw, I asked the waiter and she didn't have a suggestion off the menu for me as well)
Frustrated, I asked for peanut butter & jelly sandwich and they didn't have that.
salmon.author: ITesh J.
salmon.review:
This is a new restaurant in what was Canvas Cafe. (With it's live music night, relatively good food and nice booths/tables to park yourself with your laptop, Canvas was one of my fav spots in the Sunset.  But I remiss...) Anyway, so I'm headed to Pacific Catch because my SO is part of an acronym friends and family group (aka AF&F) and most of them are devout meat worshipers.  I mean they really, really like their meats and fish.  And don't suggest to me that fish is vegetarian.  Hello!  If it's got a face, moves and /or you keep it as a pet, it's not vegetarian.  So Pacific Catch has an upscale look and feel to the place. Nice decor, lighting and a friendly wait staff.  But the menu is not vegetarian friendly.  Lot of choices (sake salmon, calamari, thai coconut shrimp, tuna tataki etc etc...) if you like your meats and fish but not if you're vegetarian.  Most places in SF by now have a section on their menu for vegetarians. Not here. (Btw, I asked the waiter and she didn't have a suggestion off the menu for me as well)  Frustrated, I asked for peanut butter & jelly sandwich and they didn't have that. So I ended up with some starters and sides: wakame seaweed salad (kindda fishy), pineapple fried rice (kindda bland) and sweet potato fries (ok...the fries were good especially with their special dips).  Not very satisfying for $25 (w/ tips) per person bill.

Tip for Pacfic Catch.  Have something vegetarian. Something noodly on your menu. And if you can't do that, at least have peanut butter and jelly sandwich.  Is that asking for too much?

excerpts: The Crispy Salmon Taco was great.
salmon.author: Richard S.
salmon.review: Very good chance of having a super meal here. We are 5 for 5. Really good. It can be very busy and the staff can get lost in the crowd.  I thought it was easy to relax.  At least the food comes pretty quick once you get going. The Crispy Salmon Taco was great.

excerpts: Everything I had was excellent (fried calamari, salmon special with the hawaiian fried rice & bok choy).
It was all cooked nicely and tasted great.
There was even more on the menu I wanted to try, which means I will have to come back.
We sat at the counter by the kitchen because the wait was 1.5 hours on a Friday night (yikes!)
salmon.author: S. S.
salmon.review:
Two thumbs up! Everything I had was excellent (fried calamari, salmon special with the hawaiian fried rice & bok choy). It was all cooked nicely and tasted great. There was even more on the menu I wanted to try, which means I will have to come back. We sat at the counter by the kitchen because the wait was 1.5 hours on a Friday night (yikes!) but I didn't mind sitting there at all as the service was attentive and prompt.

P.S. We (two of us) had a bottle of  Sauvignon Blanc over this dinner and it made the experience even better.

excerpts: Myself, I choose the Salmon Sashimi and was not only disappointed by my choice but suffered a violent food-poisoning an hour later from it.
Needless to say, it put me off ever going back.
Lunch was fairly pricey and to get sick from it added insult to injury.
It also put me off raw fish for a good long time to come.
salmon.author: Fleur R.
salmon.review: This place was suggested to me to be a good lunch choice for a birthday celebration.  I took an elderly relative who enjoys Hawaiian Poke and that was his choice and  what he ordered.  Myself, I choose the Salmon Sashimi and was not only disappointed by my choice but suffered a violent food-poisoning an hour later from it.  Needless to say, it put me off ever going back.  Lunch was fairly pricey and to get sick from it added insult to injury.  It also put me off raw fish for a good long time to come.

excerpts:
service was outstanding

food was just ok. too much sauce in the salmon dish and the seafood just didn't taste that fresh.
salmon.author: Bobby B.
salmon.review:
service was outstanding

food was just ok. too much sauce in the salmon dish and the seafood just didn't taste that fresh. sweet potato fries were tasty however.  good selection of beer

prices are out of whack..6.95 for a california roll? 

parking is tough

excerpts: so suffice it to say, i've had better fish tacos...but the quality and freshness of the fish actually seemed pretty great, so i'll likely go back and order a salmon sandwich, or an ahi bowl or something else.
heck maybe even a steak taco, though that wouldn't really be keeping up with the theme of the restaurant very well.
salmon.author: Anne Marie B.
salmon.review:
i'm torn.  on the one hand it was nothing spectacular, but on the other hand there wasn't really anything bad about this place.  start it off by saying that the waiter was very friendly and informed us that the kitchen was really good about substitutions/preparing items that weren't on the menu, so that was a plus...but the options on the menu all seemed so good that it wasn't really necessary to ask for something different.  

i absolutely adore raw fish.  all seafood really.  but raw fish is great.  so we started with the hawaiian poke (raw ahi marinated in soy sauce etc.), huge chunks of ahi, a little heavy on the sauce, but still delish.  the calamari was also not too chewy, so props for that.  and the seaweed salad was actually pretty good.  

but then i ordered the tacos, which i've heard great things about.  i ordered the cabo shrimp and a special ahi taco that's not on the menu but the waiter recommended.  well, i wish he hadn't.  the ahi was overcooked for my taste (obvi raw would've been great, but i was expecting a slight seared edge...this was almost completely cooked through), and there was no moisture in this thing.  i need me some sauce on my tacos!  the shrimp was better, thanks to the large portion and ample sauce.  i even resorted to pouring leftover sauce from my seaweed salad on the ahi taco.  

so suffice it to say, i've had better fish tacos...but the quality and freshness of the fish actually seemed pretty great, so i'll likely go back and order a salmon sandwich, or an ahi bowl or something else.  heck maybe even a steak taco, though that wouldn't really be keeping up with the theme of the restaurant very well.

excerpts: i'm usually wary about getting salmon, but the salmon wasabi bowl here was perfect!
salmon.author: Andrey C.
salmon.review:
with the appetizer coupons we scored at the yelp party in hand, we headed over to the sunset pacific catch for some consistently delicious grub and, as usual, we weren't disappointed. we tried both the hawaiian poke (a must eat) and the baja shrimp ceviche, which came out in a cool martini glass with tortilla chips... so refreshing and good! i'm usually wary about getting salmon, but the salmon wasabi bowl here was perfect! and you can never go wrong with the rock cod fish and chips...

chef chandon and chef (eek! forgot your name!) even came out to greet us and shoot the breeze about the yelp party the night before... can't believe they actually DONATED all that food that, well, i didn't get to eat (cuz i'm not elite... pshh).

i had actually come to this location earlier this year, and enjoyed one of their lunch-time sandwiches... which were super good as well. only wish i lived closer... i'd probably eat here at least 1x a week if that were the case!

excerpts: Had the king salmon which was hardly "king.
It was shady and disappointing.
I was not full at all and it was one of the most expensive things on the menu.
The only reason why I'm giving it 3 stars is because the customer service was very good.
The waitress was very friendly and the food came promptly.
Overall a good place to hangout and chill, but I wouldn't go there for the food.
salmon.author: Tommy B.
salmon.review: Food was sub-par at best. Had the king salmon which was hardly "king." It was shady and disappointing. I was not full at all and it was one of the most expensive things on the menu. The only reason why I'm giving it 3 stars is because the customer service was very good. The waitress was very friendly and the food came promptly. Overall a good place to hangout and chill, but I wouldn't go there for the food.

excerpts: Next I had the Tokyo Salmon.
I am not always a big fan of the fried fish
but I made an exception and it worth it!
salmon.author: Miguel V.
salmon.review: This was my first time dining at "Pac Catch" and I loved it. My friend and I started with a sushi roll... DELICIOUS!!! Next I had the Tokyo Salmon. I am not always a big fan of the fried fish but I made an exception and it worth it! The sweet potato fries were also a nice treat! The service here was great and I loved the dining experience

excerpts: Mahi mahi and salmon tacos were okay.
Their best is definitely the shrimp tacos.
However a good El Tonayense taco truck can totally wip that.
Okay server was slow but it was a Friday.
A bit pricey for what it is.
However on a good final note, it does have atmosphere.
You'll love that!
Overall, just stroking a par.
salmon.author: Eugenel E.
salmon.review: Well where can I start. The sweet potato fries. Yes we'll start there. Good but not great. If you have been to Poleng Lounge, you will not be impressed by this signature side dish. Not to disagree with everyone that has reviewed this place because they were still satisfactory. Adding to the okayness, we had the calamari. Good but could use a little more flavor. Finally we had a trio of seafood tacos. Mahi mahi and salmon tacos were okay. Their best is definitely the shrimp tacos. However a good El Tonayense taco truck can totally wip that. Okay server was slow but it was a Friday. A bit pricey for what it is. However on a good final note, it does have atmosphere. You'll love that! Overall, just stroking a par.

excerpts: i also had a taste of my friend's ahi tuna sandwich and my cousin's salmon sandwich, both of which were delish!
i love the ciabatta bread they were on too! also shared one of their special sushi rolls, which had a catchy name that i am blanking on right now.
but it had a nice bite, which came form the spicy mayo, and a nice crunch from the tempura batter, mmm!!!
i'm craving some right now...
salmon.author: Pamela s.
salmon.review: came here for a late lunch on sunday after a weekend of camping/rafting in oakdale and it was nice! i ordered the fresh pick of the day, true cod (as opposed to false ones) which came with sweet potato fries, cole slaw and two dipping sauces. one was a jalapeño tartar and the other was a sweet chili sauce, the kind you dip filipino lumpia into. the fish was fried nicely and you can tell it was fresh. i also had a taste of my friend's ahi tuna sandwich and my cousin's salmon sandwich, both of which were delish! i love the ciabatta bread they were on too! also shared one of their special sushi rolls, which had a catchy name that i am blanking on right now. but it had a nice bite, which came form the spicy mayo, and a nice crunch from the tempura batter, mmm!!! i'm craving some right now...

excerpts: and I order the same thing every time (cause it's that darn good): BBQ salmon sandwich and sweet potato fries with a side of that awesome Thai chili sauce.
The ingredients are fresh and simple and I always leave satisfied.
I've brought several friends here and sparked their addictions to this place as well.
salmon.author: Novi M.
salmon.review: This is easily one of my favorite go-to places and I order the same thing every time (cause it's that darn good): BBQ salmon sandwich and sweet potato fries with a side of that awesome Thai chili sauce. The ingredients are fresh and simple and I always leave satisfied. I've brought several friends here and sparked their addictions to this place as well.

excerpts: Fried calamari was ok , but the Ahi Poke and the Salmon were waaaay too salty...

I mean everything was: the fish, the sauce, the guacamole, the vegetables, etc...
- The atmosphere: VERY loud.
I know, not much the can do there, more to do with the acoustic of the place.

But once in a while you could hear the music, and it seems like it was some random radio station playing stupid pop music... considering the decor, you'd expect some more elaborate music, whatever theme they might choose (house, blues, etc...).
- The fact that they had us wait for 10 minutes when they had plenty of 2 tops empty
salmon.author: Vithiet L.
salmon.review:
3 stars for:

- The nice decor with comfortable seats. I like their plastic walls things with twigs in them.
- Very friendly staff, polite and helpful. The host graciously answered my questions (more on this below) and the waitress gave good recomendations.
- Super quick! Appetizers came even before the drinks, which didn't take that much to come anyways... main course was there shortly after appetizers were done, which was nice considering how busy the place was.
- Reasonable prices

Not a better rating because of:

- The food. Sadly (?), this is still the main thing about rating a restaurant! Although not horrible, it was not really good either. Fried calamari was ok , but the Ahi Poke and the Salmon were waaaay too salty... I mean everything was: the fish, the sauce, the guacamole, the vegetables, etc...
- The atmosphere: VERY loud. I know, not much the can do there, more to do with the acoustic of the place. But once in a while you could hear the music, and it seems like it was some random radio station playing stupid pop music... considering the decor, you'd expect some more elaborate music, whatever theme they might choose (house, blues, etc...).
- The fact that they had us wait for 10 minutes when they had plenty of 2 tops empty... I understand there might have been organizational concerns like whose section is filled up and such (which was confirmed by the host when I asked about that, even though he found it weird a customer would ask such a thing) so I didn't care, really, but more impatient people might not be so understanding and get annoyed by it.

I would love to try again to see if the oversaltiness was just a one time mistake, but I didn't really enjoy my meal so I probably won't.
I do see good reviews from other Yelpers which help me decide on a 3 stars instead of 2... just giving them the benefit of the doubt!

excerpts: We  shared a rock n roll (eel - yummy!), a spicy tuna roll and a tempura salmon roll.
Everything tasted really fresh and, for a non-raw-sushi-eater such as me, it was a great assortment of user-friendly rolls.
I'm sure sushi experts might prefer to go elsewhere, but for sushi novices/lightweights this is a perfect middle ground.
salmon.author: Beth T.
salmon.review: I'm not a sushi expert...hell, I don't even LIKE sushi all that much. So when my husband craves it, as he did this weekend, I either have to give in or fndd a place like Pacific Catch that offers a varied menu of sushi and other seafood treats. When we sat down to dinner, I got sucked in to the sushi bandwagon and decided to split a few rolls with my dining companions. I was pleasantly surprised by how delicious it was. We  shared a rock n roll (eel - yummy!), a spicy tuna roll and a tempura salmon roll. Everything tasted really fresh and, for a non-raw-sushi-eater such as me, it was a great assortment of user-friendly rolls. I'm sure sushi experts might prefer to go elsewhere, but for sushi novices/lightweights this is a perfect middle ground.

excerpts: Had the salmon sandwich which many reviewers have said was great, and it did not disappoint.
The fish was moist and cooked just right.
salmon.author: Stephen W.
salmon.review: I have walked past this place many times on my way into Golden Gate Park.  Finally decided to try it because of a special promotion.  Well, gotta say it was very good.  Had the salmon sandwich which many reviewers have said was great, and it did not disappoint.  The fish was moist and cooked just right.  Had the sweet potato fries as the side.  I still think the Elephant Bar sweet potato fries are better, but not bad.  Prices are not bad to boot.

excerpts: We ordered the Firecracker Salmon roll which was very good.
i'm not a big grilled salmon fan
Salmon and mahi mahi taco
: Both were good and fresh.
The salsa on each one are good.
The salmon one has a spicy kick to it so if you like spicy, try that.
salmon.author: Irene C.
salmon.review:
My husband and I went to Pacific Catch on a Wednesday night and the place was pretty full.  So we sat at the bar instead so that we didn't have to wait, which turned out great cuz the bartender was very nice and both our cocktails tasted delicious!  We ordered the Firecracker Salmon roll which was very good.  We also ordered the sturgeon fish of the day which came with an avocado sauce, grilled vegetable, and sweet potato fries.  The fries were really good.  The overall portion size for the entree was just right because it still allows room for appetizer if you want.  We are small eaters so it was just right.  Our total bill was about $60 which is not too bad given we had drinks too.  We're definitely going back and will try some of the other menus.  We recommended this place to our friend who liked it too.  The only complain they had was that everything on the menu is fish but that was fine with us.

1/1/2008: This is the 2nd time I've been here and I would still give it a 4 star.  We had reservations at 7pm for 7 people and they seated us late for about 10 mins and they comped all our appetizers, without us complaining or mentioning it at all.  Now that's a restaurant that cares about their customers.  It was a pleasant surprise and treat.  The service was great throughout the meal as well.  

With 7 people, we tried alot more different dishes.  

Appetizers:
1) Shrimp ceviche - They were whole shrimp and there were lots of them.  I think they should dice up the shrimp because it was served with tortilla chips and there's no way you can get a whole shrimp on the chip.  But the taste was decent overall, nothing spectacular so I probably won't order it again
2) Grilled artichokes - Fresh, good, seasoned properly.  Would order it again.
3) Calamari - very good, came with fried lemon slices too which is an interesting touch.  the sauce was a little spicy.  Would recommend trying this and I would order it again.

Rolls
1) CA roll - good that it was real crab meat, not some doughy fake ones.  There was too much rice which will fill you up quickly.  I prefer less rice.  Probably would not order it again just because I don't think this is not a signature dish.

2) Rock 'n roll - Too much rice, couldn't find/taste the unagi (bbq eel).  Again, it tastes ok, but wouldn't order it again.

3) Firecracker roll - We had this last time, loved it.  This time it was still good.  For some reason, this roll doesn't not have as much rice as the other too, which is good.  Would order it again

Entrees
1) Mahi mahi fish of the day - came with grilled veggie, sweet potato fries, mahi mahi served with tomatillo avocado sauce.  The fish had a cajun spice rub that was a bit pungent.  The sweet potato fries as always was great.  Grilled veggie - can't go wrong with this.  Don't like the spice rub so won't order it again

2) Grilled shrimp teriyaki bowl - Very tasty, great teriyaki sauce.  Liked that it came with veggie and mushroom, chopped and mixed into the rice.   Would order it again

3) Ono fish of the day - very good.  came with fried onion rings that were delicious.  came with pineapple fried rice which everyone loved.  the fish was grilled on banana leaf so it had a great aroma and taste.  would order it gain.

4) Organic chinook fish of the day - it came with grilled artichoke and brown rice and the fish was served with a tomato sauce.  it was fresh and decently good.  i'm not a big grilled salmon fan so that's why i won't order it again. 

5) Grilled Korean beef (another daily special) - I don't eat beef so I can't comment, but my husband thought it was decent.  This place is called "Pacific Catch" so I'd stick with the fish but if you have a friend that doesn't like seafood, at least there is an option to have meat.

Overall, I'd recommend this place and would go again.  Good atmosphere for couples or groups.  Great service.  Nice decor and clean.  Lots of cocktails, decent size wine list.

2/14/08: This is visit #3.

Cocktail Review:
Sun Burn - average; menu says there's a tropical syrup in it which I think is what gave it a little after taste of some sort.
Some cocktail with Gin 209, kiwi and cucumber juice - DELICIOUS!  We had to order a 2nd one.  

House salad - Good size, very fresh greens, salad dressing was yummy, if you like a Japanese type kinda dressing w/miso; The mushrooms that were in the salad was delicious.  They're cooked in some sauce, not some uncooked mushroom.

Catch of the Day Fish and Chips - The ling cod fish and chips is the freshest fish and chips we ever had.  It's lightly fried, lightly crispy and covered in a thick batter where you eat a lot of batter and not fish.  The fish was cooked to perfection and fresh and was juicy.  The sweet potato fries as usual, are always yummy!!!

Salmon and mahi mahi taco: Both were good and fresh.  The salsa on each one are good.  The salmon one has a spicy kick to it so if you like spicy, try that.

excerpts: i had the king salmon special, and it was a little overcooked and basically drowning in this really sweet, thick sauce.
(it could've been any fish under there.)
i didn't taste any of my friends' entrees, but we all seemed to be feeling about the same.
salmon.author: brian g.
salmon.review:
so, i grew up in orlando.  for anyone who's never been, it looks, feels, and tastes exactly like this place.  all it's missing is the rest of the shopping plaza and the fifty acre parking lot.

the thing is, the food isn't TERRIBLE.  but it's not great either.  and while it might seem all right in a place like orlando, i just don't get why you'd ever eat here in SF.  yet, it was packed.  

food-wise, we shared a few appetizers, coconut shrimp, calamari, etc., which were all deep fried and okay, and then we ordered our entrees, and they were out, seriously, in thirty seconds.  call me crazy - i mean, i'm all for efficiency and all, but that kind of stuff makes me suspicious.  i had the king salmon special, and it was a little overcooked and basically drowning in this really sweet, thick sauce.  (it could've been any fish under there.)  i didn't taste any of my friends' entrees, but we all seemed to be feeling about the same.  i kept thinking, are we sure this place isn't owned by darden?

all that said, the mai tais were pretty damn good (yes, i said mai tai, thankyouverymuch), and the bartender was great.

excerpts: I always order the salmon wasabi bowl because of the delicious salmon and sour tangy wasabi flavored rice.
It's definitely great for lunch or dinner.
I especially enjoy this new location as it has tons of space and you can make reservations on opentable.com.
I have also enjoyed many of their sandwiches.
It's great for take-out as well.
It's nice to have a comfortable atmosphere and a healthy meal option for a great price.
salmon.author: Josephine L.
salmon.review: Great cheap eats! I always order the salmon wasabi bowl because of the delicious salmon and sour tangy wasabi flavored rice. It's definitely great for lunch or dinner. I especially enjoy this new location as it has tons of space and you can make reservations on opentable.com. I have also enjoyed many of their sandwiches. It's great for take-out as well. It's nice to have a comfortable atmosphere and a healthy meal option for a great price.

excerpts: I had the California salmon sandwich which was suppose to come with avocado
but there was none to be found in my sandwich or anywhere on the plate.
The organic string beans that come with every sandwich was also missing.
Either the cook doesn't know his/her own menu or they need to update it.
Overall, it was okay but not worth the price.
I probably won't be going back.
salmon.author: Austin C.
salmon.review: I think this place is overrated. The service was good and the servers were friendly, but the food was just mediocre. I had the California salmon sandwich which was suppose to come with avocado but there was none to be found in my sandwich or anywhere on the plate. The organic string beans that come with every sandwich was also missing. Either the cook doesn't know his/her own menu or they need to update it. Overall, it was okay but not worth the price. I probably won't be going back.

excerpts: (i had the salmon teriyaki).
maybe it was just the fact that i was so stuffed from shoving poke down.
the corn on the cob still does wonders.
YUM!!!
We didnt have reservations, so ended up waiting about 1 hour for our table.
but that's ok.
my friend and i were in good company of poke and sake :o)
salmon.author: Nutmeg Y.
salmon.review: FINALLY!  there is seating for more than 10 people!  this place has the BEST poke in town.  My friend and i loved it so much, we ordered two!  the marina location had excellent bowls... but at this location... it was so-so (i had the salmon teriyaki).  maybe it was just the fact that i was so stuffed from shoving poke down.  the corn on the cob still does wonders.  YUM!!!  We didnt have reservations, so ended up waiting about 1 hour for our table.  but that's ok.  my friend and i were in good company of poke and sake :o)

excerpts: My salmon teriyaki rice bowl was a bit too sweet, but the fish was cooked perfectly.
The wait was a bit long, but the prices were decent, and I look forward to coming back for dessert.
Dulce de leche spring rolls and mango cheesecake sounds interesting.
If you're craving fish or Asian fusion, Pacific Catch is a pretty safe bet.
salmon.author: James P.
salmon.review: Wooo!!! I love the sweet potato fries and the dipping sauces they come with. The calamari is excellent too. My salmon teriyaki rice bowl was a bit too sweet, but the fish was cooked perfectly. The wait was a bit long, but the prices were decent, and I look forward to coming back for dessert. Dulce de leche spring rolls and mango cheesecake sounds interesting. If you're craving fish or Asian fusion, Pacific Catch is a pretty safe bet.

excerpts: And if you ever order one of the teriyaki bowls, get the teriyaki sauce on the side, cuz i had waaay too much sauce in my salmon bowl.
I haven't been here in a while..
I need to go back.
salmon.author: JD D.
salmon.review: The Sweet Potato Fries are bangin.  And if you ever order one of the teriyaki bowls, get the teriyaki sauce on the side, cuz i had waaay too much sauce in my salmon bowl.  I haven't been here in a while.. I need to go back.

excerpts: I had the bbq salmon taco and the spicy chicken.
The spicy chicken was not spicy and lacked flavor.
The salmon was okay, but also lacked flavor.
salmon.author: edie t.
salmon.review:
cleanliness: 4/5
food quality:  2/5
service: 3/5
cost: $15-$20
other:

2nd Visit: I came here with a friend after another restaurant we wanted
to go to was closed. 

My friend ordered the poke and the traditional baja taco. I had the bbq salmon taco and the spicy chicken. The spicy chicken was not spicy and lacked flavor. The salmon was okay, but also lacked flavor. 

the service was pretty good but nothing outstanding compared to my last visit.

1st Visit:

cleanliness: 4/5
food quality:  3.5/5
service: 5/5
cost: $15-$20
other:

Found parking in the lot, probably because it was early. I came here with Helen and we sat at the bar per my request so we could grab a drink and watch the basketball game. 

She ordered the coconut shrimp and I ordered the catch of the day. She ordered a martini and I got a dark and stormy (which was great!)

The bartender was really friendly and chatted with us from time to time. The nuggets ended up winning and Helen was a great date as always. Unforunately the bartender thought Helen wanted the coconut shrimp appetizer, but she wanted the full entree. Although the coconut shrimp wasn't great, we enjoyed the sweet potato fries and my fish.

The bartender was super and comped us on the appetizer and by the end of the meal we left happy.

excerpts: I had a shrimp taco and salmon taco with a side salad.
I love that they bring out Pepperidge Farm pretzel goldfish with edamame for you to snack on.
The shrimp taco with mango salsa was good but the mango was a little bland
so I was disappointed.
Maybe I had my hopes set too high for that one?
The BBQ salmon taco was outstanding.
Good fish, great taste with the BBQ sauce, worked well in a taco.
salmon.author: Bryan Z.
salmon.review: Solid dinner time meal... I had a shrimp taco and salmon taco with a side salad. I love that they bring out Pepperidge Farm pretzel goldfish with edamame for you to snack on. The shrimp taco with mango salsa was good but the mango was a little bland so I was disappointed. Maybe I had my hopes set too high for that one? The BBQ salmon taco was outstanding. Good fish, great taste with the BBQ sauce, worked well in a taco. Sweet potato fries? Meh. But then sweet potatoes aren't my favorite to begin with.

excerpts: I've been searching for a restaurant with great fish (especially grilled fish/salmon) in San Francisco for a few years now, but I have to say the search is not over yet.
I had high hopes for Pacific Catch that I saw open on the 9th Ave a while back.
My date had the Tokyo Salmon fish & chips but said that they were average, nothing to get excited for.
salmon.author: Adore P.
salmon.review:
I've been searching for a restaurant with great fish (especially grilled fish/salmon) in San Francisco for a few years now, but I have to say the search is not over yet. I had high hopes for Pacific Catch that I saw open on the 9th Ave a while back. Yesterday evening was the time to check it out.

As an appetizer we had the Coconut Shrimp. It came with a thai sweet chili sauce, but even with that it felt a little tasteless. For entrees we had the day's special Ono Hawaiian style which was very dry. I've had Ono dishes in Hawaii and feel that they were totally superior. My date had the Tokyo Salmon fish & chips but said that they were average, nothing to get excited for.

I have not been to the other locations of Pacific Catch, but based on the other reviews I might check them out later, but for me there is no need to go back to the 9th Ave location. And where have I had excellent grilled fish? Oregon coast, Hawaii, northern Europe...

excerpts: Last night I had my usual, which was a side Wakame salad, and the Tokyo Salmon fish and chips.
Unbelievable, as usual!
I just had to write something today, although I've already been there several times.
First of all, you just can't beat their salmon for the price.
It absolutely melts in your mouth like a stick of butter.
Thats how I like my salmon.
And the fries, both sweet potato and regular are delish!
Everything I  have eaten in this restaurant has been fabulous.
I even love their Miso soup.
Oh yeah, don't miss the grilled artichoke appetizer (if you are an artichoke fan like me).
Mmmmmm.
The restaurant itself is very hip looking as well.
It easily accomodates large or small groups.
A lot more  comfy than the Chestnut location!
Loved our server last night.
My mother in law thought she had left her cell phone there, and the server literally pulled up cushions looking for it!
Not a lot of people would do something like that.
Only one critique:
I'm not really into the desserts, but I know some people adore the mochi.
salmon.author: Allison A.
salmon.review: Yummmmy!  Healthy!  (I think)  Last night I had my usual, which was a side Wakame salad, and the Tokyo Salmon fish and chips.  Unbelievable, as usual!  I just had to write something today, although I've already been there several times.  First of all, you just can't beat their salmon for the price.  It absolutely melts in your mouth like a stick of butter.  Thats how I like my salmon.  And the fries, both sweet potato and regular are delish!  Everything I  have eaten in this restaurant has been fabulous.  I even love their Miso soup.  Oh yeah, don't miss the grilled artichoke appetizer (if you are an artichoke fan like me).   Mmmmmm.  The restaurant itself is very hip looking as well.  It easily accomodates large or small groups.  A lot more  comfy than the Chestnut location!  Loved our server last night.  My mother in law thought she had left her cell phone there, and the server literally pulled up cushions looking for it!  Not a lot of people would do something like that.  Only one critique:  I'm not really into the desserts, but I know some people adore the mochi.

excerpts: We ordered a variety of stuff with the kids mostly getting various fish tacos, adults ranging from the grilled salmon to beef salad.
I got a kamikaze bloody mary (haven't had a bm for about 20 years!
and this was good, not too wasabe infused, not overly alcoholic) then the ahi poke rice bowl.
I was going to get the extra tobiko but forgot to order it.
Oh, man, that was a good bowl of food!
I'm not a sprouts eater but these were fresh and yummy and went well with all the other foods in the bowl.
And the poke was outstanding.
I wonder why I've never poke before--probably because this is the first place I've been to that has even mentioned it.
And, of course, there were desserts all around
(I take cappuccino as my dessert of choice), which I'm told were incredible.
All in all, the food was excellent, staff was unintrusive but attentive, bathrooms were clean, and I think all was well worth the prices.
My one "complaint" was that it was too noise to really chat much with the folks not directly across or next to me.
I'm glad it's in my neighborhood since I plan to make this one of my regular "take out" joints.
salmon.author: Kai T.
salmon.review: Took the family here for Father's Day (all fishermen and/or fish eaters) and we all loved it.  We ordered a variety of stuff with the kids mostly getting various fish tacos, adults ranging from the grilled salmon to beef salad.  I got a kamikaze bloody mary (haven't had a bm for about 20 years! and this was good, not too wasabe infused, not overly alcoholic) then the ahi poke rice bowl.  I was going to get the extra tobiko but forgot to order it.  Oh, man, that was a good bowl of food!  I'm not a sprouts eater but these were fresh and yummy and went well with all the other foods in the bowl.  And the poke was outstanding.  I wonder why I've never poke before--probably because this is the first place I've been to that has even mentioned it.  And, of course, there were desserts all around (I take cappuccino as my dessert of choice), which I'm told were incredible.  All in all, the food was excellent, staff was unintrusive but attentive, bathrooms were clean, and I think all was well worth the prices.  My one "complaint" was that it was too noise to really chat much with the folks not directly across or next to me.  I'm glad it's in my neighborhood since I plan to make this one of my regular "take out" joints.

excerpts: he got the salmon teriyaki and i got tacos again..
the tacos wasnt that good this time around.. maybe they had an off day?
my friend didnt think his order was that good either..
salmon.author: JUDY L.
salmon.review: i came here again with my friend.. we got the calamari appetizer.. i think the calamari pieces were too small so it had a lot of batter.. and it was also soaked in oil.. (ewwww).. he got the salmon teriyaki and i got tacos again.. the tacos wasnt that good this time around.. maybe they had an off day?  my friend didnt think his order was that good either..

excerpts: All the dishes with raw fish are really good (tuna, salmon, etc...).
salmon.author: Sanjiv B.
salmon.review: Great bar selection, fun atmosphere (after work crowd) and really good food.  The bowls are worth trying.  All the dishes with raw fish are really good (tuna, salmon, etc...).  Recommend the ahi tuna bowl.  Nice location and reasonably priced.

excerpts: The lunch special fish was really good as was the salmon sandwich.
Didn't have to wait even though it was a Sunday afternoon during lunc time.
It's a lot bigger than their other restaurant on Chestnut.
The location is great for a walk into Golden Gate park after lunch.
salmon.author: Mich C.
salmon.review: Good service.  The lunch special fish was really good as was the salmon sandwich.  Didn't have to wait even though it was a Sunday afternoon during lunc time.  It's a lot bigger than their other restaurant on Chestnut.  The location is great for a walk into Golden Gate park after lunch.

excerpts: The wasabi bowls are an incredible value, so much delicious sashimi (or cooked salmon or crab or unagi) and seaweed salad, avocado and veggies that I can never finish it all.
The sushi rolls are huge and delicious (try the shiitake/asparagus/miso roll!), and they have good prices on tap beers and unique cocktails.
The house cured salmon is delectable.
salmon.author: L J.
salmon.review: This is my favorite restaurant for a normal (non-'fancy') out-to-dinner night, or lunch, or happy hour, or to take out of town visitors. The menu is varied enough to please all comers, with asian style, mexican style, and rotating specials. The wasabi bowls are an incredible value, so much delicious sashimi (or cooked salmon or crab or unagi) and seaweed salad, avocado and veggies that I can never finish it all. The sushi rolls are huge and delicious (try the shiitake/asparagus/miso roll!), and they have good prices on tap beers and unique cocktails. The house cured salmon is delectable. I love the baja style mahi mahi and sweet potato fries. You can sit outdoors if you have a dog, or if it's just a nice day. There's a teensy parking lot, but usually ample parking on Lincoln or in the park. The servers and bartenders are really nice. They take reservations. The only thing to avoid are the booths over by the bathrooms. Otherwise, what's not to LOVE?

excerpts: But I think I just ordered the wrong thing, the lady next to me told me her plate (a salmon dish I think) was delish...
so I guess it all depends on what you order here.
salmon.author: Brittani H.
salmon.review: Well I suppose I just had a bad experience here overall. I thought it would be good since the place was packed and we had to wait 30 minutes for a table, but boy was I wrong. After careful deliberation, me and my husband decided on a salad for him and miso for me for the appetizers. The miso was okay and the salad was mediocre, but to there credit they also brought us pretzel goldfish, which was probably the best thing I ate there. Then for our entrees he had a fish and chips platter and I had a rock n' roll (Unagi and Avacado). I tried a bite of his fish n' chips and it was about the same as Captain D's. My rock n' roll was kinda all bad though. The roll itself was loose, and the pieces we way too big, while the pieces of unagi itself were skimpy and flavorless. To beat it all there was a short black hair ( I know it wasn't mine b/c my hair is not that color) on the plate beneath one of the sushis (Suprise!) but I didn't complain b/c our dinner was free anyway. Also the last bite of sushi I had felt like fire in my mouth, maybe they accidentally spilled something on it? But I think I just ordered the wrong thing, the lady next to me told me her plate (a salmon dish I think) was delish...so I guess it all depends on what you order here.

excerpts: we ordered a chicken and salmon teriyaki bowl which the rice was way to sweet.
the sweet potatoe fries were good.
the passoin mange cheese cake was good too.
i wouldnt take big number of groups there.
salmon.author: jennifer z.
salmon.review: i just went there today. the food is okay. we ordered a chicken and salmon teriyaki bowl which the rice was way to sweet. the sweet potatoe fries were good.  the passoin mange cheese cake was good too. i wouldnt take big number of groups there.

excerpts: i had the salmon sandwich, was kind of bland.
we also had chicken nuggents,
again nothing special.
we had the tuna 3 way.
needs more flavor.
fries were warm, not hot.
kind of soggy actually.
the sweet potatoe fries were good, but it was kinda of soggy also.
you could tell they dont make the fries to order.
they make it batches and lets it seat.
dessert was great, had the mango chessecake.
i was the place made food like the dessert, fresh, vibrant food, and lots of flavor.
oh, the bloody mary sucks.
just tomatoe juice with some soy sauce, very very sad.
again, the menu sounds ggood but the food doesnt work.
the place looks great.
the service needs some more work.
slow.
you have to shag down help.
i would rather walk down to pack chow next time.
salmon.author: don j.
salmon.review: i think this place was over hyped and over rated.   the menu sounds really good, but some how the food was ok.  nothing special.  its asian american fusion..  i had the salmon sandwich, was kind of bland.  we also had chicken nuggents, again nothing special.  we had the tuna 3 way.  needs more flavor.  fries were warm, not hot.  kind of soggy actually.  the sweet potatoe fries were good, but it was kinda of soggy also.  you could tell they dont make the fries to order.  they make it batches and lets it seat.  dessert was great, had the mango chessecake.  i was the place made food like the dessert, fresh, vibrant food, and lots of flavor.  oh, the bloody mary sucks.  just tomatoe juice with some soy sauce, very very sad.  again, the menu sounds ggood but the food doesnt work.   the place looks great.  the service needs some more work.  slow.  you have to shag down help.  i would rather walk down to pack chow next time.

excerpts: We've tried the Korean sticky ribs, Kona coffee ribs, fried calamari, shrimp ceviche (my favorite), the poke trio with the California, original, and white tuna, the salmon poke, and the spicy tuna sushi roll.
The Kona coffee ribs were amazing
but I think were only around for a limited time.
The sushi rolls were just mediocre, this isn't a sushi joint
so I would stay away from the rolls and stick to the poke.
The original poke is a little too salty
but it's tolerable if you pair with rice
, the white tuna poke was a little on the dry side, I would've liked more liquid/lemon on it
and it had a really "fishy" taste, the California was probably the best, and the salmon poke was good but a bit on the spicy side.
and it had a really "fishy" taste, the California was probably the best, and the salmon poke was good but a bit on the spicy side.
For entrees we've had the poke salad (amazing), the Thai curry bowl with salmon (also amazing it was one of the best salmons I've ever had), and the teriyaki bowl with steak.
To be honest I would stick to what they know best which is probably fish.
The steak was just ok
and they weren't very generous with the portions.
It was more rice and a whole lot of other stuff on it like pineapples, edamame, carrots, shiitake mushrooms, and A LOT of fried onions.
I do have to say tho that the teriyaki sauce they use is delicious, I couldn't stop eating the rice.
white tuna.author: Linz C.
white tuna.review:
I've been here a couple of times and I must say they have one of the best happy hour menus!  They even give you edamame and goldfish pretzels to snack on! 

We've tried the Korean sticky ribs, Kona coffee ribs, fried calamari, shrimp ceviche (my favorite), the poke trio with the California, original, and white tuna, the salmon poke, and the spicy tuna sushi roll.  The Kona coffee ribs were amazing but I think were only around for a limited time. The sushi rolls were just mediocre, this isn't a sushi joint so I would stay away from the rolls and stick to the poke.  The original poke is a little too salty but it's tolerable if you pair with rice, the white tuna poke was a little on the dry side, I would've liked more liquid/lemon on it and it had a really "fishy" taste, the California was probably the best, and the salmon poke was good but a bit on the spicy side.  The poke trio also comes with wonton chips, a small salad, and a delicious seaweed salad. 

For entrees we've had the poke salad (amazing), the Thai curry bowl with salmon (also amazing it was one of the best salmons I've ever had), and the teriyaki bowl with steak.  To be honest I would stick to what they know best which is probably fish.  The steak was just ok and they weren't very generous with the portions. It was more rice and a whole lot of other stuff on it like pineapples, edamame, carrots, shiitake mushrooms, and A LOT of fried onions.  I do have to say tho that the teriyaki sauce they use is delicious, I couldn't stop eating the rice.

excerpts: The mister and I shared the white tuna Poke, served with fried wontons.
Then we both ordered mix & match tacos.
white tuna.author: Dahlia C.
white tuna.review:
After a long hike at Land's End with my family, we were starving. It was a beautiful Sunday afternoon and the nearest place where there are notably tons of great eclectic spots to eat, was in the inner sunset district along Irving and 9th. Right on the corner of 9th and Lincoln is Pacific Catch, you cannot miss it. Parking can be a little difficult to find especially on weekends, but it was just our luck that we found a spot right in front. They say the law of attraction can make things happen & that's exactly what happened as my hubby and I were claiming a close spot beforehand. And on top of that, the meters said free parking, which is normally in service on Sundays. Made us feel like we won the lottery!!

Anyways, we were seated right away since it was mid-afternoon and not so crowded. The boys had kids meals: fish and chips and fish tacos. The mister and I shared the white tuna Poke, served with fried wontons. Then we both ordered mix & match tacos. I chose mahi mahi, shrimp, and steak. Hubby chose baja (fried cod), mahi mahi, and steak as well. We each ordered them with a side of fries--spicy and sweet potato. Everything was pretty much devoured really quickly, even my boys cleaned up their plates which is really rare. Either they were just hungry or they loved it, turns out to both.The only flip-side to it was that there was some damage done to our wallets. Total cost for a family of four came out to almost $80 including tax. We always try to eat where we can afford within our means, but today, I guess you can say it was a special treat:) Otherwise, be prepared to dish out some money for good seafood or save this place for special occasions.

excerpts: White Tuna Poke- not my favorite dish.
It was pretty fresh, but the sauce was very sweet and seemed kinda creamy and citrusy.
The wonton strips it came with was mostly folded and I could not eat it with the tuna.
white tuna.author: Carmen C.
white tuna.review:
Me and my friend were looking for sit-down pretty afforable and worth it place to eat. So we stopped by here and it seemed decent and there was no wait. I wouldn't say that this place was worth it. I left thinking I could totally eat more food, but I already spent more than I wanted for a quick dinner. 


White Tuna Poke- not my favorite dish. It was pretty fresh, but the sauce was very sweet and seemed kinda creamy and citrusy. The wonton strips it came with was mostly folded and I could not eat it with the tuna. I probably would try something else next time.

Fish Tacos- 
I got the 3 taco platter plate to share. First off, I got the grilled Mahi-Mahi tacos. Kind of dry, to be honest, and pretty bland. The steak taco was pretty good! very filling! Then for the third taco, I got the shrimp one. The shrimp were pretty large and fried and it was my favorite taco out of the three. Came with a side of sweet potato fries which were super delicious, so I recommend yall get that if you come here.

excerpts: I got the White Tuna Poke from here during happy hour and sent it back because it smelled/tasted off.
Long story short, I spent the night puking.
white tuna.author: Jennifer B.
white tuna.review:
Eeek. I got the White Tuna Poke from here during happy hour and sent it back because it smelled/tasted off. Long story short, I spent the night puking. When I mentioned this to a friend the next day, she told me the same thing happened to her a few months back.

I have been enjoying happy hour here for years but will probably just stick to the drinks. They make delicious mojitos and margaritas.

excerpts: My friend and I ordered the trio of poke: original, a creamy one with serreno chiles, and a white tuna one.
I LOVED the original.
I thought it was really good.
It tastes like poke is supposed to taste.
The serreno was my least favorite - it was really creamy, and I'm not super into creamy foods.
I did like the spice, though.
The white tuna was really refreshing.
white tuna.author: Jade R.
white tuna.review:
Uhm this place totally rocks. No idea why it's got low stars. I think it was GREAT.

My friend and I ordered the trio of poke: original, a creamy one with serreno chiles, and a white tuna one. I LOVED the original. I thought it was really good. It tastes like poke is supposed to taste. The serreno was my least favorite - it was really creamy, and I'm not super into creamy foods. I did like the spice, though. The white tuna was really refreshing. I would definitely order again.

They were previewing their special SF menu, so I gave their salmon BLT a shot. And OMG it was so great! I loved the salmon, the bacon was cooked to perfection... wow it was good. I only ate half, but that half was more than enough.

The waitresses were also super on top of it and really nice. I would recommend this place to anyone!

excerpts: We got the White Tuna Tataki
| seared white tuna served with crab & daikon salad $9.95.
It was REALLY bad.
Both the tuna & the crab were incredibly salty.
I also ordered a lemongrass mojito, it was not an easy drink
so I switched to my friend's papaya cooler.
Not great
but okay.
Service was okay.
white tuna.author: Cindy L.
white tuna.review:
I had high hopes for this place. I heard so many great things about their original restaurant down at Marina so always wanted to try this place.

I was surprised it felt very corporate, I had been by the Marina location and it looked more homey. But my biggest complaint was about the food of course. I think a salt monkey made our food. We got the White Tuna Tataki | seared white tuna served with crab & daikon salad $9.95. It was REALLY bad. Both the tuna & the crab were incredibly salty. I also ordered a lemongrass mojito, it was not an easy drink so I switched to my friend's papaya cooler. Not great but okay. Service was okay. The mochi fondue was a little bit different than we envisioned. We thought there will actually be a "fondue" instead of just a container of hot fudge that we dip the mochi in. I guess it's a more economical version of fondue... The hot fudge was warm by the time it got to our table, it was a little bit hard to dip.

I am surprised to see so many great reviews on yelp, we must've gotten the b team that day. We all wished we had went to park chow or hotei instead. Much cheaper and much more fulfilling. 

Damn you iPhone commercial, you lied to me!!!

excerpts: I ordered the white tuna poki with crab salad (very good) and surf & turf (
steak
w/shrimp, pineapple fried rice, onion shoe strings, and asparagus) to share with my friend.
white tuna.author: Terry D.
white tuna.review:
I love this place! Randomly decided to try Pacific Catch on a Saturday night (no reservation) and we got a table outside for 5 in less than 10 minutes. Even though it was really cold outside their heat lamps were superb and kept us toasty throughout dinner.

I actually pass by this restaurant every day on my bus ride to work and had no idea that it was an Asian fusion restaurant. The menu took me by surprise but in a good way. 

For appetizers we ordered sweet potato fries (very yummy) and artichokes (good but could have done without). I ordered the white tuna poki with crab salad (very good) and surf & turf (steak w/shrimp, pineapple fried rice, onion shoe strings, and asparagus) to share with my friend. I was very satisfied with my entrees and was completely stuffed afterwards.

The prices are reasonable. For a group of 5 we spent about $107 (pre tax and tip) so it's not bad at all. Service is very friendly as well. Definitely will go back!

excerpts: After reading the reviews, we decided to try the California Style Hawaiian Poke and Mahi Mahi Tacos.
What I loved the best of this place is the Hawaiian Poke!
That is super delicious and it comes with chips that you can use to scoop and eat with the poke.
That's probably my favorite out of the two that we tried.
Trying the mahi mahi tacos was just okay.
From the reviews about the tacos, I was looking forward to it and it was a bit of a disappointment.
I was expecting something super delicious
but it gets the job done.
Apparently, it came with fries too
california style.author: Teresa W.
california style.review:
I tried this for the first time after being recommended by a friend.  Seating was pretty fast and it came with a small dish of complementary Chickpeas and Pretzel crackers.  After reading the reviews, we decided to try the California Style Hawaiian Poke and Mahi Mahi Tacos.  What I loved the best of this place is the Hawaiian Poke!  That is super delicious and it comes with chips that you can use to scoop and eat with the poke.  That's probably my favorite out of the two that we tried.  Trying the mahi mahi tacos was just okay.  From the reviews about the tacos, I was looking forward to it and it was a bit of a disappointment.  I was expecting something super delicious but it gets the job done.  Apparently, it came with fries too and we chose the sweet potato fries.  They were okay as well. 

Overall, food was okay.  Definitely love the poke and will return for it.  Not so much for the tacos.  I love the staff though because they were super friendly.  On two occasions, I was trying to take photos with a friend and both a waitress and a waiter offered to help us take a photo.  That was a very sweet gesture of them!  Will definitely return for the awesome staff and the yummy poke!  I might try something new next time instead of the tacos.

excerpts: We ordered the California Style Poke, Marinated Skirt Steak Rice Bowl, Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl, and Firecracker Salmon Roll.
We finished majority of it all, yes we did (no shame, I'm tellin' you.)
But anyway, I really enjoy their poke, the wonton chips that comes with it was soooo crunchy and thinly cut, it melted in my mouth (a little exaggeration there, but nevertheless, I loved it).
california style.author: Anna L.
california style.review:
You know you're hungry when your bill comes out to be around 90$ total with only 2 people. Or maybe we're just fatasses.

I was craving some Hawaiian Poke, so my best friend and I decided to dine here for dinner. We sat near the bar/lounge area; this is a great spot for a good picture if you're a crazy insta-food-ographer like myself #guilty

We ordered the California Style Poke, Marinated Skirt Steak Rice Bowl, Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl, and Firecracker Salmon Roll. We finished majority of it all, yes we did (no shame, I'm tellin' you.) But anyway, I really enjoy their poke, the wonton chips that comes with it was soooo crunchy and thinly cut, it melted in my mouth (a little exaggeration there, but nevertheless, I loved it). PERFECT!

The rice bowl, however, was not as impressive especially for the price of it. I thought my rice bowl was way too overflowing with sauce, which made it so much saltier than it should taste and let me tell you, I am not a big fan of salty food. Not only that, the stuff that comes in it was nothing out of the ordinary. My friend said the same thing regarding the Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl =/ 

We've also ordered drinks as well and I believe we got the Agave Margarita and Pacific Catch Mai Tai. Not too sure if these were the drinks but it balances out the food we ate and helped extract the saltiness in the rice bowl, which is a good thing I guess? 

Other than that, I will come back and try other poke because I am a huge fan of poke!

excerpts: We got the California style poke, the salmon and gyoza special, and my boyfriend got three tacos.
Everything tasted good, and I requested my salmon to be cooked rare - and it was!
So tasty, and the manager stopped by to make sure it was rare enough haha.
The poke was awesome.
The waiter/bartender was pretty nice too, and the drinks were great.
california style.author: Medina C.
california style.review:
Had a great lunch here! I know it's a little bit of a tourist spot but does it matter if the food is cooked well and the service is great?

We got the California style poke, the salmon and gyoza special, and my boyfriend got three tacos. Everything tasted good, and I requested my salmon to be cooked rare - and it was! So tasty, and the manager stopped by to make sure it was rare enough haha. The poke was awesome. The waiter/bartender was pretty nice too, and the drinks were great. I recommend the pomegranate ginger martini.

My only complaint is that the high tables were awkward to sit at because they blocked your knees from scooting in all the way.

We're usually in and out of restaurants in like 45 minutes but pacific catch was chill and we stuck around for a second drink!

excerpts: (MUST HAVE... if it's in season), and the California Style poke.
california style.author: Joanne W.
california style.review:
I've been here twice now. The first time I was here, I was super hungover, tried, and grumpy, so I was unable to appreciate Pacific Catch in all its glory. So I would have to discount that time I went. The second time I went, I was with my coworkers. We made reservations, and they had quickly sat us down for dinner.

We ordered a pitcher of the mojito, which was AMAZING. It just so happened to be dungeness crab season - so I had myself the dungeness crab and corn chowder (MUST HAVE... if it's in season), and the California Style poke. I can't say no to avocado and ahi tuna. I must say, the poke here is phenomenal (although, I've never had real poke from Hawaii, so don't take my word on it. I just really like fish).

Finally, we ended off with two mochi fondues. THIS IS A MUST HAVE. You can't go wrong with ice cream mochi, chocolate, and Pocky sticks.

There was a bit of a kerfuffle when it came to getting our bills. However, it worked out in the end. PROTIP: If you pay with PayPal, you get $10 off.

excerpts:
- California style: creamy and really good, with avocado (winner!  
And when I went back with another group, it was the unanimous winner among those who tried it on the second visit.)
- Creamy Spicy: skip it.  
Wasn't that spicy and was therefore very similar to the california style one... just seemed to have less flavor and no avocado.
- "Salmon" - this was just OK despite the fact that I usually LOVE salmon poke.  

Wasn't that spicy and was therefore very similar to the california style one... just seemed to have less flavor and no avocado.
- "Salmon" - this was just OK despite the fact that I usually LOVE salmon poke.
california style.author: Aaron M.
california style.review:
Five stars but only if you order right!  The one thing you have to know about this place: WASABI POKE BOWL.  To try it is to love it.  The other stuff on the menu is OK.  But here's the cool thing: you can now order a "poke special" appetizer, which includes your choice of 3 kinds of wasabi poke-style mini-dishes from a list of about 10.  We chose (over two visits):
- Ahi macadamia nut, which was most similar to the famed wasabi poke bowl.  The fav on the first visit.
- California style: creamy and really good, with avocado (winner!  And when I went back with another group, it was the unanimous winner among those who tried it on the second visit.)
- Creamy Spicy: skip it.  Wasn't that spicy and was therefore very similar to the california style one... just seemed to have less flavor and no avocado.
- "Salmon" - this was just OK despite the fact that I usually LOVE salmon poke.  

A special thank you to our server who helped us order well and within food allergy restrictions.  Note to self: get the salmon based one next time!

excerpts:
California Style - a little too creamy for my taste but refreshing with a hint of lemon
3.
california style.author: Alyssaaa S.
california style.review:
Yummy poke!

Great customer service. Made reservations earlier & got seated promptly.
My best friend and I sat down while we waited of two others in our party.  The waitress served us appetizer finger foods- edamame and pretzel goldfishes - while we waited & even gave us another serving per request!

Ordered the poke trio:
1. Ahi Serrano - my fave, I love spicy food, & very light & fresh
2. California Style - a little too creamy for my taste but refreshing with a hint of lemon
3. Ahi Macadamia - something about the onions and the macadamia nuts that just pairs so well together! 

Overall, variety of fresh poke!

excerpts: on the other hand, it's not a sushi restaurant, but a fusion california style fish and chips restaurant?
i mean, i don't really understand.
good for groups of people visiting who don't know where else to eat i suppose.
california style.author: Thao T.
california style.review: the only thing positive about this place is that it's convenient for a group of tourists as it sits directly across from Golden Gate Park. it's marked up and mediocre. locals wouldn't come here for poke since there are a few other sushi restaurants in the area. on the other hand, it's not a sushi restaurant, but a fusion california style fish and chips restaurant? i mean, i don't really understand. good for groups of people visiting who don't know where else to eat i suppose.

excerpts: We ordered the California Style Hawaiian Poke, which she recommended... and it was hella good
, lawwd have mercy.
california style.author: Kate E.
california style.review:
I love this place! My boyfriend and I went here for our first time last week and it is definitely our new favorite spot. The food was great and I love the fact that I do not feel guilty eating their food since their portions are pretty big! Our server (I believe her name was Adriana) was really nice! She asked if we ate there before and of course we said no so she suggested to us what we should try. She was definitely helpful and made our experience there for our first time even better. It is always a love/hate feeling when we get a good server LOL we know we have a good server when we're thinking "dammnit now we really have to tip" lmao. Thanks Adriana!! We ordered the California Style Hawaiian Poke, which she recommended... and it was hella good, lawwd have mercy. For our entree, I ordered the Hawaiian Teriyaki rice bowl with grilled salmon and it was amazeballs. I will definitely be coming back for the rice bowl, the poke, and the service! 

Only downside is that we got pulled over before we got to the restaurant lol apparently we can't drive through a intersection until a pedestrian has gotten onto the sidewalk completely  -___- the pedestrian had barely started walking, but luckily we got off with a warning. They do have a small little lot so parking might be a bit of a hassle, but it is worth it!

excerpts: I chose the ahi tuna serrano, california style, and salmon lomi lomi.
They were all awesome; I'll definitely be going back.
california style.author: Melissa C.
california style.review: Went here last night with my boyfriend. We shared the crab soup which was super bomb!! I wish we each got our own. He had the crab sandwich which was really good, too. I got the three poke dinner which is raw fish cut in cubes and marinated/mixed with different stuff. I chose the ahi tuna serrano, california style, and salmon lomi lomi. They were all awesome; I'll definitely be going back.

excerpts: After a nice afternoon at the new California Academy of Sciences we were hunger for seafood and fresh California style cuisine.
After searching the internet we found Pacific Catch just minutes from the museum.
To my delight, they were featuring their Seafood rice bowls, the perfect meal for three tired souls.
california style.author: Steve U.
california style.review: After a nice afternoon at the new California Academy of Sciences we were hunger for seafood and fresh California style cuisine. After searching the internet we found Pacific Catch just minutes from the museum. To my delight, they were featuring their Seafood rice bowls, the perfect meal for three tired souls. I ordered the salmon with brown rice. Yes! With just the right amount of wasabi, it hit the spot. And to top it off, we had the mochi balls dipped in warm chocolate. Decadent, but delicious. Ambiance nice. Service was OK. Could have been a 5 star.

excerpts: i went for the mahi mahi (california style) and mom went for the escolar.
wait..
before that we started with the califnornia rolls pretty basic
but DEFINATELY not out of this world.
the portions were big and i left full but not satisfied...i liked the bar area though and i will definately give it another try because i saw they had a bar menu and a full bar as well...
california style.author: shannon b.
california style.review: and "meh" is right ....went here last night and we were seated right away...nice atmosphere and i was really looking forward to eating here...the menu is extremely strange...starters and sushi on one side and 3 choices of fish specials for the evening on the other. i went for the mahi mahi (california style) and mom went for the escolar. wait..before that we started with the califnornia rolls pretty basic but DEFINATELY not out of this world. the portions were big and i left full but not satisfied...i liked the bar area though and i will definately give it another try because i saw they had a bar menu and a full bar as well...

excerpts: - Ahi macadamia nut, which was most similar to the famed wasabi poke bowl.
The fav on the first visit.
ahi macadamia nut.author: Aaron M.
ahi macadamia nut.review:
Five stars but only if you order right!  The one thing you have to know about this place: WASABI POKE BOWL.  To try it is to love it.  The other stuff on the menu is OK.  But here's the cool thing: you can now order a "poke special" appetizer, which includes your choice of 3 kinds of wasabi poke-style mini-dishes from a list of about 10.  We chose (over two visits):
- Ahi macadamia nut, which was most similar to the famed wasabi poke bowl.  The fav on the first visit.
- California style: creamy and really good, with avocado (winner!  And when I went back with another group, it was the unanimous winner among those who tried it on the second visit.)
- Creamy Spicy: skip it.  Wasn't that spicy and was therefore very similar to the california style one... just seemed to have less flavor and no avocado.
- "Salmon" - this was just OK despite the fact that I usually LOVE salmon poke.  

A special thank you to our server who helped us order well and within food allergy restrictions.  Note to self: get the salmon based one next time!

excerpts: She made great reccomendations on the Mahi Mahi taco and the Ahi Macadamia nut poke bowl.
All was delicious!
ahi macadamia nut.author: Emi K.
ahi macadamia nut.review: Rachel was a wonderful server! She made great reccomendations on the Mahi Mahi taco and the Ahi Macadamia nut poke bowl.  All was delicious! :)

excerpts: We also got a sushi roll: some spicy salmon on a california roll kinda thing.
california.author: Stephanie K.
california.review:
Finally came here, despite living two blocks away. I thought it was going to be a a place that serves like cooked, whole fish, instead of more poke/hawaiian. 

Got the rice bowl with poki on top (salmon avocado). The portion size was good, but I could barely taste the dressing. The rice was also cooked really weird, kinda soggy. 

My bf got a fish sandwich thing and it seemed pretty good. He also got seasoned fries but they were a tad bit too salty.

We also got a sushi roll: some spicy salmon on a california roll kinda thing. It was pretty decent.

I think this place could be good, if you know exactly what to order. Unfortunately, I don't know what that is. I would give it another chance if this was located in some more remote area, but it's hard to resist other restaurants next door that I love.

This is a nice roomy restaurant though! So roomy and large that it felt ginormous to SF residents who are used to whole in the wall kinda places.

excerpts: Then, the California roll.
Pieces were tall, and not tightly rolled.
california.author: Elizabeth K.
california.review:
From out of town, we were hungry after driving from Reno that day.  We happened to hit happy hour, cheaper prices.  We had poke, calamari, and a sushi roll.  The poke had a nice avocado sauce with it.  Salmon in poke was chunky with large pieces, many stringy.  We didn't detect much salmon flavor, just a fish flavor.  Being from the Pacific NW, we know salmon--this was pale in flavor at best. 

Moving on to the fried calamari, it was delicious!  It had a nice crunchy coating and wasn't oily at all.  Squid was tender, not rubbery.  Good choice!

Then, the California roll.  Pieces were tall, and not tightly rolled.  A little hard to eat as it unrolled on the plate.

All in all, it was fine overall.  Fish was clean, and fresh.  Just not my favorite, for my tastebuds.

excerpts: However, the California poke use to be my favorite.
The first time I actually had to get it sent back.
The second and third, I sucked it up.
Poke is one of my favorite food
and I am 100% sure it was not fresh.
california.author: Darlene T.
california.review:
I don't know what has been happening lately, but Pacific Catch's poke quality has been bad the past 3 visits.

I come specifically because their poke is usually fresh. I noticed their original is always good. However, the California poke use to be my favorite. The first time I actually had to get it sent back. The second and third, I sucked it up. Poke is one of my favorite food and I am 100% sure it was not fresh.

excerpts: Really  enjoyed the  California
