Style Poke which is a deconstructed California Roll minus the rice.
california.author: Sandi E.
california.review:
Went for Happy Hour.  The Poke bowls are amazing.  Really  enjoyed the  California  Style Poke which is a deconstructed California Roll minus the rice.  The Ribs too much sauce and just ok.

Service was great.  The servers bartenders, busser and manager work as a team.  Bartender Riley was  excellent and Manager Mike went above and beyond to make sure everything was great

excerpts: Are you in San Francisco, California and looking for a great place to eat?
Well Pacific Catch is NOT the place to go.
So many problems, from its overpriced un-tasteful menu to it's slow terrible service.
Trust me when I tell you, it's going to be hard to find something good to eat on the menu.
However I do recommend the Pollo Asado sandwich.
Easily the best and only good thing on the menu.
Sad to say I won't be returning, PACIFIC CATCH was a sPACIFIC disaster, definitely won't CATCH me here...
california.author: Elijah G.
california.review: Are you in San Francisco, California and looking for a great place to eat? Well Pacific Catch is NOT the place to go. So many problems, from its overpriced un-tasteful menu to it's slow terrible service. Trust me when I tell you, it's going to be hard to find something good to eat on the menu. However I do recommend the Pollo Asado sandwich. Easily the best and only good thing on the menu. Sad to say I won't be returning, PACIFIC CATCH was a sPACIFIC disaster, definitely won't CATCH me here...

excerpts: Fresh Hawaiian infused California dishes, I really enjoyed myself!
california.author: Karlos G.
california.review: Waited for ever to get seated but once we did the wait was worth it! Fresh Hawaiian infused California dishes, I really enjoyed myself!

excerpts: The menu features mainly California seafood dishes with some Asian fusion touches here and there.
This corner venue is large and spacious with very high ceilings, but they keep the place pretty cold.
california.author: Joy W.
california.review:
I've been here several times over the past few years and I've come to the conclusion that it's never a bad time to have some tasty ahi, as long as it tastes fresh. The menu features mainly California seafood dishes with some Asian fusion touches here and there. This corner venue is large and spacious with very high ceilings, but they keep the place pretty cold. There is also some cozy outdoor seating under some heaters, but keep in mind, it is right next to the bus stop. 

They start you off with some complimentary shelled edamame and pretzel goldfish, which is a cute nod to the seafood menu, but I'd still prefer bread. I also think edamame is more enjoyable with the shell on.

$16.50 Japanese Wasabi rice bowl w/ Hawaiian poke - seaweed salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori, soy-wasabi sauce:
The bowl has a decent portion of bite-size chunks of sweet, juicy tuna. The soy-wasabi sauce is mild and not too strong on the wasabi. It is also seasoned with green onions, chives, and sesame seeds. Everything tastes fresh including the pale slivers of creamy avocado and crunchy, crisp seaweed salad. Be sure to get a little bit of everything in each bite, otherwise you're left with a lots of rice at the bottom of the bowl. 

$15.50 Ahi Tuna Salad w/ seared ahi, greens & romaine, avocado, cucumber, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds, soy-wasabi vinaigrette:
When I want something lighter, I'll go for the salad. The ingredients are pretty much the same, but with lettuce instead of rice. But with a salad, I go for the seared tuna instead of poke, because it creates the illusion of a meatier salad. Again, try to eat a little of everything together, otherwise you're left with a ton of greens, or as my friend calls it, 'rabbit food.'

A lot of people like the sweet potato fries. They're alright, but sweet potato fries are becoming a ubiquitous offering across the board.

Happy hour deals are pretty good if you are in the area in the afternoons. Poke is about $8.

$9 Baja Shrimp Ceviche - lime, serrano chili, avocado, cilantro, tortilla chips:
These bite-size shrimp are springy, meaty and seasoned well. The verde sauce is on the runny side and is quite spicy. I could eat this on its own without tortilla chips too, but the thin, crunchy chips make a nice vehicle.

$12.50 Hawaiian Poke with wonton chips - original ahi tuna, sesame-soy marinade, spicy seasonings:
A small bowl of juicy ahi cubes covered in sesame seeds and micro greens are accompanied with some fried wontons.

$7 Mochi Fondue - vanilla, chocolate, coffee mochi balls & chocolate dipping sauce:
I've tried this out of curiosity, but if you've ever had store-bought mochi ice cream balls, I'd say skip it. The taste is pretty similar with the addition of a little bowl of chocolate sauce on the side for dipping.

The tasty rice bowls are still my go-to items to order here. If I were in the area, I'd come back to try some of the other menu items too.

excerpts: I am ready for "California" poke!
california.author: Thuyen P.
california.review:
I'm from Hawaii and on the last day of my trip, I need my poke fix ASAP or else I will go INSANE. 

My boyfriend and I were meeting my relatives and we needed some grub before heading to the De Young museum. We got here much earlier than them and the hostess allowed us to be seated, as my Aunt made reservations.

When seated, our server (I forgot her name but she is awesome!) promptly asked us what we would like to drink. My boyfriend and I ordered our drinks and we sat there for another 30 minutes waiting for my family. Our server checked in on us regularly, but nothing to the extent of pressuring us to order food. She refilled my boyfriend's lemonade regularly even before we ordered our food. Then after 30 minutes, my family FINALLY came!! I am ready for "California" poke!

What caught my eye was the Asian bowls. My boyfriend and I both got the Japanese Wasabi. I got the Serrano along with my bowl, while my boyfriend got the Serrano and Grilled Salmon. You get a choice of getting it with all rice (White or brown) or half rice and half salad. We both chose half,half. 

At first, I was really surprised how expensive the bowls were, being that it was at $16.50, but when it came out, oh my lordy! They are HUGE. Since my boyfriend got two choices, it was $5 more, which is pricey. The bowl came out and it was a mixture of greens, ocean salad, avocado, and your fish choice and our rice on the bottom. I couldn't finish it! My boyfriend barely finished it. 

The fish quality surprised me! It was just like home. The only thing I did not particularly like were the jalapeños in the poke. I had to pick it out while eating. I like my poke spicy but I don't want jalapeños with it. That is just my personal preference.

I will be back when I come back to San Fran! I wish Hawaii had something like this... It was definitely ono (delicious in Hawaii)!! yuuum!!

excerpts: We had a waitress from Southern California whom was friendly and helped us narrow down some of our decisions.
Cost can add up fast depending if you get apps and drinks.
Our ONLY downfall was PARKING!
It took us about 15 minutes to find a parking spot.
Restaurant is very modern looking and clean.
california.author: Jackie H.
california.review: Pacific Catch was a perfect decision for our seafood wants. Calamari, rolls, fish tacos, and ahi tuna rice bowl were just enough for our family of 4. Customer service was great. We had a waitress from Southern California whom was friendly and helped us narrow down some of our decisions. Cost can add up fast depending if you get apps and drinks. Our ONLY downfall was PARKING! It took us about 15 minutes to find a parking spot. Restaurant is very modern looking and clean.

excerpts: Hawai Poke is nice, and the California is my favorite.
Always fancy the lemonade with seasonal fruit here.
california.author: Tianlu W.
california.review: had a goodbye dinner with schoolmate last time. enjoy it again with my roomies this time. The coconut shrimp is tasty. Like it a lot. Hawai Poke is nice, and the California is my favorite. Always fancy the lemonade with seasonal fruit here.

excerpts: Yesterday, I got the happy hour spicy tuna california roll.
Within half an hour, pounding headache, within an hour, I felt super hot and nauseous and my heart was pounding.
Within two hours everything in my stomach was coming out into the toilet.
Worst food poisoning I've had in a REALLY long time.
And at pac catch-
I was super surprised and now very wary of eating there.
Also, I should of known when the spicy tuna california roll came out and the spicy tuna looked like cat food.
Also, I should of known when the spicy tuna california roll came out and the spicy tuna looked like cat food.
california.author: Elizabeth N.
california.review: I've been here a few times and never had problems before, but that's probably because I ordered only drinks and a salad. Yesterday, I got the happy hour spicy tuna california roll. Within half an hour, pounding headache, within an hour, I felt super hot and nauseous and my heart was pounding. Within two hours everything in my stomach was coming out into the toilet. Worst food poisoning I've had in a REALLY long time. And at pac catch- I was super surprised and now very wary of eating there. Also, I should of known when the spicy tuna california roll came out and the spicy tuna looked like cat food. -________-

excerpts: The green tea, the California and tuna rolls to start.
the Poke 3 ways was really good as well.
My mahi green curry rice bowl was really good too, I wish it would have had a bit more fish, literally one more piece and this would have been a 5 star review
california.author: Carlos L.
california.review:
I loved it, everything we had was great and on point. The green tea, the California and tuna rolls to start. the Poke 3 ways was really good as well. My mahi green curry rice bowl was really good too, I wish it would have had a bit more fish, literally one more piece and this would have been a 5 star review :)

The deserts were great as well; the macadamia but brownie and the mochi.

Totally coming back!

excerpts: Their crab ("california roll")
salad is my absolute favorite.
california.author: Delia Z.
california.review:
Oof. Their crab ("california roll") salad is my absolute favorite. The amount of crab is generous and the meal is incredibly filling - and I just love the combination of everything in the salad! 

Fish and chips are always great, and service is good - once they brought over the wrong kind of fries, and after we pointed it out, they brought out an extra large portion of the right type. It's the little things :)

I always love to get their calamari, too - I wish we got more with the order, but they're fried perfectly and served with thinly sliced lemons (also fried) and a chipotle sauce. Delicious!

Eating here has always been a pleasant and tasty experience... and I'll definitely keep coming back!

excerpts: The california roll
: It was pretty generous for a basic roll and was very filling.
california.author: Nathan Y.
california.review:
I came here for a company dinner, which mainly consisted of delicious appetizers.

For appetizers, we had:
A starter salad
The california roll: It was pretty generous for a basic roll and was very filling.
Baja shrimp ceviche: A very delicious shrimp dish. Recommended.
Ahi tuna poke: Those wonton chips were amazing, but the Ahi tuna poke was even better. The tuna was very fresh and tender. Highly-recommended.

For my entree, I had a Japanese wasabi rice bowl with seared Ahi tuna: The wasabi taste was light but definitely noticeable. It blended very well with the included salad. Similar to the Ahi tuna poke appetizer, the tuna was delicious. It had great texture and a very juicy taste.

The restaurant had good service and gave very generous portions for appetizers and entrees. (I was beyond stuffed)

I was quite impressed and look forward to returning to one of their many locations in the Bay Area.

excerpts: We've tried the Korean sticky ribs, Kona coffee ribs, fried calamari, shrimp ceviche (my favorite), the poke trio with the California, original, and white tuna, the salmon poke, and the spicy tuna sushi roll.
The Kona coffee ribs were amazing
but I think were only around for a limited time.
The sushi rolls were just mediocre, this isn't a sushi joint
so I would stay away from the rolls and stick to the poke.
The original poke is a little too salty
but it's tolerable if you pair with rice
, the white tuna poke was a little on the dry side, I would've liked more liquid/lemon on it
and it had a really "fishy" taste, the California was probably the best, and the salmon poke was good but a bit on the spicy side.
and it had a really "fishy" taste, the California was probably the best, and the salmon poke was good but a bit on the spicy side.
For entrees we've had the poke salad (amazing), the Thai curry bowl with salmon (also amazing it was one of the best salmons I've ever had), and the teriyaki bowl with steak.
To be honest I would stick to what they know best which is probably fish.
The steak was just ok
and they weren't very generous with the portions.
It was more rice and a whole lot of other stuff on it like pineapples, edamame, carrots, shiitake mushrooms, and A LOT of fried onions.
I do have to say tho that the teriyaki sauce they use is delicious, I couldn't stop eating the rice.
california.author: Linz C.
california.review:
I've been here a couple of times and I must say they have one of the best happy hour menus!  They even give you edamame and goldfish pretzels to snack on! 

We've tried the Korean sticky ribs, Kona coffee ribs, fried calamari, shrimp ceviche (my favorite), the poke trio with the California, original, and white tuna, the salmon poke, and the spicy tuna sushi roll.  The Kona coffee ribs were amazing but I think were only around for a limited time. The sushi rolls were just mediocre, this isn't a sushi joint so I would stay away from the rolls and stick to the poke.  The original poke is a little too salty but it's tolerable if you pair with rice, the white tuna poke was a little on the dry side, I would've liked more liquid/lemon on it and it had a really "fishy" taste, the California was probably the best, and the salmon poke was good but a bit on the spicy side.  The poke trio also comes with wonton chips, a small salad, and a delicious seaweed salad. 

For entrees we've had the poke salad (amazing), the Thai curry bowl with salmon (also amazing it was one of the best salmons I've ever had), and the teriyaki bowl with steak.  To be honest I would stick to what they know best which is probably fish.  The steak was just ok and they weren't very generous with the portions. It was more rice and a whole lot of other stuff on it like pineapples, edamame, carrots, shiitake mushrooms, and A LOT of fried onions.  I do have to say tho that the teriyaki sauce they use is delicious, I couldn't stop eating the rice.

excerpts: Boyfriend and I shared a California roll (huge portion for the price with quality real crab) and the sticky ribs (great flavor but
the meat wasn't falling off the bone amazing) for starters.

He did the chipotle chicken sandwich with side of Cajun seasoned fries (wonderful flavor and the chicken breast was super tender) and I had the California bowl with poke 1/2 brown rice 1/2 salad which was ahhhhhmazing!!!
highly recommend.
On top of it all our server was knowledgeable, attentive and sweet.
california.author: Sachi P.
california.review: Really fresh seafood and for a chain restaurant this place exceeded our expectations!! Boyfriend and I shared a California roll (huge portion for the price with quality real crab) and the sticky ribs (great flavor but the meat wasn't falling off the bone amazing) for starters. He did the chipotle chicken sandwich with side of Cajun seasoned fries (wonderful flavor and the chicken breast was super tender) and I had the California bowl with poke 1/2 brown rice 1/2 salad which was ahhhhhmazing!!!  highly recommend. On top of it all our server was knowledgeable, attentive and sweet.

excerpts: After reading the reviews, we decided to try the California Style Hawaiian Poke and Mahi Mahi Tacos.
What I loved the best of this place is the Hawaiian Poke!
That is super delicious and it comes with chips that you can use to scoop and eat with the poke.
That's probably my favorite out of the two that we tried.
Trying the mahi mahi tacos was just okay.
From the reviews about the tacos, I was looking forward to it and it was a bit of a disappointment.
I was expecting something super delicious
but it gets the job done.
Apparently, it came with fries too
california.author: Teresa W.
california.review:
I tried this for the first time after being recommended by a friend.  Seating was pretty fast and it came with a small dish of complementary Chickpeas and Pretzel crackers.  After reading the reviews, we decided to try the California Style Hawaiian Poke and Mahi Mahi Tacos.  What I loved the best of this place is the Hawaiian Poke!  That is super delicious and it comes with chips that you can use to scoop and eat with the poke.  That's probably my favorite out of the two that we tried.  Trying the mahi mahi tacos was just okay.  From the reviews about the tacos, I was looking forward to it and it was a bit of a disappointment.  I was expecting something super delicious but it gets the job done.  Apparently, it came with fries too and we chose the sweet potato fries.  They were okay as well. 

Overall, food was okay.  Definitely love the poke and will return for it.  Not so much for the tacos.  I love the staff though because they were super friendly.  On two occasions, I was trying to take photos with a friend and both a waitress and a waiter offered to help us take a photo.  That was a very sweet gesture of them!  Will definitely return for the awesome staff and the yummy poke!  I might try something new next time instead of the tacos.

excerpts: The California roll that my daughter ordered was a bit dry.
It also was overpriced at $9.
The wine was overpriced too, at $9 a glass, and it wasn't that much wine in the glass.
california.author: Michelle R.
california.review:
A very solid place, with good food and great presentation.

It is an all-occasion spot, you can come for a casual Sunday dinner or to celebrate a birthday.  You can see  all ages and all kind of groups of people, from families with babies to ones with  older parents and everyone in between.  Groups of friends, ages from  20 something to seniors.

We really loved the sweet potato fries for an appetizer.  They came with red chili pepper sauce (yumm) and wasabi aioli.

My mahi mahi tacos were really good. They came with avocado and lettuce, a small bowl of beans on the side, and you could have an option of fries or salad with it.  There were 2 tacos on a plate.  I don't like huge portions, so this was plenty.

 My husband had a bowl of grilled mahi mahi with brown rice, roasted pineapple, caramelized onions and shaved coconut.   He really enjoyed it and could barely finish his plate, it was so much food.

We were so full that we couldn't  even  finish our side of warm edamame.

My son had fish and chips.  I tried his fries, the seasoning on them was a really good combination.

Some food, like sweet potato fries, tacos were served on a sheet of a newspaper which happened to be a Hawaiian Tribune from April 1, 1901.  Pretty cool, although I've seen it before (at an Italian Seafood place, on Irving and 9th, not far from this one.)

Cons:  The California roll that my daughter ordered was a bit dry. It also was overpriced at $9.  The wine was overpriced too, at $9 a glass, and it wasn't that much wine in the glass.  Also, they were out of one of Hawaiian Poke tonight - spiced tofu.

Nevertheless, we enjoyed our dinner and definitely will be back.

excerpts: We ordered the California Style Poke, Marinated Skirt Steak Rice Bowl, Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl, and Firecracker Salmon Roll.
We finished majority of it all, yes we did (no shame, I'm tellin' you.)
But anyway, I really enjoy their poke, the wonton chips that comes with it was soooo crunchy and thinly cut, it melted in my mouth (a little exaggeration there, but nevertheless, I loved it).
california.author: Anna L.
california.review:
You know you're hungry when your bill comes out to be around 90$ total with only 2 people. Or maybe we're just fatasses.

I was craving some Hawaiian Poke, so my best friend and I decided to dine here for dinner. We sat near the bar/lounge area; this is a great spot for a good picture if you're a crazy insta-food-ographer like myself #guilty

We ordered the California Style Poke, Marinated Skirt Steak Rice Bowl, Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl, and Firecracker Salmon Roll. We finished majority of it all, yes we did (no shame, I'm tellin' you.) But anyway, I really enjoy their poke, the wonton chips that comes with it was soooo crunchy and thinly cut, it melted in my mouth (a little exaggeration there, but nevertheless, I loved it). PERFECT!

The rice bowl, however, was not as impressive especially for the price of it. I thought my rice bowl was way too overflowing with sauce, which made it so much saltier than it should taste and let me tell you, I am not a big fan of salty food. Not only that, the stuff that comes in it was nothing out of the ordinary. My friend said the same thing regarding the Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl =/ 

We've also ordered drinks as well and I believe we got the Agave Margarita and Pacific Catch Mai Tai. Not too sure if these were the drinks but it balances out the food we ate and helped extract the saltiness in the rice bowl, which is a good thing I guess? 

Other than that, I will come back and try other poke because I am a huge fan of poke!

excerpts: We got the California style poke, the salmon and gyoza special, and my boyfriend got three tacos.
Everything tasted good, and I requested my salmon to be cooked rare - and it was!
So tasty, and the manager stopped by to make sure it was rare enough haha.
The poke was awesome.
The waiter/bartender was pretty nice too, and the drinks were great.
california.author: Medina C.
california.review:
Had a great lunch here! I know it's a little bit of a tourist spot but does it matter if the food is cooked well and the service is great?

We got the California style poke, the salmon and gyoza special, and my boyfriend got three tacos. Everything tasted good, and I requested my salmon to be cooked rare - and it was! So tasty, and the manager stopped by to make sure it was rare enough haha. The poke was awesome. The waiter/bartender was pretty nice too, and the drinks were great. I recommend the pomegranate ginger martini.

My only complaint is that the high tables were awkward to sit at because they blocked your knees from scooting in all the way.

We're usually in and out of restaurants in like 45 minutes but pacific catch was chill and we stuck around for a second drink!

excerpts: We got the California grilled salmon sandwich and the wasabi poke bowl.
Great food great service
I'd come back again
california.author: Georgie O.
california.review: Very tasty very satisfying. I left feeling the perfect amount of full. It's very clean and the decor is very pleasing to the eyes. We got the California grilled salmon sandwich and the wasabi poke bowl. Great food great service I'd come back again :)

excerpts: (MUST HAVE... if it's in season), and the California Style poke.
california.author: Joanne W.
california.review:
I've been here twice now. The first time I was here, I was super hungover, tried, and grumpy, so I was unable to appreciate Pacific Catch in all its glory. So I would have to discount that time I went. The second time I went, I was with my coworkers. We made reservations, and they had quickly sat us down for dinner.

We ordered a pitcher of the mojito, which was AMAZING. It just so happened to be dungeness crab season - so I had myself the dungeness crab and corn chowder (MUST HAVE... if it's in season), and the California Style poke. I can't say no to avocado and ahi tuna. I must say, the poke here is phenomenal (although, I've never had real poke from Hawaii, so don't take my word on it. I just really like fish).

Finally, we ended off with two mochi fondues. THIS IS A MUST HAVE. You can't go wrong with ice cream mochi, chocolate, and Pocky sticks.

There was a bit of a kerfuffle when it came to getting our bills. However, it worked out in the end. PROTIP: If you pay with PayPal, you get $10 off.

excerpts: California Roll Salad
: I love this salad!
Although I had it at every meal
and I got kind of sick of it at the end.
The salad is huge and you'll probably have a hard time finishing it.
It comes with a ton of avocado and a even bigger mound of real crab.
It really does taste like a california roll!
california.author: Tiffany V.
california.review:
I think the text my best friend sent me yesterday morning sums up my feelings about Pacific Catch, "wtf wtfff why are you always at pacific catch crazy woman" Haha. 

I didn't even realize how much I loved this place until I kept finding myself there. It wasn't even until the third time did I realize they had a parking lot next to the restaurant! How handy! Such a rare find in San Francisco. 

Fish & Chips: Everyone loves these but I don't think its their best thing there. You should definitely get 4 pieces though since its $14 and 2 pieces is already $10. The pieces of fish aren't that big. I love the sauces it comes with but the Jalapeno Tartar sauce was never spicy to me. I think the coleslaw side is far too small as well but I love their sweet potato fries (the only reason I wanted to come in the first place haha)

California Roll Salad: I love this salad! Although I had it at every meal and I got kind of sick of it at the end. The salad is huge and you'll probably have a hard time finishing it. It comes with a ton of avocado and a even bigger mound of real crab. It really does taste like a california roll! I think its around $13. 

Hawaiian Poke Brown Rice Bowl: I never would've thought of ordering this if it wasn't for Yelp! I'm eating it right now as I type. I had a ton leftover because it wasn't the best thing to eat yesterday morning hungover! By far my favorite thing from Pacific Catch. You can also get it with white rice or 1/2 rice & 1/2 greens. 

Mochi Fondue: Nothing special. Just 3 mochi balls cut in half and a little bowl of tasty melty chocolate to dip it in. There was way too much chocolate in the bowl though and I felt bad for wasting it. I don't think its worth the money since it isn't very creative and you could just make the same thing yourself for far less. 

There is never a wait when I go. My friend and I were about to get dinner at the Presidio location until we drove by it noticed how tiny and packed it was. We just drove all the way to the 9th street location. This location is huge. Service has always been nice as well. I probably wouldn't go on a first date here though as it is a little bit commercial and there are tons of better first date restaurants in the area.

excerpts: My wife and I like to meet after work and sit at the bar and have drinks and eat bar bites--calamari, original Poke, California roll, and
Korean ribs are all great!
The bar features hand built drinks...
I love the Mai Tai's they are best that I have ever had and the Negroni is also top notch.
Good service and good prices.
A neighborhood gem
california.author: David K.
california.review: love this place. The food is good, a fusion of Asian, Pacific Islander and American. Great bar and a great happy hour. My wife and I like to meet after work and sit at the bar and have drinks and eat bar bites--calamari, original Poke, California roll, and Korean ribs are all great! The bar features hand built drinks... I love the Mai Tai's they are best that I have ever had and the Negroni is also top notch. Good service and good prices. A neighborhood gem

excerpts: I ordered the California poke which was good but heavier and creamier than I thought it would be.
california.author: Irene R.
california.review:
My husband and I came here last night (Friday) around 930pm and easily found a table in the bar area. I ordered the California poke which was good but heavier and creamier than I thought it would be. Husband got the fish and chips sampler that included fried fish, oysters, and coconut shrimp along with sweet potato fries. All were very good.
Waited for happy hour to start at 10pm to order drinks and got 2 margaritas. Very tasty and only $6 each! Overall nice place and would come back.

excerpts: My personal favorites are the BBQ chicken salad/sandwich and the California Salmon Sandwich.
california.author: Chris S.
california.review:
I come here frequently with my wife and mom for lunch dates in between classes. The restaurant itself has nice decor, as well as a small parking lot on the side. It is always very well kept up and clean. We never have issues getting a booth, and service is always very good. 

They have a great selection of salads and sandwiches. My personal favorites are the BBQ chicken salad/sandwich and the California Salmon Sandwich. Both of these go very well with their sweet potato fries. In addition to salads and sandwiches they offer a somewhat decent variety of sushi, all of which is very good.

excerpts: I think my current favorite is the california rolls.
california.author: Win H.
california.review:
they updated their menu to have GF next to all the dishes that are GF. SUPER SUPER HELPFUL AND SO MANY OPTIONS TO CHOOSE FROM! 

I think my current favorite is the california rolls. 

:)

excerpts:
- California style: creamy and really good, with avocado (winner!  
And when I went back with another group, it was the unanimous winner among those who tried it on the second visit.)
- Creamy Spicy: skip it.  
Wasn't that spicy and was therefore very similar to the california style one... just seemed to have less flavor and no avocado.
- "Salmon" - this was just OK despite the fact that I usually LOVE salmon poke.  

Wasn't that spicy and was therefore very similar to the california style one... just seemed to have less flavor and no avocado.
- "Salmon" - this was just OK despite the fact that I usually LOVE salmon poke.
california.author: Aaron M.
california.review:
Five stars but only if you order right!  The one thing you have to know about this place: WASABI POKE BOWL.  To try it is to love it.  The other stuff on the menu is OK.  But here's the cool thing: you can now order a "poke special" appetizer, which includes your choice of 3 kinds of wasabi poke-style mini-dishes from a list of about 10.  We chose (over two visits):
- Ahi macadamia nut, which was most similar to the famed wasabi poke bowl.  The fav on the first visit.
- California style: creamy and really good, with avocado (winner!  And when I went back with another group, it was the unanimous winner among those who tried it on the second visit.)
- Creamy Spicy: skip it.  Wasn't that spicy and was therefore very similar to the california style one... just seemed to have less flavor and no avocado.
- "Salmon" - this was just OK despite the fact that I usually LOVE salmon poke.  

A special thank you to our server who helped us order well and within food allergy restrictions.  Note to self: get the salmon based one next time!

excerpts: Love the inside out - combination of california roll and spicy ahi, you just can't go wrong there.
california.author: Melissa A.
california.review:
Over the last few years, Pacific Catch has definitely improved.  They've removed a lot of the really saucy items and have made a huge effort to make quality, Hawaiian style poke - and it works.    

Appetizers:  If you're going with a group, get the ceviche trio - there's something for everyone.  Super tasty and love the won ton chips.  

Sushi:  Love the inside out - combination of california roll and spicy ahi, you just can't go wrong there.

Rice Bowl:  Highly recommend the wasabi bowl with either the poke or the salmon.  Mix it all up so the rice gets nice and flavorful.  

Tacos:  Like that you can choose from 1, 2 or 3 and you can interchange them.  I like the mahi, it's lightly seasoned and has that grilled flavor and it's not heavy so you don't feel like shit when you leave.

Always check the specials menu, they do some really great stuff (currently loving the spicy creamy ahi and cedar plank salmon).

Wine list has also improved - so thanks for that!

excerpts: We got some spicy fries and the california poke to start, and they were delicious.
Our very friendly waitress brought us out some extra aioli for our fries since we ran through the first one quickly, due to deliciousness.
Love the crab in the california poke, and the wonton chips were good ones.
Ordered our mains, and when they came out to us, I was freaked out.
Where was my pineapple, my crispy onions, my mushrooms and edamame?
Oh shit.
Had I ordered the wrong thing?
Had she maybe made a mistake?
She came back to check on us
and I said that I had meant to get the hawaiian teriyaki bowl, not the korean barbeque.
She apologized for her mistake and snatched up the bowl to bring back.
After she left, I became more and more sure that I had said Korean BBQ instead of Hawaiian teriyaki.
Yep, yep, yep, I definitely just did that.
Would I have done that again?
Probably.
I really wanted that freaking bowl, I had thought about it for a while, and I couldn't have possibly eaten anything else.
Our waitress was SO INCREDIBLY NICE about it, and kept putting it on herself, until I finally admitted my mistake when she brought out the Hawaiian Teriyaki bowl.
She laughed it off and said NBD.
I didn't catch her name
but she had medium length straight brown hair in a ponytail, average height, and waited on us at the table right near the hostess station...
A very unhelpful description
california.author: Sarah B.
california.review:
Came here after the hardly strictly bluegrass festival yesterday, and I was excited for what was ahead of me. I used to live in the Marina and either eat at that Pacific Catch or get take out from there a couple times a month. Hawaiian teriyaki was my sunshine on a bad day. I was loyal.

So after almost a year of PC deprivation, I was a little tipsy and extremely excited for my culinary journey. We got some spicy fries and the california poke to start, and they were delicious. Our very friendly waitress brought us out some extra aioli for our fries since we ran through the first one quickly, due to deliciousness. Love the crab in the california poke, and the wonton chips were good ones. Ordered our mains, and when they came out to us, I was freaked out. Where was my pineapple, my crispy onions, my mushrooms and edamame? Oh shit. Had I ordered the wrong thing? Had she maybe made a mistake? She came back to check on us and I said that I had meant to get the hawaiian teriyaki bowl, not the korean barbeque. She apologized for her mistake and snatched up the bowl to bring back. After she left, I became more and more sure that I had said Korean BBQ instead of Hawaiian teriyaki. Yep, yep, yep, I definitely just did that. Would I have done that again? Probably. I really wanted that freaking bowl, I had thought about it for a while, and I couldn't have possibly eaten anything else. Our waitress was SO INCREDIBLY NICE about it, and kept putting it on herself, until I finally admitted my mistake when she brought out the Hawaiian Teriyaki bowl. She laughed it off and said NBD. I didn't catch her name but she had medium length straight brown hair in a ponytail, average height, and waited on us at the table right near the hostess station... A very unhelpful description but I hope the restaurant knows how great of a meal facilitator she is!

As I sit here, writing this review and eating my leftover Hawaiian Teriyaki bowl, I am glad there are people out there like our waitress. And steaks out there as good as the one on this bowl.

excerpts: We then ordered the Sunset Sushi Roll (which comes in 8 pieces) and Poke Fest Trio (we tried the original, California, and the Macadamia Nut).
I personally liked the Macadamia Nut and Original Poke.
I think the California Poke was too citrusy (is that a word).
but at least it's an option in the busy inner sunset.
california.author: Phillip D.
california.review:
Finally tried this place after seeing so many friends frequent this restaurant.  I can't believe I only tried this place now. 

First of all, I love that they have a variety of "Pacific Rim" cuisine.  Everything from Hawaiian to Japanese to Korean, we actually tried a bit of all three.  We came on a Wednesday evening (just missed the Happy Hour). We started with the Korean Sticky Ribs. That was tasty but a bit messy (it's nice they have napkins and wet naps to clean off your hands).  We then ordered the Sunset Sushi Roll (which comes in 8 pieces) and Poke Fest Trio (we tried the original, California, and the Macadamia Nut).  I personally liked the Macadamia Nut and Original Poke. I think the California Poke was too citrusy (is that a word).  

I definitely want to try their happy hour (see what deals I can get). They have happy hour both from 4-6 M-F and 10-close! Great for those late night eats. Also, I have to try their rice bowl. From what I saw, they are HUGE! 

Our server (forgot her name) was real nice and pretty attentive. I don't think it was too busy but even if, good service always makes the meal (and review) even better  

They technically have a parking lot in the rear but it's usually full but at least it's an option in the busy inner sunset. 

Definitely a place to come again.

excerpts: I ordered the Tom Kha soup and California Roll.
The soup was absolutely amazing, bursting with flavors.
Loved it.
The California Roll was a major disappointment.
I could have gone to Safeway and bought a better roll.
So sad.
The taco bowls were HUGE and were brought home as leftovers.
california.author: Claudia T.
california.review:
I went to lunch with my mom and two family friends. We got seated right away which was great but then I felt like the waitress was hanging over us rushing us to order. The restaurant was close to empty. She brought our drinks and then gave us a few moments to continue to look over the menu. I ordered the nojito which is a mojito sans alcohol. It was awesome. I even got two of them for the price of one because the bartender accidentally made two. Hey, can't complain. I ordered the Tom Kha soup and California Roll. The soup was absolutely amazing, bursting with flavors. Loved it. The California Roll was a major disappointment. I could have gone to Safeway and bought a better roll. So sad. The taco bowls were HUGE and were brought home as leftovers. Their sweet potato fries were close to perfection.

Unfortunately the service was seriously lacking. The server took my mom's food and brought it back to the kitchen and put it in a to-go box. Our friend also asked to take hers home and our waitress practically threw the to-go box at her. Our friend also asked for a second glass of wine and let me tell you what a process that was. So that was super weird. It literally took our waitress an HOUR to bring us our bill. An hour? Really? Luckily we had the day off so we had plenty of time to kill and catch-up but seriously, how can it take that long to bring us our bill? Especially when the waitress asked us if we wanted anything else and we said no. Wouldn't that be your clue to bring us our bill? It was great for people watching since we had such an opportunity to watch people come and go. 

I  will return because I really liked the soup and there were other items on the menu that looked really good. Hopefully the service improves.

excerpts: The California roll was made with real crab but surprisingly lacking in flavor.
california.author: Janice C.
california.review:
On my only day off, do I really want to spend it with my crazy family?!

"Oh, don't worry, your dad's not coming" my mom said.

* If you know my 'rents, I'm sure you'd also say thank God! *

Since it was just my mom and I, we decided to have lunch at Pacific Catch.  She loves seafood -- fish, shrimps, crab, baked, fried or broiled.  This place was ideal since it was walking distance to GG park, which we were headed to after lunch.

We picked out a couple of items and decided to share.  

The sweet potato fries were recommended by Eileen H. Boy she was right!  crispy and simply adorned with rock salt, it comes with two dipping sauces. I didn't like the flavored mayo nor the sweet chili sauce, but the fries are good on their own. (a side order is enough for two people)

The California roll was made with real crab but surprisingly lacking in flavor.  I've never been so thankful for soy sauce to dip it in.

On to the poke dish -- huge chunks of ahi tuna perfectly marinated in a soy sesame dressing.  It'll be easier to chew on it if the cut was smaller, but I shouldn't complain because I got my money's worth on that dish. 

Save your $4.95 on the grilled yellowtail taco. (it was a special for that day) The taco was small and the fish was overwhelmed with all the other trimmings in there. 

My mom loved her grilled mahi mahi with pineapple salsa. Served with a side of bok choy, onion strings and a big scoop of rice.  She couldn't finish this dish, not because it wasn't delicious, but the portions were so huge!

Service is very good, both from our waitress and the bussers, constantly refilling water and taking away used dishes. 

I'm curious about their happy hour, so I may come back for that!

excerpts:
California Roll Salad - 14.5 
crab, avocado, cucumber, pickled ginger, carrots, shredded nori & soy-wasabi vinaigrette
Except for me thinking that I'd try the California Roll Salad.
For $15, I wish I ordered the Hawaiian bowl cause I wasn't sure if I was supposed to be tasting anything.
With a decent amount of crab that they give you, and an overdose of avocado, surprisingly, and the soy-wasabi sauce, it had HARDLY any taste.
I was confused.
Is this crab ...or invisible taste? o.0
Except for me thinking that I'd try the California Roll Salad.
For $15, I wish I ordered the Hawaiian bowl cause I wasn't sure if I was supposed to be tasting anything.
With a decent amount of crab that they give you, and an overdose of avocado, surprisingly, and the soy-wasabi sauce, it had HARDLY any taste.
I was confused.
Is this crab ...or invisible taste? o.0
california.author: Lindsay L.
california.review:
California Roll Salad - 14.5 
crab, avocado, cucumber, pickled ginger, carrots, shredded nori & soy-wasabi vinaigrette

Hawaiian Bowl - 15
asparagus, shiitake mushrooms, pineapple salsa, grilled bok choy, sesame seeds & house-made sake-teriyaki sauce served over seasoned sushi rice*

Taco Platter - 13
Baja, steak, and mahi mahi

Combination Captains Plate - 15 or so
3 thai coconut shrimps, 2 pieces of fried fish (forgot which kind), and 3 battered oysters with a choice of a side.  We choose the sweet potatoes.

We came on a Friday night and there was a good crowd.  I'll start by saying that the people there, the waiters and waitresses were alright.  They were cordial and polite, but I think that having worked in food myself, I definitely could've done a better job in the friendliness department.  The restaurant wasn't so busy as to have the servers running around, but after saying the food was coming out really quickly, he disappeared for a lonnng time and on top of that the food did not come out quickly at all.  Which is understandable for a Friday night, but it would've been cool not to have been ditched at our table.  Or maybe I'm just expecting too much.

Anyways, I'd give this place a 3 stars.  The ambiance is nice, the food is mostly good.   Except for me thinking that I'd try the California Roll Salad.  For $15, I wish I ordered the Hawaiian bowl cause I wasn't sure if I was supposed to be tasting anything.  With a decent amount of crab that they give you, and an overdose of avocado, surprisingly, and the soy-wasabi sauce, it had HARDLY any taste.  I was confused.  Is this crab ...or invisible taste? o.0 Pass.

All in all, I guess some things are hit or miss, but the Hawaiian was good and the coconut shrimps were tasty.

excerpts: but it is a bit pricey ($9 for a California roll).
That being said, 5 stars for taste!
california.author: Hello G.
california.review: Delish! How does this only have 3.5 stars?! This place is da' bomb. The food is super tasty. I highly recommend the wasabi bowl with salmon and brown rice. It was so so good. I like their sushi too but it is a bit pricey ($9 for a California roll). That being said, 5 stars for taste!

excerpts: The Hawaiian poke is by far the best of the four we tried (macadamia, yuzu, and California were the other three) but the yuzu was good, too.
california.author: Grace A.
california.review:
Friendly staff and decent prices. The lounge outside is nice for a medium sized group on a nice day--- we had a blast.

The Hawaiian poke is by far the best of the four we tried (macadamia, yuzu, and California were the other three) but the yuzu was good, too. I suggest getting the trio anyway just because it is fun, but definitely get the Hawaiian on its own if you can.

Also do not miss the spicy mango martini (perhaps I am forgetting the name, but they'll know what I mean) or the coconut prawns. Just, don't.

Great beer selection, too, and the bathrooms were clean. 10/10 would bang.

excerpts: I had the California sandwich with salmon.
It was an odd combination that didn't fit together.
I again took the fish out and at that.
The Cole slaw was really bland.
california.author: Lalena S.
california.review:
We were searching for a good seafood restaurant and saw this place. Overall, I'm disappointed. The service was slow and awkward, they gave one of us an incomplete menu and didn't bring us back a second one. The restaurant wasnt that busy but I think it was the way the server's stations are spread out so not everyone gets equal attention. 

The food was hit and miss. We had the calamari as the appetizer. These were the smallest calamari I've had and they also mixed it with red bell pepper and lemon. It was satisfying, nice breading but not usual. 

For dinnner, my friend got two tacos... Shrimp and halibut. They came with black beans and a salad which was so so. The fish itself was good but the combination was lacking flavor overall. He wound up eating just the fish. 

I had the California sandwich with salmon. It was an odd combination that didn't fit together. I again took the fish out and at that. The Cole slaw was really bland. It just needed some mayo. 

Overall, I wouldn't go again.

excerpts: We ordered the wasabi ahi poke bowl, the California salmon sandwich and the mixed fish and chips.
My ahi poke bowl was delicious!
So fresh and the ahi poke was very flavorful.
The wasabi sauce they use was soo good too!
My only thing was the proportion to rice to the amount of poke.
I had a ton of rice leftover.
california.author: Juvi Anne B.
california.review:
First timer here with the parents and I must say, not bad. We came in for a late lunch around 1:30 pm on a Tuesday and there wasn't a lot of people. The ambiance was quite nice. I just wished we were sitting in a booth instead of a table close to the kitchen, but that's just me being picky. 

We ordered the wasabi ahi poke bowl, the California salmon sandwich and the mixed fish and chips. My ahi poke bowl was delicious! So fresh and the ahi poke was very flavorful. The wasabi sauce they use was soo good too! My only thing was the proportion to rice to the amount of poke. I had a ton of rice leftover. My mom's sandwich was equally delicious and the sweet potato fries were super crispy. My dad enjoyed his fish and chips too but he mentioned that the regular fries were kinda soggy. The fish, shrimp and oysters were battered just enough and crispy all around.  Prices are on the higher end, but it's seafood. 

Overall, we'll definitely come here again! :)

excerpts: The salmon salad had tons of crispy fried salmon skin and the California Roll salad had plenty of crab salad but without heavy mayo.
The fish tacos were very fresh and filling.
california.author: Melissa K.
california.review:
After a long flight from the east coast, we were hungry and tired of driving around so we decided to take a chance with Pacific Catch.  What a great choice!

Coming from Hawaii, I was a bit wary of restaurant's "Hawaii" theme and of the poke and other fish items but I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food relative to the price.  Entrees range from $10-$20 and everything is fresh and delicious.  Lots of fresh, creative salads, plenty of seafood options, and the food bursts with flavor and color.  

I really enjoyed the salads and the soup of the day which consisted of seafood in a tomato base. The edamame and pretzel Goldfish crackers were very cute, and I also enjoyed the wakame salad and the broccolini. The salmon salad had tons of crispy fried salmon skin and the California Roll salad had plenty of crab salad but without heavy mayo. The fish tacos were very fresh and filling. And the cocktails are phenomenal. 

Service was very good-- the waitstaff were very friendly and welcoming. Also, I'm super glad there is a parking area!

excerpts: My friend and I were quickly seated, and I ordered the California Salmon sandwich - one of my usual entrees at the Campbell branch.
The salmon was slightly dry, the bread was a bit chewier than I'd like, and the spicy fries that arrived with the sandwich were soggy.
Meh.
california.author: Felix C.
california.review:
I usually patronize the Pacific Catch in Campbell, but I was in San Francisco one night and was in the mood for some Asian-seafood fusion, so I thought the Pacific Catch here would be a safe fall-back.

My friend and I were quickly seated, and I ordered the California Salmon sandwich - one of my usual entrees at the Campbell branch. The salmon was slightly dry, the bread was a bit chewier than I'd like, and the spicy fries that arrived with the sandwich were soggy. Meh. Meanwhile on the other side of the table, my friend had the mixed seafood platter and had no complaints, and I also got to sample some of the sweet potato fries for the first time - those are BOMB. We also ordered the Let's Get Saucy sushi roll, which was just dandy (although its pretty hard to screw up sushi).

The service here was decent. Our server was very friendly and had a good sense of humor, but didn't stop by the table very often. Whenever we needed something, we'd spend several minutes trying to flag him down cause he was consistently MIA for long periods of time.

Overall I had higher hopes for this Pacific Catch, especially considering this is San Francisco. I won't be returning and I definitely cannot recommend this location.

excerpts: California Roll ($9.00) -
Again, the roll was big.
california.author: Liza T.
california.review:
first time came here and I love it.......

We had reservation at 7:30pm but we were15 minutes early.  Good that we got seated right the way.   Parking was a nightmare there.  Make sure you come early to allow yourself to look for parking.

All the staffs were friendly there.  Our server was very nice and friendly but was lacking service toward the end of the meal,  I guess he was too busy with the other big party (15 people).  He was pretty slow and did not refill our water.

The menu was extensive.  There were a lot of varieties that you could choose from.  You can choose from Salad, Rice Bowls, Tacos, Sandwiches, etc...

What we ordered:

Pacific Ceviche Trio ($17) - a sampling of shrimp ceviche, Hawaiian poke & Peruvian ceviche with chips.  It was great.  The portion was good for share.  I really like the purple potato chips.  It was perfect to eat with the poke.  Poke was so fresh and flavorful.  

Sweet Potato Fries ($6) - Portion was big.  The fries was so good.  Thick, crispy outside and soft inside.  It came with ginger wasabi aioli and sweet Thai chili sauces.  I think the wasabi aioli was better with the fries.  

Spicy Tuna Sushi Roll ($8.50) - The sushi roll was huge.  very filling......everything was so fresh.

California Roll ($9.00) - Again, the roll was big.  The crab meat was real crab salad.  Tasty.......

I got the Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl ($15).  It had tuna, wakame salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, cucumber, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori and soy-wasabi sauce.  I agree with other Yelpers.  The portion was huge and had a lot of rice but not much fish.  $15 was a little bit over price.  But the taste was pretty good.   The fish was fresh and flavorful.  I got half brown rice and half salad.  All ingredients were very fresh and tasty.  The only thing is the soy-wasabi sauce was little bit too much.  Kinda of salty to me.

My sister got the Ahi Rice Bowl ($15).  The ingredients were the same as the other rice bowls except the fish.  Ahi was very fresh.  I did not read the menu carefully.  If I knew the Ceviche Trio had poke, I would order Ahi rice bowl instead.

I really wanted to try their mochi for the dessert but I was too full.....Ok, next time!

excerpts:
California Style - a little too creamy for my taste but refreshing with a hint of lemon
3.
california.author: Alyssaaa S.
california.review:
Yummy poke!

Great customer service. Made reservations earlier & got seated promptly.
My best friend and I sat down while we waited of two others in our party.  The waitress served us appetizer finger foods- edamame and pretzel goldfishes - while we waited & even gave us another serving per request!

Ordered the poke trio:
1. Ahi Serrano - my fave, I love spicy food, & very light & fresh
2. California Style - a little too creamy for my taste but refreshing with a hint of lemon
3. Ahi Macadamia - something about the onions and the macadamia nuts that just pairs so well together! 

Overall, variety of fresh poke!

excerpts: I got the "California Salmon Sandwich" with a side of salad and the bf got the "Traditional Baja Tacos" (I think?)...
but Anyway I was debating between that and a rice bowl.
I went with the sandwich and boy was
I delighted once it came out.
The salmon looked so PINK and FRESH!
It was cut in a certain way so that every bite I took, I was able to gather the taste of everything in the sandwich.
Also it was easy to bite into!
It was such a big surprise to me how fresh the fish was.
Usually, most restaurants serve a stingy amount of salmon and it is dry and not fresh at all.
GAWD.
It was so good!
The cole slaw was even good with it
and I hate cole slaw.
The salad was such a plus too!
california.author: Katrina T.
california.review:
i am seriously trying to go on a diet, so I have been trying to pick restaurants that serve fish or delicious salads! Looking at the pictures for Pacific Catch literally made me DROOL. The pictures of their food looked oh so good, I couldn't wait to try it ! 

Came here on a Friday with my boyfriend and were seated fairly quickly. It's so cute! Right when you sit down, they bring out a little tray with Goldfish Pretzels and Edamame. Weird combo, but I was dying of hunger so I ate it and it tasted fine. I looked at the menu for days before deciding what I really wanted. Be aware, the cost of the food is pretty pricy, but in all honesty, it is worth the money! I would definitely pay this amount to eat the food from here again! 

I got the "California Salmon Sandwich" with a side of salad and the bf got the "Traditional Baja Tacos" (I think?)...but Anyway I was debating between that and a rice bowl. I went with the sandwich and boy was I delighted once it came out. The salmon looked so PINK and FRESH! It was cut in a certain way so that every bite I took, I was able to gather the taste of everything in the sandwich. Also it was easy to bite into! It was such a big surprise to me how fresh the fish was. Usually, most restaurants serve a stingy amount of salmon and it is dry and not fresh at all. GAWD. It was so good! The cole slaw was even good with it and I hate cole slaw. The salad was such a plus too! I couldn't help but notice the couple sitting next to me with their "Hawaiian Poke" bowls!!! That looked awesome too! I super duper want that next time! 

Everything was GOOD GOOD GOOD! LOVE it! Coming back to try more freshness! 

oh yea this place definitely reminds me of Yard House. I don't know why, I couldn't tell if this place served American, Asian Fusion, Americanized Asian errr what. Whatever just as long as they satisfy my hunger I'm all about that!

excerpts: California Salmon $12:
This is where I wasn't too happy.
You get a slice of salmon that you can't even see at all, but can taste it.
I swear the slice of the salmon was the thickness of 10 sheets of paper... not the filet that you would expect from a salmon sandwich.
The bread was not toasted and so it was cold and not warm and crispy.
I think texture is key when making a sandwich, you get the lettuce, tomato, avocado and salmon (all of which have a moist texture -- except the lettuce)
and you want the bread to add a different texture...
this is just me,
I like my bread warm and crispy.
california.author: Erica T.
california.review:
My friend and I decided to come here for dinner on a Friday night. We decided to sit near the bar area because we would have to wait 15 mins for the next dining table. No biggie for us, I don't mind where I sit.

What I ordered:

Fruit punch (alcoholic cocktail) $9.50: Vodka with various types of fruit juices. This drink was STRONG! My face was red and I was pretty buzzed. I guess if I can feel the alcohol from one drink, it is worth the $9.50 you pay for it because you actually get alcohol in it, none of that watered down drinks at other places.

Thai Coconut Shrimp $13:  7 pieces of jumbo shrimp with coconut shaving batter, deep fried and with the sweet chili sauce.... mMMmm nom nom nom. My friend ordered this appetizer and I was a little hesitant. A lot of restaurants end up giving you small shrimp with crappy battered textured. This was pretty good, you can taste the actual coconut shavings, the batter was light and crispy and the shrimp was bigger than I thought it would be. I was happy with this dish.

California Salmon $12:  This is where I wasn't too happy. This dish came with a side of coleslaw (that wasn't really good) and a side of fries ( I picked the sweet potato fries). The sweet potato fries was good until it got cold and soggy, I recommend you eating it as soon as you get them! As for the sandwich, I was disappointed with it. You get a slice of salmon that you can't even see at all, but can taste it. I swear the slice of the salmon was the thickness of 10 sheets of paper... not the filet that you would expect from a salmon sandwich. The bread was not toasted and so it was cold and not warm and crispy. I think texture is key when making a sandwich, you get the lettuce, tomato, avocado and salmon (all of which have a moist texture -- except the lettuce) and you want the bread to add a different texture... this is just me, I like my bread warm and crispy. As for flavor, it had enough flavor and it was actually tasty, just sad that the main attraction in this sandwich was nowhere to be seen.

Service was great! The lady came by quite often to make sure our water will filled and to make sure we were ok. Overall, the food was ok and the service was great.  I would give 3.5 stars if Yelp let me....

excerpts: I am a super big fan of the California Roll Salad, which had TONS of real crab on it - made my meal special.
california.author: Andrew K.
california.review: I am a super big fan of the California Roll Salad, which had TONS of real crab on it - made my meal special.

excerpts: California roll salad.
california.author: Dani K.
california.review:
California roll salad. Ceviche.

Thats my lunch after a day at Golden Gate park.

Lots of Asian rice bowls with tons of choices in case I want something warm.

You can reserve a table which makes the stress of finding a place on a Sunday in the sunset disappear. Of course you have to park-- but we usually find something relatively close if we pray to the parking goddesses.

Excellent service. Fair prices.

excerpts: I had the California salmon sandwich and my BF had the fish and chips.
After having the sesame slaw and side salad, I was quite full.
I had a bit of my BF's fish and chips (he got the cod and spicy fries) and everything tasted great.
I ended up getting the sandwich to go and later on for dinner
I had half
and it was delicious.
Light, not too heavy with the sauce and the salmon tasted great.
california.author: Shauna S.
california.review:
We came for a quick bite to eat and overall, gotta say that I'm quite happy with this place.

The Cabo calamari was delicious. Although they do mention that there was lemon slices, we didn't realize that some of them would be breaded and deep fried. Anyhow, they add a great deal of flavour and the bit of spiciness (thanks to the chilies) was really good. The spicy chipotle aioli was also very tasty (and tastes great with the fried fish if you manage to save some for when your entree arrives).

I had the California salmon sandwich and my BF had the fish and chips. After having the sesame slaw and side salad, I was quite full. I had a bit of my BF's fish and chips (he got the cod and spicy fries) and everything tasted great. I ended up getting the sandwich to go and later on for dinner I had half and it was delicious. Light, not too heavy with the sauce and the salmon tasted great.

excerpts: We shared the California roll first, which was a good portion and came out quickly.
My husband ordered the swordfish; his favorite part was actually the side of grilled and seasoned brussel sprouts with finely chopped bacon.
I don't like seafood
so I tried the Hawaiian teriyaki with chicken.
The grilled pineapple and soft mushrooms with the crispy onion strings mixed nicely with the rice and chicken, but I was less excited about the edamame addition.
Service was good, but we had to wait a bit for the check.
Still, since it's nearby and the hubby loves seafood, we'll try it again.
california.author: Kacy C.
california.review: My husband and I came here on a Friday for a late dinner, around 9:30; and though things were winding down, it was still quite noisy. The ambience isn't too special, but it's nice enough, especially the tables with street views. We shared the California roll first, which was a good portion and came out quickly. My husband ordered the swordfish; his favorite part was actually the side of grilled and seasoned brussel sprouts with finely chopped bacon. I don't like seafood so I tried the Hawaiian teriyaki with chicken. The grilled pineapple and soft mushrooms with the crispy onion strings mixed nicely with the rice and chicken, but I was less excited about the edamame addition. Service was good, but we had to wait a bit for the check. Still, since it's nearby and the hubby loves seafood, we'll try it again.

excerpts: on the other hand, it's not a sushi restaurant, but a fusion california style fish and chips restaurant?
i mean, i don't really understand.
good for groups of people visiting who don't know where else to eat i suppose.
california.author: Thao T.
california.review: the only thing positive about this place is that it's convenient for a group of tourists as it sits directly across from Golden Gate Park. it's marked up and mediocre. locals wouldn't come here for poke since there are a few other sushi restaurants in the area. on the other hand, it's not a sushi restaurant, but a fusion california style fish and chips restaurant? i mean, i don't really understand. good for groups of people visiting who don't know where else to eat i suppose.

excerpts: The California roll has ACTUAL crab, so that's a plus.
california.author: Michelle R.
california.review:
4.5, rounded up to the nearest whole number. Whoop, 4th grade!

I really, really like Pacific Catch.  I love how this location serves sushi, and has a larger menu than the one on Chestnut.  It's so big, and has a great bar as well.  You're not stuffed in like sardines, and I can actually have a conversation without someone next to me eavesdropping, pretty nice.  I also really like how they bring out house appetizers, it's just a little odd that it consists of goldfish pretzels and edemame. 

The California roll has ACTUAL crab, so that's a plus.  And their Island chicken tacos are soooo good.

You should definitely give it a try.

excerpts: We ordered the California Style Hawaiian Poke, which she recommended... and it was hella good
, lawwd have mercy.
california.author: Kate E.
california.review:
I love this place! My boyfriend and I went here for our first time last week and it is definitely our new favorite spot. The food was great and I love the fact that I do not feel guilty eating their food since their portions are pretty big! Our server (I believe her name was Adriana) was really nice! She asked if we ate there before and of course we said no so she suggested to us what we should try. She was definitely helpful and made our experience there for our first time even better. It is always a love/hate feeling when we get a good server LOL we know we have a good server when we're thinking "dammnit now we really have to tip" lmao. Thanks Adriana!! We ordered the California Style Hawaiian Poke, which she recommended... and it was hella good, lawwd have mercy. For our entree, I ordered the Hawaiian Teriyaki rice bowl with grilled salmon and it was amazeballs. I will definitely be coming back for the rice bowl, the poke, and the service! 

Only downside is that we got pulled over before we got to the restaurant lol apparently we can't drive through a intersection until a pedestrian has gotten onto the sidewalk completely  -___- the pedestrian had barely started walking, but luckily we got off with a warning. They do have a small little lot so parking might be a bit of a hassle, but it is worth it!

excerpts: Tried the California Roll salad- a great new innovation.
Our children loved the fish and chips.
This is a great place for large groups-
there are so many choices and the prices are reasonable and portions generous!
california.author: Helen M.
california.review: Tried the California Roll salad- a great new innovation. Our children loved the fish and chips. This is a great place for large groups- there are so many choices and the prices are reasonable and portions generous!

excerpts: I got the California Roll salad which seemed to be a pretty popular item on the menu from all the reviews.
It DID taste like a california roll, so that was pretty cool.
I forgot to ask for dressing on the side, because I normally like my salad naked
so that was my own screw up.
The avocado was SO creamy like everyone says.
I'd come back and order this.
california.author: Jeannie L.
california.review:
Came here with mixed feelings because of what I read on Yelp but I try to never let it hender my experience. 

It's a nice, large, dimly lighted restaurant with a nice cozy feel to it. 

On the up side, our waiter was really friendly... the downside, he was really frantic and running around during our entire meal. We tried to get his attention a few times throughout and he either never saw us, or didn't have time to stop. The hostesses walking around were quite helpful though.

I got the California Roll salad which seemed to be a pretty popular item on the menu from all the reviews. It DID taste like a california roll, so that was pretty cool. I forgot to ask for dressing on the side, because I normally like my salad naked so that was my own screw up. The avocado was SO creamy like everyone says. I'd come back and order this. Plus, it IS rather large! 

The bf ordered the thai curry rice bowl devouring it quickly and my friend ordered the salmon sandwich. Both seemed pleased with their choices. 

Biggest issue was just the service... true to the reviews, it was lagging. Thankfully, my extra dirty martini helped me be more forgiving than usual. Next time, maybe not so much...

excerpts: We used to always share the California Roll Salad.
california.author: Kris L.
california.review:
A and I come here a lot now.  It's in a great location, spacious, almost always has room for us, and easy to walk to.

We used to always share the California Roll Salad.  They're awesome here because when you tell them you're sharing, they split everything up in two separate bowls for you.  

Lately, we've moved on to the Hawaiian Teriyaki Rice Bowl with Grilled Salmon and brown rice.  I like to get half brown rice and half greens.  That's greens, like salad, not green rice.  That would be weird.

I love the rice bowl.  It's tasty.  It's healthy.  But it's a bit too big for just me to finish.  I'd share with A, but he loves it so much that he always gets his own.

excerpts: I ordered the California Salmon sandwich with a side of sweet potato fries.
The sandwich was really good.
The salmon was cooked perfectly, cooked all the way through, but it was still tender.
The bread was surprisingly good.
It was a Ciabatta, but the outside was crisp and the inside was soft and warm.
It also came with avocado, and a citrus aoli.
I have to talk about the avocado because the avocado here is extremely good.
Usually, the avocado I get at restaurants are not ripe and bland, but at PC it was soft and very flavorful.
The aoli was good too.
Not sure how it's supposed to taste like, but I liked it.
The sweet potato fries were decent, this last time I had them.
When I had them this time, they were a little soggy and cold.
I was disappointed because I had them once before
california.author: Anthony N.
california.review:
Came here for lunch around 12pm.  There was no wait at all for small groups; in fact, there were quite a few tables open.  The thing is this Pacific Catch is on the corner of 9th and Lincoln, so it's really hard to find parking.  PC does have a parking lot, but it's fairly small so it's hard to find a space in there.  

Decor: The place is really nice looking for a restaurant that's not super fancy.  Nice hardwood floors.  There are booths and tables; indoor and outdoor seating.  Wine bottle light fixtures here are a cool touch.  There's an open kitchen and a bar you can hang out at if you don't want to sit down and eat.

Food:  I ordered the California Salmon sandwich with a side of sweet potato fries.  The sandwich was really good.  The salmon was cooked perfectly, cooked all the way through, but it was still tender.  The bread was surprisingly good.  It was a Ciabatta, but the outside was crisp and the inside was soft and warm.  It also came with avocado, and a citrus aoli.  I have to talk about the avocado because the avocado here is extremely good.  Usually, the avocado I get at restaurants are not ripe and bland, but at PC it was soft and very flavorful.  The aoli was good too.  Not sure how it's supposed to taste like, but I liked it.  The sweet potato fries were decent, this last time I had them.  When I had them this time, they were a little soggy and cold.  
I was disappointed because I had them once before and they were on point.

Service: Here's where PC loses some stars. Minus one star for being slow.  The waitress actually took our orders and brought our food out very quickly, but after that the service fell off.  Took awhile to get a refill on my drink, and to get the check after the meal was over.

This might be mean, but minus one star for the hostess.  Don't get me wrong, the hostess was nice and all, but she was wearing this black mini-skirt, showing off way too much skin (she wasn't the attractive).  The whole time I was thinking, you're a hostess at a restaurant, not a vegas night club.  Other than that, the foods great.

excerpts: I was very happy with my California roll salad, which was huge and worth the $15.
I will definitely be back when I'm in the area.
california.author: Nicole C.
california.review: I had a really nice experience here today. The general manager was friendly and attentive, greeted us the moment we walked in the door. We were seated promptly at the table of our choice in the bar area by the window (note: we arrived just after they opened, just before a Saturday lunch rush) and our server offered water immediately. I asked for recommendations and our server happily obliged. I was very happy with my California roll salad, which was huge and worth the $15. I will definitely be back when I'm in the area.

excerpts: Ordered california rolls, sweet potato fries, and some other things involving seafood which I do not remember.
california.author: Jenn L.
california.review:
Pretty nice place for reasonably priced fusion japanese seafood. Ordered california rolls, sweet potato fries, and some other things involving seafood which I do not remember. But I assure you it was pretty delicious. 

Oh and just noticed they have a parking lot!!! That's pretty rare in this city.

excerpts: And it's walking distance from california academy of sciences - perfect place to grab lunch during your visit at CAS or dinner after you visit the CAS
california.author: Cherie T.
california.review:
3.5 stars

ceviche - looked more like guacamole than what i've had of ceviche but it still tasted really good. they give you 7 whole shrimps and was loaded w/ fresh avocados.  Oh and they also give you tortilla chips so you can eat it w/ the ceviche.

mixed basket & chips: fish, coconut shrimp, oysters w/ sweet potato fries. Everything was fresh and were lightly battered which i like. The fish was cooked perfectly for deep fried fish. Normally at other places, i get this heavily battered fish where the meat doesn't flake off, it's just one hard and dry piece of fish. here it was still soft and flaky. The coconut shrimp was delicious in taste, i only wish it was bigger shrimp. The oyster was pretty good. The sweet potato fries was really good too - perfectly crisp and lightly salted. 

service was great! we had told them beforehand that we were going to  share the appetizer and the mixed basket. They divided the basket for us which made it easier for us to eat since we now have our own basket of food. And instead of giving us 3 oysters total.. we got 4 (2 for each of us). And we each have our own plate of cole slaw and fries! 


yes, i'd come back here again. And it's walking distance from california academy of sciences - perfect place to grab lunch during your visit at CAS or dinner after you visit the CAS

excerpts: We had calamari, California rolls and fried shrimp rolls for appetizers.
All were really tasty.
I can't even remember the last time I've had a California roll with real crab.
california.author: Amy D.
california.review:
I was the first to arrive for a birthday party of 13, 15 minutes before the reservation. Upon checking in, the hostess took my box of a dozen cupcakes back for me without me having to ask. 

We had calamari, California rolls and fried shrimp rolls for appetizers. All were really tasty. I can't even remember the last time I've had a California roll with real crab. When you order the calamari, watch out for the slices of fried lemon! 

Dinner went smoothly without any mixed up orders. The birthday girl's grandmother ordered salmon cakes and wasn't very happy with her order, but everyone else seemed satisfied. I had the Mixed Catch Basket ($13.95)- it's a lot of food. In order of preference, 1. fish 2. oysters 3. coconut shrimp. The sweet potato fries were abundant, too. 

Later, they served the cupcakes on plates with spoons to everyone and it was really nice.

I think if I were to come here again, I'd order calamari and a side of sweet potato fries for dinner.

PS- They have disposable chopsticks here, and if you use a pair for appetizers, the waiter will take them away with your plate, and you have to open a new pair of chopsticks for your entree. Am I the only one who thinks this is super wasteful? I don't mean to go all Avatar on you (I haven't even seen it), but think of the trees!

excerpts: The problem is, living down in SoCal, there's a restaurant called California Fish Grill that's very similar to this place.
Decent quality food, a plethora of choices, and a wide variety.
Not quite the "Asian-fusion" vibe or waiter service, but comparable.
california.author: Dru C.
california.review:
The family suggested this place for lunch, so we came here after finding some hard-earned street parking down several blocks away. Parking meters and their wretched quarter-gulping system... damn you! That's one thing that I hate, not enjoying a meal because you're worried if you're parking meter will run out of time. 

I'm a big seafood fan, especially fish or shrimp, so I had a tough time choosing what to eat. I finally settled on the shrimp and salmon tacos, which comes with a side of sweet potato fries. I thought everything tasted okay, fresh, crispy and not-soggy fries. Everyone else in the party seemed to enjoy their fish entrees. 

The problem is, living down in SoCal, there's a restaurant called California Fish Grill that's very similar to this place. Decent quality food, a plethora of choices, and a wide variety. Not quite the "Asian-fusion" vibe or waiter service, but comparable. The major difference is that Cali Fish Grill is very inexpensive compared to Pacific Catch. 

Our bill at Pacific Catch including tip was over $80, which I thought was very overpriced. Then again, there was nothing to complain about with the food. Perusing the reviews, it seems like Happy Hour is where it's at for the best deals. With all the other seafood choices in SF, I don't think I'd be returning again.

excerpts: Also excellent is the California crab salad.
Waiters are friendly and attentive, service is efficient.
california.author: Chris B.
california.review:
I go to the 9th Ave location for lunch, usually on Tuesdays when they have the Ahi salad on special. It is perfectly prepared, very reasonably priced and the meal includes a drink-out the door under $20 in San Francisco is rare.  
Also excellent is the California crab salad.  Waiters are friendly and attentive, service is efficient.

excerpts: My personal favorite thing is there California Grill Style with the fish of the day, and the lemon confit.
It's to die for, and always satisfies me.
Another bonus is their sushi here is delicious, and always fresh.
Quick tip: if you're going on the weekend, make a reservation!
california.author: Leah N.
california.review: Back when I was living in San Francisco, this was my favorite restaurant. It's a seafood restaurant, but it also has an Asian Fusion feel to the menu. From grilled fish, to Asian rice bowls and fish and chips, you really can't do wrong here. My personal favorite thing is there California Grill Style with the fish of the day, and the lemon confit. It's to die for, and always satisfies me. Another bonus is their sushi here is delicious, and always fresh. Quick tip: if you're going on the weekend, make a reservation!

excerpts:
The food includes hawaiian poke (yay raw raw raw fish!), california rolls (real crab, fake sushi), and fried calamari (i just can't get enough of this squiggly stuff).

I like to keep it high in protein with the hawaiian poke.
california.author: Christina C.
california.review:
The miser-li-est combination in the world might be what is happening to me now.  One, I cannot help.  The other, I brought upon myself.
