Being Asian (Chinese) and a Student.  Not just a fresh-faced co-ed.  Graduate school.  Professional.  Which means my metabolism can't run on ketchup packets and instant ramen anymore.  Neither can I pull all-nighters and still be coherent enough to be in public the next day.  

The Asian in me loves a good deal.  That's not so bad.  Until you find yourself at home, after a "great" shopping spree with 5 mismatched shoes, none of which are your size.  Just because it was on sale.  And SOMEONE you know must have that size feet.  Then, I look around to make sure that no one is looking.

The Student in me, hates it more and more each day.  Just last week, one of my classmates looked at her loan debt.  HOLY CRAP-O-LA, the amount we have to pay back is like a mortgage!  It's more than a mortgage!  This affirms my current trend of not going on the interwebs for anything productive.

And all this verbal garbage finally brings us to Pacific Catch.  They have a happy hour, which pleases me greatly.  They have food on their happy hour which pleases me even more.  The food includes hawaiian poke (yay raw raw raw fish!), california rolls (real crab, fake sushi), and fried calamari (i just can't get enough of this squiggly stuff).

However, the alcohols are still expensive.  I'm expecting something in the $5 a glass range.  But I think they are more along the $7/glass.  Maybe the rouge rough uncouth uncultured student in me has no idea that what they are really serving is the most delectable wine known to the inner sunset.  And if I can't tell, neither can my wallet.  Or my loan debts.  Oh god.  

To summarize, I would come here for the happy hour, and focus more on the food.  The portions are very generous, there is nothing dainty about it.  Because if you think about it, a roll still uses about 1/2 a cup of rice, which is as much rice as you should be eating in one sitting, you fatty globby sweaty smelly library-hugger.  I like to keep it high in protein with the hawaiian poke.  

Maybe I'll finally learn my lesson and just be content with 2 bar bites.  Do not let the judgmental eye of the waitress guilt you into ordering alcohol.  No, no, no!  You must pass your classes.  

Now, go.  And eat something.

excerpts: The California Roll was a little mushy, but they are quite honest to bill it as "fresh crab SALAD" instead of just the meat, but again, for the amount and the price, you can't beat it.
The other roll I tried was the Shiso Fine, and that little hit of Shiso leaf added a great dimension to an already good roll.
california.author: Gina H.
california.review:
3.5 Pints!  (Trying out a new rating system because I am endlessly frustrated with being limited.)

Yeah.  It's good.  Great Happy Hour choices, although I think they could come up with more than 2 signature cocktails.  The Spicy Pacific Martini ($7) is amazing!  The Agave Margarita ($6) is so-so.  They should come up with something else as I can get an agave margarita in 100 other places.

On two separate occasions I tried two types of HH Rolls ($6 for all types) and they were quite tasty, especially for the price.  A very hearty portion, good flavors and creative.  The California Roll was a little mushy, but they are quite honest to bill it as "fresh crab SALAD" instead of just the meat, but again, for the amount and the price, you can't beat it.  The other roll I tried was the Shiso Fine, and that little hit of Shiso leaf added a great dimension to an already good roll.  Avo was fresh, cold and popped with the sesame seeds and seaweed.

Great atmosphere, although it looks like the beginnings of a corporate dynasty, and very nice natural light in the bar.  (I wouldn't go on a first date if you are trying to hide any blemishes!)  

Bar staff is friendly, but not overly peppy, which makes me happy.  Seems like there are too many back there at times, though, and can seem like they get their wires crossed when it comes to who needs what.

I did notice the managers working, pouring beers, delivering food, answering the phone and greeting people.  The hands-on approach can sometimes make a staff nervous, but it's nice to see that they have a stake in the business and aren't above lending a hand.

I would go back and try other items, although I still have a hard-time paying over $10 for a sandwich.

Overall, the food will bring you back and atmosphere will bring your friends with you.

excerpts: I chose the ahi tuna serrano, california style, and salmon lomi lomi.
They were all awesome; I'll definitely be going back.
california.author: Melissa C.
california.review: Went here last night with my boyfriend. We shared the crab soup which was super bomb!! I wish we each got our own. He had the crab sandwich which was really good, too. I got the three poke dinner which is raw fish cut in cubes and marinated/mixed with different stuff. I chose the ahi tuna serrano, california style, and salmon lomi lomi. They were all awesome; I'll definitely be going back.

excerpts: After a nice afternoon at the new California Academy of Sciences we were hunger for seafood and fresh California style cuisine.
After searching the internet we found Pacific Catch just minutes from the museum.
To my delight, they were featuring their Seafood rice bowls, the perfect meal for three tired souls.
california.author: Steve U.
california.review: After a nice afternoon at the new California Academy of Sciences we were hunger for seafood and fresh California style cuisine. After searching the internet we found Pacific Catch just minutes from the museum. To my delight, they were featuring their Seafood rice bowls, the perfect meal for three tired souls. I ordered the salmon with brown rice. Yes! With just the right amount of wasabi, it hit the spot. And to top it off, we had the mochi balls dipped in warm chocolate. Decadent, but delicious. Ambiance nice. Service was OK. Could have been a 5 star.

excerpts: The california roll was okay.
california.author: Joshua C.
california.review:
I felt a little let down with the food here. The coconut shrimp was just okay. Honestly the frozen coconut shrimp from Trader Joe's is my favorite. I wasn't a fan of the sweet chili dipping sauce. C'mon, you can buy that stuff in any Asian grocery store (even TJ's has their version). I wish restaurants would be more creative and make their own sauces. The sweet potato fries were good. The california roll was okay.

I like the concept but the food I had wasn't anything special. Since I'm not much of a seafood eater, my only option was the shrimp and coconut shrimp always seems like a good idea. Don't get me wrong, I ate the whole basket (even the slaw, which I'm usually not a fan of) but I didn't feel that it was worth the money. $12.95 for some sweet potato fries and about 8 pretty small shrimps just didn't feel right.

Service was good. We had brought our own dessert for my friend's birthday and they put them on plates and served them to us. Even though it wasn't cake, the waiter put a candle in one and we sang Happy Birthday to my friend.

I wouldn't make the drive from the East Bay just for this place, but if I happened to be in the area, I just might give it a second shot. But don't hold me to it.

excerpts: Lots of variety in terms of California fusions of Asian and South American meals.
california.author: Brian J.
california.review: Great food for the price.  Lots of variety in terms of California fusions of Asian and South American meals.  We had sushi, ceviche, a chilean pork appetizer, salmon with a soy sauce glaze, coconut shrimp, and a salad.  Everything was fresh and wonderful.  The cocktails were great too, especially the pomegranate martini.

excerpts: Would you eat fresh fish fusion at a California concept cafe?
california.author: Jennifer B.
california.review:
Would you eat Mexican food at a sushi restaurant?  
Would you eat sushi at a Mexican restaurant?  
Would you eat fresh fish fusion at a California concept cafe?

OK.  Fine.  Go to Pac Catch then.

Fish has nooooooooooo flavor.  But, the wasabi bowl (besides being a misnomer) is giant, and tasty.  Fish tacos, not bad.  Sweet potato fries, nice.  Happy hour, happy.  Ambience, contrived but comfy.  Not a bad view, either (GG Park).

excerpts: Dishes that we ordered: California roll / Hawaiian surf and turf / grilled salmon with Gluten-free tortilla chips, artichoke, tomatoes / Tofu teriyaki bowl /  and fixed 3 course meal Costa-Rican (limited time only).
The grilled salmon was moist and tasty.
The grilled salmon was moist and tasty.
My 5 year old daughter polished off the California roll with real crab meat.
My mom's Tofu Bowl was very good.
I like the firmness of the tofu.
My dad's 3 course fixed price meal was very tasty.
It looked like a quesadilla with all the fixings, but without the quesadilla.
Oh, and the brown rice is a must have
california.author: Marcus Y.
california.review:
Came here after a drive back from Fresno. If it wasn't for a lucky parking spot within 50 feet, I would've eaten elsewhere, but my kids were hungry and since 1 of my daughter has a food allergy, this was a better place to go. I've heard so much about this place and thru my mom, that I was excited coming here, even after a 4 hour drive.

Dishes that we ordered: California roll / Hawaiian surf and turf / grilled salmon with Gluten-free tortilla chips, artichoke, tomatoes / Tofu teriyaki bowl /  and fixed 3 course meal Costa-Rican (limited time only).

All the food was delicious! I ordered the Hawaiian Surf & Turf. The skirt steak was very tender and so good. It also came with 2 skewers of shrimps, along with pineapple fried rice and asparagus. The grilled salmon was moist and tasty. My 5 year old daughter polished off the California roll with real crab meat. My mom's Tofu Bowl was very good. I like the firmness of the tofu. My dad's 3 course fixed price meal was very tasty. It looked like a quesadilla with all the fixings, but without the quesadilla. Oh, and the brown rice is a must have, otherwise you'll get the sushi rice, which is still good. 

It was kinda pricey, but was worth it for the delicious meal.

excerpts: We ordered the tacos (honestly, I've had better tacos at baja fresh)... and the california salad with the wasabi dressing?
(forgot the exact name).
Both were blah... very very blah.
california.author: S L.
california.review:
I don't know.. this place isn't all that and a bag of chips to me-- maybe everyone I know just played it up, and I expected too much from it.  Sorry Pacific Catch, it's not your fault.

The decor is nice and cute.  I really love the outdoor seating area, but let's face it:  It's Sunset.. and it's always gonna be cold n shiz.  The inside is cute too-- perfect little first date place.

The food is.. uhh.. meh?  We ordered the tacos (honestly, I've had better tacos at baja fresh)... and the california salad with the wasabi dressing? (forgot the exact name).  Both were blah... very very blah.  Even my friend, a loyal customer to the other Pacific Catch location, commented on the lack of quality at this particular location.

I heard that the other location is way better, and I probably just came during an off day.  

2 stars anyway cuz of the cute decor and bowl of complimentary snacks.  
FYI: I'm not one to give bad reviews (check my other reviews).. but for the price I'm paying, the food here really sucks !!!

excerpts: a bit too much, especially for sensitive folks from california.
california.author: Katie H.
california.review:
i'm kind of a forward person.  i say what i need and expect from people right up front.  this eliminates need for assumption (you know, the whole ass out of u and mption or something like that) and i find it useful when people are upfront with me.  when it's valentines day- i tell the old man exactly what i expect.  i don't sit at home hoping he brings me flowers and candy and then get passively aggressively mad when i only get dinner and wine.  

that being said- it's all about the delivery.  i'll be the first to tell you that i need to work on my delivery.  it can be a bit harsh.  a bit too much, especially for sensitive folks from california.  

i walked into pacific catch with 12 other people ready to have a great meal and party it up.  i picked the location, even after the incident with the glass (read previous review) and opted to not tell anyone in my dinner party about it.  the food here is amazing and one mistake should not ruin them for life.  

so i walk in with my 12 peeps.  dinner was being paid for by one in our party- but he wasn't paying for drinks.  it was early (read: no one else in there) and i was hoping that instead of a drink bill and a food bill we could do a food bill and separate drink tabs.  cause i hate having to deal with cash.  so after walking in i went straight to the server, who was with the manager, and asked if she could do it.  if it was that much of a pain in her ass- she could have said no.  and the manger would have backed her up.  and it would have been fine.  but she said no problem.  

so i drank several cocktails and ate a great meal.  and when it was time for everyone to pay our separate drink tabs- i yelled out for everyone to tip wicked extra good.  

asking for what you want upfront is helpful for everybody.  the worst that can happen is you get told no.  because homegirl was flexible and patient with my silly demands...she scored big time that night on tips.

and every year on valentines day...i get exactly what i want.  and everyone is happy.

excerpts: I had an order of the California Rolls, crab salad and Shrimp Teriyaki bowl.
All were over sized portions and delicious.
This was way too much food to order.
The service was beyond my expectation.
california.author: J A.
california.review:
I'm really happy that my hood has attracted a great new restaurants like Pacific Catch. They serve an assortment of seafood in a variety of styles in a very modern setting. 

I had an order of the California Rolls, crab salad and Shrimp Teriyaki bowl. All were over sized portions and delicious. This was way too much food to order. The service was beyond my expectation. A full bar added to overall experience. 

No buts, I recommend going there. Good prompt service, tasty food and great drink options make Pacific Catch the darling of the inter Sunset.

excerpts: A few other items that were a hit for my party were the california rolls, spiced cajun fries and wasabii chicken bowl.
california.author: Anne K.
california.review:
1 star for their accommodating parking spaces in the back of restaurant. Although limited, still very convenient, especially in the sunset district.

1 star for their prime customer service. The entire staff was very friendly. From the start of our experience with the host, to the end of the meal when the manager approached our table for comments.

1 star for their food. What an array of interesting selections. I enjoyed the sweet potato fries with the flavorful aioli. The fish tacos were also yummy.
A few other items that were a hit for my party were the california rolls, spiced cajun fries and wasabii chicken bowl.

Last star for the spacious floor plan. The tables and chairs weren't so crowded around each other and the place was very family friendly. 

The only reason they were shy of 5 stars were the prices. Some items were a bit overpriced for the quantity of food given.

excerpts: The wife and I split the inside-out California roll and poke sandwich.
Beat the walk-in dinner crowd after 7pm on a Friday by making your reservation online.
california.author: Joshua W.
california.review: Very fresh fish and pretty hopping Friday night crowd. The wife and I split the inside-out California roll and poke sandwich. Beat the walk-in dinner crowd after 7pm on a Friday by making your reservation online.

excerpts: The grilled salmon salad was nice except that the fish was lacking in flavor, but we were pleasantly surprised by the California Crab & Avocado salad which was just right!
california.author: OfLit G.
california.review:
We were looking for inexpensive seafood and that's what we got.
The place was clean and the service was friendly and attentive.
We started with the miso soup which was nice and a little fishy (in a good way), the Hawaiian Poke which was fresh enough but really not very well cut - it had unchewable bits, which is a big no-no in raw fish. The Mahi Mahi was overly seasoned and the fish got lost in the dish. The grilled salmon salad was nice except that the fish was lacking in flavor, but we were pleasantly surprised by the California Crab & Avocado salad which was just right! Everybody LOVED the sweet potato fries - yum!
All in all, a decent value for your money in the seafood scene.

excerpts: My friend that I was with got the rock n roll and california roll, and was pleased with it, because the pieces were large and filling.
It was a bit pricey we paid 60 for the 2 of us.
The decor of the place is very modern and the service is very good.
Definetly a place i want to go again, and a place i would recommend to anyone who loves fish.
california.author: Nikita K.
california.review: The food here is very good. I got some sort of of hawaii bbq mix with shrimp and beef and it was very good. I also got a miso soup, and it was good but I prefer the more simple one. My friend that I was with got the rock n roll and california roll, and was pleased with it, because the pieces were large and filling. It was a bit pricey we paid 60 for the 2 of us. The decor of the place is very modern and the service is very good. Definetly a place i want to go again, and a place i would recommend to anyone who loves fish.

excerpts: It's slightly pricey, but the unique fusion of Japanese and California seafood makes this place worth of a visit.
california.author: Kel S.
california.review:
The parking may drop this to an average three star rating, but that would be deceiving.  This place is simply tasty!

The food is just as fresh and scrumptious as the Marina staple and the wait staff is great.   It's much larger than the Marina stop-- almost vacuous on slow days.  The high-vaulted ceiling makes the room seem cavernous, but the clientle typically fills it up with joy and vigor.   

Try the wasabi bowls with brown rice.  It's great! 

It's slightly pricey, but the unique fusion of Japanese and California seafood makes this place worth of a visit.

excerpts: I also tried a bit of the sushi, just California Roll and Spicy Tuna.
Nothing special, so I can't speak for the quality of the specialty pieces, but if I was looking for quality basics or specialties...
I'd just go out for some sushi!
So decent sushi but not worth the price when there are much better options within walking distance.
california.author: Taylor M.
california.review:
Can't say I've been to the original location so I can't compare but I thought Pacific Catch was pretty good nonetheless. 
I had the fish and chips with the catch of the day. Quite good, extremely fresh fish (would be scared if it wasn't!). The dipping sauces added something special to the fish, which was fresh but not overwhelmingly tasty on its own, so I do recommend giving them a try (the Thai one especially). Sweet potato fries were fantastic, definitely the standout original of my meal. Probably the one thing that would get me coming back to Pacific Catch again!

I also tried a bit of the sushi, just California Roll and Spicy Tuna. Nothing special, so I can't speak for the quality of the specialty pieces, but if I was looking for quality basics or specialties... I'd just go out for some sushi! So decent sushi but not worth the price when there are much better options within walking distance. Also had a good beer from the rotating selection but it was almost $6!

So all in all, good food. Very good choice if you want a broad selection of choices on the menu, all with very fresh fish. The place seemed pretty popular on a Friday night, very trendy and nice setting. Service wasn't fantastic: very friendly, but took a while just to get water. Busy night though. For the negatives, can't recommend the sushi as a standout and the food wasn't special enough to be paying more than a 10-er for each dish (even the salads). Still. Great sweet potato fries. And sauces.

excerpts: california rolls are excellent, my crab salad wasabi bowl was excellent, and my friends poke bowl was excellent!
bartender was a really nice guy as well!
oh! and the spring roll for dessert is excellent toooo!!!
california.author: Soph I.
california.review:
the sweet potato fries ARE really good!  i liked the sweet and sour sauce that comes with it.  california rolls are excellent, my crab salad wasabi bowl was excellent, and my friends poke bowl was excellent!  
bartender was a really nice guy as well!  oh! and the spring roll for dessert is excellent toooo!!!

excerpts: It tastes like it sounds -- a salad version of a california roll.
I probably wouldn't eat the WHOLE thing as a meal though because it's too much of the same thing.
-Korean BBQ Steak:
YUM I love beef!
This was my choice, so I liked it.
If you're looking for the real deal when it comes to Korean BBQ, then obviously it doesn't size up, but the beef was perfection.
california.author: Miss H.
california.review:
Came here without a reservation for Mother's Day dinner. Only a 20 minute wait! Not bad.

Food:
-California Crab & Avocado salad: Pretty good. It tastes like it sounds -- a salad version of a california roll. I probably wouldn't eat the WHOLE thing as a meal though because it's too much of the same thing.
-Korean BBQ Steak: YUM I love beef! This was my choice, so I liked it. If you're looking for the real deal when it comes to Korean BBQ, then obviously it doesn't size up, but the beef was perfection.
-Alaskan 3-course meal w/ halibut skewers, salmon entree, and merengue & berries: They have a special 3-course meal highlighting the cuisine of places around the Pacific, so when I went, it was Alaska. I liked the skewers, especially the sauce. Even though it was battered & fried, it felt really light. The salmon was just ok -- nothing special. Didn't like the liquor-soaked ligonberries. The dessert was PERFECTION! Great balance of textures & flavors.
-Alaskan Stout: I hate dark beers, so of course, I wasn't too fond of this. My parents liked it though.

One of the nicer, bigger places to eat at in the Sunset but if you're looking for a date place, I wouldn't go here. It gets really loud! That could be due to the number of families w/ young kids dining there on Mother's Day though.

excerpts: About 20 minute later, after I walked all the way to the California Academy of Sciences, the manager called and said we stiffed him on the bill.
We hiked all the way back, missing a planetarium show we were standing in line for.
I wasn't so keen on the forgetful service, and mismanaged bill, and being accused by the manager of stiffing him.
california.author: Greg C.
california.review:
Had a lunch time birthday party there with friends.  Food was decent, if a bit on the boring side.  However they do serve some very good sweet potato fries.  

What was disappointing was the service.  They seemed disorganized, couldn't remember who ordered what, and drinks took a long time to come out.  I had brought a large party with me (around 15), but for some reason they chose to ring it up as two bills.  They forgot to run the charges through for one of the bills when we settled.  About 20 minute later, after I walked all the way to the California Academy of Sciences, the manager called and said we stiffed him on the bill.  We hiked all the way back, missing a planetarium show we were standing in line for.  I wasn't so keen on the forgetful service, and mismanaged bill, and being accused by the manager of stiffing him.

excerpts: 6.95 for a california roll?
california.author: Bobby B.
california.review:
service was outstanding

food was just ok. too much sauce in the salmon dish and the seafood just didn't taste that fresh. sweet potato fries were tasty however.  good selection of beer

prices are out of whack..6.95 for a california roll? 

parking is tough

excerpts: Sweet potato fries, crab & avocado salad, & oversized California rolls.
What more can you ask for?
They also give you Goldfish pretzels & edamame to munch on before your food arrives.
Yum!
9th & Irving is always busy, so looking for parking can be a pain.
california.author: Stephanie W.
california.review: Sweet potato fries, crab & avocado salad, & oversized California rolls. What more can you ask for? They also give you Goldfish pretzels & edamame to munch on before your food arrives. Yum! 9th & Irving is always busy, so looking for parking can be a pain.

excerpts: We also had California rolls for the kids but that tasted like a pre packed sushi box  from a supermarket.
other than that we would definitely go there again
california.author: Kevin C.
california.review: Had dinner here with two of my friends and my friend's two children under 4. Service was good and the menu had a great selection.  Why only 4 stars? Because the food was decent, not outstanding.  Some were good tho, the sweet potato fries and the sticky ribs were great but the bowls didn't wow us. We also had California rolls for the kids but that tasted like a pre packed sushi box  from a supermarket. other than that we would definitely go there again

excerpts: I had the California salmon sandwich which was suppose to come with avocado
but there was none to be found in my sandwich or anywhere on the plate.
The organic string beans that come with every sandwich was also missing.
Either the cook doesn't know his/her own menu or they need to update it.
Overall, it was okay but not worth the price.
I probably won't be going back.
california.author: Austin C.
california.review: I think this place is overrated. The service was good and the servers were friendly, but the food was just mediocre. I had the California salmon sandwich which was suppose to come with avocado but there was none to be found in my sandwich or anywhere on the plate. The organic string beans that come with every sandwich was also missing. Either the cook doesn't know his/her own menu or they need to update it. Overall, it was okay but not worth the price. I probably won't be going back.

excerpts: I don't know if it was because the name gave me the assumption they were a California Cusine restaurant with a slant of seafood offering, or the extensive menu that included American entrees, alongside Japanese items like sushi, teriyaki, and Mexican with the tacos.
The edamame they served as soon as we were seated tells me they are Japanese.
Maybe it was the Hawaiin entrees, or the fact that the visible cook staff was completely Hispanic, except for the one white guy calling out orders at the pass.
Mexliforniapanese Dining.
california.author: Bor C.
california.review:
Located on a fairly busy corner of 9th and Lincoln, this new restaurant replaced the art gallery, bar, restaurant thing that was here before. The décor was marine themed, and the place appeared clean. Being my first visit here, and sitting in one of the booths I had an impression that they may have some kind of identity confusion. I don't know if it was because the name gave me the assumption they were a California Cusine restaurant with a slant of seafood offering, or the extensive menu that included American entrees, alongside Japanese items like sushi, teriyaki, and Mexican with the tacos. The edamame they served as soon as we were seated tells me they are Japanese. Maybe it was the Hawaiin entrees, or the fact that the visible cook staff was completely Hispanic, except for the one white guy calling out orders at the pass. Mexliforniapanese Dining. Nah, doesn't have the right ring to it. 

We were disappointed in the ahi tuna poke appetizer. The ahi was fresh enough, but the seasoning was monotone, and overdone. There is no evidence of poke seasoning. Just soy sauce with bits of red and green onions. I love salty foods, but even I thought this dish was too salty, and finishes flat.

Our entrees were Wasabi Ahi Tuna sandwich, and the Mixed Catch Basket. The Ahi Sandwich was over-seared (see Medium Well), and missing any kind of a wasabi bite. It tasted good, with the avocado slices providing a nice buttery texture for the sandwich and a somewhat experimental addition of pink ginger slices (yes, the same ones served alongside sushi) that didn't do much. It was an okay sandwich, for what its worth. I couldn't help but think this was some deli's version of a sushi on a french roll - take a roll, replace rice and seaweed with bread. The Mixed Catch Basket was served with sweet potato fries. It was the probably the best component of the dish. You couldn't go to far off track with fried foods, and this basket was no exception. Good, but nothing worth writing about. I should stop here.

The coleslaw that accompanied our entrees were suprisingly good. It was a light cream dressing with a distinct Korean-type pickling tang I detected. It was light and palette refreshing.

Overall, it was an okay experience. The place is nice to be in, be seen in, but not particularly nice to eat. I'll probably be back only when we are doing something in the park, and want to hit a bar... Nah, I'll walk the extra block and head to Yancy's instead.

excerpts: i went for the mahi mahi (california style) and mom went for the escolar.
wait..
before that we started with the califnornia rolls pretty basic
but DEFINATELY not out of this world.
the portions were big and i left full but not satisfied...i liked the bar area though and i will definately give it another try because i saw they had a bar menu and a full bar as well...
california.author: shannon b.
california.review: and "meh" is right ....went here last night and we were seated right away...nice atmosphere and i was really looking forward to eating here...the menu is extremely strange...starters and sushi on one side and 3 choices of fish specials for the evening on the other. i went for the mahi mahi (california style) and mom went for the escolar. wait..before that we started with the califnornia rolls pretty basic but DEFINATELY not out of this world. the portions were big and i left full but not satisfied...i liked the bar area though and i will definately give it another try because i saw they had a bar menu and a full bar as well...

excerpts: We ordered the California Roll and the Shrimp Tempura, we also had the sweet potato fries...
yum i love those!
Their sweet potato fries did not disappoint, my husband and I finished the whole basket!
I can't say the same for the sushi rolls.
After a couple of pieces, they did not taste right to me.
I just didn't like the carrot in the California roll.
Plus it seemed like they put wasabi in the actual rolls
and I didn't like that since I don't eat wasabi anyway.
My husband ended up finishing both the rolls but he didn't really enjoy it.
So just 2 stars for the excellent potato fries.
california.author: Christine P.
california.review: We were going to the Japanese Tea Garden but before we went inside we decided to eat lunch first because we were starving. They only had cookies and tea in the garden and the nearby cafe was full of people and we didnt want to wait in line. They told us to walk along for 10mins and we'll find other food places so we did. The first restaurant we saw was Pacific Catch Grill. We decided go to in and check it out, we were excited to try their sushi. We ordered the California Roll and the Shrimp Tempura, we also had the sweet potato fries...yum i love those! Their sweet potato fries did not disappoint, my husband and I finished the whole basket! I can't say the same for the sushi rolls. After a couple of pieces, they did not taste right to me. I just didn't like the carrot in the California roll. Plus it seemed like they put wasabi in the actual rolls and I didn't like that since I don't eat wasabi anyway. My husband ended up finishing both the rolls but he didn't really enjoy it. So just 2 stars for the excellent potato fries.

excerpts: -- I ordered the california crab salad and the crab didn't seem particularly plentiful or fresh, but the worst part was our server.
Didn't introduce himself, couldn't be bothered to answer a question about an item on the menu, and had an annoying tendency to walk away  as we were mid question/request.
In general seemed 'put out' to have to be bringing us food.
Not impressive.
Finally, for what it is, I think it's a bit expensive.
california.author: Sarah G.
california.review: I'd heard a lot about Pacific Catch and its local for me so I was pretty excited to try it.  Unfortunately I was disappointed and it won't be added to the neighborhood rotation.  The food was just so so -- I ordered the california crab salad and the crab didn't seem particularly plentiful or fresh, but the worst part was our server.  Didn't introduce himself, couldn't be bothered to answer a question about an item on the menu, and had an annoying tendency to walk away  as we were mid question/request.  In general seemed 'put out' to have to be bringing us food.  Not impressive.  Finally, for what it is, I think it's a bit expensive.

excerpts: Bf got the Ecstasy roll ($12.50).
NOT WORTH IT.
It's an unconventional sushi roll with no rice (you have to pay extra for rice) and a crispy, battered seaweed.
Yes, it was good and dense and filled with fish and avocado.. but $12.50?!
Are you kidding me!?
ecstasy.author: Samantha C.
ecstasy.review:
More like 3.5.

While the food was good, it was WAY overpriced and the service was spotty. I would come back only for Happy Hour specials ($7 poke!!!) 

I tried the Ahi Tuna Salad ($14.50). The tuna was DELICIOUS- rare on the inside and nicely crusted on the outside. The salad also came with a lot of oomph- sprouts, raddish, pickled ginger, etc. However, the price point sucked. I could easily get a sashimi salad from a Japanese restaurant down the street for less!

Bf got the Ecstasy roll ($12.50). NOT WORTH IT. It's an unconventional sushi roll with no rice (you have to pay extra for rice) and a crispy, battered seaweed. Yes, it was good and dense and filled with fish and avocado.. but $12.50?! Are you kidding me!? Definitely not a "supersized" roll, as advertised.... 

I did, however, love the overall vibe. Very island-esque and nicely decorated. Wide, open windows with lots of natural light by the bar.

excerpts: Sweet potato fries and an ecstasy roll for appetizer seriously hit the table in 7 minutes flat...
i was so happy!!!
ecstasy.author: Bethany Y.
ecstasy.review:
I was so starving after we were done with the park, and stressed from chasing the kids this place has the perfect atmosphere for calming down.

Our server was busy but our drinks came quickly.  A fantastic blood orange margarita for me ( i had just had a bad one the day before so i was really craving one...) they also happened to have my favorite fume blanc, ferrari carano.

Sweet potato fries and an ecstasy roll for appetizer seriously hit the table in 7 minutes flat... i was so happy!!! The sushi was so fresh tasting i could have eaten double!!!

The kids teriyaki chicken was too dry for kids and it was left untouched but the chipotle bbq chicken breast on my salad was lightly seasoned and perfectly cooked. Super yummy!!! Also my boyfriend's salmon disappeared before i got a good look at it but i did taste the sauce that came with his artichoke... some kind of basil dill aioli? sooo nice!!! i will be trying to copy it in my kitchen right away!!!

Next time I am in town I will be back!!

excerpts: I settled on a salmon chowder, and ahi Ecstasy rolls for appetizer.
ecstasy.author: Nick D.
ecstasy.review:
My wife and I visited San Francisco, and the Academy Of Sciences. After a little over two hours that morning of looking at nature, and marching through hordes of sight seeing morons, we were in much need of a relaxing lunch. 

Nicole spotted this place on Yelp, which is within throwing distance of the inundated Academy of Foreign Masses. 

We parked on the street, and I set a timer for the meter. The hostess seated us promptly, and our waitress quickly greeted us. After ordering refreshments, we looked over the menu and were very excited by all of the seafood choices. I settled on a salmon chowder, and ahi Ecstasy rolls for appetizer. My wife ordered an Ahi salad, and I chose the wasabi bowl with Poke. 

Our waitress brought a small bowl with edamame beans, and little fish shaped pretzels to munch on before the appetizers came. The ambiance here is very casual, and is decorated in a modern/Japanese motif that is actually very relaxing. It was busy, but not at all packed. 

Both the appetizers and the food were absolutely delicious. I am not a food critique, but my taste buds were quite stimulated by the blend of flavors used in the dishes. We were both very happy to have found this gem.

excerpts: Please try the ecstasy roll ;)
ecstasy.author: Margaux M.
ecstasy.review:
We order sushi from pacific catch for delivery when we get lazy and I must say PC is the best japanese food you can get delivered to your door. 

Please try the ecstasy roll ;)

excerpts:
Ordered:
1) Ecstasy sushi roll-2.5/5, not so great
2)
ecstasy.author: Jen H.
ecstasy.review:
Overall a solid 3.5 stars, but I bumped it up an extra 0.5 star for dog friendliness.

I actually didn't expect much of this place, but it was dog friendly and there were televisions (for sports), so we decided to drop in. Pacific Catch exceeded my expectation. 

The service was fairly slow, but maybe b/c we sat outside (with the heaters right above us).

Ordered:
1) Ecstasy sushi roll-2.5/5, not so great
2) Mahi Mahi tac0-3/5, great, but not memorable 
3) Hawaiian Poke rice bowl- 4/5 This was the best dish at the table!
4) Pacific steak-3.5/5-Great, but again, nothing out of the ordinary

excerpts: and I frequently order the Ecstasy Roll and the Tempura Shrimp.
Their drinks are okay.
Margaritas are alright but nothing to write home about (but enough to mention on Yelp
I suppose).
Customer service has always been friendly and prompt, and they seem to legitimately know their menu.
ecstasy.author: Mariah O.
ecstasy.review:
I love coming to Pacific Catch. It's on my way home from work and takeout is always fast, although I do prefer dining in when I get the chance. 
The Cabo Calamari is delicious -- try the fried lemon that it comes with, so good! 
Love their rice bowls and the Vietnamese Steak Sandwich is amazing (I order it almost every time). The sushi has always been great, boyfriend and I frequently order the Ecstasy Roll and the Tempura Shrimp. 
Their drinks are okay. Margaritas are alright but nothing to write home about (but enough to mention on Yelp I suppose). 
Customer service has always been friendly and prompt, and they seem to legitimately know their menu.

excerpts: My absolute fave is the Ecstasy roll.
They have a happy hour but it doesn't include the Ecstasy roll ( sad face).
ecstasy.author: First L.
ecstasy.review: I love Pacific Catch. I love food that  reminds me of fresh fish and seafood and Hawaii so I can pretend that I'm in Hawaii. My absolute fave is the Ecstasy roll. I am not a raw fish or food person but this is so delicious I believe it's tuna and salmon with avocado wrapped in seaweed and just a couple of tempura flakes and like a one second flash fry which crisps up the seaweed skin while keeping the fish raw. It's sitting in a yummy sauce but best of all (drum roll....) NO RICE. Delicious choice for the folks low carb in it.....the shrimp ceviche is also an excellent choice very Limey. They do not cook the shrimp but it cooks itself up in the lime juice. Must be a chemical reaction how marvelous. I never knew that, how cool. I've actually never ordered anything else besides these 2 things. The Mai tais are great!!! And strong!!! I love drinking here in the sunset and eating sushi. Nice cocktails. They have a happy hour but it doesn't include the Ecstasy roll ( sad face).

excerpts: This is my first review on Yelp, and I knew exactly which restaurant I would write about first :) PS - Ecstasy roll is bomb PPS - You get pretzel goldfish and edamame while you wait!
ecstasy.author: Lauren Q.
ecstasy.review: My boyfriend and I frequent this place maybe 5-8 times/month. It's kind of ridiculous...had my 21st Birthday Dinner here...would definitely call it one of my faves in SF, having grown up here. We usually sit at the bar so we can watch whatever game is on at the time...if it's a Niners home game, well, we'll be at the Stick. Anyway, I always order a Sapporo (or cocktail if it was a long day) and the Hawaiian Poke Wasabi Bowl, half white rice, half salad, no sprouts and no ginger. I don't think it could get any better. This is my first review on Yelp, and I knew exactly which restaurant I would write about first :) PS - Ecstasy roll is bomb PPS - You get pretzel goldfish and edamame while you wait!

excerpts: This is a good option for a meal in the sunset area if you are looking for something more commercial.
sunset.author: Sherry L.
sunset.review:
This is a good option for a meal in the sunset area if you are looking for something more commercial. It was bustling on a game night, mostly in the bar area, but we didn't have any issues getting a large table for a party of two. 

We ordered two rice bowls and a two taco platter - way too much food in hindsight, but we enjoyed having all of the options. I found my Japanese wasabi bowl with salmon (grilled, btw) and 1/2 brown rice 1/2 greens to be very filling and I liked all of the toppings it included. The ingredients were fresh and they don't skimp on anything! The name is a bit of a misnomer though, as there was no wasabi that I could taste or see in my bowl. My mom's WestCoast grilled salmon bowl looked equally delicious but with an assortment of other toppings. 

The tacos were quite hefty in serving size as well. The two tacos could have been a meal on their own, but were served with a side of fries (or salad) and a small bowl of black beans. The Traditional Baja taco and the Grilled Steak taco were both excellent choices, depending on your palate and dietary preferences!

excerpts:
Here's why:

First of all, there's a parking lot which is unheard of in the Sunset area unless you're a super market or a drug store.
sunset.author: Lily F.
sunset.review:
Went here for dinner on Friday night and it was great. Here's why:

First of all, there's a parking lot which is unheard of in the Sunset area unless you're a super market or a drug store. We found a spot as soon as we pulled in. Next, the restaurant was so lively and bustling. I just loved the atmosphere from the get go. It was busy on a Friday night and the wait was long but they told us there was space at the bar so the two of us took a seat and skipped the entire line. We didn't order any alcohol but the bartender was definitely entertaining to watch. Free show/entertainment with dinner and no line?! Already a good start to the meal.

We ordered tacos (traditional Baja, Mahi Mahi, and cabo shrimp), the Hawaiian poke appetizer, and the Korean bbq rice bowl. The poke was a great wonderful mix of flavor although a tad on the saltier side. The fish was fresh and a nice texture that was not too mushy or chewy. Of the tacos, my favorite was the cabo shrimp as that one was moist and juicy while the other two tacos were a bit on the drier side which makes sense given that it was fish. The Kbbq bowl was huge and had a lot of rice. The meat on the bowl was delicious although I did find the sweet egg quite odd.

The meal took a while to come out due to some unknown reason but the manager noticed and comped our appetizer so great customer service there. The bartender was super nice too. 

Would come here again!

excerpts: There are better options a bit further away bit still in the Sunset for fish tacos.
There are better options for drinks.
I won't be back.
Disappointing.
sunset.author: Steven J.
sunset.review:
Ugh, I live nearby and drop in from time to time. The food and drinks are (generally) consistent, but one key thing isn't: the service.

Today it took 15 minutes to bring me the water I asked for when I sat down (it arrived with my food). After I ate, it took another 15 minutes for someone to come to the area I was seated in to take my card to pay. No one stopped to check how the food was, to refill the water, or anything.

There were babies / young children wailing, so a relaxing meal was out of the question.

I had the poke trio, and the two tuna options were good (Not enough Serrano peppers in its namesake dish) but the salmon was kind of oddly chewy.

In the past when I've dined at the bar, the bartenders are inattentive. You can finish your drink and they won't be around to ask for a refill until after you're ready to pay and leave.

There are better options nearby for sushi or poke bowls. There are better options a bit further away bit still in the Sunset for fish tacos. There are better options for drinks. I won't be back. Disappointing.

excerpts: Inner sunset residents head on down, great deals in the neighborhood.
Sadly, they discontinued $5 Friday mai tais when you're wearing Hawaiian gear, but still a good spot
sunset.author: Abby R.
sunset.review: Great happy hour- yummy fresh fish for reasonable prices, 4-6p and 10p to close. Inner sunset residents head on down, great deals in the neighborhood. Sadly, they discontinued $5 Friday mai tais when you're wearing Hawaiian gear, but still a good spot

excerpts: This location in the Sunset is always crowded and has systems in place (a buzzer) to notify waiting guests when a table is ready.
sunset.author: Rachel H.
sunset.review:
With seven restaurants in the Bay Area, Pacific Catch can only be called a chain restaurant, with all that that moniker conveys.  I am not a fan of chains.  But what chains lack in charm they usually make up for (if they are good) in consistency of experience.  From that standpoint, Pacific Catch is on the higher end of the curve for what a chain restaurant experience can be.

This location in the Sunset is always crowded and has systems in place (a buzzer) to notify waiting guests when a table is ready. I actually hate to dine with a buzzer, but I have to admit that I do like an efficient process and getting seated, so there are trade offs certainly.

On the plus side, we were seated quickly, ordered quickly and the fresh seafood was solid. Some things were, in fact, an excellent value (the fresh Crab Melt for example) while other things arrived and we found them disappointingly small.  Their ceviche was fresh and well seasoned, but uncommonly small down what can only be described as a minuscule handful of chips.

As a local chain, Pacific Catch certainly has more upside than down.  Despite an original restaurant with a point of view being our preferred dining experience, we can give credit to a chain restaurant and even seek it out, if it's a good one.

excerpts: This franchise lays in the heart of San Francisco's Inner Sunset neighborhood right off the of the 9th Avenue Entrance to Golden Gate Park.
Pacific Catch is a fine franchise and it's been in this location for over ten years, so despite the competition of the surrounding neighborhood this place is doing just fine.
But there are other more unique and mom and pop style options out there in the Inner Sunset area that are dying to be supported by the community and newcomers alike.
sunset.author: Jason F.
sunset.review:
Pacific Catch West Coast Fish House is a solid place to get good if unspectacular seafood dishes like soft tacos, poke and rice bowls and sushi rolls. This franchise lays in the heart of San Francisco's Inner Sunset neighborhood right off the of the 9th Avenue Entrance to Golden Gate Park. Pacific Catch is a fine franchise and it's been in this location for over ten years, so despite the competition of the surrounding neighborhood this place is doing just fine. But the question is, is it worth it?

I went for a pre-planned birthday party, so we were able to make reservations for our party of seven at 7pm on a Wednesday evening in July. Although I've been this restaurant before, I haven't been in a while and I like some of the newer things they've brought to the interior, like a nice outdoor fireplace in front of the vestibule area and all of the funky artwork on the walls and hanging from the ceilings. Upon opening the menu, I did notice that the prices are high at Pacific Catch. Be prepared to get sticker shock as this place does not represent the most affordable meals for families in or from out of town. The average price is sixteen dollars per main course, but the food was dependable and an interesting blend on the traditional seafood fusion dish. 

Since there were seven of us in our party we had to get appetizers and the Cabo Calamari, as always, is an easy choice with crispy calamari, lemon slices, fresno chilies and chipotle aioli were decent if somewhat lackluster. The Original Hawaiian Poke Trio was a nice surprise because it came in three ranges of flavors with ahi tuna and sesame-soy marinade spicy seasoning, but at 19 dollars isn't the most affordable starter meal on the menu. I do give credit to Pacific Catch as everything on the menu does sound unbelievably tasty, even their fish and chips dish is described with a mouth-watering sensibility.  

After thinking and thinking (and thinking) about what I wanted to get that would be a good representation of what Pacific Catch has to offer, I decided to go with the Island Tacos Trio mainly because at 16 dollars you can mix and match three any tacos on their menu. Although they all sounded decent, the three tacos I went with were the Traditional Baja Taco with its Crispy Alaskan Cod, cabbage jalapeno tartar, and avocado tomatillo salsa, the Spiced Chicken Taco with grilled Mary's Chicken, cabbage avocado, chipotle aioli and pico de gallo, and the Pacific Steak Taco with marinated skirt steak, crispy onions, cilantro cabbage, sriracha aioli and lime cream. All three were solid pics with a little spice, a little crunch, and a decent amount of flavor. 

Pacific Catch is a decent place with a thought-provoking menu that combines Asian Fusion, Tex-Mex and fresh seafood entrees. The service, ambiance, and overall quality and presentation of the dishes were basically all on point. I asked at the top is it worth it, and I have to admit at that rate the answer remains no because of the overall type of food being offered doesn't match up with the prices. I simply wish the price points were a little more friendlier to the average tourist that tends to frequent this neighborhood. I would consider going again, maybe for Happy Hour or a late night bite. But there are other more unique and mom and pop style options out there in the Inner Sunset area that are dying to be supported by the community and newcomers alike.

excerpts: I'm in the Sunset or golden gate park.
sunset.author: Samir K.
sunset.review: Pricey, but we only were here for a drink and some snacks. We had 2 orders of fries and a pitcher of margaritas. The special margaritas were cherry, but tasted mostly of tequila with a cherry aftertaste. Service was a little slow and the fries weren't too crispy, but had decent seasoning. I'd be curious to try the rest of the menu, as it seems intriguing. I'd come back next time I'm in the Sunset or golden gate park.

excerpts: I've been to both the Marina and sunset location.
Their poke is so fresh and good.
sunset.author: Jenna G.
sunset.review:
Honestly this place is so good. I've been to both the Marina and sunset location. Their poke is so fresh and good. I've tried the original and the salmon avocado. I also tried their mahi mahi tacos with sweet potato fries. Everything was solid. 

It is a little pricey because it's seafood, but I will keep coming back here for poke.

excerpts: Went there on Saturday night for a family dinner, and we had an enjoyable time at this Inner Sunset restaurant.
First and foremost, it is San Francisco
and if you do not have a car, that is fine; MUNI is in the area.
I came from the East Bay, and transferred to the N line at Embarcadero Station.
The N line drops you about a block from the restaurant.
I got to the restaurant, and my party was already there.
My father and I each got Fish N Chips, which were very good.
My sister got a sandwich that she took home, while my mother got a nice crab sandwich and my sister's boyfriend got three tacos that looked good as well.
The service was very good, as were in and out of there in a hour and the best part was the fact that they did not rush you.
sunset.author: Jeremy K.
sunset.review: Went there on Saturday night for a family dinner, and we had an enjoyable time at this Inner Sunset restaurant.  First and foremost, it is San Francisco and if you do not have a car, that is fine; MUNI is in the area. I came from the East Bay, and transferred to the N line at Embarcadero Station. The N line drops you about a block from the restaurant.  I got to the restaurant, and my party was already there.  My father and I each got Fish N Chips, which were very good. My sister got a sandwich that she took home, while my mother got a nice crab sandwich and my sister's boyfriend got three tacos that looked good as well. The service was very good, as were in and out of there in a hour and the best part was the fact that they did not rush you.

excerpts: This is a very good seafood restaurant located on a busy intersection in the Inner-Sunset area of San Francisco.
sunset.author: Charles A.
sunset.review:
This is a very good seafood restaurant located on a busy intersection in the Inner-Sunset area of San Francisco. It's across the street from Golden Gate park and close to many other restaurants.

We went in around 5:30 pm on a Saturday and were given one of those electronic devices that vibrates to let you know you're ready to be seated. The odd thing was that we waited almost a half-hour, but we noticed that there were about 7 or 8 tables available. We were there almost an hour and only a few people sat at those tables, so they weren't reserved. Our only guess was that maybe they were short-staffed and were "filtering" people in, but it appeared to be a time-waste for waiting customers.

We had the fish and shrimp tacos, french fries and fried cod. The tacos were very good and the fried fish was great. They serve a Jalapeno tartar sauce that had an original flavor, but I also had the vinegar. 

The service was excellent and the atmosphere was warm and inviting. They also had sushi and ahi poke, which looked good, although we didn't try it - maybe next time.

excerpts: We decided to try the Pacific Catch in inner sunset.
They have sushi!!!
We went on the tenth anniversary for the poke bowls!
sunset.author: Lisa G.
sunset.review:
I'm officially obsessed with this place.  

We decided to try the Pacific Catch in inner sunset.  They have sushi!!!  We went on the tenth anniversary for the poke bowls!  We got the Lomi Lomi poke appetizer - chopped pieces of salmon, tomatoes, sweet onions, cilantro, red chilies...deliciousness.  The fish is always so fresh.  We also got the poke bowl in a roll (yes, we love poke that much) - fresh, delicious, not too much rice, generous amounts of fish.  We each ended with a bowl.  I got the Japanese Wasabi bowl with, yes, Poke.  My fiance got the Korean BBQ Bowl with Marinated Skirt Steak.  The sauce was so good and the meat was soooo tender.  

We also had a Mai Tai and a beer.  

Once again, the staff is so friendly and welcoming.  It just makes you want to go back.

excerpts: It was a beautiful Sunday afternoon and the nearest place where there are notably tons of great eclectic spots to eat, was in the inner sunset district along Irving and 9th.
Right on the corner of 9th and Lincoln is Pacific Catch, you cannot miss it.
Parking can be a little difficult to find especially on weekends, but it was just our luck that we found a spot right in front.
They say the law of attraction can make things happen & that's exactly what happened as my hubby
and I were claiming a close spot beforehand.
And on top of that, the meters said free parking, which is normally in service on Sundays.
sunset.author: Dahlia C.
sunset.review:
After a long hike at Land's End with my family, we were starving. It was a beautiful Sunday afternoon and the nearest place where there are notably tons of great eclectic spots to eat, was in the inner sunset district along Irving and 9th. Right on the corner of 9th and Lincoln is Pacific Catch, you cannot miss it. Parking can be a little difficult to find especially on weekends, but it was just our luck that we found a spot right in front. They say the law of attraction can make things happen & that's exactly what happened as my hubby and I were claiming a close spot beforehand. And on top of that, the meters said free parking, which is normally in service on Sundays. Made us feel like we won the lottery!!

Anyways, we were seated right away since it was mid-afternoon and not so crowded. The boys had kids meals: fish and chips and fish tacos. The mister and I shared the white tuna Poke, served with fried wontons. Then we both ordered mix & match tacos. I chose mahi mahi, shrimp, and steak. Hubby chose baja (fried cod), mahi mahi, and steak as well. We each ordered them with a side of fries--spicy and sweet potato. Everything was pretty much devoured really quickly, even my boys cleaned up their plates which is really rare. Either they were just hungry or they loved it, turns out to both.The only flip-side to it was that there was some damage done to our wallets. Total cost for a family of four came out to almost $80 including tax. We always try to eat where we can afford within our means, but today, I guess you can say it was a special treat:) Otherwise, be prepared to dish out some money for good seafood or save this place for special occasions.

excerpts: The inner sunset doesn't quite draw the party animals like the Marina does.
But I didn't mind, this is a fun place to catch up with a friend since you can hear each other.
sunset.author: Jocelyn L.
sunset.review:
I recently rediscovered this place since my friend was eager to try their happy hour. They have happy hour twice a weekday, from 4-6pm and 10-closing. Not bad! So once we checked out the happy hour one Friday night, we were hooked.

I got the Riesling for $6. It wasn't the best Riesling I ever had, or even close, but it was decent and a great way to start the weekend. Let's just say I ordered 2 rounds!  The Tempura Shrimp Roll ($7) was pretty decent. Once again, it's not the best sushi you ever had, but for $7 and happy hour it was pretty good. 

Ambiance was quiet. The inner sunset doesn't quite draw the party animals like the Marina does. But I didn't mind, this is a fun place to catch up with a friend since you can hear each other.

excerpts: I don't usually write reviews but as a server (and a fellow sunset SF server)
I have to give a shout out to our server Miya tonight
she was fantastic, as was the food and drinks as per usual.
Love this spot!
Local or tourist come
one come all!
Thanks as always!
sunset.author: Starr C.
sunset.review: I don't usually write reviews but as a server (and a fellow sunset SF server) I have to give a shout out to our server Miya tonight she was fantastic, as was the food and drinks as per usual. Love this spot! Local or tourist come one come all! Thanks as always!

excerpts: In a hot day with the company of our dog and walking around inner sunset we chose to eat at the Pacific Catch.

The first good things:
-outside

tables under the shadow was great to be with the pet 
-nice cocktails 
-friendly staff 
-fast service 
-cool

view to the GGP
-busy

corner

sunset.review:
In a hot day with the company of our dog and walking around inner sunset we chose to eat at the Pacific Catch. The first good things:

-nice cocktails

excerpts: Despite being packed to the brim last night, Pacific Catch's service was as crisp as ever and upheld its reputation as one of the few reliable seafood options in the Sunset.
Sushi-wise,
sunset.author: Ahmed R.
sunset.review:
Despite being packed to the brim last night, Pacific Catch's service was as crisp as ever and upheld its reputation as one of the few reliable seafood options in the Sunset. Sushi-wise, their tempura and spicy tuna is quite good. Sandwich-wise, I would go for the Wasabi Ahi with a side of spicy fries. 

Pro Tip: Do your best to make a reservation--this place can get super busy Thursday through Sunday evenings.

excerpts:
We ordered:
Edamame - fresh, healthy, green, salted deliciousness
Sunset Sushi Roll - YUM.
Tempura sweet tofu, green bean, scallion, & carrot, wrapped with avocado, rice & nori, and drizzled with teriyaki sauce.
Japanese Wasabi Rice Bowl - Extremely fresh, and great colorful presentation.
Good portions as well.
sunset.author: Chelsea M.
sunset.review:
On a sunny (but windy) Sunday in the city, a group of friends and I stopped in to eat at Pacific Catch for dinner.

I would be giving 5 stars, if it weren't for the 40+ minute wait just to get a table when we were told it would be 15. Food was great though.

We ordered:
Edamame - fresh, healthy, green, salted deliciousness
Sunset Sushi Roll - YUM. Tempura sweet tofu, green bean, scallion, & carrot, wrapped with avocado, rice & nori, and drizzled with teriyaki sauce.
Japanese Wasabi Rice Bowl - Extremely fresh, and great colorful presentation. Good portions as well.
Korean Barbecue Rice Bowl - Pretty bomb.

Overall, the experience was a good one and a delicious one. I would definitely recommend Pacific Catch for anyone in the area who is craving some good seafood!

excerpts: Every Time I'm around inner sunset area, I would try my best to come here and get the original poke.
I also tried several of their pokes and the original is definitely my favorite.
sunset.author: Ruxin H.
sunset.review:
My default place to go when I need a Hawaiian poke fix. Every Time I'm around inner sunset area, I would try my best to come here and get the original poke. I also tried several of their pokes and the original is definitely my favorite. It is kinda marinated ahi tuna chunks with soy sauce and onions. The tuna is fresh and high grade. I wouldn't say it is the highest quality of ahi tuna, but I think it is very good for the price point.

I would recommend getting the appetizer of tuna poke as opposed to wasabi bowls. I feel the portion of fish is a little smaller in the bowls and wonton chips in the appetizer go well with the poke. 

Sometimes I got the take out order of the poke appetizer and they gave a soup cup size of poke. 

I also came here for dinner before and their salmon/catch of day is pretty good too. Very huge portion.

Plus, service is incredible here. They served edamame when you are seated

excerpts: I haven't been there since, even though I'm in the Inner Sunset constantly.
What a pleasant little surprise!
sunset.author: Tamar D.
sunset.review:
I remember when this place was some coffee/art house.  I haven't been there since, even though I'm in the Inner Sunset constantly.  What a pleasant little surprise!  Well, not that little...the place must have 50 tables, easy.

They're dog-friendly, and we didn't want to do our usual Park Chow chow.  Extremely friendly and fast service immediately upon arrival.  We sat in the corner of the outside patio area, which was away from the wind and had ample room for the pups.

The menu is vast...tons of options and they're 90% fish and seafood.  I ordered the Mixed Catch Basket, which came with fried oysters, cod, and coconut shrimp.  I loved the oysters.  I don't care where you order cod, it's the blandest fish of all whitefish.  So, its lackluster showing was totally expected.  The coconut shrimp was tasty.  The spicy fries are bomb-diggity!  Especially when dipped in the basket's accompanying jalapeno aioli.  Mmmm

Chose the lemongrass mojito, which had very little alcohol, but it was refreshingly good.  Oh, I forgot about the amuse...shelled edamame and goldfish pretzels.  Word?  Crazy combo to eat with the supplied chopsticks.

excerpts: I can't speak for the other locations, but if they're even close to how good their Inner Sunset location in SF is, they are definitely 4*s.
sunset.author: Johnnie W.
sunset.review: How do you get better and better?  Ask these guys.  It is IMPOSSIBLE to find one thing wrong with the food, service, presentation of plates, drinks, anything (which I'm totally baffled that it only has 3 1/2 stars).  I can't speak for the other locations, but if they're even close to how good their Inner Sunset location in SF is, they are definitely 4*s.

excerpts: I love drinking here in the sunset and eating sushi.
Nice cocktails.
sunset.author: First L.
sunset.review: I love Pacific Catch. I love food that  reminds me of fresh fish and seafood and Hawaii so I can pretend that I'm in Hawaii. My absolute fave is the Ecstasy roll. I am not a raw fish or food person but this is so delicious I believe it's tuna and salmon with avocado wrapped in seaweed and just a couple of tempura flakes and like a one second flash fry which crisps up the seaweed skin while keeping the fish raw. It's sitting in a yummy sauce but best of all (drum roll....) NO RICE. Delicious choice for the folks low carb in it.....the shrimp ceviche is also an excellent choice very Limey. They do not cook the shrimp but it cooks itself up in the lime juice. Must be a chemical reaction how marvelous. I never knew that, how cool. I've actually never ordered anything else besides these 2 things. The Mai tais are great!!! And strong!!! I love drinking here in the sunset and eating sushi. Nice cocktails. They have a happy hour but it doesn't include the Ecstasy roll ( sad face).

excerpts: We then ordered the Sunset Sushi Roll (which comes in 8 pieces) and Poke Fest Trio (we tried the original, California, and the Macadamia Nut).
I personally liked the Macadamia Nut and Original Poke.
I think the California Poke was too citrusy (is that a word).
but at least it's an option in the busy inner sunset.
sunset.author: Phillip D.
sunset.review:
Finally tried this place after seeing so many friends frequent this restaurant.  I can't believe I only tried this place now. 

First of all, I love that they have a variety of "Pacific Rim" cuisine.  Everything from Hawaiian to Japanese to Korean, we actually tried a bit of all three.  We came on a Wednesday evening (just missed the Happy Hour). We started with the Korean Sticky Ribs. That was tasty but a bit messy (it's nice they have napkins and wet naps to clean off your hands).  We then ordered the Sunset Sushi Roll (which comes in 8 pieces) and Poke Fest Trio (we tried the original, California, and the Macadamia Nut).  I personally liked the Macadamia Nut and Original Poke. I think the California Poke was too citrusy (is that a word).  

I definitely want to try their happy hour (see what deals I can get). They have happy hour both from 4-6 M-F and 10-close! Great for those late night eats. Also, I have to try their rice bowl. From what I saw, they are HUGE! 

Our server (forgot her name) was real nice and pretty attentive. I don't think it was too busy but even if, good service always makes the meal (and review) even better  

They technically have a parking lot in the rear but it's usually full but at least it's an option in the busy inner sunset. 

Definitely a place to come again.

excerpts: Hawaiian influenced; excellent tasting tuna poke, ahi salad and fish tacos ... very crowded on a Friday nite at the sunset district location [better make reservations] - great service n friendly ... definitely will be back when in SF again ...
sunset.author: Jerry G.
sunset.review: One of the better places ive eaten in SF this past week ... something a little different, but not too different!  Hawaiian influenced; excellent tasting tuna poke, ahi salad and fish tacos ... very crowded on a Friday nite at the sunset district location [better make reservations] - great service n friendly ... definitely will be back when in SF again ...

excerpts: Parking lot in the sunset?
sunset.author: Jessica H.
sunset.review:
So the sweet sweet deal is that they have a parking lot. Parking lot in the sunset? Homeboy say wahhhh?

Anyways, we wandered in on a Tuesday night after I scooped up D from Caltrain. Pretty calm night, and pretty empty; which is always greatly appreciated. Sometimes I want a quiet night with no crowds.

We got seated and order our meals. D and I shared a fried platter with spicy fries (the fries were bomb.com) and a Japanese Wasabi bowl with Hawaiian Poke.

The fried platter was eh, and definitely would not get again. Maybe its because I was still recovering from a cough, but it just wasnt that tasty, and the sauces didn't really seem to go well (they gave us tarter sauce and sweet chilli sauce).

The bowl on the other hand was delicious. I ordered one, and the waiter was nice enough to ask if they should split it for us, since it was pretty clear that we were sharing. Most of the time, when you split something its never enough, but it was the perfect amount for me and for D.

Coming back next time to try more of their fresh fish and stuff. But like I said, avoiding the fried platter.

excerpts: We had an excellent meal at Pacific Catch in the Inner Sunset a couple of nights ago.
sunset.author: Andy S.
sunset.review:
We had an excellent meal at Pacific Catch in the Inner Sunset a couple of nights ago.
The place was extremely busy on a Monday night around 8pm, which is a testament to the quality and variety on the menu, as well as the reasonable pricing.

My wife enjoyed a very generous portion of fried coconut shrimp with sweet potato fries.  My dinner was a very nice plate of crusted filet of sole (allegedly 'local' sole) with brown rice and asparagus.  Sole is my weak spot, and I eat it nearly everywhere I can- and this was truly tasty and I cleared the plate completely.  Also ordered was a spicy tuna roll- while it was ok, large and generous, and I completely devastated it- the sushi will not be what brings me back here.  The sole, overall great menu diversity, and the Drake's beer on tap (dark and delicious) will.  $60 for everything including the tip was quite reasonable from my perspective. See you again soon (but probably your Chestnut St restaurant as its closer to my home).

excerpts: As a neighborhood spot, I don't think there's any place in the Sunset that does this type of cuisine any better, especially with the quality of seafood product they have.
But if you're looking for food really beaming with bold and unique flavors, this might not be the best spot to try.
sunset.author: Jeffrey J.
sunset.review:
5 stars for the drinks, 3 stars for the food.

Much props to the awesome people behind the bar. Every cocktail on their menu that I've tried has been very good. I'm a sucker for Mai Tais, and I think the one they make here is one of the best around.

As far as their food goes, I enjoy that you can go here for a different experience on any given day or night. You can come for a Japanese experience one night and stick to ordering their sushi rolls. Or you can come in for some pub fare and get their fish and chips. Or if you're feeling nostalgic about your time in Hawaii (I do all the time), you can choose from a variety of poke bowls they offer. Overall, while their food is decent, I wouldn't go out of my way to come here. The fish they serve is certainly fresh, but I don't think anything is quite a home run here.

But like I said, I would go out of my way to come for drinks. I recommend coming here and hanging out at the bar and coming in for some apps while you enjoy their delicious cocktails.  As a neighborhood spot, I don't think there's any place in the Sunset that does this type of cuisine any better, especially with the quality of seafood product they have. But if you're looking for food really beaming with bold and unique flavors, this might not be the best spot to try.

excerpts: So... I know I'm not alone in being suspicious of monstrous restaurant buildings on the corner of busy intersections in the Sunset.
sunset.author: Jade T.
sunset.review:
So... I know I'm not alone in being suspicious of monstrous restaurant buildings on the corner of busy intersections in the Sunset.  In this case, possibly the busiest.

Pacific Catch.  Hm.  Tropical themed fusion-ish pan-Asian-ish fish place decorated with wicker and rattan as far as the eye can see.  How in the world can the food at such a place be any good?  Surprise.  It actually is better than decent.

(Disclaimer:  I don't have a sophisticated palate.  But you already knew that from skimming the places I've already reviewed.  Hello, Carl's Junior?)

I do like my seafood that has unfortunately been fished to the brink of extinction.  Codfish and tuna are some of my favourites, and they were fresh here.  That's half the battle.

Fish and chips used authentic cod (yes!).  I also like that Pacific Catch offers brown rice.  Three-way tuna-- yup, ahi tuna prepared three different ways.  Can't recall exactly how, other than seared and sashimi-style, but it was tasty.  And you get plenty of wasabi, pickled ginger and soy sauce; what more could a hungry customer/sushi lover want?

Drinks are good.  Girly beachy Hawaiian type concoctions.  Those are nice.  Order a Guava Cooler or Kona Lager and just hang out as you wait for a table to open up.  Drinks are always good.

Some tables are a bit small though.  Crowded with plates, cups and dishes, and we didn't even order that much.  Either down-size your serving platters-- but NOT your food-- or give me a bigger eating surface.  Yes, I am a petite slob. (Aw, that reminds me of my beloved pet kitty...)

Kudos, Pacific Catch, for a nice seafood meal and fun drinks.

Sorry about the mess. :P

excerpts: My name is Rob and I'm the General Manager at Pacific Catch in the Sunset.
I read your Yelp posting and wanted to express my concern.
Do you recall when you dined here?
Was it for lunch or dinner, or midday?
sunset.author: Matthew L.
sunset.review:
I received an email from the General Manager regarding my experience at Pacific Catch, and below is the correspondence between him and I:

**Hello Matthew,

My name is Rob and I'm the General Manager at Pacific Catch in the Sunset.  I read your Yelp posting and wanted to express my concern.  Do you recall when you dined here?  Was it for lunch or dinner, or midday?  Do you recall what manager you spoke with when you called and may I also ask what you were expecting the manager to do upon receiving your call?

We do pride ourselves on serving fresh, well-prepared food at Pacific Catch.  We also take a great amount of pride in the cleanliness of our establishment.  In fact, last year we took part in a study performed by USF and UCSF about hygiene standards and practices in the food business.  Our restaurant finished their study in first place with respect to our standards and practices.

Best regards,.
Rob

Here is the message I replied to him...

**Dear Rob,

Thank you for your response.  I appreciate your time to write to me here on Yelp, despite your busy schedule at Pac Catch.  I came here for dinner a few months ago and I had called the next day and I had spoken with you.  Please don't get me wrong, but I called to pinpoint/figure out the source of my friend's and my diarrhea.  It's true that it is hard to pinpoint where it could have come from, but when I had addressed my concerns to you, I was a little disappointed because you had completely dismissed them, and flat out had told me, around the lines of, "it's not us, sorry!"  It was upsetting to have had completely disregarded like that, especially when it's about the health of your patrons.

Thank you again for communicating and engaging me through Yelp.  Your response does make me feel a little better and much more willing to come back again.  Because management was responsive, I will consider rating Pac Catch 2 stars, but will withhold it until my next visit.

Yours faithfully,
Matthew

======
It was nice to hear back from management, and it is good that they were responsive despite the initial attitude and lack of good customer service I experienced on the telephone back a few months. Yelp truly is an excellent medium to communicate with restaurants--especially to get issues like this addressed.  However, I still rate Pac Catch a *1 star* as I await a response from the manager.  I'm STILL a bit wary and hesitant.

excerpts: This particular day we were parked near 9th in the Sunset, and looking for a place close by because I was on crutches.
We headed towards Lincoln, both starving and passing long wait lines outside of every restaurant.
We hit the end of the block in front of Pacific Catch and there didn't appear to be a wait
so we said why not.
sunset.author: Bobbi Jo F.
sunset.review:
It's taken my partner and I awhile to find a restaurant that we could both get excited about as a favorite. I'm a Lacto-Vegetarian, and he includes fish and eggs. We have many perfect places for either, but not both. This particular day we were parked near 9th in the Sunset, and looking for a place close by because I was on crutches. We headed towards Lincoln, both starving and passing long wait lines outside of every restaurant. We hit the end of the block in front of Pacific Catch and there didn't appear to be a wait so we said why not. Because it wasn't packed we were a bit skeptical. 

When I looked at the menu, my stomach growled! When our meals arrived, mine with grilled tofu and his with fish, both were beautifully presented and tasted great too. I think the biggest surprise was the side salad. It is not at all the norm that you would ususally be served, but large and prepared with sprouts, shitake mushrroms, edaname, cukes, and a delicious miso dressing. 

It's casual, and although some areas are louder than others, you can still carry a conversation. Having returned several more times now, we have our favorite spot that if necessary, is worth waiting for. The service is prompt, helpful and friendly. Substitutions are no problem and the chef really knows how to prepare vegetables.  Everything is reasonably priced.  We also got introduced to the Nojito! The non-alcoholic fresh and minty Mojito that is offered with FREE refills. In JOY!

excerpts: I would recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants to know where to eat in the Inner Sunset.
sunset.author: Kay P.
sunset.review: I think this is the best restaurant in the neighborhood.  Really like how the fish is prepared here and like to order from the specials.  I also say that they have the best sweet potato fries in the city.  This place is child friendly with a good selection on the children's menu.  When one sits down they give a small plate of pretzels and edamame to snack on while waiting for the food.  Kids love this finger food.  Also, there are chopsticks at the table as well as Western cutlery.   We have never had any complaints about the service nor prices.  I would recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants to know where to eat in the Inner Sunset.

excerpts: Yayyyy the only kitchen that is open in the Sunset on Fridays and Saturdays!
sunset.author: Julia D.
sunset.review:
Yayyyy the only kitchen that is open in the Sunset on Fridays and Saturdays! 12pm woohooo!!!

After Izakaya Sozai completely SCREWED our reservation, we were frustrated AND hungry. Not a good combo. 

So for walkin in around 11:30pm on a friday, they have some pretty good deals on their "Bar Bites" happy hour until midnight...not too shabby.

+Agave Margarita $6
+Warm Edamame $4
