rising sun.author: Lisa C.
rising sun.review:
Having been here for lunch, I was looking forward to dinner. I arrived thinking I wanted the seared ahi salad, but that quickly changed as we browsed the menu.  Instead, we opted for a few appetizers and two sushi rolls to share.  The sweet potato fries were irresistible- not too greasy; I kept chomping on them! The Hawaiian Poke and the Shrimp Ceviche starter plates both came with plenty of poke and shrimp pieces. I loved the lime-cilantro-avocado sauce the shrimps were covered in.

Though the starter plates were great, I think the sushi rolls were only ok.  We asked for brown rice for the rising sun and the firecracker salmon rolls.  I was not impressed by the rolls because the brown rice didn't stick too well and the rice fell apart.  I think the next time I'll skip the sushi rolls. 

Surprisingly, there was no wait at all for a Saturday night, and we were able to snag a nice corner window seat.

excerpts: One of my favorites and one that DOES have raw fish is the Rising Sun roll.
rising sun.author: Julia T.
rising sun.review:
Out of the three Pacific Catch locations, I would say this is my overall favorite. Chestnut St. is just way too tiny and crowded, though that might result in the food tasting better because you had to fight so hard to park/get a table. Corte Madera's location is too embedded in the outdoor mall scene and has way too many kiddies running around. But this 9th Ave. location is pretty much perfect with plenty of seating for the bar and regular dining area. It also has its own parking lot so you don't have to compete for the street meters. 

Food is pretty consistent at all locations. You can count on the fact that mostly everything you order from the regular menu will be very good. Some of my favorites are the wasabi bowls (with brown or sushi rice) and any of the fried seafood baskets. I love the Mixed Catch Basket with fish, coconut shrimp and crispy oysters with jalapeño tartar. SO GOOD. Everything comes freshly fried with those awesome sweet potato fries. But eat everything while they are fresh! I don't recommend taking leftover fries home. They really those their flavor after they've cooled down. 

Though their sushi roll selection lacks raw fish, I think they are still made very well with the mostly cooked ingredients. One of my favorites and one that DOES have raw fish is the Rising Sun roll. It has tempura shrimp and avocado wrapped in ahi tuna with a citrus sauce. I don't like that they stuff pickled ginger into the roll but if you're like me, just request that they leave it out. Otherwise it's a very tasty roll. The ahi tuna is always fresh and flavorful.  I love that they give you big pieces of it too. (We got that roll totally F-R-E-E! with the coupon in the Green Zebra book!) I could dine happily on their sushi rolls alone. 

Just recently I ventured off from my regulars and tried one of the their specials: Trout bbq'd baja style so it was spice rubbed and grilled, served with tomatilla avocado sauce, some thin slices of veggies, and fresh grilled corn over sweet potato fries. I could tell the fish was very fresh but for me, it was TOO seasoned and got a little salty since the fish wasn't very thick. And though I had originally wanted the fries, I would now have preferred and wished that the fish was served over rice. I think I'll stick to my regulars next time. 

Big pluses:
-I've talked to the workers and seen for myself that Pacific Catch is environmentally conscious. They use biodegradable materials, from the takeout containers to the straw in your drink. Pacific Catch also practices composting from their kitchen to the leftover food scraps. Smiles all around. =D
-I don't know anywhere else that you can get UNLIMITED refills on Thai iced tea. I could drink three glasses easy. LOVE IT!

excerpts: The Rock and Roll is great, the Rising Sun is decent.
rising sun.author: Max A.
rising sun.review:
I've now been in here twice for lunch, and both times I've spent far more then I'd intended but left extremely happy. 

It's very hard to resist trying their sushi rolls - oversized and fresh. The Rock and Roll is great, the Rising Sun is decent.

We've had the ceviche which was stellar and the salmon salad. The ahi salad, the mixed catch plate. Overall, everyone has always been happy with their dish. We've had no problems with service or waits, food quality or experience.

The Kamikaze Bloody Mary is fine - the wasabi is a nice way to change it up a bit, but I almost wish there was a bit more bite to the drink. Wasabi shouldn't taste tamed.

excerpts: the Sake Sake and Rising Sun are as fresh well-executed as one might find at Moki's or Blowfish.
On another night we sampled their Tuna Poke again -- and overall it's a good appetizer --
the large chunks of fresh tuna are admirable, but they might benefit from a slightly smaller cut and just a tad more dressing.
The fried wonton chips are plentiful and the perfect accompaniment.
rising sun.author: Claudine C.
rising sun.review:
We resisted this place for a long time, on account of its seeming too chain-like, too touristy...  And one day, after a certain Yelp Holiday Party, one during which we had the opportunity to sample their tuna poke, we decided to stop by.  And realized the value of their outdoor puppy-friendly space, well protected by plastic on the colder days, and well-served by heat lamps.

The food is fine -- I enjoyed their crab salad over garden greens -- you're provided with a very generous portion of pure crabmeat, serverd over very lightly-dressed salad greens, served with slices of avocado and pickled ginger.  The sushi rolls are also good -- the Sake Sake and Rising Sun are as fresh well-executed as one might find at Moki's or Blowfish.  On another night we sampled their Tuna Poke again -- and overall it's a good appetizer -- the large chunks of fresh tuna are admirable, but they might benefit from a slightly smaller cut and just a tad more dressing. The fried wonton chips are plentiful and the perfect accompaniment.  Take caution when ordering their grill items -- the fish I ordered turned out to be overcooked and a smidge dry...

Overall, PacCatch is a good alternative when the lines at Park Chow seem to be interminable, and you're looking for a nice outdoor space to sit with your puppy.

excerpts: I ordered the Rising Sun Roll and the Coconut shrimp.
The coconut shrimp was really good
and I'd go back for them, but the rising sun was filled with to much ginger and the shrimp inside
was soggy.
I went with a larger group and we decided to share some fish and chips.
The fish wasn't so great and a little bland.
The fries were good but not the best.
All in all the place wasn't my favorite and not some place I would go out of my way to go to
but I'd go back.
So I say go for the atmosphere and the coconut shrimp but don't expect anything amazing.
rising sun.author: Shelby G.
rising sun.review: White I totally enjoyed the cheerful and upbeat atmosphere I can't say i enjoyed the food as much. I ordered the Rising Sun Roll and the Coconut shrimp. The coconut shrimp was really good and I'd go back for them, but the rising sun was filled with to much ginger and the shrimp inside was soggy. I went with a larger group and we decided to share some fish and chips. The fish wasn't so great and a little bland. The fries were good but not the best. All in all the place wasn't my favorite and not some place I would go out of my way to go to but I'd go back. So I say go for the atmosphere and the coconut shrimp but don't expect anything amazing.

excerpts: Inside out roll - the spicy tuna on the outside wasn't spicy and it was creamier than I liked, like it had too much mayo.
spicy tuna.author: Angie Y.
spicy tuna.review:
First off, service was great! Hostess and waiter were both very nice, and the waiter checked up on us regularly. Unfortunately, I come back for food/drinks... good service is a bonus. 

Now onto happy hour... drinks and food. The Mai tai was great; it's not too strong but you can definitely taste the alcohol so you know they're not skimping on it. $7 for a glass or $34 for a pitcher with 5 servings ($1 saving). The food was overall subpar although portions were good--average $5.5-$6.50 / plate. 

Calamari - not crunchy; tasted almost stale (like it's been sitting out a while).
Salmon avocado poke - this was good. Fish tasted fresh. The chips that it came with was thin and crunchy, which I liked, but it tasted greasy.

Rising sun - the shrimp tempura wasn't crunchy on the inside, but I liked the fresh raw tuna on top.

In short, this wouldn't be my pick for happy hour but if my friends suggest it, I wouldn't fight them on it (if they've been here before and know what they're getting themselves into).

excerpts: The fish was fresh, though I thought the spicy tuna in my spicy tuna bowl was slightly under seasoned.
All in all, I would be back!
spicy tuna.author: Cassie A.
spicy tuna.review: Overall a solid meal. The drinks were probably the highlight for me. I had the spicy mango Serrano drink (forgetting the name), but it is amazing. Don't order if you don't like spicy though because this has a very nice kick! My friend had the kiwi drink which was super light and refreshing. The fish was fresh, though I thought the spicy tuna in my spicy tuna bowl was slightly under seasoned. All in all, I would be back!

excerpts: Yesterday, I got the happy hour spicy tuna california roll.
Within half an hour, pounding headache, within an hour, I felt super hot and nauseous and my heart was pounding.
Within two hours everything in my stomach was coming out into the toilet.
Worst food poisoning I've had in a REALLY long time.
And at pac catch-
I was super surprised and now very wary of eating there.
Also, I should of known when the spicy tuna california roll came out and the spicy tuna looked like cat food.
Also, I should of known when the spicy tuna california roll came out and the spicy tuna looked like cat food.
spicy tuna.author: Elizabeth N.
spicy tuna.review: I've been here a few times and never had problems before, but that's probably because I ordered only drinks and a salad. Yesterday, I got the happy hour spicy tuna california roll. Within half an hour, pounding headache, within an hour, I felt super hot and nauseous and my heart was pounding. Within two hours everything in my stomach was coming out into the toilet. Worst food poisoning I've had in a REALLY long time. And at pac catch- I was super surprised and now very wary of eating there. Also, I should of known when the spicy tuna california roll came out and the spicy tuna looked like cat food. -________-

excerpts: We got a mahi mahi taco, coconut shrimp, calamari, spicy tuna roll, macadamia nut poke, and we shared a mai tai.
We had a big snack, and we were satisfied.
spicy tuna.author: Brandon F.
spicy tuna.review:
Long day of shopping and was looking for a good happy hour with something to snack between lunch and dinner. Searched nearby on Yelp and came across this place! Although I'm on vacation, and trying to hit up all the hyped Yelp spots, I was happy to hit up a regular place as if I would if I was home in San Diego. 

Their drink menu and food selection is awesome during happy hour. We got a good variety of items and it was exactly what I was looking for. Our snack kind of turned into a meal that got us full and we needed up skipping our late dinner. They do a cool Hawaiian/Asian fusion and everything was great. My poke was a bit on the salty side, but everything else we got was on point. We got a mahi mahi taco, coconut shrimp, calamari, spicy tuna roll, macadamia nut poke, and we shared a mai tai. We had a big snack, and we were satisfied.

excerpts: We've tried the Korean sticky ribs, Kona coffee ribs, fried calamari, shrimp ceviche (my favorite), the poke trio with the California, original, and white tuna, the salmon poke, and the spicy tuna sushi roll.
The Kona coffee ribs were amazing
but I think were only around for a limited time.
The sushi rolls were just mediocre, this isn't a sushi joint
so I would stay away from the rolls and stick to the poke.
The original poke is a little too salty
but it's tolerable if you pair with rice
, the white tuna poke was a little on the dry side, I would've liked more liquid/lemon on it
and it had a really "fishy" taste, the California was probably the best, and the salmon poke was good but a bit on the spicy side.
and it had a really "fishy" taste, the California was probably the best, and the salmon poke was good but a bit on the spicy side.
For entrees we've had the poke salad (amazing), the Thai curry bowl with salmon (also amazing it was one of the best salmons I've ever had), and the teriyaki bowl with steak.
To be honest I would stick to what they know best which is probably fish.
The steak was just ok
and they weren't very generous with the portions.
It was more rice and a whole lot of other stuff on it like pineapples, edamame, carrots, shiitake mushrooms, and A LOT of fried onions.
I do have to say tho that the teriyaki sauce they use is delicious, I couldn't stop eating the rice.
spicy tuna.author: Linz C.
spicy tuna.review:
I've been here a couple of times and I must say they have one of the best happy hour menus!  They even give you edamame and goldfish pretzels to snack on! 

We've tried the Korean sticky ribs, Kona coffee ribs, fried calamari, shrimp ceviche (my favorite), the poke trio with the California, original, and white tuna, the salmon poke, and the spicy tuna sushi roll.  The Kona coffee ribs were amazing but I think were only around for a limited time. The sushi rolls were just mediocre, this isn't a sushi joint so I would stay away from the rolls and stick to the poke.  The original poke is a little too salty but it's tolerable if you pair with rice, the white tuna poke was a little on the dry side, I would've liked more liquid/lemon on it and it had a really "fishy" taste, the California was probably the best, and the salmon poke was good but a bit on the spicy side.  The poke trio also comes with wonton chips, a small salad, and a delicious seaweed salad. 

For entrees we've had the poke salad (amazing), the Thai curry bowl with salmon (also amazing it was one of the best salmons I've ever had), and the teriyaki bowl with steak.  To be honest I would stick to what they know best which is probably fish.  The steak was just ok and they weren't very generous with the portions. It was more rice and a whole lot of other stuff on it like pineapples, edamame, carrots, shiitake mushrooms, and A LOT of fried onions.  I do have to say tho that the teriyaki sauce they use is delicious, I couldn't stop eating the rice.

excerpts: Great food, we had the spicy tuna bowl, it has amazing flavors and was super refreshing.
Fish n chips, a classic executed beautifully.
To top it off, great service which is a must for me to give a good review.
Would def return!!
spicy tuna.author: Aelia F.
spicy tuna.review: Great food, we had the spicy tuna bowl, it has amazing flavors and was super refreshing. Fish n chips, a classic executed beautifully. To top it off, great service which is a must for me to give a good review. Would def return!!

excerpts: I always get the spicy tuna sushi, and it fills me up.
Just not a huge fan of edamame as the table snack.
I'm forever a chips
n salsa chica....
Edamame for me is like a snack I have while working when I'm trying to cut off my charbs that week.
spicy tuna.author: Carina M.
spicy tuna.review:
We go to this place for sentimental reasons more than for the actual food. The food is ok, but for the price I'd rather go somewhere else.

I always get the spicy tuna sushi, and it fills me up. Just not a huge fan of edamame as the table snack. I'm forever a chips n salsa chica....Edamame for me is like a snack I have while working when I'm trying to cut off my charbs that week. Not what I want when I sit down to eat before dinner....

Anyways, that's just personal preference. The ambiance is cool, kinda like a suburban restaurant feel to it (chainville) and you get good service. So, if you're in the neighborhodod....check it out.

excerpts: I ordered the shrimp ceviche and the spicy tuna roll.
Even though they gave us complimentary edamame and crackers while we waited for our food, the wait was excruciatingly long.
It took about 20 minutes to get our food.
When the food arrived I concluded that the waitress must've heard my order wrong because she gave sweet potato fries instead of the spicy tuna roll.
The spicy tuna roll was delicious too except for the fact that they put watercress in it (yuck).
The sweet potatoes were my favorite!
spicy tuna.author: Lisa H.
spicy tuna.review:
Came here for lunch to satisfy a seafood craving. Went late in the afternoon and there wasn't any wait to be seated. I ordered the shrimp ceviche and the spicy tuna roll. Even though they gave us complimentary edamame and crackers while we waited for our food, the wait was excruciatingly long. It took about 20 minutes to get our food. When the food arrived I concluded that the waitress must've heard my order wrong because she gave sweet potato fries instead of the spicy tuna roll. When I told her that they got my order wrong, she generously gave me the sweet potato fries on the house. 

The shrimp ceviche with avocado was delicious! It had a lot of flavor to it and the portion was generous as well. The spicy tuna roll was delicious too except for the fact that they put watercress in it (yuck). The sweet potatoes were my favorite! It was lightly salted and it came with a cream wasabi and sweet&sour sauce. 

Four stars because I think the service is great but prices are a little too steep. I understand that it's seafood and that's always gonna be expensive but the ceviche and sushi roll cost me 9 dollars each! 

Overall, this place is worth coming to. The quality of the food and the service is great.

excerpts: their tempura and spicy tuna is quite good.
spicy tuna.author: Ahmed R.
spicy tuna.review:
Despite being packed to the brim last night, Pacific Catch's service was as crisp as ever and upheld its reputation as one of the few reliable seafood options in the Sunset. Sushi-wise, their tempura and spicy tuna is quite good. Sandwich-wise, I would go for the Wasabi Ahi with a side of spicy fries. 

Pro Tip: Do your best to make a reservation--this place can get super busy Thursday through Sunday evenings.

excerpts: I had the spicy tuna bowl which was fantastic and my wife had the mahi tacos which she loved!
Great drinks .
Great atmosphere .
spicy tuna.author: Sean M.
spicy tuna.review: The staff was super friendly from the beginning. I had the spicy tuna bowl which was fantastic and my wife had the mahi tacos which she loved! Great drinks . Great atmosphere .

excerpts: I ordered a spicy tuna roll and fish and chips.
When I got the food, I could already tell I was going to hate it.
First of all, the spicy tuna was a pale pink.
I ate a piece and it literally tasted like glue or more like flour stirred in with water to make some sort of paste.
It was difficult to swallow let alone even more difficult to digest.
I'm feeling sick just thinking about it.
Then the fish and chips..
how the heck do you mess it up?
Seriously, it's all fried!
Nope, everything was cold and soggy.
You could still see the puddles of oil disintegrated into the fish and fries.
The slaw on the side was warm and looked like it was sitting out all day.
I was truly disappointed as I was looking forward to having a nice meal.
Don't come here and save your money.
There are tons of eateries nearby.
spicy tuna.author: Marie N.
spicy tuna.review: I've eaten at the other pacific catch in the marina, but ordered her multiple times before trough food delivery. I decided to dine in at this location since I was in the area. I ordered a spicy tuna roll and fish and chips. When I got the food, I could already tell I was going to hate it. First of all, the spicy tuna was a pale pink. I ate a piece and it literally tasted like glue or more like flour stirred in with water to make some sort of paste. It was difficult to swallow let alone even more difficult to digest. I'm feeling sick just thinking about it. Then the fish and chips..how the heck do you mess it up? Seriously, it's all fried! Nope, everything was cold and soggy. You could still see the puddles of oil disintegrated into the fish and fries. The slaw on the side was warm and looked like it was sitting out all day. I was truly disappointed as I was looking forward to having a nice meal. Don't come here and save your money. There are tons of eateries nearby.

excerpts: Spicy Tuna Roll ($6 HH) -
The tuna had a little too much something (aioli?) mixed in, so the roll was a pinkish color rather than a deep red.
spicy tuna.author: Kevin W.
spicy tuna.review:
I'm still wish that Pacific Catch's Happy Hour would go past 6PM for us poor working saps.  GRRR!

-- Spicy Pacific Martini ($7 HH) - My new favorite is strong and spicy with a few pepper seeds floating inside.  Much better and more unique than the typical $4.50 HH well drinks or the $6 HH well martinis.

-- Basket of Fries ($4 HH) - Don't be boring with the regular fries, and mix-and-match the spicy fries with the sweet potato fries.

-- Peruvian Ceviche ($6 HH) - Purple potato chips and a great tasting yellow ceviche with generous helpings of avocado, tomatoes, and fish.

-- Hawaiian Poke ($9.5) - I still love the Poke even though it's not on Happy Hour anymore.  It's that good.

-- Spicy Tuna Roll ($6 HH) - The tuna had a little too much something (aioli?) mixed in, so the roll was a pinkish color rather than a deep red.  Not pretty on the eyes, but pretty in the tummy.

Extend the Happy Hour, goshdarnit!

excerpts: Huge coconut shrimp, big bowl of ceviche, tacos and spicy tuna rolls, ribs...
It's crazy
I didn't come here until recently
and I only live a block away.
Also nice to have late hh option.
spicy tuna.author: Vivian H.
spicy tuna.review: Have been here for happy hour a few times and it's always such a surprisingly great value, and quite delicious! I've tried just about everything on the happy hour menu, and it's pretty extensive. Huge coconut shrimp, big bowl of ceviche, tacos and spicy tuna rolls, ribs... It's crazy I didn't come here until recently and I only live a block away. Also nice to have late hh option.

excerpts: Ordered the spicy tuna roll, the fish tacos, and the fried calamari.
spicy tuna.author: Joshua P.
spicy tuna.review:
It's just aiiiite.  Ordered the spicy tuna roll, the fish tacos, and the fried calamari.  The fried calamari was a little too greasy imo. 

However, with all that being said, I think this place will be a good place to just hang out and drink with a large party.

excerpts: Spicy tuna roll and calamari are good apps here.
spicy tuna.author: Danielle S.
spicy tuna.review: Went two nights in a row, that good! Tai curry bowl is amazing. Spicy tuna roll and calamari are good apps here.

excerpts: Also ordered was a spicy tuna roll- while it was ok, large and generous, and I completely devastated it-
the sushi will not be what brings me back here.
The sole, overall great menu diversity, and the Drake's beer on tap (dark and delicious) will.
$60 for everything including the tip was quite reasonable from my perspective.
See you again soon (but probably your Chestnut St restaurant as its closer to my home).
spicy tuna.author: Andy S.
spicy tuna.review:
We had an excellent meal at Pacific Catch in the Inner Sunset a couple of nights ago.
The place was extremely busy on a Monday night around 8pm, which is a testament to the quality and variety on the menu, as well as the reasonable pricing.

My wife enjoyed a very generous portion of fried coconut shrimp with sweet potato fries.  My dinner was a very nice plate of crusted filet of sole (allegedly 'local' sole) with brown rice and asparagus.  Sole is my weak spot, and I eat it nearly everywhere I can- and this was truly tasty and I cleared the plate completely.  Also ordered was a spicy tuna roll- while it was ok, large and generous, and I completely devastated it- the sushi will not be what brings me back here.  The sole, overall great menu diversity, and the Drake's beer on tap (dark and delicious) will.  $60 for everything including the tip was quite reasonable from my perspective. See you again soon (but probably your Chestnut St restaurant as its closer to my home).

excerpts: I had the spicy tuna roll and that was pretty good and really filling and
spicy tuna.author: Kate T.
spicy tuna.review:
It was surprisingly good! It looked like a chain restaurant so I wasn't sure about it but me and my sister were really hungry so we thought we'd give it a try. Our server was friendly and prompt and we never had to try and flag him down. 
The food was pretty good and reasonably priced. We started off with the ahi Serrano poke; the fish tasted fresh, didn't smell funny and it the flavors blended well together. I had the spicy tuna roll and that was pretty good and really filling and my sister had the mahi mahi sandwich and that was really good too. The best part was the bread pudding with the vanilla ice cream and coffee sauce....my god that was delicious!

excerpts:
Spicy Pacific Martini: 5 stars
Calamari: 5 stars
Ceviche: 5 stars
Spicy Tuna Roll: added avocado.

5 stars
Steak tacos : 5 stars
spicy tuna.author: Sabrina M.
spicy tuna.review:
I love the food and the service is exceptional. Happy Hour twice a day and they don't skimp on the portions. I've come here over 20 times and I have never been disappointed. Specials are always changing and are always good. Great list of Beers, knowledgable staff, managers remember you, ask how you are, really care. 
Spicy Pacific Martini: 5 stars
Calamari: 5 stars
Ceviche: 5 stars
Spicy Tuna Roll: added avocado. 5 stars
Steak tacos : 5 stars

excerpts: Spicy Tuna Sushi Roll ($8.50) -
The sushi roll was huge.
very filling
spicy tuna.author: Liza T.
spicy tuna.review:
first time came here and I love it.......

We had reservation at 7:30pm but we were15 minutes early.  Good that we got seated right the way.   Parking was a nightmare there.  Make sure you come early to allow yourself to look for parking.

All the staffs were friendly there.  Our server was very nice and friendly but was lacking service toward the end of the meal,  I guess he was too busy with the other big party (15 people).  He was pretty slow and did not refill our water.

The menu was extensive.  There were a lot of varieties that you could choose from.  You can choose from Salad, Rice Bowls, Tacos, Sandwiches, etc...

What we ordered:

Pacific Ceviche Trio ($17) - a sampling of shrimp ceviche, Hawaiian poke & Peruvian ceviche with chips.  It was great.  The portion was good for share.  I really like the purple potato chips.  It was perfect to eat with the poke.  Poke was so fresh and flavorful.  

Sweet Potato Fries ($6) - Portion was big.  The fries was so good.  Thick, crispy outside and soft inside.  It came with ginger wasabi aioli and sweet Thai chili sauces.  I think the wasabi aioli was better with the fries.  

Spicy Tuna Sushi Roll ($8.50) - The sushi roll was huge.  very filling......everything was so fresh.

California Roll ($9.00) - Again, the roll was big.  The crab meat was real crab salad.  Tasty.......

I got the Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl ($15).  It had tuna, wakame salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, cucumber, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori and soy-wasabi sauce.  I agree with other Yelpers.  The portion was huge and had a lot of rice but not much fish.  $15 was a little bit over price.  But the taste was pretty good.   The fish was fresh and flavorful.  I got half brown rice and half salad.  All ingredients were very fresh and tasty.  The only thing is the soy-wasabi sauce was little bit too much.  Kinda of salty to me.

My sister got the Ahi Rice Bowl ($15).  The ingredients were the same as the other rice bowls except the fish.  Ahi was very fresh.  I did not read the menu carefully.  If I knew the Ceviche Trio had poke, I would order Ahi rice bowl instead.

I really wanted to try their mochi for the dessert but I was too full.....Ok, next time!

excerpts: My partner and I shared the spicy tuna rolls which were amazing.
spicy tuna.author: Giovanni G.
spicy tuna.review: I have lived in the neighborhood for many years, but had never eaten at Pacific Catch.  Firstly, the service was amazing.  We were seated almost immediately upon our arrival (granted it was 4pm on a Saturday).  Amanda was great, her service was fast and on point.  My partner and I shared the spicy tuna rolls which were amazing.  We also shared the Wasabi Ahi Sandwich along with the the Spicy Mahi Mahi Sandwich.  To drink I had the blood orange margarita (I highly recommend it).

excerpts: We shared the calamari, ceviche, original Hawaiian poki, and split the spicy tuna salad.
Everything was fresh, delicious, and brought in a timely manner.
The staff is very friendly and accommodating.
They also have a great selection of wine.
(The Riesling was great with the fish!)
I will definitely be returning!
spicy tuna.author: Gayane B.
spicy tuna.review: I came here for the first time with a friend after hearing so much about this place! Definitely not disappointed! We shared the calamari, ceviche, original Hawaiian poki, and split the spicy tuna salad. Everything was fresh, delicious, and brought in a timely manner. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. They also have a great selection of wine. (The Riesling was great with the fish!) I will definitely be returning!

excerpts:
Con's: 
-Parking is a pain; I drove around for 25 minutes before settling for a parking spot on a busy, busy street 
-Their spicy tuna and anything that is supposed to be mildly spicy is out of this world HOT.
I love spicy tuna and anything with a kick, but geez louise, this was just ridiculous.
I only ate half of my roll.
Other than those few cons, I plan on coming back...just not for the spicy tuna or fish tacos.
spicy tuna.author: Jasmin W.
spicy tuna.review:
Not bad, not bad at all. 

Pro's: 
-"Inexpensive" for a seafood restaurant 
-Exceptional waiter service 
-Great location--LITERALLY across the street from Golden Gate Park, just walking distance from all the museums, and a few blocks away from Haight & Ashbury 
-Yummy appetizers :) 

Con's: 
-Parking is a pain; I drove around for 25 minutes before settling for a parking spot on a busy, busy street 
-Their spicy tuna and anything that is supposed to be mildly spicy is out of this world HOT. I love spicy tuna and anything with a kick, but geez louise, this was just ridiculous. I only ate half of my roll. 
-Their fish tacos are dredged in sauce and fried so much that I forgot I was eating fish for a second. 

Other than those few cons, I plan on coming back...just not for the spicy tuna or fish tacos.

excerpts:
Tuna Poke
Spicy Tuna Roll
CA Roll (REAL Crab!)
spicy tuna.author: Maggie C.
spicy tuna.review:
Two words: HAPPY HOUR. For $40, yes forty dollars (including a $10 tip b/c Grayson was a rockstar server!):

Tuna Poke
Spicy Tuna Roll
CA Roll (REAL Crab!)
Crab Rangoons (SUCCULENT morsels)
Sweet Potato Fries uh-mazing (dip them in the crab rangoon sauce!)

All regular servings  = $30 (including a soda and tax? UNREAL) 

Bottles of Sriracha on every table...be still my beating heart. 

Happy Hour. 4-6 and after 10. 'Nuff said.

excerpts: Spicy Tuna Roll:
This roll was actually spicy, which I appreciated.
spicy tuna.author: Rose J.
spicy tuna.review:
The bar area was already packed at 4:15pm on a Friday but my bf and I were quickly seated to begin our happy hour experience.  We sat at one of the tables with the tall bar stools, which was quite uncomfortable as the bottom of the table was not hollow for our legs to fit into.  My knees kept hitting the sides of the table. 

Now for the food.  I was tempted to order everything on their Bar Bites menu but opted to have just the first 5 items (minus the edamame beans and sweet potato fries) and 2 refreshing cosmos - YUM YUM.  I have been here before but for some reason the food was not as good as I remembered.  I had the following in the order of favorite to least favorite:

Asparagus & Shiitake Roll: It was an interesting vegetarian take on a sushi roll and I found the asparagus tempura and the tiny strings of mushroom and carrot to be quite lovely.

Thai Coconut Shrimp: It's funny because when I had my first bite, I was like "OMG...it feels like a Thai restaurant in my mouth."  Now looking at the menu as I write this entry, the dish's name is quite befitting. The coconut flavors are so quintessentially Thai.  I loved the crunch of the crispy coconut flakes and the juicy shrimp.  Frankly, I ended up just eating the coconut flake outer layer instead of the shrimp because it was so good.  The sweet and sour dipping sauce (that you can buy at any Asian market) was a nice complement. 

Spicy Tuna Roll: This roll was actually spicy, which I appreciated.  It was yummy with the bitterness of the daikon sprouts.  

Hawaiian Poke:  This was a disappointment as everyone had been raving about it.  Mainly because the poke tasted so gummy.  It did not simply melt in my mouth and the chopped green onions were a bit too overpowering.  I do like my poke to be marinated for a few hours so that the fish really soaks up the flavors but I just felt it had been marinated too long.  And the crispy chips started to give me a headache...which I get when I eat too much fried food.  Disappointing.

Spicy Cabo Calamari:  Pretty good but nothing too spectacular.  It was interesting that they also deep-fried slices of lemon and peppers.  The peppers were really yummy and SPICY...hehe...I attempted to eat the lemons too, but I suggest you not do that.      

The food is pretty good and very well priced. They also played good music...love Bob Marley. :) I think I hyped myself up for this dining experience as I hadn't been here in a long time.  I probably won't go for a few months.  I'm sure I will start missing the Coconut Shrimp by then.

excerpts: We ordered a steak taco, spicy tuna roll, and salmon poké.
The spicy tuna roll was indeed spicy but tolerable if you like spicy food and my poké was pretty good too.
I saw some reviews of people getting sick or not liking theirs but so far I'm feeling fine.
Overall a very good restaurant.
Must try!
spicy tuna.author: Andrea M.
spicy tuna.review: Went there for my first time today for a late birthday lunch for me with a friend for happy hour. Sat at the bar and got promptly waited on. We ordered a steak taco, spicy tuna roll, and salmon poké. Our waitor recommended this seared ahi tuna taco that was sooooo good. He also recommended my friend this spicy margarita drink that had vodka, passionfruit juice & jalapeños in it. It was good but WAY too spicy for us lol. No harm though for happy hour since it was only like $4. I paired my food with the mai thai. *caution* it is very strong so be prepared lol. (I tend to like my drinks strong anyways but it was stronger than I expected. Basically took shots towards the bottom of the drink) The spicy tuna roll was indeed spicy but tolerable if you like spicy food and my poké was pretty good too. I saw some reviews of people getting sick or not liking theirs but so far I'm feeling fine. Overall a very good restaurant. Must try!

excerpts: I wasn't a big fan of spicy tuna since i can't stand too much wasabi, but if you're a wasabi fan you'll like it.
spicy tuna.author: Dorris W.
spicy tuna.review:
They have a really good happy hour. A lot of different drink and food choices! Most happy hour places only give you a few selections, but they give you a wide variety.

The calamari and sweet potato fries were amazing! LARGE PORTION AND CHEAP! 

I wasn't a big fan of spicy tuna since i can't stand too much wasabi, but if you're a wasabi fan you'll like it.

excerpts: Their bar bites include the asparagus roll, spicy tuna roll, and spicy calamari, all for about 5-6 bucks each.
spicy tuna.author: William S.
spicy tuna.review:
Can't believe I haven't written a review on this place.  I used to come here all the time when I lived in the Inner Sunset, particularly for the late night happy hour, which I loved.  Their bar bites include the asparagus roll, spicy tuna roll, and spicy calamari, all for about 5-6 bucks each.  Beers are standard and 3 bucks, well drinks are 4.    

I do sometimes come here as a safe dinnertime option, and it's fine, but I have admittedly waited 4 hours to eat dinner just so I can come here after 10 pm for the happy hour deals.

Sometimes they're inconsistent with their late night HH because one time I went at 10 and they were like closing shop already, so don't get mad at me if that happens to you!

excerpts: Try the poke, sweet potato fries, or spicy tuna roll.
That said, happy hour is the only time I'd let the Catch reel me in.
spicy tuna.author: Lou S.
spicy tuna.review:
Don't get caught up in the hype. 

The entrees are all about $15 but aren't worth more than $10. The salads are unimpressive; the bowls are better but nothing spectacular.  

Happy hour (4-6, 10-11:30) is a good deal, with quality tap beer and small dishes $2-6. Try the poke, sweet potato fries, or spicy tuna roll. That said, happy hour is the only time I'd let the Catch reel me in.

excerpts: Spicy tuna roll.
Actually spicy.
I'm always a sucker for maguro with daikon sprouts.
spicy tuna.author: Kristine W.
spicy tuna.review:
ALL my cravings are always satisfied here. Probably because their menu is so random--Asian-Latin-whatever...it's all about the Benjamins...err, I mean the FISHIES!

First thing's first--FREE edamame and those cute little Goldfish pretzels!

Fish taco platter--mahi mahi and fried shrimp tacos. Squirt those bad boys with some lime and they're ready to go! Comes with a small side salad and black beans. Probably my favorite side salad ever.

Spicy tuna roll. Actually spicy. I'm always a sucker for maguro with daikon sprouts. Oh and it's a honker of a roll.

GINGER WHISKEY MOJITO! Probably one of THE best cocktails I've ever had. Refreshing, yet warm and earthy from the whiskey and mint. MUST TRY!

Service. On par, per usual.

Basically, I LOVE PC! Where else can you get tacos, fries, sushi, and some bomb-ass cocktails (yes, I said "bomb-ass")? It's the total package!

excerpts: We got: plenty of beer, sweet potato fries, calamari, spicy tuna roll and a few sides of rice.
I know, nothing totally unique
but regardless we had a great experience.
After all the beer I was too full to order a real entree.
Fast service, quality food at a great price, all on a beautiful day in SF.
I cant wait to go back and try the wasabi bowls.
Also, I am intrigued about the Chestnut location.
spicy tuna.author: Holl T.
spicy tuna.review:
Ever since the weird appetizers (cubed raw tuna a la cart served in a paper cup to drunk people) at the Christmas Yelp 'Elite' event last year, I have been wanting to pay a visit to Pacific Catch. I have always heard such good things and could not accept that lame appetizer as the true essence of Pacific Catch. After many hours at the Academy of Science, I wanted Seafood, and Pacific Catch was right there on the corner to full fill my needs! It just so happened to be happy hour too. We were welcomed into a spacious and rather 'safely' designed ambiance - nothing special but still comfortable and nice. 

Anyway, onto the food! Unfortunately I have to do that thing where you can only technically review the happy hour but everything I saw come out of the kitchen looked amazing! We got: plenty of beer, sweet potato fries, calamari, spicy tuna roll and a few sides of rice. I know, nothing totally unique but regardless we had a great experience. After all the beer I was too full to order a real entree. Fast service, quality food at a great price, all on a beautiful day in SF. I cant wait to go back and try the wasabi bowls. Also, I am intrigued about the Chestnut location.

excerpts:
here's their HH menu: 
Hawaiian Poke - sushi-grade ahi tuna in a sesame-soy marinade & spicy seasonings with wonton crisps
Asparagus & Shiitake - asparagus tempura & shiitake mushrooms with miso dressing
Spicy Tuna - ahi tuna with sriracha mayo
spicy tuna.author: Kapo T.
spicy tuna.review:
i m not a big asian fusion fan probably because i think asian food is traditional enough and shouldn't be made any different. i've been here 3 times and the food is OK. nothing great. the location is great if you need a snack from walking the GGP or the museums. (but there are other food to eat around there also).  

the only thing that i recommend is the happy hour here. on a nice sunny day, the bar and outside seating is packed.  happy hour is from 4p-6p so get your orders in before 6p.  

here's their HH menu: 
Hawaiian Poke - sushi-grade ahi tuna in a sesame-soy marinade & spicy seasonings with wonton crisps
Asparagus & Shiitake - asparagus tempura & shiitake mushrooms with miso dressing
Spicy Tuna - ahi tuna with sriracha mayo
Thai Coconut Shrimp - Thai sweet-chili sauce
Spicy Cabo Calamari - crispy chili & lemon with spicy chipotle sauce
Warm Edamame - Hawaiian Alaea sea salt
Basket of Fries - "signature" sweet potato, traditional or spicy 

and yup, we ordered 3 of everything on the HH menu to beat the time! get their sweet potato fries, i like that one the best

excerpts: I ordered the shrimp tempura sushi and my friend got the spicy tuna and a vegetarian roll.
The rolls are huge and definitely well priced for 8 pieces ($7.00-8.00.)
spicy tuna.author: L. L.
spicy tuna.review:
This restaurant has something for everyone! My good friend and I brought our moms here after a visit to the Academy of Sciences on one of those rare, gloriously sunny Sundays. My friend and I wanted sushi and our moms wanted fish and chips or ceviche so we came here.

I was surprised the restaurant wasn't more crowded on such a beautiful day. We got a table outside and sipped beer and pisco sours in the warm sun. My friend's mom did not like her pisco sour martini, she said it tasted like it was made from a mix. Well, in all fairness it was a pisco sour *martini* so it was not going to taste exactly like a pisco sour. She is from Chile and a connoisseur :)

I ordered the shrimp tempura sushi and my friend got the spicy tuna and a vegetarian roll. The rolls are huge and definitely well priced for 8 pieces ($7.00-8.00.) They drizzle a mayo-like sauce on them so if you're a purist I would suggest skipping the sauce.

We got the sweet potato fries and they were just as good as everyone else has commented here. I've never had bad ones so I have nothing to compare them to. I loved the horseradish dipping sauce they served with them. I'd like to come back just for drinks and appetizers sometime.

My friend's mom got the shrimp ceviche which was very good. It was loaded with cilantro and avocado. It came with corn chips for dipping. My mom got the fish and chips and was very happy with hers. Overall, everything was delicious, fresh, flavorful and satisfying. 

The service was great too. Our table was tiny but we had two servers helping us rearrange things to get everything to fit. I couldn't imagine a better way to spend my Sunday, sitting in the sun, sipping a corona with lime, eating sushi and sweet potato fries with my friend and our lovely moms. I can't wait to do this again!

excerpts: Spicy Tuna Rolls, calamari, and sweet potato fries for only $3.
The spicy tuna roll was OK, but everything else was heaven.
It also helps that there's $3 pints and $4 well drinks.
spicy tuna.author: Marissa N.
spicy tuna.review:
I love Pacific Catch.  Casual and easygoing environment with decent prices, good food, and fruity cocktails.

I've been here a few times before and I've always had a good time.  Several times I've ordered the fish tacos, poke, and fantastic speciality cocktails who's names I cannot recall.  I've had the coconut shrimp--which were only OK, but since they came with sweet potato fries, I was a happy camper and forgave the overly friend shrimps.  The desserts were HEAVEN.  The Macadamia Nut chocolate cake was to die for.  Very rich, so share with at least one other person.

I recent went there with a few friends for Happy Hour (4-6 weekdays).  I have to say I had a great time.  We sat near the bar on a few couches and ordered a truck-load of food: Poke for half price (instead of $11.95 its only $5.95, and seriously its the regular portion!), Spicy Tuna Rolls, calamari, and sweet potato fries for only $3.  The spicy tuna roll was OK, but everything else was heaven.  It also helps that there's $3 pints and $4 well drinks.  NICE.  

The service is attentive and friendly.  Our waiter got extra points for checking in with us before Happy Hour was over ("Do you want to order anything else before HH ends?"---loved it!).

PC is also a place I want to bring friends who visit from out of town. Its a nice place to grab some fusion Pacific-region food and fancy cocktails that you can't find anywhere else.

Parking off of Irving is always tough, but during happy hour it was easy to find parking on surrounding streets.  By 7pm, the dinner crowd rolled in deep.  I suggest carpooling to save some time and space.

excerpts: If you have to get sushi, their spicy tuna roll stands out.
spicy tuna.author: CT L.
spicy tuna.review:
"Spooning leads to forking" may be great nocturnal advice for an intimately-challenged couple, but it sure is not a pretty sight for a couple to be eating with their spoon AND fork at the same time. 

It was an eye opening experience to see them shoveling their fried rice with their Ahi Tuna poke (rhymes with hokey-pokey) almost non-stop until their plates were clean.  I almost said to our server:  I wanna have what they are having.  

If you have never tried Pacific Catch, please try some of their best Asian/ Fusion dishes: shrimp ceviche, crab and avocado salad, poke wasabi bowl, ahi bowl, rock cod, and their sweet potato fries.  They have been consistently delicious at this location.  Also opt for the brown rice as a healthy option.  

If you have to get sushi, their spicy tuna roll stands out.

Since Pacific Catch's parking lot fills up quickly, you can park one block away in Golden Gate Park.  You are close to the museums and botanical garden - perfect to stroll after a date.

Drinks are a bit on the weak side, even though the pomegranate mojitos and lemongrass mojitos are tasty before the ice melts.

Decor is nice and roomy inside with a few outdoor tables.
Bathroom is pleasantly clean.  Servers and hostesses are friendly.

Tips:
*  Call ahead for best seating.  Otherwise they will seat you close to the bar and not in the booths.
 
It was the couple's anniversary, and maybe they were in a hurry to move onto their next activity.  Anyway, I wish them happy spooning and happy forking!

excerpts:
a spicy tuna roll, crispy oysters, and a bottle of dry sake were a nice late night treat.
also worth mentioning were the shrimp ceviche and
hawaiian style poke served at the Yelp Holiday party.
also got a chance to chat briefly with Chandon the chef at this Pacific Catch.
nice guy who manages a kitchen that serves a quality product.
spicy tuna.author: Jeff W.
spicy tuna.review:
restaurants like Pacific Catch make living in SF special.
a spicy tuna roll, crispy oysters, and a bottle of dry sake were a nice late night treat.
also worth mentioning were the shrimp ceviche and hawaiian style poke served at the Yelp Holiday party. also got a chance to chat briefly with Chandon the chef at this Pacific Catch. nice guy who manages a kitchen that serves a quality product.

excerpts: That and the spicy tuna roll, sweet potato fries, and two orders of the let's get saucy roll.
Spicy tuna roll wasn't that good, but I really liked the let's get saucy roll.
Could've eaten that for days especially since I'm not the type of person that gets fried sushi rolls lol.
It's an exception.
spicy tuna.author: Diane L.
spicy tuna.review: Came here for a quick HH & had like 4 margaritas lol. That and the spicy tuna roll, sweet potato fries, and two orders of the let's get saucy roll. Spicy tuna roll wasn't that good, but I really liked the let's get saucy roll. Could've eaten that for days especially since I'm not the type of person that gets fried sushi rolls lol. It's an exception.

excerpts: At this local, I've had the tuna wasabi bowl, the spicy tuna roll (both brown rice), the house salad and the sweet potato fries.
The fries never disappoint but the 2 other dishes and salad weren't that tasty.
spicy tuna.author: Susan C.
spicy tuna.review:
I've only had the fish tacos at the Marina location and that's what gave their review 4 stars and this one only 3.  At this local, I've had the tuna wasabi bowl, the spicy tuna roll (both brown rice), the house salad and the sweet potato fries.  The fries never disappoint but the 2 other dishes and salad weren't that tasty.  They were under-seasoned and the brown rice wasn't as soft as I've made or had in other restaurants.

But the service was up to par, the atmosphere was sweet, and the bartenders were cute.  Hahaha.

excerpts: p  Wanted something close to the spicy tuna bowl I had at Aloha Sushi in Honolulu....
rice, 2 scoops of spicy tuna, and all the fixins in a bowl.
The bf suggested Pacific Catch for the comparable taste.
Parking was a (%&# as usual around 9th/Irving on a beautiful Sunday afternoon right next to GG park.
spicy tuna.author: Tammy H.
spicy tuna.review:
Still not off the Hawaii tip =p  Wanted something close to the spicy tuna bowl I had at Aloha Sushi in Honolulu....rice, 2 scoops of spicy tuna, and all the fixins in a bowl.  The bf suggested Pacific Catch for the comparable taste.  
Parking was a (%&# as usual around 9th/Irving on a beautiful Sunday afternoon right next to GG park.  All good...beauiful day in the sunset...cant beat those!!  Walked past the cute little tables in their patio and was seated right away and attended to.  The entire menu looked super yum!  I seriously had to narrow it down from sweet potato fries, crispy oysters, teriyaki bowls, macademia crusted seabass, catfish sandwich, sushi....it was rather extensive!!  We finally narrowed it down to....

Spicy Fries:  Normal fries just tossed with a cajun seasoning I think.  I LOVE fries so it was a great version...especially since they were "skinny" fries that were super crispy.  The dipping sauces were a nice touch: sweet chili sauce (the one for lumpia!!...I blended that combo LONG before I came here!!  I like their thinking here) and a creamy miso dip!!  yum!!  Mix them together...its perfect!

Salmon Wasabi Bowl:  I thought it was going to be raw salmon but it turned out to be grilled. Apparently the raw stuff is the Hawaiian Poke?  How the hell was I suppose to know that??!!  I wish there was a description on the menu.  Boooo!!  Even though I was in the mood for raw fish the salmon was a great compliment to the brown rice covered with a wasabi miso sauce, radish sprouts, seaweed salad, cucumber salad, pickled ginger and avocado.  It was all the ingredients to a honkin sushi roll but in a bowl.  For about $15, the portions were huge, fresh, and tastey.  I probably ate a little less than half and was STUFFED!  

Tuna Wasabi Bowl: Same condiments in the bowl just with lighly seared tuna.

I think I was a little disappointed that the salmon was cooked, obviously my fault, but I still enjoyed my meal.  Looking around at the other tables and their selections, the wasabi bowl was probably the best priced dish.  The menu will definitely bring me back to finalize their rating.  I cant wait to try all the other delicious goodies....crispy oysters....mmmm...cant wait!!!

excerpts: I ordered two sushi rolls, the spicy tuna roll and the sake sake roll (salmon, avocado, sprouts, and lemon zest).
The rolls tasted good, but the tuna roll felt a little rubbery to me.
spicy tuna.author: Storm T.
spicy tuna.review:
Pacific Catch was okay. It was good but not especially good. I ordered two sushi rolls, the spicy tuna roll and the sake sake roll (salmon, avocado, sprouts, and lemon zest). The rolls tasted good, but the tuna roll felt a little rubbery to me. Also, I wasn't expecting the center of the sake sake roll to be just avocado, as opposed having some sort of meat in the middle, but I like avocado, so it was alright.

The service, however, was good. My server was friendly, and I got my food quickly even though the restaurant was crowded. If you are willing to spend about $22 on two average-tasting sushi rolls, you can go. If you're like me, though, and find that to be a lot of money to spend on food that isn't that great, I'd pass.

excerpts: Ordered almost all of the happy hour appetizers: sweet potato fries, calamari, spicy tuna roll, and poke.
I'm not sure how discounted the happy hour pricing was, but they all seemed pretty cheap for the serving size.
Both the fries and the calamari were fried crispy and light, not at all greasy.
Poke was good, but not the best cuts of tuna, and it seemed a little heavy on the sauce.
Spicy tuna roll was good, and I'm not usually a fan of "spicy" rolls.
spicy tuna.author: marissa a.
spicy tuna.review:
Went for happy hour last Friday.  We got there early enough to snag seats at the bar, but the bar area filled up pretty quickly after we arrived.  The dining room is huge (and was pretty empty), but happy hour deals are only good if you sit in the bar area. Why?? This rule made it difficult for groups larger than 3 or 4 to sit together.

Ordered almost all of the happy hour appetizers: sweet potato fries, calamari, spicy tuna roll, and poke.  I'm not sure how discounted the happy hour pricing was, but they all seemed pretty cheap for the serving size.  Both the fries and the calamari were fried crispy and light, not at all greasy.  Poke was good, but not the best cuts of tuna, and it seemed a little heavy on the sauce.  Spicy tuna roll was good, and I'm not usually a fan of "spicy" rolls.  

Nice alcohol selection at the bar, and decent variety of beer on tap.  Also tried a kumquat mojito and a lemongrass mojito - yummm.  Not too sweet.  Service was ok, although it was hard to figure out who our server/bartender actually was.

excerpts:
Don't be fooled by their "fancy-dancy" name, NOTHING special about this place and this was what we ordered:

Spicy Tuna roll - very fresh and the ONLY satisfying dish
Sweet potato fries - decent and had better
Calamari - the WORST I ever had.
spicy tuna.author: Katy N.
spicy tuna.review:
Don't be fooled by their "fancy-dancy" name, NOTHING special about this place and this was what we ordered:

Spicy Tuna roll - very fresh and the ONLY satisfying dish
Sweet potato fries - decent and had better
Calamari - the WORST I ever had. HUGE batter covered these  diminutive shellfish & BLAND like there was no tomorrow!!!!!!!!
Spicy Ahi sandwich - mediocre
And there was one more entree yet I can't remembered, guess it tells how you how much I adore this place :P LOL

excerpts: Even though we ordered the Firecracker Salmon Roll and Spicy Tuna Roll, I don't recommend trying the sushi here.
It lacks flavor, authenticity, and freshness..but I didn't expect it to be good
so I wasn't surprised.
spicy tuna.author: Jen Y.
spicy tuna.review:
I was excited to try the Pacific Catch on 9th because I've heard great things about the space and it's kind of a hassle to go all the way to Chestnut. The look of the restaurant is beautifully casual and comfortable with plenty of seating. For that, I give this restaurant big ups. 

Our waitress on the other hand was just blah. It looked like she cared more about socializing and dancing with her co-worker friends more than earning her tip from us. The whole time she seemed insincere from the moment she brought us our drinks to handing us the check. 

I always liked Pacific Catch's food, even though it's slightly over-priced.  The food is the same in terms of taste and the sweet potato fries (which I love w/ the wasabi aeoli) were consistantly yummy. Even though we ordered the Firecracker Salmon Roll and Spicy Tuna Roll, I don't recommend trying the sushi here. It lacks flavor, authenticity, and freshness..but I didn't expect it to be good so I wasn't surprised. The fish tacos are always delicious; especially the Mahi Mahi Fish Taco which is one of my favorites. 

The atmosphere, location, and food is great. However, the waitress we had and the sushi are not. Something else was just lacking as a whole but I can't put my finger on it. But, I will be back to this location..

Service: 2
Food: 4
Atmosphere: 4
Overall: 3.5

excerpts: Before our orders were up, we had their crispy oysters and spicy tuna roll.
The oysters weren't greasy and the roll had a good kick.
As for the tacos, I liked the shrimp one better than the baja.
Cod (which was the daily catch featured in the baja taco) is a pretty bland fish unless you pair it with a flavorful partner.
In this case, it was the tomatillo salsa.
Good thing I ate that one first before the shrimp or else
I probably would have been a bit disappointed.
The shrimp taco was much better.
Even more so with the avocado and pico de gallo.
My friend and I could have ended our mission right there, but I managed to set aside some room for dessert.
Normally I would skip it, but I heard some good things about the dulce de leche spring rolls.
The concoction came drizzled with a generous amount of caramel sauce and a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
Yum!
I think the filling inside of the roll was cheesecake, not sure.
It tends to get pretty rich after a while.
Once again, I'm stuffed.
I'll have to put in a few rigorous workouts next week to compensate for all this eating.
spicy tuna.author: Rhia R.
spicy tuna.review: The days before, the day of, and those following my birthday have been filled with nothing but fun. That, and a ridiculous amount of food. I have been so well fed this week it's not even funny. One of my best friends took me here for dinner last night. PC was fairly busy in spite of the rain. She said I could order anything I want. (No, you didn't just say that!) I wasn't planning on stuffing my face, but surely I was in the mood for some tacos. I chose the double platter with one traditional baja and one cabo shrimp taco. Before our orders were up, we had their crispy oysters and spicy tuna roll. The oysters weren't greasy and the roll had a good kick. As for the tacos, I liked the shrimp one better than the baja. Cod (which was the daily catch featured in the baja taco) is a pretty bland fish unless you pair it with a flavorful partner. In this case, it was the tomatillo salsa. Good thing I ate that one first before the shrimp or else I probably would have been a bit disappointed. The shrimp taco was much better. Even more so with the avocado and pico de gallo. My friend and I could have ended our mission right there, but I managed to set aside some room for dessert. Normally I would skip it, but I heard some good things about the dulce de leche spring rolls. The concoction came drizzled with a generous amount of caramel sauce and a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Yum! I think the filling inside of the roll was cheesecake, not sure. It tends to get pretty rich after a while. Once again, I'm stuffed. I'll have to put in a few rigorous workouts next week to compensate for all this eating.

excerpts: We ordered the sake salmon sashimi, spicy tuna roll, grilled ahi tuna salad and ahi poke wasabi bowl.
The spicy tuna roll had plump pieces of tuna and rolled into a pretty good size roll.
The sake salmon sashimi however was a flop.
When the dish came, it was razor thin.
It tasted like kirkland smoked salmon from costco and the sauce was like watered down cream cheese, we had no clue where the sake infused part was.
Totally not worth the $9.
The salad and the rice bowl were delicious and a lot of food.
The ahi poke was flavorful with a wasabi-ginger sauce over warm rice, wakame and pickled veggies.
spicy tuna.author: Yun W.
spicy tuna.review:
Couple friends took us here to dinner on a Tuesday night.

I really like the decor of this place.  Love the modern look and they have nice outdoor seating with heat lamps.  

Service was great.  The guy was super friendly and attentive.  Once we sat down we got a nice little muchies of edamame and pretzels (I guess a little fusion there too).

We ordered the sake salmon sashimi, spicy tuna roll, grilled ahi tuna salad and ahi poke wasabi bowl.  The spicy tuna roll had plump pieces of tuna and rolled into a pretty good size roll.  The sake salmon sashimi however was a flop.  When the dish came, it was razor thin.  It tasted like kirkland smoked salmon from costco and the sauce was like watered down cream cheese, we had no clue where the sake infused part was.   Totally not worth the $9.  The salad and the rice bowl were delicious and a lot of food.  The ahi poke was flavorful with a wasabi-ginger sauce over warm rice, wakame and pickled veggies.  I will definitely order that again.

This place is a good sit down place with friends and we will come back here next time.

excerpts: I order the spicy tuna roll and this wasabi salmon salad thing, and I was IMPRESSED!
The fish was unbelievably fresh, tasty and flavorful, and overall one of the best fishes I had in a while (both the spicy tuna and the salmon).
Have already gone back a second time and I love it!
But, beware of waitresses that won't come to your table for a whiiillleee.
The fish was unbelievably fresh, tasty and flavorful, and overall one of the best fishes I had in a while (both the spicy tuna and the salmon).
Have already gone back a second time and I love it!
But, beware of waitresses that won't come to your table for a whiiillleee.
spicy tuna.author: Lauren G.
spicy tuna.review:
WOW!!

When I walked into this place, didn't have very high expectations. Although there were a lot of people, the place was a little tacky. We sat down at the table lead by a host who wasn't friendly nor rude. But, when they served us their substitute for bread and butter, my expectations went way further down: their substitute was edamame beans and pretzel goldfish!! Although it's a cute idea to have goldfish at a place called pacific catch, it's a little cheap considering there are $8.95 sushi rolls!

I order the spicy tuna roll and this wasabi salmon salad thing, and I was IMPRESSED! The fish was unbelievably fresh, tasty and flavorful, and overall one of the best fishes I had in a while (both the spicy tuna and the salmon). Have already gone back a second time and I love it! But, beware of waitresses that won't come to your table for a whiiillleee.

excerpts: We had the spicy tuna sandwich and 3 tacos.
spicy tuna.author: Staci M.
spicy tuna.review:
I have had two really good experiences here.  The first was during their happy hour.  The poke was delicious and they did not skimp.  

A few nights ago, our (well, my) lazy ass decided on take-out.  We had the spicy tuna sandwich and 3 tacos.  The bbq salmon taco was amazing.  Same with the crispy shrimp one.  Sandwich was what I expected- very yum.  

And what was really cool was the care they took in getting the order together.  Sides of two sauces- sweet chili and aioli- for the sweet potato fries.  

I guess they had my boyfriend waiting pretty long for the order, so the bartender bought him a beer.  V cool of them- especially since the bf is not the bitching type and was prob sweetly surprised by the freebie.  THAT'S the stuff people remember.

excerpts: I also tried a bit of the sushi, just California Roll and Spicy Tuna.
Nothing special, so I can't speak for the quality of the specialty pieces, but if I was looking for quality basics or specialties...
I'd just go out for some sushi!
So decent sushi but not worth the price when there are much better options within walking distance.
spicy tuna.author: Taylor M.
spicy tuna.review:
Can't say I've been to the original location so I can't compare but I thought Pacific Catch was pretty good nonetheless. 
I had the fish and chips with the catch of the day. Quite good, extremely fresh fish (would be scared if it wasn't!). The dipping sauces added something special to the fish, which was fresh but not overwhelmingly tasty on its own, so I do recommend giving them a try (the Thai one especially). Sweet potato fries were fantastic, definitely the standout original of my meal. Probably the one thing that would get me coming back to Pacific Catch again!

I also tried a bit of the sushi, just California Roll and Spicy Tuna. Nothing special, so I can't speak for the quality of the specialty pieces, but if I was looking for quality basics or specialties... I'd just go out for some sushi! So decent sushi but not worth the price when there are much better options within walking distance. Also had a good beer from the rotating selection but it was almost $6!

So all in all, good food. Very good choice if you want a broad selection of choices on the menu, all with very fresh fish. The place seemed pretty popular on a Friday night, very trendy and nice setting. Service wasn't fantastic: very friendly, but took a while just to get water. Busy night though. For the negatives, can't recommend the sushi as a standout and the food wasn't special enough to be paying more than a 10-er for each dish (even the salads). Still. Great sweet potato fries. And sauces.

excerpts: That appeared again in the Spicy Tuna Rolls.
Both the latter and the Rock n Roll were crude creations I could easily have made better at home.
spicy tuna.author: Kimberly V.
spicy tuna.review:
Strictly gringo.
Good friends, good company, but not for good people who know good food.
It's a great location, so I can't imagine it can fail, especially with the "Happy Hour" 1/2-offs on some of their appetizers, and I would eat here again, possibly, if I were at the De Young or CAS and in a hurry, but it is palatable and little more.
We had Ahi Poke, which I always love for its memories of Kauai, but it was sloppily cut, with quite a bit of stringy "tuna floss" to chew through.  That appeared again in the Spicy Tuna Rolls.  Both the latter and the Rock n Roll were crude creations I could easily have made better at home.  Our Warm Edamame were covered in what looked to be Hawaiian salt, WAY too much of it, even for my salt-loving son, and even the Thai Iced Tea was just not right.
I think if people haven't enjoyed much good quality Pacific Rim cuisine they could enjoy the Coconut Shrimp and other selections, and the portions are fairly large (remember that word "crude" in the last paragraph?).  Probably a better idea is to come here for a couple of beers during Happy Hour and call it a day.

excerpts: The sweet potato fries, spicy tuna roll and Hawaiian poke with won ton chips were all satisfying as a matter of fact
it was too much food.
I've never been to a restaurant where I left 1/2 of the sushi..
I did that here.
You get alot of food and the happy hour prices are outstanding.
Great for families and groups.
spicy tuna.author: Sherie R.
spicy tuna.review: It's good. It's safe. It's kinda like a chain but a little better. The space is funky and has a really hip vibe. I like the pomegranate mojito I had. The sweet potato fries, spicy tuna roll and Hawaiian poke with won ton chips were all satisfying as a matter of fact it was too much food. I've never been to a restaurant where I left 1/2 of the sushi..I did that here. You get alot of food and the happy hour prices are outstanding. Great for families and groups.

excerpts: Spicy Tuna Rolls are 5 bucks and they actually put TUNA in it!
instead of half assing it.
place constantly amazes me.
spicy tuna.author: Brandon H.
spicy tuna.review: Awesome food.  Fish and Chips are perfectly cooked every time!  Sweet potato fries are amazing!  Happy hour here kicks ass.  Mother Ship on tap, cool bartenders, beautiful women working here and Spicy Tuna Rolls are 5 bucks and they actually put TUNA in it!  instead of half assing it.  place constantly amazes me.

excerpts: For example, the spicy tuna roll is really good and the sweet potato fries!
spicy tuna.author: Sonya D.
spicy tuna.review: I really like this restuarant. All of the cocktails I've had from here were really good..esp. the Ginger Pomegranate Martini..sooo good.  Plus they have a 10pm happy hour!! How cool is that? The bar food during the happy hour is cheap and yummy. For example, the spicy tuna roll is really good and the sweet potato fries!

excerpts: We  shared a rock n roll (eel - yummy!), a spicy tuna roll and a tempura salmon roll.
Everything tasted really fresh and, for a non-raw-sushi-eater such as me, it was a great assortment of user-friendly rolls.
I'm sure sushi experts might prefer to go elsewhere, but for sushi novices/lightweights this is a perfect middle ground.
spicy tuna.author: Beth T.
spicy tuna.review: I'm not a sushi expert...hell, I don't even LIKE sushi all that much. So when my husband craves it, as he did this weekend, I either have to give in or fndd a place like Pacific Catch that offers a varied menu of sushi and other seafood treats. When we sat down to dinner, I got sucked in to the sushi bandwagon and decided to split a few rolls with my dining companions. I was pleasantly surprised by how delicious it was. We  shared a rock n roll (eel - yummy!), a spicy tuna roll and a tempura salmon roll. Everything tasted really fresh and, for a non-raw-sushi-eater such as me, it was a great assortment of user-friendly rolls. I'm sure sushi experts might prefer to go elsewhere, but for sushi novices/lightweights this is a perfect middle ground.

excerpts: did I know that it is that pink sauce that provides the "spicy" in the spicy tuna rolls.
Without it, the rolls taste like a mouthful of sprouts.
spicy tuna.author: melissa o.
spicy tuna.review: I like Pacific Catch because it is lively and has a parking lot.  However, I think that the sushi is very sloppy and the rolls are falling apart.  Also, I'm not usually a fan of mystery pink sauce on my sushi but little did I know that it is that pink sauce that provides the "spicy" in the spicy tuna rolls.  Without it, the rolls taste like a mouthful of sprouts.

excerpts: Inside out roll - the spicy tuna on the outside wasn't spicy and it was creamier than I liked, like it had too much mayo.
inside out.author: Angie Y.
inside out.review:
First off, service was great! Hostess and waiter were both very nice, and the waiter checked up on us regularly. Unfortunately, I come back for food/drinks... good service is a bonus. 

Now onto happy hour... drinks and food. The Mai tai was great; it's not too strong but you can definitely taste the alcohol so you know they're not skimping on it. $7 for a glass or $34 for a pitcher with 5 servings ($1 saving). The food was overall subpar although portions were good--average $5.5-$6.50 / plate. 

Calamari - not crunchy; tasted almost stale (like it's been sitting out a while).
Salmon avocado poke - this was good. Fish tasted fresh. The chips that it came with was thin and crunchy, which I liked, but it tasted greasy. 
Inside out roll - the spicy tuna on the outside wasn't spicy and it was creamier than I liked, like it had too much mayo. 
Rising sun - the shrimp tempura wasn't crunchy on the inside, but I liked the fresh raw tuna on top.

In short, this wouldn't be my pick for happy hour but if my friends suggest it, I wouldn't fight them on it (if they've been here before and know what they're getting themselves into).

excerpts: We ordered the inside out roll, the poke trio and the mixed catch (fried oysters, fish and coconut shrimp) to share.
The sushi roll was pretty good and fresh.
The poke trio was just okay
...pretty pricey for what you get.
Then 15 more... before we got the mixed catch.
I literally was about to cancel my order when it came out.
And it was a huge disappointment.
The fish was good at first but it got soggy really fast and the batter quickly fell off.
The oysters were pretty good but also pretty tiny.
The coconut shrimp was my least favorite.
inside out.author: Erin H.
inside out.review:
Came here a week ago because our other restaurant pick was too crowded.  Since we were in a rush, we took a seat at a bar table.  The service was a little slow at first but they were quite visy for a Sunday afternoon.  We ordered the inside out roll, the poke trio and the mixed catch (fried oysters, fish and coconut shrimp) to share.  The sushi roll was pretty good and fresh.  The poke trio was just okay...pretty pricey for what you get.  Those two dishes came out relatively fast... and then the wait...

We waited 15 minutes...

Then 15 more... before we got the mixed catch.  I literally was about to cancel my order when it came out.  And it was a huge disappointment.  The fish was good at first but it got soggy really fast and the batter quickly fell off.  The oysters were pretty good but also pretty tiny.  The coconut shrimp was my least favorite.  The best thing on the plate was the tartar sauce (yup...).

Overall, this place is okay but nothing special, especially considering the price.

excerpts: My boyfriend got the fish tacos and the margarita while I got the Spicy Pacific cocktail (very good, minimal spice) and the inside out roll.
inside out.author: Katie S.
inside out.review:
I walked past this place off and on for 6 years before trying it, mainly because I assumed it was a tourist trap.

I finally noticed they had a happy hour menu and it's pretty awesome!

My boyfriend got the fish tacos and the margarita while I got the Spicy Pacific cocktail (very good, minimal spice) and the inside out roll. 

Everything was delicious, service was speedy, and if you sit near the window at the bar you get a view of the park!

A very solid happy hour spot. Would be great to bring guests out of town to or a few local friends.

excerpts: Love the inside out - combination of california roll and spicy ahi, you just can't go wrong there.
inside out.author: Melissa A.
inside out.review:
Over the last few years, Pacific Catch has definitely improved.  They've removed a lot of the really saucy items and have made a huge effort to make quality, Hawaiian style poke - and it works.    

Appetizers:  If you're going with a group, get the ceviche trio - there's something for everyone.  Super tasty and love the won ton chips.  

Sushi:  Love the inside out - combination of california roll and spicy ahi, you just can't go wrong there.

Rice Bowl:  Highly recommend the wasabi bowl with either the poke or the salmon.  Mix it all up so the rice gets nice and flavorful.  

Tacos:  Like that you can choose from 1, 2 or 3 and you can interchange them.  I like the mahi, it's lightly seasoned and has that grilled flavor and it's not heavy so you don't feel like shit when you leave.

Always check the specials menu, they do some really great stuff (currently loving the spicy creamy ahi and cedar plank salmon).

Wine list has also improved - so thanks for that!

excerpts: I got a inside out roll, which was perfect and my boyfriend got the sticky bbq bowl.
Both were full of flavor and we couldn't stop eating.
I didn't LOVE the agave margarita and that is literally my only complaint.
Altogether with tip and us getting one than one drink, the total was under $50!
inside out.author: Kaitlin P.
inside out.review:
So delicious! After a long day of being a tourist, this place has everything you could want. We happened in here at happy hour. I got a inside out roll, which was perfect and my boyfriend got the sticky bbq bowl. Both were full of flavor and we couldn't stop eating. 
I didn't LOVE the agave margarita and that is literally my only complaint. Altogether with tip and us getting one than one drink, the total was under $50!

excerpts: Pretty pricey place.. the two of us ended up sharing the Thai coconut shrimp & a tempura shrimp roll from the appetizer menu.
Food was really tasty and even though we just got appetizers it still left me satisfied.
The restaurant itself had a nice ambiance and it was very clean.
Service was good.
tempura shrimp.author: Mirelle M.
tempura shrimp.review:
Pretty pricey place.. the two of us ended up sharing the Thai coconut shrimp & a tempura shrimp roll from the appetizer menu. Food was really tasty and even though we just got appetizers it still left me satisfied. 
The restaurant itself had a nice ambiance and it was very clean. Service was good.

excerpts: The Tempura Shrimp Roll ($7) was pretty decent.
tempura shrimp.author: Jocelyn L.
tempura shrimp.review:
I recently rediscovered this place since my friend was eager to try their happy hour. They have happy hour twice a weekday, from 4-6pm and 10-closing. Not bad! So once we checked out the happy hour one Friday night, we were hooked.

I got the Riesling for $6. It wasn't the best Riesling I ever had, or even close, but it was decent and a great way to start the weekend. Let's just say I ordered 2 rounds!  The Tempura Shrimp Roll ($7) was pretty decent. Once again, it's not the best sushi you ever had, but for $7 and happy hour it was pretty good. 

Ambiance was quiet. The inner sunset doesn't quite draw the party animals like the Marina does. But I didn't mind, this is a fun place to catch up with a friend since you can hear each other.

excerpts: and I frequently order the Ecstasy Roll and the Tempura Shrimp.
Their drinks are okay.
Margaritas are alright but nothing to write home about (but enough to mention on Yelp
I suppose).
Customer service has always been friendly and prompt, and they seem to legitimately know their menu.
tempura shrimp.author: Mariah O.
tempura shrimp.review:
I love coming to Pacific Catch. It's on my way home from work and takeout is always fast, although I do prefer dining in when I get the chance. 
The Cabo Calamari is delicious -- try the fried lemon that it comes with, so good! 
Love their rice bowls and the Vietnamese Steak Sandwich is amazing (I order it almost every time). The sushi has always been great, boyfriend and I frequently order the Ecstasy Roll and the Tempura Shrimp. 
Their drinks are okay. Margaritas are alright but nothing to write home about (but enough to mention on Yelp I suppose). 
Customer service has always been friendly and prompt, and they seem to legitimately know their menu.

excerpts: It has tempura shrimp and avocado wrapped in ahi tuna with a citrus sauce.
I don't like that they stuff
pickled ginger into the roll but if you're like me, just request that they leave it out.
Otherwise it's a very tasty roll.
The ahi tuna is always fresh and flavorful.
I love that they give you big pieces of it too.
(We got that roll totally F-R-E-E! with the coupon in the Green Zebra book!)
tempura shrimp.author: Julia T.
tempura shrimp.review:
Out of the three Pacific Catch locations, I would say this is my overall favorite. Chestnut St. is just way too tiny and crowded, though that might result in the food tasting better because you had to fight so hard to park/get a table. Corte Madera's location is too embedded in the outdoor mall scene and has way too many kiddies running around. But this 9th Ave. location is pretty much perfect with plenty of seating for the bar and regular dining area. It also has its own parking lot so you don't have to compete for the street meters. 

Food is pretty consistent at all locations. You can count on the fact that mostly everything you order from the regular menu will be very good. Some of my favorites are the wasabi bowls (with brown or sushi rice) and any of the fried seafood baskets. I love the Mixed Catch Basket with fish, coconut shrimp and crispy oysters with jalapeño tartar. SO GOOD. Everything comes freshly fried with those awesome sweet potato fries.
