But eat everything while they are fresh! I don't recommend taking leftover fries home. They really those their flavor after they've cooled down. 

Though their sushi roll selection lacks raw fish, I think they are still made very well with the mostly cooked ingredients. One of my favorites and one that DOES have raw fish is the Rising Sun roll. It has tempura shrimp and avocado wrapped in ahi tuna with a citrus sauce. I don't like that they stuff pickled ginger into the roll but if you're like me, just request that they leave it out. Otherwise it's a very tasty roll. The ahi tuna is always fresh and flavorful.  I love that they give you big pieces of it too. (We got that roll totally F-R-E-E! with the coupon in the Green Zebra book!) I could dine happily on their sushi rolls alone. 

Just recently I ventured off from my regulars and tried one of the their specials: Trout bbq'd baja style so it was spice rubbed and grilled, served with tomatilla avocado sauce, some thin slices of veggies, and fresh grilled corn over sweet potato fries. I could tell the fish was very fresh but for me, it was TOO seasoned and got a little salty since the fish wasn't very thick. And though I had originally wanted the fries, I would now have preferred and wished that the fish was served over rice. I think I'll stick to my regulars next time. 

Big pluses:
-I've talked to the workers and seen for myself that Pacific Catch is environmentally conscious. They use biodegradable materials, from the takeout containers to the straw in your drink. Pacific Catch also practices composting from their kitchen to the leftover food scraps. Smiles all around. =D
-I don't know anywhere else that you can get UNLIMITED refills on Thai iced tea. I could drink three glasses easy. LOVE IT!

excerpts:
Tempura shrimp sushi - whole shrimps, fresh, delish
2.
Fish and chips (sweet potatoes fries)

- fish is tender, fries are yummy and not so mushy considering its type
3.
Spicy ahi sandwich - medium raw ...
on ciabatta bread ... has a nice spiciness that really compliments the fish ...
tempura shrimp.author: Chau L.
tempura shrimp.review:
The name itself makes me want to go eat here wondering what I'm going to catch =)   I had lunch here with my favorite guy and we ordered the following:
1.  Tempura shrimp sushi - whole shrimps, fresh, delish
2.  Fish and chips (sweet potatoes fries) - fish is tender, fries are yummy and not so mushy considering its type
3.  Spicy ahi sandwich - medium raw ... on ciabatta bread ... has a nice spiciness that really compliments the fish ... I like it a lot =)

The chair's comfortable, lighting is just right (not too dark nor bright), may be a bit overstaffed during lunch time because we sort of had 3 different waiters, and very attentive service ...

Just a bit cold where we sat ... and I had my beanie on heheh

excerpts: I got a shrimp taco a la carte and a firecracker salmon roll.
The shrimp taco wasn't that great, fell apart and the shrimps breading fell off them.
The roll was probably the best thing we ordered.
firecracker salmon.author: Hayley D.
firecracker salmon.review:
Came here for Valentine's Day and got a reservation through open table. 

Food:
We got the calamari appetizer which was good, except the people behind us got almost twice the amount we did.

I got a shrimp taco a la carte and a firecracker salmon roll. The shrimp taco wasn't that great, fell apart and the shrimps breading fell off them. The roll was probably the best thing we ordered. It was flavorful and good. 

My boyfriend got the petrale sole with dungunees crab. We expected that to be like half fish half crab, but in reality it was like a spoonful of crab and pretty small portion of fish too. It was a $30 entree and he was still hungry. Just wasn't explained clear enough on the menu I guess. 

Service:
We got seated exactly at the time of our reservation which was nice. Our waitress was nice but didn't really explain the specials and the menu. 

Overall our food was alright, not sure we will be coming back anytime soon :(

excerpts: We ordered the California Style Poke, Marinated Skirt Steak Rice Bowl, Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl, and Firecracker Salmon Roll.
We finished majority of it all, yes we did (no shame, I'm tellin' you.)
But anyway, I really enjoy their poke, the wonton chips that comes with it was soooo crunchy and thinly cut, it melted in my mouth (a little exaggeration there, but nevertheless, I loved it).
firecracker salmon.author: Anna L.
firecracker salmon.review:
You know you're hungry when your bill comes out to be around 90$ total with only 2 people. Or maybe we're just fatasses.

I was craving some Hawaiian Poke, so my best friend and I decided to dine here for dinner. We sat near the bar/lounge area; this is a great spot for a good picture if you're a crazy insta-food-ographer like myself #guilty

We ordered the California Style Poke, Marinated Skirt Steak Rice Bowl, Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl, and Firecracker Salmon Roll. We finished majority of it all, yes we did (no shame, I'm tellin' you.) But anyway, I really enjoy their poke, the wonton chips that comes with it was soooo crunchy and thinly cut, it melted in my mouth (a little exaggeration there, but nevertheless, I loved it). PERFECT!

The rice bowl, however, was not as impressive especially for the price of it. I thought my rice bowl was way too overflowing with sauce, which made it so much saltier than it should taste and let me tell you, I am not a big fan of salty food. Not only that, the stuff that comes in it was nothing out of the ordinary. My friend said the same thing regarding the Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl =/ 

We've also ordered drinks as well and I believe we got the Agave Margarita and Pacific Catch Mai Tai. Not too sure if these were the drinks but it balances out the food we ate and helped extract the saltiness in the rice bowl, which is a good thing I guess? 

Other than that, I will come back and try other poke because I am a huge fan of poke!

excerpts: We asked for brown rice for the rising sun and the firecracker salmon rolls.
I was not impressed by the rolls because the brown rice didn't stick too well and the rice fell apart.
firecracker salmon.author: Lisa C.
firecracker salmon.review:
Having been here for lunch, I was looking forward to dinner. I arrived thinking I wanted the seared ahi salad, but that quickly changed as we browsed the menu.  Instead, we opted for a few appetizers and two sushi rolls to share.  The sweet potato fries were irresistible- not too greasy; I kept chomping on them! The Hawaiian Poke and the Shrimp Ceviche starter plates both came with plenty of poke and shrimp pieces. I loved the lime-cilantro-avocado sauce the shrimps were covered in.

Though the starter plates were great, I think the sushi rolls were only ok.  We asked for brown rice for the rising sun and the firecracker salmon rolls.  I was not impressed by the rolls because the brown rice didn't stick too well and the rice fell apart.  I think the next time I'll skip the sushi rolls. 

Surprisingly, there was no wait at all for a Saturday night, and we were able to snag a nice corner window seat.

excerpts: Definitely try their Firecracker Salmon roll - you will not be dissapointed.
The ginger cooler I had was perfect and refreshing with my Firecracker Salmon roll..
The ginger cooler I had was perfect and refreshing with my Firecracker Salmon roll..
firecracker salmon.author: Vanessa W.
firecracker salmon.review:
I was highly dissappointed that a fish market/restaurant , which was what I was told, was replacing C.G. (Canvas Gallery) and for the longest time, I would not even give P.C. the time of day...until I tried it out a couple months ago. 

P.C. blew me away. I love it! I had the Ahi Poke bowl (sub. brown rice!) and it was healthy, delicious and the fish was so fresh. The sushi rolls there are huge and everything was priced very, very reasonably. Definitely try their Firecracker Salmon roll - you will not be dissapointed. I don't think I saw any Japanese/Asian chefs there, but hey, with sushi this good, I'm colorblind.

The ginger cooler I had was perfect and refreshing with my Firecracker Salmon roll..it was strong; yet not super sugary.

The service was excellent..no complaints there. Our server was nice, friendly and attentive. 

Pacific Catch "caught" my heart.

excerpts:
My meal:
"Firecracker Salmon" roll - $9.95: not a big fan of the over-induced daikon sprouts.
Didn't know I was ordering cooked-salmon
til
I got it.
Shouldn't have overlooked the 'tempura-salmon' description.
I'll try something else next time.
firecracker salmon.author: Diwata B.
firecracker salmon.review:
Fried Oysters. Poke Roll.  It's not "to-die-for" food but I'd eat there again none the less.  Service was un-noticeably good (not too bad, nothing spectacular).  They have a mini parking lot in the back, which is good considering the parking in the nearby streets.  

Appetizer: 
"Crispy Oysters" - $9.50: about 10 on the plate.  Fried.  would order it again

My meal:
"Firecracker Salmon" roll - $9.95: not a big fan of the over-induced daikon sprouts.  Didn't know I was ordering cooked-salmon til I got it.  Shouldn't have overlooked the 'tempura-salmon' description.  I'll try something else next time.
"Hawaiian Poke" roll - $8.95:  Giant cubed ahi in a roll (which I like)   I was diggin' the sesame-soy marinade.    

Got a taste of:
"Mixed Catch Basket" - $13.95
2 pieces of fish, 4 coconut shrimp & 3 crispy oysters with jalapeno tartar
No taste of coconut in my coconut shrimp.  The side of sweet potato fries were awesome.  I'd order that on it's own.

excerpts: The firecracker salmon roll, filed with  tempura salmon, chili sauce, avocado, cucumber, daikon sprouts and crispy shallots, was another winner.
There are eight pieces, so definitely a plate to split.
firecracker salmon.author: brewgirl b.
firecracker salmon.review:
I really liked Canvass, but this seafood place is a surprisingly tasty replacement.  Great cocktails.  I had a wonderful pisco sour, with the egg whites so, so mild.  My friend had the yuzo drop, with Hangar One vodka, the Japanes citrus fruit and a sugared rim--mmmmm.  

Food portions are huge, so expect to take something home at the end of meal.  Loved the crispy oysters appetizer--very crisp and batter-fried with tender oyster meat on the inside.  The firecracker salmon roll, filed with  tempura salmon, chili sauce, avocado, cucumber, daikon sprouts and crispy shallots, was another winner.  There are eight pieces, so definitely a plate to split.  For the entree, I had one of the "chalkboard specials," which was a simple grilled opah served with a halved artichoke, brown rice, and a chunky tomato and lemon sauce.  It was very flavorful, and I had enough for lunch the next day.  Really liked the cold edamame and fish-shapped crackers they serve instead of boring, table bread and butter.  

No room for dessert, so I dont know how good they are.  Wouldnt mind coming back to find out.

excerpts: Also have tried the coconut shrimp (nice and crispy) and the firecracker salmon roll (it was only ok).
firecracker salmon.author: Christine C.
firecracker salmon.review:
3.5 stars really.

Great happy hour options (one in the evening and one from 10pm to closing), very nice and accomodating staff and the food is good too.

This is where I was first introduced to sweet potato fries! The menu said that one could choose between traditional or spicy fries.... so I asked the waiter if we could have spicy sweet potato fries. The waiter thought I was strange but he did it anyway! And they were delish!

Also have tried the coconut shrimp (nice and crispy) and the firecracker salmon roll (it was only ok). Fish tacos are pretty tasty, too(several options of fish). 

The lemongrass mojitio is a delightfully interesting combination. 

All in all, a good place to have a small bite to eat. It gets busy during dinner time.

excerpts: Even though we ordered the Firecracker Salmon Roll and Spicy Tuna Roll, I don't recommend trying the sushi here.
It lacks flavor, authenticity, and freshness..but I didn't expect it to be good
so I wasn't surprised.
firecracker salmon.author: Jen Y.
firecracker salmon.review:
I was excited to try the Pacific Catch on 9th because I've heard great things about the space and it's kind of a hassle to go all the way to Chestnut. The look of the restaurant is beautifully casual and comfortable with plenty of seating. For that, I give this restaurant big ups. 

Our waitress on the other hand was just blah. It looked like she cared more about socializing and dancing with her co-worker friends more than earning her tip from us. The whole time she seemed insincere from the moment she brought us our drinks to handing us the check. 

I always liked Pacific Catch's food, even though it's slightly over-priced.  The food is the same in terms of taste and the sweet potato fries (which I love w/ the wasabi aeoli) were consistantly yummy. Even though we ordered the Firecracker Salmon Roll and Spicy Tuna Roll, I don't recommend trying the sushi here. It lacks flavor, authenticity, and freshness..but I didn't expect it to be good so I wasn't surprised. The fish tacos are always delicious; especially the Mahi Mahi Fish Taco which is one of my favorites. 

The atmosphere, location, and food is great. However, the waitress we had and the sushi are not. Something else was just lacking as a whole but I can't put my finger on it. But, I will be back to this location..

Service: 2
Food: 4
Atmosphere: 4
Overall: 3.5

excerpts: We ordered the Firecracker Salmon roll which was very good.
i'm not a big grilled salmon fan
Salmon and mahi mahi taco
: Both were good and fresh.
The salsa on each one are good.
The salmon one has a spicy kick to it so if you like spicy, try that.
firecracker salmon.author: Irene C.
firecracker salmon.review:
My husband and I went to Pacific Catch on a Wednesday night and the place was pretty full.  So we sat at the bar instead so that we didn't have to wait, which turned out great cuz the bartender was very nice and both our cocktails tasted delicious!  We ordered the Firecracker Salmon roll which was very good.  We also ordered the sturgeon fish of the day which came with an avocado sauce, grilled vegetable, and sweet potato fries.  The fries were really good.  The overall portion size for the entree was just right because it still allows room for appetizer if you want.  We are small eaters so it was just right.  Our total bill was about $60 which is not too bad given we had drinks too.  We're definitely going back and will try some of the other menus.  We recommended this place to our friend who liked it too.  The only complain they had was that everything on the menu is fish but that was fine with us.

1/1/2008: This is the 2nd time I've been here and I would still give it a 4 star.  We had reservations at 7pm for 7 people and they seated us late for about 10 mins and they comped all our appetizers, without us complaining or mentioning it at all.  Now that's a restaurant that cares about their customers.  It was a pleasant surprise and treat.  The service was great throughout the meal as well.  

With 7 people, we tried alot more different dishes.  

Appetizers:
1) Shrimp ceviche - They were whole shrimp and there were lots of them.  I think they should dice up the shrimp because it was served with tortilla chips and there's no way you can get a whole shrimp on the chip.  But the taste was decent overall, nothing spectacular so I probably won't order it again
2) Grilled artichokes - Fresh, good, seasoned properly.  Would order it again.
3) Calamari - very good, came with fried lemon slices too which is an interesting touch.  the sauce was a little spicy.  Would recommend trying this and I would order it again.

Rolls
1) CA roll - good that it was real crab meat, not some doughy fake ones.  There was too much rice which will fill you up quickly.  I prefer less rice.  Probably would not order it again just because I don't think this is not a signature dish.

2) Rock 'n roll - Too much rice, couldn't find/taste the unagi (bbq eel).  Again, it tastes ok, but wouldn't order it again.

3) Firecracker roll - We had this last time, loved it.  This time it was still good.  For some reason, this roll doesn't not have as much rice as the other too, which is good.  Would order it again

Entrees
1) Mahi mahi fish of the day - came with grilled veggie, sweet potato fries, mahi mahi served with tomatillo avocado sauce.  The fish had a cajun spice rub that was a bit pungent.  The sweet potato fries as always was great.  Grilled veggie - can't go wrong with this.  Don't like the spice rub so won't order it again

2) Grilled shrimp teriyaki bowl - Very tasty, great teriyaki sauce.  Liked that it came with veggie and mushroom, chopped and mixed into the rice.   Would order it again

3) Ono fish of the day - very good.  came with fried onion rings that were delicious.  came with pineapple fried rice which everyone loved.  the fish was grilled on banana leaf so it had a great aroma and taste.  would order it gain.

4) Organic chinook fish of the day - it came with grilled artichoke and brown rice and the fish was served with a tomato sauce.  it was fresh and decently good.  i'm not a big grilled salmon fan so that's why i won't order it again. 

5) Grilled Korean beef (another daily special) - I don't eat beef so I can't comment, but my husband thought it was decent.  This place is called "Pacific Catch" so I'd stick with the fish but if you have a friend that doesn't like seafood, at least there is an option to have meat.

Overall, I'd recommend this place and would go again.  Good atmosphere for couples or groups.  Great service.  Nice decor and clean.  Lots of cocktails, decent size wine list.

2/14/08: This is visit #3.

Cocktail Review:
Sun Burn - average; menu says there's a tropical syrup in it which I think is what gave it a little after taste of some sort.
Some cocktail with Gin 209, kiwi and cucumber juice - DELICIOUS!  We had to order a 2nd one.  

House salad - Good size, very fresh greens, salad dressing was yummy, if you like a Japanese type kinda dressing w/miso; The mushrooms that were in the salad was delicious.  They're cooked in some sauce, not some uncooked mushroom.

Catch of the Day Fish and Chips - The ling cod fish and chips is the freshest fish and chips we ever had.  It's lightly fried, lightly crispy and covered in a thick batter where you eat a lot of batter and not fish.  The fish was cooked to perfection and fresh and was juicy.  The sweet potato fries as usual, are always yummy!!!

Salmon and mahi mahi taco: Both were good and fresh.  The salsa on each one are good.  The salmon one has a spicy kick to it so if you like spicy, try that.

excerpts: The Original Hawaiian Poke Trio was a nice surprise because it came in three ranges of flavors with ahi tuna and sesame-soy marinade spicy seasoning, but at 19 dollars isn't the most affordable starter meal on the menu.
ahi tuna.author: Jason F.
ahi tuna.review:
Pacific Catch West Coast Fish House is a solid place to get good if unspectacular seafood dishes like soft tacos, poke and rice bowls and sushi rolls. This franchise lays in the heart of San Francisco's Inner Sunset neighborhood right off the of the 9th Avenue Entrance to Golden Gate Park. Pacific Catch is a fine franchise and it's been in this location for over ten years, so despite the competition of the surrounding neighborhood this place is doing just fine. But the question is, is it worth it?

I went for a pre-planned birthday party, so we were able to make reservations for our party of seven at 7pm on a Wednesday evening in July. Although I've been this restaurant before, I haven't been in a while and I like some of the newer things they've brought to the interior, like a nice outdoor fireplace in front of the vestibule area and all of the funky artwork on the walls and hanging from the ceilings. Upon opening the menu, I did notice that the prices are high at Pacific Catch. Be prepared to get sticker shock as this place does not represent the most affordable meals for families in or from out of town. The average price is sixteen dollars per main course, but the food was dependable and an interesting blend on the traditional seafood fusion dish. 

Since there were seven of us in our party we had to get appetizers and the Cabo Calamari, as always, is an easy choice with crispy calamari, lemon slices, fresno chilies and chipotle aioli were decent if somewhat lackluster. The Original Hawaiian Poke Trio was a nice surprise because it came in three ranges of flavors with ahi tuna and sesame-soy marinade spicy seasoning, but at 19 dollars isn't the most affordable starter meal on the menu. I do give credit to Pacific Catch as everything on the menu does sound unbelievably tasty, even their fish and chips dish is described with a mouth-watering sensibility.  

After thinking and thinking (and thinking) about what I wanted to get that would be a good representation of what Pacific Catch has to offer, I decided to go with the Island Tacos Trio mainly because at 16 dollars you can mix and match three any tacos on their menu. Although they all sounded decent, the three tacos I went with were the Traditional Baja Taco with its Crispy Alaskan Cod, cabbage jalapeno tartar, and avocado tomatillo salsa, the Spiced Chicken Taco with grilled Mary's Chicken, cabbage avocado, chipotle aioli and pico de gallo, and the Pacific Steak Taco with marinated skirt steak, crispy onions, cilantro cabbage, sriracha aioli and lime cream. All three were solid pics with a little spice, a little crunch, and a decent amount of flavor. 

Pacific Catch is a decent place with a thought-provoking menu that combines Asian Fusion, Tex-Mex and fresh seafood entrees. The service, ambiance, and overall quality and presentation of the dishes were basically all on point. I asked at the top is it worth it, and I have to admit at that rate the answer remains no because of the overall type of food being offered doesn't match up with the prices. I simply wish the price points were a little more friendlier to the average tourist that tends to frequent this neighborhood. I would consider going again, maybe for Happy Hour or a late night bite. But there are other more unique and mom and pop style options out there in the Inner Sunset area that are dying to be supported by the community and newcomers alike.

excerpts: Ahi Tuna Salad w/ seared ahi, greens & romaine, avocado, cucumber, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds, soy-wasabi vinaigrette:
When I want something lighter, I'll go for the salad.
The ingredients are pretty much the same, but with lettuce instead of rice.
But with a salad, I go for the seared tuna instead of poke, because it creates the illusion of a meatier salad.

$12.50 Hawaiian Poke with wonton chips - original ahi tuna, sesame-soy marinade, spicy seasonings:
A small bowl of juicy ahi cubes covered in sesame seeds and micro greens are accompanied with some fried wontons.
ahi tuna.author: Joy W.
ahi tuna.review:
I've been here several times over the past few years and I've come to the conclusion that it's never a bad time to have some tasty ahi, as long as it tastes fresh. The menu features mainly California seafood dishes with some Asian fusion touches here and there. This corner venue is large and spacious with very high ceilings, but they keep the place pretty cold. There is also some cozy outdoor seating under some heaters, but keep in mind, it is right next to the bus stop. 

They start you off with some complimentary shelled edamame and pretzel goldfish, which is a cute nod to the seafood menu, but I'd still prefer bread. I also think edamame is more enjoyable with the shell on.

$16.50 Japanese Wasabi rice bowl w/ Hawaiian poke - seaweed salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori, soy-wasabi sauce:
The bowl has a decent portion of bite-size chunks of sweet, juicy tuna. The soy-wasabi sauce is mild and not too strong on the wasabi. It is also seasoned with green onions, chives, and sesame seeds. Everything tastes fresh including the pale slivers of creamy avocado and crunchy, crisp seaweed salad. Be sure to get a little bit of everything in each bite, otherwise you're left with a lots of rice at the bottom of the bowl. 

$15.50 Ahi Tuna Salad w/ seared ahi, greens & romaine, avocado, cucumber, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds, soy-wasabi vinaigrette:
When I want something lighter, I'll go for the salad. The ingredients are pretty much the same, but with lettuce instead of rice. But with a salad, I go for the seared tuna instead of poke, because it creates the illusion of a meatier salad. Again, try to eat a little of everything together, otherwise you're left with a ton of greens, or as my friend calls it, 'rabbit food.'

A lot of people like the sweet potato fries. They're alright, but sweet potato fries are becoming a ubiquitous offering across the board.

Happy hour deals are pretty good if you are in the area in the afternoons. Poke is about $8.

$9 Baja Shrimp Ceviche - lime, serrano chili, avocado, cilantro, tortilla chips:
These bite-size shrimp are springy, meaty and seasoned well. The verde sauce is on the runny side and is quite spicy. I could eat this on its own without tortilla chips too, but the thin, crunchy chips make a nice vehicle.

$12.50 Hawaiian Poke with wonton chips - original ahi tuna, sesame-soy marinade, spicy seasonings:
A small bowl of juicy ahi cubes covered in sesame seeds and micro greens are accompanied with some fried wontons.

$7 Mochi Fondue - vanilla, chocolate, coffee mochi balls & chocolate dipping sauce:
I've tried this out of curiosity, but if you've ever had store-bought mochi ice cream balls, I'd say skip it. The taste is pretty similar with the addition of a little bowl of chocolate sauce on the side for dipping.

The tasty rice bowls are still my go-to items to order here. If I were in the area, I'd come back to try some of the other menu items too.

excerpts: Their ahi tuna salad was delicious as well.
I would recommend this place if you're in the area.
Parking is metered parking on the street.
Highly recommended
ahi tuna.author: Kevin S.
ahi tuna.review:
This is a really nice restaurant . The place itself is nice, had a great bar with some good beers on tap, and has a nice outside seating area with a fire pit. 
The location of the restaurant is great; near golden gate park and also near a lot of shopping on Irving. 
The food here is fantastic. Their sushi rolls looked amazing. 
I ended up having the fish and chips. It was great. I recommend the seasoned fries with it. 
Their ahi tuna salad was delicious as well. I would recommend this place if you're in the area.
Parking is metered parking on the street.
Highly recommended

excerpts: Lots of avocado and julienned cucumber with a sliver of ginger, topped with a nice slice of ahi tuna.
ahi tuna.author: Tabitha E.
ahi tuna.review:
Located near UCSF, I'd seen this place a lot in my searches while inpatient and craving sushi, as well as driven by every visit on Lincoln Avenue. We wanted a place to hang out for a while before meeting up with friends later, so we parked in Golden Gate park, which was not bad cause it was a Monday, and walked the 3 minutes over. We were early for happy hour by a 1/2 hour, but I was starving so we ordered anyways. 3 mahi mahi tacos ($16)  and a sushi roll ($13), I already forgot the name of. 

The sushi roll was good, and huge. The shrimp was a nice, actually huge tempera'd shrimp (though the crunch was lost) and not those tiny ones I normally see. Lots of avocado and julienned cucumber with a sliver of ginger, topped with a nice slice of ahi tuna. I like ginger and really liked this roll, although, just wish the shrimp had retained a bit of crunch. 

I didn't try the fish tacos, but Cory seemed happy. Big pieces of fish in here and he ate them all. The fries were, fries, a little too mushy for my preference. Cory had a few beers and I had water as we sat on the patio area with a view of the corner so prime people watching area. We were told by another frequent customer they had recently renovated everything, including enclosing the patio area. More glass would be nice, but you would lose seating I guess. The patio stayed nice and warm with the various glass gas rock fireplace and overhead heating elements. 

Barely there service, so I would have preferred to be checked in on a bit more. We never were asked about food during eating. Well enough they watched Cory's beers though. 

We will probably be back on my overnight trips as this wasn't too terrible. Happy hour looks like some good deals especially for this place. Also dogs are allowed out on the patio too.

excerpts: Mai Tai and Ahi Tuna heaven!
ahi tuna.author: Callie C.
ahi tuna.review: Best location and killer Happy Hour menu. Mai Tai and Ahi Tuna heaven!

excerpts: Calamari, rolls, fish tacos, and ahi tuna rice bowl were just enough for our family of 4.
Customer service was great.
ahi tuna.author: Jackie H.
ahi tuna.review: Pacific Catch was a perfect decision for our seafood wants. Calamari, rolls, fish tacos, and ahi tuna rice bowl were just enough for our family of 4. Customer service was great. We had a waitress from Southern California whom was friendly and helped us narrow down some of our decisions. Cost can add up fast depending if you get apps and drinks. Our ONLY downfall was PARKING! It took us about 15 minutes to find a parking spot. Restaurant is very modern looking and clean.

excerpts: Love their Ahi Tuna salad!!!
For entree I got the Ahi Tuna salad.
It had a good mix of greens, avocado, sauteed cabbages, and 4 big piece of Ahi Tuna.
Everything tasted great when mixed all together, with the soy-wasabi vinaigrette.
ahi tuna.author: Wendy F.
ahi tuna.review:
Lovely Asian-fusion diner! Love their Ahi Tuna salad!!!

FOOD: We shared the Korean sticky ribs and the sweet potato fries for appetizer. The sweet potato fries were really good and not too greasy like I had at many other places. The sticky ribs were marinated well, but I didn't get too much meat from it. For entree I got the Ahi Tuna salad. It had a good mix of greens, avocado, sauteed cabbages, and 4 big piece of Ahi Tuna. Everything tasted great when mixed all together, with the soy-wasabi vinaigrette. My friend tried the Pacific Crab Salad (with real crab meat) and it was great too!

SERVICE: We came here on a Tuesday evening and was seated immediately. Very friendly waiter and food came by within reasonable time.

SETTING: I really like how spacious it is on the inside and also its ambient lighting. They have nice interior decors and there is also an outdoor patio where you can sit and dine (heat lamp provided during the freezing SF nights). Parking is probably impossible so just take Lyft or the muni. 

OVERALL IMPRESSION: I like it! I always run past this place but never really knew how tasty the food is. Will come back again for sure!

excerpts: Another friend got a ahi tuna salad and she enjoyed it.
I got the shrimp coconut
and it was just ok.
The coconut was really overpowering.
ahi tuna.author: Glendie D.
ahi tuna.review:
Food was ok. We got the poke trio which was the best part of our dinner. The poke was tender and seasoned ok. My friend got the mahi mahi tacos which she described as bland. It did look bland. Another friend got a ahi tuna salad and she enjoyed it. I got the shrimp coconut and it was just ok. The coconut was really overpowering. It wasn't anything exceptional. 

My suggestion is to get the dishes that have poke if you like that. You would have a better chance of having a tasty dinner.

excerpts: I regularly (like at least once a week for lunch) order the veggie salad and rotate between adding grilled Mary's chicken, grilled salmon, or seared Ahi tuna on top.
The miso dressing is so delicious and the way they "zoodle" the cucumbers is unique.
It's a good portion and is very filling on its own.
The chicken is always grilled and seasoned perfectly.
That's probably my favorite protein add-on.
The Ahi tuna and salmon (in that order) are good too for some variety.
The Ahi tuna and salmon (in that order) are good too for some variety.
ahi tuna.author: Traci R.
ahi tuna.review: This restaurant has a solid salad game. I regularly (like at least once a week for lunch) order the veggie salad and rotate between adding grilled Mary's chicken, grilled salmon, or seared Ahi tuna on top. The miso dressing is so delicious and the way they "zoodle" the cucumbers is unique. It's a good portion and is very filling on its own. The chicken is always grilled and seasoned perfectly. That's probably my favorite protein add-on. The Ahi tuna and salmon (in that order) are good too for some variety.

excerpts: I tried the Ahi Tuna Salad ($14.50).
The tuna was DELICIOUS- rare on the inside and nicely crusted on the outside.
The salad also came with a lot of oomph- sprouts, raddish, pickled ginger, etc.
However, the price point sucked.
ahi tuna.author: Samantha C.
ahi tuna.review:
More like 3.5.

While the food was good, it was WAY overpriced and the service was spotty. I would come back only for Happy Hour specials ($7 poke!!!) 

I tried the Ahi Tuna Salad ($14.50). The tuna was DELICIOUS- rare on the inside and nicely crusted on the outside. The salad also came with a lot of oomph- sprouts, raddish, pickled ginger, etc. However, the price point sucked. I could easily get a sashimi salad from a Japanese restaurant down the street for less!

Bf got the Ecstasy roll ($12.50). NOT WORTH IT. It's an unconventional sushi roll with no rice (you have to pay extra for rice) and a crispy, battered seaweed. Yes, it was good and dense and filled with fish and avocado.. but $12.50?! Are you kidding me!? Definitely not a "supersized" roll, as advertised.... 

I did, however, love the overall vibe. Very island-esque and nicely decorated. Wide, open windows with lots of natural light by the bar.

excerpts: original Hawaiian (ahi tuna), salmon avocado Hawaiian , and the serrano Hawaiian...
I preferred the Serrano Hawaiian
ahi tuna.author: Dee R.
ahi tuna.review:
I guess this place is a chain restaurant. Went here for lunch . The place has a nice ambiance. Food was mediocre...

I had the fish and chips with sweet potato fries. It was an Alaskan Cod...quite greasy...lacked salt but the jalapeño sauce that it came with balanced out the blandness. 

My friend had the trio poke...original Hawaiian (ahi tuna), salmon avocado Hawaiian , and the serrano Hawaiian...I preferred the Serrano Hawaiian

excerpts: Ahi tuna poke
: Those wonton chips were amazing, but the Ahi tuna poke was even better.
The tuna was very fresh and tender.
For my entree, I had a Japanese wasabi rice bowl with seared Ahi tuna: The wasabi taste was light but definitely noticeable.
It blended very well with the included salad.
Similar to the Ahi tuna poke appetizer, the tuna was delicious.
ahi tuna.author: Nathan Y.
ahi tuna.review:
I came here for a company dinner, which mainly consisted of delicious appetizers.

For appetizers, we had:
A starter salad
The california roll: It was pretty generous for a basic roll and was very filling.
Baja shrimp ceviche: A very delicious shrimp dish. Recommended.
Ahi tuna poke: Those wonton chips were amazing, but the Ahi tuna poke was even better. The tuna was very fresh and tender. Highly-recommended.

For my entree, I had a Japanese wasabi rice bowl with seared Ahi tuna: The wasabi taste was light but definitely noticeable. It blended very well with the included salad. Similar to the Ahi tuna poke appetizer, the tuna was delicious. It had great texture and a very juicy taste.

The restaurant had good service and gave very generous portions for appetizers and entrees. (I was beyond stuffed)

I was quite impressed and look forward to returning to one of their many locations in the Bay Area.

excerpts: Wasabi bowl (ahi tuna)
: you have the option of choosing brown rice and 1/2 rice&1/2 veggies no extra charge.
An otherwise healthy balanced dish with a good variety of veggies, protein, and carbs was drenched in too much sauce.
ahi tuna.author: Bin X.
ahi tuna.review:
Ambiance: 4.5 (super spacious and not a long wait) 

Service: 4 (fast and knowledgable)

Food: 3

Trio poke: we ordered the original, Serrano, and macadamia nut. The tuna was super fresh, my favorite was the Serrano which was a creamy spicy sauce. I didn't care too much for the macadamia nut, it was too salty/soy sauce. It's a good appetizer to sample their numerous poke selections.

Wasabi bowl (ahi tuna): you have the option of choosing brown rice and 1/2 rice&1/2 veggies no extra charge. An otherwise healthy balanced dish with a good variety of veggies, protein, and carbs was drenched in too much sauce. The portion is very generous and it'd be a perfect, perfect dish if they laid off on the sauce a bit. 

I will definitely come back here again and maybe ask for sauce on the side or light sauce for the bowls and try the other poke. As you can tell by the photos, pretty much all the dishes are visually stunning (esp the wasabi bowls), I feel healthier already just by looking at it.

excerpts: We got the fish and chips, ahi tuna salad, Tom yum soups, blood orange margarita pitcher, and Cajun fries.
ahi tuna.author: Michelle F.
ahi tuna.review:
I've been wanting to try this place for a little while and finally had a chance to yesterday. They are remodeling their exterior a bit, but I thought the place was still pretty cute- I like the bamboo theme they have going. It was a warm afternoon so we opted to sit at the loungey table right outside the entrance. 

Food- I would give more stars because the food was pretty delish. We got the fish and chips, ahi tuna salad, Tom yum soups, blood orange margarita pitcher, and Cajun fries. (And also ceviche, but it never came) 

Service- The staff was very friendly. BUT they didn't bring out our ceviche, twice! We ordered it the first time, and she didn't get our order. We went inside and followed up with another server, but they didn't put it down on our check. We followed up with our server, but she didn't hear about our ceviche and told us she didn't hear our order. The ceviche ended coming out AFTER we paid for our check... Which we sent back.

excerpts: The seared ahi tuna taco was really good.
I wish I had gotten two of these.
The chicken one was definitely on the bland side and not as desirable.
But the seared ahi tuna had a ton of great flavor--I also loved that they put crispy onion ring pieces to make the texture a bit more interesting.
ahi tuna.author: Jasmine X.
ahi tuna.review:
This review is for delivery only.

Mmm I like this place. I got the the seaweed salad with a seared ahi taco and a chicken taco. Good stuff. Delivery probably made the taco taste slightly worse than it otherwise would have, but at the end of the day, it was still pretty good. The seaweed salad was pretty flavorful--they also mixed cucumbers into it which was pretty unique and something I haven't seen done with seaweed salad before.

The seared ahi tuna taco was really good. I wish I had gotten two of these. The chicken one was definitely on the bland side and not as desirable. But the seared ahi tuna had a ton of great flavor--I also loved that they put crispy onion ring pieces to make the texture a bit more interesting. 

tldr; all in all, good asian fusion. go for a taco!

excerpts: My favorites include fish tacos, poke, fish & chips, ahi tuna sando, calamari, & the sushi is also excellent.
You leave full & not like you inhaled a pound of lard.
Pacific Catch is great place for all types of picky eaters.
ahi tuna.author: Denniz S.
ahi tuna.review:
Great quality food, casual atmosphere and a fantastic happy hour makes Pacific Catch one of my favorites in the city. 

The menu covers all the bases. My favorites include fish tacos, poke, fish & chips, ahi tuna sando, calamari, & the sushi is also excellent. You leave full & not like you inhaled a pound of lard. Pacific Catch is great place for all types of picky eaters. Everyone will find something and really like it. 

Expect to see a reasonably priced menu that provides generous portions. They aren't stingy with the food. The service is also really knowledgeable & upbeat.  

When it's HH & bottles are 1/2 they will help you decide on a perfect pairing

excerpts: The ahi tuna salad at $14.50 is reasonably priced.
Large portion for a salad with tangy sesame dressing.
Avocado and alfalfa sprouts with leafy greens were a good combo.
Ahi tuna was fresh, although the smaller portion size still left me a bit hungry after.
ahi tuna.author: Gino I.
ahi tuna.review:
Nice seafood restaurant located right off the Golden Gate Bridge park, on 9th and lincoln.  I think it's a good spot for a quick meal especially if you don't want to travel far from the park or want a happy hour. 

The ahi tuna salad at $14.50 is reasonably priced.  Large portion for a salad with tangy sesame dressing.  Avocado and alfalfa sprouts with leafy greens were a good combo.  Ahi tuna was fresh, although the smaller portion size still left me a bit hungry after.  I came here looking for a quickly healthy bite and that's exactly what I got.  

They have sushi rolls and tacos for happy hour as well, but only at the bar.  My friends said their rice bowls and tacos were decent.  Not a bad place, it gets the job done!

excerpts: I ordered the Ahi Tuna Salad ($14.50) which has seared ahi tuna, avocado, cucumber, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds, and soy-wasabi vinaigrette.
YUM!!
At most restaurants, they don't put enough dressing.
At Pacific Catch, my salad was overly drenched in dressing...
but that's okay.
The salad itself was HUGE.
So filling.
ahi tuna.author: Stefanie C.
ahi tuna.review:
They have incredible service here. The bartenders and servers are super friendly, and the service is fast. They give you a little bowl of edamame and pretzel goldfish to snack on while you wait for your food, which is cute.

I ordered the Ahi Tuna Salad ($14.50) which has seared ahi tuna, avocado, cucumber, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds, and soy-wasabi vinaigrette. YUM!! At most restaurants, they don't put enough dressing. At Pacific Catch, my salad was overly drenched in dressing... but that's okay. The salad itself was HUGE. So filling. So worth it. 

Great place to visit whether you live right around the corner or you're on your way to Golden Gate Park.

excerpts: I've dined here plenty of times that I can safely say that you can't go wrong with their Japanese wasabi bowl with either poke or ahi tuna!
Of the four to choose from, the Japanese one is definitely my favorite because of the seaweed salad and fresh avocado.
There's hints of wasabi flavor fused in, yet it's not too strong that I find it unbearable.
ahi tuna.author: Priscilla W.
ahi tuna.review:
Since my first visit to Pacific Catch over three years ago, the restaurant has definitely added more options to the menu. The sandwiches now come with a small coleslaw and a choice of fries (it used to be only coleslaw). And now they have four Pan-Asian rice bowls to choose from: Japanese, Korean, Hawaiian, and Thai (it used to be only Japanese and Hawaiian). I've dined here plenty of times that I can safely say that you can't go wrong with their Japanese wasabi bowl with either poke or ahi tuna! Of the four to choose from, the Japanese one is definitely my favorite because of the seaweed salad and fresh avocado. There's hints of wasabi flavor fused in, yet it's not too strong that I find it unbearable. Also, you can substitute the white rice for brown rice and/or greens for a healthier option.

Overall, the restaurant is quite large and spacious. The chairs are very comfy as well. I find the tables are a bit taller at the bar seating area as I have to stretch my torso in order to eat my meal. Service is still hit or miss, depending whether it's peak hours or not. And they have a small, private parking lot -- a great perk to this location over the one in the Marina.

excerpts: I can't say no to avocado and ahi tuna.
I must say, the poke here is phenomenal
(although, I've never had real poke from Hawaii, so don't take my word on it.
ahi tuna.author: Joanne W.
ahi tuna.review:
I've been here twice now. The first time I was here, I was super hungover, tried, and grumpy, so I was unable to appreciate Pacific Catch in all its glory. So I would have to discount that time I went. The second time I went, I was with my coworkers. We made reservations, and they had quickly sat us down for dinner.

We ordered a pitcher of the mojito, which was AMAZING. It just so happened to be dungeness crab season - so I had myself the dungeness crab and corn chowder (MUST HAVE... if it's in season), and the California Style poke. I can't say no to avocado and ahi tuna. I must say, the poke here is phenomenal (although, I've never had real poke from Hawaii, so don't take my word on it. I just really like fish).

Finally, we ended off with two mochi fondues. THIS IS A MUST HAVE. You can't go wrong with ice cream mochi, chocolate, and Pocky sticks.

There was a bit of a kerfuffle when it came to getting our bills. However, it worked out in the end. PROTIP: If you pay with PayPal, you get $10 off.

excerpts: It is kinda marinated ahi tuna chunks with soy sauce and onions.
The tuna is fresh and high grade.
I wouldn't say it is the highest quality of ahi tuna, but I think it is very good for the price point.
ahi tuna.author: Ruxin H.
ahi tuna.review:
My default place to go when I need a Hawaiian poke fix. Every Time I'm around inner sunset area, I would try my best to come here and get the original poke. I also tried several of their pokes and the original is definitely my favorite. It is kinda marinated ahi tuna chunks with soy sauce and onions. The tuna is fresh and high grade. I wouldn't say it is the highest quality of ahi tuna, but I think it is very good for the price point.

I would recommend getting the appetizer of tuna poke as opposed to wasabi bowls. I feel the portion of fish is a little smaller in the bowls and wonton chips in the appetizer go well with the poke. 

Sometimes I got the take out order of the poke appetizer and they gave a soup cup size of poke. 

I also came here for dinner before and their salmon/catch of day is pretty good too. Very huge portion.

Plus, service is incredible here. They served edamame when you are seated

excerpts: The Ahi Tuna Poke salad was pretty good.
The romaine lettuce and carrots provided a great crunchy texture, while the avocado provided a rich and creamy element to the salad.
The salad was not overdressed, which is a definite plus.
The Ahi tuna poke, although well marinated, would have benefitted from an additional splash of rice vinegar; as the soy and sesame marinade resulted in a one-dimensional tasting poke.
ahi tuna.author: Joshua S.
ahi tuna.review:
A very popular restaurant, as they are often filled to capacity during the weekends. The service is very accommodating of various requests, such as delivering appetizers while our party was waiting outside and trying their best to fit together a party of 14.

The fried oyster was pretty good. They were a bit over-battered, which masked the freshness of the oyster. However, the accompanying avocado and tomato sauce gave a nice creamy acidity; which allowed the dish to be delicious.

Once we were seated, the wait for our actual mains did take awhile. However, had a large party, so that would have been the cause of the delay.

The Serrano Ahi Poke was okay. The spicy mayo sauce overpowered the flavor of the tuna. The accompanying fried wonton wrapper provided a nice crispy texture.

The Ahi Tuna Poke salad was pretty good. The romaine lettuce and carrots provided a great crunchy texture, while the avocado provided a rich and creamy element to the salad. The salad was not overdressed, which is a definite plus. The Ahi tuna poke, although well marinated, would have benefitted from an additional splash of rice vinegar; as the soy and sesame marinade resulted in a one-dimensional tasting poke.

Overall, the food is good. The above average service definitely made up for the rather average tasting food. Definitely a great place to come with friends.

excerpts: Seared Ahi Tuna is my favorite.
Their service is always great.
Nice people.
ahi tuna.author: Cindy C.
ahi tuna.review: Love their Japanese Wasabi bowls. Seared Ahi Tuna is my favorite. Their service is always great. Nice people.

excerpts: Ahi Tuna salad - so good!!!
I usually end up having some sort of shared starter - calamari or a roll of some sort, and then go for the Ahi Tuna salad.
I have tried other things, but this just has my heart.
My boyfriend has tried many different items on the menu as well (most recently one of the rice bowls, I think?)
Pacific Catch, Ahi Tuna, MaiTai, Amanda - I'll be back for you!
ahi tuna.author: Missy M.
ahi tuna.review:
I'm far overdue for a review here.  I have been to Pacific Catch a handful of times now, and have always had a great experience.

Location: Right next to Golden Gate Park - perfect for a stop in post bike ride to the beach (great location for post bay to breakers people watching ...).  The bus picks up right outside, and there is also plenty of bike parking where you can still see your bike from your seat.

Food: That Ahi Tuna salad - so good!!!  I usually end up having some sort of shared starter - calamari or a roll of some sort, and then go for the Ahi Tuna salad.  I have tried other things, but this just has my heart.  My boyfriend has tried many different items on the menu as well (most recently one of the rice bowls, I think?) and he has enjoyed everything he tried.

Service: I have only ever sat at the bar area, and received great service every time. The bartenders are always very nice, and seem to enjoy working with one another.  If the bartender Amanda is there I suggest sitting in her bar area.  Amanda has been there a few times when I was there and she always makes for a great time.  She was able to help guide me through the drink menu, and help me figure out what one (or two, or three) of their cocktails I wanted to try.  She is also very knowledgeable about the beer, and found one that my boyfriend was very happy with.  It is nice to eat at a place where the food is great, and the staff makes you feel welcome, and wanting to come back for more.

Pacific Catch, Ahi Tuna, MaiTai, Amanda - I'll be back for you!

excerpts: For my main, I got an Ahi tuna poke salad bowl.
The poke was too salty for my taste but the wasabi dressing was good.
ahi tuna.author: Karen S.
ahi tuna.review:
I was introducing the Boyfriend to a good friend & her fiancé so I thought we'd go somewhere slightly fancy & offers something that everyone would like.

I started out with a Pisco punch which was really strong & had no muddled pineapple as described.  For my main, I got an Ahi tuna poke salad bowl.  The poke was too salty for my taste but the wasabi dressing was good.  I asked for no pickled ginger but there was still a few pieces lying around.

Overall, the meal was decent & the service was good; we actually had a waitress & a waiter-in-training.  At the end of our meal, we got a free Friend dulce de leche "spring rolls" as a thank you for putting up with out trainee.  Unfortunately, it wasn't very good.

excerpts: Love Love Love the rice wasabi bowl with salmon or ahi tuna!!
ahi tuna.author: Lindsay Y.
ahi tuna.review: Great service in the restaurant and for pick up (Eat24). Love Love Love the rice wasabi bowl with salmon or ahi tuna!!

excerpts: My son had the ahi tuna rice bowl.
He loved it.
Wife had the fish and chips.
She liked it.
Portion size was just right.
Will eat here again!
ahi tuna.author: Robert B.
ahi tuna.review: We were in a rush. Fast fast service. Great rice bowls. The Hawaiian rice bowl with mahi mahi is great. My son had the ahi tuna rice bowl. He loved it. Wife had the fish and chips. She liked it. Portion size was just right. Will eat here again!

excerpts: I ordered a veggie salad plus ahi tuna, no dressing, and subbed edamame for green beans.
I got a Ahi Tuna Salad with dressing.
He was quick to get this taken back and fixed.
I still got a Ahi Tuna Salad and not the Veggie Salad which has a lot of veggies such as mushroom, green beans, and tomatoes.
I didn't want to send it back again but did ask for some mushrooms.
I think then they realized that I got the completely wrong entree.
ahi tuna.author: Tao Tao W.
ahi tuna.review:
3.5 stars. I have been to the Marina location  so when we were deciding on a place to eat with some friends, we went to this place since they are bigger and take reservations. It is much bigger than the marina location and food is pretty consistent too.

Service seems to be not as good here. When we got there, it took a good few minutes before we got greeted. I understand that there is a hostess but there were 3 waiters/waitresses standing right there that could have said something - not a good first impression. Things turned around though when we were seated, our waiter was great. he was attentive, gave suggestions, and checked on us plenty. However when the food arrived, things went negative again. I ordered a veggie salad plus ahi tuna, no dressing, and subbed edamame for green beans. I got a Ahi Tuna Salad with dressing. He was quick to get this taken back and fixed. I still got a Ahi Tuna Salad and not the Veggie Salad which has a lot of veggies such as mushroom, green beans, and tomatoes. I didn't want to send it back again but did ask for some mushrooms. I think then they realized that I got the completely wrong entree. They were nice enough to take it off the bill entirely so that was nic eof them.

Even though it was the wrong salad, it was consistent with marina and was delish. My hubs got the clam chowder but he wasn't impressed. There were clams but he thought it was too many veggies and not creamy enough. He also got the Japanese Wasabi bowl and thought that was good. The Ahi Poke was very flavorful.

excerpts: Japanese wasabi bowl with ahi tuna, half salad and half brown rice; Racer IPA; cutie pie edamame-and-goldfish-pretzel "amuse bouche"; high table with view of Golden Gate Park and busy smiling bartenders.
What a perfect meal!
ahi tuna.author: Valerie E.
ahi tuna.review: Japanese wasabi bowl with ahi tuna, half salad and half brown rice; Racer IPA; cutie pie edamame-and-goldfish-pretzel "amuse bouche"; high table with view of Golden Gate Park and busy smiling bartenders. What a perfect meal!

excerpts: On to the poke dish -- huge chunks of ahi tuna perfectly marinated in a soy sesame dressing.
ahi tuna.author: Janice C.
ahi tuna.review:
On my only day off, do I really want to spend it with my crazy family?!

"Oh, don't worry, your dad's not coming" my mom said.

* If you know my 'rents, I'm sure you'd also say thank God! *

Since it was just my mom and I, we decided to have lunch at Pacific Catch.  She loves seafood -- fish, shrimps, crab, baked, fried or broiled.  This place was ideal since it was walking distance to GG park, which we were headed to after lunch.

We picked out a couple of items and decided to share.  

The sweet potato fries were recommended by Eileen H. Boy she was right!  crispy and simply adorned with rock salt, it comes with two dipping sauces. I didn't like the flavored mayo nor the sweet chili sauce, but the fries are good on their own. (a side order is enough for two people)

The California roll was made with real crab but surprisingly lacking in flavor.  I've never been so thankful for soy sauce to dip it in.

On to the poke dish -- huge chunks of ahi tuna perfectly marinated in a soy sesame dressing.  It'll be easier to chew on it if the cut was smaller, but I shouldn't complain because I got my money's worth on that dish. 

Save your $4.95 on the grilled yellowtail taco. (it was a special for that day) The taco was small and the fish was overwhelmed with all the other trimmings in there. 

My mom loved her grilled mahi mahi with pineapple salsa. Served with a side of bok choy, onion strings and a big scoop of rice.  She couldn't finish this dish, not because it wasn't delicious, but the portions were so huge!

Service is very good, both from our waitress and the bussers, constantly refilling water and taking away used dishes. 

I'm curious about their happy hour, so I may come back for that!

excerpts: My boyfriend and I shared the grilled ahi tuna rice bowl with extra fish and brown rice.
They even split the bowl for us into two servings!
We also shared the Peruvian ceviche.
I have to say the ceviche wasn't their finest hour.
The fish wasn't raw and the sauce was oily.
In the past, I've also tried their sandwiches, fish tacos and sushi.
ahi tuna.author: Alice W.
ahi tuna.review:
I've been to this place several times and also their location in the marina. I absolutely adore the rice bowls here!! What other way to wind down after a marathon than a big bowl of the good stuff?

Surprisingly, my three friends who rode their bikes were able to get there ahead of time after the race and hold a table for 10!! I was expecting an epic wait but for some reason, the place wasn't all that full. I guess runners wanted deep fried goodness after their runs (who can blame them?).

My boyfriend and I shared the grilled ahi tuna rice bowl with extra fish and brown rice. They even split the bowl for us into two servings! We also shared the Peruvian ceviche. I have to say the ceviche wasn't their finest hour. The fish wasn't raw and the sauce was oily. In the past, I've also tried their sandwiches, fish tacos and sushi. Everything were fantastic, especially the sweet potato fries.

This location is much bigger than the place in the marina and great for groups. Can't wait to have another rice bowl again!

excerpts: We ordered the ceviche, the tortilla lime soup, fried oysters and the ahi tuna salad (which they split for us).
This mean was perfect for two people.
ahi tuna.author: Jenna R.
ahi tuna.review:
My mom wanted to take me out on a celebratory dinner after passing my Exit exam. She said anywhere, and I chose Pacific Catch because it has been a very long time without their ceviche.

We ordered the ceviche, the tortilla lime soup, fried oysters and the ahi tuna salad (which they split for us). This mean was perfect for two people. My mom felt ambitious and was about to get the oyster basket, but our server asked if we wanted the appetizer size and I thought that was the better choice.

If you have never had their ceviche, you are missing out.

excerpts: My better half went with the ahi tuna sandwich; given that he inhaled it in under 2 minutes, I'd venture to say he really enjoyed it.
ahi tuna.author: Justine M.
ahi tuna.review:
We were a little wary about trying this place out after reading several sub-par reviews, but I'm glad to say our experience was fantastic all around. Shared the carrot ginger soup to start, which had a very robust -- but not too overwhelming -- flavor that complemented the coconut shrimp really nicely. I was also impressed with our waitress's wine recommendation, as the sauvignon blanc she suggested went perfectly with the food I ordered. 

I went with the mahi mahi (on special) and was pleasantly surprised at how delicate it tasted: not at all chewy or meaty like I'd had at other places. Really generous portion size, too! My better half went with the ahi tuna sandwich; given that he inhaled it in under 2 minutes, I'd venture to say he really enjoyed it. 

So overall, excellent service and food for the price -- looking forward to our next visit!

excerpts: Three-way tuna-- yup, ahi tuna prepared three different ways.
Can't recall exactly how, other than seared and sashimi-style, but it was tasty.
ahi tuna.author: Jade T.
ahi tuna.review:
So... I know I'm not alone in being suspicious of monstrous restaurant buildings on the corner of busy intersections in the Sunset.  In this case, possibly the busiest.

Pacific Catch.  Hm.  Tropical themed fusion-ish pan-Asian-ish fish place decorated with wicker and rattan as far as the eye can see.  How in the world can the food at such a place be any good?  Surprise.  It actually is better than decent.

(Disclaimer:  I don't have a sophisticated palate.  But you already knew that from skimming the places I've already reviewed.  Hello, Carl's Junior?)

I do like my seafood that has unfortunately been fished to the brink of extinction.  Codfish and tuna are some of my favourites, and they were fresh here.  That's half the battle.

Fish and chips used authentic cod (yes!).  I also like that Pacific Catch offers brown rice.  Three-way tuna-- yup, ahi tuna prepared three different ways.  Can't recall exactly how, other than seared and sashimi-style, but it was tasty.  And you get plenty of wasabi, pickled ginger and soy sauce; what more could a hungry customer/sushi lover want?

Drinks are good.  Girly beachy Hawaiian type concoctions.  Those are nice.  Order a Guava Cooler or Kona Lager and just hang out as you wait for a table to open up.  Drinks are always good.

Some tables are a bit small though.  Crowded with plates, cups and dishes, and we didn't even order that much.  Either down-size your serving platters-- but NOT your food-- or give me a bigger eating surface.  Yes, I am a petite slob. (Aw, that reminds me of my beloved pet kitty...)

Kudos, Pacific Catch, for a nice seafood meal and fun drinks.

Sorry about the mess. :P

excerpts: Spicy mahi mahi and wasabi ahi tuna always remain favorites.
ahi tuna.author: Priya C.
ahi tuna.review: I've been going to Pacific Catch for a while and am consistently impressed by the menu. Always exceptionally yummy sandwiches, fresh fish, friendly staff and good prices! I love how they offer daily special and add new variety to the menu. Spicy mahi mahi and wasabi ahi tuna always remain favorites.

excerpts: Ahi Tuna Poke is my favorite here!!
Great food for the price.
ahi tuna.author: Shiva A.
ahi tuna.review: Ahi Tuna Poke is my favorite here!! Great food for the price.

excerpts: We also shared the sweet potato fries, ahi tuna salad, and mahi mahi tacos.
Every single dish was so delicious, and even though we were full after our meal, we didn't feel like we were about to explode
ahi tuna.author: Melinda W.
ahi tuna.review:
After many years of refusing sashimi, I've recently acquired the taste for raw fish, so my roommates decided to introduce me to the Hawaiian Poke at Pacific Catch. Wow, and I do mean WOW that is goooooood. Beautifully flavored and pairs well with the chips served in the appetizer dish. We also shared the sweet potato fries, ahi tuna salad, and mahi mahi tacos. Every single dish was so delicious, and even though we were full after our meal, we didn't feel like we were about to explode like we sometimes do after a carb binge.

Service was great and the interior was very well decorated. Made me feel like I was dining at a classy seaside resto (until I looked out the window and saw the traffic instead of the ocean, but whatever).

excerpts: Ahi tuna one is great.
ahi tuna.author: Rebecca D.
ahi tuna.review:
This is a solid fish place, and perhaps has a special place in my heart since my boyfriend took me here on our first date. We've been back many times since.

I like the fish sandwiches. Ahi tuna one is great. I am alway sure to get it with the sweet potato fries.

I also really like the fish and chips and ceviche. I find the sushi rools to be delicious!

excerpts: Be sure to check out their Cabo shrimp tacos, ahi tuna bowl, sweet potato fries, coconut shrimp, calamari and fried oysters!
But skip the dungeons crab chowder-- totally not worth it!
ahi tuna.author: Tiffany U.
ahi tuna.review: The good thing about this location is the parking-- it's still not good but it beats trying to find parking on Chestnut! The food here is exactly like the location on Chestnut, always consistent and fresh. I love how this location never has a wait! Be sure to check out their Cabo shrimp tacos, ahi tuna bowl, sweet potato fries, coconut shrimp, calamari and fried oysters! But skip the dungeons crab chowder-- totally not worth it!

excerpts: My group got ahi tuna, ceviche, sushi, and
everything was super fresh and delicious.
The happy hour is only from 4-6p Monday through Friday, so I suggest making a bee-line to hit this spot!
You won't regret it!
ahi tuna.author: Marie B.
ahi tuna.review: Happy Hour at Pacific Catch is the bomb!   Our bartender Adam not only knew his stuff mixing marvelous mai tais, but he was super fun with his "cork toss" game.  I got a large plate of sweet potato fries and a steak taco for only 3 bucks each.  My group got ahi tuna, ceviche, sushi, and everything was super fresh and delicious.  The happy hour is only from 4-6p Monday through Friday, so I suggest making a bee-line to hit this spot!   You won't regret it!

excerpts: Unfortunately when we went they were not serving ahi tuna but we improvised.
Ordered the pitcher of blueberry mojitos which tasted like heaven.
Freshest mojito I have ever had.
Then we got the calamari to start, and ended up ordering some fish tacos and Thai shrimp curry and added chicken.
ahi tuna.author: Amanda H.
ahi tuna.review:
This review is of the food only. Service was sub par. 

Visiting from Houston for the first time and wanted to get some seafood. Unfortunately when we went they were not serving ahi tuna but we improvised. Ordered the pitcher of blueberry mojitos which tasted like heaven. Freshest mojito I have ever had. Then we got the calamari to start, and ended up ordering some fish tacos and Thai shrimp curry and added chicken. Let me just say, those mahi mahi tacos are life altering. Seriously the best fish taco I've had in my entire life. The Thai curry had an amazing flavor as well and they did not skimp on the meats. I would highly recommend this place to anyone visiting from out of town who wants to try something delicious.

excerpts: I often order the Ahi Tuna Rice Bowl over Brown Rice and greens.
Delish!
Never a bad piece of Ahi.
ahi tuna.author: Howard S.
ahi tuna.review:
Many years ago, there was a small seafood restaurant on Chestnut called Pacific Catch. Ate there and was hooked. I now know of two others-one in Corte Madera, and one on 9th and Lincoln in SF. I frequent the 9th Ave. place the most. 

It is consistently good. How many places can rate this remark? I often order the Ahi Tuna Rice Bowl over Brown Rice and greens. Delish! Never a bad piece of Ahi. My wife enjoys Wild Salmon Teriyaki Bowl. I sometimes splurge on their Sweet Potato Fries. Outstanding! This was the first restaurant where I had this dish. Now most places have it on their menu.

Service is professional and prices are reasonable. Decor is cool, yet friendly. My only complaint is this place does get a bit noisy at times. There is a bar off to one side and it can get rowdy. 

I still give it 5 stars, mostly for the consistent food quality.

excerpts:
FOOD FAVs: 
Hawaiian Poke - sushi-grade ahi tuna in a sesame-soy marinade with wonton crisps
House Cured Sake Salmon - nori rice cakes, wasabi creme fraiche & black tobiko caviar
ahi tuna.author: Elaine L.
ahi tuna.review:
LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE!

1. Tasty food (I'll get into that below)
2. Great atmosphere
3. Friendly servers, bartenders, & owners
4. Great happy hour specials! Even late night!!

All ingredients to win a spot as one of my favorite restaurants!!

FOOD FAVs: 
Hawaiian Poke - sushi-grade ahi tuna in a sesame-soy marinade with wonton crisps
House Cured Sake Salmon - nori rice cakes, wasabi creme fraiche & black tobiko caviar
Sweet Potato Fries Basket - "signature" fries
Fried Dulce de Leche "Spring Rolls" - with vanilla ice cream & caramel sauce 

Happy Hour
4:00pm - 6:00pm, Monday through Friday
10:00pm - close, nightly

I've seen Pacific Catch participate at a ton of local events like the SF Weekly DISH and the Yelp Unwrapped Holiday Party and it's always been a big hit!  They really love their local customers and it shows when you talk to the staff either at these events or in their restaurant.

Now, I'm just patiently waiting till they open one up in the East Bay =)

excerpts: I've had their tacos and ahi tuna entree salad.
They were also good.
ahi tuna.author: J C.
ahi tuna.review: I had their entree salad with salmon and I liked it. For $15, I was pretty stuffed. Service was friendly. Filled up our cups right away. I've had their tacos and ahi tuna entree salad. They were also good. I like their original location bec it is a lot smaller but intimate. However, this location has plenty of space with a lot more seating and a parking lot for maybe 6-7 cars.

excerpts: The Ahi tuna salad is good tasting, even though the thin slices are a bit skimpish.
ahi tuna.author: David H.
ahi tuna.review:
A low cost healthy fish yummy fish joint.
Salad are not weighed down with tons of dressing, light flavorful.

The Ahi tuna salad is good tasting, even though the thin slices are a bit skimpish.  

Reading all the reviews here, I agree the best value is the healthy fare, as the fried portions are just ok / nothing to write home about.

excerpts: Amazing balls, especially with ahi tuna.
Wish they were in the east bay, I'd go all the time.
ahi tuna.author: Laura W.
ahi tuna.review: Three words: Japanese Wasabi Bowl!  Amazing balls, especially with ahi tuna. Wish they were in the east bay, I'd go all the time.

excerpts: We ended up getting the sweet potato fries( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/F7Jasi9YOKm_xukGraPLqw/l ), Hawaiian surf & turf( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/b-odRG7EHLA9pF6Tad_32Q/l ), and the ahi tuna wasabi bowl( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/yQEL8q5t9x7sXXys5QP-mA/l ).
ahi tuna.author: Patra I.
ahi tuna.review:
I read so many reviews saying how people really liked Pacific Catch.  I live so close to this place, I had to try it for myself.  I went on a Thursday night at 7:30, and expected a wait, but there were actually a lot of open tables.

Of course we had to start out dinner with drinks, so we got the Pacific Punch and Kamikaze Bloody Mary( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/xrXCgiAiwQKfIcWmIUZDpQ/l ).  The Pacific Punch really tasted like punch...very easy to get drunk off of them!

It took a while to pick what we wanted for dinner.  Nothing really stood out on the menu.  We ended up getting the sweet potato fries( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/F7Jasi9YOKm_xukGraPLqw/l ), Hawaiian surf & turf( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/b-odRG7EHLA9pF6Tad_32Q/l ), and the ahi tuna wasabi bowl( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/yQEL8q5t9x7sXXys5QP-mA/l ).  

The fries were good, but the rest of the food was just ok.  Nothing was super spectacular.  They have happy hour from 4:00-6:00, so I'll just be back for some drinks.

excerpts: Our table of 3 shared a meal-sized salad with hawaiian poke, a three taco platter prepared Traditional Baja style, a Japanese wasabi rice bowl with seared ahi tuna, a grilled yellowtail platter, and fried dolce de leche "spring rolls".
Unfortunately, the yellowtail special was not that special.
The sauce didn't really make sense with the fish.
The hawaiian poke, on the other hand, was wonderfully seasoned and a delight with the mixed greens.
The Japanese wasabi rice bowl came with a perfectly spicy wasabi sauce.
The seared tuna, unfortunately, fell a bit short.
The ahi tuna did not come with a sharp, crisp sear, instead appearing as a small gradient from the cooked exterior and the raw interior.
The tuna was also not as fresh as Mikuni's in Sacramento, which remains to be my top choice for seared tuna.
Now that I've talked about the other dishes, I can finally talk about the fish tacos.
Let me tell you, the fish tacos are heavenly!
If you choose to have your tacos prepared Traditional Baja style, the fis will vary with the catch of the day.
The two times I went, the FOTD was True Cod.
The cod was as fresh as if it had been caught that morning.
The batter came out crisp but not overly thick as to drown out the subtle flavors of the fish.
The guacamole was creamy deliciousness.
Squeeze a bit of lemon on it
and you've got the perfect fish taco.
After a very satisfying meal, we decided to order the fried dolce de leche "spring rolls.
Definitely unique and tasty.
ahi tuna.author: Jenny C.
ahi tuna.review:
Let me preface this by saying that I am not a fish person. At least, not cooked fish. Far too often, fish at restaurants is not fresh and further ruined by being cooked until it's completely dried out. For this reason, I've never paid much attention to Pacific Catch despite passing by its admittedly attractive looking building thousands of times. As far as I was concerned, it would just be another disappointing seafood restaurant. I probably would've continue to ignore this place had my fellow food enthusiast, Andrew W., not urged me to try their fish tacos, which he swore were some of the best he's ever had. We have similar taste in food, so finally, I decided to give it a shot. 

Our table of 3 shared a meal-sized salad with hawaiian poke, a three taco platter prepared Traditional Baja style, a Japanese wasabi rice bowl with seared ahi tuna, a grilled yellowtail platter, and fried dolce de leche "spring rolls". Unfortunately, the yellowtail special was not that special. The sauce didn't really make sense with the fish. The hawaiian poke, on the other hand, was wonderfully seasoned and a delight with the mixed greens. The Japanese wasabi rice bowl came with a perfectly spicy wasabi sauce. The seared tuna, unfortunately, fell a bit short. The ahi tuna did not come with a sharp, crisp sear, instead appearing as a small gradient from the cooked exterior and the raw interior. The tuna was also not as fresh as Mikuni's in Sacramento, which remains to be my top choice for seared tuna. Now that I've talked about the other dishes, I can finally talk about the fish tacos. Let me tell you, the fish tacos are heavenly! If you choose to have your tacos prepared Traditional Baja style, the fis will vary with the catch of the day. The two times I went, the FOTD was True Cod. The cod was as fresh as if it had been caught that morning. The batter came out crisp but not overly thick as to drown out the subtle flavors of the fish. The guacamole was creamy deliciousness. Squeeze a bit of lemon on it and you've got the perfect fish taco. After a very satisfying meal, we decided to order the fried dolce de leche "spring rolls." Definitely unique and tasty. One person at my table found the dolce de leche to be a bit too sweet, but I liked it just fine. 

Just writing about Pacific Catch makes me crave it. I can't wait to come back again for the fish tacos and dessert.

excerpts: The ahi tuna sandwich is tasty.
The ceviche is good, but nothing insane.
This place looks and feels like a Chevy's type restaurant.
But whatever....
ahi tuna.author: Click C.
ahi tuna.review: Almost always delicious.  The ahi tuna sandwich is tasty.  The ceviche is good, but nothing insane. This place looks and feels like a Chevy's type restaurant.  But whatever....

excerpts: Ahi tuna bowl was fatty and tough, and my Teriyaki bowl arrived looking like a TV dinner- rice with little areas of vegetable that were sliced too large to even fit in your mouth.
ahi tuna.author: Brooke C.
ahi tuna.review:
I've walked by this place for years and finally decided to try it last night. 
Applebee's meets Pacific/Asian fusion. "Fresh" fish on a  rice bowl, on pasta, on a salad or in a sandwich along side any option of tropical corn syrup cocktail.

The waitress was very nice but when taking our order asked, "What kind of protein would you like on that?" Granted there are three options, but if I'm paying $20 for a rice bowl I don't want to feel like I'm at Jamba Juice. 

The ambiance- just like eating in a Holiday Inn lobby. Short carpet on the floor, plastic wicker chairs and TERRIBLE, generic prints of fish all over. 

My boyfriends seared Ahi tuna bowl was fatty and tough, and my Teriyaki bowl arrived looking like a TV dinner- rice with little areas of vegetable that were sliced too large to even fit in your mouth. 

I should have know things could only go down hill when the first thing they brought to the table was complimentary Edamame and PRETZEL GOLDFISH. This would have been neat...if I was 5. 

Lesson learned: I will never, ever eat here again.

excerpts: The ahi tuna wasabi sandwich that I used to die for is now lost its great taste and the tuna isnt just as fresh anymore.
The firecracker sushi is still alright.
ahi tuna.author: Michelle I.
ahi tuna.review: We were excited to see this place open a couple of years ago in our neighborhood. Since then we have been there multiple times. Recently we found the food to have lost its luster. The ahi tuna wasabi sandwich that I used to die for is now lost its great taste and the tuna isnt just as fresh anymore. The firecracker sushi is still alright. And their sweet potato fries cannot be done wrong. Too bad this place lost its footing and I am hoping maybe the next time I give this place a chance it will be different!

excerpts: It was pretty packed on a Saturday around 6 p.m., which was no surprise, so I ordered for take-out and decided to wait at the bar, grab a beer and watch the game while my wasabi ahi tuna bowl was being prepared.
Although the place was packed my order was ready before I could finish my beer
and I don't nurse my beers.
Since it was a beautiful and warm evening in SF I decided to journey across the street into Golden Gate Park to enjoy a quiet, relaxing meal in the summer sun.
I would definitely like to come back some time to try what else this place has to offer, but so far I thought the food was pretty good and filling.
I also give this establishment a plus for serving Kona Longboard lager on tap.
ahi tuna.author: Erich D.
ahi tuna.review:
I've been wanting to check this place out ever since I passed by it one time on my way to Golden Gate Park via 9th Ave. 

It was pretty packed on a Saturday around 6 p.m., which was no surprise, so I ordered for take-out and decided to wait at the bar, grab a beer and watch the game while my wasabi ahi tuna bowl was being prepared. Although the place was packed my order was ready before I could finish my beer and I don't nurse my beers. Since it was a beautiful and warm evening in SF I decided to journey across the street into Golden Gate Park to enjoy a quiet, relaxing meal in the summer sun. I would definitely like to come back some time to try what else this place has to offer, but so far I thought the food was pretty good and filling. I also give this establishment a plus for serving Kona Longboard lager on tap.

excerpts: Les suggested the items I should get, ahi tuna bowl thing and oysters.
With all the noise and crowd, we still talked for hours..
talk about work, guys, drama, gossip, and the best part, she understood my embarrasment from the past and reassured me that its better to be alone than with a 2timer.
But its in the past, and the tuna ahi bowl was sitting in front of me..
So freaking good.
We also had sweet potatoe fries (yuumy sauce) and oysters.
I loved it.
I wish I had a bigger stomach to eat more!
The waitress was awesome.. gave us plenty of suggestions.
oh and the drinks!
yummy!
I think I had a lemongrass mojito??
ahi tuna.author: Cel A.
ahi tuna.review:
Before I tried this spot, I use to drive by it every time I shopped around Haight street. Back in the days, I went to this spot when it was Canvas. 

Anyways, I ran into a long lost friend, Leslie R. (she's on my Yelp).  Long story short, I bumped into Les at a nail salon.
