I freaked out and got a lil embarrassed bc unfortunately, Les knows me from my ex's softball team.  (FYI, its not really fun to run into people who know that you got played). We chatted for a bit, and exchanged numbers.  Now I love hanging out with her.  She invited me to lunch at Pacific Catch.

Les suggested the items I should get, ahi tuna bowl thing and oysters.  With all the noise and crowd, we still talked for hours.. talk about work, guys, drama, gossip, and the best part, she understood my embarrasment from the past and reassured me that its better to be alone than with a 2timer.  But its in the past, and the tuna ahi bowl was sitting in front of me.. So freaking good. We also had sweet potatoe fries (yuumy sauce) and oysters.  I loved it.  I wish I had a bigger stomach to eat more!  The waitress was awesome.. gave us plenty of suggestions.  oh and the drinks! yummy! I think I had a lemongrass mojito?? I had some mojito and it made me a lil tipsy. 

I think the best part about it, the sauces.  The sauces really make the dish.  And it wasnt the same sauce in every dish (like some lazy restaurants do)  There was a sauce for each specific dish.  I love it here, only bc I love seafood! I can't wait to come here again!

excerpts: Korean ribs tasted as if they were prepared week ago, ahi tuna slices were not chewable, crab salads have been much better in other places.
Please add a very slow service.
ahi tuna.author: Boris S.
ahi tuna.review: Mediocre food. Not sure why it is so popular . Korean ribs tasted as if they were prepared week ago, ahi tuna slices were not chewable, crab salads have been much better in other places. Please add a very slow service.

excerpts: My favorite was Hawaiian poke, sushi-grade ahi tuna in a sesame-soy marinade & spicy seasonings with wonton crisps, and Calamari.
To me, the ahi tuna got slightly too salty near the bottom of the bowl, I think it might be the soy sauces that marinade the fish.
For dinner we ordered, the Fried Dulce de Leche "Spring Rolls", which spring roll that wrap with cluster or cheese cake filling.
And served with vanilla ice cream & caramel sauce....
Yummy
ahi tuna.author: Stacy L.
ahi tuna.review:
Went there on Saturday for dinner, and we got seated right before the dinner crowded came in.  Finding parking is always challenge in Irving area at night, but we were lucky to find a parking in the parking lot. The dinner was great and the services was fast. For two of us, we ordered the Hawaiian Poke, Cabo Calamari, King crab leg soup, and traditional tacos with sweet potato fries. 
My favorite was Hawaiian poke, sushi-grade ahi tuna in a sesame-soy marinade & spicy seasonings with wonton crisps, and Calamari. To me, the ahi tuna got slightly too salty near the bottom of the bowl, I think it might be the soy sauces that marinade the fish. For dinner we ordered, the Fried Dulce de Leche "Spring Rolls", which spring roll that wrap with cluster or cheese cake filling.  And served with vanilla ice cream & caramel sauce....Yummy

excerpts:
For lunch we had:
- Ahi tuna poke (starter) served with wonton chips- super fresh and just as tasty as I remember.
I could probably eat a whole serving of this myself
ahi tuna.author: Nadia L.
ahi tuna.review:
I was introduced to this place a couple of years ago when we attended a graduation celebration here. Since then I haven't had a chance to make it back here until recently and I'm so glad I did. 

After running B2B, we were trying to decide where to eat and since I've been talking about wanting to go back here for I don't know how long, the rest of my group decided to accomodate my request. 

We got there right at 11am when it opened which was perfect since we were able to find parking in the small lot next to the restaurant for customers and we were seated in a nice table next to the window where we could see peopel walkby in their costumes.

For lunch we had:
- Ahi tuna poke (starter) served with wonton chips- super fresh and just as tasty as I remember. I could probably eat a whole serving of this myself
- Sushi grade ahi salad- seared ahi, avocado, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds with soy-wasabi vinaigrette- delicious and fresh it was a perfect meal after a run
- Cabo shrimp taco- crispy shrimp with pico de gallo, avocado, jalapeño tartar & lime crema- huge shrimp, lightly battered and super tasty. 
- Monthly special: Some fish that starts with an e that I can't remember, but it had some spice rub on it, served with some green sauce, sweet potato fries and grilled zucchini, peppers and corn.
- Dessert: Mochi fondue- came with 3 type of mochi- chocolate, vanilla and coffee with a warm fudge in the middle- yummy!! 

Everything was fantastic. If I lived in SF or if my office was remotely close to this restaurant,  I would probably be here a lot more. Service was also super friendly and I appreciate our server for putting up with my endless requests for tea (it was freezing outside!). What can I say, I love this place and am looking forward to coming back to try more dishes from their menu.

excerpts: My particular favorite is the Pan-Asian bowl, with Ahi tuna (the poke is also good), with half rice and half salad.
Healthy, tasty, and affordable (as seafood goes).
I also love their fish and chips.
ahi tuna.author: Rio S.
ahi tuna.review:
This is one of my favorite restaurants. They have very high quality fish, an attentive wait staff who remember me, and interesting choices in food.

My particular favorite is the Pan-Asian bowl, with Ahi tuna (the poke is also good), with half rice and half salad. Healthy, tasty, and affordable (as seafood goes). I also love their fish and chips.

excerpts: Our waitor recommended this seared ahi tuna taco that was sooooo good.
He also recommended my friend this spicy margarita drink that had vodka, passionfruit juice & jalapeños in it.
It was good
but WAY too spicy for us lol.
No harm though for happy hour since it was only like $4.
I paired my food with the mai thai.
*caution
* it is very strong so be prepared lol.
(I tend to like my drinks strong anyways but it was stronger than I expected.
Basically took shots towards the bottom of the drink)
ahi tuna.author: Andrea M.
ahi tuna.review: Went there for my first time today for a late birthday lunch for me with a friend for happy hour. Sat at the bar and got promptly waited on. We ordered a steak taco, spicy tuna roll, and salmon poké. Our waitor recommended this seared ahi tuna taco that was sooooo good. He also recommended my friend this spicy margarita drink that had vodka, passionfruit juice & jalapeños in it. It was good but WAY too spicy for us lol. No harm though for happy hour since it was only like $4. I paired my food with the mai thai. *caution* it is very strong so be prepared lol. (I tend to like my drinks strong anyways but it was stronger than I expected. Basically took shots towards the bottom of the drink) The spicy tuna roll was indeed spicy but tolerable if you like spicy food and my poké was pretty good too. I saw some reviews of people getting sick or not liking theirs but so far I'm feeling fine. Overall a very good restaurant. Must try!

excerpts: For lunch, we had the Ahi Tuna Sandwich ($10), the assorted seafood tacos ($15), and a brownie sundae ($7).
The ahi sandwich was excellent and I would definitely recommend it.
The seafood tacos were fair, but I would only get the shrimp again.
ahi tuna.author: Rob R.
ahi tuna.review:
For lunch, we had the Ahi Tuna Sandwich ($10), the assorted seafood tacos ($15), and a brownie sundae ($7).  The ahi sandwich was excellent and I would definitely recommend it.  The seafood tacos were fair, but I would only get the shrimp again.  The sweet potato fries make an excellent combo!

The service was average, but we did manage to ask for a couple of refills of iced tea.

excerpts:
Appetizer:
Ahi Tuna Poke - OK
ahi tuna.author: Yan N.
ahi tuna.review:
Appetizer:
Ahi Tuna Poke - OK
Won Ton Chips were tasty, not bland for once

Entree:
Sturgeon with Sweet Potato Fries & Veggies
Nothing really special, a bit disappointed

The one star for our waiter being awesome! (Parker)
Gave us dessert on the house since we didnt really enjoy our food
Dulche De Leche Sping Rolls - The highlight of the whole meal!

I probably wont be coming back here...

excerpts: I got the ahi tuna salad, which was 15$, pretty expensive for a salad not enough fish or dressing on it, it was very big though but it needed more fish and dressing!
also ordered a cocktail,which was delicious.
Overall I liked it
but it wasn't anything special,and a bit overpriced.
ahi tuna.author: Milla K.
ahi tuna.review: Wanted to go here for a long time, friend loves this place and I am a huge seafood lover so I came along! Our waitress was very nice and helpful so 5 stars for her, but the food was just Okay. I got the ahi tuna salad, which was 15$, pretty expensive for a salad not enough fish or dressing on it, it was very big though but it needed more fish and dressing! also ordered a cocktail,which was delicious. Overall I liked it but it wasn't anything special,and a bit overpriced.

excerpts: I chose the ahi tuna serrano, california style, and salmon lomi lomi.
They were all awesome; I'll definitely be going back.
ahi tuna.author: Melissa C.
ahi tuna.review: Went here last night with my boyfriend. We shared the crab soup which was super bomb!! I wish we each got our own. He had the crab sandwich which was really good, too. I got the three poke dinner which is raw fish cut in cubes and marinated/mixed with different stuff. I chose the ahi tuna serrano, california style, and salmon lomi lomi. They were all awesome; I'll definitely be going back.

excerpts: From what I noticed with other people, they had a choice of white or brown rice, half salad and half Ahi tuna.
ahi tuna.author: Ede S.
ahi tuna.review:
I thought I did a good job by reading Yelp reviews before I came to this place for my future brother in law's surprise birthday lunch. After seeing what everyone else at the table ordered compared to me and my fiance, I was deeply disappointed in myself. I should've read everything more thoroughly, doh!

I did read that the fish tacos were good so I ordered that. They weren't horrible, but comparing my dish to everyone else, it felt like I was a kid who got chicken fingers and fries at a wedding whereas everybody else got the prime rib. Speaking of fries, SWEET POTATO FRIES, yummay!! The Cajun fries weren't bad too, but I love sweet potato fries and these would be rated 9 on my scale of 10 (10 being absolute perfection).

For a casual encounter, I would definitely recommend fish tacos which comes with the choice of fries (choose sweet potato). But everyone at the table (or at least 90% of the people) ordered the Wasabi bowl. Next time I'm back, I will definitely get that. Not only does it look delish, it's also quite healthy as well. From what I noticed with other people, they had a choice of white or brown rice, half salad and half Ahi tuna. Oh my gosh my mouth is watering and my stomach just grumbled a bit while I thought about that.

Next time... Wasabi bowl... get in my belly!!!

excerpts:
here's their HH menu: 
Hawaiian Poke - sushi-grade ahi tuna in a sesame-soy marinade & spicy seasonings with wonton crisps
Asparagus & Shiitake - asparagus tempura & shiitake mushrooms with miso dressing
Spicy Tuna - ahi tuna with sriracha mayo
ahi tuna.author: Kapo T.
ahi tuna.review:
i m not a big asian fusion fan probably because i think asian food is traditional enough and shouldn't be made any different. i've been here 3 times and the food is OK. nothing great. the location is great if you need a snack from walking the GGP or the museums. (but there are other food to eat around there also).  

the only thing that i recommend is the happy hour here. on a nice sunny day, the bar and outside seating is packed.  happy hour is from 4p-6p so get your orders in before 6p.  

here's their HH menu: 
Hawaiian Poke - sushi-grade ahi tuna in a sesame-soy marinade & spicy seasonings with wonton crisps
Asparagus & Shiitake - asparagus tempura & shiitake mushrooms with miso dressing
Spicy Tuna - ahi tuna with sriracha mayo
Thai Coconut Shrimp - Thai sweet-chili sauce
Spicy Cabo Calamari - crispy chili & lemon with spicy chipotle sauce
Warm Edamame - Hawaiian Alaea sea salt
Basket of Fries - "signature" sweet potato, traditional or spicy 

and yup, we ordered 3 of everything on the HH menu to beat the time! get their sweet potato fries, i like that one the best

excerpts: It has tempura shrimp and avocado wrapped in ahi tuna with a citrus sauce.
I don't like that they stuff
pickled ginger into the roll but if you're like me, just request that they leave it out.
Otherwise it's a very tasty roll.
The ahi tuna is always fresh and flavorful.
I love that they give you big pieces of it too.
(We got that roll totally F-R-E-E! with the coupon in the Green Zebra book!)
ahi tuna.author: Julia T.
ahi tuna.review:
Out of the three Pacific Catch locations, I would say this is my overall favorite. Chestnut St. is just way too tiny and crowded, though that might result in the food tasting better because you had to fight so hard to park/get a table. Corte Madera's location is too embedded in the outdoor mall scene and has way too many kiddies running around. But this 9th Ave. location is pretty much perfect with plenty of seating for the bar and regular dining area. It also has its own parking lot so you don't have to compete for the street meters. 

Food is pretty consistent at all locations. You can count on the fact that mostly everything you order from the regular menu will be very good. Some of my favorites are the wasabi bowls (with brown or sushi rice) and any of the fried seafood baskets. I love the Mixed Catch Basket with fish, coconut shrimp and crispy oysters with jalapeño tartar. SO GOOD. Everything comes freshly fried with those awesome sweet potato fries. But eat everything while they are fresh! I don't recommend taking leftover fries home. They really those their flavor after they've cooled down. 

Though their sushi roll selection lacks raw fish, I think they are still made very well with the mostly cooked ingredients. One of my favorites and one that DOES have raw fish is the Rising Sun roll. It has tempura shrimp and avocado wrapped in ahi tuna with a citrus sauce. I don't like that they stuff pickled ginger into the roll but if you're like me, just request that they leave it out. Otherwise it's a very tasty roll. The ahi tuna is always fresh and flavorful.  I love that they give you big pieces of it too. (We got that roll totally F-R-E-E! with the coupon in the Green Zebra book!) I could dine happily on their sushi rolls alone. 

Just recently I ventured off from my regulars and tried one of the their specials: Trout bbq'd baja style so it was spice rubbed and grilled, served with tomatilla avocado sauce, some thin slices of veggies, and fresh grilled corn over sweet potato fries. I could tell the fish was very fresh but for me, it was TOO seasoned and got a little salty since the fish wasn't very thick. And though I had originally wanted the fries, I would now have preferred and wished that the fish was served over rice. I think I'll stick to my regulars next time. 

Big pluses:
-I've talked to the workers and seen for myself that Pacific Catch is environmentally conscious. They use biodegradable materials, from the takeout containers to the straw in your drink. Pacific Catch also practices composting from their kitchen to the leftover food scraps. Smiles all around. =D
-I don't know anywhere else that you can get UNLIMITED refills on Thai iced tea. I could drink three glasses easy. LOVE IT!

excerpts: It was an eye opening experience to see them shoveling their fried rice with their Ahi Tuna poke (rhymes with hokey-pokey) almost non-stop until their plates were clean.
I almost said to our server:
ahi tuna.author: CT L.
ahi tuna.review:
"Spooning leads to forking" may be great nocturnal advice for an intimately-challenged couple, but it sure is not a pretty sight for a couple to be eating with their spoon AND fork at the same time. 

It was an eye opening experience to see them shoveling their fried rice with their Ahi Tuna poke (rhymes with hokey-pokey) almost non-stop until their plates were clean.  I almost said to our server:  I wanna have what they are having.  

If you have never tried Pacific Catch, please try some of their best Asian/ Fusion dishes: shrimp ceviche, crab and avocado salad, poke wasabi bowl, ahi bowl, rock cod, and their sweet potato fries.  They have been consistently delicious at this location.  Also opt for the brown rice as a healthy option.  

If you have to get sushi, their spicy tuna roll stands out.

Since Pacific Catch's parking lot fills up quickly, you can park one block away in Golden Gate Park.  You are close to the museums and botanical garden - perfect to stroll after a date.

Drinks are a bit on the weak side, even though the pomegranate mojitos and lemongrass mojitos are tasty before the ice melts.

Decor is nice and roomy inside with a few outdoor tables.
Bathroom is pleasantly clean.  Servers and hostesses are friendly.

Tips:
*  Call ahead for best seating.  Otherwise they will seat you close to the bar and not in the booths.
 
It was the couple's anniversary, and maybe they were in a hurry to move onto their next activity.  Anyway, I wish them happy spooning and happy forking!

excerpts: The Ahi tuna Wasabi bowl, is delicious.
Lots of ahi and enough rice to feed a family.
ahi tuna.author: mike j.
ahi tuna.review:
This place is a pretty good asian fusion place.  I must admit that although I've been here quite a few times, I tend to get the same thing...because it's so damn good and filling.

The Ahi tuna Wasabi bowl, is delicious.  Lots of ahi and enough rice to feed a family.  You won't be able to finish this.  

I also like the Ahi 3 ways, which is served 1) seared, 2) hawaiian poke style and 3) sashimi.  That's pretty tasty as well.

The sweet potato fries are really good too!

excerpts: Started off with the rare ahi tuna over a small salad: this was really good.
The tuna was fresh and tasty.
The salad was light and not overwhelming with dressing.
ahi tuna.author: Thuy H.
ahi tuna.review:
Started off with the rare ahi tuna over a small salad: this was really good.  The tuna was fresh and tasty.  The salad was light and not overwhelming with dressing.  It's how a starter should be, it left me wanting more.

I ordered the mahi mahi special.  The mahi mahi was small, and there was a whole lot of grilled onions.  I wasn't a fan of the grilled onions.  What I should have done was substitute it for the sweet potato fries, but I didn't know how popular they were until it was too late.

I was so disappointed in my meal I was tempted to try the vietnamese special sandwich.  It seemed as if everyone had ordered it and  it looked so good!

Our waitress wasn't so nice.  Service was a little slow.

excerpts: Anyway, I ordered the 3 Ahi something, that came with 3 different kinds of ahi tuna.
Sounded like a small meal, but I got it anyway.
ahi tuna.author: kim w.
ahi tuna.review:
Came back here with Kylie L.!! What brought us in......just the sweet potato fries.

Kylie L. OOo'ed, and I Ahh'd, and we went in.  It seemed busy, but there were a few tables that were free.  The hostess said it will take about 5-10 mins..........wtf? There are tables, so after waiting for about 3mins id say, we got one of the empty tables near the entrance...hmmm

Anyway, I ordered the 3 Ahi something, that came with 3 different kinds of ahi tuna.  Sounded like a small meal, but I got it anyway. Kylie L. got fish and chips that came with sweet potato fries and we got an extra basket of SPF's.  Yummy!! the spf came with sweet and sour sauce, and a sweet horse radish sauce.  The horse radish one is good!  I ate half the basket, theyre just addicting.  

My ahi came, DANG, it was huge, maybe because of the big bowl of rice in the middle.  3 pieces of seared ahi covered with sesame seeds, that one was the best.  Another 3 pieces of seared ahi with some kinda thousand island dressing on it..2nd place. And tuna poke.  Poke ALWAYS sounds good, but it is not so good here...its just drenched in soy sauce.  SO i have 3 different  kinds of ahi in 3 different kinds of sauces, and one the side were shitake mushrooms fried with something also in sauce...hmm..all the sauces mixed together did not go so well with my rice...so i had a lot left over and made chinese porridge the next day.  That was not so good either..

I didnt try the fish and chips, but it looked like a lot.

The goods: food comes fast and SPF's
The bads: didnt i just tell u about them?

excerpts: The bread on the wasabi ahi tuna sandwich was really chewy and tough.
The sandwich also had very little tuna for 9 dollars.
The fried mix fish basket was only ok, again nothing special.
Menu doesn't really have cohesion.
I guess that's the price you pay for lots of choices: nothing is exceptional.
The service was not good.
ahi tuna.author: Jen Y.
ahi tuna.review:
Pluses:
The place is pretty nice, spacious with cool lighting.
Large menu with lots of choices
Big plates
Kids are welcome

Ehs:
The food was okay. The sweet potato fries are nothing special.
Five spice fries taste like bbq chips, not my thing.
The bread on the wasabi ahi tuna sandwich was really chewy and tough. The sandwich also had very little tuna for 9 dollars.
The fried mix fish basket was only ok, again nothing special.
Menu doesn't really have cohesion. I guess that's the price you pay for lots of choices: nothing is exceptional.
The service was not good. I think there were only one or two waitresses working the entire place.

Overall: good for large parties who want a lot of choice but it's nothing special.

excerpts: My aunt and I split the ahi tuna salad, small sweet potato fries and the shiso roll.
The salad was alright, they could have given more pieces of ahu, but the dressing was good.
Not salty like most restaurants and my salad was drowning in it.
I loved the shiso roll!!
It went well with the tempura and avocado in it.
The sweet potato fries were ok.
ahi tuna.author: Lindsay G.
ahi tuna.review: They have a little bit of every thing on the menu. My aunt and I split the ahi tuna salad, small sweet potato fries and the shiso roll. The salad was alright, they could have given more pieces of ahu, but the dressing was good. Not salty like most restaurants and my salad was drowning in it. I loved the shiso roll!! It went well with the tempura and avocado in it. The sweet potato fries were ok.

excerpts: Ahi Tuna 3 way - poke, sesame seared and another kind of seared with rice, seaweed salad, some terryaki mushroom edamame mix and another mixed salad that could've been one of those japanese mixes with turnip.
ahi tuna.author: Stacey C.
ahi tuna.review:
I just came back from my Valentine's Day dinner and I'm all alone and yelping already.  I was really excited to try this place because the reviews are pretty decent so far.  So we went for the Valentine's Day special for $65.  Everything on there I believe you can order through the chalkboard special menu or regular dinner menu.  

Decor was nice and the place looks a lot bigger than it does from the outside.  I guess I never noticed Canvas was that big inside.  The beech wood on the ceiling brightens up the place while still looking a little romantic, and even the bathroom walls/doors have the little bamboo inside plexiglass look which is nice to look at when you have to pee.

Starter:
Firecracker roll - a spicy tempura salmon roll
Entrees:
1. Ahi Tuna 3 way - poke, sesame seared and another kind of seared with rice, seaweed salad, some terryaki mushroom edamame mix and another mixed salad that could've been one of those japanese mixes with turnip.
2. Grilled Salmon with artichoke and a layer of tomatos
Dessert:
Mochi ice cream fondue with vanilla, coffee and chocolate flavored ice cream
Drinks: Sparkling white wine

The portions were pretty good sized for $65 for 2 people.  The firecracker roll was rather large, but if you look closely, it's a lot of rice wrapped in them.  It still tasted good though and didn't come out looking all sloppy like some restaurants make their sushi.  I really liked the ahi 3-way.  The seared kinds were better and more buttery than the poke, which to me was kind of chewy.  Not exactly the way I pictured poke.  But every other piece was fine.  My husband had the salmon and said he wished he picked something else.  Salmon is salmon - nothing special, but cooked really nicely - not overcooked, just right.  
Dessert was really good.  I love chocolate and I like mochi ice cream on a stick.  This was just right.  
The wine was definitely not the best.  I think with our chosen food, the wine just ended up tasting sour.  But I love sweet white wines and that's just my preference.

The service was really good for such a crowded night.  We had a really upbeat and polite waitress and they served us our food quickly enough.  A nice place to eat overall with a lot more to try.  I love sweet potato fries so that will be part of my next meal there.  They have what, 5 parking spaces there, but there's plenty of parking across the street and in the park.

excerpts: Went to Pacific Catch on Friday and tried the recommended wasabi ahi tuna bowl.
Wow - lots of food
and I liked the garnishes that came with it, especially the ocean seaweed salad.
The ahi was seared perfectly, but the wasabi dressing could have been a little hotter as I could hardly taste any wasabi at all.
ahi tuna.author: S D.
ahi tuna.review:
Great tip from one of last week's Top Yelpers-Erich D.! 

Went to Pacific Catch on Friday and tried the recommended wasabi ahi tuna bowl.  Wow - lots of food and I liked the garnishes that came with it, especially the ocean seaweed salad.  The ahi was seared perfectly, but the wasabi dressing could have been a little hotter as I could hardly taste any wasabi at all.  Had a bite of their Korean BBQ which was pretty tasty, but there wasn't much BBQ meat for the price.

Good thing I went on 08-08-08 cuz I scored the last parking space in their tiny lot.  Otherwise, looking for street parking around that busy intersection would have been a real downer.  Would have given it a higher rating if parking were better.  Hint: go before 6 p.m. to avoid the crowd.

excerpts: It came out as a generous portion of rice, ahi tuna, sprouts, teriyaki sauce - or was it sriracha?, and a plethora of different vegetables.
Despite how good it was, I could not finish it.
ahi tuna.author: Elsa C.
ahi tuna.review:
I went here on a Friday night sometime a few weeks ago. It was pretty filled up but it didnt look like there was anyone waiting. I had always driven by it and wanted to try it since it was converted from being "The Canvas" For some reason I thought this was strictly an American Fish restaurant - you know, salmon with wild rice and choice of vegetable kinda place, because that is what it looks like on the outside - but it turned out was a Japanese fusion restaurant. 

We started off with some sushi appetizers. If you don't like wasabi, you should ask them to hold it on the sushi, because you wouldn't know it just by looking at the rolls that they a pretty generous amount in there. I myself, love wasabi, but had I known that there was so much in it, I would not have dipped it so much in my super wasabi/soy sauce combo. I admit it, it made me tear. And usually I can handle alot of wasabi.

Then I had the ahi turn wasabi bowl - with tobiko. It came out as a generous portion of rice, ahi tuna, sprouts, teriyaki sauce - or was it sriracha?, and a plethora of different vegetables. Despite how good it was, I could not finish it. It defeated me =(

It was a birthday celebration so they gave us free dessert. It was mochi in a chocolate fondue. YUMMY. I am a sucker for fondue. And fondue and ice cream? What could be better?

I would come back again.

excerpts: my guess is that they did not order the ahi tuna 3 way dish that i did.
ahi tuna.author: Edibleocea N.
ahi tuna.review:
I cant believe anyone would rate this as less than 5 stars... my guess is that they did not order the ahi tuna 3 way dish that i did.

the dish had plenty of tuna prepared three ways; seared, poke, and raw over a bed of rice with a seaweed salad that was all prepared to perfection.  the tuna amount was so ample i literally did not touch my rice having plenty of fish and sides on the dish.

there is a full bar, though we stuck with beers, but i can see this being a great place to stop in for a meal before or after a visit to Golden Gate Park since its literally across the street from one of the entrances.

excerpts: and I stuck what I always love at Pacific Catch... the ahi tuna salad bowl and the sweet potato fries!
YUM!!!
ahi tuna.author: Denise L.
ahi tuna.review:
Great space! It's HUGE! I love it since it's always a pain to go to the one on Chestnut. There's a bar here too, so it's a great place for cocktails. The menu is also more extended with sushi offerings as well as other specialties such as Korean BBQ beef.

I came here two already and I stuck what I always love at Pacific Catch... the ahi tuna salad bowl and the sweet potato fries! YUM!!!

excerpts: They have delicious, fresh and healthy seared ahi tuna (or spicy poki) bowls and salads.
They make pretty good cocktails, too.
At this location the seating usually isn't a problem and the service is good.
It feels a little chain restaurant-ish, but it's not.
Good sustainable options, too.
Consistent all the way around.
ahi tuna.author: Robynne W.
ahi tuna.review: I love Pacific Catch! They have delicious, fresh and healthy seared ahi tuna (or spicy poki) bowls and salads. They make pretty good cocktails, too. At this location the seating usually isn't a problem and the service is good. It feels a little chain restaurant-ish, but it's not. Good sustainable options, too. Consistent all the way around.

excerpts: I ordered the Wasabi Bowl with Ahi Tuna (and brown rice).
This food is awesome if you're looking for a healthy meal.
As I said before, the Ahi was as fresh and flavorful as it gets, and the bowl included avocadoes, ginger, sprouts, ect.
ahi tuna.author: Damon B.
ahi tuna.review:
Awesome food for a random Saturday night. We had a group of four and were seated immedietly. The place was about half full at about 9:30 PM. Good drink selection (I had a Sierra Nevada). As appetizers we got Edamame (served warm, not cold for a change) and the Ahi Poke. I have to say, the Ahi was about as fresh as it gets. Very flavorful. I ordered the Wasabi Bowl with Ahi Tuna (and brown rice). This food is awesome if you're looking for a healthy meal. As I said before, the Ahi was as fresh and flavorful as it gets, and the bowl included avocadoes, ginger, sprouts, ect. The other three people in our group ordered salads...all healthy portions. 

I live in San Jose and I wish we had a Pacific Catch closer to home. 

My buddy suggested the place as we were walking by (he's been there several times) and I'll agree, this is really good, fresh food.

excerpts: I'm in love with their Ahi Tuna bowl with brown rice.
The tuna is always PERFECTLY seared... except for the one time I ordered it to go.
By the time I got back to the office, it had cooked itself in the box, unfortunately.
But at the restaurant, it's always cooked on the outside, and still pink and juicy in the middle.
You also get little bits of seaweed salad, sprouts, and pickled vegetables.
ahi tuna.author: Jane A.
ahi tuna.review:
First off, how awesome is it that they give you little fish pretzels and edamame to start off your lunch?  I have this bad habit of getting busy at work and putting off my lunch break until 1:00 or later, so by the time I get to a restaurant, I'm starving.  Having a little snack while I'm waiting for my food is exactly what I need to put me in a good mood again. 

I'm in love with their Ahi Tuna bowl with brown rice.  The tuna is always PERFECTLY seared... except for the one time I ordered it to go.  By the time I got back to the office, it had cooked itself in the box, unfortunately.  
But at the restaurant, it's always cooked on the outside, and still pink and juicy in the middle.  You also get little bits of seaweed salad, sprouts, and pickled vegetables.  Tasty!

They also have fun, sugary martini drinks, which I always enjoy (after work, of course).  I wish they'd have a happy hour discount on them, though, because it's a little cost prohibitive to have more than one.  

Speaking of cost-prohibitive, I would come here more often if their entrees were also a little less expensive.  Minus one star for that.  I don't normally like to spend more than $10 on lunch, so it feels like a waste to spend $15-20 at Pacific Catch, when there are lots of delicious and cheap restaurants in the neighborhood.   As it is, I still manage to go to Pacific Catch about once a month, so apparently it's occasionally worth it for the perfect tuna.  :-)

excerpts: I really wanted to order the famous rice bowls but I opted for ahi tuna 3 ways!!!!
And 3 ways I was pleased.
Sweetie got the beef with prawns.
I don't know what it was called because I was busy concentrating on my tuna.
He said his was delicious except it was not enough.
(Disclaimer:
my sweetie is a hefty eater.
ahi tuna.author: Leah E.
ahi tuna.review:
My sweetie wanted to give this place 5 stars. No,  he is not a Yelper but he vicariously Yelps through me.  His Yelp is as valid as mine since we are in this together.  

So, we had a nice delicious date night at Pacific Catch on 9th Street. Initially I planned on taking a nice walk at the Botanical Garden at Golden Gate Park to induce some nature in sweetie's system but it closes at 5 pm which meant it will be too early for dinner at Pacific Catch. So, we slept in anyway on that day and didn't make it to the City until almost 7 PM.  

Found parking at GG Park as soon as we entered the park. Crossed Lincoln holding hands and informed the hostess that we had a 7:30 reservation at 6:50 PM. Got seated right away.  I felt sad!!!! This used to be Canvas Cafe where my very, very dear friend Russell used to perform.  I remembered the good old days when he used to bring down the house!!!!! 

Anyway, sweetie and I got a welcome appetizer of Asian pretzel and edamame. We barely had time to eat it when our appetizer of fried oysters arrived. It was actually very good!!! The oysters were fresh and light.  (Our waiter was very prompt and attentive.)  I really wanted to order the famous rice bowls but I opted for ahi tuna 3 ways!!!! And 3 ways I was pleased.  Sweetie got the beef with prawns.  I don't know what it was called because I was busy concentrating on my tuna.  He said his was delicious except it was not enough. (Disclaimer:  my sweetie is a hefty eater. Pacific Catch's portions are adequate for normal human eaters like me who is Asian, petite but can pack  it in once in a while if the food is yummy!)  

Then we shared the mochi fondue which was nice contrast between the hot and the cold. Cold ice cream wrapped in the soft skin of rice flour dipped in hot smooth chocolate. The flavor just burst in my mouth.   

Overall, the experience was great.  I still could not give it 5 stars, though, even though the venue was hip and welcoming. Maybe because it should have stayed as Canvas Cafe where my dear, dear friend could have been still playing and bringing down the house. Maybe someday.... I will learn to forgive Pacific Catch eventhough I know it was not his fault. But I will definitely go back to his arms again......

We finished the evening with me showing sweetie my old hangout places like Tart to Tart   (that's for another Yelp review) and staying up until 2 PM watching "Eyes Wide Shut."  Yup, I was right all along. Nicole Kidman said the "F" word at the end of the movie.

excerpts: My faves: salmon or ahi tuna wasabi bowl with brown rice, or the taco combo with sweet potato fries.
ahi tuna.author: Misha F.
ahi tuna.review:
Without a blink, 4 stars. 

I seriously love this place. I love the menu, the ambiance, the wicked happy hour deals. 

Sign up for the Pacfic Catch newsletters...there is always a monthly "deal." In October, it was 'buy one entree, get the 2nd free!' 

My faves: salmon or ahi tuna wasabi bowl with brown rice, or the taco combo with sweet potato fries.

I love coming here with girlfriends, esp because you can get opentable.com reservation points--win-win baby!

excerpts: Anywho, my friend and I ordered the wasabi bowl with ahi tuna and crab salad to share.
The bowl was really good and had huge portions.
The salad had a lot of crab, but not much flavor.
The Thai salad on the other hand I liked.
ahi tuna.author: Adrianna C.
ahi tuna.review:
I took my friends here as a late Christmas dinner, subsitute present after my other friend told me how delicious this place was. After confirming the fact on Yelp, I decided to make a reservation. As my friend and I sat and waited for our other friends to arrive, the waiter was kind and attentive. He asked us if we wanted anything to eat as we waited, filled our water cups, and gave us our complentary plate of edamame and pretzel gold fishes. 

To start we ordered Rock & Roll and also sweet potatoe fries. The sweet potatoe fries were really good and the sauce was delicious. Rock & Roll, not so much - it's not that it was bad, rolls are just not a good choice for this restaurant. Anywho, my friend and I ordered the wasabi bowl with ahi tuna and crab salad to share. The bowl was really good and had huge portions. The salad had a lot of crab, but not much flavor. The Thai salad on the other hand I liked. My other friend ordered the salmon sashimi. It wasn't good and unlike the heaping portions of salad and wasabi bowl - it was lacking. She ended up eating from our plates. The meal came out to $80 with tax and tips. A little pricey, but considering what we ate and the occasion, it was pretty good. I would come back, when my wallet permits it. 

The interior design and the high ceiling of the restaurant felt warm and cozy, and definitely made me feel like I was out of the Sunset. This is definitely a romantic restaurant and would be a great place to take a girl on a date. Maybe not a first date though, cause the noise level kills that.

excerpts: It comes with seaweed, fish (depending on what kind, I get the Ahi Tuna or Poke Tuna), guacamole, and some other ingredients I don't remember.
The bowl itself is pretty big, and will definitely fill you up!
It costs about $15 for this bowl.
ahi tuna.author: Diane L.
ahi tuna.review:
I'm so glad that they opened up a Pacific Catch in Inner Sunset... the Marina one is just WAY WAY WAY too small and difficult to get to with parking issues too.  

Pacific Catch is in no way supposed to be close to being authentic japanese food.  Instead of serving you bread, they give you a small plate of fish pretzels and edamame beans.  

They have a large variety of dishes to try.  I like their wasabi bowls.  It comes with seaweed, fish (depending on what kind, I get the Ahi Tuna or Poke Tuna), guacamole, and some other ingredients I don't remember.  The bowl itself is pretty big, and will definitely fill you up!  It costs about $15 for this bowl.  Their sweet potato fries are also very delicious, served with sweet and sour sauce.  Their sushi rolls are average, and nothing spectacular...

I tried their soup special one day... I forget the actual name of it, but it was similar to a ciopinno.  It was a tomato based soup with seafood.  The broth was very flavorful!  There was plenty of content in the soup too.  I was actually surprised by how much I enjoyed it!!  The soup cost about $12 though.  But very delicious.  It's something not always on their menu.

Their fish and chips were very good, comes with about 3-4 pieces depending on what combo you get...  The fish was fresh.  I also got a fish special of the day.  The fish was cooked nicely, and not overcooked.  I don't remember what was in it, but it was reallygood over all.

Overall, if you go here, get their fish dishes.  It's not as cheap as the other restaurants on Irving, but it's worth it for what they give you.  They also can take large groups with reservations... we had a group of 14 or so and the service wasn't bad or lagging at all.

excerpts: but I stayed faithful to my beloved ahi tuna wasabi bowl.
I love it... if I could, I would eat it at least once a week!
I'm coming here from now on to get my ahi fix.
ahi tuna.author: Katherine C.
ahi tuna.review: I've always gone to the Pacific Catch on Chestnut and love it there! The only thing is that parking is impossibleee to find and its a very small place. Decided to come to the one here on 9th to let some out of towners try the food. This Pacific Catch restaurant is sooooo big! They have more stuff on the menu and it came with small dishes of peeled edamami and pretzel fish. I did want to try the 3 way ahi (on the dinner menu but our waitress said they can make it for lunch as well) but I stayed faithful to my beloved ahi tuna wasabi bowl. I love it... if I could, I would eat it at least once a week! I'm coming here from now on to get my ahi fix.

excerpts: I have had on both visits, the Hawaiian Poke (sushi-grade ahi tuna in a delicious sesame-soy marinade with spicy seasonings with fresh wonton crisps (not ordinary wontons found in Chinese places).
ahi tuna.author: Lee S.
ahi tuna.review:
My last  find of 2009 and one of my new favorites in 2010 in San Francisco. This place is great (at least so far for happy hour). I will definitely return again and look forward to doing dinner there soon.

The well-priced happy hour (M-F 4-6 & again from 10-closing) serves daily-featured) house wines at $6. The bar menu is interesting. I have had on both visits, the Hawaiian Poke (sushi-grade ahi tuna in a delicious sesame-soy marinade with spicy seasonings with fresh wonton crisps (not ordinary wontons found in Chinese places). It's a hefty serving at $6.

It's a bit noisy in the bar between 5 & 6 due to the USC students so I suggest before 5 if you prefer a smoother atmosphere.

In Patrick (bartender & server) the establishment could not hope for a better ambassador...thoroughly knowledgeable regarding all the restaurant's programs and very cordial in explaining them as they seem a little complicated at first.

Once again, all in all, a very pleasurable experience.

excerpts: I ordered the Ahi Tuna Wasabi Bowl, topped with (of course) ahi tuna, wakame salad, avocado, ginger and cucumber.
The sushi rice was flavored with a wasabi sauce, which was somewhat mild, but SO GOOD!!
4 stars for their strong drinks, my Ahi Tuna Wasabi bowl and my friend's sweet potato fries!
Although I did like my Ahi Tuna from my last dining here, I would recommend the Ahi Poke over that.
My Lemon Grass Mojito was refreshing as well.
ahi tuna.author: Serena W.
ahi tuna.review:
Arrived here expecting just sushi. Their menu only consisted of about 5-7(?) plain-nothing-out-of-the-original sushi rolls. Then me and my friend realized Pacific Catch was a Japanese-Mexican fusion restaurant, but we decided to give it a try anyways since we were drooling over the food on the table next to us. 

We started off with the Spicy Cabo Calamari, which was really soft in texture, definitely not crispy because the breaded exterior would fall off whenever we tried to pick at one; not spicy at all, it lacked much taste until i doused the heck out of it with the dipping sauce. Then we also figured out they also added a few other concocsions that should have just been left outta the fryer.....like the fried lemon I accidently ate.....twice. 

My friend ordered the Mixed Catch Basket. There wasn't anything special about this, except the fact that her side of Sweet Potato Fries were YUMMY!!

I ordered the Ahi Tuna Wasabi Bowl, topped with (of course) ahi tuna, wakame salad, avocado, ginger and cucumber. The sushi rice was flavored with a wasabi sauce, which was somewhat mild, but SO GOOD!! It's basically like sushi, but bigger and broken down into all its components. 

We also ordered two drinks, a Mai Tai & forgot the name of the other one, but both were pretty strong!! I like! I like!

Gotta come back to try their Mojito & Mochi Fondue!!

4 stars for their strong drinks, my Ahi Tuna Wasabi bowl and my friend's sweet potato fries!


[UPDATED: 4.26.2008]

Came here again with another friend around 8ish. Considering it was a Friday, there was a 30 min. wait for the tables inside, so we decided to dine outside, which turned out really nice...although it was butt-freezing cold at first. Thank god they had the protective sheet to block off most of the wind. 

Tried the Ahi Poke Wasabi bowl this time and it was delicious! Although I did like my Ahi Tuna from my last dining here, I would recommend the Ahi Poke over that. My Lemon Grass Mojito was refreshing as well. My friend's Gin & Tonic was pretty stiff.

Service was still attentive, friendly, consistent and quick. The bar was open till 1AM that day, but too bad we couldn't stay for another round of  drinks considering my friend had the Asian glow by the time he finished his Gin & Tonic. -sigh-

excerpts: The ahi tuna sandwich was lightly seared with spring greens, tomato, wasabi mayonaise, fresh ginger and avocado on chewy ciabatta bread.
ahi tuna.author: Esther R.
ahi tuna.review:
We had an amazing early dinner on the small outdoor patio with Sadie.  As we basked in the warm summer breeze, I gobbled up the shrimp ceviche.  It was perfectly tangy tart with a satisfyingly large quantity of plump, sweet shrimp with lime juice, cilantro, onions, and avocado.  I tossed the tortilla chips aside and just started forking it up.  The ahi tuna sandwich was lightly seared with spring greens, tomato, wasabi mayonaise, fresh ginger and avocado on chewy ciabatta bread.  It was like a sushi sandwich aka the best sandwich I have had in a long time.  

One star down for the sides.  The sweet potato fries were just ok (didn't get any dip) and the cole slaw was bland - both could use some heavier seasoning.  Skip the lemongrass tea.  It was like slightly flavored water for $2.25.  

Service was average.

This is a great stop before or after visiting GG Park.  I'll be back.

excerpts: I am considering flying back to San Fran JUST for the Ahi Tuna Wasabi bowl.
ahi tuna.author: Shoshana g.
ahi tuna.review:
oh.my.god. I am considering flying back to San Fran JUST for the Ahi Tuna Wasabi bowl. 

Sushi was fresh and amazing and exactly what I was hoping for.

LOVED the sweet potato fries as well. 

Wish I had had room for dessert!

excerpts: So you have your unagi or ahi tuna w/
the sushi rice, strips of nori, cucumber, etc...
I got it w/
the sushi rice and
ahi tuna.author: Grace G.
ahi tuna.review:
Better than I thought. =P I must admit that I walked in w/ mediocre expectations -- just another Japanese fusion place. And in reality, it pretty much is that, but its also surprisingly tasty! I had a wasabi bowl, which, oddly enough, doesn't include wasabi. (go figure). It was described to me as all the ingredients that go into a sushi roll...but in a bowl. So you have your unagi or ahi tuna w/ the sushi rice, strips of nori, cucumber, etc...I got it w/ the sushi rice and it was very yum. 

If you like sweet drinks, the kumquat mojito is uuuber yums, even if you're not a fan of mojitos. Its just sweet, but you will have to deal w/ all the mint leave and over-excessive foliage in your drink. =P I'd def go again as a standard in the inner sunset.

excerpts: I usually order the Ahi Tuna Wasabi Bowl with the white rice (the brown rice tastes disgusting to me!)
and it is delicious!
The portions are very filling as well.
This place is good for groups but make sure you make a reservation!
It gets filled up quick for dinner but not so much for lunch.
ahi tuna.author: Vikki K.
ahi tuna.review:
I've been here over a good seven times and I must say, I am pleased each time I visit Pacific Catch. The lunch specials menu is pretty affordable ranging from 7-15 dollars. I usually order the Ahi Tuna Wasabi Bowl with the white rice (the brown rice tastes disgusting to me!) and it is delicious! The portions are very filling as well. This place is good for groups but make sure you make a reservation! It gets filled up quick for dinner but not so much for lunch. The ambiance of the restaurant is nice at night with the hanging blue bottles on the ceiling.

Two tips though! Parking is definitely challenging but they have a private parking lot next to the restaurant! And if the tables are full, the bar tables are up for grabs!

excerpts: The ahi tuna wasabi bowl came in a large bowl, but the tuna did not taste too fresh.
I did appreciate that they offered brown rice as a substitute for white rice.
I will go back for those fries!
ahi tuna.author: Joe O.
ahi tuna.review:
This place is supposed to be FUSION of Asian and American cuisine.

Basically it's Asian food for white people as my friend said over dinner.  The American food with an Asian twist wins.  The Asian food with American flavor is somewhat bland and uninspired.

Waitresses are very friendly, and service was great.  There is this Asian guy that stands at the counter, but is not dressed in a uniform.  He looked like a customer, but don't be fooled he works there =T 

Fried Fish (n Chips)= WIN (Not greasy, well fried, mostly good chunks)
Sweet potato fries = WIN (They need to cut these bigger! So GOOD)
Any Ice Tea= LOSE (water with lemon tastes better than lemon grass)
WASABI BOWLS= LOSE (4 tiny pieces of not fresh tuna, and rice $14)
Sanwich= WIN

Sweet potato fries are great, and I only wish they came in bigger cuts.  I liked the sweet dipping sauce.  The ahi tuna wasabi bowl came in a large bowl, but the tuna did not taste too fresh.  I did appreciate that they offered brown rice as a substitute for white rice.  I will go back for those fries!

excerpts: P.S. Ahi Tuna has high levels of Mercury.
I'm trying not to eat tuna too much!!
eep!
(See article in NYTimes).
ahi tuna.author: J T.
ahi tuna.review:
I like their sweet potato fries and the wasabi bowls. :)

But I think they are pricey. Pricey price pricey! For what the food is...

I didn't like the poke too much. I thought they should had cut the cubes smaller and marinated them w/ a light yummier sauce.

They should get some pointers from hawaii :) Places in hawaii serve DELICIOUS poke. I can still remember the taste... every morsel of it.... :9

I hear the Pacific Catch in the Marian District is better -- in taste and price. :)

P.S. Ahi Tuna has high levels of Mercury. I'm trying not to eat tuna too much!! eep! (See article in NYTimes).

excerpts: Ok down to the food - ahi tuna/poke wasabi bowl with brown rice!
ahi tuna.author: Julie H.
ahi tuna.review:
I have been a fan of Pacific Catch for years now!  Def am relieved that the Irving location has opened - its so much bigger...

Ok down to the food - ahi tuna/poke wasabi bowl with brown rice!  You cannot go wrong..sweet potato fries are seriously the best...their tacos (big portions) are filled with freshest fish...granted I only go for my favorites - but I've nibbled off a few of my friends' plate, and have yet to be disappointed by the food.

The new location beats waiting in line - def try this place out if you're looking for a fresh alternative!

excerpts: I've only ever gotten one thing here - ahi tuna wasabi bowl - and it's delicious!
Unfortunately it's a little pricey
so I can't go
that often (that's why the 4 stars and not 5 - otherwise it would get 5 stars all the way!).
Their margaritas are also great.
My mouth is watering thinking about it!
ahi tuna.author: Simona M.
ahi tuna.review: Favorite place! I've only ever gotten one thing here - ahi tuna wasabi bowl - and it's delicious! Unfortunately it's a little pricey so I can't go that often (that's why the 4 stars and not 5 - otherwise it would get 5 stars all the way!). Their margaritas are also great. My mouth is watering thinking about it!

excerpts: We ordered the sake salmon sashimi, spicy tuna roll, grilled ahi tuna salad and ahi poke wasabi bowl.
The spicy tuna roll had plump pieces of tuna and rolled into a pretty good size roll.
The sake salmon sashimi however was a flop.
When the dish came, it was razor thin.
It tasted like kirkland smoked salmon from costco and the sauce was like watered down cream cheese, we had no clue where the sake infused part was.
Totally not worth the $9.
The salad and the rice bowl were delicious and a lot of food.
The ahi poke was flavorful with a wasabi-ginger sauce over warm rice, wakame and pickled veggies.
ahi tuna.author: Yun W.
ahi tuna.review:
Couple friends took us here to dinner on a Tuesday night.

I really like the decor of this place.  Love the modern look and they have nice outdoor seating with heat lamps.  

Service was great.  The guy was super friendly and attentive.  Once we sat down we got a nice little muchies of edamame and pretzels (I guess a little fusion there too).

We ordered the sake salmon sashimi, spicy tuna roll, grilled ahi tuna salad and ahi poke wasabi bowl.  The spicy tuna roll had plump pieces of tuna and rolled into a pretty good size roll.  The sake salmon sashimi however was a flop.  When the dish came, it was razor thin.  It tasted like kirkland smoked salmon from costco and the sauce was like watered down cream cheese, we had no clue where the sake infused part was.   Totally not worth the $9.  The salad and the rice bowl were delicious and a lot of food.  The ahi poke was flavorful with a wasabi-ginger sauce over warm rice, wakame and pickled veggies.  I will definitely order that again.

This place is a good sit down place with friends and we will come back here next time.

excerpts: I had the ahi tuna rice bowl.
AMAZING.
The service was outstanding aswell.
Very friendly staff.
ahi tuna.author: Samantha W.
ahi tuna.review: very small inside but i decided to eat outside. The price is are very cheap in my opinion. I had the ahi tuna rice bowl. AMAZING. The service was outstanding aswell. Very friendly staff.

excerpts: the poke appetizer was perfectly seasoned with just the right amount of soy sauce, onions, and ginger; both the spicy mahi mahi and spicy ahi tuna sandwiches were equally satisfying!
ahi tuna.author: arpee q.
ahi tuna.review:
once upon a time, there were two girls named rhea and shirley who were training for the nike women's half marathon. one morning, during an 8 mile training run, shirley told rhea, "i'm sad; my work had a hawaiian-themed party and there was no "hawaiian" food. all they had was hawaiian pizza and maui onion-flavored chips, and i wanted poke!"

rhea replied, "ooh, some poke and kalua pig sound REALLY good". they continued on with their run and a couple of miles later, rhea asked shirley how she was doing (with the run). shirley responded, "i can't stop thinking about poke!"

so, after they finished their run, they visited their friend, lizette, to find out where they could find some of this much sought after poke. she saved the day when she told rhea and shirley about pacific catch, where they immediately found parking in the restaurant's lot (on a saturday afternoon, no less!) and enjoyed a delicious lunch.

the poke appetizer was perfectly seasoned with just the right amount of soy sauce, onions, and ginger; both the spicy mahi mahi and spicy ahi tuna sandwiches were equally satisfying!

...and they lived happily ever after (well, except for the no kalua pig part). the end.

excerpts: I love the one in the Marina and frequented it regularly for the salad bowl with Ahi Tuna Poke and sweet potato fries.
I tried something new today and we split a coconut shrimp appetizer which was really good.
I had fish tacos this time around which were all pretty decent but the sweet potato fries were a bit tasteless.
The ones at the Marina location have also changed from how delicious they used to be.
Not sure if they're using different sweet potatoes
but they're definitely brighter orange and less sweet than they used to be.
Anyway, there was a bit of a glitch in the computer
so our order took a while, but this was all a trial run, so
ahi tuna.author: Dave L.
ahi tuna.review:
Oh wow, look at that, I'm the first person to actually have eaten here that is writing a review (despite being the 3rd review).  Disclaimer: This review was written on a preview service meal (first ever served) so please take it with a grain of salt!    

I just had lunch today for the preview service of the newest location of Pacific Catch (Corta Madera and Marina are the other two).  They're doing a preview lunch today and tomorrow before hopefully opening on Tuesday (as per inspectors approving them).  They did an amazing job with all the space of the old Canvas Cafe which I frequented weekly.  The red really pops and the decor is great.  There's a full bar and PLENTY of seats all around.  The vibe is really good and the food is well...it's Pacific Catch!  I love the one in the Marina and frequented it regularly for the salad bowl with Ahi Tuna Poke and sweet potato fries.  I tried something new today and we split a coconut shrimp appetizer which was really good.  I had fish tacos this time around which were all pretty decent but the sweet potato fries were a bit tasteless.  The ones at the Marina location have also changed from how delicious they used to be.  Not sure if they're using different sweet potatoes but they're definitely brighter orange and less sweet than they used to be.  Anyway, there was a bit of a glitch in the computer so our order took a while, but this was all a trial run, so I'm sure it'll be worked out by opening time.  

They have an expanded menu at this location (same as Corta Madera) with sushi and sashimi bar.  The prices are slightly higher than the Chestnut location though.  This place is awesome and I highly recommend it.  Easy parking across the street in Golden Gate Park.  The space is gorgeous (high ceilings with skylight).  The management and staff were really nice and friendly.  The place is huge so you shouldn't have a problem getting seated.  I highly recommend checking it out!

excerpts: As usual, ordered the ahi tuna wasabi bowl.
It's the best wasabi bowl I've had in Pac Catch.
Tuna was not overcooked; sometimes they overcooked it in the Chestnut location.
Not so keen on the lemongrass iced tea though.
Service was wonderful.
Nice ambiance.
Will definitely be a frequent customer here.
ahi tuna.author: Poof S.
ahi tuna.review: Oh joy, Pacific Catch finally opens at this location. Double joy, I got the free meal this past Monday when they were having the mock "opening day." Ordered the calamari as appetizer, which was good but not superb. I'd stick with sweet potatoes next time. As usual, ordered the ahi tuna wasabi bowl. It's the best wasabi bowl I've had in Pac Catch. Tuna was not overcooked; sometimes they overcooked it in the Chestnut location. Not so keen on the lemongrass iced tea though. Service was wonderful. Nice ambiance. Will definitely be a frequent customer here.

excerpts: and I had the ahi tuna - yum yum yum.
I've never been to the location on Chestnut, but I'd like to check it out.
ahi tuna.author: meagan m.
ahi tuna.review: This place was great- a perfect spot for a nice dinner that wasn't super expensive. I had the wassabi bowl, which was delicious, really flavorful, filling and healthy. It was a bowl filled with veggies, brown rice, sesame seeds and I had the ahi tuna - yum yum yum. I've never been to the location on Chestnut, but I'd like to check it out.

excerpts: I'd stray against the catch of the day, the ahi tuna, and the poke all together.
ahi tuna.author: Jenny L.
ahi tuna.review: The decor was fantastic, but I wish I could say the same about the fish.  The waiter needs to pay attention better; our drink orders were fulfilled.  The sweet potato fries and the spicy fries are definitely worth a try.  I'd stray against the catch of the day, the ahi tuna, and the poke all together.

excerpts: the ahi tuna was so fresh that the soft and tender fish melted in my mouth.
it was a mouthful of flavor...
thesoy sauce that they put with the tuna had wasabi mixed into it
so it added the perfect kick to the dish.
I substituted the sushi rice with brown rice...tasted just as good and was healthier
The bowl included shredded veggie salad (daikon, cucumber, carrot), sliced avocado, sesame seeds, and shredded seaweed on top.
This was an excellent and filling meal and I would definitely come back!
ahi tuna.author: Ivy L.
ahi tuna.review: Came here with a friend for the first time and was blown away at how fresh their fish was. I had the HAWAIIAN POKE WASABI BOWL. This was amazing! the ahi tuna was so fresh that the soft and tender fish melted in my mouth. it was a mouthful of flavor...thesoy sauce that they put with the tuna had wasabi mixed into it so it added the perfect kick to the dish. I substituted the sushi rice with brown rice...tasted just as good and was healthier :) The bowl included shredded veggie salad (daikon, cucumber, carrot), sliced avocado, sesame seeds, and shredded seaweed on top. This was an excellent and filling meal and I would definitely come back!

excerpts: I ordered the Spicy Ahi Tuna Sandwich with sweet potato fries (which were so delicious).
I liked the sandwich but I have to say the tuna wasn't very flavorful.
I also mooched off my friends' Teriyaki Bowls and Wasabi Bowls..pretty good!
ahi tuna.author: Tiffany T.
ahi tuna.review: I was just here the other day for a friend's birthday, and it was the perfect place to have it - loud, colorful environment. It was pretty busy but they do take reservations. Their menu is rather unique - they have an interesting variety ranging from sushi rolls to tacos. I ordered the Spicy Ahi Tuna Sandwich with sweet potato fries (which were so delicious). I liked the sandwich but I have to say the tuna wasn't very flavorful. I also mooched off my friends' Teriyaki Bowls and Wasabi Bowls..pretty good! We shared the Mochi Fondue and some kind of brownie a la mode which was really delicious. The service was good, and there was a really cute bus boy. :)

excerpts: I had the ahi tuna salad with Hawaiian Poke...
what huge portions they serve you...
totally worth adding $1.
ahi tuna.author: Jenny W.
ahi tuna.review: Went there last Friday for dinner with a couple of friends. The service was good, and the wait wasn't too bad. I had the ahi tuna salad with Hawaiian Poke...what huge portions they serve you...totally worth adding $1.

excerpts: I had the seared ahi tuna salad that came with 6 pieces of perfectly cooked tuna that was still raw on the inside.
ahi tuna.author: Florence T.
ahi tuna.review:
First pro of eating at Pacific Catch is that reservations can be made online at opentable.com! The interior is much roomier than the marina location and the decor is trendy and comfortable. Our server was friendly and even showed me the box package of the tea that they brew when I asked what type of green tea they used as it has some fruity floral notes unlike other traditional green teas. 

We started with the spicy fries, which were perfectly crispy and had a cajun spice sprinkled on top. It was served hot and the side sized order was a perfectly adequate amount to avoid overfilling on starches before our meal. My boyfriend had the fish and chips with the "catch of the day" which was cod. It was flaky and soft and the batter was light and airy. The sweet potato fries were crispy and tasted really good with the tar tar sauce and sweet/sour sauce that accompanied the dish. I had the seared ahi tuna salad that came with 6 pieces of perfectly cooked tuna that was still raw on the inside. Instead of the wasabi soy dressing, I opted for the miso dressing and was happy with my change as the dressing was creamy and tangy, which matched perfectly with the fish. 

Pacific Catch is a great place to indulge in seafood and enjoy a nice night out in a trendy joint, which i must mention also has a bar area.

excerpts: i also had a taste of my friend's ahi tuna sandwich and my cousin's salmon sandwich, both of which were delish!
i love the ciabatta bread they were on too! also shared one of their special sushi rolls, which had a catchy name that i am blanking on right now.
but it had a nice bite, which came form the spicy mayo, and a nice crunch from the tempura batter, mmm!!!
i'm craving some right now...
ahi tuna.author: Pamela s.
ahi tuna.review: came here for a late lunch on sunday after a weekend of camping/rafting in oakdale and it was nice! i ordered the fresh pick of the day, true cod (as opposed to false ones) which came with sweet potato fries, cole slaw and two dipping sauces. one was a jalapeño tartar and the other was a sweet chili sauce, the kind you dip filipino lumpia into. the fish was fried nicely and you can tell it was fresh. i also had a taste of my friend's ahi tuna sandwich and my cousin's salmon sandwich, both of which were delish! i love the ciabatta bread they were on too! also shared one of their special sushi rolls, which had a catchy name that i am blanking on right now. but it had a nice bite, which came form the spicy mayo, and a nice crunch from the tempura batter, mmm!!! i'm craving some right now...

excerpts: I had the sweet potato fries that everyone mentioned, and the ahi tuna 3 way which included the tuna poke that was also mentioned.
The food is ok and prices are reasonable.
Very mediocre chain seafood.
but at least there was a small parking lot to the side.
ahi tuna.author: Yen C.
ahi tuna.review: I dont know what all the fuss is about.  I had the sweet potato fries that everyone mentioned, and the ahi tuna 3 way which included the tuna poke that was also mentioned.  The food is ok and prices are reasonable. Very mediocre chain seafood. but at least there was a small parking lot to the side.

excerpts: We shared an ahi tuna wasabi bowl with brown rice and a mahi mahi taco platter.
The fish in both dishes was incredibly well prepared.
Amazing how good (and simple) fresh fish can be!
ahi tuna.author: L F.
ahi tuna.review:
ohmigoooood!  This place is so unbelievably good I can't stop thinking about it!  We finally got into the Marina location about a year ago and really enjoyed both our meal and our server - friendly, funny and muy helpful!  The only thing we didn't like was how chummy you needed to be with your neighbor.  Definitely elbow to elbow situation.

Last night we wandered over to the 9th street location after a major hot hike in Marin.  While we really liked the coffee shop which occupied this space previously - I have to say welcome to the neighborhood PC!  The space has a very zen-like feel - great color scheme - awesome bar area - even the bathroom is nice with the bamboo stalks pressed between smoked glass.   

Great little starter vittles (sesame? goldfish and edamame).  We shared an ahi tuna wasabi bowl with brown rice and a mahi mahi taco platter.  The fish in both dishes was incredibly well prepared.  Amazing how good (and simple) fresh fish can be!  The sweet potato fries were delish.  The sesame salad in the bowl was refreshing.  The only thing that wasn't absolutely fabulous were the black beans which weren't bad - just merely came across as an afterthought.   Washing everything down with a cold beer - we were two very happy campers!

Service was friendly and attentive - seems like a good place for families and larger groups - definitely one of our new faves along the Irving corridor!

excerpts: Ahi tuna sandwich was excellent and so were the sweet potato fries.
The calamari was bland and only edible because of the good sauce it came with.
ahi tuna.author: Jason W.
ahi tuna.review: Ahi tuna sandwich was excellent and so were the sweet potato fries. The calamari was bland and only edible because of the good sauce it came with.

excerpts: The sweet potatoe fries are the first thing I order with a salad and seared ahi tuna.
Customer service is excellent.
ahi tuna.author: Marie G.
ahi tuna.review: After a long day at Golden Gate park Pacific Catch is the first place that comes to mind when my stomach starts growling. The sweet potatoe fries are the first thing I order with a salad and seared ahi tuna. Customer service is excellent.

excerpts: I am actually not a big seafood fan, but my boyfriend highly recommends the ahi tuna salad and the fried seafood basket.
ahi tuna.author: Patti L.
ahi tuna.review: I really like this place.  Not super cheap, but great food and atmosphere!  I am actually not a big seafood fan, but my boyfriend highly recommends the ahi tuna salad and the fried seafood basket.  The chipotle chicken sandwich and sweet potato fries are also yummy.  Extra points for the unique edamame and pretzel gold fish to snack on while you wait!

excerpts: We were disappointed in the ahi tuna poke appetizer.
The ahi was fresh enough, but the seasoning was monotone, and overdone.
There is no evidence of poke seasoning.
Just soy sauce with bits of red and green onions.
Our entrees were Wasabi Ahi Tuna sandwich, and the Mixed Catch Basket.
The Ahi Sandwich was
over-seared (see Medium Well), and missing any kind of a wasabi bite.

It tasted good, with the avocado slices providing a nice buttery texture for the sandwich and a somewhat experimental addition of pink ginger slices (yes, the same ones served alongside sushi) that didn't do much.
It was an okay sandwich, for what its worth.
I couldn't help but think this was some deli's version of a sushi on
a french roll - take a roll, replace rice and seaweed with bread.
ahi tuna.author: Bor C.
ahi tuna.review:
Located on a fairly busy corner of 9th and Lincoln, this new restaurant replaced the art gallery, bar, restaurant thing that was here before. The décor was marine themed, and the place appeared clean. Being my first visit here, and sitting in one of the booths I had an impression that they may have some kind of identity confusion. I don't know if it was because the name gave me the assumption they were a California Cusine restaurant with a slant of seafood offering, or the extensive menu that included American entrees, alongside Japanese items like sushi, teriyaki, and Mexican with the tacos. The edamame they served as soon as we were seated tells me they are Japanese. Maybe it was the Hawaiin entrees, or the fact that the visible cook staff was completely Hispanic, except for the one white guy calling out orders at the pass. Mexliforniapanese Dining. Nah, doesn't have the right ring to it. 

We were disappointed in the ahi tuna poke appetizer. The ahi was fresh enough, but the seasoning was monotone, and overdone. There is no evidence of poke seasoning. Just soy sauce with bits of red and green onions. I love salty foods, but even I thought this dish was too salty, and finishes flat.

Our entrees were Wasabi Ahi Tuna sandwich, and the Mixed Catch Basket. The Ahi Sandwich was over-seared (see Medium Well), and missing any kind of a wasabi bite. It tasted good, with the avocado slices providing a nice buttery texture for the sandwich and a somewhat experimental addition of pink ginger slices (yes, the same ones served alongside sushi) that didn't do much. It was an okay sandwich, for what its worth. I couldn't help but think this was some deli's version of a sushi on a french roll - take a roll, replace rice and seaweed with bread. The Mixed Catch Basket was served with sweet potato fries. It was the probably the best component of the dish. You couldn't go to far off track with fried foods, and this basket was no exception. Good, but nothing worth writing about. I should stop here.

The coleslaw that accompanied our entrees were suprisingly good. It was a light cream dressing with a distinct Korean-type pickling tang I detected. It was light and palette refreshing.

Overall, it was an okay experience. The place is nice to be in, be seen in, but not particularly nice to eat. I'll probably be back only when we are doing something in the park, and want to hit a bar... Nah, I'll walk the extra block and head to Yancy's instead.

excerpts: 1st time I had the ahi tuna the 2nd time I had the eel.
I liked both
but if I had to pick I'd choose the bbq eel first.
ahi tuna.author: Cee D.
ahi tuna.review: I've eaten here twice and walked away satisfied each time. I haven't been to other locations so I can't really compare them, but I like the interior of the place. Nothing over the top but not plain and boring either. Nice casual place to come and grab some grub.  Each time I've eaten one of the wasabi bowls, 1st time I had the ahi tuna the 2nd time I had the eel. I liked both but if I had to pick I'd choose the bbq eel first.

excerpts: Worst ahi tuna (sesame and seared) ever!
You can tell it just came out of the freezer.
Big let down.
ahi tuna.author: Aimee L.
ahi tuna.review:
Don't do it.  I was really excited to see a new restaurant open in the area and decided to give it a try.  

Pros:  Service was excellent, we had the nicest waitress ever.  She was knowledgeable and didn't push drinks/apps/desserts on us.  Sweet potato fries and calamari were decent.  Dipping sauces were excellent.  Poke flavor was great.

Cons:  Worst ahi tuna (sesame and seared) ever!  You can tell it just came out of the freezer.  Big let down.  Cost is high for quality of food.

I say skip it, and go to a neighboring restaurant for better food.

excerpts: I highly recommend the wasabi ahi tuna sandwich!
ahi tuna.author: Michael S.
ahi tuna.review: This place is great. Food is delicious, atmosphere is warm - and the only affordable place in San Francisco I know of with so much space. I highly recommend the wasabi ahi tuna sandwich!

excerpts: Recommend the ahi tuna bowl.
Nice location and reasonably priced.
ahi tuna.author: Sanjiv B.
ahi tuna.review: Great bar selection, fun atmosphere (after work crowd) and really good food.  The bowls are worth trying.  All the dishes with raw fish are really good (tuna, salmon, etc...).  Recommend the ahi tuna bowl.  Nice location and reasonably priced.

excerpts: The poki (ahi tuna) was on the salty side and the fish recommended by the waitress was dry.
At $17.00 which included a slightly small piece of fish, veggies and potatoes, it was not worth it.
Fried fish and chips was nothing to brag about.
Then, the ahi tuna salad was drenched in salty dressing.
My friend just ate what was sitting on top of the bowl.
We mentioned it to the waitress and she was apologetic.
Allowed us to order a dessert on the house.
Coffee was on the house too because the first round of coffee that came out was cold.
ahi tuna.author: Di F.
ahi tuna.review: Go for the Happy Hour between 4-6 p.m.  that includes bar bites.  Dinner was a little disappointing.  The poki (ahi tuna) was on the salty side and the fish recommended by the waitress was dry.  At $17.00 which included a slightly small piece of fish, veggies and potatoes, it was not worth it.  Fried fish and chips was nothing to brag about. Then, the ahi tuna salad was drenched in salty dressing.   My friend just ate what was sitting on top of the bowl.  We mentioned it to the waitress and she was apologetic.  Allowed us to order a dessert on the house.  Coffee was on the house too because the first round of coffee that came out was cold.

excerpts: I love getting the Ahi tuna salad
, it's one of my favorite dishes here to get.
It comes with tuna that is lightly seared with a bed of arugala and natural greens.
It comes with daikon, pickled ginger and some wakame...
I believe.
Either way its great
and I love getting it everytime
I come here.
The wasabi and teriyaki bowls are also really good here.
The wasabi bowls come with alot of other stuff other than your "main" choice of meat/veggie.
The teriyaki bowls comes with pineapple fried rice, yum... with some seared bok choy to go along with it!
GREAT STUFF.
The sweet potatoe fries are the best stuff that ever happened to this earth after tofu soup.
I cannot describe how good they are.
It doesn't taste like any old regular fries, it actually has it own distinctive taste to it.
It comes with an asian sweet chili sauce which is so good with the fries to give it a kick, and it also comes with a wasabi mayo that is also really good.
Yum... making me hungry just talkign about this stuff!
I love to come here ever so often, i'm such a fan of this place and espically theres one across from where I work
makes this stuff even better.
ahi tuna.author: Johnny T.
ahi tuna.review: The food here is great, the service here is great, but here comes the downfall! The parking here SUCKS! You're going to have to circle the blocks plenty of times before finding a parking spot here. Other than that, the place is really good. The service here is alright. Sometimes when you want to ask for something, they don't give you the undivided attention that you need. Maybe they don't hear me loud enough? Idk, I think i'm pretty loud. Anyways, the food here is great. I love getting the Ahi tuna salad, it's one of my favorite dishes here to get. It comes with tuna that is lightly seared with a bed of arugala and natural greens. It comes with daikon, pickled ginger and some wakame... I believe. Either way its great and I love getting it everytime I come here. The wasabi and teriyaki bowls are also really good here. The wasabi bowls come with alot of other stuff other than your "main" choice of meat/veggie. The teriyaki bowls comes with pineapple fried rice, yum... with some seared bok choy to go along with it! GREAT STUFF. The sweet potatoe fries are the best stuff that ever happened to this earth after tofu soup. I cannot describe how good they are. It doesn't taste like any old regular fries, it actually has it own distinctive taste to it. It comes with an asian sweet chili sauce which is so good with the fries to give it a kick, and it also comes with a wasabi mayo that is also really good. Yum... making me hungry just talkign about this stuff! I love to come here ever so often, i'm such a fan of this place and espically theres one across from where I work makes this stuff even better.

excerpts: i had the wasabi bowl with ahi tuna
- it was fine.
not particularly delicious, and nothing to write home about.
plus, there was WAY too much rice included with it.
the fried oysters were pretty tasty, but it's not that hard to fry an oyster (or anything else).
and my ginger yuzu cooler was bo-ring.
in sum, you're better off getting a chicken quesedilla at gordo's or sushi at ebisu if you are eating dinner on 9th at irving.
ahi tuna.author: oona m.
ahi tuna.review: the food at pacific catch is perfectly ok. i had the wasabi bowl with ahi tuna - it was fine. not particularly delicious, and nothing to write home about. plus, there was WAY too much rice included with it. the fried oysters were pretty tasty, but it's not that hard to fry an oyster (or anything else). and my ginger yuzu cooler was bo-ring. in sum, you're better off getting a chicken quesedilla at gordo's or sushi at ebisu if you are eating dinner on 9th at irving.

excerpts: My husband ordered the chipotle chicken and his was soooooo good!
Loved the flavors that meshed together.
chipotle chicken.author: CJ L.
chipotle chicken.review: I had the Vietnamese sandwich and to me it was really good and spicy. Their coleslaw made the meal taste extra good too. Their water was good than some places I've had. On the other hand my grandma had the Salmon salad and it was dry and tasteless. I felt bad for her we had to order her food some where else afterwards. My husband ordered the chipotle chicken and his was soooooo good! Loved the flavors that meshed together.
