excerpts: I recommend the Chipotle chicken or the salmon for the salad.
They have
chipotle chicken.author: Arman J.
chipotle chicken.review: I come here all the time.  I love their salad bowls and their calamari is to die for. I recommend the Chipotle chicken or the salmon for the salad.  They have really good sweet potato fries and their coconut shrimp ate pretty good as well.

excerpts: He did the chipotle chicken sandwich with side of Cajun seasoned fries (wonderful flavor and the chicken breast was super tender) and I had the California bowl with poke 1/2 brown rice 1/2 salad which was ahhhhhmazing!!!
highly recommend.
On top of it all our server was knowledgeable, attentive and sweet.
chipotle chicken.author: Sachi P.
chipotle chicken.review: Really fresh seafood and for a chain restaurant this place exceeded our expectations!! Boyfriend and I shared a California roll (huge portion for the price with quality real crab) and the sticky ribs (great flavor but the meat wasn't falling off the bone amazing) for starters. He did the chipotle chicken sandwich with side of Cajun seasoned fries (wonderful flavor and the chicken breast was super tender) and I had the California bowl with poke 1/2 brown rice 1/2 salad which was ahhhhhmazing!!!  highly recommend. On top of it all our server was knowledgeable, attentive and sweet.

excerpts: Though I am not the biggest fan of seafood, I decided to get the chipotle chicken salad.
It was very refreshing and I enjoyed every bit of it!
The chicken could've had more bbq sauce on it to top the entire dish off
but overall it was great!
chipotle chicken.author: Ricardo R.
chipotle chicken.review: Pretty good place! There is quite the selection to choose from, especially since it's a seafood based restaurant. Though I am not the biggest fan of seafood, I decided to get the chipotle chicken salad. It was very refreshing and I enjoyed every bit of it! The chicken could've had more bbq sauce on it to top the entire dish off but overall it was great!

excerpts: Aside from the fries, I also ordered the chipotle chicken sandwich because nothing on the menu really appealed to me.
But the sandwich turned out really good.
The chicken was not dry, which is a plus.
chipotle chicken.author: Willa L.
chipotle chicken.review:
I actually came here just to try their sweet potato fries. I was actually debating with my boyfriend whether to get the traditional or spicy potato fries.  The waiter (he was extremely nice and I forgot his name), actually suggested to me that I should do half/half. I was excited that I could try both at one time. So, I ordered a whole basket of it since I LOVE sweet potato fries!

Aside from the fries, I also ordered the chipotle chicken sandwich because nothing on the menu really appealed to me. But the sandwich turned out really good. The chicken was not dry, which is a plus. I couldn't even finish the whole sandwich by myself, so I was able to pack it to go to eat the next day. 

I was lucky enough to find a parking spot in their mini parking lot, but I am not complaining. I am glad they actually have a parking lot to begin with.

excerpts: The chipotle chicken sandwich and sweet potato fries are also yummy.
Extra points for the unique edamame and pretzel gold fish to snack on while you wait!
chipotle chicken.author: Patti L.
chipotle chicken.review: I really like this place.  Not super cheap, but great food and atmosphere!  I am actually not a big seafood fan, but my boyfriend highly recommends the ahi tuna salad and the fried seafood basket.  The chipotle chicken sandwich and sweet potato fries are also yummy.  Extra points for the unique edamame and pretzel gold fish to snack on while you wait!

excerpts: My mom's WestCoast grilled salmon bowl looked equally delicious but with an assortment of other toppings.
grilled salmon.author: Sherry L.
grilled salmon.review:
This is a good option for a meal in the sunset area if you are looking for something more commercial. It was bustling on a game night, mostly in the bar area, but we didn't have any issues getting a large table for a party of two. 

We ordered two rice bowls and a two taco platter - way too much food in hindsight, but we enjoyed having all of the options. I found my Japanese wasabi bowl with salmon (grilled, btw) and 1/2 brown rice 1/2 greens to be very filling and I liked all of the toppings it included. The ingredients were fresh and they don't skimp on anything! The name is a bit of a misnomer though, as there was no wasabi that I could taste or see in my bowl. My mom's WestCoast grilled salmon bowl looked equally delicious but with an assortment of other toppings. 

The tacos were quite hefty in serving size as well. The two tacos could have been a meal on their own, but were served with a side of fries (or salad) and a small bowl of black beans. The Traditional Baja taco and the Grilled Steak taco were both excellent choices, depending on your palate and dietary preferences!

excerpts: I got the Serrano along with my bowl, while my boyfriend got the Serrano and Grilled Salmon.
You get a choice of getting it with all rice (White or brown) or half rice and half salad.
grilled salmon.author: Thuyen P.
grilled salmon.review:
I'm from Hawaii and on the last day of my trip, I need my poke fix ASAP or else I will go INSANE. 

My boyfriend and I were meeting my relatives and we needed some grub before heading to the De Young museum. We got here much earlier than them and the hostess allowed us to be seated, as my Aunt made reservations.

When seated, our server (I forgot her name but she is awesome!) promptly asked us what we would like to drink. My boyfriend and I ordered our drinks and we sat there for another 30 minutes waiting for my family. Our server checked in on us regularly, but nothing to the extent of pressuring us to order food. She refilled my boyfriend's lemonade regularly even before we ordered our food. Then after 30 minutes, my family FINALLY came!! I am ready for "California" poke!

What caught my eye was the Asian bowls. My boyfriend and I both got the Japanese Wasabi. I got the Serrano along with my bowl, while my boyfriend got the Serrano and Grilled Salmon. You get a choice of getting it with all rice (White or brown) or half rice and half salad. We both chose half,half. 

At first, I was really surprised how expensive the bowls were, being that it was at $16.50, but when it came out, oh my lordy! They are HUGE. Since my boyfriend got two choices, it was $5 more, which is pricey. The bowl came out and it was a mixture of greens, ocean salad, avocado, and your fish choice and our rice on the bottom. I couldn't finish it! My boyfriend barely finished it. 

The fish quality surprised me! It was just like home. The only thing I did not particularly like were the jalapeños in the poke. I had to pick it out while eating. I like my poke spicy but I don't want jalapeños with it. That is just my personal preference.

I will be back when I come back to San Fran! I wish Hawaii had something like this... It was definitely ono (delicious in Hawaii)!! yuuum!!

excerpts: I regularly (like at least once a week for lunch) order the veggie salad and rotate between adding grilled Mary's chicken, grilled salmon, or seared Ahi tuna on top.
The miso dressing is so delicious and the way they "zoodle" the cucumbers is unique.
It's a good portion and is very filling on its own.
The chicken is always grilled and seasoned perfectly.
That's probably my favorite protein add-on.
The Ahi tuna and salmon (in that order) are good too for some variety.
The Ahi tuna and salmon (in that order) are good too for some variety.
grilled salmon.author: Traci R.
grilled salmon.review: This restaurant has a solid salad game. I regularly (like at least once a week for lunch) order the veggie salad and rotate between adding grilled Mary's chicken, grilled salmon, or seared Ahi tuna on top. The miso dressing is so delicious and the way they "zoodle" the cucumbers is unique. It's a good portion and is very filling on its own. The chicken is always grilled and seasoned perfectly. That's probably my favorite protein add-on. The Ahi tuna and salmon (in that order) are good too for some variety.

excerpts: The bread was so soft and complimented the grilled salmon perfectly.
Service was amazing and food came out fast.
Will be returning
grilled salmon.author: Raman D.
grilled salmon.review:
Order the Ahi sandwich but substituted the ahi for salmon and oh my goodness it was delicious! 
The bread was so soft and complimented the grilled salmon perfectly. Service was amazing and food came out fast. Will be returning

excerpts: We got the California grilled salmon sandwich and the wasabi poke bowl.
Great food great service
I'd come back again
grilled salmon.author: Georgie O.
grilled salmon.review: Very tasty very satisfying. I left feeling the perfect amount of full. It's very clean and the decor is very pleasing to the eyes. We got the California grilled salmon sandwich and the wasabi poke bowl. Great food great service I'd come back again :)

excerpts: the Grilled Salmon Salad and the salmon was the driest shit of my life.
The dressing was also bland and nothing special.
grilled salmon.author: Christine A.
grilled salmon.review:
Ew. I came here again and we got HORRIBLE service. Our server didn't come to take our orders until almost 20 minutes after we were seated. The waiter also didn't collect our check way after we were ready to pay. The restaurant wasn't even that busy at the time! 

The food was not that good either. I had the Grilled Salmon Salad and the salmon was the driest shit of my life. The dressing was also bland and nothing special. The only thing good that we ordered was the basket of sweet potato fries.

Parking is a bitch because it's 9th and Irving. I really wouldn't have came here again if it wasn't for the fact that it's one of the bigger restaurants on the street, so it didn't have a wait. Now I know why...

excerpts: Their grilled salmon japanese wasabi bowl with brown rice was outstanding!!
Everything came out fresh and the flavors were on point.
grilled salmon.author: La C.
grilled salmon.review:
YUMMM!!! Just came back from an awesome lunch at Pacific Catch!! Their grilled salmon japanese wasabi bowl with brown rice was outstanding!! Everything came out fresh and the flavors were on point. Portions were generous to offset the price. 

Don't forget dessert --- you gotta try their dulce de leche fried rolls with vanilla ice cream! Completely delicious....

Service during lunch was not too shabby.....

excerpts: I had the grilled salmon salad with long beans, shiitake mushrooms, cherry tomatoes, and a miso salad dressing.
It also came with fried salmon skin pieces, very similar to fried pork skins.
The salmon was juicy and not dry at all!
grilled salmon.author: Samantha L.
grilled salmon.review:
Complimentary edamame and goldfish pretzels - Yay?! Pacific Catch on Lincoln & 9th is a large restaurant. Both the bar area and the tables for larger parties are accommodating. As long as you are willing to battle for parking spots in lower irving then your'e good to go. It's a popular restaurant and has been on my list to try for a while.

All salads are $13.50.  I had the grilled salmon salad with long beans, shiitake mushrooms, cherry tomatoes, and a miso salad dressing. It also came with fried salmon skin pieces, very similar to fried pork skins. The salmon was juicy and not dry at all! It was a large salad and i only wish there were more long beans and cherry tomatoes in the mix! 

If i'm ever in the mood for an asian/hawaiian/seafood inspired menu i will be sure to come back to try more off the menu.

excerpts: And thus, I LOVE Pacific Catch's Japanese rice bowl with grilled salmon.
grilled salmon.author: Laurel K.
grilled salmon.review:
I have an unhealthy obsession with salmon. Well, I guess not that unhealthy if you take into account the omega-3s but seriously, I always crave it. And thus, I LOVE Pacific Catch's Japanese rice bowl with grilled salmon. Everything (avocado, seaweed, veggies) is fresh, and the salmon is cooked perfectly. Plus, it's big enough that I usually eat it over two meals.

I've also had the Hawaiian poke, and it's delicious - fresh and light.

I saw some complaints w/service here - whenever I've been it's definitely bustling, but I've never experienced any delays. Last time, the kitchen made an extra order of sweet potato fries, so the server gave it to my friend and I gratis! Heart.

excerpts: I ordered the Grilled Salmon salad which said it had these ingredients - salmon, green beans, shiitake mushrooms, tomatoes, crispy salmon skin "croutons", citrus-miso dressing.
I had the dressing on the side and removed the fried salmon skins (there was way too much...)
so it would just be veggies and salmon.
However, after I started eating it, something felt off.
The mushrooms and green beans tasted as if they have been coated in some slick oil.
Somehow there was salad dressing in my salad even though I asked for it to be on the side.
The salmon was grilled with the same slick oil that made my digestive system act up for the remainder of the night.
My husband also had the grilled salmon special.
And guess what.
My husband also had the grilled salmon special.
And guess what.
grilled salmon.author: Lucy C.
grilled salmon.review:
I had high expectations for this place after perusing the menu online.  Since I am on a strict clean eating diet to determine some food allergies, I thought this would be a good place to go.

I ordered the Grilled Salmon salad which said it had these ingredients - salmon, green beans, shiitake mushrooms, tomatoes, crispy salmon skin "croutons", citrus-miso dressing. I had the dressing on the side and removed the fried salmon skins (there was way too much...) so it would just be veggies and salmon.  However, after I started eating it, something felt off.  The mushrooms and green beans tasted as if they have been coated in some slick oil.  Somehow there was salad dressing in my salad even though I asked for it to be on the side. The salmon was grilled with the same slick oil that made my digestive system act up for the remainder of the night.  

My husband also had the grilled salmon special. And guess what. He also had his tummy act up for the night as well.

Anyway, it was not a pleasant experience and wished we had gone to the other tons of restaurants in the Inner Sunset. I guess the lesson learned here is to explicitly ask if the ingredients in a salad are raw or coated in something... (Usually when I get a salad the ingredients are raw veggies unless they specifically say its not!)

Pros - 
- Service was great with a very attentive server 
- The restaurant is spacious and good for groups
- There was no wait to be seated even though the place was getting crowded

Cons -
- Parking is tough on the weekends around this area.  We parked a few blocks away
- Food is not super high quality for seafood

excerpts: He got the Japanese Wasabi bowl with Grilled Salmon.
I personally didn't taste it, but he said it was too rich, although the salmon was still pretty good.
grilled salmon.author: Czarina Y.
grilled salmon.review:
My friends and I decide that every time we decide to eat out, we need to try a new place. My friend suggested this place, we gave it a shot.

For starters, we tried one of their chalkboard specials. It's a Poke, forgot exactly what's called, but it's calamari poke. It was so good! Then I ordered their Island Tacos, for some reason, I went with their 3-taco platter just like what my friend got. It's pretty awesome that you can mix and match so we tried the Traditional Baja, Mahi Mahi and Cabo Shrimp. My friend finished the entire plate plus his side salad. I didn't =( but I ate all the shrimp and fish just not the tortilla. It was good though, next time I will remind myself that I don't have a huge appetite like my friends do and order 2 tacos maybe :P
My other friend who happens to be my boyfriend got the Pan-Asian Rice Bowl. He got the Japanese Wasabi bowl with Grilled Salmon. I personally didn't taste it, but he said it was too rich, although the salmon was still pretty good. 

Server was friendly and attends very well to our needs. Great experience! Can't complain and I will definitely go back. =)

excerpts: My favorite entree is the veggie special salad with grilled salmon.
I have even been known to add the korean steak to it.
Recently, I tried their salmon club special.
WTF?
grilled salmon.author: Irina S.
grilled salmon.review:
Why have I not reviewed this place earlier? I love it here. I am a regular here; the servers recognize me, stay and chat. It's great. Sure, like with every place one can have a bad experience, but the great experiences and delicious food (well priced too)  outweigh any hiccup that might occur. 

My favorite entree is the veggie special salad with grilled salmon. I have even been known to add the korean steak to it. It's just perfect. 

Recently, I tried their salmon club special. WTF? That was just awesome! 

I also love me some thai iced tea! They make it super tasty and are generous with the refills. The lemongrass iced is great too, but please don't forget about the full bar! 

Lastly, a very special treat are the Fried Dulce de Leche Spring Rolls. Yea. Wow. Seriously, WOW!

I haven't mentioned their appetizers yet, but I feel like I should. The ceviche and fried oyster appetizers, and their hawaiian poke are really tasty. The spicy fries make a good side or just a yummy starter. 

Ok. I have to control myself. But this place is really good to come to just when you want a quick dinner, to catch up with a friend, or with a group. 

p.s. they have opentable to you get points for making reservations, and just recently started using the punchh app. Double perks for eating here!!!! Yes please.

excerpts: For our entree, I ordered the Hawaiian Teriyaki rice bowl with grilled salmon and it was amazeballs.
grilled salmon.author: Kate E.
grilled salmon.review:
I love this place! My boyfriend and I went here for our first time last week and it is definitely our new favorite spot. The food was great and I love the fact that I do not feel guilty eating their food since their portions are pretty big! Our server (I believe her name was Adriana) was really nice! She asked if we ate there before and of course we said no so she suggested to us what we should try. She was definitely helpful and made our experience there for our first time even better. It is always a love/hate feeling when we get a good server LOL we know we have a good server when we're thinking "dammnit now we really have to tip" lmao. Thanks Adriana!! We ordered the California Style Hawaiian Poke, which she recommended... and it was hella good, lawwd have mercy. For our entree, I ordered the Hawaiian Teriyaki rice bowl with grilled salmon and it was amazeballs. I will definitely be coming back for the rice bowl, the poke, and the service! 

Only downside is that we got pulled over before we got to the restaurant lol apparently we can't drive through a intersection until a pedestrian has gotten onto the sidewalk completely  -___- the pedestrian had barely started walking, but luckily we got off with a warning. They do have a small little lot so parking might be a bit of a hassle, but it is worth it!

excerpts: The Grilled Salmon salad.
Loaded with greens, mushrooms, a generous filet of salmon, and the best part - salmon skin croutons.
grilled salmon.author: Denise M.
grilled salmon.review:
I've found my new favorite salad.  The Grilled Salmon salad.  Loaded with greens, mushrooms, a generous filet of salmon, and the best part - salmon skin croutons.  YUM!!!  

As a special, they have a Dungoness crab and corn chowder.  OMG.  Slightly spice, but sooooooo good.  Chunks of crab to enjoy.

Hubby had 3 tacos.  Two types of fish, and the third was shrimp.  Very generously filled and very tasty.

Will definitely go back.  Only problem is, I'll just want that salad again... so many other things to try on the menu.

excerpts: but at the end i finally ordered the 3 tacos platter (Grilled Salmon taco -- which was very good!,
Spicy Chicken Taco -- very disappointing because it wasn't spicy at all!, & Shrimp Taco -- my favorite because it comes with a mango salsa).
grilled salmon.author: Carol Y.
grilled salmon.review:
I had a great time dining at Pacific Catch tonight. My friend and i walked into Pacific Catch without reservations and were seated promptly. I LOVE the decor, you wouldn't even think the place was previously the Canvas Gallery. I love the red walls, there are plenty of seating, full bar & most importantly an open kitchen. I love restaurants with an open kitchen which means the place is clean.

It was my first time dining at Pacific Catch and i thought the menu was overwhelming but at the end i finally ordered the 3 tacos platter (Grilled Salmon taco -- which was very good!, Spicy Chicken Taco -- very disappointing because it wasn't spicy at all!, & Shrimp Taco -- my favorite because it comes with a mango salsa). The taco platter also includs sweet potato fries (YUM!!) & black beans. The platter cost about $14.95. My friend ordered the Eel Wasabi Bowl but she requested no wasabi but instead terayaki sauce which was really good! i wished i ordered the Eel bowl instead ($14.95). In addition to the menu, each meal includes  fish shaped pretzels & endame beans.  Our whole meal cost about $30 with drinks. 

Overall, i really enjoyed my meal and i cant wait to come back and try the other items in the menu. I thought the service was really good, our waitress was very sweet and attentive. I am not sure why there are some bad reviews about the service. The waitress even came back to refill my diet coke without me requesting for one! 

thanks Pacific Catch for a memorable dinner! :) 

PS. parking can be alittle tough!

excerpts: Lately, we've moved on to the Hawaiian Teriyaki Rice Bowl with Grilled Salmon and brown rice.
I like to get half brown rice and half greens.
That's greens, like salad, not green rice.
grilled salmon.author: Kris L.
grilled salmon.review:
A and I come here a lot now.  It's in a great location, spacious, almost always has room for us, and easy to walk to.

We used to always share the California Roll Salad.  They're awesome here because when you tell them you're sharing, they split everything up in two separate bowls for you.  

Lately, we've moved on to the Hawaiian Teriyaki Rice Bowl with Grilled Salmon and brown rice.  I like to get half brown rice and half greens.  That's greens, like salad, not green rice.  That would be weird.

I love the rice bowl.  It's tasty.  It's healthy.  But it's a bit too big for just me to finish.  I'd share with A, but he loves it so much that he always gets his own.

excerpts: My daughter and I usually just getting our favorite grilled salmon or ahi salads.
The wait staff is friendly, the ambience is low-key and just upscale enough to make it a good place to have business meals.
Just plan ahead if you need to park - lots of tourists around there on weekends.
grilled salmon.author: Julianne W.
grilled salmon.review: This is one of our 'go to' places when we're in SF - always great!  The menu choices are interesting and varied - have not been disappointed yet! My daughter and I usually just getting our favorite grilled salmon or ahi salads.  The wait staff is friendly, the ambience is low-key and just upscale enough to make it a good place to have business meals. Just plan ahead if you need to park - lots of tourists around there on weekends.

excerpts: I went with the grilled salmon salad.
Before the food arrives you will get an appetizer, fresh cold lemon green beans and  very cute  fish shaped crackers.
I never had these kinds of beans before, very cool.
The salad was served quickly after, and was nothing short of amazing (see picture.)
The salmon was grilled crispy on the outside but still soft on the inside.
The salad consisted of bean sprouts, shitake mushrooms, and various salads, mostly baby leafs making it very crunchy.
It also came with what I understand was a yoghurt/lemon/soy sauce dressing.
It was blissful, never had anything like it before.
Another cool thing: the salmon skin is deep fried and served as a replacement for croutons to make everything a little crunchier, very cool idea.
Now this isn't a cheap place by any means, the salad was 14 dollars, but trust me when I say it was worth every penny!
Highly recommended.
grilled salmon.author: Matthias K.
grilled salmon.review: I ended up here after a long walk through Golden Gate Park, and at first I must say I wasn't impressed. From the outside and from quickly glancing over the menu I had the impression that this was a touristy place, pricey but average. Boy was I wrong. After being seated I had a closer look at the menu (there's also a daily catch one) and there were lots of really innovative and tasty sounding things on it, from Asian rice bowls to sandwiches and meal sized salads. I went with the grilled salmon salad. Before the food arrives you will get an appetizer, fresh cold lemon green beans and  very cute  fish shaped crackers. I never had these kinds of beans before, very cool. The salad was served quickly after, and was nothing short of amazing (see picture.) The salmon was grilled crispy on the outside but still soft on the inside. The salad consisted of bean sprouts, shitake mushrooms, and various salads, mostly baby leafs making it very crunchy. It also came with what I understand was a yoghurt/lemon/soy sauce dressing. It was blissful, never had anything like it before. Another cool thing: the salmon skin is deep fried and served as a replacement for croutons to make everything a little crunchier, very cool idea. Now this isn't a cheap place by any means, the salad was 14 dollars, but trust me when I say it was worth every penny! Highly recommended.

excerpts: As far as the food, he ordered grilled salmon/artichoke/jalepeno sauce, I ordered the meal sized salmon salad.
Both of which left much to be desired.
The oil on the salmon was all I could taste,
when I tasted my boyfriends dish, there was virtually no difference from mine.
grilled salmon.author: Judy A.
grilled salmon.review:
Unfortunately I chose this restaraunt to celebrate my boyfriends 45th Birthday. The service was so slow and the waiter and waitress were bothered by us when we requested water, or to see their selection of teas.  

As far as the food, he ordered grilled salmon/artichoke/jalepeno sauce, I ordered the meal sized salmon salad. Both of which left much to be desired. The oil on the salmon was all I could taste, when I tasted my boyfriends dish, there was virtually no difference from mine. It was like cafeteria food! 

Lastly, our waitress and waiter came by to check on us once only, the 2 or three times we needed anything, we were searching and waiting to flag them down, neither one would look in our direction. The dressing on my salad was absolutely bitter, unpalatable. 
 
I had long awaited trying the food here because it is just a great location with a nice ambiance, and I'm very sad to say, EVERYTHING was extremely disappointing.....

Don't waste your money.

excerpts: Comes in a big big bowl with nori, ginger, rice, seaweed salad, and your choice of hawaiian poke, grilled salmon, seared tuna or crab.
YUM!
Also really like their Guava mint cooler.
Alcoholic drink..
but you don't taste it too much.
grilled salmon.author: Rhonda H.
grilled salmon.review: Been here a few times and I've always left satisfied. Most favorite item on the menu is the Japanese Wasabi rice bowl with Hawaiian poke. Comes in a big big bowl with nori, ginger, rice, seaweed salad, and your choice of hawaiian poke, grilled salmon, seared tuna or crab. YUM! Also really like their Guava mint cooler. Alcoholic drink..but you don't taste it too much.

excerpts: The size of the grilled salmon could have certainly been larger, and the quantity of rice could have been far less.
grilled salmon.author: B. Earl K.
grilled salmon.review:
Very easy to make a same day (Sunday) lunch reservation via OpenTable.com.

They started us with a small two-compartment dish of fresh edamame and some little Pepperidge Farm-esque pretzel nuggets. 

Extremely fast service for our "appetizer", Hawaiian Poke. The ahi cubes were very soft and the sesame soy marinade was perfect. This dish was a great value at $8.50...the ahi was piled high alongside and on top of several tasty wonton crisps.

My wife ordered the fried oysters with sweet potato fries subbed in for their traditional fries...both DEE-licious. I ordered the salmon teriyaki bowl with brown rice subbed in for the pineapple fried rice. The latter didn't sound very appealing to me; plus, my wife is always telling me about the healthy benefits of brown rice! Their bowls are HUGE, btw. The size of my bowl reminded me of something I would get at the Cheesecake Factory. The size of the grilled salmon could have certainly been larger, and the quantity of rice could have been far less. Otherwise, it was just okay.

Friendly, speedy service. Nice variety on their menu(s). We'll definitely return to try some more of what they have to offer!

excerpts:
Grilled Salmon with artichoke and a layer of tomatos
Dessert:
Mochi ice cream fondue with vanilla, coffee and chocolate flavored ice cream
grilled salmon.author: Stacey C.
grilled salmon.review:
I just came back from my Valentine's Day dinner and I'm all alone and yelping already.  I was really excited to try this place because the reviews are pretty decent so far.  So we went for the Valentine's Day special for $65.  Everything on there I believe you can order through the chalkboard special menu or regular dinner menu.  

Decor was nice and the place looks a lot bigger than it does from the outside.  I guess I never noticed Canvas was that big inside.  The beech wood on the ceiling brightens up the place while still looking a little romantic, and even the bathroom walls/doors have the little bamboo inside plexiglass look which is nice to look at when you have to pee.

Starter:
Firecracker roll - a spicy tempura salmon roll
Entrees:
1. Ahi Tuna 3 way - poke, sesame seared and another kind of seared with rice, seaweed salad, some terryaki mushroom edamame mix and another mixed salad that could've been one of those japanese mixes with turnip.
2. Grilled Salmon with artichoke and a layer of tomatos
Dessert:
Mochi ice cream fondue with vanilla, coffee and chocolate flavored ice cream
Drinks: Sparkling white wine

The portions were pretty good sized for $65 for 2 people.  The firecracker roll was rather large, but if you look closely, it's a lot of rice wrapped in them.  It still tasted good though and didn't come out looking all sloppy like some restaurants make their sushi.  I really liked the ahi 3-way.  The seared kinds were better and more buttery than the poke, which to me was kind of chewy.  Not exactly the way I pictured poke.  But every other piece was fine.  My husband had the salmon and said he wished he picked something else.  Salmon is salmon - nothing special, but cooked really nicely - not overcooked, just right.  
Dessert was really good.  I love chocolate and I like mochi ice cream on a stick.  This was just right.  
The wine was definitely not the best.  I think with our chosen food, the wine just ended up tasting sour.  But I love sweet white wines and that's just my preference.

The service was really good for such a crowded night.  We had a really upbeat and polite waitress and they served us our food quickly enough.  A nice place to eat overall with a lot more to try.  I love sweet potato fries so that will be part of my next meal there.  They have what, 5 parking spaces there, but there's plenty of parking across the street and in the park.

excerpts: Dishes that we ordered: California roll / Hawaiian surf and turf / grilled salmon with Gluten-free tortilla chips, artichoke, tomatoes / Tofu teriyaki bowl /  and fixed 3 course meal Costa-Rican (limited time only).
The grilled salmon was moist and tasty.
The grilled salmon was moist and tasty.
My 5 year old daughter polished off the California roll with real crab meat.
My mom's Tofu Bowl was very good.
I like the firmness of the tofu.
My dad's 3 course fixed price meal was very tasty.
It looked like a quesadilla with all the fixings, but without the quesadilla.
Oh, and the brown rice is a must have
grilled salmon.author: Marcus Y.
grilled salmon.review:
Came here after a drive back from Fresno. If it wasn't for a lucky parking spot within 50 feet, I would've eaten elsewhere, but my kids were hungry and since 1 of my daughter has a food allergy, this was a better place to go. I've heard so much about this place and thru my mom, that I was excited coming here, even after a 4 hour drive.

Dishes that we ordered: California roll / Hawaiian surf and turf / grilled salmon with Gluten-free tortilla chips, artichoke, tomatoes / Tofu teriyaki bowl /  and fixed 3 course meal Costa-Rican (limited time only).

All the food was delicious! I ordered the Hawaiian Surf & Turf. The skirt steak was very tender and so good. It also came with 2 skewers of shrimps, along with pineapple fried rice and asparagus. The grilled salmon was moist and tasty. My 5 year old daughter polished off the California roll with real crab meat. My mom's Tofu Bowl was very good. I like the firmness of the tofu. My dad's 3 course fixed price meal was very tasty. It looked like a quesadilla with all the fixings, but without the quesadilla. Oh, and the brown rice is a must have, otherwise you'll get the sushi rice, which is still good. 

It was kinda pricey, but was worth it for the delicious meal.

excerpts: The grilled salmon salad was nice except that the fish was lacking in flavor, but we were pleasantly surprised by the California Crab & Avocado salad which was just right!
grilled salmon.author: OfLit G.
grilled salmon.review:
We were looking for inexpensive seafood and that's what we got.
The place was clean and the service was friendly and attentive.
We started with the miso soup which was nice and a little fishy (in a good way), the Hawaiian Poke which was fresh enough but really not very well cut - it had unchewable bits, which is a big no-no in raw fish. The Mahi Mahi was overly seasoned and the fish got lost in the dish. The grilled salmon salad was nice except that the fish was lacking in flavor, but we were pleasantly surprised by the California Crab & Avocado salad which was just right! Everybody LOVED the sweet potato fries - yum!
All in all, a decent value for your money in the seafood scene.

excerpts: The grilled salmon was dried up and burnt.
The waitress seemed quite proud of them being organic salmon, though.
grilled salmon.author: Robert L.
grilled salmon.review:
I thought this would be a good place. Seafood in San Francisco? Sounds like a sure bet.

Not so.  Scallops, while fresh and big, were tasteless and merely lightly grilled.  The grilled salmon was dried up and burnt.  The waitress seemed quite proud of them being organic salmon, though.  They did have some big rice bowls, but you might as well go to the Serramonte Mall's food court if you want to eat rice bowls.

The only saving grace is the sweet potato fries.  And only because not a lot of restaurants have sweet potato fries.  

Two stars because I'm not coming back here and won't recommend anyone else to.

excerpts: i'm not a big grilled salmon fan
grilled salmon.author: Irene C.
grilled salmon.review:
My husband and I went to Pacific Catch on a Wednesday night and the place was pretty full.  So we sat at the bar instead so that we didn't have to wait, which turned out great cuz the bartender was very nice and both our cocktails tasted delicious!  We ordered the Firecracker Salmon roll which was very good.  We also ordered the sturgeon fish of the day which came with an avocado sauce, grilled vegetable, and sweet potato fries.  The fries were really good.  The overall portion size for the entree was just right because it still allows room for appetizer if you want.  We are small eaters so it was just right.  Our total bill was about $60 which is not too bad given we had drinks too.  We're definitely going back and will try some of the other menus.  We recommended this place to our friend who liked it too.  The only complain they had was that everything on the menu is fish but that was fine with us.

1/1/2008: This is the 2nd time I've been here and I would still give it a 4 star.  We had reservations at 7pm for 7 people and they seated us late for about 10 mins and they comped all our appetizers, without us complaining or mentioning it at all.  Now that's a restaurant that cares about their customers.  It was a pleasant surprise and treat.  The service was great throughout the meal as well.  

With 7 people, we tried alot more different dishes.  

Appetizers:
1) Shrimp ceviche - They were whole shrimp and there were lots of them.  I think they should dice up the shrimp because it was served with tortilla chips and there's no way you can get a whole shrimp on the chip.  But the taste was decent overall, nothing spectacular so I probably won't order it again
2) Grilled artichokes - Fresh, good, seasoned properly.  Would order it again.
3) Calamari - very good, came with fried lemon slices too which is an interesting touch.  the sauce was a little spicy.  Would recommend trying this and I would order it again.

Rolls
1) CA roll - good that it was real crab meat, not some doughy fake ones.  There was too much rice which will fill you up quickly.  I prefer less rice.  Probably would not order it again just because I don't think this is not a signature dish.

2) Rock 'n roll - Too much rice, couldn't find/taste the unagi (bbq eel).  Again, it tastes ok, but wouldn't order it again.

3) Firecracker roll - We had this last time, loved it.  This time it was still good.  For some reason, this roll doesn't not have as much rice as the other too, which is good.  Would order it again

Entrees
1) Mahi mahi fish of the day - came with grilled veggie, sweet potato fries, mahi mahi served with tomatillo avocado sauce.  The fish had a cajun spice rub that was a bit pungent.  The sweet potato fries as always was great.  Grilled veggie - can't go wrong with this.  Don't like the spice rub so won't order it again

2) Grilled shrimp teriyaki bowl - Very tasty, great teriyaki sauce.  Liked that it came with veggie and mushroom, chopped and mixed into the rice.   Would order it again

3) Ono fish of the day - very good.  came with fried onion rings that were delicious.  came with pineapple fried rice which everyone loved.  the fish was grilled on banana leaf so it had a great aroma and taste.  would order it gain.

4) Organic chinook fish of the day - it came with grilled artichoke and brown rice and the fish was served with a tomato sauce.  it was fresh and decently good.  i'm not a big grilled salmon fan so that's why i won't order it again. 

5) Grilled Korean beef (another daily special) - I don't eat beef so I can't comment, but my husband thought it was decent.  This place is called "Pacific Catch" so I'd stick with the fish but if you have a friend that doesn't like seafood, at least there is an option to have meat.

Overall, I'd recommend this place and would go again.  Good atmosphere for couples or groups.  Great service.  Nice decor and clean.  Lots of cocktails, decent size wine list.

2/14/08: This is visit #3.

Cocktail Review:
Sun Burn - average; menu says there's a tropical syrup in it which I think is what gave it a little after taste of some sort.
Some cocktail with Gin 209, kiwi and cucumber juice - DELICIOUS!  We had to order a 2nd one.  

House salad - Good size, very fresh greens, salad dressing was yummy, if you like a Japanese type kinda dressing w/miso; The mushrooms that were in the salad was delicious.  They're cooked in some sauce, not some uncooked mushroom.

Catch of the Day Fish and Chips - The ling cod fish and chips is the freshest fish and chips we ever had.  It's lightly fried, lightly crispy and covered in a thick batter where you eat a lot of batter and not fish.  The fish was cooked to perfection and fresh and was juicy.  The sweet potato fries as usual, are always yummy!!!

Salmon and mahi mahi taco: Both were good and fresh.  The salsa on each one are good.  The salmon one has a spicy kick to it so if you like spicy, try that.

excerpts: We ordered a variety of stuff with the kids mostly getting various fish tacos, adults ranging from the grilled salmon to beef salad.
I got a kamikaze bloody mary (haven't had a bm for about 20 years!
and this was good, not too wasabe infused, not overly alcoholic) then the ahi poke rice bowl.
I was going to get the extra tobiko but forgot to order it.
Oh, man, that was a good bowl of food!
I'm not a sprouts eater but these were fresh and yummy and went well with all the other foods in the bowl.
And the poke was outstanding.
I wonder why I've never poke before--probably because this is the first place I've been to that has even mentioned it.
And, of course, there were desserts all around
(I take cappuccino as my dessert of choice), which I'm told were incredible.
All in all, the food was excellent, staff was unintrusive but attentive, bathrooms were clean, and I think all was well worth the prices.
My one "complaint" was that it was too noise to really chat much with the folks not directly across or next to me.
I'm glad it's in my neighborhood since I plan to make this one of my regular "take out" joints.
grilled salmon.author: Kai T.
grilled salmon.review: Took the family here for Father's Day (all fishermen and/or fish eaters) and we all loved it.  We ordered a variety of stuff with the kids mostly getting various fish tacos, adults ranging from the grilled salmon to beef salad.  I got a kamikaze bloody mary (haven't had a bm for about 20 years! and this was good, not too wasabe infused, not overly alcoholic) then the ahi poke rice bowl.  I was going to get the extra tobiko but forgot to order it.  Oh, man, that was a good bowl of food!  I'm not a sprouts eater but these were fresh and yummy and went well with all the other foods in the bowl.  And the poke was outstanding.  I wonder why I've never poke before--probably because this is the first place I've been to that has even mentioned it.  And, of course, there were desserts all around (I take cappuccino as my dessert of choice), which I'm told were incredible.  All in all, the food was excellent, staff was unintrusive but attentive, bathrooms were clean, and I think all was well worth the prices.  My one "complaint" was that it was too noise to really chat much with the folks not directly across or next to me.  I'm glad it's in my neighborhood since I plan to make this one of my regular "take out" joints.

excerpts: California Roll Salad
: I love this salad!
Although I had it at every meal
and I got kind of sick of it at the end.
The salad is huge and you'll probably have a hard time finishing it.
It comes with a ton of avocado and a even bigger mound of real crab.
It really does taste like a california roll!
california roll salad.author: Tiffany V.
california roll salad.review:
I think the text my best friend sent me yesterday morning sums up my feelings about Pacific Catch, "wtf wtfff why are you always at pacific catch crazy woman" Haha. 

I didn't even realize how much I loved this place until I kept finding myself there. It wasn't even until the third time did I realize they had a parking lot next to the restaurant! How handy! Such a rare find in San Francisco. 

Fish & Chips: Everyone loves these but I don't think its their best thing there. You should definitely get 4 pieces though since its $14 and 2 pieces is already $10. The pieces of fish aren't that big. I love the sauces it comes with but the Jalapeno Tartar sauce was never spicy to me. I think the coleslaw side is far too small as well but I love their sweet potato fries (the only reason I wanted to come in the first place haha)

California Roll Salad: I love this salad! Although I had it at every meal and I got kind of sick of it at the end. The salad is huge and you'll probably have a hard time finishing it. It comes with a ton of avocado and a even bigger mound of real crab. It really does taste like a california roll! I think its around $13. 

Hawaiian Poke Brown Rice Bowl: I never would've thought of ordering this if it wasn't for Yelp! I'm eating it right now as I type. I had a ton leftover because it wasn't the best thing to eat yesterday morning hungover! By far my favorite thing from Pacific Catch. You can also get it with white rice or 1/2 rice & 1/2 greens. 

Mochi Fondue: Nothing special. Just 3 mochi balls cut in half and a little bowl of tasty melty chocolate to dip it in. There was way too much chocolate in the bowl though and I felt bad for wasting it. I don't think its worth the money since it isn't very creative and you could just make the same thing yourself for far less. 

There is never a wait when I go. My friend and I were about to get dinner at the Presidio location until we drove by it noticed how tiny and packed it was. We just drove all the way to the 9th street location. This location is huge. Service has always been nice as well. I probably wouldn't go on a first date here though as it is a little bit commercial and there are tons of better first date restaurants in the area.

excerpts:
California Roll Salad - 14.5 
crab, avocado, cucumber, pickled ginger, carrots, shredded nori & soy-wasabi vinaigrette
Except for me thinking that I'd try the California Roll Salad.
For $15, I wish I ordered the Hawaiian bowl cause I wasn't sure if I was supposed to be tasting anything.
With a decent amount of crab that they give you, and an overdose of avocado, surprisingly, and the soy-wasabi sauce, it had HARDLY any taste.
I was confused.
Is this crab ...or invisible taste? o.0
Except for me thinking that I'd try the California Roll Salad.
For $15, I wish I ordered the Hawaiian bowl cause I wasn't sure if I was supposed to be tasting anything.
With a decent amount of crab that they give you, and an overdose of avocado, surprisingly, and the soy-wasabi sauce, it had HARDLY any taste.
I was confused.
Is this crab ...or invisible taste? o.0
california roll salad.author: Lindsay L.
california roll salad.review:
California Roll Salad - 14.5 
crab, avocado, cucumber, pickled ginger, carrots, shredded nori & soy-wasabi vinaigrette

Hawaiian Bowl - 15
asparagus, shiitake mushrooms, pineapple salsa, grilled bok choy, sesame seeds & house-made sake-teriyaki sauce served over seasoned sushi rice*

Taco Platter - 13
Baja, steak, and mahi mahi

Combination Captains Plate - 15 or so
3 thai coconut shrimps, 2 pieces of fried fish (forgot which kind), and 3 battered oysters with a choice of a side.  We choose the sweet potatoes.

We came on a Friday night and there was a good crowd.  I'll start by saying that the people there, the waiters and waitresses were alright.  They were cordial and polite, but I think that having worked in food myself, I definitely could've done a better job in the friendliness department.  The restaurant wasn't so busy as to have the servers running around, but after saying the food was coming out really quickly, he disappeared for a lonnng time and on top of that the food did not come out quickly at all.  Which is understandable for a Friday night, but it would've been cool not to have been ditched at our table.  Or maybe I'm just expecting too much.

Anyways, I'd give this place a 3 stars.  The ambiance is nice, the food is mostly good.   Except for me thinking that I'd try the California Roll Salad.  For $15, I wish I ordered the Hawaiian bowl cause I wasn't sure if I was supposed to be tasting anything.  With a decent amount of crab that they give you, and an overdose of avocado, surprisingly, and the soy-wasabi sauce, it had HARDLY any taste.  I was confused.  Is this crab ...or invisible taste? o.0 Pass.

All in all, I guess some things are hit or miss, but the Hawaiian was good and the coconut shrimps were tasty.

excerpts: The salmon salad had tons of crispy fried salmon skin and the California Roll salad had plenty of crab salad but without heavy mayo.
The fish tacos were very fresh and filling.
california roll salad.author: Melissa K.
california roll salad.review:
After a long flight from the east coast, we were hungry and tired of driving around so we decided to take a chance with Pacific Catch.  What a great choice!

Coming from Hawaii, I was a bit wary of restaurant's "Hawaii" theme and of the poke and other fish items but I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food relative to the price.  Entrees range from $10-$20 and everything is fresh and delicious.  Lots of fresh, creative salads, plenty of seafood options, and the food bursts with flavor and color.  

I really enjoyed the salads and the soup of the day which consisted of seafood in a tomato base. The edamame and pretzel Goldfish crackers were very cute, and I also enjoyed the wakame salad and the broccolini. The salmon salad had tons of crispy fried salmon skin and the California Roll salad had plenty of crab salad but without heavy mayo. The fish tacos were very fresh and filling. And the cocktails are phenomenal. 

Service was very good-- the waitstaff were very friendly and welcoming. Also, I'm super glad there is a parking area!

excerpts: I am a super big fan of the California Roll Salad, which had TONS of real crab on it - made my meal special.
california roll salad.author: Andrew K.
california roll salad.review: I am a super big fan of the California Roll Salad, which had TONS of real crab on it - made my meal special.

excerpts: California roll salad.
california roll salad.author: Dani K.
california roll salad.review:
California roll salad. Ceviche.

Thats my lunch after a day at Golden Gate park.

Lots of Asian rice bowls with tons of choices in case I want something warm.

You can reserve a table which makes the stress of finding a place on a Sunday in the sunset disappear. Of course you have to park-- but we usually find something relatively close if we pray to the parking goddesses.

Excellent service. Fair prices.

excerpts: I got the California Roll salad which seemed to be a pretty popular item on the menu from all the reviews.
It DID taste like a california roll, so that was pretty cool.
I forgot to ask for dressing on the side, because I normally like my salad naked
so that was my own screw up.
The avocado was SO creamy like everyone says.
I'd come back and order this.
california roll salad.author: Jeannie L.
california roll salad.review:
Came here with mixed feelings because of what I read on Yelp but I try to never let it hender my experience. 

It's a nice, large, dimly lighted restaurant with a nice cozy feel to it. 

On the up side, our waiter was really friendly... the downside, he was really frantic and running around during our entire meal. We tried to get his attention a few times throughout and he either never saw us, or didn't have time to stop. The hostesses walking around were quite helpful though.

I got the California Roll salad which seemed to be a pretty popular item on the menu from all the reviews. It DID taste like a california roll, so that was pretty cool. I forgot to ask for dressing on the side, because I normally like my salad naked so that was my own screw up. The avocado was SO creamy like everyone says. I'd come back and order this. Plus, it IS rather large! 

The bf ordered the thai curry rice bowl devouring it quickly and my friend ordered the salmon sandwich. Both seemed pleased with their choices. 

Biggest issue was just the service... true to the reviews, it was lagging. Thankfully, my extra dirty martini helped me be more forgiving than usual. Next time, maybe not so much...

excerpts: We used to always share the California Roll Salad.
california roll salad.author: Kris L.
california roll salad.review:
A and I come here a lot now.  It's in a great location, spacious, almost always has room for us, and easy to walk to.

We used to always share the California Roll Salad.  They're awesome here because when you tell them you're sharing, they split everything up in two separate bowls for you.  

Lately, we've moved on to the Hawaiian Teriyaki Rice Bowl with Grilled Salmon and brown rice.  I like to get half brown rice and half greens.  That's greens, like salad, not green rice.  That would be weird.

I love the rice bowl.  It's tasty.  It's healthy.  But it's a bit too big for just me to finish.  I'd share with A, but he loves it so much that he always gets his own.

excerpts: I was very happy with my California roll salad, which was huge and worth the $15.
I will definitely be back when I'm in the area.
california roll salad.author: Nicole C.
california roll salad.review: I had a really nice experience here today. The general manager was friendly and attentive, greeted us the moment we walked in the door. We were seated promptly at the table of our choice in the bar area by the window (note: we arrived just after they opened, just before a Saturday lunch rush) and our server offered water immediately. I asked for recommendations and our server happily obliged. I was very happy with my California roll salad, which was huge and worth the $15. I will definitely be back when I'm in the area.

excerpts: My favorite entree is the veggie special salad with grilled salmon.
I have even been known to add the korean steak to it.
Recently, I tried their salmon club special.
WTF?
veggie special.author: Irina S.
veggie special.review:
Why have I not reviewed this place earlier? I love it here. I am a regular here; the servers recognize me, stay and chat. It's great. Sure, like with every place one can have a bad experience, but the great experiences and delicious food (well priced too)  outweigh any hiccup that might occur. 

My favorite entree is the veggie special salad with grilled salmon. I have even been known to add the korean steak to it. It's just perfect. 

Recently, I tried their salmon club special. WTF? That was just awesome! 

I also love me some thai iced tea! They make it super tasty and are generous with the refills. The lemongrass iced is great too, but please don't forget about the full bar! 

Lastly, a very special treat are the Fried Dulce de Leche Spring Rolls. Yea. Wow. Seriously, WOW!

I haven't mentioned their appetizers yet, but I feel like I should. The ceviche and fried oyster appetizers, and their hawaiian poke are really tasty. The spicy fries make a good side or just a yummy starter. 

Ok. I have to control myself. But this place is really good to come to just when you want a quick dinner, to catch up with a friend, or with a group. 

p.s. they have opentable to you get points for making reservations, and just recently started using the punchh app. Double perks for eating here!!!! Yes please.

excerpts: From their appetizers and fish tacos to their fish & chips and daily chalkboard specials, the food at Pacific Catch is generally pretty fresh...except for all of their fried stuff, like their Mixed Catch plate that my buddy likes).
mixed catch.author: Mike L.
mixed catch.review:
I don't intend for this to sound like a slight, but I always seem to forget about Pacific Catch.  Whether it's because they've been around for so long or because I've b een here so many times, it's gotten to the point now where they just kind of fade into the background for me.  Which might explain why, despite all of those trips here, I've still never written a review for these guys!  Although, I could've sworn I wrote something about them at some point over the years...

While the place is starting to show a bit of its age (though they did convert part of their entry way into an outdoor seating area with a fire pit), Pacific Catch hasn't let its menu get outdated.  Along with expanding the choices for their long time staples (rice bowls, fried seafood, fish-centric entrees, sushi rolls, etc.), they also keep a rotation of daily chalkboard specials and added a "raw bar" menu, which features varieties of ceviche, poke, taktaki, platters/towers, and more.

Given how many times I've been here, I've been able to try a number of things on their menu, so I'd like to think I have a pretty good sense of them overall.  From their appetizers and fish tacos to their fish & chips and daily chalkboard specials, the food at Pacific Catch is generally pretty fresh...except for all of their fried stuff, like their Mixed Catch plate that my buddy likes).  However, whether it's been when I've dined in or when I used to get takeout, I usually end up getting the same thing every time - their JAPANESE WASABI BOWL with Poke ($16.50).

Filled with Seaweed Salad, Avocado, Daikon Salad, Ginger, Sesame Seeds, Shredded Nori, and Soy-Wasabi Sauce, this isn't bad, but lacking compared to what you can get from poke joints.  While their poke (tuna) is generally pretty fresh, everything else is hit or miss.  The seaweed salad and avocado are good, but I'm not a fan of their daikon salad and the sauce is just okay (I personally prefer ponzu-based ones).  What's more, the rice can be a little inconsistent (can be overcooked).

Despite how their food may not strike me like how it used to, I certainly appreciate how steady and consistent Pacific Catch has been.  From my first trip here, to the time we sat at their bar and watched the Giants clinch the 2014 World Series, to this most recent trip, the food hasn't changed much, for better or worse.  Still, it's nice that whenever I do come back, they're (probably) going to be as reliable as ever!

excerpts: DH had the Mixed Catch, deep fried oysters, fish and coconut shrimp combo, and really liked it.
I had the wasabi bowl, 1/2 brown rice and 1/2 mixed greens topped with poke.
For some reason, it lacked flavor and the texture of the poke was past its prime.
There was zero wasabi flavor.
mixed catch.author: Joanna S.
mixed catch.review:
Second visit here, I usually go to the San Mateo location and think it's better

For some reason, the food seems fresher and more flavorful in San Mateo.

We started with the calamari appetizer, which was very good.

DH had the Mixed Catch, deep fried oysters, fish and coconut shrimp combo, and really liked it. I had the wasabi bowl, 1/2 brown rice and 1/2 mixed greens topped with poke.  For some reason, it lacked flavor and the texture of the poke was past its prime. There was zero wasabi flavor.  My previous visit, for lunch was ok, not great. 

After eating at the San Mateo location many times, the menu here seems very familiar but the food does not taste the same.  I know this is an older location, but I thought the food would be comparable.

Next time I am in that neighborhood I'll stick to Park Chow.

excerpts: We ordered the inside out roll, the poke trio and the mixed catch (fried oysters, fish and coconut shrimp) to share.
The sushi roll was pretty good and fresh.
The poke trio was just okay
...pretty pricey for what you get.
Then 15 more... before we got the mixed catch.
I literally was about to cancel my order when it came out.
And it was a huge disappointment.
The fish was good at first but it got soggy really fast and the batter quickly fell off.
The oysters were pretty good but also pretty tiny.
The coconut shrimp was my least favorite.
mixed catch.author: Erin H.
mixed catch.review:
Came here a week ago because our other restaurant pick was too crowded.  Since we were in a rush, we took a seat at a bar table.  The service was a little slow at first but they were quite visy for a Sunday afternoon.  We ordered the inside out roll, the poke trio and the mixed catch (fried oysters, fish and coconut shrimp) to share.  The sushi roll was pretty good and fresh.  The poke trio was just okay...pretty pricey for what you get.  Those two dishes came out relatively fast... and then the wait...

We waited 15 minutes...

Then 15 more... before we got the mixed catch.  I literally was about to cancel my order when it came out.  And it was a huge disappointment.  The fish was good at first but it got soggy really fast and the batter quickly fell off.  The oysters were pretty good but also pretty tiny.  The coconut shrimp was my least favorite.  The best thing on the plate was the tartar sauce (yup...).

Overall, this place is okay but nothing special, especially considering the price.

excerpts: Also had the mixed catch fish and chips.
The fish and chips were okay
but I don't really know how to describe the tacos.
The tortilla was on the dry side and most of it was filled with cabbage, a lot of thick slices of cabbage.
The ingredients didn't really hold together, just felt like hasty assortment of ingredients thrown together.
The mahi-mahi was really dry.
The crispy Alaskan cod was mildly crispy
so I ended up eating just the fish.
You can get much better taco at any taco truck.
Service was good.
Environment was clean.
mixed catch.author: Raymond N.
mixed catch.review: Had the three taco platter with traditional Baja, mahi-mahi, and cabo shrimp and side of sweet potato fries. Also had the mixed catch fish and chips. The fish and chips were okay but I don't really know how to describe the tacos. The tortilla was on the dry side and most of it was filled with cabbage, a lot of thick slices of cabbage. The ingredients didn't really hold together, just felt like hasty assortment of ingredients thrown together. The mahi-mahi was really dry. The crispy Alaskan cod was mildly crispy so I ended up eating just the fish. You can get much better taco at any taco truck. Service was good. Environment was clean.

excerpts: I went for the "mixed catch basket".
Deep fried alaskan cod, deep fried coconut shrimp and deep fried oysters.
I really am not a fan of fried oysters....
but I was so surprised ... these were wonderful.
And it came with two dipping sauces,  jalapeño tartar and  thai sweet chili.
As well with fries and coleslaw.
This was one of the best deep fried fish I had ever had.
It was obviously FRESH EVERY THING.
On the daily special menu they had Tom Yam soup.
Tom yam is a coconut milk base Thai soup, and a favorite of mine.
A rich broth with shrimp, tomatoes, mushrooms, and traditional Thai seasonings.
I could have eaten 6 bowls.
Everyone at the table tasted it, everyone loved it.
We all shared a chocolate cream brûlée for dessert.
$127.00 for four people with drinks and apps and the dessert.
Very reasonable for the quality and amount of food.
I am looking forward to my next trip to San Francisco just so I can return to Pacific Catch.
mixed catch.author: India G.
mixed catch.review: This was a wonderful experience.  When we travel to San Francisco, we love to try new and different places.  We always get together with our Niece that lives in San Francisco for a meal. I had heard about this place from her, she has been to one of their restaurants with her dad.  This one is off Lincoln on 9th av.  I checked it out online and it looked good, so we made a date.  They also had a nice selection of specials not on the website.  The restaurant is very nice and roomy inside.  Not too noisy.  The staff was great.  Our waiter was very attentive.  Our water was never empty and he kept checking on us every few minutes.  The food... Knocked it out of the park.  It is a seafood place but they do offer chicken, ribs, and steak dishes.   As it is called "Pacific Catch" the food reflects different flavors of the Pacific Rim.  I like flavorful and spice in my food, but I do not like HEAT.  The waiter assured me it would not be too much heat. I love deep fried fish and chips.  I try them everywhere I go.  I went for the "mixed catch basket".  Deep fried alaskan cod, deep fried coconut shrimp and deep fried oysters. I really am not a fan of fried oysters.... but I was so surprised ... these were wonderful.  And it came with two dipping sauces,  jalapeño tartar and  thai sweet chili.  As well with fries and coleslaw.  This was one of the best deep fried fish I had ever had.  It was obviously FRESH EVERY THING.  On the daily special menu they had Tom Yam soup.  Tom yam is a coconut milk base Thai soup, and a favorite of mine.  A rich broth with shrimp, tomatoes, mushrooms, and traditional Thai seasonings.  I could have eaten 6 bowls.  Everyone at the table tasted it, everyone loved it.  We all shared a chocolate cream brûlée for dessert.  $127.00 for four people with drinks and apps and the dessert.  Very reasonable for the quality and amount of food.  I am looking forward to my next trip to San Francisco just so I can return to Pacific Catch.

excerpts: I ordered the Mixed Catch Basket, which came with fried oysters, cod, and coconut shrimp.
I loved the oysters.
I don't care where you order cod, it's the blandest fish of all whitefish.
So, its lackluster showing was totally expected.
The coconut shrimp was tasty.
The spicy fries are bomb-diggity!
Especially when dipped in the basket's accompanying jalapeno aioli.
mixed catch.author: Tamar D.
mixed catch.review:
I remember when this place was some coffee/art house.  I haven't been there since, even though I'm in the Inner Sunset constantly.  What a pleasant little surprise!  Well, not that little...the place must have 50 tables, easy.

They're dog-friendly, and we didn't want to do our usual Park Chow chow.  Extremely friendly and fast service immediately upon arrival.  We sat in the corner of the outside patio area, which was away from the wind and had ample room for the pups.

The menu is vast...tons of options and they're 90% fish and seafood.  I ordered the Mixed Catch Basket, which came with fried oysters, cod, and coconut shrimp.  I loved the oysters.  I don't care where you order cod, it's the blandest fish of all whitefish.  So, its lackluster showing was totally expected.  The coconut shrimp was tasty.  The spicy fries are bomb-diggity!  Especially when dipped in the basket's accompanying jalapeno aioli.  Mmmm

Chose the lemongrass mojito, which had very little alcohol, but it was refreshingly good.  Oh, I forgot about the amuse...shelled edamame and goldfish pretzels.  Word?  Crazy combo to eat with the supplied chopsticks.

excerpts: I got the Mixed Catch for lunch and the Michi Fondue for dessert.
If I lived in the area I would defiantly come again.
mixed catch.author: Nicole R.
mixed catch.review: If you like sea food you will love this place! I would have given it 5 stars but the service was kind of slow. The decor was very beautiful and gave off a great vibe. We were in the area visiting the botanical gardens across the street while on vacation, and found this wonderful place. One of the best meals I had so far while visiting San Fransisco! I got the Mixed Catch for lunch and the Michi Fondue for dessert. If I lived in the area I would defiantly come again.

excerpts: I ordered the mixed catch basket, which comes with coconut shrimp, fried oysters, fish, and sweet potato fries.
I thought the coconut shrimp was kinda forgettable - something about it
didn't wow me.
The fish was definitely fresh but like the coconut shrimp, I was "whatever" about it.
I did, oddly enough, really like the fried oyster.
Maybe it's because it was the only thing in my basket that had tons of flavor?
And the sweet potato fries were kinda cold?
Or at least, they were not warm.
I love sweet potato fries and mine were just bland in a way.
mixed catch.author: Stephanie B.
mixed catch.review:
Eh - so much hype for this place and it really wasn't allll that. 

It's cute they give you goldfish and edamame to munch on but kinda weird they give a small amount. But then again, you don't want to eat too much!

You MUST MUST MUST order the Hawaiian poke as an appetizer. It was my favorite dish of the night. The wonton chips were perfectly crispy and well cooked (also had a bit of a sweet flavor), and the ahi-tuna was melt in your mouth DELISH! I loved it. 

After the poke though, everything else fell kinda short.

The cabo calamari was good but not unique or better than other calamari dishes I have tried. Calamari is always the standard appetizer, but I say get the Hawaiian poke instead.

I ordered the mixed catch basket, which comes with coconut shrimp, fried oysters, fish, and sweet potato fries. I thought the coconut shrimp was kinda forgettable - something about it didn't wow me. The fish was definitely fresh but like the coconut shrimp, I was "whatever" about it. I did, oddly enough, really like the fried oyster. Maybe it's because it was the only thing in my basket that had tons of flavor? And the sweet potato fries were kinda cold? Or at least, they were not warm. I love sweet potato fries and mine were just bland in a way.

They also don't give you enough sauce for your food.

I'm hoping that maybe I ordered the wrong thing? Or maybe at the wrong time? I would just come back for the Hawaiian poke!

excerpts: My 1.5 year old threw up from the salmon and my husband got sick from the mixed catch (fried seafood and french fries).
mixed catch.author: Momo F.
mixed catch.review:
I would give zero... we've gotten food poisoning now 2 times. The first time we didn't call them but the 2nd time we spoke to the manager Patrick. Not only was he defensive and unsympathetic,  (and I was being really nice about it although I was furious) but he told me he would call me back about it the next day to follow up. Of course NO call. He also claimed that food poisoning takes 6 hours at least to set in, but if you look it up, if you are eating shellfish, like oysters, it can take 1-6 hours to set in.  

I would stay clear from this place or they should get rid of Patrick. My 1.5 year old threw up from the salmon and my husband got sick from the mixed catch (fried seafood and french fries).

excerpts: Ordered the Baja Shrimp Ceviche... Fish & Chips mixed catch basket...
Escolar..and ummm ok
, i guess i forgot what my mom ordered..
but it was good from what i stole a bite from, and she finished it without really sharing =
mixed catch.author: Kenneth V.
mixed catch.review:
Me and my sister took our mom here for Mothers Day lunch time.  I would prob give this place a 5 if we didn't get seated 5 min. after our reservation time... but understandable, it was mothers day and busy is busy.

any how, hands down... The food is Bomb. If your into seafood... hit this place up!

Ordered the Baja Shrimp Ceviche... Fish & Chips mixed catch basket...  Escolar..and ummm ok, i guess i forgot what my mom ordered.. but it was good from what i stole a bite from, and she finished it without really sharing =P

My 2x mojitos was  surprisingly  heavy handedly poured :)  which was cool but i got somewhat of a headache by 5pm

excerpts: I had the Mixed Catch Basket ($13.95)-
it's a lot of food.
In order of preference, 1. fish 2.
oysters 3.
coconut shrimp.
mixed catch.author: Amy D.
mixed catch.review:
I was the first to arrive for a birthday party of 13, 15 minutes before the reservation. Upon checking in, the hostess took my box of a dozen cupcakes back for me without me having to ask. 

We had calamari, California rolls and fried shrimp rolls for appetizers. All were really tasty. I can't even remember the last time I've had a California roll with real crab. When you order the calamari, watch out for the slices of fried lemon! 

Dinner went smoothly without any mixed up orders. The birthday girl's grandmother ordered salmon cakes and wasn't very happy with her order, but everyone else seemed satisfied. I had the Mixed Catch Basket ($13.95)- it's a lot of food. In order of preference, 1. fish 2. oysters 3. coconut shrimp. The sweet potato fries were abundant, too. 

Later, they served the cupcakes on plates with spoons to everyone and it was really nice.

I think if I were to come here again, I'd order calamari and a side of sweet potato fries for dinner.

PS- They have disposable chopsticks here, and if you use a pair for appetizers, the waiter will take them away with your plate, and you have to open a new pair of chopsticks for your entree. Am I the only one who thinks this is super wasteful? I don't mean to go all Avatar on you (I haven't even seen it), but think of the trees!

excerpts: Mixed Catch Basket - deep fried coconut shrimp, fish, oysters with more sweet potato fries.
The fish was nice and flaky but maybe they need to work on the batter.
mixed catch.author: Ellis L.
mixed catch.review:
Sorry friends, while I greatly enjoyed your company, the decision to eat here was not.

Sweet Potato Fries - while I love them, there was nothing impressive here. They came with some Thai chili sauce and this other mayo-based sauce. I preferred them with the mayo-based sauce that came with the calamari.

Calamari - not bad, maybe their specialty is to batter-fry the lemon/peppers with it too...I was like: eeek, this calamari tastes like a lemon! (It was!)

Mixed Catch Basket - deep fried coconut shrimp, fish, oysters with more sweet potato fries. The fish was nice and flaky but maybe they need to work on the batter. For me, aside from good ingredients, if I'm gonna eat something fried, the batter needs to be helllla bomb.

The boy ordered some sort of sushi with salmon on it. And avocado. Both of which I love, but not at this particular place.

Sorry Pacific Catch, maybe I caught you on an off day.

excerpts: Ceviche, fish tacos, and the mixed catch basket was ordered and though I didn't try anything from the catch basket, I was told it was delish.
mixed catch.author: Ninja H.
mixed catch.review:
Loved it!  For some reason I really wanted fish tacos which I NEVER crave but thought we'd check out this restaurant since it had been on my list for a while...and it served fish tacos.

Ceviche, fish tacos, and the mixed catch basket was ordered and though I didn't try anything from the catch basket, I was told it was delish.  The ceviche and fish tacos were to die for and if I ever want some good seafood I'll definitely be back!

I was too full for dessert but suggested the chocolate mochi to the chocolate lover and he absolutely liked it.  I tried a bite and it was incredible.  (I giggle at the description of "mochi" on the menu)

Our waiter was an older gentlemen who looked like he would have been cold and unpleasant but he was surprisingly very welcoming and attentive.

They seem to have a great bar lounge that I would like to come back for at some point.

excerpts: I had the "mixed catch basket" ($13.95)
The mixed catch basket has 3-4 crispy oysters (did I mention how much I loved those?), three big pieces of the catch of the day, a skewer of coconut shrimp, and your choice of fries (sweet potato!).
There were also two sauces -
When I pointed out to the server that my mixed catch basket lacked crispy oysters (ack!)
she was going to bring me a side of them, but ended up bringing me another entire entree!
I was really pleased, and it never hurts to bring home leftovers.
mixed catch.author: Jennie K.
mixed catch.review:
Crispy.  Oysters.  Crispy oysters crispy oysters crispy oysters CRISPYOYSTERS YAY!

I've meant to come here for ages, on the recommendation of one of my foodie friends.  I'm glad I finally did.  I understand this is a local chain, but don't let that deter you: it might be a little sanitized and carefully-put-together, but the food is awesome.

I had the "mixed catch basket" ($13.95) and my friend had a mahi-mahi sandwich ($8-$10, not on the menu - mahi mahi, sprouts, avocado, and other apparently delicious accoutrement).  The mixed catch basket has 3-4 crispy oysters (did I mention how much I loved those?), three big pieces of the catch of the day, a skewer of coconut shrimp, and your choice of fries (sweet potato!).  There were also two sauces - one was a ginger-wasabi cream sauce, and the other was a sweet and spicy sauce.

I don't eat much normally, but I scarfed that basket of goodness down like a thirteen-year-old-boy-undergoing-a-growth-spurt.   It was worth every penny.  

At 5pm on a Thursday it was practically empty, and there seemed to be acres of seating.  The decor is really pretty (I want the graduated hanging-blue-bottle light fixtures, over the bar, for my apartment, please), the service was pleasant, and our food came out quite fast.  

I balk a little at a $6 glass of wine, but I was headed to the Academy of Sciences Nightlife, where wine is $8/glass... so it's all relative, I suppose.

And did I mention the crispy oysters?  I think my only complaint was that there weren't more.  To eat on the epic journey to CAS, and to eat on the way back, and to eat for breakfast, and oh for heaven's sake...why don't I have a personal chef?

EDIT - 03/30/09 --
I took my dad, uncle, and assorted other people here on a Saturday night.  They were pretty good about serving a party of 8, and everyone seemed to enjoy the food.

Two things I wanted to update about: 
1. The spicy pacific martini.  Holy CRAP, that is good.  Mango puree, vodka, and serrano chili - the perfect fruit drink, with a spicy kick.  Goes so well with seafood, and worth the $8 (I don't say that lightly, either).

2. Food mixup.  When I pointed out to the server that my mixed catch basket lacked crispy oysters (ack!) she was going to bring me a side of them, but ended up bringing me another entire entree!  I was really pleased, and it never hurts to bring home leftovers.

excerpts: I love the Mixed Catch Basket with fish, coconut shrimp and crispy oysters with jalapeño tartar.
SO GOOD.
mixed catch.author: Julia T.
mixed catch.review:
Out of the three Pacific Catch locations, I would say this is my overall favorite. Chestnut St. is just way too tiny and crowded, though that might result in the food tasting better because you had to fight so hard to park/get a table. Corte Madera's location is too embedded in the outdoor mall scene and has way too many kiddies running around. But this 9th Ave. location is pretty much perfect with plenty of seating for the bar and regular dining area. It also has its own parking lot so you don't have to compete for the street meters. 

Food is pretty consistent at all locations. You can count on the fact that mostly everything you order from the regular menu will be very good. Some of my favorites are the wasabi bowls (with brown or sushi rice) and any of the fried seafood baskets. I love the Mixed Catch Basket with fish, coconut shrimp and crispy oysters with jalapeño tartar. SO GOOD. Everything comes freshly fried with those awesome sweet potato fries. But eat everything while they are fresh! I don't recommend taking leftover fries home. They really those their flavor after they've cooled down. 

Though their sushi roll selection lacks raw fish, I think they are still made very well with the mostly cooked ingredients. One of my favorites and one that DOES have raw fish is the Rising Sun roll. It has tempura shrimp and avocado wrapped in ahi tuna with a citrus sauce. I don't like that they stuff pickled ginger into the roll but if you're like me, just request that they leave it out. Otherwise it's a very tasty roll. The ahi tuna is always fresh and flavorful.  I love that they give you big pieces of it too. (We got that roll totally F-R-E-E! with the coupon in the Green Zebra book!) I could dine happily on their sushi rolls alone. 

Just recently I ventured off from my regulars and tried one of the their specials: Trout bbq'd baja style so it was spice rubbed and grilled, served with tomatilla avocado sauce, some thin slices of veggies, and fresh grilled corn over sweet potato fries. I could tell the fish was very fresh but for me, it was TOO seasoned and got a little salty since the fish wasn't very thick.
