And though I had originally wanted the fries, I would now have preferred and wished that the fish was served over rice. I think I'll stick to my regulars next time. 

Big pluses:
-I've talked to the workers and seen for myself that Pacific Catch is environmentally conscious. They use biodegradable materials, from the takeout containers to the straw in your drink. Pacific Catch also practices composting from their kitchen to the leftover food scraps. Smiles all around. =D
-I don't know anywhere else that you can get UNLIMITED refills on Thai iced tea. I could drink three glasses easy. LOVE IT!

excerpts: - Mixed Catch Basket | 2 pieces of fresh fish, 4 coconut shrimp & 3 oysters with traditional fries $13.95.
I would probably just order the Shrimp.
I liked the oysters, but it is not all that...
I rather not eat my oysters fried.
The tartar sauce was great.
I ordered the seasoned fries with this one.
They were very tasty.
mixed catch.author: Amelia M.
mixed catch.review:
I was never intending on going, but decided to try something new...  I walked in and couldn't believe this was my beloved Canvas Cafe once... I miss you Canvas!  They changed everything inside... it is decorated in warm colors and the light are really nice... they look like blue bottles... hmm... they could be bottles. They have lots of booths with comfortable cushions.  We were served by Misa who was really nice and very helpful. She made sure we had our fill of tea and was very attentive.  

Here is what we ordered:
- Spicy Cabo Calamari | fried with fresh chilis and crispy lemon, served with a chipotle dipping sauce $8.95. This was delicious. The sauce might be too spicy for some. The calamari rings were cooked to perfection (nothing worse than over cooked ring!)


- Mixed Catch Basket | 2 pieces of fresh fish, 4 coconut shrimp & 3 oysters with traditional fries $13.95. I would probably just order the Shrimp.  I liked the oysters, but it is not all that... I rather not eat my oysters fried.  The tartar sauce was great. I ordered the seasoned fries with this one.  They were very tasty. Next time I will try the sweet potatoes.  

- Teriyaki Bowl - Topped with asparagus, glazed shiitake mushrooms, grilled bok choy, sesame seeds & house-made teriyaki sauce served over pineapple fried rice with Fresh Salmon $13.95. This was ordered by my friends. I had some of the rice with the sauce and it tasted YUMMMY. 

- Mochi Fondu | vanilla, chocolate & coffee mochi ice cream with warm chocolate dipping sauce $5.50 When you get this dessert... eat fast... the hot chocolate makes it a bit difficult to get the mochi out of there before it melts down.  (Suggestion for restaurant owners/chefs - Perhaps if you use spoons or little ladle like utensils it would help save the bites from getting lost in the fondue. The wooden pick slips right off when dipped in the warm chocolate fondue after a few minutes.) I really loved this dessert... YUM! 

Total bill for two was a bit over $50. 

I would go back to try some other dishes.  It turned out to be a nice place to go. It does feel a bit chain like, but either way, I still enjoyed it.  I just don't feel like it fits in with the neighborhood.  I am used to the more wall in the hole feel.  Not a bad thing... it is just an observation. =)

excerpts:
Got a taste of:
"Mixed Catch Basket" - $13.95
2 pieces of fish, 4 coconut shrimp & 3 crispy oysters with jalapeno tartar
No taste of coconut in my coconut shrimp.
mixed catch.author: Diwata B.
mixed catch.review:
Fried Oysters. Poke Roll.  It's not "to-die-for" food but I'd eat there again none the less.  Service was un-noticeably good (not too bad, nothing spectacular).  They have a mini parking lot in the back, which is good considering the parking in the nearby streets.  

Appetizer: 
"Crispy Oysters" - $9.50: about 10 on the plate.  Fried.  would order it again

My meal:
"Firecracker Salmon" roll - $9.95: not a big fan of the over-induced daikon sprouts.  Didn't know I was ordering cooked-salmon til I got it.  Shouldn't have overlooked the 'tempura-salmon' description.  I'll try something else next time.
"Hawaiian Poke" roll - $8.95:  Giant cubed ahi in a roll (which I like)   I was diggin' the sesame-soy marinade.    

Got a taste of:
"Mixed Catch Basket" - $13.95
2 pieces of fish, 4 coconut shrimp & 3 crispy oysters with jalapeno tartar
No taste of coconut in my coconut shrimp.  The side of sweet potato fries were awesome.  I'd order that on it's own.

excerpts: The ahi salad, the mixed catch plate.
Overall, everyone has always been happy with their dish.
mixed catch.author: Max A.
mixed catch.review:
I've now been in here twice for lunch, and both times I've spent far more then I'd intended but left extremely happy. 

It's very hard to resist trying their sushi rolls - oversized and fresh. The Rock and Roll is great, the Rising Sun is decent.

We've had the ceviche which was stellar and the salmon salad. The ahi salad, the mixed catch plate. Overall, everyone has always been happy with their dish. We've had no problems with service or waits, food quality or experience.

The Kamikaze Bloody Mary is fine - the wasabi is a nice way to change it up a bit, but I almost wish there was a bit more bite to the drink. Wasabi shouldn't taste tamed.

excerpts: had the mixed catch basket (fried shrimp, oysters and fish)
and it was just so so.
it was good but nothing to write home about.
i definitely think i'll stick to the wasabi bowls when i come back
mixed catch.author: Patrick L.
mixed catch.review:
Came here on a Saturday night.  It was pretty busy and we had to wait.  The cool part is that you can leave your cell phone number with them and they would call you when your table is ready.  This let us wander around the neighborhood. 

The food is definitely good.  The wasabi bowl is pretty good.  We had it with brown rice.  The rice is flavored with a touch of wasabi so it was pretty tasty.  I had the sturgeon.  It was ok but I think I liked the wasabi bowl better.

I would definitely come back.

One thing that was a little weird was that every other table had cloth napkins but we didn't.  We had a paper napkin.  Kinda weird.

*Update* - came back again last night.  had the mixed catch basket (fried shrimp, oysters and fish) and it was just so so.  it was good but nothing to write home about.  i definitely think i'll stick to the wasabi bowls when i come back

excerpts: My friend ordered the Mixed Catch Basket.
mixed catch.author: Serena W.
mixed catch.review:
Arrived here expecting just sushi. Their menu only consisted of about 5-7(?) plain-nothing-out-of-the-original sushi rolls. Then me and my friend realized Pacific Catch was a Japanese-Mexican fusion restaurant, but we decided to give it a try anyways since we were drooling over the food on the table next to us. 

We started off with the Spicy Cabo Calamari, which was really soft in texture, definitely not crispy because the breaded exterior would fall off whenever we tried to pick at one; not spicy at all, it lacked much taste until i doused the heck out of it with the dipping sauce. Then we also figured out they also added a few other concocsions that should have just been left outta the fryer.....like the fried lemon I accidently ate.....twice. 

My friend ordered the Mixed Catch Basket. There wasn't anything special about this, except the fact that her side of Sweet Potato Fries were YUMMY!!

I ordered the Ahi Tuna Wasabi Bowl, topped with (of course) ahi tuna, wakame salad, avocado, ginger and cucumber. The sushi rice was flavored with a wasabi sauce, which was somewhat mild, but SO GOOD!! It's basically like sushi, but bigger and broken down into all its components. 

We also ordered two drinks, a Mai Tai & forgot the name of the other one, but both were pretty strong!! I like! I like!

Gotta come back to try their Mojito & Mochi Fondue!!

4 stars for their strong drinks, my Ahi Tuna Wasabi bowl and my friend's sweet potato fries!


[UPDATED: 4.26.2008]

Came here again with another friend around 8ish. Considering it was a Friday, there was a 30 min. wait for the tables inside, so we decided to dine outside, which turned out really nice...although it was butt-freezing cold at first. Thank god they had the protective sheet to block off most of the wind. 

Tried the Ahi Poke Wasabi bowl this time and it was delicious! Although I did like my Ahi Tuna from my last dining here, I would recommend the Ahi Poke over that. My Lemon Grass Mojito was refreshing as well. My friend's Gin & Tonic was pretty stiff.

Service was still attentive, friendly, consistent and quick. The bar was open till 1AM that day, but too bad we couldn't stay for another round of  drinks considering my friend had the Asian glow by the time he finished his Gin & Tonic. -sigh-

excerpts: I ordered the Mixed Catch Basket.
Thumbs up and two snaps up!
The fish was thick, super duper soft, and flaky.
The oysters were warm and just the right softness and moistness.
The coconut shrimp were big and yummy.
I had also ordered a Nojito, a mojito w/out the rum.
Totally refreshing, flavorful, and perfect.
mixed catch.author: Kekumukula N.
mixed catch.review:
I've always wanted to try this place as I've heard about it.  Finally my hubbie and I were able to eat here for a late lunch.  It was quiet and mellow past 2 p.m.  I found the restaurant to be clean and spacious and had nice decor.  Even the ladies' restroom was clean and I liked the bamboo motif on the stall's walls and door.
I ordered the Mixed Catch Basket.  Thumbs up and two snaps up!  The fish was thick, super duper soft, and flaky.  The oysters were warm and just the right softness and moistness.  The coconut shrimp were big and yummy.  I had also ordered a Nojito, a mojito w/out the rum.  Totally refreshing, flavorful, and perfect.
My husband had the Thai rice bowl with the crab salad; he was pleased with it esp. the crab salad and was full.  Lemme tell you, it takes a lot for my husband to get full.  The rice bowl could fit at least four, Chinese rice bowls of rice in it.  He had also ordered the Aguave Lemonade.  That was awesome to drink as I got to try it.
Our server was friendly, efficient, and checked up on us.  We received good service from him.
I would love to come here again and oh, there were families here so it's child friendly for sure.

excerpts: The Hawaiian Poke appetizer and the mixed catch basket with sweet potato fries are definitely our favorites.
When it comes to drinks, the Dark and Stormy is delicious and has quite a kick!
They have happy hour after 10pm with good deals off the bar menu.
Parking in the area is sometimes difficult
but I'd definitely consider it worth it.
mixed catch.author: Dominique K.
mixed catch.review: My boyfriend and I have been coming in here at least once a week for the past couple of months.  We choose to sit in the bar where it seems to be a cozier atmosphere than in the main restaurant.  We are always given menus and order is taken right away.  The bartenders are very friendly and the service is spot on.  The Hawaiian Poke appetizer and the mixed catch basket with sweet potato fries are definitely our favorites.  When it comes to drinks, the Dark and Stormy is delicious and has quite a kick!   They have happy hour after 10pm with good deals off the bar menu.  Parking in the area is sometimes difficult but I'd definitely consider it worth it.

excerpts: Some items I have tried here: the Hawaiian Poke, Wasabi Rice Bowls (which is a freaking large portion), side of Pineapple rice, the Mixed Catch Basket, the calamari, the sweet potato fries, etc etc.
Everything is great.
I would highly recommend any of these items!
mixed catch.author: Jennifer H.
mixed catch.review: This place is near where I work so I've been here several times. Some items I have tried here: the Hawaiian Poke, Wasabi Rice Bowls (which is a freaking large portion), side of Pineapple rice, the Mixed Catch Basket, the calamari, the sweet potato fries, etc etc. Everything is great. I would highly recommend any of these items!

excerpts:
this one had tempura inside with tuna on the outside)
-Mixed Catch Basket with SWEET POTATO FRIES (the fries came with diff sauce, but it tasted good dipped in this other seafood sauce from another dish we had, and also good dipped in this sweet sauce that came with our mixed catch basket.
Mixed Catch Basket came with 2 pieces of fish, 4 coconut shrimp, and 3 oyster.
My sister and I agreed the oysters were the best.
Breaded on the outside and when you bite into, it's soft, not quite slimy, and very good!!
We could have done without the so-so fish, and the coconut shrimp)
But I like the appetizers and the sushi and sweet potato fries, so indeed I would return.
Oh, and those oysters, too!!
mixed catch.author: Anita C.
mixed catch.review:
Went back today with my family for birthday dinners. My sister and I wanted to have and try several things, so we shared A LOT of food. (In our defense, we were going to share with the others in our family, too.)

My sister and I chose:

-Sake Sake Sushi (still very very good. tastes so fresh and yummy. not overdone. had avocado inside with salmon and roe on the outside)
-Rising Sun Sushi (this was okay for me. just may not be a huge fan of the tempura inside. this one had tempura inside with tuna on the outside)
-Mixed Catch Basket with SWEET POTATO FRIES (the fries came with diff sauce, but it tasted good dipped in this other seafood sauce from another dish we had, and also good dipped in this sweet sauce that came with our mixed catch basket. Mixed Catch Basket came with 2 pieces of fish, 4 coconut shrimp, and 3 oyster. My sister and I agreed the oysters were the best. Breaded on the outside and when you bite into, it's soft, not quite slimy, and very good!! We could have done without the so-so fish, and the coconut shrimp)
Last but not least, we also had:
-today's special appetizer - seafood in sauce(i love sauce) with a piece of very crispy bread that was grilled and tasted excellent dipped in the seafoody sauce, and it was topped with some spicy mustard that gave some surprising zing)

Our family also shared:
-Hawaiian Poke (very good. many pieces of poke with little chips to eat with it, though the poke was a little salty)
-Baja Shrimp Ceviche (this was great. tortilla chips with the sour sauce tasted good. and there were many large shrimp we kept discovering beneath the sauce too)

Other family members had:
-Pineapple fried rice - apparently not very good
-Shrimp taco - tasted ok
-sweet tea - basically just sweetened tea
-spicy fries - not too special
-shrimp tempura roll - nothing special. the tempura just didn't do much for me

AND, because my family had 3 birthdays, they comped 3 desserts for us! We got two Mochi Fondues, that come with the ice cream mochis in chocolate, vanilla, and coffee flavors to be dipped in warm chocolate sauce. I had the vanilla and that tasted pretty good. We also had the Macadamia Nut Brownie Sundae. I had a bite, and it was good, but just too sweet for my taste.

Also, the service was interesting. They kept collecting our chopsticks, and once even collected plates they gave my sister and I to use to share our food. We hadn't even used our chopsticks (2nd set) and plates yet! So our food came, and we're like...where are our plates AND our chopsticks! So I was onto my 3rd pair of chopsticks. After that, every time they came by, I held onto my chopsticks. Can you be overserviced?

But I like the appetizers and the sushi and sweet potato fries, so indeed I would return. Oh, and those oysters, too!! So that helps me forget about some of the negatives and give Pacific Catch another 4 stars!

Maybe sometime I can just come for happy hour between 4-6pm, and get the things I like, and not make it a full on meal. :-)

excerpts: Our entrees were Wasabi Ahi Tuna sandwich, and the Mixed Catch Basket.
The Ahi Sandwich was
over-seared (see Medium Well), and missing any kind of a wasabi bite.

It tasted good, with the avocado slices providing a nice buttery texture for the sandwich and a somewhat experimental addition of pink ginger slices (yes, the same ones served alongside sushi) that didn't do much.
It was an okay sandwich, for what its worth.
I couldn't help but think this was some deli's version of a sushi on
a french roll - take a roll, replace rice and seaweed with bread.
The Mixed Catch Basket was served with sweet potato fries.
It was the probably the best component of the dish.
You couldn't go to far off track with fried foods, and this basket was no exception.
Good, but nothing worth writing about.
mixed catch.author: Bor C.
mixed catch.review:
Located on a fairly busy corner of 9th and Lincoln, this new restaurant replaced the art gallery, bar, restaurant thing that was here before. The décor was marine themed, and the place appeared clean. Being my first visit here, and sitting in one of the booths I had an impression that they may have some kind of identity confusion. I don't know if it was because the name gave me the assumption they were a California Cusine restaurant with a slant of seafood offering, or the extensive menu that included American entrees, alongside Japanese items like sushi, teriyaki, and Mexican with the tacos. The edamame they served as soon as we were seated tells me they are Japanese. Maybe it was the Hawaiin entrees, or the fact that the visible cook staff was completely Hispanic, except for the one white guy calling out orders at the pass. Mexliforniapanese Dining. Nah, doesn't have the right ring to it. 

We were disappointed in the ahi tuna poke appetizer. The ahi was fresh enough, but the seasoning was monotone, and overdone. There is no evidence of poke seasoning. Just soy sauce with bits of red and green onions. I love salty foods, but even I thought this dish was too salty, and finishes flat.

Our entrees were Wasabi Ahi Tuna sandwich, and the Mixed Catch Basket. The Ahi Sandwich was over-seared (see Medium Well), and missing any kind of a wasabi bite. It tasted good, with the avocado slices providing a nice buttery texture for the sandwich and a somewhat experimental addition of pink ginger slices (yes, the same ones served alongside sushi) that didn't do much. It was an okay sandwich, for what its worth. I couldn't help but think this was some deli's version of a sushi on a french roll - take a roll, replace rice and seaweed with bread. The Mixed Catch Basket was served with sweet potato fries. It was the probably the best component of the dish. You couldn't go to far off track with fried foods, and this basket was no exception. Good, but nothing worth writing about. I should stop here.

The coleslaw that accompanied our entrees were suprisingly good. It was a light cream dressing with a distinct Korean-type pickling tang I detected. It was light and palette refreshing.

Overall, it was an okay experience. The place is nice to be in, be seen in, but not particularly nice to eat. I'll probably be back only when we are doing something in the park, and want to hit a bar... Nah, I'll walk the extra block and head to Yancy's instead.

excerpts: I ordered the Ahi Tuni wasbai bowl and he had the mixed catch with sweet potato fries.
Both of us were really happy with our meals.
Really good food and good prices.
The only reason I gave it 4 stars was that the service wasn't so great.
I think she was pretty busy though.
We will definitley be back!
mixed catch.author: Sarah C.
mixed catch.review: My husband I tried this place for the first time last night. I have heard about it so  many times and we were in the area and hungry so we figured it was good time. We walked in at 8:30 on a Friday night and no wait! That was great. The food was very good. I ordered the Ahi Tuni wasbai bowl and he had the mixed catch with sweet potato fries. Both of us were really happy with our meals. Really good food and good prices. The only reason I gave it 4 stars was that the service wasn't so great. I think she was pretty busy though. We will definitley be back!

excerpts: I used to like the Marina location much better, but now the two locations are comparable in winning my heart for a Hawaiian Poke Wasabi Bowl or Crispy Oyster Basket.
crispy oyster basket.author: Ally W.
crispy oyster basket.review:
This location of Pacific Catch has improved a lot over the last few years.  I used to like the Marina location much better, but now the two locations are comparable in winning my heart for a Hawaiian Poke Wasabi Bowl or Crispy Oyster Basket.  The wasabi is not very strong at all, just enough to tickle my palate.

1 star off: The tacos and sandwiches are just all right...nothing that you cannot get anywhere else.

I am usually so full after ordering the Wasabi Bowl, but still manage to stuff my face with fried oysters.

excerpts:
Also had the:
Crispy Oyster Basket (Pacific Coast oysters with jalapeño tartar)

Hooray!!!
crispy oyster basket.author: Janice T.
crispy oyster basket.review:
I went  for Saturday afternoon late lunch. This place changed a lot since Art Cafe. It now has a warm modern, comfortable, and casual decor. You are surrounded by hints of fish artwork and cute blue bottle lights hang from the ceiling. 

Menu is quite interesting. Menu has seaweed and hints of wasabi here and there. Reminds me of Hawaii.

I had the:
JAPANESE WASABI Pan-Asian Rice Bowl (my choice of brown rice  1/2 &  1/2 greens)
(wakame salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, cucumber, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori & soy-wasabi sauce-Hawaiian Poke) 

I was so surprised, how delightful and well balanced this bowl was. Brown rice was super moist. I think there was miso dressing for the salad and it actually blended very nicely with everything else. The Hawaiian Poke was fresh and a good amount was provided.

Also had the:
Crispy Oyster Basket (Pacific Coast oysters with jalapeño tartar)

Hooray!!! Fat Oyster and good batter. Fresh and delicious. Another pleasant surprise. I was expecting peanut sized oysters, but they were size of buffalo wings. It was goooooooood. 

I definitely want to go back and try other dishes. Or just eat the rice bowl and oysters.

excerpts: On my first time, I got the Wasabi Ahi sandwich and loved it!
wasabi ahi.author: Remy B.
wasabi ahi.review:
I came here for lunch on a weekday. It wasn't crowded at all, so they seated us very quickly! 

The staff was very nice and attentive.

I tried a few different things on the menu. First of all, their lemonade is very good! It's on the sweeter side, but tasted fresh. As an appetizer, we got the crab cakes. They were cold and a bit more crunchy than I'm used to, but they still tasted great. For my main entree, I decided to get tacos. I really wasn't a fan of them. They were very dry, the chicken was a bit chewy, and the fish wasn't cooked too well.

I've been here once before so I know their food is amazing. I think it was just a bit off on this visit. On my first time, I got the Wasabi Ahi sandwich and loved it! It's very moist and tasted amazing.

Next time I go, I'll avoid the tacos and probably get a sandwich instead.

excerpts: We ordered the calamari appetizer, wasabi ahi rice bowl, and the variety coconut shrimp, fish, and fried oyster basket.

I could live without (too much  onion for my liking) but onto the next..

Wasabi Ahi Bowl: this dish alone would be enough to bring me back.
wasabi ahi.author: Danielle R.
wasabi ahi.review:
First time goer, so here are my initial impressions: restaurant atmosphere is nice, service is great, and food is good.

We ordered the calamari appetizer, wasabi ahi rice bowl, and the variety coconut shrimp, fish, and fried oyster basket.
By the end of the meal we were both stuffed!!

Calamari: good portion, lightly breaded, and very TENDER. I can't emphasize enough how tender it is because so many other places I've been the calamari is chewy bleh! I also love the chipotle chili aioli they serve as a dipping sauce (has a very slight kick) that compliments the calamari really well. Would order again and recommend you try it.

I'll call it the "Fried Variety Basket" because I forgot what it's called on the menu: comes with two pieces of lightly breaded and deep fried cod, 3 coconut shrimps, 3 fried oysters, and your choice of fries, seasoned fries, sweet potatoe fries, or a side salad. Sweet potatoe fries are on point! And the fried oysters were the star of this entree. I would come back and just order the basket of fried oysters!! Shrimp was also good, but the cod was bland. Also the little cole slaw side they have I could live without (too much  onion for my liking) but onto the next..

Wasabi Ahi Bowl: this dish alone would be enough to bring me back. It's honestly like a deconstructed sushirrito in a big ass bowl. I know it can seem daunting that it's $15 but it's worth it especially because it's enough for two people to share. Fish is very fresh and it was just great.

Tried to do the "pay with Paypal and get $10 off your meal deal" but it was conveniently not working for us.. Hmmm. 

But still.. Will definitely be returning once I am no longer a broke student =)

excerpts: Sandwich-wise, I would go for the Wasabi Ahi with a side of spicy fries.
wasabi ahi.author: Ahmed R.
wasabi ahi.review:
Despite being packed to the brim last night, Pacific Catch's service was as crisp as ever and upheld its reputation as one of the few reliable seafood options in the Sunset. Sushi-wise, their tempura and spicy tuna is quite good. Sandwich-wise, I would go for the Wasabi Ahi with a side of spicy fries. 

Pro Tip: Do your best to make a reservation--this place can get super busy Thursday through Sunday evenings.

excerpts: Spicy mahi mahi and wasabi ahi tuna always remain favorites.
wasabi ahi.author: Priya C.
wasabi ahi.review: I've been going to Pacific Catch for a while and am consistently impressed by the menu. Always exceptionally yummy sandwiches, fresh fish, friendly staff and good prices! I love how they offer daily special and add new variety to the menu. Spicy mahi mahi and wasabi ahi tuna always remain favorites.

excerpts: We ordered the wasabi ahi poke bowl, the California salmon sandwich and the mixed fish and chips.
My ahi poke bowl was delicious!
So fresh and the ahi poke was very flavorful.
The wasabi sauce they use was soo good too!
My only thing was the proportion to rice to the amount of poke.
I had a ton of rice leftover.
wasabi ahi.author: Juvi Anne B.
wasabi ahi.review:
First timer here with the parents and I must say, not bad. We came in for a late lunch around 1:30 pm on a Tuesday and there wasn't a lot of people. The ambiance was quite nice. I just wished we were sitting in a booth instead of a table close to the kitchen, but that's just me being picky. 

We ordered the wasabi ahi poke bowl, the California salmon sandwich and the mixed fish and chips. My ahi poke bowl was delicious! So fresh and the ahi poke was very flavorful. The wasabi sauce they use was soo good too! My only thing was the proportion to rice to the amount of poke. I had a ton of rice leftover. My mom's sandwich was equally delicious and the sweet potato fries were super crispy. My dad enjoyed his fish and chips too but he mentioned that the regular fries were kinda soggy. The fish, shrimp and oysters were battered just enough and crispy all around.  Prices are on the higher end, but it's seafood. 

Overall, we'll definitely come here again! :)

excerpts: I've gotten the wasabi ahi sandwich a few times, and I really do like it!
The wasabi mayo is very good, and it's interesting that they put pickled ginger inside the sandwich.
I love sushi ginger, so definite plus for me.
wasabi ahi.author: Erica A.
wasabi ahi.review:
Been here a few times, and I really love the ambiance! I think it's really great that they are open past 10pm. Oh, AND there's a parking lot! Definite plus since it's an absolute pain to find parking in that area during dinner time, and meters in SF are too expensive!

I've gotten the wasabi ahi sandwich a few times, and I really do like it! The wasabi mayo is very good, and it's interesting that they put pickled ginger inside the sandwich. I love sushi ginger, so definite plus for me. The sweet potato fries with sweet chili sauce were very yummy. I had their spicy fries, which were too salty and soggy for me.

Service seems like a hit or miss.. When I went last night, our waiter was very unpleasant. He didn't check on us once during our meal, he walked up to us and just kind of stared at us for a few seconds before asking us to order. After we finished ordering our food, I had to shout after him to ask for a lemonade because he didn't bother asking if we wanted drinks.

By the end of the meal, when we were just kind of sitting there and talking, he walked up to us and just stared at me blankly for about 10 seconds before I just flat out asked "may I please have a box?"

Having worked in a food establishment before, I understand that shifts are long and by the end of the day people are usually just WORN out, but come on.. USE YOUR WORDS!

excerpts: We also shared the Wasabi Ahi Sandwich along with the the Spicy Mahi Mahi Sandwich.
To drink I had the blood orange margarita (I highly recommend it).
wasabi ahi.author: Giovanni G.
wasabi ahi.review: I have lived in the neighborhood for many years, but had never eaten at Pacific Catch.  Firstly, the service was amazing.  We were seated almost immediately upon our arrival (granted it was 4pm on a Saturday).  Amanda was great, her service was fast and on point.  My partner and I shared the spicy tuna rolls which were amazing.  We also shared the Wasabi Ahi Sandwich along with the the Spicy Mahi Mahi Sandwich.  To drink I had the blood orange margarita (I highly recommend it).

excerpts: My dad loves their sandwiches, specifically the Wasabi Ahi.
It was grilled rare ahi with ginger, avocado, daikon sprouts and ginger-wasabi aioli.
The sandwich was really filling.
wasabi ahi.author: Tiffany H.
wasabi ahi.review:
PC is very roomy, theres a bar, booth seats, and tables. Families can definitely have a nice dinner here. I love their high ceilings!

My dad loves their sandwiches, specifically the Wasabi Ahi. It was grilled rare ahi with ginger, avocado, daikon sprouts and ginger-wasabi aioli. The sandwich was really filling. The sandwich was served with coleslaw and sweet potato fries. 

My mom loves the Pacific Ceviche Trio. Three different types of ceviche served with purple potato chips. Yummmmmmm. The fish was grilled seared with ginger! Very flavorful! 

We also had the Pan Asian Bowl, the thai curry with grilled chicken. They were very nice and gladly adhered to our half brown rice and half vegetable request (thank you!). The crispy shallots also added a nice touch.

Customer service? Very nice and speedy. 

My younger sister had Korean BBQ, the Marinated Skirt Steak. She thought it was too salty. She only ate the meat (left the vegetables and rice alone) because she said it was way too salty. (This says a lot because she normally loves rice.)

This place was definitely worth it, but my recommendation? Stay clear of the Korean BBQ!

excerpts: It was pretty packed on a Saturday around 6 p.m., which was no surprise, so I ordered for take-out and decided to wait at the bar, grab a beer and watch the game while my wasabi ahi tuna bowl was being prepared.
Although the place was packed my order was ready before I could finish my beer
and I don't nurse my beers.
Since it was a beautiful and warm evening in SF I decided to journey across the street into Golden Gate Park to enjoy a quiet, relaxing meal in the summer sun.
I would definitely like to come back some time to try what else this place has to offer, but so far I thought the food was pretty good and filling.
I also give this establishment a plus for serving Kona Longboard lager on tap.
wasabi ahi.author: Erich D.
wasabi ahi.review:
I've been wanting to check this place out ever since I passed by it one time on my way to Golden Gate Park via 9th Ave. 

It was pretty packed on a Saturday around 6 p.m., which was no surprise, so I ordered for take-out and decided to wait at the bar, grab a beer and watch the game while my wasabi ahi tuna bowl was being prepared. Although the place was packed my order was ready before I could finish my beer and I don't nurse my beers. Since it was a beautiful and warm evening in SF I decided to journey across the street into Golden Gate Park to enjoy a quiet, relaxing meal in the summer sun. I would definitely like to come back some time to try what else this place has to offer, but so far I thought the food was pretty good and filling. I also give this establishment a plus for serving Kona Longboard lager on tap.

excerpts: We shared the "Crab Fest 2010" Crab & Corn Chowder which and both got the Wasabi Ahi sandwich (served on fresh-baked rolls with organic spring greens & sesame slaw on the side).
wasabi ahi.author: Cecilia L.
wasabi ahi.review:
Dropped in for an early dinner after visiting the Cartier and America exhibit at the Legion of Honors. 

My friend and I were STARVING. It had been 5 hours since brunch and we decided to grab an early bite before heading back to Russian Hill. 

We shared the "Crab Fest 2010" Crab & Corn Chowder which and both got the Wasabi Ahi sandwich (served on fresh-baked rolls with organic spring greens & sesame slaw on the side). Of course we added sweet potato fries for $1.95 more.

Food was fast, fresh, and tasty. Can't beat it when you're in the mood for seafood!

excerpts: The bread on the wasabi ahi tuna sandwich was really chewy and tough.
The sandwich also had very little tuna for 9 dollars.
The fried mix fish basket was only ok, again nothing special.
Menu doesn't really have cohesion.
I guess that's the price you pay for lots of choices: nothing is exceptional.
The service was not good.
wasabi ahi.author: Jen Y.
wasabi ahi.review:
Pluses:
The place is pretty nice, spacious with cool lighting.
Large menu with lots of choices
Big plates
Kids are welcome

Ehs:
The food was okay. The sweet potato fries are nothing special.
Five spice fries taste like bbq chips, not my thing.
The bread on the wasabi ahi tuna sandwich was really chewy and tough. The sandwich also had very little tuna for 9 dollars.
The fried mix fish basket was only ok, again nothing special.
Menu doesn't really have cohesion. I guess that's the price you pay for lots of choices: nothing is exceptional.
The service was not good. I think there were only one or two waitresses working the entire place.

Overall: good for large parties who want a lot of choice but it's nothing special.

excerpts: Went to Pacific Catch on Friday and tried the recommended wasabi ahi tuna bowl.
Wow - lots of food
and I liked the garnishes that came with it, especially the ocean seaweed salad.
The ahi was seared perfectly, but the wasabi dressing could have been a little hotter as I could hardly taste any wasabi at all.
wasabi ahi.author: S D.
wasabi ahi.review:
Great tip from one of last week's Top Yelpers-Erich D.! 

Went to Pacific Catch on Friday and tried the recommended wasabi ahi tuna bowl.  Wow - lots of food and I liked the garnishes that came with it, especially the ocean seaweed salad.  The ahi was seared perfectly, but the wasabi dressing could have been a little hotter as I could hardly taste any wasabi at all.  Had a bite of their Korean BBQ which was pretty tasty, but there wasn't much BBQ meat for the price.

Good thing I went on 08-08-08 cuz I scored the last parking space in their tiny lot.  Otherwise, looking for street parking around that busy intersection would have been a real downer.  Would have given it a higher rating if parking were better.  Hint: go before 6 p.m. to avoid the crowd.

excerpts: Wasabi Ahi Poke bowl with brown rice.
Always an awesome option on the menu.
Wasabi bowl anything is usually reaaaaaallly good.
wasabi ahi.author: Steph M.
wasabi ahi.review:
NUTS!! I was hoping to be the first to review, but 6 other people beat me to it.  Thats ok! :)

My friend and I saw that there were people inside, so we walked in.  Apparently, the restaurant was closed for Friends & Family before the grand opening, but they sat us anyway! 

Full, tasty menu, same great taste as the Chestnut location.  We were more than pleasantly surprised when they told us our meal was free so that the wait staff could practice on us.  (Our waiter seemed to be able to read out minds when he brought us a glass of water perfectly on time.)

We had the fried calamari, which was really good, but also really greasy.  I ate 1/3 of the plate and ended up feeling extremely nauseas afterwards.  Probably my own fault for eating so much of it!!!! :)  That being said though, the calamari was extremely soft.  There was no hard calamari texture that you sometimes get.  hurrah!

Our main course came:  Wasabi Ahi Poke bowl with brown rice.  Always an awesome option on the menu.  Wasabi bowl anything is usually reaaaaaallly good.  We also had the Crispy Catch of the Day which came with the sweet potato fries and 2 dipping sauces.  The Talapia was SO good and the sweet potato fries are always delicious.  It was just hard to eat after feeling too woozy from the calamari.

Anyway--loved it!!!! it's going to be hugely successful.  I do miss Canvas because of the art, but Pacific Catch has some super cool art itself.

Thanks for the free meal Pacific Catch!  It was absolutely delicious!!!!!

excerpts: I have had the Wasabi Ahi sandwich and the Salmon Sandwich, both were amazing!
wasabi ahi.author: Maureen R.
wasabi ahi.review: Have been to the new Campbell location a couple times now and LOVE this place. I have had the Wasabi Ahi sandwich and the Salmon Sandwich, both were amazing! I have tried all three fries and the original are my fav but my husband likes the sweet potato. The wait staff has been very helpful and there when you need them, but not overbearing. They even had a chalk board and chalk for my son to play with while we waited. It is a little messy but a great way to pass the time until his food arrives. A new favorite place!

excerpts: The "Wasabi Ahi" sandwich or salad are my usual faves.
wasabi ahi.author: Jared D.
wasabi ahi.review:
Oh, Pacific Catch, how did I go so long without you in my life? This is now my current favorite restaurant in the Inner Sunset.  Despite being right under my nose, it took me something like 2 years before I tried this gem, and now I'm hooked.

The normal menu is brilliant.  I love how they have similar fish/flavor combinations available in different forms depending on if you are in the mood for a salad, a sandwich, or a 'bowl'. The "Wasabi Ahi" sandwich or salad are my usual faves.

The daily specials are really nice too.  Ask about the different "side styles" since they will let you change the "style" if you'd prefer something different.  Periodically, they have a special "regional" 3 course menu.  For example, currently it's Chilean-inspired for Restaurant Week, but I've tried the Vietnamese ones as well.

The service here is amazingly wonderful.  For awhile we kept getting the same waiter who remembered us after our first visit.  We thought it was just him, but as we got other servers we received similarly great service.

The space has a nice modern yet inviting decor.  The main dining room has lots of seating alongside the kitchen, so reservations aren't really needed.  If you make reservations (or if it's slow), you can get slightly nicer and roomier table/booth near the windows.  If they are busy or want a more casual vibe, you can usually grab a table in the bar area.  The bar area is also open later with a bar bites menu and late night happy hour everyday.

Only complainant is that when they opened they painted over the sweet street art that used to cover the entire wall alongside their parking lot! ;)

excerpts: Our entrees were Wasabi Ahi Tuna sandwich, and the Mixed Catch Basket.
The Ahi Sandwich was
over-seared (see Medium Well), and missing any kind of a wasabi bite.

It tasted good, with the avocado slices providing a nice buttery texture for the sandwich and a somewhat experimental addition of pink ginger slices (yes, the same ones served alongside sushi) that didn't do much.
It was an okay sandwich, for what its worth.
I couldn't help but think this was some deli's version of a sushi on
a french roll - take a roll, replace rice and seaweed with bread.
The Mixed Catch Basket was served with sweet potato fries.
It was the probably the best component of the dish.
You couldn't go to far off track with fried foods, and this basket was no exception.
Good, but nothing worth writing about.
wasabi ahi.author: Bor C.
wasabi ahi.review:
Located on a fairly busy corner of 9th and Lincoln, this new restaurant replaced the art gallery, bar, restaurant thing that was here before. The décor was marine themed, and the place appeared clean. Being my first visit here, and sitting in one of the booths I had an impression that they may have some kind of identity confusion. I don't know if it was because the name gave me the assumption they were a California Cusine restaurant with a slant of seafood offering, or the extensive menu that included American entrees, alongside Japanese items like sushi, teriyaki, and Mexican with the tacos. The edamame they served as soon as we were seated tells me they are Japanese. Maybe it was the Hawaiin entrees, or the fact that the visible cook staff was completely Hispanic, except for the one white guy calling out orders at the pass. Mexliforniapanese Dining. Nah, doesn't have the right ring to it. 

We were disappointed in the ahi tuna poke appetizer. The ahi was fresh enough, but the seasoning was monotone, and overdone. There is no evidence of poke seasoning. Just soy sauce with bits of red and green onions. I love salty foods, but even I thought this dish was too salty, and finishes flat.

Our entrees were Wasabi Ahi Tuna sandwich, and the Mixed Catch Basket. The Ahi Sandwich was over-seared (see Medium Well), and missing any kind of a wasabi bite. It tasted good, with the avocado slices providing a nice buttery texture for the sandwich and a somewhat experimental addition of pink ginger slices (yes, the same ones served alongside sushi) that didn't do much. It was an okay sandwich, for what its worth. I couldn't help but think this was some deli's version of a sushi on a french roll - take a roll, replace rice and seaweed with bread. The Mixed Catch Basket was served with sweet potato fries. It was the probably the best component of the dish. You couldn't go to far off track with fried foods, and this basket was no exception. Good, but nothing worth writing about. I should stop here.

The coleslaw that accompanied our entrees were suprisingly good. It was a light cream dressing with a distinct Korean-type pickling tang I detected. It was light and palette refreshing.

Overall, it was an okay experience. The place is nice to be in, be seen in, but not particularly nice to eat. I'll probably be back only when we are doing something in the park, and want to hit a bar... Nah, I'll walk the extra block and head to Yancy's instead.

excerpts: I alternate between my two favorites whenever I eat here: a wasabi bowl (usually poke) or the wasabi ahi sandwich.
You can't go wrong with either!
wasabi ahi.author: Jenn O.
wasabi ahi.review: I really enjoy eating here. I alternate between my two favorites whenever I eat here: a wasabi bowl (usually poke) or the wasabi ahi sandwich. You can't go wrong with either! For an extra $1.95, you can get the delicious sweet potato fries with your sandwich. If you sign up for the e-newsletter, you get a free appetizer (alternates between baja shrimp ceviche with tortilla chips and poke) with any $12.95 order. There is a small parking lot behind the restaurant. I think it fits about eight cars. Looking for parking around here is not fun, especially on a Friday or Saturday night. Making a reservation doesn't hurt to help you get seated quicker! So far service has been good.

excerpts: I highly recommend the wasabi ahi tuna sandwich!
wasabi ahi.author: Michael S.
wasabi ahi.review: This place is great. Food is delicious, atmosphere is warm - and the only affordable place in San Francisco I know of with so much space. I highly recommend the wasabi ahi tuna sandwich!

excerpts: My personal favorites are the BBQ chicken salad/sandwich and the California Salmon Sandwich.
california salmon.author: Chris S.
california salmon.review:
I come here frequently with my wife and mom for lunch dates in between classes. The restaurant itself has nice decor, as well as a small parking lot on the side. It is always very well kept up and clean. We never have issues getting a booth, and service is always very good. 

They have a great selection of salads and sandwiches. My personal favorites are the BBQ chicken salad/sandwich and the California Salmon Sandwich. Both of these go very well with their sweet potato fries. In addition to salads and sandwiches they offer a somewhat decent variety of sushi, all of which is very good.

excerpts: We ordered the wasabi ahi poke bowl, the California salmon sandwich and the mixed fish and chips.
My ahi poke bowl was delicious!
So fresh and the ahi poke was very flavorful.
The wasabi sauce they use was soo good too!
My only thing was the proportion to rice to the amount of poke.
I had a ton of rice leftover.
california salmon.author: Juvi Anne B.
california salmon.review:
First timer here with the parents and I must say, not bad. We came in for a late lunch around 1:30 pm on a Tuesday and there wasn't a lot of people. The ambiance was quite nice. I just wished we were sitting in a booth instead of a table close to the kitchen, but that's just me being picky. 

We ordered the wasabi ahi poke bowl, the California salmon sandwich and the mixed fish and chips. My ahi poke bowl was delicious! So fresh and the ahi poke was very flavorful. The wasabi sauce they use was soo good too! My only thing was the proportion to rice to the amount of poke. I had a ton of rice leftover. My mom's sandwich was equally delicious and the sweet potato fries were super crispy. My dad enjoyed his fish and chips too but he mentioned that the regular fries were kinda soggy. The fish, shrimp and oysters were battered just enough and crispy all around.  Prices are on the higher end, but it's seafood. 

Overall, we'll definitely come here again! :)

excerpts: My friend and I were quickly seated, and I ordered the California Salmon sandwich - one of my usual entrees at the Campbell branch.
The salmon was slightly dry, the bread was a bit chewier than I'd like, and the spicy fries that arrived with the sandwich were soggy.
Meh.
california salmon.author: Felix C.
california salmon.review:
I usually patronize the Pacific Catch in Campbell, but I was in San Francisco one night and was in the mood for some Asian-seafood fusion, so I thought the Pacific Catch here would be a safe fall-back.

My friend and I were quickly seated, and I ordered the California Salmon sandwich - one of my usual entrees at the Campbell branch. The salmon was slightly dry, the bread was a bit chewier than I'd like, and the spicy fries that arrived with the sandwich were soggy. Meh. Meanwhile on the other side of the table, my friend had the mixed seafood platter and had no complaints, and I also got to sample some of the sweet potato fries for the first time - those are BOMB. We also ordered the Let's Get Saucy sushi roll, which was just dandy (although its pretty hard to screw up sushi).

The service here was decent. Our server was very friendly and had a good sense of humor, but didn't stop by the table very often. Whenever we needed something, we'd spend several minutes trying to flag him down cause he was consistently MIA for long periods of time.

Overall I had higher hopes for this Pacific Catch, especially considering this is San Francisco. I won't be returning and I definitely cannot recommend this location.

excerpts: I got the "California Salmon Sandwich" with a side of salad and the bf got the "Traditional Baja Tacos" (I think?)...
but Anyway I was debating between that and a rice bowl.
I went with the sandwich and boy was
I delighted once it came out.
The salmon looked so PINK and FRESH!
It was cut in a certain way so that every bite I took, I was able to gather the taste of everything in the sandwich.
Also it was easy to bite into!
It was such a big surprise to me how fresh the fish was.
Usually, most restaurants serve a stingy amount of salmon and it is dry and not fresh at all.
GAWD.
It was so good!
The cole slaw was even good with it
and I hate cole slaw.
The salad was such a plus too!
california salmon.author: Katrina T.
california salmon.review:
i am seriously trying to go on a diet, so I have been trying to pick restaurants that serve fish or delicious salads! Looking at the pictures for Pacific Catch literally made me DROOL. The pictures of their food looked oh so good, I couldn't wait to try it ! 

Came here on a Friday with my boyfriend and were seated fairly quickly. It's so cute! Right when you sit down, they bring out a little tray with Goldfish Pretzels and Edamame. Weird combo, but I was dying of hunger so I ate it and it tasted fine. I looked at the menu for days before deciding what I really wanted. Be aware, the cost of the food is pretty pricy, but in all honesty, it is worth the money! I would definitely pay this amount to eat the food from here again! 

I got the "California Salmon Sandwich" with a side of salad and the bf got the "Traditional Baja Tacos" (I think?)...but Anyway I was debating between that and a rice bowl. I went with the sandwich and boy was I delighted once it came out. The salmon looked so PINK and FRESH! It was cut in a certain way so that every bite I took, I was able to gather the taste of everything in the sandwich. Also it was easy to bite into! It was such a big surprise to me how fresh the fish was. Usually, most restaurants serve a stingy amount of salmon and it is dry and not fresh at all. GAWD. It was so good! The cole slaw was even good with it and I hate cole slaw. The salad was such a plus too! I couldn't help but notice the couple sitting next to me with their "Hawaiian Poke" bowls!!! That looked awesome too! I super duper want that next time! 

Everything was GOOD GOOD GOOD! LOVE it! Coming back to try more freshness! 

oh yea this place definitely reminds me of Yard House. I don't know why, I couldn't tell if this place served American, Asian Fusion, Americanized Asian errr what. Whatever just as long as they satisfy my hunger I'm all about that!

excerpts: California Salmon $12:
This is where I wasn't too happy.
You get a slice of salmon that you can't even see at all, but can taste it.
I swear the slice of the salmon was the thickness of 10 sheets of paper... not the filet that you would expect from a salmon sandwich.
The bread was not toasted and so it was cold and not warm and crispy.
I think texture is key when making a sandwich, you get the lettuce, tomato, avocado and salmon (all of which have a moist texture -- except the lettuce)
and you want the bread to add a different texture...
this is just me,
I like my bread warm and crispy.
california salmon.author: Erica T.
california salmon.review:
My friend and I decided to come here for dinner on a Friday night. We decided to sit near the bar area because we would have to wait 15 mins for the next dining table. No biggie for us, I don't mind where I sit.

What I ordered:

Fruit punch (alcoholic cocktail) $9.50: Vodka with various types of fruit juices. This drink was STRONG! My face was red and I was pretty buzzed. I guess if I can feel the alcohol from one drink, it is worth the $9.50 you pay for it because you actually get alcohol in it, none of that watered down drinks at other places.

Thai Coconut Shrimp $13:  7 pieces of jumbo shrimp with coconut shaving batter, deep fried and with the sweet chili sauce.... mMMmm nom nom nom. My friend ordered this appetizer and I was a little hesitant. A lot of restaurants end up giving you small shrimp with crappy battered textured. This was pretty good, you can taste the actual coconut shavings, the batter was light and crispy and the shrimp was bigger than I thought it would be. I was happy with this dish.

California Salmon $12:  This is where I wasn't too happy. This dish came with a side of coleslaw (that wasn't really good) and a side of fries ( I picked the sweet potato fries). The sweet potato fries was good until it got cold and soggy, I recommend you eating it as soon as you get them! As for the sandwich, I was disappointed with it. You get a slice of salmon that you can't even see at all, but can taste it. I swear the slice of the salmon was the thickness of 10 sheets of paper... not the filet that you would expect from a salmon sandwich. The bread was not toasted and so it was cold and not warm and crispy. I think texture is key when making a sandwich, you get the lettuce, tomato, avocado and salmon (all of which have a moist texture -- except the lettuce) and you want the bread to add a different texture... this is just me, I like my bread warm and crispy. As for flavor, it had enough flavor and it was actually tasty, just sad that the main attraction in this sandwich was nowhere to be seen.

Service was great! The lady came by quite often to make sure our water will filled and to make sure we were ok. Overall, the food was ok and the service was great.  I would give 3.5 stars if Yelp let me....

excerpts: I had the California salmon sandwich and my BF had the fish and chips.
After having the sesame slaw and side salad, I was quite full.
I had a bit of my BF's fish and chips (he got the cod and spicy fries) and everything tasted great.
I ended up getting the sandwich to go and later on for dinner
I had half
and it was delicious.
Light, not too heavy with the sauce and the salmon tasted great.
california salmon.author: Shauna S.
california salmon.review:
We came for a quick bite to eat and overall, gotta say that I'm quite happy with this place.

The Cabo calamari was delicious. Although they do mention that there was lemon slices, we didn't realize that some of them would be breaded and deep fried. Anyhow, they add a great deal of flavour and the bit of spiciness (thanks to the chilies) was really good. The spicy chipotle aioli was also very tasty (and tastes great with the fried fish if you manage to save some for when your entree arrives).

I had the California salmon sandwich and my BF had the fish and chips. After having the sesame slaw and side salad, I was quite full. I had a bit of my BF's fish and chips (he got the cod and spicy fries) and everything tasted great. I ended up getting the sandwich to go and later on for dinner I had half and it was delicious. Light, not too heavy with the sauce and the salmon tasted great.

excerpts: I ordered the California Salmon sandwich with a side of sweet potato fries.
The sandwich was really good.
The salmon was cooked perfectly, cooked all the way through, but it was still tender.
The bread was surprisingly good.
It was a Ciabatta, but the outside was crisp and the inside was soft and warm.
It also came with avocado, and a citrus aoli.
I have to talk about the avocado because the avocado here is extremely good.
Usually, the avocado I get at restaurants are not ripe and bland, but at PC it was soft and very flavorful.
The aoli was good too.
Not sure how it's supposed to taste like, but I liked it.
The sweet potato fries were decent, this last time I had them.
When I had them this time, they were a little soggy and cold.
I was disappointed because I had them once before
california salmon.author: Anthony N.
california salmon.review:
Came here for lunch around 12pm.  There was no wait at all for small groups; in fact, there were quite a few tables open.  The thing is this Pacific Catch is on the corner of 9th and Lincoln, so it's really hard to find parking.  PC does have a parking lot, but it's fairly small so it's hard to find a space in there.  

Decor: The place is really nice looking for a restaurant that's not super fancy.  Nice hardwood floors.  There are booths and tables; indoor and outdoor seating.  Wine bottle light fixtures here are a cool touch.  There's an open kitchen and a bar you can hang out at if you don't want to sit down and eat.

Food:  I ordered the California Salmon sandwich with a side of sweet potato fries.  The sandwich was really good.  The salmon was cooked perfectly, cooked all the way through, but it was still tender.  The bread was surprisingly good.  It was a Ciabatta, but the outside was crisp and the inside was soft and warm.  It also came with avocado, and a citrus aoli.  I have to talk about the avocado because the avocado here is extremely good.  Usually, the avocado I get at restaurants are not ripe and bland, but at PC it was soft and very flavorful.  The aoli was good too.  Not sure how it's supposed to taste like, but I liked it.  The sweet potato fries were decent, this last time I had them.  When I had them this time, they were a little soggy and cold.  
I was disappointed because I had them once before and they were on point.

Service: Here's where PC loses some stars. Minus one star for being slow.  The waitress actually took our orders and brought our food out very quickly, but after that the service fell off.  Took awhile to get a refill on my drink, and to get the check after the meal was over.

This might be mean, but minus one star for the hostess.  Don't get me wrong, the hostess was nice and all, but she was wearing this black mini-skirt, showing off way too much skin (she wasn't the attractive).  The whole time I was thinking, you're a hostess at a restaurant, not a vegas night club.  Other than that, the foods great.

excerpts: I had the California salmon sandwich which was suppose to come with avocado
but there was none to be found in my sandwich or anywhere on the plate.
The organic string beans that come with every sandwich was also missing.
Either the cook doesn't know his/her own menu or they need to update it.
Overall, it was okay but not worth the price.
I probably won't be going back.
california salmon.author: Austin C.
california salmon.review: I think this place is overrated. The service was good and the servers were friendly, but the food was just mediocre. I had the California salmon sandwich which was suppose to come with avocado but there was none to be found in my sandwich or anywhere on the plate. The organic string beans that come with every sandwich was also missing. Either the cook doesn't know his/her own menu or they need to update it. Overall, it was okay but not worth the price. I probably won't be going back.

excerpts: I had the BBQ Salmon Sandwich.
The fillet was perfectly cooked and rested in bread that was neither too hard to too soft and topped with the best sauce I ever tasted.
I'm definitely coming back.
bbq salmon.author: Randy S.
bbq salmon.review: I debated whether or not I wanted post a review because, well, the place is already busy enough. We came here after a day at Golden Gate Park and truly stumbled into a gem. I had the BBQ Salmon Sandwich. The fillet was perfectly cooked and rested in bread that was neither too hard to too soft and topped with the best sauce I ever tasted. I'm definitely coming back.

excerpts: BBQ salmon for me, hawaiian themed escolar for him.
Both very blah.
bbq salmon.author: Fancypants X.
bbq salmon.review:
Date & Time: Thursday, 9 pm
Reason For Going: 9th Annual Dine Out For Life (25% of your bill goes to STOP AIDS Project)
Company: The BFF
Rating: 2.5 stars (I don't think I will ever eat at PC again. especially at this location.) 

Hostess was wonderful (enthusiastic, friendly) but our waitress clearly hated her job. Service was horrid--it took forever to order, we were basically neglected (checked on once right before we were done eating), water glasses filled once (again, pretty much at the end of the meal.) I don't expect any server to be Little Miss Sunshine (especially at the end of their shift) but please save the curt, one word answers & annoyed look for when you're fighting with your bf, not when you're dealing with a customer. 

Food was boring, uninspired, unseasoned--the artichokes were begging for flavor & the sweet potato fries were nothing without the dipping sauces (which were brought out only when I asked for them...u mean if I didn't ask for sauce, I would have been stuck w/ boring fries?! Boring fries are a no-no!) 

We ordered chicken wings which were brought out way after our entrees, so they graciously took it off the bill. Our entrees were lukewarm (pretty much the same way I felt about the entire dining experience with the exception of my best friend's company which is always 10 stars.) BBQ salmon for me, hawaiian themed escolar for him. Both very blah. The only thing that kept me from giving 1 star is the fact that the entire bill was about $41. 

The only positive thing that came out of dinner was being able to catch up with my friend & doing a small good deed at the same time.

excerpts: My BBQ salmon sandwich with spicy fries was excellent.
Plenty of interesting menu choices, kid-friendly and free parking.
It's an  easy to get to location (especially if you're just driving through SF on I-280/GG bridge).
bbq salmon.author: Anna J.
bbq salmon.review: Relaxed, casual pan-Asian dining. My BBQ salmon sandwich with spicy fries was excellent. Plenty of interesting menu choices, kid-friendly and free parking. It's an  easy to get to location (especially if you're just driving through SF on I-280/GG bridge).

excerpts: My favorite, hands down, was the BBQ Salmon taco.
Next time, I would get only Salmon for all three.
bbq salmon.author: Rachel H.
bbq salmon.review:
Having a child is a huge pain in the ass. People tell you this before you have a baby, and you understand in theory, but not in practice. Luckily, Baby H. and his face and his blonde locks are the cutest thing ever, so I don't mind lugging him, sans stroller (I forgot), along with all his accoutrements, for eight blocks to get to Pacific Catch. I just die when I get there, and hand over baby care to Grandparents while I drink my adult beverage.

So, parking is difficult, but if you don't have a gigantic baby with lots of luggage, it's not a terrible place to be walking blocks and blocks to and from your car.

I ordered the Kamikazi Margarita, which was a godsend. It made me feel super. For my lunch I had three tacos, each with a different kind of fish. My favorite, hands down, was the BBQ Salmon taco. Next time, I would get only Salmon for all three. 

I shared the fish part of the taco and the black beans that came with it with Baby H. He also enjoyed eating the complimentary Pretzel Fish Crackers and edamame. He was a totally happy guy, and flirted/screamed with/at the waitress a lot. He likes brunettes.

This is a good place to get a nice semi-healthy lunch and bring your baby, but DO NOT forget the stroller. I have since purchased an umbrella stroller that lives in my trunk all the time.

excerpts:
Green tea : tasted like thai tea without milk  -.-"
BBQ salmon sandwich : flavorful, must try!
Hot/spicy fries : tasted like bbq fries to me, fine with that!
bbq salmon.author: Annie Y.
bbq salmon.review:
Green tea : tasted like thai tea without milk  -.-"
BBQ salmon sandwich : flavorful, must try!
Hot/spicy fries : tasted like bbq fries to me, fine with that!

excerpts: For $12 bucks, you can get a savory BBQ Salmon Sandwich with a generous helping of orange goodness.
To top it off, the two extra sauces (sweet spicy & wasabi aioli) makes everything that much better.
bbq salmon.author: Alexander H.
bbq salmon.review:
Reunited at last. The last time I had good sweet potato fries was back in LA at Father's Office.  Coming here was a must once I knew we were going to the Academy Arts & Sciences Nightlife.  For $12 bucks, you can get a savory BBQ Salmon Sandwich with a generous helping of orange goodness.  To top it off, the two extra sauces (sweet spicy & wasabi aioli) makes everything that much better.  Although I haven't tried their tacos, but judging from the silence at the table I figured it was DAMN good.

I'll be back soon to try their bowls.  I don't think you can go wrong at this restaurant, it's definitely a "CATCH". =)

excerpts: -2 Chipotle BBQ Salmon Tacos.
This was a mistake.
bbq salmon.author: Steve L.
bbq salmon.review:
After a pretty big banquet lunch at Golden Horse, I figured I was done eating for the day. We dropped by my folks place after lunch, and since they haven't seen the kids in a while, they wanted to spend some time with them. They offered to watch the girls and feed them dinner, so the wife and I can go out for dinner. 

What a nice surprise! An unexpected date night with my wife. Yeah, we were still full from lunch, but we took my folk's offer and headed out. Problem was that it was 7PM on a Saturday night, we had no reservations, and most places were pretty crowded already. We struck out on a couple of places either because parking sucked (No Nopa this time), business closed (bye PJ's), or I was wearing the wrong clothes (I had a sweater, and Naan and Curry was steaming inside, unless I wanted a permanent tandoori smell).

We walked into Pacific Catch, and got a table in the bar area. Pretty lively inside the bar area, with the Cal vs. UCLA hoops game going on (too bad Cal). A lot of people in the bar section were dining in, so the waitresses were doing double duty serving drinks and serving food. 

We ordered: 

-House Cured Sake Salmon. This came with 2 crispy nori rice cakes, wasabi creme fraiche, onions, and black tobiko caviar. Salmon had a mildly cured taste, the wasabi creme fraiche had a little, but not overpowering kick. Rice cakes were nice and crispy. OK starter. 

-2 Chipotle BBQ Salmon Tacos. This was a mistake. My wife wanted 1 salmon taco, and one Cabo shrimp taco, but they gave her 2 salmon tacos, but she didn't complain. These taco were topped with cabbage, corn salsa, and lime crema. Nice big chunk of salmon in each taco, and very tasty. 

-5 piece Fish and chips. Fish of the day was rock cod. This came with cole slaw and sweet potato fries. Lightly battered so not to overwhelm the fresh rock cod. Very juicy and moist on the inside, slight crispiness on the outside. Came with a jalapeno tartar sauce and and a Thai sweet chili sauce. I added some more sriracha sauce for more kick. Purple-cabbage cole slaw had a nice light vinaigrette for refreshing taste, instead of a creamy sauce. Sweet potato fries were great. Not overly fried, but crispy enough so I could still taste the sweet potatoes. 

Too full for dessert : ( 

Food came out pretty quickly, and the servers remembered and follow on requests in spite of the bar being elbow to elbow. 

I driven by this place for years while driving along Lincoln Blvd, and glad we finally tried it. Places like this reminded my wife and I of our dating years. Nice memories......

excerpts: Also we ordered 2 a la carte tacos, the BBQ Salmon and the Tropical Shrimp which were very good.
bbq salmon.author: Janet H.
bbq salmon.review:
Wandering around Golden Gate Park and DeYoung Museum, we realized we were close by the many restaurants in the Inner Sunset.  We walked into Pacific Catch on a beautiful day.

For starters we each got the Signature Miso and Shiitake Miso.  I thought the miso could have had a little bit more flavor in the broth, but it was still good.  The shiitake miso had veggies (mushrooms & asparagus) which made it also good.

Our entrees were the Sesame Crusted Ahi and the Crispy Catch of the Day.  I chose the Ahi as a healthy alternative and it was seared perfectly.  The catch was fresh rock cod served with sweet potato fries.  Although the rock cod was battered, it didn't taste to overly deep fried like what you would expect.  Also we ordered 2 a la carte tacos, the BBQ Salmon and the Tropical Shrimp which were very good.

We noticed there was loud music playing overhead (why?).  We also noticed that Pacific Catch is kid friendly.  This is a plus for parents who are looking for a healthier choice than a diner or greasy spoon.  Pacific Catch is a good midday meal!

excerpts: Had the special chowder to start which was great, and then the Island Tacos (Baja, BBQ Salmon and Cajun Shrimp), with sweet potato fries.
Was very good.
There is a lot of food for not a huge amount of money, I think the chowder was about $6 and the Tacos were $14.
bbq salmon.author: Paul G.
bbq salmon.review:
Dropped in on Pacific Catch on 9th on New Year's Day following a wander round the Botanical Gardens and had a great late lunch. I had tried Pacific Catch's booth at Outside Lands Festival and really liked the food.

Had the special chowder to start which was great, and then the Island Tacos (Baja, BBQ Salmon and Cajun Shrimp), with sweet potato fries. Was very good. There is a lot of food for not a huge amount of money, I think the chowder was about $6 and the Tacos were $14. Not cheap, but by no means expensive, especially for fresh fish.

The wait staff was very friendly and the place is very clean and has great decor. Definitely a recommended spot if you're over near 9th and Irving....

excerpts: 1 BBQ salmon with corn salsa and lime crema, 1 tropical grilled shrimp with mango salsa, and 1 spice-rubbed grilled mahi mahi with avocado tomatilla salsa.
Now let me first say that I am a little biased when it comes to fish tacos.
I've been a long time advocate for Wahoo's fish tacos and nothing has ever compared to their tacos.
Pacific catch however served me some really tasty fish tacos, which can definitely compete with Wahoo's.
I really appreciated the nice quality of salsas and toppings that went into the tacos.
They worked well and tasted great with the various fish and shrimp pairings.
bbq salmon.author: Timothy C.
bbq salmon.review:
Pacific Catch just recently opened on 9t Street and we decided to go try it for a mellow weekend lunch.  We weren't sure what to expect because it was new, but the online menu sure looked great.

The decor is modern and clean, providing a rather trendy atmosphere.  The place wasn't crowded when we came so we didn't have to wait for a table, which is always nice.  We saw one table had ordered the Baja Shrimp Ceviche so we decided to start with that.   The presentation was really cool.  The ceviche, stuffed full of shrimp and avocado, was served in a tall martini glass with a pile of tortilla chips sprawled around the base.  The best thing about this dish was how much shrimp they gave us!  It's always annoying when you pay a premium for a shrimp entre and get 3 shrimp.  We counted each shrimp as we were going through the ceviche, they were good sized shrimp mind you, and ended up with almost 20! The chef was overly generous with the shrimp for the price we payed.

For my entre, I went with 3 tacos; 1 BBQ salmon with corn salsa and lime crema, 1 tropical grilled shrimp with mango salsa, and 1 spice-rubbed grilled mahi mahi with avocado tomatilla salsa.  Now let me first say that I am a little biased when it comes to fish tacos.  I've been a long time advocate for Wahoo's fish tacos and nothing has ever compared to their tacos.  Pacific catch however served me some really tasty fish tacos, which can definitely compete with Wahoo's.  I really appreciated the nice quality of salsas and toppings that went into the tacos.  They worked well and tasted great with the various fish and shrimp pairings.  I took down these bad boys so fast and had to restrain myself from ordering more!

We also ordered sweet potato fries which were good.  I tend to find any type of french fry that offers a spin off the traditional French fry (different potatoes, etc) very satisfying.

Pacific Catch is definitely a decent restaurant and we will for sure go there again.  They had other dishes, such as sushi and fancy deserts that I would also like to try.  I also noticed they had a pretty nice full bar with comfy seats and a decent happy hour.  This would be a good place to come have some drinks and a nice dinner with some friends or even a date.

excerpts: The bbq salmon taco was amazing.
Same with the crispy shrimp one.
Sandwich was what I expected-
bbq salmon.author: Staci M.
bbq salmon.review:
I have had two really good experiences here.  The first was during their happy hour.  The poke was delicious and they did not skimp.  

A few nights ago, our (well, my) lazy ass decided on take-out.  We had the spicy tuna sandwich and 3 tacos.  The bbq salmon taco was amazing.  Same with the crispy shrimp one.  Sandwich was what I expected- very yum.  

And what was really cool was the care they took in getting the order together.  Sides of two sauces- sweet chili and aioli- for the sweet potato fries.  

I guess they had my boyfriend waiting pretty long for the order, so the bartender bought him a beer.  V cool of them- especially since the bf is not the bitching type and was prob sweetly surprised by the freebie.  THAT'S the stuff people remember.

excerpts: and I order the same thing every time (cause it's that darn good): BBQ salmon sandwich and sweet potato fries with a side of that awesome Thai chili sauce.
The ingredients are fresh and simple and I always leave satisfied.
I've brought several friends here and sparked their addictions to this place as well.
bbq salmon.author: Novi M.
bbq salmon.review: This is easily one of my favorite go-to places and I order the same thing every time (cause it's that darn good): BBQ salmon sandwich and sweet potato fries with a side of that awesome Thai chili sauce. The ingredients are fresh and simple and I always leave satisfied. I've brought several friends here and sparked their addictions to this place as well.

excerpts: I had the bbq salmon taco and the spicy chicken.
The spicy chicken was not spicy and lacked flavor.
The salmon was okay, but also lacked flavor.
bbq salmon.author: edie t.
bbq salmon.review:
cleanliness: 4/5
food quality:  2/5
service: 3/5
cost: $15-$20
other:

2nd Visit: I came here with a friend after another restaurant we wanted
to go to was closed. 

My friend ordered the poke and the traditional baja taco. I had the bbq salmon taco and the spicy chicken. The spicy chicken was not spicy and lacked flavor. The salmon was okay, but also lacked flavor. 

the service was pretty good but nothing outstanding compared to my last visit.

1st Visit:

cleanliness: 4/5
food quality:  3.5/5
service: 5/5
cost: $15-$20
other:

Found parking in the lot, probably because it was early. I came here with Helen and we sat at the bar per my request so we could grab a drink and watch the basketball game. 

She ordered the coconut shrimp and I ordered the catch of the day. She ordered a martini and I got a dark and stormy (which was great!)

The bartender was really friendly and chatted with us from time to time. The nuggets ended up winning and Helen was a great date as always. Unforunately the bartender thought Helen wanted the coconut shrimp appetizer, but she wanted the full entree. Although the coconut shrimp wasn't great, we enjoyed the sweet potato fries and my fish.

The bartender was super and comped us on the appetizer and by the end of the meal we left happy.

excerpts: The BBQ salmon taco was outstanding.
Good fish, great taste with the BBQ sauce, worked well in a taco.
bbq salmon.author: Bryan Z.
bbq salmon.review: Solid dinner time meal... I had a shrimp taco and salmon taco with a side salad. I love that they bring out Pepperidge Farm pretzel goldfish with edamame for you to snack on. The shrimp taco with mango salsa was good but the mango was a little bland so I was disappointed. Maybe I had my hopes set too high for that one? The BBQ salmon taco was outstanding. Good fish, great taste with the BBQ sauce, worked well in a taco. Sweet potato fries? Meh. But then sweet potatoes aren't my favorite to begin with.

excerpts: Spicy mahi mahi and wasabi ahi tuna always remain favorites.
spicy mahi mahi.author: Priya C.
spicy mahi mahi.review: I've been going to Pacific Catch for a while and am consistently impressed by the menu. Always exceptionally yummy sandwiches, fresh fish, friendly staff and good prices! I love how they offer daily special and add new variety to the menu. Spicy mahi mahi and wasabi ahi tuna always remain favorites.

excerpts: We also shared the Wasabi Ahi Sandwich along with the the Spicy Mahi Mahi Sandwich.
To drink I had the blood orange margarita (I highly recommend it).
spicy mahi mahi.author: Giovanni G.
spicy mahi mahi.review: I have lived in the neighborhood for many years, but had never eaten at Pacific Catch.  Firstly, the service was amazing.  We were seated almost immediately upon our arrival (granted it was 4pm on a Saturday).  Amanda was great, her service was fast and on point.  My partner and I shared the spicy tuna rolls which were amazing.  We also shared the Wasabi Ahi Sandwich along with the the Spicy Mahi Mahi Sandwich.  To drink I had the blood orange margarita (I highly recommend it).

excerpts: My husband and his friend had the spicy mahi mahi sandwich and both said it was lukewarm.
spicy mahi mahi.author: Mrs F.
spicy mahi mahi.review:
We returned on a Saturday at 1.30 with two friends and the ankle biter.  The food was less awesome than last time (seems to be the case with a lot of our reviews).  The fries were lukewarm!  All of our fries were lukewarm, it was disappointing.  My husband and his friend had the spicy mahi mahi sandwich and both said it was lukewarm.  Our friend said it was better at the Marina location.  

I still like this place though, so I will chalk it up to we went at an off time (but it was tres busy at 1.30 on a Saturday).  Maybe next time will return at prime lunch time and if we get lukewarm food again, we will speak out.

excerpts: Everything from the spicy mahi mahi sandwich to the tuna tekka
don is good.
The new location on 9th can handle large groups but tends to get blogged down around dinner time.
You can thank the hoards of tourists scrambling for grub before tackling the City's exit points.
spicy mahi mahi.author: MTBer I.
spicy mahi mahi.review: Simply put, good seafood at a reasonable price.  Everything from the spicy mahi mahi sandwich to the tuna tekka don is good.  The new location on 9th can handle large groups but tends to get blogged down around dinner time.  You can thank the hoards of tourists scrambling for grub before tackling the City's exit points.

excerpts: the poke appetizer was perfectly seasoned with just the right amount of soy sauce, onions, and ginger; both the spicy mahi mahi and spicy ahi tuna sandwiches were equally satisfying!
spicy mahi mahi.author: arpee q.
spicy mahi mahi.review:
once upon a time, there were two girls named rhea and shirley who were training for the nike women's half marathon. one morning, during an 8 mile training run, shirley told rhea, "i'm sad; my work had a hawaiian-themed party and there was no "hawaiian" food. all they had was hawaiian pizza and maui onion-flavored chips, and i wanted poke!"

rhea replied, "ooh, some poke and kalua pig sound REALLY good". they continued on with their run and a couple of miles later, rhea asked shirley how she was doing (with the run). shirley responded, "i can't stop thinking about poke!"

so, after they finished their run, they visited their friend, lizette, to find out where they could find some of this much sought after poke. she saved the day when she told rhea and shirley about pacific catch, where they immediately found parking in the restaurant's lot (on a saturday afternoon, no less!) and enjoyed a delicious lunch.
