the poke appetizer was perfectly seasoned with just the right amount of soy sauce, onions, and ginger; both the spicy mahi mahi and spicy ahi tuna sandwiches were equally satisfying!

...and they lived happily ever after (well, except for the no kalua pig part). the end.

excerpts: The Traditional Baja taco and the Grilled Steak taco were both excellent choices, depending on your palate and dietary preferences!
traditional baja.author: Sherry L.
traditional baja.review:
This is a good option for a meal in the sunset area if you are looking for something more commercial. It was bustling on a game night, mostly in the bar area, but we didn't have any issues getting a large table for a party of two. 

We ordered two rice bowls and a two taco platter - way too much food in hindsight, but we enjoyed having all of the options. I found my Japanese wasabi bowl with salmon (grilled, btw) and 1/2 brown rice 1/2 greens to be very filling and I liked all of the toppings it included. The ingredients were fresh and they don't skimp on anything! The name is a bit of a misnomer though, as there was no wasabi that I could taste or see in my bowl. My mom's WestCoast grilled salmon bowl looked equally delicious but with an assortment of other toppings. 

The tacos were quite hefty in serving size as well. The two tacos could have been a meal on their own, but were served with a side of fries (or salad) and a small bowl of black beans. The Traditional Baja taco and the Grilled Steak taco were both excellent choices, depending on your palate and dietary preferences!

excerpts: We ordered tacos (traditional Baja, Mahi Mahi, and cabo shrimp), the Hawaiian poke appetizer, and the Korean bbq rice bowl.
The poke was a great wonderful mix of flavor although a tad on the saltier side.
The fish was fresh and a nice texture that was not too mushy or chewy.
Of the tacos, my favorite was the cabo shrimp as that one was moist and juicy while the other two tacos were a bit on the drier side which makes sense given that it was fish.
The Kbbq bowl was huge and had a lot of rice.
traditional baja.author: Lily F.
traditional baja.review:
Went here for dinner on Friday night and it was great. Here's why:

First of all, there's a parking lot which is unheard of in the Sunset area unless you're a super market or a drug store. We found a spot as soon as we pulled in. Next, the restaurant was so lively and bustling. I just loved the atmosphere from the get go. It was busy on a Friday night and the wait was long but they told us there was space at the bar so the two of us took a seat and skipped the entire line. We didn't order any alcohol but the bartender was definitely entertaining to watch. Free show/entertainment with dinner and no line?! Already a good start to the meal.

We ordered tacos (traditional Baja, Mahi Mahi, and cabo shrimp), the Hawaiian poke appetizer, and the Korean bbq rice bowl. The poke was a great wonderful mix of flavor although a tad on the saltier side. The fish was fresh and a nice texture that was not too mushy or chewy. Of the tacos, my favorite was the cabo shrimp as that one was moist and juicy while the other two tacos were a bit on the drier side which makes sense given that it was fish. The Kbbq bowl was huge and had a lot of rice. The meat on the bowl was delicious although I did find the sweet egg quite odd.

The meal took a while to come out due to some unknown reason but the manager noticed and comped our appetizer so great customer service there. The bartender was super nice too. 

Would come here again!

excerpts: My husband ordered traditional Baja fish tacos, he said it was good but the black beans that came with it as a side were no bueno.
I ordered a poke chashimi, never had it before
but it sounded good.
It was a larger portion than I expected, everything tasted fresh and delicious, would have liked more seaweed salad.
Only giving four stars because our waiter wasn't that welcoming, and seemed like he was in a rush even though the place was empty.
traditional baja.author: Zarafina H.
traditional baja.review: Decent little seafood place. It has a new/ modern style. Fresh fish daily and a good variety. They give free edamame, which is cool if you like that. I ordered a Thai tea, it was actually surprisingly good besides being a premade tea. The menu had poke bowls a few sushi rolls rice bowls, salads, seafood towers(expensive) cocktails steak and of course fresh fish platters. My husband ordered traditional Baja fish tacos, he said it was good but the black beans that came with it as a side were no bueno. I ordered a poke chashimi, never had it before but it sounded good. It was a larger portion than I expected, everything tasted fresh and delicious, would have liked more seaweed salad. Only giving four stars because our waiter wasn't that welcoming, and seemed like he was in a rush even though the place was empty.

excerpts: I like to get the three taco platter ($17.50 with the sweet potato fries) with traditional baja and cabo shrimp.

With the cod and avocado-tomatillo salsa, the traditional baja is my personal favorite because it seems juicier and fresher, but I'm also a sucker for the cabo shrimp because of the generous amount of avocado
it comes with.

With the cod and avocado-tomatillo salsa, the traditional baja is my personal favorite because it seems juicier and fresher, but I'm also a sucker for the cabo shrimp because of the generous amount of avocado
it comes with.
traditional baja.author: Amy C.
traditional baja.review:
Apologies in advance to anyone from San Diego, but Pacific Catch is my baseline for good fish tacos. I know it's technically a Bay Area chain restaurant, but there's no denying that Pacific Catch manages to keep locals coming back whenever they're craving some unpretentious seafood: abundant seating (with the chance to choose between a livelier, younger happy hour crowd on the left side of the restaurant and a more family-oriented booth seating on the right), complimentary pretzel Goldfish and edamame at the beginning of your meal, and a plethora of menu options.

Sure, you can order a rice bowl, sandwich, or maybe even a slightly overpriced poke bowl here, but I truly think the fish tacos are where Pacific Catch shines. Having driven past Pacific Catch all the time when I was younger, I didn't think to finally check it out until a few years ago when two of my friends shared that this was where they got their fish taco fix. 

Whatever you do, do not turn down the opportunity to pay an extra $1 for sweet potato fries. They are beyond flavorful and help you forget that you're eating at a chain restaurant. I also like the quaint Honolulu Tribune newspaper wax/butcher paper that the fish tacos come on because it feels like how a mom-and-pop fish stand would serve 'em. I like to get the three taco platter ($17.50 with the sweet potato fries) with traditional baja and cabo shrimp. With the cod and avocado-tomatillo salsa, the traditional baja is my personal favorite because it seems juicier and fresher, but I'm also a sucker for the cabo shrimp because of the generous amount of avocado it comes with. $17.50 certainly seems like a lot to pay for three fish tacos, but I've never been disappointed with the quality of the fish or found myself hungry again a few hours later.

Speaking of prices, the Mai Tai here sure is tasty and will fulfill all your rum-related dreams, but at $11, I have a hard time justifying it because it's not exactly of cocktail bar caliber. So get a pitcher of it instead -- $40 for five servings!

excerpts: Although they all sounded decent, the three tacos I went with were the Traditional Baja Taco with its Crispy Alaskan Cod, cabbage jalapeno tartar, and avocado tomatillo salsa, the Spiced Chicken Taco with grilled Mary's Chicken, cabbage avocado, chipotle aioli and pico de gallo, and the Pacific Steak Taco with marinated skirt steak, crispy onions, cilantro cabbage, sriracha aioli and lime cream.
traditional baja.author: Jason F.
traditional baja.review:
Pacific Catch West Coast Fish House is a solid place to get good if unspectacular seafood dishes like soft tacos, poke and rice bowls and sushi rolls. This franchise lays in the heart of San Francisco's Inner Sunset neighborhood right off the of the 9th Avenue Entrance to Golden Gate Park. Pacific Catch is a fine franchise and it's been in this location for over ten years, so despite the competition of the surrounding neighborhood this place is doing just fine. But the question is, is it worth it?

I went for a pre-planned birthday party, so we were able to make reservations for our party of seven at 7pm on a Wednesday evening in July. Although I've been this restaurant before, I haven't been in a while and I like some of the newer things they've brought to the interior, like a nice outdoor fireplace in front of the vestibule area and all of the funky artwork on the walls and hanging from the ceilings. Upon opening the menu, I did notice that the prices are high at Pacific Catch. Be prepared to get sticker shock as this place does not represent the most affordable meals for families in or from out of town. The average price is sixteen dollars per main course, but the food was dependable and an interesting blend on the traditional seafood fusion dish. 

Since there were seven of us in our party we had to get appetizers and the Cabo Calamari, as always, is an easy choice with crispy calamari, lemon slices, fresno chilies and chipotle aioli were decent if somewhat lackluster. The Original Hawaiian Poke Trio was a nice surprise because it came in three ranges of flavors with ahi tuna and sesame-soy marinade spicy seasoning, but at 19 dollars isn't the most affordable starter meal on the menu. I do give credit to Pacific Catch as everything on the menu does sound unbelievably tasty, even their fish and chips dish is described with a mouth-watering sensibility.  

After thinking and thinking (and thinking) about what I wanted to get that would be a good representation of what Pacific Catch has to offer, I decided to go with the Island Tacos Trio mainly because at 16 dollars you can mix and match three any tacos on their menu. Although they all sounded decent, the three tacos I went with were the Traditional Baja Taco with its Crispy Alaskan Cod, cabbage jalapeno tartar, and avocado tomatillo salsa, the Spiced Chicken Taco with grilled Mary's Chicken, cabbage avocado, chipotle aioli and pico de gallo, and the Pacific Steak Taco with marinated skirt steak, crispy onions, cilantro cabbage, sriracha aioli and lime cream. All three were solid pics with a little spice, a little crunch, and a decent amount of flavor. 

Pacific Catch is a decent place with a thought-provoking menu that combines Asian Fusion, Tex-Mex and fresh seafood entrees. The service, ambiance, and overall quality and presentation of the dishes were basically all on point. I asked at the top is it worth it, and I have to admit at that rate the answer remains no because of the overall type of food being offered doesn't match up with the prices. I simply wish the price points were a little more friendlier to the average tourist that tends to frequent this neighborhood. I would consider going again, maybe for Happy Hour or a late night bite. But there are other more unique and mom and pop style options out there in the Inner Sunset area that are dying to be supported by the community and newcomers alike.

excerpts: We both had the two taco platters - traditional Baja and grilled steak.
Perfect amount for a lunch on the go, and absolutely delicious!
Great service, and
they even charged our nearly-dead cell phones.
We'll definitely be back the next time we're in San Fran!
traditional baja.author: Amy H.
traditional baja.review: New Englanders in town for just three days, we were starving after a full morning of sight seeing. We came out of golden gate park, saw Pacific Catch across the street, and made a beeline!  We were so glad we did.  We both had the two taco platters - traditional Baja and grilled steak.  Perfect amount for a lunch on the go, and absolutely delicious!  Great service, and they even charged our nearly-dead cell phones. We'll definitely be back the next time we're in San Fran!

excerpts: Had the three taco platter with traditional Baja, mahi-mahi, and cabo shrimp and side of sweet potato fries.
traditional baja.author: Raymond N.
traditional baja.review: Had the three taco platter with traditional Baja, mahi-mahi, and cabo shrimp and side of sweet potato fries. Also had the mixed catch fish and chips. The fish and chips were okay but I don't really know how to describe the tacos. The tortilla was on the dry side and most of it was filled with cabbage, a lot of thick slices of cabbage. The ingredients didn't really hold together, just felt like hasty assortment of ingredients thrown together. The mahi-mahi was really dry. The crispy Alaskan cod was mildly crispy so I ended up eating just the fish. You can get much better taco at any taco truck. Service was good. Environment was clean.

excerpts: The traditional Baja cod and shrimp tacos were delightful.
The cod was nicely crisp and not greasy.
The ingredients in both tacos were well balanced.
I would add, delicious,  too.
traditional baja.author: Debbie T.
traditional baja.review:
I got the 'mix & match' tacos.  The service was mix and match as well.

In the case of the food, I chose two seafood tacos. The traditional Baja cod and shrimp tacos were delightful.  The cod was nicely crisp and not greasy.  The ingredients in both tacos were well balanced.  I would add, delicious,  too.  Fries were soggy, though.

About the service, everyone was nice and friendly.  Attentive they were not.  There were very lengthy time lapses between wait service, from start to finish.   To that I say, a good place to sit and converse as long as you like.  You'll have enough time.  No rush to give up your table for someone who is waiting.

excerpts: I got the "California Salmon Sandwich" with a side of salad and the bf got the "Traditional Baja Tacos" (I think?)...
but Anyway I was debating between that and a rice bowl.
I went with the sandwich and boy was
I delighted once it came out.
The salmon looked so PINK and FRESH!
It was cut in a certain way so that every bite I took, I was able to gather the taste of everything in the sandwich.
Also it was easy to bite into!
It was such a big surprise to me how fresh the fish was.
Usually, most restaurants serve a stingy amount of salmon and it is dry and not fresh at all.
GAWD.
It was so good!
The cole slaw was even good with it
and I hate cole slaw.
The salad was such a plus too!
traditional baja.author: Katrina T.
traditional baja.review:
i am seriously trying to go on a diet, so I have been trying to pick restaurants that serve fish or delicious salads! Looking at the pictures for Pacific Catch literally made me DROOL. The pictures of their food looked oh so good, I couldn't wait to try it ! 

Came here on a Friday with my boyfriend and were seated fairly quickly. It's so cute! Right when you sit down, they bring out a little tray with Goldfish Pretzels and Edamame. Weird combo, but I was dying of hunger so I ate it and it tasted fine. I looked at the menu for days before deciding what I really wanted. Be aware, the cost of the food is pretty pricy, but in all honesty, it is worth the money! I would definitely pay this amount to eat the food from here again! 

I got the "California Salmon Sandwich" with a side of salad and the bf got the "Traditional Baja Tacos" (I think?)...but Anyway I was debating between that and a rice bowl. I went with the sandwich and boy was I delighted once it came out. The salmon looked so PINK and FRESH! It was cut in a certain way so that every bite I took, I was able to gather the taste of everything in the sandwich. Also it was easy to bite into! It was such a big surprise to me how fresh the fish was. Usually, most restaurants serve a stingy amount of salmon and it is dry and not fresh at all. GAWD. It was so good! The cole slaw was even good with it and I hate cole slaw. The salad was such a plus too! I couldn't help but notice the couple sitting next to me with their "Hawaiian Poke" bowls!!! That looked awesome too! I super duper want that next time! 

Everything was GOOD GOOD GOOD! LOVE it! Coming back to try more freshness! 

oh yea this place definitely reminds me of Yard House. I don't know why, I couldn't tell if this place served American, Asian Fusion, Americanized Asian errr what. Whatever just as long as they satisfy my hunger I'm all about that!

excerpts: so we tried the Traditional Baja, Mahi Mahi and Cabo Shrimp.
My friend finished the entire plate plus his side salad.
I didn't =(
but I ate all the shrimp and fish
just not the tortilla.
It was good though, next time I will remind myself that I don't have a huge appetite like my friends do and order 2 tacos maybe :P
My other friend who happens to be my boyfriend got the Pan-Asian Rice Bowl.
traditional baja.author: Czarina Y.
traditional baja.review:
My friends and I decide that every time we decide to eat out, we need to try a new place. My friend suggested this place, we gave it a shot.

For starters, we tried one of their chalkboard specials. It's a Poke, forgot exactly what's called, but it's calamari poke. It was so good! Then I ordered their Island Tacos, for some reason, I went with their 3-taco platter just like what my friend got. It's pretty awesome that you can mix and match so we tried the Traditional Baja, Mahi Mahi and Cabo Shrimp. My friend finished the entire plate plus his side salad. I didn't =( but I ate all the shrimp and fish just not the tortilla. It was good though, next time I will remind myself that I don't have a huge appetite like my friends do and order 2 tacos maybe :P
My other friend who happens to be my boyfriend got the Pan-Asian Rice Bowl. He got the Japanese Wasabi bowl with Grilled Salmon. I personally didn't taste it, but he said it was too rich, although the salmon was still pretty good. 

Server was friendly and attends very well to our needs. Great experience! Can't complain and I will definitely go back. =)

excerpts: I ordered the 3 taco plate (mahi mahi, shrimp, and traditional baja) and enjoyed the shrimp taco the best.
One of the tacos, I think the traditional baja, lacked flavor and was disappointing.
For $15, I was stuffed at the end of the meal and had no room for dessert.
The service was excellent and the staff was attentive.
traditional baja.author: Allan L.
traditional baja.review:
Pacific Catch sounds like a corny show from the 90s but in reality, it's a mighty fine restaurant. I enjoyed my Pacific Catch experience. We came here on a Saturday night and had a reservation, so they seated us immediately. We got lucky and found a spot in their free parking lot, but parking is incredibly difficult in this area, so give yourself enough time to find a spot.

We started off with the fried calamari. It was a healthy portion, and had a small kick to it. We were tempted to also start off with some sweet potato fries, but since many of the dinner meals come with a side of fries, we decided not to. I ordered the 3 taco plate (mahi mahi, shrimp, and traditional baja) and enjoyed the shrimp taco the best. One of the tacos, I think the traditional baja, lacked flavor and was disappointing. For $15, I was stuffed at the end of the meal and had no room for dessert. The service was excellent and the staff was attentive. I'd come here again.

My tummy gives Pacific Catch...4 Stars!

excerpts: Our table of 3 shared a meal-sized salad with hawaiian poke, a three taco platter prepared Traditional Baja style, a Japanese wasabi rice bowl with seared ahi tuna, a grilled yellowtail platter, and fried dolce de leche "spring rolls".
Unfortunately, the yellowtail special was not that special.
The sauce didn't really make sense with the fish.
The hawaiian poke, on the other hand, was wonderfully seasoned and a delight with the mixed greens.
The Japanese wasabi rice bowl came with a perfectly spicy wasabi sauce.
The seared tuna, unfortunately, fell a bit short.
The ahi tuna did not come with a sharp, crisp sear, instead appearing as a small gradient from the cooked exterior and the raw interior.
The tuna was also not as fresh as Mikuni's in Sacramento, which remains to be my top choice for seared tuna.
Now that I've talked about the other dishes, I can finally talk about the fish tacos.
Let me tell you, the fish tacos are heavenly!
If you choose to have your tacos prepared Traditional Baja style, the fis will vary with the catch of the day.
The two times I went, the FOTD was True Cod.
The cod was as fresh as if it had been caught that morning.
The batter came out crisp but not overly thick as to drown out the subtle flavors of the fish.
The guacamole was creamy deliciousness.
Squeeze a bit of lemon on it
and you've got the perfect fish taco.
After a very satisfying meal, we decided to order the fried dolce de leche "spring rolls.
Definitely unique and tasty.
traditional baja.author: Jenny C.
traditional baja.review:
Let me preface this by saying that I am not a fish person. At least, not cooked fish. Far too often, fish at restaurants is not fresh and further ruined by being cooked until it's completely dried out. For this reason, I've never paid much attention to Pacific Catch despite passing by its admittedly attractive looking building thousands of times. As far as I was concerned, it would just be another disappointing seafood restaurant. I probably would've continue to ignore this place had my fellow food enthusiast, Andrew W., not urged me to try their fish tacos, which he swore were some of the best he's ever had. We have similar taste in food, so finally, I decided to give it a shot. 

Our table of 3 shared a meal-sized salad with hawaiian poke, a three taco platter prepared Traditional Baja style, a Japanese wasabi rice bowl with seared ahi tuna, a grilled yellowtail platter, and fried dolce de leche "spring rolls". Unfortunately, the yellowtail special was not that special. The sauce didn't really make sense with the fish. The hawaiian poke, on the other hand, was wonderfully seasoned and a delight with the mixed greens. The Japanese wasabi rice bowl came with a perfectly spicy wasabi sauce. The seared tuna, unfortunately, fell a bit short. The ahi tuna did not come with a sharp, crisp sear, instead appearing as a small gradient from the cooked exterior and the raw interior. The tuna was also not as fresh as Mikuni's in Sacramento, which remains to be my top choice for seared tuna. Now that I've talked about the other dishes, I can finally talk about the fish tacos. Let me tell you, the fish tacos are heavenly! If you choose to have your tacos prepared Traditional Baja style, the fis will vary with the catch of the day. The two times I went, the FOTD was True Cod. The cod was as fresh as if it had been caught that morning. The batter came out crisp but not overly thick as to drown out the subtle flavors of the fish. The guacamole was creamy deliciousness. Squeeze a bit of lemon on it and you've got the perfect fish taco. After a very satisfying meal, we decided to order the fried dolce de leche "spring rolls." Definitely unique and tasty. One person at my table found the dolce de leche to be a bit too sweet, but I liked it just fine. 

Just writing about Pacific Catch makes me crave it. I can't wait to come back again for the fish tacos and dessert.

excerpts: I had a 3-taco platter which included a mahi mahi taco, a traditional baja taco, and a cabo shrimp taco.
All tasty, but unremarkable.
And that pretty much sums up the place: decent asian fusion seafood fare, AWESOME life lessons.
traditional baja.author: Derek L.
traditional baja.review:
Halfway through our dinner on Christmas eve with my close group of friends, the waiter asked us if it was a special occasion. We said no, we only wanted to see each other for the holidays. Then he imparted some endearing wisdom about how true friends are hard to find, and that you should hold on to the ones you care about. His words were heartfelt, but too bad they weren't on the menu.

The food was maybe a step above your run-of-the-mill sit down chain restaurant. I had a 3-taco platter which included a mahi mahi taco, a traditional baja taco, and a cabo shrimp taco. All tasty, but unremarkable. And that pretty much sums up the place: decent asian fusion seafood fare, AWESOME life lessons.

excerpts: I ordered one each of (1) a Grilled Mahi-Mahi taco,  (2) a traditional Baja-style fried fish taco, and (3) one shrimp taco.
As for Taco #2, I think I've had better at Rubios..
Um.
wait..
I have..
The others were okay.
traditional baja.author: Harry W.
traditional baja.review:
Wow.. after reading all the glowing reviews for Pacific Catch on 9th, we dashed on over there to see what all the hubbub was about..

Sorry to say, we were a bit disappointed.  

Nutshell Review: Anything we experienced that was good tonight (food, service, etc), also had an unexpected mild downside to it.

The Good stuff: The sweet potato fries were pretty good, and yeah.. for dessert, we split the mango cheesecake - now.. this WAS good.  I'd order this again.  OK.. all good on the dessert.

The three tacos I ordered up as the main dish were decent.  I ordered one each of (1) a Grilled Mahi-Mahi taco,  (2) a traditional Baja-style fried fish taco, and (3) one shrimp taco.  As for Taco #2, I think I've had better at Rubios.. Um. wait.. I have..  The others were okay. The best was probably the shrimp taco.  

Grilled Corn - this little side dish was complemented beautifully with a flavorful chili-lime butter - AWESOME butter. but hey.. they didn't grill the corn the whole way - either that, or it was just sitting around too long after leaving the grill.  Parts of the kernels were clearly COLD upon biting em.. 

The Mahi-Mahi Teriyaki Bowl my significant other had was overseasoned and covered in a heavy sweet sauce that completely drowned out any other flavors or texture that once were part of the pineapple fried rice which became almost mush.   The Mahi itself was perfectly prepared.  What a bummer.  Maybe the better way to go here is to go instead with the brown rice they also offer as an option.

Service: So-so.  Our greeter and waitress were very friendly and greeted us with HUGE smiles and a wonderful attitude, but once we ordered up our food, our server was very hard to find, even though we were seated near the front of the restaurant where all of the OTHER servers congregated.  It seemed as if I was invisible there tonight, as I was pretty thirsty, but well,  we only got refills twice over the hour we were there.    Our waitress did a great job and was probably swamped. It's just that the other help that we tried to flag down seemed as if we didn't exist.

 I'll probably give them another try, but there's plenty of competition from other cuisines all over this neighborhood.  

I was expecting much better, and to place this restaurant into our normal "rotation" of places to eat. Oh well.  Blame it on my expectations being sky-high..

excerpts: I had the traditional baja and pacific steak tacos and my friend got the baja and chicken tacos.
traditional baja.author: An-Nhien L.
traditional baja.review: Went here for a catch-up dinner date with one of my girlfriends and had a great time! I love the complimentary pretzel goldfish and edamame. Our waiter was great and the food came fast. I had the traditional baja and pacific steak tacos and my friend got the baja and chicken tacos. We had sweet potato fries of course as well. Everything was delicious fresh and flavorful. I also had a 50% off deal from Scoutmob which the waiter graciously accepted. I always make it a point to tip the waiter/waitress generously when I come with a coupon, especially if the service was good. Will definitely be coming back!

excerpts: I chose the double platter with one traditional baja and one cabo shrimp taco.
traditional baja.author: Rhia R.
traditional baja.review: The days before, the day of, and those following my birthday have been filled with nothing but fun. That, and a ridiculous amount of food. I have been so well fed this week it's not even funny. One of my best friends took me here for dinner last night. PC was fairly busy in spite of the rain. She said I could order anything I want. (No, you didn't just say that!) I wasn't planning on stuffing my face, but surely I was in the mood for some tacos. I chose the double platter with one traditional baja and one cabo shrimp taco. Before our orders were up, we had their crispy oysters and spicy tuna roll. The oysters weren't greasy and the roll had a good kick. As for the tacos, I liked the shrimp one better than the baja. Cod (which was the daily catch featured in the baja taco) is a pretty bland fish unless you pair it with a flavorful partner. In this case, it was the tomatillo salsa. Good thing I ate that one first before the shrimp or else I probably would have been a bit disappointed. The shrimp taco was much better. Even more so with the avocado and pico de gallo. My friend and I could have ended our mission right there, but I managed to set aside some room for dessert. Normally I would skip it, but I heard some good things about the dulce de leche spring rolls. The concoction came drizzled with a generous amount of caramel sauce and a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Yum! I think the filling inside of the roll was cheesecake, not sure. It tends to get pretty rich after a while. Once again, I'm stuffed. I'll have to put in a few rigorous workouts next week to compensate for all this eating.

excerpts: My friend ordered the poke and the traditional baja taco.
traditional baja.author: edie t.
traditional baja.review:
cleanliness: 4/5
food quality:  2/5
service: 3/5
cost: $15-$20
other:

2nd Visit: I came here with a friend after another restaurant we wanted
to go to was closed. 

My friend ordered the poke and the traditional baja taco. I had the bbq salmon taco and the spicy chicken. The spicy chicken was not spicy and lacked flavor. The salmon was okay, but also lacked flavor. 

the service was pretty good but nothing outstanding compared to my last visit.

1st Visit:

cleanliness: 4/5
food quality:  3.5/5
service: 5/5
cost: $15-$20
other:

Found parking in the lot, probably because it was early. I came here with Helen and we sat at the bar per my request so we could grab a drink and watch the basketball game. 

She ordered the coconut shrimp and I ordered the catch of the day. She ordered a martini and I got a dark and stormy (which was great!)

The bartender was really friendly and chatted with us from time to time. The nuggets ended up winning and Helen was a great date as always. Unforunately the bartender thought Helen wanted the coconut shrimp appetizer, but she wanted the full entree. Although the coconut shrimp wasn't great, we enjoyed the sweet potato fries and my fish.

The bartender was super and comped us on the appetizer and by the end of the meal we left happy.

excerpts: I ordered the Traditional Baja taco which is basically a Baja fish taco with Jalepeno sauce over it, and the Shrimp Cabo which is with crispy shrimp, a special chef sauce, pico de gallo and avocado (YUMM).
The Shrimp Cabo taco was my friends favorite as well.
The Entree's are about  $10-15 depending on what you get.
SO all in all, the experience wasn't the best, but the food was very tasteful.
I DO, want to go again, but maybe this time to a different location.
If any of you do decide to try this location out for yourself
STAY CLEAR of NEAL.
He is a douche.
And a horrible waiter.
If it weren't for the service, I would give this place 5 stars or food and location.
Hope this helps?
traditional baja.author: Allanah S.
traditional baja.review: So I will start off by saying that on a different day I'm sure my experience would have been a lot better than it was. I went on a Saturday evening, about 5pm with a reservation of 10 people. The place is nice enough for a casual dinner or lunch with a friend or coworker but not for a quick bite. It is definitely a sit down type of restaurant. The place is pretty spacious, the booths are made to fit about 5 people per booth, unless sitting in the chair seating area. There is a full bar on the outside looking out onto Irving street. The lighting is dim and warm (very complementing to your skin :) ). As well as their paintings on the walls, very welcoming. So, after we all walked in they took about 10 minutes just to acknowledge that our group was waiting to be seated. After we were seated, we had a waiter named Neal, tall, middle-aged, white male with glasses and long-ish white hair, He was really impatient and rude. He did not give us that much time to review the menu before he kept bugging about ordering. By the second or third time of him asking, we were actually ready and he left in the middle of us telling him we were ready to order in irritation. He also made four mistakes on the bill (we had split checks) and was very sarcastic when we had to add more money (because he did not divide the cards right), and I quote, " Wow how generous of you all, now I am blushing because you added more money", it might not sound as bad as he said it, but it came off very rude and sarcastic. After the fourth mistake we asked for the manager to set the cards right because clearly he didn't know what he was doing. And even the manager cut my friend off in the middle of expressing our frustration with the cards and also Neal's service to us. Then, once the manager spoke to Neal he came back to us saying " SO whats the problem now!?!" then walking away AGAIN in the middle of our sentence shaking his head. I have NO IDEA why they were so out of it with their service but it was EXTREMELY disappointing because the FOOD WAS REALLY GOOD. I ordered the 2 taco Entree with the choice to mix and match with the other styled tacos. I ordered the Traditional Baja taco which is basically a Baja fish taco with Jalepeno sauce over it, and the Shrimp Cabo which is with crispy shrimp, a special chef sauce, pico de gallo and avocado (YUMM). The Shrimp Cabo taco was my friends favorite as well. The Entree's are about  $10-15 depending on what you get. SO all in all, the experience wasn't the best, but the food was very tasteful. I DO, want to go again, but maybe this time to a different location. If any of you do decide to try this location out for yourself STAY CLEAR of NEAL. He is a douche. And a horrible waiter. If it weren't for the service, I would give this place 5 stars or food and location. Hope this helps?

excerpts: We ordered tacos (traditional Baja, Mahi Mahi, and cabo shrimp), the Hawaiian poke appetizer, and the Korean bbq rice bowl.
The poke was a great wonderful mix of flavor although a tad on the saltier side.
The fish was fresh and a nice texture that was not too mushy or chewy.
Of the tacos, my favorite was the cabo shrimp as that one was moist and juicy while the other two tacos were a bit on the drier side which makes sense given that it was fish.
The Kbbq bowl was huge and had a lot of rice.
mahi mahi.author: Lily F.
mahi mahi.review:
Went here for dinner on Friday night and it was great. Here's why:

First of all, there's a parking lot which is unheard of in the Sunset area unless you're a super market or a drug store. We found a spot as soon as we pulled in. Next, the restaurant was so lively and bustling. I just loved the atmosphere from the get go. It was busy on a Friday night and the wait was long but they told us there was space at the bar so the two of us took a seat and skipped the entire line. We didn't order any alcohol but the bartender was definitely entertaining to watch. Free show/entertainment with dinner and no line?! Already a good start to the meal.

We ordered tacos (traditional Baja, Mahi Mahi, and cabo shrimp), the Hawaiian poke appetizer, and the Korean bbq rice bowl. The poke was a great wonderful mix of flavor although a tad on the saltier side. The fish was fresh and a nice texture that was not too mushy or chewy. Of the tacos, my favorite was the cabo shrimp as that one was moist and juicy while the other two tacos were a bit on the drier side which makes sense given that it was fish. The Kbbq bowl was huge and had a lot of rice. The meat on the bowl was delicious although I did find the sweet egg quite odd.

The meal took a while to come out due to some unknown reason but the manager noticed and comped our appetizer so great customer service there. The bartender was super nice too. 

Would come here again!

excerpts: Some other notable favorites are the Hawaiian teriyaki rice bowl, fried oysters, pacific crab salad, fish and chips, mahi mahi and steak tacos, and seasoned fries.
Service is always good except one time, nobody came to give me my bill and took a long time to flag someone down.
But, otherwise they are attentive.
mahi mahi.author: Annie L.
mahi mahi.review: Yummy goodness! I've been coming to this location for for the past 7 years and every time I get yumminess! With friends, we get a booth in the back but when I'm by myself, I sit at a table in the bar section. I almost always order their Salmon Salad..it is so delicious it is my favorite salad in the world. The sauce is what makes it bomb! Can I buy a bottle? Some other notable favorites are the Hawaiian teriyaki rice bowl, fried oysters, pacific crab salad, fish and chips, mahi mahi and steak tacos, and seasoned fries. Service is always good except one time, nobody came to give me my bill and took a long time to flag someone down. But, otherwise they are attentive.

excerpts: BUT I am not happy with the mahi mahi island tacos.
When I took my first bite I realized how completely raw it was.
Not good!
Luckily, a waitress came by and asked if everything was fine and took care of the bill.
I'm not quite sure if I'll be back.
I guess I should always check if the food is cooked from now on.
Although, one would assume that it would be.
mahi mahi.author: William Y.
mahi mahi.review: I happen to be in the area and stopped by with a friend to grab the poke. It was delicious as usual BUT I am not happy with the mahi mahi island tacos. When I took my first bite I realized how completely raw it was. Not good! Luckily, a waitress came by and asked if everything was fine and took care of the bill. I'm not quite sure if I'll be back. I guess I should always check if the food is cooked from now on. Although, one would assume that it would be.

excerpts: 3 mahi mahi tacos ($16)  and a sushi roll ($13)
mahi mahi.author: Tabitha E.
mahi mahi.review:
Located near UCSF, I'd seen this place a lot in my searches while inpatient and craving sushi, as well as driven by every visit on Lincoln Avenue. We wanted a place to hang out for a while before meeting up with friends later, so we parked in Golden Gate park, which was not bad cause it was a Monday, and walked the 3 minutes over. We were early for happy hour by a 1/2 hour, but I was starving so we ordered anyways. 3 mahi mahi tacos ($16)  and a sushi roll ($13), I already forgot the name of. 

The sushi roll was good, and huge. The shrimp was a nice, actually huge tempera'd shrimp (though the crunch was lost) and not those tiny ones I normally see. Lots of avocado and julienned cucumber with a sliver of ginger, topped with a nice slice of ahi tuna. I like ginger and really liked this roll, although, just wish the shrimp had retained a bit of crunch. 

I didn't try the fish tacos, but Cory seemed happy. Big pieces of fish in here and he ate them all. The fries were, fries, a little too mushy for my preference. Cory had a few beers and I had water as we sat on the patio area with a view of the corner so prime people watching area. We were told by another frequent customer they had recently renovated everything, including enclosing the patio area. More glass would be nice, but you would lose seating I guess. The patio stayed nice and warm with the various glass gas rock fireplace and overhead heating elements. 

Barely there service, so I would have preferred to be checked in on a bit more. We never were asked about food during eating. Well enough they watched Cory's beers though. 

We will probably be back on my overnight trips as this wasn't too terrible. Happy hour looks like some good deals especially for this place. Also dogs are allowed out on the patio too.

excerpts: I had the Hawaiian Mahi mahi rice bowl  (half brown rice, half greens).
It was amazing!
Definitely coming back!
mahi mahi.author: Ali Q.
mahi mahi.review: I wasn't sure what I wanted as I've never been to this restaurant.  My waiter explained a few different options and he hit it on the nose for me and my taste buds.  I had the Hawaiian Mahi mahi rice bowl  (half brown rice, half greens). It was amazing!  Definitely coming back!

excerpts: My mother got the mahi mahi bowl and hers wasn't that good either.
mahi mahi.author: Peter K.
mahi mahi.review:
We came here for Mother's Day. The restaurant looks nice and the service was good. Other than that, the food was pretty terrible. 

We first started off with the Poke Trio. It seemed overly sauced to hide the fact that the fish wasn't fresh. Let's just say I have an iron stomach and later that night and the next day my stomach was out of commission. 

My wife got the three tacos combo, and she said it looked sloppy and didn't taste very fresh. 

My mother got the mahi mahi bowl and hers wasn't that good either.  The fish was very bland. 

Dad got the crab cake loco moco, and he wasn't impressed either. He only ate 1/3 of it. 

Forgot what my brother got, but he didn't like his food either. 

It seems as if this place just overly sauces all their food to mask the bad taste. 

Not a fan.

excerpts: I also tried their mahi mahi tacos with sweet potato fries.
mahi mahi.author: Jenna G.
mahi mahi.review:
Honestly this place is so good. I've been to both the Marina and sunset location. Their poke is so fresh and good. I've tried the original and the salmon avocado. I also tried their mahi mahi tacos with sweet potato fries. Everything was solid. 

It is a little pricey because it's seafood, but I will keep coming back here for poke.

excerpts: We ordered fried oysters, soft shell crab salad, shrimp ceviche and beef & mahi mahi tacos.
Loved the tacos!
mahi mahi.author: Tiffany M.
mahi mahi.review:
Really enjoyed apps and drinks in the bar area on a very busy evening. My friend and I could not get a table inside the restaurant area or patio dining area. But the bar area was great! The service was super speedy and friendly, mindful of timing our apps delivery, too! We ordered fried oysters, soft shell crab salad, shrimp ceviche and beef & mahi mahi tacos. Loved the tacos! Came with sweet potato fries as a choice of side. The steak was amazing so tender and tasty, hint of sweetness. Pretzel
Fish and edamame come as bar snacks while you wait for your food, pretty creative and yummy. This was our first visit here and we were really surprised. Only one con to mention, the menu lacks entrees. The restaurant feels like a main entree type restaurant but actually has a tapas menu. I was in the mood for fish main entree, still good though. The outer patio looks cozy with gas fireplace pits! Reception area and wait staff were all very helpful and friendly. I will try the San Mateo branch next time, closer to my house.

excerpts: My friend ordered the Mahi Mahi Hawaiin teriyaki bowl which looked, smelled, and tasted
One Mahi Mahi, one Cabo Shrimp, and lastly a Pacific steak taco.
mahi mahi.author: Katerina Y.
mahi mahi.review:
I drive by this place every, single day. so it eventually made it on to my "must try" list.

 I finally went in yesterday and I honestly regret waiting so long. Everything my friend and I ordered was so delicious and not to mention our waitress was so attentive and delightful!

We ordered a Blood Orange Cocktail and a Kiwi Flash. If it wasn't a Monday night, we honestly wouldn't have stopped at just one each!lol

We started off with a Fire Cracker Salmon roll, which was delicious! 

My friend ordered the Mahi Mahi Hawaiin teriyaki bowl which looked, smelled, and tasted oh so good!

I ordered the 3 taco platter. One Mahi Mahi, one Cabo Shrimp, and lastly a Pacific steak taco. Yes, yes, and YES!! 

The portions were huge so we were full almost immediately but we still had room for some Mochi Fondue!! 

Overall, great location, delicious food, heated outdoor seating, can't go wrong!

excerpts: My friend got the mahi mahi tacos which she described as bland.
It did look bland.
mahi mahi.author: Glendie D.
mahi mahi.review:
Food was ok. We got the poke trio which was the best part of our dinner. The poke was tender and seasoned ok. My friend got the mahi mahi tacos which she described as bland. It did look bland. Another friend got a ahi tuna salad and she enjoyed it. I got the shrimp coconut and it was just ok. The coconut was really overpowering. It wasn't anything exceptional. 

My suggestion is to get the dishes that have poke if you like that. You would have a better chance of having a tasty dinner.

excerpts: Anyways, I came here for lunch for the mahi mahi sandwich.
They serve 5-7 different types of poke which I had to take a look at
but I didn't try it since the price seemed a little high.
Anyways, the fish was fresh and tender on a good piece of bread.
I'd come back to try more on the menu since there was so many things to choose from.
The salad looked pretty large as well
so it's definitely an option for next time.
mahi mahi.author: Ryan C.
mahi mahi.review:
Showed up at about 1230 on a Sunday with about 7-8 tables open and surprised the host told us we'd have to wait 10 minutes. Maybe they were understaffed at the moment but everyone that came after us had to wait as well. Then a large party sat down so maybe they were reserving space for them. 

Anyways, I came here for lunch for the mahi mahi sandwich. They serve 5-7 different types of poke which I had to take a look at but I didn't try it since the price seemed a little high. Anyways, the fish was fresh and tender on a good piece of bread. I'd come back to try more on the menu since there was so many things to choose from. The salad looked pretty large as well so it's definitely an option for next time.

excerpts: We got a mahi mahi taco, coconut shrimp, calamari, spicy tuna roll, macadamia nut poke, and we shared a mai tai.
We had a big snack, and we were satisfied.
mahi mahi.author: Brandon F.
mahi mahi.review:
Long day of shopping and was looking for a good happy hour with something to snack between lunch and dinner. Searched nearby on Yelp and came across this place! Although I'm on vacation, and trying to hit up all the hyped Yelp spots, I was happy to hit up a regular place as if I would if I was home in San Diego. 

Their drink menu and food selection is awesome during happy hour. We got a good variety of items and it was exactly what I was looking for. Our snack kind of turned into a meal that got us full and we needed up skipping our late dinner. They do a cool Hawaiian/Asian fusion and everything was great. My poke was a bit on the salty side, but everything else we got was on point. We got a mahi mahi taco, coconut shrimp, calamari, spicy tuna roll, macadamia nut poke, and we shared a mai tai. We had a big snack, and we were satisfied.

excerpts: I opted for the two tacos combo, steak & mahi mahi tacos and they are pretty big tacos.
It came with a side of spicy fries which were delicious!
I mean who can refuse fries?!?!
The tacos were okay but my favorite thing about that night was my choice in drink!
My girlfriend and I both tried the Hawaiian Punch cocktail and it as so yummy!!!
mahi mahi.author: Kary Y.
mahi mahi.review:
I love the overall remodeling of Pacific Catch on 9th but I have to say the service is still mediocre.

Came here Tuesday night with a girlfriend around dinner time and the place was pretty packed. We weren't really greeted properly and when seated our waitress seemed like she was in a rush.

Despite this hiccup, my girlfriend and I have been here before so we have the menu a quick browse. If you're into some quick grilled fish, poke, or just fusion food.. Pacific Catch may satisfy your craving.

I opted for the two tacos combo, steak & mahi mahi tacos and they are pretty big tacos. It came with a side of spicy fries which were delicious! I mean who can refuse fries?!?! The tacos were okay but my favorite thing about that night was my choice in drink! My girlfriend and I both tried the Hawaiian Punch cocktail and it as so yummy!!! You could barely taste the alcohol too :P

Overall, an okay dinner experience but I would come back for happy hour.

excerpts: After reading the reviews, we decided to try the California Style Hawaiian Poke and Mahi Mahi Tacos.
What I loved the best of this place is the Hawaiian Poke!
That is super delicious and it comes with chips that you can use to scoop and eat with the poke.
That's probably my favorite out of the two that we tried.
Trying the mahi mahi tacos was just okay.
From the reviews about the tacos, I was looking forward to it and it was a bit of a disappointment.
I was expecting something super delicious
but it gets the job done.
Apparently, it came with fries too
mahi mahi.author: Teresa W.
mahi mahi.review:
I tried this for the first time after being recommended by a friend.  Seating was pretty fast and it came with a small dish of complementary Chickpeas and Pretzel crackers.  After reading the reviews, we decided to try the California Style Hawaiian Poke and Mahi Mahi Tacos.  What I loved the best of this place is the Hawaiian Poke!  That is super delicious and it comes with chips that you can use to scoop and eat with the poke.  That's probably my favorite out of the two that we tried.  Trying the mahi mahi tacos was just okay.  From the reviews about the tacos, I was looking forward to it and it was a bit of a disappointment.  I was expecting something super delicious but it gets the job done.  Apparently, it came with fries too and we chose the sweet potato fries.  They were okay as well. 

Overall, food was okay.  Definitely love the poke and will return for it.  Not so much for the tacos.  I love the staff though because they were super friendly.  On two occasions, I was trying to take photos with a friend and both a waitress and a waiter offered to help us take a photo.  That was a very sweet gesture of them!  Will definitely return for the awesome staff and the yummy poke!  I might try something new next time instead of the tacos.

excerpts: I chose mahi mahi, shrimp, and steak.
Hubby chose baja (fried cod), mahi mahi, and steak as well.
mahi mahi.author: Dahlia C.
mahi mahi.review:
After a long hike at Land's End with my family, we were starving. It was a beautiful Sunday afternoon and the nearest place where there are notably tons of great eclectic spots to eat, was in the inner sunset district along Irving and 9th. Right on the corner of 9th and Lincoln is Pacific Catch, you cannot miss it. Parking can be a little difficult to find especially on weekends, but it was just our luck that we found a spot right in front. They say the law of attraction can make things happen & that's exactly what happened as my hubby and I were claiming a close spot beforehand. And on top of that, the meters said free parking, which is normally in service on Sundays. Made us feel like we won the lottery!!

Anyways, we were seated right away since it was mid-afternoon and not so crowded. The boys had kids meals: fish and chips and fish tacos. The mister and I shared the white tuna Poke, served with fried wontons. Then we both ordered mix & match tacos. I chose mahi mahi, shrimp, and steak. Hubby chose baja (fried cod), mahi mahi, and steak as well. We each ordered them with a side of fries--spicy and sweet potato. Everything was pretty much devoured really quickly, even my boys cleaned up their plates which is really rare. Either they were just hungry or they loved it, turns out to both.The only flip-side to it was that there was some damage done to our wallets. Total cost for a family of four came out to almost $80 including tax. We always try to eat where we can afford within our means, but today, I guess you can say it was a special treat:) Otherwise, be prepared to dish out some money for good seafood or save this place for special occasions.

excerpts: My mahi mahi tacos were really good.
They came with avocado and lettuce, a small bowl of beans on the side, and you could have an option of fries or salad with it.
There were 2 tacos on a plate.
My husband had a bowl of grilled mahi mahi with brown rice, roasted pineapple, caramelized onions and shaved coconut.
mahi mahi.author: Michelle R.
mahi mahi.review:
A very solid place, with good food and great presentation.

It is an all-occasion spot, you can come for a casual Sunday dinner or to celebrate a birthday.  You can see  all ages and all kind of groups of people, from families with babies to ones with  older parents and everyone in between.  Groups of friends, ages from  20 something to seniors.

We really loved the sweet potato fries for an appetizer.  They came with red chili pepper sauce (yumm) and wasabi aioli.

My mahi mahi tacos were really good. They came with avocado and lettuce, a small bowl of beans on the side, and you could have an option of fries or salad with it.  There were 2 tacos on a plate.  I don't like huge portions, so this was plenty.

 My husband had a bowl of grilled mahi mahi with brown rice, roasted pineapple, caramelized onions and shaved coconut.   He really enjoyed it and could barely finish his plate, it was so much food.

We were so full that we couldn't  even  finish our side of warm edamame.

My son had fish and chips.  I tried his fries, the seasoning on them was a really good combination.

Some food, like sweet potato fries, tacos were served on a sheet of a newspaper which happened to be a Hawaiian Tribune from April 1, 1901.  Pretty cool, although I've seen it before (at an Italian Seafood place, on Irving and 9th, not far from this one.)

Cons:  The California roll that my daughter ordered was a bit dry. It also was overpriced at $9.  The wine was overpriced too, at $9 a glass, and it wasn't that much wine in the glass.  Also, they were out of one of Hawaiian Poke tonight - spiced tofu.

Nevertheless, we enjoyed our dinner and definitely will be back.

excerpts: The others got dishes from the special menu, which were ribs and mahi mahi.
Pacific Catch has big dishes with large portions.
The dishes look hearty.
I like the interior of the restaurant.
mahi mahi.author: Denise C.
mahi mahi.review: This Pacific Catch caught my eye, and I finally got to eat here today for the first time with my uncle and his wife. They treated me to a dinner here. I picked something from the menu ahead of time and it was the shrimp tacos. I thought they were good. The others got dishes from the special menu, which were ribs and mahi mahi. Pacific Catch has big dishes with large portions. The dishes look hearty. I like the interior of the restaurant. If you check-in for the first time at this restaurant on Foursquare, you get a free dessert, so I ordered the mochi fondue, which we liked. It comes with chocolate dipping sauce. This is a fun restaurant with an interesting menu. The dishes you can get at other restaurants. Most of it isn't that new to the eye or mouth, but overall it's a nice dining experience, and you will probably and hopefully leave satisfied.

excerpts: My favorite protein for these is the mahi mahi although the salmon and crab salad are a close second.
I got stuck on the tropical iced tea for a long time but recently tried the sparkling lemonade which offers free refills and is delicious!
mahi mahi.author: Krislyn T.
mahi mahi.review: This is a great place for lunch and has become my go-to spot where I take all my friends.  The modern decor is refreshing.  Their rice bowls and salads are wonderful with the half rice and salad option in the rice bowl.  My favorite protein for these is the mahi mahi although the salmon and crab salad are a close second.  I got stuck on the tropical iced tea for a long time but recently tried the sparkling lemonade which offers free refills and is delicious!  Oh and always opt for those sweet potato fries.  I've never had a bad experience and whoever hires all the servers finds the nicest people in the City!

excerpts: I got the Mahi Mahi and the beef tacos.
mahi mahi.author: Meredith W.
mahi mahi.review:
I've eaten at Pacific Catch a couple of times before, but this time was, by far, the worst service I have ever had. 



We waited about 15-20 minutes before we were seated, which wasn't really a problem. Then, we proceeded to sit at our table for another 15 minutes before anyone even acknowledged that we were sitting there, even though multiple servers had passed our table a few times. 
When our waitress finally realized we were sitting in her section, she basically told us that she didn't know we were there and that she didn't know that we were seated in her section, when in reality she had passed our table at least 5 times previously. So, we placed our orders, which did come out in a reasonable amount of time. Our waitress, on the other hand, hardly ever checked on us for refills, and my friend had to get up and find the pitchers to refill our drinks. She didn't even bring condiments for our food so we had to get that as well. 

At least the food is good. The poke is really tasty, and the tacos are really good. I got the Mahi Mahi and the beef tacos.

excerpts:
Mahi Mahi tac0-3/5, great, but not memorable 
3)
mahi mahi.author: Jen H.
mahi mahi.review:
Overall a solid 3.5 stars, but I bumped it up an extra 0.5 star for dog friendliness.

I actually didn't expect much of this place, but it was dog friendly and there were televisions (for sports), so we decided to drop in. Pacific Catch exceeded my expectation. 

The service was fairly slow, but maybe b/c we sat outside (with the heaters right above us).

Ordered:
1) Ecstasy sushi roll-2.5/5, not so great
2) Mahi Mahi tac0-3/5, great, but not memorable 
3) Hawaiian Poke rice bowl- 4/5 This was the best dish at the table!
4) Pacific steak-3.5/5-Great, but again, nothing out of the ordinary

excerpts: Ordered the special 3 poke combo, with sweet potato fries, and a mahi mahi fish taco duet.
mahi mahi.author: Benjamin B.
mahi mahi.review:
Second time here, first time this location. Reserved tables via open table and had no problem walking in and getting seated. Our waitress was super nice. 

Ordered the special 3 poke combo, with sweet potato fries, and a mahi mahi fish taco duet. 

Everything tasted superb, A little pricey, but I still really enjoyed it

excerpts: the Mahi Mahi tacos, the Sushi, Chicken salad, rice bowls, Salmon dinners, sandwiches and everything tastes fabulous.
A real winner.
Also, all of their drinks are tasty and refreshing.
I will be going back soon.
mahi mahi.author: Donna C.
mahi mahi.review: What a fabulous newly renovated restaurant with a hip, beautiful ambiance in the bar, restaurant and patio. The food is excellent. I have had the Mahi Mahi tacos, the Sushi, Chicken salad, rice bowls, Salmon dinners, sandwiches and everything tastes fabulous. A real winner. Also, all of their drinks are tasty and refreshing. I will be going back soon.

excerpts: The Hawaiian rice bowl with mahi mahi is great.
mahi mahi.author: Robert B.
mahi mahi.review: We were in a rush. Fast fast service. Great rice bowls. The Hawaiian rice bowl with mahi mahi is great. My son had the ahi tuna rice bowl. He loved it. Wife had the fish and chips. She liked it. Portion size was just right. Will eat here again!

excerpts: My mom loved her grilled mahi mahi with pineapple salsa.
Served with a side of bok choy, onion strings and a big scoop of rice.
mahi mahi.author: Janice C.
mahi mahi.review:
On my only day off, do I really want to spend it with my crazy family?!

"Oh, don't worry, your dad's not coming" my mom said.

* If you know my 'rents, I'm sure you'd also say thank God! *

Since it was just my mom and I, we decided to have lunch at Pacific Catch.  She loves seafood -- fish, shrimps, crab, baked, fried or broiled.  This place was ideal since it was walking distance to GG park, which we were headed to after lunch.

We picked out a couple of items and decided to share.  

The sweet potato fries were recommended by Eileen H. Boy she was right!  crispy and simply adorned with rock salt, it comes with two dipping sauces. I didn't like the flavored mayo nor the sweet chili sauce, but the fries are good on their own. (a side order is enough for two people)

The California roll was made with real crab but surprisingly lacking in flavor.  I've never been so thankful for soy sauce to dip it in.

On to the poke dish -- huge chunks of ahi tuna perfectly marinated in a soy sesame dressing.  It'll be easier to chew on it if the cut was smaller, but I shouldn't complain because I got my money's worth on that dish. 

Save your $4.95 on the grilled yellowtail taco. (it was a special for that day) The taco was small and the fish was overwhelmed with all the other trimmings in there. 

My mom loved her grilled mahi mahi with pineapple salsa. Served with a side of bok choy, onion strings and a big scoop of rice.  She couldn't finish this dish, not because it wasn't delicious, but the portions were so huge!

Service is very good, both from our waitress and the bussers, constantly refilling water and taking away used dishes. 

I'm curious about their happy hour, so I may come back for that!

excerpts:
Hawaiian Bowl - 15
asparagus, shiitake mushrooms, pineapple salsa, grilled bok choy, sesame seeds & house-made sake-teriyaki sauce served over seasoned sushi rice*

Taco Platter - 13
Baja, steak, and mahi mahi

Combination Captains Plate - 15 or so
3 thai coconut shrimps, 2 pieces of fried fish (forgot which kind), and 3 battered oysters with a choice of a side.
mahi mahi.author: Lindsay L.
mahi mahi.review:
California Roll Salad - 14.5 
crab, avocado, cucumber, pickled ginger, carrots, shredded nori & soy-wasabi vinaigrette

Hawaiian Bowl - 15
asparagus, shiitake mushrooms, pineapple salsa, grilled bok choy, sesame seeds & house-made sake-teriyaki sauce served over seasoned sushi rice*

Taco Platter - 13
Baja, steak, and mahi mahi

Combination Captains Plate - 15 or so
3 thai coconut shrimps, 2 pieces of fried fish (forgot which kind), and 3 battered oysters with a choice of a side.  We choose the sweet potatoes.

We came on a Friday night and there was a good crowd.  I'll start by saying that the people there, the waiters and waitresses were alright.  They were cordial and polite, but I think that having worked in food myself, I definitely could've done a better job in the friendliness department.  The restaurant wasn't so busy as to have the servers running around, but after saying the food was coming out really quickly, he disappeared for a lonnng time and on top of that the food did not come out quickly at all.  Which is understandable for a Friday night, but it would've been cool not to have been ditched at our table.  Or maybe I'm just expecting too much.

Anyways, I'd give this place a 3 stars.  The ambiance is nice, the food is mostly good.   Except for me thinking that I'd try the California Roll Salad.  For $15, I wish I ordered the Hawaiian bowl cause I wasn't sure if I was supposed to be tasting anything.  With a decent amount of crab that they give you, and an overdose of avocado, surprisingly, and the soy-wasabi sauce, it had HARDLY any taste.  I was confused.  Is this crab ...or invisible taste? o.0 Pass.

All in all, I guess some things are hit or miss, but the Hawaiian was good and the coconut shrimps were tasty.

excerpts: Try the mahi mahi tacos - so good.
The sake sake roll is better with brown rice, and comes in eight large pieces.
mahi mahi.author: Colleen M.
mahi mahi.review:
I'm a dedicated advocate of Pacific Catch, as they seem to serve some of the freshest seafood in San Francisco. 

Their Asian fusion food is pretty well executed; the poke wasabi bowl is one of my favorites! Try the mahi mahi tacos - so good. The sake sake roll is better with brown rice, and comes in eight large pieces. End a date or outing with mochi fondue and you're good to go. 

Service has been quick and courteous every time I've been there but it is true that the tables could use a little more cleaning. I don't care though, I'm definitely coming back!

excerpts: I had the mahi mahi, and my boyfriend had the shrimps and squid special.
My mahi mahi was prepared with a green curry and paired with sweet coconut cakes.
I thought my mahi mahi was so fresh that the green curry, once again, overpowered the freshness of the fish.
mahi mahi.author: Sharon C.
mahi mahi.review:
If you like fusion seafood, then I would highly recommend this restaurant.  I personally like my fresh seafood to be prepared as simple as possible (fresh seafood shouldn't require much preparation, in my humble opinion.) 

We had the grilled shrimps and mixed seafood ceviche as appetizers.   The shrimps are highly recommended.  The ceviche is prepared in a mango salsa, which I thought overpowered the flavors of the seafood.  The ceviche was also served with purple yam chips, which was not crispy or sturdy enough to hold the heavy salsa (heavy due to the mango puree.) 

I had the mahi mahi, and my boyfriend had the shrimps and squid special.  My mahi mahi was prepared with a green curry and paired with sweet coconut cakes.  I thought my mahi mahi was so fresh that the green curry, once again, overpowered the freshness of the fish.  Coconut cakes were different, but nothing to write home (or yelp, in this case) about... 

Overall, I would not visit this restaurant again unless I am in the neighborhood and was starving and was craving some fusion seafood.

excerpts: I went with the mahi mahi (on special) and was pleasantly surprised at how delicate it tasted: not at all chewy or meaty like I'd had at other places.
Really generous portion size, too!
mahi mahi.author: Justine M.
mahi mahi.review:
We were a little wary about trying this place out after reading several sub-par reviews, but I'm glad to say our experience was fantastic all around. Shared the carrot ginger soup to start, which had a very robust -- but not too overwhelming -- flavor that complemented the coconut shrimp really nicely. I was also impressed with our waitress's wine recommendation, as the sauvignon blanc she suggested went perfectly with the food I ordered. 

I went with the mahi mahi (on special) and was pleasantly surprised at how delicate it tasted: not at all chewy or meaty like I'd had at other places. Really generous portion size, too! My better half went with the ahi tuna sandwich; given that he inhaled it in under 2 minutes, I'd venture to say he really enjoyed it. 

So overall, excellent service and food for the price -- looking forward to our next visit!

excerpts: my sister had the mahi mahi sandwich and that was really good too.
The best part was the bread pudding with the vanilla ice cream and coffee sauce....
my god that was delicious!
mahi mahi.author: Kate T.
mahi mahi.review:
It was surprisingly good! It looked like a chain restaurant so I wasn't sure about it but me and my sister were really hungry so we thought we'd give it a try. Our server was friendly and prompt and we never had to try and flag him down. 
The food was pretty good and reasonably priced. We started off with the ahi Serrano poke; the fish tasted fresh, didn't smell funny and it the flavors blended well together. I had the spicy tuna roll and that was pretty good and really filling and my sister had the mahi mahi sandwich and that was really good too. The best part was the bread pudding with the vanilla ice cream and coffee sauce....my god that was delicious!

excerpts: Spicy mahi mahi and wasabi ahi tuna always remain favorites.
mahi mahi.author: Priya C.
mahi mahi.review: I've been going to Pacific Catch for a while and am consistently impressed by the menu. Always exceptionally yummy sandwiches, fresh fish, friendly staff and good prices! I love how they offer daily special and add new variety to the menu. Spicy mahi mahi and wasabi ahi tuna always remain favorites.

excerpts: I had the Mahi Mahi rice bowl with 1/2 greens and a yummy Coconut brew from Maui.
Mind you
it's tiny and gets super busy, so don't go at high tide (excuse the pun).
mahi mahi.author: G W.
mahi mahi.review: There aren't many places in the city to get fresh seafood for a decent price and a healthy portion. I had the Mahi Mahi rice bowl with 1/2 greens and a yummy Coconut brew from Maui.  Mind you it's tiny and gets super busy, so don't go at high tide (excuse the pun).

excerpts:
mahi mahi - the best taco of the three! just tasted perfect
3.
: i'd be back only for the traditional tuna poke and the mahi mahi taco and that corn.
but with all the "OK" food i had, all that dragged this review down to a 3 star.
mahi mahi.author: Kenny L.
mahi mahi.review:
After driving by and walking by this place so many times, I finally decided to give it a try on a thursday night

Stepped in about 630ish and there was no wait, which was perfect but yet not so much a good thing too? I guess that means the place isn't as popular as i thought?

Ordered:
Poke Trio.
1. traditional - the only perfect one. nice kick to the tuna
2. lomi lomi - i love salmon but it was ruined by the saltiness of the citrus/salt
3. caifornia style - i didnt really taste the crab but it wasn't bad

Taco trio.
1. traditional - tasted ok, the serrano salsa makes it better
2. mahi mahi - the best taco of the three! just tasted perfect
3. cabo shrimp - least favorite one. it just fell apart

grilled corn w/ lime butter - this was probably the best part of the meal. that corn was some of the best corn i've ever had


OVERALL: i'd be back only for the traditional tuna poke and the mahi mahi taco and that corn. but with all the "OK" food i had, all that dragged this review down to a 3 star.

excerpts: She made great reccomendations on the Mahi Mahi taco and the Ahi Macadamia nut poke bowl.
All was delicious!
mahi mahi.author: Emi K.
mahi mahi.review: Rachel was a wonderful server! She made great reccomendations on the Mahi Mahi taco and the Ahi Macadamia nut poke bowl.  All was delicious! :)

excerpts: We also shared the sweet potato fries, ahi tuna salad, and mahi mahi tacos.
Every single dish was so delicious, and even though we were full after our meal, we didn't feel like we were about to explode
mahi mahi.author: Melinda W.
mahi mahi.review:
After many years of refusing sashimi, I've recently acquired the taste for raw fish, so my roommates decided to introduce me to the Hawaiian Poke at Pacific Catch. Wow, and I do mean WOW that is goooooood. Beautifully flavored and pairs well with the chips served in the appetizer dish. We also shared the sweet potato fries, ahi tuna salad, and mahi mahi tacos. Every single dish was so delicious, and even though we were full after our meal, we didn't feel like we were about to explode like we sometimes do after a carb binge.

Service was great and the interior was very well decorated. Made me feel like I was dining at a classy seaside resto (until I looked out the window and saw the traffic instead of the ocean, but whatever).

excerpts: Cousin had the Hawaiian Teriyaki (shiitake mushrooms, grilled pineapple, glazed carrots, edamame, crispy sweet onions, sesame seeds & teriyaki sauce) with Mahi Mahi.
Said great things about it.
mahi mahi.author: Alisha H.
mahi mahi.review:
Ate here on 3/6/13

Arrived around earlier dinner time (probably 6pm). It was busy but not crowded. We were taken to a table right away and our waiter was over to order our drinks promptly.  

Drinks: I had the Long Coast Tangerine Wheat on Tap while my cousin had a mojito. She said sadly the mojito was not up to par with other places and opted not to have a second.  

We both had the Pan-Asian Rice Bowls.  

I tried the Thai Curry (sauteed eggplant, red bell peppers, green beans, cucumber, onions, toasted coconut, crispy shallots & green curry sauce) with Tofu and Shrimp.  Was a HUGE portion and could easily have been split between the two of us.  It was delicious.  Just enough heat and kick to know it was Thai inspired but not overpowering.  Also had a ton of veggies and the rice underneath seemed to regenerate with every bite. 

Cousin had the Hawaiian Teriyaki (shiitake mushrooms, grilled pineapple, glazed carrots, edamame, crispy sweet onions, sesame seeds & teriyaki sauce) with Mahi Mahi. Said great things about it.  But again HUGE portions. 

Noise level was average, as well as the crowd. The one down would be that our waiter wasnt particularly helpful with the menu when we had questions and seemed a bit tuned out in wanting to answer our questions regarding certain dished. But all in all a pretty good choice for my first night in the city.

excerpts: I had the mahi mahi island taco, and while it was way better than their bowl, the combination of sauces was just kind of weird.
I don't think I'll come back for a third try.
Plus, their cutting fee for cakes is ridiculous!
edit: so my cutting fee was charged the first time I came here, which was a while back.
I received a message from the marketing manager, and apparently they don't charge a cutting fee anymore.
mahi mahi.author: Karen L.
mahi mahi.review:
The first time I came here I ordered one of their wasabi bowls.  It was nothing special and I left unfulfilled.  I came here recently since I thought that maybe I just ordered the wrong thing.  I had the mahi mahi island taco, and while it was way better than their bowl, the combination of sauces was just kind of weird.
I don't think I'll come back for a third try.  Plus, their cutting fee for cakes is ridiculous!
edit: so my cutting fee was charged the first time I came here, which was a while back.  I received a message from the marketing manager, and apparently they don't charge a cutting fee anymore.

excerpts: so we tried the Traditional Baja, Mahi Mahi and Cabo Shrimp.
My friend finished the entire plate plus his side salad.
I didn't =(
but I ate all the shrimp and fish
just not the tortilla.
It was good though, next time I will remind myself that I don't have a huge appetite like my friends do and order 2 tacos maybe :P
My other friend who happens to be my boyfriend got the Pan-Asian Rice Bowl.
mahi mahi.author: Czarina Y.
mahi mahi.review:
My friends and I decide that every time we decide to eat out, we need to try a new place. My friend suggested this place, we gave it a shot.

For starters, we tried one of their chalkboard specials. It's a Poke, forgot exactly what's called, but it's calamari poke. It was so good! Then I ordered their Island Tacos, for some reason, I went with their 3-taco platter just like what my friend got. It's pretty awesome that you can mix and match so we tried the Traditional Baja, Mahi Mahi and Cabo Shrimp. My friend finished the entire plate plus his side salad. I didn't =( but I ate all the shrimp and fish just not the tortilla. It was good though, next time I will remind myself that I don't have a huge appetite like my friends do and order 2 tacos maybe :P
My other friend who happens to be my boyfriend got the Pan-Asian Rice Bowl. He got the Japanese Wasabi bowl with Grilled Salmon. I personally didn't taste it, but he said it was too rich, although the salmon was still pretty good. 

Server was friendly and attends very well to our needs. Great experience! Can't complain and I will definitely go back. =)

excerpts: Let me just say, those mahi mahi tacos are life altering.
Seriously the best fish taco I've had in my entire life.
The Thai curry had an amazing flavor as well and they did not skimp on the meats.
I would highly recommend this place to anyone visiting from out of town who wants to try something delicious.
mahi mahi.author: Amanda H.
mahi mahi.review:
This review is of the food only. Service was sub par. 

Visiting from Houston for the first time and wanted to get some seafood. Unfortunately when we went they were not serving ahi tuna but we improvised. Ordered the pitcher of blueberry mojitos which tasted like heaven. Freshest mojito I have ever had. Then we got the calamari to start, and ended up ordering some fish tacos and Thai shrimp curry and added chicken. Let me just say, those mahi mahi tacos are life altering. Seriously the best fish taco I've had in my entire life. The Thai curry had an amazing flavor as well and they did not skimp on the meats. I would highly recommend this place to anyone visiting from out of town who wants to try something delicious.

excerpts: My friends also seemed to have enjoyed their mahi mahi and sandwich.
I'd be back ... for appetizers and drinks and
to people watch the folks heading in or out of the park.
mahi mahi.author: Kathleen W.
mahi mahi.review:
It looks like the type of place that cares more about décor and location than food ...  I was happy to be proven wrong.

The drink menu is delicious ... I had the Dark & Stormy ... and the part that I got to drink before spilling it all over the entire dining room was quite tasty.  Fred and Gail both got some guava cocktail that they were both raving over as well.

We shared some fries, got the poke (which was well prepared, well seasoned and was top quality ahi ... but in giant 1 inch cubes ... I would have enjoyed it much more if the tuna was cut smaller).

I got the Ahi house salad- which was pretty average - but I think priced appropriately.  My friends also seemed to have enjoyed their mahi mahi and sandwich.  I'd be back ... for appetizers and drinks and to people watch the folks heading in or out of the park.

excerpts: We also shared the Wasabi Ahi Sandwich along with the the Spicy Mahi Mahi Sandwich.
To drink I had the blood orange margarita (I highly recommend it).
mahi mahi.author: Giovanni G.
mahi mahi.review: I have lived in the neighborhood for many years, but had never eaten at Pacific Catch.  Firstly, the service was amazing.  We were seated almost immediately upon our arrival (granted it was 4pm on a Saturday).  Amanda was great, her service was fast and on point.  My partner and I shared the spicy tuna rolls which were amazing.  We also shared the Wasabi Ahi Sandwich along with the the Spicy Mahi Mahi Sandwich.  To drink I had the blood orange margarita (I highly recommend it).

excerpts: Mahi Mahi Taco with onion strings atop--delish!
N match of the Steak taco and the Mahi mahi taco (both with onion strings atop) with sweet potato fries and black beans.
The steak taco was yummy
but boy was the Mahi mahi
totally something different.
I absolutely recommend this combo!
mahi mahi.author: Kat L.
mahi mahi.review:
Mahi Mahi Taco with onion strings atop--delish! Day dream worthy! 

Did a mix N match of the Steak taco and the Mahi mahi taco (both with onion strings atop) with sweet potato fries and black beans. The steak taco was yummy but boy was the Mahi mahi totally something different. I absolutely recommend this combo! 
Sweet potato fries were just right--not too sweet and not too salty. 

Our appetizer = Seviche with sun baked chips on the side. Little too salty for my taste but I'm guessing that's the whole point with seviche? 

Service was good; we arrived around noon time and was sat instantly by the bar along the window--beautiful view of the outskirts of Golden Gate Park on a sunny day! Really loved the atmosphere of the place and I think it's mainly because of the huge, open bay windows.
