I can see this as a nice dinner place in the evening with amber lighting. Great place for family, friends or dates.

excerpts: I ordered the 3 taco plate (mahi mahi, shrimp, and traditional baja) and enjoyed the shrimp taco the best.
One of the tacos, I think the traditional baja, lacked flavor and was disappointing.
For $15, I was stuffed at the end of the meal and had no room for dessert.
The service was excellent and the staff was attentive.
mahi mahi.author: Allan L.
mahi mahi.review:
Pacific Catch sounds like a corny show from the 90s but in reality, it's a mighty fine restaurant. I enjoyed my Pacific Catch experience. We came here on a Saturday night and had a reservation, so they seated us immediately. We got lucky and found a spot in their free parking lot, but parking is incredibly difficult in this area, so give yourself enough time to find a spot.

We started off with the fried calamari. It was a healthy portion, and had a small kick to it. We were tempted to also start off with some sweet potato fries, but since many of the dinner meals come with a side of fries, we decided not to. I ordered the 3 taco plate (mahi mahi, shrimp, and traditional baja) and enjoyed the shrimp taco the best. One of the tacos, I think the traditional baja, lacked flavor and was disappointing. For $15, I was stuffed at the end of the meal and had no room for dessert. The service was excellent and the staff was attentive. I'd come here again.

My tummy gives Pacific Catch...4 Stars!

excerpts: We got the korean bbq ribs, serrano poke, and the original, mahi mahi and steak tacos with spicy fries.
The best thing for both of us by far was the poke.
I'm not a big or experienced poke fan (insert joke here) but it was very tasty with enough heat but not too much.
The thing I liked second, my friend not so much, was the ribs.
The original and mahi mahi tacos lacked really any flavor and were disappointments with the steak taco being the one taco we both agreed we wish we got instead.
This is also the first time I got black beans with no flavor.
I thought my friend was joking
but it actually had no flavor.
Just a suggestion I think they should put more cheese in with the beans since it added more flavor than without the cheese bites.
Also parking here is TOUGH!
Best parking is either at the park across the street or a couple blocks down on one of the streets.
The original and mahi mahi tacos lacked really any flavor and were disappointments with the steak taco being the one taco we both agreed we wish we got instead.
This is also the first time I got black beans with no flavor.
I thought my friend was joking
but it actually had no flavor.
Just a suggestion I think they should put more cheese in with the beans since it added more flavor than without the cheese bites.
Also parking here is TOUGH!
Best parking is either at the park across the street or a couple blocks down on one of the streets.
mahi mahi.author: Mike D.
mahi mahi.review:
Kinda torn on this since this place is like a bowl of kid cereal... wonderful candy marshmallows mixed with things we don't like as much.

Heard all the great reviews so wanted to eat here but found out the meter we paid for was only for 30 mins max. So we decided to get take out and just eat at the beach. We met a very friendly worker named Andrea? Audrea? working in the bar area who took our order, gave us tips, even felt bad for us having to do take out and gave us free sodas for our wait. We got the korean bbq ribs, serrano poke, and the original, mahi mahi and steak tacos with spicy fries. The best thing for both of us by far was the poke. I'm not a big or experienced poke fan (insert joke here) but it was very tasty with enough heat but not too much. The thing I liked second, my friend not so much, was the ribs. I loved the sauce they used and enough meat to not think you got cheated. 

On the other side we found the spicy fries cold and soggy but we drove 5 minutes away so HOPEFULLY that was just our fault and I will put that on us BUT kind of skimpy on them (i think my friend counted 10 thin fries) and it didn't have any "kick" to be called spicy in my opinion. The original and mahi mahi tacos lacked really any flavor and were disappointments with the steak taco being the one taco we both agreed we wish we got instead. This is also the first time I got black beans with no flavor. I thought my friend was joking but it actually had no flavor. Just a suggestion I think they should put more cheese in with the beans since it added more flavor than without the cheese bites. Also parking here is TOUGH! Best parking is either at the park across the street or a couple blocks down on one of the streets. The meters were 30 min max and the parking enforcement marked tires I think so knew if you put in more money and still ticket you.

Overall, I give this place 2 stars for the food we liked and had to give 1 star to Andrea or Audrea (sorry I butchered your name) since she rocks! She gave EXCELLENT customer service, was helpful, very friendly and considerate to give free sodas once she realized the customers had to go with Plan B. THAT is what customer service is all about! Other than that while there are a couple of good things to eat and we may be back we both felt it's not a MUST GO place for us.

excerpts: Each taco has a different fish, mahi mahi, cod and salmon.
mahi mahi.author: Frankie F.
mahi mahi.review:
My 2nd visit:

I was so impressed with my meal at P Catch the other night I had to try a couple things on the menu I wasn't able to the 1st time around.  So I ordered a bunch of rolls for pick up last night. 

Once again service rocks and the rolls were great. There are 8 large rolls per order, you have the option to substitute for brown rice which was a nice thing to see. Hopefully more sushi places will follow in P Catchs' footsteps and be offering this healthy option more.   

OG Review:

Pacific Catch really saved the day on Saturday night. I called in for a 15 head party the morning of and Rob, the general manger, really came through for me. He had a large party already booked but recommended I book 2 reservations and he would try to seat the parties close to each other. 

We all adjourned in the bar area for drinks. The bartender was awesome, great customer service! We were then seated and Rob reserved  2 booths next to each other. It worked out perfect because we used 1 booth as the kids table and the other for the 8 adults. 

There are peeled soy beans and pretzel gold fish on the tables to start munching. The menu rocks!  You can order sushi rolls, and sashimi for the sushi lover but for the not so seasoned raw fish eater there are teriyaki bowls and great specials available as well. I started with the seaweed salad and clam miso, so good. The table ordered the fried calamari which was liked by everybody. Watch out!  It comes with a spicy creamy dipping sauce which was received well, but it is hot! 

The tacos were a favorite of the group. Each taco has a different fish, mahi mahi, cod and salmon. They come with sweet potato fries, yum! I had the Surf and Turf, for 19.95, amazing!  The surf was shrimp with 2 skewers loaded, about 6 shrimp to a skewer. The meat was seasoned and juicy, very good. The entree also came with fried shoestring onions and pineapple fried rice, you have the option to substitute for plain brown rice. Large portion and great price! 

The staff brought out a complimentary dessert for the birthday girl. I didn't try any but I have a pic I'll attach. It looked fantastic and finished the night off perfectly. 

We had a great time and the staff was just great to us. Very accommodating. I will definitely be back and I love that it is so close to home!

excerpts: For my entree, I had the mahi mahi, which was served with amazing sweet potato fries, a delicious tomatillo sauce, and fresh grilled vegetables.
So delicious!
mahi mahi.author: Noelle T.
mahi mahi.review:
My husband and I have eaten at Pacific Catch on our last two trips to San Francisco after getting lost, being crabby hungry, and stumbling across this gem last summer.  We loved it so much the first time that we made sure to make it a part of our vacation itinerary.

The food here is amazing!  Both times, I have tried things off of their seasonal menu.  The first time we went there, I tried items on their chalkboard menu that was Peruvian themed, and my husband ordered Korean barbeque.  On this last trip, we shared the shrimp coctel that was served with a mini shot of tequila.  For my entree, I had the mahi mahi, which was served with amazing sweet potato fries, a delicious tomatillo sauce, and fresh grilled vegetables. So delicious!  My husband got the salmon that came with rice and vegetables.  

The real star of the meal is the dessert!  Both times, we have had the fried dulce de leche.  It is literally the most incredible dessert ever.  It's rich, creamy, cheesecakey, gooey, and it's served with caramel sauce and vanilla ice cream.

I will definitely go back to this restaurant again!

excerpts: My in-laws are in love with the mahi mahi tacos!
Even better, the restaurant is exceptionally able to accommodate folks with specific dietary needs.
The "Nojito" (non-alcoholic mojito) is excellent, and they have a gluten-free menu for those who need it!
Enjoy!!!
mahi mahi.author: Sandra H.
mahi mahi.review:
While I don't usually love chains, I have always been pleased when eating here.  Although the space is very large, the tables feel intimate and the staff are always very helpful.  While the food can be over-salted, especially the poke ceviche and some of the glazes on the sushi, in general everything is great.  My in-laws are in love with the mahi mahi tacos!  
Even better, the restaurant is exceptionally able to accommodate folks with specific dietary needs.  The "Nojito" (non-alcoholic mojito) is excellent, and they have a gluten-free menu for those who need it!  Enjoy!!!

excerpts: I tried all 3 of the seafood tacos (fried fish, shrimp, and mahi mahi) and have to say they were waaaaay too bland.
mahi mahi.author: Nelson S.
mahi mahi.review:
First of all, the waitress at our particular table never once smiled. Thats kinda weird, especially since all the other waitstaff were smiling up a storm. It looked like they might have been a little understaffed, but even still she just wasnt that great of a waitress.

Except for the black beans and sweet potatoe fries, this place was amazingly mediocre. I tried all 3 of the seafood tacos (fried fish, shrimp, and mahi mahi) and have to say they were waaaaay too bland. All I could taste was sauce, I almost forgot there was fish in there. 

But,  the sweet potatoe fries and black beans were FANTASTIC! Or maybe I only thought they were good because they were the only thing on my plate that had any flavor...

The drinks were pretty awesome though, if I do come back it will solely be to get drunk. 

 In the end the hostess was the most attractive thing they had to offer.

excerpts:
The mahi mahi had that gas fired grill taste I don't know if they have a gas grill but whatever seasoning they use maybe they need to change to hardwood seasoning instead of gas seasoning.
The taco platter was yummie but the single shells fall apart as soon as you think about picking them up. 
There is something to be said for doubling the shells.
Ben our bartender was great attentive even though he was pretty busy behind the bar.
Overall great experience would go again for the free tuna poke but may not stay for an entree.
mahi mahi.author: Lawrence T.
mahi mahi.review:
Thank you Yelp for the free appetizer. After having the tuna poke at the holiday party we just had to have it again. The poke is fantastic, love it, finger lick'n good.
The mahi mahi had that gas fired grill taste I don't know if they have a gas grill but whatever seasoning they use maybe they need to change to hardwood seasoning instead of gas seasoning.
The taco platter was yummie but the single shells fall apart as soon as you think about picking them up. There is something to be said for doubling the shells.
Ben our bartender was great attentive even though he was pretty busy behind the bar.
Overall great experience would go again for the free tuna poke but may not stay for an entree.

excerpts: I ordered the 3 taco platter with a shrimp taco, a fish taco, and the mahi mahi taco.
The shrimp and fish tacos were well cooked and perfectly seasoned
but I was disappointed that the Mahi mahi taco was cooked too long.
The meat was definitely overcooked to the point that it was a little on the rubbery side.
Aside from that blemish, everything else was good.
mahi mahi.author: Joe K.
mahi mahi.review: Many times I have driven by this place but never had a chance to go and try it. I ordered the 3 taco platter with a shrimp taco, a fish taco, and the mahi mahi taco. The shrimp and fish tacos were well cooked and perfectly seasoned but I was disappointed that the Mahi mahi taco was cooked too long. The meat was definitely overcooked to the point that it was a little on the rubbery side. Aside from that blemish, everything else was good.

excerpts: I opted for the shrimp, mahi mahi and the catch of the day which was rock cod, and the rock cod was probably my favorite.
The tacos held their form pretty well, but I still had to eat a little with my fork.
No complaints, it was equally delicious.
mahi mahi.author: Chelsea P.
mahi mahi.review:
Pretty solid.

Generous servings on the fish tacos. Big chunks of fish, lots of tomatillo sauce and aoili (I had to scrape some off). I opted for the shrimp, mahi mahi and the catch of the day which was rock cod, and the rock cod was probably my favorite. The tacos held their form pretty well, but I still had to eat a little with my fork. No complaints, it was equally delicious. Awesome sweet potato fries with kosher salt, a nice mildly sweet twist from the fish tacos with salsa and plenty of lime. The lemongrass mojito was sharp, and they have some pretty good beer on tap. Bomb.

Annnnnd if you snagged a goody bag at the Yelp Holiday Party this year there's a coupon for a free Hawaiian poke or shirmp ceviche appetizer with a  purchase of entree priced at $12.95 or above. The poke they had at the party had bit too much soy, but my guess is because it was made and then brought to the party (poke chunks probably dripped along the way and gathered a pool), not made to order like at the restaurant. The poke we ordered was plump and by no means soggy. Served with plenty of fried won tons. MMMM.

I wouldn't come here for sushi, but they do seafood well and the staff (including the chefs they had at PLEY!) were very friendly. Not the decor, but the menu seemed a little touristy and like a chain (a la Elephant Bar and such), but the food was good. They offer a late night happy hour on the weekend (after 10pm, but before they close at 11pm) with cheap appetizers and drinks, definitely a great deal. There's even a parking lot for customers. How awesome is that?!

excerpts: I ordered the triple taco mahi mahi platter for $14.50.
The tacos were very good.
The fish was hot and crispy and the flavors were all around delightful.
mahi mahi.author: Dorian T.
mahi mahi.review:
Came here tonight for my friend's graduation dinner.

I ordered the triple taco mahi mahi platter for $14.50. The tacos were very good. The fish was hot and crispy and the flavors were all around delightful. The sweet potato fries however, unlike Helen V.'s review, were cold. 

The waitress was very friendly, even joking around with some of my friends and I. Although the price for the food was fair, it did not wow me to the point where finding parking was worth being a regular here.

However, they do have a happy hour menu and I probably will come back for that. Till then - Happy Dining!

Oh, and I found out one of the waitresses do not like spicy sauce, and no I was not hitting on her.

excerpts: My husband and his friend had the spicy mahi mahi sandwich and both said it was lukewarm.
mahi mahi.author: Mrs F.
mahi mahi.review:
We returned on a Saturday at 1.30 with two friends and the ankle biter.  The food was less awesome than last time (seems to be the case with a lot of our reviews).  The fries were lukewarm!  All of our fries were lukewarm, it was disappointing.  My husband and his friend had the spicy mahi mahi sandwich and both said it was lukewarm.  Our friend said it was better at the Marina location.  

I still like this place though, so I will chalk it up to we went at an off time (but it was tres busy at 1.30 on a Saturday).  Maybe next time will return at prime lunch time and if we get lukewarm food again, we will speak out.

excerpts: Fish taco platter--mahi mahi and fried shrimp tacos.
Squirt those bad boys with some lime and they're ready to go!
Comes with a small side salad and black beans.
mahi mahi.author: Kristine W.
mahi mahi.review:
ALL my cravings are always satisfied here. Probably because their menu is so random--Asian-Latin-whatever...it's all about the Benjamins...err, I mean the FISHIES!

First thing's first--FREE edamame and those cute little Goldfish pretzels!

Fish taco platter--mahi mahi and fried shrimp tacos. Squirt those bad boys with some lime and they're ready to go! Comes with a small side salad and black beans. Probably my favorite side salad ever.

Spicy tuna roll. Actually spicy. I'm always a sucker for maguro with daikon sprouts. Oh and it's a honker of a roll.

GINGER WHISKEY MOJITO! Probably one of THE best cocktails I've ever had. Refreshing, yet warm and earthy from the whiskey and mint. MUST TRY!

Service. On par, per usual.

Basically, I LOVE PC! Where else can you get tacos, fries, sushi, and some bomb-ass cocktails (yes, I said "bomb-ass")? It's the total package!

excerpts: I had a 3-taco platter which included a mahi mahi taco, a traditional baja taco, and a cabo shrimp taco.
All tasty, but unremarkable.
And that pretty much sums up the place: decent asian fusion seafood fare, AWESOME life lessons.
mahi mahi.author: Derek L.
mahi mahi.review:
Halfway through our dinner on Christmas eve with my close group of friends, the waiter asked us if it was a special occasion. We said no, we only wanted to see each other for the holidays. Then he imparted some endearing wisdom about how true friends are hard to find, and that you should hold on to the ones you care about. His words were heartfelt, but too bad they weren't on the menu.

The food was maybe a step above your run-of-the-mill sit down chain restaurant. I had a 3-taco platter which included a mahi mahi taco, a traditional baja taco, and a cabo shrimp taco. All tasty, but unremarkable. And that pretty much sums up the place: decent asian fusion seafood fare, AWESOME life lessons.

excerpts: last time i was there the catch of the day was red snapper, which is a nice light versatile fish for cooking, they were also offering opah and something else that was NOT swordfish or mahi mahi.
it is spacious, and they have a full bar.
my margarita tasted like honey.
and the service is helpful, efficient and good looking.
thanks for reading.
mahi mahi.author: yayoi s.
mahi mahi.review:
I love this menu, because there are times when i am at a resto, and i think to myself, why didn't i speak up! i wanted to eat this or that.  
i cannot have that excuse because they have mexi, japi, ameri, fryzi,
sure it is not the authentic creme of the milk of any of those cuisines, but everything they have to offer is still tasty and jammin.
yes, their poke is good with those fried bubbly crackly things.  they use lil sprigs of watercress as garnish for everything.  i usually get some sort of fried fish or fries and they don't disappoint.  last time i was there the catch of the day was red snapper, which is a nice light versatile fish for cooking, they were also offering opah and something else that was NOT swordfish or mahi mahi.  
it is spacious, and they have a full bar.  my margarita tasted like honey.  and the service is helpful, efficient and good looking.
thanks for reading.

excerpts: Mahi Mahi Bowl.
Etc.
mahi mahi.author: Liane T.
mahi mahi.review:
I found this place courtesy of you yelpers out there, and because of you all it is now one of my favorites :)

I took my boyfriend out here for a lunch date in the city. When you first walk in, the ambiance is something of it's own. It has a semi-formal feel, and then it has a casual feel and  I like the fusion of different asian decor. It was rather light out in the day so the sun coming in also had a nice feel. 

Our server was one of the most hospitable that I've ever encountered in my dining out life. He was welcoming since we were new to the place and made recommendations accordingly. He even brought out some of the drink samples (non alcoholic haha mind you) so we could figure out what we'd like. 

We had the thai coconut shrimp appetizer which was delicious, but rather on the small side. My bf has the mixed fish basket and I ordered the fried oyster basket. And they both came with the sweet potato fries! It was so tasty & delicious! The jalapeno tartar sauce was also a nice touch. Oh, and the tropical tea + lemongrass tea fused together tastes like an arnold palmer :) jus thought i'd mix both to give it a try.

I would definitely recommend this place to anyone and everyone. Great service, great ambiance. Parking is a little of a pain but hey, it's the city, it's expected. 

Note to self: A million more things to try next time. Hawaiian Poke. Mahi Mahi Bowl. Etc.

excerpts:
I wanted to order the hawaiian mahi mahi, but it just happens that they were running low on fish that day or something because upon ordering, our waitress announced that they ran out of mahi mahi and a LONG list of other items :*(

So to replace my mahi, i got the mong chong fish.
mahi mahi.author: Rosalynn D.
mahi mahi.review:
I came here last night for my birthday dinner with my girls and i thought the food was pretty good. I wanted to order the hawaiian mahi mahi, but it just happens that they were running low on fish that day or something because upon ordering, our waitress announced that they ran out of mahi mahi and a LONG list of other items :*(

So to replace my mahi, i got the mong chong fish. i dont know what that is but it sure ain't the same as mahi. oh well. i'll try back another time. The pineapple fried rice was just okk...it was a bit on the soggy side though, so try to avoid that & their weak skinny onion rings.

It was so hard to choose what I wanted from the menu since everything sounded so good but I have to come back next time to try their fish tacos. I'm craving for some fish tacos & sweet potato fries right now! yum! Oh my friend got the lemongrass iced tea along with added sweeteners & it was so refreshing!

Overall, i thought this place was decent and accommodating to our party of 12 even though we all arrived at different times. damn asians.

i give it a 3.5

excerpts: and my friend had a mahi-mahi sandwich ($8-$10, not on the menu - mahi mahi, sprouts, avocado, and other apparently delicious accoutrement).
mahi mahi.author: Jennie K.
mahi mahi.review:
Crispy.  Oysters.  Crispy oysters crispy oysters crispy oysters CRISPYOYSTERS YAY!

I've meant to come here for ages, on the recommendation of one of my foodie friends.  I'm glad I finally did.  I understand this is a local chain, but don't let that deter you: it might be a little sanitized and carefully-put-together, but the food is awesome.

I had the "mixed catch basket" ($13.95) and my friend had a mahi-mahi sandwich ($8-$10, not on the menu - mahi mahi, sprouts, avocado, and other apparently delicious accoutrement).  The mixed catch basket has 3-4 crispy oysters (did I mention how much I loved those?), three big pieces of the catch of the day, a skewer of coconut shrimp, and your choice of fries (sweet potato!).  There were also two sauces - one was a ginger-wasabi cream sauce, and the other was a sweet and spicy sauce.

I don't eat much normally, but I scarfed that basket of goodness down like a thirteen-year-old-boy-undergoing-a-growth-spurt.   It was worth every penny.  

At 5pm on a Thursday it was practically empty, and there seemed to be acres of seating.  The decor is really pretty (I want the graduated hanging-blue-bottle light fixtures, over the bar, for my apartment, please), the service was pleasant, and our food came out quite fast.  

I balk a little at a $6 glass of wine, but I was headed to the Academy of Sciences Nightlife, where wine is $8/glass... so it's all relative, I suppose.

And did I mention the crispy oysters?  I think my only complaint was that there weren't more.  To eat on the epic journey to CAS, and to eat on the way back, and to eat for breakfast, and oh for heaven's sake...why don't I have a personal chef?

EDIT - 03/30/09 --
I took my dad, uncle, and assorted other people here on a Saturday night.  They were pretty good about serving a party of 8, and everyone seemed to enjoy the food.

Two things I wanted to update about: 
1. The spicy pacific martini.  Holy CRAP, that is good.  Mango puree, vodka, and serrano chili - the perfect fruit drink, with a spicy kick.  Goes so well with seafood, and worth the $8 (I don't say that lightly, either).

2. Food mixup.  When I pointed out to the server that my mixed catch basket lacked crispy oysters (ack!) she was going to bring me a side of them, but ended up bringing me another entire entree!  I was really pleased, and it never hurts to bring home leftovers.

excerpts: I had the macadamian crusted mahi mahi; the outer crust was awesome and the nuts gave it an extra crunch.
I gave 4 stars because they were out of the malasadas
so I had to order a substitute dessert like the mochi
and then they were out of the vanilla mochi, so
I ordered the brownie with ice cream  and it was very decadent.
The mochi may have come from Trader Joes freezers and it was okay.
Parking had to be in the park.
mahi mahi.author: h f.
mahi mahi.review: I had the macadamian crusted mahi mahi; the outer crust was awesome and the nuts gave it an extra crunch.  I gave 4 stars because they were out of the malasadas so I had to order a substitute dessert like the mochi and then they were out of the vanilla mochi, so I ordered the brownie with ice cream  and it was very decadent. The mochi may have come from Trader Joes freezers and it was okay. Parking had to be in the park.

excerpts: I ordered the mahi mahi special.
The mahi mahi was small, and there was a whole lot of grilled onions.
I wasn't a fan of the grilled onions.
mahi mahi.author: Thuy H.
mahi mahi.review:
Started off with the rare ahi tuna over a small salad: this was really good.  The tuna was fresh and tasty.  The salad was light and not overwhelming with dressing.  It's how a starter should be, it left me wanting more.

I ordered the mahi mahi special.  The mahi mahi was small, and there was a whole lot of grilled onions.  I wasn't a fan of the grilled onions.  What I should have done was substitute it for the sweet potato fries, but I didn't know how popular they were until it was too late.

I was so disappointed in my meal I was tempted to try the vietnamese special sandwich.  It seemed as if everyone had ordered it and  it looked so good!

Our waitress wasn't so nice.  Service was a little slow.

excerpts: the fish sandwiches are constructed well, but the mahi mahi inside lacked flavor and the texture was a bit dry; sweet potato french fries on the side were good as well.
mahi mahi.author: Peter T.
mahi mahi.review:
ambiance was lovely, windows adorn the interior with ample light, and views of golden gate park directly across the street.

the ahi poke is nearly indistinguishable from the Hawaiian original. 

the fish sandwiches are constructed well, but the mahi mahi inside lacked flavor and the texture was a bit dry; sweet potato french fries on the side were good as well.

desert was awesome, caramel something with ice cream and mango passion fruit cheese cake. 

appetizer + 2 sandwiches + 2 deserts = 52 bucks.. not bad at all

excerpts: On the good side, my mahi mahi rice bowl was delicious as was my Kamikaze Bloody Mary (with wasabi,  yummm).
I definitely recommend their drinks but most of the food fell way short.
mahi mahi.author: Lauren B.
mahi mahi.review:
I want to give this place more stars but it just really didn't live up to my expectations. The waiter, though very friendly and well-meaning, was a complete bubble brain and seemed confused the whole time. Half of our orders came out 20 minutes before the rest so some of us were done before the others even got their food. The "spicy" fries were wayyy over seasoned (and not spicy at all) and the sweet potato fries (supposedly one of their specialities) weren't very special at all. Also, their sushi was not good and I would not recommend it at all. The tacos were pretty yummy but too dry. 

On the good side, my mahi mahi rice bowl was delicious as was my Kamikaze Bloody Mary (with wasabi,  yummm). I definitely recommend their drinks but most of the food fell way short.

excerpts: We had the Mahi Mahi, which was super fresh, and "Surf & Turf", also delicious!
mahi mahi.author: Lisa W.
mahi mahi.review:
I've passed this place a million times and we finally decided to try it tonight. It was way better than I expected. Good drinks (Pisco Punch!) and really great dishes. We had the Mahi Mahi, which was super fresh, and "Surf & Turf", also delicious!

A lot of people around us were having sushi and I think this would be an excellent place for something light with drinks after a day spent in the park.

excerpts: I ordered the mahi mahi teriyaki bowl with pineapple fried rice and really enjoyed it.
The boyfriend ordered the fish and chips.
AH?
Fish you say?!
YES FISH!!
And guess what?
He LIKED it!
For dessert, we had the Dulce de leche Spring rolls.
MM MM GOOD!!
mahi mahi.author: Amy A.
mahi mahi.review:
My boyfriend HATES fish. As long as I've known him he has refused to eat fish. I, however, am a crafty and creative girl and I SWORE that ONE DAY I would get him to enjoy fish!
So...
One day we both had a sweet potato craving and I casually mentioned that there was a place near the park where we could eat and take a casual stroll. It was a nice day so he agreed. Ah ha! After 4 years, my plan was working..

We came in and sat down but we were sat in these super uncomfortable tall akward wicker chairs. "Surprise Boyfriend! We're at a fish place!"
Then we were served edamame and cute fishy crackers which was awesome because we were starving and made up for the crappy seating. I ordered some kind of ginger-tini and the boyfriend ordered a dark and stormy. Both were fabulous! The drinks were top notch! 
The two of us split a sweet potato basket of fries and loved it. Great dipping sauces!
I ordered the mahi mahi teriyaki bowl with pineapple fried rice and really enjoyed it. The boyfriend ordered the fish and chips. AH? Fish you say?! YES FISH!! And guess what? He LIKED it! 
For dessert, we had the Dulce de leche Spring rolls. MM MM GOOD!! If your thinking of going, make reservations.

***Update: The boyfriend took me here for Valentines day and it was one of the best dates ever! We had a cute corner table with candle light and it was very romantic. Waitress was sweet and attentive while still giving us plenty of time to stare deeply in each others eyes. The tokyo salmon was great but the calamari was not so great. Still love the sweet potato fries and next time I will try the sushi which looks yummy. ****

excerpts: Taco platter with the Mahi Mahi which comes with Sweet Potato Fries.
(The fries were amazing!
Definitely my favorite part of my meal.

The tacos were also pretty flavorful)
-Skirt Steak Teriyaki bowl (Felt like we could get this as part of a Bento box at any Japanese restaurant.) 
-Spicy
Mahi Mahi sandwhich (This was also superb.
It came with avocados which added so much flavor.)
-Skinny
Dip ON TAP!!!
And the chorus begins to sing...
mahi mahi.author: Helen V.
mahi mahi.review:
I came with my parents around 7:30 and were told we had to wait 25 minutes.  So we sat down grabbed a menu and decided what we wanted for dinner.  No more than 10 minutes later, our table was ready.  This place we off to a good start.  But it took forever for our food to come!  Tables that were seated after us...got their food before us!  ???  But back to the food.  We ordered...

-Calamari (Not seasoned well enough for me and a little dry)
-Two Taco platter with the Mahi Mahi which comes with Sweet Potato Fries.  (The fries were amazing!  Definitely my favorite part of my meal.  The tacos were also pretty flavorful)
-Skirt Steak Teriyaki bowl (Felt like we could get this as part of a Bento box at any Japanese restaurant.) 
-Spicy Mahi Mahi sandwhich (This was also superb.  It came with avocados which added so much flavor.)
-Skinny Dip ON TAP!!! *And the chorus begins to sing...*

Overall a decent dinner at Pacific Catch.  The food was good for the price we paid; however, nothing really "caught" my attention.  I did notice that they have Happy Hour daily and will probably come back to try that!

excerpts: Bubs got the hawaiian mahi mahi which was a bit too grilled and smokey for our taste.
mahi mahi.author: Jo M.
mahi mahi.review:
i got the mixed basket of fish, coconut shrimp, and oysters, with sweet potato french fries.  It was delicious.  Bubs got the hawaiian mahi mahi which was a bit too grilled and smokey for our taste.  But it came with pineapple rice which was yum.  

for desert we had the macadamia nut brownie sundae, with toasted almonds and fudge.  that was incredibly delicious and worth the trip alone!  

the atmosphere is laid back but trendy-ish.  the waiter looked like ellen degeneris and was super nice!

excerpts: I started off small, I got their 3 tacos; two chicken and one mahi mahi.
All I have to say is that the mahi mahi is far better than the chicken!
mahi mahi.author: Hedieh G.
mahi mahi.review:
First and foremost, I am not a big seafood fan. After years of my boyfriend trying to get me to go, I finally decided to give them a shot. I started off small, I got their 3 tacos; two chicken and one mahi mahi. All I have to say is that the mahi mahi is far better than the chicken! But what made me an immediate fan was their fried dulce de leche spring rolls. I drool at the thought of them, they are that delicious. The springrolls are crunchy on the outside, warm and gooey on the inside and here's the kicker, a really yummy scoop of ice cream with a caramel drizzle. This thing is a heart attack on a plate, but a heart attack that I'm willing to suffer. 

My second visit I decided that since I had a great experience with their seafood the first time, that I would try experimenting something new. I ordered the seared ahi macadamia, the best ahi I've ever had. For those of you who don't like ahi because of it's aftertaste or "fishy" taste, this dish does not have anything like that. The ahi has a yummy mango thai citrus salad that really compliments the ahi and is delicious!

The bar scene can be really fun, it's nice to stop by, have an appetizer and beer and watch the local games. 

As far of prices, for a party of 2 with 2-3 drinks total, one appetizer, 2 entrees, dessert and coffee with run you close to $80, so for a full course meal it's not that pricey!

excerpts: Her two kids had the salmon sandwhich and mahi mahi and both were very happy with their dishes as well.
We hadn't seen each other in years and we were left to sit and talk and catch up after dinner, not rushed out at all (it was a slow night, plenty of open tables).
I'm glad I gave this place another shot.

After my last review I doubt I would, and the manager messaged me to help try and rectify the situation, which I appreciated (although I couldn't help her with any more info to pinpoint my lousy server).
She was eager to not have it happen again, so hopefully everyone got a reminder on how to be a great server.
All I know is that I certainly enjoyed ours last night, so thanks!
mahi mahi.author: Jen K.
mahi mahi.review:
Ok, I came her again last night.  Despite what my earlier review said.  Some friends from out of town were visiting and wanted seafood.  Since I live in Inner Sunset, Pacific Catch is really the only option.  So, what the hell, give it another try.

OMG, SUCH a better experience.

We had a very friendly waiter who was very helpful with suggestions and attentive but not obtrusive.  The food the second time around was MUCH better as well.  The seafood was fresh, cooked just right and served very quickly.  I had the Salmon Teriyaki bowl and it was huge, nice to bring home leftovers for lunch!  My friend had the thai salmon and really enjoyed her dish as well.  Her two kids had the salmon sandwhich and mahi mahi and both were very happy with their dishes as well.  We hadn't seen each other in years and we were left to sit and talk and catch up after dinner, not rushed out at all (it was a slow night, plenty of open tables).  I'm glad I gave this place another shot.  After my last review I doubt I would, and the manager messaged me to help try and rectify the situation, which I appreciated (although I couldn't help her with any more info to pinpoint my lousy server).  She was eager to not have it happen again, so hopefully everyone got a reminder on how to be a great server.  All I know is that I certainly enjoyed ours last night, so thanks!

excerpts: I ordered the three tacos, one shrimp, one steak, and one mahi mahi.
I would say the fish taco was the best and the Tangerine wheat bear was great!
Love the unlimited edamame!
Definitely recommend to all if your hungry!
Just a little full right now!
mahi mahi.author: Eric H.
mahi mahi.review: Just finished an excellent meal here! Used a complimentary calamari coupon for checking in with foursquare to start as an appetizer. I ordered the three tacos, one shrimp, one steak, and one mahi mahi. I would say the fish taco was the best and the Tangerine wheat bear was great! Love the unlimited edamame! Definitely recommend to all if your hungry! Just a little full right now!

excerpts: One grilled mahi mahi and one cabo shrimp with a side of sweet potato fries.
mahi mahi.author: BrElla4eva H.
mahi mahi.review:
I'd really give this place 3 1/2 stars...4 stars for food, 3 stars for the service. I actually really like this restaurant. The place is pretty casual, but fun. A good spot to get together with a small group of friends for a reasonably priced dinner. The food was delicious, but the service was mediocre. I think our server was new to the job so I felt bad for him. . We ordered the hawaiian poke to start off but didn't end up actually getting it till a little bit after our server came out with our entrees. But better late than never because it was ooh so good. Very fresh and flavorful. After contemplating about the many enticing choices on the menu, I opted for the island tacos for my main entree. One grilled mahi mahi and one cabo shrimp with a side of sweet potato fries. Definite thumbs up! 

I do need to mention a strange but funny incident we had while dining here. As we were all finishing up our food, one of my friends was drinking waster out of his glass...when all of a sudden I see a big splash. At first I thought he dropped his glass of water but it turned out that the bottom of his glass broke and all the ice and water spilled out! And let me just tell you...it broke just on the bottom of the glass in almost a perfect, complete circle! How weird is that!?! Luckily he already finished his meal. We, of course, complained to our server and he was able to get his meal for free. He mentioned that it probably happened because the glass was hot when they poured in cold water.

Now for dessert...always my favorite part! The four of us shared 2 different plates....the mochi fondue and the fried dulce de leche spring rolls. Both were scrumptious! I never thought of dipping mochi ice cream balls in hot chocolate sauce but it is dee-lish!

YES, I'd come back to this place and YES, I recommend it!

excerpts: We ordered a set of Mahi Mahi tacos containing two tacos with sweet potato fries, a four piece Fish and Chip set with regular fries and the Hawaiian Poke as an appetizer.
The Hawaiian Poke was a first for me.
It's essentially tuna sashimi that is drowned in soy sauce and sesame seed oil.
It comes with this wonton strip-like crackers that are light and crunchy, which you eat with the tuna just like chips to salsa.
At first try, it's very flavorful with the soft, creamy texture of the tuna mixed with the crunchy...chip?
The soy sauce and sesame seed oil work
well together, but only on the top most portion of the tuna.
Most of the sauce stayed at the bottom, which made the tuna at the bottom too salty.
It would be better if the tuna were equally marinated instead of having a special few that literally drowned in its own sauce.
So each of us had a basket with one Mahi Mahi Taco and a basket with Fish and Chips.
I love the sweet potato fries!
Sweet and soft goodness in a crispy outer crust!
It's definitely a good alternative to the regular potato fries, but good thing
it's an option.
I still prefer the ol' fashioned potato fries.
Still sweet potato fries...good alternative.
The Mahi Mahi Tacos were good.
The Mahi Mahi was grilled, of course, instead of the usual beer battered filet.
Everything on the taco was well-balanced and the fish was light.
There's a picture with a couple of tacos dressed with a generous portion of guacamole.
mahi mahi.author: Jeremy L.
mahi mahi.review:
I've always wanted to try Pacific Catch from every moment that I have driving on 9th from Golden Gate Park! Well, I got my chance when I wanted Fish and Chips and this was the place my girlfriend and I decided to go to!

First thing's first, it was awesome how they could call you when your seat is ready. It was a twenty minute wait for us, so we opt for them to call us and took a stroll along Irving for the duration of the time. 

After being seating, I was taken away from the comfortable booth seats! I could lean back a little for a more relax sitting position, but note that it works for someone my height (at about 5'10''). Either way, it's very comfortable. 

We ordered a set of Mahi Mahi tacos containing two tacos with sweet potato fries, a four piece Fish and Chip set with regular fries and the Hawaiian Poke as an appetizer. 

The Hawaiian Poke was a first for me. It's essentially tuna sashimi that is drowned in soy sauce and sesame seed oil. It comes with this wonton strip-like crackers that are light and crunchy, which you eat with the tuna just like chips to salsa. At first try, it's very flavorful with the soft, creamy texture of the tuna mixed with the crunchy...chip? The soy sauce and sesame seed oil work well together, but only on the top most portion of the tuna. Most of the sauce stayed at the bottom, which made the tuna at the bottom too salty. It would be better if the tuna were equally marinated instead of having a special few that literally drowned in its own sauce. Recommended dish, but eat in moderate for its sodium content.

The entrees were both great and it was pleasant of the waiting staff to separate the taco and fish for the both of us since we wanted to share. So each of us had a basket with one Mahi Mahi Taco and a basket with Fish and Chips. 

I love the sweet potato fries! Sweet and soft goodness in a crispy outer crust! It's definitely a good alternative to the regular potato fries, but good thing it's an option. I still prefer the ol' fashioned potato fries. Still sweet potato fries...good alternative.

The Mahi Mahi Tacos were good. The Mahi Mahi was grilled, of course, instead of the usual beer battered filet. Everything on the taco was well-balanced and the fish was light. There's a picture with a couple of tacos dressed with a generous portion of guacamole. Looks just like that, but with grilled white fish filet instead. 

Fish and Chips are like any other Fish and Chips. The only problem I had with it was the thickness of the batter. A little too thin for me. I drizzled some lemon over the fish and the batter couldn't hold the fish together, so it became a messy basket of fish meat and batter. The good part about it: the freshness of the fish, which was Tilapia that night (I think). 

Overall, I thought it was a delightful experience eating at Pacific Catch. There are sushi and rolls on the menu, but I learn to have sushi elsewhere for now. The tacos and fish and chips are something to try out and there are many other options to choose from. The price is reasonable with the more expensive choice under the special catch of the day. I would come back again for another try.

excerpts: The Mahi Mahi was overly seasoned and the fish got lost in the dish.
mahi mahi.author: OfLit G.
mahi mahi.review:
We were looking for inexpensive seafood and that's what we got.
The place was clean and the service was friendly and attentive.
We started with the miso soup which was nice and a little fishy (in a good way), the Hawaiian Poke which was fresh enough but really not very well cut - it had unchewable bits, which is a big no-no in raw fish. The Mahi Mahi was overly seasoned and the fish got lost in the dish. The grilled salmon salad was nice except that the fish was lacking in flavor, but we were pleasantly surprised by the California Crab & Avocado salad which was just right! Everybody LOVED the sweet potato fries - yum!
All in all, a decent value for your money in the seafood scene.

excerpts: 1 BBQ salmon with corn salsa and lime crema, 1 tropical grilled shrimp with mango salsa, and 1 spice-rubbed grilled mahi mahi with avocado tomatilla salsa.
Now let me first say that I am a little biased when it comes to fish tacos.
I've been a long time advocate for Wahoo's fish tacos and nothing has ever compared to their tacos.
Pacific catch however served me some really tasty fish tacos, which can definitely compete with Wahoo's.
I really appreciated the nice quality of salsas and toppings that went into the tacos.
They worked well and tasted great with the various fish and shrimp pairings.
mahi mahi.author: Timothy C.
mahi mahi.review:
Pacific Catch just recently opened on 9t Street and we decided to go try it for a mellow weekend lunch.  We weren't sure what to expect because it was new, but the online menu sure looked great.

The decor is modern and clean, providing a rather trendy atmosphere.  The place wasn't crowded when we came so we didn't have to wait for a table, which is always nice.  We saw one table had ordered the Baja Shrimp Ceviche so we decided to start with that.   The presentation was really cool.  The ceviche, stuffed full of shrimp and avocado, was served in a tall martini glass with a pile of tortilla chips sprawled around the base.  The best thing about this dish was how much shrimp they gave us!  It's always annoying when you pay a premium for a shrimp entre and get 3 shrimp.  We counted each shrimp as we were going through the ceviche, they were good sized shrimp mind you, and ended up with almost 20! The chef was overly generous with the shrimp for the price we payed.

For my entre, I went with 3 tacos; 1 BBQ salmon with corn salsa and lime crema, 1 tropical grilled shrimp with mango salsa, and 1 spice-rubbed grilled mahi mahi with avocado tomatilla salsa.  Now let me first say that I am a little biased when it comes to fish tacos.  I've been a long time advocate for Wahoo's fish tacos and nothing has ever compared to their tacos.  Pacific catch however served me some really tasty fish tacos, which can definitely compete with Wahoo's.  I really appreciated the nice quality of salsas and toppings that went into the tacos.  They worked well and tasted great with the various fish and shrimp pairings.  I took down these bad boys so fast and had to restrain myself from ordering more!

We also ordered sweet potato fries which were good.  I tend to find any type of french fry that offers a spin off the traditional French fry (different potatoes, etc) very satisfying.

Pacific Catch is definitely a decent restaurant and we will for sure go there again.  They had other dishes, such as sushi and fancy deserts that I would also like to try.  I also noticed they had a pretty nice full bar with comfy seats and a decent happy hour.  This would be a good place to come have some drinks and a nice dinner with some friends or even a date.

excerpts: The fish tacos are always delicious; especially the Mahi Mahi Fish Taco which is one of my favorites.
mahi mahi.author: Jen Y.
mahi mahi.review:
I was excited to try the Pacific Catch on 9th because I've heard great things about the space and it's kind of a hassle to go all the way to Chestnut. The look of the restaurant is beautifully casual and comfortable with plenty of seating. For that, I give this restaurant big ups. 

Our waitress on the other hand was just blah. It looked like she cared more about socializing and dancing with her co-worker friends more than earning her tip from us. The whole time she seemed insincere from the moment she brought us our drinks to handing us the check. 

I always liked Pacific Catch's food, even though it's slightly over-priced.  The food is the same in terms of taste and the sweet potato fries (which I love w/ the wasabi aeoli) were consistantly yummy. Even though we ordered the Firecracker Salmon Roll and Spicy Tuna Roll, I don't recommend trying the sushi here. It lacks flavor, authenticity, and freshness..but I didn't expect it to be good so I wasn't surprised. The fish tacos are always delicious; especially the Mahi Mahi Fish Taco which is one of my favorites. 

The atmosphere, location, and food is great. However, the waitress we had and the sushi are not. Something else was just lacking as a whole but I can't put my finger on it. But, I will be back to this location..

Service: 2
Food: 4
Atmosphere: 4
Overall: 3.5

excerpts: My friend had the grilled mahi mahi which I tasted and thought it was good.
mahi mahi.author: Kevin L.
mahi mahi.review:
I went to Pacific Catch this evening for dinner and while I like the concept of the menu I wasn't overly impressed with my salmon teriyaki bowl. Yes it was fresh, but the rice had a bit too much sauce on it for my taste. I'm not sure if this was the reason, but I was extremely thirsty after having a few bites of my entree. Even when I got home I was thirsty. My friend had the grilled mahi mahi which I tasted and thought it was good. We got the sweet potato fries as an appetizer. While they were good I've had them elsewhere so it wasn't that exciting. The sweet potato fries don't hold their temperature long so you need to enjoy them fast.

The decor of the restaurant is eco-friendly and asian themed. They used quite a bit of bamboo throughout the restaurant and use environmentally friendly products per the insert in the menu. Overall I liked the decor and the openess of the restaurant which is a result of the high ceilings. Regardless it's nice to be able to have room when you're dining. 

Service was decent but nothing really spectacular. A manager did come by and greet us and thank us for making a reservation on OpenTable. I'm not too sure if this has anything to do with being an OpenTable VIP member. For those wondering I haven't noticed anything different when dining since being designated a VIP user.

excerpts: Everything from the spicy mahi mahi sandwich to the tuna tekka
don is good.
The new location on 9th can handle large groups but tends to get blogged down around dinner time.
You can thank the hoards of tourists scrambling for grub before tackling the City's exit points.
mahi mahi.author: MTBer I.
mahi mahi.review: Simply put, good seafood at a reasonable price.  Everything from the spicy mahi mahi sandwich to the tuna tekka don is good.  The new location on 9th can handle large groups but tends to get blogged down around dinner time.  You can thank the hoards of tourists scrambling for grub before tackling the City's exit points.

excerpts:
+ Mahi Mahi fish tacos
+ Grilled Asparagus w/ wasabi mayo dip
+ Sweet Potato Fries
+ Lemongrass Mojitos
mahi mahi.author: Tulip F.
mahi mahi.review:
+ Mahi Mahi fish tacos
+ Grilled Asparagus w/ wasabi mayo dip
+ Sweet Potato Fries
+ Lemongrass Mojitos

excerpts: I ordered the grilled mahi mahi tacos and my boyfriend ordered the coconut shrimp and fish & chips.
Our waitress came out with a mahi mahi sandwich, but she quickly brought it back in because I wanted the tacos.
When I finally received the tacos, I took a bite, and immediately discovered that the rub on the mahi mahi was kind of yucky...
Oh well... I just continued eating, but then I noticed that they left out the avocado and instead of chipotle Crema, they gave me a little drizzle of sour cream
AND they never gave me a side of black beans.
At this point, I was annoyed
and I didn't want it anymore, so I told my boyfriend to try it.
He took a couple bites and hated it.
So I told her what had been left out and that I didn't like the taco, so she asked me if I wanted a side of avocado....
NO I DON'T!!!
( I didn't yell, I was nice).
So she tried giving me the old mahi mahi sandwich (
oh yeah!
I want an old soggy sandwich... what a smart girl!)
I obviously said no.
She asked me if I wanted something else, so
I ordered the fried calamari.
She asked if my boyfriend wanted the other taco I had left, but he din't, so she took it back with my new order.
Then out came the calamari and it was okay
( you can't really mess that up).
It would have been better if wasn't swimming in oil, though!
mahi mahi.author: Lauren D.
mahi mahi.review:
This tops the list as one of the worst restaurants I have ever been to. My boyfriend and I came on a Friday afternoon for lunch. The inside was cute, but it was freezing (not really a big deal). I ordered the grilled mahi mahi tacos and my boyfriend ordered the coconut shrimp and fish & chips. Our waitress came out with a mahi mahi sandwich, but she quickly brought it back in because I wanted the tacos. When I finally received the tacos, I took a bite, and immediately discovered that the rub on the mahi mahi was kind of yucky... Oh well... I just continued eating, but then I noticed that they left out the avocado and instead of chipotle Crema, they gave me a little drizzle of sour cream AND they never gave me a side of black beans. At this point, I was annoyed and I didn't want it anymore, so I told my boyfriend to try it. He took a couple bites and hated it. So I told her what had been left out and that I didn't like the taco, so she asked me if I wanted a side of avocado.... NO I DON'T!!! ( I didn't yell, I was nice). So she tried giving me the old mahi mahi sandwich ( oh yeah! I want an old soggy sandwich... what a smart girl!) I obviously said no. She asked me if I wanted something else, so I ordered the fried calamari. She asked if my boyfriend wanted the other taco I had left, but he din't, so she took it back with my new order. Then out came the calamari and it was okay ( you can't really mess that up). It would have been better if wasn't swimming in oil, though! EW! 

After we had finished eating, she came over with the check and didn't say a word..... she had the nerve to charge me for half of my other meal when it didn't even come to me complete!! Instead of complaining, we figured her tip could cover the sneaky little half charge she added on to our check.

All was not bad... I tried my boyfriends coconut shrimp and hey were delicious, but not enough to come back to this crappy place.

excerpts: My go-to items are the mahi mahi terriyaki rice bowl or the mahi mahi sandwich.
The same dishes are available with salmon, but I prefer mahi mahi.
Nice grilled vegetables go with the plates to ease your health consciousness.
mahi mahi.author: Evelyn B.
mahi mahi.review: Plenty of seating, quick waitstaff, and tasty food. What isn't to like about Pacific Catch? This restaurant gets the job done when it comes to seafood. My go-to items are the mahi mahi terriyaki rice bowl or the mahi mahi sandwich. The same dishes are available with salmon, but I prefer mahi mahi. Nice grilled vegetables go with the plates to ease your health consciousness.

excerpts: the poke appetizer was perfectly seasoned with just the right amount of soy sauce, onions, and ginger; both the spicy mahi mahi and spicy ahi tuna sandwiches were equally satisfying!
mahi mahi.author: arpee q.
mahi mahi.review:
once upon a time, there were two girls named rhea and shirley who were training for the nike women's half marathon. one morning, during an 8 mile training run, shirley told rhea, "i'm sad; my work had a hawaiian-themed party and there was no "hawaiian" food. all they had was hawaiian pizza and maui onion-flavored chips, and i wanted poke!"

rhea replied, "ooh, some poke and kalua pig sound REALLY good". they continued on with their run and a couple of miles later, rhea asked shirley how she was doing (with the run). shirley responded, "i can't stop thinking about poke!"

so, after they finished their run, they visited their friend, lizette, to find out where they could find some of this much sought after poke. she saved the day when she told rhea and shirley about pacific catch, where they immediately found parking in the restaurant's lot (on a saturday afternoon, no less!) and enjoyed a delicious lunch.

the poke appetizer was perfectly seasoned with just the right amount of soy sauce, onions, and ginger; both the spicy mahi mahi and spicy ahi tuna sandwiches were equally satisfying!

...and they lived happily ever after (well, except for the no kalua pig part). the end.

excerpts: we had the salmon teriyaki bowl and mahi mahi special which were totally edible.
we also decided to get the rock and roll (unagi roll) with brown rice.
what a way to ruin a meal.
the brown rice was super hard (cold and perhaps undercooked?)
and the unagi was disgusting.
it was cold (like they had taken it out of the fridge) and they used the hard crusty pieces (hard skin attached, the fish was just hard in general).
SERIOUSLY??
mahi mahi.author: joyce l.
mahi mahi.review:
i came back here after going to the academy of science.  we had the salmon teriyaki bowl and mahi mahi special which were totally edible. we also decided to get the rock and roll (unagi roll) with brown rice. what a way to ruin a meal. the brown rice was super hard (cold and perhaps undercooked?) and the unagi was disgusting. it was cold (like they had taken it out of the fridge) and they used the hard crusty pieces (hard skin attached, the fish was just hard in general). SERIOUSLY???  what a disappointment for an $8 roll

of course the sweet potato fries were good. don't get the sushi with brown rice or eel if you go!!!

the service was still good but i just had to downgrade them based on the sushi experience.

excerpts: We ordered the wasabi hawaiian poke bowl and the two taco platter (grilled steak & mahi mahi) with sweet potato fries.
Also, I ordered one of the house made drinks that consisted of mint leaves & lime that the waitress recommended.
The poke bowl was a big disappointment.
It felt like there was not a consistency with everything going together and there was very little poke.
The mahi mahi taco was not good, but the grilled steak taco was pretty tasty.
The best thing about this place?
Their sweet potato fries.
The drink I ordered was way too pricey for what it really was too.
Disappointment there also.
I don't think I'd come back anytime soon.
mahi mahi.author: Syd T.
mahi mahi.review: Came to try this place out with my boyfriend since he loves poke bowls. We got free calamari for checking in and the calamari was mediocre and not even hot. The waitress even forgot to take it off our tab so I had to remind her when she gave us the bill. We ordered the wasabi hawaiian poke bowl and the two taco platter (grilled steak & mahi mahi) with sweet potato fries. Also, I ordered one of the house made drinks that consisted of mint leaves & lime that the waitress recommended. The poke bowl was a big disappointment. It felt like there was not a consistency with everything going together and there was very little poke. The mahi mahi taco was not good, but the grilled steak taco was pretty tasty. The best thing about this place? Their sweet potato fries. The drink I ordered was way too pricey for what it really was too. Disappointment there also. I don't think I'd come back anytime soon.

excerpts: Mahi mahi and salmon tacos were okay.
Their best is definitely the shrimp tacos.
However a good El Tonayense taco truck can totally wip that.
Okay server was slow but it was a Friday.
A bit pricey for what it is.
However on a good final note, it does have atmosphere.
You'll love that!
Overall, just stroking a par.
mahi mahi.author: Eugenel E.
mahi mahi.review: Well where can I start. The sweet potato fries. Yes we'll start there. Good but not great. If you have been to Poleng Lounge, you will not be impressed by this signature side dish. Not to disagree with everyone that has reviewed this place because they were still satisfactory. Adding to the okayness, we had the calamari. Good but could use a little more flavor. Finally we had a trio of seafood tacos. Mahi mahi and salmon tacos were okay. Their best is definitely the shrimp tacos. However a good El Tonayense taco truck can totally wip that. Okay server was slow but it was a Friday. A bit pricey for what it is. However on a good final note, it does have atmosphere. You'll love that! Overall, just stroking a par.

excerpts: I also had the 3 different types of Taco: the Baja, Shrimp and Mahi Mahi.
I thought the Baja taco was good but the Shrimp and Mahi Mahi was average.
I recommend the Mango cheesecake for desert though.
It was very refreshing.
Overall, Pacific Catch was OK.
I would go back for the Ahi Poke and the Mango cheesecake
but that's it.
mahi mahi.author: Natalie S.
mahi mahi.review: I read the mixed reviews on this restaurant and decided to go and check it out myself.  Service was good and fast. I have to agree with everyone that wrote about the Ahi Poke - it was delicious!  The spicy calamari was OK, spicy (which I enjoyed) but not very crispy.  I also had the 3 different types of Taco: the Baja, Shrimp and Mahi Mahi.  I thought the Baja taco was good but the Shrimp and Mahi Mahi was average. I recommend the Mango cheesecake for desert though.  It was very refreshing.  Overall, Pacific Catch was OK. I would go back for the Ahi Poke and the Mango cheesecake but that's it.

excerpts: We shared an ahi tuna wasabi bowl with brown rice and a mahi mahi taco platter.
The fish in both dishes was incredibly well prepared.
Amazing how good (and simple) fresh fish can be!
mahi mahi.author: L F.
mahi mahi.review:
ohmigoooood!  This place is so unbelievably good I can't stop thinking about it!  We finally got into the Marina location about a year ago and really enjoyed both our meal and our server - friendly, funny and muy helpful!  The only thing we didn't like was how chummy you needed to be with your neighbor.  Definitely elbow to elbow situation.

Last night we wandered over to the 9th street location after a major hot hike in Marin.  While we really liked the coffee shop which occupied this space previously - I have to say welcome to the neighborhood PC!  The space has a very zen-like feel - great color scheme - awesome bar area - even the bathroom is nice with the bamboo stalks pressed between smoked glass.   

Great little starter vittles (sesame? goldfish and edamame).  We shared an ahi tuna wasabi bowl with brown rice and a mahi mahi taco platter.  The fish in both dishes was incredibly well prepared.  Amazing how good (and simple) fresh fish can be!  The sweet potato fries were delish.  The sesame salad in the bowl was refreshing.  The only thing that wasn't absolutely fabulous were the black beans which weren't bad - just merely came across as an afterthought.   Washing everything down with a cold beer - we were two very happy campers!

Service was friendly and attentive - seems like a good place for families and larger groups - definitely one of our new faves along the Irving corridor!

excerpts: the mahi mahi almost didn't look real....and the grill marks were just a bit too perfect....almost like burger king is behind this restaurant or something.
it was also a bit overdone.
the pineapple fried rice was way too mushy.
mahi mahi.author: Miss P.
mahi mahi.review:
okay, before i go into the restaurant, i just have one question about parking...when the hell did it become okay for someone to stand in a parking spot to save it for their friends?  wtf?!?!?!?  if you are not a vehicle, you have no business taking up a parking spot.  people like you deserve to have a million bird poopies land of you AND your stinking car...so there!

....now on to the food.  i have to admit, the calamari was pretty dang good!  i would go there for that alone.  i'm not totally sure why some of the slices of lemon were fried up...was i supposed to eat that?  i wasn't sure, so i decided not to take the risk.

the sweet potato fries were okay, although i wasn't sure why they served it with the sweet/spicy sauce....i actually dipped it in the spicy aioli that came with the calamari, and that worked well...while the calamari was good with the sweet/spicy sauce....go figure....maybe it's their ploy to make you order both....

the entree is where they lost me.  the mahi mahi almost didn't look real....and the grill marks were just a bit too perfect....almost like burger king is behind this restaurant or something.  it was also a bit overdone.  the pineapple fried rice was way too mushy.  the the vegetable side was overdone also.

bottom line, i would come here for the calamari, and then go have dinner elsewhere....

excerpts: Mahi mahi fish of the day - came with grilled veggie, sweet potato fries, mahi mahi served with tomatillo avocado sauce.
The fish had a cajun spice rub that was a bit pungent.
Salmon and mahi mahi taco
: Both were good and fresh.
The salsa on each one are good.
mahi mahi.author: Irene C.
mahi mahi.review:
My husband and I went to Pacific Catch on a Wednesday night and the place was pretty full.  So we sat at the bar instead so that we didn't have to wait, which turned out great cuz the bartender was very nice and both our cocktails tasted delicious!  We ordered the Firecracker Salmon roll which was very good.  We also ordered the sturgeon fish of the day which came with an avocado sauce, grilled vegetable, and sweet potato fries.  The fries were really good.  The overall portion size for the entree was just right because it still allows room for appetizer if you want.  We are small eaters so it was just right.  Our total bill was about $60 which is not too bad given we had drinks too.  We're definitely going back and will try some of the other menus.  We recommended this place to our friend who liked it too.  The only complain they had was that everything on the menu is fish but that was fine with us.

1/1/2008: This is the 2nd time I've been here and I would still give it a 4 star.  We had reservations at 7pm for 7 people and they seated us late for about 10 mins and they comped all our appetizers, without us complaining or mentioning it at all.  Now that's a restaurant that cares about their customers.  It was a pleasant surprise and treat.  The service was great throughout the meal as well.  

With 7 people, we tried alot more different dishes.  

Appetizers:
1) Shrimp ceviche - They were whole shrimp and there were lots of them.  I think they should dice up the shrimp because it was served with tortilla chips and there's no way you can get a whole shrimp on the chip.  But the taste was decent overall, nothing spectacular so I probably won't order it again
2) Grilled artichokes - Fresh, good, seasoned properly.  Would order it again.
3) Calamari - very good, came with fried lemon slices too which is an interesting touch.  the sauce was a little spicy.  Would recommend trying this and I would order it again.

Rolls
1) CA roll - good that it was real crab meat, not some doughy fake ones.  There was too much rice which will fill you up quickly.  I prefer less rice.  Probably would not order it again just because I don't think this is not a signature dish.

2) Rock 'n roll - Too much rice, couldn't find/taste the unagi (bbq eel).  Again, it tastes ok, but wouldn't order it again.

3) Firecracker roll - We had this last time, loved it.  This time it was still good.  For some reason, this roll doesn't not have as much rice as the other too, which is good.  Would order it again

Entrees
1) Mahi mahi fish of the day - came with grilled veggie, sweet potato fries, mahi mahi served with tomatillo avocado sauce.  The fish had a cajun spice rub that was a bit pungent.  The sweet potato fries as always was great.  Grilled veggie - can't go wrong with this.  Don't like the spice rub so won't order it again

2) Grilled shrimp teriyaki bowl - Very tasty, great teriyaki sauce.  Liked that it came with veggie and mushroom, chopped and mixed into the rice.   Would order it again

3) Ono fish of the day - very good.  came with fried onion rings that were delicious.  came with pineapple fried rice which everyone loved.  the fish was grilled on banana leaf so it had a great aroma and taste.  would order it gain.

4) Organic chinook fish of the day - it came with grilled artichoke and brown rice and the fish was served with a tomato sauce.  it was fresh and decently good.  i'm not a big grilled salmon fan so that's why i won't order it again. 

5) Grilled Korean beef (another daily special) - I don't eat beef so I can't comment, but my husband thought it was decent.  This place is called "Pacific Catch" so I'd stick with the fish but if you have a friend that doesn't like seafood, at least there is an option to have meat.

Overall, I'd recommend this place and would go again.  Good atmosphere for couples or groups.  Great service.  Nice decor and clean.  Lots of cocktails, decent size wine list.

2/14/08: This is visit #3.

Cocktail Review:
Sun Burn - average; menu says there's a tropical syrup in it which I think is what gave it a little after taste of some sort.
Some cocktail with Gin 209, kiwi and cucumber juice - DELICIOUS!  We had to order a 2nd one.  

House salad - Good size, very fresh greens, salad dressing was yummy, if you like a Japanese type kinda dressing w/miso; The mushrooms that were in the salad was delicious.  They're cooked in some sauce, not some uncooked mushroom.

Catch of the Day Fish and Chips - The ling cod fish and chips is the freshest fish and chips we ever had.  It's lightly fried, lightly crispy and covered in a thick batter where you eat a lot of batter and not fish.  The fish was cooked to perfection and fresh and was juicy.  The sweet potato fries as usual, are always yummy!!!

Salmon and mahi mahi taco: Both were good and fresh.  The salsa on each one are good.  The salmon one has a spicy kick to it so if you like spicy, try that.

excerpts: I ordered the plat of the day; girlled Mahi Mahi, and grilled articoke and brown rice.. yum yum while my boyfriend got the Fried sampler; fried mahi, oysters and coconut shrimp.
We began with some cocktails and the Poke, which I highly recommend!
Next time Im getting a "Sashimi" bowl with tuna.... we skipped on the sushi rolls b/c
we are so die hard for our sushi guy (see my other yelp review, chin bistro)
but next time Im giving it a go...
Service was friendly and appologetic, though I think she had smoked a joint in the park before work because she was super forgetful.!!
SO GLAD DUMB CANVAS has been replaced!!
mahi mahi.author: Liz C.
mahi mahi.review: Someone must have thought of my dream combo.. Fish and Chips plus japanese/hawaian style cusine!! So we went here by chance, just to check it out. I was across the street getting "Blue Brothers" at Le Video, and was super hunger and didnt want to go to far... I ordered the plat of the day; girlled Mahi Mahi, and grilled articoke and brown rice.. yum yum while my boyfriend got the Fried sampler; fried mahi, oysters and coconut shrimp. We began with some cocktails and the Poke, which I highly recommend! Next time Im getting a "Sashimi" bowl with tuna.... we skipped on the sushi rolls b/c we are so die hard for our sushi guy (see my other yelp review, chin bistro) but next time Im giving it a go... Service was friendly and appologetic, though I think she had smoked a joint in the park before work because she was super forgetful.!! SO GLAD DUMB CANVAS has been replaced!!

excerpts: So I ordered the 2 fish taco platter and ordered one grilled mahi mahi and the other one a baja style.
Both of them were pretty bland.
mahi mahi.author: Adrian D.
mahi mahi.review:
Uhm...where do I start....oh....they have a parking lot.  Ok I think that's the highlight of the place oh...and the place looks nice.  Now on to the food.  Hmm...bleh.  That's what I thought about it.  So I ordered the 2 fish taco platter and ordered one grilled mahi mahi and the other one a baja style.  Both of them were pretty bland.  The sweet potato fries were ok.  Lorraine L. ordered the mixed the mixed basket which had skewered coconut shrimp, fish fillets, and deep fried oysters.  The coconut shrimp was hard to eat.  She tried to slip one of the shrimps off the skewer and was having a hard time cuz the breading would come right off.  The actual taste of it wasn't too impressive.  Her oysters were somewhat chewy and her fish was just ok.  Another friend ordered the special for the night which was sea bass...which they didnt have so they said they had trout instead.  Hmm...trout is way different than sea bass last time I checked.  Anyway she got the trout but was pretty flustered about it.  The rest of the friends ordered fish & chips.  Oh...if you wanna ask about how big the fish is...don't ask.  

I think the only reason why I might come back is to try out there late night happy hour.  Other than that I wouldn't come back. =/

excerpts: Edamame, wasabi rice bowls, seaweed salad, grilled fish (mahi mahi and tuna are always good), fish tacos, sweet potato fries --
all tasty.
Sometimes the fried fish tacos are a little fishy tasting because they don't always get all of that gray stuff off whatever fish they use for that...
but that's kind of a nit.
Interior's nice too
mahi mahi.author: Steve R.
mahi mahi.review:
The rare intersection of great food AND reasonable prices.  Edamame, wasabi rice bowls, seaweed salad, grilled fish (mahi mahi and tuna are always good), fish tacos, sweet potato fries -- all tasty.   Sometimes the fried fish tacos are a little fishy tasting because they don't always get all of that gray stuff off whatever fish they use for that... but that's kind of a nit.  Interior's nice too (though if you require super fancy-schmancy, this might not be you spot).  

Plus -- they actually have (limited) free, dedicated parking.

excerpts: I had the barbecue shrimp tacos and the fried mahi mahi tacos.
Both tacos were yummy, but i liked the shrimp ones best..
mahi mahi.author: LaSha G.
mahi mahi.review: I believed that there was a high probability that this place was going to suck big time when I walked in.  The space was HUGE *by SF standards* and had that sort of Texas Big Chain restaurant feel to it. But I was wrong. I thoroughly enjoyed my meal here.  I had the barbecue shrimp tacos and the fried mahi mahi tacos.  Both tacos were yummy, but i liked the shrimp ones best..  My tacos came with lots of sweet and salty sweet potato fries.  They were the best I've had to date (although I've only tried them 2 other times in my life).  My boyfriend at the time ordered the ahi sandwich and thoroughly enjoyed it.  I also ordered a Mai Tai in the middle of the day and it was not only sufficiently strong, but tasty as well.  Thank you helpful waitress, for assisting me in finalizing that selection.  All in all, I had a good experience, but after reading the rest of the Yelp reviews, I get the feeling that the food here can be a little hit and miss.

excerpts: The tacos were tasty - we had one of each: cod, tropical shrimp, and i think mahi mahi.
Overall, all of the seafood tasted fresh.
mahi mahi.author: Michelle H.
mahi mahi.review: My boyfriend and I tried this place on Monday and I thought the food was just average.  The place is really nice and modern looking. I made reservations through Opentable and got a seat right away.  We got there around 7 and there were still plenty of tables open. I also liked how this place has a parking lot - small, but we were able to get a space.  We ordered the calamari appetizer which was very good! - probably some of the best I've ever had.  For entrees, we got the 3 piece fish n chips and the 3 taco platter.  The fish n chips were average - seasoning was good but not as crispy as I usually like.  The tacos were tasty - we had one of each: cod, tropical shrimp, and i think mahi mahi.  Overall, all of the seafood tasted fresh.  Oh, and had the sweet potato fries - hella good!  They were nice and crispy.  Another cool thing was that they gave us pretzel Goldfish crackers and edamame as snacks before we ordered!!  The service here was also great!!  I only gave this place 3 stars since the food was pretty average but kind of pricey for what it was.  And the place could use better ventilation (the kitchen is open though, which was kind of nice).  Even though I miss Canvas, I'm glad this place is here.

excerpts: i went for the mahi mahi (california style) and mom went for the escolar.
wait..
before that we started with the califnornia rolls pretty basic
but DEFINATELY not out of this world.
the portions were big and i left full but not satisfied...i liked the bar area though and i will definately give it another try because i saw they had a bar menu and a full bar as well...
mahi mahi.author: shannon b.
mahi mahi.review: and "meh" is right ....went here last night and we were seated right away...nice atmosphere and i was really looking forward to eating here...the menu is extremely strange...starters and sushi on one side and 3 choices of fish specials for the evening on the other. i went for the mahi mahi (california style) and mom went for the escolar. wait..before that we started with the califnornia rolls pretty basic but DEFINATELY not out of this world. the portions were big and i left full but not satisfied...i liked the bar area though and i will definately give it another try because i saw they had a bar menu and a full bar as well...

excerpts: I love the baja style mahi mahi and sweet potato fries.
You can sit outdoors if you have a dog, or if it's just a nice day.
There's a teensy parking lot, but usually ample parking on Lincoln or in the park.
The servers and bartenders are really nice.
They take reservations.
The only thing to avoid are the booths over by the bathrooms.
Otherwise, what's not to LOVE?
mahi mahi.author: L J.
mahi mahi.review: This is my favorite restaurant for a normal (non-'fancy') out-to-dinner night, or lunch, or happy hour, or to take out of town visitors. The menu is varied enough to please all comers, with asian style, mexican style, and rotating specials. The wasabi bowls are an incredible value, so much delicious sashimi (or cooked salmon or crab or unagi) and seaweed salad, avocado and veggies that I can never finish it all. The sushi rolls are huge and delicious (try the shiitake/asparagus/miso roll!), and they have good prices on tap beers and unique cocktails. The house cured salmon is delectable. I love the baja style mahi mahi and sweet potato fries. You can sit outdoors if you have a dog, or if it's just a nice day.
