There's a teensy parking lot, but usually ample parking on Lincoln or in the park. The servers and bartenders are really nice. They take reservations. The only thing to avoid are the booths over by the bathrooms. Otherwise, what's not to LOVE?

excerpts: We ordered tacos (traditional Baja, Mahi Mahi, and cabo shrimp), the Hawaiian poke appetizer, and the Korean bbq rice bowl.
The poke was a great wonderful mix of flavor although a tad on the saltier side.
The fish was fresh and a nice texture that was not too mushy or chewy.
Of the tacos, my favorite was the cabo shrimp as that one was moist and juicy while the other two tacos were a bit on the drier side which makes sense given that it was fish.
The Kbbq bowl was huge and had a lot of rice.
cabo shrimp.author: Lily F.
cabo shrimp.review:
Went here for dinner on Friday night and it was great. Here's why:

First of all, there's a parking lot which is unheard of in the Sunset area unless you're a super market or a drug store. We found a spot as soon as we pulled in. Next, the restaurant was so lively and bustling. I just loved the atmosphere from the get go. It was busy on a Friday night and the wait was long but they told us there was space at the bar so the two of us took a seat and skipped the entire line. We didn't order any alcohol but the bartender was definitely entertaining to watch. Free show/entertainment with dinner and no line?! Already a good start to the meal.

We ordered tacos (traditional Baja, Mahi Mahi, and cabo shrimp), the Hawaiian poke appetizer, and the Korean bbq rice bowl. The poke was a great wonderful mix of flavor although a tad on the saltier side. The fish was fresh and a nice texture that was not too mushy or chewy. Of the tacos, my favorite was the cabo shrimp as that one was moist and juicy while the other two tacos were a bit on the drier side which makes sense given that it was fish. The Kbbq bowl was huge and had a lot of rice. The meat on the bowl was delicious although I did find the sweet egg quite odd.

The meal took a while to come out due to some unknown reason but the manager noticed and comped our appetizer so great customer service there. The bartender was super nice too. 

Would come here again!

excerpts: I like to get the three taco platter ($17.50 with the sweet potato fries) with traditional baja and cabo shrimp.

With the cod and avocado-tomatillo salsa, the traditional baja is my personal favorite because it seems juicier and fresher, but I'm also a sucker for the cabo shrimp because of the generous amount of avocado
it comes with.

With the cod and avocado-tomatillo salsa, the traditional baja is my personal favorite because it seems juicier and fresher, but I'm also a sucker for the cabo shrimp because of the generous amount of avocado
it comes with.
cabo shrimp.author: Amy C.
cabo shrimp.review:
Apologies in advance to anyone from San Diego, but Pacific Catch is my baseline for good fish tacos. I know it's technically a Bay Area chain restaurant, but there's no denying that Pacific Catch manages to keep locals coming back whenever they're craving some unpretentious seafood: abundant seating (with the chance to choose between a livelier, younger happy hour crowd on the left side of the restaurant and a more family-oriented booth seating on the right), complimentary pretzel Goldfish and edamame at the beginning of your meal, and a plethora of menu options.

Sure, you can order a rice bowl, sandwich, or maybe even a slightly overpriced poke bowl here, but I truly think the fish tacos are where Pacific Catch shines. Having driven past Pacific Catch all the time when I was younger, I didn't think to finally check it out until a few years ago when two of my friends shared that this was where they got their fish taco fix. 

Whatever you do, do not turn down the opportunity to pay an extra $1 for sweet potato fries. They are beyond flavorful and help you forget that you're eating at a chain restaurant. I also like the quaint Honolulu Tribune newspaper wax/butcher paper that the fish tacos come on because it feels like how a mom-and-pop fish stand would serve 'em. I like to get the three taco platter ($17.50 with the sweet potato fries) with traditional baja and cabo shrimp. With the cod and avocado-tomatillo salsa, the traditional baja is my personal favorite because it seems juicier and fresher, but I'm also a sucker for the cabo shrimp because of the generous amount of avocado it comes with. $17.50 certainly seems like a lot to pay for three fish tacos, but I've never been disappointed with the quality of the fish or found myself hungry again a few hours later.

Speaking of prices, the Mai Tai here sure is tasty and will fulfill all your rum-related dreams, but at $11, I have a hard time justifying it because it's not exactly of cocktail bar caliber. So get a pitcher of it instead -- $40 for five servings!

excerpts: Cabo Shrimp tacos - delish!
Thank you for always being attentive.
cabo shrimp.author: Natalie G.
cabo shrimp.review:
First timer - I like it! Drinks were awesome, food was great. Nice atmosphere & music, there is also a small parking lot off Lincoln. Thank you for keeping it dust free :)  Excellent drinks - Mai Tai, Pisco,Kiwi flash.
Cabo Shrimp tacos - delish! Thank you for always being attentive.

excerpts: One Mahi Mahi, one Cabo Shrimp, and lastly a Pacific steak taco.
cabo shrimp.author: Katerina Y.
cabo shrimp.review:
I drive by this place every, single day. so it eventually made it on to my "must try" list.

 I finally went in yesterday and I honestly regret waiting so long. Everything my friend and I ordered was so delicious and not to mention our waitress was so attentive and delightful!

We ordered a Blood Orange Cocktail and a Kiwi Flash. If it wasn't a Monday night, we honestly wouldn't have stopped at just one each!lol

We started off with a Fire Cracker Salmon roll, which was delicious! 

My friend ordered the Mahi Mahi Hawaiin teriyaki bowl which looked, smelled, and tasted oh so good!

I ordered the 3 taco platter. One Mahi Mahi, one Cabo Shrimp, and lastly a Pacific steak taco. Yes, yes, and YES!! 

The portions were huge so we were full almost immediately but we still had room for some Mochi Fondue!! 

Overall, great location, delicious food, heated outdoor seating, can't go wrong!

excerpts: Had the three taco platter with traditional Baja, mahi-mahi, and cabo shrimp and side of sweet potato fries.
cabo shrimp.author: Raymond N.
cabo shrimp.review: Had the three taco platter with traditional Baja, mahi-mahi, and cabo shrimp and side of sweet potato fries. Also had the mixed catch fish and chips. The fish and chips were okay but I don't really know how to describe the tacos. The tortilla was on the dry side and most of it was filled with cabbage, a lot of thick slices of cabbage. The ingredients didn't really hold together, just felt like hasty assortment of ingredients thrown together. The mahi-mahi was really dry. The crispy Alaskan cod was mildly crispy so I ended up eating just the fish. You can get much better taco at any taco truck. Service was good. Environment was clean.

excerpts: cabo shrimp - least favorite one.
cabo shrimp.author: Kenny L.
cabo shrimp.review:
After driving by and walking by this place so many times, I finally decided to give it a try on a thursday night

Stepped in about 630ish and there was no wait, which was perfect but yet not so much a good thing too? I guess that means the place isn't as popular as i thought?

Ordered:
Poke Trio.
1. traditional - the only perfect one. nice kick to the tuna
2. lomi lomi - i love salmon but it was ruined by the saltiness of the citrus/salt
3. caifornia style - i didnt really taste the crab but it wasn't bad

Taco trio.
1. traditional - tasted ok, the serrano salsa makes it better
2. mahi mahi - the best taco of the three! just tasted perfect
3. cabo shrimp - least favorite one. it just fell apart

grilled corn w/ lime butter - this was probably the best part of the meal. that corn was some of the best corn i've ever had


OVERALL: i'd be back only for the traditional tuna poke and the mahi mahi taco and that corn. but with all the "OK" food i had, all that dragged this review down to a 3 star.

excerpts: Be sure to check out their Cabo shrimp tacos, ahi tuna bowl, sweet potato fries, coconut shrimp, calamari and fried oysters!
But skip the dungeons crab chowder-- totally not worth it!
cabo shrimp.author: Tiffany U.
cabo shrimp.review: The good thing about this location is the parking-- it's still not good but it beats trying to find parking on Chestnut! The food here is exactly like the location on Chestnut, always consistent and fresh. I love how this location never has a wait! Be sure to check out their Cabo shrimp tacos, ahi tuna bowl, sweet potato fries, coconut shrimp, calamari and fried oysters! But skip the dungeons crab chowder-- totally not worth it!

excerpts: so we tried the Traditional Baja, Mahi Mahi and Cabo Shrimp.
My friend finished the entire plate plus his side salad.
I didn't =(
but I ate all the shrimp and fish
just not the tortilla.
It was good though, next time I will remind myself that I don't have a huge appetite like my friends do and order 2 tacos maybe :P
My other friend who happens to be my boyfriend got the Pan-Asian Rice Bowl.
cabo shrimp.author: Czarina Y.
cabo shrimp.review:
My friends and I decide that every time we decide to eat out, we need to try a new place. My friend suggested this place, we gave it a shot.

For starters, we tried one of their chalkboard specials. It's a Poke, forgot exactly what's called, but it's calamari poke. It was so good! Then I ordered their Island Tacos, for some reason, I went with their 3-taco platter just like what my friend got. It's pretty awesome that you can mix and match so we tried the Traditional Baja, Mahi Mahi and Cabo Shrimp. My friend finished the entire plate plus his side salad. I didn't =( but I ate all the shrimp and fish just not the tortilla. It was good though, next time I will remind myself that I don't have a huge appetite like my friends do and order 2 tacos maybe :P
My other friend who happens to be my boyfriend got the Pan-Asian Rice Bowl. He got the Japanese Wasabi bowl with Grilled Salmon. I personally didn't taste it, but he said it was too rich, although the salmon was still pretty good. 

Server was friendly and attends very well to our needs. Great experience! Can't complain and I will definitely go back. =)

excerpts: Cabo shrimp tacos had two measly pieces of shrimp.
Tasty though.
cabo shrimp.author: Raul S.
cabo shrimp.review:
FAST Review 

Food 3/5 
Mahi tacos overpowered by sauce. Cabo shrimp tacos had two measly pieces of shrimp. Tasty though. Good sweet potato fries.

Ambiance 3/5 
Hmm, to describe briefly: Bland, minimalist, clean, modern

Service 4/5
Good, prompt service

Total Impression 3/5 
Standard Pacific Asian American fusion fare

excerpts:
vinaigrette- delicious and fresh it was a perfect meal after a run
- Cabo shrimp
taco- crispy shrimp with pico de gallo, avocado, jalapeño tartar & lime crema-
huge shrimp, lightly battered and super tasty.
- Monthly special:
cabo shrimp.author: Nadia L.
cabo shrimp.review:
I was introduced to this place a couple of years ago when we attended a graduation celebration here. Since then I haven't had a chance to make it back here until recently and I'm so glad I did. 

After running B2B, we were trying to decide where to eat and since I've been talking about wanting to go back here for I don't know how long, the rest of my group decided to accomodate my request. 

We got there right at 11am when it opened which was perfect since we were able to find parking in the small lot next to the restaurant for customers and we were seated in a nice table next to the window where we could see peopel walkby in their costumes.

For lunch we had:
- Ahi tuna poke (starter) served with wonton chips- super fresh and just as tasty as I remember. I could probably eat a whole serving of this myself
- Sushi grade ahi salad- seared ahi, avocado, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds with soy-wasabi vinaigrette- delicious and fresh it was a perfect meal after a run
- Cabo shrimp taco- crispy shrimp with pico de gallo, avocado, jalapeño tartar & lime crema- huge shrimp, lightly battered and super tasty. 
- Monthly special: Some fish that starts with an e that I can't remember, but it had some spice rub on it, served with some green sauce, sweet potato fries and grilled zucchini, peppers and corn.
- Dessert: Mochi fondue- came with 3 type of mochi- chocolate, vanilla and coffee with a warm fudge in the middle- yummy!! 

Everything was fantastic. If I lived in SF or if my office was remotely close to this restaurant,  I would probably be here a lot more. Service was also super friendly and I appreciate our server for putting up with my endless requests for tea (it was freezing outside!). What can I say, I love this place and am looking forward to coming back to try more dishes from their menu.

excerpts: had the cabo shrimp tacos
those were good, but the spicy chipolte chicken one was a bit on the dry side.
cabo shrimp.author: Stella J.
cabo shrimp.review:
service was really good, it was speedy!

tried the clam miso soup, not really a fan of miso soup, but this one changed my mind, it had the right amount of flavor and it wasnt like other places way too salty.

had the cabo shrimp tacos those were good, but the spicy chipolte chicken one was a bit on the dry side. the sweet potato fries it came with were so good.

my friend had the hawiian poke dish, the poke was so good here and it was fresh. it came with a tad too much rice though.

overall, i would come back here again, it was good!

excerpts: I had a 3-taco platter which included a mahi mahi taco, a traditional baja taco, and a cabo shrimp taco.
All tasty, but unremarkable.
And that pretty much sums up the place: decent asian fusion seafood fare, AWESOME life lessons.
cabo shrimp.author: Derek L.
cabo shrimp.review:
Halfway through our dinner on Christmas eve with my close group of friends, the waiter asked us if it was a special occasion. We said no, we only wanted to see each other for the holidays. Then he imparted some endearing wisdom about how true friends are hard to find, and that you should hold on to the ones you care about. His words were heartfelt, but too bad they weren't on the menu.

The food was maybe a step above your run-of-the-mill sit down chain restaurant. I had a 3-taco platter which included a mahi mahi taco, a traditional baja taco, and a cabo shrimp taco. All tasty, but unremarkable. And that pretty much sums up the place: decent asian fusion seafood fare, AWESOME life lessons.

excerpts: My wife wanted 1 salmon taco, and one Cabo shrimp taco, but they gave her 2 salmon tacos, but she didn't complain.
These taco were topped with cabbage, corn salsa, and lime crema.
cabo shrimp.author: Steve L.
cabo shrimp.review:
After a pretty big banquet lunch at Golden Horse, I figured I was done eating for the day. We dropped by my folks place after lunch, and since they haven't seen the kids in a while, they wanted to spend some time with them. They offered to watch the girls and feed them dinner, so the wife and I can go out for dinner. 

What a nice surprise! An unexpected date night with my wife. Yeah, we were still full from lunch, but we took my folk's offer and headed out. Problem was that it was 7PM on a Saturday night, we had no reservations, and most places were pretty crowded already. We struck out on a couple of places either because parking sucked (No Nopa this time), business closed (bye PJ's), or I was wearing the wrong clothes (I had a sweater, and Naan and Curry was steaming inside, unless I wanted a permanent tandoori smell).

We walked into Pacific Catch, and got a table in the bar area. Pretty lively inside the bar area, with the Cal vs. UCLA hoops game going on (too bad Cal). A lot of people in the bar section were dining in, so the waitresses were doing double duty serving drinks and serving food. 

We ordered: 

-House Cured Sake Salmon. This came with 2 crispy nori rice cakes, wasabi creme fraiche, onions, and black tobiko caviar. Salmon had a mildly cured taste, the wasabi creme fraiche had a little, but not overpowering kick. Rice cakes were nice and crispy. OK starter. 

-2 Chipotle BBQ Salmon Tacos. This was a mistake. My wife wanted 1 salmon taco, and one Cabo shrimp taco, but they gave her 2 salmon tacos, but she didn't complain. These taco were topped with cabbage, corn salsa, and lime crema. Nice big chunk of salmon in each taco, and very tasty. 

-5 piece Fish and chips. Fish of the day was rock cod. This came with cole slaw and sweet potato fries. Lightly battered so not to overwhelm the fresh rock cod. Very juicy and moist on the inside, slight crispiness on the outside. Came with a jalapeno tartar sauce and and a Thai sweet chili sauce. I added some more sriracha sauce for more kick. Purple-cabbage cole slaw had a nice light vinaigrette for refreshing taste, instead of a creamy sauce. Sweet potato fries were great. Not overly fried, but crispy enough so I could still taste the sweet potatoes. 

Too full for dessert : ( 

Food came out pretty quickly, and the servers remembered and follow on requests in spite of the bar being elbow to elbow. 

I driven by this place for years while driving along Lincoln Blvd, and glad we finally tried it. Places like this reminded my wife and I of our dating years. Nice memories......

excerpts: But, the Hawaiian Poke appetizer and Cabo Shrimp tacos I got were totally delicious,
amazing
I dare say.
A lot of creativity goes into the seasoning and synthesizing of dishes here.
The tacos were served with black beans (average) and my choice, sweet potatoes fries (heaven).
cabo shrimp.author: Jeff H.
cabo shrimp.review:
The owners and the cooks should fire the wait staff. Well, maybe just the server we had last night. But still.

The point is this: Pacific Catch would've been a shoe-in for four, maybe 4.5, stars were it not for the attitude of our server, which lasted the entire 90-minute duration of our visit.

It wasn't the same person, but the fact that I was brought water (after not having been offered it for the better part of 45 minutes in) in a glass that had a crack that would dwarf the San Andreas fault doesn't help matters.

But, the Hawaiian Poke appetizer and Cabo Shrimp tacos I got were totally delicious, amazing I dare say. A lot of creativity goes into the seasoning and synthesizing of dishes here. The tacos were served with black beans (average) and my choice, sweet potatoes fries (heaven). So, hats off to the chef, cooks, and owners.

But shame on you, server. I mean, was it the fact that me and the love of my life shamed ourselves by sitting on the same side of our spacious booth? That we took an extra 3.2 seconds to order because we weren't sure what we wanted to drink? What was it?

Whatever it was, it should've been overlooked, because you dampened an otherwise awesome dinner.

The clientele should've bothered me, but didn't. I think the seclusion of our booth helped matters.

I'll go back, for sure, because the optimist in me wants to believe this was a one-off.

excerpts: One grilled mahi mahi and one cabo shrimp with a side of sweet potato fries.
cabo shrimp.author: BrElla4eva H.
cabo shrimp.review:
I'd really give this place 3 1/2 stars...4 stars for food, 3 stars for the service. I actually really like this restaurant. The place is pretty casual, but fun. A good spot to get together with a small group of friends for a reasonably priced dinner. The food was delicious, but the service was mediocre. I think our server was new to the job so I felt bad for him. . We ordered the hawaiian poke to start off but didn't end up actually getting it till a little bit after our server came out with our entrees. But better late than never because it was ooh so good. Very fresh and flavorful. After contemplating about the many enticing choices on the menu, I opted for the island tacos for my main entree. One grilled mahi mahi and one cabo shrimp with a side of sweet potato fries. Definite thumbs up! 

I do need to mention a strange but funny incident we had while dining here. As we were all finishing up our food, one of my friends was drinking waster out of his glass...when all of a sudden I see a big splash. At first I thought he dropped his glass of water but it turned out that the bottom of his glass broke and all the ice and water spilled out! And let me just tell you...it broke just on the bottom of the glass in almost a perfect, complete circle! How weird is that!?! Luckily he already finished his meal. We, of course, complained to our server and he was able to get his meal for free. He mentioned that it probably happened because the glass was hot when they poured in cold water.

Now for dessert...always my favorite part! The four of us shared 2 different plates....the mochi fondue and the fried dulce de leche spring rolls. Both were scrumptious! I never thought of dipping mochi ice cream balls in hot chocolate sauce but it is dee-lish!

YES, I'd come back to this place and YES, I recommend it!

excerpts: I chose the double platter with one traditional baja and one cabo shrimp taco.
cabo shrimp.author: Rhia R.
cabo shrimp.review: The days before, the day of, and those following my birthday have been filled with nothing but fun. That, and a ridiculous amount of food. I have been so well fed this week it's not even funny. One of my best friends took me here for dinner last night. PC was fairly busy in spite of the rain. She said I could order anything I want. (No, you didn't just say that!) I wasn't planning on stuffing my face, but surely I was in the mood for some tacos. I chose the double platter with one traditional baja and one cabo shrimp taco. Before our orders were up, we had their crispy oysters and spicy tuna roll. The oysters weren't greasy and the roll had a good kick. As for the tacos, I liked the shrimp one better than the baja. Cod (which was the daily catch featured in the baja taco) is a pretty bland fish unless you pair it with a flavorful partner. In this case, it was the tomatillo salsa. Good thing I ate that one first before the shrimp or else I probably would have been a bit disappointed. The shrimp taco was much better. Even more so with the avocado and pico de gallo. My friend and I could have ended our mission right there, but I managed to set aside some room for dessert. Normally I would skip it, but I heard some good things about the dulce de leche spring rolls. The concoction came drizzled with a generous amount of caramel sauce and a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Yum! I think the filling inside of the roll was cheesecake, not sure. It tends to get pretty rich after a while. Once again, I'm stuffed. I'll have to put in a few rigorous workouts next week to compensate for all this eating.

excerpts: i ordered the cabo shrimp and a special ahi taco that's not on the menu but the waiter recommended.
well, i wish he hadn't.
the ahi was overcooked for my taste (obvi raw would've been great, but i was expecting a slight seared edge...
this was almost completely cooked through), and there was no moisture in this thing.
i need me some sauce on my tacos!
the shrimp was better, thanks to the large portion and ample sauce.
cabo shrimp.author: Anne Marie B.
cabo shrimp.review:
i'm torn.  on the one hand it was nothing spectacular, but on the other hand there wasn't really anything bad about this place.  start it off by saying that the waiter was very friendly and informed us that the kitchen was really good about substitutions/preparing items that weren't on the menu, so that was a plus...but the options on the menu all seemed so good that it wasn't really necessary to ask for something different.  

i absolutely adore raw fish.  all seafood really.  but raw fish is great.  so we started with the hawaiian poke (raw ahi marinated in soy sauce etc.), huge chunks of ahi, a little heavy on the sauce, but still delish.  the calamari was also not too chewy, so props for that.  and the seaweed salad was actually pretty good.  

but then i ordered the tacos, which i've heard great things about.  i ordered the cabo shrimp and a special ahi taco that's not on the menu but the waiter recommended.  well, i wish he hadn't.  the ahi was overcooked for my taste (obvi raw would've been great, but i was expecting a slight seared edge...this was almost completely cooked through), and there was no moisture in this thing.  i need me some sauce on my tacos!  the shrimp was better, thanks to the large portion and ample sauce.  i even resorted to pouring leftover sauce from my seaweed salad on the ahi taco.  

so suffice it to say, i've had better fish tacos...but the quality and freshness of the fish actually seemed pretty great, so i'll likely go back and order a salmon sandwich, or an ahi bowl or something else.  heck maybe even a steak taco, though that wouldn't really be keeping up with the theme of the restaurant very well.

excerpts: Although they all sounded decent, the three tacos I went with were the Traditional Baja Taco with its Crispy Alaskan Cod, cabbage jalapeno tartar, and avocado tomatillo salsa, the Spiced Chicken Taco with grilled Mary's Chicken, cabbage avocado, chipotle aioli and pico de gallo, and the Pacific Steak Taco with marinated skirt steak, crispy onions, cilantro cabbage, sriracha aioli and lime cream.
pacific steak.author: Jason F.
pacific steak.review:
Pacific Catch West Coast Fish House is a solid place to get good if unspectacular seafood dishes like soft tacos, poke and rice bowls and sushi rolls. This franchise lays in the heart of San Francisco's Inner Sunset neighborhood right off the of the 9th Avenue Entrance to Golden Gate Park. Pacific Catch is a fine franchise and it's been in this location for over ten years, so despite the competition of the surrounding neighborhood this place is doing just fine. But the question is, is it worth it?

I went for a pre-planned birthday party, so we were able to make reservations for our party of seven at 7pm on a Wednesday evening in July. Although I've been this restaurant before, I haven't been in a while and I like some of the newer things they've brought to the interior, like a nice outdoor fireplace in front of the vestibule area and all of the funky artwork on the walls and hanging from the ceilings. Upon opening the menu, I did notice that the prices are high at Pacific Catch. Be prepared to get sticker shock as this place does not represent the most affordable meals for families in or from out of town. The average price is sixteen dollars per main course, but the food was dependable and an interesting blend on the traditional seafood fusion dish. 

Since there were seven of us in our party we had to get appetizers and the Cabo Calamari, as always, is an easy choice with crispy calamari, lemon slices, fresno chilies and chipotle aioli were decent if somewhat lackluster. The Original Hawaiian Poke Trio was a nice surprise because it came in three ranges of flavors with ahi tuna and sesame-soy marinade spicy seasoning, but at 19 dollars isn't the most affordable starter meal on the menu. I do give credit to Pacific Catch as everything on the menu does sound unbelievably tasty, even their fish and chips dish is described with a mouth-watering sensibility.  

After thinking and thinking (and thinking) about what I wanted to get that would be a good representation of what Pacific Catch has to offer, I decided to go with the Island Tacos Trio mainly because at 16 dollars you can mix and match three any tacos on their menu. Although they all sounded decent, the three tacos I went with were the Traditional Baja Taco with its Crispy Alaskan Cod, cabbage jalapeno tartar, and avocado tomatillo salsa, the Spiced Chicken Taco with grilled Mary's Chicken, cabbage avocado, chipotle aioli and pico de gallo, and the Pacific Steak Taco with marinated skirt steak, crispy onions, cilantro cabbage, sriracha aioli and lime cream. All three were solid pics with a little spice, a little crunch, and a decent amount of flavor. 

Pacific Catch is a decent place with a thought-provoking menu that combines Asian Fusion, Tex-Mex and fresh seafood entrees. The service, ambiance, and overall quality and presentation of the dishes were basically all on point. I asked at the top is it worth it, and I have to admit at that rate the answer remains no because of the overall type of food being offered doesn't match up with the prices. I simply wish the price points were a little more friendlier to the average tourist that tends to frequent this neighborhood. I would consider going again, maybe for Happy Hour or a late night bite. But there are other more unique and mom and pop style options out there in the Inner Sunset area that are dying to be supported by the community and newcomers alike.

excerpts: One Mahi Mahi, one Cabo Shrimp, and lastly a Pacific steak taco.
pacific steak.author: Katerina Y.
pacific steak.review:
I drive by this place every, single day. so it eventually made it on to my "must try" list.

 I finally went in yesterday and I honestly regret waiting so long. Everything my friend and I ordered was so delicious and not to mention our waitress was so attentive and delightful!

We ordered a Blood Orange Cocktail and a Kiwi Flash. If it wasn't a Monday night, we honestly wouldn't have stopped at just one each!lol

We started off with a Fire Cracker Salmon roll, which was delicious! 

My friend ordered the Mahi Mahi Hawaiin teriyaki bowl which looked, smelled, and tasted oh so good!

I ordered the 3 taco platter. One Mahi Mahi, one Cabo Shrimp, and lastly a Pacific steak taco. Yes, yes, and YES!! 

The portions were huge so we were full almost immediately but we still had room for some Mochi Fondue!! 

Overall, great location, delicious food, heated outdoor seating, can't go wrong!

excerpts: I like getting the Pacific Steak Island Tacos (marinated grilled steak, crispy sweet onions, cabbage & sriracha aioli), but I think they took it off their menu, but if you ask for it they will still make it.
pacific steak.author: Stephanie L.
pacific steak.review:
I loveeeeee their Dulce de Leche Spring Rolls dessert!! I have to get it every time I go here!

I like getting the Pacific Steak Island Tacos (marinated grilled steak, crispy sweet onions, cabbage & sriracha aioli), but I think they took it off their menu, but if you ask for it they will still make it. Sweet potato fries are also really yummy.

One time I came here and my server kept on forgetting to bring me utensils and water so to make up for it she offered us Iced Teas or Thai Iced Teas on the house. I worked at a Thai restaurant, so I wanted to try something I haven't already. We decided to get the Lemongrass Infused Tea and the Tropical Iced Tea. The ice teas were unsweetened, bleh :/ I like it sweet.

I want to come back and try the Poke Wasabi Bowl!

excerpts: I love Pacific Catch especially the pacific steak tacos... mmm yummy.
Great service and very accommodating.
pacific steak.author: Audra H.
pacific steak.review: I love Pacific Catch especially the pacific steak tacos... mmm yummy. Great service and very accommodating.

excerpts: I had the traditional baja and pacific steak tacos and my friend got the baja and chicken tacos.
pacific steak.author: An-Nhien L.
pacific steak.review: Went here for a catch-up dinner date with one of my girlfriends and had a great time! I love the complimentary pretzel goldfish and edamame. Our waiter was great and the food came fast. I had the traditional baja and pacific steak tacos and my friend got the baja and chicken tacos. We had sweet potato fries of course as well. Everything was delicious fresh and flavorful. I also had a 50% off deal from Scoutmob which the waiter graciously accepted. I always make it a point to tip the waiter/waitress generously when I come with a coupon, especially if the service was good. Will definitely be coming back!

excerpts: It was just right and delicious with Hawaiian poke.
The Brussel sprouts was also really good.
We finished everything!
hawaiian poke.author: Donna L.
hawaiian poke.review:
I am never disappointed when I come here. A cosmo martini is only $8!  Wow!  Score. I also had the Japanese wasabi poke rice bowl and Brussels sprouts.  I got
The rice bowl 1/2 brown rice and 1/2 greens. It was just right and delicious with Hawaiian poke. The Brussel sprouts was also really good. We finished everything!

excerpts: We ordered tacos (traditional Baja, Mahi Mahi, and cabo shrimp), the Hawaiian poke appetizer, and the Korean bbq rice bowl.
The poke was a great wonderful mix of flavor although a tad on the saltier side.
The fish was fresh and a nice texture that was not too mushy or chewy.
Of the tacos, my favorite was the cabo shrimp as that one was moist and juicy while the other two tacos were a bit on the drier side which makes sense given that it was fish.
The Kbbq bowl was huge and had a lot of rice.
hawaiian poke.author: Lily F.
hawaiian poke.review:
Went here for dinner on Friday night and it was great. Here's why:

First of all, there's a parking lot which is unheard of in the Sunset area unless you're a super market or a drug store. We found a spot as soon as we pulled in. Next, the restaurant was so lively and bustling. I just loved the atmosphere from the get go. It was busy on a Friday night and the wait was long but they told us there was space at the bar so the two of us took a seat and skipped the entire line. We didn't order any alcohol but the bartender was definitely entertaining to watch. Free show/entertainment with dinner and no line?! Already a good start to the meal.

We ordered tacos (traditional Baja, Mahi Mahi, and cabo shrimp), the Hawaiian poke appetizer, and the Korean bbq rice bowl. The poke was a great wonderful mix of flavor although a tad on the saltier side. The fish was fresh and a nice texture that was not too mushy or chewy. Of the tacos, my favorite was the cabo shrimp as that one was moist and juicy while the other two tacos were a bit on the drier side which makes sense given that it was fish. The Kbbq bowl was huge and had a lot of rice. The meat on the bowl was delicious although I did find the sweet egg quite odd.

The meal took a while to come out due to some unknown reason but the manager noticed and comped our appetizer so great customer service there. The bartender was super nice too. 

Would come here again!

excerpts: The Original Hawaiian Poke Trio was a nice surprise because it came in three ranges of flavors with ahi tuna and sesame-soy marinade spicy seasoning, but at 19 dollars isn't the most affordable starter meal on the menu.

excerpts: $16.50 Japanese Wasabi rice bowl w/ Hawaiian poke - seaweed salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori, soy-wasabi sauce:
The bowl has a decent portion of bite-size chunks of sweet, juicy tuna.
The soy-wasabi sauce is mild and not too strong on the wasabi.
It is also seasoned with green onions, chives, and sesame seeds.
Everything tastes fresh including the pale slivers of creamy avocado and crunchy, crisp seaweed salad.

$12.50 Hawaiian Poke with wonton chips - original ahi tuna, sesame-soy marinade, spicy seasonings:
A small bowl of juicy ahi cubes covered in sesame seeds and micro greens are accompanied with some fried wontons.
hawaiian poke.author: Joy W.
hawaiian poke.review:
I've been here several times over the past few years and I've come to the conclusion that it's never a bad time to have some tasty ahi, as long as it tastes fresh. The menu features mainly California seafood dishes with some Asian fusion touches here and there. This corner venue is large and spacious with very high ceilings, but they keep the place pretty cold. There is also some cozy outdoor seating under some heaters, but keep in mind, it is right next to the bus stop. 

They start you off with some complimentary shelled edamame and pretzel goldfish, which is a cute nod to the seafood menu, but I'd still prefer bread. I also think edamame is more enjoyable with the shell on.

$16.50 Japanese Wasabi rice bowl w/ Hawaiian poke - seaweed salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori, soy-wasabi sauce:
The bowl has a decent portion of bite-size chunks of sweet, juicy tuna. The soy-wasabi sauce is mild and not too strong on the wasabi. It is also seasoned with green onions, chives, and sesame seeds. Everything tastes fresh including the pale slivers of creamy avocado and crunchy, crisp seaweed salad. Be sure to get a little bit of everything in each bite, otherwise you're left with a lots of rice at the bottom of the bowl. 

$15.50 Ahi Tuna Salad w/ seared ahi, greens & romaine, avocado, cucumber, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds, soy-wasabi vinaigrette:
When I want something lighter, I'll go for the salad. The ingredients are pretty much the same, but with lettuce instead of rice. But with a salad, I go for the seared tuna instead of poke, because it creates the illusion of a meatier salad. Again, try to eat a little of everything together, otherwise you're left with a ton of greens, or as my friend calls it, 'rabbit food.'

A lot of people like the sweet potato fries. They're alright, but sweet potato fries are becoming a ubiquitous offering across the board.

Happy hour deals are pretty good if you are in the area in the afternoons. Poke is about $8.

$9 Baja Shrimp Ceviche - lime, serrano chili, avocado, cilantro, tortilla chips:
These bite-size shrimp are springy, meaty and seasoned well. The verde sauce is on the runny side and is quite spicy. I could eat this on its own without tortilla chips too, but the thin, crunchy chips make a nice vehicle.

$12.50 Hawaiian Poke with wonton chips - original ahi tuna, sesame-soy marinade, spicy seasonings:
A small bowl of juicy ahi cubes covered in sesame seeds and micro greens are accompanied with some fried wontons.

$7 Mochi Fondue - vanilla, chocolate, coffee mochi balls & chocolate dipping sauce:
I've tried this out of curiosity, but if you've ever had store-bought mochi ice cream balls, I'd say skip it. The taste is pretty similar with the addition of a little bowl of chocolate sauce on the side for dipping.

The tasty rice bowls are still my go-to items to order here. If I were in the area, I'd come back to try some of the other menu items too.

excerpts: Another thing that caught my eye was the Hawaiian Poke ("raw fish salad") selections.
Being from Hawaii, I wanted to try them out, but I've had enough poke in my life.
hawaiian poke.author: Benjamin B.
hawaiian poke.review:
This was a nice seafood restaurant to go to during my trip to San Francisco. My friend lived by Golden Gate Park, and we were about to go to the Botanical Garden so we stopped here for a quick bite to eat.

-- VENUE --
This place has a nice pier decor to it with modern-styled brick walls, wood floors and wall accents, and comfortable rattan chairs. It was a nice, comfortable place for a seafood restaurant.

-- MENU --
I love seafood, so I'm a little biased in this department. A majority of the menu sounded tasty, and I wish I could've eaten more. I had the 'Korean Stick Ribs' while my friend had a salad. It was presented well and tasted just as good as it looked. When I come back here again I will try more things.

Another thing that caught my eye was the Hawaiian Poke ("raw fish salad") selections. Being from Hawaii, I wanted to try them out, but I've had enough poke in my life. Next time.

-- SERVICE --
The server and waitress were nice, filled our drinks, and let us have our space. What more can you ask for?

-- SUMMARY --
This place checked all the marks on my first visit: great service, nice presentation, tasty food. I'm looking forward to coming back again. Recommended.

excerpts: The Hawaiian poke made me sick of my stomach.
It is already pre-maid tuna binded with mayo.
Not good.
Anyways, there room for plenty of improvement.
I went with 10 co-workers and none of them liked their food.
None!
hawaiian poke.author: Eryka S.
hawaiian poke.review:
Horrible sushi. They aren't a sushi resrayrant, but oh wow, at least do something descent. Rolls were falling apart, tastless. I ordered the salmon roll and did not have salmon in it. They were awkward big, cut in different sizes and full of cheap veggies but no salmon.
The Hawaiian poke made me sick of my stomach. It is already pre-maid tuna binded with mayo. Not good.
Anyways, there room for plenty of improvement.
I went with 10 co-workers and none of them liked their food. None!

excerpts: Only order the seafood main items but whether it is a taco platter, fish sandwich, fish and chips, Hawaiian poke or a chalkboard seafood special, the food has always been fresh and well prepared and the service nice.
The crispy Brussels Sprouts w bacon and a hint of lime are great!
hawaiian poke.author: Steven B.
hawaiian poke.review: Ben here many times. Only order the seafood main items but whether it is a taco platter, fish sandwich, fish and chips, Hawaiian poke or a chalkboard seafood special, the food has always been fresh and well prepared and the service nice. The crispy Brussels Sprouts w bacon and a hint of lime are great!

excerpts: I came here based on a recommendation from a friend to try the wasabi bowl with hawaiian poke.
This was an excellent choice!
I don't normally like wasabi
but it's flavor
was mild in this dish.
The combination of the sauce, poke, and the seaweed, salad and sprouts was flavorful yet light.
hawaiian poke.author: Ali F.
hawaiian poke.review:
I came here based on a recommendation from a friend to try the wasabi bowl with hawaiian poke. This was an excellent choice! I don't normally like wasabi but it's flavor was mild in this dish. The combination of the sauce, poke, and the seaweed, salad and sprouts was flavorful yet light. We also had the fish and chips with sweet potato fries and that was a good choice too. The batter was slightly sweet and crispy.

The restaurant is large so it shouldn't be too difficult to get a table. And they have outdoor seating with a fireplace and heat lamps.

excerpts: Japanese Wasabi Pan-Asian Rice Bowl with Hawaiian Poke - $15 - 4/5 - wakame salad, avocado, daikon, sprouts, cucumber, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori and soy-wasabi sauce.
This bowl was fairly good.
Per other yelper's reviews, I asked for the soy wasabi sauce on the side, but I guess she forgot.
The avocados were flavourless and not ripe, I guess they're not in season?
Everything else was very delicious, the rice was a little bit on the tougher side.
The Hawaiian Poke was quite fresh and delicious.
hawaiian poke.author: Kaje Y.
hawaiian poke.review:
Posted hours say they open at 11am. Now, I've been fasting for 2.5 days, (my eating disorder is a whole other story), so after 60 hours of not eating, I decided I should put some food in my belly before I pass out! 

11:03AM I arrive and the doors are locked. 
11:05AM a UPS man comes by to deliver some packages. Doors unlocked.
11:09AM somebody props the door open and brings the signs out. I ask if they're open and they say yes, is it 11AM yet?

I enter, and takes about 1 minute for somebody to tend to me, despite being the first customer there. I'm seated and provided menus.

Shortly after, a waitress came to see what I wanted to drink, but I have not looked at the menu yet, so I said water is fine and she left. She came back with water and complementary Edamame and Goldfish Pretzels. She leaves again to give me some time to decide on what I want.

My waitress comes back shortly. When I order, she decides to memorize it rather than write it down. I ordered the following:

FOOD 3.75/5*
++  Japanese Wasabi Pan-Asian Rice Bowl with Hawaiian Poke - $15 - 4/5 - wakame salad, avocado, daikon, sprouts, cucumber, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori and soy-wasabi sauce.
=    This bowl was fairly good. Per other yelper's reviews, I asked for the soy wasabi sauce on the side, but I guess she forgot. The avocados were flavourless and not ripe, I guess they're not in season? Everything else was very delicious, the rice was a little bit on the tougher side. The Hawaiian Poke was quite fresh and delicious. 

++    2 Piece Fish and Chips with Sweet Potato Fries - $10 - 3/5 - When ordering this, there is a choice of regular, spicy, or sweet potato fries or a salad. Yelp says get the sweet potato fries! After ordering, the waitress returned and had to ask which fries I asked for. The presentation of this dish is quite cute. It comes on a newspaper themed wax/butcher paper. The fish wasn't very crispy. They were large slabs of fish, but after sitting there for under 5 minutes, the whole bottom side was soggy. No bueno. 
= The sweet potato fries were very very good when they came out hot. If you don't order the appetizer, it doesn't come with the ginger wasabi aioli, but it does come with the Thai chile sauce. Pairs really well with the Thai Chile sauce.

++    Ballast Point Calico Amber Ale - $5.50 - 5/5 - YUM. Upon my first sip, I thought I was drinking an IPA, but then I looked down and saw it was a warm amber colour. Amber Pale Ale? The flavours were great, complex body, and hops off the end. Great beer, decently priced. 

**It's a weighted average.

PRICE 3.5/5
The pricing is fairly average, but just a little bit on the pricier side. Nothing spectacular, but also pretty affordable for SF.

SERVICE 4/5
The service was very very nice. My waitress smiled a lot, was very attentive. I saw in my peripheral that she would talk to the other waiters/waitresses but occasionally glance over to see I was still doing okay. She came over to see how everything wa around my half way point. Only thing is that she should have just written down my order so nothing was missed. (sauce on the side, sweet potato fries)

ROOM AND DECOR 5/5
There is plenty of seating, good for both intimate conversations and large groups. The decor is primarily fish paintings and sculptures. Very fitting.

TIPS / NOTES:
+ UCSF (students?) employees get 10% off
+ They are currently running a $10 off if you pay with Paypal Mobile (the receipt will generate a code, you enter the code into your phone, and it'll pay them automatically. The app will first show the full amount, then after you submit it, it will send you a confirmation email or with the amount you paid as $10 less.)
+ Happy hour: M-F 4-6 and M-Su 10pm-close.

+Rice bowl recommended
-Fish and Chips NOT recommended
+Sweet potato fries recommended
+Ballast Point Calico Amber Ale recommended

Overall, I enjoyed the food. Don't worry I didn't finish it. Boxed the leftovers. It was good, and I may stop by to try some stuff on happy hour.

excerpts: After reading the reviews, we decided to try the California Style Hawaiian Poke and Mahi Mahi Tacos.
What I loved the best of this place is the Hawaiian Poke!
That is super delicious and it comes with chips that you can use to scoop and eat with the poke.
That's probably my favorite out of the two that we tried.
Trying the mahi mahi tacos was just okay.
From the reviews about the tacos, I was looking forward to it and it was a bit of a disappointment.
I was expecting something super delicious
but it gets the job done.
Apparently, it came with fries too
hawaiian poke.author: Teresa W.
hawaiian poke.review:
I tried this for the first time after being recommended by a friend.  Seating was pretty fast and it came with a small dish of complementary Chickpeas and Pretzel crackers.  After reading the reviews, we decided to try the California Style Hawaiian Poke and Mahi Mahi Tacos.  What I loved the best of this place is the Hawaiian Poke!  That is super delicious and it comes with chips that you can use to scoop and eat with the poke.  That's probably my favorite out of the two that we tried.  Trying the mahi mahi tacos was just okay.  From the reviews about the tacos, I was looking forward to it and it was a bit of a disappointment.  I was expecting something super delicious but it gets the job done.  Apparently, it came with fries too and we chose the sweet potato fries.  They were okay as well. 

Overall, food was okay.  Definitely love the poke and will return for it.  Not so much for the tacos.  I love the staff though because they were super friendly.  On two occasions, I was trying to take photos with a friend and both a waitress and a waiter offered to help us take a photo.  That was a very sweet gesture of them!  Will definitely return for the awesome staff and the yummy poke!  I might try something new next time instead of the tacos.

excerpts: all salad and Hawaiian Poke!
hawaiian poke.author: Michelle L.
hawaiian poke.review:
My usual is the Japanese Wasabi bowl w/ all salad and Hawaiian Poke! It's nice, healthy, and light! 

I brought my sister and parents for their first time last week. My ma ordered the Japanese Wasabi bowl w/ crab since I already ordered one with poke! The crab was really nice but I think I still prefer the poke!

My sister ordered the 3 taco platter and all three were delicious! 

My dad ordered the steak dinner w/ kimchee fried rice, veggies, etc. Sadly, the steak wasn't so nice.. We told our waitress and she swapped out his dinner for Salmon instead. I mean I guess just stick to what they're known for here.. seafood and not steaks? She was nice enough to change his meal and ended up not charging us for the steak or the salmon dinner. Sucks though cause I don't think my dad would want come back

excerpts: Also, they were out of one of Hawaiian Poke tonight - spiced tofu.
hawaiian poke.author: Michelle R.
hawaiian poke.review:
A very solid place, with good food and great presentation.

It is an all-occasion spot, you can come for a casual Sunday dinner or to celebrate a birthday.  You can see  all ages and all kind of groups of people, from families with babies to ones with  older parents and everyone in between.  Groups of friends, ages from  20 something to seniors.

We really loved the sweet potato fries for an appetizer.  They came with red chili pepper sauce (yumm) and wasabi aioli.

My mahi mahi tacos were really good. They came with avocado and lettuce, a small bowl of beans on the side, and you could have an option of fries or salad with it.  There were 2 tacos on a plate.  I don't like huge portions, so this was plenty.

 My husband had a bowl of grilled mahi mahi with brown rice, roasted pineapple, caramelized onions and shaved coconut.   He really enjoyed it and could barely finish his plate, it was so much food.

We were so full that we couldn't  even  finish our side of warm edamame.

My son had fish and chips.  I tried his fries, the seasoning on them was a really good combination.

Some food, like sweet potato fries, tacos were served on a sheet of a newspaper which happened to be a Hawaiian Tribune from April 1, 1901.  Pretty cool, although I've seen it before (at an Italian Seafood place, on Irving and 9th, not far from this one.)

Cons:  The California roll that my daughter ordered was a bit dry. It also was overpriced at $9.  The wine was overpriced too, at $9 a glass, and it wasn't that much wine in the glass.  Also, they were out of one of Hawaiian Poke tonight - spiced tofu.

Nevertheless, we enjoyed our dinner and definitely will be back.

excerpts: I was craving some Hawaiian Poke, so my best friend
and I decided to dine here for dinner.
We ordered the California Style Poke, Marinated Skirt Steak Rice Bowl, Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl, and Firecracker Salmon Roll.
We finished majority of it all, yes we did (no shame, I'm tellin' you.)
But anyway, I really enjoy their poke, the wonton chips that comes with it was soooo crunchy and thinly cut, it melted in my mouth (a little exaggeration there, but nevertheless, I loved it).
My friend said the same thing regarding the Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl
hawaiian poke.author: Anna L.
hawaiian poke.review:
You know you're hungry when your bill comes out to be around 90$ total with only 2 people. Or maybe we're just fatasses.

I was craving some Hawaiian Poke, so my best friend and I decided to dine here for dinner. We sat near the bar/lounge area; this is a great spot for a good picture if you're a crazy insta-food-ographer like myself #guilty

We ordered the California Style Poke, Marinated Skirt Steak Rice Bowl, Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl, and Firecracker Salmon Roll. We finished majority of it all, yes we did (no shame, I'm tellin' you.) But anyway, I really enjoy their poke, the wonton chips that comes with it was soooo crunchy and thinly cut, it melted in my mouth (a little exaggeration there, but nevertheless, I loved it). PERFECT!

The rice bowl, however, was not as impressive especially for the price of it. I thought my rice bowl was way too overflowing with sauce, which made it so much saltier than it should taste and let me tell you, I am not a big fan of salty food. Not only that, the stuff that comes in it was nothing out of the ordinary. My friend said the same thing regarding the Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl =/ 

We've also ordered drinks as well and I believe we got the Agave Margarita and Pacific Catch Mai Tai. Not too sure if these were the drinks but it balances out the food we ate and helped extract the saltiness in the rice bowl, which is a good thing I guess? 

Other than that, I will come back and try other poke because I am a huge fan of poke!

excerpts: The man ordered the regular Hawaiian poke with half brown rice half white rice the rest greens.
Mmmm.
The serving size is ginormous.
(Welcome to America).
And the meal is good enough to be split into two.
hawaiian poke.author: Bern M.
hawaiian poke.review:
The man and I went out for dinner after an exhausting working putting us both out of commission in the kitchen...even for eggs.

We meandered through the neighborhood and went into this CA chain.

Ooooo, weee! I love me some poke.

We ordered the bowls.

I ordered the salmon poke bowl with half greens and half brown rice! I love this option. The man ordered the regular Hawaiian poke with half brown rice half white rice the rest greens. Mmmm. The serving size is ginormous. (Welcome to America). And the meal is good enough to be split into two. We took the extra helpings home for lunch the next day.

We also ordered the salmon skin roll. Oh yum! While I love the crunch of salmon skin, I also loved that herby minty leaf they put in the roll. I forgot to ask what exactly it is, but I'll pop in and ask soon! 

We'll be back for more and I can see this being one of our go-to restaurants. 

Come here to sit by the fire and heater or enjoy your food indoors!

excerpts: My favorite appetizer is the Hawaiian poke with wonton crisps!
So mouth watering.
If you're in the mood for dessert than definitely try the dulce de leche spring rolls!
Absolute FAV!
hawaiian poke.author: Tiffany H.
hawaiian poke.review: THE BOWLS!! Every bowl is so good!! I definitely love coming here and I always went with my boyfriend so it's a great place for dinner dates or birthday dinners! You get a free birthday dessert also! I've gotten the Hawaiian Ahi poke bowl and I've tried the Korean BBQ bowl! Both are equally good. But if you're more into the light wasabi flavor than definitely try the Hawaiian Ahi Bowl. My favorite appetizer is the Hawaiian poke with wonton crisps! So mouth watering. If you're in the mood for dessert than definitely try the dulce de leche spring rolls! Absolute FAV!

excerpts:
[ F O O D ]
- ORIGINAL HAWAIIAN POKE - yummmy!
must get!

I love the combination of avocado, tuna, seaweed salad, etc.
- Fish and Chip - I've had better but its not bad here...
I liked the Jalepeno tartar.
hawaiian poke.author: Tammy F.
hawaiian poke.review:
We came for a Mother's Day Dinner with my Mom and brother. We made a reservation and waited about 15 minutes for our table. 

[ S E R V I C E ] 
- Our waitress Chelsea is super friendly. She came back to check on us multiple time. GREAT SERVICE!

[ F O O D ]
- ORIGINAL HAWAIIAN POKE - yummmy!! must get! I love the combination of avocado, tuna, seaweed salad, etc.
- Fish and Chip - I've had better but its not bad here...I liked the Jalepeno tartar.
- Calfornia Salmon Sandwich - my brother said it was one of the best sandwich he ever had.
- Sweet potato fries - yummy
- Sticky Ribs Korean BBQ - I liked it! Finger-lickin' good!

[ A M B I A N C E ]
- Bar is nice with TVs so you can watch the game.
- Restaurant seemed cleaned.
- Spacious! I love the booths!

[ P A R K I N G ]
- Parking lot located right next to the restaurant but there are limited spaces and they are usually occupied. I usually look for street parking, which could be hard around that area.

[ H A P P Y H O U R ]
- Happy hour from 4:00 to 6:00 Monday through Friday and everyday from 10pm to closing. Will definitely come back and try the HH.

excerpts: Hawaiian Poke Brown Rice Bowl: I never would've thought of ordering this if it wasn't for Yelp!
I'm eating it right now as I type.
I had a ton
leftover because it wasn't the best thing to eat yesterday morning hungover!
By far my favorite thing from Pacific Catch.
hawaiian poke.author: Tiffany V.
hawaiian poke.review:
I think the text my best friend sent me yesterday morning sums up my feelings about Pacific Catch, "wtf wtfff why are you always at pacific catch crazy woman" Haha. 

I didn't even realize how much I loved this place until I kept finding myself there. It wasn't even until the third time did I realize they had a parking lot next to the restaurant! How handy! Such a rare find in San Francisco. 

Fish & Chips: Everyone loves these but I don't think its their best thing there. You should definitely get 4 pieces though since its $14 and 2 pieces is already $10. The pieces of fish aren't that big. I love the sauces it comes with but the Jalapeno Tartar sauce was never spicy to me. I think the coleslaw side is far too small as well but I love their sweet potato fries (the only reason I wanted to come in the first place haha)

California Roll Salad: I love this salad! Although I had it at every meal and I got kind of sick of it at the end. The salad is huge and you'll probably have a hard time finishing it. It comes with a ton of avocado and a even bigger mound of real crab. It really does taste like a california roll! I think its around $13. 

Hawaiian Poke Brown Rice Bowl: I never would've thought of ordering this if it wasn't for Yelp! I'm eating it right now as I type. I had a ton leftover because it wasn't the best thing to eat yesterday morning hungover! By far my favorite thing from Pacific Catch. You can also get it with white rice or 1/2 rice & 1/2 greens. 

Mochi Fondue: Nothing special. Just 3 mochi balls cut in half and a little bowl of tasty melty chocolate to dip it in. There was way too much chocolate in the bowl though and I felt bad for wasting it. I don't think its worth the money since it isn't very creative and you could just make the same thing yourself for far less. 

There is never a wait when I go. My friend and I were about to get dinner at the Presidio location until we drove by it noticed how tiny and packed it was. We just drove all the way to the 9th street location. This location is huge. Service has always been nice as well. I probably wouldn't go on a first date here though as it is a little bit commercial and there are tons of better first date restaurants in the area.

excerpts: *HAWAIIAN POKE WASABI BOWL w/ Tobiko & Brown Rice ($14.95 +$2 for Tobiko):  YUMMY!
hawaiian poke.author: Cherylynn N.
hawaiian poke.review:
The Third Time was Definitely a Charm...

Before my Yelping hiatus which started two years ago, I had come to this Pacific Catch location two other times and was not impressed, not even remotely. The food was mediocre at the very best and forgettable.

On Friday, 5.27.11, I came to Pacific Catch for my friend's Birthday Dinner. We had reservations for a party of 14 at 7 pm. Upon arrival, it took about 5-7 minutes for them to set up our table and be seated.

F O O D:
This time I did my due diligence and made sure I looked at the other Yelper's reviews to see what to order. The Poke and Sweet Potato Fries were overwhelming mentioned in many reviews, so I decided to entrust in my fellow Yelpers and I was not disappointed. Thank you, Yelpers!

*HAWAIIAN POKE WASABI BOWL w/ Tobiko & Brown Rice ($14.95 +$2 for Tobiko):  YUMMY!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/3bxO8T8U96uKu2numljjsw?select=GXy8_YmqbfOJ6fPhUrOi7w

The poke was hands down the BEST I've ever had! The thick chunks of tuna were uber fresh, tender and succulent. The soy wasabi sauce, albeit a bit salty, gave the tuna a nice savory sweet flavor with a hint of spice while the sesame seeds and roasted nori gave it a touch of nuttiness. The accoutrements of wakame salad, daikon sprouts, cucumber, and ginger were all very fresh and crisp. The brown rice, however, was undercooked and hard.

*SWEET POTATO FRIES ($3.50 for a Side Order): DANGEROUSLY ADDICTING!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/3bxO8T8U96uKu2numljjsw?select=neBvXM0nJIZivB8_tiEe7g

The fresh-out-of the fryer sweet potato fries were crispy throughout with a soft, fluffy center. The light sprinkle of salt brought out the natural sweetness of the potatoes. There were two accompanying sauces: Thai Sweet Chili and Wasabi Aioli. I preferred the Wasabi Aioli as it added a layer of creaminess with a slight nose tingle from the wasabi.

S E R V I C E:
Very friendly but slow which is understandable because we were in a large party and the restaurant was packed. Nevertheless, the staff did a good job making sure everyone got their entrees at the same time although the last three took 5 minutes longer than the others. I did have to ask several times for my water glass to be refilled so perhaps leaving a water pitcher for larger parties may be a good idea.

A M B I A N C E / D É C O R:
Contemporary and fun; Pacific Catch is good for casual lunch and dinners. Since it's a large restaurant, it's also good for large parties. The noise level is very, very loud though so it's very likely you'll have to scream across the table if you want to be heard.

P A R K I N G:
Although Pacific Catch has a small lot with a 10-car capacity, getting a parking space in that lot is like hitting the jackpot. Street parking is no easy task either so make sure to allot an extra 15 minutes to find parking. Your best bet is looking for parking at Golden Gate Park which is just across the street. 

The is one of the few times that Yelpers didn't lead me astray, so if you're coming to Pacific Catch, definitely order the Poke and Sweet Potato Fries. You will NOT be disappointed!

excerpts: I used to like the Marina location much better, but now the two locations are comparable in winning my heart for a Hawaiian Poke Wasabi Bowl or Crispy Oyster Basket.
hawaiian poke.author: Ally W.
hawaiian poke.review:
This location of Pacific Catch has improved a lot over the last few years.  I used to like the Marina location much better, but now the two locations are comparable in winning my heart for a Hawaiian Poke Wasabi Bowl or Crispy Oyster Basket.  The wasabi is not very strong at all, just enough to tickle my palate.

1 star off: The tacos and sandwiches are just all right...nothing that you cannot get anywhere else.

I am usually so full after ordering the Wasabi Bowl, but still manage to stuff my face with fried oysters.

excerpts: Ordered the Calamari Appetizer $9.95 and Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl $15.50.
So fresh!
The Calamari was lightly battered and tender as can be.
The Hawaiian Poke Rice bowl taste exactly like a Sushirito (in San Francisco yelp it!)
hawaiian poke.author: Moses D.
hawaiian poke.review:
Had my first experience here the other day and I can say that they put great quality in their food. Ordered the Calamari Appetizer $9.95 and Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl $15.50. So fresh! The Calamari was lightly battered and tender as can be. The Hawaiian Poke Rice bowl taste exactly like a Sushirito (in San Francisco yelp it!) but in a bowl version. 

I'm thinking of going here during happy hour cause most items are discounted. Ps if you pay with PayPal you get $10 off your meal!

excerpts: My default place to go when I need a Hawaiian poke fix.
hawaiian poke.author: Ruxin H.
hawaiian poke.review:
My default place to go when I need a Hawaiian poke fix. Every Time I'm around inner sunset area, I would try my best to come here and get the original poke. I also tried several of their pokes and the original is definitely my favorite. It is kinda marinated ahi tuna chunks with soy sauce and onions. The tuna is fresh and high grade. I wouldn't say it is the highest quality of ahi tuna, but I think it is very good for the price point.

I would recommend getting the appetizer of tuna poke as opposed to wasabi bowls. I feel the portion of fish is a little smaller in the bowls and wonton chips in the appetizer go well with the poke. 

Sometimes I got the take out order of the poke appetizer and they gave a soup cup size of poke. 

I also came here for dinner before and their salmon/catch of day is pretty good too. Very huge portion.

Plus, service is incredible here. They served edamame when you are seated

excerpts: My go-to bowl is the Japanese Wasabi Bowl with Hawaiian Poke and Brown Rice in lieu of White Rice.
My friend got another bowl, which looked really good, too!
hawaiian poke.author: Jennifer L.
hawaiian poke.review:
I came here after a shitty day at Oysterfest... and this was PERFECT.  Seriously made my day 1000000% better.  I was nursing a hangover for the first part of the day, and then waiting in lines at Oysterfest didn't make it better. 

I HIGHLY recommend the Pan-Asian Rice Bowls!!  My go-to bowl is the Japanese Wasabi Bowl with Hawaiian Poke and Brown Rice in lieu of White Rice.  My friend got another bowl, which looked really good, too!  If you're hesitant about spending $15 on a bowl, it's because you're getting a HUGE bowl! 

The salads are pretty similar to the bowls, but without rice, so if you don't want to carry around leftovers, go for that :)  I ate at the Pacific Catch stand at Oysterfest, and I have also been to the Marina location.

I loooove this place just because it will fill you up without making you feel all greasy or weighed down!

excerpts: Hawaiian Poke rice
bowl-

This was the best dish at the table!
4) Pacific steak-3.5/5-Great, but again, nothing out of the ordinary
hawaiian poke.author: Jen H.
hawaiian poke.review:
Overall a solid 3.5 stars, but I bumped it up an extra 0.5 star for dog friendliness.

I actually didn't expect much of this place, but it was dog friendly and there were televisions (for sports), so we decided to drop in. Pacific Catch exceeded my expectation. 

The service was fairly slow, but maybe b/c we sat outside (with the heaters right above us).

Ordered:
1) Ecstasy sushi roll-2.5/5, not so great
2) Mahi Mahi tac0-3/5, great, but not memorable 
3) Hawaiian Poke rice bowl- 4/5 This was the best dish at the table!
4) Pacific steak-3.5/5-Great, but again, nothing out of the ordinary

excerpts: Hawaiian Poke (regular menu) - SO DELICIOUS!
If you come here, you need to get a poke something.
hawaiian poke.author: Jessica L.
hawaiian poke.review:
My girlfriends and I came here for happy hour M-F 4-6pm, 10pm-close only in the bar area.

Hawaiian Poke (regular menu) - SO DELICIOUS! If you come here, you need to get a poke something. The poke cubes are bigger than normal, super fresh, and is so good.

Happy hour menu was all delicious! We ordered Spicy Pacific Martinis and Agave Margaritas, both good. I would recommend the martini on the rocks!

Highlights were the peruvian ceviche, thai coconut shrimp, cabo calamari, let's get saucy, and shiso fine. We ordered double of some of these (fatties, I know), but the other hh options are definitely more normal items you can get anywhere. This is a great place for happy hour with great prices, and I would for sure recommend it!

excerpts:
Peruvian Ceviche ($6 HH) - Purple potato chips and a great tasting yellow ceviche with generous helpings of avocado, tomatoes, and fish.

-- Hawaiian Poke ($9.5)
hawaiian poke.author: Kevin W.
hawaiian poke.review:
I'm still wish that Pacific Catch's Happy Hour would go past 6PM for us poor working saps.  GRRR!

-- Spicy Pacific Martini ($7 HH) - My new favorite is strong and spicy with a few pepper seeds floating inside.  Much better and more unique than the typical $4.50 HH well drinks or the $6 HH well martinis.

-- Basket of Fries ($4 HH) - Don't be boring with the regular fries, and mix-and-match the spicy fries with the sweet potato fries.

-- Peruvian Ceviche ($6 HH) - Purple potato chips and a great tasting yellow ceviche with generous helpings of avocado, tomatoes, and fish.

-- Hawaiian Poke ($9.5) - I still love the Poke even though it's not on Happy Hour anymore.  It's that good.

-- Spicy Tuna Roll ($6 HH) - The tuna had a little too much something (aioli?) mixed in, so the roll was a pinkish color rather than a deep red.  Not pretty on the eyes, but pretty in the tummy.

Extend the Happy Hour, goshdarnit!

excerpts: We had a lot of dishes, fish and chips, deep fried Brussels sprouts, sweet potato fries, Hawaiian poke rice bowl, and the daily fish.
Everything was cooked well,with lots of flavor.
Fish and chips had an especially nice batter and the cod was nice and flaky.
hawaiian poke.author: John R.
hawaiian poke.review:
Great service and really tasty food. The parking lot was a nice relief from a crowded area.

We had a lot of dishes, fish and chips, deep fried Brussels sprouts, sweet potato fries, Hawaiian poke rice bowl, and the daily fish. Everything was cooked well,with lots of flavor. Fish and chips had an especially nice batter and the cod was nice and flaky.

excerpts: I am fan of their Hawaiian Poke Trio, I enjoy a dish that you can sample a variety of fusion of flavors.
The poke is fresh and tasty.
Also, to spicy things up try the Spicy Pacific cocktail.
The cocktail has serrano chilies that are muddled, just enough heat for those who like just a hint of it.
hawaiian poke.author: D. S.
hawaiian poke.review:
First, I highly recommend to make a reservation or you will be waiting for a long time.
I am fan of their Hawaiian Poke Trio, I enjoy a dish that you can sample a variety of fusion of flavors. The poke is fresh and tasty. Also, to spicy things up try the Spicy Pacific cocktail. The cocktail has serrano chilies that are muddled, just enough heat for those who like just a hint of it. I my self always ask for it to be extra spicy and they always deliver on my requests.

Also give the Cabo Calamari a go, a dish that also has a hint of heat [fresh chilies]. You can ask for it to be extra  spicy or not so spicy,

excerpts: They have lots of seafood options for dinner including some chicken, standard fish and chips, fish tacos, hawaiian poke apps (I wish they had Poke entrees like poke rice bowl or salad) and sushi rolls.
I had the tom Kha special soup which was really good, but an american version super thick and creamy - almost chowder like
but it was very good.
The roll i tried and my poke were good as well- nothing outstanding.
The fish and chips and fish tacos others in my party had were reported and good also.
Seems quite popular and accommodating for families with kids.
hawaiian poke.author: B S.
hawaiian poke.review: A great option for those looking to stick to "american" food in this neighborhood. They have lots of seafood options for dinner including some chicken, standard fish and chips, fish tacos, hawaiian poke apps (I wish they had Poke entrees like poke rice bowl or salad) and sushi rolls. I had the tom Kha special soup which was really good, but an american version super thick and creamy - almost chowder like but it was very good. The roll i tried and my poke were good as well- nothing outstanding. The fish and chips and fish tacos others in my party had were reported and good also. Seems quite popular and accommodating for families with kids.

excerpts: Pacific Catch is my go-to American seafood restaurant, and I go pretty regularly  whenever I crave Hawaiian poke.
Sometimes I get their poke trio, which as the name implies, consists of three different kinds of poke/ceviche, but the Hawaiian poke is always the best.
Their entrees change depending on what's fresh that day, but the fish is always fresh, well prepared, and their servings are generously sized.
The service is always friendly and efficient, and the price is very reasonable.
hawaiian poke.author: Allen T.
hawaiian poke.review: Pacific Catch is my go-to American seafood restaurant, and I go pretty regularly  whenever I crave Hawaiian poke. Sometimes I get their poke trio, which as the name implies, consists of three different kinds of poke/ceviche, but the Hawaiian poke is always the best. Their entrees change depending on what's fresh that day, but the fish is always fresh, well prepared, and their servings are generously sized.  The service is always friendly and efficient, and the price is very reasonable.

excerpts: D and I shared a fried platter with spicy fries (the fries were bomb.com) and a Japanese Wasabi bowl with Hawaiian Poke.
hawaiian poke.author: Jessica H.
hawaiian poke.review:
So the sweet sweet deal is that they have a parking lot. Parking lot in the sunset? Homeboy say wahhhh?

Anyways, we wandered in on a Tuesday night after I scooped up D from Caltrain. Pretty calm night, and pretty empty; which is always greatly appreciated. Sometimes I want a quiet night with no crowds.

We got seated and order our meals. D and I shared a fried platter with spicy fries (the fries were bomb.com) and a Japanese Wasabi bowl with Hawaiian Poke.

The fried platter was eh, and definitely would not get again. Maybe its because I was still recovering from a cough, but it just wasnt that tasty, and the sauces didn't really seem to go well (they gave us tarter sauce and sweet chilli sauce).

The bowl on the other hand was delicious. I ordered one, and the waiter was nice enough to ask if they should split it for us, since it was pretty clear that we were sharing. Most of the time, when you split something its never enough, but it was the perfect amount for me and for D.

Coming back next time to try more of their fresh fish and stuff. But like I said, avoiding the fried platter.

excerpts: I have tried several other poke places in the Bay Area and I can safely say this is the closest thing to Hawaiian poke.
hawaiian poke.author: Erick K.
hawaiian poke.review:
Poke, poke, poke. It's what folks are clamoring about here, and it certainly didn't disappoint! I have tried several other poke places in the Bay Area and I can safely say this is the closest thing to Hawaiian poke. The original and macadamia flavors really complemented each other. Combined with the awesome sweet potato, and they have a recipe for success. 

We also ordered the ahi salad (not poke) and it was great. The vegetable was fresh, and the ginger complemented the overall dish well. The ahi is the star though as it was cooked perfectly. Crisp on the outside and raw on the inside. Yum. 

Was mulling for 5 stars but the fish taco was on the average side. Taco is a bit thick and it overpowers the cod fish inside. Definitely 4.5 start though. And if you like poke, definitely a great place to go.

excerpts: The second time I got the ceviche sampler, which comes with the baja shrimp ceviche, the Peruvian ceviche and the Hawaiian poke.
hawaiian poke.author: Christine U.
hawaiian poke.review:
I've been here twice now, and seafood is definitely fresh. The first time I got the Baja shrimp ceviche and the coconut shrimp. Both were really tasty, the coconut batter on the shrimp was just right and the shrimp ceviche had a lot of shrimp in it. The second time I got the ceviche sampler, which comes with the baja shrimp ceviche, the Peruvian ceviche and the Hawaiian poke. The Baja was still the best, the Poke was a little over seasoned and the Peruvian kind of skimped on the amount of fish (and was kind of...oily?).

While I liked my meals, the people that I went with (on both occasions) both got the rice bowls and complained that it was way too much rice and not nearly enough meat/fish. 

The food is pretty good, but the rice bowls ($15)  were overpriced in my opinion for the amount of protein you get. 

I would give this a 3.5 probably but the staff was nice so I rounded up!

excerpts: I would most definitely recommend this place to anyone who loves Hawaiian Poke!!!
No words to describe how delicious it was :) I will for sure be back here!!!
mmmm....
hawaiian poke.author: Julia K.
hawaiian poke.review:
This place is incredibly awesome. Me and my boyfriend decided to come here one Friday because it always looks super packed and we did not regret it. The service was just amazing, we were seated within the first 5 minutes and everyone was so sweet and friendly.

We got a waitress that was awesome as well! She told us all about the best dishes and the the food was to die for. All the fish was so fresh and yummy! 

I would most definitely recommend this place to anyone who loves Hawaiian Poke!!! No words to describe how delicious it was :) I will for sure be back here!!! mmmm....

excerpts: My favorite thing to get here is their Japanese Wasabi Bowl with Hawaiian poke and half brown rice, half greens.
So good
and it's also pretty big,
so it's filling; I can never finish one.
I ask for the dressing on the side though, because sometimes they put too much and it can be overpowering in the bowl.
I love how it comes with seaweed salad, and avocado too!
My bf ordered the poke trio once and I definitely recommend that as well.
They also serve you pretzel goldfish and edamame while deciding what to order.
Their cocktails are strong too; I remember being really buzzed after 1 drink.
hawaiian poke.author: Stephanie G.
hawaiian poke.review: This restaurant is very spacious compared to most SF restaurants and there is also a bar area. I would have given this place 3.5 stars the first time I ate here because I didn't really like what I ordered (tacos), but after coming here again, I bumped it up to 4 stars. My favorite thing to get here is their Japanese Wasabi Bowl with Hawaiian poke and half brown rice, half greens. So good and it's also pretty big, so it's filling; I can never finish one. I ask for the dressing on the side though, because sometimes they put too much and it can be overpowering in the bowl. I love how it comes with seaweed salad, and avocado too! My bf ordered the poke trio once and I definitely recommend that as well. They also serve you pretzel goldfish and edamame while deciding what to order. Their cocktails are strong too; I remember being really buzzed after 1 drink.

excerpts: I had the Japanese Wasabi rice bowl with Hawaiian poke.
SO GOOD.
Everything about it was perfect, I highly recommend it.
It had the perfect amount of wasabi, soy sauce and the poke was really fresh.
Service was bit slow
but it was really busy
and we were pretty distracted by the game
hawaiian poke.author: Alli Q.
hawaiian poke.review:
So glad that I finally got to try this place! We came on a Sunday around 6:30PM and sat at the bar because we wanted to watch NBA finals. It was pretty busy but we got lucky because there was one table open. I can't speak for the normal seating area but the bar area is really nice! They had seasonal and fresh drinks that looked really good too.  I had the Japanese Wasabi rice bowl with Hawaiian poke. SO GOOD. Everything about it was perfect, I highly recommend it. It had the perfect amount of wasabi, soy sauce and the poke was really fresh.
