Service was bit slow but it was really busy and we were pretty distracted by the game so it didn't ruin our experience at all!

P.S. They had a gluten free menu - you just gotta ask for it!

excerpts: The Hawaiian poke is by far the best of the four we tried (macadamia, yuzu, and California were the other three) but the yuzu was good, too.
hawaiian poke.author: Grace A.
hawaiian poke.review:
Friendly staff and decent prices. The lounge outside is nice for a medium sized group on a nice day--- we had a blast.

The Hawaiian poke is by far the best of the four we tried (macadamia, yuzu, and California were the other three) but the yuzu was good, too. I suggest getting the trio anyway just because it is fun, but definitely get the Hawaiian on its own if you can.

Also do not miss the spicy mango martini (perhaps I am forgetting the name, but they'll know what I mean) or the coconut prawns. Just, don't.

Great beer selection, too, and the bathrooms were clean. 10/10 would bang.

excerpts: I chose the Original Hawaiian Poke, the special of Pulled Pork sliders with pineapple slaw, and a blood orange margarita.
hawaiian poke.author: Jenessa R.
hawaiian poke.review:
Decided to stop by this place for dinner after walking around the Lincoln/ 9th Ave/ Irving area. What really caught my eye on the menu was the variety of Poke options, and I love me some poke.

The restaurant itself is pretty cute; it has a casual, beachy feel while still seeming nice enough for dinner after work. I chose the Original Hawaiian Poke, the special of Pulled Pork sliders with pineapple slaw, and a blood orange margarita.

Overall, the food was decent. I wasn't too thrilled about it though. I've had some pretty good poke, so my expectations are pretty high. While it was nice, both the poke itself and the wonton chips served with it had way too much salt for me. I finished most of it, but couldn't get through the last little bit just because the taste of salt became so overwhelming. 

The pulled pork sliders were really delicious, with the pork being so nicely seasoned and cooked, and the sweetness of the pineapple slaw plus the Hawaiian rolls were a nice blend. My only gripe about these little sliders is that I wanted there to be more of the pork to balance out the thick fluffiness of the roll. 

The margarita was pretty good; Blood orange flavoring seems to be getting popular right now, and I'm all for that.

My mom seemed to be a little annoyed at how little our server was attending to us. She was very nice and polite when she was, but we had to keep scanning for her and didn't see her very often. 

It was a nice dinner. I may come back here again if I'm in the area, but I'm not salivating or yearning to come back in the near future.

excerpts: After many years of refusing sashimi, I've recently acquired the taste for raw fish, so my roommates decided to introduce me to the Hawaiian Poke at Pacific Catch.
Wow, and I do mean WOW that is goooooood.
Beautifully flavored and pairs well with the chips served in the appetizer dish.
hawaiian poke.author: Melinda W.
hawaiian poke.review:
After many years of refusing sashimi, I've recently acquired the taste for raw fish, so my roommates decided to introduce me to the Hawaiian Poke at Pacific Catch. Wow, and I do mean WOW that is goooooood. Beautifully flavored and pairs well with the chips served in the appetizer dish. We also shared the sweet potato fries, ahi tuna salad, and mahi mahi tacos. Every single dish was so delicious, and even though we were full after our meal, we didn't feel like we were about to explode like we sometimes do after a carb binge.

Service was great and the interior was very well decorated. Made me feel like I was dining at a classy seaside resto (until I looked out the window and saw the traffic instead of the ocean, but whatever).

excerpts: You MUST MUST MUST order the Hawaiian poke as an appetizer.
It was my favorite dish of the night.
The wonton chips were perfectly crispy and well cooked (also had a bit of a sweet flavor), and the ahi-tuna was melt in your mouth DELISH!
Calamari is always the standard appetizer, but I say get the Hawaiian poke instead.
I would just come back for the Hawaiian poke!
hawaiian poke.author: Stephanie B.
hawaiian poke.review:
Eh - so much hype for this place and it really wasn't allll that. 

It's cute they give you goldfish and edamame to munch on but kinda weird they give a small amount. But then again, you don't want to eat too much!

You MUST MUST MUST order the Hawaiian poke as an appetizer. It was my favorite dish of the night. The wonton chips were perfectly crispy and well cooked (also had a bit of a sweet flavor), and the ahi-tuna was melt in your mouth DELISH! I loved it. 

After the poke though, everything else fell kinda short.

The cabo calamari was good but not unique or better than other calamari dishes I have tried. Calamari is always the standard appetizer, but I say get the Hawaiian poke instead.

I ordered the mixed catch basket, which comes with coconut shrimp, fried oysters, fish, and sweet potato fries. I thought the coconut shrimp was kinda forgettable - something about it didn't wow me. The fish was definitely fresh but like the coconut shrimp, I was "whatever" about it. I did, oddly enough, really like the fried oyster. Maybe it's because it was the only thing in my basket that had tons of flavor? And the sweet potato fries were kinda cold? Or at least, they were not warm. I love sweet potato fries and mine were just bland in a way.

They also don't give you enough sauce for your food.

I'm hoping that maybe I ordered the wrong thing? Or maybe at the wrong time? I would just come back for the Hawaiian poke!

excerpts: Next time, maybe sure to order the Japanese Wasabi bowl, the Seared Ahi (MMM) or the Hawaiian Poke!
hawaiian poke.author: Joyce M.
hawaiian poke.review:
This place was A-OK. I went with a friend during my visit in San Francisco. He recommended the Pan-Asian Rice Bowls so I gave it a try! I have NO idea why I got the Korean BBQ bowl........wtf? LOL worst place to get a KBBQ bowl....why wasn't I thinking clearly with the poke.. or something seafood.. Anyway I had that and it was very mediocre plus the pricing was XXXXXXPENSIVE! My friend got the Hawaiian Terriyaki and that was alright too...

Next time, maybe sure to order the Japanese Wasabi bowl, the Seared Ahi (MMM) or the Hawaiian Poke!

excerpts: Hawaiian poke and a mojito are my goto.
This will be my deathrow last meal request some day, and I can't wait!!!!!
hawaiian poke.author: Jason B.
hawaiian poke.review: My favorite joint in San Francisco! Hawaiian poke and a mojito are my goto. This will be my deathrow last meal request some day, and I can't wait!!!!!

excerpts:
What we ordered:

Pacific Ceviche Trio ($17) - a sampling of shrimp ceviche, Hawaiian poke & Peruvian ceviche with chips.
I got the Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl ($15).
It had tuna, wakame salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, cucumber, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori and soy-wasabi sauce.
I agree with other Yelpers.
The portion was huge and had a lot of rice but not much fish.
$15 was a little bit over price.
But the taste was pretty good.
The fish was fresh and flavorful.
I got half brown rice and half salad.
All ingredients were very fresh and tasty.
The only thing is the soy-wasabi sauce was little bit too much.
hawaiian poke.author: Liza T.
hawaiian poke.review:
first time came here and I love it.......

We had reservation at 7:30pm but we were15 minutes early.  Good that we got seated right the way.   Parking was a nightmare there.  Make sure you come early to allow yourself to look for parking.

All the staffs were friendly there.  Our server was very nice and friendly but was lacking service toward the end of the meal,  I guess he was too busy with the other big party (15 people).  He was pretty slow and did not refill our water.

The menu was extensive.  There were a lot of varieties that you could choose from.  You can choose from Salad, Rice Bowls, Tacos, Sandwiches, etc...

What we ordered:

Pacific Ceviche Trio ($17) - a sampling of shrimp ceviche, Hawaiian poke & Peruvian ceviche with chips.  It was great.  The portion was good for share.  I really like the purple potato chips.  It was perfect to eat with the poke.  Poke was so fresh and flavorful.  

Sweet Potato Fries ($6) - Portion was big.  The fries was so good.  Thick, crispy outside and soft inside.  It came with ginger wasabi aioli and sweet Thai chili sauces.  I think the wasabi aioli was better with the fries.  

Spicy Tuna Sushi Roll ($8.50) - The sushi roll was huge.  very filling......everything was so fresh.

California Roll ($9.00) - Again, the roll was big.  The crab meat was real crab salad.  Tasty.......

I got the Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl ($15).  It had tuna, wakame salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, cucumber, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori and soy-wasabi sauce.  I agree with other Yelpers.  The portion was huge and had a lot of rice but not much fish.  $15 was a little bit over price.  But the taste was pretty good.   The fish was fresh and flavorful.  I got half brown rice and half salad.  All ingredients were very fresh and tasty.  The only thing is the soy-wasabi sauce was little bit too much.  Kinda of salty to me.

My sister got the Ahi Rice Bowl ($15).  The ingredients were the same as the other rice bowls except the fish.  Ahi was very fresh.  I did not read the menu carefully.  If I knew the Ceviche Trio had poke, I would order Ahi rice bowl instead.

I really wanted to try their mochi for the dessert but I was too full.....Ok, next time!

excerpts: I've also had the Hawaiian poke, and it's delicious - fresh and light.
hawaiian poke.author: Laurel K.
hawaiian poke.review:
I have an unhealthy obsession with salmon. Well, I guess not that unhealthy if you take into account the omega-3s but seriously, I always crave it. And thus, I LOVE Pacific Catch's Japanese rice bowl with grilled salmon. Everything (avocado, seaweed, veggies) is fresh, and the salmon is cooked perfectly. Plus, it's big enough that I usually eat it over two meals.

I've also had the Hawaiian poke, and it's delicious - fresh and light.

I saw some complaints w/service here - whenever I've been it's definitely bustling, but I've never experienced any delays. Last time, the kitchen made an extra order of sweet potato fries, so the server gave it to my friend and I gratis! Heart.

excerpts: I couldn't help but notice the couple sitting next to me with their "Hawaiian Poke" bowls!!!
That looked awesome too!
hawaiian poke.author: Katrina T.
hawaiian poke.review:
i am seriously trying to go on a diet, so I have been trying to pick restaurants that serve fish or delicious salads! Looking at the pictures for Pacific Catch literally made me DROOL. The pictures of their food looked oh so good, I couldn't wait to try it ! 

Came here on a Friday with my boyfriend and were seated fairly quickly. It's so cute! Right when you sit down, they bring out a little tray with Goldfish Pretzels and Edamame. Weird combo, but I was dying of hunger so I ate it and it tasted fine. I looked at the menu for days before deciding what I really wanted. Be aware, the cost of the food is pretty pricy, but in all honesty, it is worth the money! I would definitely pay this amount to eat the food from here again! 

I got the "California Salmon Sandwich" with a side of salad and the bf got the "Traditional Baja Tacos" (I think?)...but Anyway I was debating between that and a rice bowl. I went with the sandwich and boy was I delighted once it came out. The salmon looked so PINK and FRESH! It was cut in a certain way so that every bite I took, I was able to gather the taste of everything in the sandwich. Also it was easy to bite into! It was such a big surprise to me how fresh the fish was. Usually, most restaurants serve a stingy amount of salmon and it is dry and not fresh at all. GAWD. It was so good! The cole slaw was even good with it and I hate cole slaw. The salad was such a plus too! I couldn't help but notice the couple sitting next to me with their "Hawaiian Poke" bowls!!! That looked awesome too! I super duper want that next time! 

Everything was GOOD GOOD GOOD! LOVE it! Coming back to try more freshness! 

oh yea this place definitely reminds me of Yard House. I don't know why, I couldn't tell if this place served American, Asian Fusion, Americanized Asian errr what. Whatever just as long as they satisfy my hunger I'm all about that!

excerpts:
+++Peruvian Ceviche
-Thai Coconut Shrimp (they were just okay)
- - Cabo Calamari (soggy, stringy, not impressive)

+Hawaiian Poke - $9.5
hawaiian poke.author: Julia D.
hawaiian poke.review:
Yayyyy the only kitchen that is open in the Sunset on Fridays and Saturdays! 12pm woohooo!!!

After Izakaya Sozai completely SCREWED our reservation, we were frustrated AND hungry. Not a good combo. 

So for walkin in around 11:30pm on a friday, they have some pretty good deals on their "Bar Bites" happy hour until midnight...not too shabby.

+Agave Margarita $6
+Warm Edamame $4
++++Peruvian Ceviche
-Thai Coconut Shrimp (they were just okay)
- - Cabo Calamari (soggy, stringy, not impressive)

+Hawaiian Poke - $9.5 Worth it!

Conclusion: If I ever get screwed like that again, and really hungry late at night after a ravenous night of drinkin' it's alright to make an exception.

excerpts: Amazing Hawaiian poke.
Get the trio to taste a few different kinds!
Service is wonderful too.
hawaiian poke.author: Chris S.
hawaiian poke.review: Amazing Hawaiian poke. Get the trio to taste a few different kinds! Service is wonderful too.

excerpts:
I had the:
JAPANESE WASABI Pan-Asian Rice Bowl (my choice of brown rice  1/2 &  1/2 greens)
(wakame salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, cucumber, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori & soy-wasabi sauce-Hawaiian Poke) 

The Hawaiian Poke was fresh and a good amount was provided.
hawaiian poke.author: Janice T.
hawaiian poke.review:
I went  for Saturday afternoon late lunch. This place changed a lot since Art Cafe. It now has a warm modern, comfortable, and casual decor. You are surrounded by hints of fish artwork and cute blue bottle lights hang from the ceiling. 

Menu is quite interesting. Menu has seaweed and hints of wasabi here and there. Reminds me of Hawaii.

I had the:
JAPANESE WASABI Pan-Asian Rice Bowl (my choice of brown rice  1/2 &  1/2 greens)
(wakame salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, cucumber, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori & soy-wasabi sauce-Hawaiian Poke) 

I was so surprised, how delightful and well balanced this bowl was. Brown rice was super moist. I think there was miso dressing for the salad and it actually blended very nicely with everything else. The Hawaiian Poke was fresh and a good amount was provided.

Also had the:
Crispy Oyster Basket (Pacific Coast oysters with jalapeño tartar)

Hooray!!! Fat Oyster and good batter. Fresh and delicious. Another pleasant surprise. I was expecting peanut sized oysters, but they were size of buffalo wings. It was goooooooood. 

I definitely want to go back and try other dishes. Or just eat the rice bowl and oysters.

excerpts:
FOOD FAVs: 
Hawaiian Poke - sushi-grade ahi tuna in a sesame-soy marinade with wonton crisps
House Cured Sake Salmon - nori rice cakes, wasabi creme fraiche & black tobiko caviar
hawaiian poke.author: Elaine L.
hawaiian poke.review:
LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE!

1. Tasty food (I'll get into that below)
2. Great atmosphere
3. Friendly servers, bartenders, & owners
4. Great happy hour specials! Even late night!!

All ingredients to win a spot as one of my favorite restaurants!!

FOOD FAVs: 
Hawaiian Poke - sushi-grade ahi tuna in a sesame-soy marinade with wonton crisps
House Cured Sake Salmon - nori rice cakes, wasabi creme fraiche & black tobiko caviar
Sweet Potato Fries Basket - "signature" fries
Fried Dulce de Leche "Spring Rolls" - with vanilla ice cream & caramel sauce 

Happy Hour
4:00pm - 6:00pm, Monday through Friday
10:00pm - close, nightly

I've seen Pacific Catch participate at a ton of local events like the SF Weekly DISH and the Yelp Unwrapped Holiday Party and it's always been a big hit!  They really love their local customers and it shows when you talk to the staff either at these events or in their restaurant.

Now, I'm just patiently waiting till they open one up in the East Bay =)

excerpts: I was drawn here by the Hawaiian Poke at the Yelp Holiday Party and decided to come with a couple of friends.
We got, as expected, the Hawaiian poke as an appetizer and somehow we all ended up ordering more tuna for our main course: the Ahi 3-Way for me, an Ahi Wasabi Bowl, an Ahi Salad... etc.
(Which really took the waiter aback.
So, maybe next time I should just leave it at Hawaiian Poke for the appetizer and try their catch of the day or seasonal special.
I will see about returning and updating my review.
hawaiian poke.author: Josh K.
hawaiian poke.review:
I was drawn here by the Hawaiian Poke at the Yelp Holiday Party and decided to come with a couple of friends. We got, as expected, the Hawaiian poke as an appetizer and somehow we all ended up ordering more tuna for our main course: the Ahi 3-Way for me, an Ahi Wasabi Bowl, an Ahi Salad... etc. (Which really took the waiter aback. I don't blame him.)

Why did we do this? We were basically looking for more raw fish, more innovations in the same ballpark as the Poke. Not finding it we all settled on seared Ahi or the Poke, which was as raw as it gets. And it turns out, it's kind of a one trick pony. I found my Ahi 3-Way to be pretty disappointing. It was a wad of rice, a wad of poke, a wad of seaweed salad, a wad of seared ahi in one style and another wad in another style. I found it pretty uninspired and pretty uncohesive.

It was also pretty expensive: $17.95 for what did not amount to $17.95 worth of fish (and as you know, rice is basically free for restaurants.)

So, maybe next time I should just leave it at Hawaiian Poke for the appetizer and try their catch of the day or seasonal special. I will see about returning and updating my review.

excerpts: For appetizers, I recommend the Hawaiian Poke (4 stars) or the Fried Oysters (3.5 stars).
You can get the oysters with fries (I recommend the yam fries -
my favorite: Hawaiian Poke (5 stars) with brown or sushi rice (both good).
If you've never tried it, get it; it's unique to Pacific Catch
and it's awesome.
For a lighter alternative, try their salads:
hawaiian poke.author: Eugene M.
hawaiian poke.review:
I come here a few times a month. Awesome place... as long as you order the right items (I'm gonna tell you which, don't worry). 

For appetizers, I recommend the Hawaiian Poke (4 stars) or the Fried Oysters (3.5 stars). You can get the oysters with fries (I recommend the yam fries - ask for a side of Chili-Pepper sauce, you'll love it). 

For main, I'd go with a Wasabi Bowl; my favorite: Hawaiian Poke (5 stars) with brown or sushi rice (both good). If you've never tried it, get it; it's unique to Pacific Catch and it's awesome. For a lighter alternative, try their salads: House Special Salad with salmon (4.5 stars) OR the Salmon Salad (4.5 stars) OR the Thai Steak salad (4 stars). 

For dessert, get the caramel Spring Roll (4.5 stars)- it's on the sweeter side, but it's delicious.

excerpts: Hawaiian Poke ($9.50): this is probably the only appetizer that actually shines.
The tuna is marinated in a sesame-soy marinade and served with crispy wonton chips.
hawaiian poke.author: Samantha L.
hawaiian poke.review:
I have been to Pacific Catch a number of times (mainly due to the fact that it's pretty close to UCSF) and it's consistently pretty good/"a-ok."  I've never actually come for dinner, because I think there are plenty of better (and more student-budget-friendly restaurants) in the area, but it is a great option for happy hour or just place to catch up with friends over a drink and appetizers.

The restaurant is pretty nice looking inside, yet casual.  If you dine-in, they give you a tray of pretzel goldfish and edamame.  Some of the many appetizers I've tried include:

Cabo Calamari ($9): fried calamari (both rings and tentacles, lemon slices and chilies); taste is pretty standard and it's served with a "spicy" chipotle aioli.  During my last visit, this was free via a Foursquare check-in offer.

Sweet Potato Fries ($6):  always delicious and served with interesting dipping sauces: ginger wasabi aioli and sweet Thai chili.  I prefer ketchup.  

Baja Shrimp Ceviche ($8.50):  a fair amount of shrimp, lime, cilantro and chilies, served in a martini glass and surrounded by tortilla chips.  This was pretty tasty, but not that stand-out is.  

Hawaiian Poke ($9.50): this is probably the only appetizer that actually shines.  The tuna is marinated in a sesame-soy marinade and served with crispy wonton chips.  It can be a bit salty, but just make sure you have a nice cocktail also.

Happy hour is 4-6 p.m. Monday through Friday and also 10 p.m. to close each night.  They have a fair selection of beer for $3-4, wells for $4.50 and a selection of appetizers as well.  The service is generally pretty helpful and I think overall, it's a pretty fun place to get snacks/drinks.

excerpts: The ceviche and fried oyster appetizers, and their hawaiian poke are really tasty.
hawaiian poke.author: Irina S.
hawaiian poke.review:
Why have I not reviewed this place earlier? I love it here. I am a regular here; the servers recognize me, stay and chat. It's great. Sure, like with every place one can have a bad experience, but the great experiences and delicious food (well priced too)  outweigh any hiccup that might occur. 

My favorite entree is the veggie special salad with grilled salmon. I have even been known to add the korean steak to it. It's just perfect. 

Recently, I tried their salmon club special. WTF? That was just awesome! 

I also love me some thai iced tea! They make it super tasty and are generous with the refills. The lemongrass iced is great too, but please don't forget about the full bar! 

Lastly, a very special treat are the Fried Dulce de Leche Spring Rolls. Yea. Wow. Seriously, WOW!

I haven't mentioned their appetizers yet, but I feel like I should. The ceviche and fried oyster appetizers, and their hawaiian poke are really tasty. The spicy fries make a good side or just a yummy starter. 

Ok. I have to control myself. But this place is really good to come to just when you want a quick dinner, to catch up with a friend, or with a group. 

p.s. they have opentable to you get points for making reservations, and just recently started using the punchh app. Double perks for eating here!!!! Yes please.

excerpts: Hawaiian Poke Wasabi Bowls are my weakness
and I love how Pacific Catch puts everything together.
One time, I came here with a friend for lunch
but I knew the bowl would be overkill at the time.
So our server suggested splitting the bowl between the two of us.
perfection.
hawaiian poke.author: Maria B.
hawaiian poke.review:
I love Pacific Catch. Been coming here since it opened, and it has not failed me yet. Even though I only love getting one thing - it just tastes so good every time. 

Hawaiian Poke Wasabi Bowls are my weakness and I love how Pacific Catch puts everything together. One time, I came here with a friend for lunch but I knew the bowl would be overkill at the time. So our server suggested splitting the bowl between the two of us. perfection. I wasn't even sure they do that because I know how much of a hassle it can be. 

Had my birthday dinner here last October and everyone was so accommodating. In a big group, I get nervous that other people will start getting annoyed or the orders get mixed up. But dinner went without a hitch. 

Next: gotta make it here for happy hour and drinks

excerpts: Our table of 3 shared a meal-sized salad with hawaiian poke, a three taco platter prepared Traditional Baja style, a Japanese wasabi rice bowl with seared ahi tuna, a grilled yellowtail platter, and fried dolce de leche "spring rolls".
Unfortunately, the yellowtail special was not that special.
The sauce didn't really make sense with the fish.
The hawaiian poke, on the other hand, was wonderfully seasoned and a delight with the mixed greens.
The Japanese wasabi rice bowl came with a perfectly spicy wasabi sauce.
The seared tuna, unfortunately, fell a bit short.
The ahi tuna did not come with a sharp, crisp sear, instead appearing as a small gradient from the cooked exterior and the raw interior.
The tuna was also not as fresh as Mikuni's in Sacramento, which remains to be my top choice for seared tuna.
Now that I've talked about the other dishes, I can finally talk about the fish tacos.
Let me tell you, the fish tacos are heavenly!
If you choose to have your tacos prepared Traditional Baja style, the fis will vary with the catch of the day.
The two times I went, the FOTD was True Cod.
The cod was as fresh as if it had been caught that morning.
The batter came out crisp but not overly thick as to drown out the subtle flavors of the fish.
The guacamole was creamy deliciousness.
Squeeze a bit of lemon on it
and you've got the perfect fish taco.
After a very satisfying meal, we decided to order the fried dolce de leche "spring rolls.
Definitely unique and tasty.
hawaiian poke.author: Jenny C.
hawaiian poke.review:
Let me preface this by saying that I am not a fish person. At least, not cooked fish. Far too often, fish at restaurants is not fresh and further ruined by being cooked until it's completely dried out. For this reason, I've never paid much attention to Pacific Catch despite passing by its admittedly attractive looking building thousands of times. As far as I was concerned, it would just be another disappointing seafood restaurant. I probably would've continue to ignore this place had my fellow food enthusiast, Andrew W., not urged me to try their fish tacos, which he swore were some of the best he's ever had. We have similar taste in food, so finally, I decided to give it a shot. 

Our table of 3 shared a meal-sized salad with hawaiian poke, a three taco platter prepared Traditional Baja style, a Japanese wasabi rice bowl with seared ahi tuna, a grilled yellowtail platter, and fried dolce de leche "spring rolls". Unfortunately, the yellowtail special was not that special. The sauce didn't really make sense with the fish. The hawaiian poke, on the other hand, was wonderfully seasoned and a delight with the mixed greens. The Japanese wasabi rice bowl came with a perfectly spicy wasabi sauce. The seared tuna, unfortunately, fell a bit short. The ahi tuna did not come with a sharp, crisp sear, instead appearing as a small gradient from the cooked exterior and the raw interior. The tuna was also not as fresh as Mikuni's in Sacramento, which remains to be my top choice for seared tuna. Now that I've talked about the other dishes, I can finally talk about the fish tacos. Let me tell you, the fish tacos are heavenly! If you choose to have your tacos prepared Traditional Baja style, the fis will vary with the catch of the day. The two times I went, the FOTD was True Cod. The cod was as fresh as if it had been caught that morning. The batter came out crisp but not overly thick as to drown out the subtle flavors of the fish. The guacamole was creamy deliciousness. Squeeze a bit of lemon on it and you've got the perfect fish taco. After a very satisfying meal, we decided to order the fried dolce de leche "spring rolls." Definitely unique and tasty. One person at my table found the dolce de leche to be a bit too sweet, but I liked it just fine. 

Just writing about Pacific Catch makes me crave it. I can't wait to come back again for the fish tacos and dessert.

excerpts: Our waitress was very friendly and prompt without being overbearing, The hawaiian poke wasabi bowl is TO DIE FOR.
The best part?
It's totally reasonably priced!
I'll definitely be back.
hawaiian poke.author: Kim C.
hawaiian poke.review:
I love this place! This is probably one of my favorite restaurants in the Bay Area. 

After much convincing, we came here on a Saturday night with a party of six, and the host greeted us warmly and told us our wait would be around 15 minutes. He then took us to a lounge area where he let us sit and order drinks while we waited.

Service here is always top-notch. Our waitress was very friendly and prompt without being overbearing, The hawaiian poke wasabi bowl is TO DIE FOR. The best part? It's totally reasonably priced! I'll definitely be back.

excerpts: We ordered the California Style Hawaiian Poke, which she recommended... and it was hella good
, lawwd have mercy.
hawaiian poke.author: Kate E.
hawaiian poke.review:
I love this place! My boyfriend and I went here for our first time last week and it is definitely our new favorite spot. The food was great and I love the fact that I do not feel guilty eating their food since their portions are pretty big! Our server (I believe her name was Adriana) was really nice! She asked if we ate there before and of course we said no so she suggested to us what we should try. She was definitely helpful and made our experience there for our first time even better. It is always a love/hate feeling when we get a good server LOL we know we have a good server when we're thinking "dammnit now we really have to tip" lmao. Thanks Adriana!! We ordered the California Style Hawaiian Poke, which she recommended... and it was hella good, lawwd have mercy. For our entree, I ordered the Hawaiian Teriyaki rice bowl with grilled salmon and it was amazeballs. I will definitely be coming back for the rice bowl, the poke, and the service! 

Only downside is that we got pulled over before we got to the restaurant lol apparently we can't drive through a intersection until a pedestrian has gotten onto the sidewalk completely  -___- the pedestrian had barely started walking, but luckily we got off with a warning. They do have a small little lot so parking might be a bit of a hassle, but it is worth it!

excerpts:
-Calamari: they give you a lot and the dipping sauce is delicious
-Seaweed (wakami) salad: comes with the Hawaiian Poke bowl or you can order it as a side.
hawaiian poke.author: Yee-Shing W.
hawaiian poke.review:
Menu highlights:

-Hawaiian Poke Bowl: try the half brown rice and half salad option if you're watching carbs ;) HUGE portions
-Calamari: they give you a lot and the dipping sauce is delicious
-Seaweed (wakami) salad: comes with the Hawaiian Poke bowl or you can order it as a side. My favorite.

They have a weekday happy hour that I think ends at 7pm. 

Bar and regular seating areas with outside patio seating too. It can get crowded so make reservations on Friday or Saturday nights.

Oh and this is NOT a sushi restauarant. I warned you...they do have sushi rolls but they are mostly drowned in sauce. Go with what they're known for - bowls and the hot food. You won't be disappointed...

excerpts: We also loved the ceviche trio, which had Hawaiian Poke, Peruvian ceviche, and shrimp ceviche... that was delicious!
hawaiian poke.author: Caroline L.
hawaiian poke.review:
Went here for my mom's birthday on New Years Day. The ease of getting a reservation was great... thank you OpenTable!

Upon arriving, the hostess was really nice and said that she could seat us even though it was about ten minutes before our actual reservation. That was also great because our group was pretty hungry. Another point for wonderful!

For the food, to me it was a hit and a miss. It was crab week at the time, so of course I decided to take advantage of that. I really liked the crab chowder (it had really good flavor and lots of bacon in it), and the birthday girl had the crab with garlic noodles which she thoroughly enjoyed. We also loved the ceviche trio, which had Hawaiian Poke, Peruvian ceviche, and shrimp ceviche... that was delicious! 

What I did regret was getting the tacos, three of them also. I think I didn't expect them to fry the shrimp in the batter (then I realized I should have actually read the menu more carefully haha). Also there seemed to be some kind of kitchen malfunction, so our food was coming out late. Our waitress was really apologetic about it, which we really appreciated. She also gave my dad a free beer, and that was cool too.

I don't know if I would come back here any time soon, but I do know what I am NOT getting the next time I go. I think I'll stick to the more fresher options, like the rice bowls.

excerpts: I got the wasabi bowl with hawaiian poke.

It was a very large bowl with many pieces of poke, japanese seaweed, avocado, ginger, sprouts, sesame seeds and other random ingredients that are sometimes found in sushi over your choice of white or brown rice.
hawaiian poke.author: Margaret R.
hawaiian poke.review:
I got the wasabi bowl with hawaiian poke. It was a very large bowl with many pieces of poke, japanese seaweed, avocado, ginger, sprouts, sesame seeds and other random ingredients that are sometimes found in sushi over your choice of white or brown rice. The pieces of poke were fresh and well marinated...you definitely get a good amount of poke so much that I felt that I was all "fished" out towards to end of my meal.

I also tried the sweet potato fries which I thoroughly enjoyed because they didn't taste overly fried or oily. They came with a special wasabi dip which complemented the fries well.

The overall atmosphere was pretty chill and definitely relaxing when it's a nice sunny day as you can sit against the window or outside. Service was friendly and fast.

excerpts: My biggest disappointment, however, was with their Hawaiian Poke.
Looked like someone hacked away at some tuna and threw it in a bowl.
The quality of fish wasn't nearly as great, and the portion keeps getting smaller.
hawaiian poke.author: Sophia B.
hawaiian poke.review: Pacific Catch just isn't what it used to be. With every visit, the food and service gets worse. Tonight was no exception. First they seated us with no menus. Then we waited for our food as a table that placed their orders after us finished their meals. My biggest disappointment, however, was with their Hawaiian Poke. Looked like someone hacked away at some tuna and threw it in a bowl. The quality of fish wasn't nearly as great, and the portion keeps getting smaller. My shrimp tacos were still good, but the sweet potato fries were cold and soggy. Thirty minutes after finishing our meal, we weren't offered a dessert menu. I think we might've been stuck their all night if I didn't flag our waiter down for the check.

excerpts:
Hawaiian poke, avocado, cucumber, daikon sprouts, ginger & sesame seeds with soy-wasabi vinaigrette $13.50
-Side of sweet potato fries $3
-Spicy Tuna: hi tuna with sriracha aioli, chili oil, cucumber, daikon sprouts & green onion $8
-(*)Fried Dulce de Leche "Spring Rolls": with vanilla ice cream & caramel sauce
hawaiian poke.author: Stacey L.
hawaiian poke.review:
We ate here on Thursday for dinner and had a deal from Scoutmob.  I believe our server's name was Neal.  5 stars to him.  He went out of his way to ensure that we were enjoying our time, filled our glasses, split our salad into two bowls for my sister and & I to share, brought extra dessert forks and spoons.  I haven't had this great of service in months.  Our order:

-3 Taco Platter $14.50
-Vietnamese Steak Sandwich: marinated grilled steak, seasoned cucumber-daikon-carrot salad, sliced chilies, cilantro & sriracha aioli $12
-(*)Sushi Grade: Hawaiian poke, avocado, cucumber, daikon sprouts, ginger & sesame seeds with soy-wasabi vinaigrette $13.50
-Side of sweet potato fries $3
-Spicy Tuna: hi tuna with sriracha aioli, chili oil, cucumber, daikon sprouts & green onion $8
-(*)Fried Dulce de Leche "Spring Rolls": with vanilla ice cream & caramel sauce  $6

(*) = Favorites

excerpts:
Hawaiian Poke - YUM (chunks are a bit too big though...)
Hawaiian Poke Roll - Was okay
hawaiian poke.author: Heidi C.
hawaiian poke.review:
This review is for both the Marina district and 9th Ave locations.

9TH AVE -- accommodating for a huge party (takes reservations)
MARINA -- the whole restaurant seats maybe 20 at a time. VERY SMALL (does NOT take reservations)
Btw, parking at both locations suck but the 9th Ave location has a small parking lot in back which maybe parks about 8 cars at most.

Thai Iced Tea - YUM
Hawaiian Poke - YUM (chunks are a bit too big though...)
Hawaiian Poke Roll - Was okay
Ceivche - Too limey, not enough chips
Sweet Potato Fries - YUMMM
Catch of the Day - YUM
Teriyaki bowls - TOO SWEET, sickkk
Any Tacos - Mediocre (go to Nick's Crispy Tacos instead)
Mochi Fondue - A must get!!

And that is about all the food I've tried between the two locations. The place is cute, service is good and you just have to come and try this restaurant at least once in your life.

(Photos uploaded)

excerpts: The baja shrimp ceviche was tasty and tangy, the Hawaiian poke tuna was perfectly marinated, and the Peruvian ceviche was close to being great!
I come from an area where Peruvian restaurants sort of rule, so
I'm used to the ceviche being more authentic- with the white cornuts and the yucca-
hawaiian poke.author: Yahra V.
hawaiian poke.review:
My first time here, definitely not my last!

We were in quandry about where to go for my birthday dinner last night; after a bit of research and wanting to not venture too far out into the city since we had family in town, we decided on Pacific Catch.

Treading through GGP with a 4-year old nephew can make anyone very hungry so it was great that we were so close. We kept our car parked at the park (lol) and walked less than a block to the restaurant. 

First impressions work always- the place was clean, nice decor and the wait staff was friendly.

Early dinner equals Happy Hour... unfortunately they only serve the happy hour menu at the bar and it just didn't seem right to sit there with younger ones in tow. Womp womp :(
That didn't stop me from trying their lemongrass mojito though- delicious! Tart and sweet and minty with the right amount of rum... yum!

The trio ceviche was enjoyed by all- even the ones that weren't fans of fish (really?). The baja shrimp ceviche was tasty and tangy, the Hawaiian poke tuna was perfectly marinated, and the Peruvian ceviche was close to being great! I come from an area where Peruvian restaurants sort of rule, so I'm used to the ceviche being more authentic- with the white cornuts and the yucca- but this was still tasty and satisfying. 

Our dinner was an assortment of their rice bowls, fish tacos, fish and chips (made with the catch of the day... cod) and chicken tenders for the little one. All the dishes were very good. The taco and fish plates came with fries. Regular and sweet potato thumbs up- nothing spectacular about the "spicy" fries though. And nothing really "spicy" about them. dipping sauces were a plus, epecially the jalapeno tartar for the fish and chips and the wasabi (guessing) ranch for the sweet potato fries.

Our server was friendly and attentive and when asked a few questions about the menu she was knowledgeable and in one instance when she didn't know, she returned later with information and actually followed up. That was nice!

Lastly, my surprise birthday dessert (surprise!) was a near perfect brownie topped with vanilla ice cream and chocolate sauce. The brownie was dense but moist with walnuts and the vanilla bean ice cream... the icing on the cake!

Price was very reasonable for a party of 5.5.... $120 or so. Gratuity not included.

Overall, an enjoyable experience and a memorable birthday! 

Thanks Pacific Catch!

excerpts: Got the hawaiian poke wasabi rice bowl - it was delicious and came in a huge portion.
I could have shared this or save half for the next meal.
Service was quick and free parking lot in the back!
hawaiian poke.author: Linda L.
hawaiian poke.review: Came here once for happy hour and once for dinner. Had great experiences both times. Their poke is so good. Got the hawaiian poke wasabi rice bowl - it was delicious and came in a huge portion. I could have shared this or save half for the next meal. Service was quick and free parking lot in the back!

excerpts: if you snagged a goody bag at the Yelp Holiday Party this year there's a coupon for a free Hawaiian poke or shirmp ceviche appetizer with a  purchase of entree priced at $12.95 or above.

The poke they had at the party had bit too much soy, but my guess is because it was made and then brought to the party (poke chunks probably dripped along the way and gathered a pool), not made to order like at the restaurant.
The poke we ordered was plump and by no means soggy.
Served with plenty of fried won tons.
hawaiian poke.author: Chelsea P.
hawaiian poke.review:
Pretty solid.

Generous servings on the fish tacos. Big chunks of fish, lots of tomatillo sauce and aoili (I had to scrape some off). I opted for the shrimp, mahi mahi and the catch of the day which was rock cod, and the rock cod was probably my favorite. The tacos held their form pretty well, but I still had to eat a little with my fork. No complaints, it was equally delicious. Awesome sweet potato fries with kosher salt, a nice mildly sweet twist from the fish tacos with salsa and plenty of lime. The lemongrass mojito was sharp, and they have some pretty good beer on tap. Bomb.

Annnnnd if you snagged a goody bag at the Yelp Holiday Party this year there's a coupon for a free Hawaiian poke or shirmp ceviche appetizer with a  purchase of entree priced at $12.95 or above. The poke they had at the party had bit too much soy, but my guess is because it was made and then brought to the party (poke chunks probably dripped along the way and gathered a pool), not made to order like at the restaurant. The poke we ordered was plump and by no means soggy. Served with plenty of fried won tons. MMMM.

I wouldn't come here for sushi, but they do seafood well and the staff (including the chefs they had at PLEY!) were very friendly. Not the decor, but the menu seemed a little touristy and like a chain (a la Elephant Bar and such), but the food was good. They offer a late night happy hour on the weekend (after 10pm, but before they close at 11pm) with cheap appetizers and drinks, definitely a great deal. There's even a parking lot for customers. How awesome is that?!

excerpts: For two of us, we ordered the Hawaiian Poke, Cabo Calamari, King crab leg soup, and traditional tacos with sweet potato fries.
My favorite was Hawaiian poke, sushi-grade ahi tuna in a sesame-soy marinade & spicy seasonings with wonton crisps, and Calamari.
hawaiian poke.author: Stacy L.
hawaiian poke.review:
Went there on Saturday for dinner, and we got seated right before the dinner crowded came in.  Finding parking is always challenge in Irving area at night, but we were lucky to find a parking in the parking lot. The dinner was great and the services was fast. For two of us, we ordered the Hawaiian Poke, Cabo Calamari, King crab leg soup, and traditional tacos with sweet potato fries. 
My favorite was Hawaiian poke, sushi-grade ahi tuna in a sesame-soy marinade & spicy seasonings with wonton crisps, and Calamari. To me, the ahi tuna got slightly too salty near the bottom of the bowl, I think it might be the soy sauces that marinade the fish. For dinner we ordered, the Fried Dulce de Leche "Spring Rolls", which spring roll that wrap with cluster or cheese cake filling.  And served with vanilla ice cream & caramel sauce....Yummy

excerpts: Hawaiian Poke:
This was a disappointment as everyone had been raving about it.
Mainly because the poke tasted so gummy.
It did not simply melt in my mouth and the chopped green onions were a bit too overpowering.
I do like my poke to be marinated for a few hours so that the fish really soaks up the flavors
but I just felt it had been marinated too long.
And the crispy chips started to give me a headache...which I get when I eat too much fried food.
hawaiian poke.author: Rose J.
hawaiian poke.review:
The bar area was already packed at 4:15pm on a Friday but my bf and I were quickly seated to begin our happy hour experience.  We sat at one of the tables with the tall bar stools, which was quite uncomfortable as the bottom of the table was not hollow for our legs to fit into.  My knees kept hitting the sides of the table. 

Now for the food.  I was tempted to order everything on their Bar Bites menu but opted to have just the first 5 items (minus the edamame beans and sweet potato fries) and 2 refreshing cosmos - YUM YUM.  I have been here before but for some reason the food was not as good as I remembered.  I had the following in the order of favorite to least favorite:

Asparagus & Shiitake Roll: It was an interesting vegetarian take on a sushi roll and I found the asparagus tempura and the tiny strings of mushroom and carrot to be quite lovely.

Thai Coconut Shrimp: It's funny because when I had my first bite, I was like "OMG...it feels like a Thai restaurant in my mouth."  Now looking at the menu as I write this entry, the dish's name is quite befitting. The coconut flavors are so quintessentially Thai.  I loved the crunch of the crispy coconut flakes and the juicy shrimp.  Frankly, I ended up just eating the coconut flake outer layer instead of the shrimp because it was so good.  The sweet and sour dipping sauce (that you can buy at any Asian market) was a nice complement. 

Spicy Tuna Roll: This roll was actually spicy, which I appreciated.  It was yummy with the bitterness of the daikon sprouts.  

Hawaiian Poke:  This was a disappointment as everyone had been raving about it.  Mainly because the poke tasted so gummy.  It did not simply melt in my mouth and the chopped green onions were a bit too overpowering.  I do like my poke to be marinated for a few hours so that the fish really soaks up the flavors but I just felt it had been marinated too long.  And the crispy chips started to give me a headache...which I get when I eat too much fried food.  Disappointing.

Spicy Cabo Calamari:  Pretty good but nothing too spectacular.  It was interesting that they also deep-fried slices of lemon and peppers.  The peppers were really yummy and SPICY...hehe...I attempted to eat the lemons too, but I suggest you not do that.      

The food is pretty good and very well priced. They also played good music...love Bob Marley. :) I think I hyped myself up for this dining experience as I hadn't been here in a long time.  I probably won't go for a few months.  I'm sure I will start missing the Coconut Shrimp by then.

excerpts: I usually don't like raw fish but the Hawaiian Poke is wonderful!
Weather you get it in a salad or a sushi roll
hawaiian poke.author: Michelle B.
hawaiian poke.review:
This place is very Yummy! I usually don't like raw fish but the Hawaiian Poke is wonderful! Weather you get it in a salad or a sushi roll it is very good with great flavor! 

I used to come here since this was the only place way back when that had sweet potato fries. Since everyone has them now it isn't as fun however I must say this is the best place still compared to everywhere I have tried them! 

The island tacos are very tasty as well! Not very big but still great. But the reason why i love it here is for the JAPANESE WASABI RICE BOWLS! (wakame salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, cucumber, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori & soy-wasabi sauce). I was here about two months ago and I see they changed and added some new rice bowls but I haven't tried them yet. These are very filling and you will for sure have something to take home with you for later if that is what you are looking for. 

Also if you likes sweets you cant leave this place without trying their Fried Dulce de Leche "Spring Rolls" (vanilla ice cream & caramel sauce). OMG TO DIE FOR! It is not a huge dessert and since it tastes so great it is NOT FOR SHARING! lol 

Definitely a good place to eat...

excerpts: Highly recommend brown rice bawl with either fish or chicken, sunrise roll and Hawaiian poke.
Yum!
hawaiian poke.author: Abe L.
hawaiian poke.review: Here we are....Friday night, traffic is horrendous and we are hungry as hell...went for a walk in a park and decided to stop in for a drink and poke. As always, everything is fresh, service is wonderful and and kids enjoyed themselves. Highly recommend brown rice bawl with either fish or chicken, sunrise roll and Hawaiian poke. Yum!

excerpts: and I was delighted to have the Hawaiian Poke since I've been craving something fresh and you can't get any fresher than raw fish done right.
It was the perfect intro to Nightlife at the Academy of Sciences, which is walking distance from the restaurant.
hawaiian poke.author: Myra A.
hawaiian poke.review:
I'm not quite sure if I enjoyed Pacific Catch simply because I had just returned to the US after being abroad for a year and I was looking at the American world through rose-colored glasses...or if it really is a great place. 

My boyfriend took me here for happy hour and I was delighted to have the Hawaiian Poke since I've been craving something fresh and you can't get any fresher than raw fish done right. It was the perfect intro to Nightlife at the Academy of Sciences, which is walking distance from the restaurant.

excerpts: The highlights are the Wasabi Brown Rice Bowls (Usually get the Hawaiian Poke), the Fish Tacos (whatever is the special fish of the day), and the Sweet Potato Fries.
hawaiian poke.author: Dee T.
hawaiian poke.review:
I used to grub at the Marina location once a month, but since they established the Sunset location, I was ecstatic as there is parking lot, more spacious, and no long lines.  

The highlights are the Wasabi Brown Rice Bowls (Usually get the Hawaiian Poke), the Fish Tacos (whatever is the special fish of the day), and the Sweet Potato Fries. The dipping sauces are such a great complement. 

Ambiance is definitely more airy than the Marina joint and the decor has a contemporary feel. 

Prices are reasonable for its generous portions. 

Staff is always friendly and don't make you wait to long to place an order, ask for stuff, or get you the bill. 

Can't wait for my next trip here...

excerpts: The first two times, I became infatuated with their Japanese Wasabi 'Asian Bowl' with Hawaiian Poke.
Ordered sushi rice both times over brown rice and loved the combination of flavors with the added zing of the wasabi.
The bowl seems a little on the pricey side until you get it
and it's huge and filling.
hawaiian poke.author: Kuishinbo E.
hawaiian poke.review:
I've been here three times in the past 13 months.  The first two times were last summer, 2010, with the most recent being yesterday.  The first two times, I became infatuated with their Japanese Wasabi 'Asian Bowl' with Hawaiian Poke.  Ordered sushi rice both times over brown rice and loved the combination of flavors with the added zing of the wasabi.  The bowl seems a little on the pricey side until you get it and it's huge and filling.  Forgot to mention to start out with the sweet potato fries, which are probably the best I've ever had.   

My only gripe about this place came yesterday, when my party was among the handful of tables here but had to wait to be seated, wait to make our orders, and on top of that, the waiter messed up on everything.  I think he was trying to be cool and memorize our order (not too hard because we only ordered three things), but my bowl came out with brown rice instead of sushi rice, and halfway through the meal we figured out we wouldn't be getting our sweet potato fries.  I'm guessing the manager came out and took over our table because of the multiple errors and comped our fries.

All in all, whether it was the poor service or just my overdue, over-hyped expectation, my bowl was not as great as last year.  Sad to say, this experience ruined this place a little for me which is too bad because the place is a nice place to eat.  Also, my silverware was dirty and that's unacceptable when you're charging $40+ for lunch.

excerpts: My friends and I ordered fried calamari, peruvian ceviche, sweet potato fries, and platters of hawaiian poke.
The dishes are soo fresh!
I liked the fried battered lemons and the brown rice on my entree.
The service was excellent, the atmosphere was relaxing, and the food is delicious!
I would love to come back!
A bit pricy but worth it!
hawaiian poke.author: Allister D.
hawaiian poke.review: This place is legit for their seafood platters. My friends and I ordered fried calamari, peruvian ceviche, sweet potato fries, and platters of hawaiian poke. The dishes are soo fresh! I liked the fried battered lemons and the brown rice on my entree. The service was excellent, the atmosphere was relaxing, and the food is delicious! I would love to come back! A bit pricy but worth it!

excerpts:
The food includes hawaiian poke (yay raw raw raw fish!), california rolls (real crab, fake sushi), and fried calamari (i just can't get enough of this squiggly stuff).

I like to keep it high in protein with the hawaiian poke.
hawaiian poke.author: Christina C.
hawaiian poke.review:
The miser-li-est combination in the world might be what is happening to me now.  One, I cannot help.  The other, I brought upon myself.

Being Asian (Chinese) and a Student.  Not just a fresh-faced co-ed.  Graduate school.  Professional.  Which means my metabolism can't run on ketchup packets and instant ramen anymore.  Neither can I pull all-nighters and still be coherent enough to be in public the next day.  

The Asian in me loves a good deal.  That's not so bad.  Until you find yourself at home, after a "great" shopping spree with 5 mismatched shoes, none of which are your size.  Just because it was on sale.  And SOMEONE you know must have that size feet.  Then, I look around to make sure that no one is looking.

The Student in me, hates it more and more each day.  Just last week, one of my classmates looked at her loan debt.  HOLY CRAP-O-LA, the amount we have to pay back is like a mortgage!  It's more than a mortgage!  This affirms my current trend of not going on the interwebs for anything productive.

And all this verbal garbage finally brings us to Pacific Catch.  They have a happy hour, which pleases me greatly.  They have food on their happy hour which pleases me even more.  The food includes hawaiian poke (yay raw raw raw fish!), california rolls (real crab, fake sushi), and fried calamari (i just can't get enough of this squiggly stuff).

However, the alcohols are still expensive.  I'm expecting something in the $5 a glass range.  But I think they are more along the $7/glass.  Maybe the rouge rough uncouth uncultured student in me has no idea that what they are really serving is the most delectable wine known to the inner sunset.  And if I can't tell, neither can my wallet.  Or my loan debts.  Oh god.  

To summarize, I would come here for the happy hour, and focus more on the food.  The portions are very generous, there is nothing dainty about it.  Because if you think about it, a roll still uses about 1/2 a cup of rice, which is as much rice as you should be eating in one sitting, you fatty globby sweaty smelly library-hugger.  I like to keep it high in protein with the hawaiian poke.  

Maybe I'll finally learn my lesson and just be content with 2 bar bites.  Do not let the judgmental eye of the waitress guilt you into ordering alcohol.  No, no, no!  You must pass your classes.  

Now, go.  And eat something.

excerpts: I love their "asian fusion" cusine which included hawaiian poke.
Hawaiian poke wasabi bowl with extra nori.
need i say more?
hawaiian poke.author: jennifer f.
hawaiian poke.review:
service is amazing. quick and to the point.. they're also great at recommending food for you to try if you're brave enough to take on the challenge.

HUGE seating area that includes booths, tables, and a bar. I love their "asian fusion" cusine which included hawaiian poke.

so.. Hawaiian poke wasabi bowl with extra nori. need i say more? The pictures got me drooling and when the food came out, i slaughtered it. 

the bf got fish and chips -- eh. fried fish isn't that amazing to begin with, but their spicy fries we're to die for. definitely order some type of fries with your meal because they're crunchy and flavorful.

last but definitely not least, i got 1 scoop of the salted caramel ice cream. it was creamy and deeeeelicious. BF killed it before i could finish savoring my first bite. :) although this was purchased somewhere else, it's great that they support other san francisco based businesses.

excerpts: Hawaiian Poke bowls!
hawaiian poke.author: Tristan D.
hawaiian poke.review:
Hawaiian Poke bowls! So good.

I'm over the atmosphere here. Some people may think it's upscale and nice, whatever. I would still eat the food if it were served from a taco truck in front. It's good, I'm just not one of those people that needs to be surrounded by an environment that makes me feel like I am underdressed (because I am.)

They serve Hawaiian beers here, so that is a plus.

The service can be hit or miss.  Sometimes it is great, sometimes avg, and other times (though rarely) it is mediocre.  By this I mean they can seem to just be annoyed with you coming in and bothering them.  Not every time, just once in a while, esp earlier in the day.  The poke and a Longboard make up for it, so until that goes downhill...

excerpts: I used to LOVE the Hawaiian Poke.
it was always fresh, had cucumber pieces and was simply delicious.
The last 4-6 times I ordered it, it was a disappointment.
The Tuna was not fresh, and one time the waitress said that "its just a different kind of tuna".
I eat a lot of Poke, and  I just got back from Maui a few days ago
so I know exactly how fresh tuna looks.
Not sure if the chef changed, but the quality of this poke has definitely gone down.
Maybe its the days I go when the tuna is not fresh?
I dont know, but it doesn't make me want to go back as often and when I do
I definitely dont order the poke anymore.
the cucumber pieces really added flavor, and now its just plain.
would love to see the quality improve so I can enjoy it again!
hawaiian poke.author: Tati M.
hawaiian poke.review: Let me just start by saying that this used to be my favorite restaurant in the Inner Sunset, but over the last few months things have changed. I used to LOVE the Hawaiian Poke. it was always fresh, had cucumber pieces and was simply delicious. The last 4-6 times I ordered it, it was a disappointment. The Tuna was not fresh, and one time the waitress said that "its just a different kind of tuna". I eat a lot of Poke, and  I just got back from Maui a few days ago so I know exactly how fresh tuna looks. Not sure if the chef changed, but the quality of this poke has definitely gone down. Maybe its the days I go when the tuna is not fresh? I dont know, but it doesn't make me want to go back as often and when I do I definitely dont order the poke anymore. the cucumber pieces really added flavor, and now its just plain. would love to see the quality improve so I can enjoy it again!

excerpts: I think I've held off on reviewing Pacific Catch because it makes me think of the food, and when I think of the food I start salivating, my stomach starts to rumble and the thought of hawaiian poke just fills my mind and my cravings for it go out of whack.
hawaiian poke.author: Heidi L.
hawaiian poke.review:
I think I've held off on reviewing Pacific Catch because it makes me think of the food, and when I think of the food I start salivating, my stomach starts to rumble and the thought of hawaiian poke just fills my mind and my cravings for it go out of whack.  

Always always always start off with the sweet potato fries.  Always.  Then order whatever the hell you want to drink.  Then order a dish that includes  poke.  The rice bowl for a heartier meal, a salad for a light one, but always with the poke!  Whatever else you want to order is up to you =)

excerpts: We tried the shrimp ceviche, ecstacy roll, and the Hawaiian poke bowl with brown rice.
The shrimp ceviche was so delicious!
The right amount of spiciness, tons of fresh juicy shrimp served in a little cute cocktail glass with tortilla chips.
The ecstacy roll was just okay, kind of bland.
More of an Americanized type of roll than what I'm used to eating at Japanese sushi restaurants.
The Hawaiian poke was good though, tons of poke and seaweed salad, and you can have the option of splitting it into two bowls to share!
Since we did that, I had to get brown rice too cause the boyfriend wanted it, but I would have much preferred white rice.
Maybe that's why I didn't like the bowl so much
but he at least he did.
Could have used a little more spiciness to it though.
Parking sucks in the area but usually if you drive down into the park area, there's plenty of parking on the sidewalk along the park and its a short walk to the restaurant.
hawaiian poke.author: Thao V.
hawaiian poke.review: Spacious place, plenty  of seating and nice ambiance. We tried the shrimp ceviche, ecstacy roll, and the Hawaiian poke bowl with brown rice. The shrimp ceviche was so delicious! The right amount of spiciness, tons of fresh juicy shrimp served in a little cute cocktail glass with tortilla chips. The ecstacy roll was just okay, kind of bland. More of an Americanized type of roll than what I'm used to eating at Japanese sushi restaurants. The Hawaiian poke was good though, tons of poke and seaweed salad, and you can have the option of splitting it into two bowls to share! Since we did that, I had to get brown rice too cause the boyfriend wanted it, but I would have much preferred white rice. Maybe that's why I didn't like the bowl so much but he at least he did. Could have used a little more spiciness to it though. Parking sucks in the area but usually if you drive down into the park area, there's plenty of parking on the sidewalk along the park and its a short walk to the restaurant.

excerpts: Subsituted with Hawaiian Poke.
Avocado, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds with soy-wasabi vinaigrette.
The portion size of this salad is quite generous, great for a meal or for sharing with another dish.
hawaiian poke.author: Tracy T.
hawaiian poke.review:
This place is a great find. Parking is pretty ridiculous here. I seriously thought parking would be cake, since the park is across the street and by evening time all cars would be gone leaving plenty of street parking. WRONG! NO PARKING during evening hours stated clearly on the signs, but many cars were parked. A cop car drove in and I decided not to risk it. They do have a small parking lot next to the restaurant, but it fills up quickly. I suggest biking or walking. What better way to burn off those after dinner calories than riding/taking a stroll in GG park (warning: it gets really dark in there at night)?!

- Salmon Teriyaki Bowl ($14.95): Asparagus, shiitake mushrooms, grilled bok choy, sesame seeds with teriyaki sauce, served over pineapple fried rice (I substituted with brown rice). The brown rice was a little too hard for my liking. Other than that, I really liked the abundance of vegetables and the sweet/flavorful mix of pineapple in the rice was delicious. 

- Sushi Grade Ahi Salad ($12.95): Subsituted with Hawaiian Poke. Avocado, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds with soy-wasabi vinaigrette. The portion size of this salad is quite generous, great for a meal or for sharing with another dish. The poke accompanied the vegetables well giving me a healthy yet satisfying feeling of fullness. 

- Pineapple-Orange-Guava juice ($2.95): Tasted just how it sounds like; a mixture of all 3 with the guava juice standing out the most. Came in a pretty small glass, so I didn't feel like I got my money's worth. 

No reservations were made and there were plenty of empty tables in the main dining area, but the hostess escorted us and said the only table available was in the bar area. I did not even see the empty tables in the dining area fill up throughout my meal. I don't like the tables at the bar, not much leg room. Other than that, service was quick and efficient. The poke salad and rice bowls are definitely worth coming back for! 

P.S. Opened late until 11PM on Sun-Thurs and 12AM on Fri & Sat, score!

excerpts: I ate the rice bowl with Hawaiian Poke and it was delicious a big bowl of sushi delight.
We also tried a meat sandwich it was very flavorful.
I will try again!
hawaiian poke.author: Sandra M.
hawaiian poke.review: The food was plentiful and service was great. I ate the rice bowl with Hawaiian Poke and it was delicious a big bowl of sushi delight.  We also tried a meat sandwich it was very flavorful.  I will try again!

excerpts: I would go here more often if it weren't that pricey, but otherwise I would definitely recommend the Hawaiian poke, one of the wasabi bowls, or the tacos.
hawaiian poke.author: Nick L.
hawaiian poke.review: I came here for a birthday party, and all I have to say is that this place offers fresh seafood and is worth trying. I would go here more often if it weren't that pricey, but otherwise I would definitely recommend the Hawaiian poke, one of the wasabi bowls, or the tacos. My girlfriend had the salmon fish and chips. The fish was pretty dry, but the sweet potato fries were pretty nice. I would go here again!

excerpts: My friend ordered an appetizer, the Hawaiian Poke, and
But I think I could have just had the Hawaiian Poke for a meal because that's much
hawaiian poke.author: Pudgy G.
hawaiian poke.review:
When this restaurant first opened, it wasn't really that great to me. And I remember the menu being very limited like it was only one page of dishes you could order. 

However, I went back yesterday and the menu has expanded and someone told me the chef changed from when they first opened and I was amazed by how much better it got.

My friend ordered an appetizer, the Hawaiian Poke, and I was just was all over it because it tasted so good!

As for my entree I had the Korean BBQ with steak and salmon which was also good. But I think I could have just had the Hawaiian Poke for a meal because that's much I was over it and kept wanting it.

The service was average between good, but not excellent.

excerpts: Hawaiian Poke Japanese Wasabi Pan-Asian Bowl and Marinated Beef Skirt Korean Barbecue Pan-Asian Bowl was pretty good.
The hawaiian poke was better than the beef skirt.
It was not a smart idea to drown the bowls with sauce.
The excess amounts of sauce killed the dishes.
The Tropical Iced Tea was nothing special.
hawaiian poke.author: Tony L.
hawaiian poke.review: Hawaiian Poke Japanese Wasabi Pan-Asian Bowl and Marinated Beef Skirt Korean Barbecue Pan-Asian Bowl was pretty good. The hawaiian poke was better than the beef skirt. It was not a smart idea to drown the bowls with sauce. The excess amounts of sauce killed the dishes. The Tropical Iced Tea was nothing special.

excerpts: Dear Hawaiian Poke Wasabi Bowl,
hawaiian poke.author: Krystle S.
hawaiian poke.review:
Dear Hawaiian Poke Wasabi Bowl,

How do I love thee? Let me count the ways.

1. Your bed is a TON (way more than any person should eat in a single sitting) of delicious sushi rice
2. You double team me with nori AND wakame
3. You get me slightly hot and bothered with your spicy daikon sprouts then cool me down with a tickled-pink ginger
4. You come with a soy-wasabi sauce that makes me want to spoon all night long
5. You were my first...a meal of raw fish where I'm actually FULL without spending $60!?  I've never had so much poke in one bowl (esp. for $11)!!!

You are the perfect catch!

excerpts: - Hawaiian Poke (my FAV dish here!
the tuna on the wonton crisp is just something else... this Hawaiian can poke me any ole time!)
hawaiian poke.author: Amit S.
hawaiian poke.review:
ACK! That's Marlin, Nemo and Dory you're serving on my plate, you freak!

... just kidding! 

This place is actually not that bad at all. Even months after they reopened, I could not make myself go in for the simple fact that I was an avid fan of the Canvas Gallery that occupied the space before, and to see it close was truly sad... I am in mourning...

... OK. Sob story over... back to me now...

... checked it out on a nice and sunny Sunday (those rare ones in the Inner Sunset when you can wear shorts, a tank and flip flops) and had a great time.

I recommend:
- Warm Edamame (sea salt is umm good!)
- House-made Miso Soup (dunno who'se "house" it was made in but they make it darn good)
- Hawaiian Poke (my FAV dish here! the tuna on the wonton crisp is just something else... this Hawaiian can poke me any ole time!)
- Cabo Calamari (What? Messican Calamari?? Odd name but all the same pretty good thought a wee bit greasy with the deep frying)
- Fish & Chips (Can't go wrong with this one... actually, you can! good but not as good as Woodhouse Fish Company)
- Teriyaki Bowl ((nice especially with bok choy, sprouts and nori!)
- Macadamia Nut Brownie (DROOL! DRIP!... nuf said!)
- Bloody Mary (Sunday and Bloody Mary's?? Ya betcha!)

Nice place, crowd (tourists, neighbors, folks from other hoods), kid friendly, dog friendly (outside), waiter service outdoors can be a bit iffy until you throw in some 'tude.

excerpts: The Hawaiian Poke and the Shrimp Ceviche starter plates both came with plenty of poke and shrimp pieces.
hawaiian poke.author: Lisa C.
hawaiian poke.review:
Having been here for lunch, I was looking forward to dinner. I arrived thinking I wanted the seared ahi salad, but that quickly changed as we browsed the menu.  Instead, we opted for a few appetizers and two sushi rolls to share.  The sweet potato fries were irresistible- not too greasy; I kept chomping on them! The Hawaiian Poke and the Shrimp Ceviche starter plates both came with plenty of poke and shrimp pieces. I loved the lime-cilantro-avocado sauce the shrimps were covered in.

Though the starter plates were great, I think the sushi rolls were only ok.  We asked for brown rice for the rising sun and the firecracker salmon rolls.  I was not impressed by the rolls because the brown rice didn't stick too well and the rice fell apart.  I think the next time I'll skip the sushi rolls. 

Surprisingly, there was no wait at all for a Saturday night, and we were able to snag a nice corner window seat.

excerpts: With Hawaiian Poke - Another large portion, fresh, and tasty
hawaiian poke.author: Po L.
hawaiian poke.review:
I've been meaning to try this place for a while.  The beautiful decor always catches my eye when I head to the park, AOS, or just eat in the area.

So today's the day Pacific Catch.  Don't disappointment me after all the build up and recommendations from friends.  Went here on a date and tried to park in the parking lot next door.  No spaces, and around the corner we go.  A little walk never hurt anyone, unless you have a broken leg and no crutches.

We ordered
Sushi Grade Ahi Salad - Large portion, fresh, good
Wasabi Bowls With Hawaiian Poke - Another large portion, fresh, and tasty

This place has no crutch; good food, good service, and good atmosphere, unless you have a broken leg.

excerpts: Hawaiian Poke appetizer was tasty.
It was a saturday dinner after 6PM and the wait was only 15 mins.
But in an hour the place was packed.
hawaiian poke.author: Jessica N.
hawaiian poke.review: I recently came back here and enjoyed the food better than the last time.  I had the today's special yellow tail over brown rice.  It was good but nothing to write home about.  I also tried wild salmon and it was overcooked.  Hawaiian Poke appetizer was tasty.  It was a saturday dinner after 6PM and the wait was only 15 mins.  But in an hour the place was packed.

excerpts: By far the best bang for the buck is the Wasabi bowl (around $16) with your choice of protein (I'm a fiend for the Hawaiian poke).
You get a huge bowl of rice, seaweed salad, sprouts, wasabi, and all sorts of other tasty additions, plus of course, the poke.
This is the dish that, when ordered, everyone at the table sort of eyes ruefully, perhaps wishing they'd ordered it themselves.
hawaiian poke.author: Ravena F.
hawaiian poke.review:
This is by far my favorite rendition of this space.  Ideally located on a corner spot, near Golden Gate Park, Pacific Catch has an expansive and airy feel.  Add to that the double happy hour times (4-6pm & 10-closing), and you have yourselves a very pleasant atmosphere in which to relax and chat over some mighty fine beverages.  (Don't forget to add sweet potato fries!)

Dinners are quite tasty as well, though all dishes are not created equally.  By far the best bang for the buck is the Wasabi bowl (around $16) with your choice of protein (I'm a fiend for the Hawaiian poke).  You get a huge bowl of rice, seaweed salad, sprouts, wasabi, and all sorts of other tasty additions, plus of course, the poke.  This is the dish that, when ordered, everyone at the table sort of eyes ruefully, perhaps wishing they'd ordered it themselves.  Combine this with the spicy martini (vodka, chili peppers, passion fruit juice), and there I am: leaning back, rubbing my belly, convinced I'm on a tropical vacation, with nothing to do except melt into a silky little puddle of happy place.  

Pacific Catch strikes me as more of a chill with friends or colleagues place, rather than a hot date place.  It is good for groups (definitely make reservations).  I've been told that groups have a 2 hour time limit (even on weekdays), though in my experience that has yet to be enforced.

So to recap:
Go spend a sunny day in the park, get here in time for happy hour, eat, rub your belly.  Thank me later.

excerpts: Hawaiian Poke.
hawaiian poke.author: Liane T.
hawaiian poke.review:
I found this place courtesy of you yelpers out there, and because of you all it is now one of my favorites :)

I took my boyfriend out here for a lunch date in the city. When you first walk in, the ambiance is something of it's own. It has a semi-formal feel, and then it has a casual feel and  I like the fusion of different asian decor. It was rather light out in the day so the sun coming in also had a nice feel. 

Our server was one of the most hospitable that I've ever encountered in my dining out life. He was welcoming since we were new to the place and made recommendations accordingly. He even brought out some of the drink samples (non alcoholic haha mind you) so we could figure out what we'd like. 

We had the thai coconut shrimp appetizer which was delicious, but rather on the small side. My bf has the mixed fish basket and I ordered the fried oyster basket. And they both came with the sweet potato fries! It was so tasty & delicious! The jalapeno tartar sauce was also a nice touch. Oh, and the tropical tea + lemongrass tea fused together tastes like an arnold palmer :) jus thought i'd mix both to give it a try.

I would definitely recommend this place to anyone and everyone. Great service, great ambiance. Parking is a little of a pain but hey, it's the city, it's expected. 

Note to self: A million more things to try next time. Hawaiian Poke. Mahi Mahi Bowl. Etc.

excerpts:
here's their HH menu: 
Hawaiian Poke - sushi-grade ahi tuna in a sesame-soy marinade & spicy seasonings with wonton crisps
Asparagus & Shiitake - asparagus tempura & shiitake mushrooms with miso dressing
Spicy Tuna - ahi tuna with sriracha mayo
hawaiian poke.author: Kapo T.
hawaiian poke.review:
i m not a big asian fusion fan probably because i think asian food is traditional enough and shouldn't be made any different. i've been here 3 times and the food is OK. nothing great. the location is great if you need a snack from walking the GGP or the museums. (but there are other food to eat around there also).  

the only thing that i recommend is the happy hour here. on a nice sunny day, the bar and outside seating is packed.  happy hour is from 4p-6p so get your orders in before 6p.  

here's their HH menu: 
Hawaiian Poke - sushi-grade ahi tuna in a sesame-soy marinade & spicy seasonings with wonton crisps
Asparagus & Shiitake - asparagus tempura & shiitake mushrooms with miso dressing
Spicy Tuna - ahi tuna with sriracha mayo
Thai Coconut Shrimp - Thai sweet-chili sauce
Spicy Cabo Calamari - crispy chili & lemon with spicy chipotle sauce
Warm Edamame - Hawaiian Alaea sea salt
Basket of Fries - "signature" sweet potato, traditional or spicy 

and yup, we ordered 3 of everything on the HH menu to beat the time! get their sweet potato fries, i like that one the best

excerpts: The Hawaiian poke is my personal favorite (that's what SHE said), on top o' rice bowl or a salad.
hawaiian poke.author: Kerry D.
hawaiian poke.review:
Under the sea
Under the sea
Nobody beat us
Fry us and eat us
In fricassee
We what the land folks loves to cook
Under the sea we off the hook
We got no troubles
Life is the bubbles
Under the sea!

I feel really bad for people who don't eat seafood.  I love me some fish! 
 
I know a lot of feathers were ruffled when Pacific Catch took the place of Canvas.  One less hipster coffee shop in SF, boo-freakin-hoo.  I really like what they did with the space here and I think Pacific Catch adds a lot to the Inner Sunset restaurant selection.  
The Hawaiian poke is my personal favorite (that's what SHE said), on top o' rice bowl or a salad.  The Baja Shrimp Ceviche starter is a another highlight, arriving in a classy martini glass with tortilla chips.  Island tacos, fresh sushi rolls, stews and fish and chips (with sweet potato fries!)  are also scrumptious choices and help diversify the menu.  There really is a little something for everyone.  This location next to the park is ideal and the limited outdoor seating is lovely.  

I've had consistently spotty service here, with the place both packed and empty.  But even so, luckily the food itself is consistently delicious and fresh.  If you have the patience to endure being ignored by the waitstaff and a large space CRAWLING with young kids (Hey -I love 'em, but I know some people don't....) Pacific Catch is a solid casual dining spot.

excerpts: Hawaiian Poke that is.
Pacific Catch has great fresh seafood, and the best Hawaiian Poke this side of Hawaii.
As compared to the Marina location, this has tons more seating.
Parking can be hit or miss.
For dinner, he had a trio of tacos while I had a Hawaiian Poke ($14.95) wasabi bowl.
Topped with wakame salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, cucumber, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori and soy-wasabi sauce served over sushi rice.
hawaiian poke.author: Flor D.
hawaiian poke.review:
All Aboard!  Get ready to set sail on a FISHY adventure! 
If ever a man wants to get to my heart...let him do it with a POKE! 
Hawaiian Poke that is. Pacific Catch has great fresh seafood, and the best Hawaiian Poke this side of Hawaii.
As compared to the Marina location, this has tons more seating. 
Parking can be hit or miss.  If you go for dinner, it's easier, as you can park across the street at Golden Gate Park.

I am an anti Valentine kinda girl.  In fact, I wish Hallmark would call the holiday what it really is : Happy eat, drink anything you LOVE with those that make you smile Day.  So...going along with this them, I requested my date take me to eat one of my favorite things.

As a starter, the cube and I shared one of the special ceviches on the board. All I remember was big chunks of fish, lime, tomato, and fried plantain chips. At $7.95, I was in heaven. 

For dinner, he had a trio of tacos while I had a Hawaiian Poke ($14.95) wasabi bowl.  Topped with wakame salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, cucumber, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori and soy-wasabi sauce served over sushi rice. I asked for brown.

Healthy, delicious, fast, and convenient. Now that's romance!  Forget that they sat us down and told us they needed the table back in an hour and a 1/2...it didn't spoil our efficient LOVE dinner.
