excerpts: Their Hawaiian Poke Wasabi Bowl is very yummy!
I like their late night happy hour items as well!
hawaiian poke.author: Jobin C.
hawaiian poke.review:
Their Hawaiian Poke Wasabi Bowl is very yummy! 
I like their late night happy hour items as well!

excerpts: On 3/17, the waiter handed us a not so fresh order of Hawaiian poke.
Its color was brown with a hint of red.
My boyfriend and I did not mention anything because we thought they had a bad batch of fish that day.
As we were about to leave, we saw a fresh, bright red batch of Hawaiian poke served to the table behind us.
hawaiian poke.author: Goldie L.
hawaiian poke.review:
Oh Pacific Catch,
You used to be a 4 but now you're a 0 so you average a 2. I was a reguar (about 3x/week) at the Pacific Catch on 9th because I lived fairly close, because they have a parking garage (although it's packed most of the time), and mainly because they have happy hour from 10-12. I've tried everything on their happy hour menu and among my favorites are the hawaiin poke, spicy fries, calamari, and lemon drop martini. 
Why I haven't been in awhile: On 3/17, the waiter handed us a not so fresh order of Hawaiian poke. Its color was brown with a hint of red. My boyfriend and I did not mention anything because we thought they had a bad batch of fish that day. As we were about to leave, we saw a fresh, bright red batch of Hawaiian poke served to the table behind us. 

Yes, asians don't tend to send their orders back but make sure it does not happen again please. 

And employee discounts should be allowed even for happy hour then I will think about coming back :).

excerpts: Most favorite item on the menu is the Japanese Wasabi rice bowl with Hawaiian poke.
Comes in a big big bowl with nori, ginger, rice, seaweed salad, and your choice of hawaiian poke, grilled salmon, seared tuna or crab.
YUM!
Also really like their Guava mint cooler.
Alcoholic drink..
but you don't taste it too much.
hawaiian poke.author: Rhonda H.
hawaiian poke.review: Been here a few times and I've always left satisfied. Most favorite item on the menu is the Japanese Wasabi rice bowl with Hawaiian poke. Comes in a big big bowl with nori, ginger, rice, seaweed salad, and your choice of hawaiian poke, grilled salmon, seared tuna or crab. YUM! Also really like their Guava mint cooler. Alcoholic drink..but you don't taste it too much.

excerpts: I knew that I was going to order the Hawaiian Poke Rice bowl since I saw many great looking pictures.
Then my big bowl of Hawaiian Poke ($14.95) came.
You could choose between sushi rice or brown rice.
Me, of course went with the sushi rice!
The big bowl came with tons of fresh tuna cubes, topped with wakame salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, cucumber, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori and soy-wasabi sauce.
I just wanted to dive into the bowl and stuff it all in my mouth.
But I am a lady, and I do have manners at the table.. sometimes...
Everything in the bowl was yummy besides the avocado..
There were big brown spots everywhere.
Ewww...
I didn't know if it was suppose to be eaten like a bi bim bap or just pick things out as you go..
So I just mixed everything together and ate it.
So good.
hawaiian poke.author: Juliane N.
hawaiian poke.review:
I don't know who invented mysitic tans but whoever did, I really dislike you! After a long busy night and then a long busy morning at work, I was starving. Everyone decided to tan and do mytics the last minute and I just wasn't feeling it. I was so happy when I got off that all I wanted to do was stuff my face with food because that is all I was thinking about. I did have a bag of Ruffles on the desk but couldn't eat it since I had clients sitting on the couch staring at me.. I wouldn't want no orange lips, smelly cheesy breath, and pieces of chips all over me... that's just not professional....

After I got off, we headed to Pacific Catch! Finally got the chance to come try this place out! I've heard mixed reviews but more good then bad. I've wanted to try this place out since I saw it on Chestnut but never had the chance. Glad I ended my year with a good meal. 

Everything on the menu and everything on other customers tables looked so good but I came in here knowing what I was going to order. The rice bowls! I knew that I was going to order the Hawaiian Poke Rice bowl since I saw many great looking pictures. We also got a whole basket of sweet potato fries.. Yum!!!!

The basket of sweet potato fries ($4.95) came with two sides of dips, wasabi mayo and chili sweet and sour? Wasabi mayo was delicious. Went great with the sweet potato fries.. Those were amazingly good. Crispy and sweet. Then my big bowl of Hawaiian Poke ($14.95) came. You could choose between sushi rice or brown rice. Me, of course went with the sushi rice! The big bowl came with tons of fresh tuna cubes, topped with wakame salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, cucumber, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori and soy-wasabi sauce. I just wanted to dive into the bowl and stuff it all in my mouth. But I am a lady, and I do have manners at the table.. sometimes... Everything in the bowl was yummy besides the avocado.. There were big brown spots everywhere. Ewww... I didn't know if it was suppose to be eaten like a bi bim bap or just pick things out as you go.. So I just mixed everything together and ate it. So good. I think there bowls are a must order because I noticed a lot of the tables ordered those too!

The place itself had a very comfy feel. Service could of been better. I was getting very impatient with the waitress. My water glass was not filled and I was thirsty, and the check took FOREVER to come.... I would definitely come back because everything else on the menu sounded good.

excerpts: But, the Hawaiian Poke appetizer and Cabo Shrimp tacos I got were totally delicious,
amazing
I dare say.
A lot of creativity goes into the seasoning and synthesizing of dishes here.
The tacos were served with black beans (average) and my choice, sweet potatoes fries (heaven).
hawaiian poke.author: Jeff H.
hawaiian poke.review:
The owners and the cooks should fire the wait staff. Well, maybe just the server we had last night. But still.

The point is this: Pacific Catch would've been a shoe-in for four, maybe 4.5, stars were it not for the attitude of our server, which lasted the entire 90-minute duration of our visit.

It wasn't the same person, but the fact that I was brought water (after not having been offered it for the better part of 45 minutes in) in a glass that had a crack that would dwarf the San Andreas fault doesn't help matters.

But, the Hawaiian Poke appetizer and Cabo Shrimp tacos I got were totally delicious, amazing I dare say. A lot of creativity goes into the seasoning and synthesizing of dishes here. The tacos were served with black beans (average) and my choice, sweet potatoes fries (heaven). So, hats off to the chef, cooks, and owners.

But shame on you, server. I mean, was it the fact that me and the love of my life shamed ourselves by sitting on the same side of our spacious booth? That we took an extra 3.2 seconds to order because we weren't sure what we wanted to drink? What was it?

Whatever it was, it should've been overlooked, because you dampened an otherwise awesome dinner.

The clientele should've bothered me, but didn't. I think the seclusion of our booth helped matters.

I'll go back, for sure, because the optimist in me wants to believe this was a one-off.

excerpts: I also like the Ahi 3 ways, which is served 1) seared, 2) hawaiian poke style and 3) sashimi.
hawaiian poke.author: mike j.
hawaiian poke.review:
This place is a pretty good asian fusion place.  I must admit that although I've been here quite a few times, I tend to get the same thing...because it's so damn good and filling.

The Ahi tuna Wasabi bowl, is delicious.  Lots of ahi and enough rice to feed a family.  You won't be able to finish this.  

I also like the Ahi 3 ways, which is served 1) seared, 2) hawaiian poke style and 3) sashimi.  That's pretty tasty as well.

The sweet potato fries are really good too!

excerpts: Extremely fast service for our "appetizer", Hawaiian Poke.
The ahi cubes were very soft and the sesame soy marinade was perfect.
This dish was a great value at $8.50...
hawaiian poke.author: B. Earl K.
hawaiian poke.review:
Very easy to make a same day (Sunday) lunch reservation via OpenTable.com.

They started us with a small two-compartment dish of fresh edamame and some little Pepperidge Farm-esque pretzel nuggets. 

Extremely fast service for our "appetizer", Hawaiian Poke. The ahi cubes were very soft and the sesame soy marinade was perfect. This dish was a great value at $8.50...the ahi was piled high alongside and on top of several tasty wonton crisps.

My wife ordered the fried oysters with sweet potato fries subbed in for their traditional fries...both DEE-licious. I ordered the salmon teriyaki bowl with brown rice subbed in for the pineapple fried rice. The latter didn't sound very appealing to me; plus, my wife is always telling me about the healthy benefits of brown rice! Their bowls are HUGE, btw. The size of my bowl reminded me of something I would get at the Cheesecake Factory. The size of the grilled salmon could have certainly been larger, and the quantity of rice could have been far less. Otherwise, it was just okay.

Friendly, speedy service. Nice variety on their menu(s). We'll definitely return to try some more of what they have to offer!

excerpts: Anyway, I always order a Sapporo (or cocktail if it was a long day) and the Hawaiian Poke Wasabi Bowl, half white rice, half salad, no sprouts and no ginger.
I don't think it could get any better.
hawaiian poke.author: Lauren Q.
hawaiian poke.review: My boyfriend and I frequent this place maybe 5-8 times/month. It's kind of ridiculous...had my 21st Birthday Dinner here...would definitely call it one of my faves in SF, having grown up here. We usually sit at the bar so we can watch whatever game is on at the time...if it's a Niners home game, well, we'll be at the Stick. Anyway, I always order a Sapporo (or cocktail if it was a long day) and the Hawaiian Poke Wasabi Bowl, half white rice, half salad, no sprouts and no ginger. I don't think it could get any better. This is my first review on Yelp, and I knew exactly which restaurant I would write about first :) PS - Ecstasy roll is bomb PPS - You get pretzel goldfish and edamame while you wait!

excerpts: Their poke tastes really fresh so if you're looking for something a bit more filling than bar bites, try either the Hawaiian Poke Wasabi Bowl or the Ahi Three Way, both dishes that come with poke.
hawaiian poke.author: Cristofer P.
hawaiian poke.review:
The real standout is the basket of sweet potato fries which comes with an out of this world wasabi aoli and a spicy sweet and sour sauce for dipping. Their poke tastes really fresh so if you're looking for something a bit more filling than bar bites, try either the Hawaiian Poke Wasabi Bowl or the Ahi Three Way, both dishes that come with poke.

I love that they have a late night happy hour.

excerpts: - Hawaiian Poke:
My absolute fave of the night.
I always have to try poke if a restaurant has it on their menu and this one totally hit the spot.
Not as good as homemade, but close enough!
Could do without the won ton chips.
If I were to go back it would be for the sweet potato fries, Hawaiian poke, and maybe to try the Wasabi Bowls and fish tacos.
hawaiian poke.author: Ashley C.
hawaiian poke.review:
So my boyfriend took me here for Mother's Day because a friend suggested it. And EVERYONE we knew that has been there told us to get the sweet potato fries. 

The first thing that I noticed was that out of all the booths, the hostess sat us at one where I was literally blinded by the sunlight. I ended up sitting next to my boyfriend, which is nice, but I like sitting across from him so we can talk easier. Our waiter (his name totally slipped my mind, sorry!) was nice and attentive. Took our orders and our appetizers came out in like 10 minutes! Kind of threw me off on how fast it came out. 

we ordered: 

- Sweet Potato Fries: My boyfriend is a fries fiend so he totally enjoyed this. I'm not that big on fries, but I must admit that it was pretty delish. 

- Hawaiian Poke: My absolute fave of the night. I always have to try poke if a restaurant has it on their menu and this one totally hit the spot. Not as good as homemade, but close enough! Could do without the won ton chips. Would have been great with a seaweed salad. 

- Cabo Calamari: This is another dish we usually always try if it's on the menu. We were quite disappointed. Usually when you eat a piece of calamari without the sauce, it should still have some flavor from the breading its coated in, but this was just so...BLAND. Then when we dipped it in the sauce, it completely broke apart. No good. 

- Miso Glazed Salmon: Loved the crispy outside and buttery inside. Sauce, mushroom & edamame side, was delicious. The salad on the side was not to my liking. I don't know what it was, but the flavor was horrible and the texture was really tough. 

- Korean BBQ Steak: First of all, the waiter hadn't asked my boyfriend how he wanted it cooked. It came out medium rare which was fine though. Tim loved the flavor, but the meat was TOUGH. Don't think it was the way it was cooked, just that that particular cut of meat was tough. He also didn't like the salad. 

- Lemongrass Mojito: Pretty good. Bartender made it strong, just the way I like it. 

Overall, it was alright. If I were to go back it would be for the sweet potato fries, Hawaiian poke, and maybe to try the Wasabi Bowls and fish tacos.

excerpts: The Japanese Wasabi Bowl with Hawaiian Poke was delicious and very filling.
I finished my leftovers the next day.
I recommended mixing everything in the bowl.
It tastes even better.
hawaiian poke.author: Jon H.
hawaiian poke.review: The Japanese Wasabi Bowl with Hawaiian Poke was delicious and very filling.  I finished my leftovers the next day.  I recommended mixing everything in the bowl.  It tastes even better.

excerpts: Apparently the raw stuff is the Hawaiian Poke?
How the hell was I suppose to know that??!!
I wish there was a description on the menu.
Boooo!!
hawaiian poke.author: Tammy H.
hawaiian poke.review:
Still not off the Hawaii tip =p  Wanted something close to the spicy tuna bowl I had at Aloha Sushi in Honolulu....rice, 2 scoops of spicy tuna, and all the fixins in a bowl.  The bf suggested Pacific Catch for the comparable taste.  
Parking was a (%&# as usual around 9th/Irving on a beautiful Sunday afternoon right next to GG park.  All good...beauiful day in the sunset...cant beat those!!  Walked past the cute little tables in their patio and was seated right away and attended to.  The entire menu looked super yum!  I seriously had to narrow it down from sweet potato fries, crispy oysters, teriyaki bowls, macademia crusted seabass, catfish sandwich, sushi....it was rather extensive!!  We finally narrowed it down to....

Spicy Fries:  Normal fries just tossed with a cajun seasoning I think.  I LOVE fries so it was a great version...especially since they were "skinny" fries that were super crispy.  The dipping sauces were a nice touch: sweet chili sauce (the one for lumpia!!...I blended that combo LONG before I came here!!  I like their thinking here) and a creamy miso dip!!  yum!!  Mix them together...its perfect!

Salmon Wasabi Bowl:  I thought it was going to be raw salmon but it turned out to be grilled. Apparently the raw stuff is the Hawaiian Poke?  How the hell was I suppose to know that??!!  I wish there was a description on the menu.  Boooo!!  Even though I was in the mood for raw fish the salmon was a great compliment to the brown rice covered with a wasabi miso sauce, radish sprouts, seaweed salad, cucumber salad, pickled ginger and avocado.  It was all the ingredients to a honkin sushi roll but in a bowl.  For about $15, the portions were huge, fresh, and tastey.  I probably ate a little less than half and was STUFFED!  

Tuna Wasabi Bowl: Same condiments in the bowl just with lighly seared tuna.

I think I was a little disappointed that the salmon was cooked, obviously my fault, but I still enjoyed my meal.  Looking around at the other tables and their selections, the wasabi bowl was probably the best priced dish.  The menu will definitely bring me back to finalize their rating.  I cant wait to try all the other delicious goodies....crispy oysters....mmmm...cant wait!!!

excerpts: "Hawaiian Poke" roll - $8.95:
Giant cubed ahi in a roll (which I like)
hawaiian poke.author: Diwata B.
hawaiian poke.review:
Fried Oysters. Poke Roll.  It's not "to-die-for" food but I'd eat there again none the less.  Service was un-noticeably good (not too bad, nothing spectacular).  They have a mini parking lot in the back, which is good considering the parking in the nearby streets.  

Appetizer: 
"Crispy Oysters" - $9.50: about 10 on the plate.  Fried.  would order it again

My meal:
"Firecracker Salmon" roll - $9.95: not a big fan of the over-induced daikon sprouts.  Didn't know I was ordering cooked-salmon til I got it.  Shouldn't have overlooked the 'tempura-salmon' description.  I'll try something else next time.
"Hawaiian Poke" roll - $8.95:  Giant cubed ahi in a roll (which I like)   I was diggin' the sesame-soy marinade.    

Got a taste of:
"Mixed Catch Basket" - $13.95
2 pieces of fish, 4 coconut shrimp & 3 crispy oysters with jalapeno tartar
No taste of coconut in my coconut shrimp.  The side of sweet potato fries were awesome.  I'd order that on it's own.

excerpts: I have had on both visits, the Hawaiian Poke (sushi-grade ahi tuna in a delicious sesame-soy marinade with spicy seasonings with fresh wonton crisps (not ordinary wontons found in Chinese places).
hawaiian poke.author: Lee S.
hawaiian poke.review:
My last  find of 2009 and one of my new favorites in 2010 in San Francisco. This place is great (at least so far for happy hour). I will definitely return again and look forward to doing dinner there soon.

The well-priced happy hour (M-F 4-6 & again from 10-closing) serves daily-featured) house wines at $6. The bar menu is interesting. I have had on both visits, the Hawaiian Poke (sushi-grade ahi tuna in a delicious sesame-soy marinade with spicy seasonings with fresh wonton crisps (not ordinary wontons found in Chinese places). It's a hefty serving at $6.

It's a bit noisy in the bar between 5 & 6 due to the USC students so I suggest before 5 if you prefer a smoother atmosphere.

In Patrick (bartender & server) the establishment could not hope for a better ambassador...thoroughly knowledgeable regarding all the restaurant's programs and very cordial in explaining them as they seem a little complicated at first.

Once again, all in all, a very pleasurable experience.

excerpts: I always get the hawaiian poke wasabi bowl!
SOOOOO GOOD!
I usually get it with sushi rice
but I got it with brown rice recently
and it was just as good!
and healthier too might I add.
the mahi and tuna sandwiches are also quite tasty.
Their fish is fresh and always cooked perfectly in the sandwiches.
hawaiian poke.author: LiveToEat F.
hawaiian poke.review:
I like this location more than the one on Chestnut.  

This location is roomy and the decor is quite nice.  I always get the hawaiian poke wasabi bowl!  SOOOOO GOOD! I usually get it with sushi rice but I got it with brown rice recently and it was just as good! and healthier too might I add.   the mahi and tuna sandwiches are also quite tasty.  Their fish is fresh and always cooked perfectly in the sandwiches.  
The sweet potato fries are a must!!!  They are so thin, sweet and delicious!  

A plus:  I love the complimentary edamame and pretzel fishes.  YES! FREE FOOD!

I'll be back!

excerpts: We've been sticking to the Hawaiian Poke because it's a great bang for your buck, but we've also tried 2 different sushi rolls which were great and well worth the cost.
And if you time it right, you can catch an outside seat with the sun going down and a gentle breeze through the bamboo.
hawaiian poke.author: Heather W.
hawaiian poke.review:
Well, to be honest, I'm not even sure that I should be writing this review, because I'm very content with my little 'find' of a Happy Hour and exposing it here just might jinx it.  But, what good is something great if you can't share it?

I was pretty skeptical of the whole restaurant when it 1st moved in.  I really loved The Canvas (the previous business in this location), and the new restaurant looked big, scary, and corporate.

Turns out that they have a really great Happy Hour!

Well drinks (well made!) and pints (good beers, like Longboard!) for $3-$4.  Several of the appetizers are also discounted between $5-$8 and they're really nice quality and a handsome portion.  

We've been sticking to the Hawaiian Poke because it's a great bang for your buck, but we've also tried 2 different sushi rolls which were great and well worth the cost.  And if you time it right, you can catch an outside seat with the sun going down and a gentle breeze through the bamboo.

excerpts: I had one of the teriyaki bowls and my friend had the hawaiian poke wasabi bowl.
The teriyaki bowl had a little too much teriyaki sauce mixed into the bowl.
However, the steak that I got with it was very good - the rest of the bowl was just too much; too much sweet-taste.
The poke wasabi bowl was very tasty.
The fish was done just right.
But, it was just too much of the same thing with the same flavor.
It was slightly on the salty side (wasabi
+ soy sauce was mixed into the rice).
hawaiian poke.author: Brian L.
hawaiian poke.review:
I had lunch here not too long ago - I had one of the teriyaki bowls and my friend had the hawaiian poke wasabi bowl. The teriyaki bowl had a little too much teriyaki sauce mixed into the bowl. However, the steak that I got with it was very good - the rest of the bowl was just too much; too much sweet-taste. The poke wasabi bowl was very tasty. The fish was done just right. But, it was just too much of the same thing with the same flavor. It was slightly on the salty side (wasabi + soy sauce was mixed into the rice). The fried yam fries were cooked well and reminded me of my southern roots. 

Overall, not bad, (~mid $30ish for 2 people) with reasonable portions. However, the food is flavorful and good for the first 1/3 of the meal and then it's simply too much of the (very) sweet or salty flavor. If you're craving fried yam fries, definitely come here but if you're craving some type of japanese rice bowl, go to an authentic japanese place - you'll be more satisfied and happier with yourself!

excerpts:
Cabo Calamari
Seared Ahi Bowl
Hawaiian Poke Bowl
hawaiian poke.author: Jessica B.
hawaiian poke.review:
I used to come here whenever I had disposable 20 and wanted to treat myself to some qual-it- A food. I've had fun happy hour times with some friends and even quick one drink hang outs. I had not eaten here in over a year and was excited when the opportunity came to indulge in a yummy lunch. After Bay to Breakers, my friends went to Gordos (YUM) and I chose to order take out from Pacific Catch. I requested the seared ahi rice bowl.  Excited to chow down, I ran to Gordos and proceeded to stuff my face. However, one thing felt wrong. The fish did not taste the same. Again, here is another place that overloads on the sodium to masque the taste of their food. Not only was the fish too salty, but there was something fishy about the fish. After a while, I decided to cease my "chow down" and wrapped the food back into the bag. There is a huge problem if I order food and do not devour the entire thing. This means I either am not hungry or the food does not taste good. Thinking that I must not have been hungry, I decided to eat the bowl later that day. From the moment I went to my bfs house to later that afternoon, my stomach was hurting. I assumed it was due to the hangover from B2B, but it did not make sense. I went to go finish the bowl and figured out my stomach was hurting from the food. Pretty sad. The bowls used to be enjoyable.

What I have eaten here: 
Baja Shrimp Ceviche
Sweet Potato Fries (Get them!)
Cabo Calamari
Seared Ahi Bowl
Hawaiian Poke Bowl

I'll keep the rating 3/5 because this could have been the one bad experience. I was always a fan of Pacific Catch, but I may need to take a permanent break from them. SORRY!

excerpts: My friend kept recommending this place to me, so I finally went and tried their Hawaiian Poke Wasabi bowl with brown rice.
It was great.
It reminded me of the Korean dish bibimbap but this in a Japanese/ Hawaiian fusion version.
You have a choice of white rice, sushi rice or brown rice.
And you can also have it with half salad
half rice instead of full rice.
It is a big bowl for its price and can definitely be split into at least 2 servings.
The tuna was well seasoned and the rice had a great wasabi soysauce all over it.
hawaiian poke.author: Crystal L.
hawaiian poke.review:
My friend kept recommending this place to me, so I finally went and tried their Hawaiian Poke Wasabi bowl with brown rice. It was great.  It reminded me of the Korean dish bibimbap but this in a Japanese/ Hawaiian fusion version. You have a choice of white rice, sushi rice or brown rice.  And you can also have it with half salad half rice instead of full rice.  It is a big bowl for its price and can definitely be split into at least 2 servings.   The tuna was well seasoned and the rice had a great wasabi soysauce all over it.  We also order a small side order of sweet potato fries.  It's sweet potato fries. It's great. haha

My friend said this location has a larger sitting area than the marina/cow hollow location and is easier to find parking.  There is a small parking lot available, but mainly street parking.

excerpts: Had the Hawaiian Poke Wasabe Bowl and it was gooooooood.
The wasabi sauce had bite
but it wasn't overpowering.
The portion size was pretty big.
You'll definitely get your money's worth on this one.
hawaiian poke.author: Arnold M.
hawaiian poke.review: Had the Hawaiian Poke Wasabe Bowl and it was gooooooood.  The wasabi sauce had bite but it wasn't overpowering.  The portion size was pretty big.  You'll definitely get your money's worth on this one.

excerpts: One of their refreshing cocktails, Sweet potato fries, and Hawaiian Poke.
Yummmmm!
hawaiian poke.author: Nat S.
hawaiian poke.review:
I am kind of obsessed with this place. The food is delicious, very fresh and interesting seafood dishes. My favorite part though, is it's close proximity to CA Academy of Sciences. For some reason, every time I go to CA Academy of Sciences, I have a mad craving to eat seafood. That may seem a little perverse, but at least I don't crave animals after the zoo.  Anyways, I am writing this review after my last visit there on a Thursday night (after my mouth watered from staring at the fish in CA Academy)....I went around 9 pm and Pacific Catch was pretty packed. Luckily, without reservations, the super sweet and amazing Anastasia was so helpful. She walked me and my date directly to a table. I'm not sure why Anastasia got a  bad review before, she was so nice and prompt to accommodate my hunger pangs. 
Must orders for Pacific Catch: One of their refreshing cocktails, Sweet potato fries, and Hawaiian Poke. Yummmmm!

excerpts: We ordered the hawaiian poke to start off but didn't end up actually getting it
till a little bit after our server came out with our entrees.
But better late than never because it was ooh so good.
Very fresh and flavorful.
After contemplating about the many enticing choices on the menu, I opted for the island tacos for my main entree.
hawaiian poke.author: BrElla4eva H.
hawaiian poke.review:
I'd really give this place 3 1/2 stars...4 stars for food, 3 stars for the service. I actually really like this restaurant. The place is pretty casual, but fun. A good spot to get together with a small group of friends for a reasonably priced dinner. The food was delicious, but the service was mediocre. I think our server was new to the job so I felt bad for him. . We ordered the hawaiian poke to start off but didn't end up actually getting it till a little bit after our server came out with our entrees. But better late than never because it was ooh so good. Very fresh and flavorful. After contemplating about the many enticing choices on the menu, I opted for the island tacos for my main entree. One grilled mahi mahi and one cabo shrimp with a side of sweet potato fries. Definite thumbs up! 

I do need to mention a strange but funny incident we had while dining here. As we were all finishing up our food, one of my friends was drinking waster out of his glass...when all of a sudden I see a big splash. At first I thought he dropped his glass of water but it turned out that the bottom of his glass broke and all the ice and water spilled out! And let me just tell you...it broke just on the bottom of the glass in almost a perfect, complete circle! How weird is that!?! Luckily he already finished his meal. We, of course, complained to our server and he was able to get his meal for free. He mentioned that it probably happened because the glass was hot when they poured in cold water.

Now for dessert...always my favorite part! The four of us shared 2 different plates....the mochi fondue and the fried dulce de leche spring rolls. Both were scrumptious! I never thought of dipping mochi ice cream balls in hot chocolate sauce but it is dee-lish!

YES, I'd come back to this place and YES, I recommend it!

excerpts: Seriously, I will come here just for that, but more my usual addition is the Hawaiian Poke which is really tasty.
The Poke is really something I recommend as the appetizer version
b/c
hawaiian poke.author: Stephanie W.
hawaiian poke.review:
I heart the sweet potato fries from this place! Seriously, I will come here just for that, but more my usual addition is the Hawaiian Poke which is really tasty. The Poke is really something I recommend as the appetizer version b/c then it comes with yummy fried won tons to eat it on. 

The drinks are usually solid standards with a slight twist that have never done me wrong and dessert is always fun if I have room after consuming mass quantities of sweet potato fries!

excerpts: I usually order the sweet potato fries and the Hawaiian poke (pronouced po-kee, not like "poke" in the eye) wasabi bowl.
The rice in the last wasabi bowl I had was poorly cooked and still hard.
I hope they can refocus on serving quality...
It's A-OK.
hawaiian poke.author: Randall L.
hawaiian poke.review:
I came here to eat with my family for my birthday.  Why did I pick it?  I was bored of all the other food I had eaten in the past week and hadn't been here for about a year.  I just wanted a change of taste plus a restaurant that wasn't anything too fancy or expensive.  And that's exactly what we got.  

There's nothing too special or particularly awesome about their seafood and Asian/Hawaiian inspired dishes.  Pacific Catch has become a mainstream chain that lacks uniqueness.  There's nothing that will WOW you here.

I usually order the sweet potato fries and the Hawaiian poke (pronouced po-kee, not like "poke" in the eye) wasabi bowl.  The rice in the last wasabi bowl I had was poorly cooked and still hard.  I hope they can refocus on serving quality...  It's A-OK.

excerpts: My sister is addicted to the Hawaiian Poke Wasabi Bowl with brown rice.
It looked like health food.
Yuck!
Then I tasted it.
It's tasty.
Taking one bite made me feel healthier.
We also had some of the Dulce de leche spring rolls a la mode, which was not greasy and very good.
Can't wait to try this place again.
hawaiian poke.author: Babette C.
hawaiian poke.review:
My sister comes here a lot when she's in the avenues to hang out with her friends.  She insisted that I try it.  I was reluctant, because I hate driving out to the avenues ad I abhor street parking in San Francisco, but I trust my sister's instincts when it comes to food, because she's as particular as I am.

It's places like this that makes me trust her.  This place was pretty good.  I'd give it 4 stars, but I hate crowded places and this place is crowded.  People love this place and the wait to get in is trying.  We must have missed the height of the dinner rush, because we were seated after 20 minutes.  

I had the Thai Coconut Shrimp with sweet potato fries.  People rave about the sweet potato fries and they are good, but I've had better.  You can't go wrong with the Shrimp.  My sister is addicted to the Hawaiian Poke Wasabi Bowl with brown rice.  It looked like health food.  Yuck!  Then I tasted it.  It's tasty.  Taking one bite made me feel healthier.  We also had some of the Dulce de leche spring rolls a la mode, which was not greasy and very good.  Can't wait to try this place again.

excerpts: We ordered a set of Mahi Mahi tacos containing two tacos with sweet potato fries, a four piece Fish and Chip set with regular fries and the Hawaiian Poke as an appetizer.
The Hawaiian Poke was a first for me.
It's essentially tuna sashimi that is drowned in soy sauce and sesame seed oil.
It comes with this wonton strip-like crackers that are light and crunchy, which you eat with the tuna just like chips to salsa.
At first try, it's very flavorful with the soft, creamy texture of the tuna mixed with the crunchy...chip?
The soy sauce and sesame seed oil work
well together, but only on the top most portion of the tuna.
Most of the sauce stayed at the bottom, which made the tuna at the bottom too salty.
It would be better if the tuna were equally marinated instead of having a special few that literally drowned in its own sauce.
So each of us had a basket with one Mahi Mahi Taco and a basket with Fish and Chips.
I love the sweet potato fries!
Sweet and soft goodness in a crispy outer crust!
It's definitely a good alternative to the regular potato fries, but good thing
it's an option.
I still prefer the ol' fashioned potato fries.
Still sweet potato fries...good alternative.
The Mahi Mahi Tacos were good.
The Mahi Mahi was grilled, of course, instead of the usual beer battered filet.
Everything on the taco was well-balanced and the fish was light.
There's a picture with a couple of tacos dressed with a generous portion of guacamole.
hawaiian poke.author: Jeremy L.
hawaiian poke.review:
I've always wanted to try Pacific Catch from every moment that I have driving on 9th from Golden Gate Park! Well, I got my chance when I wanted Fish and Chips and this was the place my girlfriend and I decided to go to!

First thing's first, it was awesome how they could call you when your seat is ready. It was a twenty minute wait for us, so we opt for them to call us and took a stroll along Irving for the duration of the time. 

After being seating, I was taken away from the comfortable booth seats! I could lean back a little for a more relax sitting position, but note that it works for someone my height (at about 5'10''). Either way, it's very comfortable. 

We ordered a set of Mahi Mahi tacos containing two tacos with sweet potato fries, a four piece Fish and Chip set with regular fries and the Hawaiian Poke as an appetizer. 

The Hawaiian Poke was a first for me. It's essentially tuna sashimi that is drowned in soy sauce and sesame seed oil. It comes with this wonton strip-like crackers that are light and crunchy, which you eat with the tuna just like chips to salsa. At first try, it's very flavorful with the soft, creamy texture of the tuna mixed with the crunchy...chip? The soy sauce and sesame seed oil work well together, but only on the top most portion of the tuna. Most of the sauce stayed at the bottom, which made the tuna at the bottom too salty. It would be better if the tuna were equally marinated instead of having a special few that literally drowned in its own sauce. Recommended dish, but eat in moderate for its sodium content.

The entrees were both great and it was pleasant of the waiting staff to separate the taco and fish for the both of us since we wanted to share. So each of us had a basket with one Mahi Mahi Taco and a basket with Fish and Chips. 

I love the sweet potato fries! Sweet and soft goodness in a crispy outer crust! It's definitely a good alternative to the regular potato fries, but good thing it's an option. I still prefer the ol' fashioned potato fries. Still sweet potato fries...good alternative.

The Mahi Mahi Tacos were good. The Mahi Mahi was grilled, of course, instead of the usual beer battered filet. Everything on the taco was well-balanced and the fish was light. There's a picture with a couple of tacos dressed with a generous portion of guacamole. Looks just like that, but with grilled white fish filet instead. 

Fish and Chips are like any other Fish and Chips. The only problem I had with it was the thickness of the batter. A little too thin for me. I drizzled some lemon over the fish and the batter couldn't hold the fish together, so it became a messy basket of fish meat and batter. The good part about it: the freshness of the fish, which was Tilapia that night (I think). 

Overall, I thought it was a delightful experience eating at Pacific Catch. There are sushi and rolls on the menu, but I learn to have sushi elsewhere for now. The tacos and fish and chips are something to try out and there are many other options to choose from. The price is reasonable with the more expensive choice under the special catch of the day. I would come back again for another try.

excerpts: We started with the miso soup which was nice and a little fishy (in a good way), the Hawaiian Poke which was fresh enough but really not very well cut - it had unchewable bits, which is a big no-no in raw fish.
hawaiian poke.author: OfLit G.
hawaiian poke.review:
We were looking for inexpensive seafood and that's what we got.
The place was clean and the service was friendly and attentive.
We started with the miso soup which was nice and a little fishy (in a good way), the Hawaiian Poke which was fresh enough but really not very well cut - it had unchewable bits, which is a big no-no in raw fish. The Mahi Mahi was overly seasoned and the fish got lost in the dish. The grilled salmon salad was nice except that the fish was lacking in flavor, but we were pleasantly surprised by the California Crab & Avocado salad which was just right! Everybody LOVED the sweet potato fries - yum!
All in all, a decent value for your money in the seafood scene.

excerpts: I ordered the Hawaiian poke bowl while my female counterpart ordered the miso salmon.
My girlfriend's miso salmon was good however, nothing of the taste made it stand out as a Pacific Catch dish.
hawaiian poke.author: Brian V.
hawaiian poke.review:
Pacific Catch is a fusion Japanese/seafood place that I've had my eye on for a while.  It sure is gaudy and lures you with the baubles and trinkets however, fails to live up to the expectations.  It is like a beautiful yet underwhelming performer of a car.  Walking in, it is very ample in size.  The ambiance is very cozy and there is a nautical theme.  Our hostess led us to our table and accommodated us when we wanted to sit in the booth.  The back support of soft cushions beats those of hard wooden backings any day.  Our waiter was a very nice chap, a water sprite of some sort...calm and collected on the surface but a giggler I am sure underneath.  

We were given goldfish/unsalted beans to start of the night.  Never was served goldfish as a starter but I can't complain.  I love goldfish.  Alas, it was the nasty pretzel flavored ones.  I ordered the Hawaiian poke bowl while my female counterpart ordered the miso salmon.  We also ordered sweet potato fries.  This was the first time I have ever tried sweet potato fries and I became a believer.  I always thought it was for females for some reason....excuse my ignorant rationale.  It was so good that I hogged the whole basket.  The only thing I was not fond of was the wasabi sauce.  They give you this asian dipping sauce also which is the secret to King of Thai #31...wadDUUUP.  I eat my fries with 2 things...ranch or ketchup.  I grabbed the ketchup bottle, squirted a gob and was good.  While sweet potatoe fries were good, regular french fries still capture the majority of my thump thump.  My poke bowl came out and it looked very good.  They were not scrouges on the poke.  Everything was neatly proportioned...a couple slivers of avacado, wakame salad, radish, a lotta poke, etc.  When I took my first bite, I nearly grimaced.  I forgot to request no wasabe sauce.  While the taste wasn't overly strong, it was still lingering enough to make me quite sad.  My girlfriend's miso salmon was good however, nothing of the taste made it stand out as a Pacific Catch dish.  It tasted like something I could get at any Jap restaurant.  

Pacific Catch is very generous in portions and the price is not too bad.  However, the food, while nice in presentation, was only that...superficial...the way I like my girls...jk jk.  You will leave this place full, no doubt about that, but it is the type of full that leaves you hungering for more tasteful experience.

excerpts: I love usually get the Sushi Grade Ahi salad substituted with Hawaiian Poke with sweet potatoe fries, edamame, and Peruvian ceviche.
The service is usually really fast and I never have to wait that long,
esp if we have lunch around 2-3 instead of noon.
I've never had any complaints for this place!
hawaiian poke.author: Tiffany P.
hawaiian poke.review: I love usually get the Sushi Grade Ahi salad substituted with Hawaiian Poke with sweet potatoe fries, edamame, and Peruvian ceviche. The service is usually really fast and I never have to wait that long, esp if we have lunch around 2-3 instead of noon. I've never had any complaints for this place!

excerpts: Try the Hawaiian poke and the Pacific Punch :)
hawaiian poke.author: B M.
hawaiian poke.review: Awesome food!!! Great service!!! Try the Hawaiian poke and the Pacific Punch :)

excerpts: We had the delicious Hawaiian Poke (so good we ordered another one).
My friend had a mai tai, I had gin & tonics.
All the drinks were really stiff.
hawaiian poke.author: Leslie S.
hawaiian poke.review:
I will definitely be going back for the happy hour! 

We sat in the bar/lounge area and all three adorable bartenders waited on us. We had the delicious Hawaiian Poke (so good we ordered another one). My friend had a mai tai, I had gin & tonics. All the drinks were really stiff. Felt like we were getting our moneys worth. 

The prices during happy hour were great! Fresh fish for $4.50!? I was skeptical about the $4 well drinks (sounded pricey for a happy hour), but their 'well' alcohol is way decent. We also ate the sweet potato fries which were great and come with tasty dips, and the edamame, which was yawn. I guess you can't win 'em all.

excerpts: The Hawaiian poke was also decent.
I tried the Alaskan Oatmeal Stout just because it sounded interesting.
At first glance, it was a dark beer, but didn't taste dark at all, which was good for me.
Overall, it was good, but I didn't get much of a chance to taste much of the Asian fusion seafood, which makes up much of their menu.
Happy hour prices are decent, but it doesn't really showcase fish much other than the tuna.
hawaiian poke.author: Bailey Z.
hawaiian poke.review: Over the years, I have seen this location transform from an empty building to a coffee shop/bar, to this current seafood restaurant. After a quick bite to eat across the street, we walked over here for happy hour. It seems to cater to the after work crowd and they deliver on the cheap foods. After the wonderful smell of fried calamari on the roof of the Academy of Sciences, I craved the fried appetizer here. They make it decent here with an aioli dip. Don't be food by the fried lemon, it doesn't taste great. We also tried the sweet potato fries, which is served with an interest sweet and sour sauce. Never had sweet potato fries with that before, but it was pretty good. At $3 for a huge basket, it's hard to beat. The Hawaiian poke was also decent. I tried the Alaskan Oatmeal Stout just because it sounded interesting. At first glance, it was a dark beer, but didn't taste dark at all, which was good for me. Overall, it was good, but I didn't get much of a chance to taste much of the Asian fusion seafood, which makes up much of their menu. Happy hour prices are decent, but it doesn't really showcase fish much other than the tuna.

excerpts: The Hawaiian Poke appetizer and the mixed catch basket with sweet potato fries are definitely our favorites.
When it comes to drinks, the Dark and Stormy is delicious and has quite a kick!
They have happy hour after 10pm with good deals off the bar menu.
Parking in the area is sometimes difficult
but I'd definitely consider it worth it.
hawaiian poke.author: Dominique K.
hawaiian poke.review: My boyfriend and I have been coming in here at least once a week for the past couple of months.  We choose to sit in the bar where it seems to be a cozier atmosphere than in the main restaurant.  We are always given menus and order is taken right away.  The bartenders are very friendly and the service is spot on.  The Hawaiian Poke appetizer and the mixed catch basket with sweet potato fries are definitely our favorites.  When it comes to drinks, the Dark and Stormy is delicious and has quite a kick!   They have happy hour after 10pm with good deals off the bar menu.  Parking in the area is sometimes difficult but I'd definitely consider it worth it.

excerpts: If I am with company I will usually add the Hawaiian Poke; both to share of course.
Now for the main course I will almost always go for the Crispy Oysters.
I can say honestly that I have tried everything on their menu and I continue going back to the Oysters.
Now I am a big Oyster fan
and I love how they prepare them.
The fish and chips are a signature goodie and there are great things to explore on the menu.
They have something for everyone.
Now for dessert
and I'm not joking when I say this
, they have the best dessert I have ever tasted.
I will go there just for their dulce de leche spring rolls, they are out of this world.
They are the reason Pacific Catch goes from 4 to 5 stars for me.
The service is great and they are super attentive to the customers needs.
Just a great semi-casual place.
Good for kids and adults alike.
Just some more good eats on Ninth Ave.
hawaiian poke.author: Anna B.
hawaiian poke.review: The perfect meal for me when coming to Pacific Catch is as follows. A starter of Calamari, which is my favorite starter anywhere, meaning I get  picky and Pacific Catch makes them well. If I am with company I will usually add the Hawaiian Poke; both to share of course. Now for the main course I will almost always go for the Crispy Oysters. I can say honestly that I have tried everything on their menu and I continue going back to the Oysters. Now I am a big Oyster fan and I love how they prepare them. The fish and chips are a signature goodie and there are great things to explore on the menu. They have something for everyone. Now for dessert and I'm not joking when I say this, they have the best dessert I have ever tasted. I will go there just for their dulce de leche spring rolls, they are out of this world. They are the reason Pacific Catch goes from 4 to 5 stars for me. The service is great and they are super attentive to the customers needs. Just a great semi-casual place. Good for kids and adults alike. Just some more good eats on Ninth Ave.

excerpts: I have become addicted to the  Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl & Brown Rice.
hawaiian poke.author: donal c.
hawaiian poke.review:
I have been here on a number of occasions (i.e. the bigger restaurant in the Sunset -- I have never been to the original hole-in-the-wall place in the Marina) and I remain unconvinced & on-the-fence about the place.

The location is in a well-trafficked area near a main entrance to Golden Gate Park and in the busy 9th & Irving area of the Sunset. It's a big, comfortable-looking restaurant with a large-ish bar area facing the Park. The menu has a large selection of seafood dishes (as the restaurant name would suggest) done in a variety of fusion-ish ways. Some of these are predictable, and in my experience, not that exciting. I have had the Fish & Chips and the Fish Tacos in the past, and I wasnt very impressed by either. (Big portions... though on the flip-side, the prices are on the high side.) However, I was very impressed by some of the more unusual and interesting dishes. In particular, the different Rice Bowl options are very good. I have become addicted to the  Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl & Brown Rice. VERY tasty, and it feels healthy, with its variety of veggies and carbs (though it probably isnt!)

The place itself feels a bit impersonal - especially, the large restaurant area. It has the feel (just a bit...) of a suburban Red Lobster or TGI Friday's. (Not anything like as cheezy -- but there's a sense of it - not a good thing in an area where there are so many other places that do have personality & character.) The bar feels a bit better - tho the quality of the wait-staff & bartenders is hit-and-miss. 

So - definitely ambivalent about the place, and typically, the price-tab for a meal is a bit on the high side  - but Pacific Catch has its upsides. I remain hopeful, but unconvinced about it.

excerpts: Hawaiian Poke Wasabi Bowl and the Fish Tacos are AMAZING!
The service is also great.
The only downfall is that we brought a cake and their charged us $2 per person for a cutting fee, which  we weren't told of prior to and we were shocked when we saw the bill.
The cuttings fees ended up costing more than the cake.
Luckily, I love their service and food.
hawaiian poke.author: Joe d.
hawaiian poke.review: Hawaiian Poke Wasabi Bowl and the Fish Tacos are AMAZING! The service is also great. The only downfall is that we brought a cake and their charged us $2 per person for a cutting fee, which  we weren't told of prior to and we were shocked when we saw the bill. The cuttings fees ended up costing more than the cake. Luckily, I love their service and food.

excerpts: Desiring for a guilt-free meal at times, my husband and I used to trek to the Chestnut location to treat ourselves to their ahi-tuna or hawaiian poke salads.
Now, ask anyone close to me, and they will affirm that my palette is adamantly of the anti-salad mode, but Pacific Catch's hawaiian poke salad has converted me.

The salads are HUGE, comprised of a generous helping of rare hawaiian poke atop a bed of mixed greens garnished generously with slices of avocado, a handful of baby tomatoes, a healthy sprig of daikon sprouts, shredded carrots in a joyous, unassuming soy-wasabi vinaigrette.
hawaiian poke.author: Jana H.
hawaiian poke.review:
Alas, the much-anticipated Pacific Catch has finally reached the Inner Sunset!  Though The Canvas served up delicious lemon bars and ambiance conducive for a late afternoon catch-up with a close friend, Pacific Catch seems to round off the 9th Ave area perfectly by joining the ranks of cheap eats like Park Chow, Hotei and Pluto's.

Desiring for a guilt-free meal at times, my husband and I used to trek to the Chestnut location to treat ourselves to their ahi-tuna or hawaiian poke salads.  Now, ask anyone close to me, and they will affirm that my palette is adamantly of the anti-salad mode, but Pacific Catch's hawaiian poke salad has converted me.  The salads are HUGE, comprised of a generous helping of rare hawaiian poke atop a bed of mixed greens garnished generously with slices of avocado, a handful of baby tomatoes, a healthy sprig of daikon sprouts, shredded carrots in a joyous, unassuming soy-wasabi vinaigrette.

If you're doubtful that the salad won't quench your appetite, order a side order of their sweet potato fries to push you just over the edge.  These crispy, subtly sweet fries score big on their own, but what knocks them out of the ballpark for me is the sweet chili dipping sauce.  For those who enjoy variety (as my hubby and I do!), they also have a wasabi-aioli dipping sauce too.

Just when we thought Pacific Catch couldn't impress us anymore, today we tried their fried dulce de leche 'spring rolls' for a sweet finish to our already yummy meal.  W-O-W!!  That's all I have to say.  It was a sweet perfection of texture and flavor that honestly, you won't comprehend unless you experience it yourself.  The warmth of the deep fried outside and the contrast with the vanilla ice cream that it's served with is an absolute wonder in the mouth.  And that's not even taking note of the dulce de leche and mascarpone in the middle of the deep fried bliss.  

Don't miss out on this place!  It offers a ton of variety so you're never bored and there's always something new to tempt your tastebuds.

excerpts: I usually order the Hawaiian Poke and Spicey Tuna roll.
hawaiian poke.author: Daria M.
hawaiian poke.review:
I usually come to Pacific Catch for the happy hour. They have two, one at 4-6pm, and one from 10pm til late. The happy hour menu is pretty nice. I usually order the Hawaiian Poke and Spicey Tuna roll. The calamari and Sweet Potato fries aren't bad either.

I wouldn't recommend coming for a regular meal as they get more pricey for the amount you get.

excerpts: Some items I have tried here: the Hawaiian Poke, Wasabi Rice Bowls (which is a freaking large portion), side of Pineapple rice, the Mixed Catch Basket, the calamari, the sweet potato fries, etc etc.
Everything is great.
I would highly recommend any of these items!
hawaiian poke.author: Jennifer H.
hawaiian poke.review: This place is near where I work so I've been here several times. Some items I have tried here: the Hawaiian Poke, Wasabi Rice Bowls (which is a freaking large portion), side of Pineapple rice, the Mixed Catch Basket, the calamari, the sweet potato fries, etc etc. Everything is great. I would highly recommend any of these items!

excerpts: the hawaiian poke salad was sooo good!!!
hawaiian poke.author: Maria S.
hawaiian poke.review: good good food and service! the hawaiian poke salad was sooo good!!!

excerpts: the breakdown of the 4 stars: 3 for the korean sticky ribs and 5 for the hawaiian poke half-half bowl for an average of 4. let's start with the bad...the "ribs" were tough, not melting off the bone like i had envisioned.
they looked and tasted more like pork chops than ribs.
the best part of the appetizer was the sweet sticky sauce.
not too salty with lots of flavor.
now to the gooooood...
and it's pretty damn good.
the hawaiian poke over half brown rice and half greens has become my go-to healthy meal now.
like a japanese style bibimbap, it's loaded with seaweed salad, pickled ginger, avocado slices, and big chunks of yummy poke.
are you salivating yet??
hawaiian poke.author: Melissa Y.
hawaiian poke.review: the breakdown of the 4 stars: 3 for the korean sticky ribs and 5 for the hawaiian poke half-half bowl for an average of 4. let's start with the bad...the "ribs" were tough, not melting off the bone like i had envisioned. they looked and tasted more like pork chops than ribs. the best part of the appetizer was the sweet sticky sauce. not too salty with lots of flavor. now to the gooooood...and it's pretty damn good. the hawaiian poke over half brown rice and half greens has become my go-to healthy meal now. like a japanese style bibimbap, it's loaded with seaweed salad, pickled ginger, avocado slices, and big chunks of yummy poke. are you salivating yet??

excerpts: the hawaiian poke sashimi was a close second to the fries.
hawaiian poke.author: Anh V.
hawaiian poke.review:
hmmm, i do love their pomegranate martinis...

the mood is open and casual.  it's unassuming and friendly to families and big groups with choices of seating at the bar, tables and chairs or comfy booths.  

well, since i was not on a liquid diet yet, i had to sample their menu.

thanks to yelpers, i did read up a bit on what to order.

the grilled artichoke was good but yes, do order the sweet potato fries.  i couldn't choose between the two dipping sauces so i compromised on dipping into both.  
the hawaiian poke sashimi was a close second to the fries.

for entrees, i do recommend the korean bbq skirt steak and  the unagi wasabi bowl - we added grilled fresh salmon to it.
i had the giant scallops which had a jerk chicken like seasoning.  so if you aren't into kicky spices, then this is not the dish for you.  the menu is pretty extensive so there is something for everyone.

we ended the evening with the fried dulce de leche spring rolls which were delish.  next time, i'll have to come back and order the passion mango cheesecake.

parking is tough in the neighborhood but there is a lot a block away.  frankly, i rather pony up for the parking and be sipping on their yummy martinis than circling the block.

excerpts: The sweet potato fries, spicy tuna roll and Hawaiian poke with won ton chips were all satisfying as a matter of fact
it was too much food.
I've never been to a restaurant where I left 1/2 of the sushi..
I did that here.
You get alot of food and the happy hour prices are outstanding.
Great for families and groups.
hawaiian poke.author: Sherie R.
hawaiian poke.review: It's good. It's safe. It's kinda like a chain but a little better. The space is funky and has a really hip vibe. I like the pomegranate mojito I had. The sweet potato fries, spicy tuna roll and Hawaiian poke with won ton chips were all satisfying as a matter of fact it was too much food. I've never been to a restaurant where I left 1/2 of the sushi..I did that here. You get alot of food and the happy hour prices are outstanding. Great for families and groups.

excerpts: My personal favorite for years and years was the Hawaiian poke yet
here I find it to be really salty every time I order even though I keep order it again and again thinking the last time was hopefully a fluke.
It wasn't.

My other let down was possibly the pineapple fried rice, which I usually tend to think, there is no way to mess up, which they diddn't, but they also didn't do anything with to make me even want to finish eating it!
Let down!
If it sounds like I am complaining I don't mean to because I usually do like what I order here, just the last two times
the fried rice and poke have been letting me down.
Usually though my experience here though does leave me satisfied, and as mentioned earlier, the atmosphere and service always stay consistent.
hawaiian poke.author: Denise B.
hawaiian poke.review:
Same concept as the other location on Chestnut Street except in real restaurant format, ie. you sit down and order with a waitress. 

My favorite things about this location I must say are the service which I find fast and friendly, and the atmosphere which is warm and inviting. 
The food, I honestly felt was better at the original location, yet I keep coming back to this location since it's alot closer to me. 

Anyway, onto the food.......the sweet potato fries are yummy and once you start you can't stop eating them. They are a bit addicting, I think they are perfect as is, but my fiance likes to add salt to them but then again he adds salt to everything and takes blood pressure meds............the sushi is good and consistent, and the menu is extensive enough where if you have any seafood fan they most likely will find something they will like here. Most of the food is healthy, but if you want something fried there are plenty of options for that also. My personal favorite for years and years was the Hawaiian poke yet here I find it to be really salty every time I order even though I keep order it again and again thinking the last time was hopefully a fluke. It wasn't. My other let down was possibly the pineapple fried rice, which I usually tend to think, there is no way to mess up, which they diddn't, but they also didn't do anything with to make me even want to finish eating it! Let down! If it sounds like I am complaining I don't mean to because I usually do like what I order here, just the last two times the fried rice and poke have been letting me down. Usually though my experience here though does leave me satisfied, and as mentioned earlier, the atmosphere and service always stay consistent.

excerpts: we ordered a lot of appetizers.. hawaiian poke, sweet potato fries, and calamari... and we were stuffed before entrees came.
I WISH
I had room because from the few bites that I did have... it was so tasty!
I had the Wasabi Bowl with Hawaiian Poke.
The wasabi bowls come with all the things I love
and they all are so great together.
The hubby got the 3 taco platter with 3 different tacos, and they looked delicious as well.
Our friends had also got meals that looked DELICIOUS...
hawaiian poke.author: Kymberli C.
hawaiian poke.review: We were close to the Chestnut location but it was totally packed, and TINY... so we decided to drive over to this location... We were starving and our eyes were hungrier than are stomachs... we ordered a lot of appetizers.. hawaiian poke, sweet potato fries, and calamari... and we were stuffed before entrees came.  I WISH I had room because from the few bites that I did have... it was so tasty!  I had the Wasabi Bowl with Hawaiian Poke.  The wasabi bowls come with all the things I love and they all are so great together.  The hubby got the 3 taco platter with 3 different tacos, and they looked delicious as well.  Our friends had also got meals that looked DELICIOUS... a miso salmon and the salmon wasabi bowl... mmm....  This location is a lot bigger with its own parking lot and the service is very friendly and attentive as well.

excerpts: I took an elderly relative who enjoys Hawaiian Poke and that was his choice and  what he ordered.
hawaiian poke.author: Fleur R.
hawaiian poke.review: This place was suggested to me to be a good lunch choice for a birthday celebration.  I took an elderly relative who enjoys Hawaiian Poke and that was his choice and  what he ordered.  Myself, I choose the Salmon Sashimi and was not only disappointed by my choice but suffered a violent food-poisoning an hour later from it.  Needless to say, it put me off ever going back.  Lunch was fairly pricey and to get sick from it added insult to injury.  It also put me off raw fish for a good long time to come.

excerpts: The Hawaiian Poke with those chrispy things are well received by the table.
the sushi was
fresh and fried calamari even came with fried sliced lemons.
Never tried friend sliced lemons before this night and
it was better
hawaiian poke.author: Mona B.
hawaiian poke.review:
I don't turn down food so when I was invited to attend the opening Friday night, I was more than happy to attend with an empty stomach.

I agree with Dave, the ambiance is well done in this location.  The male servers, though most very young, are great eye-candy.  Everyone working was attentive.  My glass was empty and no less than 5 people asked if they could bring me another drink.

The apps are out of this world. The Hawaiian Poke with those chrispy things are well received by the table.  the sushi was fresh and fried calamari even came with fried sliced lemons.  Never tried friend sliced lemons before this night and it was better I expected, though I couldn't eat a whole one.

The main entree wasn't as stellar as the apps.  I had the grilled shrimp over rice with mushrooms and other veggies. The portion of the rice was big but the shrimp felt like they weren't marinated but just grilled plain.  My DH got a seafood basket. I did enjoy the fried oysters but not so much the coconut shrimp.

Mochi-Mochi-Mochi. The server called it Mo-ki so I corrected him.  It came with warm chocolate dipping sauce. Perfection.  They served three flavors, chocolate, mocha, and vanilla. It was so soft, YUMMY!

If I wasn't so full, I would have ordered more entress to try out but I think this place will do well and so I'll be back.

excerpts: We ordered the wasabi hawaiian poke bowl and the two taco platter (grilled steak & mahi mahi) with sweet potato fries.
Also, I ordered one of the house made drinks that consisted of mint leaves & lime that the waitress recommended.
The poke bowl was a big disappointment.
It felt like there was not a consistency with everything going together and there was very little poke.
The mahi mahi taco was not good, but the grilled steak taco was pretty tasty.
The best thing about this place?
Their sweet potato fries.
The drink I ordered was way too pricey for what it really was too.
Disappointment there also.
I don't think I'd come back anytime soon.
hawaiian poke.author: Syd T.
hawaiian poke.review: Came to try this place out with my boyfriend since he loves poke bowls. We got free calamari for checking in and the calamari was mediocre and not even hot. The waitress even forgot to take it off our tab so I had to remind her when she gave us the bill. We ordered the wasabi hawaiian poke bowl and the two taco platter (grilled steak & mahi mahi) with sweet potato fries. Also, I ordered one of the house made drinks that consisted of mint leaves & lime that the waitress recommended. The poke bowl was a big disappointment. It felt like there was not a consistency with everything going together and there was very little poke. The mahi mahi taco was not good, but the grilled steak taco was pretty tasty. The best thing about this place? Their sweet potato fries. The drink I ordered was way too pricey for what it really was too. Disappointment there also. I don't think I'd come back anytime soon.

excerpts: I had the HAWAIIAN POKE WASABI BOWL.
This was amazing!
hawaiian poke.author: Ivy L.
hawaiian poke.review: Came here with a friend for the first time and was blown away at how fresh their fish was. I had the HAWAIIAN POKE WASABI BOWL. This was amazing! the ahi tuna was so fresh that the soft and tender fish melted in my mouth. it was a mouthful of flavor...thesoy sauce that they put with the tuna had wasabi mixed into it so it added the perfect kick to the dish. I substituted the sushi rice with brown rice...tasted just as good and was healthier :) The bowl included shredded veggie salad (daikon, cucumber, carrot), sliced avocado, sesame seeds, and shredded seaweed on top. This was an excellent and filling meal and I would definitely come back!

excerpts: so we started with the hawaiian poke (raw ahi marinated in soy sauce etc.)
, huge chunks of ahi, a little heavy on the sauce, but still delish.
the calamari was also not too chewy, so props for that.
hawaiian poke.author: Anne Marie B.
hawaiian poke.review:
i'm torn.  on the one hand it was nothing spectacular, but on the other hand there wasn't really anything bad about this place.  start it off by saying that the waiter was very friendly and informed us that the kitchen was really good about substitutions/preparing items that weren't on the menu, so that was a plus...but the options on the menu all seemed so good that it wasn't really necessary to ask for something different.  

i absolutely adore raw fish.  all seafood really.  but raw fish is great.  so we started with the hawaiian poke (raw ahi marinated in soy sauce etc.), huge chunks of ahi, a little heavy on the sauce, but still delish.  the calamari was also not too chewy, so props for that.  and the seaweed salad was actually pretty good.  

but then i ordered the tacos, which i've heard great things about.  i ordered the cabo shrimp and a special ahi taco that's not on the menu but the waiter recommended.  well, i wish he hadn't.  the ahi was overcooked for my taste (obvi raw would've been great, but i was expecting a slight seared edge...this was almost completely cooked through), and there was no moisture in this thing.  i need me some sauce on my tacos!  the shrimp was better, thanks to the large portion and ample sauce.  i even resorted to pouring leftover sauce from my seaweed salad on the ahi taco.  

so suffice it to say, i've had better fish tacos...but the quality and freshness of the fish actually seemed pretty great, so i'll likely go back and order a salmon sandwich, or an ahi bowl or something else.  heck maybe even a steak taco, though that wouldn't really be keeping up with the theme of the restaurant very well.

excerpts: we tried both the hawaiian poke (a must eat) and the baja shrimp ceviche, which came out in a cool martini glass with tortilla chips... so refreshing and good!
hawaiian poke.author: Andrey C.
hawaiian poke.review:
with the appetizer coupons we scored at the yelp party in hand, we headed over to the sunset pacific catch for some consistently delicious grub and, as usual, we weren't disappointed. we tried both the hawaiian poke (a must eat) and the baja shrimp ceviche, which came out in a cool martini glass with tortilla chips... so refreshing and good! i'm usually wary about getting salmon, but the salmon wasabi bowl here was perfect! and you can never go wrong with the rock cod fish and chips...

chef chandon and chef (eek! forgot your name!) even came out to greet us and shoot the breeze about the yelp party the night before... can't believe they actually DONATED all that food that, well, i didn't get to eat (cuz i'm not elite... pshh).

i had actually come to this location earlier this year, and enjoyed one of their lunch-time sandwiches... which were super good as well. only wish i lived closer... i'd probably eat here at least 1x a week if that were the case!

excerpts: I had the ahi tuna salad with Hawaiian Poke...
what huge portions they serve you...
totally worth adding $1.
hawaiian poke.author: Jenny W.
hawaiian poke.review: Went there last Friday for dinner with a couple of friends. The service was good, and the wait wasn't too bad. I had the ahi tuna salad with Hawaiian Poke...what huge portions they serve you...totally worth adding $1.

excerpts: I had the big green salad with Hawaiian poke.
The other had tacos and the kids had sushi.
Plates were cleaned.
hawaiian poke.author: Erin M.
hawaiian poke.review: Five kids, Five adults on a Saturday afternoon.  The food was great and the service was great and everyone really enjoyed themselves.  I had the big green salad with Hawaiian poke.  The other had tacos and the kids had sushi. Plates were cleaned.

excerpts: The fish in the Hawaiian Poke bowl I ordered was fresh and well marinated and it seems healthy with all of the vegies they give you.
This place is great for kids too.
Good service as well.
hawaiian poke.author: Ethan C.
hawaiian poke.review:
I like this place even though its a chain.. I like the location of this one better than the marina one.  The fish in the Hawaiian Poke bowl I ordered was fresh and well marinated and it seems healthy with all of the vegies they give you.  This place is great for kids too.  Good service as well.  I would come back again.

 A bit pricey though!

excerpts: i always get cravings for the hawaiian poke appetizer which is awesome.
came here for dinner on a saturday night with my family without a reservation and we were still able to get a table pretty quickly.
i would advise making reservations though.
i had the surf and turf entree which was super yummy, a bit too much rice
but otherwise no complaints.
service was great and the restaurant itself has a very calm and pleasant atmosphere.
i like!
hawaiian poke.author: Linda N.
hawaiian poke.review: i can't believe i haven't reviewed this place yet! i've been here a few times and have not been dissappointed yet. i always get cravings for the hawaiian poke appetizer which is awesome. came here for dinner on a saturday night with my family without a reservation and we were still able to get a table pretty quickly. i would advise making reservations though. i had the surf and turf entree which was super yummy, a bit too much rice but otherwise no complaints. service was great and the restaurant itself has a very calm and pleasant atmosphere. i like!

excerpts: Anyhow, we ordered the Hawaiian Poke as appetizer.
You actually get a decent size dish for $8.50 -- big chunks of raw tuna, probably a little TOO big.
hawaiian poke.author: Amy V.
hawaiian poke.review: I ate here the first time last Friday.  I usually go to Park Chow but saw this relatively new restaurant so decided to check it out with my friend.  I was pleasantly surprised.  First, it's kind of a Hawaiian fusion restaurant.  There are not a lot of these restaurants in the city so it's kind of unique for me. The only other place I can remember is Roy's downtown.  Anyhow, we ordered the Hawaiian Poke as appetizer.  You actually get a decent size dish for $8.50 -- big chunks of raw tuna, probably a little TOO big.  As entrees, we ordered fish from their chalkboard specials.  I think what makes it cool was that they give you some side dishes as well which sort of fill you up.  At other places like Aqua, you get just a piece of fish for like $30.  The fish was pretty good.  My friend ordered the scallops which was big and juicy as well.  We'll certainly come back again.

excerpts: i had a hawaiian poke wasabi bowl, which tasted just okay.
hawaiian poke.author: Porkers T.
hawaiian poke.review: this place is overpriced for the quality and quantity of food you get. you could get better quality and quantity at whole foods market or bristol farms. really. because thats what it reminds me of. i had a hawaiian poke wasabi bowl, which tasted just okay. also crispy catch of the day with their sweet potato fries which are good, but not thaaat good. so if you dont toss your money around like trash, stay away from this seemingly trendy fusion of a restaurant more like upscale fastfood joint.

excerpts: Their seared Ahi Sammich is bangin'.
The gf got some fish and chips which she has relayed to me that they were indeed delicious.
seared ahi.author: Gary B.
seared ahi.review: Their seared Ahi Sammich is bangin'. The gf got some fish and chips which she has relayed to me that they were indeed delicious.

excerpts: Ahi Tuna Salad w/ seared ahi, greens & romaine, avocado, cucumber, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds, soy-wasabi vinaigrette:
When I want something lighter, I'll go for the salad.
The ingredients are pretty much the same, but with lettuce instead of rice.
But with a salad, I go for the seared tuna instead of poke, because it creates the illusion of a meatier salad.

$12.50 Hawaiian Poke with wonton chips - original ahi tuna, sesame-soy marinade, spicy seasonings:
A small bowl of juicy ahi cubes covered in sesame seeds and micro greens are accompanied with some fried wontons.
seared ahi.author: Joy W.
seared ahi.review:
I've been here several times over the past few years and I've come to the conclusion that it's never a bad time to have some tasty ahi, as long as it tastes fresh. The menu features mainly California seafood dishes with some Asian fusion touches here and there. This corner venue is large and spacious with very high ceilings, but they keep the place pretty cold. There is also some cozy outdoor seating under some heaters, but keep in mind, it is right next to the bus stop. 

They start you off with some complimentary shelled edamame and pretzel goldfish, which is a cute nod to the seafood menu, but I'd still prefer bread. I also think edamame is more enjoyable with the shell on.

$16.50 Japanese Wasabi rice bowl w/ Hawaiian poke - seaweed salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori, soy-wasabi sauce:
The bowl has a decent portion of bite-size chunks of sweet, juicy tuna. The soy-wasabi sauce is mild and not too strong on the wasabi. It is also seasoned with green onions, chives, and sesame seeds. Everything tastes fresh including the pale slivers of creamy avocado and crunchy, crisp seaweed salad. Be sure to get a little bit of everything in each bite, otherwise you're left with a lots of rice at the bottom of the bowl. 

$15.50 Ahi Tuna Salad w/ seared ahi, greens & romaine, avocado, cucumber, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds, soy-wasabi vinaigrette:
When I want something lighter, I'll go for the salad. The ingredients are pretty much the same, but with lettuce instead of rice. But with a salad, I go for the seared tuna instead of poke, because it creates the illusion of a meatier salad. Again, try to eat a little of everything together, otherwise you're left with a ton of greens, or as my friend calls it, 'rabbit food.'

A lot of people like the sweet potato fries. They're alright, but sweet potato fries are becoming a ubiquitous offering across the board.

Happy hour deals are pretty good if you are in the area in the afternoons. Poke is about $8.

$9 Baja Shrimp Ceviche - lime, serrano chili, avocado, cilantro, tortilla chips:
These bite-size shrimp are springy, meaty and seasoned well. The verde sauce is on the runny side and is quite spicy. I could eat this on its own without tortilla chips too, but the thin, crunchy chips make a nice vehicle.

$12.50 Hawaiian Poke with wonton chips - original ahi tuna, sesame-soy marinade, spicy seasonings:
A small bowl of juicy ahi cubes covered in sesame seeds and micro greens are accompanied with some fried wontons.

$7 Mochi Fondue - vanilla, chocolate, coffee mochi balls & chocolate dipping sauce:
I've tried this out of curiosity, but if you've ever had store-bought mochi ice cream balls, I'd say skip it. The taste is pretty similar with the addition of a little bowl of chocolate sauce on the side for dipping.

The tasty rice bowls are still my go-to items to order here. If I were in the area, I'd come back to try some of the other menu items too.

excerpts: My husband got the seared ahi salad.
Again, ahi was subpar and too gristly to be enjoyable.
The veggies in the salad, however, were extremely fresh and delicious.
But come on, this isn't Pacific Veggies or a vegetarian restaurant.
seared ahi.author: Betty R.
seared ahi.review:
Quality of the food at this place has really gone down. Very disappointing meal.

My husband and I spent the afternoon at the DeYoung Museum so thought we'd grab dinner to avoid traffic heading home to Oakland. I remembered this place was close by and the food was always good so I suggested we eat here. Boy was I wrong! 

We started with the scallop poke which was the seasonal menu appetizer. This sad dish looked like it had been sitting out all day--scallops looked dried out and definitely not fresh. There were little pieces of mango in the dish but there just wasn't much natural sweetness to the scallops so it isn't something I'd order again. I ordered the Chirashi which was literally $23 of old poke served on a platter of very little sushi rice. The ahi was gristly as all hell--I ended up spitting out 1/4 of it because I simply could not chew it down enough to swallow. Both the ahi and salmon looked days old and was very low quality raw fish. For being in San Francisco, I wouldn't even give this a rating of mediocre because it was far below that. My husband got the seared ahi salad. Again, ahi was subpar and too gristly to be enjoyable. The veggies in the salad, however, were extremely fresh and delicious. But come on, this isn't Pacific Veggies or a vegetarian restaurant. If I'm paying over $20 per entree for seafood I expect some quality grub! 

Overall vibe and ambiance of the restaurant was good. They've always been family friendly. We had our 2 month old baby so they gave us a big booth so I could have him sit next to me in his car seat. They offered us a high chair and brought the kids menu which had a decent selection of yummy items for the kiddos. Too bad my little one is still too small for solid food. Outside patio had lots of heaters and a fireplace so was toasty and warm. Service as expected was impeccable as always.
