We had someone clearing our plates as soon as we finished and the server was pleasant and helpful. However, the food is just really lacking and not what I remember it being. 

Do yourself a favor and take your pick of any of the other awesome restaurants off of Irving rather than waste $70+ on a meal for two at Pacific Catch.

excerpts: I regularly (like at least once a week for lunch) order the veggie salad and rotate between adding grilled Mary's chicken, grilled salmon, or seared Ahi tuna on top.
The miso dressing is so delicious and the way they "zoodle" the cucumbers is unique.
It's a good portion and is very filling on its own.
The chicken is always grilled and seasoned perfectly.
That's probably my favorite protein add-on.
The Ahi tuna and salmon (in that order) are good too for some variety.
The Ahi tuna and salmon (in that order) are good too for some variety.
seared ahi.author: Traci R.
seared ahi.review: This restaurant has a solid salad game. I regularly (like at least once a week for lunch) order the veggie salad and rotate between adding grilled Mary's chicken, grilled salmon, or seared Ahi tuna on top. The miso dressing is so delicious and the way they "zoodle" the cucumbers is unique. It's a good portion and is very filling on its own. The chicken is always grilled and seasoned perfectly. That's probably my favorite protein add-on. The Ahi tuna and salmon (in that order) are good too for some variety.

excerpts: For my entree, I had a Japanese wasabi rice bowl with seared Ahi tuna: The wasabi taste was light but definitely noticeable.
It blended very well with the included salad.
seared ahi.author: Nathan Y.
seared ahi.review:
I came here for a company dinner, which mainly consisted of delicious appetizers.

For appetizers, we had:
A starter salad
The california roll: It was pretty generous for a basic roll and was very filling.
Baja shrimp ceviche: A very delicious shrimp dish. Recommended.
Ahi tuna poke: Those wonton chips were amazing, but the Ahi tuna poke was even better. The tuna was very fresh and tender. Highly-recommended.

For my entree, I had a Japanese wasabi rice bowl with seared Ahi tuna: The wasabi taste was light but definitely noticeable. It blended very well with the included salad. Similar to the Ahi tuna poke appetizer, the tuna was delicious. It had great texture and a very juicy taste.

The restaurant had good service and gave very generous portions for appetizers and entrees. (I was beyond stuffed)

I was quite impressed and look forward to returning to one of their many locations in the Bay Area.

excerpts: I got the the seaweed salad with a seared ahi taco and a chicken taco.
Good stuff.
Delivery probably made the taco taste slightly worse than it otherwise would have, but at the end of the day, it was still pretty good.
The seaweed salad was pretty flavorful--they also mixed cucumbers into it which was pretty unique and
The seared ahi tuna taco was really good.
I wish I had gotten two of these.
The chicken one was definitely on the bland side and not as desirable.
But the seared ahi tuna had a ton of great flavor--I also loved that they put crispy onion ring pieces to make the texture a bit more interesting.
seared ahi.author: Jasmine X.
seared ahi.review:
This review is for delivery only.

Mmm I like this place. I got the the seaweed salad with a seared ahi taco and a chicken taco. Good stuff. Delivery probably made the taco taste slightly worse than it otherwise would have, but at the end of the day, it was still pretty good. The seaweed salad was pretty flavorful--they also mixed cucumbers into it which was pretty unique and something I haven't seen done with seaweed salad before.

The seared ahi tuna taco was really good. I wish I had gotten two of these. The chicken one was definitely on the bland side and not as desirable. But the seared ahi tuna had a ton of great flavor--I also loved that they put crispy onion ring pieces to make the texture a bit more interesting. 

tldr; all in all, good asian fusion. go for a taco!

excerpts: I ordered the Ahi Tuna Salad ($14.50) which has seared ahi tuna, avocado, cucumber, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds, and soy-wasabi vinaigrette.
YUM!!
At most restaurants, they don't put enough dressing.
At Pacific Catch, my salad was overly drenched in dressing...
but that's okay.
The salad itself was HUGE.
So filling.
seared ahi.author: Stefanie C.
seared ahi.review:
They have incredible service here. The bartenders and servers are super friendly, and the service is fast. They give you a little bowl of edamame and pretzel goldfish to snack on while you wait for your food, which is cute.

I ordered the Ahi Tuna Salad ($14.50) which has seared ahi tuna, avocado, cucumber, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds, and soy-wasabi vinaigrette. YUM!! At most restaurants, they don't put enough dressing. At Pacific Catch, my salad was overly drenched in dressing... but that's okay. The salad itself was HUGE. So filling. So worth it. 

Great place to visit whether you live right around the corner or you're on your way to Golden Gate Park.

excerpts: Seared Ahi Tuna is my favorite.
Their service is always great.
Nice people.
seared ahi.author: Cindy C.
seared ahi.review: Love their Japanese Wasabi bowls. Seared Ahi Tuna is my favorite. Their service is always great. Nice people.

excerpts:
I had seared ahi salad and a side of sweet potato fries. 
Everything was delicious, and ginger-lemongrass iced tea was very refreshing.
Service was fast and friendly.
A lady at the next table was asking about the seasoning on the fries, and the chef came out to talk to us and was very friendly. 
It's a great place, if you are in that area check it out!
seared ahi.author: Marina I.
seared ahi.review:
It's a small restaurant that serves amazing seafood. I had seared ahi salad and a side of sweet potato fries. Everything was delicious, and ginger-lemongrass iced tea was very refreshing.
Service was fast and friendly.
A lady at the next table was asking about the seasoning on the fries, and the chef came out to talk to us and was very friendly. 
It's a great place, if you are in that area check it out!

excerpts: We then had the Japanese rice bowl with poke and seared ahi as well as the miso salmon (also from the specials menu).
The rice bowl had great flavors- daikon, cucumber, sesame seeds and wasabi.
The poke was definitely the better protein.
(I've previously had the thai-flavored rice bowl and have to say the Japanese one has a much better flavor profile).
The miso salmon was just average, not that interesting, cooked fine, but overall not much to write about.
seared ahi.author: Amy D.
seared ahi.review:
Pacific catch has pricey mediocre food of large proportions. The service was friendly although our entrees came out before our appetizers which was not ideal.

We started with the crab dumplings from the specials menu.  They were mushy and came with a bad-Chinese-restaurant-style dipping sauce.  We then had the Japanese rice bowl with poke and seared ahi as well as the miso salmon (also from the specials menu). The rice bowl had great flavors- daikon, cucumber, sesame seeds and wasabi. The poke was definitely the better protein. (I've previously had the thai-flavored rice bowl and have to say the Japanese one has a much better flavor profile). The miso salmon was just average, not that interesting, cooked fine, but overall not much to write about.

The agave lemonade and the mint and lime "nojito" were also just forgettable drinks. They tasted like average watery lemonade and flavored soda water, respectively.

Overall, the meal was fairly bleh to average (which we count as two stars) but pricey for just average mains ($18-$20). I doubt we will be coming back for dinner. However, their happy hour is pretty good and the poke is on it as well.

excerpts: Our friends ordered the seared ahi bowl to share since they weren't very hungry.
seared ahi.author: Jeff C.
seared ahi.review:
I couldn't decided between 3 and 4 stars, so I'll just go in between... 3.5 but round down to 3.  Now for me, a 3 star place is somewhere where I wasn't disappointed with, it just wouldn't be my VERY first choice in the area.  However, I did enjoy my visit to Pacific Catch for the most part.

I've heard so much about the sweet potato fries that I just had to try them.  And they didn't disappoint!  Great flavor and good texture (crispy outside, soft inside) with two dipping sauces.  Mmmm.  Definitely one of the better sweet potato fries I've eaten.  We also had the poke appetizer, that was a winner too!

For the main course, I ate the "Rising Sun" roll and my gf ate the "Let's Get Saucy Roll".  Not bad at all.  Our friends ordered the seared ahi bowl to share since they weren't very hungry.  It was a nice touch that they served it in two separate bowls for them.

The atmosphere and environment were really nice...  very clean and a pleasant place to eat.  But the issues that irked me was that it is a little bit pricey and the happy hour specials are only at the bar!  They wouldn't give us the specials at our table even though the place was around half full only.  Booooooo....

excerpts: The boyfriend ordered the seared ahi salad and I had the taco platter (shrimp, mahi and steak for him).
Everything was delicious as always.
Super fresh fish.
The plating of their menu items is always aesthetically pleasing as well.
It's no wonder this is one of our favorite neighborhood restaurants.
seared ahi.author: Sarah L.
seared ahi.review: Disappointed that the dining room was pretty empty but it still took 5 minutes for somebody to notice we were standing by the door waiting to be seated. The food more than made up for it though. The boyfriend ordered the seared ahi salad and I had the taco platter (shrimp, mahi and steak for him). Everything was delicious as always. Super fresh fish. The plating of their menu items is always aesthetically pleasing as well. It's no wonder this is one of our favorite neighborhood restaurants.

excerpts: Next time, maybe sure to order the Japanese Wasabi bowl, the Seared Ahi (MMM) or the Hawaiian Poke!
seared ahi.author: Joyce M.
seared ahi.review:
This place was A-OK. I went with a friend during my visit in San Francisco. He recommended the Pan-Asian Rice Bowls so I gave it a try! I have NO idea why I got the Korean BBQ bowl........wtf? LOL worst place to get a KBBQ bowl....why wasn't I thinking clearly with the poke.. or something seafood.. Anyway I had that and it was very mediocre plus the pricing was XXXXXXPENSIVE! My friend got the Hawaiian Terriyaki and that was alright too...

Next time, maybe sure to order the Japanese Wasabi bowl, the Seared Ahi (MMM) or the Hawaiian Poke!

excerpts: Not finding it we all settled on seared Ahi or the Poke, which was as raw as it gets.
And it turns out
, it's kind of a one trick pony.
I found my Ahi 3-Way to be pretty disappointing.
It was a wad of rice, a wad of poke, a wad of seaweed salad, a wad of seared ahi in one style and another wad in another style.
seared ahi.author: Josh K.
seared ahi.review:
I was drawn here by the Hawaiian Poke at the Yelp Holiday Party and decided to come with a couple of friends. We got, as expected, the Hawaiian poke as an appetizer and somehow we all ended up ordering more tuna for our main course: the Ahi 3-Way for me, an Ahi Wasabi Bowl, an Ahi Salad... etc. (Which really took the waiter aback. I don't blame him.)

Why did we do this? We were basically looking for more raw fish, more innovations in the same ballpark as the Poke. Not finding it we all settled on seared Ahi or the Poke, which was as raw as it gets. And it turns out, it's kind of a one trick pony. I found my Ahi 3-Way to be pretty disappointing. It was a wad of rice, a wad of poke, a wad of seaweed salad, a wad of seared ahi in one style and another wad in another style. I found it pretty uninspired and pretty uncohesive.

It was also pretty expensive: $17.95 for what did not amount to $17.95 worth of fish (and as you know, rice is basically free for restaurants.)

So, maybe next time I should just leave it at Hawaiian Poke for the appetizer and try their catch of the day or seasonal special. I will see about returning and updating my review.

excerpts: Our table of 3 shared a meal-sized salad with hawaiian poke, a three taco platter prepared Traditional Baja style, a Japanese wasabi rice bowl with seared ahi tuna, a grilled yellowtail platter, and fried dolce de leche "spring rolls".
Unfortunately, the yellowtail special was not that special.
The sauce didn't really make sense with the fish.
The hawaiian poke, on the other hand, was wonderfully seasoned and a delight with the mixed greens.
The Japanese wasabi rice bowl came with a perfectly spicy wasabi sauce.
The seared tuna, unfortunately, fell a bit short.
The ahi tuna did not come with a sharp, crisp sear, instead appearing as a small gradient from the cooked exterior and the raw interior.
The tuna was also not as fresh as Mikuni's in Sacramento, which remains to be my top choice for seared tuna.
Now that I've talked about the other dishes, I can finally talk about the fish tacos.
Let me tell you, the fish tacos are heavenly!
If you choose to have your tacos prepared Traditional Baja style, the fis will vary with the catch of the day.
The two times I went, the FOTD was True Cod.
The cod was as fresh as if it had been caught that morning.
The batter came out crisp but not overly thick as to drown out the subtle flavors of the fish.
The guacamole was creamy deliciousness.
Squeeze a bit of lemon on it
and you've got the perfect fish taco.
After a very satisfying meal, we decided to order the fried dolce de leche "spring rolls.
Definitely unique and tasty.
seared ahi.author: Jenny C.
seared ahi.review:
Let me preface this by saying that I am not a fish person. At least, not cooked fish. Far too often, fish at restaurants is not fresh and further ruined by being cooked until it's completely dried out. For this reason, I've never paid much attention to Pacific Catch despite passing by its admittedly attractive looking building thousands of times. As far as I was concerned, it would just be another disappointing seafood restaurant. I probably would've continue to ignore this place had my fellow food enthusiast, Andrew W., not urged me to try their fish tacos, which he swore were some of the best he's ever had. We have similar taste in food, so finally, I decided to give it a shot. 

Our table of 3 shared a meal-sized salad with hawaiian poke, a three taco platter prepared Traditional Baja style, a Japanese wasabi rice bowl with seared ahi tuna, a grilled yellowtail platter, and fried dolce de leche "spring rolls". Unfortunately, the yellowtail special was not that special. The sauce didn't really make sense with the fish. The hawaiian poke, on the other hand, was wonderfully seasoned and a delight with the mixed greens. The Japanese wasabi rice bowl came with a perfectly spicy wasabi sauce. The seared tuna, unfortunately, fell a bit short. The ahi tuna did not come with a sharp, crisp sear, instead appearing as a small gradient from the cooked exterior and the raw interior. The tuna was also not as fresh as Mikuni's in Sacramento, which remains to be my top choice for seared tuna. Now that I've talked about the other dishes, I can finally talk about the fish tacos. Let me tell you, the fish tacos are heavenly! If you choose to have your tacos prepared Traditional Baja style, the fis will vary with the catch of the day. The two times I went, the FOTD was True Cod. The cod was as fresh as if it had been caught that morning. The batter came out crisp but not overly thick as to drown out the subtle flavors of the fish. The guacamole was creamy deliciousness. Squeeze a bit of lemon on it and you've got the perfect fish taco. After a very satisfying meal, we decided to order the fried dolce de leche "spring rolls." Definitely unique and tasty. One person at my table found the dolce de leche to be a bit too sweet, but I liked it just fine. 

Just writing about Pacific Catch makes me crave it. I can't wait to come back again for the fish tacos and dessert.

excerpts:
- food -

I ordered the Pan-Asian Rice Bowls: wakame salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, cucumber, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori & soy-wasabi sauce with seared Ahi with brown rice.
The presentation of the bowl was very balanced, I enjoy most was the seared Ahi; it was perfectly grilled and raw in the middle.
It was so good you can even taste that it was seared on a grill and the Ahi
just melts in your mouth with the soy-wasabi sauce on top.
The salad was a bit interesting with mixed greens and Romanians top off with some Japanese style shredded green seaweed with the soy-wasabi sauce too.
I am a fan of brown rice and there brown rice is made perfect, not to soft or hard.
If you are not a fan of wasabi, I would not recommended because it is a little bit mild spicy.
You can have the choice of either 1/2 salad or 1/2 rice
I eat a lot
so I thought I would have too much rice
seared ahi.author: Kenneth Y.
seared ahi.review:
Had a great experience eating at this restaurant I must first say, especially the waiter and the food had made this experience to a five star.  

Before we begin looking at the Menu, the server saw us walk to the table and simply gave us some starters in a rectangle dish that's divided with edamame and pretzel goldfishes.  We were extremely hungry and read to chow down. So we finished it and after we ordered our food the server refilled it again.  Normally I guess they don't do it, or maybe they are lazy but he did the extra mile and refilled us not twice but three times total.  I was really happy and the waiter knew how to treat his customer's right!

- food -

I ordered the Pan-Asian Rice Bowls: wakame salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, cucumber, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori & soy-wasabi sauce with seared Ahi with brown rice.

The presentation of the bowl was very balanced, I enjoy most was the seared Ahi; it was perfectly grilled and raw in the middle.  It was so good you can even taste that it was seared on a grill and the Ahi just melts in your mouth with the soy-wasabi sauce on top.  The salad was a bit interesting with mixed greens and Romanians top off with some Japanese style shredded green seaweed with the soy-wasabi sauce too.  I am a fan of brown rice and there brown rice is made perfect, not to soft or hard.  If you are not a fan of wasabi, I would not recommended because it is a little bit mild spicy.  You can have the choice of either 1/2 salad or 1/2 rice I eat a lot so I thought I would have too much rice but I would get full rice next time!


I also tried some of the Fish & chips my girlfriend order: 2 pieces of fish, 3 coconut shrimp & 3 crispy oysters with jalapeño tartar 

The fish and chips were amazing, the batter they used was very light and not overwhelming, yet enough to have a crunch, the fish was tender and juicy.  The fried oysters were smooth and creamy.  The sweet potato fries kicked an up a notch and balanced the meal with the sweetness and crunchiness to the fries.  It is some good stuff, I usually don't like sweet potato fries and I sure do like these!

Overall the food is great, the se

excerpts: - Sushi grade ahi salad- seared ahi, avocado, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds with soy-wasabi
seared ahi.author: Nadia L.
seared ahi.review:
I was introduced to this place a couple of years ago when we attended a graduation celebration here. Since then I haven't had a chance to make it back here until recently and I'm so glad I did. 

After running B2B, we were trying to decide where to eat and since I've been talking about wanting to go back here for I don't know how long, the rest of my group decided to accomodate my request. 

We got there right at 11am when it opened which was perfect since we were able to find parking in the small lot next to the restaurant for customers and we were seated in a nice table next to the window where we could see peopel walkby in their costumes.

For lunch we had:
- Ahi tuna poke (starter) served with wonton chips- super fresh and just as tasty as I remember. I could probably eat a whole serving of this myself
- Sushi grade ahi salad- seared ahi, avocado, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds with soy-wasabi vinaigrette- delicious and fresh it was a perfect meal after a run
- Cabo shrimp taco- crispy shrimp with pico de gallo, avocado, jalapeño tartar & lime crema- huge shrimp, lightly battered and super tasty. 
- Monthly special: Some fish that starts with an e that I can't remember, but it had some spice rub on it, served with some green sauce, sweet potato fries and grilled zucchini, peppers and corn.
- Dessert: Mochi fondue- came with 3 type of mochi- chocolate, vanilla and coffee with a warm fudge in the middle- yummy!! 

Everything was fantastic. If I lived in SF or if my office was remotely close to this restaurant,  I would probably be here a lot more. Service was also super friendly and I appreciate our server for putting up with my endless requests for tea (it was freezing outside!). What can I say, I love this place and am looking forward to coming back to try more dishes from their menu.

excerpts: The seared ahi wasabi bowl is my meal of choice...and always stellar.
Today I paid careful attention to the menu because I'm trying to pay careful attention to my figure...
(I know -
the wasabi sauce has got to be really bad for me somehow) and discovered that not only could I substitute the white rice for brown rice, but I could also substitute half of THAT for lettuce.
Bonus!
I can eat the whole thing and not be the complete pig I want to be.
And let me tell you, I'm not a brown rice fan, but this stuff was delicious.
Anyway, the bad news was the fish.
When getting the seared ahi on top, I'm used to maybe part of a piece or two being a little too fibrousy-chewy.
Unfortunately, this time, Only a piece or two was NOT too yucky to eat.
Believe me, I didn't leave behind much of anything else, so when I let the server know that was the case (pretty obvious since all the fish was leftover), he deducted $4 off the tab.
And believe me, I let him know he didn't really have to do that.
But that's good service right there and saved them a star.
seared ahi.author: Laurie H.
seared ahi.review:
Oh, Pacific Catch....I've loved you for so long. The only problem is that I never order anything new. But I guess that's the definition of comfort food, right?

This was my first visit to this location.  The seared ahi wasabi bowl is my meal of choice...and always stellar. Today I paid careful attention to the menu because I'm trying to pay careful attention to my figure...(I know - the wasabi sauce has got to be really bad for me somehow) and discovered that not only could I substitute the white rice for brown rice, but I could also substitute half of THAT for lettuce. Bonus! I can eat the whole thing and not be the complete pig I want to be. And let me tell you, I'm not a brown rice fan, but this stuff was delicious. Anyway, the bad news was the fish. When getting the seared ahi on top, I'm used to maybe part of a piece or two being a little too fibrousy-chewy. Unfortunately, this time, Only a piece or two was NOT too yucky to eat. Believe me, I didn't leave behind much of anything else, so when I let the server know that was the case (pretty obvious since all the fish was leftover), he deducted $4 off the tab. And believe me, I let him know he didn't really have to do that. But that's good service right there and saved them a star. But you know I can't give you 5 stars when your name is Pacific Catch, and the catch in my bowl can't be eaten, right?

There is no question - I will be back either to this location or the Chestnut St. one. I know they'll figure it out and not do that to me again....right?

excerpts: I usually come here for their seared ahi-tuna salad over rice.
What I like about their dishes is that they always gives you lots of vegetables and more rice than is fashionable these days.
It's hard to finish the entire bowl, especially if you include all that rice.
seared ahi.author: Robert C.
seared ahi.review: The fish selection is pretty limited and it gets really loud when it's busy.  I usually come here for their seared ahi-tuna salad over rice.  What I like about their dishes is that they always gives you lots of vegetables and more rice than is fashionable these days.  It's hard to finish the entire bowl, especially if you include all that rice.  What is disappointing is their other dishes that are Asian-based, such as their Salmon Teriyaki, fall below the standards of your average Japanese restaurant in the city.  Still, I give this restaurant credit for giving decent sized portions of fresh vegetables with most of their orders.  Their vegetables are fresh, and usually cooked firm.

excerpts: I had the Japanese Wasabi with seared ahi!
*rubs tummy*
seared ahi.author: Lauren H.
seared ahi.review:
Pan-Asian Rice Bowls...Pan-Asian Rice Bowls! Woo Hoo!

My boyfriend came to visit San Francisco, and had a taste for some fish. Since it was pouring raining, and we were visiting Golden Gate Park, we decided to go to Pacific Catch, because it was close. However, we weren't dissapointed. 

I had the Japanese Wasabi with seared ahi! *rubs tummy*   He had something with salmon...I believe it was a sandwich, and those french fries were good. 

Our waitress was cool and I liked how she was able to recommend some wine for dinner. This place is alright with me!

excerpts: Our waitor recommended this seared ahi tuna taco that was sooooo good.
He also recommended my friend this spicy margarita drink that had vodka, passionfruit juice & jalapeños in it.
It was good
but WAY too spicy for us lol.
No harm though for happy hour since it was only like $4.
I paired my food with the mai thai.
*caution
* it is very strong so be prepared lol.
(I tend to like my drinks strong anyways but it was stronger than I expected.
Basically took shots towards the bottom of the drink)
seared ahi.author: Andrea M.
seared ahi.review: Went there for my first time today for a late birthday lunch for me with a friend for happy hour. Sat at the bar and got promptly waited on. We ordered a steak taco, spicy tuna roll, and salmon poké. Our waitor recommended this seared ahi tuna taco that was sooooo good. He also recommended my friend this spicy margarita drink that had vodka, passionfruit juice & jalapeños in it. It was good but WAY too spicy for us lol. No harm though for happy hour since it was only like $4. I paired my food with the mai thai. *caution* it is very strong so be prepared lol. (I tend to like my drinks strong anyways but it was stronger than I expected. Basically took shots towards the bottom of the drink) The spicy tuna roll was indeed spicy but tolerable if you like spicy food and my poké was pretty good too. I saw some reviews of people getting sick or not liking theirs but so far I'm feeling fine. Overall a very good restaurant. Must try!

excerpts: I arrived thinking I wanted the seared ahi salad, but that quickly changed as we browsed the menu.
Instead, we opted for a few appetizers and two sushi rolls to share.
seared ahi.author: Lisa C.
seared ahi.review:
Having been here for lunch, I was looking forward to dinner. I arrived thinking I wanted the seared ahi salad, but that quickly changed as we browsed the menu.  Instead, we opted for a few appetizers and two sushi rolls to share.  The sweet potato fries were irresistible- not too greasy; I kept chomping on them! The Hawaiian Poke and the Shrimp Ceviche starter plates both came with plenty of poke and shrimp pieces. I loved the lime-cilantro-avocado sauce the shrimps were covered in.

Though the starter plates were great, I think the sushi rolls were only ok.  We asked for brown rice for the rising sun and the firecracker salmon rolls.  I was not impressed by the rolls because the brown rice didn't stick too well and the rice fell apart.  I think the next time I'll skip the sushi rolls. 

Surprisingly, there was no wait at all for a Saturday night, and we were able to snag a nice corner window seat.

excerpts: 3 pieces of seared ahi covered with sesame seeds, that one was the best.
Another 3 pieces of seared ahi with some kinda thousand island dressing on it..
2nd place.
And tuna poke.
Poke ALWAYS sounds good, but it is not so good here...
its just drenched in soy sauce.
SO i have 3 different  kinds of ahi in 3 different kinds of sauces, and one the side were shitake mushrooms fried with something also in sauce...
hmm..
all the sauces mixed together did not go so well with my rice...
so i had a lot left over and made chinese porridge the next day.
seared ahi.author: kim w.
seared ahi.review:
Came back here with Kylie L.!! What brought us in......just the sweet potato fries.

Kylie L. OOo'ed, and I Ahh'd, and we went in.  It seemed busy, but there were a few tables that were free.  The hostess said it will take about 5-10 mins..........wtf? There are tables, so after waiting for about 3mins id say, we got one of the empty tables near the entrance...hmmm

Anyway, I ordered the 3 Ahi something, that came with 3 different kinds of ahi tuna.  Sounded like a small meal, but I got it anyway. Kylie L. got fish and chips that came with sweet potato fries and we got an extra basket of SPF's.  Yummy!! the spf came with sweet and sour sauce, and a sweet horse radish sauce.  The horse radish one is good!  I ate half the basket, theyre just addicting.  

My ahi came, DANG, it was huge, maybe because of the big bowl of rice in the middle.  3 pieces of seared ahi covered with sesame seeds, that one was the best.  Another 3 pieces of seared ahi with some kinda thousand island dressing on it..2nd place. And tuna poke.  Poke ALWAYS sounds good, but it is not so good here...its just drenched in soy sauce.  SO i have 3 different  kinds of ahi in 3 different kinds of sauces, and one the side were shitake mushrooms fried with something also in sauce...hmm..all the sauces mixed together did not go so well with my rice...so i had a lot left over and made chinese porridge the next day.  That was not so good either..

I didnt try the fish and chips, but it looked like a lot.

The goods: food comes fast and SPF's
The bads: didnt i just tell u about them?

excerpts: We also both ordered the seared ahi sandwich and house salad, which comes with edamame and a miso dressing.
Both were really good.
I was impressed by the amount of ahi on the sandwich and the unique blend of flavors and was able to take a half home after all the other food.
The servers were really nice, too.
A little pricey
but I would go back to try some of the other amazing things on the menu.
seared ahi.author: Courtney A.
seared ahi.review: I went here with a friend and had a great time! We got free sweet potato fries for checking in on yelp/foursquare, which was an instant bonus, and also had the orange ale, which was a great beer and cheap for a nice restaurant! We also both ordered the seared ahi sandwich and house salad, which comes with edamame and a miso dressing. Both were really good. I was impressed by the amount of ahi on the sandwich and the unique blend of flavors and was able to take a half home after all the other food. The servers were really nice, too. A little pricey but I would go back to try some of the other amazing things on the menu.

excerpts: They have delicious, fresh and healthy seared ahi tuna (or spicy poki) bowls and salads.
They make pretty good cocktails, too.
At this location the seating usually isn't a problem and the service is good.
It feels a little chain restaurant-ish, but it's not.
Good sustainable options, too.
Consistent all the way around.
seared ahi.author: Robynne W.
seared ahi.review: I love Pacific Catch! They have delicious, fresh and healthy seared ahi tuna (or spicy poki) bowls and salads. They make pretty good cocktails, too. At this location the seating usually isn't a problem and the service is good. It feels a little chain restaurant-ish, but it's not. Good sustainable options, too. Consistent all the way around.

excerpts: The Japanese Wasabi bowl with brown rice and seared ahi is delicious!
Very fresh vegetables and fish.
Also, the Kiwi Flash, an unlikely pairing of kiwi and cucumber, offers a refreshing beverage.
seared ahi.author: Chaz G.
seared ahi.review: The Japanese Wasabi bowl with brown rice and seared ahi is delicious! Very fresh vegetables and fish. Also, the Kiwi Flash, an unlikely pairing of kiwi and cucumber, offers a refreshing beverage.

excerpts: I ordered the seared ahi macadamia, the best ahi I've ever had.
For those of you who don't like ahi because of it's aftertaste or "fishy" taste, this dish does not have anything like that.
seared ahi.author: Hedieh G.
seared ahi.review:
First and foremost, I am not a big seafood fan. After years of my boyfriend trying to get me to go, I finally decided to give them a shot. I started off small, I got their 3 tacos; two chicken and one mahi mahi. All I have to say is that the mahi mahi is far better than the chicken! But what made me an immediate fan was their fried dulce de leche spring rolls. I drool at the thought of them, they are that delicious. The springrolls are crunchy on the outside, warm and gooey on the inside and here's the kicker, a really yummy scoop of ice cream with a caramel drizzle. This thing is a heart attack on a plate, but a heart attack that I'm willing to suffer. 

My second visit I decided that since I had a great experience with their seafood the first time, that I would try experimenting something new. I ordered the seared ahi macadamia, the best ahi I've ever had. For those of you who don't like ahi because of it's aftertaste or "fishy" taste, this dish does not have anything like that. The ahi has a yummy mango thai citrus salad that really compliments the ahi and is delicious!

The bar scene can be really fun, it's nice to stop by, have an appetizer and beer and watch the local games. 

As far of prices, for a party of 2 with 2-3 drinks total, one appetizer, 2 entrees, dessert and coffee with run you close to $80, so for a full course meal it's not that pricey!

excerpts: I requested the seared ahi rice bowl.
Excited to chow down, I ran to Gordos and proceeded to stuff my face.
However, one thing felt wrong.
The fish did not taste the same.
Again, here is another place that overloads on the sodium to masque the taste of their food.
Not only was the fish too salty, but there was something fishy about the fish.
After a while, I decided to cease my "chow down" and wrapped the food back into the bag.
There is a huge problem if I order food and do not devour the entire thing.
This means I either am not hungry or the food does not taste good.
Thinking that I must not have been hungry, I decided to eat the bowl later that day.
From the moment I went to my bfs house to later that afternoon, my stomach was hurting.
I assumed it was due to the hangover from B2B, but it did not make sense.
I went to go finish the bowl and figured out my stomach was hurting from the food.
Pretty sad.

Cabo Calamari
Seared Ahi Bowl
Hawaiian Poke Bowl
seared ahi.author: Jessica B.
seared ahi.review:
I used to come here whenever I had disposable 20 and wanted to treat myself to some qual-it- A food. I've had fun happy hour times with some friends and even quick one drink hang outs. I had not eaten here in over a year and was excited when the opportunity came to indulge in a yummy lunch. After Bay to Breakers, my friends went to Gordos (YUM) and I chose to order take out from Pacific Catch. I requested the seared ahi rice bowl.  Excited to chow down, I ran to Gordos and proceeded to stuff my face. However, one thing felt wrong. The fish did not taste the same. Again, here is another place that overloads on the sodium to masque the taste of their food. Not only was the fish too salty, but there was something fishy about the fish. After a while, I decided to cease my "chow down" and wrapped the food back into the bag. There is a huge problem if I order food and do not devour the entire thing. This means I either am not hungry or the food does not taste good. Thinking that I must not have been hungry, I decided to eat the bowl later that day. From the moment I went to my bfs house to later that afternoon, my stomach was hurting. I assumed it was due to the hangover from B2B, but it did not make sense. I went to go finish the bowl and figured out my stomach was hurting from the food. Pretty sad. The bowls used to be enjoyable.

What I have eaten here: 
Baja Shrimp Ceviche
Sweet Potato Fries (Get them!)
Cabo Calamari
Seared Ahi Bowl
Hawaiian Poke Bowl

I'll keep the rating 3/5 because this could have been the one bad experience. I was always a fan of Pacific Catch, but I may need to take a permanent break from them. SORRY!

excerpts: besides their few signature dishes, which ARE truly great - the rice bowls and meal-sized salads with seared ahi (prices for which rose some time recently), sweet fries and, as we found out this time, the poke starter - the rest of the specials and entries pretty much SUCK.
The fish and preparation is very mediocre: for example, last night "Japanese-style trout" had very little Japanese about it (and I've eaten in Japan), and trout itself was totally average.
seared ahi.author: Sasha M.
seared ahi.review:
Yeah, yeah, I miss Canvas too, but considering I loved the Marina Pacific Catch location and gave it a great review here, this did not taint my last night's dining experience here. And here is the basic problem, I guess regardless of location, invariably tested over the last couple of visits: besides their few signature dishes, which ARE truly great - the rice bowls and meal-sized salads with seared ahi (prices for which rose some time recently), sweet fries and, as we found out this time, the poke starter - the rest of the specials and entries pretty much SUCK. The fish and preparation is very mediocre: for example, last night "Japanese-style trout" had very little Japanese about it (and I've eaten in Japan), and trout itself was totally average. It wasn't worth the price.

Don't like the decor much - given the size of the space and the treatment it was getting from Canvas, they could've put more imagination into it! The bar area was empty before midnight on Friday...
2.5 stars, really, but given high marks I already gave the Marina location (where I sometimes go for lunch, for which those bowls are perfect), I round it down.

excerpts: The interior is really nice and the food is excellent (I got the seared ahi wasabi bowl with half greens and half brown rice)
the staff has been super friendly and not overbearing both times
I came here and the mixed drinks are awesome!
I've had ( at the risk of exposing my alcoholic tendencies)
the agave margarita, the guava cooler (or something) the lemongrass mojito, and the black and white drink (don't remember the exact name)
they were all really girly and yummy
but I still felt the alcohol...
and no, it's not because I drank all of that at once-
remember I've been here
seared ahi.author: Amy L.
seared ahi.review:
Gorgeous! The interior is really nice and the food is excellent (I got the seared ahi wasabi bowl with half greens and half brown rice) the staff has been super friendly and not overbearing both times I came here and the mixed drinks are awesome! I've had ( at the risk of exposing my alcoholic tendencies) the agave margarita, the guava cooler (or something) the lemongrass mojito, and the black and white drink (don't remember the exact name) they were all really girly and yummy but I still felt the alcohol...and no, it's not because I drank all of that at once- remember I've been here twiiiice

I'd recommend this place for birthdays, dates or nice dinners to catch up with friends...pacific catch 'caught' me!! Harhar...

excerpts: We were very happy with the food - shared a few sushi rolls and a seared ahi dish with a mango salad.
The sushi iitself was pretty standard but we especially enjoyed the brown rice option for the rolls.
The service was excellent, and our server Ben even obliged when we asked him his opinion on some juicy relationship gossip.
The urban - chic atmosphere was also pleasing, but seems a little out of place in this neighborhood which is full of low-key but amazing restaurants.
But what do i know, maybe it's just what the area needs.
We would definitely go again, although if you're just looking for good sushi I would still prefer Hotei.
seared ahi.author: Izzy S.
seared ahi.review:
My girlfriend and i wandered into this place after realizing Hotei was closed down the street. About halfway through dinner we learned that it was the first night serving dinner at the new Pacific Catch. We were very happy with the food - shared a few sushi rolls and a seared ahi dish with a mango salad. The sushi iitself was pretty standard but we especially enjoyed the brown rice option for the rolls. The service was excellent, and our server Ben even obliged when we asked him his opinion on some juicy relationship gossip. 
The urban - chic atmosphere was also pleasing, but seems a little out of place in this neighborhood which is full of low-key but amazing restaurants. But what do i know, maybe it's just what the area needs. We would definitely go again, although if you're just looking for good sushi I would still prefer Hotei.

excerpts: I had the seared ahi tuna salad that came with 6 pieces of perfectly cooked tuna that was still raw on the inside.
seared ahi.author: Florence T.
seared ahi.review:
First pro of eating at Pacific Catch is that reservations can be made online at opentable.com! The interior is much roomier than the marina location and the decor is trendy and comfortable. Our server was friendly and even showed me the box package of the tea that they brew when I asked what type of green tea they used as it has some fruity floral notes unlike other traditional green teas. 

We started with the spicy fries, which were perfectly crispy and had a cajun spice sprinkled on top. It was served hot and the side sized order was a perfectly adequate amount to avoid overfilling on starches before our meal. My boyfriend had the fish and chips with the "catch of the day" which was cod. It was flaky and soft and the batter was light and airy. The sweet potato fries were crispy and tasted really good with the tar tar sauce and sweet/sour sauce that accompanied the dish. I had the seared ahi tuna salad that came with 6 pieces of perfectly cooked tuna that was still raw on the inside. Instead of the wasabi soy dressing, I opted for the miso dressing and was happy with my change as the dressing was creamy and tangy, which matched perfectly with the fish. 

Pacific Catch is a great place to indulge in seafood and enjoy a nice night out in a trendy joint, which i must mention also has a bar area.

excerpts: The sweet potatoe fries are the first thing I order with a salad and seared ahi tuna.
Customer service is excellent.
seared ahi.author: Marie G.
seared ahi.review: After a long day at Golden Gate park Pacific Catch is the first place that comes to mind when my stomach starts growling. The sweet potatoe fries are the first thing I order with a salad and seared ahi tuna. Customer service is excellent.

excerpts: I had the seared ahi salad, which wasn't earth-shattering, but was solidly executed and fresh.
seared ahi.author: A W.
seared ahi.review: I went for lunch today after a morning at the de Young b/c Park Chow was packed with a giant waiting list.  I've been hesitant to come here b/c it's a chain, but I was pleasantly surprised. The place was pretty empty at just after noon on a Sunday, but started to fill up while I was there.  Nice wine by the glass list and friendly service. I had the seared ahi salad, which wasn't earth-shattering, but was solidly executed and fresh.

excerpts: I've had the tacos, seared ahi salad and some sushi rolls.
All were just average.
For the location, building and food, I'd probably give this place a 3 overall.
One thing irks me enough to take it down to 2.
The staff.
I've been to this location 3 times and each time have been left in awe of the "too cool for school" attitude.
I can't really describe it, other than to say it's a terribly annoying egotistical tone the servers and bartenders use to talk to you.
No, you're not cute.
Oh, and minus points for $1.50 extra charge for tobiko on sushi.
Not cool.
seared ahi.author: M M.
seared ahi.review: The space is cool but little of that has to do with the restaurant.  The building is cool just as it was cool when it was The Canvas.  There is little other reason to go here.  Plus, have you ever sat in the bar?  You can't fit your legs under the tables.  Stupid design flaw.  And I'd really like to know why I always get seated in the bar when other tables are available.  Anyway, It's fairly expensive for being a "reasonably priced" seafood joint.  The food is ok.  I've had the tacos, seared ahi salad and some sushi rolls.  All were just average.  For the location, building and food, I'd probably give this place a 3 overall.  One thing irks me enough to take it down to 2.  The staff.  I've been to this location 3 times and each time have been left in awe of the "too cool for school" attitude.  I can't really describe it, other than to say it's a terribly annoying egotistical tone the servers and bartenders use to talk to you.  No, you're not cute.  Oh, and minus points for $1.50 extra charge for tobiko on sushi.  Not cool.

excerpts: Some other notable favorites are the Hawaiian teriyaki rice bowl, fried oysters, pacific crab salad, fish and chips, mahi mahi and steak tacos, and seasoned fries.
Service is always good except one time, nobody came to give me my bill and took a long time to flag someone down.
But, otherwise they are attentive.
crab salad.author: Annie L.
crab salad.review: Yummy goodness! I've been coming to this location for for the past 7 years and every time I get yumminess! With friends, we get a booth in the back but when I'm by myself, I sit at a table in the bar section. I almost always order their Salmon Salad..it is so delicious it is my favorite salad in the world. The sauce is what makes it bomb! Can I buy a bottle? Some other notable favorites are the Hawaiian teriyaki rice bowl, fried oysters, pacific crab salad, fish and chips, mahi mahi and steak tacos, and seasoned fries. Service is always good except one time, nobody came to give me my bill and took a long time to flag someone down. But, otherwise they are attentive.

excerpts:
Two things on the menu:

- crab salad is huge and made with real crab.
crab salad.author: Darwin L.
crab salad.review:
Two things on the menu:

- crab salad is huge and made with real crab. They are very generous with the crab 

- fish and chips which you can order more Alaskan cod at around 2 dollars per piece. The only problem is that it's a bit overcooked for my tastes

excerpts: My friend tried the Pacific Crab Salad (with real crab meat) and it was great too!
crab salad.author: Wendy F.
crab salad.review:
Lovely Asian-fusion diner! Love their Ahi Tuna salad!!!

FOOD: We shared the Korean sticky ribs and the sweet potato fries for appetizer. The sweet potato fries were really good and not too greasy like I had at many other places. The sticky ribs were marinated well, but I didn't get too much meat from it. For entree I got the Ahi Tuna salad. It had a good mix of greens, avocado, sauteed cabbages, and 4 big piece of Ahi Tuna. Everything tasted great when mixed all together, with the soy-wasabi vinaigrette. My friend tried the Pacific Crab Salad (with real crab meat) and it was great too!

SERVICE: We came here on a Tuesday evening and was seated immediately. Very friendly waiter and food came by within reasonable time.

SETTING: I really like how spacious it is on the inside and also its ambient lighting. They have nice interior decors and there is also an outdoor patio where you can sit and dine (heat lamp provided during the freezing SF nights). Parking is probably impossible so just take Lyft or the muni. 

OVERALL IMPRESSION: I like it! I always run past this place but never really knew how tasty the food is. Will come back again for sure!

excerpts: We also had the crab salad and the poke bowl.
Both were super fresh and delicious.
They have a poke "bar" with several choices of poke and all looked fresh and flavorful!
crab salad.author: Samantha B.
crab salad.review:
I have not been to Pacific Catch in awhile and was absolutely blown away with their menu selection & seriously wonderful staff.

We had the special soft shell crab roll and it was INCREDIBLE!  Super fresh, flavors were wonderful!  We also had the crab salad and the poke bowl.  Both were super fresh and delicious.  They have a poke "bar" with several choices of poke and all looked fresh and flavorful!  Fresh is very important when you are dealing with raw/semi raw fish and Pacific Catch has definitely nailed it!

While the food was fabulous the true super star was our server, Rachel.  She was, hands down, the sweetest, most professional and kind server we've ever had.  Her sweet demeanor coupled with the great food makes this place outstanding!  We truly appreciated Rachel's hard work and knowledge.  She is definitely an asset to Pacific Catch.

This was a great experience and I'm looking forward to going back soon!!

excerpts: We ordered fried oysters, soft shell crab salad, shrimp ceviche and beef & mahi mahi tacos.
Loved the tacos!
crab salad.author: Tiffany M.
crab salad.review:
Really enjoyed apps and drinks in the bar area on a very busy evening. My friend and I could not get a table inside the restaurant area or patio dining area. But the bar area was great! The service was super speedy and friendly, mindful of timing our apps delivery, too! We ordered fried oysters, soft shell crab salad, shrimp ceviche and beef & mahi mahi tacos. Loved the tacos! Came with sweet potato fries as a choice of side. The steak was amazing so tender and tasty, hint of sweetness. Pretzel
Fish and edamame come as bar snacks while you wait for your food, pretty creative and yummy. This was our first visit here and we were really surprised. Only one con to mention, the menu lacks entrees. The restaurant feels like a main entree type restaurant but actually has a tapas menu. I was in the mood for fish main entree, still good though. The outer patio looks cozy with gas fireplace pits! Reception area and wait staff were all very helpful and friendly. I will try the San Mateo branch next time, closer to my house.

excerpts: The crab salad had a great serving of crab and avocado.
crab salad.author: Sharon R M.
crab salad.review: What a great amalgamation of tastes! The asian, Hawaiian, Hispanic influences make for a great seafood experience!  We enjoyed the poke starter and calamari. the Thai rice bowl was delicious. The crab salad had a great serving of crab and avocado.

excerpts: My favorite protein for these is the mahi mahi although the salmon and crab salad are a close second.
I got stuck on the tropical iced tea for a long time but recently tried the sparkling lemonade which offers free refills and is delicious!
crab salad.author: Krislyn T.
crab salad.review: This is a great place for lunch and has become my go-to spot where I take all my friends.  The modern decor is refreshing.  Their rice bowls and salads are wonderful with the half rice and salad option in the rice bowl.  My favorite protein for these is the mahi mahi although the salmon and crab salad are a close second.  I got stuck on the tropical iced tea for a long time but recently tried the sparkling lemonade which offers free refills and is delicious!  Oh and always opt for those sweet potato fries.  I've never had a bad experience and whoever hires all the servers finds the nicest people in the City!

excerpts: The salmon salad had tons of crispy fried salmon skin and the California Roll salad had plenty of crab salad but without heavy mayo.
The fish tacos were very fresh and filling.
crab salad.author: Melissa K.
crab salad.review:
After a long flight from the east coast, we were hungry and tired of driving around so we decided to take a chance with Pacific Catch.  What a great choice!

Coming from Hawaii, I was a bit wary of restaurant's "Hawaii" theme and of the poke and other fish items but I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food relative to the price.  Entrees range from $10-$20 and everything is fresh and delicious.  Lots of fresh, creative salads, plenty of seafood options, and the food bursts with flavor and color.  

I really enjoyed the salads and the soup of the day which consisted of seafood in a tomato base. The edamame and pretzel Goldfish crackers were very cute, and I also enjoyed the wakame salad and the broccolini. The salmon salad had tons of crispy fried salmon skin and the California Roll salad had plenty of crab salad but without heavy mayo. The fish tacos were very fresh and filling. And the cocktails are phenomenal. 

Service was very good-- the waitstaff were very friendly and welcoming. Also, I'm super glad there is a parking area!

excerpts: The crab meat was real crab salad.
crab salad.author: Liza T.
crab salad.review:
first time came here and I love it.......

We had reservation at 7:30pm but we were15 minutes early.  Good that we got seated right the way.   Parking was a nightmare there.  Make sure you come early to allow yourself to look for parking.

All the staffs were friendly there.  Our server was very nice and friendly but was lacking service toward the end of the meal,  I guess he was too busy with the other big party (15 people).  He was pretty slow and did not refill our water.

The menu was extensive.  There were a lot of varieties that you could choose from.  You can choose from Salad, Rice Bowls, Tacos, Sandwiches, etc...

What we ordered:

Pacific Ceviche Trio ($17) - a sampling of shrimp ceviche, Hawaiian poke & Peruvian ceviche with chips.  It was great.  The portion was good for share.  I really like the purple potato chips.  It was perfect to eat with the poke.  Poke was so fresh and flavorful.  

Sweet Potato Fries ($6) - Portion was big.  The fries was so good.  Thick, crispy outside and soft inside.  It came with ginger wasabi aioli and sweet Thai chili sauces.  I think the wasabi aioli was better with the fries.  

Spicy Tuna Sushi Roll ($8.50) - The sushi roll was huge.  very filling......everything was so fresh.

California Roll ($9.00) - Again, the roll was big.  The crab meat was real crab salad.  Tasty.......

I got the Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl ($15).  It had tuna, wakame salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, cucumber, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori and soy-wasabi sauce.  I agree with other Yelpers.  The portion was huge and had a lot of rice but not much fish.  $15 was a little bit over price.  But the taste was pretty good.   The fish was fresh and flavorful.  I got half brown rice and half salad.  All ingredients were very fresh and tasty.  The only thing is the soy-wasabi sauce was little bit too much.  Kinda of salty to me.

My sister got the Ahi Rice Bowl ($15).  The ingredients were the same as the other rice bowls except the fish.  Ahi was very fresh.  I did not read the menu carefully.  If I knew the Ceviche Trio had poke, I would order Ahi rice bowl instead.

I really wanted to try their mochi for the dessert but I was too full.....Ok, next time!

excerpts: Also excellent is the California crab salad.
Waiters are friendly and attentive, service is efficient.
crab salad.author: Chris B.
crab salad.review:
I go to the 9th Ave location for lunch, usually on Tuesdays when they have the Ahi salad on special. It is perfectly prepared, very reasonably priced and the meal includes a drink-out the door under $20 in San Francisco is rare.  
Also excellent is the California crab salad.  Waiters are friendly and attentive, service is efficient.

excerpts: My wife had the crab salad.
She loves that thing!
While it has the usual suspects in a salad it is generously packed with crab meat and avocados.
Today I went with coconut shrimp and they were good.
crab salad.author: Ryan B.
crab salad.review:
It was late in the day and my wife and I were craving a good lunch. We hit up Fresh Catch and like a Irish Brother it was there for us!

My wife had the crab salad. She loves that thing!  While it has the usual suspects in a salad it is generously packed with crab meat and avocados. Today I went with coconut shrimp and they were good. Nothing over the top or different but prepared well for what they were.

It was quite at lunch but then again it is the day before Thanksgiving. Parking is a pain but they do have a side lot that if lucky you can find a spot in. I typically part in the park and walk over. This visit we sat in the bar and had great service by the bartender. 

I grew up in New England (specifically Boston) and this place reminds me of Legal Seafood.

excerpts: The California Roll was a little mushy, but they are quite honest to bill it as "fresh crab SALAD" instead of just the meat, but again, for the amount and the price, you can't beat it.
The other roll I tried was the Shiso Fine, and that little hit of Shiso leaf added a great dimension to an already good roll.
crab salad.author: Gina H.
crab salad.review:
3.5 Pints!  (Trying out a new rating system because I am endlessly frustrated with being limited.)

Yeah.  It's good.  Great Happy Hour choices, although I think they could come up with more than 2 signature cocktails.  The Spicy Pacific Martini ($7) is amazing!  The Agave Margarita ($6) is so-so.  They should come up with something else as I can get an agave margarita in 100 other places.

On two separate occasions I tried two types of HH Rolls ($6 for all types) and they were quite tasty, especially for the price.  A very hearty portion, good flavors and creative.  The California Roll was a little mushy, but they are quite honest to bill it as "fresh crab SALAD" instead of just the meat, but again, for the amount and the price, you can't beat it.  The other roll I tried was the Shiso Fine, and that little hit of Shiso leaf added a great dimension to an already good roll.  Avo was fresh, cold and popped with the sesame seeds and seaweed.

Great atmosphere, although it looks like the beginnings of a corporate dynasty, and very nice natural light in the bar.  (I wouldn't go on a first date if you are trying to hide any blemishes!)  

Bar staff is friendly, but not overly peppy, which makes me happy.  Seems like there are too many back there at times, though, and can seem like they get their wires crossed when it comes to who needs what.

I did notice the managers working, pouring beers, delivering food, answering the phone and greeting people.  The hands-on approach can sometimes make a staff nervous, but it's nice to see that they have a stake in the business and aren't above lending a hand.

I would go back and try other items, although I still have a hard-time paying over $10 for a sandwich.

Overall, the food will bring you back and atmosphere will bring your friends with you.

excerpts: I ordered for myself, the Crab Salad RICE BOWL, which they accidently put in as just the Crab Salad.
I guess its ok to eat a little bit more greens.
I'm cool with that
and I really did enjoy it.
The dressing on the veggies was lightly tangy and sweet and the crab meat was plentiful.
I probably would have enjoyed the rice too, but did quite good without it.
crab salad.author: Vincent K.
crab salad.review:
Another fun experience at Pacific Catch.  When I first reserved the spot, I didn't get why 6 and 7 mattered that much.  At 6 persons, a table was available for 7:00pm, but with 7, NO!  had to make it 7:15 which turned to 7:25ish to get seated.  Nonetheless, i'm glad the table we got was nice and big and allowed everyone to really enjoy their meal and share embarassing memories.  

And certainly, I'm never going to go to the Marina one since this place is so much bigger and nicer.  Between the 7 of us, a lot of people got the sushi which everyone enjoyed.  Diana K. and I shared the firecracker (I believe) which was really big and tasty with the fresh fish.  

I ordered for myself, the Crab Salad RICE BOWL, which they accidently put in as just the Crab Salad.  I guess its ok to eat a little bit more greens.  I'm cool with that and I really did enjoy it.  The dressing on the veggies was lightly tangy and sweet and the crab meat was plentiful.  I probably would have enjoyed the rice too, but did quite good without it.

excerpts: I had an order of the California Rolls, crab salad and Shrimp Teriyaki bowl.
All were over sized portions and delicious.
This was way too much food to order.
The service was beyond my expectation.
crab salad.author: J A.
crab salad.review:
I'm really happy that my hood has attracted a great new restaurants like Pacific Catch. They serve an assortment of seafood in a variety of styles in a very modern setting. 

I had an order of the California Rolls, crab salad and Shrimp Teriyaki bowl. All were over sized portions and delicious. This was way too much food to order. The service was beyond my expectation. A full bar added to overall experience. 

No buts, I recommend going there. Good prompt service, tasty food and great drink options make Pacific Catch the darling of the inter Sunset.

excerpts: Anywho, my friend and I ordered the wasabi bowl with ahi tuna and crab salad to share.
The bowl was really good and had huge portions.
The salad had a lot of crab, but not much flavor.
The Thai salad on the other hand I liked.
crab salad.author: Adrianna C.
crab salad.review:
I took my friends here as a late Christmas dinner, subsitute present after my other friend told me how delicious this place was. After confirming the fact on Yelp, I decided to make a reservation. As my friend and I sat and waited for our other friends to arrive, the waiter was kind and attentive. He asked us if we wanted anything to eat as we waited, filled our water cups, and gave us our complentary plate of edamame and pretzel gold fishes. 

To start we ordered Rock & Roll and also sweet potatoe fries. The sweet potatoe fries were really good and the sauce was delicious. Rock & Roll, not so much - it's not that it was bad, rolls are just not a good choice for this restaurant. Anywho, my friend and I ordered the wasabi bowl with ahi tuna and crab salad to share. The bowl was really good and had huge portions. The salad had a lot of crab, but not much flavor. The Thai salad on the other hand I liked. My other friend ordered the salmon sashimi. It wasn't good and unlike the heaping portions of salad and wasabi bowl - it was lacking. She ended up eating from our plates. The meal came out to $80 with tax and tips. A little pricey, but considering what we ate and the occasion, it was pretty good. I would come back, when my wallet permits it. 

The interior design and the high ceiling of the restaurant felt warm and cozy, and definitely made me feel like I was out of the Sunset. This is definitely a romantic restaurant and would be a great place to take a girl on a date. Maybe not a first date though, cause the noise level kills that.

excerpts: I ordered my usual, the crab salad wasabi rice bowl.
It came out promptly and was delicious!!!
Lots of crab salad and toppings.
crab salad.author: Jen P.
crab salad.review:
In a nutshell: Yummy! Good service, great location, nice & casual ambiance.

Having had an AWFUL experience at their ugly stepsister restaurant on Chestnut, I was a bit apprehensive to try out the new place in the Sunset. Given that it's a new location & the staff is still fairly new, I had a fabulous lunch here today!

The location can't be beat, across the street from GG park. Much closer for me to get to, living in the Richmond. They did a great job with the space. This location is far more comfortable than the Chestnut PC. Lots of space and casual dining means parents with babies. LOTS of them. However, this actually wasn't too bad at all since the acoustics of this PC just makes everyone's noises blend in to the overall sound of dining.

I ordered my usual, the crab salad wasabi rice bowl. It came out promptly and was delicious!!! Lots of crab salad and toppings. 

Our server was obviously new but did a great job nonetheless. Our waters and soda didn't ever stay empty for long and he came by regularly to check how we were doing. 

Overall, this location is FAR better than the one on Chestnut. Pac Catch has finally redeemed itself, I'll be back for sure.

excerpts: Bigger menu (try the crab salad with yellowtail appetizer, yum to the vietnamese beef sandwich, crispy calamari, grrr!), nice, warm space and drink-worthy bar (
crab salad.author: Mark S.
crab salad.review:
Good tasting, reasonably priced seafood is hard to find.  Variety in terms of the different ways it is prepared is often pretty limited in most places.

What I love about Pacific Catch is that when I am feeling taco-y, the salmon tacos are the bomb. When I am hunkering for a fish sandwich, the spicy ahi is just killer.  Feeling like a rice bowl, the ahi wasabi rice bowl is sushi-grade goodness.  Heck, my wife and kids even eat there enthusiastically.

We have been long time customers at Chestnut location and were thrilled when 9th avenue opened.  Why?  Bigger menu (try the crab salad with yellowtail appetizer, yum to the vietnamese beef sandwich, crispy calamari, grrr!), nice, warm space and drink-worthy bar (tasty strong drinks).

Highly recommended.  Family friendly too.

excerpts: I ordered the crab salad wasabi bowl.
The avocado, crab, and wakame salad was not that tasty; the majority of the taste came from the wasabi sauce.
Also, the texture of the rice was supposedly "sushi rice" but it turned out to be a little more watery than I had expected; the sushi roll we ordered was good though.
The meal all together was decent
but I think the price is a bit steep.
I usually like asian fusion
but I didn't find this place particularly outstanding.
crab salad.author: Ryan L.
crab salad.review: I came here with a few friends for no special occasion. We were seated pretty quickly. The tables were a little sticky so I didn't want to put my bare forearms on it. I ordered the crab salad wasabi bowl. The avocado, crab, and wakame salad was not that tasty; the majority of the taste came from the wasabi sauce. Also, the texture of the rice was supposedly "sushi rice" but it turned out to be a little more watery than I had expected; the sushi roll we ordered was good though. The meal all together was decent but I think the price is a bit steep. I usually like asian fusion but I didn't find this place particularly outstanding.

excerpts: The food is fine -- I enjoyed their crab salad over garden greens -- you're provided with a very generous portion of pure crabmeat, serverd over very lightly-dressed salad greens, served with slices of avocado and pickled ginger.
The sushi rolls are also good --
crab salad.author: Claudine C.
crab salad.review:
We resisted this place for a long time, on account of its seeming too chain-like, too touristy...  And one day, after a certain Yelp Holiday Party, one during which we had the opportunity to sample their tuna poke, we decided to stop by.  And realized the value of their outdoor puppy-friendly space, well protected by plastic on the colder days, and well-served by heat lamps.

The food is fine -- I enjoyed their crab salad over garden greens -- you're provided with a very generous portion of pure crabmeat, serverd over very lightly-dressed salad greens, served with slices of avocado and pickled ginger.  The sushi rolls are also good -- the Sake Sake and Rising Sun are as fresh well-executed as one might find at Moki's or Blowfish.  On another night we sampled their Tuna Poke again -- and overall it's a good appetizer -- the large chunks of fresh tuna are admirable, but they might benefit from a slightly smaller cut and just a tad more dressing. The fried wonton chips are plentiful and the perfect accompaniment.  Take caution when ordering their grill items -- the fish I ordered turned out to be overcooked and a smidge dry...

Overall, PacCatch is a good alternative when the lines at Park Chow seem to be interminable, and you're looking for a nice outdoor space to sit with your puppy.

excerpts: I ordered the white tuna poki with crab salad (very good) and surf & turf (
steak
w/shrimp, pineapple fried rice, onion shoe strings, and asparagus) to share with my friend.
crab salad.author: Terry D.
crab salad.review:
I love this place! Randomly decided to try Pacific Catch on a Saturday night (no reservation) and we got a table outside for 5 in less than 10 minutes. Even though it was really cold outside their heat lamps were superb and kept us toasty throughout dinner.

I actually pass by this restaurant every day on my bus ride to work and had no idea that it was an Asian fusion restaurant. The menu took me by surprise but in a good way. 

For appetizers we ordered sweet potato fries (very yummy) and artichokes (good but could have done without). I ordered the white tuna poki with crab salad (very good) and surf & turf (steak w/shrimp, pineapple fried rice, onion shoe strings, and asparagus) to share with my friend. I was very satisfied with my entrees and was completely stuffed afterwards.

The prices are reasonable. For a group of 5 we spent about $107 (pre tax and tip) so it's not bad at all. Service is very friendly as well. Definitely will go back!

excerpts: My husband had the Thai rice bowl with the crab salad; he was pleased with it esp.
the crab salad and was full.
Lemme tell you, it takes a lot for my husband to get full.
The rice bowl could fit at least four, Chinese rice bowls of rice in it.
He had also ordered the Aguave Lemonade.
That was awesome to drink as I got to try it.
Our server was friendly, efficient, and checked up on us.
We received good service from him.
I would love to come here again
and oh, there were families here
so it's child friendly for sure.
crab salad.author: Kekumukula N.
crab salad.review:
I've always wanted to try this place as I've heard about it.  Finally my hubbie and I were able to eat here for a late lunch.  It was quiet and mellow past 2 p.m.  I found the restaurant to be clean and spacious and had nice decor.  Even the ladies' restroom was clean and I liked the bamboo motif on the stall's walls and door.
I ordered the Mixed Catch Basket.  Thumbs up and two snaps up!  The fish was thick, super duper soft, and flaky.  The oysters were warm and just the right softness and moistness.  The coconut shrimp were big and yummy.  I had also ordered a Nojito, a mojito w/out the rum.  Totally refreshing, flavorful, and perfect.
My husband had the Thai rice bowl with the crab salad; he was pleased with it esp. the crab salad and was full.  Lemme tell you, it takes a lot for my husband to get full.  The rice bowl could fit at least four, Chinese rice bowls of rice in it.  He had also ordered the Aguave Lemonade.  That was awesome to drink as I got to try it.
Our server was friendly, efficient, and checked up on us.  We received good service from him.
I would love to come here again and oh, there were families here so it's child friendly for sure.

excerpts: california rolls are excellent, my crab salad wasabi bowl was excellent, and my friends poke bowl was excellent!
bartender was a really nice guy as well!
oh! and the spring roll for dessert is excellent toooo!!!
crab salad.author: Soph I.
crab salad.review:
the sweet potato fries ARE really good!  i liked the sweet and sour sauce that comes with it.  california rolls are excellent, my crab salad wasabi bowl was excellent, and my friends poke bowl was excellent!  
bartender was a really nice guy as well!  oh! and the spring roll for dessert is excellent toooo!!!

excerpts: I ordered the crab salad wasabi bowl with brown rice and miso soup with mushrooms and asparagus.
The miso soup was okay, way too much asparagus which distorted the flavor of the soup a little bit (and also too pricey for what it was).
However, I  was pleasantly surprised to be graced with a decent portion of crab in the wasabi bowl.
The crab salad wasn't too heavy, which I preferred.
Unless one is starving, the wasabi bowl is a good choice if you're trying to get two meals out of it (and keeps pretty well in the fridge for a day).
I'd definitely go back again, although the pretzel fishes kind of weirded me out...in a cute way I guess.
My friend and I were seated in a booth, so the ambiance was pretty good.
However, they have some 2 person tables in awkward places that didn't look too comfortable.
I'm only knocking the place down a star because the soup was too over priced and they charged for tea (even though it's a fushion restaurant).
crab salad.author: T L.
crab salad.review:
I'm not going to lie-I had low expectations for this place. After months of walking by Pacific Catch on the way to other restaurants on Irving, my friend had a hankering for fish and chips so off we went. I ordered the crab salad wasabi bowl with brown rice and miso soup with mushrooms and asparagus. The miso soup was okay, way too much asparagus which distorted the flavor of the soup a little bit (and also too pricey for what it was). However, I  was pleasantly surprised to be graced with a decent portion of crab in the wasabi bowl. The crab salad wasn't too heavy, which I preferred. Unless one is starving, the wasabi bowl is a good choice if you're trying to get two meals out of it (and keeps pretty well in the fridge for a day).
I'd definitely go back again, although the pretzel fishes kind of weirded me out...in a cute way I guess.
My friend and I were seated in a booth, so the ambiance was pretty good. However, they have some 2 person tables in awkward places that didn't look too comfortable.
I'm only knocking the place down a star because the soup was too over priced and they charged for tea (even though it's a fushion restaurant).

excerpts: -- I ordered the california crab salad and the crab didn't seem particularly plentiful or fresh, but the worst part was our server.
Didn't introduce himself, couldn't be bothered to answer a question about an item on the menu, and had an annoying tendency to walk away  as we were mid question/request.
In general seemed 'put out' to have to be bringing us food.
Not impressive.
Finally, for what it is, I think it's a bit expensive.
crab salad.author: Sarah G.
crab salad.review: I'd heard a lot about Pacific Catch and its local for me so I was pretty excited to try it.  Unfortunately I was disappointed and it won't be added to the neighborhood rotation.  The food was just so so -- I ordered the california crab salad and the crab didn't seem particularly plentiful or fresh, but the worst part was our server.  Didn't introduce himself, couldn't be bothered to answer a question about an item on the menu, and had an annoying tendency to walk away  as we were mid question/request.  In general seemed 'put out' to have to be bringing us food.  Not impressive.  Finally, for what it is, I think it's a bit expensive.

excerpts: My husband had a bowl of grilled mahi mahi with brown rice, roasted pineapple, caramelized onions and shaved coconut.
grilled mahi mahi.author: Michelle R.
grilled mahi mahi.review:
A very solid place, with good food and great presentation.

It is an all-occasion spot, you can come for a casual Sunday dinner or to celebrate a birthday.  You can see  all ages and all kind of groups of people, from families with babies to ones with  older parents and everyone in between.  Groups of friends, ages from  20 something to seniors.

We really loved the sweet potato fries for an appetizer.  They came with red chili pepper sauce (yumm) and wasabi aioli.

My mahi mahi tacos were really good. They came with avocado and lettuce, a small bowl of beans on the side, and you could have an option of fries or salad with it.  There were 2 tacos on a plate.  I don't like huge portions, so this was plenty.

 My husband had a bowl of grilled mahi mahi with brown rice, roasted pineapple, caramelized onions and shaved coconut.   He really enjoyed it and could barely finish his plate, it was so much food.

We were so full that we couldn't  even  finish our side of warm edamame.

My son had fish and chips.  I tried his fries, the seasoning on them was a really good combination.

Some food, like sweet potato fries, tacos were served on a sheet of a newspaper which happened to be a Hawaiian Tribune from April 1, 1901.  Pretty cool, although I've seen it before (at an Italian Seafood place, on Irving and 9th, not far from this one.)

Cons:  The California roll that my daughter ordered was a bit dry. It also was overpriced at $9.  The wine was overpriced too, at $9 a glass, and it wasn't that much wine in the glass.  Also, they were out of one of Hawaiian Poke tonight - spiced tofu.

Nevertheless, we enjoyed our dinner and definitely will be back.

excerpts: My mom loved her grilled mahi mahi with pineapple salsa.
Served with a side of bok choy, onion strings and a big scoop of rice.
grilled mahi mahi.author: Janice C.
grilled mahi mahi.review:
On my only day off, do I really want to spend it with my crazy family?!

"Oh, don't worry, your dad's not coming" my mom said.

* If you know my 'rents, I'm sure you'd also say thank God! *

Since it was just my mom and I, we decided to have lunch at Pacific Catch.  She loves seafood -- fish, shrimps, crab, baked, fried or broiled.  This place was ideal since it was walking distance to GG park, which we were headed to after lunch.

We picked out a couple of items and decided to share.  

The sweet potato fries were recommended by Eileen H. Boy she was right!  crispy and simply adorned with rock salt, it comes with two dipping sauces. I didn't like the flavored mayo nor the sweet chili sauce, but the fries are good on their own. (a side order is enough for two people)

The California roll was made with real crab but surprisingly lacking in flavor.  I've never been so thankful for soy sauce to dip it in.

On to the poke dish -- huge chunks of ahi tuna perfectly marinated in a soy sesame dressing.  It'll be easier to chew on it if the cut was smaller, but I shouldn't complain because I got my money's worth on that dish. 

Save your $4.95 on the grilled yellowtail taco. (it was a special for that day) The taco was small and the fish was overwhelmed with all the other trimmings in there. 

My mom loved her grilled mahi mahi with pineapple salsa. Served with a side of bok choy, onion strings and a big scoop of rice.  She couldn't finish this dish, not because it wasn't delicious, but the portions were so huge!

Service is very good, both from our waitress and the bussers, constantly refilling water and taking away used dishes. 

I'm curious about their happy hour, so I may come back for that!

excerpts: One grilled mahi mahi and one cabo shrimp with a side of sweet potato fries.
grilled mahi mahi.author: BrElla4eva H.
grilled mahi mahi.review:
I'd really give this place 3 1/2 stars...4 stars for food, 3 stars for the service. I actually really like this restaurant. The place is pretty casual, but fun. A good spot to get together with a small group of friends for a reasonably priced dinner. The food was delicious, but the service was mediocre. I think our server was new to the job so I felt bad for him. . We ordered the hawaiian poke to start off but didn't end up actually getting it till a little bit after our server came out with our entrees. But better late than never because it was ooh so good.
