Very fresh and flavorful. After contemplating about the many enticing choices on the menu, I opted for the island tacos for my main entree. One grilled mahi mahi and one cabo shrimp with a side of sweet potato fries. Definite thumbs up! 

I do need to mention a strange but funny incident we had while dining here. As we were all finishing up our food, one of my friends was drinking waster out of his glass...when all of a sudden I see a big splash. At first I thought he dropped his glass of water but it turned out that the bottom of his glass broke and all the ice and water spilled out! And let me just tell you...it broke just on the bottom of the glass in almost a perfect, complete circle! How weird is that!?! Luckily he already finished his meal. We, of course, complained to our server and he was able to get his meal for free. He mentioned that it probably happened because the glass was hot when they poured in cold water.

Now for dessert...always my favorite part! The four of us shared 2 different plates....the mochi fondue and the fried dulce de leche spring rolls. Both were scrumptious! I never thought of dipping mochi ice cream balls in hot chocolate sauce but it is dee-lish!

YES, I'd come back to this place and YES, I recommend it!

excerpts: 1 BBQ salmon with corn salsa and lime crema, 1 tropical grilled shrimp with mango salsa, and 1 spice-rubbed grilled mahi mahi with avocado tomatilla salsa.
Now let me first say that I am a little biased when it comes to fish tacos.
I've been a long time advocate for Wahoo's fish tacos and nothing has ever compared to their tacos.
Pacific catch however served me some really tasty fish tacos, which can definitely compete with Wahoo's.
I really appreciated the nice quality of salsas and toppings that went into the tacos.
They worked well and tasted great with the various fish and shrimp pairings.
grilled mahi mahi.author: Timothy C.
grilled mahi mahi.review:
Pacific Catch just recently opened on 9t Street and we decided to go try it for a mellow weekend lunch.  We weren't sure what to expect because it was new, but the online menu sure looked great.

The decor is modern and clean, providing a rather trendy atmosphere.  The place wasn't crowded when we came so we didn't have to wait for a table, which is always nice.  We saw one table had ordered the Baja Shrimp Ceviche so we decided to start with that.   The presentation was really cool.  The ceviche, stuffed full of shrimp and avocado, was served in a tall martini glass with a pile of tortilla chips sprawled around the base.  The best thing about this dish was how much shrimp they gave us!  It's always annoying when you pay a premium for a shrimp entre and get 3 shrimp.  We counted each shrimp as we were going through the ceviche, they were good sized shrimp mind you, and ended up with almost 20! The chef was overly generous with the shrimp for the price we payed.

For my entre, I went with 3 tacos; 1 BBQ salmon with corn salsa and lime crema, 1 tropical grilled shrimp with mango salsa, and 1 spice-rubbed grilled mahi mahi with avocado tomatilla salsa.  Now let me first say that I am a little biased when it comes to fish tacos.  I've been a long time advocate for Wahoo's fish tacos and nothing has ever compared to their tacos.  Pacific catch however served me some really tasty fish tacos, which can definitely compete with Wahoo's.  I really appreciated the nice quality of salsas and toppings that went into the tacos.  They worked well and tasted great with the various fish and shrimp pairings.  I took down these bad boys so fast and had to restrain myself from ordering more!

We also ordered sweet potato fries which were good.  I tend to find any type of french fry that offers a spin off the traditional French fry (different potatoes, etc) very satisfying.

Pacific Catch is definitely a decent restaurant and we will for sure go there again.  They had other dishes, such as sushi and fancy deserts that I would also like to try.  I also noticed they had a pretty nice full bar with comfy seats and a decent happy hour.  This would be a good place to come have some drinks and a nice dinner with some friends or even a date.

excerpts: My friend had the grilled mahi mahi which I tasted and thought it was good.
grilled mahi mahi.author: Kevin L.
grilled mahi mahi.review:
I went to Pacific Catch this evening for dinner and while I like the concept of the menu I wasn't overly impressed with my salmon teriyaki bowl. Yes it was fresh, but the rice had a bit too much sauce on it for my taste. I'm not sure if this was the reason, but I was extremely thirsty after having a few bites of my entree. Even when I got home I was thirsty. My friend had the grilled mahi mahi which I tasted and thought it was good. We got the sweet potato fries as an appetizer. While they were good I've had them elsewhere so it wasn't that exciting. The sweet potato fries don't hold their temperature long so you need to enjoy them fast.

The decor of the restaurant is eco-friendly and asian themed. They used quite a bit of bamboo throughout the restaurant and use environmentally friendly products per the insert in the menu. Overall I liked the decor and the openess of the restaurant which is a result of the high ceilings. Regardless it's nice to be able to have room when you're dining. 

Service was decent but nothing really spectacular. A manager did come by and greet us and thank us for making a reservation on OpenTable. I'm not too sure if this has anything to do with being an OpenTable VIP member. For those wondering I haven't noticed anything different when dining since being designated a VIP user.

excerpts: I ordered the grilled mahi mahi tacos and my boyfriend ordered the coconut shrimp and fish & chips.
Our waitress came out with a mahi mahi sandwich, but she quickly brought it back in because I wanted the tacos.
When I finally received the tacos, I took a bite, and immediately discovered that the rub on the mahi mahi was kind of yucky...
Oh well... I just continued eating, but then I noticed that they left out the avocado and instead of chipotle Crema, they gave me a little drizzle of sour cream
AND they never gave me a side of black beans.
At this point, I was annoyed
and I didn't want it anymore, so I told my boyfriend to try it.
He took a couple bites and hated it.
So I told her what had been left out and that I didn't like the taco, so she asked me if I wanted a side of avocado....
NO I DON'T!!!
( I didn't yell, I was nice).
So she tried giving me the old mahi mahi sandwich (
oh yeah!
I want an old soggy sandwich... what a smart girl!)
I obviously said no.
She asked me if I wanted something else, so
I ordered the fried calamari.
She asked if my boyfriend wanted the other taco I had left, but he din't, so she took it back with my new order.
Then out came the calamari and it was okay
( you can't really mess that up).
It would have been better if wasn't swimming in oil, though!
grilled mahi mahi.author: Lauren D.
grilled mahi mahi.review:
This tops the list as one of the worst restaurants I have ever been to. My boyfriend and I came on a Friday afternoon for lunch. The inside was cute, but it was freezing (not really a big deal). I ordered the grilled mahi mahi tacos and my boyfriend ordered the coconut shrimp and fish & chips. Our waitress came out with a mahi mahi sandwich, but she quickly brought it back in because I wanted the tacos. When I finally received the tacos, I took a bite, and immediately discovered that the rub on the mahi mahi was kind of yucky... Oh well... I just continued eating, but then I noticed that they left out the avocado and instead of chipotle Crema, they gave me a little drizzle of sour cream AND they never gave me a side of black beans. At this point, I was annoyed and I didn't want it anymore, so I told my boyfriend to try it. He took a couple bites and hated it. So I told her what had been left out and that I didn't like the taco, so she asked me if I wanted a side of avocado.... NO I DON'T!!! ( I didn't yell, I was nice). So she tried giving me the old mahi mahi sandwich ( oh yeah! I want an old soggy sandwich... what a smart girl!) I obviously said no. She asked me if I wanted something else, so I ordered the fried calamari. She asked if my boyfriend wanted the other taco I had left, but he din't, so she took it back with my new order. Then out came the calamari and it was okay ( you can't really mess that up). It would have been better if wasn't swimming in oil, though! EW! 

After we had finished eating, she came over with the check and didn't say a word..... she had the nerve to charge me for half of my other meal when it didn't even come to me complete!! Instead of complaining, we figured her tip could cover the sneaky little half charge she added on to our check.

All was not bad... I tried my boyfriends coconut shrimp and hey were delicious, but not enough to come back to this crappy place.

excerpts: So I ordered the 2 fish taco platter and ordered one grilled mahi mahi and the other one a baja style.
Both of them were pretty bland.
grilled mahi mahi.author: Adrian D.
grilled mahi mahi.review:
Uhm...where do I start....oh....they have a parking lot.  Ok I think that's the highlight of the place oh...and the place looks nice.  Now on to the food.  Hmm...bleh.  That's what I thought about it.  So I ordered the 2 fish taco platter and ordered one grilled mahi mahi and the other one a baja style.  Both of them were pretty bland.  The sweet potato fries were ok.  Lorraine L. ordered the mixed the mixed basket which had skewered coconut shrimp, fish fillets, and deep fried oysters.  The coconut shrimp was hard to eat.  She tried to slip one of the shrimps off the skewer and was having a hard time cuz the breading would come right off.  The actual taste of it wasn't too impressive.  Her oysters were somewhat chewy and her fish was just ok.  Another friend ordered the special for the night which was sea bass...which they didnt have so they said they had trout instead.  Hmm...trout is way different than sea bass last time I checked.  Anyway she got the trout but was pretty flustered about it.  The rest of the friends ordered fish & chips.  Oh...if you wanna ask about how big the fish is...don't ask.  

I think the only reason why I might come back is to try out there late night happy hour.  Other than that I wouldn't come back. =/

excerpts: Although they all sounded decent, the three tacos I went with were the Traditional Baja Taco with its Crispy Alaskan Cod, cabbage jalapeno tartar, and avocado tomatillo salsa, the Spiced Chicken Taco with grilled Mary's Chicken, cabbage avocado, chipotle aioli and pico de gallo, and the Pacific Steak Taco with marinated skirt steak, crispy onions, cilantro cabbage, sriracha aioli and lime cream.
marinated skirt steak.author: Jason F.
marinated skirt steak.review:
Pacific Catch West Coast Fish House is a solid place to get good if unspectacular seafood dishes like soft tacos, poke and rice bowls and sushi rolls. This franchise lays in the heart of San Francisco's Inner Sunset neighborhood right off the of the 9th Avenue Entrance to Golden Gate Park. Pacific Catch is a fine franchise and it's been in this location for over ten years, so despite the competition of the surrounding neighborhood this place is doing just fine. But the question is, is it worth it?

I went for a pre-planned birthday party, so we were able to make reservations for our party of seven at 7pm on a Wednesday evening in July. Although I've been this restaurant before, I haven't been in a while and I like some of the newer things they've brought to the interior, like a nice outdoor fireplace in front of the vestibule area and all of the funky artwork on the walls and hanging from the ceilings. Upon opening the menu, I did notice that the prices are high at Pacific Catch. Be prepared to get sticker shock as this place does not represent the most affordable meals for families in or from out of town. The average price is sixteen dollars per main course, but the food was dependable and an interesting blend on the traditional seafood fusion dish. 

Since there were seven of us in our party we had to get appetizers and the Cabo Calamari, as always, is an easy choice with crispy calamari, lemon slices, fresno chilies and chipotle aioli were decent if somewhat lackluster. The Original Hawaiian Poke Trio was a nice surprise because it came in three ranges of flavors with ahi tuna and sesame-soy marinade spicy seasoning, but at 19 dollars isn't the most affordable starter meal on the menu. I do give credit to Pacific Catch as everything on the menu does sound unbelievably tasty, even their fish and chips dish is described with a mouth-watering sensibility.  

After thinking and thinking (and thinking) about what I wanted to get that would be a good representation of what Pacific Catch has to offer, I decided to go with the Island Tacos Trio mainly because at 16 dollars you can mix and match three any tacos on their menu. Although they all sounded decent, the three tacos I went with were the Traditional Baja Taco with its Crispy Alaskan Cod, cabbage jalapeno tartar, and avocado tomatillo salsa, the Spiced Chicken Taco with grilled Mary's Chicken, cabbage avocado, chipotle aioli and pico de gallo, and the Pacific Steak Taco with marinated skirt steak, crispy onions, cilantro cabbage, sriracha aioli and lime cream. All three were solid pics with a little spice, a little crunch, and a decent amount of flavor. 

Pacific Catch is a decent place with a thought-provoking menu that combines Asian Fusion, Tex-Mex and fresh seafood entrees. The service, ambiance, and overall quality and presentation of the dishes were basically all on point. I asked at the top is it worth it, and I have to admit at that rate the answer remains no because of the overall type of food being offered doesn't match up with the prices. I simply wish the price points were a little more friendlier to the average tourist that tends to frequent this neighborhood. I would consider going again, maybe for Happy Hour or a late night bite. But there are other more unique and mom and pop style options out there in the Inner Sunset area that are dying to be supported by the community and newcomers alike.

excerpts: My fiance got the Korean BBQ Bowl with Marinated Skirt Steak.
marinated skirt steak.author: Lisa G.
marinated skirt steak.review:
I'm officially obsessed with this place.  

We decided to try the Pacific Catch in inner sunset.  They have sushi!!!  We went on the tenth anniversary for the poke bowls!  We got the Lomi Lomi poke appetizer - chopped pieces of salmon, tomatoes, sweet onions, cilantro, red chilies...deliciousness.  The fish is always so fresh.  We also got the poke bowl in a roll (yes, we love poke that much) - fresh, delicious, not too much rice, generous amounts of fish.  We each ended with a bowl.  I got the Japanese Wasabi bowl with, yes, Poke.  My fiance got the Korean BBQ Bowl with Marinated Skirt Steak.  The sauce was so good and the meat was soooo tender.  

We also had a Mai Tai and a beer.  

Once again, the staff is so friendly and welcoming.  It just makes you want to go back.

excerpts: We ordered the California Style Poke, Marinated Skirt Steak Rice Bowl, Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl, and Firecracker Salmon Roll.
We finished majority of it all, yes we did (no shame, I'm tellin' you.)
But anyway, I really enjoy their poke, the wonton chips that comes with it was soooo crunchy and thinly cut, it melted in my mouth (a little exaggeration there, but nevertheless, I loved it).
marinated skirt steak.author: Anna L.
marinated skirt steak.review:
You know you're hungry when your bill comes out to be around 90$ total with only 2 people. Or maybe we're just fatasses.

I was craving some Hawaiian Poke, so my best friend and I decided to dine here for dinner. We sat near the bar/lounge area; this is a great spot for a good picture if you're a crazy insta-food-ographer like myself #guilty

We ordered the California Style Poke, Marinated Skirt Steak Rice Bowl, Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl, and Firecracker Salmon Roll. We finished majority of it all, yes we did (no shame, I'm tellin' you.) But anyway, I really enjoy their poke, the wonton chips that comes with it was soooo crunchy and thinly cut, it melted in my mouth (a little exaggeration there, but nevertheless, I loved it). PERFECT!

The rice bowl, however, was not as impressive especially for the price of it. I thought my rice bowl was way too overflowing with sauce, which made it so much saltier than it should taste and let me tell you, I am not a big fan of salty food. Not only that, the stuff that comes in it was nothing out of the ordinary. My friend said the same thing regarding the Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl =/ 

We've also ordered drinks as well and I believe we got the Agave Margarita and Pacific Catch Mai Tai. Not too sure if these were the drinks but it balances out the food we ate and helped extract the saltiness in the rice bowl, which is a good thing I guess? 

Other than that, I will come back and try other poke because I am a huge fan of poke!

excerpts: Hawaiian Teriyaki rice bowl w/ marinated skirt steak, brown rice, shiitake mushrooms, grilled pineapple, glazed carrots, edamame, crispy sweet onions, sesame seeds & teriyaki sauce.
Ordered to be "healthy" & balance the fried indugence.
It was good &
marinated skirt steak.author: Kim S.
marinated skirt steak.review:
Smart to capitalize on the World Series fever.  The 2 flat screens over the bar were showing the game with the sound on!  I wouldn't have known that except for the chalkboard sign outside.  Scored a table dead center to 1 of the tv's so we were set.  Oh the food...we shared...

Fish & Chips - opted for the sweet potato fries - a must do!  The cod still moist & perfectly fried with a crunchy coating.  Not greasy...totally yummy!  Gobbled it up.

Hawaiian Teriyaki rice bowl w/ marinated skirt steak, brown rice, shiitake mushrooms, grilled pineapple, glazed carrots, edamame, crispy sweet onions, sesame seeds & teriyaki sauce.  Ordered to be "healthy" & balance the fried indugence.  It was good & the brown rice not dry.

Oh, I like the pretzel goldfish & edamame samples you get when ordering entrees.

excerpts: I had the Thai green curry bowl of grilled shrimp, and he had the Korean marinated skirt steak bowl.
marinated skirt steak.author: Shirley N.
marinated skirt steak.review:
It's been awhile since we've come. We came for dinner, and there was a good size crowd.  Maybe because of their happy hour 4p-6m.  Hubby & I both had a rice bowl with brown rice.  I had the Thai green curry bowl of grilled shrimp, and he had the Korean marinated skirt steak bowl.  Daughter had the crispy shrimp taco plate.  

The Korean bowl was somewhat too sweet for hubby.

We started with the Peruvian ceviche consisting of ono and served with  purple chips which were a bit soggy.

There's a small parking lot; however, we always park inside the GG Park and walk over.

excerpts: My younger sister had Korean BBQ, the Marinated Skirt Steak.
She thought it was too salty.
She only ate the meat (left the vegetables and rice alone) because she said it was way too salty.
marinated skirt steak.author: Tiffany H.
marinated skirt steak.review:
PC is very roomy, theres a bar, booth seats, and tables. Families can definitely have a nice dinner here. I love their high ceilings!

My dad loves their sandwiches, specifically the Wasabi Ahi. It was grilled rare ahi with ginger, avocado, daikon sprouts and ginger-wasabi aioli. The sandwich was really filling. The sandwich was served with coleslaw and sweet potato fries. 

My mom loves the Pacific Ceviche Trio. Three different types of ceviche served with purple potato chips. Yummmmmmm. The fish was grilled seared with ginger! Very flavorful! 

We also had the Pan Asian Bowl, the thai curry with grilled chicken. They were very nice and gladly adhered to our half brown rice and half vegetable request (thank you!). The crispy shallots also added a nice touch.

Customer service? Very nice and speedy. 

My younger sister had Korean BBQ, the Marinated Skirt Steak. She thought it was too salty. She only ate the meat (left the vegetables and rice alone) because she said it was way too salty. (This says a lot because she normally loves rice.)

This place was definitely worth it, but my recommendation? Stay clear of the Korean BBQ!

excerpts: We ordered the sticky ribs and the marinated skirt steak asian bowls.
Both were excellently prepared and delicious.
marinated skirt steak.author: Ken C.
marinated skirt steak.review:
Pacific Catch is a nice stop for a drink or dinner if you're near the golden gate park area. Don't let the name fool you though, there's plenty of turf to go along with the surf. I came here for dinner and was very pleased. 

First the food, there is an asian section on the menu that caught our eyes. We ordered the sticky ribs and the marinated skirt steak asian bowls. Both were excellently prepared and delicious. For dessert we got the fondu mochi balls which were fun and great tasting. 

The Service was good. No complaints here. 

The Restaurant is pretty large. This place would be perfect for large parties and is in high traffic area of the city so I could definitely see myself holding a party here. I'd definitley say this place has a casual, chainy type vibe to it. It's very nice inside but something about it gives off a cookie cutter feel where you can tell they followed a blue print on how to build restaurants so I don't think you're going to find any SF charm here. 

Overall, great dinner experience. I'd definitely come back here again and would recommend it. Enjoy!

excerpts: I recommend the coconut skewered shrimp and ordering anything that will get you some of their delicious sweet potato fries (healthier than regular fries, at least!)!
skewered shrimp.author: Amy L.
skewered shrimp.review:
While I desperately miss the Canvas Gallery, this place is a lovely new addition to one of my favorite neighborhoods, the Inner Sunset.  The food is good while offering many healthy options, the prices mostly reasonable, the feel is spacious, clean and stylish, and there's even a small parking lot by the side of the building with free parking for patrons...it's hard not to love this place!

This place doesn't add anything special to the neighborhood from a culinary standpoint, since it's another Asian Fusion place on the same block with three (yes, THREE!!!) other Japanese restaurants and within a block or two of several more sushi bars and fish restaurants...and arguably there's something formulaic and trite about the intentional hipness of the decor...

But there's also something to be said for dining in comfort, which is exactly what whoever designed and decorated this restaurant seemed to have in mind:  the lighting is mild and pleasant, the ceiling vaulted, giving the overall feeling of weightlessness, and the chairs and booths are mostly comfortable...although the booths will feel slightly cramped if you are very tall or have a big butt or tummy, since the tables are low and there's a non-removeable 1/2-height cushion behind your back that takes up about 5-6" of your rump room.  If you are under 6' tall and on the slender side, you'll be just fine.

The servers are very friendly and attentive, which is a pleasant departure from many restaurants in San Francisco, where courteous service sometimes seems to have been otherwise forgotten in the shuffle.  Pacific Catch seems to operate the way many serious, highly rated professional restaurant environments do, with a highly trained staff, attention to detail overall, and a menu that reflects modern trends.  For example, this menu offers not only foodie versions of Miso soup, but also a brown rice substitution option for those of us watching our waistlines or simply attempting to eat a more healthy diet.  

I recommend the coconut skewered shrimp and ordering anything that will get you some of their delicious sweet potato fries (healthier than regular fries, at least!)!  Be warned that you won't be able to eat just one...

I also thoroughly enjoyed their salmon teriyaki bowl which came with shitake mushrooms, asparagus cut into the perfect size bites, and bok choy which was cooked to perfection, served over brown rice that's been dosed with some more of their flavorful teriyaki sauce (normally it's served with pineapple fried rice, but I opted for their complimentary brown rice substitution instead).

Their traditional miso soup is average at best, and at twice the price that other Japanese restaurants in the neighborhood will charge for the same size bowl, it's nothing special and you get the feeling it's pricier because everything on the menu is priced a little higher, not because of an increase in quality.  Still, the presentation of the bowl, which arrived covered and was quickly de-topped by the server at the table, gives at least some clue as to what your money buys here:  a higher end experience, even if it's at a chain restaurant, even if the menu looks like a mash-up of Sushi-Bar-Meets-Fish'n'Chips-Joint, even if it's a Monday night in the Inner Sunset.  

There's something to be said for a restaurant that does what it does well.

excerpts: We had the Korean Sticky Ribs and Calamari for our appetizers.
The meat on the ribs were flavorful, but a bit tough and overly sweet.
The calamari pieces were way too oily and small.
Next came our entrees:
Crispy Alaskan Cod, an ahi poke salad, an ahi poke bowl, Dungeness Crab Melt, and a 3-taco plate.
I can only vouche for the Crispy Alaskan Cod, which was not crispy at all.
The cod arrived soggy and the salad and coleslaw that accompanied
it was overly dressed.
On the plus side, the entrees were nicely presented.
sticky ribs.author: Aimee I.
sticky ribs.review: This place is just okay. The decor is contemporary and interesting, but the food is mediocre. We had the Korean Sticky Ribs and Calamari for our appetizers. The meat on the ribs were flavorful, but a bit tough and overly sweet. The calamari pieces were way too oily and small. Next came our entrees: Crispy Alaskan Cod, an ahi poke salad, an ahi poke bowl, Dungeness Crab Melt, and a 3-taco plate. I can only vouche for the Crispy Alaskan Cod, which was not crispy at all. The cod arrived soggy and the salad and coleslaw that accompanied it was overly dressed. On the plus side, the entrees were nicely presented.

excerpts: We shared the Korean sticky ribs and the sweet potato fries for appetizer.
The sweet potato fries were really good and not too greasy like I had at many other places.
The sticky ribs were marinated well, but I didn't get too much meat from it.
sticky ribs.author: Wendy F.
sticky ribs.review:
Lovely Asian-fusion diner! Love their Ahi Tuna salad!!!

FOOD: We shared the Korean sticky ribs and the sweet potato fries for appetizer. The sweet potato fries were really good and not too greasy like I had at many other places. The sticky ribs were marinated well, but I didn't get too much meat from it. For entree I got the Ahi Tuna salad. It had a good mix of greens, avocado, sauteed cabbages, and 4 big piece of Ahi Tuna. Everything tasted great when mixed all together, with the soy-wasabi vinaigrette. My friend tried the Pacific Crab Salad (with real crab meat) and it was great too!

SERVICE: We came here on a Tuesday evening and was seated immediately. Very friendly waiter and food came by within reasonable time.

SETTING: I really like how spacious it is on the inside and also its ambient lighting. They have nice interior decors and there is also an outdoor patio where you can sit and dine (heat lamp provided during the freezing SF nights). Parking is probably impossible so just take Lyft or the muni. 

OVERALL IMPRESSION: I like it! I always run past this place but never really knew how tasty the food is. Will come back again for sure!

excerpts: We've tried the Korean sticky ribs, Kona coffee ribs, fried calamari, shrimp ceviche (my favorite), the poke trio with the California, original, and white tuna, the salmon poke, and the spicy tuna sushi roll.
The Kona coffee ribs were amazing
but I think were only around for a limited time.
The sushi rolls were just mediocre, this isn't a sushi joint
so I would stay away from the rolls and stick to the poke.
The original poke is a little too salty
but it's tolerable if you pair with rice
, the white tuna poke was a little on the dry side, I would've liked more liquid/lemon on it
and it had a really "fishy" taste, the California was probably the best, and the salmon poke was good but a bit on the spicy side.
and it had a really "fishy" taste, the California was probably the best, and the salmon poke was good but a bit on the spicy side.
For entrees we've had the poke salad (amazing), the Thai curry bowl with salmon (also amazing it was one of the best salmons I've ever had), and the teriyaki bowl with steak.
To be honest I would stick to what they know best which is probably fish.
The steak was just ok
and they weren't very generous with the portions.
It was more rice and a whole lot of other stuff on it like pineapples, edamame, carrots, shiitake mushrooms, and A LOT of fried onions.
I do have to say tho that the teriyaki sauce they use is delicious, I couldn't stop eating the rice.
sticky ribs.author: Linz C.
sticky ribs.review:
I've been here a couple of times and I must say they have one of the best happy hour menus!  They even give you edamame and goldfish pretzels to snack on! 

We've tried the Korean sticky ribs, Kona coffee ribs, fried calamari, shrimp ceviche (my favorite), the poke trio with the California, original, and white tuna, the salmon poke, and the spicy tuna sushi roll.  The Kona coffee ribs were amazing but I think were only around for a limited time. The sushi rolls were just mediocre, this isn't a sushi joint so I would stay away from the rolls and stick to the poke.  The original poke is a little too salty but it's tolerable if you pair with rice, the white tuna poke was a little on the dry side, I would've liked more liquid/lemon on it and it had a really "fishy" taste, the California was probably the best, and the salmon poke was good but a bit on the spicy side.  The poke trio also comes with wonton chips, a small salad, and a delicious seaweed salad. 

For entrees we've had the poke salad (amazing), the Thai curry bowl with salmon (also amazing it was one of the best salmons I've ever had), and the teriyaki bowl with steak.  To be honest I would stick to what they know best which is probably fish.  The steak was just ok and they weren't very generous with the portions. It was more rice and a whole lot of other stuff on it like pineapples, edamame, carrots, shiitake mushrooms, and A LOT of fried onions.  I do have to say tho that the teriyaki sauce they use is delicious, I couldn't stop eating the rice.

excerpts: Boyfriend and I shared a California roll (huge portion for the price with quality real crab) and the sticky ribs (great flavor but
the meat wasn't falling off the bone amazing) for starters.

He did the chipotle chicken sandwich with side of Cajun seasoned fries (wonderful flavor and the chicken breast was super tender) and I had the California bowl with poke 1/2 brown rice 1/2 salad which was ahhhhhmazing!!!
highly recommend.
On top of it all our server was knowledgeable, attentive and sweet.
sticky ribs.author: Sachi P.
sticky ribs.review: Really fresh seafood and for a chain restaurant this place exceeded our expectations!! Boyfriend and I shared a California roll (huge portion for the price with quality real crab) and the sticky ribs (great flavor but the meat wasn't falling off the bone amazing) for starters. He did the chipotle chicken sandwich with side of Cajun seasoned fries (wonderful flavor and the chicken breast was super tender) and I had the California bowl with poke 1/2 brown rice 1/2 salad which was ahhhhhmazing!!!  highly recommend. On top of it all our server was knowledgeable, attentive and sweet.

excerpts:
- Sweet potato fries - yummy
- Sticky Ribs Korean BBQ - I liked it!
sticky ribs.author: Tammy F.
sticky ribs.review:
We came for a Mother's Day Dinner with my Mom and brother. We made a reservation and waited about 15 minutes for our table. 

[ S E R V I C E ] 
- Our waitress Chelsea is super friendly. She came back to check on us multiple time. GREAT SERVICE!

[ F O O D ]
- ORIGINAL HAWAIIAN POKE - yummmy!! must get! I love the combination of avocado, tuna, seaweed salad, etc.
- Fish and Chip - I've had better but its not bad here...I liked the Jalepeno tartar.
- Calfornia Salmon Sandwich - my brother said it was one of the best sandwich he ever had.
- Sweet potato fries - yummy
- Sticky Ribs Korean BBQ - I liked it! Finger-lickin' good!

[ A M B I A N C E ]
- Bar is nice with TVs so you can watch the game.
- Restaurant seemed cleaned.
- Spacious! I love the booths!

[ P A R K I N G ]
- Parking lot located right next to the restaurant but there are limited spaces and they are usually occupied. I usually look for street parking, which could be hard around that area.

[ H A P P Y H O U R ]
- Happy hour from 4:00 to 6:00 Monday through Friday and everyday from 10pm to closing. Will definitely come back and try the HH.

excerpts: my boyfriend ordered the Korean bbq bowl with white rice and sticky ribs.
let me tell you....
the ribs were PRETTY sticky, hahah.
we both barely even touched our bowls because we were so filled up on the two appetizers.. but we took them to go.
and for two appetizers and two main courses, the total only came out to be $50!
so I thought that was a good deal.
the presentation of each dish was really presentable and nicely put together.
the interior of the place was huge and you could opt for outdoor seating too.
I literally felt as if I was dining in Hawaii.
I do plan to come back, but my eyes were definitely bigger than my stomach... haha.
sticky ribs.author: Audrey K.
sticky ribs.review:
I've been waiting to try this place! I've heard mixed reviews from people I knew. but, my boyfriend said he's been here many times and said it was good. 
we came around 11, right when they open and it was getting relatively busy! so I'm taking that as a good thing. as we browsed through the menu, he mentioned that the sweet potato fries were a must. I love sweet potato fries, so.... why not! they were delicious with two choices of sauces. a sweet and tangy sauce(usually eaten with egg rolls) and a wasabi ginger kind. I wasn't a big fan of wasabi or ginger haha. but the fries were yummy! then we ordered salmon poke. the salmon was nicely seasoned with small cuts of avocado too. it was with a side of crispy wonton chips to compliment the appetizer even more. it had a nice refreshing flavor. then...... onto the main course! I ordered the Hawaiian teriyaki pan Asian bowl with grilled chicken. they had the option to change the white rice to 1/2 brown rice and 1/2 salad. so that's what I did. I didn't know the bowl was going to be so huge.... omg. it came with crispy onions, mushrooms, grilled pineapple, carrots. it wasn't too overly sauced, but the chicken tasted very chewy. I don't know, it was weird. haha. but everything else in the bowl was good. my boyfriend ordered the Korean bbq bowl with white rice and sticky ribs. let me tell you.... the ribs were PRETTY sticky, hahah. we both barely even touched our bowls because we were so filled up on the two appetizers.. but we took them to go. and for two appetizers and two main courses, the total only came out to be $50! so I thought that was a good deal. the presentation of each dish was really presentable and nicely put together. the interior of the place was huge and you could opt for outdoor seating too. I literally felt as if I was dining in Hawaii. I do plan to come back, but my eyes were definitely bigger than my stomach... haha.

excerpts: We started with the Korean Sticky Ribs.
That was tasty but a bit messy
(it's nice
they have napkins and wet naps to clean off your hands).
sticky ribs.author: Phillip D.
sticky ribs.review:
Finally tried this place after seeing so many friends frequent this restaurant.  I can't believe I only tried this place now. 

First of all, I love that they have a variety of "Pacific Rim" cuisine.  Everything from Hawaiian to Japanese to Korean, we actually tried a bit of all three.  We came on a Wednesday evening (just missed the Happy Hour). We started with the Korean Sticky Ribs. That was tasty but a bit messy (it's nice they have napkins and wet naps to clean off your hands).  We then ordered the Sunset Sushi Roll (which comes in 8 pieces) and Poke Fest Trio (we tried the original, California, and the Macadamia Nut).  I personally liked the Macadamia Nut and Original Poke. I think the California Poke was too citrusy (is that a word).  

I definitely want to try their happy hour (see what deals I can get). They have happy hour both from 4-6 M-F and 10-close! Great for those late night eats. Also, I have to try their rice bowl. From what I saw, they are HUGE! 

Our server (forgot her name) was real nice and pretty attentive. I don't think it was too busy but even if, good service always makes the meal (and review) even better  

They technically have a parking lot in the rear but it's usually full but at least it's an option in the busy inner sunset. 

Definitely a place to come again.

excerpts: We started with the Korean sticky ribs (yummy and finger licking good)!
I had the chicken and steak island tacos after for my meal.
The tacos were good (better flavor than I remember from last time) and were filling.
Also had a Foursquare newbie check in special for a free dessert.
sticky ribs.author: Miss H K.
sticky ribs.review:
4 1/2 years later...and I return!
Came here today to celebrate my mom's bday for lunch. Had no problem making a reservation on Opentable. 
This location is larger than some of the other PC's I've seen and has a nice, modern and casual atmosphere. Our waitress was very friendly and attentive and our dining experience was very nice overall.
We started with the Korean sticky ribs (yummy and finger licking good)! I had the chicken and steak island tacos after for my meal. The tacos were good (better flavor than I remember from last time) and were filling. Also had a Foursquare newbie check in special for a free dessert. We had the chocolate macadamia nut brownie sundae (my least favorite part of the meal...pretty dry and not very moist-but it was free).
Overall the food and service was good. I'd recommend this place for asian fusion or seafood if in the area. Nice place for small groups or a date.

excerpts: We ordered the sticky ribs and the marinated skirt steak asian bowls.
Both were excellently prepared and delicious.
sticky ribs.author: Ken C.
sticky ribs.review:
Pacific Catch is a nice stop for a drink or dinner if you're near the golden gate park area. Don't let the name fool you though, there's plenty of turf to go along with the surf. I came here for dinner and was very pleased. 

First the food, there is an asian section on the menu that caught our eyes. We ordered the sticky ribs and the marinated skirt steak asian bowls. Both were excellently prepared and delicious. For dessert we got the fondu mochi balls which were fun and great tasting. 

The Service was good. No complaints here. 

The Restaurant is pretty large. This place would be perfect for large parties and is in high traffic area of the city so I could definitely see myself holding a party here. I'd definitley say this place has a casual, chainy type vibe to it. It's very nice inside but something about it gives off a cookie cutter feel where you can tell they followed a blue print on how to build restaurants so I don't think you're going to find any SF charm here. 

Overall, great dinner experience. I'd definitely come back here again and would recommend it. Enjoy!

excerpts: sticky ribs
oh baby.
Entrees were superb  my friend Christy got the poke salad
and since she's Miss Hawaii
everything must be on par from there.
She gave it thumbs up.
I had the yellowtail dinner.
Very fresh tasty.
